They have a couple of pizza choices (white pizza & trad. veggie) with my favorite "pizza topping," broccoli, they do it right (perfectly chunked and sautéed).

The crust has a terrific flavor and texture (slightly crunchy, tender) and bends like a NY pizza.

Next time I will order a slice of the white broccoli pizza, as well as the veggie pizza!

Note: Thanks for wearing face masks, too!
I saw the light on the sign turn off as I walked up and it was defeating because the hours says they're open until 2am.

First time trying to pizza place. They have variety of pizza and they all seem delicious. The owner was very nice enough to replace a pizza for me because I thought there was marinara sauce on it but didn't. Highly recommend!
Brand new clean open bright small menu authentic food so happy to finally get a good restaurant downtown FiDi!

Imm Thai is a new restaurant that specializes in tom yum items and other Thai comfort food! Be sure to stop by and make sure to order some of their tasty tom yum dishes!

What we ordered:

- Seafood tom yum noodle creamy soup
- Yum Seafood salad
- Crispy pork rice bowl w/ tom yum sauce
- Roasted chicken over rice
- Shrimp dumplings
- Southern Thai chicken
- Thai tea
- Butterfly tea lemonade

My standout dishes were the tom yum noodle soup and the seafood salad. The tom yum soup has the perfect mix of sour and salty in the broth, and the seafood salad was both salty and refreshing with their anchovy lime dressing and came with a generous amount of mixed seafood. Their chicken is also really tender and flavorful and worth trying! The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the Thai Iced Tea which tasted like it had no sugar/ sweetness.

I can't get over this meal and neither can my friend!

We needed a quick meal in the area, and this one caught our eyes. I thought the place was actually fast food style because of the small size, but it was actually a dine-in.

You are able to change your spice levels here! I got the Seafood Tom Yum Noodle Creamy Soup ($15) with egg noodle. They also offer rice noodle. Upon sipping the soup, I felt immediately attacked by the pungent broth! It was very sour, yet spicy, yet also slightly sweet. It was a whole range of flavors that my normally bland taste palette was not used to. I didn't like it at first, but after having with the noodles, I started adjusting to the unique mixture the more I ate. I never had Tom Yum before, and even with the coconut milk used, the broth still remains to be pretty clear tasting, which is great to prevent it from being heavy.

The noodles are typical, but the seafood will draw your interest. They give such a nice diverse amount, with fish, mussels, squid, you name it! All were so delicious, especially when coupled with the broth!

By the end, our broth was basically gone. For offering such a complex delicious broth that grows on you, I highly recommend their noodle soups here!

i'm a sucker for good comfort food and was so excited to try this spot, which opened in fidi recently. when i went, they were still in their soft opening phase, but legit everything we tried made us feel at home. great flavors that weren't *too much*iykyk - if i had a thai auntie, i'm sure this is the food she would make me.

what we ordered (* = my faves):
- drinks: pandan water*, thai iced tea, butterfly tea lemonade*
- shrimp dumplings*
- golden honey chicken
- yum crispy pork salad
- seafood tomyum noodle creamy soup*
- salmon + garlic oyster sauce rice bowl*

some of their items marked as spicy, weren't THAT spicy. everything came out looking exactly like the menu photos tho which is SUCHHH a green flag. i loved their homemade(!!) pandan water so much, wish we got more for the road. the shrimp dumplings were top tier, each one uses an entire shrimp and the tomyum sauce was sooo good.

their tomyum broth is fantastic, so creamy and flavorful! i'm salivating thinking about it LOL and i'm such a big fan of the salmon rice bowl and the fresh veggies they add on. i felt right at home eating here and i'm not even Thai!! would highly recommend checking out if you're in fidi :)

I stumbled to this Thai restaurant on the Halloween night, I basically have the place all to ourselves when everyone is bustling and hustling in parade.  we ordered a stirfry seafood dish and glass noodle padthai, omg, the flavor are above and beyond!! It takes me back to thailand! the true authentic thai foods and flavors!The glass noodles are soft and moist, shrimps are tangy and juicy, much better the average padthai. The menu is not expansive but covers veggies, pork and seafoods. the place is small and cozy.  service was quick and friendly! I will definitely come back.

Ordered the Pad Kra Pao Gai ( Spicy ) and it was one of the highlights of my trip to NYC. Came back twice with friends within a few days because it was so good.
Super friendly and attentive staff and quality ingredients

Ordered take out from this place, it's pretty new on Nassau St, in between Fulton and John, which sadly is the street take out places go to die.

One great thing about this place is it is Unique.  We already have like 4 Thai places in a 5 block radius that serve the same food.  This place is completely different and that's what's great about it.

One of their main noodle dishes the Mee Hang is actually something we used to get 'off-menu' at Bennies Thai, when it was still around.  It's just a great simple dry noodle dish, and this place does a great job with it.

We also ordered a couple of Apps.  The Golden Honey chicken was spot on, tasted great, nice crisp and good flavor.  The Shrimp Dumplings were ok. Kind of weird, they put a whole shrimp on top of some meat dumpling filling and wrap it in a wonton wrapper.  They didn't taste bad, but their texture and execution was just a little off.

The last thing I ordered was the Yum Crispy Pork Salad.  This was pretty dope.  Two small criticisms, really not quite enough salad relative to Pork, it was like a Lot of crisp pork, which basically tasted like good Chicharonnes, and everything was in a fish sauce dressing.  That would be the second minor criticism, because there wasn't as much of a salad base, it was a bit too much sauce.  Easy things to fix, a few less pieces of pork, another handful of lettuce and then this salad is perfect.

I hope this place sticks around, which is why I am giving it 5 stars.  It's probably a 4 star spot right now, but with minor improvements, easily can earn a 5 star rating.  But I want people to go here so they can stay in business, because it's refreshing to have a Thai place in the area that doesn't just serve the same old stuff.

Anyways, hope this was helpful.  Order and enjoy!

Honey ribs was great. After the dinner, we ordered it again to have it again!!!

It is a small nook . Surprising cozy if you sit down in the booth.

My review is only based on my takeout experience. I ordered the mee hang and it was ready within 10 minutes which is always a plus. The mee hang had ground pork which lacked flavor and didn't really add anything to the dish. I liked the wonton chips which added a different texture but overall the dish needed a stronger flavor profile to give it that yum taste. I might try this place again and update my review accordingly.

I'm dropping my review to 2 stars after buying take out a couples of time. I decided to eat in and was disappointed at the service received. We got sat and have to call the waiter a couples of time before we could get served. He was definitely a bit all over the place. I order the rice bowl with crispy chicken. It was good, although I like how they give you sauce separately when to go. My colleague ordered the Tom yum noodle soup and added the lemon that came with it. It was too sour once added. We asked if we could get a bit more broth to balance the acidity, but we got charged an $4. I guess I'm going to give this place a break. $20+ for a small bowl of noodles that wasn't even that good it's not worth it.
The chicken red curry and pad thai were really great! Service was very friendly as well!

Food- i would give it two stars. I only gave 3 stars because the staff was nice and attentive but I ordered a pork salad and it was so disappointing. There wasn't enough lettuce in the bowl at all. I was hoping for baby arugula, along with the lettuce. I paid $16 when I should've paid $7 maximum for this salad. It's unfair to charge customers the amount and give them a super small portion. The pork was OK but the dressing was just not good at all. Tasted like soy sauce mainly.

Ambience & staff- the staff were nice and attentive & the decor is nice clean and beautiful. The only thing is the staff gave a few people honey fried chicken samples and there wasn't a piece of chicken in the bite that I had. Another customer said it was good, but her problem was that it was just too hard/crunchy.  

Overall, I think this restaurant could be something, but they need to make major improvements in the kitchen.

I'm sad now cause i wasted money & I am so hungry. Honestly, I want my money back.
Best lunch spot ever. Great service. Quick food. Clean space. Love love love. Totally recommend the tom yum noodle soup and the pork clear soup one. Will be back soon!!!

10/10 amazing would come again
It tastes like my thai mom cooking the nostalgia hit's different

I was born and raise in New york. I have Had try a lot of Thai food from here my whole life. Wow, this Pad Thai is really different from the others. The chef made the noodles colorful with color from snow peas flower. That's so creative. And the taste also the best pad thai I ever had in New York.i Can't wait to see and try the new creativity of Thai dish from here again. Love it  Five start review from me. Don't believe me  until you try it out yourself.

Cozy spot for modern-inspired Thai food. Limited seating options but the restaurant is clean and nicely decorated. We ordered the green curry, pad Thai, and Tom yum. Food presentation was nice, but we didn't love the food. The pad thai was a bit bland. They use rice noodles for the pad thai, which is unique and adds a nice texture but tasted mostly like oil.

The food here is delicious. I recently ordered the salmon bowl with basil sauce and the crispy pork with Tom yum. Both dishes were so flavorful and fresh. The veggies have the perfect bite to them, the rice was fluffy and warm, the salmon was moist and not overcooked, the pork was so crispy and tender, and the sauces have such a depth of flavor and great spice level. Whatever you order, I'm sure you will not be disappointed. The staff is friendly and attentive, and it's obvious that the kitchen staff takes pride in the food they make. I will definitely be back to try more.

Small place, and amazing! It's my husband's go to place! He loves the vegetable soup, and the appetizers! Prices are reasonable too.

Highly recommend!
I  recommend the rice bowl it's was fast and the taste was great " Crispy Chicken with Basil sauce " you must try on

I really wanted to like this place more...I saw this place got 4.4 on Yelp so I decided to check it out on a rainy Sunday evening when we got there it was rainy and no one was there, it did sound fill up qucikly...the host/waitress was friendly and let us sit anywhere we wanted....we were excited to try this place out after looking at the menus that have pictures....They started strong with the apps, the Thai fried chicken and shrimp dumplings were winners! It is the main dishes that I think this hs went down hill...I ordered the seafood rice bowl with garlic mussel sauce. So I expected a bowl not a flat plate....what i got was some seafood on a flat plate with some steamed American style veggies on the side ( carrots, cauliflower and string beans) ...I expected the sauce to be a brown color and cover the rice and vegetables but the sauce was kind of a clear tasteless goop that was underneath the seafood....Totally not what I expected....I thought it would have a lot of flavor and include some traditional Thai veggies...That dish didn't have a photo so that might have helped...I have to say the seafood was very fresh just wish the portion was bigger (and would have paid more for bigger portion), I was hungry so I resorted to eating plain rice on the plate...Perhaps I ordered the wrong thing because some of the other dishes people ordered looked better than what I got...i was so hungry from this portion that I had to go next door to get a burger from 7th st burger....Ouch
The food here is amazing authentic Thai food, prepared and served by a family from Bangkok.  A hidden gem on Nassau street!
The golden honey chicken was savoryyy. Inexpensive and comforting so we are definitely coming back again another time!
Excellent food, great ambiance! lots of good appetizers the kids loved it and theirs soups was delicious. Definitely coming back whenever we visit NYC.
Authentic Thai food, excellent service, cute n neat place ! Great addition to the neighbourhood.
The golden honey chicken and Tom yum noodle soup is really good! The sour flavor of soup is just right the point.

Dumplings served basically cold and not very good.  Doesn't feel like a Thai style restaurant. Food presented in an odd way. Worker seemed a bit confused and forgetful. $200 bill for 6 people with a couple appetizers and only 3 entrees and soft drinks. We ordered light just to try the place. Not very memorable and definitely not good value for money. They're new so maybe it's growing pains, but I wouldn't go back for a couple months if I decide to give them another try. I gave them 3 stars for effort and hope they improve.
Small and new restaurant with authentic Thai food. Best after a long day of sightseeing in NYC. The staff was very friendly. Recommend this restaurant 100%.

The best Thai restaurant to open up in the FIDI (Fulton/Nassau Street) area in a very long time.  There is eat in table service or takeout. The restaurant is meticulously designed.  They have a liquor license.    The food is authentic and fresh.  The staff are respectful and polite. The menu items are reasonable priced.   Delightful.
I had the honey chicken and it was AMAZING!!! Trust me...go have lunch at Imm you won't regret.

TLDR: Bonkers. One of the best birthday meals I was fortunate enough to have. Obviously - not cheap but if you want to splurge, this is a proper place to drop some coin. What sets Icca apart is some of these pieces, you really won't get anywhere else.

As the short version explained, this was a birthday meal I was lucky to be able to enjoy. It's in the back of the restaurant and what followed was arguably one of the best meals I've had - period.

Chef was wonderful to watch as he worked and prepared each course. What an interesting opener, a cut roll of trout rolled with chives and shiso leaf. Fatty, refreshing, herby. We're off to go a good start.

Sashimi with salt and wasabi for contrasting flavors. A bunch of sushi rice mixed with abalone liver. Whoa - so rich and flavorful. I could eat a hand roll of just this. The abalone itself was delightfully soft and so full of umami.

Japanese hairy crab or kegani. This was topped over herb pasta and served cold for a wonderful Japanese/Italian combination. Icca's owners also have access to this Olive beef from Japan which is just ridiculously tasty. Think wagyu but more beef forward. A grilled scallop sandwiched between crispy nori - the meal just keeps getting better and better. The nigiri hasn't even started yet!

Most memorable dish, smoked firefly squid with leek sauce. I have not found this again since and yet - I can still taste the flavors like yesterday. Sweet, smoky, charred leeks, so friggin' good. All of the nigiri was wonderful but the aji (horse mackerel) was especially good. The squid ink risotto mixed with uni. The hand roll was especially signature. Nodoguro temaki! WTF - it's that super lux nigiri piece but let's make a handroll with it. It's like making a Salisbury Steak with Wagyu. So smoky, fatty, luscious and wrapped in this perfectly crisp seaweed shell.

If you're going to take a dive into the $300+ realm, I'd highly recommend giving Icca a try.

I now live in Utah, so when I travel, I try to eat as much seafood as possible. During a recent trip to Manhattan, icca was on my list. I had been dying to dine there with my daughter Jess, because "icca"! We were joined by my cousin and my older sister.

To get to the dining room with the sushi counter, you must walk through a bar area, where the restaurant serves its Italian kappo menu. The sushi counter is wood with seating for seven along the front and two on the side.

I enjoyed the best omakase sushi that I've had in the United States. We loved the Nagasaki abalone prepared two different ways, Hokkaido hairy crab with Hokkaido sea urchin pasta, tempura-fried shiso-wrapped icefish, 10-day aged fatty bluefin tuna and the amazing variety of other fish. Plus, the sake pairing presentation by our Host would have been an amazing event on its own.

Chef Kazu, our Host, the Sous Chef and the front of house staff were all amazing. I will definitely return for another meal.

Icca is simply a transformative experience. I have had hundreds of omakase meals at this point and my experience here was one of the very best.

Icca is a sushi temple with almost an entirely wood interior with sweepingly high ceilings. I liked this as this was a departure from many sushi establishments where the ceilings are lower and provide a lesser sense of awe for guests.

I would describe Chef Kazu in three words: craftsmanship, mastery, and showmanship. The atmosphere is lightened from his lively interaction and his ability to communicate with his guests. I always engage all sushi chefs at the counter as I feel it is a vital part of the experience and to add to my limited knowledge of sushi. His willingness to answer my questions without hesitation was a highlight for me, personally.

Our menu included the following: chilled zucchini egg custard, tairagai sashimi, kawahagi with liver sauce, steamed Japanese awabi, awabi liver sauce nigiri, capellini pasta with Hokkaido kegani and uni, Hokkaido wagyu (N34), baby ayu, managatsuo, kinmedai, hon maguro, squid ink sharisotto, iwashi, grilled hotate, madai, botan ebi, nodoguro temaki, otoro, kohada, ishigakigai, Hokkaido uni, unagi, tamago, amadai soup, and corn crème brûlée as the dessert.

Every course that was presented to us held their own and were of the highest quality. That is the key to a strong omakase, where no courses are weak and presented in their most optimal way to showcase both the flavor and texture of each item.

For me personally, the awabi liver sauce nigiri was one of the best bites of food I have ever had. This is not an exaggeration or an outlandish statement from my perspective. The rich, decadent, and umami saturated liver sauce coated each individual grain of rice with a velvety, viscous consistency. This was harmoniously paired with the optimally warm temperature of the rice; which provided an absolutely orgasmic level of ecstasy for the taste buds. For my next visit to Icca, I will specifically request additional pieces of this unbelievable nigiri if possible. Unfortunately, Chef Kazu could not accommodate my request for additional awabi liver sauce nigiri that night as there was a very limited quantity of it.

The other standout dishes included the kawahagi with liver sauce, capellini pasta with Hokkaido kegani and uni, squid ink sharisotto, iwashi nigiri, ishigakigai nigiri, and surprisingly, the corn crème brûlée. Kawahagi, also known as thread-sail filefish, is an exceptionally rare fish with a chewy texture and consistency. The rich liver is extracted and used as a sauce for the thin strips of kawahagi for a somewhat noodle-like experience. The chilled capellini pasta featured luxurious Hokkaido kegani and uni; the combination of all these ingredients was absolutely sublime and a clearly unique item that I've never seen on any other omakase menu. The Italian flair of the menu was continued with the squid ink sharisotto, with the pronounced earthy flavor of the squid ink coating every grain of rice; it paired nicely with the briny, sweet, and creamy components of the Hokkaido uni adorned on top.

For the conventional Japanese items, the two items that I favored the most were the iwashi (sardine) and the ishigakigai. As the hikarimono class is my favorite type of neta, this was definitely a highlight for me. The iwashi was quite large and had the clean oceanic taste and slightly oily consistency from the tender flesh. This was definitely of the highest quality, quality that I have similarly seen from Yoshino and Noz 17. The ishigakigai (Bering Sea cockle) was particularly bouncy but tender at the same time; it was an interesting texture as normally clams can be overly rubbery if not particularly dispatched at the counter or stored properly.

Chef Kazu understands the temperature of the shari is important, and I observed him switching and changing the rice for every two pieces of nigiri. This involves more work, but this is what I have noticed all the very best sushi chefs do. He uses a blend of two types of Hokkaido rice, not of the koshihikari variety from what I was able to understand. The individuality of the rice grains, the acidic sweetness from the Yokoi akazu, the disbursement of the rice grains on the tongue as the nigiri is pressed up against the roof of the mouth, the formation and volume of the shari, and the aforementioned temperature of the shari were all exactly as they should be in classic edomae nigiri.

I would like to say that the "holy trinity" of New York City omakase is represented by Icca, Sushi Noz, and Yoshino. Granted, I haven't been able to try every high-end omakase in the city, but I can confidently say that these three establishments should be on the top of any sushi connoisseur's list. I very much look forward to coming back during my next trip to New York.

Chef Kazushige Suzuki is a master at his craft.

My bf and I greatly enjoyed our time at Icca. I liked that they didn't give you a menu, so you're anticipating what magic will come next. Chef Suzuki did an amazing job highlighting the star of each dish (i.e., the fish, shrimp, scallops, etc). He was also just a great mix of professional but funny, so the meal didn't feel pretentious/stuffy.

The value you get for what you pay is insane!!! It will rank high on memorable NYC meals for me. I salivate thinking about the sweet shrimp, mackerel roll, uni galore and basically all the nigiri.

Icca is a top 5 sushi restaurant in NYC.

I had mistakenly stayed away from Icca because of the chef's association with Sushi Ginza Onodera. Sushi Ginza has a well-priced lunch course but the dinner menu always looked too expensive for the offering. Icca is a way better restaurant. At the recommendation of two trusted friends who spoke very highly of Icca, I decided to make a reservation.

Icca's counter is headed by Master Chef Kazushige Suzuki, an incredibly kind, engaging, and welcoming sushi chef. I was lucky to be seated directly in front of him and we chatted about Japan, restaurants, his work, and sushi throughout the evening. Chef Kazu's personality, combined with the beautifully constructed room and counter, created a calm and relaxing environment that added to my enjoyment of the meal.

Icca is built on three culinary pillars: Edomae sushi, Japanese beef, and Italian cuisine.  While I could have done without the beef and Italian food, they did not distract too much from the main event. I believe that the Japanese otsumami, nigiri, and related items were much stronger than the auxiliary elements even though dishes like capellini pasta with hairy crab and uni still showcase Chef Kazu's skill and creativity.

Throughout the evening, I noticed a number of things that set Icca apart from the other top-tier sushi restaurants in NYC. Chef Kazu used a number of sauces apart from the traditional shoyu and nikiri such as a sake dipping sauce for the sashimi and white shoyu on one of the nigiri. The seared bonito featured the tiniest dot of garlic chives/ramps that enhanced the flavor of the dish. His Ankimo was topped with pickle and a small dollop of Japanese mustard that added a great contrast of texture and flavor. And he featured seafood that I hadn't seen before such as hon ara for sashimi, umeiro (a seasonal snapper) nigiri, and ensui (salt-water packed) murasaki uni from Hokkaido that he served with a pinch of salt instead of soy sauce. If you watch Chef Kazu's Eater 'Omakase' profile video on Youtube you will understand what separates him and his approach from other chefs.

I would be remiss if I did not mention the two outstanding abalone courses that featured the flesh and liver of the mollusk. The steamed abalone in kombu sauce gifts guests with the quintessential chew of the abalone (the gift that keeps on giving) and Chef Kazu's signature abalone liver nigiri is warm, rich, and coats the tongue in umami and delicacy.

Shion specializes in technical excellence and Amakusa seafood, Yoshino specializes in tuna, and Nakaji in uni. Icca specializes in its chef. Visit Icca to experience the exceptional craftsmanship of Itamae Kazu.

The omakase at Icca was wonderful.
Chef Kazushige Suzuki (Executive Chef from Sushi Ginza Onodera) is a warm, friendly man who interacts with his guests throughout the evening.
The food is spectacular.
The labor intensive preparation is obvious with each course presentation.
The room is beautiful and serene. There are 8 seats at the counter.
We had a memorable evening and look forward to returning

The 3 stars has nothing to do with me not liking the concept . It's just not good flavors. It felt very fishy, from the scallops, to the mackerel tartar, the shrimp and fish soup... I needed something in between those really strong flavors. The food needed acid. The braised meat course was delicious. The venue classy. The service impeccable. The chef said hello to the Japanese guests ONLY. Slightly put off by that.  It's of that you don't speak too much English but at least say hello. I don't get this place. The food was not for me and it was very Japanese, though the menu was an Italian fusion. There was 1 pasta dish near the end.  You all just have to try it to see.  The food was beautiful but not my type of flavor. And for the value? You could go elsewhere for much less. I really wanted to love this place. Bon appetit!

Wow, what a dinner at Icca! Chef Kazushige Suzuki created such a wonderful menu and experience for the group. Some of my favorites were the hairy crab with pasta, abalone liver sauce nigiri and the fatty tuna. Every dish was amazing, light while bursting with flavor. We were gifted Japanese seasoning salt at the end of our night, along with a copy of the menu.

I had the chance to partake the collaboration experience between Abe-san (from former Kajitsu) and Kazu-san on 2023-06-19, and I am 80% sure it is the best meal I had in my life. The originality and smooth flow of this meal makes me doubt several times during dining, whether I am in a chapter of some sushi manga.

The progression is perfectly contrapposto-ed between Kaiseki courses and sushi courses. While the light and elegant kaiseki courses soothe the palate and herald the mouse-watering nigiris, the rich and complex nigiris elicits the eye-catching kaiseki. After heavily hit by a sequence of seasonal classics like hamo and hon-mirugai, the meal conludes a fortississimo with the ayu handroll, a combination of the best of both worlds, a culmination in fragrance and umami. Then it recedes with live-cooked mochi and eel in eggroll, exits with boiled matcha.

If I have the appetite, it's an experience for which I would book both seatings. Congratulations to Icca team and I am upping my expectations for future events!

I tried out their Japanese/Italian tasting menu that I haven't seen much in nyc. All the courses were generally good. Here are quick thoughts on the courses:
- White fish cake: starting off strong! The fish cake was crispy outside and soft inside, the combination of the ingredients was delicious. One of my fav of the night.
- White asparagus: the uni was creamy and the asparagus added the crunchy texture that balanced out the uni and the sauce. Solid dish
- Trout tartare: this dish was unfortunately salty for me. Otherwise, the flavor was good.
- Seared tokachi herb beef: I heard this was the beef raised in their own farm in Japan. The beef was not too fatty, not too lean, and so tender. The pickles were surprisingly fresh and flavorful. The dish had different sauces, all of which went well with the beef and pickles. Another of my fav.
- Sauteed scallop: the cauliflower risotto was so so good! The scallop was tasty but unfortunately also a bit too salty for me.
- Penne bolognese: this was nice, but not memorable for me
- Icca soup: served in a stone cup, and very tasty
- Braised Beef: the beef was very tender and the sauce was nice
- Sweet Potato creme brulee: I loved this dessert so much. It was creamy and delicious, and had enough sweetness but not too much. This was served with the roasted green tea.

The place was quiet and peaceful. The service was attentive, even though there was a point, between the seared beef and the sauteed scallop courses, where I had to wait for almost half an hour for the next course. I'm not sure why, but the pace afterwards was back to normal again.

Overall, I liked the food, some more than the other and none of them were bad. I still really enjoyed the experience and recommended this spot!

Amazing omakase from Chef Kazu. The sea urchin was one of our favourites, coming from Vancouver Canada with many omakases this was an extremely enjoyable and completely new experience. We will for sure be returning.
Food: 5/5  |  Service: 5/5  |  Atmosphere: 5/5

I loved this place!  Food was amazing, service was phenomenal. I don't think there was a single item I didn't like!  Got the sake pairing too and had a chance to try some amazing new flavor profiles I never even knew could exist in a sake!

10/10 every time I go!

Chef Kazu-san keeps getting better each time and is one of the best in the city.  

The otsumami including the signature abalone nigiri were all amazing and of course the nigiri is some the best sushi you will have anywhere.

He is very friendly and interactive, add the great sake selections along with the stellar service and you'll understand why Icca is considered one of the top sushiya today!

Probably the best sushi omakase so far!
I also liked that the executive sushi chef served every customer. Sushi quality was amazing. Abalone the chef presented to us was the biggest one I had seen. Restaurant was new and clean. Wine glasses were unique as well. Servers were attentive. Would love to come back sometime!

Review for the Icca Bar.

Overall okay, safe, nothing really wowed yet acceptable.

Tokachi Herb Beef was my fav dish if I have to pick one.

Nice ambiance, attentive service.

Wonderful experience ! Chef Suzuki has excellent skills. We had a lot appetizer, then sushi course. I was so full after the appetizer. The Kani course is amazing ! My husband had wine pairing , manager introduced alot sake culture and information , the pairing is valuable. We had great experience. Will recommend for my friends.

For the omakase experience, I would most definitely recommend. The dishes were impeccable & the chef was quite entertaining. Every dish was worth the wait and my homegirl & I savored every last bite. I felt icca is truly for the "treat yourself" moment if you have the money to dish out for the experience.
A very good Omakse experience.  Chef Suzuki is a master of his art, and the experience was one to remember.  Definitely the best I have had in New York City.

Worst experience ever. Got into Emergency Room due to gastroenteritis the night before this reservation. I tried to contact with the restaurant for serval times and ask for modify the reservation to a later date and I told them I will be able to provide medical evidence.
The restaurant said no changes or refund even for COVID cases. And they told me on the phone that "we are not forcing you to come, and if you have any medical concerns after dine in our restaurant, it's not our responsibility "

This restaurant doesn't give a damn about their customers health wellbeing. With this kind of stupid cancellation policy, If someone who actually tested positive for COVID and they won't be able to modify their reservation, and insisted coming to the restaurant, anyone who is in the restaurant will be at risk.

I went this MICHELIN STARRED the restaurant anyway, and I won't be able to eat seafood due to gastroenteritis. The restaurant offered me NO SEAFOOD OMAKASE and they tried to offer me five pieces of PICKLE SUSHI

After dining at so many Michelin started restaurants in my life, this is definitely one of a time experience.

Review for the sushi omakase by Executive chef/head sushi chef Kazushige Suzuki san, who was previously the head chef at Michelin star Sushi Ginza Onodera NYC.

Already being here four times, just to show how much I love the sushi omakase here.

It's expensive at $400 (2nd most expensive, along with Yoshino), but it's worth the splurge.

In my top 3 sushi omakase in NYC.

Wonderful sommelier and service.

Highest recommendation.

: 10 calendars

Bar menu is wonderful. A Japanese Italian tasting menu for $160 featuring special Hokkaido beef heavily - not as marbled as usual Japanese wagyu but you can taste the beef much better. Great wine list too. Only wish they would offer wines by the glass.

One of the best dining experiences we've ever had! Omakase at the Sushi bar with the Sake pairing was short of amazing. The back room seats 8 comfortably, providing a very intimate atmosphere. Each bite and pairing was better than the next.
Absolutely spectacular experience. Wonderful kind people serving phenomenal ingredients in a pristine, serene, gorgeous environment.

Such a great experience at Icca! We came here for our anniversary. Kazu-san was absolutely welcoming and friendly. The fish was fresh and marinated very nicely. The plates were beautifully plated. I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience here and will be returning soon.

They set up everything just right for you to focus on the delicate pieces of food. We did tasting menu at the bar for our anniversary. The chef and waitress provided superior experience. Highly recommend it!

Icca is the most satisfying and fully-realized Japanese restaurant to open in NYC in years.  It's really that special.

The place is on a stretch of Warren in TriBeCa that could most generously be described as nondescript.  But you'll see the front door immediately, like a welcoming beacon.  And when you walk inside, you're in another world.

The mood is quiet, but not hushed.  The decor is spare and beautiful.  There are sounds of music, water and giddy conversation.  The staff is polished in a way that is remarkable for a month-old spot.  The entire effect is soothing, like you know that -- no matter what your day was like -- you're in a better place now.

There are two menus and experiences at Icca.  The first is a multi-course presentation from chef Hisanori Yamamoto that melds Italian and Japanese cuisines in a new form called Itameshi that's become popular in Asia.  Icca is, I think, the only high-end place to serve it in the city.

Our personal experience was with the 20-course omakase menu created by Michelin-starred chef Kazushige Suzuki (late of Sushi Ginza Onodera).  Ten seats around a bar.  Such an intimate space, a very private-room feel, and it allowed wonderful interactions with the chefs and fellow diners.

A note about our fellow diners:  everyone was there for the food.  Cool people.

The restaurant, as you might expect, flies ingredients in several times per week from Japan -- from Toyoso (aka Tsukiji) and Kyushu, with beef coming from Hokkaido.

The menu changes daily, but our offerings included tilefish, abalone, hairy crab, beef and a parade of super-fresh nigiri.  Dessert was an insane sorbet doused in Yamazaki 12.

There's a beverage menu that features a huge selection of sakes and (primarily French) wines.  But the smart tip is to go with the sake pairing.  It's a super-delicious education, and the sommelier Leila Anruku did a masterful job describing each one.

Speaking of beverages, there is also a fairly awesome selection of Japanese whisky to choose from, along with a bartender who -- like every other staffer at Icca -- has an expertise that is extraordinary.

Yes, dinner here is expensive.  It's an indulgence.  Is it worth saving up for?  Yes.  Is the food as good as it gets?  Yes.  Is it a transformative experience?  Absolutely.

This is a new spot and the 6 course tasting at the bar is incredible. Everything was unique and delicious- a unique blend of Italian and japanese. They don't have a wine pairing but have amazing cocktails and great recommendations for wine that pairs with the food. The bartender is super knowledgeable and the chef is preparing the food in front of you. Highly recommend! Allow about 2 hours for the experience

I'm guessing they are out of business.  Seamless order failed.  Minor Seamless failure.

Update: Actually they did show up.  I wish they hadn't.  This was some of the worst Indian food I've ever had.  Even the naan was bad.

We ordered delivery from here last night.  Delivery was on time and correct but that's about all that was right with it.  Luckily for me I'm vegan and didn't eat the paneer tikka but my wife did and it literally made her vomit within 10 minutes of eating it. The green chutney smelled like human perspiration.  The channa masala was bland and watery.  The navratan korma was spicy but otherwise lacked the aroma and blend of spices that it would usually have when prepared by someone who knows how to cook Indian food.  The owners seemed to have spent more time trying to come up with kitschy Bollywood-inspired names for their dishes than actually learning how to cook them properly.  If you're looking for good Indian food, this is not where you should look.

Now...Il Giglio, this restaurant sets high standards and meets them all. The space is modern, clean, minimalist yet warm. The staff is professional and on point. The beautiful doors open to the street,  had dinner on Saturday night for a great evening.
We started with the complimentary appetizer, which was a nice opening to our dinner. We enjoyed a wonderful vegetable soup, and squid ink seafood pasta for appetizer - shared for the table - wonderful.  The red snapper for entrée was done beautifully as was the grilled veal chop...not to be missed ! It was cooked perfectly. The veal  Osso bucco was also a star! I  must say we were not left wanting in any regard. The manager, server and staff could not have been better, the food was prepared and executed perfectly.
Il Giglio not missing a beat!
Looking forward to returning, would recommend without reservation go and enjoy!

Delicious, fun, hospitable & generous night out at Il Mulino. Delicious food & attentive service. We enjoyed the lentil angel hair soup (zuppa di lenticchie), the leek & potato velouté (vellutata porri y patate), the spaghetti alla vongole (clams), pappardelle alla bolognese and the special fettuccine lamb ragú. All were delicious & Al dente...the way Mama likes it!

We were celebrating two birthdays and the house generously offered 3 Proseccos & a lovely dessert of Italian apple pie ala mode and peach sorbet in a frozen peach. Just a terrific time for us all thanks to Barnabus, Michael, and Donna(?). They were all so warm & made it a terrific night for us.

Looking forward to returning.

Our waiter Eduardo was the best, so so sweet and I loved how he always addressed me first and was very attentive. It was busy but he did a great job and even asked for feedback when we were leaving. Clearly cares about his customers and his job!

It was also interesting because we did get the menus right away, it's kind of a more slow luxury experience where you get some complimentary little apps and bread and then menus come as you enjoy. The app was zucchini chips which were good but had a kick! Also included some hard cheese and salami and honestly for something complimentary was very good. It was a nice change of pace.

We both got the specials (make sure to ask as it seems they have a lot!) I got a fettuccine seafood pasta special with clams, shrimp and scallops and my boyfriend got the osso bucco which was fall off the bone, so tender and delicious! I liked my pasta but his was the star!

Came here for a Saturday night date night. We split the Caesar, chicken parm and linguine il mulino. To start they offer some parm and salami, fried zucchini bites and bruschetta to every table (this was quite good!). While everything was good (portion of the chicken park was HUGE) it felt quite overpriced. Granted yes a nice meal in nyc will cost you a lot, there's tons of other Italian spots nearby for much more reasonable prices and just as good food if not better.

Came here for our 5 year anniversary ! So let me start by saying the hospitality at this restaurant is amazing! We felt welcomed from the moment we walked in the door to the moment we left with our bellies full. They generously bring you different appetizers to try such as bread and some delicious fried zucchini dish. For our meals I had the truffle ravioli and my fiancé had the lobster ravioli. When I say I had to close my eyes for a second when I took the first bite of my food. Hands down the best pasta I've ever tasted. So flavorful and the perfect texture. My fiancé's lobster ravioli was also delicious but I think the truffle ravioli was the star for sure. For drinks we had espresso martinis which I didn't think would be my thing but it was really delicious. It tasted like a nice strong cup of iced coffee (the perfect amount of cold) and I barely tasted the alcohol but it was very strong and I felt it soon. Finally, the dessert. I had a peach sorbet inside of a frozen peach which was such an experience and so delicious. We also got a tiramisu paired with a lovely song from the staff wishing us a happy anniversary! The ambiance is beautiful and everyone is dressed to impress. Perfect for a date night to treat yourself! Definitely want to return again!

Ridiculously dark. They must not want you to see what they're feeding you. Manager refused to turn lights up in spite of multiple tables requesting that he do so. Too many better options than to have to deal with such craziness at ridiculous prices.

I'd go 3.5 stars if allowed. Food is solid to above average but no one in a large group thought anything was spectacular with perhaps the exception of the $48 chicken parm which while good was still $48.  Wine list is extensive but pricey. Inside gets loud when busy.

this place has the best italian food i've ever had (in america)! the service is quick and all of the servers are extremely kind! the place is lively and has great ambiance! i would recommend this place to anyone.

Il Mulino has an upscale vibe to it with white table linens without feeling stuffy. We found our meal to be highly delightful especially the chicken parm. Lobster was good too. Servers were friendly, we got good wine recommendations. Italian food can be tricky for me, I'm super picky but the food here was well prepared and fresh. Good date spot if you want high end Italian food.

My husband and I had a date night here last week. The ambiance is not the same... Soho location feels cozy, but Tribeca is a big, loud room with bright lights and no music. The service was prompt, but lacked the attention to detail you expect for "fine dining." Pasta dish was tasty, but the chicken parm was extremely dry. Overall, I think there are better options at this price point.

Went here last weekend with my wife. It was a cold night and we decided to go somewhere close and we were excited to see it had reopened after a year and a half of living in neighborhood.

Sad to say but the experience was not great. Service was a mess. Took over fifteen minutes just to bring the bottle of wine we ordered and both the apps and entrees were sub par. Everyone expects an over priced meal at il Mulino but at least the food and service is generally very good.

Hopefully it was just the reopen and they will figure it out.

Most likely will not go back unless someone else is paying.

The service is absolutely outstanding. I have been there with friends for drinks at the bar and we have been treated like royalty every time. We have been served complimentary bites the times we've been at the Tribeca location and we keep going back!

I absolutely loved this place. Truly confused where all the haters come from because the food was terrific. The chicken Parm on the bone was unique and flavorful and every dish was served with grace. I can't even begin to talk about the service because it was truly some of the best I've experienced and I worked at the vet restaurant in the entire South. Give this place a try, you won't regret it

Ps the names of the captain and server were Luca and Gustavo. Both very funny, happy, and professional.

We always enjoy Il Mulino and this was our first time in TriBeCa. Easy, fun ambiance, not crowded because it was Sunday dinner. The fried calamari and zucchini were greasy as if they had been taken out and plopped on plates. The tagliatelle was quite good.  Custom cacio e pepe w garlic was not flavorful enough. The Cavatelli was homemade w braised short ribs and parmigiano was delicious, as what the perfect Caesar's salad. The tiramisu was so-so. Young and nice servers.

I had the ultimate dining experience here.  On a Monday evening, the place was quiet and empty.  My friend and I got there close to 6 & we were the only diners. We got a great table, of course we were the only two people in the joint.  Ricardo, our wonderful server, was attentive and so generous.  They gave us extra food for free, brought my friend some amazing wine and didn't charge full price.  Really, I couldn't believe I was in NY.  GORGEOUS & delicious menu.  I will definitely make sure I go back when I return to NY.

This is by far my top favorite Italian place ever. The service is always 20/10 the food, even better 30/10. Truly a great experience all around with the ambiance, food, and service - the perfect tri fecta! Don't pass on an opportunity to eat here!

What a so wonderful dining experience! I came with a group of 6 for a dinner on a Wednesday night. We started the night with burrata -which was fresh and creamy, grilled octopus-a little tough but good nonetheless and of course fried calamari.

I had the Bologense which delicious and one of my top 5-I am a bit of a creature of habit and get rigatoni bolognese whenever I get Italian. It was flavorful and rich. I would have liked a bit more spice. One of the people I was with had the chicken parmigiana and I HAD to have a bite. Top motion and they said it was the best chicken parmigiana they'd had in years.

The highlight of the evening was our server Ricardo who when asked if he could "set something on fire" whipped out raspberries and a hot plate in order to make a raspberry sauce table side to pour on top of our ice cream!

Great service, wonderful food. I'd recommend coming here anytime.

OMG, Il Mulino New York - Tribeca was simply remarkable. Overall, I think this is a great, fun spot. Each and every single thing that we have ordered was extremely fresh and delicious. All of the staff are super welcoming - you definitely feel welcome and looked after. Go enjoy and relax.

We had the prix fixe lunch menu for $29.   The food was generally good with some misses (see below), but the service left a lot to be desired.  Our waiter was pushy about ordering alcohol and seemed visibly disappointed when we just ordered soda.  Also he didn't give us the prix fixe lunch menu without being asked and only presented us the much more expensive dinner menu.  Pretty sure they did that on purpose...

In terms of the food:
- tuna tartare: worst dish of the meal with no flavor
- octopus appetizer:  pretty bland but at least edible unlike the tartare
- branzino: nicely cooked and flavorful
- chicken: tender and flavorful... very good dish
- lemon tart: highlight of the meal... light, creamy and not too sweet
- cannoli:  decent cannoli w/ light filling and not too sweet

I love the original restaurant in the west village but outside of the complementary apps I could not tell this was the same restaurant. Although the staff is very nice -every single order delivered to the table was wrong. Starting with my drink. On a hot summer night it felt like the room had no AC which made matters even worse.
I understand this is a new restaurant but for a 100$ meal they need to do better. Even when the meals were corrected they still were missing components such as vegetables and retuned to the table half the size as originally presented. Disappointed.

Came in this place to get away from the snow with some friends from work, I think they just opened recently, and I didn't its like famous, wow, very clean place, nice long bar, had appetizers from the bar menu and they have happy hour prices, even better.
A lot of Wall Street type guys mixed with Tribeca locals. Really nice mix, they have a girl at the hostess stand that looks like she just came off the runway in Milan, everyone here is friendly and warm,  definitely coming back!

We enjoyed a great dinner here on a week night. I started with the caprese, had the salmon as my main, and finished with the panacotta. I also got to try my friends' dishes of chicken parm, veal, and the risotto starter. The best dish of the night was definitely the risotto! It was perfectly balanced, cheesy heaven. I enjoyed my salmon.. it was cooked perfectly. And the chicken parm was also impressive. The service was really great when I went. Overall, we had a great experience. I'd definitely come back.

I just left the restaurant snd i cant help myself to express myself.
This place is damm good, im was with 4 friends and they wanted italian, wow, we were blown away, they hit with chunks of parmigian cheese, some kind of zucchini and 3 different kinds of bread before taking your deink order, thats hospitality, ive been around snd this place is amazing, was here when it opened and it was like vanilla, looks like someone took notice and step up their gane
We had the.b bRanzino and the  rigatoni, octopus.
Really nice ppl here someone , i dropped my fork and someone's
Was right there ro replace it
I asked how did u know
They said it makes a certain noise
Wow, ill  defenetly be back

I don't want to hit a restaurant while it's down but when we get past Covid-19 the restaurants that thrive will be those that take hygiene seriously.

Pre Covid-19 Il Mulino did not take the safety of its guests seriously. Bartenders take sterile wine glasses out of the dishwasher and then stick their dirty hand and a rag into the glass to ... I don't know what ... contaminate them? I'm pretty sure regulations prohibit this. I also saw bartenders shake hands with regulars and then not wash their hands.

The food is exceptional. It's like Carbone -- elevated Italian American peasant food like chicken parmigiana.

Tribeca needs an Italian alternative to Eataly and Locanda Verde. But after this pandemic ends, Il Mulino needs to dramatically boost staff safety training or else we're better off without it.
81 health code violations. Might be the highest offender on the sanitary conditions list.

I was looking for a clean place to sit and have lunch, I'm a little o c d when it comes to restaurants, walked by this place and looked very clean, decided to sit at the beautiful long bar and have lunch, I had the salmon, it was cooked perfect, very friendly staff, I think they have another one uptown, when I asked the server, he said they have 4 in Manhattan, now I know why, wow, I'm impressed and just made reservations for next week with some friends, I heard they have a great happy hour with Wall Street types, definitely coming back.
The service was outstanding. Wonderful food from the oysters to the chicken Parmesan. A lovely atmosphere and perfect for a party. Really impressed by the meatballs, caviar, risotto and beet salad!

The food here is actually good (4/5). Eggplant Parmigiana and Lamb Raghu were great. They also brought zucchini chips and fresh cheese which were nice touches.

The service however was unacceptable. We went at lunch midweek. To start never had a waiter been ruder when told we don't want drinks with lunch. Then we got eye rolls for asking for the restaurant week menu. During the meal they have a tradition of providing tables with cheese which he forgot until reminded. And finally was quite slow and rude providing a check.

Overall food is good, but would not recommend as the service makes for a negative experience that doesn't justify the high prices.

Was seated at 7:45, had our main course by 8:11 after a round of appetizers. I get it's restaurant week so they are trying to move everything alone, but ambiance, yup that's absent along with service.

Now on to the background of our meal, Il Mulino is a place in the neighborhood and we have walked by several times since they opened in late summer 2018. As a resident who is an advocate of the neighborhood, when I walk by Il Mulino Tribeca any night when it's not restaurant week...well wait for the crickets. The dining room is empty, as well as the bar. So here comes restaurant week and I think that could be a good opportunity to give it a try with limited downside. I'll admit it, I was wrong!

Is the food good? sure it's good, not fantastic but good. But the service was next to robotic. 28 minutes from seating to our entree.

Yes, we ordered off the restaurant week menu. The meatballs appetizers was a single, yes 1 meatball. The table next to us ordered the caprese as an appetizer off the restaurant week menu, and they laughed when they got a quarter or a tomato and piece of mozzarella as an appetizer.

We hadn't even had our bottle of wine delivered when our appetizer was done. It took so long to get our dessert that we asked for the check sans dessert. Still took 10 minutes to get the check.

If you enjoy Italian food in a similar neighborhood, I highly recommend Osteria Morini, Scalini Fedeli, or Locanda Verde. Both have a fantastic menu, with service to match. Don't take my word, just google them.

Unfortunately this outpost of the original Il Mulino has tried to capitalize on the original reputation of Il Mulino on W3. Bottom line what used to be great, has decent food, with a reprehensible attitude and is an embarrassing shadow of what the original Il Mulino on W3 was.

Save your money, check out Osteria Morini, Scalini Fedeli, or Locanda Verde, and the food will be immensely better for the same price.

Left this place in such a hurry. The staff was soooooo rude upon entry. I work in the area, not far from my home. I always went to third street and was excited about this new location. Not now. The guy in the bad gray suit should be ashamed of himself, he's one of the most rude people I've ever encountered. See ya on 3rd street.
Great food and ambiance!!! Chef Bruno makes the best Bronzino! This dish is made to order and I love it....!! The risotto is so delicious!! Luca was a great server!

Second time here.  Don't know what others hav issues with.  The drinks tops? The antipasto and bread plates are excellent.  If you disagree you don't know real Italian.  
The seafood linguine was fresh and done perfectly.

Sadly I was very excited to go there today with some clients and no one was there. That's fine if it's the day before Christmas  but they upsold everything on a mediocre menu and because I was with clients I couldn't disagree. However it was very bad form. This was their chance to do something good and they didn't.

Met a friend for dinner on a Wednesday night. Arrived 20 minutes early and had a drink at the bar. Was greeted warmly by the staff. Decor was impressive and the food was excellent as you would expect from Il Mulino. Great addition to Tribeca!

The entire dining experience was beyond perfect!  Welcoming and attentive staff, incredibly delicious food, and warm ambience.  The meal carried many special moments, meeting Nino, introduced as the Truffle King as he carried the magnificent truffles under a glass jar to the table.  They were superb, layered over a special of the day - pumpkin and ricotta stuffed ravioli (to die for).  Valentina approached our table carrying  the largest block of parmesan I have ever seen.  Big chunks were carved off for us to eat with our bread. The service was outstanding but the food even better.  I will definitely be back!

Wandered in on Saturday night with a friend after seeing Rocketman. No reservation, asked to be seated at the bar, and immediately we had a spot to chill, drink and eat. We each ordered drinks and dinner. Had a fantastic time. Meal service was a bit slow, but the manager and bartender more than made up for that with their attentiveness. The portions here are really large! We could've shared an entree very easily, but now we each took home lunch or dinner for tomorrow. I had the chicken piccata - not floured which was great for me being gluten free and my friend ordered the Parmesan chicken. Extremely flavorful. Split the spinach side, which was equally great. Asked about dessert and ended up getting the fruit with sauce and the flourless chocolate cake. Really just delicious - not too sweet or too dense and the fruit was sublime.

We absolutely LOVED our lunch at Il Mulino in Tribeca. The food was delicious, fresh and high quality. The staff was amazing too. We came to celebrate something very special and our waiter Fabio was so thoughtful in making our experience memorable. He was so nice and took great care of us. He was thoughtful by bringing us extra Italian treats to try too! We will definitely be back to dine with Fabio again. Thank you for a lovely experience!
Rude and unwelcoming staff upon arrival. Not Impressed. Take some lessons from 3rd street. Disappointing.

Service was unreal, from the wine recommendation thru dessert.  Came here for an anniversary meal, and it surpassed all expectations.  Highly recommend to any and all.  The space is awesome, and much more seating than you'd expect.  The bar scene is also lively, solid spot if you ever need to entertain clients or want to take your better half for a pop.

Il Mulino was absolutely fantastic. The service was incredible from start to finish. There were so many people working that were all beyond helpful and very friendly. The prices are quite high, however there are so many delicious complimentary starters that really increase the value of your meal. I had the seafood linguini as an entree and it was one of the best I've ever had. I would highly recommend coming here for a special occasion or a treat yourself type of dinner!

My girlfriends and I live in the neighborhood, we stumbled by accident to this location of il mulino in tribeca,for brunch, we didn't think that they would have a good espresso martini, so we asked for one, after we tried it we had 3 rounds lol, I don't know how they made it but it's the best espresso martini we ever had.
The food-
We ordered off the dinner menu, we were not in the
For the brunch menu, since we told that they are know. For classic Italian dishes, we had the chicken parm which the person taking care of us cut it into pizza slices, Delish, then this s u v pulls up, and who gets out, cristy Brinkley, wow we sat 2 tables away from her, she looks great for 64.
Service-
So friendly and not snooty like most restaurants of this caliber, warm and very acclimating.
This is our weekend spot from now on.

Great service, lots of bruschetta and bread, but food is complete #ripoff. Pasta is ok, cocktails good, just food is 30% higher vs. it's friendly competition.
This is a clear business plan by Il Mulino down to the terribly #fake Italian accents to make lots of $$ with the customer ending up 2nd.

I discovered this restaurant foR the first time years ago in their WEst Village location. It was an amazing experience. We recently went to theTribeca location and were disappointed. It's still a solid place with great service and nice atmosphere. But it's not that unique experience we had years ago. The food was just ok. I'm sure it'll be painful for them to hear but CarmIne's food is  much better and a better value even if service and ambiance are not as sophisticated. Nevertheless I'll give it 4 stars since it's not a bad meal, it's justt not living up to their own benchmark.

Ok, this place is really next level. We were warmly greeted by the front staff and Bar. Excellent martinis and a really thick wine selection. Be ready to splurge or have someone else pay ;) the appetizers were really nice and then we went for it with the Porterhouse. On par with Lugers or any of the other great steaks I have had throughout my life. Pro-tip: even though everything sounds good for the first courses show some restraint as we had a hard time finishing the jewel of the meal which was the steak. Recommended for date or business meeting.

I had the pleasure of dining here with a great group of friends.  We had a great experience.  Marco made us all feel welcome.
The food was on point. I have eaten in several I'll Mulino's and this one does the name justice.
Service was excellent.  The food was delicious and definitely comparable to the West 3rd location.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to my family and friends.

what was not ok ...

$7.00  each for iced tea.... and the manager disappeared when I WANTED TO DISCUSS

My husband and I had dinner tonite .The Caesar salad was very good . The main courses were the red snapper , very nice , and the sole that the waitress described as grilled . When the sole was served , it was soaking in a butter sauce and was sautéed with flour coating .
I complained to the waitress , the sole was put in another plate and came back cold .
I did not want to return it again and I ate it .
I don't think I the restaurant had its act together yet .

We were in the neighborhood step in on a Sunday late lunch with my family I was very impressed what a nice place we were seated prompt great service had a great bottle of supertuscan. Wich our server recomend  the manager was very nice and open  the bottle for us great wine food was out of this world I was happy we had the restaurant for our selfs I ask why was so quiet and there was a Super Bowl Sunday anyway I was very happy so as my wife And family and we are foodies thanks il mulino
Excellent service and very good food. A bit pricey. Nice spot for a business lunch or dinner.
Loved it here. Thank you Nino and all the awesome people who work there. The food and service were fantastic and the staff could not have been lovelier. We will be back!

III L's Pizzeria is just wonderful. Its the ambiance that wins me over here. All so flavorful and just fabulous flavors. The service was also outstanding and everybody was kind. I must say, I'll definitely be back here.

Subpar for NYC pizza. The slices are very thick and bready. Seating area is very small and finding a seat during lunch can be tough. People often ask to sit with you even if you do get a spot (which can be very awkward eating alone with a stranger. But hey, maybe youll meet your soul mate) . Anyways, I do like the $5 lunch special that includes a soda and 2 slices. Cant get lunch in lower manhattan for any cheaper than that.

INDAY!!!! I LOVE YOU!!!

I always look forward to getting Inday for lunch when I work from the office. It's fresh and so flavorful!!! You really can't find food as delicious and convenient as this place.

You just need to try it, I can't even begin to describe!! Plus the staff is always sooo nice and helpful. Also FYI if you order online and create an account you get $5 off your first purchase!!!!!!

Excellent food and fast service.
Today was 2nd eating at this place and food is consistently good...

Ever since the pandemic started, downtown foot traffic has been extremely light, so it was a huge surprise to me when I saw Inday open in the One New York Plaza Shops area.

For the longest time, Thunder Bun had been an occupant at the One New York Plaza Shops, however, at some point, they closed and in came Inday. Honestly, I thought it was a fantastic idea to open an Indian restaurant in the building, mainly to cater to the large population of Indian employees that work here. I would assume that Inday would have a steady stream of business, however it's definitely hard to predict because Inday is a fast food Indian chain after all and I don't know if many people would question it's authenticity.

Anyhow, with the above said, I decided to give Inday a try on the 1st day I saw it. Of course it didn't hurt that if I downloaded their app, I would be able to apply a $7 promo code + $7 app signup credit, so I did like that! The menu, albeit a bit small, consisted of some Indian favorites like Chicken Tikka Masala, Coconut Chickpea Curry, Saag Paneer, just to name a few. In addition, there are small sides like Roasted Brussel Sprouts or Coconut Chickpeas. These are just a few of the things you can order, but there aren't a whole lot more either. However, if you do those few small things correct, it's all that matters, right?

Since I had $14 in discounts, I just went all out and ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, a side of Coconut Chickpeas and a Mango Lassi beverage. In total, it came out to $22, quite the hefty lunch bill, but with my $14 in discounts, it was very manageable. However, without the discounts, chances were I would have kept my bill a bit lower.

So, how was the food then? It was all.....just OK. The Chicken Tikka Masala was decent, but the rice could have been better cooked as it didn't seem fully ready. Flavors were average for the masala. There was definitely flavor, but I've had way better. In addition, the portion was a huge disappointment as the bowl was only half full. For $12.50, I would expect more, especially when other restaurants nearby (Naya Express, Chipotle) are packing their bowls to the brim. I did like the Coconut Chickpea Curry though. It was tasty and, most importantly, there were plenty of chickpeas inside.

Unfortunately, I never had a chance to try the Mango Lassi as they didn't have it. This was an even bigger disappointment than the portion of the Chicken Tikka Masala. I was stuck with drinking their "Lemonaid", which was basically lemonade, with a small kick, in a bottle. Oh, and the Lemonaid was $3 less than the Mango Lassi to boot, so I felt a bit ripped off.

Inday definitely has potential, but I can see why there wasn't a lot of foot traffic here. Most of the attention was still paid to Naya Express and Chipotle. Although Inday's food isn't bad, it's pricey for the small portion and I think most folks question the authenticity of the flavor because it's a chain. They're worth a try, but not sure if they're worth return trips.
Absolutely phenomenal fast/casual restaurant. Solid entrees and great garlic Naan. My go-to lunch spot while I'm in the office

Great find for some delicious Indian eatery. Had a macro bowl with salmon and cauliflower and quinoa. Loaded with beets, avocado, sweet potatoes, chickpeas and sauced with tamarind tahini. Quite good and staff is friendly. The place is clean and plenty of seats. Will visit again!

This is my new go-to lunch place! The flavors are amazing. Besides the delicious food I must highlight the awesome customer service. Sharon has been so nice and welcoming each visit.

I've been several times. The menu highlights for me are the Chicken Tikka Masala and Tamarind Glazed Salmon. Sauces:
The Homemade green hot sauce is a must and the Lemon herb yogurt is delish.

I'm also a fan of the cauli-quinoa. Honestly I really like everything. Came here today with a coworker and we split the kebab and the charred chicken bowls. So good.

On my next visit I want to try the gunpowder potatoes.
One of my fav lunch spots. They are quick and efficient. I always get my order on time even during the lunch hours. Food is delicious and reasonably priced. Highly recommend.

I ordered lunch from Inday FiDi today and everything was absolutely delicious!  The tamarind glazed salmon was cooked to perfection and the garlic naan was so fluffy you could have used it as a pillow.  They never disappoint.
I got the charred chicken via MealPal. And the chicken itself was stale - I threw it in the bin. The salad was beautiful and pickely and yum but the chicken was so bad ! No more Inday for me :(

I don't recommend there falafel chat. Pretty dry and boring. Falafel with some slices tomatoes over rice, just not a good dish. Couldn't finish it. I have had there chicken dishes and they where pretty good. I wish they had better vegetarian options.
Everything's just perfect. Taste is AMAZING and surprisingly cheap for a lunch bowl. 200 times better than DIG/sweet green. For an extra $4 you get a massive side. MASSIVE.
Food is great. Staff are friendly. I highly recommed the Golden Chicken Curry. This place crosses all the checks for me in terms a good lunch spot.

This place really hits the spot! It is real small but has amazing food. Came here to get some lasagna and it was delicious. Friend got the lobster ravioli and said it was good too. I would like to come back to try the pizza. Everything is very reasonably priced.

Not a huge pizza fanatic, unlike dh, but we drove allllll the way down here to try the pizza on a recommendation of a friend. It's a small, old-school pizza shop with NO lighted sineage and a handwritten menu board. The staff was friendly, New York friendly, so if you are from outside of the tri-state area, suck it up, Buttercup.
Dh got a Sicilian and a slice. I opted for the Hawaiian. (YES, PINEAPPLES BELONG ON PIZZA!) Husband loved his pizza and is raving on his yelp as I type this.
Personally, I've had better Hawaiian, but what I did love was the quality of the crust. The pizza crust was firm without being too hard to execute a proper New York pizza fold. It also held its form and didn't flop (which isn't necessarily a bad thing, especially with a piping hot cheese pizza) The pineapple on this slice was obviously canned, and it wasn't grill charred like you can do with fresh pineapple slices. Because of dh, I know we will be back, so I'll try a basic traditional pepperoni or plain cheese slice and try it.
I'll give it 3  because Hawaiian pizza isn't as easy to pull off, but the crust was good, and it tasted good if you don't know what a Hawaiian is supposed to taste like.

Small intimate, old style pizza joint. Limited seating is available on the outside of the restaurant. Courteous staff. They make sure you have everything you need before leaving. I ordered a regular slice and a slice of Sicilian. They offer the standard selection of drinks, Coke, Pepsi, Root Beer, etc. The pizza was delicious, consisting of the right balance of sauce and cheese. The crust wasn't greasy or floppy. I definitely will return.

My boyfriend and I have been on the hunt for the best pizza in NYC for a couple months now. We've been to Soho. We've been to East Village. But did I ever expect to (potentially) find NYC's best slice in Tribeca??

The food: y'all the pizza is AMAZING. As with many places in NYC, you pick what you want from the counter and it gets toasted fresh in a matter of minutes. We decided to get a slice of the bacon pepperoni pizza to split, and it was revolutionary. The cheese pull was divine. The crust was CRISPY. They didn't skimp on the meat, and there was more than enough bacon and pepperoni to go around.

Everything about this pizza just made sense. The only way I can describe it is like the best pizza dream you've ever had come to life.

The atmosphere: this is the type of hole-in-the-wall place where you *know* the food is going to be good. There's a single table and chair inside, in case you want to sit down (but most people take their slices to go). There's some garlic and red pepper flakes on the side too, in a little self-serve station by the door.

TLDR: If you're in Tribeca, Il Mattone is a must visit. This pizza joint is truly a gem, and one of the best kept secrets in NYC.

Il Mattone is a hole-in-the-wall pizzeria on Beach Street. the tiny pizza shop has no seats--it's basically a takeout and delivery joint. it's a little messy inside but the interior is clean. there are small parks within walking distance if you want to eat al fresco and enjoy your 'zza right away. il Mattone has a variety of pies and slices on display-- their menu includes a variety of pasta and sandwiches, too.

while there is no lack of good pizza places in NYC--Il Mattone hits this standard easily and serves up a very good to great classic NYC slice. grabbed two slices for lunch, and the 'zza did not disappoint. the slice is everything you want in the old school New Yorker pizza. the slice is thin crust style--fairly crispy and a little bit of chew in the crust. the sauce is seasoned well balanced between saltiness, sweetness, and Italian spices. a soft  melty blanket of cheese topping it all. all combining to make one delicious slice that will sate the hangriest of eaters. served super hot as i prefer. plain cheese slice, $3 + tip

staff is curt and efficient.

drops mic cuz pizza is life
i out
zzz
Looks closed from the outside, but it's a lie! It's actually open !!! Yummy pizza, highly recommend!

A literal hole in the wall you might miss with all of the scaffolding. Today I was craving an old school ny slice for lunch and il mattone hit the spot. Some tips: if you use credit there's a 4 percent surcharge. A slice is $3 cash. There's literally one chair and one table if you plan to eat there. They offer $10 and $14 lunch specials which in Tribeca is quite the deal. I'll be back.
Hands down my favorite pizza place in NYC. Try the pepperoni & jalapeño slice - you won't be disappointed.
You would have no idea it's there and that's the reason I love this place . Somehow in this small corner they have for a kitchen they are cranking out some quality pies

Are you looking for NY pizza? Your search is over. This place is amazing! I've been eating NY pizza my whole life and this is exactly what my mima brings home when ever I fly back to NY. I was here for a week and ate here 4 times. I went to other places but nothing satisfied the way this does. The owner or main person reminds me exactly of my uncle.
I'll probably be making one last stop before the airport tomorrow! Highly recommend.

Also, side note free delivery! I ordered to my hotel after a long day of work and my order was at my door no more than 10 mins later

I love my neighborhood pizza spot but when I needed them most they let me down!! I had 6 hungry boys for my sons birthday party and they were 45 minutes late for a party where I had to transport them to the movies. Maybe it was seamless maybe it was their staffing but either at I was panicked with hungry kids circling me with dagger eyes.

The next day we ordered a pie with a grubhub delivery. First off they delivered it way quicker than I could have walked there and back. Next, it was nice and hot. Well worth whatever it cost.  
The pizza itself was awesome. Tons of cheese, sauce and sausage. They did a nice job on the pizza. I highly recommend this pizza shop. Very consistent. Good yesterday and good today.
Great little hole in the wall unassuming pizza joint for a classic NY slice. Totally worth the trek to TriBeCa. The crust and sauce are perfection. The staff was friendly. Will definitely be back.

Don't order on seamless!
Food doesn't come after restaurant confirms order and they don't answer the phone.
Waited an hour and a half and never received the order.

The food is always cold  . It's like they don't care about warming up your pizza. If I had a oven this would be a 2 star review because then I could actually warm my own pizza up. The service is okay, some people are nice but one guy made a comment to another about my weight and I heard it. Finally the ambience is awful and I'm pretty sure they are breaking some codes since they are just leaving cold pizza all day on a rack and using their hands to put it on your plate and then not even warm it for you without gloves

I was very excited to try this pizza based off of the reviews, but was majorly disappointed. I'll give 2 stars solely because the dough was fresh and tasty, but the rest of the pizza wasn't good. We got a large pepperoni pizza and ate it fresh in front of the store. The cheese didn't have much pull and the sauce was forgettable. I only had 1 slice because I couldn't bear to eat another.

The storefront is small and you may even miss it walking by the first time, but the slices are legit. The vodka and white slices were quite good and the grandma slice had something about it... dare I say anchovies? Regardless it reminded me of my grandmas pasta sauce and that's enough to keep me coming back. Thanks Il Mattone!
BEST PIZZA IN TOWN.  Worth making the trip over even if you don't live super close.  Family owned with positive vibes every time I go.
Excellent pizza by the slice or a whole pie if you want it, in Tribeca area. Went twice during my last stay in NYC. Would go back. Cheese or Pepperoni won't steer you wrong.

My friends and I were passing around in this area and smelled great pizza! Even though we were not hungry, we had to try it out!!

Pros:
1. Great pizza!! The cheese slice is pretty good; the right amount of sauce and the right amount of cheese. We asked for the pizza to be well done and it was perfect- neither burned nor too soggy!
2. Tried the chicken roll as well (since the name sounded interesting). Turned out to be pretty tasty! Was kind of a calzone filled with mozzarella and chicken and little marina sauce.
3. Accepts credit cards! (important since most slice pizza places in the city don't accept cards)

Cons:
1. Very little space to sit. I think they only have 2 tables with 4 chairs per table. No place/bench to sit outside either.
2. The place is kinda small, so it can get crowded quickly.
Ordered delivery and got a great pizza!  Can't wait to order again.  Crust was amazing!

This was the first place my friends and I ate when visiting NYC for the first time. We wanted true New York style pizza and so yelping was obviously our go-to. We saw II Mattone and one other place that looked up our alley but the reviews and price here were just better.

At first, when we pulled up, we were a bit confused because the inside was smaller than we imagined but we decided to go in anyway. Truly, we were not disappointed. You pick your slices and then they put it in the oven and serve it to you on paper plates. Nothing fancy here. We ate in the shop, as it was only us, but it got busy after we started eating. I ordered a white pizza slice with fresh ricotta on it, pepperoni and the square pizza. Oh. Man. It was SO heavenly. Each piece was cooked perfectly. The crust was crunchy and the cheese was cheesy. The flavors were all there.

I honestly don't even know any other way to describe it but.. this was the best pizza I have ever had. I still think about it and I CANNOT wait to go back. PLEASE visit here. Inexpensive, delicious and the guys who work there are really nice.

Realistically 4.5 stars but rounding up because of the price and the fact that delivery is so reliable from this spot.
