I've ordered a bunch of times to the office and have been very pleased with my order every time - first of all, I'm no stranger to Seamless orders so I always appreciate the nuts and bolts of delivery (i.e. consistently confirms order quickly, delivers within or close-to-within the quoted amount of time, food isn't an absolute disastrous mess when it arrives) and this place checks every box. Furthermore, the price is more than right - pizzas, even with toppings, are super cheap, and can be split between a couple people.

Onto the food - for the most part, phenomenal. I've gotten the calzones a few times and they're massive, filling, and delicious, with ample sauce on the side and a nice blend of cheese. The pizza is always delivered piping hot and is a good size for a small. My one and only big complaint is that this spot does NOT do barbecue chicken well, which is probably my all-time favorite pizza topping: they do a weird mix of barbecue sauce and red sauce that I don't like at all. Besides the barbecue chicken, however, I've been really happy with everything I've ordered.

All in all, will definitely order again. One of my favorite, if not my favorite, spots on Seamless for pizza. Definitely want to try the pasta dishes at some point as well.

Small storefront, unassuming Pizza shop...Pizza how we love - crust and sauce crunchy and smooth...Ordered Catering and the Chicken Parm, Rigatoni and Shrimp were all mouth watering. Friendly and reliable...glad they are close by!
Food was delicious, a quick walk from where we stayed.  The sandwich with mozzarella, chicken, spinach and pesto was amazing.  Toasted perfectly. The plain pizza was good, sandwich stole the show.

I love NY pizza!  This place will renew your faith in what it means to be a slice of pizza in the city.  There's no place to sit at II Mattone, it's just a grab & go place.  I stopped in, ordered a couple slices and left.  No fan fair, no ambiance, no special services.  Just GREAT pizza at a good price.  Exactly as it should be...

Whenever I'm in NYC, I sample as many pizza joints as possible.  The prices are all over the place and some places have lost their love of pizza and it shows.  

This place stay true to the pizza!
Ok pizza, nothing special. Looked like it was sitting out for a little while. Obviously better than most pizza in the US because it's from NYC

Picked up lunch from here in late December and was very pleased. Order: gluten free margherita pizza with hot sausage, sun dried tomatoes, and spinach. As a celiac my #1 question is whether the food is truly gluten free - in my experience here it was. I was impressed by the quantity added for each topping and thought it was a terrific deal for the price - in any location, but especially in NYC. Will certainly come again next time I'm in town!

This was a really excellent slice of pie. The cheese was oily, garlicky, and had just enough balance to bring in some freshness.

The ingredients all tasted very high-quality and packed a very strong flavor punch.

The crust was soft and chewy and played up the flavors of the cheese and sauce very well.

This place is a gem. This pizza place is far better then the famous pizza places in the city. Super amazing pizza slice with an amazing crust.

Pros : crust of the pizza is just too good
        :  perfect amount of sauce which makes pizza      just so delicious.(hungry already)

Cons: very small place with the sitting of hardly 4-5 people.

I came here for dinner after work on a Wednesday since I was in the Tribeca area and there were not many options.  The place was pretty small and there was limited seating, like 2 small tables really.  I ordered two cheese slices to go since the place was crowded.  The pizza was made well.  The slices were hot and fresh.  It had a flavorful sauce and a lot of cheese.  There was a good chew to the crispy crust.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.  They take credit cards, no minimum which was great.  I would come back to try their other pizzas if I'm ever in the area.

I've had pizza several times here, as I work around the corner. The pizza is pretty solid..  service is always fast.   I've also had a chicken pa rm here, and that was amongst the best I've ever had...

I was craving some Italian food and opted for this spot because their prices are pretty reasonable. I got the chicken parm with a side of rigatoni pasta in vodka sauce, mozzarella sticks, and a side of broccoli rabe. The chicken parm and pasta was a good portion for a meal. The chicken wasn't too juicy and the breading wasnt crispy anymore but it was covered in sauce and the cheese was melted well on top. The rigatoni was a bit too thick but it was still pretty good with the vodka sauce. The mozzarella sticks weren't as good as I had hoped since it lacked that cheese pull. The sautéed broccoli rabe was pretty salty and cooked with lots of garlic but they do give a good portion. I also tried their garlic knots which were pretty good. Overall, pretty good Italian food and would order from here again.

I was in NY for work and was aimlessly wandering around the TriBeCa neighborhood when I came across this place. It's a small little joint but I was greeted with a warm welcome. I was that obnoxious new customer who wanted to read everything in their overhead menu before deciding on something basic, but they were very friendly and patient with me. There were many different pizzas on display and they even offered cauliflower crust pizza, but since I had pizza the night before, I opted for the meat lasagna instead.

I was served a huge portion of lasagna along with some nice toasty bread. Let me just say, I definitely didn't leave hungry (I couldn't even finish my food). What I loved most was seeing the woman (I think the owner?) interact with the other patrons. Customers made sure to personally say hello and goodbye to her, she asked her regulars who they and their families were doing, and she even sat down with another customer to chit chat with him when there was a short break in the line. This place is ran by good, honest people serving their community. Seeing how the owner interacted with the patrons will definitely bring me back here when I'm back in town.
Decent pizza. It's a tiny space and the owner doesn't wear a mask - didn't wear one before vaccines either...  if that thing matters to you (I think it should)

Got the penne with vodka sauce. Small portion, but granted given that it's the lunch special for $10. Ordered through the app Ritual and was able to pick up the order in a timely manner. Been coming here for a variety of menu items, but the penne vodka has always been a favorite among myself and my co-workers. Good place if you want authentic Italian food. Feels always like a hustle and bustle place given the small restaurant size and crowds during rush hour.
Definitely a must stop by! Great service, great food, great price, and a great quick meal. I got a margherita slice, cheese slice, garlic knots, nutella calzone, and cannolis and all were fantastic.

Finding good pizza in Tribeca is a difficult task, and Mattone fills that void.  It's affordable and the toppings are fresh and delicious- no called mushrooms here! Their crust is thin and crispy but also denser then most. Sauce is a little on the sweet side, and the vodka sauce slice is solid.

They also have a board with $10 and $13 lunch specials with everything from salads to pasta to heroes. Service is courteous.

Now the place is small. If you want to eat there plan on sharing one of 8 seats at 2 tables trying to not make eye contact with a complete stranger while you stuff your face.
Fantastic pizza!  I had the grandma slice and they add fresh basil olive oil and grated Parmesan.very friendly staff. Definitely coming back!!

Admittedly, I never went into this place until I got Mealpal because it just looked like a nondescript pizzeria from the outside while I was on my way to pick up my salad from Sweet Green.  However, they offered some delicious looking pasta on Mealpal, so I ordered it.  Very delicious and good size portions, unlike some other stingy restaurants on Mealpal.  They also have some decent lunch specials for $10 and $13, so I will be coming back.  I like to have a choice when it comes to lunch.

Writing this for management to see so they can correct this issue.

We really like this place and order from here every week.

We got a pizza yesterday - 2.12.21 and maybe for the second time it was quite subpar. worst I have ever had in NY.

1) dough was not cooked through

2) sauce was not sweet

3) ingredients were thrown on it randomly - one slice would have 5 pepperonis and another only 2

4) spots were missing sauce and other spots were missing cheese

It felt like a new chef in training was working last night.

Please fix so we can continue coming back and ordering from you.

Thank you

The reviews did not disappoint!  We wanted our New York Pie!  We walked over a mile that morning to stand in line just to get our slice on.  And we were so glad we did! The people lined up to order in the crowded space, and they shuffle around while they wait for their slice selections to be heated in the oven- most take their food (lots of pastas on the menu as well) but we sat at one of the tables.  SO GOOD!!!!!  Crisp, thin,, not greasy, not overloaded, just perfect.
Solid slice of pizza, great place to grab a slice. A native New Yorker told me to try this place and it did not disappoint.

I usually get the penne vodka pasta and I love it. Today I used mealpal for lunch and got a chicken parmesan sandwich and it was quite good for mealpal. It's usually pretty quick (under 10 minutes). Overall, Il Mattone is a great lunch spot and I recommend it. They have multiple lunch specials each day for 10 dollars.
The food is really good there, they even have gluten free pizza. My kids love it and friends always ask where the food came from.  If there prices were a tad bit cheaper I would order more often.

Il Mattone is a lovely place. Firstly, the price is hard to beat. Il Mattone has an incredible Cannoli, this was my very first time trying it here, and I was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. The service was also fabulous and every one was kind. Love them, will be back again and again.

What a wonderful surprise. Il Mattone pizza is fantastic- their crust is what dreams are made of. The sauce needs a little tweaking- and if they did my fiancé said would be "the best pizza". Doing the pizza gods work there.

*we both are from the tri-state area so we KNOW

I ordered delivery to my apartment, an order or mozzarella sticks and an order of garlic knots, both with a side of vodka sauce (Sunday scaries meal). The mozz sticks definitely did not disappoint and the half of the  garlic knots were delicious, accompanied by a really great vodka sauce. The other half, however, were so burnt they were inedible. Would order again with special instructions for properly cooked garlic knots. Simple quality control and this place would be solid.

Ordered a meatball parm hero. The bread was generous but the meatballs paltry and there was virtually no cheese on the "parm" sandwich. See photo. Three tiny meatballs (shown with quarter for scale), each cut in half and spread across a 10" roll. $10 for the epitome of a Nothing Sandwi your money and just get a slice instead.

As someone who frequents TriBeCa and isnt repulsively wealthy, I was SO happy to come across Il Mattone. I didnt think takeout slices still existed in this part of town, or that they would be any good if they did, but Il Mattone has amazing slices, good variety, seats!, and normal prices. I've had the mushroom, grandma, and sicilian - each is delicous. Better mushroom slice than most places. Solid crust, sweet chunky sauce, and good quality cheese. Can't ask for much more. They also have pastas and sandwiches as lunch specials all under $15. I'm so thankful to take refuge here at lunch break, with a couple of slices, root beer , and less than $10 spent

Great theater, comfortable yet regal and modern feel, and clean bathrooms.

They food is good! Tried the brussel sprouts and they were very creamy and filling.

The seats in the first row are not overwhelmingly close.

Even if the movie you see is bad, the theater experience and this theater makes it worth it.

First timer experience -

Def love the couple seat privacy. You can have little discussion without disturbing the neighbors.

Recliner was comfy but it makes awkward sounds as you recline and back due to the sticky upholstery material.

Here comes the glitch - we ordered the popcorn and drinks at the concession, it was 5-10 min wait for the popcorn. Ok sure we will come back to get it. (Totally forgot we came to the place we could order in the theater!) 15 min later, we went out to pick it up, it wasn't ready yet (movie has just started), little after, popcorn was out but was told that butter is another 5-10 minutes wait, is this a joke?!! The staff in theater was kind enough to get butter for us even though she told us she couldn't help us with the concession order. And later we were told that the concession suppose to check our ticket and NOT let us order outside.

What a confusing first timer experience.

From now on, I'm seeing every move at this location. I'd rather pay a little more trusting that everything about it will be as great of a time as we had here.

It was my partners bday weekend and I had him on a scavenger hunt all over the city since our plans to visit  Scottsdale Arizona got warped by a canceled flight. He wanted to see Mission Impossible and if I'm going to have to sit through damn dear 3 hours of a movie, I need comfort.

We were lucky to get a pod in the front row. For those who've never been, the pods are a two seater reclined big comfy leather couch that allows pairs to be super close and extra comfy. We love them. You can take off you shoes, completely curl up and snuggle.

We ordered our popcorn, some drinks, coffee and candy to make out time what we needed it to be. The customer service was warm and efficient even when but seemingly got busy. Workers kept pace with the customer demands and lines moved swiftly.

Overall, we loved it. The only challenge is finding parking or committing to pay at least $50 for 2-3 hrs. Bar none, the best movie experience you can have locally.

This was my first time going to the movies at IPIC theater. I love every single minute of it. It's a beautiful movie theater with a restaurant and full bar on the third floor. The service is amazing with friendly staff members. With premium tickets for $30, you get a server with full service. The prices are reasonable and affordable. I ordered a margarita and chicken tacos, with truffle fries. The fries were delicious, but the tacos were bland.

Will definitely visit again.

- more like 3.5
- parking isn't the best
- get there early if u plan on eating
- they make you pre order, then u have to leave during the movie to pick up your food
- the food line was pretty long on a Sunday summer afternoon
- apparently if u buy premium ticket, u get serve, and u don't have to deal with the aforementioned problems
 I overheard this, but cannot verify
- there's plenty of fun activity after the movie
 You can eat and drink plentifully without having to do so, during the movie

A group of us came to IPic to see the new Barbie movie. The theater had a lot of photo opportunities with a Barbie box and background. The theater had a bar where we got drinks. We also ordered food. Since we were sitting in the front of the theater on the beds we couldn't have a server so we had to order ourselves and wait for the food. The beds were really close to the screen as well so I won't be reserving those seats ever again. The theater was huge and really clean. I enjoyed the food. Right outside the theater was the Barbie cafe so that was really nice. Overall, it was a fun experience.

I like this theater a lot. It's in a great location - especially ideal if you're looking to grab a drink before or after your movie.

I've come here a few times and have ordered food in the theater just once. I'm typically a grab-your-popcorn-and-drink and bring it to the theater kind of girl, but I wanted to switch it up one night when my partner and I were on a date, so we sat down during previews and put in an order for food. To be honest I can't remember what all we got, but I can second the (many) reviews that don't rave about the quickness of the service. It took a while to get what we ordered, and if they forget something, it takes a while to resolve or get what you asked for. It's been a while since I ordered food so I would do it again, but would absolutely arrive early, get seated, and put in an order right away so you're all set for the movie.

The seats themselves are great. Comfy, nice, and the little pods are great for a date. If you're going to see a movie solo, it's a bit weird to me personally to get one seat within a pod, so I've chosen the second row with standard seating in that scenario.

Overall I like this theater and will definitely come back! Prices are good, sound and visual quality is great, and the overall experience is solid.

10 10 10 10 across the board the design is well out to give classy and classical with a modern twist..the staff are accommodated they are always ready to help you get around and to your seats. The servers are excellent to be able to come in to give orders in the dark takes so much patience and skills....I loved my server when I saw The Little Mermaid ‍  and the manager was very helpful when my showing was canceled due to un control weather conditions made me feel like all wasn't lost....I enjoy the couple seating with recliner seats they give blankets and pillows and it's really cozy not sure you want to be too cozy cause good drinks and food that they served was delicious and I almost didn't want to leave but I will return to watch a new movie there everytime so worth it all. Great dinners upstairs in the Tuck Room more classiness with a rustic gastby vibe. Always a pleasure to be grown and sexy and watch a good movie on a date night...highly recommend

Always get your tocket in advance for a good seating

Movie food is average definitely needs an update or a real kitchen manager on duty. Seemed as if the shift manager was running every position. Bathroom is on 3rd floor.

Seats are comfy and place is always clean when we come

One big problem we had at iPic though was that there was missing food and after multiple attempts to get that food, it was to no avail. The atmosphere though is comfy for a dine in theatre. The food, we did end up having was medicore.

Shirley Temple (82.5% | B) - A simple non-alcoholic beverage mixing sprite and grenadine. The acidity from the grenadine mixes well with the sweetness of sprite; the only point of improvement here to make is the presentation can be elevated, especially coming out of a bar.

Impossible Burger (72.5% | C) - The impossible burger was a surprisingly juicy and flavorful burger despite being vegan, and it was really pleasing that the burger did not have any funky taste that comes along being a vegan substitute. The fries, on the other hand, were just rather dull.

My friend and I watched Fantastic Beasts: Secrets of Dumbledore here. I purchased our tickets online and selected General Admission, which was only for the first couple rows, and cost $15 + $2 processing fee. The VIP seats were $25, and this is the option to choose if you would like the food to be brought to you.

The interior of this theater is really lovely with cool artwork and plush couches in the lobby area. I just wasn't a fan of the placement of the restroom, which was up the escalator and through the Tuck Room restaurant.

For my meal, I ordered Red Velvet Waffles with Fried Chicken, as well as Truffle Parmesan Fries. In total, this was around $35. Once our food was ready, we brought it to our seats ourselves. Even though we were in General Admission seats, they were still pretty comfortable and there was ample room for the food. The Red Velvet Waffles were delightfully crunchy, slightly sweet, and made even yummier with the bourbon maple syrup. The Fried Chicken was wonderfully crispy and well seasoned. Also, it was boneless, which I appreciated. In addition, I enjoyed the Parmesan Truffle Fries, which tasted full of potato goodness, with a satisfying crunch. The Parmesan flavor mingled with the Truffle worked together beautifully.

The screen was humongous, the picture crystal clear, and the sound was excellent. I'm glad I was able to experience this theater and its delicious gourmet food options. I might return to treat myself at some point, but won't be back anytime soon, due to this place being on the expensive side.

I first reviewed the one upstate NY. This is the only theater I'll go to when I rarely go. Love this brand. Love the unique appeal each location offers. This one is closest & located in the best area. The service is always great with such friendly staff that cater to you & treat you kindly. It's 98% clean at all times I've gone.
Prices have always been fairly competitive, so I prefer here over anywhere else that's prone to be sticky, dirty, smelly, etc. this theater I've only ever seen classy individuals at. Never experienced issues.
Food is only decent but somehow I do always feel the need to buy something here regardless. The vibe simply requires it.
The seats are practically perfect if you ask me! I've tried them all.
My only issue is the changing menu items. Because I only go once in a blue moon, an item I saw on a Yelp menu could sound like the best but I go & it's no longer sold. That's when I just buy a small popcorn & save my dollars lol...bummer.
Go, enjoy!
Best seats ever. Food's a little pricey but nevertheless delicious. Reclining adjustable seats with table in the middle, cup holders on the side.

Love the theatre here it's on Fulton st so near
financial district of Manhattan. The theatre itself is great- staff seems friendly at first impression. Unfortunately it's run down. Blankets smell bad- and menus are dirty. Legit they scribbled on all of the menus (many foods not available). The food comes at once - I got my dessert with my popcorn (why?) My sweet potato fries and popcorn was stale- Literally looked like they took it off other peoples plates. I still paid for the food - except the dessert I sent back . We also ordered seltzer water and it never came - waitress didn't even realize I kept having to call her during the menu to complain / fix the bill. I would be back for movie but the kitchen is run down. I was scared to even send food back bc I didn't believe they would be able to fix it.

Updated review:

It was just okay. I came here to see Black Panther 2 and I wanted to be comfortable because it is such a long movie. Whenever I come to iPic I get the buffalo chicken spring rolls, and this time around they were not good. There was nothing crispy about these spring rolls. In fact, they were just doughy and luke warm. I also tried the gochujang wings were just okay. The wings were fried a little to hard for me and were a little dry. For the length of time it took for my food to come out I would figure things would be hot and fresh. For my drink, I got an Arnold Palmer which wasn't great as the iced tea was unsweetened. The lemonade portion was okay but the unsweetened ice tea just made the drink taste watery. Not pictured is the chocolate chip toffee cookie which was amazing. It was warm, chewy and had the perfect crispy texture edges. I would go back just for the cookie. Overall the experience was just MEH. Not sure if the pandemic changed the quality control, but it just wasn't what I experienced in the past. I think I'll keep going to the Fort Lee location.

IPIC FOOD WAS BLAH.  I had to send my fries back which is why they are not pictured here.  They were like cold and then heated up to seem fresh.  I expressed that to the waitress and it was like she questioned me and then touched the container they were served in as to say they are hot.  Ms.  Please dnt question a customer.  It took an additional 10 or so mins for a replacement to come but they were new and you could tell the difference.  To be honest by this time I was turned off and the turkey burger's bun was soggy and not appealing to me anymore.  It has so much sauce cheese on it, it immediately became a wet bun and not a burger bun.  Overall bad food experience but the movie "WOMAN KING" was 10/10

IPIC is definitely one of the nicer theaters I've been to (for reference, I've only been to AMC and some local ones in Virginia lmaoo). After picking up our tickets, we went to the second floor to grab some food. My boyfriend ordered a burger and I ordered the shrimp avocado wrap. I did not expect the wrap to be as healthy as it was LOL. The wrap featured lettuce and shrimp in a spinach wrap with a bit of pesto. I swapped the fries for some green beans, although they still gave us a side of fries as well. Definitely felt like a healthy queen in the theater. My only complaint was the food felt a biiit overpriced, both items cost around $45 post-tax.

The theater features pod and individual seating so you can grab your boo and cuddle up together during a movie. There's a table in the middle as well which you can put your food/drinks on.

Overall, I had a good time at this theater and would come again!

I truly used to love IPIC NYC. My fiancée and I have visited about five times in the past few months. We saw Antman&the Wasp , Creed III , Scream IV , SHAZAM and Woman King just to name a few. The ambiance is great. The cleanliness has took a toll for the worst. The seats don't feel cleaned and you no longer a blanket for yourself during your film even though it gets cold. Additionally service has been FAIR. The staff tries there best to accommodate but the food has been so horrible as of lately. I've had ice cold nachos come out every time. Lukewarm french fries that taste microwaved. Like just gross as of lately. If I choose to watch a movie at IPIC I won't order food at all because it has been completely gross.

I'm hoping that management fixes this and they turn things around.

A/c not working yesterday in theater.  When asked the server said the manager told her they hav no control.  Wouldn't refund or anything.

Food ordered doesn't get served until halfway into movie.

Over charged for food. Alcohol is so overpriced we decided to drink water.  

Our suggestion is if you go, don't go to eat.  Popcorn fine but they have padded the bill significatly for alcohol and food.

Not much to say here honestly. I've been coming to this location since 2019 but this is my first time writing a review about it. Honestly the only time I had a problem was when we had a very rude and impatient server but honestly I never saw her again after so who knows if she even still works here anymore.

I didn't take a picture of the drinks but I had a coke and my bf had a Shirley temple.

Our goto is the Chicken Nachos we literally get it every time we come. It usually looks more esthetically pleasing than the picture below but still taste very good. You can get steak instead but I believe there's no other meat option. We don't get the steak because it's too chewy and never works out.

Other things we've had in the past before that's not in the pictures:

Mahi Fish & Chips: are the BOMB.COM like so delicious! Honestly I should of ordered it today but my bf was dead set on getting 2 Chicken Nachos since you get so much and he's a bottomless pit hehe.

Buffalo Chicken Spring Rolls: also very tasty it comes with a blue cheese dip. I definitely recommend trying that out

Crispy Mozzarella: If you love mozzarella sticks you'll love this because it's literally a bigger version of it and the marinara sauce that it comes with is good which is a big deal because a lot of people actually are not good at making that particular sauce for some reason lol

Chicken Wings: *DON'T EVER GET THE WINGS* it's never seasoned properly and lacks flavor. Extremely bland... You'll just get mad at yourself for taking the chance. Trust me.

Popcorn: Okay so this is very important...  you HAVE to tell them to add butter to it or else they won't do it... I know it's weird but you have to because there has been back and forth about that in the past in my personal experience. They also have different powders to make it taste even better like Cheddar & Churro powder. I get the cheddar powder and actually like asking for nacho cheese to dip it in since I'm a cheese head lol

They spray and wipe down the seats after each movie which gets an A++ from me because I really don't see a lot of places doing that.

The bathroom is very clean and spacious with MANY stalls. There's always soap in the bathroom (as it should be but you'd be surprised) and the water has a motion sensor installed so you don't have to touch it to turn it on.

Cons: I've been coming here for years and every time I take the escalator to the bathroom it's ALWAYS sticky on the floors. And I mean every time I come here. I don't know why that's a consistent thing but it is. When I leave the place I make sure to wipe my feet on the mat thoroughly because no one  has time for that when they reach home. We don't like sticky floors in our house that's a no no! Lol

::Overall::  This is our favorite place to go to for popular movies or movies me and my bf or friends are equally excited about. And also when we want to feel fancy with assigned seating. That's why I've never been to Alamo Drafthouse I know it's the same concept but you're still sitting next to strangers like a regular theater. Where as in IPIC you're in your own little "Island"  (section) it's a little more intimate. Great for hanging out with your bestie and also a nice "dinner/movie" date with your significant other! And if you don't want to watch a move and just want to eat on the upper level where the bathrooms are there's a restaurant called "The Tuck Room" with a beautiful view and nice seating!

Check it out and tell me what you think! Enjoy! ^_^

Great place to go for the overall movie experience!

We had the Premium Plus seats which recline and are very comfy.  We enjoyed the movie while snacking on the Fully Loaded Tater Tots and the Truffle Fries (both excellent)

Jayda was our server and she was friendly and very efficient in getting our food order placed and delivered.

Very happy to be going to this IPic as we become more comfortable in returning to going out to see movies.  They also properly check for the vaccination status of the guests which adds to our comfort level.

I've been wanting to go to IPIC for the longest and finally happened to watch Spider-Man. Make sure to pre order tickets since it sells out quickly, especially if you wanted the pod seats. It's hard to get street parking so you have to park in the lot which cost us $45 to see Spider-Man since the movie is longer and charged us by hour.

When we arrived, we went to scan the tickets and the employee told us the theatre number but didn't tell us where since there are multiple floors. We got lost since we had to use the restroom on the third floor and the theater was in the second floor.

We sat in our seats with a blanket. The place is really nice with the cup holders on the side and the table in the middle. We ordered our food and got :
-cheddar biscuit
-churro popcorn
-fried mozzarella
-tuna with crispy rice
-Arnold Palmer
-Shirley temple
-chocolate mousse
-chicken & red velvet waffles

Everything was good except that we didn't receive the chicken and waffles. I asked if was coming out and said they just sold out. If I've known that it was sold out, i would have tried out another item since it was our first time.

Overall it was good and would come back here cause it was a nice set up.

I've been a good member of IPic since it opened in 2015. The changes are been very noticeable. Gold/Platinum members used to get free small popcorn, well that's no longer a thing. When you got to your seat, they used to have sparkling water waiting , they stopped doing that too. You do get 10% off your bill as a Gold/Platinum member, but check your bill because the servers often don't give you the discount. Now they have changed the food menu, which is a good thing. But when I went this past Friday (Beast) they no longer had drink shakers. It much more cost effective to buy the shaker for $38 than 1 drink for $13. Hopefully, they bring it back. But I love the privacy of the movie pods to sit in. Nobody walking back and forth in front of you. And because these movie tickets are $25/ea, there are too many kids at this theatre. It's the perfect date night.
Simply Put do not spend any money here please I'm warning you HORRIBLE customer service
All I will say is we ordered popcorn and never got our popcorn. Go to Alamo or Nighthawk instead. This place is a joke.

Lovely theater - pricey but a nice expierence with an eclectic menu of food choices. Tickets are $25 but seats fully recline, include a full table, and blankets for added comfort. For the food we ordered a large popcorn and steak fries both were delicious and very well seasoned. Each theater is pretty small so definitely book tickets in advance!

I went to see Spiderman 6/1/23. Took my 2 kids and was excited to see it in iPic. The place was nice but serviced sucked. My kids had to wait 40 mins before we could get their lemonade.  My husband had to ask for supervisior to complain but Supervisor Bri didn't help at all.   The covering manager Ms. Sabrina came and she was Awesome. She apologized and help us with our issue and got my kids their drinks. If it wasn't for Sabrina and my kids there, I would of walked out and never came back.  She even came back twice to make sure we were okay. Ms. Sabrina thank you again because if it wasn't for you I would never come back.

When movie ended Assistant Manager Kris listened to my concerns and gave us comp tickets to come back to watch the movie we pretty much missed. i want to thank Kris and Sabina for all your hard work and dedication. Making sure my family got the best customer service. I would  give so-called supervisor Bree DONKEY OF THE DAY! For her terrible customer service and also the waitress that was servicing my family.

It's really pricey at $25 per seat for the reclining seats, that have menu service.

I'm assuming from the price tiers that the less expensive seats don't offer that, and just offer popcorn, etc.

This is a multi level restaurant situation, with a LOT of seating.  Some of it on the 3rd floor has booths that look out onto South street seaport.

We came on a holiday Monday morning for an 11:30am show.
Our food option (sliced prime rib sandwich) took a long time to pop out (about 1 hr), I think because the area that was responsible for that menu item, didn't get going until around 12noon.   No biggie, I wasn't starving, but that's long.   The food was ok with the salty fries.   Didn't knock my socks off, but at around $30 total, it wasn't too bad.

The staff and our waiter was really nice and accommodating.  Everyone was.

We bought tickets online, and then you check in at the front desk, and they pop out your ticket and tell you your theater number.

Pick your seats wisely.  I'm a bit tall at 6ft, and with my seat fully extended, my feet hang over a bit.  We were in the front row of what I'd say is the balcony, and with my feet hanging over, people were walking past me, bumping into my feet.  It was annoying until everyone got settled.
No biggie, but if I'm paying $25 per seat, then I'd rather that not happen.

Some of the other pods are more insulted from that (i.e. no walking path in front of them.)  I'd pick those if I ever return.
Also, the sound is really loud!  I don't mind that, I'm like a "home theater" kind of "crank it up" person... but if you're with someone that gets rattled by that....take that into consideration.

Overall, a different level experience if want to pay a premium price.

Great concept, poor execution. Glad I tried it, but I won't bother again or recommend it.  No one who works here seems to care about customer service, from our check-in to food/drinks to seating. There's nothing "luxury" about this theatre or service you get while you're there. Grab your favorite bottle of whatever and go to your normal movie theatre.

Definitely my go to movie theater of choice especially when I'm seeing a blockbuster movie. Ambiance is nice and comfortable clean but the food has really fallen off. The more I visit the less appetizing the food gets which is disappointing. They have good dishes on your menu but the simplest thing taste horrible. I had the wings and there were over cooked and salty I only ate 2. I also had the tuna over crunchy rice that rice was as hard as a brick and no flavor. My partner had the chicken tacos very bland. The only thing that was good was the chips and guacamole. The guacamole was surprisingly fresh. I had the lemon berry mule which was well done. If you want a comfortable movie experience and secluded from people with nice drinks it's good but the food not so much.

I can't believe this is a theater! It's in a great location, there's beautiful art on the inside, the bartenders and staff are wonderful. The actual theater is clean and all orders got to us quickly. Great experience

The movie theater is clean spacious. The chairs in the pod can recline back; it also gives a romantic feel because it's private. The waiters and customer service was great and attentive. The food was good it's not 5 stars but good enough to eat and enjoy. One of the best movie theaters ever. It pricey but worth it.

Once you go luxury, you can't go back!

Weekday - $17
Weekend - $25

We came here on a Wednesday night to watch Shang Chi and had the best movie experience. We purchased movie tickets ahead of time to reserve our spots. Once we arrived, the cashier checked our vaccine card and tickets. We headed to third floor for the restroom. Restroom was very nice and clean. Then we headed back to second floor to our movie theater. Grab a blanket right before going into the theater, it's right outside. You can't miss it. The blanket kept us cozy and warm during the movie.

If you're seated at the bottom, you need to walk all the way up then it will lead you to the stairs to your personal pod. We didn't know and had to go back around. haha! Once seated, the server came over and introduced himself and took our food / drink order.

Omg, the seats were super comfy. Recline seats! The personal pod blocks you from the people around you, so it feels like you're the only one there watching the movie. The surround sound system was very nice and clear.

Overall, 10/10. Highly recommend!

You ever find something so next level that you tell yourself that you've been living a lie your entire adult life? Yeahhhh this movie theater is that. Now I've been to a number of Dine-In theaters but nothing like this.

Let's start with the inside, ohhhhh man it's beautiful. As soon as you walk in you are greeted by 2 employees on the 1st floor before you can even access the other floors. The employees are very welcoming & everyone was wearing masks. It's always best to book your tickets way in advance since it's not 200 seats like some other theaters. The second floor is where all of the theaters are but we'll get to that. What you need to be concerned with is the 3rd floor which is their restaurant (The Tuck Room) so you can get a little tipsy while waiting for your theater to open. Try to arrive 1-2 hours early to enjoy their happy hour & drinks. IPIC has a full bar & the bartenders absolutely know what they are doing. Every cocktail was perfect. You can always tell how good a bartender is by how their old fashioned tastes, it was delicious.

After I had a few drinks I headed to the theater. All seats are reserved so make sure you pick a good spot. The thing that sets IPIC apart from other theaters is the pod seating. It's not like an ACTUAL pod, more like what the seats look like in 1st class. The seats recline, you get a blanket, & it's a button that you press whenever you need your server. Best thing to do is order your food during the previews so your food arrives at the beginning of the movie. If I could only recommend 1 thing I would say get the Meatza pizza, it was sooooo good. The buffalo chicken spring rolls, biscuits, & truffle fries were also very good while the calamari was not so skip that.

The servers are nice enough to let you know when it's last call. I think they do last call when it's 45 minutes till the movie ends. I ordered 2 drinks for last call and enjoyed the rest of Black Widow. This dine-in experience was like no other. I don't see myself going to any other theater unless I'm out of town. IPIC is too EPIC!!!!

The food is very pricey, the popcorn wasn't the best but decently priced. The theatre was FREEZINGGG and they had no more blankets to give out which made the whole movie uncomfortable from literally shivering the entire time. My nose was even cold to the touch as if I were outside. The theatre was pretty much empty besides my friend and I and two other couples so not sure why there were no more blankets for a Sunday 1pm showing. The steak fries were delicious though and the premium seats were cozy but not much different than other theatre's.

We back outside!!

If you've never been to Ipic, it's one of the dopest movie theaters in NYC. I love the private intimate seating, the food, the service, and the bathroom. The bathroom is amazing!!!! It's so clean & luxurious, and as an artist, the artwork throughout the theater is pretty awesome.

Ipic is the only theater I frequent so I don't mind paying a little extra for comfort.

They do check for proof of vaccination, and it is required.

Because I've been so many times, my only gripe is the menu can become redundant as it doesn't change often or at all. I've eaten pretty much everything they have to offer so today I just had candy and a margarita.

They used to give out free popcorn, but that is no longer a thing. I'm not sure if it's due to Covid, but it was a nice little complimentary snack given the price of the movie ticket.

I saw the movie Candyman, and although the movie was a little dry for me, it was nice to get out of the house and see a movie.

"....luxe dinner and movie night out...."

Located on a walking path on Fulton street and nestled amongst urban chic, artsy fartsy craft and coffee shops; is your local nyc ipic theater.  It is everything you have heard and read about -  and based on our today's experience... a little extra!

Upon entering, we were mesmerized by the eye popping, jaw dropping, soaring high ceiling and unique design of the space.  Everything about the decor, ambiance and ultra modern wall art is simply "wow!"

We Treated ourselves to a private two-seat booth that was awaiting us upon entering ($25/per ticket).  In the hallway, you will find blankets to take to your seats.  The fully reclining leather seats are part of a reasonably private cocoon booth whereby the tray has a discrete blue light to contact wait staff who will take your order and open a tab.

The popcorn ($7) and 32oz sodas served in a glass ($5) have unlimited refills, just press the blue button!

From the menu, which is fully available on the ipic app,  we started with the Edamame ($11), which came in a small porcelain cup with accompanying bacon crumbles and a unique ranch style dipping sauce; we found that combination unique and very tasty! Never imagined Edamame served this way - and we will definitely be doing that when entertaining!

Next, the chicken tandoori skewers platter ($16) came on a nice ceramic olive platter with a side of garlic green beans.  The item is on their "guiltless pleasures" section consisting of keto and healthy menu selections.  The dish was tasty; the chicken was cooked perfectly while the presentation was beautiful -  but, yes there is always a but sometimes, so BUT,  there was nothing "tandoori" about the chicken; usually reddish in color, slightly chargrilled with a mint chutney accompagnement.  Ipic should simply name the dish just that, plain old chicken skewers with a yogurty style dip and side vegetable of the day.  Either way it was nice and delicious!

We finished off with the toffee ice cream sandwiches ($10) which were delicious although super sweet, with their syrupy, nicely decorated ice cream stuffed cookie sandwicherie... Definitely shareable for two or four!!!

Four (4) Pro tips -

1) Download the ipic app so you can strategize your full booth premium plus seat reservation; otherwise the experience is not the same and you might as well go to a regular cinema

2) View the menu ahead of time on the app so you can tailor your selections with your appetite and the movie duration

3) Remember to grab a blanket on the way into the theater for that little extra "deluxe expérience" and for when they crank the air conditioner up.

4) if someone from ipic is reading, you shouldn't put your glasses of sodas filled to the rim with ice cubes and then serve them with an extra wide and large straws!  Otherwise, best to order your sodas " no ice" as it is annoying to bother the wait staff to constantly bring refills that last only four(4)  sips!  Again, best to order your drinks With no ice or ice on the side,  as when you ask "very little ice", it goes from 100% of the glass size to 85%, not much less hehehe

The wait staff was prompt, courteous and attentive.  Ipic is definitely a repeat luxe dinner and movie night out; treat yourself! We will definitely return!!!

Definitely one of the best theaters I've been to in the city. They have a bunch of different seat types to choose from, including pairs of seats with dividers to make it feel more like an at-home experience. We snagged the last two premium seats, which reclined pretty far back and were plenty spacious and comfortable.

The staff was attentive and very friendly, although they were a little distracting when speaking at full volume during quieter scenes. The food was decent--the buffalo chicken spring rolls were definitely our favorite. Chicken quesadilla was eh (guac was clearly out of a container). The popcorn was popcorn.

My only real complaint is that the positioning and size/shape of the table meant you had to slouch forward while eating. It was pretty uncomfortable to eat and watch the movie at the same time, which kind of defeats the purpose of this sort of thing.

Overall, I'd say it's probably worth the high price point (I think we paid $54 for 2 seats) and I think we'll be back.

This theatre makes it very hard to ever go to a normal theatre ever again!!  What's not to love about this place,  it has very comfortable power reclining seats with pillows and blankets, it has a divider so my husband and I can have a little privacy from the next couple, and it serves great food and alcohol to top it off.  The drinks that we ordered in the theatre itself are not as strong which is very understandable considering they probably don't want people getting sloppy drunk watching a movie but I still enjoyed my cocktails.   This theatre is definitely a bit pricey if you're ordering food and drinks, but it's most a place to go for a good date night if all else fails!!!
I just really hope the management keeps the place looking new and clean and don't let it go down the drain.

I can see it being good but my visit wasn't great.  

They aim for premium.  I see it.  Nice seats that recline.  Blankets.  Excellent restrooms, with good paper towels and toilet seat covers.  Good bar at the top.  

So where did they miss?   Food was cold and delivered pretty late.  My guess is the food was made and they either forgot or didn't have enough servers to deliver the food.  There's also the questionable aspect of eating food in the dark. Staff members were also more than willing to stand up in front of other patrons and loudly talk about orders.  The screen was also partially covered on both sides.  Did they not have someone to pull the curtains apart fully?

I understand what they were aiming but they fell a bit short.  Maybe they just missed the execution in my visit though so it might be worth a repeat just to be sure.

Oh iPic, I didn't want it to come to this, but alas here we are.  I've been a fan since iPic opened.  I hadn't been since pre covid and decided to surprise my boyfriend with date night (he had never been before).  Our server not so politely informed us that the kitchen would be closing in 20 minutes and we had to order everything right away including dessert.  No problem.  We got a bottle of wine, chicken wings and calamari.  Pretty straight forward right?  A full hour goes by, no food.  Finally the server plopped the calamari down on the table with no utensils, so naturally my very hungry boyfriend went to grab a piece and realized it was ICE cold and soggy.  When she came back with the wings we brought this to her attention, she argued that it just came out of the kitchen so it should be fine.  I told her to touch it if she didn't believe us, she mumbled about taking it off the check and took it away.  It was then that I noticed that with our (also cold) chicken wings they had only brought one utensil roll.  I got her attention again several minutes later and she said "is there another problem?"  I pointed out that she had only brought one set of utensils/napkin and she snapped back with "you need a second one?"  At this point I knew I would be following up with management.

Here's where we enter into part 2 of iPic completely lacking any and all hospitality.  I tried to call a few times over the weekend and couldn't get anyone to answer.  We were there Friday evening.  It is now Monday.  One business day.  I got the manager John on the phone and explained to him that I've been a loyal guest for years and also work in the industry and figured it best to have a private conversation regarding my negative experience rather than take to the internet to air my grievances.  
Then I had a conversation with John and everything changed.  This man was so rude and condescending it's truly no wonder why his staff carries the same attitude during service.  As soon as I started to tell him about our experience he cut me off to say Friday night was very busy for the kitchen.  I continued to explain that even though we ate the wings out of desperation they were also ice cold and we were fully charged for them.  He continued to interrupt me and told me that they weren't going to offer me any compensation because I should have complained in person after the movie on Friday night.  
First of all it was 1 AM and we were tired and hungry and just wanted to be done with the place.  Second of all, since when is the burden of seeking out a manager on the guest?!  If the server was aware that the food took over an hour, was sent back, and clearly things weren't going great for us why didn't they do their due diligence and send a manager to the table?  
When I told John I would be writing a review he said "Well you said you've been coming here for years.  If you feel like you need to write a bad review for one negative experience out of how many I guess go ahead"
JOHN!  Are you serious my dude?! This is not hospitality!  Are you trying to tell me that a "luxury theater" that charges top dollar for food and tickets is OK with their guests having a terrible time as long as its only once in a while?
I have not been so baffled by a hospitality interaction in ages.  
iPic theater has clearly turned into nothing but a cash grab that doesn't care about their loyal guests.  A $20 voucher or even a genuine apology would have shut me up.  But after the way I was spoken to by John I will not be returning ever again and if you made it to the end of this diatribe you should steer clear as well.
Hope you're happy John.

This was my first time ever coming to this theater. For 2 $25.50 tickets. To arrive and the kitchen be closed. They offered a refund. For a movie we really wanted to see. There was no remorse for us having to pay extra for seats to be serviced when the kitchen was closed. I asked for the difference back and they wouldn't even do that. We were only allowed popcorn candy and drinks just as the seats that cost $15.50. What is the point in paying 10 dollars extra if we get the same thing. The worse part was we didn't eat purposely before coming because we were excited to eat there. Was a horrible experience.

The movie just turned off halfway through - never to turn on again - and we sat doing nothing listening to people complain (apparently a power surge or overheating projectors?). I hardly noticed cuz the movie was so bad and I had several Heineken.

Things happen and this would be forgivable if not for the fact that this business is so distressed and strapped for cash that they refused to refund our money and proceeded to gaslight us with "we definitely gave you free passes." Hmmm, nope?  

Also, the food. The food.....If you are ordering food here, god bless you. Everything tastes like it was made in a microwave. Some dude in front of us appeared to have ordered seafood linguine. That made me lose a bit of faith in humanity. Stick to things that humans couldn't feasibly mess up like prepacked M&M's.

This place is like every other ghetto movie theater you have been to, it just has a fraudulent advertising program.

We went there to watch "Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania".
The theatre looks very nice and the chairs are awesome because you can basically lay down.
There were three issues with our experience that made it a really bad experience:
- We were in theatre 8 in the right back. Right above us was the AC running and made a constant noise that sounded like the fan of the AC was hitting something every second. We couldn't really concentrate on the movie because that constant noise was distracting us. Staff couldn't do anything about it.
- We ordered 2 Soft drinks, Nachos and Popcorn. First they brought us Fries and spring rolls. We let the staff know that we didn't order it and send it back. Then they brought us a burger. Again not our order and we had to tell them what we ordered initially. Finally after 30 minutes they brought us the nachos but no popcorn. After waiting for 15 more minutes we told them that we never received the popcorn. After 10 more minutes they finally brought us the popcorn.
- There were two people in front of us that were constantly chatting throughout the movie. We asked the staff to tell them to keep it down but they didn't follow up. It seemed like they didn't care.

The unique selling points this cinema has actually resulted in us having a very bad experience and we couldn't really enjoy the movie

I had a BLAST at Ipic. Attended a private screening of In the Heights hosted by Bacardi USA. Their signature cocktail, the Coco Conga, was divine! A coconut twist on a classic mojito. Can't wait to recreate it using this cute cocktail kit box!

And the movie, despite the very VALID critiques (google it), was soooooo good!

Now let's get into this food, chile. I see you out here Ipic! Never knew I would come to the movies and have delicious eats. The Buffalo Chicken Spring Rolls were crisp on the outside and zesty in the center, soft pretzels were on point, but it was really the caramelized onions on that double patty Boss Burger for meeee

Ipic has a noticeable decline in cleanliness, quality, & service over the past year. The AC was not working last night in the space. Furniture is broken. Everything is dirty. We used to come here all the time, but for these prices will go to Alamo.
Extravagantly decorated, amazing decor, and high class movie theater experience.

Sorry I took so long with this review!!‍ took my husband to ipic for Father's Day and he loved it we usually go to drafthouse off of central avenue!!But this was more classy and service was great .my husband enjoyed a dinner and a movie all in one. Drinks were on point (margaritas )

I used to work here at Ipic theatres and I had a decent time getting used to the program and familiarizing myself with the equipment and working with my co workers. The way it works is that when you are on training you're not allowed to take orders on the computers from the customers. Although after you complete training you're expected to have high performance and know how to take orders quickly which is very counter intuitive. Make it make sense, horrible community that does not want to see you grow and the managers don't do their jobs most of the time. Very poor management by the managers Sam and Kris. Will not return
Food and service was amazing it was just too cold in the theater. Ambiance was a vibe.

Went here without a reservation and loved the ambiance & the service. I sat inside by the bar and got served by Merlyn! She made the experience there so much better; always making sure we were okay & checking in if we liked the food and drinks. She highly recommended the lamb lollipops (so flavorful & tender) & the Honeybee pizza, and it was amazing, the pizza was good! the spicy honey really made me go wow! :) the drinks were superb! Can't wait to go back and taste more of the amazing foods Industry Kitchen has on their menu & hope to see Merlyn again.

This is now one of my new favorite places to eat at in New York City! One of my colleagues had made a reservation at Industry Kitchen, in the NYC Financial/Seaport area for a 5:30 P.M on a Wednesday evening. The walk wasn't too far from our office, a few blocks away.

Industry Kitchen overlooks the river and the city. It's absolutely stunning view, especially during sunset. We had seating in the middle of the restaurant where our table was partially inside and outside.

The service was phenomenal at Industry Kitchen! We were immediately seated and provided waters. The menu has a wide range of items from wood fired pizza, salads, seafood, and much more! My colleague and I decided to share several dishes.

Duo Dips ($16): Sundried Tomato Hummus, Basil Ricotta, Soft Pita

Watermelon & Feta ($17): Baby Arugula, Fresh Basil, Pickled Red Onion, White Balsamic Glaze

Wood Fired Pizza: Bianca ($22): Mozzarella, Ricotta, Parmesan-Reggiano, Baby Arugula

The food, just like service, was outstanding. The appetizers came out first, which included the Duo Dips and the Watermelon & Feta Salad. The Watermelon & Feta salad was my favorite. The watermelon was juicy and fresh. The balsamic glaze wasn't overpowering, and there wasn't too much on the fruit or cheese. The feta cheese blended well with the salad. I would order this dish again instantly!

The Duo Dips were scrumptious! I've never had a dip quite like the sundried tomato hummus before. It was quite unique. It had a garden harvest flavor to it. The Basil Ricotta was yummy!

The Bianca Wood Fired Pizza was amazing! There was a ton of arugula on it. The dough was perfectly cooked, not burnt on the bottom. The cheese was melted and the sauce was creamy.

I had such a wonderful experience at Industry Kitchen. It was slightly expensive, but the food was totally worth it! I can't wait to go again in the future.

I had a work lunch at Industry Kitchen and we sat outside since it was a nice day. To start, we split the charcuterie board and the dips. The dips was pretty lackluster. One of the dips - the green one - was so bland that none of us touched it after a 1st try. The charcuterie board was nice and we devoured it.

I had a Caesar salad with shrimp. Others in my party had the Cacio e pepe gnocchi and a pizza. My salad was fine, nothing to write home about. I was told the gnocchi didn't really taste like a cacio e pepe at all, but was good enough.

We split the tiramisu cones and the creme brulee. Creme brulee was solid but the tiramisu cones were a little weird and unwieldly. Also very tough to split if you're not 3 people. Coffee was solid.

Service was fairly attentive and our waitress was very nice and friendly.

I did find it odd that all cups were plastic, even the alcoholic beverage cups.

The area is kind of a wasteland for sit down restaurants, but I do think there are better options, especially for the price.

This was our second time here and we had delicious food & excellent service both times. (Ask for Ryan!) For appetizers we shared the short rib bao buns, lamb lollipops, tuna nachos, steamed mussels, & burrata which were all WONDERFUL.

The Caesar salad with added grilled chicken was very flavorful & don't skip the Honeybee pizza- It's a perfect blend of sweet & spicy.

The cocktail menu is very trendy & fun, go for the Purple Butterfly if you want something refreshing that's also pretty!

We've eaten both indoors or outside overlooking the water and you can't go wrong either way. Industry Kitchen is a must visit in the area if you're looking for great food with a fun vibe.

3.5 / 5.0 - Industry Kitchen is in the perfect location for outdoor dining on a nice day or evening out. It's spacious and  right by the water facing the river, so you don't have to worry about cars driving by while you're eating, like other restaurants in the city.

The food hasn't been amazing, but you're coming here more for the chill waterfront vibe and atmosphere. This time, I tried the Maine Lobster Ravioli ($38+), which was good, but not very warm. The Watermelon & Feta Salad ($17+) was tasty, but not very large.

The prices are comparable to other restaurants nearby, so it could be a good option if you're looking for a nice spot to hang out by the water.

This place is underrated! Great food, amazing view and exceptional  services. Came here for the winter wonderland and found this place. 1. Burrata & Prosciutto Pizza (amazing!) 2. Roasted Cauliflower Steak (fantastic!) 3. Applewood Smokes Berkshire Pork Chop ( so unique!). All are must try!!!

We came here around 4:30 Sunday afternoon for dinner menu. They have large area for outside patio right beside the water with a nice view of Brooklyn. Like the life vibe here with the beautiful view.
We ordered :

Ahi Tuna Nachos- 4/5
This is not a traditional Nachos with Napa cabbage, jalapeño, avocado, wasabi aioli, sweet soy, micro cilantro, wonton chips, nice and light.

SE Spicy Steamed Mussels 5/5
big portion, served in a pot, with soup inside which is delicious.

Cured Meats & Cheese Board 4/5

Tuscan Kale & Brussels Sprouts 4/5
With aged Gouda, orange supremes, smoked almonds, lemon vinaigrette, good portion

Margherita pizza 4/5
plum tomato, mozzarella, basil, olive oil , thin crust

Diablo pizza 5/5
spicy cheese tortilla crust, chorizo ragu, mozzarella, jalapeño, avocado aioli, pickled red-eye bird chili,  liked the combination

White sangria 4/5

Service is good and fast, they are very busy, so make sure to reserve before you come.

3.5 stars

My colleagues and I were looking for a place to grab lunch before a summertime work meeting downtown.  I had been curious about Industry Kitchen and knew it offered stellar views, so I selected it as our destination.  It was rather humid that day, so we skipped the patio dining and grabbed a table inside, which still offered a nice view of the East River and Brooklyn.  

We started by sharing a few appetizers.  The Grilled Lamb Lollipops were a bit fatty, but were well-cooked and uniquely crusted with goat cheese and pistachios.  The chops were topped with a sweet fig jam that paired perfectly with the funk of the goat cheese.  There was also some mache lettuce included as a garnish.  The Duo of Dips included a sundried tomato hummus and a basil ricotta, both of which were very flavorful.  However, the included "soft pita" was rather dry and bland.  

After those bites, we each selected our own main dishes.  I went with the seasonal Watermelon & Feta Salad, which included huge chunks of melon, cheese crumbles, baby arugula, fresh basil, and pickled red onion.  I added Grilled Jumbo Shrimp, which were perfectly cooked and seasoned.  I loved that the menu specified that my addition would include 4 shrimp; they also had noted that if you added grilled chicken, it would be 8-ounces worth.  There is nothing worse than paying for an extra topping and feeling like the restaurant was stingy about what it provided for the cost.  The salad's white balsamic glaze was light and allowed the fresh ingredients to really pop.

From the tasty food to the excellent views, Industry Kitchen was a perfect selection for our corporate lunch.

I visited Industry Kitchen a few times more since my first review. I'd say there's been an improvement. Granted, the food is about above average but the waterfront views cannot be beat.

We happened to snag a cabana-like table last evening. It was a spacious seating arrangement that could easily accommodate 8 people although we were just 4.

Service was pretty good as were drinks
Some table appetizers included Truffle Fries (I arrived later and didn't try it), Shishito Peppers (very good) and an Asian Broccoli appetizer which resembled a side dish. It was tasty.

My friends ordered Lobster Cobb  (which looked colorful and good), Salmon and Tuna Tacos
My dish was a splurge having ordered the Lobster Cioppino.

The Cioppino had a lovely presentation with just one toast laying on top. More toast was necessary since it didnt run evenly with the broth. A lone lobster tail, salmon, shrimp and Mussels were included in the tomato broth.
Opinion? Pretty good although I've tasted better. The portion size was a bit underwhelming and the broth didn't pack much flavor. I felt that the dish was light and healthy though.

Because  it was a beautiful summer evening spent with close friends and we were satisfied overall with the food/service, I am updating my rating .

Industry Kitchen will satisfy your visit especially with the gorgeous view. And sometimes, it's a wonderful ttradeoff.

After our visit to Freedom Tower we walked along the Pier and made a much needed stop at Industry Kitchen. The day was beautiful and we had the luck of an open table outside. We  started off with a nice dry Rosé. My only negative on the Rosé is that they use plastic wine glasses but ok . i also would hope that our waitress would know if asked if it was dry or sweet, she guessed. I will say it was dry and it was good. We continued with the Watermelon Feta salad, not much salad, (a bummer) alit of watermelon, a plus and a sprinkling of feta. I wouldn't order again to be honest. The tuna nachos with wontons was delish and flavorful. I would order this again. The fries were plentiful and steak cut.

This is a really pretty place with indoor and outdoor seating. Great place to grab a bite if your walking by south street seaport.

I wouldn't say the food is a 10. But for something average this is a decent place. I loved the lobster tacos and kale salad. Also tried the Diablo 2.0 pizza which has a crust made of cheese.

Servers are nice. The place is okay

Industry Kitchen is in a great location, right on the water in the South Street Seaport. We had brunch here on a Saturday afternoon in May. It may have been raining, but we still enjoyed dining indoors. This is a popular spot, with a large brunch crowd...make a reservation if you're heading here.

After ordering cocktails, we had appetizers of meatballs with polenta and pita with 2 different kinds of hummus. Both were very good, especially the meatballs! For brunch entrees, my wife and I each ordered the Lemon Ricotta Pancakes, my daughter had a poached egg with sourdough toast. The pancakes served with blueberry compote and maple syrup were excellent!

Delicious food in a great location...excellent brunch!

This was a great closer for the night. Celebrating day two of my visit to New York with family and friends. Service was great. The food was outstanding. And the company could not be compared. Will definitely be coming back for an actual meal and drinks.
Awesome food, drinks and even better service!! We got the hummus, broccoli, and pizzas and they were great. It's also a great place for large groups

We had made a reservation a day prior to coming here on Resy. An outdoor cabin for 2 people at 8 pm. They will call you the day before to confirm your reservation. Another important thing to note is that their kitchen closes at 9 pm.

We ordered the Burrata, Diablo 2.0 and Truffle curls as our dishes to share. For drinks, we got the Spicyla and half a bottle red wine. The food was more than enough for two people, and the portions were fair. The food came out faster than I expected!! To end off, we had a Lava Cake for dessert which was delicious.

The outdoor cabin was very well built and structured. They have a small portable heater which is strong enough to warm up the entire cabin. Just make sure to watch your step while going in and out of the cabin! Overall, I would come back again since the view is pretty nice and by the water as well!

We walked in on a Tuesday around 5PM without a reservation and we were seated right away. We opted to sit in one of the outdoor igloos, which was perfect for the 70 degree weather we were experiencing in NYC!

We ordered the Honeybee pizza, Tuscan Kale salad (my favorite item we ordered) and spanish octopus, which was perfect for two to share. The food came out quickly and was great.

Overall a great place for a casual dinner after work and great views of Brooklyn! Looking forward to returning to try some of the other pizzas and drinks!

I appreciated the outdoor tables with nice views of the water but the food tasted like mildly elevated bar food. I was unimpressed. We went in a large group and ordered several appetizers and sides to share, including the tuna nachos, broccoli, octopus, shishito peppers, and two pizzas - all of which were mediocre at best. For my entree, I got the lobster Cobb salad. The lobster pieces were tiny and should've been cut larger. They also didn't taste particularly fresh.

Mediocre food aside, the views were nice and the service was great. Attentive and friendly wait staff. I will say they get bonus points for having what I call "scorpion bowls" (those big bowls of alcohol you share with a group of people from back in college). The wine menu was meh - would've appreciated more options, esp by the bottle.

This place was great! My husband and I visited while on an anniversary trip to NYC. We were staying near by and decided to check it out. The views did not disappoint. The photographer coming around was a nice touch and we received a nice picture to remember our anniversary. I had the lobster ravioli and it was delicious! So much lobster. The ravioli filling was so smooth and creamy. Highly recommend!

Yum! Yum! Yum!!! What a fabulous place! The food was soooooo good (minus the brussel sprouts  LOL)!!! I wanted to treat my 86 year old grandmother to dinner for her birthday! I wanted it to be a really nice place, great music, fantastic food with great service. Check! Check! Check! Check!

I wasn't drinking... (just getting over covid today and I'm in a bway show so I need to take care of my voice) so we got tea! I got their special hot tea and it was served in the fanciest way, which I loved and it was also very tasty! We ate the lamb lollipops, the winter squash pizza and the lobster ravioli! Yuuummmmyyyy!!! The chef deserves an award! The portion sizes for the entree was wonderful, as well!  Absolutely worth the price!

The ambiance outside on this very warm winter evening in the 50's just before the sun went down inside the little clear little house just for 2 was absolutely perfect!

I think our waiter's name was Arthur (forgive me if I got their name wrong!) and I think she was the manager, Rachel, stopped by to see how we were! Loved them both! Then they gifted us the most decadent dessert for grandmother's  birthday! Wow! What a treat to come upon such an awesome place!

I'll be back! Thank you so much!

Rating: 3.5 stars

My friend and I stopped by on a Sunday around 12:30 PM to try out their personal greenhouses. They had many empty greenhouses so we were seated right away.

Service at Industry Kitchen is like a fine tuned machine. Everything was done so quickly and efficiently. I was thoroughly impressed.

For our brunch we ordered a couple dishes to share:

--EGGS BENEDICT: The Benedict was pretty good! I just wish there was Canadian bacon or an option for smoked salmon instead of the regular ham you get. The curled potatoes it came with were not very good though - very bland. And there was just a pile of leaves next to the side of the entree.

--NORTHERN ITALIAN BEAN & VEGETABLE SOUP: We ordered a bean and veggie soup and it was bursting with veggies and not as much broth. Additionally, the broth was very light as well so it ended up feeling like we were just eating a bowl of beans.

--MARYLAND BLUE CRAB CAKE: The crab cake was very yummy! All components of it came together very well.

Additionally, after our meal they had a photographer come around and take pics and we got a free souvenir photo which was a nice little memory.

All in all, though food wasn't the most impressive, service was definitely the star of the meal.

This review is for their brunch menu-- Expected this spot to be "paying for the views" rather than having good food but was pleasantly surprised. They have cute outdoor glass huts with space heaters during the winter overlooking the water which are perfect for a little romantic date. They also have plenty of indoor seating for those who do not want to brave the cold.

For food, we got the pork baos which were highly recommended by our waiter and other Yelp reviews. I also got the huevos rancheros and my partner got a lobster omelette.

Pork baos (5/5): So good! Was surprised. The bun is so sweet, pork is very refreshing and not too fatty. Tastes Asian but also not at the same time. Came with a somewhat sweet sauce drizzled over it.

Huevos Rancheros (5/5): Also so awesome. Came looking like a sandwich with nachos on both sides. Was stuffed with filling and the egg was perfectly runny.

Lobster Omelette (4/5): They gave quite a bit of lobster but all the toppings were poorly distributed so the beginning had a lot of lobster and the end had a lot of this white creamy stuff (maybe cheese), and since it's an omelette, it was difficult to realize this was the case until we were at the end.

Last time I was here we came for dinner, so I was excited to be able to come and check out the brunch menu!  I was excited to try the Huevos Rancheros and it did not disappoint.  It was cooked perfectly and it tasted delicious!  

Our server was super attentive without ever rushing us, and checked in to make sure we had everything we needed!

This is a great spot for breakfast, lunch or dinner!

It was my 2nd visit to the Industry kitchen. The energy was great with views of the East River. The general manager and all the staff treated my friend and me as VIPs. I ordered a delightful salmon with mashed potatoes and my friend got the Devil pizza. It was delicious too. I ordered a lemonade and I was surprised because it tasted like natural squeezed lime, it was the best lemonade I tasted in a restaurant in downtown NY. My friend had a mojito and she loved it too. We didn't crave to order dessert because we were very satisfied with the food and the vibe.

Being located walking distance from Wall Street made Industry Kitchen a convenient place to stop for dinner while visiting the city. When we walked up the sun was setting and the buildings across the river were shining in the late day sun. The restaurant is located right on the water with beautiful views of the river, Brooklyn, the Brooklyn bridge and the Manhattan bridge. They have little houses outside as well as open outdoor seating so you can enjoy the outdoor seating year round. We sat inside this time and the ambiance was romantic as the lighting is dim. The inside is trendy and I love the open kitchen so you can see them cooking your meal. The food was enjoyable. Great date night spot in the city.

I've passed by this restaurant on so many occasions but one day decided to stop by. It has always caught my eye due to the set up (the restaurant is fully surrounded by windows so you can see inside). Previously I've only been there to grab a quick cocktail. I had an amazing waiter (really wish I could remember his name as this was over a month ago).

We ordered some cocktails, the wood fire pizza and lobster tacos. One word to describe the food: DELICIOUS! It was packed with flavor and the perfect consistency. Also, we didn't need a reservation and were seated immediately.

This was my second time here and I enjoyed both visits.  It is a great location and I received excellent customer service both times.  I came during the evening but we were still able to get a nice two seater outside.  I ordered the lobster ravioli. It was full of flavor and very delicious.  We also had the lamb that was good and tender.  Overall, I really enjoyed my experience however for the price the appetizer were overpriced.  

It do not mind spending money then this is a good little spot.

Ambiance is out of this world! Food is a 3 at best. Industry kitchen is located right on the water with a beautiful view of brooklyn and Long Island city. The restaurant is beautifully decorated as well.

The food was good with a ton of variety. I tried the scallops and unfortunately the sauce was just way to sweet and not very good. The scallops were quiet rubbery. There were a handful of other dishes that we tried. The lobster ravioli was probably the best one.

All in all, ambiance was good! Everything else is mediocre.

Love this place!! Came here twice and both times was amazing. The first time I sat outdoor and when the sun was setting, they had fairy lights and we can oversee the ocean. It was such a romantic experience and they had good music playing which also was not too loud!

The second time I came I wanted to sit indoor because it was a bit chilly and the way they had it set up was I was technically indoors but there it is open room so my table was indoor but on the right it was outdoor. I was inside not cold and could also experience outdoor dinning with the lights and view.

The food prices is very reasonable and their pizza is so good!
Eddie took care of us , We ordered Spicy steamed mussels and Diablo 2.0 with chicken nuggets instead of pork. Super good food. The place looks just out of the world.

Conveniently located right by the ferry stops, Industry Kitchen became our dinner spot pick. That is, if we had a reservation.

The only way to get in was bypassing the worker by the entrance, and with how popular this place was, there was a line. A number of us didn't have reservations, and while we were rejected the first time, check for reservations online as the times are different from the time they state!

Our server was really courteous and always made sure to swing by our table to see if we needed anything, despite attending to so many others. Other than the service, there wasn't anything spectacular about the menu options or the food.

The Mussels ($19) looked like a lot, but they were the smallest mussels I ever had. The sauce was so salty, although I did enjoy the complimentary bread to dip into the sauce.

The Smoked Bacon Pizza ($25) was unfortunately the worst restaurant pizza I ever had. It was like eating plain cheesy bread, with some potatoes and dry thick bacon pieces splattered on.

I'm surprised they told us we would have to wait 1 hour for seats at first, as many of the tables were empty for the rest of the night. The place was huge, with much dedication put into their storefront and interior than on their food.
