Nice place with a view near the pier. I had the lamb shank with risotto which was good and worth the try. As this is New York it's pretty pricey but all in all a good balance. Location and interior are nice but above all service definitely stood out. Our waitress was fast and attentive!

A little disappointed by the service and food quality of this trip to Industry Kitchen. Our server seemed very understaffed , as he seemed to be covering all of the outdoor seating area on his own. I had to ask 3 servers for a pitcher of water and it took over 10 minutes to Arrive.

The food was not the best this time - ordered the ahi tuna nachos with the pork belly pizza. The nachos initially tasted ok but the guac was very brown and didn't look too fresh. The pork belly was rather dry - would not order that again.

I'd be interested to try again as I've had fond memories at this restaurant pre Covid, it's a pity if quality has declined since

Really nice spacious restaurant by the piers. We did outdoor seating in one of their little sheds. Their outdoor seating seems to be dog friendly. We got their grilled pinwheel sausage, Diablo 2.0 pizza, Huevos Rancheros and truffle potato curls. Food came out relatively quickly. My favorites were the pizza and potato curls that were crispy on the outside and very pillowy on the inside. Pizza was crispy and flavorful but wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be.

Good thing we made reservations because the place filled up rather quickly despite just opening for the day (they open at 12).

Our server checked in with us frequently and was pretty spot on with her recommendations.

We shared:
- Mussels (Crowd favorite! The sauce is especially great for dipping bread! If you enjoy mussels, definitely get this. Good portion size too!)
- Ahi tuna nachos (Tasty! This dish has great flavor and the wontons were crispy, but it would've been even better with larger pieces of tuna... I scooped up more greens than tuna.)
- Truffle potato curls (Great side dish for sharing. Loved that it was topped with herbs and romano cheese.)
- Lamb lollipops (Good, esp. with the goat cheese, jam sauce, and pistachios, but they are definitely lollipop sized. You can finish each one in one or two bites. Also, there are only 3 pieces, so you will need to order more if you are sharing with more people.)
- Beurremont Burrata (A very light, refreshing dish. It was fine, but not particularly memorable.)

Drinks:
- Frose (+$1 for strawberry, blueberry, or peach). Great for a hot summer day. Had the strawberry frose and loved that they used fresh strawberry puree.
- Margarita (+$1 for strawberry, blueberry, or peach). Friends had the peach and strawberry margaritas. I tried a bit of the peach margarita and it was very strong. My friends felt sick after having 2 of them so be careful (could've also been the heat from hot, sunny weather lol).

Great views (not right at the water's edge, but fairly close), good service, and good food! Definitely worth checking out if you are in the area. Highly recommend getting the mussels and truffle curls. Make a reservation in advance because we went on a weekday and the place was fairly busy throughout our meal.

Found this place by walking along the East River in the financial district. The vibes were immaculate the music selection was also very current. The lamb lollipops were so delicious and juicy with the sweet fig sauce.
I had the kale salad which could've had a little more salad dressing. There were also seeds in my oranges. Overall everything was tasty.
The wine sangria was delicious with lots of fresh fruits.

Industry Kitchen is a great spot with an amazing view of the Brooklyn! It is located right on the waterfront and is the perfect date spot. The food was incredibly flavorful and left a phenomenal aftertaste! This food is a perfect blend of very different tastes. We got small plates to share and had plenty of leftovers afterwards. The food also came out very quickly. I would definitely recommend this spot if you're by the seaport area!

Industry Kitchen has a cute setup. My party was seated in a cute heated mini house, a unique seating option for the winter.

Service took a little longer in the mini house but they get busy so I understand.

For the price of the food I don't think it was worth it. Food was good but not great. Nothing stood out. I probably would not go back but still think it's a cute restaurant to bring someone if you want a unique seating during the winter.

The food and vibes were so good. I got the Valentine's pizza for Valentine's Day and it was really delicious. However, it was not really shaped like a heart. It also took a long time to get to our table, but it was worth the wait. The campfire s'mores for dessert was amazing. I would love to come back and eat in one of the sheds.

As a hungry vegetarian I was satisfied with the Greek salad. My friend had eggs and steak and looked like a big plate.
We had the cheese plate and we expected much bigger for the price. It is nicely presented though.

Break down
1. View is great
2. You are paying for the view and trendiness
3. Place to go with friends and be ready to spend at least $45-60 per person for brunch

We had a lovely lunch here. Staff were attentive and let us sit for a bit and catch up with people we hadn't seen in a long time.

I had been eating a lot of heavy things so I was happy to see a large Greek salad on the menu. It was a great size and tons of feta too. I had the Nutella hot chocolate and it was so tasty.

The pizza was really big and served two of us. Everyone was happy with their meals.

The restaurant is right by the water. They have indoor and outdoor space. The outdoor has these cute little greenhouses that allow you to be outside even when it's cold.

Visited this restaurant on our first night in NYC. The location was great! It was easy to get to and within convenient walking distance from our hotel. The holiday decorations were really beautiful and welcoming. They offer private cabana-type tents outside if you do not want indoor dining. Unfortunately, our experience was subpar. Service was very slow and we found ourselves having to flag down and ask for help on several occasions including drink refills, questions about food, and getting the check. The server was very inattentive as well as all other staff in the place. The food was also just so-so and for a bill of over $200, we felt it was not worth it. We left disappointed.

I hate to say this but to be completely honest, the food here at Industry Kitchen was by far the worst meal I've had in NYC. The potato curls were hard as a rock and almost impossible to eat. The Lobster ravioli tasted as if it was processed and microwaved. I do not recommend the food here at all. The place itself, however, is beautiful.

Ordered:
Serendipity (~$15): Salcombe Rosé gin, Chambord, Grand Marnier, lemon juice
Steamed Mussels (~$19): mussels with shallots, garlic, white wine, diced tomato, lemon zest, parsley; bread basket
Spanish Octopus (~$21): patatas bravas, black garlic, saffron aioli, smoked almond Romanesco sauce

Aya's take:
Private outdoor seating in one of their glass houses with great, unobstructed views of Brooklyn and the water. We were here for a birthday dinner and someone came and took photos of the group which was awesome! It was a chilly night and it seemed like our waiter was not mindful of that and kept opening the door to our glass house letting a lot of cold air in. Nonetheless, we made the best of it. I really enjoyed the Serendipity. Pretty drink, not too sweet, and great to sip on with dinner. The Spanish Octopus was disappointing; I'd skip it. The Steamed Mussels were actually delicious but I felt that it being served with a bread basket was unusual rather than fries which either seems like an oversight on their end or a way to save money. Cute date spot but I wouldn't be super excited to return any time soon.

The view 10/10; the  service was quick and very good! The water view drink was on the sweeter side if u like that then it's for you!! The shot tuna app is fresh light and perfect to share . The star of lunch was the Tuscan kale salad believe it or not the lemon dressing is amazing and the combination of citrus and cheese just went perfect absolutely a must get !! Even if you are not a salad person this is amazing . The potato curls were infused with truffle and a solid choice. Can't go wrong! This place is a must try!!

Coming to a festival located on the Seaport was a bust. This restaurant came through when we wanted a bite to eat to quickly seat and feed us. For a party of 6, they seated us immediately and it was on a gorgeous front by the water. A perfect warm Autumn day with a slight breeze. Our waiter was very courteous and took our drink orders and food choices quickly. This place so far was a win. I ordered the Ahi Tuna Nachos because I wasn't too hungry and just needed something with flavors to snack on. This dish surprised in so many good ways. Points go to the creativity of this dish where instead of nacho chips and cheese overflow. Instead it goes to using Asian ingredients such as the wonton crisps as chips, wasabi and avocado spread, some Napa cabbage for the green salads, sesame oil and the ahi tuna as the protein. I enjoyed this dish so much that it was all me who munched on it. Also ordered the blueberry frosé but was not a fan of it, just stick to the strawberry flavor. The blueberry one had a tint of bitterness more than I'd like in my alcoholic beverage.

Very pricy place with a good view, as expected of a restaurant on South Street Seaport. But my reason for deducting a star is because of the weird bathroom structure. There were two doors but both doors led to the same room. It was a hollowed out bathroom with lots of confusion and how to form a line when waiting for the stalls. Granted I've been hit by the doors (plural) a few times just waiting for a free stall. This was an interesting experience and I understand the need for open space but it was quite weird.  Aside from the bathroom, everything itself was nicely done. I will try dining indoors to experience the cozy comforts next time.

I came here after work for a group outing. They have a really nice setup with these clear cabins outside. I'm not sure if the cabins are just for the wintertime or year round but nonetheless they are a nice addition any time. Just a note, you reserve the cabins for a set timeframe so keep that in mind because if it's busy you won't be able to extend your time. They have a nice variety of dishes from traditional American fare to bao buns. I ordered the steamed mussels, which were lacking flavor. They would have been tastier if the bowl wasn't fulled to the point where you can't access the liquid/ sauce at the bottom. The mussels tasted great with the sauce, but you can't access it until you get halfway to the bottom. The truffle potato curls were tasty, but you can't go wrong with truffles on anything. Overall, the service was good. Our server was attentive, and the food arrived quickly.

We came here on Christmas Day, as most places were closed and we were around the area. The service was 10/10 and food was generally good. They have a cute outside setup, great for photos. The Spicyla margarita was ok, not the greatest I've had. The pizzas were really yummy but small. The lava cake was the highlight especially since it was warm. I would for sure return when there is warmer weather and the view is impeccable.

Alexandra(works at the bar ) consistently provides top-notch customer service, and it's the primary reason I visit Industrial Kitchen every week. Her dedication and excellent service keep me coming back!

I've been here for a date. Staff was friendly. I got seated right away even though my date was running late.
Date was just ok. But the view was amazing! Even if the date didn't turn out to be good, but the view definitely saved the day! Looking at the view, you would think:"ah, there's still hope out there..."

The address was hard to locate, it took me 15 mins walking up and down South street to find it, and still ended up not finding it and my friend had to came out to look for me, bummer!
Then I got there and they wouldn't find my reservation, bummer #2! Good they had a lot of open tables and they just seated us.
Tried their water view cocktail and it was so sweet that I didn't taste alcohol at all! And this is coming from someone who has a low tolerance for alcohol!
The bathroom is for both men and women. I found it kinda odd when I first walked in and thought I was in the wrong place!
The outdoor seating was nice and the view to the ocean was nice too. The ocean breezes were refreshing and relaxing too. If I were to go back, it's for the view and the outdoor seating.

I came in ,the other day, by chance -seeking a comfortable seat and a nice drink-and I found both here-and more!
A nice respite from the Nyc  Labor Day rush and a creative menu-
I opted for fried calamari-good- and a watermelon vodka special.The appetizer portion was so big I could barely eat a third of it.
And a good group of sophisticated people were in the dining room.
The bartender-a young man-was friendly and gave very good service.
I ended up taking home the Lobster Quesadilla with chopped lobster and a nice spin on it -with the addition of melted Brie.
I couldn't  finish it -large portion-but the taste was delicious.
Count me in!
This is the cutest neighborhood restaurant in the upper east side I can't say enough about the awesome staff!

Island is not a place I would seek out -- we dined there recently when a family member who lives on the Upper East Side suggested it and treated us. My impression is that most of its customers live nearby and want convenience and comfort. The decor is generically refined but not noteworthy.
Our meals were very tasty. My husband's black cod was perfectly cooked with white wine and butter, and accompanied by sweet potato and kale, also perfectly cooked. I had a generously sized crab cake on a bed of creamy spinach and ate it all. The chocolate gelato was amazing.
Drawbacks? The service from our early-20s server; she was not terribly attentive -- we had to ask for water refills on a very slow evening -- and she was a little too abrupt, casual, and "hi guys" for the refined ambiance. The cloth bench on one side of our table had a few stains on it and the cloth tablecloth had food on it at the hem. Overall, I would forgive these misfires and recommend Island for those on the UES.
I've gone to island twice now. Both times were great service was great and drinks were very tasty. My favorite thing so far is the asparagus appetizer, a must try!

When Barbara Corcoran recommends a lunch spot close to her office we had to try t.

Great lunch spot! Awesome tomorrow soup, great salmon bowl, and blt.

Make a reservation- it fills fast!
Fantastic brunch all around, from the poached eggs to the chopped Cobb salad, the service was great! Quaint neighborhood restaurant. Will be back!

My wife loves this place but quiet honestly it is hands down the worst place on the UES. The got our entire order wrong, it took forever and to make things worse the waiter argued with us about what we ordered. I have never left zero tip before, I did tonight.
Definitely recommend making a reservation. The salads are good and they have a nice variety. Good location. Waitstaff always seem a bit annoyed.

From the high-end, high-cuisine dining sophistication to more affordable spots in the UES, hubs decided to go for this underdog on Madison & 93rd. Despite the already preppie, old-money attire at Island, our sneaks and my Nike pants had to suffice as we just finished with an Ephrat Asherie performance at the Guggenheim.

With their yacht and nautical design, Island paints a picture of an almost sea-worthy journey- without a trip to the beach. We nabbed an 8pm Wednesday reservation in their second dining room right off their bar. Seats directly in front of the bar however, are skillfully arranged in a narrow stretch- as it's the only way to get to the middle and back dining rooms.

The menu seems to represent just about any island in every continent you can think of: Caribbean islands, Islands off South America, Asian islands, islands in the Indian Ocean and so many others. When you hear about a place is "all over the place" you generally think of chaos- but not here. It's actually the menu because it's all over the place. You have Hummus next to Guacamole next to a Tuna Poke Bowl. So Mr. Owner- please don't take any insult- the menu has A LOT because it's formed around the world.

Miso Japanese Eggplant appetizer was creative and delicious while hubs enjoyed his Arugula salad with a load of Parmesan. My rare, sesame crusted Tuna as requested was juicy but needed a hair touch of salt to bring the dish together and hubs' Maine Lobster Quesadillas had juicy lump meat- but weren't form correctly.

I'm admittedly not much of a pie person and it's unlike me to order anything outside of Chocolate but the Key Lime Pie with Meringue called me. That sucker was tart, good and incredibly sweet (maybe turn down the sweetness on this one a bit)- while hubs' Blueberry Cobbler had the right warm temp and oozed nicely. Despite everything, food was very nice and service was awesome from our server.
My favorite lunch spot on the UES. My go-to is the Autumn Kale salad paired with sweet potato fries (and an Island Margarita or two).

I have been coming to Island since I was probably three years old. It's a time honored tradition of my family to come to Island after church whether it be for brunch, dinner or just some drinks.

The food is always exceptional. I try to change up my order every time and it always blows me away in the best way possible. I live for the lobster quesadilla and the calamari though! For drinks I highly recommend an espresso martini made by Rudy.

Maria and Adriana are divine and always so accommodating. They truly make you feel like family! The entire staff for that matter do! Always with a smile on their face and always remember your name.

The ambiance and atmosphere are cozy and classy. Small, lovely, but absolutely perfect. You can always find me at the Island whenever I'm in Carnegie Hill!

I honestly cannot speak to the food, but had to get on to write a review about the staff at this restaurant. I had an unfortunate incident today where I was being harassed and followed on the street. I instinctively ducked into Island because it was the first place I saw. Three of the staff - two young women and one waiter, instantly sprang into action to help me. They sat me down, calmed my nerves, and brought me a glass of water. They patiently and kindly let me sit for minutes and escorted me out of the restaurant safely. I wish I got their names but I was so frazzled. I am so appreciative and thankful for their help today. I will definitely be returning to the restaurant to actually experience the food soon. The management and owner of Island should be extremely proud of the high quality staff they have hired.
My kale salad was delicious. The vibe is nice and the staff are friendly. It was a good spot for lunch.
Food and service are adequate at best. It's in a area that is not noted for great restaurants. Skip it

Great location and very cozy and intimate setting.
Nicely decorated Outdoor seating available with heaters or on sidewalk .
Staff is very friendly and professional. Locals frequent this restaurant probably due to its warm setting and great and consistent menu.
Don't miss any of the desserts especially the doughnuts!

We had our second visit to Island for brunch yesterday and our feeling was confirmed...It's best compared to country club food, from not a very good country club. There were 2 poke bowls, 1 tuna burger and a goat cheese omelet at our table. The poke bowls arrived on plates but that's not really a big deal, it's what's on the plate that counts, and that was really sad. There was a ring of "cold" mashed avocado sitting on an ordinary green salad and the "sushi grade" (not) tuna on the avocado. Circling the plate were easily the worst corn tortilla chips I've ever had. The refrigerated avocado mash had zero flavor as did the tuna. The green salad was definitely a green salad, that's about it.

The tuna burger was completely flavorless. The omelet was surprisingly good.

There were sweet potato fries served with the tuna burger and were excellent.

We ordered donut holes for the table which were fried in old oil and if you've ever tasted something fried in old oil....well I'm sure you get it.

I will tell you that on our first visit I had the chicken melt sandwich which was spectacular! Chicken topped with mozzarella, arugula and a balsamic dressing pressed between 2 slices of sour dough bread, perfectly crisp.

I would happily go back for the chicken melt sandwich, but I would get it to go if its a nice day and eat it in a park bench.

Delicious spot in the UES. Such a quaint atmosphere, generous and friendly staff, and the food is top notch. We ordered the kale salad (so fresh and crispy), roasted chicken, tuna, and fillet of sole. All were quality entrees and perfectly flavored. And can't forgot the donuts for dessert - over the top!

Very cute spot that I want to love, but overall was a bit underwhelming. The place has a cool island concept, and the menu certainly reflects that, but the prices don't really match up to what you pay for, and service pretty inconsistent. The staff was all very nice but I think there was a large party in the back while we were there, and our server would disappear for long amounts of time, and we ended up ordering certain things with a different server.

The calamari was fine, standard frozen situation. The mussels were a little bit under-seasoned, and the fries that were meant to go with them came out about 10 minutes later. The steak was good but again for the price I was expecting a little bit more. My favorite part of the meal was the ice cream sundae (but in all fairness it's hard to mess that up).

Overall, would try this place again to hopefully get better results!

A friend of mine's kid went to school in one of the many prep schools in this area so he became quite familiar with Island And text me there every time I am in the city. I love it. The staff is wonderful and the food is refreshing. Drinks are perfect.

I visited Island for the first time in many years last night. I very much enjoyed it! The decor is preppy meets nautical and the clientele skews older but we felt welcome.

Ordered:

Caesar Salad ($14)- this salad was made with Boston lettuce instead of the typical romaine. This was a nice touch. The Boston lettuce was softer than romaine. The salad had croutons and a generous amount of fresh Parmesan cheese. The dressing was the real star. It had depth of flavor and the taste of anchovies.

Roasted Maple Glazed Norwegian Salmon ($30)- the salmon was a nice sized piece that was cooked to order. It was roasted with a maple mustard glaze. The skin was crispy. The salmon was not dry/overcooked. It came over roasted Brussels sprouts.

Seafood Linguini ($28)- the pasta was cooked al dente and served with shrimp, mussels and clams. The sauce was natural, made from the liquid from the mussels and clams, olive oil, garlic and multicolored cherry tomatoes. I really enjoyed this dish! I was a little disappointed that one of the clams arrived shut and therefore couldn't be eaten.

Overall, I really enjoyed my dinner at Island. It was a little more expensive than other restaurants I typically dine at, but the service and the quality of the food was very good.

Enter a New Yorker cartoon on this enchanted Island! Was the maitre d playing Wordle? No matter the best table is available in the middle of a buzzing lunch hour on a Thursday. How cozy to be surrounded by Hermes bags and blonde ladies who speak in hushed tones! Wait staff brings tap water (the native choice) without asking!  Lovely calamari feeds a family of 3, followed by a crab cake special (very nice) and juicy burgers. You may want to hang out just to people watch and forget all about that nasty pandemic.

A forgettable restaurant - from food to service. The price is expensive for the food taste and portion size, but the location is convenient. They do seem somewhat family friendly though.

Got the burger and asked for sweet potato fries... they messed up the sub and charged me for a full side. The burger was undercooked. There was a SINGLE leaf of romaine lettuce lol

Maria is the best bartender/waitress.  Everything she recommended was spot on and delicious.  I cannot wait to come back to have another great time! She works Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday.  She knows her stuff!!!

The kitchen is barely trying. Like seriously how do you mess up a burger. At the very least get a proper bun, not the cheapest crap bun you literally can buy. And the steak is tough as shoe leather. You don't deserve the attention you get from the geriatrics that go there out of convenience. Just try a little and it could be great.

Staff is very kind. Place looks great. But chef should be tossed.

I came to Island last night after having a beyond disappointing dinner at Pil Pil, and I must say they saved the night! I want to first highlight the service there - both our server as well as the wait staff were very attentive to us and made sure that we had a great experience. They even let us move our table outside so that we weren't sitting in the dark -- it was pretty late in the evening at that point. Now, onto the food... the tuna burger that I had was amazing as were the sweet potato fries that they came with. My friends' dishes looked and smelled great as well. The drinks were good as well. I would recommend the Island Margarita. I can't wait to come back and explore the rest of their menu items. If you're having a disappointing night, there's a high chance Island might make it better.

Island was generally good and had a lot of menu options so there is something for everyone whether you want seafood, pasta, or meat. They checked our temperature when we entered and gave us hand sanitizer. We had to wait 10 minutes for a table to get cleared. The tables probably could have been spaced out a little bit more as it felt like more than 25% capacity. The bread was really good and came with butter at the perfect temperature so it was easy to spread. For cocktails, we got a hot toddy and cherry old fashioned. They overdid the sour in the hot toddy and the bitters in the old fashioned. We shared the special salad which was Boston lettuce with chickpeas, quinoa, avocado, feta, and cherry tomatoes. The salad was really flavorful and the feta provided a nice balance of saltiness. I got the ahi tuna which came with snow peas, pickled ginger, and bean sprouts. The tuna was a big chunk and was cooked well. For desert, we got the apple tartan. I was a little disappointed that the dish came on a thin pie crust instead of the traditional tarte shell. As a result, the dish was very soggy. Our server was very friendly and attentive.
Always excellent food & service, ambiance inside or out calming. My favorite is the French Toast at brunch and or those crab cakes! Brioche French Toast
Upscale tropical villa ambiance, excellent reading and intimate conversational volume. The food tasted whole and simple - No mystery ingredients.   will definitely return to this restaurant.

Let's start with the positive: the decor is pleasant. While the menu at Island is varied, the food and service are average at best. The hummus was bad and they don't even give you enough pita bread to eat with it. The chicken melt sandwich was okay, but tiny. The Cobb salad was fair. There was a minuscule amount of tiny pieces (slightly larger than peas) of chicken, slightly more blue cheese, a couple hard-boiled eggs and a decent amount of bacon. Who wants a salad full of bacon? The dressing lacked taste. The server was friendly when he took the order and was MIA for the rest of the meal, then again, we didn't order drinks.

What a delightful restaurant experience we enjoyed here. Island has an attractive, rather intimate dining room with a little space for sidewalk tables, and the theme is sort of yacht-like without going overboard about it (keep in mind the restaurant's name). And the eclectic menu offers some appealing seafood dishes without slipping into Red Lobster mode. For instance, you can find some delicious crispy calamari, a tasty lobster quesadilla, Maryland crab cake sliders and a moist and lightly crusted yellowfin tuna burger if you are so inclined. We did and relished all but the crab cakes, which weren't bad at all but lacked the bursting crab meat flavor we've found at a few other restaurants (looking at you Guppy's in Florida). We also, however, tried the Kobe beef hot dog, an item we have never seen anywhere before this. When served, it looked almost like the Oscar Meyer weinermobile, neatly curved over a bun and packed with lots of sauerkraut. The verdict? Gimme' more.

We didn't try any of the desserts though our server said we would be missing something good. No doubt. The wait staff seemed attentive and friendly though not obtrusive. In general, the atmosphere is not quite laid back but spiffy and focused as you might hope the staff on your yacht would be. As we said, a good experience, and given it's location not far from a family member's home, we'll certainly return.
Maria is brilliant the best bartender! Everything she suggested was fabulous! She knows her things, and was very attentive.

We sat down the block outside and not in the little building they built where cars should be parked and that was nice..........except for the sounds of busses and motorcycles and garbage trucks. I had a caesar salad and a hamburger and they were fine. Service nice and we sat outdoors for more than 2 hours. I guess this is what a NY neighborhood restaurant has become during covid season

I was visiting a friend on the UES and he lives close by to Island. We went for Sunday brunch. The space itself is very nice inside, small and intimate. Our wait staff was excellent, friendly and attentive.

Island serves these dough puff things that are like crack, especially when your hungry. I had the Goat Cheese Omelette with cherry tomatoes and fresh herbs with mesclun greens and home fries. This was excellent and cooked just right. A few others in our party of five ordered the Brioche French Toast with fresh berries and maple syrup. This was huge and looked really tasty.

I would definitely return to Island again and after reading some other Yelp reviews, try the hamburger.

4 soldi Yelp stars for brunch.

I ate here a few months ago and had a great experience. Good food with nice and welcoming staff. I wanted to get my five stars in considering the posts circulating social media right now. It's a good spot and and I'll come back again. Don't judge an entire restaurant by one experience posted by someone else, look at the aggregate of all the reviews and go for yourself.

The food was fantastic. The ambiance was wonderful...the service was a touch slow (but they were quite busy so it was understandable). The main area where Island needs improvement are the desserts, which are fine but nothing special especially after having the wonderful food. I had the Seafood Skewers with rice which was absolutely divine. But then I had the Key Lime pie and while the crust and meringue were good, there was not a trace of key lime that I could detect, and I have sampled several key lime pies in Key West, FL, so I know what it's supposed to taste like. The owner is a sweetheart and was on the premises to make sure everything was going smoothly. I would suggest reservations - this place is cute and good and in a great location, so it gets busy and very full quickly.

Good quality food and patient,  accommodating staff. There are both indoor and outdoor tables. The salads are great! I love beets, and the combo of goat cheese,  greens, nuts and a lite dressing in the beet salad is perfect for warm weather.  Beware of the bread! It's too good and will fill you up before your meal!

I highly recommend. The food and drink were wonderful. The people were so warm and welcoming and friendly. The ambiance and atmosphere were lovely. I'm so glad i stopped by. I will definitely go again.

you have to come here! We found it, by luck, on open table, and we were SO happy with it! They keep it so warm with heaters, and it's such a lovely vibe. We got Ronald as our server and let me tell you, ASK. FOR. RONALD. He is the kindest soul, best server. The best place ever!

I usually do not do reviews, but for my bartender Maria on Wednesday's and Friday night.. i have to. I come here every time to get served with the most gorgeous bubbly bartender ever. Love her. Only reason I come.

This restaurant sits right on Madison Ave very close to Central Park.

It is very cozy but super cute too.

I arrived right Brunch and lunch time and even though they were a little bit busy and already had reservations booked, they still sat me and took great care of me.

My server was Kate and she was very knowledgeable about their cuisine.

As an appetizer they serve popovers with strawberry jelly. The popovers doesn't really taste like anything but the strawberry jelly more than compensates for it so be sure to eat them together.

I order the scrambled eggs and it came with bacon, leafy greens, potatoes and multi grain bread. I loved the entire combination but their bacon was by far the best bacon I have ever had from any restaurant. Not sure if they smoke it and what they do, but it is delicious.

I am so glad I went there for brunch, I received great service, the price was very fair and the food was also pretty tasty.
I have been here 3 times by now and I am in love with it! I have already tried the Nicoise salad, kale salad and seafood skewers! All of them were great!

Island is one of the best restaurants on the Upper East side. Great menu and very good service. The grilled salmon is excellent and so is the Tuna.
Also very good salads and Burgers. You can't miss with Island- always good quality food. Highly recommended.

my husband had lunch at Island and the waiter lost his credit card.  he was still charged for the meal and nobody even offered him a gift card for the inconvenience.  i called today to see if they found it and the manager told me he's sorry, but when i said that they should at least make it right and give us a gift card, he said sorry, we can't do that. never going back there again and telling all my friends who frequent it

Adriana  was our server tonight. My friend and I both enjoyed our meal. Our bill was $110 plus tax. I split the bill with my friend and paid in $75 cash and she paid $72 with her credit card.
This server Adriana followed us out to the restaurant lobby, with the credit card bill in her hand, and said "by the way YOU never tipped me"!
What? She had the credit card receipt in her hand with $12 tip? She then said to me, and YOU paid me $75 cash. Ummmm $75 plus $72= $147!

You publicly insulted us and we left you a 25% TIP.

Ken S: An arresting restaurant experience. Last Saturday my wife and I and another couple, all of us seniors in our 80s, made a reservation for dinner at Island, a restaurant on Madison at 92nd. We requested a table in their outdoor shed. When we arrived all of the tables in the shed were occupied but we said that we would wait until one of them opened.
While waiting, we were offered a table on the sidewalk and we said that we would sit there until the shed table was available. We sat down, ordered two glasses of wine and a soft drink, and in about twenty minutes, the occupants of the shed table left. We started to move to that table but were asked to wait until it was cleared and reset. We were then startled to see other people sitting down at that table. When told that we could not have the table we had been waiting for we objected and said we would leave and dine elsewhere. As we were leaving a waiter told us that we would not have to pay for the three drinks we consumed. We got up and walked down Madison Avenue towards another restaurant across the street when we were accosted by the Island manager who demanded that we pay for the drinks. We said that the waiter had said that we did not have to pay for them in view of the failure of the restaurant to give us the table we had waited for. We went to the restaurant across the street, had an excellent dinner and were preparing to leave about an hour later when the Island manager and two NYC policemen appeared and threatened to arrest us if we did not pay $42 for the drinks. After a prolonged argument we decided to pay to end the matter. However, this travesty of restaurant hospitality deserves notice. I will never go back to Island and hope that all who hear of this outrageous behavior by the restaurant manager will not patronize his establishment.

Went there for an early dinner the other night. Lots of people outside but only one waiter working. Our food took at least an hour to come out. I don't think a single person at our table enjoyed the food. The pasta dish was just plain pasta, no sauce, that seemed like it took two seconds to make. Someone got a salad with chicken on top and it was gross chicken probably from a can. My sister got salmon on top of her salad and it was cold. Honestly one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. I can't believe we paid that much to eat plain pasta and cold salmon. Never coming back.

As promised, I came back but this was less successful.  I foolishly -- lobster lover that i am -- ordered a lobster roll.  It came on a sweet half bun -- no one wants a sweet roll with lobster -- and had very little lobster and was, all in all, not well priced and not great.  Restaurants have lost so much money, no one can complain if prices are higher, but the portion was too samll and all in all, my experience was not good.  

And the coffee was also disappointing.  The service and comfort are fine.
Will travel all the way back here just for the key lime pie. DELICIOUS! Otherwise, the lobster quesadilla (brunch item) was underwhelming and small.
Every time we go, we have delicious food, gorgeous atmosphere, and super friendly table service.

I have been going to Island since high school. I have a high school graduate now. Never have I witnessed a scene like the one told on this chain. Let's not write off this neighborhood institution and instead try to identify with thé pressures restaurants and staff are under in the current climate. This is a teaching moment and a reminder that cooler heads always prevail. It's dinner out, in a close knit neighborhood, scraping it's way back from a global pandemic. We are not in siege mode anymore. Gratitude that eateries are still open is due.  Be better than silly cancel culture tactics and please do your part to support our neighborhood small businesses.

The Very best amazing fresh delicious pizza I have had outside of Rome, Italy!
Dangerous in it's temptation since it's right around the corner from me.
We need to return and taste every single variation (which may be about 35+).
Better than any of the elegant Italian restaurants UES for care, joy and
service!

Get there!

Great new pizza shop which recently opened up in Yorkville.

So many pizzas to choose from, and it was a big help when I dropped in at 11pm after a late night training run. The 3 sauce pizza was so good! I was hangry!

Nice staff here, it's clean and bright, with plenty of seating and a dining area in the back. Opens in the morning and closes late. I'll definitely be back to try another pizza type.

IL Cantuccio gets my vote! They would have been Five Stars if the employees behind the counter were welcoming and smiling. I'm sure I expressed excitement when I saw the white pizza options were not limited to one. I'm also so happy they open up at 9am. I like to eat early.
The atmosphere is quiet and very clean. I did have to leave when the employee began cleaning with a strong smelling Clorox type cleaner. I'm glad they have outdoor seating. I moved outside.
Prices are very good for this neighborhood and it's a hearty slice for me. I'll definitely return.
Excellent new pizza on the UES. I just stopped there to check them out and enjoyed a few squares. I noticed they are family-friendly, and I will return!

Solid entry into the Yorkville pizza scene. Ordered a couple of pies for delivery over a month. Both were fast, hot, and tasty. Supreme's crust was a little soggier than expected in the middle of the pie. Margherita was perfect. Worth a spot in the delivery rotation.
Suuuuuuper good pizza, extremely clean seating and not bad on pricing. I hope they stay a round for a long long time!

Been here a couple of times. Pizza is pretty good and I would grab a slice here again. However I ordered a sub sandwich the other day and it was AWFUL. Soggy, doused in oil or vinaigrette. And the meat did not taste fresh, it tasted like that prepackaged stuff you get at the grocery store that's packed with tons of water. I couldn't finish the sandwich- it was so bad. So in summary, it's a decent place for a slice of pizza, but steer clear of the sandwiches.
Great new spot and the pizza always looks fresh! Love the quick service and every slice I've tried so far has been really good

Excellent new pizza place on the UES! I like all the variety they have and specifically recommend the vodka-pesto-chicken pizza.

The atmosphere was warm and welcoming. Everyone in there was smiling and, honestly, just seemed like good people.

I really hope this place survives because it's an affordable, family-friendly pizza place on the upper east side. I believe they're also building a bar or something like that in the back.

So glad to see this place in the neighborhood. The pizza is as good as it gets! Also, the service is fantastic - very friendly. And if you choose to eat in, it's so clean, spacious and comfortable. What an original idea: they actually clean the floor and tables (unlike other places).
Service was lovely, staff was very friendly and accommodating! My boyfriend doesn't eat pork, and they let us know that the bacon is all beef.

Great service. Great new spot in the neighbourhood!
Nice ambience with the open front and lots of options

Very good and delicious
Free slice all the time :)
I'll come again
Good pizza place yay
Moe is an absolute homie. Showed up after they were closing and still got let into buy some slices
Great food and great service. Definitely pay them a visit! Ambiance is nice and ample seating too.
Consistently serving some of the best pizza in the neighborhood. Must try if in the area!

Yes !
Nice place good pizza
Variety of choices of pizza
Clean new and friendly workers
Great local spot! Great service. Will go here whenever I want good local pizza and yummy garlic knots.
My new favorite pizza spot. Super friendly staff and they open late while most fast causal spots are closed early!
Fantastic pizza. New spot but they've nailed the sauce and crust. Competes easily with all your favorite Brooklyn spots. And the folks working there are so friendly and kind. 10/10 recommend.
They have amazing pizza and awesome service. The chicken bacon ranch jalepeno slice is insane. This is my new favorite place!

For a NEW Upper East Side Pizzeria, this place leaves much to be desired. The pizza is filled with dough rather than toppings. Very thick and honestly, not very flavorful. With a pizza shop on every other corner, you'd think they would want to compete. The portions are small in comparison to other locals. The food/pizza lacks flavor and the staff is (kind of) stand off(ish). They've not been around long enough to be that way and corner their market. Perhaps it's a learning curve and I hope they learn before it's too late to figure out that curve. It looks like they invested quite a bit into the storefront. I hope they succeed.
Great slices that are made fresh, the service was extremely quick and helpful and the prices were super fair! Will definitely return!
absolutely great! huge fan of the place and Mo!! highly recommend! great local neighborhood pizza place:)

One of the worst places I've ever been to. I waited 30 minutes for 2 slices. Then when the order was ready, he gave me one garlic knot instead of the 5 he gave every other customer prior. He might has well had slammed my head into the glass and told me to suck him off. Disrespectful people. NEVER AGAIN
Super nice people, super great food. Would strongly recommend anyone to stop by - lots of variety, food is always fresh, reasonably priced.
Shes very warm, welcoming and inviting. She has samples just for taste and loves customer input. It has really nice decor and a lot of options for crepes,  worth a try

Increpeable was an accidental find when I went to the health food store. I was going to eat when I got home but after I saw how accommodating the owners were I decided I would try one.
This is a Mother and her son family owned business. The batter is made fresh daily.
When I saw that I could create my own crepe with the ingredients I selected I was very happy. I had a crepe with cream cheese, with tax it was only $7.62. They take cash and credit cards. The mother prepared my crepe while I took a seat at the counter.
Oh my was it delicious and filling. Before I knew it I wolfed it down!
I definitely recommend you visit. We certainly need a crepe cafe in our neighborhood. It's been years since the last one on 86th Street closed. I'm definitely returning! Next time I may get strawberries on top! I forgot to take a photo of the hours. They open at 11am.

Best crepes
Just like Paris
Homemade Jams for sale
Sweet and savory
Third and 94th

Adorable new addition to the upper east side. I love crepes and these didn't disappoint. The owner is so sweet and kind - she didn't pressure me to make a decision. I loved the tea she was sampling as well. Will be back :)

Incredible food! When I was there, another customer shared that he's French, and that these crepes are the best he's had outside of France!  I believe it. Fast, professional, personable, friendly service.

This is a new hidden gem! The crepes are amazing and the people who work here are literally so sweet and go out of their way to make sure you have everything you need. I'm so happy I stopped here while visiting New York.

The Farmer's crepe with cranberries was yummy - freshly made.  The home made vitamin water was also delicious and refreshing, lots of flavor.  Very friendly service.  Look forward to trying some of the other flavors.
Amazing food & ambiance! The people are wonderful and the service is great!  Definitely not to be missed!!
A new spot in the Upper Eastside serving delicious crepes.  Good choices and a nice sitting area too.  Definitely will be back for more!!

Increpeable is a new gem in the neighborhood! The crepes are freshly made and exquisite, the fillings creative and incredibly flavorful (both savory and sweet), the service is fantastic, and the atmosphere very cozy. I can't wait to go back.
Delicious! Happy to have a solid crepe spot in the early 90s! Cute decorations inside and the lemon curd crepe was very yummy. Friendly owners, fast service and I will be back for sure!

We tried the cilantro/scallion cream cheese and the mascarpone/mixed berry crepes, and they were incredible! The crepe itself is so soft and delicious and the ingredients are fresh and yummy! We will definitely be coming back! The owners are also so kind and let me sample their homemade jelly!

Delicious crepes and teas in an adorable feel good local shop. Everything tastes healthy and fresh that you don't feel guilty eating there. The owner is so welcoming and sweet that it feels like you are visiting your aunt's kitchen. Will be back

My friend and I went for lunch and sat indoors. It was a nice calming atmosphere with soothing piano music. Our server was attentive and lovely. I enjoyed everything I ordered: Miso soup, yellowtail roll, unagi and ikura nigiri. Fish was very fresh and delicious. Might be my new favorite neighborhood sushi spot!

Just don't. Taking fish from the grocery store and putting it on rice does not make it sushi. Poor quality overall and not fresh. I did take out so I can't speak on the fine in service but I will say the take out experience was quick.

Got 2 rolls of sushi from here, the Manhattan roll and Philadelphia roll. They were good but not great. Too much rice, not enough filling. I might come back if I'm passing by and want some sushi, but wouldn't go out of my way to come here.

Isohama is a great UES sushi spot. Every time I eat there, I find something new on the menu to love. From the miso soup to the different rolls they offer, everything is well done and carefully crafted by the sushi chefs. Depending on the time of day, the service might be a bit slow. The staff are very attentive, however, and the wait is worth it for the quality of sushi you get. I sat at the sushi bar last time I was there - talked with a woman who had been eating there for 30 years and told us she has never been disappointed.

For appetizers, my favorites are the steamed Shumai, Veggie Spring Rolls, and Miso soup. The rolls which stand out to me are the rainbow roll, spicy triangle (so yummy), and volcano roll. They also do the classics very well (philadelphia and california) but I recommend being adventurous with the menu - it has always paid off for me! Overall, it is a chill, reliable sushi spot
Sit at the bar and talk to the sushi chef! He won't disappoint. My favorite is Yellowtail sushi, maki roll is also good.

I went to Isohama a couple of times and although it's not my favorite sushi place it is good. Maybe I'm not ordering the best things they offer. I think I would rate it 3.5 stars. This time I ordered takeout. I tried the California roll which has tobiko balls (fish roe) and also tried the sweet potato tempura roll. The sweet potato used was white in color and I found it to be harder in texture and not as pleasant to eat as a result. The California roll was pretty standard. In my opinion there's better sushi in the neighborhood but Isohama is a fine choice if I'm in the area and don't want to travel further for sushi.

We came here for a quick dinner and really enjoyed our experience.

Food: We ordered the fried veggie gyoza and fried tempura for our appetizers. They were both delicious. The gyozas and tempura were crispy and the tempura batter was also very tasty. The dipping sauces for both could have used a little more salt. For dinner we ordered 3 rolls - sweet potato tempura roll, ume maki, and Phoenix roll. All three were tasted good. It was our first time trying plum sauce and for us it was too sour so I don't think we'll get the ume maki roll again but it still tasted good. The Phoenix roll was delicious! The tofu skin was cooked to perfection. And of course the potato tempura roll was nice and crispy, exactly how you'd want it to be.

Drinks: The beers are great as always as they are great Asian beer choices. I got the pomegranate margarita and it was not good at all. I think the syrup was clearly very artificial and you could taste it. If I go back I'd probably order a beer or a glass of wine instead.

Atmosphere: Inside the restaurant, the decor is really nice and upscale. It's great for a date spot. The outside dining area is not so great, more of a casual hangout. We sat on conference room chairs which I always thing is odd for a restaurant.

Prices: The prices here are very reasonable especially considering NYC prices. My husband got a large beer (22oz) for only $7. I got a pomegranate margarita and it was only $9. And these are regular prices. They also have lower prices for lunch specials and "early hours." Our entire meal came to less than $60 (included 2 drinks,  2 appetizers, and 3 sushi rolls).

The service was good but the food was way better before the pandemic. They are pricier than the other places but since my favorite place closed down I gave them another chance. So disappointing. The fish tasted and smelled fishy.

I order the same thing all the time because it is usually a 3 roll special; tuna avocado, salmon avocado, and whitefish with jalapeño maki rolls. Sushi should never smell. It should always be so fresh that it doesn't have a smell. This fish was very fishy and most of it went into the trash.

I will not be ordering from them again.

Basic Japanese with very good sushi and very generous portions
I loved their sushi sashimi combo
Delicious sushi and sashimi! The ambiance is simple and unassuming. Also, they have fried ice cream! This dessert is rare to find in any restaurant, and they do it well!

My wife and I have come here a few times now and have enjoyed it every time. The sushi is great, but we were also surprised at the variety of other traditional Japanese favorites on the menu--for example, a bowl of Zaru Soba (cold buckwheat noodles served in a basket with dipping sauce on the side) really hit the spot as an appetizer on a hot summer day. Add to that their creative roll specials, friendly staff, and a great sake/cocktail selection and you're in for a great night.

For dog owners--there's a patio outside where we were able to dine with our four-legged friend, and the waitress brought out a bowl of water for him.
Usually very good but our tuna rolls tonight look like they were filled with chopped tuna rather than solid pieces.  This is not ok.

Deserves clearly 5 starrs! This place has been consistently good in all our deliveries plus, recently we dined in taking advantage of the lunch specials. Fresh fish, amazing service (the lady is really nice) and clean place. We went with the stroller and although the place was fairy empty they were super accommodating
Def recommend it!!!

I would say that this is by far the worst Japanese restaurant in upper east side. We order Japanese food all the time so we are pretty used to the menu, choices and taste. The w tire order from this place had to go straight in the garbage. Not one roll was good. Chicken was dry. Edamame had strange taste. Look at the bill they have a $12 service charge, so obnoxious, if I saw it at the time wouldn't have ordered. seamless is great at hiding it.

Sashimi not fresh. It hasnt gone bad, but amazingly bland, which is a dead giveaway it isnt very fresh.

The chirashi sushi is $21, a bit cheaper than some of the other japanese restaurants here. But contents are the usual 4-5 fishes (tuna, salmon, mackerel, amd a couple others i cant readily name) plus tamago (egg), imitatiom crab, and small fish roes...  portion is small but resonable for its price, however the lack of freshness makes it very disappointing.

We also ordered Zaru Soba (spelled zaro soba on their menu for some reason). Which came overly boiled and with the seasoning tasting more like soysauce mixed with water than the standard tsuyu that should come with it. Literally any store bought tsuyu would taste better than this soysauce water.

The only thing made us happy was that they have a few selection of japanese beer and we found out we really like Kirin Light.

Overall i didnt feel like it was a rip off,  but its fairly close.  If they charged $25+ for the chirashi I would have given 1 star instead of 2 for sure

Visited my niece at school at Mount Sinai and decided on Sushi. Walked to this destination for an early dinner.

Isohama has a full menu from Sushi to main entrees at reasonable prices. I started with a $9 Mango Martini which was quite delicious.

We enjoyed Miso soup and 4 sushi rolls:  2 Veggie, 1 Mango and 1 spicy tuna.

The service was very good as was the surroundings. By the time we finished the tables were full with customers.

I would definitely return. Enjoy!

Arrived to the restaurant 1 hr before it closes as per the website and the staff did not want to serve me. This is highly unprofessional to have false advertisements on the Yelp app. The staff did not even have the decency to open the door and explain. They just made hand gestures for me to leave even when I pointed out the time.

I would give this zero stars.

I got the rainbow and Manhattan roll for $26. Sushi was pretty good and satisfied all my cravings! I will say this is pretty pricey for the amount you get and I wish the ginger was not pink but still thankful we have a good sushi spot in Yorkville.

The food at this neighborhood staple is always fresh and good they have been in the neighborhood over 25 years they have a secret early bird dinner special on the back of there menu from 5-7 wines are $4 cocktails $6 try there lychee martini and there pomegranate martini not the friendliness staff but this is typical of Japanese restaurants

Very pleased with this place. I've been ordering takeaway about once a week since Feb -- (It's April now) We usually pick it up since we are about three blocks away.

Fresh, great customer service, a decent size menu. I've had a lot of sushi on the UES and keep coming back. I would love to actually sit in some time (ha ha) My favourite is the Sushi for 2. I wish they would make a sushi for four!

You won't regret ordering from this place, though a smidge pricey -- you can't skimp on sushi!

They would have 5 stars accept one day they were too busy for delivery !?!?!
Definitely not the New York way
Good food !!!

I came around 5:30pm on a Saturday and was greeted at the door with hospitality. I chose to sit inside but they did have outdoor seating available as well. They have a very big menu! I ended up choosing the chirashi dish which came with either a soup or salad. I chose the miso soup and that came right away before my main dish. The soup tasted fresh and had lots of tofu. The chirashi was delicious!
They also offer many types of drinks as well. I'll certainly come back again to try the katsu and other menu items.

Edit 10/11/21: I tried their sushi and it's very good!

We ordered take out, and it was well packed and placed really well even in the take out boxes.  They also were very fresh and tasted very good.  I have always loved eel roll but the sauce could be too sweet for me a lot of times, this dancing eel roll we ordered today was good, not too sweet. The yellow tails were very fresh.  There were only three big pieces oh age dashi tofu, I would rather they made it smaller for easy eating.
Although service was a little slow, the food was excellent, fresh, varied and it was a nice and comfortable place to chat.

One criterion I always use for Japanese restaurants is the miso soup. Isohama's was shockingly watered down!  First time I've had that experience   The Alaska roll was average. The vegetable katsu looked particularly unappealing and didn't taste much better, with whole edamame combined with a vegetable paste.  Odd.  The hijiki was fine
Got the house salad, spicy triangle and wasabi salmon. I didn't think any of these were spicy. I thought the rolls were good and the staff were friendly.
This is a review for the delivery experience: missing dish, cold food, and request for extra soy sauce denied

I have been craving Japanese food lately and Isohama has been my go-to place. I have tried their chicken katsu, tonkatsu, pork gyoza, edamame, avocado sushi, avocado/cucumber sushi and it has all been consistently good.

Extremely rude. This is the third time the woman that takes orders is rude. She is rude to me in person and rude on the phone as well. However I've seen her treat others kindly. Today I ordered a little more than the usual for delivery. I called back quickly and decided to just change it to two orders of what I normally get. The woman hung the phone up on me. After I was trying to tell her no need to make a price adjustment just keep the extra money. NOOOWW... they can keep the food and refund my money as I no longer want to eat from an establishment that is rude and will hang up. I've given this lady too many chances and quite frankly I don't trust them preparing my food if this is their attitude. Her response is ... she's busy over on her end. I replied "that's fine, but communicate that with me don't just hang up. Now I don't want anything". The sushi isn't that great to have to deal with such an attitude. I only order from there because ooki sushi is a little further away. Never again. Keep your attitude and your less than mediocre food. Thanks. One less customer to make you less busy now

Decent sushi in the UES. Decently priced and you get your food pretty quickly. The atmosphere is nice and quiet.

The service was great - our server was very kind and attentive. The interior was comfortable and clean.

Make a quick stop here to get your sushi fix!

I went here pre pandemic and it was really good. However, I picked up dinner from there today and that was not the case. I got assorted sushi and salmon roll. I wasn't convinced it was horrible until...One of the fish that came with the assortment was shrimp. The shrimp had not been cleaned and still had shit in it. I added a photo but it is a little blurry. I got a seaweed salad which I had to toss out as well. I won't be returning.
Sushi was generally good there. The Isohama special 1 was good but didn't really stay together. Overall good value and atmosphere but wasn't as fast as we were expecting.

Can't trust the Seamless menu! Ordered pick-up from this place since it was close by and was told upon arrival (not when they received the order) that an add-on I opted for on Seamless was a mistake and so was NOT honored/included (I guess an economically bad deal for the restaurant). Bit annoying but I let it go.

Turns out they had also made an upward adjustment in price to my order for another item, as I discovered later. This fact was NOT communicated to me when I picked up the food (and the Seamless price adjustment alert was vague on the details, forcing me to call the restaurant later to figure out what the deal was).  Apparently, the item was, again, "mistakenly priced" when I ordered on Seamless.

I really fail to see how any of this is my problem - either this restaurant or Seamless made a mistake in pricing or had a system glitch - but the restaurant didn't even feel apologetic for not honoring the original order and seemed to think it was perfectly reasonable for the customer to be footing the bill (and bearing the frustrations) for THEIR oversight.

The thing that really took this to a 1 star experience though, was the restaurant's proposal to credit back the upward adjustment (it was only a few measly bucks), but only if I ordered from there again. This coercive type of "customer service" just really does not fly with me. Their food is decent but not amazing - def not worth dealing with tacky business practices.

On the bright side, this has gotten me to break my COVID drought (laziness) on writing Yelp comments hehe.

Best sushi ever!  Honestly!! We are visiting from the west coast and took a chance on this place and we're so thankful we did. Loved the crispy jalapeño calamari, cucumber gimlets, lychee martinis and specialty appetizers.  This was such a great find!!

5 stars for a 5 star establishment!!!

I've been visiting this lovely restaurant since 2016 and can confidently say this is one of my favorite sushi spots in NYC.

Most reviews below mention their liking towards the menu and the quality. I can attest to both as I've tried numerous dishes (both for dine in and take out) and have always tasted the freshness in their food. This is especially true  with foods where quality can be the differentiator. Try the uni, limited toro rolls or the ikura (picture attached) to taste it yourself!

I've been really impressed with their service during COVID as they continue to deliver exceptional food with exceptional service. The staff tends to patrons promptly, offering a warm attitude and a clean atmosphere (they immediately scrub tables + super thorough). They opened up a fantastic outdoor seating area with heaters, sliding doors, and sliding windows, making the dining experience a tad bit more comfortable.

Easily the best neighborhood joint UES can ask for. I've moved quite far from the area but nothing can stop me from coming back :)

Delicious specialty rolls. The space is large enough, feels comfy and the service was great. I came right they opened looking for a lunch getaway from work and my wish was fulfilled.

I loved the dressing on the green salad. I will definitely come back here, theres not many great sushi spots in the 90s!

I've lived on the upper Eastside for for a long time and tried most of the sushi places here. I don't know how it took me so long to find this place.  They have the best sushi in the 80s and 90s blocks in Yorkville. I've started to regularly order the sushi lunch and I've had the sushi for two (only for one, don't judge) and everything was really tasty and has great texture.
They also don't water down their wasabi so it's nice and spicy and they give a generous portion.

The staff is always really friendly too which is a feat given the pandemic. So happy I found them!

Unfortunately, this restaurant did not live up to expectations. The nigiri was tough and had an unpleasant chew to it. The rolls were loose and fell apart as I picked them up. The whole meal had an unfortunate "fishy" smell characteristic of seafood that had sat out a bit too long.

On the positive side, the staff was friendly and the food was ready promptly.
Great food. Nice staff. I especially love the lunch specials. Bento boxes with veg tempura, dumplings, and sushi roll.

I loved everything about my time here! The vibe is very chill, good for a date or chill catch up with friends. The prices are pretty reasonable, especially for UES. The food was really good! They sanitized throughly between each sitting, which I appreciated. Everyone was very nice! Will definitely come here again!

Service to customers was much better in the past. Prices have increased.
I have to look for another place for Japanese food nearby. How sad.

Easy 5 stars for one of my favorite sushi spots in NYC.

One thing I live about going to sushi restaurants is that every place has their own unique dishes, something you can't get anywhere else. The first time I went I asked the waitress what she recommended I try that was unique to their menu and she suggested the crazy tuna roll- out of this world. I asked why their tuna roll tastes so great and I was informed that this place uses real bluefin tuna (very high-grade).

They also have a very wide drink selection. Last time I had the Japanese soju which was very refreshing to have with the meal but they also make Lychee martinis and along with Japanese beer.

Aside from the amazing food, the service was truly amazing. Everyone couldn't have been more friendly or accommodating.

Overall- this place is a must try if you're looking for sushi in the UES. Whether  you come here on a date or in a large group, you'll have a good time!

This is one of my favorite casual Asian restaurants on the upper east side. I was very pleased with their food, especially their yaki udon, sushi, seafood tempura (a must try!) and calamari with special, spicy Asian sauce. The workers were very kind and the service was very good. Isohama has great lunch specials and an amazing early bird dinner deal!

A pretty decent sushi restaurant in the UES to dine in at.

I got the Spicy Triangle Roll (6 pcs) which contains spicy salmon, yellowtail, tuna flakes, with masago & chili sauce on the outside. Very nice presentation and pretty standard specialty sushi roll pricing at $16.

Service is pretty decent. Someone is there to check up on you every once in a while and to refill your water glass. Looking forward to trying out other specialty rolls that they offered as they do look intriguing.

This review is for delivery only - I've never had a sit-down experience but this doesn't exactly inspire confidence.

I fully acknowledge that part of what transpired rests on my shoulders. After all, Japanese takeout isn't known for having generous portions. Maybe I'm just too used to seeing sushi laid out on a plate as opposed to crammed inside a takeout box but I could have sworn all my other sushi excursions have involved, well, much bigger portions.

I just don't think the minute portions and the so-so quality of the fish justified the high prices. In total, one chirashi bowl, one naruto roll (without rice), and one tofu appetizer cost $45. $45!! I could have made an obscenely extravagant meal with $45. Look, I don't mind spending more on high quality food, even if that food requires me to eat a second meal. But what I don't like is getting mushy fish, taking gingery bites of said fish, and waiting in trepidation for my stomach to explode hours later.

Also, the tofu appetizer was absolutely laughable. They forgot to pack in a little thimble of seasoning and bonito flakes so when I unpacked the bag, I pulled out a small container of tofu blocks ... on a bed of ice chips. Yes. I paid $5 for a container of tofu, a solid cup of ice, and some cucumber slices. I ended up calling Isohama and asking for a refund but not sure if the refund ever went through, as neither Seamless nor Isohama have gotten back to me yet.

My naruto roll, on the other hand, was delicious. Puny in all its 5-piece glory but delicious. I suppose I'll chalk all this up to a hard-learned lesson that unless I go all in to an AYCE sushi joint, I'm never going to get full off of regular sushi.

Steeling myself for the inevitable comment from the owner in 5 ... 4 ... 3 ...

UPDATE: I have to admit that the owner's response was pretty funny. I wasn't aware that a hatred of extraneous ice chips had anything to do with one's political leanings but I learn something new every day!

unfortunately the fish didn't taste fresh in the salmon/tuna roll I got... they delivered in 20 minutes and are so close to me, but with $22 for one fish roll and one vegetarian roll, it should be a lot better

We got the sashimi box that comes with salmon roll
It was a disappointment!
Sushi was not fresh the rice was not fresh
Almost like the quality of  the sushi you can get from grocery store !

And dear funny manager, we are not at it. It's in the garbage!!! I would suggest to spend your energy on your food quality!
Always good food. Super reliable and very fast! One of the best joints on the upper east side!

Food was delivered fast, it was fresh, delicious, AND the delivery woman walked up 5 flights of stairs to drop it off! It tasted even better than I had anticipated and will definitely be ordering from them again

This is the story of the girl who worked on Saturday mornings during the summer. Well, the girl who lived on takeout and grew to love the same order from Isohama of:
1 Fried Vegetable Gyoza
1 Spicy Dragon Roll
1 Miso Soup

The above order came to about $23, which for one person is quite reasonable for a sushi dinner on Manhattan's Upper East Side. The sushi is tender and quite fresh. I love this order because its a mix of spicy, sweet, and very filling.

Ivan has been here for years. I just realized this morning he's not in Yelp. I told him I added him. I got a Pistachio Muffin. He sells out fast. Unlike the other cart I went to this morning Ivan currently sells his muffins for $1.75. He's a very nice man and is popular with the local residents like me!! I'm recommending.....

Food: There are a lot of options when it comes to food and drinks. There are so many veggie rolls to pick from and they even made something off menu for my husband. I got the veggie tempura roll and it was so yummy. They actually had all types of veggies in it and it was perfectly crispy. We got 2 appetizers there - the veggie gyoza and the scallion pancake. The scallion pancakes were delicious and perfectly flavored. I will say that the veggie gyoza tasted like all others I've had at other restaurants, good but not excellent. There are a few other veggie apps I definitely plan to try when we go back. My husband got an off menu avocado peanut roll. This is one of the few sushi places where I felt like they didn't skimp  on the avocado or peanuts. The drinks menu looked delicious but we weren't really feeling like alcohol so we got a pot of tea. The tea comes in this beautiful pot with very nice cups. We're big tea drinkers and are pretty specific about our teas and their jasmine tea was very nice - beautiful blend of different flavors.  This whole pot of premium jasmine tea was $3!? We were stunned!

Service: The staff is very friendly and the service is very fast even when they are really busy.

Ambiance: This place is so cute. I love the theme, it feels very modern but comfortable at the same time. It's great spot for dates or small groups. All their dishware and glassware was so beautiful and perfectly in theme with the restaurant.

Price: The prices are very reasonable and I was very surprised at the amount of food we were able to get for less than $40 for 2 people. We got 2 appetizers, 2 sushi rolls, and a big pot of tea. Bonus: Unlike most places, they didn't charge us extra for sriracha or spicy mayo.

Overall, this was such an amazing dining experience. I am so grateful it's in our local neighborhood so we can keep coming back. Our favorite sushi place closed down post COVID so we are ecstatic to have found Ikyu.

Not bad, but not great either

The ambience is very chic.

Wagyu was not Wagyu
Toro tasted like herring
Uni quality was not what you'd expect for Hokkaido uni
Uni was $16 per piece- a bit overpriced
The crakes lacked flavor and we got 3 for $18 (this included the toro- see above)
Service was slow, but it was a busy night (so understandable).

I enjoyed Ikyu when I went for dinner with my friends! We came on a Friday night and it wasn't that busy we were seated right away. The service started out pretty fast but got a bit slower over the course of our meal. But the staff were friendly.

I decided to go with the sautéed broccoli in garlic sauce with chicken. It was pretty solid! It tasted pretty classic, good flavor but nothing super fancy or anything. My friends got sushi which looked absolutely delicious! The tricolor sashimi looked absolutely beautiful and my other friends got the maki C roll combo which they said was very good!

They seemed to have a good lunch special so if I come back I def wanna try that! Overall it was a pretty solid spot but didn't blow me away. I found it a bit expensive for what I got but I guess it is New York so...

High ratings for a reason! One of the best sushi spots I've been to.
Firstly, we walked in and every table was full, instead of asking us to wait they offered a spot at the bar, perfect for my uncle and I, seating us right away! Bright, modern decor, definitely thoughtful about the space. I loved it compared to other spots in the neighborhood. Prices are absolutely reasonable for the quality of service and food! Don't be afraid to be adventurous here, you won't regret it! I wish there were more drink offerings, however the lychee martini paired nicely with everything we ordered. Cheers Ikyu, I'll be returning and recommending you!

Not bad but not great. I thought the fish quality was kind of mediocre and the flavors just kind of average. The uni sushi was $16 but was kind of watery and flavorless not the creamy briny flavor I had hoped from something claiming to be from Hokkaido. I was also taken aback that my tuna crake only had 3 little pieces for a whopping $18. Made worse by it not tasting like tuna at all. For the price, I'd expect slightly better quality! The decor inside was very cute nonetheless, very trendy! Service was slow, but it was pretty busy, so understandable.

But I guess what do you really expect from a Japanese place that also for some reason serves general tso chicken...

The water here tasted very questionable. Not sure what was happening there.

The fish, however, and main course, was pretty good. Relatively fresh and pretty tasty.

We stopped by on the second opening day and got 20% off our meal plus a complimentary dessert.

When walking into this restaurant, it has a beautiful decor, very bright and nicely designed. There is also a sushi bar to sit in front of the restaurant.

We ordered the sushi for 2 which came with both soup and salad. The sushi pieces, while they were fresh and good quality, I would've liked to see more better variety. They did mention that the Moriwase option would've been the "better selection fish". Will have to get that option next time.

The complimentary dessert was a matcha pudding, which was delicious!

The service was also excellent and very attentive!

Overall will try next time and get different dishes!

Not really a standout among the japanese restaurants in this area. We stopped in to dine during their soft opening. We wanted to get a good scope of the new place so we got a sashimi platter, sushi roll, yaki udon, Thai tea, and matcha pudding.

Our favorite was probably the sushi roll; the sashimi just didn't carry the punch. The Thai tea was.... Definitely not it. The udon and pudding was good, but not good enough for a repeat.

It just seems like Ikyu is putting on the clothes of higher end Japanese dining and hoping you don't notice that the ingredients are middle tier at best.

We ordered delivery from here and I thought the sushi was just ok. The spicy tuna just didn't taste that fresh and the crunchies were pretty soggy. I also didn't love the salmon avocado roll. Maybe it would have been better to order the special rolls or sushi/sashimi dinners.

Came in without a reservation for dinner for two and got seated right away! (Which was lucky, it seems like a busy spot). The interior was well-decorated and cozy, though many of the tables are so close together it sometimes felt like I was eating with strangers. Service was incredibly friendly, but more importantly, the sushi tasted so fresh. We got the sushi and sashimi combo and were both fighting over pieces because everything was so delicious. The cuts of fish were thick, and the rice yummy and not too chewy. Will definitely consider coming here again for date night in the future!

Pearl scallop roll - get it! Skip the teriyaki here though, it was kind of dry and there wasn't much sauce or flavor at all. The rice and vegetables stood out more in the dish we got. Also loved rainbow Naruto roll, my friend prefers rolls with rice so the pearl scallop was definitely a standout. Also got the agedashi tofu from here, one of my go-tos and it was solid.

So, for context, I entered within an hour of opening on a Friday and was the only sit down customer here for my dining experience. It was immaculately quiet and the staff are highly respectful.

Food: 5/5 --  This is easily the best miso soup I've had -- I know someone else wrote this, but seriously it is REALLY good. If you don't believe them, believe me. I could probably order two miso soups per entree because it is HITTING. As for the sushi itself - I ordered the three roll lunch special and once again this is likely the best sushi on the UES. I've been searching for a new king after Isohama changed ownership and I think I've found it. The fish tastes very fresh, and while the rice could be warmer, I believe ** Ikyu's fish quality is punching above its weight price-wise. **

Service: 5 (?) /5 --  I entered on a slow Friday at around 12:55 and was the only sit down customer. YMMV on busier times and days, but I have no complaints. I don't get the sensation you'd be left wanting for more unless you are used to very upscale service. This is NOT your place for being treated like royalty.
