Ambiance / Decor / Aesthetic: 4.5 / 5  -- Whether you're taking a date or friends, Ikyu has you covered as far as aesthetics goes. While I'm not huge on flashy looks, there is a trendy look with very comfy brick walls and a beautiful light-up wooden wall panel carved in the shape of ocean waves. It feels like what Ikyu wants you to do is relax, and they achieve it. Also, their seats are very comfortable.

What a great restaurant!!!

I'd been looking a new great sushi place in the UES and I think I just found it!  I hate having to go all the way downtown or midtown when I want good sushi so I'm always on the lookout for great new places in the neighborhood.

Ambience in this restaurant is really nice.  I like how calm and pristine the place is.  It's definitely a place where you come to enjoy the amazing food in a quiet and calm environment.  It's not a huge location, but very well designed with ample space between tables alongside a sushi bar and a drinks bar.

Now on to the food - had a Kani salad. Sweet shrimp sushi and a spicy salmon hand roll.  Every single one the dishes was better than the other.  Will definitely be coming back to have some of the regular and special rolls as well as some of the hot dishes.

Finally service - nothing extraordinary to call out, but a decent complement to the other 2 drivers of a 5 star review for this restaurant.
Loved!! Food was great, inside was very cute and clean. We were seated quick and our waiter was very attentive. Will def be going back!
Great addition to the neighborhood. We loved the special rolls, rock shrimp and edamame. Staff was also great

Really soft and calming atmosphere with delish sushi rolls. While I didn't try any speciality rolls, the quality of fish, rice, etc. was really wonderful. Miso soup was a 10/10. Only downside is that they didn't have their liquor license yet when I visited for sake, but I'm sure that's coming soon.

We stopped by today for an early dinner. Turns out this place has only been open for a week! The decor was calm and minimal and the service was delightful. I have celiacs, which can be a pain - especially with Japanese food, but they were knowledgeable and had gluten free soy sauce for me.

My boyfriend ordered the pork katsu with the miso soup and in his very descriptive words, says it was, "perfectly cooked." I tried his soup and I think it might be the best miso soup I've ever had. It was had this wonderful caramel depth to it. Hard to describe, but you should try it.  I ordered the edamame, cucumber roll, and the spicy scallop roll. Edamame was heavily salted, but in a good way. The cucumber roll was simple and refreshing and the spicy scallop roll was absolutely delicious. The scallop was still sweet and the spice was perfect. Plus I love the crunch of tobiko.

I absolutely recommend this place and I'm excited it's so close by! I'll definitely be back. I hope you try it and enjoy too.

Ok so let me start off by saying that this is restaurant is the definition of Confusion Fusion .

Their menu goes from Sushi to soup dumplings to general Tao chicken .

My girl and I always passed by this new spot and thought about trying it until we finally did .
From the outside , the restaurant seems somewhat elegant and interesting enough to try it out . It was by far the worst mistake of my life .  

First we ordered -pork soup dumplings - it took so long for our dumplings to come out that I genuinely assumed they forgot to place the order .

When it finally came out steaming hot I couldn't help myself but take a bite of it right away .

Something didn't feel right my first bite so I ripped open the dumpling and took a look inside . The pork had chunks of raw meat and I almost puked .  We respectfully sent the soup dumplings back and canceled it .

Next was the chicken and broccoli and general Tao chicken .

The chicken and broccoli was oh Kay . It just wasn't sauceyyy enough for me to mix it with my rice like anyone would .  

The general Tao chicken was delicious but something was sketchy about the texture of the meat . It was way to tender in a weird rubbery way .

I was soooo disappointed in this spot and their menu that

1.) I WOULD NEVER GO BACK
2.)  I appreciate my local hole in the wall chinese food spot.
3.) again , I WOULD NEVER GO BACK

I hate to leave negative reviews but this one was a must .

Came on a Friday at 8pm without reservation, and the whole place was packed with multiple parties in line. Was told our party of 2 will need to wait for ~30min. They unfortunately have too many tables for 4 that were only seating 2 people (I counted at least 4) while there is a party of 4 sitting at the sushi counter, so overall not optimized for the crowd and seating. They don't combine parties into a table, so kudos to them. But would highly recommend that they get more tables for 2 that can be combined into tables for 4/6/etc. All their tables for 2 were full.

The exterior and interior of the restaurant look very elegant. Ambience was nice. Lots of couples/parties of two.

Food was delicious! My partner greatly enjoyed the sushi. Am not a big sushi eater, so I mainly ate the yaki udon and the fried rice, both are super delicious with lots of meat/veggies. The fried rice contains chicken, beef, and shrimp, but you can ask them to remove any of those ingredients.

Would come again during non-rush hour or if they are able to optimize the seating.

Love a nice freshly decorated Japanese/Asian fusion restaurant in the neighborhood. Ordered the yellowtail jalapeño tri color sashimi on the Japanese side. Was decent and acceptable for a local sushi spot, nothing worth going out of the way for. Came with a salad or miso soup, we got the soup.

Was feeling hopefully about the Asian fusion dishes (see note below), so got the Szechuan dumplings and crispy orange chicken. But it was also fine. Nothing to write home about. Or maybe I came in with my expectations too high.

Service was good. Good was good. Atmosphere is probably the best thing about it. Definitely nothing negative to say. But nothing totally spectacular.

Side note: on the delivery apps, this restaurant uses the same account as the now closed China Jade. Since it was once of my favorite restaurants in the city, I was hopeful that this is its revival. (Staff denied any connection, but same delivery app account, same napkins, same dish names- could you blame me?) But alas, the fusion menu items may contain some items from it, but certainly does not taste as good.
Ordered the 3 roll lunch special for delivery and it was the best one I've had quality wise on the UES. Will definitely be my new sushi ordering go-to!

Incredible addition to the UES (and conveniently right next door!). Solid lunch options at 3 rolls for $15 and and 2 rolls for $12. I got the chirashi bowl and was quite happy with the quality and quantity of the fish. My girlfriend got three rolls--basic staples like spicy tuna, salmon cucumber, etc, and also was very happy--the rolls are fat!

The interior is quite pleasant with nice light wood paneling and soft ambient lighting. Will likely go here for lunch takeout but it's nice to sit down and eat in as well.

As for the service, no complaints. The waitstaff were prompt and polite.
This place is consistently delicious. I love the combination of specialty rolls as well as great entrees. Friendly and quick service and great ambiance.

A new sushi and Asian fusion restaurant is on the upper east side, and I recommend you try it. The restaurant is beautifully renovated. We shared Edamame, Black Forest roll (soft shell crab, avocado, and cucumber topped with eel and avocado), Dragon roll (shrimp tempura, avocado and cucumber) and yaki soba with chicken (which was accompanied by a delicious miso soup). To top off the meal, we had Matcha pudding (which was like a panna cotta) covered with sweet red beans and beautifully presented with a dusting of Confectioner's' sugar and Matcha. We also liked that the pitchers of water were infused with lemon. A delicious meal. The staff are lovely and welcoming. We are definitely coming back.
Great fresh fish with vibrant harmonious flavors! Quick service and nice aesthetic, hit the spot.

My wife took me there after having a take out the other day. The food was great so I followed her this time to sit down and eat there.
Food was still great. And the place looks meat. Service.... Awful. The bartender was juicing his lemons with a very loud machine for the entire meal while joking loudly with coworkers like he was in his apartment kitchen.
The waitress was incapable of lifting her feet up in order to walk like a normal person and was sliding across the room with the very obnoxious sound of her shows ripping the floor out every time she needed to go anywhere. Might wanna get a couple back up pairs.
And then, after we paid and were chatting for a min, I kid you not, she literally dropped dirty dishes from another table right next to my wife in order to pick up her glass to then carrying it on to the dish area.
If it was dropped next to me I probably would have had a bad reflex and slammed it away. This was unbelievably disrespectful and nasty.
Next time will be a take out again!
Fish was very fresh - some of the best I've had in the Upper East Side. Service was quick. Hit the spot! Definitely try the ooki special roll

We had the edamame, shishito peppers, beef negimaki for apps followed by "sushi and sashimi for three". Everything was consistently great. The service additionally was top tier--our server Ken was so attentive, helpful and fun. The space itself is clean and welcoming with nice wood finishes and lots of warm light. Will be back!

Have been wanting to try Ikyu since it opened up.  Was not disappointed!  The sushi was so fresh and the atmosphere inside the restaurant was so calm and peaceful.  My order arrived quickly, the staff were friendly & I will most definitely be back!

FRESH and CLEAN

The inside is beautifully minimal: a very calming aesthetic. The service was perfect, no complaints there. Salmon sashimi was served with a lemon zest. Not a huge citrus fan but the salmon was delicate and fresh nonetheless. The shishito peppers were heavily salted (which I liked) and perfectly cooked: delicious. The miso soup had a soothing texture and vibrant flavor: one of the best in town. I also ordered the angry dragon roll and the yellowtail and scallion roll: both really good!

Definitely recommend coming here. I will be back.
This place is a scam. They run multiple seamless places in it and food is horrible. Stay away from this scam
An okay restaurant portions are good sizes but overall the restaurant lacks major features that warrant a reason to come back to the restaurant

We were there couple of time ( two times in a week ) the food was very tasty , fresh and great value for money . The green peas were wonderful, sushi is nice and the cheese cake ( Yuzu ) is excellent , worth trying ...
Excellent house fried rice. Only got takeout, but the inside looked really nice and inviting. Will be back to dine in soon.
This place is delicious !! So beautifully decorated, amazing food, and reasonably priced. The service was also incredible. Will absolutely be back

Julio is an amazing host.  His kind and gracious demeanor made our evening exquisite.  The food was phenomenal and the drinks out of this world.  We enjoyed a dinner with our daughter who was going to Fordham. It was an unforgettable evening.  We came back the next night for desert.  The quality of service and hospitality is exceptional!

With the overabundance of restaurants in this area it's a bit of a mystery how such an underwhelming joint stay in business.

Positives:
* Ambience: we sat outside which is nice for people-watching and to enjoy the breeze when not too hot or not too cold
* Service: overall attentive although they yanked the bread from the table a few minutes before the entrée was served without even asking.
* The menu says splits are $2.50 extra, but they split both dishes for free

Negatives
* Prices: this place is way too expensive for the quality of the food they offer.
* Food quality:
   o Risotto: was bland and not as creamy as you would expect. The rice quality itself seemed low or maybe they did not use the right rice. Also, it is supposed to come with chopped asparagus, but there were just a couple of small pieces.
   o Sole: I thought the flavor was very good (although my wife was not as impressed), but the texture was pretty bad, very mushy and undercooked.
   o Bread: the first round of bread tasted stale; we asked for more with our secondo and they brought out a completely different much better one (why not just offer the good one?)
* Variety: the menu does not have all the options you expect from an Italian restaurant

If they cut their prices in half I will consider going back.

IL Carino was an unforgettable experience!!! You get generous portions and the service was INCREDIBLE! Special shout out to Julio who went above and beyond :') The bathrooms were clean, and the ambiance was perfect too!!! Make sure you try the tiramisu!!!!!!! There's nothing like the one at IL Carino!!!!! Thank you Julio and staff!!!!

Do not come here.
Food was horrible! The bread tasted so stale and the mixed green salad was way too salty. The tomato in the caprese had zero taste, was not fresh. The tiramisu also had a stale taste to it. Chicken parm and gnocchi was good.

Note: early bird menu price increased from $25 to $30, but it's not stated on seatd. Waiter was very unaccommodating to this fact and made us cancel our seatd reservation to be able to order from early bird menu lol.

The restaurant was a ghost town when we arrived and should've taken it as a sign not to enter.

Will Not be returning!
Absolutely wonderful environment. The bolognese was superb and the fried vanilla ice cream was divine! Can't wait to come back, everyone was so incredibly kind! 10/10

We came to this restaurant because it was on Seated and close to us. We're so glad we ended up coming!

The wine here is EXCELLENT. I got the house wine and it's one of the best house wines I've had. I recently got back from Italy and after that, most wines have been disappointing but Il Carino definitely exceeded expectations.

As an appetizer we got the zucchini fritti. Again, exceeded my expectations. The batter they used was well seasoned, the zucchini was cut thinly, and the entire thing was perfectly crisp.

As entrees, I got the pappardelle alla boscailo. The entree was okay. The sauce was really good but the pasta was a little too sticky and felt eggy to me.  My husband got the orecchiette caccese and he LOVED his food. He killed the entire dish. We also got their tiramasu as it was part of the Yelp check in. The tiramasu was delicious, not too sweet but a little dry.

They also give complimentary bread.

Ambiance - It's a really cute restaurant. They also have outdoor seating the front which was nice.

Price - The restaurant is a bit on the pricey side. The appetizer was almost $20 and the entrees were closer to $30. My glasses of wine were over $20 but I will caveat and say the pours are generous.
We did luck out as we had used Seated so we got 17% back on our bill so we didn't mind too much. If you're local to the city, you should definitely try Seated to get cashback on your dining. If you use this link, you'll get $15 extra on top of your cashback: seated.app.link/5p5snzGX…

Went to this Italian restaurant in NYC for dinner with my extended family due to convenience to our rented apartment and the good Yelp reviews and was disappointed. We all found it solidly okay, nothing more. The interior is quaint. Service was a bit grumpy - zero flexibility on subbing out the mashed potatoes that came with the shrimp with pasta instead, which seems odd when there was no lack of pasta on the menu. Also found it strange that the waiter described a red snapper special and when I ordered it 2 minutes later - with only 3 other tables full in the restaurant - he told me it was sold out. My filet of sol was fine but not great. The broccoli side dish with garlic was excellent. It was a very meat heavy menu - both chicken dishes had meat added to them, which I also find strange in 2023. You can do better in NYC!
Great food and services excellent dining service love the dessert ice cream with pear

I don't recommend this place. Poor greeting, poor service and absurd prices ($21 house wine with no menu).
Came in as a single female for dinner tonight. I made a reservation in the Seated App an hour earlier. The restaurant had 1 couple in it so it really didn't matter if I was a walk in or on Seated (an app where I upload my receipt and get cash back from the company, not the restaurant).
The man who greeted me was rude and barked at me that he didn't get a call from Seated.
He sat me, rudely barked the specials with zero prices and also wine list (no prices). I asked for a house red (which he rudely said they all were) and he poured me a $21 (TWENTY ONE) dollar glass of wine.
I got a salad with really disgusting, not fresh bacon bits, pasta that was super salty and some tiramisu- that was fine. My bill was $80 because of the wine- absolutely insane.

No wine menu or pricing was offered.
I asked for a receipt and again was barked at for not taking a picture of a hand written bill (against the rules of the app because it lacked a name, date or time).

I will NEVER dine here again and have already told multiple people of my awful experience and warned them not to dine here ever since I left the resturant.

Unsure if the server/owner(?) was sexist, racist or just hated that I was a single female dining alone but it was not a good time and I should have left earlier.

I kept thinking it would improve but it absolutely did not.

DIRTY DELETE-
Edit to say to the owner who called me names on Google Review and put me down for dining alone (then DELETED his comment): What an ugly thing to say. I don't dine alone, I just did this time. Interesting how you can't argue with anything I stated because it was the truth. What an awful establishment. I'll be sharing your comment all over social media to ensure no one else experiences this.
To be clear- they wrote me an awful response AND THEN REWROTE IT.
Also they're wrong. Other people in their reviews have complained about their bait and switch about pricing. I'm not the only one.
Go ahead and look at other reviews.
Proof is there.

I noted the gnocchi and Fettuccine Bolognese recommendations from a previous Yelp review when I and my party of two walked past the quaint storefront. The gnocchi did not disappoint -- it was soft and deliciously creamy.  The Chicken Francese had a very strong "Lipton Noodle Soup" taste -- quoting my dinner guest.  The desserts were wonderful, specifically the Tiramisu.

Like other reviewers, we also experienced the grumpy host who would walk away whenever we asked for his recommendation: "Not now, I am busy." Well, thank goodness for Yelp!  We ordered what was recommended on the app. We were glad to get out of the cold and we were obliged a table within 15 minutes without a reservation on a Saturday night, so there's that.  I also appreciate that they were ridiculously understaffed.

Our wine was soo good! The meals were superb, the salad on special was split 3 ways (we ordered 2)

I had the sausage and pasta ears, wife had the white clam sauce and daughter had gnoge also excellent, we are getting desert as well. Atmosphere is really nice, can hear each other and the service is very attentive

Great date spot, but also a nice family meal

We had dinner here tonight and it was wonderful, Julio took such great care of us from our water, drinks, appetizers/salads to our entrees and dessert. We had such a nice time and could not have asked for a better dinner. The food was on point (and delicious) but the wow factor was Julio preparing zabaglione tableside for us!

Went for a weekend dinner, no wait. Take our review with a grain of salt as we're not very familiar with Italian / American-Italian, but we didn't like it very much.

Had the ORECCHIETTE CACCESE & GNOCCHI DI PATATE CON CREMA ROSA AL TARTUFO. The caccese was more like a stew, we were expecting it to be more oil based. The gnocci was also just ok. Also had an app that was eggplant in red sauce which I can't see on the menu on that was good. The tiramisu at the end was the best part, as we like ours moist. Some people may not like that. May just have ordered incorrectly and maybe other stuff on the menu is better, but we probably won't be returning.

Standard American Italian food. They serve the kind of stuff you can definitely make better at home when you aren't trying to serve a large amount of people under restaurant pressure.

They fall into the category of : you are feeling lazy and want something familiar and comforting for a fair price. Under those conditions this place will do the trick. Similar to your neighborhood pizza spot that isn't great but is reliable when you just need a standard slice and have had a long day and don't want to cook nor clean.
Amazing service and amazing food. So glad I got experience this place while visiting NY. Will definitely come back!!!
Service was fantastic, as was the food. In a neighborhood loaded with restaurants this is certainly a place worth considering.
What was that sauce on the chicken parm?   I have been going here for years and that was just ick.  New chef?

From the appetizers to the main course to finally the dessert...it was amazing. We had fresh baked mozzarella with their home sauce; a fish and scallop dish; roasted pork with homemade fettuccine; and a liqueur whipped cream on fresh strawberries. The service was great. We highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic night out!
Cute little hole in the wall place for when you want real authentic Italian food. We were a large group of 7 and all of us loved the meal.

Gnocchi is omg so delicious. It honestly just makes other pastas live in the dark. Gotta try that Gnocchi! Yum!
We redeem this free tiramisu from Yelp check-in as you can just show it to the waiters. It's so good! And see how nicely they setup the plate for this free tiramisu! :9
Also, Il Carino has great interior aesthetics with vibe - it's great for dates and family/friends gathering. I love how each waiters are passionate about food and proud of their dishes - definitely appreciate that enthusiasm & you'd want that at a restaurant!
However, one thing I wanna point out is that the price is set higher than most places while the pasta I tried isn't as worth the price.

I honestly didn't have any expectations before coming since it was a last minute reservation for my gf and I but boy was i wowed . As you walk in, you sense how intimate ambiance of the restaurant with the close tables and dimly lit lights. The servers were incredibly respectful, chatty and offered great recommendations. We got the veal and pappardelle and sheesh were they delicious. The creamy mushroom sauce from the noodles paired perfectly with the tenderness of the veal. My mouth still waters when I think about the mushroom pasta sauce . I would say if your looking for an intimate night out...definitely try this place out!!

Amazing!!!  The veal scalloppini with white wine, capers and lemon sauce was exquisite.  Their halibut flaked nicely with a slight char that stimulated my senses just so, but left no bitterness on my palate.  The sauces were perfect: not too overwhelming and complemented the meats and pasta.  Dessert was just lovely!  If you like sweets, try their tartufo: vanilla and chocolate gelato with a cherry or raspberry sauce, shaped into a ball and covered with a chocolate shell.  Tiramisu was also delicious!  I would go back again and bring all my friends with me :-)

Delicious food and amazing service!! I went there for dinner on my birthday weekend and we were all so happy with their food and portion sizes. The staff was super nice and the banana and ice cream dessert we got in the end was something I'm definitely going to go back for.
ravioli was really good, and the service was great, tratuffo was amazing definitely recommend that for dessert

With all the other Italian options nearby, don't bother with this one. Fine dining prices with the added experience of a bullying waiter.

The service made me feel stereotyped and exploited. Us 3 ladies should have taken the hint when we arrived on a busy Saturday night but this restaurant was void of activity.

After we told the waiter we weren't interested in bottles of wine, the waiter up-sold us on glasses of wine that turned out to cost as much as our $30-$50 entrees. When we asked for the check, he aggressively pushed the dessert options at us and left us to "reconsider our decision" when we declined twice. We had to flag down his colleague to get the bill and remove ourselves from the hostage situation.

Finally, when the bill came our waiter was suddenly unable to split the bill for the 3 of us. At that time, there were maybe 9 people dining. Not a problem, we wrote down our card numbers next to the items we ordered. He returned. We wrote our names and calculated our own subtotals without tax. He couldn't run it. Finally, he insultingly told us we would have to calculate the tax ourselves because he couldn't figure it out himself. Sorry your POS is a POS, but I understand why others dine elsewhere.

There's too much competition in NYC for good Italian food and kind service, and Il Carino has eliminated itself from the running.

We got their gnocchi and it was pretty good. Good portion sizes as we had enough leftovers for tomorrow. We got take out, but from what I saw, the restaurant looked homey and welcoming. I would recommend it to the homies!

A favorite of ours in the upper east side! We love coming and ordering takeout at IL Carino, both ways food is great! We ordered from pre fixe menu and also got an off the menu dish, the Veal Parm. And did I mention homemade pasta! Was surprised that this is not a regular menu dish, I suggest this to be a regular, it is that good!! Can't wait to start coming here during the summer with the live music!

The best Italian spot in the UES! If you are looking for an upscale and authentic spot, this is it. The food is delicious and so fresh and the service is impeccable. People should be running to il Carino! The apps of mozzarella and the eggplant were delicious, not a crumb on our plates. For dessert our fried ice cream with berries was to die for. For dinner I did the shrimp in the spicy marinara and my partner did the Bolognese, both made to perfection. Their wine list is expansive and a price point for everyone.

First of all very expensive for mini bowls of pasta
The you got to watch you bill also
Two Salad as they say meaning sharing it with two others. The salad was six leafs of arugula on each plate for $30 please give me a break!!!
Plus get a green card too.
Food ok
Break a bit stale too

Amazing food and service. We had the arugula special for appetizer which was tasty and good size portion. The pastas were perfect, tried the linguine and fettuccine bolognese, both delicious. The chicken parm was good but recommend the other dishes first. The service was amazing and quick . Highly recommend for an authentic cozy Italian dinner

Overall (2.5/5): A hopeful contender for your local neighborhood Italian spot, but falls flat. Food is unimaginative and bland, service is less than average, cost is trying too hard to impress.

Food (2/5): We ordered two plates of pasta and both were imbalanced - either too salty or too much wine without enough herby-ness. The tiramisu was cloying sweet and not satisfying.

Atmosphere (3/5): It was a bitterly cold winter night and we opted to sit in the outdoor seating area with heating. The heat was not adequate and we were shivering. The service was both overbearing and not attentive enough. We had to wait for a table even though there were plenty of empty seats available upon arrival.

Uniqueness (2/5): Nothing to note of special here. The specials listed that night were fairly typical for Italian fare.

Value (3/5): Split a bottle of wine and a meal with dessert came to around $50-60 per person.

This is our family's go-to spot for special occasions or when we had a bad day as we are always treated like family. The food is always delicious and if nothing on the menu sounds good, the chef will special make me something. (His grilled chicken is stupidly delicious). We always let Julio pick our wine and he always picks affordable but perfect wine. I cannot recommend this place enough.
Best Fra Diavlo!! Great staff. Consistently tasty and just what I needed. I'd recommend them to anyone

The food and serving here were amazing! My bf and I had to specials of the day which were so tasty! Our host and waiter were super nice and friendly. Try the house wine it was delicious.
Would definitely recommend
Amazing restaurant and food! The gnocchi was perfect. Service was incredible, such  a hidden gem. Highly recommend!

We had a reservation and got there early ..there was a private party going on and the hostess came out the door and said they are closed.. like we were in the wrong place. I told her we had a reservation and she said, NO! Very rude tone. I said we were early and she said, also in a rude tone, later maybe but not now. We left and went across the street to Cafe D'Alsace and had amazing service they were full but took us right away and we have a lovely table, food and wonderful service. We'll never go back to Il Carino ever again. They do not value customers . Note to staff, never say NO to a customer. Kindly explain the situation and apologize for the inconvenience... don't treat them like they are mistaken and at the wrong restaurant.

The pasta dishes the 4 of us had were all below average--the mushroom pappardelle almost terrible with mushroom that tasted like canned mushroom and overcooked pappardelle; yet the fettuccine bolognese and linguini clam cause were not cooked at all (pasta had still white uncooked portion yet the water first responded that's al dente...). The calamari was also nothing special. Do not understand why this place has 4 stars on Yelp when there are so many better Italian restaurants in the city.
The food is was delicious. The ambiance charming and very Italian. The service was wonderful. I ordered the veal and my wife ordered the fettuccini bolognese. Both were wonderful.

Came here for sit down dinner. They checked for proof of Covid vaccination. The wait staff was patient and didn't rush us to order nor give us the bill until we were done with dessert.
The lighting is quite dark inside and would've been better if the light was brightened up a bit so that we can see our friends and the food better.  
The pastas we ordered were good size portions.

We had an excellent Friday night dinner here with my family. 10/10 service.

We ordered the eggplant rollatini appetizer (10/10!!) and a few pastas. The orchiette with sausage and pappadelle marsala were two of our favorites. I had the veal picatta as my main- also very good.

Can't wait to come back again.
Highly recommend.

Let me start off by saying I'm picky about Italian food. Nothing tastes quite like the homemade Italian food of my childhood. This place did not disappoint. Drinks were great. Appetizers were fabulous and the homemade pasta & gnocchi was amazing. This was an amazing dinner. Absolutely loved it.

Indoor dining
very attentive staff who are well informed of the dishes and prices
Salmon, chicken and veal dishes all very well made The food was delicious especially the salmon.  Very well prepared with attention to detail. They served bread which was also very fresh!

It's a small cozy restaurant and one of my favorites. I like to stop by every month or so to treat myself to their pasta dishes. I've had the bolognese, the gnocchi, and a surprisingly lovely pasta e fagioli soup. Delicious food and excellent service.

They have the best minestrone soup! I'm a big fan of making fresh soup, but when I'm not really up for it all... I ordered from here and get my fix. It's just like in Italy.

I love their pastas, I've had a chicken dish or two that were great and the tiramisu is amazing.

To be honest; I haven't had a bad experience with anything I've had here.

Visiting the city for a running event tomorrow. Needed a good pasta dinner so my wife and I decided to check IL Carino's out based on the food pics. All I can say is that it was excellent top to bottom. Great authentic Italian food & excellent service and ambiance.  What a hidden jewel. Highly recommended.

Good food. Got the gnocchi. Nice gentlemen when I walked in to pick up my order. The restaurant is very cozy and very welcoming. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone who's looking for something more lowkey.

Really bad experience. Went for my father in laws birthday with my family and initially started out okay. A small thing was the waiter seriously tried to up-sell us multiple times, for example by only offering sparkling water to start, and pushing us 3 times to order drinks before everyone even arrived, which both we rufesed. The real issue started when my fourteen year old niece asked if her uncle (the birthday man) could get dessert on the house 'secretly', which they agreed to bring something out. I was actually surprised they did but was willing to pay for ONE dessert with a candle or something if she had been mistaken so I was not worried. They brought out a beautiful plate of desserts which we all thought was really nice of them, until we received the check with a charge of four desserts for over $60 alone. When I asked about it they said that my neice (again who is fourteen) had ordered all four desserts. Which to be fair she did ask for something to be brought out with a candle, maybe it was wrong to assume it was on the house but charging for four desserts seemed like taking advantage of us, especially since they informed no one of this and it was ordered by a child!
Additionally when I tried to explain this, the waiter became really rude and said that they had been so nice to us and 'even split the plate of two people that had been sharing' which we agreed was really thoughtful but we did not ask for at all, and to make it worse they charged us for each plate they split without informing us it would be more expensive. Eventually they took off the dessert but not without making a scene and bad mouthing us to customers at the next table which was embarrassing.
Overall the service and food was okay but the deception and overcharging put a damper on the night, and ruined a birthday. I would not go again, instead invest your money at any of the other lovely restaurants near by with actually nice staff.

IL Carino is the best Italian food in the area. The Carbonara and Bolognese are incredible. The experience is so memorable - the owner is very attentive and personable. Pro tip: ask for the Bananas Foster even if it's not on the menu. They make it table-side and it's delicious! They even gave us complementary after dinner drinks for being returning customers. Highly recommend!!
I can't believe I paid $50 for the worst meal ever! The baked clams were burnt, like eating rubber and had NO taste. Linguine in clams was just had bad.  Won't be ordering for here EVER again!.
Love this place for its old world charm, good food, and lovely staff. My husband and I recently had a fancy date here and they treated us like beloved family  the pasta is *chef kiss*

the food size is humongous, it is really worth your money. the service is fast and they are very accommodating , they pay attention to your needs. the ambiance is lit!  i will definitely highly recommend this place for any occasions! it is worth the travel and money well spent

Place was LITTT !!! Service was awesome !!!
The food was better than I expected  lastly ambience was on point !!!!

my friends and I celebrate a bachelor party for our friend and it was the best decision ever. the ambiance is lit! the music makes you want to dance non stop! service is spectacular! definitely recommend this place! food serving is humongous!

I came here with a group of girls for a birthday brunch on a Saturday, and there weren't a lot of other parties inside, which I found odd for a brunch spot in midtown. We made a good time of it though.

The coolest thing about this place is that with whichever pre-fixe option you select, you're given a full size bottle of champagne, which you're able to drink, out of a straw. I mean how often can you say that you've drunk an entire bottle of champagne, through a straw?! I elected to go for the surf&turf option. The food wasn't terrible but again it wasn't something that made an impact; it got the job done. It was helpful to have on hand when drinking the champagne.

The DJ played some good songs and it definitely got people out of their chairs. By the time we left, the establishment still wasn't full, but we made had a good time overall.

As others mentioned, you come for the vibes and not the food. I was here for a birthday brunch at 230pm. I ordered a bottle of red sangria and the waiter opened a bottle of white sangria. I told him i ordered red, to which he then said "they ran out".... This wasn't true but he had to say that because he had already uncorked the bottle.

I ordered eggs Benedict. The food for the party literally came out at 5pm. I couldn't even eat the eggs then. I did try and a couple of bites in, I bit into an egg shell. Great! I couldn't finish eating. The food was cold too.

The only plus here is that you can do a brunch and celebrate during the day like it's a club. Music was good and vibes too.

My friend had a birthday dinner here, and it was very interesting for lack of a better word...

Vibes 2/5: The interior reminded me of Sugar Factory but dimly lit and with a cigarette smoke stench. And the DJ...my oh my...he was so bad that it was funny. He played the same song 3 times within an hour and used the weirdest sound effects. Thankfully, he had a decent playlist. Lots of RnB, Reggaeton, Afro Beats, and Hip Hop.

Service 1/5: So, I think they gave us the wrong menu. The week leading up to the reservation, my friend was in contact with a manager who agreed to provide the Friday dinner menu that comes with apps, an entreé, dessert, and bottomless drinks. However, they ended up giving us a Saturday menu, which (for $50) came with 1 entreé and a choice of rosé, champagne, or sangria. Also, instead of glasses of water, we got mini bottled waters, which was strange; it felt like I was at an elementary school party.

Food 4/5: There was a choice of 3 entreés. Penne vodka, chicken parm, or rigatoni. The chicken parm was surprisingly good, tender, and quite large. Penne vodka was decent.

I don't think I will come again :( It felt a little ghetto tbh, but for the price point, I guess you can't really expect too much!

This place didn't live up to the hype. They moved locations literally last minute, a day before my friend and I were supposed go there. Good thing my friend checked because it was originally a 5 minute walk from her place that then turned into a 35 minute walk, we would've missed our reservation if she didn't check her email last minute and realize the location change. The pricing was good, I will give it that. $50 for a bottle with a meal included is great. And the music was good. But it was way too hot and since we were just a party of 2, we got shoved in a corner. Theres not enough space. We did have a good time but this place is overrated.

The staff and reservation folks are phenomenal! Always great hospitality and do a good job with booking large parties.

This spot is a littttt brunch. Expect dancing, being tipsy and having a grand ole time. the 2-6pm time slot tends to be the most fun.

My issue is the consistency with the prices. The brunch ended up being like 80 a person up from the 65 that was originally mentioned. A the prices at the bar are super random and they charge a pretty penny at the bar.

Also this spot is more about the vibes, the food is an afterthought.

Great place!! You would miss it if the music wasn't felt outside.  Great place to celebrate birthdays. Place was full. I believe they have 3 sessions of seating- noon, 2pm and 4pm. Not sure if they have anymore. The food selection is good. You would definitely find something you can eat.  

I was with a party of 15 mostly girls. We had a blast. Due to the size of the party we waited longer for our tables.  But we still had a great time.

I ordered the Par LaFreda burger , can't go wrong with that. It wasn't medium rare but it was still delicious and it comes with fries and a bottle of red sangria.  
We danced the whole time! I would definitely  come back.

This was a very fun and chaotic brunch spot. Admittedly, when we booked the place, we did not know that this would be basically a club but we were pleasantly surprised when we walked in and Drake is bumping in the back.

This is definitely not a place where you want to go and drink and have a conversation. You will not be able to hear the person next to you. It is very much a drink eat and dance place.

The deal they offer, full bottle of your choice of red or white wine, champagne or rose and entree per person for around $60 was great. The champagne was great. The food was bad but also wasn't the best. I think the lobster Mac was the best think I had there. Also you're not really coming here for the food, you're coming for the champagne and the vibes.

Service was good too, the people were friendly and they brought out sparklers and a sign for my friends birthday. Overall I would come back if this was the vibe I was looking for for brunch.
Soo fun, great atmosphere. A little busy- food was delicious, took a while but was worth the wait

I went on 10/28 for the 12pm brunch and it was mediocre at best. I was basically told that we had to get there @ 12 pm or wouldnt be seated if anyone was late and if they decided that we were to still come in that our brunch deal will be rated at the highest price. i was told that we only have the table for bottomless for 90mins! You would assume from 12pm until 1:30pm. I was also  told to let the waiter know I was celebrating my birthday to get free goodies (a free shot and confetti with a sign).

All 12 of my guest got there at 11:50am. They opened the doors at 12:07pm and we were seated by 12:15pm.

The men's and women's bathrooms were completely filthy and rancid from the night before, it was disgusting.

The waiter we had was so rude, he never smiled and was not helpful. He came to us at 12:38pm to take our order And that's when we we're served our drinks.  When we told the waiter it was my birthday for the goodies, he said everyone had to buy shots to get the "free goodies."

The food was okay, nothing special.  At 1:30pm we were given the bill and were told that was the end of bottomless were all very upset. I was told we had 90 mins of bottomless but only were given 52 mins instead.

After I spoke to management he allowed us to hang out 30 mins more with only one more bottle of champagne for 12 ppl!  

Needless to say, I'm disappointed and will never do an event here again.

So this place would've been POPPIN' IF all of the tables were filled. I went on a Friday night (9:30pm) I was told that they just started doing Friday's so people may be unaware that they're open....

Upon entering there was a DJ playing good hip hop music... The tables had black cloth and the lights were really dim so it was a party scene. My friend and I were seated and waited on rather quickly. We all ordered different entrees. The drinks that came with the $45 Prefix was a cheap $5 bottle of Champagne/Rosè. You can get better champagne for a steep up charge. There are a few items on the menu at prefix price but if you pay attention there's an up-charge for specific foods.
Everyone found their food to be okay no complaints.

I just wish there was a bigger crowd for the night to experience the place in its best form where everyone is on the dance floor having a time!  

I wouldn't come back because at the end of the day I feel like some things are just meant to be a 1 time experience. It's not worth the money that they're asking for.

I came to this brunch spot for a birthday brunch and would never go back again. The only reason I gave 2 stars is being held by how good my food was. I got the steak and eggs and it was so juicy good cooked to perfection.

However my overall experience was a 2/10
We walk in and coat check is mandatory so the lobby is filled with people waiting to hang their coats up $5. It was a blood boiler when 1 person from a maybe 8+ party tried to have their people cut the entire line after they came much later. We were lucky someone in the lobby said the heck with that and made a scene. Even though another 1 person in front of me had the coat check woman go OUTSIDE to grab 2 other people's jackets. The young girl working the front just watched all of this unfold and cut in when voices started to raise. That was a joke. Anyway, We walk in and most of the tables to sit are on the dance floor. People are dancing and pumping into you while you are eating, real fun. They did not have enough space on the table for our reservation that was made weeks prior. They bring a small table and it is literally broken as I'm falling when you lean on it. Another issue was that they did not have the number balloons we reserved (suppose to be apart of the package we pay for) The bottle per person was of course all sugar and 5% alcohol the white sangria has a chemical taste to it and the mimosa was not a good selection as it tasted so sugary.

I feel like the place is run by teenagers who have no idea what they are doing or what's going on.

I would not recommend visiting this spot.
2/10

I came here for my best friends brunch. We had a nice time. The music was good and the DJ kept the vibes going. To eat I had the burger and a side of Mac and cheese. The burger was delicious and the fries were AMAZING. I do not recommend the Mac and cheese. It had absolutely no flavor. To drink I had the Bellini which was good.

If you read the reviews on this place, it is true they do charge $75 for a bottle and an entree. The bottles are the same ones you can purchase in the liquor store for $6-10. The bathrooms definitely need an upgrade. Also our waiter was not very attentive. Overall I wouldn't return, Coming for the experience was enough. If the bottle selection was different, possibly but I think it's a bit outrageous to mark up $6-10 liquor store selections so much.
Went on a Sunday and unbeknownst to me, there was a brunch party going on. Too loud, too tacky, extremely bland food, and overpriced.

The place was nice, for a young crowd that's into super loud music. My friend had her birthday here and she enjoyed herself. (I wasn't a fan of the music or the vibes but it was her bday not mine). We all had a bottle of champagne with a straw which was really cool, and the price was awesome for champagne and meal (I had lobster and crab quesadilla which I really enjoyed) but the service was slow/ we had a reservation and it took forever to get the table. Getting shots at the bar was also slow. All in all, it's a cute spot for people in their early 20s who love to party.

this place is TRASH! i went with my girls for brunch. I needed to use the ATM. i was told by staff to use the ATM near the rest room. When i did,  my card got stuck in the machine and has been stuck in there, for the past forty minutes. i was told by the manager that my card wpuod be out in five minutes bc the guy with the key the atm-was on his way. While documenting what was going on, the bar tender took my phone and light attached and slammed it to the floor. I was so shocked all i could do was call
911. I told the manger and he is still on the clock. It was mind boggling. I'm never patronizing this place, -again. i was so
Excited to come here.

Whole bottle to yourself with long straw.

Jumbo shrimp very good.
Dj played tunes very loud vibe, like a nightclub almost.

Dance floor was good but
bathroom need improvement.. dryer dont work and stalls were narrow and small.

Service: Nothing really remarkable. The server did his job and that was that. He was able to make some recommendations that helped to narrow down the choices.

Food & Drinks: THE FOOD WAS AMAZING!!! Flavorful, Fresh just PERFECT!! Absolutely, no complaints with any of the meals.! The wine bottles were a nice touch - we did not get straws but I assume they were out. For those of us that didn't drink, they had alternative options.

Ambiance: The music selection was "GIVING"! Such a vibe. The floors were a little beat up, especially inside compared to what the waiting area looked like. I loved that they gave free cake pops & number balloons for birthday's - nice touch! DJ was good, they played pretty much ever genre except Rock music - great balance.

Bathroom: The bathroom was horrible - there were toilet seats actually missing. They had an attendant for the bathroom - nice touch.

Sidenote: I took mostly food videos, and they are on instagram.

For more photos and videos, please support my foodies instagram @hike4foodies

Left after 5 minutes. We were seated fast and were provided menus by a server. The menus were disgusting. Actually the most disgusting menu I've ever had the displeasure of being presented- and I've been to a lot of restaurants in my lifetime. Both were sticky, discolored, and old looking ... did I mention both were STICKY?! The photo I posted shows the condition and the splotchy areas were the stickiness. My friend mentioned the menus were sticky, the server was visibly immediately annoyed and waved his hand and said "well that's what they gave me I don't know " gesturing to what I assume to be the kitchen? Um ok. No offer for new ones, no apology, nothing but annoyance at our mentioning it. While viewing these filthy relics they called menus, I tried to look something up on my phone and noticed no signal at all. Tried to log into wifi- three wifis were listed as Il Bastardo but locked. We ask the server for the password, again- immediate visible annoyance, he plops his phone in the table to show me the password while mumbling " yeah but I don't know if it works". Umm ok. I tried it and it didn't work. I ask if there is someone else who might know or can help and he's now more annoyed/flustered and asking us repeatedly for our order. Another gentleman came over and walked me to the front to try to help and clearly this is an ongoing issue no one knew how to solve. After being treated so piss poor by the server, the condition of the menu, the confusion of basic wifi- we decided to leave. The security gentlemen, host who seated us, and bartender were kind and treated us well and the only reason for any star at all. Would not recommend or return. The chandeliers are pretty ... that's all I got ‍

I'm going to give it a 4 because the brunch prefix menu and a champagne bottle to yourself. The atmosphere and music is dope . But the FOOD was not it , I had the steak and eggs and I wasn't happy about it like at all. I was struggling to cut my steak and YES I ordered it Medium - Well. It wasn't giving what it was suppose too. Also, I felt the servers was a bit pushy when it came to serving the table. That's all I had to complain about.

I would recommend going with a group of your good friends just to get f*cked up and enjoy the vibes.

Food: 5/10
Music: 5/10
Vibes: 7/10

I came here yesterday for my cousins b-day brunch. Sunday Brunch at Il Bastardo was basically having brunch in a loud club. The music was so loud that I had to scream over it in order to speak to anyone. The music itself was ok. The DJ played a lot of old songs and old r&b, with a small amount of new songs. Usually, I like it to be the other way around, but that's just personal preference. The food itself was also just ok. I think that $75 (per person-not including tax & gratuity) for basic chicken and waffles and a bottle of mimosa is too much. It could've easily been like $50. The food took an hour to come, which was annoying because I was starving. I drank my entire mimosa bottle, and I was just barely buzzed. I know it's just champagne, but I've had much stronger mimosas before at other places.The only things I liked about this place were the vibes and the look of the place. The decor kinda reminds me of clubs in Miami. Overall, I think that Il Bastardo is overpriced and overrated. Most likely, I won't be coming back here.

Might as well start the class action lawsuit for the irreparable ear damage I suffered while attending brunch. The rose is sparkling... falsely advertised on the menu... unacceptable. Food was mid. Music way too loud. Service was slow, and they were not accommodating.
Go anywhere else. Dollar slice would suff

So upset I even have to give 1 star.

1- mandatory coat check for a cropped motorcycle jacket that was apart of my outfit- $5

2- I had to leave my card and ID in the front in an envelope.. keep in mind I left a visa

3- time to pay, I use my AMEX.. the manager who I gave it to returns to the table 5 mins later with the receipt for me to sign but hands me the Visa and ID I left in the front earlier. I said where's the card I just gave you "what card? This isn't it?"  Proceeds to look on the table for the card.. he's like "check the receipt" ... I started to think maybe I was losing it & didn't give him the AMEX, check the receipt and I was correct my AMEX is what was swiped. He goes "oh" then walks away and comes back with it. Such a scam, how does my card get misplaced immediately after swiping it but you some how end up with the card and ID I left in the front.

4- let's not forget about the chase we had to do to get our waitresses attention because she was so focused on 1 of the many fights that took place during my 1 hour there.

5- once a party leaves, they just smoothen the table cloth out and sit the next guest.. no changing of the linens, no disinfecting, not even a candle on the table.. just a plain dirty black table cloth

I don't know how anyone celebrates a birthday here

So many events in 1 hour, I'm pretty sure I forgot some t.

So after seeing this restaurant on Instagram I was so excited to come here and experience their brunch and I wasn't impressed at all. There was nothing extravagant once you leave the entry vestibule into the dining space. The music was decent with the DJ they had for that day. The service was as good as it could be I suppose. The food however was just okay - nothing that left me wanting more. A potential highlight to others might be that you get an individual bottle based on the menu tier you order from, but that doesn't appeal to me. It felt very cheap and I won't be coming back.

I visited Il Bastardo with a friend for their birthday and it was a great experience. We made a reservation for a Saturday for brunch. They mainly played loud, hip hop music and there were various tables celebrating birthdays so it made for a good experience. We went in broad daylight but the club/restaurant is DARK, it literally feels like it's midnight when you're there. Everyone was pretty much dressed up in dresses, dress pants, etc.

We ordered the French toast and the regular champagne as well as Moët. The French toast was pretty good and the champagne definitely had us drunk. Overall, it was a great experience! A fun place to come to celebrate birthdays or any other fun celebrations.
Fun place for a celebratory boozy brunch! I'd been wanting to come here for a while and staff helped make my friend's birthday special.
lit vibe, food is good and photographers are good!! I had an awesome time here for the Saturday brunch with friends. It was 8 of us and we all had a good time!!

Came here for the first time to celebrate my fellow elite's birthday! I was thrown off at the 5 dollar mandatory cost check.. CASH ONLY. It would of been nice to know this information before hand on the website. Also, it's not consistent as I saw many patrons going in with light jackets similar to what I had on.

Inside it is completely dark and LOUD. Loud to the point that I had to type out on notes what my order was and communicate with various members of the party. The space is SMALL and I understand that the Covid numbers are low but still.. wow!! The service was decent. The waitress did the absolute best she could considering the large amount of tables she was handling. The wait staff made sure we had water (bottles). The food portion is large yes however for a 75 dollar pre fix menu to only
Include pancakes and one other basic item is horrible. Even if you were getting a burger it's an additional monetary amount.

I noticed they really really emphasize on birthdays. This is a birthday spot. Please don't go for a family brunch or date night. It's not romantic or calm lol. The DJ played the best music and even honored my special music request

A huge problem is the BATHROOM. The stalls are broken and poorly managed to the point I walked in on someone using the restroom. Super embarrassing.

The location is not really near public transportation but it's in a nice neighborhood.

If you're looking a nice dinner, this ain't the spot to go to. Prices are garbage. 50 dollar minimum - For Eggs! The vibe isn't it for a get together, you can't talk even to each other it's so loud. Pretty lame
Came for a coworkers birthday brunch and had a wonderful time. The service was amazing, considering seeing coming back for my birthday
The food is overpriced. The music was way too loud for my liking and the facility overall isn't clear. Please don't waste your money here!

Never even if if this place before me friend mentioned going. At first we was told it was a popping place on the weekends but maybe we just got there early we got there at 10 music was loud just not a lot of people. It was a pre-fixed menu that came with a bottle of champagne or wine. We ordered our food I got the lobster Mac and cheese it was additional 15 dollars I didn't see anything on the prefixed menu that I wanted or seem appealing it came out in a timely manner was very hot. The lobster Mac and cheese I must say was delicious it had lots of lobster which I didn't expect so I was very happy about that. My friend got the burger was included on the pre-fixed menu she said it was a good burger. My other friend got the rib eye steak which was a extra 30 dollars she said it wasn't worth it the steak was bland. But all in all I can say we enjoyed ourselves and the food will go back but hopefully it's more lively with more people

This is not your average brunch. It's a club that serves brunch. My chicken sandwich was good, massive, but fell apart quickly. My friend got the Mac n cheese and it was so delicious.  Be prepared to not speak to people, music is wicked loud. But it's a fun time. Mandatory $5 cost check upon entry.

WHAT A GOOD TIME! I researched forever for the perfect place to have my bday brunch as I had friends in from out of town. I was on the fence about this place bc of all the extra charges but when I did the math it wasn't much more than any other bottomless brunch spot so I went for it and was so glad. If you arrive on time for a noon seating and get a regular meal and bottle it's ~$65pp including tax and tip. And it's soooo worth it. The Dj was amazing, the bottle you get is FULL SIZE and will get you drunk. Food is ok and comes with sides as described.
They do have mandatory $5 coat check unless you can fit your jacket in your bag but they didn't charge me the 5% admin fee or cake cutting fee and I brought my own cake. Service was great and the number balloons were indeed free. We had a great time and I'd def go back for another special occasion.

Great brunch spot but eat before you go. I had the undercooked chicken and waffles and the bacon and cheese stuffed tater tots. What they don't tell you is that you only get 3 the rest was regular and sweet potato tots.

Not sure how I can sum up my experience, but there was nothing exceptional about this spot. Don't get me wrong. Its nice but not exciting. I visited on a recent Saturday to celebrate one of my close friends' birthday. Il Bastardo is located conveniently close to Hudson Yards. If you've had a chance to see their instagram page, you'll notice lots of sparkle and celebrations. We went for their brunch event. When you walk in, there is a $5 mandatory coat check. Not sure why its' mandatory because I saw quite a few men inside with their coats around their chairs. Once you walk into the establishment, it is dark with some LED lights, just like a night club, and the music was really loud. It didn't give me the typical brunch atmosphere I'm used to. There are two sections, one on the main floor and another section just slightly above. I'm guessing the lower section is really a dance floor with table situated there. It wasn't too packed when I arrived around 4:30pm. Very few people were dancing and there was a man dressed in a light-up robot suit, going around and entertaining everyone.

Once seated, we began to order. Il bastardo offers a pre-fixed option which I think is overpriced. Starting at $75, you get 1 entree and a full bottle of alcohol (e.g. champagne, sangria, mimosa etc). The menu offers a variety of American brunch classics and some lunch/dinner options such as, chicken and waffles, steak and eggs, french toast, etc. Depending on what you choose, it may cost you more. For my choice, I went with the crispy chicken sandwich which was an extra $10. For my drink, I chose a white sangria. When I think of a white sangria, I think of a mixed drink with fresh fruits. What I received was a bottle of Arbor Mist. Disappointing. I did not bother asking for something else, as I'm not a drinker. I ended up sharing the bottle among the table. The food came within a reasonable time. The chicken sandwich was made quite well. Although small, the sandwich features a crispy fried chicken breast on a brioche bun, topped with some aioli sauce, lettuce, tomato, and a slice of avocado. It also came with a side of crispy fries in a decorative basket. Everything was tasty, prepared well, and at the right temperature however, the portion seemed a little small. My friends enjoyed their meals, no complaints. After our meal, we continued to order shots and other drinks. The staff came over twice with a happy birthday sign and sparklers to celebrate my friend. We brought a cake but they charge a plating fee per person, which my friend did not want to partake in.

Our reservation was from 3pm-6pm however, they will allow you to sit longer until they need the table. We were able to sit until about 8:30pm, which was nice. We spent the rest of our time afterward, at the bar. As time went on, the place began to get packed. It turned into a full on club. Women were taking their shoes off and twerking at their tables. Guys standing on the side taking photos with their friends. At one point, someone proposed to their loved one. Among all things, vaccination is required however, masks did not seem to be. People (except staff) were walking throughout the establishment without masks - in the bathroom, at the table, on the dance floor, everywhere. I wish they had enforced that a little more. The crowd seems to be mostly early to mid 20s of all ethnicities. The music is a blend of popular hip-hop, R&B, and reggatone however, the DJ was not that great. Sometime he would play some great songs but transitioned poorly or cut the track too early. When we asked for a little Caribbean music, he played maybe 4 songs then went right back to hip-hop. We asked again once a different DJ came on board. He played the same songs the last DJ played but added maybe 3 more. Not enough variety in my opinion. Service was good. All of the staff are kind and attentive. No issues.

Overall, I didn't think this was an amazing experience. It was mediocre at best. Despite the food being good, I don't think it was $85 worth of good food, and that does not including tax or tip. Thats pretty expensive. I've had a better time in Harlem at a boozy brunch, for that price. I hate that the pre-fixed option includes a full bottle of liquor for one person. I would rather the option of a mixed drink or an unlimited pitcher for the table. A bottle seems overwhelming. In addition, the vibe was not as upscale as I would expect for the area. I felt like I was at an 18+ party. As someone in their early 30s, this is not the spot if you're looking for good music and food with an occasional two step. So, 3 stars for good food and service. However, I will not be returning and I would not recommend to anyone seeking a more mature vibe.

oh nah..

this place is a no no.

came here for a friend's brunch and looked at the 'dress code' and thought i'd follow out of respect for the party but had i known i could show up like a hoodrat I would have.

anyway, i fully understand why this place is named il bastardo because you feel like one once you step in. a big one.

this is a new york one & done, never see myself coming back here unless someone wanted to disrespect my corpse.

Went here for my bachelorette brunch/party and had an amazing time. Kinda hard wrapping my head around the bad reviews. I guess the place is a hit or miss. Staff were friendly and helpful, there was no wait to be seated at our reserved table (we did come at 12:30pm so if you dont want a wait, I recommend coming early). Dj was on point, food was great and came out quickly. Overall a great experience. Perfect for celebrations. 10/10

Came on Friday because we were told by their staff they are open. Went and found out from the restaurant next door you guys are never open. Disappointed on how they market the business on saying they are open and are not officially. Honestly, wouldn't recommend if their people can't even be honest on time.

Visited last weekend to attend a birthday brunch. Overall, the atmosphere of the place was great! There was a great vibe and the DJ was playing classic old school throwbacks as well as current top hits. Everybody was dancing and enjoying themselves. The waiter was friendly and attentive. Also, he never rushed us and there was no time limit. The plan was to order from the prix fixe menu but there were not many options and I didn't want to have eggs with my champagne as I knew that wouldn't sit well with me. So, I paid $10 extra for the crispy chicken sandwich. Then, an additional $10 for a side of fries. The sandwich was really good but I was kind of annoyed that it didn't come with a side. This place basically nickel and dimes you anywhere they can. When the waiter dropped off the champagne bottles at the table he never brought a mixer such as orange juice. When I looked around at other tables no one had juice as well. I thought that was odd as I never experienced a brunch that did not include that. I'm not sure if someone from our table asked for the juice but eventually he brought some when I was pretty much halfway done drinking the bottle. Also, a silly thing to point out but those straws are super long and they don't bend. They are not practical for drinking with those bottles but look cute in photos. Lol. I rated four stars because I had a good time but overall the place is mediocre.

for anyone who is thinking aabiut coming here for a bday celebration... dont. you would have more fun buying food from a diner, getting drinks from a liquor store and hanging out IN a dumpster. if you have a 12pm reservation, doors do not open until 12. expect to get in, be seated, and order food by 1pm.

if you bring a cake, they will bring sparklers and a bug birthday sign. perhaps even number balloons. if you just do the 12pm $50 pre fixe expect a $8.99 bottle if champagne and the most underseasoned meal youve ever had in your life. they will give you a tiny bottle of water and a free dessert for your bday.

there is a mandatory coat check.

i knew from the reviews that this wasn't going to be great but i went for the experience anyway. the dj played every 90s hip hop song throughout and the led costumed guy never showed up. i was just very underwhelmed. bring bagatelle back.

if you want to experience this, feel free. but for the price and what you are actually getting, that's gonna be a no from me in the future dawg. the gnocchi was also v bland. the burger was the only decent meal but even that was just ok.

Was a little nervous to book my birthday brunch here as there were so many mixed reviews, but my party and I loved It.

Pros:
-when we were there It was more of the older twenties and up crowd, which was nice for our group.
-food was great! Nothing fancy on our end for the basic options but tasty brunch food nonetheless. All of us enjoyed our entrees.
-each person gets their own bottle of champagne or rosé.
-the DJ kept things really lively. Definitely lives up to the "club brunch" title

Cons:
-Food took a really long time to arrive, and we had to ask a few times about some missing entrees
-bathrooms were ROUGH
-music was LOUD . Like can't hear what the person next to you is saying loud.

Overall, if a club brunch is what you're looking for, this is a great spot. $75 a person grants you club entry, an entree, and your own bottle of bubbly. I would come back for a birthday celebration. Heads up they do make you pay on one card.

I'm giving it 2 stars 1 because of the vibe and the 2nd because the dj as well as the front hostess was great! Went to brunch on a Sunday to celebrate my sisters birthday, our reservation was for 4pm and we didn't get seated until about 5pm. There is a mandatory $5 coat check they don't mention anywhere. Once we got seated there were soooo many bottle options unavailable besides Champagne and Sangria. Everyone at the table chose the $75 prefix option which stated Premium bottles. When I asked the waiter the difference in bottles he said the $50 was house champagne and $75 was premium. Now as a champagne drinker there's no way in hell you're giving us Wycliff a $7 champagne bottle and telling us it's Premium!!! We were beyond pissed! It's a waste of money and absolutely ridiculous for all of that give unlimited mimosas. The food came cold but we were sooo hungry after waiting so long we didn't even complain. I wouldn't recommend this spot for the amount of money you pay at all! There also needs to be some more organization!

My friend and I did a joint birthday brunch this year.

I must admit reservation time and making sure our tables were booked was not a great experience. We spoke to 3 different people who clearly weren't on the same page, didn't have the same information. Im glad I thought to reach out prior to confirm or things would have been a disaster the day of. They were just reopening at the time, so I'm assuming things may have been a bit chaotic on their end.
Other than that, I had a wonderful time. Was let in a little bit earlier to decorate my table, I love that they allow you to do that! The personal bottles ARE regular size bottles for anyone wondering. The food was meh  had chicken and waffles. The waffles were fluffy, chicken was bland.
The Dj was great and interacted a lot with me lol  It was fun! Go!

Over priced and ghetto as hell. I would never go back to this place. They don't care about their guests all they care about is money. They try to force people to get a bottle with your meal when you do not have to in reality ! Never going back.

I went this past Sunday with my family and what a horrible experience from beginning to end ! The waiter was not attentive at all and had an attitude the whole time!! Although, we were late and they have a strict time policy meanwhile, my other friends who dine later told me they were not rushed nor kicked off the table as we were. Yes, you read it right after spending almost $800 we were kicked off the table very rudely and told to get up ! How embarrassing !! If you decide to go make sure you eat before you get there and don't except to enjoy yourself because you will be rushed to leave and eat. There's no appetizers to even sustain you till you main course arrives. Good Luck !

I was worried about coming here after all the terrible Yelp reviews, but you know what? I was pleasantly surprised!

I came here for my coworkers party and had a great time. You don't come here for fine dining. I was expecting the food to be inedible, but I was happy with my avocado toast and my husband liked his chicken sandwich. Their fries are tasty as well. The only thing cold for us were the potatoes. The servers were also great. They made sure our table was clean and took care of some late comers in our party. I always saw people keeping the dance floor clean.

As far as people complaining about how expensive this place is, yes it is pricey for a boozy brunch. But if you go to other brunch parties spot, you'll end up paying more money for drinks. Here, you'll get tipsy off of the bottle they give you.

We loved the music and the DJ was spinning some awesome mixes. I like the fact that they have an actual dance floor as well.

Overall, I think this is a great place to come with a group and party. The pre-fixe makes splitting the bill easy. I'll definitely be back.

Amazing restaurant, fantastic atmosphere, delicious food!
Very professional and friendly staff!
drinks are greattt, steak and eggs and the poach egg benedits definitely have to have it
restaurant manager  sharif, was very attentive and helpful. He made the experience beyond amazing.

AMAZING SPOT! From the food, to the atmosphere and amazing service! The owner was so friendly and you can tell he puts a lot of love into this place. Absolutely amazing will be returning for that granola bowl!

I've been meaning to check this place out because I always walk past it, and it's usually quite busy. We came on a Saturday morning at 10AM for breakfast.

Food/Drinks:
- Avocado Toast ($18): I know it's basic, but I love avocado toast. It's light, refreshing, and pairs well with the radishes. I recommend trying their hot sauce with it because I like having a little kick to mine. It's an additional $4 for an egg, which I find to be a bit of an annoying trend in NYC, especially since it's only for one egg.

Service/Ambiance: Located on a busy street block in Hudson Yards, there was a line when we got there. We were seated within 15 minutes though, so it was a short wait. You can order coffee and food to go, or you can wait to enjoy it there. No outdoor dining available. Very trendy with light airy cafe vibes. Service was fast and efficient!

Overall: Would come back to sample some other menu items!

The size of the coffee is insanely overpriced. The medium sized latte is actually a small and the small one is even smaller.

I met a friend to have a quick chat, but ended being cut even shorter cuz they kicked us out within 10 min after we sat down.  The whole time we felt rush for "only purchasing coffee". Mid coffee we were asked to "please pay the check and leave".

Do not go there for anything but a really quick overpriced bite.

Overall super cute cafe close to Penn station, but prices are high (sadly the norm in NYC). College me would be appalled by the prices I pay now for a piece of toast and matcha, but here we are. I'd probably still stop by again if I were in the area to try other things.

FOOD
Ricotta toast ($16) - it was yummy. You can't really go wrong with ricotta, honey, and bread. Was it worth $16? Probably not, but I was content.
Iced matcha latte ($8) - definitely not worth. I also completely missed that iced drinks were $1 more.

My friends got the breakfast sandwich ($12) which looked good but also probably something you could get elsewhere.

AMBIENCE
Everything is super aesthetically pleasing, but literally everyone in the restaurant was waiting to use their 1 bathroom lol.

SERVICE
Service was friendly. You can either sit down and they'll take your order, or you can order at the counter for takeaway. At the end, you pay at the counter.

A cute neighborhood breakfast/brunch spot! My friend and i got seated without wait on a saturday noon, even when the restaurant looked crowded in the small space. We got the brekkie bagel, ricotta toast, and iced latte. The food and coffee was good - overall a decent place to catch up with friends while getting lighter weight food than actual brunch dishes. The employees there were super friendly too!

Hey mate! You are a barista.... Nothing more!!!
Is it normal for a store owners in NYC to demand a customer purchase more expensive items? Not sure the owner was having a bad day or if he's just rude. My wife and I are visiting NYC and love coffee, this looked like a cool spot until we witnessed the owner of the cafe go over to two people and essentially tell them to leave or buy more items... it was bizarre and rude and made us uncomfortable. Surely sitting at a table for a few mins is okay after you've purchased a $5.50 coffee? He also ran over to a lady and told her to stop smoking on the street... seems like this person is on a total power trip. We have noticed that a lot of Australian coffee shops are run by snobs that think their shit doesn't stink. Maybe his rent is too high?? Go back to New Zealand or Australia or South Africa you miserable fuck.

We were split between this coffee shop and another for a pit stop as the rain was pouring and I'm glad that we picked In Common. We got seated quickly even though it was packed. The whipped ricotta toast and shakshuka toast are definitely the things to get. The mocha was perfect.

This is a great spot to get an excellent cup of coffee and some breakfast. We ordered flat whites (delicious) and I had the ricotta toast. It was delicious and beautifully presented. The place is not huge, but it is comfortable and inviting. No laptops allowed as to make sure tables are not held up for a long time. The entrance is of 9th avenue, not 35th street as google maps wants you the believe. Great spot!!!

Came here for brunch and had the shakshuka toast which looked and sounded super interesting. I didn't really get the same taste or feeling as having shashuka, but it's a good break from having avocado toast. The sourdough bread it came on was really good, and the ambiance inside was nice too! Well air conditioned with colorful seating.

Bright, cheery, clean cafe with very nice staff. I guess it is an Australian joint. The food was super fresh.. I got the aubergine sandwich and my husband got the chicken parma. Both tasty! Oh and the coffee was top notch!! Not your Starbucks grind.

I happen to be in this area with colleagues & one of them had been here before, but this was my first time here.

There menu is very simple & straight forward. They sell teas, cappuccinos & lattes along with salads & sandwiches. I tried their kale salad with avocado & it had parmesan cheese & croutons, both of my colleagues had sandwiches & finished it. Once of them mentioned to me it was good. For drinks two of us got green tea & one latte. Which my colleague said he didn't like the latte.

I saw when my colleague paid the bill, it was a little short of a $100 which I think for 2 sandwiches, a salad & 3 drinks served in a 8oz cup to be a little under $100 is a bit much. I wish their drinks came in different sizes, but I digress. If I wanted a bit to eat & was around this area, would I come again, probably not. It's midtown & there's a ton of other options that would be more satisfying to my palate & get more buck for my bang.
