Absolutely WONDERFUL service!  The night we came, a musician named Johnny was playing the ukulele Italian style, imagine Godfather in the Sicily scenes; that beautiful "twangy" sound of romantic Italy.  Johnny really made our night, and so did the fabulously attentive service.  We had a group of 6, so had a chance to try so many things.  All pasta is homemade - even the side spaghetti!  You cannot go wrong with anything you try.  Faves are the Seafood Salad with piled high shrimp, calamari, fish, mussels, the fried burrata style appetizer, veal parm, Bolognese, I guess everything!  Outdoor seating is so relaxing and also entertaining with people finally milling about.  Little Italy is always a treat, especially with live music and great food.

Food was great and price was cheap!

The thee course special was the perfect lunch get away.

Wandering down Mulberry Street on a hot day, we were looking for "some place new for us".  Thanks to the woman outside, we ended up at Il Piccolo Bufalo.
I had the lunch special, stuffed shells, and my friend ordered eggplant parmigiana, with spaghetti.   We both enjoyed our meals and because it wasn't crowded, we were able to "people watch" for a long time.
Highly recommend!

Stopped by Little Italy and found this spot.  No kids menu, but they did accommodate switching to penne pasta for my special needs daughter to make it easier for her to eat.  All of our dinners were excellent.  Service was a little slow, but everyone was nice.
Really bad service. food wasn't good and was not as described in the menu. They were rushing us to leave so they could sit more people. Overall not a good experience.

The hospitality is impeccable! After some frustration trying to find a place to eat in Little Italy as a walk-in, we stumbled across this place. it was full inside which to us meant decent food, but did not have a line waiting outside, so there was hope! A gentleman reminding me of my grandfather was the host (and possibly the owner) and told us he should be able to seat us within 20 minutes. I think he could sense the frustration and defeat in us and he offered us wine and lemonade for our son while we waited. We were seated much quicker than the 20 mins and the food was delicious. A pleasant surprise for us. We had a Caesar salad, bruschetta, lentil soup, carbonara, mushroom pizza and chicken parmesan. They saved the day! :) The icing on the cake? The stuffed buffalos around the restaurant which were such a sweet touch and made me google the meaning of Il Piccolo Bufalo and it means the tiny buffalo. Too cute!

On New Years Eve I was walking down Mulberry just on a stroll to see where my friends and I may get an early dinner before a comedy show when a funny man came out of this restaurant and started speaking to me in Italian! I am fluent in Spanish so I laughed and kept up but he convinced me to come back to this spot at 5pm.
It looked much fancier from the outside than the inside but the cheaper prices do match the inside. Regardless of prices, the food was quite good! Maybe not Nonna's but it was flavourful & good!
My boyfriend ordered the eggplant parmesan (~18) and it was delicious! I was in the mood for gnocchi (~14)but they didnt have sorrentina on the menu but they made it for me! It was so good and super cheesy, just my style!
We also got the stuffed artichoke but I wouldn't really recommend it-- not crispy or flavourful just okay
Stop by this spot in Little Italy!

Excellent and highly UNDERrated staple of Little Italy.  We are local to the area and stopped in randomly for pizza before a movie.  Fabulous, New York style classic pizza and the seafood pizza was even better than expected - no cheese and topped with fresh shrimp, calamari, mussels and clams.  The decor is cute and reminiscent of older restaurants, but it was very clean.  Waitress and gentleman who seemed to be the owner were professional and lovely.  We will definitely be back.  PS the buffalo pillows are adorable

Had the most delicious bowl of linguine vongole here.  Nice al dente pasta, large scrumptious clams and perfectly seasoned sauce.  My favorite spot for this dish in Manahattan thus far.  Don't forget the aperol and tre colore salad to kick off the meal.  Friendly staff.

As we were checking out different restaurants in Little Italy we came upon this restraunt.  We were greeted be a very helpful and informative gentleman,  who later we found out was the owner.    We got chicken parm( it was huge!) and gluten free Alfredo.  Everything was beyond what we expected.   After we were done the owner made sure we were satisfied and asked us where we were from and had a nice conversation with us.  The entire staff was also amazing.

I would recommend this restaurant and will definitely be stopping back again!

MUST EAT!! 10/10 recommend.

Joe stopped us on our way to another restaurant. He him self was enough to make us stay and eat there honestly. He sold us on the chicken cardinal and the $10 frozen pina colada.

We got a table outside, very lovely little Italy views. The waitress was great, she brought us our water and took our order right away. We got the Chicken Cardinal (with pasta) and the Calzone Rustico, which came out with bread.

Everything was amazing! EVERYTHING! The pasta and the bread which were sides could be mains how great they were.

My boyfriend stated and I quote, "the food eats itself, the way it melts in your mouth." Needless to say he was amazed.
Walking around Little Italy we found this place decided to have her dinner there. Food was delicious we staff was really nice,
The tables were cute and the food was decent. They didn't have any wine except for a white and red, they said they were waiting on a delivery. Didn't hate it but I wouldn't go back.
Great food.   Good specials food and beverages.   Seafood pizza looked fabulous.  Staff were pleasant.   Host was very helpful with directions.   Personable.

All the restaurants in little Italy are touristic and this is why they have their magic. This place doesn't charge you over $20 per pasta and is much more logical price wise.
As Vegan we took puttanesca pasta and veggie pizza without cheese and both were very good (I have to add - surprisingly!).
The white wine (Sauvignon blanc) was too sweet but the red merlo was tasty.
The toilets were dirty, but if you don't go there, you don't know, and the experience doesn't get hurt.
The food is horrible don't eat over here they say Italian for all Mexican food they don't know how to make Italian pizza

We stopped at this place on Saturday during the San Genarro Feast on Mulberry st. After spending so many hours on the street we just wanted to find a place where we could sit down and have a drink. This was the perfect place. We sat at a high top table and had several beers and wines. The ambiance was great and the staff was quick to take care of us and constantly checked in on us and kept the beers coming. We liked it and it fit our needs for this particular day.

We were walking through Little Italy and trying to figure out which restaurant we wanted to eat at. A nice gentleman outside of Il Piccolo Buffalo caught our attention and we ended up going inside. He advertised that it was happy hour and everything was $6 plus that they had the best food at their restaurant so we decided to try it!

Food: Ordered the linguini with CLAMS and white sauce. Somehow mussels came out. I let it go as I was too hungry. The white sauce lacked in flavor and needs something to push it over the edge. Maybe some butter? My bf ordered the fettuccini alfredo and although it sounds basic it was probably the best pasta dish I had in a while. The chicken was crispy which added a nice, flavorful touch.

When we got our bill, we paid. But just before leaving I noticed our two happy hour drinks were charged at $8 instead of the $6 advertised from the worker outside. I'm hoping it was an honest mistake and it wasn't the establishment trying to make a quick buck. Our time here was decent but we left a little upset.
Margherita Pizza, delicious pizza dough and delicious fried cheese raviolis. Everything great and super friendly staff.

This place was amazing hands down the best in new Yorks little Italy its a must try customer service is great they go above and beyond to make sure you are satisfied will definitely stop by next time I visit new york it's totally worth it

The margherita pizza was actually quite good and reasonably priced for the area. The only issue was we waited longer to get our check than the time we spent actually eating despite asking multiple times.

Such a disappointing experience.

The service at this restaurant was horrible- when we arrived at the table, it was covered in gross crumbs and we sat at the table for at least ten minutes before we were even asked what we wanted to drink- took another 10 mins for the water to get to the table. We asked for some bread with our water and were told we couldn't have bread until we ordered food (despite us having ordered some wine to start). Blender was broken, so no frozen drinks.

After ordering entrees, we asked for bread 3 separate times and they ended up bringing one tiny basket for a table of 5 along with the food instead of as an appetizer. A friend joined us later in the meal and same thing- at least 15 mins until we finally had to ask for service.

The whole time we could see our waitress standing at the back of the restaurant and no, it wasn't a crowded night.

The icing on the cake was that the food wasn't even great- I would have preferred the Olive Garden.

$7 glass of wine marked up as an $8 glass on our tab. Wouldn't normally bother with such a small mistake if it wasn't for everything else.

There's so many restaurants in little Italy- look elsewhere if you want a quality experience with good food.

I went with a friend over here since she got the drink with the big boba and I really wanted to get it after I saw that. This shop was on a busy street in chinatown and it was easy to miss since there is also a burger place in the same building

The big boba drink only came with the thai tea. I was fine with that since thai tea is my favorite boba drink. The big boba itself was different, it was different from your usual boba and felt a bit more jelly-like than that.

Overall it was a good drink and I really liked the concept of the drink.

I'Milky is a quaint bubble tea shop located in the heart of Chinatown, NYC that serves up a delightful selection of onigiri and rice balls. Their most popular bubble tea flavors include the Galaxy Egg, Spicy Pork Belly Kimchi Riceball, and Mala Beef Riceball with Purple Rice. The Galaxy Egg is a unique concoction made with a chocolate milk tea base and a colorful hard candy shell topping. The Spicy Pork Belly Kimchi Riceball is a savory rice ball packed with spicy pork belly and kimchi. The Mala Beef Riceball with Purple Rice is an explosion of flavor with mala beef and purple rice filling.

In addition to their delicious bubble tea and rice balls, I'Milky also offers a range of other snacks and drinks like mochi, takoyaki, and fruit tea. The shop has really friendly staff

I passed by this shop countless times but finally happened to stop by earlier this week. It's located on busy Grand Street, the same block as the subway station. It's a small counter that shares its dining area with Burger by Day. The onigiris (rice balls or rice triangles wrapped in seaweed) here are about two dollars more than the onigiris you will find at a nearby Chinese bakery. What you're paying for are better quality fillings, sauces, white or purple rice options, and everything is made to order. I ordered the mala beef with purple rice. I didn't opt for any sauces. The lady taking the order helpfully warned me that it would be spicy and I assured here the mala spice is what I was most looking forward to. Mala beef is beef sautéed with Szechuan peppercorns, which have a mouth numbing spiciness to it. It's a different experience you get from eating Jalapeños or Thai chilis. The beef was tender and had a nice little kick. My coworker got the mala beef too as well as the seaweed salad rice ball. These are well-sized rice balls so you can really be stuffed after having two. They also have lunch combos with a milky rice, bubble, or tea drink to round out a very filling meal.

I'd definitely come back again to try their other onigiris, or just get the mala beef one again. I want to try the Tuna and corn rice ball or the spicy pork one next time. The dining area they share with another restaurant in the same store front is really well-maintained and clean. Yes, the onigiris may be a couple dollars more than you're used to paying and they take about 10 minutes to make if they have a long line but it's all worth it.

Here for the jumbo boba Thai Iced Tea. The staffs are friendly. However, this jumbo boba is overpriced cost $9 after tax for a drink. The boba was chewy. The place is next to a burger shop located in Chinatown.
Honey green tea was really good!! Went on a hit summer day and felt instantly refreshed. (It's also a pretty good mixer)

Convenient new imilky spot in Chinatown. The inside of the store is very clean and has a lot of seating, so it's a comfortable spot to relax, enjoy your boba, and chat with friends.

There's also a bathroom in the back for customers!

＊Fresh Taro Oat Milk w/ Holiday Snowman Bottle
Have been hankering for the lovely Snowman Bottle for awhile and I finally broke my bank to buy it. As I am not intrigued by the holiday special flavors, I ordered the signature Taro Milk instead and added $3.25 to get the snowman. (Yes I know it is pricy af it costs me over $12 in total but it worths!) The bottle is solid and adorable, I actually washed it afterwards so I can reuse it at home.

They used Oatly Barista version as the milk base, and poured a generous amount of creamy and smooth taro paste. The sweetness level is fixed, but luckily it isn't too sweet. It gives a natural and mild flavor of taro sweetness.

However, I prefer the taro paste that I've had in Hong Kong I'Milky as it keeps more raw mashed taro, which diversifies the texture of the drink. I wish the NY I'Milky could do the same.

Overall, the price of I'Milky is steep indeed, but they really use the best ingredients. You won't regret spending a considerate sum of money to get a cup of drink from them. Highly recommend the Chinatown branch - lovely staff, clean toilet, and they provide sofa and tables :)

My Recommendation: Taro Milk

Worth Returning ? YES
(given the price, probably not too frequent lol)

Great, clean, crisp and minimal spot to get some Taiwan boba tea. Love the ordering options especially being able to control the sweetness and ice is a PLUS.

I will say the only disappointment here is not having coconut milk available only in the taro drink. Totally ok though as they do have oatmilk. I'm used to order Thai tea which wasn't available here but totally cool! Ordered the brown sugar (with real brown sugar) and it was pretty good.

Ordering is quick and easy especially if you're just getting a drink. They gave some food options like riceballs and bento boxes too.

I liked the bubble tea here! I got the classic milk tea. Size and price of the drink was pretty decent. I loved the design of the cup and their logo. There was a line but it moved pretty quickly. There's not that many tables and they also share a mini food court with another restaurant. Bathrooms are available. Service was excellent! The baristas were friendly and polite. They have two locations in NYC - Chinatown and Williamsburg. Overall rating: 10/10

The store is connected to what looks like another restaurant in the back. There's some seating indoors to enjoy your drink/ snack but not many. This cafe location feels much more like a grab and go in my opinion. Service is good.
I like that I can taste the black tea in their black milk tea! Boba is nice and chewy and definitely above average overall. 4/5
I was a bit too full when I had it so maybe I'd enjoy it more if I was more hungry.
The onigiri are ok and make an easy snack. It's a bit too heavy on the rice for me. Spicy pork belly is a bit plain 2/5
Fired chicken is a lot better but I still wish there was less rice and seaweed was more crispy 3/5

Got the taro milk tea! Best one I ever had. They use freshly blended taro with fresh milk. I got mine with oatmilk and it was still so delicious. Not too sweet! Remember to shake and mix the drink before drinking it or you'll mostly get milk of taro!

Would definitely come again but due to the fresh ingredients be ready to spending $8-9 on one drink.

I'Milky shares is storefront with Burger by Day.
I'm forever in the mood for Boba, and luckily, my friend and I had both just finished eating at Burger by Day. While he chose cookies and creme ice cream, I had my eyes set on some Boba tea because it's been ages since I had it.

I got a very simple order: Brown milk bubble tea with 100% sugar and no ice. The cashier was sweet to inform me that, although I want no ice, there still needs to be a few pieces because the Boba is hot. That was a great piece of information to have.

When I got my Boba, I had to shake vigorously 10-15 times and then use the straw to pierce the cover. This last step, embarrassingly, took more than a few times. Though, I usually like Boba, I felt like I could have been okay with just the milk only. It's was like Boba was getting in the way of my delicious milk. I know that entirely defeats the purpose of Boba tea, but it needs to be written.

As one might expect, this is a very popular takeaway spot, so it doesn't get too crowded inside as most people who are taking the seats are eating burgers. Overall, nice place, decent price point.

My friend was craving boba. We decided to stopped in as we were walking by. The staff was really nice and gave us suggestions for what to order. We both ended up ordering the taro milk drink that was being advertised on the counter. You have to shake it aggressively to mix the drink all the way through. The staff member showed us how to shake it up multiple times until we were able to get the drink to start looking the way it should. I got mine with boba which helped with the shaking. It was chewy and pretty good texture- not too hard, not overcooked. The milk was so creamy and there was actual taro in it. The drink was addictive; I finished it pretty quickly. It was rather filling. My friend and I got dinner after but we didn't order much.

There is space to sit inside but we werent only picking up a drink so I didnt notice the inside as much.

I would absolutely come back and get something else next time. Possibly another milk drink. It's just so creamy and delicious.

The jasmine green milk tea is good, and the boba is on point: the consistency, chewiness is perfect! It's not too hard and not too soft; just right. I also got the Fresh Taro Milk, which I don't recommend; it tasted very different from taro milk in the Bay Area and I had to throw most of it away.

For Easter, there were 3 drinks on the menu that were served in plastic egg cups! I got all 3 since they were so cute. The pink strawberry one is a little too artificial tasting for me, but it's pretty. The galaxy egg drink was good, but the best egg drink was the Golden Magic Egg. The mango flavor and coconut were delicious and reminded me of mango sago.
Lots of space inside this location! They don't make pick-up drinks until you arrive to ensure quality and freshness. Great boba and drinks - solid option!

A little pricey, but I definitely think it's worth it. My friend went in at 5ish on a Sunday and it wasn't too busy. The person working the counter took their time to explain each and every drink to us.

What I ordered: I got the classic milk tea with oat milk and boba. They had several non-dairy options. This is a size small and was around $8. The tea and boba were delicious. I definitely recommend.

Located in the heart of Chinatown, this shop is definitely in the right area for boba lovers. They are located in a shop with two other vendors. Although the menu is extensive, I did not really find anything out of the ordinary for the prices charged. They clearly use fresh teas and juices but for the price, I expected more.

I ordered a regular milk tea with tapioca at the lowest sugar setting (forgot the percentage) and the Taiwan premium green milk tea with tapioca at 50% sugar. They most definitely mixed up the sugar levels for both drinks. With the reduced amount of sugar, I expected a hefty amount of tea flavors but I was getting more milk than anything. I hate to sound repetitive but the price point does not justify the tremendous lack of tea flavor I anticipated. I will definitely give them another go to see if that was a one-off incident, but the drinks were definitely average at best.

One of the best premium boba shops I've been to lately!

I've been eyeing I'Milky for awhile and was able to try it on a recent food crawl outing I was on. I ordered the Fresh Mango Green Tea at 30% sugar and less ice. It was sooo good. Not too sweet and it was surprisingly more like a pureed mango drink. I was expecting just a mango flavored drink, but this was great!

Will definitely come back since the milk based drinks seem super tempting and aesthetically pleasing.

Modern and clean space!! It's connected to a burger place and located near the D train (Grand st.). There are a few places to sit inside and AC!

I love i'milky and was not disappointed! We got a strawberry green tea and a shrimp tempera riceball with spicy mayo.

Friendly service!

Came here to get a drink and bite in the cold weather and was not disappointed.

This spot is relatively new and conveniently next to the train station in the event you need to grab and go.

I got the jasmine milk tea with boba and shrimp rice ball, and a oolong black tea with boba. Both drinks were very satisfying, with the oolong tea being the most comforting since it was hot. I devoured the shrimp rice ball was it was incredibly delicious and the shrimp delightful crunchy and flavorful. Would come back to try the smash burgers they have in the back along with other drinks. Worth a visit

I appreciate the existence of this imilky branch because it's one of the few places with good spacious seating in Chinatown (the place where it lacks cafes). I got the matcha milk tea with bubbles. I think it's my first time trying their matcha. It's not bad, but it just doesn't give me the strength and depth that I crave. If I were buying from there, I might as well get matcha from Maiko Matcha just one block away. I still got it, because I wanted to try and here I did.

Also I think I prefer their medium size over large because of how the medium cups have the rounded bottom vs large cups being tall and straight like most other places. The rounder bottom is more comfortable to hold on to.

I've had their earl grey milk tea and black milk tea at their midtown branch, so now the better question is what should I get next if none of these are up to my standards. I've always wanted to try their taro milk, but it looks super heavy. It'd have to be a meal replacement or something for me. Stay tuned~
My go to drink is the fresh taro milk. I love that they use fresh taro to make this drink. After shaking the drink, I find the sweetness level just right.

OG here who hasn't had bubble tea in 20 years. Was thirsty and lightheaded so stopped to grab an iced jasmine green tea with bubbles, no milk, light ice light sugar. It was just what I needed: strong tea, qq bubbles, not too sweet. I like the customizable sugar and ice levels (guess we can all thank sbux for that).  The sticker shock wasn't as bad as I expected (but the last time I bought bubble tea it was $3 for sugar powder drink mix so there's that). Good amount of seating for a small looking storefront. Worth a visit if you want bubble tea.

Had to come try the strawberry mango pomelo sago

Register is right at the window and is connected to a burger place. Tables inside to sit at but half are for the burger place. Workers are nice and drinks come out quick.

For $9 and some change for this little cup... idk if it's worth it. Got 30% sweetness and bro it was still so sweet and strong pomelo taste which was good.

Got strawberry green tea with 50% sweetness and for almost $7 it was good and not too sweet at all. The strawberry was a good flavor and could taste the tea. It was a good sweetness!

I'Milky is pretty new. I've only had one drink here and that was the Strawberry Green Tea. They only have one size, which is large, for $7.50. The drink was delicious. It's tastier than Kung Fu Tea (2mins away) and they make it faster than Teado (maybe 3mins away). The price is $1-$2 more because they only sell large for this drink. I think I might start coming here more often for my fruit tea due to the taste, speed, and cleanliness.

Bonus: They accept credit card and as far as I'm aware, no minimum. Other fruit tea places in Chinatown might have a $10 minimum.

Excellent milk tea. Plenty of seating inside. Really enjoyed the 30% less sugar, 70% ice.

Their fruit drinks are their main draw though. Incredibly sweet, but also very good drinks.

Super intrigued with farm fresh milk in bubble tea. I love the concept of using fresh ingredients, especially when you are paying a hefty price for bubble tea.

Can you really tell the difference in the milk quality? Yes, it does taste fresh!!  There was a huge selection too so it was difficult to narrow it down. Ended up ordering the oolong black milk tea with boba. The boba was perfect too! Service was pleasant and friendly.

Would highly recommend!

I had tried Burger by the day and decided I wanted bubble tea. I always see this spot have a line and it was new in Chinatown so decided to give it a try. Price for bubble tea are getting more steep. Order with the cashier decided to get the classic milk bubble tea earl grey tea a medium size. They take credit card. You have the ice and sugar options like all the other bubble tea spot. Drinks came out fairly quick. Was told to shake it before drinking it. So the price for a medium bubble tea credit card charge at $7.08 total. The bubble was chewy and can tell was fresh. Tea was okay. Another option to think about when you want to give other boba spot a try.

Pretty good bubble tea with very fresh ingredients.

We almost missed the store since the space is shared with Burger-By-Day. I had the black milk tea with bubbles, and my friends got the fresh strawberry milk, fresh mango milk, and brown sugar bubble milk. As advertised, all the drinks were super fresh and tasted delicious. I would recommend the strawberry and mango drinks. The drinks run a tad expensive, but they're definitely worth it.

Btw, the tea strength meter on the menu and how-to instructions are great for first-time milk tea drinkers.

Head over heels in love with I'Milky! It's been a while since I first discovered this bubble tea franchise during their soft opening, and since then I've been frequenting this location and their Midtown location way too often. But hey, who's counting? That is, besides my wallet, of course!

So far, we've tried their:
- brown sugar bubble milk (with both whole milk and oat milk)
- jasmine green tea lemonade
- classic bubble milk tea (earl grey)
- fresh strawberry milk
- fresh grapefruit green tea
- fresh coconut taro milk
- classic milk tea (earl grey)
- fresh mango milk
- fresh strawberry green tea
- oolong black milk tea

Surprisingly, or unsurprisingly enough, I've never had a bad drink or a bad experience. In fact, the drinks here are always so delicious! The bubbles are warm and chewy, the tea fragrant, and the ingredients fresh. I love that they offer other milk alternatives as well, such as oat milk and soy milk.

Also, ever since I introduced I'Milky to my sister, she always has me dropping by whenever I'm in the area to bring home a drink for her. Most recently, she's been obsessed with their fresh mango milk (with no added sugar).

Note: If you download their app, you get 10% off your first order. However, this location currently does not have the app set up yet, thus making this offer non-redeemable (though it is redeemable at their other locations!). But, if you download the app anyways, you can click 'forgot scan' and manually enter the receipt id to earn points for your order.

Cheers, and happy drinking!

You know your drink is good when there's an instructional video to show you the correct way to shake the drink, Ordered the Iced Mango Milk which tasted refreshing, and satisfying. Mango drink had just the right amount of sweetness and milk ratio that makes the drink taste good. Didn't order any additional topping as the mango meat was enough to keep this drink tasty. There's plenty of seating for a sit down meal, as there's a burger joint in the back, so it's basically a one two punch for a great snack attack.

We passed by this place and decided to order a combo to try a little of everything for a quick snack. While ordering and coming up to the payment part, the price skyrocketed from the sticker price. The cashier explained that it was an extra charge for items past a certain value. From an operations standpoint, the menu is not practical or user-friendly at all. There are too many fine print technicalities for every single customer to understand, making decision-making longer, and lines even longer. After receiving our order, we were excited to try everything since we wanted to try a new spot. Unfortunately, the rice in the rice ball was hard, the soba was terrible (I guess our fault for ordering soba at a non-Japanese restaurant), and the drink was okay. I don't plan on coming back but maybe the drinks are more promising than the food.
Loved this holiday drink I got a few months back. It was really cute and delicious. I don't know too much about bubble tea and the workers were helpful.
Clean and relaxing, the foods are delicious and made to order  all natural ingredients and the stuff are very helpful

Stopped by with a friend after getting a facial not far. The storefront can be easily missed because you'll see Burger By Day" instead of "imilky" but it's there!

I got the Taiwanese premium green milk tea with less sugar and loved it. My friend got the brown sugar boba with less sugar also and found it too be too sweet so I would recommend trying their other drinks if you don't have a sweet tooth.

Service was awesome, decor was nice and was able to sit for a bit. Would def stop by again when I'm in the area!
Very pleasant friendly staff. Large selection of teas, many types of alternative milk. Pleasant interior. Very tasty tea. Above average prices
Great red rice boba topping. Sort of on the expensive side. Highly recommend. Also nice seating area

At 242 Grand Street, just inside the door of the excellent burgers-and-shakes palace Burger-By-Day, there exists a slightly hidden and completely separate, different restaurant: A bubble-tea (and bubble coffees) place that is one of the first US locations of the incredibly popular Taiwan boba drinks giant "I'Milky."  

I'Milky is a drinks destination that has become insanely popular in east Asia.  Try a few of their drinks.  They come in many, many flavors - all featuring those chewy 'pearls' of tapioca that you have to chew while drinking - (it's not difficult) ... and you will quickly understand why there are almost 50 I'Milky locations in the better districts of the finest cities from one end of the South China Sea to the other.  I'Milky is spreading fast in 5 countries over there -- including over 20 shops on Taiwan alone.  What?  For bubble tea?  Yes: For THIS bubble tea.  You see, I'Milky is the best bubble tea in the world.  Nobody comes close to their level of quality.

This Chinatown location is one of three so far in New York City.  Stay tuned for more.  People fall in love with I'Milky drinks.  I've seen it happen out of the corner of my eye while dining at the adjacent Burger By Day: People line up enthusiastically for their boba-this and boba-that.  You've got to at least try I'Milky and find out for yourself what all the fuss is about.
It's located in a joint location with burger place. Don't get the ginger hot drink, unless you can tolerate the fire of the intense fingers! It's intense!

BEST BUBBLE TEA EVER. I love boba and I've been on a fresh taro milk/milk tea kick since I first discovered I'Milky in Midtown. Now that was back when Midtown was the only location and I was staying around the corner from it. Since then I've been dreaming about their fresh taro boba and finally had a chance to return to the city this weekend. The Chinatown location is bigger and has more seating options. They don't have rice balls on their menu like the Midtown location but the space is shared with a made to order burger place. The best part is the Coconut Taro Milk was delicious as I remembered it. Highly recommend it! I don't travel into the city as often as I'd like to anymore so please open your Tangram location soon as I'm from CT!

The drinks here are amazing and to die for. With alternative milk options for those who are lactose intolerant and amazing staff who always smile. This bubble tea shop is truly one of a kind, especially considering they have a burger joint in the same shop. Both with amazing prices and service. I personally love the mango milk.

I wish I had taken more pics. But I will in the future. Because I will definitely be coming back. One of my favorites is the mango green tea. It's very refreshing. I recently went back and tried the taro milk. Omg! I was so in love. Their service was also great. I will be coming back for more.
Great quality boba tea with quick, friendly service! Love that they have food options in the back of the shop with generous amount of seating to enjoy the food and drinks.

Ordered the Jasmine Green Tea with Lemonade and I saw them squeezing real lemons! You can definitely taste the lemon flavor along with the green tea. My drink came out very fast and there was enough seating for me to sit and relax. There's also a burger joint in the back, but I didn't get a chance to try it yet. Will definitely visit again next time!

A NEW BOBA SPOT IN CT!! I got the grapefruit green tea with boba, so good!! Boba is super chewy and fresh. You can tell they use good quality fresh grapefruit juice. My daughter got the fresh strawberry milk, she loved it and it's not too sweet with 30% sugar and no caffeine so perfect for kids. The other drink is Jasmine green tea lemonade, the lemonade is a slush added to the jasmine green tea, such a unique mix. 10/10 would recommend
My new favorite for place for drinks off the grand st station in lower Manhattan little Italy and Chinatown

You can tell when the boba is fresh when the bottom of the cup where the bubbles are is warm and that's always a gr9 first impression when receiving your boba order. The bubbles themselves were super chewy and yummy. Half sugar is not too sweet. The large size is actually quite a lot. Come thruuuuuu

I often stop by after classes with friends. There's a lot to pick from the menu and you can customize the ice and sugar level so there's bound to be something you like. When you first get your drink, you can tell that the boba is fresh from the warmth from the bottom of the cup. My go-tos are the Matcha Milk Tea and Mango Milk.

New boba tea place in Chinatown, little Italy, SoHo
With burger joint
In side is very spacious and comfortable,  friendly atmosphere    

I had the boba milk tea and brown sugar boba
You could taste the natural tea and the boba was just perfect texture

The drinks are so good!! We love the match milk with bubbles, Jasmine green tea lemonade, and mango tea! My go to is the taro milk (with oat milk because I can't drink regular milk). Love the different milk options. So good! The staff are friendly and so helpful. They use all fresh ingredients. Will definitely be back to try the other drinks and gotta try out the burger shop in the back Burger By Day once it's opened. The inside seating looks so nice. My kids are so happy. Thank you for opening one near me.

Being Lebanese, I have high standards for Middle Eastern food. I've heard of ilili which is a fancy Lebanese restaurant while ilili Box is their fast-casual take on Middle Eastern food. It is located inside The Canal Street Market along with many other food vendors.
My sister and I both decided to get the ilili Box Combo (~$17) to share. It includes a rice bowl or sandwich, Phoenician fries or Brussels sprouts, and a green lemonade. I ordered the 8-hr Lamb Shoulder Rice Box with Phoenician fries and a green lemonade. My sister ordered the Spiced Chicken Rice Box with Phoenician fries and a green lemonade.
The Lamb Shoulder Rice Box included lamb & beef shawarma, roasted tomatoes, parsley, onion, sumac, and tahini with rice. The Spiced Chicken Rice Box included roasted spiced chicken, sumac garlic whip, and pickles. Their rice is interesting because it contains chickpeas. The chicken and lamb & beef shawarma tasted fresh and was well-seasoned. I wasn't a huge fan of the rice but it did the job of being a base for this meal. The Phoenician fries were topped with sumac salt and served with aleppo garlic whip. The fries were crispy and warm. The garlic whip was pretty addicting! It's a little different than what you'd find in an authentic Lebanese restaurant but it was still delicious! The Green Lemonade was super light, not too sweet, and basically tasted like cucumber-infused lemonade. I didn't hate it but I didn't love it. If it didn't come with the combo, I don't think I'd order it myself.
Overall, ilili Box was a good one-time try for me! It was filling and tasted fine but it is pretty pricy and there are plenty of other authentic Middle Eastern places in the city to check out.

Avoid this place like the plague.

Ordered the roasted lamb with rice bowl for takeout. Everything was disgusting. Not to mention it made my stomach hurt after eating it.

Lamb was hard, dry and tasteless. The white sauce they drizzled over everything was sour and clumpy. There was an abundance of scallions which was an overload for the dish. My breath smelled like scallions for the rest of the day. The lime/cucumber/mint drink tasted extremely sour and eerily similar to pickle juice.

Just stay away from this place and don't bother eating from here.

Update: 3 days after dining here, my stomach is still upset and I've been going to the bathroom because of the runs at least 5 times today. The NYC Health Department has also reached out to me and I will be filing a case with them.

I do not recommend ilili Box at all, especially the Korean falafel wrap. The wrap was super dry and floury. The falafel was also dry and did not have any flavor. I had a hard time even swallowing the wrap without choking on it. The entire thing tasted premade and it was not fresh at all. The fries here are decent but is quite expensive for what it is. I rather just get French fries from any other fast food chain.

The service here was okay. The employee saw me waiting to order but just walked away to talk to other coworkers.

Got illi box with Korean falafel wrap, Brussels sprouts and green lemonade - never again! In the wrap, the sauce was unbearably salty but once you take it off the falafel was super dry..lose-lose. Half the dish of the Brussels sprouts was just burnt Brussels leaves and the other half pecans and topped off with grapes. The sauce was also intense in flavor and mixed with the burned leaves it was so bad. The best thing was the lemonade. Waste of 21$

Fresh and delicious quick food at this market. My Falafel Beiruti sandwich was fresh and filling. Plenty of food. I also got a side of brussel sprouts which were equally as good. Walnuts and grapes were a unique addition. I enjoyed this and would go back if I am in the area.

This serving of takeout fries came in a brown paper bag that we tore apart getting to these addictive fries. They're called 'Phoenician Fries', and that means they're lightly charred and grilled and are seasoned with  a surprising sumac spice salt. The serving of fries also comes with an aleppo garlic whip, which is a thick lemon-y yogurt.

There's nothing exceptional about the fries themselves, but the combination of salty spice and a refreshing citrus cream in the seasoning and dip are a novel spin on a standard side.

The falafel here is very VERY dry. I ordered two types of falafel wraps and had the same experience for each. The first time, I got the Silk Road wrap. It was dry. Felt like they didn't put enough sauce inside the wrap, so the second time around, I got the Korean wrap and asked for extra sauce on the side to make sure I had backup sauce in case they got cheap with the internal sauce again. I was told the sauce on the side costs like an extra $1.60. Are you kidding me?! For sauce? For sauce that I only need to get more of because of how dry your food is?!

Anyway, long story short, I ended up getting the  sauce only on the side and had more than enough sauce. However, the falafel was still super dry. I wouldn't say the food tasted bad, but with the amount of money they charge for food at this place (and even a side of sauce which many places give you for free), there's no excuse for the dryness. I've had much better falafel at less than half the price at a local food cart. I prob should've read the other Yelp reviews prior to re-ordering here.

Very tasty. Lots of flavor. Fresh. Big portions. Pager system allows you to find a seat while you wait for fresh food. Sits in a food court with equally as good vendors and small shopping flea next door.

A review for  the Green Lemonade - I'm a fan!

Bold flavors of mint/ginger/cucumber -- sounds kinda healthy, but it's probably not. Guessing there is a good dose of sugar in it  (as most lemonades do). I found it to be very refreshing, and good balance of sweet/tart.

At $4 a cup, it is a little expensive - but enjoyed it a lot!

Can ask for a sample. We tried the sample, and was like  WOW haha

I love their original restaurant and I just tried today they fast casual spot. It's delicious! I'm so happy they are expanding!
I got their Ilili Box which was actually lots of food for $18 so: delicious and priced right!

Highly suggested!

This place is pricey for what you get.

One time I got the chicken bowl - it was ok but there was way too much of the yogurt whip. A bit overpowering.

Next time I got the box deal - green lemonade was tasty. Lamb wrap was dry and barely had anything in it. Lacked flavor. Lastly, the fries were baked (not.....fried) and were underdone/soggy.

Both times I paid around $20 which I think is overpriced for what I received.  

I'd consider trying another bowl, but not a wrap or fries again.

I ordered this lunchtime and my halloumi wrap and fries took EIGHTEEN MINUTES.

Other people were waiting around too and it seemed like one of the slowest and least popular places in the food market. I picked it cos, well, halloumi, dur. The server was apologetic and said that each portion of fries takes at least 8 minutes in the oven. If I had known this in advance I probably would have eaten elsewhere.

The food was okay but the wait made it unworkable as a lunch option.

Incredibly dry "Korean style" Falafel wrap.  Nothing deliciously Korean or deliciously Mediterranean about the experience.  Taste buds were incredibly bored by the chewy and dry falafel and the disappointing cole slaw they called "Korean" in a boring wrap.
I'm getting bored thinking about it. There are better options - just go to a halal cart.
$12.50 Lamb Taco was incredible hard, dry, and nothing delicious. The service is ok, but for the price it's not worth it.

The falafels in the Korean style wrap tastes premade and extremely dry. The sauce added to compensate the dryness prevents you from choking but it doesn't add any overall appeal to the wrap. There are better vendors in the market for lunch options.

The rice was hard and the chicken was dry! Would not recommend this place and I had better Mediterranean food!

Btw...they yelp messaged me and never sent me a gift card that they promised and never responded back afterwards!

Willing to go back to give it another try, but not anytime soon willingly anyways.
Took me 20 minutes to get my order.
Long story short, I placed my order, waited for 15 minutes and watched 3 parties order and get their food. I go back and the girl behind the counter, Lisbeth has shocked look on her face (kinda like she forgot my order).
After that my order was done in 5 minutes.
The food was good, but then again if you're starving and your food takes 20 minutes to come out where it should take 5, everything tastes good.

Stumbled upon this place at the Canal Street Market...and, boy, am I glad I did. The wraps are so good that I brought everyone from work to feast on this! Also, the service was excellent. Highly recommend.
The fries were soggy and disgusting. So disappointed. The picture looked fabulous... do not be fooled!

I got two rice boxes to go, one chicken one duck. It kind of reminds me of bougie halal cart food but I'm ABOUT IT. The quality of meet and the "white" yogurt sauce, as well as the hot sauce that you can purchase on the side, make for a wonderful combination! One thing that I like the most is that their meats are super lean, which is something you don't always get at halal food carts or with shredded duck meat. It seems they really make sure to rid of the fatty bits but the addition of their yogurt sauce ensures it is not dry! Because of this,  it overall feels like a healthy sort of meal regardless of whether it is or not, but the taste is great so I would 10/10 do it again!

I just ordered Lebanese Salad with duck to go-it is terrible-the duck is very dry-tastes horrible-doe not even taste like duck. the sald is 14 dollars and not worth it. i would go back and complain but it is a few blocks from my office so not practical to go back.

I've been trying to lose weight and needed a reliable, healthy, and tasty spot that I could just get the same thing every day (so I didn't have to worry about what I was eating every day). I found it at the Ilili Box. I have been going to this spot for the last five weeks. Every day. Getting the same order every time. The spiced chicken pita, and the spiced chicken bowl. That is my lunch and dinner for the day. It is delicious and reliable. Which is what I was looking for. I'm down 13 pounds since I started eating here. Also, Jasmine and Lizbeth have been there making my order every time and they are amazing. I've never left a yelp review, but I signed up for an account just so I could sing their praises. Can't recommend this place highly enough. Thank you so much!

This is a great spot for quick, fresh meal. I got a Chicken BLT (which was incredibly delicious) along with an Almaza Beer, the perfect combination!! In addition, the staff was amazing; great customer service. Definitely would come back & definitely would recommend it to everyone to come & experience!
Solidly mediocre food but fine if you are craving Mediterranean. There are better options in the Canal St market
Great service and excellent food! The Tofu was delicious!! The owner came to chat with us and gave us tips on other excellent Japanese eateries in the area.

Came here after seeing that they had an anime/ One Piece theme at the bar. Made a reservation prior, but when I got there it was pretty empty. We requested to sit at the bar instead of a table when we got there so we can watch the episodes playing on the projector.

The food, especially the skewers hit the spot and the service was amazing. Our bartender/server recommended a drink which was absolutely amazing. The drink I ordered was so nostalgic, with the popsicle.

Overall, I would come again to try other drinks and food.

Went there with 17 other people, they treated us well, great service, and we had a tasty time. Cute interior, looks sorta like a Japanese small town dive bar that you don't expect to have great food, and it hella does.

Most everything I had I enjoyed. I'd go back, and I'd eat a lot less, but knowing what I know now about the amount of food and the taste of it all, at least I know what I'd order and what I'd share with a friend.

YAKITORI. All great, sauced nice, cooked perfect, great to share with a beer or drink. Scallops were my fave.

SIGNATURE KARAAGE. Came out extra hot with awesome crunch, great spice, and the cup of spicy mayo was a perfect dip. Another great one to chomp on with a drink. Enough to share, but you'll miss it when it's gone.

PORK KAKUNI. My fave. I dunno how it was made, I would never attempt it, it was friggin awesome, most tender pork in a lil broth that you'd either slurp or spill on some rice to finish it off. My table had extra & I had no shame finishing it off. If I went back, I'd get this, sit in a corner and gobble. Get it!

GYU DON. Loved this too. Comfort food 2.0. Beef was perfectly cooked, rice soft and lovely, egg is silken yum-yum, & ginger slices gave the sharp tang. Mix it all up and use a spoon, it's plenty to share as well.

PORK KATSU CURRY. Liked this, but I've had better. The pork katsu was perrrfectly fried, crunch plus tender meat. Another comfort food dish, it was great, but I didn't expect it based on the rest of the food served here. If you're craving Japanese curry, get it, but it's not a Must.

MENTAIKO MAZZEMEN. Excellent. Everyone who put this in their mouth did not regret it. Just pulling the noodles to serve it makes you googly-eyed. I could see myself going by due to a craving of this. Silky, creamy, perfect umami, and the lil pops of fish roe make it fun.

MISO BACON. niiiiice! I could eat a bunch of this just chopped on top of rice. A great bar snack if you must, and the lil grill and fire it comes on top of shows you how greedy you are when it's gone. Texture is good, and the taste is odd enough for you to be convinced its worth whatever it costs.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! My partner and I come here fairly regularly, and each time we have come, the food has always been delicious.

Some of our personal favorites are the skewers - all are amazing and reasonably priced. The karaage loaded fries are a fun treat (cheesy with a solid amount of chicken and jalapeño), along with the glazed bacon. They have a great selection of Japanese beer, too.

I also really appreciate the overall vibe here. The decor inside is full of anime memorabilia, artwork, and neon signs. They also project movies and shows above the bar, another fun touch. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and service is quick.

Definitely would recommend Izakaya Juraku to a friend!

Chill vibes at this izakaya- volume was pretty low throughout and the servers were very attentive. Personal faves are the grilled Hokkaido scallops and the mentaiko mazemen. The char on the scallops had the perfect flavor and the mazemen although few ingredients tasted delicious. The karage was cooked just right, super tender, although I'd recommend getting the signature over the oroshi (the radish was interesting). The other dishes were ok, fun to share. Would not recommend the bacon personally. Will definitely come back for snacks and drinks in the future.

Izakaya Juraku is the place to go for Japanese cocktails and beer. The selection of Japanese beers and spirits is outstanding. My favorite cocktail is "The ChiChi."
Don't forget to order some ramen, skewers, miso bacon, wasabi shake shake fries and their world famous signature karaage.

Really enjoyed our impromptu stop at izakaya Juraku. Was a very unique atmosphere especially for nyc. It was very laid back, anime was on tv, and so many cool mementos from Japan were everywhere you looked. I loved how big the Japanese beer menu (including craft) was. Wish there were physical menus tho because the QR menu was pretty difficult to navigate through with so many pages. Of the food we tried, we really liked the garlic edamame and the curry katsu. The chicken gyoza and chicken thigh skewer were pretty decent but nothing overly mind blowing.

When I first walked in, I immediately noticed they paid detailed attention from their sword designed hand bar, and to the anime theme interior! For the foods, the signature karaage is the perfect side dish to this meal! Juicy yet crispy. Also really enjoy the yuzu slushy that is not pictured, a good amount of yuzu flavor and it was really refreshing.

We also get the Kushiyakidon(grilled skewers over rice): Hokkaido scallop skewer stand out the most, Katsu curry and Kuro(black garlic) ramen.

Izakaya Juraku won us over after our third visit in a single month. We were immediately impressed by the delicious dishes and prompt, efficient customer service.

This is not your typical divey izakaya joint. It has a proper full bar, high tables, and communal tables for large groups. We appreciated that they still use QR codes for menu ordering.

We started with a 200 ml cold bottle of sake and the Yakiniku, sautéed Washu beef with Korean-style BBQ sauce. The Karaage, their signature fried chicken, was served with spicy mayo. Both dishes were so delicious that I quickly asked the server for a bowl of rice. It was the perfect addition.

I then ordered the Kuro (black garlic) ramen, a braised pork bone broth with egg noodles, boiled egg, spinach, braised pork loin, and house-made black garlic oil. The overall flavor and presentation of this dish was excellent. My partner ordered the katsu curry, Muji-Fuji pork cutlet with Japanese pickles. He found the curry a little sweet for his liking.

Overall, we had a great dining experience at Izakaya Juraku and will return to try other dishes on the menu. We highly recommend this place!

Perfect place to come and hang with a big group to catch up, drink, and share food. We had a group of 7 for a weeknight dinner earlier this summer and had made a reservation ahead of time. Pretty easy to get within a week of our visit. Our server was very friendly and helped us gauge how many skewers and dishes were enough to share with our big group, some of whom had already foolishly eaten before arriving. For skewers, we had the zucchini, skirt steak, pork belly, mushroom, shrimp, scallop, and pork sausage. We also ordered yakiniku. The food wasn't anything fancy, just honest ingredients cooked to perfection with simple seasoning. This place also has quite the variety of Japanese beers to choose from, more than I've seen at any restaurant. Our group ordered a large bottle of sake and a few pitchers of beer. Would absolutely recommend again, especially for a larger group.

Good food! I came on a Saturday evening with some friends and it was just right in terms of crowds. We started off with a couple of drinks. I ordered the Aomori seagrass and it was just as strong as it needed to be. I didn't need anything else. The servers were very patient as it was our first time eating here. We also got the chicken, beef and shrimp skewers and they were sooo tasty. Only thing was I ordered the chicken and beef skewers and got beef and shrimp. The second time I ordered it came out slow so I assumed that it was getting more packed. The ambiance inside was very nice. There were many painting and posters of a couple of popular memes but translated to Japanese. Overall nice spot and it would return!

Just ate here last night with a group of friends.  We showed up early for our reservation but they were able to accommodate us while we enjoyed some cocktails at the bar.  The staff were so friendly and helpful when my friends inquired about their different Japanese beers.  We met the Manager Kiyo who recommended some amazing dishes!  We really enjoyed all their dishes and we ordered A LOT!  The wasabi Shake Shake fries have got to be my favorite.  Oh no wait, the raw octopus might be my favorite.  And the Kaarage Loaded Fries.  Actually EVERYTHING was so flavorful. Can't go wrong with the skewered meats: steak and the kuro buta sausage were yummy!  We are looking forward to returning.  It was such a welcoming atmosphere and the food was fresh and tasty that went well with drinks!  Kiyo was SUPER nice and even took a photo with us outside!  Thanks so much.  Can't wait to return!!

Have gone a couple of times with a group of friends for food and drinks. Think it's a good place to go but it's a bit pricey.
The skewers are pretty good here ( one of the best places I've had). I think all the bar food is pretty good too to snack on with a couple of drinks.

Good ambience, wide selection of Japanese drinks and foods, perfect place to go with friends who are not on a budget haha.
Easy to get a reservation, good service and reasonable prices. Dorayaki wasn't as good as I'd hoped, but mentaiko mazemen exceeded expectations. They didn't skimp out on the mentaiko

Came to this place after work with friends on a Friday evening. We were a party of 4 but made reservations in advance. We ordered so many things to try, not pictured were the mentaiko carbonara. I was in the devouring mode by the time it came out.

Food came out really quickly despite how busy it was.  My favorites were the mentaiko carbonara and the squid calamari. They were generous with the amount of squid that came with the order. The mentaiko carbonara was made from thinner maybe ramen noodles, not the usual pasta noodle. But the flavor was super rich and creamy.

This place was one of the better tasting Izakaya places I've been to. Service was also really good with the waiter checking in on us and refilling our water regularly. I got the yuzu ginger ale but it wasn't the best alcoholic drink IMO so I would try another cocktail next time.

Tip: Make sure to book a reservation in advance. I believe there is also a fee if your party is a no show.

Atmosphere is great. Love the vibe and the choice of the playlist is pretty wide range. Bartender and waiter are on top of their game and the food... GAWD!!! So good. The skirt steak skewer is to die for. 5/5 would come back again

Consistently solid (and creative) Izakaya spot and part of my standing rotation. After a few months, went again this evening and was reminded why I love this Izakaya Juraku so much - so many delicious (and quality) options both from a drink (mainly beer and sake) and good standpoint.

Some of our favorites are the loaded chicken karage fries (yes it's as heavy and delicious as it sounds - elevated cheese fries), the scallop skewer, and the pork belly skewer. We tried the takowasa and pork buns this time around and both where super tasty. While we didn't get drinks this time, previously my favorite has been the matcha IPA (forgetting name off hand). Such an interesting meld of complex flavors.

Also - service is always pretty good and attentive. I've gone both by reservation and walk-in (which is a gamble, but I've been lucky), and I'd recommend making a reservation.

Cute place! Went here for my birthday and they took a reservation with a baby. Extremely friendly staff and very patient and accommodating!

Had a fun time trying the dishes and splitting them. I liked all the skewers- the chicken, scallops, and beef ones were tender and tasty. I enjoyed the raw octopus, the chicken wings were also moist and flavorful, and the french fries with karaage chicken is a great dish to share.

Prices here were decent! Great ambiance. Would come back here again.
Can't wait to come back here everything we ordered was delicious and I've never had edamame like that before it was soo good! service was great too and the place is so kawaii :)

Incredible. A Must try !

If you're looking for quality Ramen to impress your date or a #TreatYourself lunch that you highly deserve- Izakaya Juraku is your place.

One word to describe this place is:  Original

Expect outstanding food and service while you're here.

Follow me on Yelp Facebook instagram and YouTube as I travel the world in search of the perfect bowl of noodle soup  

@noodlesoupr

#Food #Seafood #DateNight #Cocktail #NewYorkFood #NYCFood #NewJerseyBlogger

Atmosphere: This place is perfect if you're looking for a late night izakaya option. Super chill. If you're into Japanese food/culture, and like restaurants like Kenka, you'll love this place. The decor is awesome, and they play classic anime like City Hunter on their TVs, and project episodes of One Piece onto the wall. Heads up, this place usually requires reservations, but you can get a seat at the bar if you don't have one.

Food: I've noticed that food at izakayas tend to be lower quality than if you were to go to a full-blown restaurant, for example. But honestly, you don't go to izakayas for the food. You go for cheap, good eats, a nice vibe and drinks. And this place delivered on those fronts. I ordered the Brown Butter Miso Ramen, and as a ramen lover I'd give this a 7.7 out of 10. It really tasted like buttered popcorn mixed with ramen, but hey, I'd still eat it. We also got Takoyaki and Karaage Loaded Fries. One thing I should say about this place is that their beer selection is HUGE. If you're a fan of imported beer or sake this place is like heaven.

Service: Service was amazing. So we didn't have a reservation, but they let us sit at the bar. And the bartender was super nice. He gave us good recommendations on food and drink and then he even gave us a Matcha Bomb on the house! While I can't guarantee they will give complimentary drinks out for anyone who visits, just know you can expect good service if you sit at the bar! The owner also helped us identify the anime playing on the TVs. He's quiet, but a nice man for sure.

I was craving Ramen and I found this spot.  The Ramen broth was out of this world and I can drink it for days. The yuzu slushy was so delicious I ordered two! The fried chicken was super crispy, tender and juicy.
What I ordered: Kuro (black garlic) Ramen, Brown Butter Ramen, & Yuzu Slushy With Soju :)
One piece was playing while we ate
The vibes are immaculate.

Such a fun little restaurant! This is where the Old Man Run Club meets on Saturday mornings, and they always have great snacks and vibes. I got the chicken katsu cutlet and shiso fries this morning after my run, and both were super crispy and flavorful! Just what I needed for a post-run recovery! Check this place out if you want a casual time with good drinks and eats!

Nice spot to unwind after a long day at work! They offer a wide selection of Japanese craft beers. We enjoyed both the lacto stout and the anbai (salty plum) beers.

The skewers were on point -- the savory and juicy pork belly, scallops, and chicken thighs all hit the spot. The "good" edamame (garlic and buttery) was indeed good. Don't bother with the plain!

The manager/owner was fun and did a great job describing the various beers. Not everyone might appreciate the pretend-attitude but it made us laugh. Good times!

Came here with a group after a movie at Regal nearby. We were quite hungry, and ordered several apps and a main each, as well as sake. I think the apps, namely the karaage and fried horse mackerel were good, though it's hard to do fried stuff wrong. The sake was nice as well. I think all of us were a little underwhelmed with our mains though. My gyudon was probably the best, but none of the ramens really tasted great and the noodles didn't seem super fresh. The black garlic one especially was kind of too sweet somehow? Didn't taste garlicky enough and seemed like the focus more was on  the broth looking very black rather than tasting great.

I think for LES, you can do a lot better. It seems like the bar vibe is nice and maybe that's what people really love. There is really cool interior decoration as well. Good vibes overall, but this is just not the strongest place for Japanese food.

This is a very lowkey izakaya place (as most are) and the food is comforting, delicious, and affordable.  Yes they used to have a happy hour but times are changing and the food is still reasonably priced so there's no reason not to go.  My friends and I got the chicken karaage and takoyaki to start and for dinner I got the black garlic ramen.  I don't know how prevalent garlic ramen is because I've never actively looked for it and it was simply recommended by our waiter.  However, I will definitely be on the lookout for it because it's pretty delicious.  I also love garlic in general as it's the basis in most of the cuisines of where I'm from.  

For the drinks, I typically enjoy sake but didn't enjoy whatever the waiter had recommended, which is obviously completely fine.  As for the appetizers, I've had better karaage (Raku) and takoyaki (Dokodemo).  I would still return again but just use my own judgement on picking which sake/beer and stick to the ramen here.

Food was good! Especially the karage fries and yakiniku!! We got 2 orders once the first was finished. A group of 9 surprising the birthday boy in the corner of the restaurant made it a good place to hide. As the tables were bar designed with high tops and slim space for free leg/arm room, we made the birthday boy limbo to his middle table seating arrangement. Great atmosphere with drinks / entree and apps. The japanese spaghetti about $22 was delicious, just wish it was a tad bit more creamier/saucier( add a protein, it's  only noodles). Chicken katsu with rice and curry was thick and filling. Ramen bowls looked great and not dense with oil. By the end of our meal, surprisingly they gave us matcha alcoholic shots, that's not on the menu. Not bad. Instead of the normal hot burn down your throat, it was brain freeze cold  lol
Decent Izakaya. All the food and drinks were cheap/fair price. The food also tasted pretty good for bar food. Enjoyed my time here.

Came here for lunch and everything was so good! The katsu, fries, and the RAMEN!!!! It was surprisingly good. Also tried this melon beer that tasted like melona. They also make alcoholic slushies. At night the place gets pretty fun, will come back!

Came to this place to try. The appetizers were really good. The calamari a little different from most places. The batter was already seasoned and squeeze some lemons on it and you don't need marinara sauce. The takoyaki had the right amount of sauce on it. Some places usually drenched. The skewers were done well. But the sauce was too sweet. The chicken wings fried very well. But too much sauce overpowered the chicken. The don was okay. And the ramen unique flavor to it. Not a bad place to try. But I did not like the height of the food was at the appetizer and then went down from the entree. But my ramen unfortunately was too buttery and oily gave me a stomachache and had diarrhea. Flavors good. But maybe too buttery for the stomach. I would come back for the apps and maybe a different ramen that's not buttery or oily.

i didn't take as many photos because i was too busy loving every single drink here!!! the food wasn't that memorable but i would def come again and again for the amazing drinks

the drinks: got the melon ale beer, pear beer, yuzu slushie, get fucked 2.0, and oolong cocktail. but the BEERS omg you must try their fruit flavored ales, it's literally the most magical beers i've ever tasted in my life. yuzu slushie was a close second, super refreshing and light!

the food: got the karaage fries and edemamme, these were just ok!

the space: simple japanese bar, but i loved how they were projecting one piece right above the bar.

This is a great, low-key spot for Izakaya food and drinks. They have so many drinks, and even a bottled sake that comes in a cute keepsake glass with a doggo on it! My friends and I walked in without a reservation on a Friday night and were still able to get a table with no trouble. I like that the vibe is not pretentious at all, and there's no need to dress up to dine here. They have the usual Izakaya fare but we only ordered karage to share. The karage comes with a big portion. The chunks of chicken are meaty but tender and well battered. I also ordered the black garlic ramen, which was on par with what you would find at a ramen shop. Thick, smooth noodles, flavorful broth and the usual char sieu and soft boiled egg yolk made this an excellent bowl of ramen. My only complaint was that they only have one piece of char siew and half a  soft boiled egg while most places give 2 of each.

We love this place!

Huge sale selection, very friendly and hospitable, delicious food.
Cozy and not stressful here!  

We've tried the skewers and many other small plates.  Will update!

3.5 stars. Spicy ramen here was certainly welcome after a long walk in the neighborhood although I have had better. It came in hot and spicy but I couldn't taste any other flavors. Very little pork too. Nonetheless it was welcome on a cold day  ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Bento chicken box was mediocre. Everything in the box; chicken,veggies along with dumplings were just ok.

The service was great; we were quickly accommodated in their outdoor seating area even though it was previously locked. So, definitely a thumbs up for that.

They do have an interesting selection of Japanese beers and some unique mixed drinks which can be fun to try with friends (with their appetizers and shake shake fries)

Visited on a Sunday for brunch and there was plenty of seating! I wanted to try this place for a while, and finally got to it on Sunday and I am so happy that I picked the perfect timing!!

Izakaya Juraku had us try some new fry ideas and it was absolutely delicious! We tried Furikake fries (I think that's what the seasoning is called, but it's a purple salt seasoning) and wasabi fries! Both were amazing, but the wasabi fries are to die for! It was sweet and salty, a perfect combination. It didn't taste much like wasabi, but you will not be disappointed! The furikake fries were also delicious, but it wasn't as amazing as the wasabi fries. I personally don't even like wasabi, but I was in love with the wasabi fries.

I would've had a meal of wasabi fries over my spicy ramen any day!

In addition to the food, the service was absolutely amazing. We were actively check up on and the waiter was very friendly, and fun to talk to! This place is amazing!! I'm surprise it wasn't as crowded as the food was amazing!

tl;dr - amazing service; great food; wasabi fries - get them!!

My wife and I had dinner here on Saturday night, 7pm. I had a couple Sapporo beers (which I wish had been colder and in a colder mug, even though I saw them stored in the beer fridge). We ordered maybe 7-8 things, and loved the chicken pieces (deep fried, and a very tasty spicy sauce).

Most other items were middling or not great. Shishito peppers were small and seemed more microwaved than blistered fresh. The seaweed salad was also fine, not special. Gyoza/dumplings were not grilled and seemed steamed (not crunchy at all).

So, not great. One of the chicken items (karashee?) was great; others were average at best. Beer was fine but warmer than I like.

My wife paid, and I think the total as $102? But I didn't see the total bill so am not sure about that or the tip amount.
Great ramen, delicious drinks, lovely staff! Definitely going to dine here again. Black Garlic Ramen

Came here with my boyfriend on a Saturday evening for some drinks and a quick bite. Moderately noisy, but no crazy loud music so you can definitely hold a conversation in here. Server was attentive, came to check up on us pretty often.

For food, we got the karaage, gyu don and the skewer (kushi yaki) don.  My favorite out of the three was the karaage, as I believe they specialize in small plates and appetizers over entrees. The chicken was moist, flavorful and came with a great dipping sauce. I enjoyed my skewer don too (came with your choice of skewers, so I chose chicken, pork, and beef). The pork one came out a bit burnt and charred, the chicken was a bit underseasoned, but the beef was the best of the 3.

I was also looking forward to trying their house special "Juraku Nipon Rice Lager" but they did not have that available so I settled for a Sapporo. Overall it was a decent experience and I'd like to come back just for the small plates next time.

Visited on a Saturday night with a reservation. We were in the area about 30 minutes early, and they were able to accommodate us at that time. The inside has a laid back and trendy ambiance that's perfect for an Izakaya. We ordered a Yuzu sake carafe and a variety of dishes for the table to share (yakiniku, skewers, karaage, and yakisoba).

Every single dish we ordered was fantastic! All the meats were moist and cooked to perfection. The sauces were balanced flavors with excellent use of spicy and sweet notes. The Yuzu sake was sour and not too sweet, making it a great balance to the fried foods. After trying several izakayas in the city, this one is by far my favorite!

On top of excellent food, the service was friendly and efficient. I would note that most of the tables are small (seating 2-4), so this wouldn't be the best choice for a large group. But for small groups, highly recommend making a visit!

Ever since 29B stopped their evening hours my friend Rod and I have been coming here - Amazing selection of Japanese beers and sakes - the food is top notch Izakaya as well. If it's not too busy, Kiyo will whisk up a Matcha beer unlike any other. Love this place!

Back again for the wonderful food and Valentine's Day. I brought my mom who was visiting
and roommate. Can't recommend this place enough- thank you Kiyo!!!

Fun spot to have dinner or drinks with a group. Tucked away in a street filled with bars and other small / quick service restaurants, Izakaya Juraku offers a relatively large menu with Japanese tapas and entrees that are shareable depending on how much you want to share haha.

Came here with a party of about 8 and tried many things. Some notable items were the Karaage, Miso bacon, Grilled squid and Washu beef.

TBH, nothing was OMG I can't wait to come back and have that again good- but nothing was disappointing either. Pair it with some drinks and you will have a nice chill night with decent to good eats and a good selection of Japanese beverages.

I've been coming here pretty much since it opened. I've never been disappointed. Excellent and wide selection of sakes.

I pretty much always have to order the braised pork, and the tomato skewers were a surprise hit for me and my friends.

The service is prompt and friendly, I cannot recommend enough.

The worst ramen I've ever had! The broth tasted like burned over used oil! It was also extremely salty and had just one tiny piece of meat.
The appetizers were also bad! Such a waste of my stomach space!
The service was slow. The place was stinking.
Never coming here again!
One of the best Izakaya in NYC. They got  amazing selections of food and drinks. I can count on the service as well.

Came in search of Happy Hour which they no longer have but still ended being a happy hour after all! :)

Great selection of drinks / beers, and there were no misses with the varied appetizers and entrees my friends and I shared. My top favorites were the mentaiko mazeman and the skewers (pork belly, steak)! The mazemen is super creamy and savory, and the skewers were juicyyyyy.

We also ordered the fried squid, fried oysters, fried ebi katsu, and the buta kimchi don, and some other skewers. All the fried apps were crispy and yummy.

I'd definitely come back for a casual dinner or drinks with friends.

They also have their own GIFs on Instagram - super cute!

Came here on a Thursday night after 7pm. It was quite empty at first and around 8pm, it was packed. From the outside, it didn't look like much but once you enter, the atmosphere and the decor gives a nice bar vibe. The menu is very long so I had a hard time choosing what to eat but the waiter gave us good recommendations. Highly recommend this place if you ever want quick japanese food.

Food: 5/5
Price: 5/5
Service: 5/5

The food here was beyond delicious . Definitely will be coming back, Kio helped me because I have allergies and he accommodated me very well, many thanks once again!! Loved the food check the pictures also I had the black garlic ramen but veggie style (not finna tell y'all my secret menu selections) but defiantly come by, Japanese pub run by some great guys and the food will blow your mind

We were a party of 4 and came here on a Wednesday!  We ordered 2 of each skewers on the menu.  They all have the same sauce and was pretty salty.  The skewers was warm/ kind of cold.  I think the skewers were pre-made and they just heated back up!  I would categorize as a bar more than a Izakaya place.

Delicious lunch option! Friendly staff

Gyu Don is a good portion if you're pretty hungry. Plenty of sweet onions and a hint of ginger. Soft poached egg in the center over a bed of rice dressed with a sweet sauce of dashi, mirin and soy sauce.

IXTA is beautiful-- definitely gives tulum vibes.

Went for dinner on a Friday night around 6 and the place was fairly empty but did get more crowded once we were leaving.

Wait staff was friendly and attentive! We tried the fish tacos, birria tacos, flautas and truffle queso-- which were all delicious. Finished up with their spin on churros and the sauces were so tasty!

I had the only mocktail on the menu-- tasted just like a pina colada and came in a pretty tiki class!

Solid option for fun but not too authentic Mexican in spacious environs on the LES.

My highlights were the vegetarian enchiladas and the esquites. I'm not sure whose idea it was to add a ton of haldi to esquites, but honestly this weird fusion corn curry was super delicious. The enchiladas had a very rich mole sauce, which I find too few restaurants offer as a pairing with a vegetarian option, so I was pleased they did so here.

I've seen this place on Tik Tok a bunch so we decided to come here to celebrate a friend's publication. We came on a Sunday evening and it was pretty empty. That meant service was great for us! The space is really beautiful, almost feels like you're being transported to a restaurant in Mexico. We ordered drinks and they came out pretty quickly. I had the Mucha Pasión because I'm a sucker for anything with passion fruit in it. I was expecting something sweeter, but it felt like it had more of a mild flavor to it aside from the strong tequila. My friend had the Buenas Vibras mocktail and thought it was delicious (must have been, she got 3!).

The food:

Flautas Durados: These were some of the most crispy flautas I've ever had. Chicken was moist and flavorful and the salsa had a nice kick to it. Easily the best thing we had all night!
Truffle Tots and Cheese: Honestly, this was a very confusing dish. We thought it would be like tater tots topped with queso, but it was queso with potatoes and meat stuffed throughout. It wasn't bad but not great either. It also doesn't come with chips to dip in, you'll need to order this for an additional price.
Oysters: Standard east coast oysters. A little pricy ($18). The sauce for topping was nice and spicy!
Birria Tacos: These were tasty. The meat was tender and the consommé on the side was amazing. A little disappointed that it only came with two for the price.
Pollo Rostizado: The chicken was a little dry but the mole sauce was really good.
Elote: SO GOOD! They give a decent-sized portion. Would highly recommend as a side to share with the sable.
Papas Bravas: We also really enjoyed these. They were well seasoned and came topped with a yummy sauce, just not enough sauce for the entire portion.
