Never ever will i go to this criminal den thinking im helping a small business and getting a fair price. If i could give zero stars i would. Stay away and buy your food elsewhere, you'll save a ton of money and you'll actually being helping a hard working family.

THE BEST HALAL I have had in nyc so far. we got the combo over rice and had to immediately come back for seconds because it was so good.

the rice, the flavors, the tenderness of the meat... truly my favorite meal of this trip. Ali was the sweetest. I would come back to nyc just for this food cart. also this was eaten while fully sober, so just think how good this would be as late night drunk food. mind blowing, i can only imagine

If you're ok with getting food from a cart (and you absolutely should be)...run to this cart. Not only is the food delicious and the cart immaculate,  Firoz, the owner is about as nice as it gets. And in a time where the pandemic has made support of small businesses a priority, choose wisely and choose often. And choose this midtown cart!
So so tasty. I would eat the falafel gyro every week if I could. I've made a special trip here in the past and look forward to my next meal here
Super good! Was delicious! Just visiting NYC but needed a quick bite and this was perfectly placed on our path! It was all filling and reasonably priced!
Great service, quick and tasty food! Had the chicken gyro, hot dogs and chicken teriaki over rice. All tasted amazing

BEWARE, THIS OWNER IS A CROOK!!! Notice his cart doesn't have any prices, just pictures. He charged me $15 for a lamb gyro. Best ask how much before you order. I am visiting NYC , and don't really know prices but a gyro should not be more than $10. Would definitely pay him a visit tomorrow and ask him why he ripped me off.

I have been getting Lamb Kati Rolls minus cilantro from this cart for over a year. The husband cooks your order and the wife collects money from the customers. They always have a smile on their faces and seemed like very happy couple. I met up with my friend for lunch and suggested Tasty because 2 kati rolls are only 6 bucks. Definitely a cheap lunch lol

We stopped here to try Chicken Biryani and we were not disappointed. We ended up stopping by to grab food every day of our trip while in New York. I also had the chance to try the Falafel with rice and it was delcious as well. The service was friendly and the prices are as reasonable as one can get in NY. Can't wait to visit this cart again during our next trip to the city.
Very sweet man selling wonderful food. Hit the spot! We had the biryani-- it was delicious and full of flavor.

Was in the city during lunch looking for somewhere to eat and came across this truck. I tried the lobster mac. It was delicious. The lobster was a fried lobster tail on a bed of macaroni pie. I enjoyed it. Pro tip add a bit of jerk sauce on it. Thank me later

Nothing to write home about...

Highlights: jerk chicken and rice moist, chicken has that super crispy texture in the outside, very fresh food

Cons: portion size is small for a $17 meal, jerk sauce almost non existent, spring salad had no dressing

This place is like an Americanized Jamaican spot, down with the seasoning, up with the price, down with the portions

I had a chance to try out this spot the other day and the jerk chicken is juicy! And the salad underneath the chicken is fresh. Will definitely check out this food truck again but next time I'm going for spicy instead of mild.

I recently had the pleasure of visiting I'milky, and my experience was nothing short of amazing! As a self-proclaimed boba enthusiast, I can confidently say that I've found my new favorite spot for the perfect matcha boba tea.

From the moment I walked in, the cozy ambiance and friendly staff made me feel right at home. The menu at I'milky boasts an impressive array of boba tea options, but it was the Matcha Boba Tea that truly stole the show for me.

The matcha flavor was rich, authentic, and perfectly balanced. It wasn't overly sweet, allowing the earthy notes of the matcha to shine through. The boba pearls were flawlessly cooked--chewy and bursting with flavor with every delightful sip. What sets I'milky apart is their commitment to using high-quality ingredients, evident in every aspect of their drinks.

The presentation was impeccable, served in a cute, Instagram-worthy cup that added to the overall experience. The attention to detail, from the vibrant green color of the matcha to the precisely cooked pearls, showcased the craftsmanship that goes into each drink.

The staff at I'milky were not only knowledgeable about their menu but also eager to offer recommendations based on personal preferences. Their enthusiasm for boba tea was infectious, and it's evident that they take pride in delivering a top-notch experience to their customers.

I'milky has undoubtedly earned its place as my go-to boba tea spot. If you're a matcha lover or just someone looking for a fantastic boba tea experience, do yourself a favor and visit I'milky. You won't be disappointed!

Depending on the time of the day, the lines at this location can either be long, or short. Either way, the workers try to be as efficient as they can.

I have never tried their food, but I always find myself craving their fresh coconut taro milk. It is just the right amount of sweetness with a mixture of both coconut and taro flavor.
Bring cash for a small discount!

Currently feeding my boba obsession! I really like that they use premium tea leaves, 100% farm fresh milk, cane sugar, fresh fruit, and pure honey for their drinks. Their customer service is great, establishment is clean, the workers are patient, polite, and they also offer food options as well.

My go-to is their I'Milky premium Black Milk tea, 50% sugar, and with added bubbles. Keep in mind that the toppings cost extra but the texture of their bubbles are always spot on! Chewy, soft yet slightly firm, and coated with just the right amount of sweetness. Next time I'll aim to try their fruit teas!

Super cute boba shop! I happened to walk right by it as I was making my way back to the hotel and so I turned around and popped right in.

The employees were friendly and greeted me right away. There was no line when I walked in but as I waited for my drink the line started to get long.

I ordered a regular traditional milk tea with boba in a cute Christmas Bear cup and for some reason the cup made me so happy! The drink was really good and refreshing and the boba was delicious. For the holidays, they have cute igloos at the front where you can enjoy your drinks, very cute!

I will definitely stop by again when visiting the city!

I loved my drinks here! I got the Thai iced tea jumbo boba drink and it was so fun and perfect for the fall season. I also found the boba to be the perfect texture for me, not super chewy but also not blobby. I also had onigiri and the meat inside was delicious. The staff were VERY kind! The inside is a bit small so be wary of going as a large group.

Small boba place tucked in on 6th. First time here and the cashier was really helpful. I ordered a Barley Milk Tea and an Onigiri. They told me that if I wanted an additional Onigiri, it would only be another $2.

The Barley Milk tea was really good. I don't see this often so I wanted to give it a try and it didn't disappoint. I think the pricing here is fair and overall I would return!

This is a decent food/bubble tea place to check out, but I think you could likely find better elsewhere.

I ordered takeout from here because the bento box/milk tea combo was a pretty decent price. With that in mind, this meal was satisfying. I think the quality and quantity both met the price. Nothing was great, but nothing was bad either.

Overall, I wouldn't come back expecting a good meal, but for a quick and affordable stop, it fits the bill. I'd consider ordering again in a pinch, but I probably wouldn't order it again soon.

I've heard great things about I'Milky and was excited to finally have the chance to try. I ordered the Fresh Taro Milk w/ Brown Sugar Boba and the taro was standout - not too sweet, perfect thickness, and overall great flavor. The taro to milk ratio is definitely quite high, as the drink ended up being more like a dessert rather than your typical boba drink.

Service at this location was unfortunately slow with some issues with ordering (there were multiple people in front of me who had to have their orders remade). The drinks are also on the pricier side, but this could be justified by the quality. Not sure if I'Milky will be a spot I revisit often, but would still suggest giving them a try!

Came here on a Sunday night and we got lucky there was no line since it seems like a popular place. But the line started forming right after, even tho it was raining hard.

We ordered:
- Fresh taro milk with purple rice: it's like those cold Asian sweet soups you can get at dessert places but in drink form. The 50% sweetness was the right amount of sweet and the purple rice was a good texture (not mushy). Wound recommend this one if you're looking for a caffeine-free option.

- Barley milk tea: another caffeine-free option. I wanted to try this one bc I haven't seen this at many boba places. The barley taste was subtle and the taste was alright.

- Earl Grey milk tea (not pictured): this one was so good! Strong and aromatic tea flavor, which wasn't overpowered by the milk. This one is a classic and one of the best earl grey milk teas I've had!

Overall, I can see why this place is so popular! The staff were friendly and patient in helping us decide what to order. The boba itself was soft, chewy and sweet.. They have food options also, so it's a great place to have a meal with great drinks. Wish they wouldn't charge extra for milk alternatives.  But would still recommend this place!

Tip: pay with cash to get 5% off.

As soon as I saw I'Milky's giant boba on social media, I knew I had to go check it out! Heard good things about this chain but unfortunately my experience was only alright. The jumbo/giant boba turned out to be grass jelly (rather than actual boba), and you can ONLY get them with thai milk tea so no drink subsitutions allowed. I love grass jelly but their version was less smooth and more bitter than expected. Each drink only comes with 4 giant boba. Their actual boba was very solid and chewy but the thai tea itself was ok. The drink itself was a little disappointing but what made it worse was that the first drink had a little fly. The staff was nice enough to remake our order, nevertheless.
The store itself was small and can only really accomodate 6-8 people inside. I liked how they have videos playing to show people who to mix their drinks (lol) and the seats were comfortable. You get a 5% discount if you bring cash.

Had read good things about this place online and was a little disappointed by the drinks. The place was right in the heart of Williamsburg near Bedford av so the location was prime.
I ordered a coconut taro boba, they didn't offer it as a smoothie but that's fine, with regular milk.
When i tell you the thing was almost entirely milk (??) and that the little bit of taro that there was tasted funny, it was like drinking a dreamy frothy milk w slight coconut taste.
Unfortunately because i usually love this drink and had high expectations here.
Great price point for boba and mine was super tasty. I like how it is customizable and my order came out fast. I will definitely be back!

Slightly higher prices than I'm used to but I'd pay it any time - 100% worth it cause they actually put a good amount of filling in the rice balls, most than most supermarkets / ootoya does. Also, one of the only places with non caffeinated boba in Manhattan. Love that purple rice is an option as well for the rice balls

Totally loved this spot. It is real quality u can taste. I loveddd the creamy but not overbearingness of the fresh strawb milk. The medium felt quite small (or mayb i was just thirsty) so maybe size up!

Was super excited to try this place for their drinks per a friend's recommendation and I was pretty happy with what I got!

My friend got their new taro drink and I decided to try their brown sugar milk tea. Ultimately, service was friendly and fast, the drink tasted amazing, and pricing was average so I would definitely come again to try out their other drinks and food items!

Only caution is to stay near the store or outside so that you can hear your order number be called, and there are only about 2-3 small tables inside so you'll likely be getting something to go!

Maybe I'm becoming older, but starting to realize that $8-10 probably isn't worth a cup of ice and flavored syrup! Wait took a while too, so that factors in my experience here.

Was kinda disappointed seeing how hyped it was on social media, but it was refreshing for a hot summer night; I'll come back and try more.

Came here again and tried their Fresh Taro Milk ($7) and Fresh Strawberry Milk ($7.25). They make their drinks with real taro and real strawberries, not powder. The taro in their fresh taro milk drinks were too compacted for me. I couldn't mix it enough to get them dissolved to drink. Taro was definitely fresh, though. I'm normally not a taro person but read some reviews here raving about it so I was tempted.

The strawberry milk drink was delicious. I watched them used fresh strawberries to make it. It was easier to mix with the milk. Can't wait for their food menu to come!

Their commitment to fresh ingredients and high quality milks are unmatched and unlike any bubble tea place I've been to. I came here on Thursday afternoon, and it was packed. There was a line out the door to order, and on the inside all of the chairs and tables were filled. I love how there so many different kinds of milk you can choose from for your drinks, and they also have a handful of toppings you can add to your drink. I ended up getting the classic bubble milk tea, large size, no sugar, no ice, with soy milk and added pudding. This specific drink itself already came with boba, which is great. They also sell food -- bento boxes, rice balls etc. I didn't end up trying their food in this visit. However, I plan on returning here and showing my partner and friends when I'm back here next. You'll have to come check it out, it's a really cool experience, and it's nice to see a business really leveling up that bubble tea game. The staff here were really friendly, knowledgeable, efficient and accommodating to drink modifications.

I'm a pretty big fan of the place. There's almost always a line and it has a good location in between Bryant park and Herald Square.

The shop itself is very small with three tables and a very small space between the entrance and the counter.

My go to here is the coconut taro with pudding. Their taro is naturally sweetened, so it doesn't require adjusting the sugar levels. The ingredients here are pretty high quality, which does reflect in the taste.

I'Milky is worth the stop!

Some of my go-to's are:

-Brown Sugar Bubble Milk (with Oat Milk)
-Shrimp Tempura Riceball (with white sauce)
-Fried Chicken Nuggets

When you first get your boba, they have you shake your cup to blend and maximize the flavors. You could definitely taste the brown sugar, but it wasn't overbearingly sweet, which I liked since I'm not a fan of too sweet of drinks.

The riceball was yummy too! I only wish there was more shrimp tempura in it. It took awhile to reach but when I did, it was delicious. The white sauce was an added bonus and paired well with it, in my opinion.

The fried chicken was seasoned and made well. Good serving size.

I love how they use fresh ingredients rather than powders like most other spots, too!

They have multiple locations  across Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens. Service has always been friendly and efficient.

Hot tip: They offer non-dairy options

Very impressed by this boba shop we stumbled upon after a day of shopping, my mom and I weren't expecting much at all while visiting from CA. Service was slightly slow since they were busy and the only other dock was we ordered no boba on one of the drinks but still got boba in it (not complaining too much as we didn't notice until we got back to the hotel)

My mom ordered their Taro Coconut Milk (sweetness not adjustable but was actually barely sweet at all, perfect for Asian mom approval) and the Taro was real, blended and tasted fresh - not too chunky or artificial at all!

I got the #1 drink Brown Sugar Boba Milk since it was late and I didn't feel like getting the tea version. The brown sugar syrup here is on another level, with such a deep rich roasted/"browned" sugar flavor unlike any other spot I've tried. This made it so addicting and enjoyable, and I appreciated being able to still adjust the sweetness on this! I got less ice and less sugar, it was perfect.

Best boba in town!! I came here so many times during my month long stay. L'milky has soft, chewy boba, great service, a large variety, and just the right sweetness.

The brown sugar milk tea was my go to drink. A large is only 50 cents more than a small, they only have oat milk (no almond) which is 85 cents more.

The packaging is very cute, the shop is clean and the staff is very friendly!

On my most recent NYC trips, my boyfriend and I have been staying in KTown and after trying multiple boba places in the area, we have decided that I'Milky is probably our favorite!
The boba itself has a great consistency and taste. The drinks are delicious. I love the variety of teas they have as well. I haven't tried the food yet but I am excited to try the next time I go back.

There isn't too much seating inside but it is very cute. It is a bit on the pricey side but...what else can you expect from KTown NYC? Hahaha

I loveeee this place! It's such a quick but filling meal/snack! My favorite Originis are the shrimp, chicken and spicy pork belly! I always get the special that included 2 originis and a drink! 100% recommended!
Oh! And I had the special snowman holiday drink and it was so yummy and cute!

Milky, creamy, and light. It's an extremely small space, and any more than 3 people in line will send people outside the door waiting. I think I was like 6 in line when I arrived, it took me roughly 30-40 minutes to get my drink. There is little to no sitting space (only like 3-4 small circle tables).

Drinks are a bit pricey, and not sure if it's entirely worth the price for a considerably small cup. However, it's worth trying at least once and definitely getting one of their "milky" specialties.
.....

MANGO MILK: 4/5
drink was naturally sweetened from the mango, which was pleasantly fresh as well

I'm knocking off a star right off the bat purely because of the online ordering policy: you have to specify your arrival time in the "additional notes" section of your order otherwise the order will *start* being prepared *when* you arrive. Nowhere is this mentioned on the online ordering system (I used mobile Yelp/Grubhub). The rationale is to keep the boba pearls as chewy-fresh as possible, but, come on now, I've had boba pearls that were still perfectly chewy even an hour after they were submerged in milk tea lol. So yeah, wasn't really thrilled that upon my arrival after ordering ahead of time my order wasn't even in the process of being made.

Setting my saltiness aside, pretty okay stuff here overall. No skimping on the green tea in the fresh strawberry green tea drink and the green tea itself was quite delicious. The strawberry purée was a bit sugary, but the strong green tea flavor helped balance the overall taste of the drink. The boba pearls were fantastically chewy, and, surprise-surprise, they were still that even later in the day lol. Not much barley tea in the barley milk tea; drink tasted almost like straight milk. As for the rice balls, very flavorful filling but it was like 20% filling and 80% rice.

Ehh overall not a bad boba spot if you're craving for some boba. Just heed my warning about ordering ahead! Lol.

I was looking for cafes near the hotel I was staying at, and saw this place was highly rated. And then I saw Pamela L. wrote a raving review for I'Milky, so I knew I had to visit because she is Ms. Bobalicious after all! This was my favorite milk tea out of the other places I tried in Midtown (Tea Makers, Grace Street, Machi Machi).

They are located near 6th Ave and 37th St, next to Krispy Kreme. Inside seating is limited, and the register is literally by the door as soon as you walk in. There's also not a lot of space to wait inside, so sometimes a line will form outside.

Their food menu was pretty robust, with several rice balls (onigiri), bentos, and other miscellaneous items (edamame, soba, chicken nuggets, shrimp tempura). Drinks include milk teas, coffees, ice teas, and more. Dairy alternatives include Lactaid, soy, and oat. Not a lot of options for toppings, but they have the most popular ones. Adjustable ice and sugar levels.

Big emphasis on freshness here. They proudly proclaim their ingredients are all natural and high quality. Real fruits instead of purees. Honey and cane sugar, not fructose.

Both drinks were excellent. Jasmine Green Milk Tea was steeped well and had fragrant floral notes. Earl Grey also had a good flavor that pairs well with the milk. Boba was served warm and the consistency was chewy. I also appreciated how slightly sweet each tapioca pearl was, it seems like most places are not soaking them long enough in the syrup bath these days.

100% would come back again!

Actually went out of my way to hunt this down! Saw it on Instagram, advertising the cute snowman cups!! I know I'm a bubble tea fanatic  but collecting cute bubble tea cups, especially the reusable one. OMG! I cant.

When I got there. I was taken back by how cute the place look. Would really love to get the snowman cups.. but $3.25 for the cup. I can't bring myself to do it.. ( kinda on a budget you feel me?)

Anyways, I love how they use legit milk for their milk teas not milk powder like everywhere else. But legit milk like oat, soy and lactaid which was pretty neat and definitely up my alley. I got the fresh taro milk and I absolutely adore it! It honestly tastes nicer the than ones from milk jar. You can get 100% sugar and it's not too sweet. Actually taste like the taro paste dessert from Chinese restaurant (one of my favorites Chinese desserts)

Definitely recommend to come try it out! Oh! Side note, I know I'm not a fan of bobas, but I tried theirs and it's actually real soft and chewy ;)

My drink of the day was boring but classic. Plain o milk tea (earl gray) with no bubbles and 50% sugar. Taste was fine but I could go higher with the sweetness to hit that just right spot.

Menu looks great with a variety of choices and accommodations to personal preferences. They also sell food and have combo deals to go with drinks!

It's more of a take out spot even though they have limited seating of 3 small tables to the side. Not sure when they clean the seating area but it feels quite dirty.

There's a wifi password on the receipt! No restrooms here.

LOVED this place! Tried the fresh taro with whole milk with purple rice and it was filled with rich, fresh taro and wasn't overly sweet. Their earl grey milk tea was rich in tea flavor which I loved. Will definitely return!!

I'Milky is one of my go-to boba stops when I'm in NYC! Noticed they were advertising seasonal drinks in snowman cups on their Instagram and well, the marketing tactic worked because we rerouted ourselves to try it

One thing I really appreciate about I'Milky is their use of fresh ingredients. My friend always orders Taro and they always use FRESH TARO in their drinks! Yes, it costs like ~$9-10 for a Taro milk tea, but I'll pay the price for premium ingredients. Same goes for their milk, sweetener, honey, fruit, etc...all of it is fresh!

I got the strawberry matcha and it was SO good. The quality of the matcha and strawberry jam is top notch. I usually pick up some of their onigiri as well because they offer combo deals. You typically have to wait anywhere from 5-10 mins for your order and the seating area inside is usually full and a little cramped, but it's worth it for the fresh taste and quality.

Already looking forward to being back!

Delicious onigiri! I enjoyed the kimchi beef more than the shrimp tempura. What makes this place unique and untraditional is that they serve their onigiri with an aioli dipping sauce. I chose the green sauce, which was delicious.

Great place for a quick snack or take it with you for later.

I am a big fan of Bubble Tea and haven't tried too many in midtown, so I was happy to see they were close to where I had my shoot!

I tried their Coconut Bubble Tea and it was delicious. Compared to the brands I've tried before, this consistency was definitely less watery than the ones I've had and had coconut pieces inside. Definitely a great spot and pick! I will come by again to try another flavors!

First of all, I was impressed by the cozy and inviting atmosphere of the café. The interior had a modern yet comfortable feel, with plenty of seating options for customers. The staff was friendly and attentive, creating a welcoming environment.

Ordered the Taro Milk Coconut Taro Milk Tea and it was exceptional. The tea had a rich and creamy texture that blended perfectly with the taro flavor. The balance between the coconut tea and taro was just right, creating a delightful and refreshing beverage. The sweetness level was also on point, not overpowering but still providing a pleasant taste. It was evident that the tea was made with high quality ingredients, with pure farm fresh milk.

Came here on a Saturday evening and even with a line out the door, the staff moved pretty quickly to get everyone's order satisfied. The space was relatively small as well though so there wasn't much room to wait. We were lucky to get a table though and so we sat to enjoy our food and drinks.

The bubble tea itself was well made and I enjoyed the consistency and texture of the tapioca. Overall, I found the tea to be worth the price. My rice balls however were pretty disappointing - the amount of filling in both was way too small compared to the size of the rice ball itself. I got the tuna and spicy pork belly kimchi ones - I preferred the taste of the latter and the filling proportion was a little better for that one, but still overall disappointing.

I would say their drinks are worth it, but their food left a lot to be desired. Regardless, I'm glad I tried this place to learn that at least their drinks were really refreshing and satisfying for my boba craving at the time!

YUM. I love love love how customizable this bubble tea is - non dairy? Less sugar? More ice? You got it. I also love how they use natural ingredients and let their ingredients shine.

Cannot even describe how delicious the taro milk tea with purple rice and oat milk is. I love it and definitely can't wait to come back.
Place is small and tight. I suggest order for pick up. Food was okay for the price. Would suggest honey lemonade!
Looking for tea in NYC? Come here! They have very quick service and their quality is great. Comparable to many top tier tea places in SoCal. Pleasantly surprised!

This is my first ever Yelp review. First off, their bubble tea is gas. BUT, I got a bento box today and that shit was GARBAGE. They left the curry sauce in a ziploc bag wrapped up in the box. I called and they said they do this so it doesn't spill. Then ok use the $14 price point to get a proper sauce container - don't think I need to explain getting served food in a ziploc bag when it's overpriced is a slap in the face. The chicken was also heavily over salted. I sent my friends pictures and they all laughed at how I got scammed. I don't see the option to upload a pic, but I think you would laugh too if you saw it.

In NYC for 12 hours and we had to get boba no matter what. This place looks super pleasing but their brown sugar bubble milk tea was definitely not worth the price for me. Paid around $6.80 for it and it didn't hit the spot.

Felt very watered down and it wasn't as sweet. I do have to give them props for good soft chewy boba!

This place was just adorable. There was a small seating area and they sell food too. I came here for the fresh taro and it was so so so delicious! I wish it was a bit creamier but it was the perfect flavor. The service was quick though there was a sign to wait outside and it was a little confusing as to what that meant. Altogether very good experience!

IMilky came across our New York adventures as a must try place! I do not regret getting milk tea from here because the pearls were made to perfection. The quality of the milk tea was also amazing. Definitely better than your average boba place.

Interesting take on trendy boba, nice packaging and smart!  Cute & cozy shop right on herald square area off 36 & 6th Ave, serving up onigiri (rice balls) and boba selection.

I got myself a brown sugar pudding drink and it was quite yummy! Not too sweet and ratio of pudding to drink was perfect.

Friendly staff and patient with their first time customer - didn't mind explaining the variety of selection available.

I can't wait yo try their rice ball offerings
Lovely staff who were engaging and positive! Boba was on point with it being not too sweet. Would come back again!

I visited I'Milky today to get a quick drink before my nail appointment as I was running around in a pinch and had remembered going to a different location and had a great experience.

Unfortunately, this time it took 15 minutes to get one drink (a small taro milk tea with tapioca) with no line ahead of me. This isn't really a big deal for me, except they insisted I pay with cash for a "5%" discount. My order was $8.01, I paid with a $50 and a penny, and they gave me $22 back. Essentially I paid for a $28 drink.

This is disappointing on its own as this basic customer service is essential to building trust with your market, but my drink tasted like whipped cream with not even an essence of taro.

Unfortunately I will not be recommending I'Milky, especially not this location, to my peers.

Not sure why this place has such good reviews tbh... The inside seating area is very small and very dirty.. The chairs look like they were never sanitized or cleaned (pics included).

The mango drink that I got was about $10 dollars and it really didn't seem worth that high of a price. I kept having little mango skin(?) chunks while sipping and had to constantly spit that out while drinking.. Really didn't see this drink to be anything special.. The mango was not that sweet either so it was just okay.

Staff is very friendly and nice though and the drinks come pretty fast!

I got the taro coconut milk with pudding. It was good, but could've used a little bit more taro. I went mid day and waited 8 minutes for my order. There are a few tables inside but barely enough standing room to wait. It was a super hot day outside. The service was very friendly.

What I found interesting was that two people entered a bit after I placed my order and asked for their order to be rushed (classic bubble milk tea) and got their order a minute later. It came off as ___ privilege. Wouldn't everyone like to know that there was a rush option to rush their order? I think there were at least 2 people who placed orders after me before they arrived.

I did make a return here and I got to have the chicken rice ball I originally wanted. It turns out my kids loved the place more than I did. I have to say I followed the directions of how to wrap the riceball this time, they show a video inside the store of how to wrap it. I must say it was fun. One of my daughters who is the pickiest eater I know, loved the chicken riceball. It was well seasoned and was a better fit with all the rice wrapped around it. I would just buy that, as for the shrimp I think they should use two pieces. I also got to enjoy a strawberry green tea with Boba this time, I found that to be delicious. It was the best flavor I had so far regarding the Boba teas I had. Although next time I would add less Boba.

Overall I still give this place a four. My kids talked about how they wanted to come back, and my middle daughter wanted to come and try more of their Boba teas along with the riceballs. I just found out as I'm writing this review that they are now honoring the Yelp free topping check-in but its a lil to late for me, because I won't be back for another visit for awhile. If your in the area you have until June 26th. -Happy Yelping!

This is a cute small place that is close to Macy's or Penn Station

This place offers tea, fresh milk tea, fresh flavored milk, expresso, fresh fruit drinks, and winter (hot only drinks).

How to order:
- Choose your drink
- Choose the size
- Choose the sugar level
- Choose the ice amount

The employee is friendly and guides me through the process.  I decided on a strawberry milk, medium (even though the large cost $0.50 more), asked about sugar level and decided on 30% sugar, and half the ice.  You wait for your drink.  The employee reminds me to shake my drink.  The drink changes from red (top) and white (bottom) to a pinkish color.  This was pretty good.

I have to try the other milk drinks next time and rice balls.

Great quality teas and boba.  I always order the Milk Green Tea with boba . Not overly sweet and great milky taste. Unfortunately, They don't allowed to substitute fructose syrup for honey . So minus a star
we got the golden chicken curry bowl and the tiki masala and man it was DELICIOUS!! 10/10 would recommend this place.

Simple and fast lunch option! This location has no seating so it's more of a grab and go place. There's two kiosks to order and the food came out under 10 minutes.

I got the lemon chicken bowl and it was pretty decent. Filling and flavorful (the chicken was a little dry so would recommend getting extra sauce), good choice for a quick lunch.

the food is great to me.  
I have only ordered for delivery. Been pretty quick and food is great.

Food is good, but is not the best Indian food I ever had. It seems to fit the vibe of the environment. This is one of those quick grab and go places for the people who work in the area that can't find a good Indian food spot. You can order from the Kiosk or at the counter. The samosas were good, but the Chicken Tikka Masala bowl felt that it was missing something in the flavor.

Good Food. Love the Samosas and the Green Chutney is my favorite. Relatively priced in comparison to the area it's located. I like the flavor combinations, it's not too overpowering on the taste buds.

Not good. Very flavorless and bland. Not worth the money.

Service was great and food came out super fast

I could probably eat their Saag Paneer everyday. It's perfect.

What would make this place even more perfect would be if they had more vegetarian entrées.

Thank you Inday!

Stopped by today as I seem this place a few times but it was always closed so decided to grab lunch. I wanted a roll but wanted salmon as my protein which they don't have an option for so had tonorder everything separately. I got a side salmon, garlic Naan and a side of tamarind sauce. The Naan was good the tamarind was good the salmon was a bit softer then I like think it was cooked medium rare and I prefer my salmon well done. The service although you have minimal interaction with them as everything is mainly kiosk is not friendly. I asked the guy about my order as I was waiting for a while and a bunch of people that ordered after me was getting their items given it was chicken so I assumed the salmon had a different cook time hut wanted to inquire. He rudely just looked at me and said what did you get when the other staffer told him salmon he it's cooking and walked off rudely.
Yummy lunch. I grabbed it and walked over to eat in Bryant Park. Good deal, and super tasty.

I had Chicken Tikka curry and a side of coconut chickpea curry for takeout. Food has good taste but IT IS BARELY WARM! Others have left similar reviews... it would be awesome if they fix this aspect and serve their food hit, which is hot Indian food is supposed to be.
Food was a bit luke warm . I was expecting it to be warm . That's all for now . Service was great . I was greeted by a warm smile
Amazing place for lunch. Try the tikka Masala and add the Garlic Naan it is heaven sent.

Ambience was cutesy. Cool. The service was so nice like they were SOOOO NICE. but the FOOD. I BUSTED. HOLY COW. I tear fell from my eyes. Me and my buddy went non verbal for 20 minutes. It was just that good. Lord. I nearly died and went to hell (probably).

TLDR: ippudo is worth trying once so you can experience this style of ramen. But it's not something we'd seek again

We came to Ippudo wanting something warm after a brisk November day of exploring. Bear in mind there was a 20 min wait by 4pm.

For apps we got the karaage chicken and shishito peppers. I will say the shishito peppers were much spicier than I've ever had before which was a surprise! They were also small and a tad oily. Karaage chicken with mentaiko mayo was standard but delicious nonetheless.

Our whole table ordered the Akamura ramen. The broth was savory and rich. You have to pay for an egg which is a little annoying. The red sauce a signature ippudo sauce which is sweet, taste like honey and pepper paste? Some were not a fan at all of incorporating sweetness into the ramen. Buyer beware!

2nd time at Ippudo's 5th Avenue location, and it definitely doesn't disappoint!

Service: Staff was friendly and approachable! Catered to all our needs and were extremely transparent about wait times. The food definitely made the wait very worth it.

Food: For starters, we had a sampler of pork/chicken buns, Takoyaki, and French Fries. The pork/chicken were flavorful, but I would've appreciated the buns being a bit warmer. The french fries were definitely made to order, which was great, but a bit on the salty side. Takoyaki was hot (this was good) and creamy on the inside.

For ramen, I was recommended the Bonnie Bonito, a seasonal addition to the menu. This fish flavored broth had the perfect umami notes, while the noodles/assorted veggies really added some body. The pork loin chashu was also very tender and served as a perfect complimentary protein.

Overall, the wait at Ippudo is a testament to their great service and food. Would come here again!

Great first visit to Ippudo, just east of Times Square. Plenty of seating on a Tuesday evening and didn't have to wait at all for a spot. Service was speedy and friendly.

Our group was a big fan of the spicy pork ramen (~$18), which was very tasty and had a solid combination of flavor and kick. Would definitely come back for another trip next time I'm in the area to try several other options on the menu!

5/5 food, we had the pork buns, karaka spicy ramen, and the dumplings.  The ramen was simply amazing and this is our spot when he go to NYC.

5/5 ambiance

5/5 service, was quick and fast because there is always a line so they want you in and out. They way I like it!

FYI- the karaka spicy ramen is pretty hot so eat at your risk.

I love Ippudo but it's so damn expensive. Came here for dinner, and was happy to immediately be seated as the people who came 30 minutes after us weren't so lucky.

I ordered the Akamaru Modern, and for a ramen that is $20+, they really need to give you a free egg - not an egg that you can add on for $3 which is ridiculous. The Ippudo noodles are unmatched as they are thin and al dente, almost like a pasta feel and goes well with the broth that isn't overly salty. I also appreciate the pickled bamboo shoots which went well with the fatty chasu. I do think the spicy miso paste made a difference and elevated the dish.

Honestly, I'm still a big fan of Ippudo but it's food is really too damn expensive. I would say it's still one of my favorite ramen places in the city even though it is a chain.

Wanting something hot and within walking distance of our hotel, we stumbled upon Ippudo about a block away. Walking in around dinner time on a Monday evening, the wait actually wasn't too bad. And we wound up getting seated after about a 15min wait.

Although rather small and unassuming from the outside, this restaurant actually goes pretty deep, and can seemingly seat quite a few tables. Once we were led to the dining area, we got to see just how busy and packed this place is. A stark contrast to the quiet and rather empty wait area out front.

My wife opted for the Akamaru Shinaji ($20), while I chose the Potara Miso ($22). The Akamaru Shinaji consisted of pork tonkatsu broth, Hakata thin noodles, scallions, bamboo shoots, topped with our choice of protein (we chose pork). While the Potara Miso consisted of Ippudo pork tonkatsu broth mixed with spinach, corn, bamboo shoots, marinated pork chashu, and Tokyo thick wavy noodles.

We both really enjoyed our respective bowls of ramen, however did agree that it was priced on the higher end given what was served. Service was pretty friendly, however we had quite the wait trying to close out our check.

This place was literally right next door to our hotel.
We were able to be seated right away.
We ordered the Karaka Spicy Kasane with an egg and corn on the side and karaage.
The ramen was ok, I wish the broth was more creamy and it was not spicy at all. The karaage had no flavor and the dipping sauce was weird.
The ramen was not worth $30, definitely overpriced.

Got the "akamaru shinaji", which is like a pork tonkotsu, with pork belly and egg.  Overall experience was very good.  But if I had to nitpick, I wish they filled the bowl with more broth, especially considering it was $21 (and $3 more for 1 egg).  Personally would've liked price closer to $17-18 for what I got.

But having said that, still recommend for the experience.  People used to wait hours for this in the East Village, yet here the wait is reasonable.  But having tried this and also the one in Japan, my verdict is it is very good, but not worth waiting more than 10 minutes for.

If you want great ramen  then check out Ippudo. We shared some Ramen and buns at Ippudo. We got Pork buns and a Shrimp bun.

I got the Yozu Shoyo Ramen which had Tokyo wavy noodles, pork, egg, and bamboo shoot

My girlfriend got the Potara Miso - Pork Tonkotsu broth Miso with pork chasu, spinach, bamboo shoots, onion chips, and corn

Great Ramen/buns! One of my favorite Ramen places in the city. Top notch!

Ramen was just ok. Stumbled to this location on a whim and expected to have consistent ramen. I ordered the akamaru. The broth was bland. I thought my order was the only one. Tried the broths in the other bowls. They were all muted in terms of flavor and spice. The noodles were ok too. No chew. Was a miss. Won't be back.

Akamaru shinaji: $21
Karaka spicy: $24
Miso ramen: $24

Came here to order some ramen to go. The restaurant is nice on the outside. On the inside, it was dark, I didn't go past the waiting area. I ordered the shiromaru motoaji ramen. I also got a spice ball. Unfortunately, I really didn't like the ramen taste, and thank goodness I got the spice ball, or I would have really been upset. It didn't have too much flavor to it, and the toppings were lacking. I have had better ramen for cheaper, so this was disappointing.

The service was quick, and the wait staff gave great customer service. I will gladly give them another try, and have something new.

the ramen bowl was never ending but the overall place was a pretty loud atmosphere.

*akamaru shinaji ramen: it was an overall good ramen bowl, a lot pricier than what I usually pay for. however there was a LOT of ramen which was nice. at one point I was getting so full but there was more and more noodles as I continued.

*takoyaki: do not skip out! I loved it and the portion sizes are so much bigger compared to most ramen shops.

*my tips: be sure to check for reservations (some places offer them and some don't)

would I go again? Yes

Truly horrible service. Nothing worth suffering the inhuman treatment for. Same instant noodles you get on ANA airline.

Totally overrated. The reception can't handle a larger waiting crowd professionally.

Personally I understand the Japanese culture but I also appreciate my personal space and prefer not having staff members yelling next to me.

The reception team needs to go back to hospitality school to learn about what politeness means. Perhaps the militant style bossing waiting customers around works in Japan but not here in North America.

Not seating guests until everyone has arrived is a silly and rude rule. Far better to set a time limit for the table.

We were hungry on our way to an art exhibit and decided to have lunch first. The service here was fast and efficient, which was really great since we were rushing to our destination. The interior had a minimalistic design with a classy vibe.

We ordered their limited edition spicy ramen (3/5). The broth was rich and flavorful, and the noodles were cooked well. The portion size was adequate. However, the spicy pork topping was overly salty. On the other hand, the classic tonkotsu ramen (4/5) was also delicious, with a rich umami-flavored broth, and every component was of great quality. The chicken karaage (3.5/5) was decent enough but a tad bit bland.
Mediocre ramen that looked a lot better than it tasted, the soup didn't have much flavor. However the service was fast and there was no wait during weekday lunch rush

I've been to the other Ippudo restaurants in NYC and this one ranks the lowest for me. It's the hipster version of it and misses some of the uniqueness the other have, which is why it gets a 4 not a 5.

The flavor just wasn't as good as the others with the broth just lacking a little flavor, but still a really good bowl of ramen!

With the plethora of ramen options all over NYC and in every neighborhood, there is really no need to patronize this location for a solid bowl of ramen outside of sheer convenience. Since the original EV location became such a popular destination and establish the brand, the quality of ramen and broth has taken a dip for sure.  But that is not to say it is not a solid option for a convenient and quick ramen fix or lunch option. However if you are craving for true ramen satisfaction, this location wouldn't be on the list of recommendation overall in my opinion.

Despite the not-so-stellar rating for this location, I had a good experience here for a small group dinner.

Got the spicy ramen with an additional egg and it was delicious - full bodied broth, molten flavorful egg yolk, noodles with a bit of bite to them (not in the undercooked way), and melt-in-your-mouth charsiu.

Parfait was surprisingly good with a froyo scoop and matcha biscuits/cereal. And mocktails were a lot of fun.

I almost walked past this. I wanted to get Ippudo again. The last time I had this was at the Tokyo airport and that was just a baby take out restaurant. I'm so glad I got to revisit this again.

Akamuru shinaji was my top ramen for me then the sukiyaki special. I'd probably say that the only edge it out because it probably appeals more to the general public the sukiyaki might be more acquired as it has fish broth in it so it's a bold flavor.

The truffle fries were on point we ordered two. The Karaage was perfectly crispy and the sauce was Fantastic. The spare ribs has a real nice grilled taste to it.

Had an amazing dinner at Ippudo. I came in early, before the dinner rush so it wasn't too crowded.

The chicken appetizer was delicious! The honey mustard was really good and definitely added a lot to the dish.

We ordered the lychee drink and I really enjoyed it. I don't typically love most cocktails but this one really tasted like lychee!

And for the ramen... amazing! A large bowl and so many options + add ons available. You can also ask to replace the noodles with wavy noodles- a personal favorite!

I do think they are a but expensive but the staff were very nice and the food tasted pretty good.

Honestly it's difficult to beat Ippudo in terms of quality, even in NYC. Yes, the line is long, and yes, it's no cheap, but every time I'm here, I absolutely love what I'm consuming. The soup is rich without being heavy, and the noodles are the perfect amount of QQ.

Would not recommend coming here if you want a place to catch up and relax. Because the line is out-the-door, they're typically trying to turn tables ASAP

We have tried the Ippudo in Asakusa as well as the Westside and this 5th Avenue restaurant and I can say that the quality and service at all three are excellent.   We were given a 20 minute wait time when we arrived at around 7pm and it was pretty accurate.   The server was wonderful and the restaurant and the restroom was clean.   As for the food it's always the same top notch quality you expect from this establishment.   I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu.   I highly recommend the vegetable bun and the spicy gyoza.   The flavor was off the charts.   If you're looking for the best ramen in the city this is the place to go!

Love this place! Slight wait but it was convenient since I was a party of one. Small inside! Service is good! Sake was soooo good. Got the flight. I loved the bun! Soft and so flavorful. I ordered one of the bowls and the flavor was so good. Come to find out it had tofu but it was yummy  so all was good. I ordered a sorbet to top off a delish dinner! Good place to dine solo but there were couples there. I'm sure they could accommodate larger parties but I mainly saw two tops. Good find, delish food, good service and cool vibe!

Very expensive spot for ramen that isn't amazing. Seats are cramped and tight, right next to each other. I've had ramen at other spots for much less. Ending up paying $85 for two bowls of miso ramen with egg ($3 extra) and an order of karage. Service was subpar and the minimum suggested tip is 20% when paying. Didn't think they deserve that much. Won't be going back!

On a sizzling summer day this place had the forethought to include a cold noodle bowl on the menu - points for that. It tasted great and hit the spot, tiding me over until the late train dumped me back in my hometown. Clean restaurant, chatty but not too loud, and the waiter provided just the right amount of attention. For a last-minute decision, this place turned out to be pretty good.

What better than a bowl of piping hot ramen on a cold day? Came here a few months back and it was packed on a Wednesday afternoon. The wait time was around 15 minutes and we were seated at the back of the restaurant, tucked into a corner. Interior is heavy on the wooden accents and very cozy (read: depending on where you're sitting, you could be practically elbow to elbow with your neighbor).
Right off the bat, I would say to skip the appetizers. We got the recommended kara-age and truffle fries, both underwhelming. Five pieces of chicken-nugget-esque chunks arrived in front of us garnished with a lemon wedge and two shishito peppers. It was.. bad. I bit into a solid chunk of batter which was not cooked through. The second bite was not much better, as there was an excess of untrimmed fat. Honestly, the highlight of this was the mentaiko mayo dipping sauce which we kept for the fries. Speaking of, the truffle fries were a joke as well. The 'truffle paste' was dumped haphazardly over the shoestring-style fries, which meant you were either wrestling to spread it with another fry, eating one with nothing on it, or getting a chunk of the salty paste. Some of the fries were perfect but a greater portion felt like we were biting into oil (you can see in the picture how thoroughly soaked the parchment paper was on one side touching the fries). The ridiculous upcharge on apps would have been more negligible had the food quality actually been on par with the price.

Now for the redeeming qualities, and why people actually come to Ippudo:
The ramen is fantastic, there's no argument here.
Karaka Spicy- rich tonkotsu broth with al dente thin noodles, perfect for clinging onto the soup. The drizzle of garlic oil and dollop of spicy paste completely transforms the flavor of the broth so I usually have a few bites and sipes before mixing everything together.
Yuzu Shoyu- this pork-free soy-sauce based broth was surprising not as light as I expected it to be. It tasted very strongly of the bonito fish dashi, but not in an unpleasant way. The noodles used are a thicker wavy variety which provided an interesting texture. The yuzu was fragrant and gave the ramen a nice citrus aftertaste. Everything worked very well together in this bowl.
Lastly, we also got Lychee 75, a cocktail that packs a punch. They definitely don't skimp on their liquor.
Overall, the ramen alone bumps the rating up to 3 stars, and is all I would really come back to Ippudo for. The overpriced appetizers left much to be desired.

This is the best ramen I have ever had!!!

I ordered the Nirvana Karaka Ramen (VG) with a poached egg and it was served very quickly. I'm glad I got the spicy noodle option, it was sooo flavorful and good!!! There's enough noodles for all the broth. The toppings are all amazing. Tofu for no extra!! The egg was an add-on. I was slurping the broth down it was soooo good!! I can't wait to bring friends/family here when they visit. The atmosphere is very chill and family-friendly. Very clean.
I ordered the Karaka Spicy Ramen ($24 a bowl). It was okay but nothing remarkable about it

Great location, definitely better than anything we have in the South. The ramen is top notch with a great balance of saltiness and dimension that clings onto the noodles. Very easy to slurp without being too overwhelming. I came here a few minutes after 5:00pm and didn't have to wait, but the location started getting packed when we left around 6:10.

Definitely RTE - especially if you don't have an Ippudo close to you on a regular basis.

Ippudo never disappoints! Having been to other locations for the last few years, it was great to try this final location.

We arrived on Saturday around 6pm for dinner and were seated right away. The tables were lined up very closely together, and you can't help but listen in on other conversations and fight the urge to contribute.

For our meal, we ordered the truffle fries and oishii karaage to start. You can order a sauxe of your choice for the kaaarage so we went with the mentai Mayo dipping sauce. I love that the truffle fries had flecks of truffle and wasn't just drizzled with oil. The karaage was juicy and delicious, and went really well with the mentai Mayo.

Now for the main star. I forgot which type of ramen I like since it had been a few years, so I went with the Karaka Spicy, which a tonkotsu broth with noodles, chashu, green onions, and seasoned bamboo shoots. What I really wanted was the Akamaru Shinaji, which had secret
umami paste.

Overall, it was a solid bowl of ramen.

The food was delicious! I got the Karaka Spicy Ramen (which was more expensive that I thought it would be) with an egg added in be it was so good. It wasn't as spicy as I had expected, but none the less I thoroughly enjoyed it. The ambiance was good and the service was good and fast. I will definitely be returning here.

So another Ippudo ramen place we had to gone to. They are a big chain ramen restaurant. This one was right next door to our hotel at Hilton Garden Time Square North and didn't want to go far since it was raining in the city. Easy to find. Not super crowded when we came for dinner at 6p. Plenty of space and for bigger groups. Good service and very attentive.  

We had gyoza and pork bun for appetizers.  Always very good. We both chose the pork ''Potara Miso Ramen'. It was pretty good but too much of something smoky taste in it. I couldn't put my finger in what it was. It has lots of ingredients and was good for cold night in the city. [56th R]

My daughter didn't feel like having ramen so we tried the appetizers. The rice balls and the tuna rolls were heavy and sticky. Defiantly enough flavor to be with filling up on. The ramen was good. The best part was the spice.  The noodles felt a bit tough.
The worse part was when paying, the guy was standing over our head looking while paying which was very uncomfortable. The lowest top amount in the handheld device was 20%. The next amounts were 25 and 30%. If you want to pay less you have to manually change it which is hard to do while he us standing over your head.
I wanted to leave less cause even though my daughter hardly touched her food and I told them that she didn't like it they didn't offer to change it or take it off.
I hope they read this and do better moving forward.

I ordered the spicy karaka ramen with pork and it was not satisfying. I've ordered the akamaru, which was just okay, so i thought the karaka would be a nice change of flavor but i was wrong. The broth's flavors was muted over the spices. I enjoy spices as much as the next person; the ramen was just underwhelming for having a pork based broth. Also, the noodles were rubbery and didn't seem properly cooked. I was here last night before i was with my coworkers, so not by choice. I don't plan to come back.

Great service + ambiance! The inside is really clean and the bar seating is perfect for friends/a date. I got the Special, which was the spicy sukiyaki ramen (left). The broth was so rich and flavorful, but had the perfect balance of sweet, savory, and spicy. They were also very generous with the meat portions and I had enough to take home for leftovers. Would highly rec trying the special !

Loved this spot!  I am usually unimpressed with most ramen shops, but the soup was well seasoned and the meat was so tender! I ordered the karaka spicy with chicken and my husband ordered the shiromaru motoaji with pork belly.  

For my karaka spicy, the spicy sauce was  mildly sweetened with a szechuan flavor profile without the mouth numbing effects.  Most places that I previously tried outside of Ippudo have a tendency to make it too sweet, which was not the case here and it was PERFECT!

Also, loved the yuzu desert! It has so many layers of texture and the highest complement of all, it was "not too sweet."

I was shocked to see the star number for this Ippudo. Honestly never had a bad experience at either location. But this one is my favorite location personally the set up of the seating inside is more intimate. All their ramen is top tier so rich and decadent. They have really good truffle fries as well. But the one thing that made me continuously visit was the Beef Teppan. It's this beautifully cooked skirt steak with cauliflower in THE BEST sauce I think I have ever tried in my life. They have great cocktails as well and it's never too packed. So worth visiting you wont regret!

I went to this place because of a few friends who recommended it pre covid. I came in on a weekday, around 2pm, so the lunch rush had passed.

I knew I wanted a ramen bowl, plus that's what everyone had recommended. There were 3 vegetarian options to chose from. No lunch specials - the cheapest vegetarian bowl is $20, which seemed kind of pricey for some ramen but I figured I should still give it a shot. I got the Nirvana Akamaru ($21). The Nirvana Shiromaru was a dollar less but this one had a secret sauce so figured it was worth trying (didn't really do much for me).

The service was quick and the broth was hot, but so was the staff's constant eye to see if I was done. I felt like I was practically being asked "are you done yet" every time they paused to peer into my bowl when passing me. The bowl itself was pretty mediocre, with 2 thin pieces of tofu, a few mushrooms, and noodles. Any other add on was $2-$5, which was a bit ridiculous considering you're charging $21 for ramen. I also didn't appreciate the starting "suggested tip" being 20%. That's not standard tipping and they pressure the customer to pay that by having it listed first. My meal of 1 bowl of ramen was almost $30 with tip and it wasn't even that good, nor did I have a pleasant experience in the restaurant.

I agreed with others' reviews that there are very similar ramen spots for less. Can't say I would go again.

Quick place to stop by for some food near times square. You must have your whole party present to be seated. The two most popular items are the Akamaru Shinaji and the Karaka Spicy. I opted for the Akamaru Shinaji as I didn't want something too spicy.  The noodles were served in less than 5 minutes. The broth was rich and flavorful, and but didn't seem to stand out from other ramen places I have been too. I did like that the spoon was massive so you could get noodles and soup in one bite. Prices are a tad higher than other places, probably because of the name. Overall, good ramen, but I will probably try out some other places before returning.

A little overhyped in my opinion. I always order roughly the same thing anytime I try somewhere new: some shio broth with a topping combo that usually includes extra chashu, spice, nori and egg.

It tasted fine but I paid about $35 for something that I know I can get at other places for 50-75% the price for the same quality.

It was just me and it took a long time for me to get cashed out or have my water refilled. It was on a Thursday afternoon.

The ramen was delicious and I remember this was my first time at Ippudo, as well as learning about the tradition of "Kaedama" (asking for more noodles). We arrived at a pretty late time and the wait was pretty long originally but we were determined to eat ramen that night. We finally got seated and ordered; the server was very courteous to mention the kitchen would be closing soon and made sure we had all of our food accounted for, including the extra noodles that most of us ordered, without sounding pushy and urging us to hurry up- it was almost as if she anticipated our insatiable need for delicious light broth and noodles.

Cute and intimate ramen place, and while the ramen was very good it's definitely a little overpriced for what you get. Base ramens usually have the broth, noodle, and meat but any other toppings can be a $2-$5 add on. Overall pretty good ramen, but there's plenty of other places that can do the same for cheaper.

I was really hyped to try Ippudo after having Ichiran and hearing so much about it. The 5th ave location wasn't busy and we got seated right away. I tried the pork bun as an appetizer and for $5 for one it was good but I've had better that was cheaper. Now moving on to the main dish, I got the Potara Miso Ramen to try a little bit of everything. The ramen did not meet my expectations and I did not like it a single bit. The flavors were off and didn't go well together. The broth wasn't that rich and was on the bland side, not worth the $20 price tag that it comes with. I think I should have ordered another one since my friends enjoyed the ramen that they ordered. Overall, pretty disappointed with everything.

We walked in with little wait. They told us that we would have to wait 25 minutes, but seated us within 5 minutes. The hostess was so considerate and put us at a table big enough so we could have my baby in the stroller without getting in people's way.

The takoyaki was really unique that they had it on a plate rather than in the little plate. You could tell they just made them. The French fries is not something I usually order, but my son wanted some and I loved you could have a side of guacamole with it. They had great flavor a little grated cheese or something that made it more delicious than plain salt.

My husband and I both ordered ramens - kimidori and tantan mien. Both were really different in flavors. I loved that since most ramen dishes at other places tend to all taste similar. Service was also very on point, but not too intrusive.

The food in short was amazing and fairly affordable. The restaurant is pretty small, so don't expect to fit any group bigger than 4 people there.

So this would be the second time I ate here and this time I did not get the spicy ramen, which meant I could enjoy the food this time and not be sweating bullets lol Anyways got the ramen and it was good, nothing too special, but not bad at all. Not the price it used to be back in the day, but overall still yummy. I was so hungry I ate everything, including the veggies, and I hate and don't eat veggies! Anyways, yeah! The broth was warm and juicy, the toppings and all. But the star of the show was the shaved ice! So big so cold, so much brain freezes.

Deff a fun date night place for sure! Service was quick, food was good, little dark for old folks like me, and the bathroom is close by if you need it-the spicy ramen will hit you quick if you know what I mean.

Came here for the first time on a Saturday after 1:30 PM. I thought that would be a slow time but I still waited 35 minutes for one single seat as I am a party of one. This place does not observe any kind of social distancing and keep in mind this place is tiny.

Further you can see through to part of the kitchen and the staff preparing the Ramen are not wearing masks covering their nose or their mouth's. Despite all of this I still sat down and order food because I have heard incredible things about this place but they're San Francisco locations from family members. So now I had an opportunity to try it and I could not pass it up.

This place is incredible and super tasty well worth the weight and reasonably price considering it's location to upper Eastside. The portions are very fair and I am not hunting for noodles nor am I hunting for pork belly or in this case chicken.  I will definitely come back and have to come back. The only other disappointment was the fact that there was random lettuce in the bowel bun I ordered which I don't understand.

Service is extremely quick once you sit down and turn around for you to get your food is also extremely quick so no complaints for me.

This place is on my PERMANENT never again list. I just picked up my order, and was lectured about how I can't just order extra broth, noodles, and toppings.

To rewind, I'm neurodivergent and certain food textures are a huge trigger. I was so happy to find that ippudo supposedly let you put together a ramen order ala carte, which means that I wouldn't be WASTING food that I will absolutely never eat.

I came in 20 minutes before the order was scheduled, which is something I'd let pass normally. If I schedule for a noon pickup, please don't tell me it's ready 45 minutes early. But fine, I'll let that go, but I didn't expect to be treated so poorly over an order put in on their own website. I totally get when Uber eats allows orders that shouldn't be put thru, but the LET ME ORDER THIS WAY. And then have the nerve to shame me when I picked it up - all in the name of not wanting to waste food.

Ippudo clearly is NOT neurodivergent-friendly and they SUPPORT WASTING FOOD.

Looks like a hole in the wall and it's pretty true. Very small inside. Wait was about 45 mins at 1 PM on a Tuesday which wasn't terrible but still a lot for the afternoon. Probably crowded because it's in midtown (lots of tourists in the area).

Food was sub-par, unfortunately. Started with the Goma Q which was a cucumber salad which was VERY salty. The flavor was hypothetically good if the salt was decreased. The takoyaki was not good at all. Very doughy and mushy on the inside with barely any octopus. The unagi rice roll was lacking flavor.

Thankfully, the ramen was good! The broth was flavorful despite it being vegetarian. We did add spice to it (we got it on the side in order to control the spice). It was very large and very filling. The tofu was very rubbery though and we didn't eat it.

Overall, pretty mediocre.

My husband and I were going to an event in the city, so I was looking for ramen places in the area for us to have dinner at after.

Unfortunately, from start to finish, this was just an overall terrible experience. When we entered, there's a small bar looking area, which is the waiting area and apparently, not an actual bar area. They didn't take reservations, so when we went in, we waited to put our name down and check on the wait. The hostess was very flippant and unconcerned with helping anyone. She wasn't even at her post when some people were coming in, so it was a weird situation of people awkwardly standing around waiting to see what the deal was.

When she finally could be bothered, she turned to the groups waiting and asks the customers the order in which they'd all arrived. Insane. Some people had been waiting for a while and we're just passed right over.  

We were told the wait would be about 30 minutes. We figured, okay, we can maybe leave and come back - since it was getting a bit crowded, but they didn't call or text people when tables were ready, so we had to wait. We then thought, okay, we could have a drink or something in the meantime. Nope. The hostess said we couldn't order any drinks until we were seated. Odd that they'd have a bar are in front then, hm?

When we were finally seated, we'd obviously had more than enough time to think about what we were going to order, so wanted to get that out of the way asap instead of waiting for servers to go back and forth and eventually come back our way. We ordered appetizers (bao buns) and drinks and our ramen. Our bao buns came out - they tasted okay, but I didn't really love how sweet the dressing was on mine. Our ramen came out. We were halfway through our meal and still ... no drinks? We flagged someone down - and guess what? They'd completely forgotten to bring our drinks or put in the order. Awesome.

I ordered the yuzu Shoyu ramen and my husband got the karaka spicy ramen. I asked for mine to also be spicy - which they didn't do for some reason. When I asked for chili oil or some sort of hot sauce, apparently that's extra, so they gave me togaroshi flakes which I guess was fine.

Neither my husband nor I enjoyed our ramen. The portions were fine, but the ramen itself - left so much to be desired. They were both pretty flavorless and the broths were strangely light. The noodles were thin and not really that nice Al dente you'd typically hope for.

I really didn't have a great experience at all, I barely ate the ramen, the service was really negligent. I definitely don't think the entire thing was worth our 30 minute wait. Wouldn't recommend and don't think I'd be returning.

We were walking back from Time's Square and craving a pizza!

We saw this place and it was absolute memory of Italian Nights. From the decoration to the menu.

The vibe and wall arts was very cute, the food was decent!

I wish we had to time to go back one more time to try the pasta which really looked good on our neighbors table

It was self service style, and they were helpful and patient.

Overall totally recommended! You can order build your own pizza too.

We got their avocado toast, iced latte and a croissant.
They do not know how to make an iced latte so please do not get that. It was mostly room temperature milk with very little coffee and no sugar.
I would still go here again, though, for their food. The croissants were perfect. The avo toast was unique and delicious. It was a focaccia sandwich with hard-boiled eggs and mashed avocados. I was initially skeptical when our order arrived because i had not seen avo toast made like that, but it was tasty.
The girls who took our order were very sweet and polite.
The cafe has an italian vibe to it so there are jars full of flavored olive oil just lying around if you want some. I don't know if this is a thing in italy lol, but i liked it.

A Delicious Italian Culinary Journey!

My recent visit to Italian Trattoria was a delightful experience of Italian flavors and craftsmanship.
The raspberry croissant, while incredibly flaky and delicious, was slightly on the sweeter side for my taste. However, the ham and cheese croissant provided a savory balance that left me satisfied. The pepperoni pizza slice showcased a perfect combination of crunchiness at the bottom and chewiness on top, and the standout was undoubtedly the chocolate cannoli with its exceptional filling that left me craving for more.

Place was decorated nicely and many seats available! Definitely come visit!

A very charming little Italian cafe in Manhattan. I loved my pasta and dessert! And the staff were friendly and quick. Very much recommend for a charming lunch,  or stop in for an espresso and Italian pastry!

Love love love this place! I originally found this place in Miami last week on my trip and loved the mushroom truffle pasta so much that I had it for 2 days straight! Had to come here and try the basil pesto pasta which blew my mind. I quickly scarfed it down! Two best pastas to have here: the tartufo pasta and the basil genovese pasta!! Their moscato is super tasty so it goes well with the pasta. This is my new fav place in NYC! It's cute and small and the cashiers speak English and Italian! Cute men as well ;) It's a self service trattoria but hands down the tasty one! I don't even feel bad spending money here because the food is delicious!

Stopped by for a late lunch.  Tried beef bolognese, pasta with pesto and spaghetti with creme sauce and prosciutto.  While expensive and the dishes were small portions, the dishes were excellent. The pesto was my favorite.  All the pasta was cooked El dente and the sauces tasted vey homemade and mature.  Nice spot for pizza and pasta. Will definitely return.

Trattoria IT, Not It.

While looking for lunch, the fresh appearing pizza in the windows caught my eye. At the counter the variety of delicious looking premade salads were almost as appealin as the pizza but definitely healthier.

The guy at the counter was very nice, he welcomed me with a smile and patiently described every salad I pointed at. I picked the "Roma" salad to go.

The leaves were fresh and crisp, the eggplant was flavorful, the tomatoes were juicy. However, the chicken was completely dried out and tough. I try to sop up all the juices on the bottom of the bowl but it didn't help the chicken. I needed like 4 flossers after chewing on those flavorless tough strips of chicken breast. The portions are small for the price, so everything in the salad should be perfect.

Most definitely not coming here again for the salad which is too bad because it is a block away from the office.

Not IT.

They have several different flavors of flat beard, I tried a slice of the mushroom parmesan truffle and the caprice salad, both where great. They have the olive oil and balsamic vinegar for you to serve yourself.

This place is something in between a deli and a resto.  You order at a counter that looks like a deli counter, but they serve food on these plastic plates that look like ceramic resto plates.

The food wasn't bad - and they have a very efficient operation figured out - but you're really paying for the location IMO.  Sit down resto prices but more like a fast casual.  Which is why when I ate there it was like 90+% tourists.  I would probably prefer a full service restaurant at these prices.  

Portions are good sized.

Staff seemed very friendly and helpful.

Came here recently for dinner and got the truffle mushroom pizza + spaghetti genovese. Staff is super and friendly but the food is not great. Spaghetti was way too salty I stopped eating it halfway through. The pizza was better but lacked flavor :( Overall, it's an ok spot but had to give it a 2 star given sad food and high price for smaller portions

The pizza was terrible! The place is pac because you don't have more place like this.
Is not cheap. The pizza is small you don't have service at table. They don't have regular sodas all is Italian and they charge more for that reason and they didn't offer tap water

What a wonderful discovery! The ambience has you thinking you are in Italy and the food is sublime. Also, met the owner and his warmth just added to the already incredible atmosphere.  And the music was perfect.  This place made my day and will definitely be back!!!!!.

Clean and pretty. There are a few tables where you can enjoy your lunch and have a glass of wine. Portions are not big and pasta was not worth $20.
4 stars for the ambiance and guys at the counter: energetic, full of life, friendly, seemed to be happy and quick at what they do - you don't always get that in Times Square.
I may go try their pizza next time as it looked pretty good.

We had breakfast there and it was tasty. I wish I could try their pastries. Good ambience, and great location, as well. I am giving 4/5, though a 4.5/5 is more relevant but not available in Yelp, since it took a bit longer that what we expected (i.e., the drinks).

This place had recently opened on 2/7/23. I had been wanting to visit this restaurant since i saw them constructing it.
I went in and spoke with one lf the employees who was explained a lot of the food and the restaurant itself. This is their second location, their first is in Miami FL. They said that the food is made fresh everday, especially the pasta. The staff was very friendly and informative on their menu.
Here on a date and we got 2 of the pastas and their strawberry pistachio tiramisu.
We started with the tiramisu which was so surprising on how amazingly delicious it was. It was light and not to sweet and the pistachio crunch gave it the right amount of texture. It is a slice that makes you feel like you can eat a full cake size of the tiramisu. Definitely get this if you decide to stop by.
The pastas that we got were the Spaghetti Modena and the Spaghetti Carbonara. The modena was creamy with the taste of the mushrooms and olives with prosciutto it was delicious 4.5/5. The carbonara was delicious and cheesey with the carbonara bacon 4.5/5. The pasta felt undercooked in which I believe it could have been cooked for another minute or two but the taste made up to it entirely.
I will be returning to this location whenever possible.

The selection and quality was off the charts, we went here several times during our visit to NYC and just couldn't get enough.  Highly recommend and we would love to return for some tasty treats.  Plenty of seating too which is not always the case at bakeries.

Food: 4/5, pretty solid for a casual italian spot. Don't go in expecting michelin star food, and you'll be satisfied. We ordered the tartufo pizza and the spaghetti genovese, both of which I would give a 4/5. The tartufo pizza was a little heavy on the truffle but the flavors melded well together. I do wish it was cooked a little more but that's a personal preference so don't let that hinder you. The spaghetti looked a bit weird (watery) when it came out, but tasted great, so no issues there. The portions are pretty decent as well, especially for the price.

Service: 3.5/5, the staff are super friendly and nice, but it was a bit understaffed and it showed. The one guy taking orders was definitely overworked so he was running around managing several people's orders at once. Another hiccup is that they mistakenly tried to give us the wrong pasta, but when we pointed it out the promptly and helpfully corrected it and gave us the right order instead. The 3.5 rating is not indicative of the staff, but rather of the lack of staff (hopefully management can resolve this).

Vibes: 4/5, good trattoria/cafe vibes, fun little spot. When we got there it wasn't too crowded but by the time we left it definitely was.

Italian food is Italian food, right? Throw some sauce on some pasta, maybe some salad or pizza, and call it a day. Wrong. The food is legitimately good, the portions are huge, and the service is excellent.
