Upon seeing that it was taking a little longer to get my meal, the manager was gracious enough to bring my dish to my table and offered dessert. I turned it down because I couldn't eat anymore.

Service often makes or breaks a meal. This service made my meal and made me a future repeat customer.

Found this little place on our last day in NYC.  Everything looked great. The flatbread sandwich was good. I wish it had a little more meat, but the flavor and texture of the bread was excellent.

I ordered a small latte and was immediately impressed with the quality of the espresso.  There was no trace of bitterness. It was smooth and satisfying with perfect temperature. I'm not a sweet coffee drinker, and this was perfect with no sweetener, sugar or syrup added. Honestly, I think it's the best latte I've ever had.

The owner and staff were friendly and we felt very welcome here. You can tell they take pride in their products. This place was also very clean and was like stepping into an Italian cafe right off the bustling NY streets.

I looked at some of the other reviews about their pizza and was baffled. No joke; this was the worst pizza I've ever had. And I've eaten a lot of pizza. I got the burrata pie. The crust was terrible, legitimately repulsive, the prosciutto (which I didn't order, but got and paid for) was gross, and overall, it was just terrible. I'm flabbergasted. I really don't understand how pizza can be this bad. I've had lots of $1 pizza and also have been to New Haven several times, so I've tried a diverse world of pizza. It just can't be this bad. Use some salt. Add some flavor. Anything would be better than this crap. The service was good, it came out quickly and the place was solid but the flavor was inexcusable. This may be the first time I've ever thrown out multiple slices and couldn't eat the majority of the crust. Never coming back and I don't recommend you go either.

Wow.

Legitimately felt like the cafes we went to in Italy.
The pizza + sandwiches were exceptional.

Will come back to try more!

IThe place is very appealing and the presentation of the various foods is
lovely.  I've eaten there twice in one week.  The salad with Tomato, Mozzarella and prosciutto was excellent as is the service.

However, the taste of the rigatoni bolgonese was so different from any I had encountered before.  There was an unpleasent "tangy" taste to the sauce that I didn't like.  Usually, a bolognese has a deep flavor and has been cooked for several hours to create a "creamy" sauce.  This sauce tasted like it was cooked quickly and the deep flavor did not have a change to develop.  Maybe the tomatoes used were not quite ripe,.  I did not like the flavor of the dish at all...rather unpleasant.  So disappointed because the menu and presentation are very appealing,  I will try again.

Just finished eating a chocolate croissant from this place and all I can say it's the best I ever had , it was so good!!
Can't believe I am saying this as I have eaten croissants all over the world and this was perfect.

While we were strolling around Times Square, we noticed this really cute Italian restaurant/cafe. We decided to stop in for some dessert and refreshments. We had the traditional Tiramisu and got one of the Smeraldina  waters. The Tiramisu was perfectly sweet and very creamy, and it wasn't too heavy or light. The staff was also very nice and welcoming. The interior decor is very cute and makes you feel as if you are in a small town in Italy. If you have never had water from Italy before, or if you have only ever had San Pellegrino, you should definitely try Smeraldina water as it has a really crisp taste that is hard to find here!

I had a wonderful experience at this Italian restaurant. The food was delicious and authentic, especially the fresh pasta that was made in-house. The staff was friendly and attentive, and they made me feel welcome and comfortable. I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves real Italian cuisine and wants to enjoy a cozy and relaxing meal.
This is undeniably one of the best pizzas I've had in a long time. It was not just good; it was absolutely delicious, leaving me craving for more.

Walked by and they had all their pizzas displayed in the window and we simply couldn't pass. Just grabbed a slice with pepperoni and it was incredible. All fresh, homemade ingredients. Zippy red sauce and light, flaky crust! So good!

We've been to the Miami Beach location, loved it and were so happy to find it in NYC. I love their truffle pasta, my favorite on my menu. And their desserts are super good. The sandwiches they make are delicious because the bread is made the Italian way. I love this place, and the people were so incredibly nice and welcoming. Next time we're in NYC, we will come visit. Thank you

The spaghetti genovese is saltier than the ocean. Had to pace it with the small expensive drink just to make sure I had something to wash it down with. Think they should have a water dispenser. I couldn't finish it and had to give up. These are restaurant prices for counter served dishes.
They treat their customers based on how they feel. They are rude and made me feel uncomfortable when I was waiting for my order.

What a treat in the heart of midtown.  I was in a rush and grabbed a slice of pizza and it delicious!  I got the mushroom pizza with truffle oil (which they drizzle on with each oil).  The employees were nice and able to articulate the dishes.  The space is nice and clean too.  I definitely want to come back and try other items on the menu.

so disappointed, i got a margherita pizza with prosciutto and it was so not traditional. the crust is pretty thin compared to a real Neapolitan pizza and they use cheap cheese. but you can pay more for better cheese... on top on the already high prices. then they use dried basil even though they also put fresh basil, why?? also they use shaved parmesan which isnt authentic either, just grate it. definitely not impressed but its not awful so i give it two stars
So glad there's a cafe in the garment district I can have a macchiato while shopping for supplies!!! It's hard to find fresh made macchiato in NYC! The owner is super friendly and welcoming!!!
I don't think the pictures do justice. Quality of pasta and the taste is amazing! Definitely will come back, here visiting.
The people are super nice. The pizza is AMAZING!! Looks like they have great pasta and pastries as well! Highly recommended!!!
The pizza and light and delicious.  The homemade pasta is excellent.  Great and attentive staff.

We didn't even get to taste the food because the manager started yelling at our 16 year old son who needed to use the restroom telling him to get out as we were ordering.  We are a black family and he immediately assumed our son was doing something wrong.  We are tourist coming to spend our hard earned money and will not put up with being treated like crap.  Don't support a business that profiles their customers and won't even let a child/customer use the restroom.
Absolutely fantastic pizza. Wonderful atmosphere and very friendly. Italian-style pizza that definitely hit the spot.

Si vous voulez manger autre chose que des Burgers susur New York, c'est ici qu'il faut venir. Les plats sont maisons, avec de tres bons ingrédients, les salades appétissantes et le tiramisu à tomber par terre. Tres bien situé,  pres de Times Square

We had the best late night pizza here after our broadway show. The flavor was great and their crust is my new favorite. The service was exceptional, the staff was helpful and even remembered us from coming in to grab a water and use the restroom the day before. I would definitely recommend!

Fun place to grab food with friends! Expansive menu with lots of interesting options to choose from.
We didn't have reservations, just walked in and were seated within 10 min around 6pm.

The noise level can get a bit loud so probably not the best place to have conversation.

Another delicious meal at Mew.  This restaurant has been consistent in serving fresh salmon sashimi.  The lunch special came with a small seaweed salad and miso soup.  The salad and soup were tasty, and added nice touches to our meal.  The dynamite roll is amazing.

The decor was nice.  Prices were very reasonable.  The waitress always seemed busy.  Service was a bit slow.  The bathroom definitely could use some upgrades.  

We would surely return to Mew!

I met up with a friend here for dinner and was excited since I've been wanting to visit. Thankfully we got there early, we got a table quickly. Generally it is recommended that you make a reservation.

The staff were helpful and came to take order and serve our drinks. There were many good choices to choose from the menu that even before we ordered I decided that I'm going to have to come back and try things we didn't order.

The place got busy quickly and was packed with people. The noise level got louder as the night goes. So it definitely would not be a good idea if you are looking for quality conversation and long stay.

Food ordered were  scallop carpacio, fried chicken with egg salad, omu soba and salmon salad. Overall everything was very tasty and well prepared. The service was helpful and food came quickly.

We were so full that we didn't order dessert. I'm definitely coming back to try other dishes.

I've been here about 5 times already.  This place feels like a NY spot as you have to go down to the restaurant.  My only complaint is that the food can be hit or miss. If you have people from out of town or something take them.  Ambiance and service is good.  

The hamburger steak was good and the chicken karaage. I'll update again if I ever come back.

For some reason, I never came for lunch. It is sooo worth it! A lot of options under $15.

They have an extensive lunch special menu with cooked foods and sushi. I got chicken nanban and it was delicious! Their miso soup is also good!

Good food at reasonable prices.  We went for
lunch and had the Nigiri lunch, Omu Soba and a Mew Special Roll and an Empire Roll.  All good especially the Omu Soba which was impressive.

Located literally in a basement but they make good use of the space

I've been to Izakaya Mew multiple times throughout the years. But the most recent visit was my first time there post COVID. The restaurant always gets so crowded, so quickly. So it's best to try to get there right at opening if possible.

For my latest meal, I put my name down for a group of five around 7 PM on a Sunday night. They estimated around a 35-45 min wait but thankfully we only ended up waiting around 30 minutes. After we received a text that said our table was ready they still ended up having us wait inside for a little over 5 minutes as they prepared the table for us.

Everything in the restaurant is quite chaotic since they are trying to get as many people in and out as possible. They get your food orders down and out to you so quickly which is a pro but it is hard to flag anyone down if you need service throughout the meal unfortunately.

The dishes I tried during the meal were:

MEW SPECIAL ROLL: Great flavor! Good amount of salmon in the roll.

TUNA TARTARE DOME: Yummy and creamy; however, flavor was a bit light. Additionally, in the menu picture they had drizzled the sauce over the item but for the dome we received, they did not. More sauce over the top would have helped to make the flavor a bit better.

AGE TOFU: Great taste. And each piece of tofu is pretty big.

CHICKEN NANBAN: Great fried chicken and the egg salad on top was perfect. Very comforting dish.

KANI CREAM CROQUETTES: Nice flavor but quite heavy

GYU DON: The beef was super fatty and had great flavor that really paired well with the rice.

All in all, though service itself may be considered both a hit or miss; food wise most everything was great and allows for an enjoyable quick meal.

Great food, fast service with moderate ambiance. Izakaya Mew is located in the basement and it's incredibly noisy in here. The music is on volume LOUD and everyone is screaming to have a conversation.

Otherwise, food is great :)
Be prepared to wait 40+ minutes if you have no reservations. Get the kimchi cream udon and the omu soba. You will bet regret it.

A wonderful stop for delicious and relatively affordable Japanese food, Izakaya MEW, offers medium sized plates that are worth a try. The restaurant is hidden beneath ground floor, almost like a speakeasy vibe, and the raw fish tastes fresh. Playing is very pretty. The tuna tartare roll was my favorite. It was rich and flavorful. The chicken was pretty good although a little fatty so it can be hard to eat many pieces. And the salmon don was very good except the rice to salmon ratio was a bit off -- I wish there was more salmon!

Overall, would recommend

This place doesn't need more praise! Love the ambiance, service and my food was delicious!! I got the special kaizen donburi and it really didnt disappoint for the price! It included crab, yellowtail tuna salmon scallop and even uni! This was a super filling meal and everything was fresh paired with the rice. For the price, it was great plus it came with miso soup and side dishes.

I know this place gets packed so make sure to make a reservation! I am excited to come back again!

FOOD - v yummy the first time, but not the second?

hotate carpaccio - flavor was yummy, scallops were decent quality but not as good as u would get at an actual sushi restaurant. a little on the pricier side

amakara sweet and sour ribs - these were fire, loved the flavor and the ribs was so tender fall off the bone. only complaint is that the bone is like cut so bits of it get into the meat which was not that great

kimchi cream udon - so yummy, the flavors mixed well and it wasn't too heavy or salty or spicy or sour. would totally get again

sushi - I also got one of the rolls but forgot which, but honestly if ur looking to get sushi I wouldn't suggest this place. the sushi was just a bit better than quality grocery store sushi ¯⁠\⁠_⁠(⁠ツ⁠)⁠_⁠/⁠¯

PRICE - relatively cheap overall but some dishes are expensive and some are cheap LOL...

SERVICE - waiters are nice and attentive and food comes out p fast

AMBIANCE - dark and bar like

This Japanese restaurant is a bit tricky to find, but it's worth the effort. Once you descend the stairs, you're greeted by a dimly lit space with traditional Japanese decor. It's the perfect spot for a casual meal with friends.

I ordered the takoyaki, and it was some of the best I've ever had. The balls were perfectly crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside, and the octopus was tender and flavorful.

The service was also excellent. Our waiter was attentive and friendly, and our food came out quickly.

Almost walked past the entrance as it's a door between two businesses. Walked down a dim staircase to the reception area with a bar. Came without reservations and was told 45 minutes, so I ordered a Sapporo on tap which was excellent. Bar staff were super friendly. After 20 minutes our shared table was ready. Music was lovely and staff were loud and happy, great vibes as the music changed to sing somebody happy birthday.  Excellent time and the food was all top notch. Excellent experience.

Izakaya MEW is a cute, small restaurant with great vibes! It's underground and dimly lit and has a great ambiance. The service was friendly as well. I think the food is a great value as well. I had the nigiri combination, and it was $28 for a roll, 8 pieces of nigiri, miso soup, and pickled veggies.

The combination set as a whole didn't blow me away, but there were some pieces that were great. The yellowtail and scallop were standout pieces for me. The kimchi udon was delicious! Next time I go, I will try something that isn't in the sushi/sashimi realm, but I definitely wasn't disappointed by my first experience.

Their food is still great. It's very surprising that the prices are still the same.
There was this server. Short asian guy. He has a grumpy face, never smiled. Me and my friends we met after a long time, so we were catching up. It's been an hour and we were still working on our food, but this guy kept asking if we are done. He wanted us to leave. He looked very mad. I know we sat there for an hour but we still have food and there were no people waiting outside.
Everything was amazing as always except that server. He ruined our night.

** Reviewing for lunch **
Next time I'll definitely check out the Izakaya menu and drinks!

Came here with friends on a Sunday around noon, and there was no wait! My friends and I opted for a breakfast/lunch type of deal because we weren't super hungry. The lunch sets were the perfect option.
I tried the Saba Shioyaki, Grilled mackerel with salt, and my friend had the
Chicken Nanban, Deep-fried chicken with egg salad. I would opt for the Chicken nanban because it comes with the different proteins and some cabbage. All in all, I really liked these. Comes with soup, pickled cucumbers, seaweed, rice, and the entree.

Quite filling and good quality! The service was good as well.

It's been a few years since I've been back to this area in NYC and I'm glad to see the spot is still here going strong. I came for lunch this time and was pleased to see that seating wasn't an issue. Nice and cozy place to get izakaya vibes. All the sushi we got tasted delicious. No complaints for a good lunch!

Super cute underground Japanese restaurant with lots of options including rolls, sashimi dons, udon, ramen, rice dishes, and Asian-inspired cocktails! I would definitely come back to try more things on their menu! They're reasonably priced especially in such a busy & popular area.

My friend and I ordered the Kimchi Cream Udon (5/5 & $15 - this was super unique and definitely worth) and their Chicken Nanban Teishoku (5/5 & $14 - my friend gets this every time he comes)！

Usually, this place is so busy but I came in for Monday lunch right when they opened at 12pm and got seated immediately! The staff were very friendly and food came out pretty quick.

I was unsuccessful in making a reservation during lunchtime for izakaya mew the day before I intended on going, but we were still successful in getting a table. There were a good amount of empty tables for walk-in throughout the duration of our visit, but they actually have separate tables against the wall set aside for reservations. We were a group of three, but they chose to seat us at a two person table with a slightly uncomfortable chair placed on the side against another table. When asking to be seated at a larger table, we were told that they were only for reservations. However, many of the reservation tables stayed empty. The staff was kind in allowing my friends to sit at the table to wait for me even though I was late.

In terms of food, we ordered the omu soba, kimchi cream udon, and the nikomi hamburg tei. The food came out relatively quickly and all of them came with miso soup and what I believe was cabbage on the side. The kimchi cream udon was very enjoyable with just the right amount of kick, but not too spicy. I was also very glad that the shrimp came without its shell. The omu soba was also delicious, but slightly difficult to eat given the lack of fork and knife to tackle the omelette wrapping the noodles.

Overall, I would return to try other items on the menu!

Quick service upon being seated. Food was delicious. Came with a big group of like 15 ppl for a birthday and many of us got the Kimchi Cream Udon. We all loved it. The udon was delicious. So was the miso soup and the other side.

For the food specifically, I would give this place 5 stars. Unfortunately, that's not how reviews work. This place has an issue with customer service. They have a large amount of people waiting in the cramped entryway, but they also shoo people or tell them to get out of the way. To where?! This could be easily remedied by partial seating, instead of making everyone wait in purgatory and causing chaotic foot traffic. The hostess seemed very new and in over her head. The guy helping her was very curt and rude. The reservation was for a party of two, and he looked at my friend and I and asked if the party was complete. I said yes, and he didn't even look at me. The waiter had an attitude and seemed very rushed. I understand this is a popular place and rightfully so, the food is great, but some customer service would go a long way. The food itself was great; if you enjoy family style food and sharing apps/rolls etc, definitely check it out. I would recommend making a reservation and trying to have everyone in your group come 10-15 minutes early. They have a great cocktail list and even accommodated mocktails, to my pleasant surprise.

We walked in without reservations and they were nice to accommodate us, but giving us a time limit of 1.5 hours which was plenty of time for our party of 4. We ordered a lot of small platters - from karaage, squid, shrimp skewers, Hotate Carpaccio (came with only 5, not 10 like the picture), kalbi, yuzu French fries, Amakara Sweet & Sour Ribs, kikusui sake. Overall, food was decent... we weren't really a huge fan of the ribs, portion was huge maybe for a bigger appetite. Kalbi was delicious. That was our favorite. Kikusui was their sweetest option, we actually ended up with 2 bottles. The hot yuzu fries with the cheese pull was pretty tasty as well.

Reservation for 2. So first impressions looks like an eclectic style dive bar. Definitely owner or someone is a fan of Murakami in there, prints/posters all over. Almost no waiting period but grabbed a drink at the standing bar. Bar was quite small but the "Take me home was tasty, rum, prosecco and peach syrup were quite noticeable. "Fig out" was light and sweet with lemon and maple notes, fig piece was a nice touch for a quick bite.

Appetizers seem to be where this is at, we started off with the salmon tataki, quick to arrive and the finely cut pieces and the cream sauce with wasabi stimulated my appetite. Following shortly was the yellowtail carpaccio paired well with the apple ponzu, now the amakara sweet sour ribs the sauce was impeccable. I would have drowned most of my food with that with a light touch on more sensitive items. However, however, the ribs themselves did not do the dish justice. The sauce was amazing and the ribs started off tender but led to disappointment, while not all the pieces were overcooked dry, seemed like too many would get that unlucky stick.

For the main it was a shared Nigiri set, Kimchi udon and black dragon roll. While the sushi was good I did not enjoy the salmon sushi pieces that much when salmon is usually my favorite, other cuts on my other sushi pieces did not seem finely cut, rather quickly put together. Kimchi udon was deliciously creamy, shrimp and vegetables cooked to the right temperature, while a few pieces did have some sear. Black dragon roll was a good mix of avocado, shrimp and eel. I would definitely recommend over the normal sushi rolls.

Sadly no dessert but do recommend that this spot is worth a try, ambiance is nice, moderately spaced out so your not having dinner with strangers. Service was attentive and food service was fast, I would suggest sticking to the drinks and small bites. Also I did what I could with the yellow tinted lighting and why oh why does this camera exist on the Samsung A54 but here ya go. Will do better for you next time.

Wow! This place was popping, it was so loud and packed. The pace is extremely fast. You order fast, food and drinks come out super fast. Each dish was very tasty and good! The prices are a bit high for the portion size but the udon was really big! Highly reccomend the udon and the mushroom tempura!

This spot is a great lunch or dinner restaurant with very affordable dishes and a beautiful interior! I got the Yaki Udon which was the perfect amount of noodles and under $18, which is hard to find in NYC now with prices going up everywhere. My sister ordered the Garlic Fried Rice which was less than $15 and had lots of flavor. We also shared the Tsukune which was grilled nicely. The service here was also good! We will come back for sure.

The food is premium quality at a reasonable price. It's a diverse menu from okonomiyaki (excuse my spelling) to delicious sushi items like their iburi salmon and tuna and delicious special rolls. Also their kimchi shrimp udon is divine. The cocktails are delish, especially the kiwiyachi. Also plenty of sake options. Not many dessert items that I'd recommend but I always get too stuffed to even think about it. The service is some of the best in the city. The staff are all super polite and also very fast and efficient. I love the warm greeting you get when walking in. I also love the ambience. Good music at a low volume with soft lighting and brick facades. 11/10 absolutely must eat experience

This would definitely be one of my favorite to go options for dinner after work in the city. I've been back 3 times and never disappointed.

You don't make reservations but I'd advise getting there early to put down your name and number. They will text you when your table is ready. They're constantly busy but it's worth the wait in my opinion.

10/10 for food and service no doubt about that. Food is really delicious and will fill you up fast. It's worth the price as well.
They did forget one order but it's most likely because it was so busy and they were very quick to get it fixed for me.

Love the underground vibes with the brick and cute lights in this place! Such a fun spot to bring a big group of friends. Came here for lunch and there was no wait. All the dishes were great. My favorites were the Karaage chicken, tan tan ramen, sashimi over rice, kimchi creamy udon. All were super filling and came with nice sides. Service was quick and friendly. Would def come back!

Bumping spot, quick service, good food (and a decent portion) for the price! Large variety of Japanese dishes you can get many different things here. We've had the creamy udon (so good!) - a must try. Every dish was done very well. It is always a hit with our out of town friends. Highly recommend if you can get a resy, otherwise put your name down and just explore ktown!

Head down the stairs here on 35th Street and *poof* you're now in a cozy hangout dining spot that serves Japanese grub and drinks.

I tried a few menu items and I'll rattle their individual reviews off here:

Omu soba: very flavorful yakisoba and there's no skimping on the pork! My favorite thing that I tried here.

Kurobuta sausage: not the snappiest kurobuta sausage that I've tried but still pretty decent in flavor.

Geso kara: crispy chunky squid legs. Good portion of geso kara compared to that at most other Japanese restaurants.

Hamachi kamayaki: my first time trying fish collar. It was alright. Fairly tender fish meat.

Fatty tuna roll: hmm I think I simply prefer whole fatty tuna as I wasn't digging the overly minced version in the roll (a bit mushy for my liking).

Yuzu-kiki: drink had a nice citrusy punch to it but was a bit light on the liquor.

Fall in toki: drink is whiskey-based but taste was very reminiscent of straight Henny lol.

---------------
Loved the social vibes here but the place did get pretty echoey loud. It was difficult hearing folks who were sitting right next to me.

Overall pretty decent spot if you happen to be in the area craving for some Japanese food/drink fare.

there were soo many options to choose from, and everything looked good. my favs were the kimchi udon and sashimi don. they tasted so good, and they were not overbearing. the katsu don and okonomiyaki is pretty generic and wasnt anything special in my opinion, but it was still good! i would definitely go back to get the kimchi udon again and try new things

I absolutely loved Mew! I loved the simple yet rustic aesthetic of the place. When talking about a hole in the wall this is it, literally have to take the stairs down to get in. The service was 10/10, got seated instantly upon arrival with our reservation, once seated our orders were placed pretty quickly also.

Food wise, everything I ordered and tasted was delicious! For drinks, I ordered the purple mellow which was refreshing, sweet, and such a pretty drink! I ordered the Mew wings, which were a nice savory dry rub (in my opinion). I also got the kurobuta sausage, which I really enjoyed, not your typical sausage, it has a nice flavor to. I also enjoyed the buta potato maki, never really imagined mashed potato inside pork belly, but it was interesting. Not pictured are the takoyaki Kara age; I'm glad I tried it but I probably wouldn't do it again, it didn't taste but but it was just not my preference.

The best part of the night was the cheesecake, it was delicious!! We shared it with a large party and all got a nice little amount to end the night of our endless tapas. If you're here, get the cheesecake! Overall, loved this place and will definitely return when I'm back in NYC!

The food is great, and the lady who serves us table sucks.

I was told by her not to bring anything outside to drink within the restaurant, even though I told her that's my own hot water in my own water bottle. I'm not going to drink any ice water due to stomach problem. She agreed to serve me hot water first, but didn't serve me any until I talked to her again.

Here's the thing: as I asked again, she soon changed her previous statement, saying I'm allowed to drink my own water. Her exact word is "I accept it". I was offended by her condescending arrogant attitude, increased my voice a bit and insisted I wanna have hot water from the restaurant. She finally gave me that.

Although I was mildly offended by her, I still give the almost 20 ％ tip since the food is nice and relatively cost-effective. Other waiters seem to be pretty nice. To whom who happens to read this review, Pls assert urself when encountering such disrespectful waitress, and say no directly.

I've heard so many great things about this place. I popped in here solo on a Thursday night with no reservation around 7pm. I was able to snag a table without having to wait.

The ambiance was super cool. It was underground, had dim lighting and a warehouse feel. I really enjoyed the ambiance but sad I experienced it alone!

I got the shrimp skewers, yellowtail carpaccio and the sexy roll. All were extremely flavorful! The yellowtail was fresh and complicated well with the ponzu sauce. The sexy roll had so many different flavors along and loved the soy paper. The shrimp skewers had amazing depth with the fried onion. All the dishes were amazing.

I also got basque cheesecake and tiramisu to go. Both were creamy and contained a perfect amount of sweetness.

Overall, I lucked out with getting a last minute seat. Definitely bringing my girl back here next time :)

We decided to stop by here after looking at the lunch special menu. We knew coming in that we wanted the sushi lunch special to share, and it was super good. The set up is cute inside, and the service was good too. The table next to us got this beer with what looked almost like frosting or ice cream on top that I wanted to try, but didn't get to. I'd like to try it next time!

I saw this place on tiktok and was super excited to try it out. We went during Saturday at around 6:30pm and there was no wait but it was only for two people.

The tiktok I saw recommended we try the croquettes, the kimchi cream udon, and the frozen Kirin. The croquettes did not disappoint! I would say the croquettes were my personal favorite dish. The udon noodles were super chewy but wasn't a huge fan of the actual sauce. The frozen part of the frozen Kirin was just the foam so that was a bit underwhelming and would probably just get another drink instead.

The sashimi plate wasn't bad for the price. I don't think I would get the salmon carpaccio or the okonomiyaki again.

Overall, I think this place executes the izakaya vibe well and would definitely come back with friends but would probably get different dishes.

A group of friends and I decided on Izakaya Mew for lunch. Since we had a party of 7, we made reservations. I ordered the karaage ($9) to share with one friend and the omu soba ($15).

The juicy kaarage seemed well seasoned with a light, crunchy breading. The omu soba, essentially yakisoba in an omelet, tasted savory and came in a generous portion for extra value. The essential yakisoba garnishes, bonito flakes and sauce, adorned both the omelet and the yakisoba itself. Also, the miso soup had an extra dashi kick.

Overall, the lunch seemed solid.

Coming to NYC I always feel like it's a must to have any sort of Asian Infusions since it's So diversified and people come from all around the world to visit and stay. This place was amazing ! My family decided this was the spot they wanted to go to for their birthday celebration and of course we had to do our Yelp investigations. Once we saw the 4.5, we already said let's go, make the reservations!

Overall getting their was fairly simple and located close to the Empire State Building. To get into the restaurant , you need to go down the stairs and then it looks like it's own little world. The smells , atmosphere, and overall ambiance was great. And we got sat down with a party of 10 within 40 mins.

Now for the best part, we ordered a bunch of dishes to try and they all were amazing. We ordered wings, sausages , edamame, tasted a couple other menu items like fried chicken , gyoza , and Cheesecake.
My favorite was definitely the gyoza because it came out nice and hot and the texture was cooked to perfection.

Really loved this spot and I feel that I have to come back here when I'm in town again because this was definitely one of my top spots on my vacation.

I've visited several Izakayas, but few boast a better location than this one in K-Town, within 10 minutes of both Times Square and Central Park. Nestled downstairs in a dimly lit, brick-clad room with a bustling open kitchen in the back, it feels like a serene escape from the city traffic overhead. The servers are friendly, efficient, and greet you with a formal Japanese welcome--Irasshaimase--setting the tone for an authentic experience. This is my go-to spot for catching up with friends working in midtown or traveling from outer boroughs. The food consistently impresses, with slightly smaller but fitting portions for an Izakaya. Unfortunately, as always, I forgot to capture pictures of most dishes amidst the delightful experience.

Upd 3: still great. Consistently awesome sushi rolls at a reasonable price. The waitress was incredibly quick and helpful. Hard to get in after 7pm, but worth it. It can get pretty noisy inside, but overall a great experience!

I actually been here before for dinner and ordered sooo many things, and everything was sooo good. I had to come back with my friends for lunch. We ordered a bunch of different food, but I really enjoyed the kimchi cream udon and omu soba. Everything was hugeee portions, but I was able to finish it cuz it was just that good. The cocktails were also really sweet and refreshing. Service was fast and friendly.

Listennnnn! When I tell you this spot was Ah-MAZING, please believe me. It's a basement restaurant so it's easy to miss when walking down the street. There was a short wait but so glad we waited. Whatever you do, order the kimchi cream udon noodles. You will NOT be disappointed. We also ordered the yellow tail carpaccio and the avocado tofu salad- both wonderful. The only thing o didn't adore was the Black Dragon sushi roll... it was just meh. But I noticed that most people around us did NOT order sushi, so there you go.
It was very loud so be ready to yell in order to tell each other how good the food is.

Don't blink or you'll miss the entrance! Its a basement restaurant where the locals go! The place is tight, with loud music, and people talking so loud its hard to hear one another. The food here is absolutely delicious. We ordered a little bit of everything from kimchi, galbi, hamachi, tuna tartare, to uni pasta.

A great gem for sure!

Food were fine
Service were okay
The vibe of this restaurant is way too chaotic, too loud (like everyone keep raising their voice while talking just so they could hear each other). Other ppl may like it but not quite for me.

We ordered the following (apologies for my missing photos bc we weren't in a mood to take them all)
Okonomiyaki: The flour taste good. Sadly my dish got way too overcooked-- the bottom of the pancake was burned.
Yellowtail Carpaccio: underseasoned. fish was good tho
Katsudon : tasty, chicken was tender, rice and sauce was good.
Zuke Salmon Don -- we like this dish the most. Well marinated salmon.
Matcholic -- meh... I followed some reviews from yelp but I was disappointed. I think it taste weird.

Overall I think it was fine, but there's so many outstanding restaurants in ny. I'd rather spend time somewhere else.

This is such a cool little underground place! I came on a Tuesday night and the wait was probably around 20 mins for 2 people but we got a drink at the bar to pass time. Both drinks we got, the Matcholic and Yuzu-Kiki, were absolutely delicious with the perfect amount of alcohol. The other thing I like about this place is that it's definitely super affordable and the food is delicious. We got the omu soba, okonomyaki, and takoyaki which was plenty of food for 2 people. The table next to us got sushi that looked super fresh as well. Only downside was that it took a little long for us to get our check once we were done eating. If you know for sure you want to eat here I would recommend making a reservation, but it's definitely worth the wait if you're in the mood for some good Japanese food.

Great spot with a nice vibe and solid eats for cheap!

I ordered the set with grilled mackerel, which was only $14. It came with pickles, a sweet potato (or pumpkin?) side dish, miso soup, and rice. The mackerel was tender and seasoned well. I'm still not sure what exactly was in the pickles, but they were VERY pickled. I really enjoyed the sweet potato/pumpkin thing, it was sweet and soft without being overwhelming, and the seeds added a nice crunch.

I came here with a reservation with a couple of friends, and we were seated pretty quickly. The restaurant is a bit loud, dark, cramped, and a little hard to find, and the food overall was decent. The service was meh. I felt very rushed and the server taking our order was not super accommodating. I would say my rating for this place falls between at 3.5-4.

The food was alright, but nothing was too exceptional. We had the gyoza, kimchi udon noodles, takoyaki, yellowtail, and cheesecake. The only stand out fish was the kimchi udon noodles. Everything else was just okay, and the rest of the menu didn't look too interesting. I would not choose to come back here with all of the other great restaurant options in the area for a comparable price.

This place is always packed for a reason, and it's because of their delicious food and very affordable prices! The Taki Wasa is raw octopus with a wasabi marinade - it's worth trying, as long as you're comfortable with raw seafood texture (similar to raw scallops), and it pairs very well with the crispy seaweed! The Amakara Ribs were super tender and sweet! The Salmon Don became a go-to for me based on how good it was + you can't beat this price - anywhere else, this dish would've easily costed more.

Glad to be this businesses 2758th review! I came here with a bunch of coworkers and had a fun and delicious time. The entrance is easily missed if you're not looking for it and I actually love places like that.. give it a bit of a mysterious hidden vibe.

While this place is certainly quite busy, the food came out extremely fast, everything was delicious and priced fairly. I appreciate how energetic our food runner was. His enthusiastic personality really was a highlight for me and set the tone for a fun meal with friends.

I'm only giving four stars as the bathroom could have been tidier. I also would have loved to be given a few more menus for the table and offered some recommended items.

All in all, a cool spot and great for groups!

Let's see, I arrive and place a to go order for a breakfast quesadilla, omelette, and two coffees.    It takes a good 40 minutes to get the food out.   In the meantime, I'm sitting without any service for 10 minutes before I ask to have one of my coffees while I wait.

Bill comes out to be 40+ bucks, and I can't even figure out the price breakdown because the bill wasn't itemized. Did he apply my coupon? I have no idea.  Did he get my order right? Who knows.  

So when I ask to get it, he proceeds to tell me the items I ordered instead of just printing one out.  I have to insist just to get him to print it out.

It turns out they charge full service 18% on to-go orders.  Really? Ok, whatever. I'm new to NY so maybe that is the case here. But then he forgot to apply my 10% off coupon as well.  

Honestly, this place is completely disorganized for to-go orders. Need ketchup? They put some in some large soup bowl.  Salt and pepper? Same story. What the heck is wrong with this place.  I felt sorry for the guy who was fumbling around trying to assemble my demanding requests like Macgyver.  

If you stay at St. Giles the court, stay far away from this place if you want to pick something up.  Maybe the sit down breakfast is better.

They make a solid slice here.  Wasn't originally planning to go but the sight of the pepperoni reeled me in.  The pepperoni they use is that kind that is slightly smaller and crisps and bends up around the edges, allowing for more pepperoni surface area and maximum pepperoni satisfaction.

We used to order here a lot, but our last experience was terrible. We received our pizza in a crumpled box, and all the cheese was fused to the lid. None of it was on the pizza. They also only sent a small can of soda when I paid for a whole bottle, which I'd normally forgive, but it was just one more thing in this disaster. We called the restaurant about the condition of the pizza and they refused to send a new one, claiming it was the delivery guy's fault, not theirs (???) and they also refused to refund the cost. We threw away a $22 (plus delivery fees & tip) inedible pizza crust and will not be ordering again. Terrible customer service.

Ordered delivery 5/12/19 . delivery came quick when i opened the pizza box my dough was not cooked from the pre made frozen glueten free pizza and cheese and sauce was everywhere it shouldn't have been . I just wanted my money back from this event and was told i was but didnt recieve my money . I wish no buisness nothing but the best but this place has no hope

Hands down one of the worst pizza I ever had! The ingredients were super bland and the so called crust was bland bread... I bought 2 slices, ate one, but I think the other is going to visit the trash can... That bad!

I popped in here on a whim. Friendly staff but canned chicken wings. I've had some great wings from pizza places in the past but this is definitely not one of those places. It's the standard sauce & dip poured straight out of bottles while still being charged a dollar a wing. If you are looking for average or better wings, this is not your place.
The have good food especialy the garlic nuts i would give it 5 stars but my slice of pizza had a bit more grease han i would have liked

This is a really sad place. They charge for delivery and it comes with the pizza all over the place and cold. Took 1.5 hours to deliver a pizza.
I don't expect this place to be around too long.
Makes sense why they are open late night for the drinkers. If you are looking for some good food, don't waste your time; just go somewhere else.
Amazing pizza! Stopped in for a slice of their Green House, honestly one of the best slices I've had in the city. Service was friendly too.

Called them to ask what type of flour they use in their gluten free pizza.  Was told that no one in the restaurant has any idea what type of flour.  That may be one of the most ridiculous things I've ever heard.  And obviously means they don't make the pizza dough onsite.  If you actually care about your food, someone should know what you are selling to people.

Visitor review... lol I don't like red sauce but coming to New York I knew I wanted to try pizza .. my husband loveeesss pizza... we where leaving a ferry tour our hotel was located near Times Square.. some how We ended up at i pizza on 9th ave... the ambiance of the space is small and straight to the point.. but anyway as soon as I saw the pizza crust I told him to try the pizza... we sliddd over to the counter and ordered a pepperoni slice the worker placed it in the oven and I yelled make it extra crispy... when that slice came out the oven and my husband folded it and took it bite. First thing he said was babyyyyyyy this pizza is so good.. so of course I got a slice of pizza cheese for me because I don't eat pork .. andddddd itttt was bomb.

Pizza is middling, but the big problem is they're dishonest (more below).

If you're looking for quality you'd be better off across 9th at one of their new places or 4 blocks up at the dollar slice place - far better sauce and crust.

I happened to make an online order for pickup (the place further uptown was in the wrong direction and usually busy, for good reason). I arrived to pickup my pizza, even a few minutes late, and when asked the person at the desk said they had no order for that name.

They checked with coworkers and had nothing on record. They then checked their fax machine (which is a whole different level of nonsense) and discovered my order and told me they could make it but it would 15 minutes.

Obviously one does not make orders in advance to sit at a humid, sticky pizza place.  I told them to skip it and just cancel the order.  The response - "We can't."

"Why not?"
"We can't, but you can."
"There's no way to cancel an order that's already gone beyond pickup time - if there's any way at all.  I'm sure you can if you ran out of something."
"We can't."
"I don't believe that."
"Well ok I can but I have to call my manager."

I told the gentleman at the desk to call his manager and get it done.  On my way out I checked the confirmation email from Get Sauce (their e-commerce provider) and the reply address was a Support@ address, not a no-reply address, so I dropped them a line while still on the corner. The rep who answered said they'd look into it.

A full week later I got a reply from Get Sauce - they claim the restaurant "confirmed they prepared the order after having tablet issues and the order was not picked up. Food was made" which is absolutely not the case.

I can forgive missing an order - it's a busy Saturday night, etc. etc.  But lying about it to a service provider over a $30 pizza bill - that's absurd and bad business.

Hungry post Broadway show, we stumbled in here when we saw it across the bar our friends were at. Not the cheapest NY pizza but also not the worst tasting.

Inside had some seating and it was clean. The staff were friendly and welcoming. The pizza was about $3 a slice. We got margarita and pepperoni. They were huge and great for a dinner serving. I loved that it was fresh and ready. Thin crust and a good amount of cheese.

As a side note I was dying that their "pride decorating" consisted of them taping reusable ikea rainbow bags to the walls. Crushed it.
The pizza is just okay. I'm not too crazy about their sauce. They do put a ton of cheese on their slices,  however. It does the job for a quick bite in the city, but I wouldn't rave about this place.

Fresh faster food on Columbus as a regular on the way home to New Jersey. Friendly customer service and welcome greeting. The food variety of pizza, Jamaican beef Pattie', steak and chicken sandwiches. Burgers, fries and deserts. Overall the restaurant is clean and peaceful to eat in during you're free time. Thank you staff and to iPizza. Will see you soon again.

DO NOT eat here no matter what. I wouldn't even drop 1 star if I I was able to. Don't eat here if you're drunk or event hungry and starving. Anywhere would take care of you better.
I'm on spring break and they're telling us "crispy crunchy wings", but the fries are old and the chicken sand which doesn't even have chicken, the one thing I needs. Thank you for reading my review and good night.

I was really craving some penne alla vodka and stopped in to have some pasta. I was a little nervous but it was amazing. I added chicken to it and loved it. I will definitely be back to eat here. I also had the pizza and it was tasty. You can't go wrong with the pizza or pasta but they do have other options as well such as chicken tenders, wings, Philly cheese steaks and other sandwiches. Great little spot to eat!

Should have listened to the reviews. Stopped here randomly one night and it was a mistake. Service is fine but the pizza tastes like a frozen one you get at the grocery store. Only got one star because the place is fine and people are kind.

Doesn't do much for taste and will hurt your pockets.
Margherita pizza average at best.
I can grab a Great pepperoni Stromboli while doing laundry across the street. Pleasant staff. Clean restroom. Looking forward to trying the Buffalo wings.
The worst pizza I have ever had. It looked (and tasted) like someone ran over it with their car. I would rather lick the streets of new york than ever eat here again.
I had the buffalo chicken pizza. Sauce was above average but the chicken was pretty dry. The Parmesan chicken sandwich was pretty good!

If I could take another star away I would. We ordered pizza and the entire thing was destroyed upon delivery. We called the restaurant to let them know what had happened and the person on the line hung up the phone. The only thing he let us know was that the pizza was made first thing in the morning, and we ordered it at 8pm. A Tostitnos frozen pizza would have been 100x's better. If you're reading this, please avid this place at all costs.

Super average but not terrible pizza spot! It was raining and we were tired so we just stopped by here. The staff is friendly and the pizzas are totally edible which is my only bar for a restaurant like this haha. Skip the deep dish pizza.

We did have to sit through an entire rap performance from another diner though as he tried to impress a table of women so there's that.

The pizza was one of the best I've had! The slices are huge. I didn't realize that they were so big and accidentally ordered too much! The place is a very small building with not a lot of seating. There was a line out the door and we waited awhile, but it was worth it!
The pizza is terrible. Truly just awful. And it's expensive. Won't bother ever again.

This is the worst pizzeria in the city, if you even want to call it a pizzeria, its more like a pizzashit. The sauce is garbage tastes disgusting. The pizza was stale and served cold the cheese was hard on margherita slice and crust was hard as a rock. Terrible service too, the employee is a miserable person, if you hate your job just quit. Terrible food, terrible service, garbage place, dont ever eat here!!!!

I love that place.
i don't like dining in , the place is not updated so I always order to go
the pizza is great they put a lot of cheese which I like

Pretty tasty pepperoni pizza slice.  Came in on a whim and was not disappointed.

They serve fried chicken too.  Looked nice and crunchy.  I will have to come back and get that next time.
Very expensive pizza 2 slices came out to 12$  was it good ... wasn't terrible but wasn't what I grew up eating in nyc... def not what nyc is known for

Humongous pizza. Chicken pieces were huge. All the food was good and the staff was very friendly
Good food
Thin crust, great variety. It's exactly what you expect NY pizza to be - fresh, assorted variety, simply delicious. Friendly service too.
Not very good, borderline gross but I'm trying to be nice given we're in a pandemic. Definitely not coming back.

Yo this place is TRASHHHHHHH. Its for tired tourists too hungry to search for anything better. Yall can do better cmon.

This some playdough ass tasting pizza

It was 430am when I got into my uber wif this drunk guy from New Zealand.  He had a slice of pizza that looked really good and he offered me a bite so I took it.  It looked so good I really didn't have to think twice.  

Then he offered me a bite of himself and I totally thought about it for what seemed like the longest 5 minutes ever.  Decided not to tho.  He let the slice fall to the floor and my heart stopped for a moment.  Jerk!

Not sure why this is at 3 but I'm giving it a solid 5.  We stumbled upon this place when the restaurant down a few doors down had a 30 min wait.  It was 2pm and I had my 5 and 7 year old with me so we needed to keep moving.  So glad we found this place! It was empty and definitely ranks towards the top of my favorite pizza list.  We are just visiting NY but already thinking of coming back tomorrow.  Go here for a quick NY pizza fix.

So today is the 4th of July, and what better way to celebrate than to eat what has become America's favorite food pizza? Sure its originally Italian, but it was here where the classic triangle slice of pizza was perfected!!

So I was walking around Hell's Kitchen when I came across this place. Its pretty unassuming and at first you might just dismiss it as another regular mom & pop pizza place. But this is where you'd be missing out! I Pizza NY uses all fresh ingredients, from the tomatoes to the cheese. They offer a wide selection of pies from all vegetarian to all meat, and they even offer the Margherita pie.

I decided to go for the classic NY slice, but with my own personal twist. I ordered a regular slice and then also added both extra tomato sauce AND extra cheese. A regular slice never has enough sauce and certainly not enough cheese for my liking, hence why I always make my special order this way. You guys should try it you will LOVE IT!
Just did a review for another pizza place but this was way better for gluten free! Definitely go here if you're near by.

I've been to this place several times. I was heading to the deli next door and saw the lunch special sign so came on for lunch today.

I got the chicken, fries and soda got under $6 can't beat that.

The space is small however I've never seen it crowded and unable to find a seat, the pizza is not bad but a bit pricy. The Philly cheese steak is claimed to be the best in NY, it's not. It's OK. Nothing too special

Don't bother. I came in specifically wanting the pesto chicken Stromboli and ended up with a chicken and cheese.  When I told the guy, he said it was my fault and didn't even bother to try accommodating it. What ever happened to good customer service? From what I understood, it had to be made as a special order so I believe it was pure laziness

Wasn't great, was just ok.

Wouldn't go back.  So much better to pick from in the city for a slice.

I Pizza NY defies the traditional rating structure, but 3.5 stars seems reasonable. I tend not to like combination places - pizza and burgers, pizza and bagels - so the pizza and cheesesteak emphasis didn't grab me. Stranger still, this appears to be a franchise of Krispy Krunchy Chicken, which claims to provide a Cajun-themed product.

Sure enough, I Pizza NY sells jambalaya. It doesn't look like the picture. It was probably the weakest link the strange sampler I assembled. As for the chicken, the wing seemed liked it would have better many hours earlier but the breast was stunningly good, something that would pass a blind taste test against many of NYC's more upscale fowl purveyors.

The pizza was better than it looked. The cheese created a pale, bland surface but the inside was redeemed by tangy tomato sauce.

I will kindly preface this missive with a firm stance that, yes, I will be returning to this location. I just need to pull the coattails of the two OG's that work there. They laid out a square-sized, Sicilian-style, thin slice pepperoni pie the other day and it WASN'T HAPPENING. I bit into it expecting a nice payoff from what looked liked a nice crust on those floppy pepperoni slices just dotting the top. Boy, was I wrong. What was that taste? A little pungent?? Observe the photo. The damn dough is not cooked! You have a slice of pizza not cooked thoroughly. Under normal circumstances this shop is holding it down with good fare but, WHOA, NELLY. It's not like heads need to roll over a simple oversight but these guys need to know that one was a stinker. Let's not rest on our laurels gentlemen and know that your taste has a standard.

I'll add that I had some other items that day without incident and if they have zeppoles, get them. They're sold out often, thus proving my point.

I don't know why the stars for this place is so low.. its good lol i have only ordered from here so i don't know whats its like in the store

my internship program orders from this place A LOT - pasta, sandwiches, pizza, and fried chicken (with rice and beans, mac and cheese, biscuit)

The pasta is good (penne vodka) lots of cheese and sauce
sandwiches (america, italian and veg) are pretty awesome too. I personally think the bread is a little too hard, but my friends said they were fine.
Pizza is amazing here!!! must have!
just had the friend chicken yesterday and it was superb!! we ordered rice and beans, mac and cheese and biscuit with it. everything was so good. the biscuits had a little honey on top, better than i imagined actually. everyone was raving about the ac and cheese. rice and beans were great, but not as popular as the mac and cheese and fried chicken

After visiting their other location I had to have this food again after being around the area.  Their food is delicious.  I had the chicken tenders and some pasta and it was great.  Very friendly and clean location.  A must visit.

TOURIST TRAP

Severely overpriced for the disgusting food they serve. Not sure why I let a friend drag me here. He has very low standards and even he was thoroughly unimpressed. The service is also "reluctant at best".

WORST PLACE I'VE EVER ORDERED FROM! Food arrived an hour late, cold, soggy and inedible by a hostile delivery person.

Customer service - TERRIBLE, communication - NOT THEIR STRONGSUIT, delivery guy - made an already awful situation THE WORST!
Sub par nyc guy scammed me at register.dollar pizza is much  better then this place. Not coming back food was horrible honestly
Very nice small restaurant in the corner not very far from time square. There's a open restroom that you use as well.

I was looking for a local vendor that would deliver to our office for our southern food themed party. I spoke with Mike who was nothing but accommodating from our first call. He ensured we stayed within our budget and that our order was delivered on time and piping hot. We ordered mixed fried chicken, mac and cheese and biscuits for 60 people and everyone enjoyed tremendously. The chicken was crisp, not too oily, with a delicious Cajun spice. I highly recommend you consider them when you are looking for catering options.

We were headed to the Intrepid Air and Space Museum and looking for a quick lunch when we stumbled on iPizza NY on 9th Avenue.  This is a "pizza by the slice" kind of place (although they do sell whole pizzas as well) and my wife an I each ordered a slice of their cheeseburger pizza.  The cheeseburger pizza was very good and 3 slices between us was plenty - nice size slices of pizza.  The place doesn't have a lot of atmosphere but seems typical of a lot of small Manhattan eateries.  The food was good, the service was good and the price was very reasonable.

While we only had pizza, their menu includes a full line of pasta, sandwiches, salads, stromboli and calzones as well as entrees like chicken and veal parmigiana.

I came in for a pepperoni slice, but they offer pepperoni with breaded chicken on display which looked great, so I gave it a try. A few minutes and $4.50 later, I walked out of the establishment with my seemly tasty slice. I took my first bite and was immediately disappointed. How can one possibly make bland pizza? This is a cardinal sin. Pizza should never, ever be bland. I tried to stuff it down my face, I really did, but once I finished my 5th bite, I came to a realization that I deserved more! So I chucked it out. I. TOSSED. OUT. PIZZA. oh mama...

Bottom line: Bland pizza. Just another sad pizza wanna be franchise. Go across the street to two boots.

Got a delivery 5/12/19 . food came fast used grub hub . when i open the box od pizza the cheese is all over the place most likely from the delivery guy not keeping the box level . then I see the dough is raw. I call in and say I can make you another one . i said no and requested my money back . I was promised the next day i would but nothing . to run a place like this is a shame .
My favorite pizza in New York. Big sliced pizza and crispy fried chicken. Great service and great pizza!

This place took me COMPLETELY by surprise. I've passed by tons of times and have commented on their "KRISPY KRUNCHY CHICKEN" sign on multiple occasions (it really irks me that they chose to misspell "crispy" and "crunchy" when the proper spelling would allow alliteration, but I digress). After an evening of rock climbing my boyfriend and I were REALLY craving chicken. Popeye's was our first choice, but at 10 PM it was already closed. There were other chicken spots in our area (Le Bon Choix, Hell's Chicken, Red Hen) but we weren't really in the mood for those places. Especially since we'd already been to some of them and knew what to expect.

Our choice to come here was really a last resort, but I don't regret it at all. It was damn good in all honesty. My boyfriend got chicken tenders (and I never understand WHY considering he hates dry chicken and tenders are bland breast meat that have a habit of overcooking) and I got the four piece mixed basket with a biscuit. I think in total our two orders came out to less than $15? Not bad at all.

We received our orders quickly and I instantly knew that mine would be better than his. My chicken were steaming hot and beautifully crisp. And inside? Moist and luscious. It was literally falling off the bone! I almost couldn't contain myself, it was that tasty. His chicken tenders looked a bit sad, and wouldn't y'know it, they were dry, so I gave him my drum stick as well as others bits and bites of my order. The people seated behind us (who were definitely inebriated) were enjoying their chicken as well. So much so that I noticed they'd completely ignored their pizza.

If you're looking for quick and cheap chicken in this particular area I HIGHLY recommend this spot, but only if Popeye's is closed.
Any time we are in New York, we must have the best pepperoni pizza on the planet! We ordered a large and the young man up sized it to an XL for free. SEE YOU AGAIN SOON!

The chicken is great, but the service is abysmal.  I ordered 2 pieces of dark meat chicken from a dismissive counter guy (already overpriced at $6) and the guy tried to give me two tiny little drumsticks (and he "forgot" to give me my biscuit which I didn't discover until I got home).  Then I said I wanted french fries and even before I could answer his question of small or large a group of three other people walked in and he stopped what he was doing so that he could take their orders.  I stood their in confusion and waited, when I should have just walked out in retrospect.

The whole place is also really disorganized.  You place your order at one end of the counter, have to go to the other end to pay and return to original end to pick up your food, but by then the person is already helping someone else so you have to wait even longer for your food.
Ordered pizza after a long day. Paid $25. Pizza never came. Had to go to sleep hangry and they didn't answer the phone despite being open. Don't go here unless you want to be angry.
Good pizza overall. Slow service. They have tons of celebrity photos on their wall, so you can look at them while they take forever making your pizza!

Meh- I should have known better to go to a pizza and fried chicken place. But I was short in time. The pizza was ok. It just wasn't what I have come to expect from NYC pizza. The guys at the counter were friendly. Overall, stick to somewhere else- you can get a slice every 20 yards in the city.

Happened to be walking by on the way to The Met at Lincoln Center  and looked in at their pizzas

They all looked great

I got the pizza with mushrooms cause the mushrooms looked the best of any pizza I've seen so far

It did not disappoint   It was fantastic

Do not eat here. Ever. The pizza taste like butt juice and it costs a million dollars. Literally learn to make a pizza before eating here. Call a travel agent and book a trip to Italy before you eat here. The pizza is TRASH. The epitome of what NYC has become, overpriced pizza. Sad
Pretty good slice.  Wished there was more cheese and sauce though.  Easy to find corner location for those late nights out.
The best pizza! Classic yet innovative toppings. Space to sit and eat.  Was looking for a great tasting pizza and found it.

A plain slice is just shy of $4/slice when they factor in tax.  A quick option before or after theater nearby.  More seating space than other quick slice shops nearby.

Cheese Slice: I like how this slice had a little more sauce than a typical slice.  But other than that it's fairly standard with a crispy crust and lots of cheese.

Sooooo  i don't like red sauce but coming to NY I knew I wanted to try pizza .. my husband is a pizza fanatic .. we went to a big bus tour seeing our hotel was located near Times Square.. some how We ended up at i pizza on 9th ave right  before the tour ended... the ambiance of the place is small and straight to the point with a few chairs.  but anyway as soon as I saw the pizza crust I told him to try the pizza... we sliddd over to the counter and ordered a pepperoni slice the worker placed it in the oven and I yelled make it extra crispy... when that slice came out the oven and my husband folded it and took it bite. First thing he said was my loveeeee this pizza is so good.. so of course I got a slice of pizza cheese for me because I don't eat pork .. andddddd itttt was theeeeee boooooommmbbbbb

2am New York Pizza is a hidden gem located in the heart of New York City. The pizza here is absolutely incredible, with a perfectly crisp and flavorful crust that is topped with high-quality ingredients. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, and the staff is friendly and attentive. I have been coming to this pizzeria for years, and it never disappoints. The slices are huge, making it a great value for the price. If you're in the area and looking for a delicious slice of pizza, definitely give 2am New York Pizza a try. You won't be disappointed.

New location!! Had the pleasure in meeting the Owner. He was very friendly and welcoming.
I tried the Margherita pizza. Normally its not my favorite.  But If you order it here, it's not like any other Margherita pizza. The sauce was so fresh and cheese was gooey at the same time. It had a great mouth feel so it's not thin.
I love a crispy crust. You can hold it up it won't bend. I would definitely recommend this pizza.
From one happy customer!!

New iPizza location, this might be one that just moved a few blocks down.  I went in not expecting a ton, as these kinds of places are normally a little... not great.  I was pleasantly surprised.  This isn't gonna be my favorite slice in the neighborhood, but their basic cheese slice was fairly solid.  Not bad at all.

We were tired after walking all over the city all day and decided on a whim to go in here for pizza and stromboli.  We were pleasantly surprised!  Great prices and the food was delicious!!  The stromboli was especially good.  Not the cleanest (tables needed a good wipe down) but it was fine.  Friendly employees too.  Wish we could have gone back another day for more.  Next time!

My family needed an economical dinner, and iPizzaNY was a great choice! The pizza was good quality, good taste, and a good size. We also enjoyed sitting at one of their open air tables. Good experience and food!

After a late-night in NY we wanted to find pizza close to our hotel and within walking distance and we got so lucky finding this spot. I ordered the Supreme Pizza and Garlic knots. Everyone was so nice the pizza was really good, exactly what we needed. I should have ordered one more slice because the pepperoni pizza was really good and I was picking off of my friend's slice.

Got the vegan pizza on the regular pie crust, which they make themselves along with the sauce. It was absolutely delicious. Also got a vegan stromboli, which was great too. It's a little pricy and evenmore so when you add vegan meat toppings, but the guys are super-nice and service was fast.
Quick stop pizza place in midtown. They rushed the slice in the oven. But it filled the need for a slice. Good seating options.

Woo hoo! Here's to a new great pizza place! The margarita pizza is awesome - fresh mozzarella, thick sauce and there is a great bite to the dough. I also had the seasoned fries which were also very tasty! Don't let the lack of lines fool you - they recently opened up shop in this location. Must try if you're in the area!

This place is solid. Ordered the lamb shawarma with Turkish bread. Fantastic. And I'm saying this as a middle eastern (very particular about middle eastern food).

Place is quaint and very welcoming. Staff is great.

You gotta get the Turkish tea as well. They made it perfectly right.

Cheers

Decent authentic Turkish spot, but could be much better. First of all, when I ordered my Lamb Doner with pita bread ($12), it came in a tin foil wrap- I was dining in but they basically treated it as if it was take out... so not the best first impression of the food. The pita wrap was quite bland and so was the lamb and veggies (lettuce, onion, and tomato) inside- basically no seasoning or sauce (although there was some separate sauce in bottles at the table). The taste wasn't too bad, but I've definitely had better. The French fries ($8) were actually pretty good though, as they seasoned them well, although they didn't give any ketchup with it.

The place is quite small, as there are only around 5 tables inside. Luckily, there weren't many others in there when we went. Given most of the food is already pre-prepared / essentially ready to go, the service speed is pretty quick. The staff are average friendliness. The vibes are definitely on the casual side, as I wouldn't exactly call the interior environment nice- not that it was necessary dirty or anything, just could use a bit of sprucing up.

Overall, I think this place could be fine for delivery/take-out or if you are just looking to grab a quick Turkish bite. But if you are looking for a nicer sit-down restaurant, then you might be better off visiting one of the many other restaurants in the area.

This place is a small restaurant with maybe around four or five tables only. We came here with recommendation by someone who lives close by and it was good!
We tried chicken/ lamb Döners as well as falafel with hummus. I am guessing it is authentic and surely was delicious! With the meal they also served Turkish bread. Also very good.
Yelp checkin and we got a free dessert. We opted for kazandibi which was like a caramelized pudding.
Seating is rather limited. But they're trying their best.
I got the lamb gyro lunch special. It was very tasty and filling. The lamb was delicious, fresh and cut very thinly!

The lamb doner pita sandwich is delicious! Lots of meat with raw onions, lettuce and sliced tomatoes. So much meat, it's big enough for 2 small meals. Also had the Turkish chicken soup, which was just ok. Not salty but has an oily layer.

Chanced upon this halal Turkish establishment on my last evening in NYC and counted myself as lucky. Got a lamb doner sandwich on turkish bread, and it was delicious with enormous portions; you'll get some serious value for money here. Staff is friendly, reasonable amount of seating available, and prices are quite reasonable. Highly recommend.
The food is very healthy and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant. This Mediterranean style restaurant is consistently great

The food here is legit. Bland Utah dude right here that has never eaten shawarma, and it was amazing. If you are visiting, skip the overrated time square stuff and eat here. The people are super nice too.

We ordered 2 Lamb Doner. What we got was nothing like the picture on the menu. The lamb we got was essentially halal cart lamb. Unlike in the picture on the menu where the strips of lamb are long and thinly cut as described in the description, we got chunks of lamb (again, as you'd get from a cart.) Additionally, the salad we got was a different salad than shown in the menu. It had cabbage, and no cucumber or carrot.

The point is that the menu is misleading and I can't recommend the food. For the $23 price tag the quality was as low as a poor NYC halal cart.

Walking along the street, there's lots to see. The restaurant is in a cool location. We were seated right away but did not get our waters for a while. Nor was our water filled until we asked. We weren't asked for our orders after a long wait. The staff wasn't terrible they just weren't attentive. Plating looks great, tasted dry more than bland, and they were quite bland. I didn't expect so much veggies when I ordered the chicken.

Yummy
The food here was delicious. Loved the adana kabob which I normally don't get. I think there was red peppers in it. Definitely going to come again.

What a hidden gem! Literally blink and you would have missed it. Stopped by to get takeout before a movie night, and ordered the lamb doner sandwich. The price was really good for NYC (~$10) and service was extremely fast. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant was crowded but very homey.

Sandwich was packaged in foil, no spillage. The portion was also a steal for the price, this was the most stuffed sandwich I'd ever had. Meat was well seasoned, the garlic and chili sauces were a wonderful addition and very well paired with each other. Wished that maybe the chili sauce was a little more spicy. It was a huge sandwich, my friend was doubtful that I would be able to finish it - but it was so good that I INHALED it!

While I was there I was eyeing the baklava and the hummus, will definitely be back to try those dishes in the future!

This is a small kebab place and is a little bit crammed sitting area. Hey!!.. that's the beauty of it. It literally welcomes you to the Turkish delight lol. That being said, their food is amazing. It was fast, fresh, and well cooked meat. We ordered the Lamb Doner and Chicken Adana Kebab. It was juicy and tender. It was purr-fect for 5 people who wants to explore a different side of NYC restaurants.
I have had better authentic Turkish food from my hometown in Saudi Arabia and this place was almost close to that level. ;}
Overall, their service was great, the staff, she was very friendly and engaging with my family which made them feel at home. Hey!!, that's all we want. When we go to a restaurant, we should feel like we are welcomed and to let them tell their story through food.

The chicken doner was so juicy. However the flavor could have been better it was just a little bland. The rice was cooked perfectly and the salad was fresh. The lamb doner was very flavorful but it was too dry. So, maybe I just got old pieces. All in all this is a good place just needs a bit more seasoning on everything.
Gyro is good but small portions. The lamb donor  was 90% rice as can be seen in photo

Ordered for delivery this evening for 3 people. All the bread was stale and meat was dry. We threw out half the food since it was so bad. I have had ok experiences in the past here but will not be returning. Seems like they just were using scraps and old bread. Falafel was cold and soft with no flavor. Lamb was dry and no seasoning. In fairness the Sigara Boregi was very good although laid on top of wilting, nasty looking lettuce and the baba ganoush was decent but the main dishes were not acceptable. Order was almost $100 in total and most went into the garbage. Unfortunately, can't imagine going back despite some previous visits that were ok.

The food at this tiny joint might be some of the best kebab I have had in the city. This place exactly what New York's vibrant food scene is about, grabbing a bite before or after your Broadway show is the perfect was to complete a night out in the city experience. It may not be the fanciest of places but if you want a party in your mouth and for your stomach to thank you for the delicious food, definitely checkout this spot!

Not sure if it was good or not! I am use to eat Dôner or Iskender Döner Kebab in Turkey and Germany!! The lamb meat ( Dôner)  was a little on the dry side, salad wasn't that fresh ( it had a kitchen odor) bread was ok but not whau the yogurt sauce had a good taste but was very liquid! One portion was a large lamb Döner/ Gyro on turkish bread but we received a lamb Döner with some meat and a lot of rice?!?  We spend almost $100 and wasn't satisfied, what is sad! Sorry but true!
Maybe we are spoiled with real Turkish and Turkish-Germany Döner meals

Amazing! This place has to be one of the most authentic restaurants when it comes to Turkish Mediterranean food. It's just that good. This was our first dinner in NYC so we had a bit of everything and everything was prepared to perfection. Hummus was some of the best I've had, bread excellent, salad fresh, falafel good, lamb chop perfect, Chicken juicy and flavorful, kofta...need I continue. This is a must. They would know me by name if I lived here. Loved seeing everything prepared right in front of me.
I've been coming here for years, best lunch special deals from 11am to 3pm. Must try Lamb Doner

This in assuming kebab place is a hidden gem. This small Turkish place is filled with people who's first language is not English. That should speak for itself. The food does as well. I could not be happier I stuck my head in here and sat down. The proportions are not only huge but delicious. Till next time I am in the area.
Thanks

The food was good!

We ordered here for takeout and it was good food. We ordered the platter which ended up being more than enough for the two of us.

We enjoyed two of the dishes (the chicken chop and the kebab). But the shish and the doner were a bit dry unfortunately. The addition of the charred vegetables were a nice and welcome touch. The sauces were okay though the red sauce felt like it was ketchup with some spice thrown in.

Overall, probably not my top kebab place but would order from here in a pinch

Food was delicious; stop playing.

We had the chicken and the lamb and it was delicious. Go there and be happy.

Ordered delivery from here tonight. The large lamb doner with homemade Turkish bread and no rice. Also ordered the Turkish coffee.
Everything arrived on time and was hot. The Turkish bread was good. Soft in center and firm around edges. No butter came with it. No utensils or napkins.
The lamb doner was DELICIOUS!!! Definitely recommend the lamb. Tender cooked meat and flavorful. Salad was fresh with red onion, tomatoes and a hot pepper. For $20.50 you get a good amount. It's very filling!
