The Turkish coffee on the other hand was a disappointment. It was hot and tasted okay when it arrived. As I drank closer to the bottom, I got a mouthful of grounds. It's 1/3 full of grounds and it's already a small amount of coffee for $3.50. Hard pass next time!
Food or good. Skip the coffee.

We had an excellent meal at the Istanbul Kebab House! Our order of chicken kebabs, red lentil soup and rice pudding were prepared to perfection. The chicken was moist and succulent. This is a great place for a quick pre-theater dinner that doesn't break the bank. The dining room is small, so come early!

Great place to stop by for authentic middle eastern food.

Coming in around 5pm for my dinner after a day of hard work. The wait staff greeted me with warmth and sat me down without rushing me to order. I asked for something economic and simple and he recommended me the kebab plate.

A huge plate full of veggie, chicken, lamb and rice with red and white sauce on the side. It was definitely a full plate to be considered for dinner. I'm falling asleep as i leave this review.

Quick, clean and crisp. Even after dining, they did not rush me to get the check, let me me chill. Where else have you come across this in midtown. Very rare to come by these days.

Will return with friends

It's a small unassuming place that you could easily walk by because it is very small but don't. Go inside and have some delicious food. Not only was the food delicious but I need to give a special shout-out to the waitress who managed so many people in a small space and took delivery food orders at the same time. We were a large party and she was so gracious. She was definitely overwhelmed but didn't let it stop her. Onto the rest, the restaurant is cute and I'm surprised they managed to fit 12 of us in because it is tiny. We ordered a lot of things and everything was yummy. We ordered hummus, baba ganoush, sigara boregi, and shepherd salad for our starters. They come with warm Turkish bread. They were all really good but the sigara boregi were my favorite because they were crispy, cheesy, and hot out of the fryer! I got the doner sandwich with chicken and lamb in lavash bread. It was really satisfying but messy though. My friends all enjoyed their kabab platters and there were no complaints. They also liked the tea that came in beautiful small cups. The Kazandibi dessert is like a flan and I definitely recommend it to end off a wonderful meal! I will be returning!

Pros: N/A

Cons: One of the sandwiches might have been the cause of diarrhea. Eggplant salad contained too much dill.

The lamb donner sandwich was so good! The turkish bread was nice and fluffy, and the meat portion was very generous. Your sandwich also comes with a free drink which includes turkish tea. The baklava was also really delicious.

First time in Hell's Kitchen, we were told not to stop at the first restaurant we see...and boy do we appreciate that advice!  Further up 9th Ave., we found this place.  It wasn't much to look at from the outside, but once inside, we were treated to a wonderful aroma!  We ordered the lamb/chicken combo (saw the guy eating the same dish next to us), and split it.  

The meal was absolutely delicious, service was great, the facility was immaculate; we couldn't ask for a better overall value/experience!
I ordered delivery. The doner kabob arrived cold, dry, and grisly. The spinach dish was good. However, I ordered Turkish bread, and instead they sent pita which was hard and stale.
Delicious food with generous portions. The service was also excellent. Highly recommend!

After a day of walking all over NYC, we were craving something tasty but quick for supper. We found Istanbul Kebab House and were not disappointed. The doner/shawarma sandwiches were delicious - packed full of grilled meat, veggies, and sauce. You know it's going to be good when it's that messy. We ended with the strong Turkish coffee. Can't wait to come back once the pandemic is over. (We visited in summer 2019)
I highly recommend this place. Food was so delicious and staff were very friendly. Small but warm.

My friend and I were in the mood for Mediterranean cuisine so we decided to give this place a try. This spot is small and cozy with brick walls, photography, decorative and colorful cloth pillow cases.

We both ordered the lamb shwarma / doner / gyro which is the meat from the rotating spit. The meal came with rice, salad and white sauce. We were also served tasty complimentary bread with sesame seeds.

There was quite a bit of pieces of thin lamb meat which were well seasoned, juicy and tender. The addition of the savory white sauce made the meat even more delicious! The salad was crisp and fresh with onions, as well as tomatoes.

With the Yelp check in, you can get free dessert after writing a review. I chose the baklava which was delightfully syrupy sweet with strong taste of honey, flaky sticky phyllo dough and pistachios in the center.

Service was pretty good. The hostess / waitress were welcoming and friendly. Prices were very reasonable and I had enough left over to take some home with extra white sauce. I would like to have the Mixed Grill if I return.

We came here while visiting a friend in New York. Staff were very nice and food was so delicious! We ordered a chicken kebab plate, but the chef cooked us up an amazing special platter with kebab, shawarma, and even a lamb steak and didnt charge us any extra! It really made our day a happy one and i am so appreciative of their generosity. Next time I'm in New York I'm definitely coming back.

This place has next level falafel. It is crispy and the flavors are scrumptious. No other falafel will ever compare. I also had the chicken kebab which was tasty as well. There bread is homemade and fluffy like a cloud. I would eat at this place everyday just to try everything on the menu.

Really, really good. Had the lamb Doner on the Turkish bread, definitely get the Turkish bread. Huge portions. The sauces that came with it were great.

The best item though had to be the lentil soup. By far the best I've had, and comes with the awesome Turkish bread which they toast.

Definitely coming back in the future for their other items, their eggplant dishes looked great.

Everything was delicious, and served quickly. The 4-choice cold appetizer spread was enough as a meal, the baba ganoush was by far the best. Loved the Turkish bread, and the rice. Would love to go back for the seafood options. Service was fast and welcoming.
I really recommend the place; the kebab was great, and so was coffee; hopefully I will have another go when I get to New York.

We were visiting from out of town and this place popped up. We are glad we tried it because the food was excellent. I dont know soke of these yelpers are just whiners like the lady saying she had better in Saudi... Really? get a life. If you're looking for good food give them a shot. I am not a falafel fan but I tried some off my wifes plate and it was rhe best I have e er had. Wasnt super dry and hard as a rock like other places. Definitely will eat here again when we are in NYC. Thr Baklava was aslo excellent.

Stumbled upon this spot en route to a venue. Decided to check it out & it was a full house. Usually if an eatery is full is a good sign that the food is good. We waited for a table approximately 20 minutes and as soon as we sat down we scanned the menu.

First up the lentil soup and it was very good, not like any if I've tried before. The Turkish tea was small and it packed a strong punch. The falafel appetizer with hummus & tomatoes was very tasty. The chicken shish kebab with white rice & chick peas, mixed salad along with hot sauce & yogurt cucumber sauce was gulped down by my mom, this evenings food partner.

Once you check-in & write a review you receive a free dessert too.  We picked rice pudding but it was ok, nothing to rave about.

The space is small but the food is reasonably priced & tasty with good portions.
Food was delicious, service was excellent. It was a late night dinner, almost closing but they didn't rush us or cut any corners. Definitely will return when back in NYC!

Amazing food and service here . Plus BYOB which keeps the bill at a very reasonable price! Our waitress on Saturday night ( I think her name is Cassel) was TERRIFIC in every way. She made great recommendations and was just a PLEASURE ! She made our experience the BEST it could possibly be!
This is a review for mealpal pickup. Portion is huge with salad, bread and lamb kebab. Food is ok - Lamb is dry and flavorless.

this is the worst restaurant ever in the new york area because they don't have ranch sauce for the fries and secondly the restaurant itself it's very tiny and small because it's very small and i recommend you don't visiting this place because it's very small and the fact that it's not something that you would like honestly in the new york area but that's all i gotta say for now!!!

Amazing food, the bread was fresh and everything tasted authentic!!

Highly recommend the baklava!

I don't know what to say. We made a reservation for a party of 4 for 7pm but when we arrived at 7pm, all the tables were occupied. We were not seated till about 10 minutes later.

For the appetizer, we ordered the fried calamari and hummus. I found the fried calamari and hummus to be okay. We aimed for the complementary toasted pita bread instead of the regular complementary Turkish bread and it was just okay as well...not the best since I can literally taste the char on it.

For the entree, we ordered the chicken kabab and the lamb kabab. The lamb kabab was pretty dry and chewy. The chicken was a bit better since it's more on the tender side but still not the best.

Only ordered takeout from here during the 2020 quarantine. Overall, pretty impressed with the food. They have a variety of dips and meat selection. For the dips, the roasted eggplant sauce, hummus, and baba Ganoush were all delicious. My favorite surpringsly was the roasted eggplant sauce. For meats we ended up getting the lamb shish kabob and lamb kofta kebab platter. The meat was a little dry (I think maybe because it was takeout) but if you dipped it in the tzatziki sauce and hot Sauce it tasted great.

Got the small appetizer with hummus, baba ganoush, toasted eggplant and tzatizki and they were so good along with the Turkish bread. Got the combination platter with lamb kebab and lamb Adana and they were delicious too. A lot of rice but it was tasty

Formerly known as Rincon 50 .
Opened by the same people!

Never disappoints !

Check it out though! Brand NEW Menu and the food is absolutely AMAZING!

Same great classy, low-key vibe as Rincon 50 once had.

I had a fantastic dining experience at Il Divino on a Saturday night around 6pm. I had searched all afternoon for a last-minute Italian cuisine dinner reservation and luckily they had some openings. I was skeptical at first as there weren't many reviews online at the time of my reservation on 11/4/23 but I went with it. The service was attentive and friendly, the atmosphere & ambiance were great and the decor was lovely. We had ordered the following: Calamari Fritti, Polpette al pomodoro (homemade veal meatballs), Caprese, Zuppa del Giorno. Spaghetti con polpette, Pollo alla parmagiana, Pollo ai Porcini and Ravioli di Zucca al Divino...each dish was amazing and tasteful. Pre-tax total came to be around ~$180. Il Divino charges you an additional +3% tax if you use a credit card versus cash. The tip is at your discretion.

I just had lunch, and I had to immediately write a review on the food and the service here. My server, Marcello, was is attentive and just lovely to talk to. For a starter I had the bruschetta al fungi which was tasty and the bread toasted perfectly. For my entry I had the gnocchi tartuffo which was soft rich and creamy - absolutely delicious! The restaurant is close to me - on the corner of 50&9. Great ambiance inside with a bar and outdoor seating. Overall, a great experience. I will be back for sure. Thank you!

Honestly, I was positive shocked. I moved to midtown west in 2020 and would always pass by this. However, I decided to go on my birthday and ordered saag, biryani, chicken tikka masala, and naan. They were really good. It's a good place to get some good Indian food.

My husband and I usually get the chicken tikka sizzler and the saag paneer.  The chicken is nicely seasoned and never overcooked.  The saag paneer is flavorful with nice sized pieces of paneer.  We've ordered other things as well and they've been good.  My only criticism is that spicy isn't spicy but then again I am REALLY into spicy.

This place is scummy--18% automatic tip (see: no incentive for waiters), sticky tables that I had to "pry myself off of", and ridiculously priced food: $8.27 for the smallest ras malai (less than 1 inch diameter). I am floored at how pathetic this place is. If you're looking for Indian food in the Times Square area, go to Curry India; they're relatively unknown which is a shame given how delicious their food is + the fact that they've been around since 1915 (A little after electricity was brought to Time Square and all the signs were alight).

When we swung by for lunch today only two other tables were seated. The waiter still found a way to take forever; not only did he not pour any water (82 degrees out), it took him at least 15 minutes to come and get our order. Even then, he seemed to have left his faculties elsewhere, with significant latency "Is there tandoori on the menu?" "Uhhhh".  Uhhh to everything. It seemed evident he had been at the place for a while though so I'm not sure why he didn't know the menu.

The other patrons also seemed displeased with the wait--the 2 tables that is. Either way, our tandoor chicken + tikka masala eventually came out. Very generic Indian food not even holding a flame to the the authentic spots where the cabbies eat! I was shaken to the core at how inept the waiter was--but that was before I saw the ras malai. I have never seen such a laughable thing in my life: less than 1 inch in diameter in the tiniest "bowl"--this is the most scanty dessert offering ever $8.27.

The real cherry on top--which shall now be also recognized as a dessert having seen this place's "ras malai"--was waiting on the check. The waiter made us wait 10m idly (finished all our food) so we ended up asking a second time. He had to serve other tables when he was literally so close to the register so we had to ask a 3rd time.

We were not gonna leave a tip, which is uncommon for us, but they ended up having gratuity anyways. Screw this place.

We order delivery from this place. We had the turmeric rice with the okra and the chicken tikka masala. It was pretty good. Nothing exceptional. Flavors were mild, even though we asked for extra super spicy.  Decent size portions, and the price was very reasonable. But the food quality was a little disappointing.

The food and service here is awesome. I reached this place barely 15 mins before their closing time and still the owners welcomed me without hesitation and allowed me to take my time to place the order. Next time you are in time square give this place a try!
The first thing I liked was their interior.  even because of this, I'm ready to return.
Very expensive India restaurant.. not a cent  worth.. I don't have an option but have to at least select 1 star while writing the review.

We were pleased when India at Times Square reopened after closing during the pandemic, because it was a favorite pre-theater dining destination. We gave it a try recently (December 2022) and found the food to still be quite good, although not all of the dishes we tried were the same caliber as previous. For example, the pakoras were a bit greasy and the chickpea flour was a little raw in places, and the sauce on the gobi Manchurian was a tad sweet and the cauliflower wasn't deep fried. However, the butter chicken was excellent, as were the Sikh kebabs, and the breads were really good and still reasonable with 4 pieces per serving. Unfortunately, some of the more interesting menu items were gone, but there also were a few new additions.  My only complaint was that service was a bit lackluster, with no excuse because the restaurant was pretty empty.
Location is good, decor is well done, very clean, the service was great and the food was fabulous.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

It can be hard to find this place with the small indistinguishable awning entrance but the interior is pretty nice. They have these green velvetly chairs and it's nicely decorated with a painting at the front and some fake vines with flowers at the entrance.

I came here already a few times for work lunches and the food has been pretty consistent and good. I had a mango lassi today it was refreshing and they gave it in a pretty big cup. The naan is solid as well as the garlic naan. The samosas are tasty. They have this pan puri which I had never had, it's supposedly Mumbai street food. It's basically like an open, crunchy samosa with some potatoes in the middle and comes with this watery brown sauce. It was different, and pretty good, although this was the first time I've had it

The Rajasthani curry was tasty, and the butter chicken was really creamy and came in a thiccc sauce. Very good. I also had the lamb tandoori which tastes great also, and has a slightly nice crispy finish.

The tikka masala is pretty standard, very good though as well.

It's usually not crowded at all there when we've gone for lunch. As a matter of fact, we were often the only ones there, not sure why being this is really close, basically right on the close outskirts of the heart of Times Square.

The reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is the service can be a bit slow, and a few times they forgot an order. I'm usually very forgiving with that as long as a "sorry" is said or they put a pep in their step but since it happened like two thirds of the time we were there when there was barely anyone else in the restaurant, I am holding it against them.

However, definitely a solid, and good Indian place in Times Square. I think that's even more credible and noteworthy given the mostly chain restaurants in the area and generally thin dining options for good, authentic food in the immediate Times Square area.

While the was good, i have been there 3 times. They have now added an 18% service fee for tourists with a suggested tip printed on receipt calculated inclusive of service fee. When i asked the waitress what is was, in stead of being honest she said oh it is a service fee, i asked if that was the tip amd she said well if you want to think of it that way then yes. Off my list!   rip off somebody else

The review is overdue for me. This place is the best place to eat halal food. I love the owner and his wife. They know how to accommodate their guest. The food is very delicious.. puri is out of this world

Went here as wanted to pick up some Indian before getting on bus back to hoboken.

Will keep it short.  This generic looking place that looks like a cross between a hgtv remodel and 80s idea of Indian fancy.

Food was okay but nothing special as it tasted like  a frozen Indian meal from grocery store.

I see no reason to return.

The food here is delicious and the staff is friendly and courteous.  The place is quiet (but not too quiet) and the atmosphere is casual and welcoming. This is a great place to go to for dinner before a show because of its proximity to bustling Times Square, it is great any other time as well! I'm excited to explore more of the menu. I got the fresh shrimp last time and it was the perfect size for a small meal. The shrimp came in a tasty gravy and came with a big puffed bread.
Visited on a Thursday night and place was empty but dishes were delicious but on the small side . 4 dishes for 4 was not enough

Loved it, friendly people, and the food was really amazing!
I'm not an expert, but we were blown away with the depth of flavors

Place was clean and very accommodating. The food was good and the staff super friendly. Would definitely come back. We had the shrimp parkoor, butter naan, and the butter chicken. Everything was great
Food was terrific! Had Vegetable Samosa, Saag Paneer, Chicken Tikka Masala, and garlic naan, and Indian beer.

I've honestly never felt more disrespected eating at any restaurant before. This place is racist. Literally sat there for over hour after eating and they never asked us if we were done or if we needed anything else. While we were eating an old white couple got seated right next to us. They got their food, finished eating and got the check. In that time we're we're done eating with our plates not in front of us, with empty glasses and waited for the waiter to come to our table. He literally went to every table probably 6 or 7 times to check on them, we were the only black people in the restaurant by the way, everyone else was white. After all the waiting we had to get up and tell them we needed a to go box. My girlfriend just wanted to walk out and not pay but I just wanted to just give a 1 penny tip but the tip was included on the bill. If I had known the tip was included I would've just walked out because the absolute terrible and disrespectful service warranted it. Just a heads up if you're black you will be ignored and the service will be terrible.

We arrived when they first opened, and service was slow. They advertise that we could order from the menu but kept pushing the buffet.

Finally our servers decided that we could order from the menu. I had the tomato soup with about five croutons, and my friends had Butter Chicken and some sort of lamb. They both enjoyed their dishes. Also, we had the Naan Garlic Bread and it was delicious

Overall, it was a good experience but the service could be better. The customer service was good but the servers seemed confused. If you enjoy Indian food and not in a hurry, I would recommend this restaurant. The decor was pretty emerald green.
Paneer was not what normally paneer tastes like- it was more tofu style rather than milk based and much tough than soft. Overall, it still tasted good and we enjoyed our meal-

I was very disappointed when I went in there first of all I sat and waited for a very long time when there were four weight staff and maybe 10 other people in the restaurant. So then I ordered iced tea only to be told we're out of that so then I said I'll have lemonade oh we're out of that so I said okay I'll just have water. I am then told they don't pour a glass of water I needed to purchase a bottle of San Pellegrino or a regular bottled water be the $7 or $4 again they do not provide water to their customers. At this point I told them thank you but it was my first visit and would be my last and I left.

Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing. Waiter recommended the Goan fish so I got it. The fish was cooked well (slightly crispy on the outside but soft and tender on the inside) but the curry sauce wasn't my favorite. Probably just a personal preference but the sauce felt like it had shreds of coconut, which gave it a weird texture and taste.

Service was friendly albeit a little slow. Spacious interior.

They do have an intriguing prefix option for $35 that I would've gotten if I had been more hungry. Choose two appetizers, two entrees, a soup plus a dessert. I didn't see how big the portions were but sounds like a good deal to me!

They also appear to have a lunch buffet every day for $17.95 (not sure when it starts but I think it goes until 3:30pm), which I might come back to try just to see if I just ordered the wrong thing this visit.
I've been to many Indian restaurant but this has to be the best one so far. Food was delicious and the service was excellent!! Their butter chicken and mango lassi is to die for.Highly recommended !!
This place is amazing. Omg the food Is so delicious and the staff is gracious and amazing. I love this place. Wish I lived closer. I would've taken pics but I devoured the food already:/

Excellent food and great service. It was a pleasure to meet the owner, who took time to talk to us at length. Loved their house drink, which took me back the memory lane when I loved it growing up in Pakistan.

Wow! What a fantastic meal. I had the goan fish curry and the mixed appetizers with chai. My wife had chicken tikka masala. Everything was delicious with a real variety of flavors. Service was fast and prices reasonable. Can't wait to go back.

Great place for breakfast right in the middle of the city!

Fantastic taste.
Aloo GobiAloo Parantha

I wish I can provide zero or negative rating. They simply served    frozen food. Doesn't looks they made anything fresh in the restaurant. Very very bad taste and no flavor at all any any of the items.

Amazing. We came here during their partial opening and the ambience was beautiful with a royal twist in their interior design. The service was impeccable and very professional. We were pretty clueless on what to order but our server Mohan took care of it by recommending vegetable samosas for the appetizer, butter chicken (masala) and chicken curry for the entree with side of regular naan and garlic naan. The food was spot on and of high quality. I really liked the chicken masala; it went perfectly with the rice, the naan, or even on its own. Towards the end of our meal, we were offered a complimentary dessert known as Rasmalai, which is basically cottage cheese soaked in condensed milk. Overall, this is definitely a great addition to the neighborhood and will definitely be back again. It's definitely one of the better Northern Indian cuisine I have had in a long while.

This is an excellent addition to the neighborhood. We went for the lunch buffet which cost about $20 each. The buffet had salad, basmati rice, dal makhani, lamb curry, tandoori chicken, peas & carrots, saag paneer, and a dessert dish. The owner came by to give us naan, and check on us a few times. Everything was delicious. Service was excellent. It is very clean and has a nice appearance. It has only been open for 2 weeks, but they seem to have their act together. They do not have a liquor license, as yet, but apparently that is in the works. My only suggestion would be to add a little heat to a few of the dishes which are all quite mild. I would recommend this restaurant for authentic, and tasty North Indian food at a reasonable price.

Great hospitality...The owners and staff make you feel at home...the food we ordered was spot  on tasty.. service was quick on a Tuesday 9.30 PM when we went... drink (cocktail) was fabulous...!! overall a very pleasing experience... I will visit again before I leave NY in the weekend...!! Thanks you guys...!!!
Poor service, relatively high prices, average food, automatic gratuity - there are much better options in Manhattan! Also not open for lunch as listed.
Great food and fabulous service! Make sure to order Aloo Parantha and Veg. Biryani! It's totally worth it
Pretty mediocre food. The Kachumbar salad was a plate of sliced cucumbers and carrots with little or no seasoning. The Chana Masala not very good. The service was poor.

They don't give information to customers about charging fees for credit card payment, top of that they charge 18% gratuity without any notice in restaurant. Food was ok pakoras was refried and papad was also not cooked.

While in the city for work, I needed a quick bite and I wanted to not spend more than 20.00. I knew I would need take out but I found this newly opened Indian restaurant on Yelp and decided it looked perfect for what I wanted that day.
I walked in around noon and a few tables were seated. Its a decent sized place. Right when you walk in they have an array of vegetarian and meat options that they were excited to have you try. Nothing there that I hadn't heard of or had elsewhere but boy I thought they executed everything pretty well. It was hot, fresh and each dish had its own distinct flavor. I asked for some cups for the sauces and the man at the front ran to the back and grabbed one of each for me to enjoy with my meal. The naan was pillowy and crisp all at the same time. If I lived in NY, Id be there again right now!
I think if you were seeing a show, this would be a good option since its close to theatres.

This venue is amazing!  The food, decor and service are all extraordinary.  

Their samosas, yellow dal tadka and chef's Moghul Emperor special curry are outstanding.  I've dined here weekly since they opened.  Words cannot express how happy I am to have India at Times Square in my neighborhood!

We loved our dinner here a few days ago! The food was excellent and fairly priced. Generous portions of food, and everything tasted great. Great location is convenient for a meal before you see a show or just happen to be in Times Square / Hell's Kitchen area.
They also have a lunch buffet and we are excited to try that out as well!

Conveniently located restaurant with a pleasant ambience.

It was  great having a parking garage right next door as I was driving into the city from NJ for a business lunch.

The buffet had sufficient variety and certainly enough for a vegetarian. All items were well prepared and tasted authentic. The naan bread, served freshly made at each table, was particularly delicious.

My only complaint is the height of the buffet counter. That made self servIce a  little tricky for a short person like me.

We finished the meal with carrot halva and some spiced tea. Both very tasty.

I will certainly be going there again, most probably to try out the a la carte dinner menu.

Very good Indian food in Time Square.  
Slow service...
But you look past it because of the wonderful food!  We will be back !

I had been keeping my eye on this space when I heard that it was going to become an Indian restaurant. i had passed by the other night [it was already closed] but saw their sign for the all you can eat buffet for $17.95 from 11:30 to 3:30 daily. I stopped in for lunch the other day. It is a large square space, nicely decorated. There was a family of 6 on one side and a couple on the other. I sat in the center. I told them that i wanted the buffet and my water glass was filled and I went to see what awaited me at the buffet. i got a dish and the choices were significant. Basmati rice, daal [black lentils] kadi pakada, saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, a lamb and peas curry and a vat of tandoori chicken. I was looking for naan but they said it came to the table. I began eating and the food was very good and tasty. It did take a while for the naan to arrive and the tandoori chicken was a bit dry but otherwise tasty. The waiter and staff were very helpful and accommodating. It may be a little pricey but the food was good and it is probably comparable for the area. I would recommend and return.

Lunch buffet today was great. Went back for seconds of the Fish Malabar. Outstanding. A really wonderful South Indian coconut curry.
Roti perfect. Tandoori Chicken excellent. Samosas great.
Very, very welcome addition to the neighborhood. Beautiful place too.

Great place for dinner, food is fast and hot! I hate it when food is preheated, but the dish here is fresh!

Services is great, they are offering 15% off since it's new!!! Wow.. new furniture and clean

It such great place, come here for lunch quick bit. The food are tasty, failover are good, but very limited selection, only 7 dish. it cost around 18 dollars before the tax. Which looks ok for time square price.

I had my doubts.  Mostly because I've never known a restaurant positioned next to a parking lot to be very good, but DAMN, I was wrong.  This food was SLAMMING.  We ordered the Pakora for an appetizer, which was prepared perfectly, and not greasy.  I wish there'd been more of the spinach, potato, cauliflower ones.  For our entrees, we got the Dhal Makhani and the Aloo Gobi. When I tell you my mouth was totally shocked by the flavor.  So rich and perfectly seasoned.  The service is also fantastic!  I'm so happy there is finally an incredible Indian restaurant in Times Square!

We're big fans of Indian cuisine and this one promises to be stellar.  Great flavor with appropriate heat.  Had the briryani with lamb... great.  Chicken kabob was stellar. Rogan Josh was perfect.

They are still in start up mode and you really wouldn't have guessed it.

The furniture is fun and makes for a nice eating environment. The appetizers included veggie pakora, mango lassi and samosa all were very good. Aloo Gobi and chana masala very tasty with nice spicy ness.  
I would definitely come back.

Amazing!  I live in Hell's kitchen and this is now officially my go to Indian spot. They are still working on extending their menu, so they made me an off the menu vegetarian entree which was amazing.  Prices were reasonable, especially considering how everything near Times Square is over priced.  Staff was very friendly and attentive.

Highly recommended!!! I almost never write review but I have to say that this Indian restaurant really stands out!!
Best Indian restaurant I went too.
Staff is super professional and nice! 5 stars without any doubt!! Thanks for this experience
Nice quick stop on the way to a play. Falafel and fries hit the spot. Asked for no onions, which seemed like a pipe dream, and yes, they still put onions on.

I think this place is criminally underrated: they load you up with one of the best lamb I've ever had (tastes and feels like brisket tbh). Great volume, great price point, and well it's nowhere as good as the Turkish food I had in Germany years ago but it's still very solid and will satisfy you. Their chicken is inconsistent, sometimes it's a hit and the juiciest softest chicken, sometimes it's a little firm and dry.

Delish falafel wrap alert!  Stopped in here on a whim as it was pouring rain and I wanted something how I could take back to my room.  The falafels wee small but super dense & after about half way through, I was thinking to myself whoa I'm full..... but somehow I managed to polish off the whole thing.

Next time, I'll make sure to order a side of their spicy sauce to see what that's like but the flavor was delish as it was - you can't go wrong with the falafel

Freshly made to order, staff was super friendly. Thank you for the perfect, quick & easy takeaway on a cold, rainy day

I had a kebab with chicken, it was really good! The Turkish bread was perfect and there were plenty of vegetables and sauces. The owner provides an excellent service, particularly attentive to the customers need. The place is tiny, but with few seats and cozy atmosphere. I would recommend it! And will be back for sure once in New York!!
The portions are massive!  The staff is very nice. The chicken is delicious,  the lamb is very similar to what you'd get at most street halal guys.

I ordered a chicken gyro and French fries. While it was clearly fresh and made-to-order, it seemed like it really lacked any kind of seasoning. The chicken was just kind of bland. Not horrible and certainly edible, but overall that was the one critique me and the other person I was dining with had. The fries were really good and had a great amount - shoe string type.

Wow, food is beyond flavorful and truly authentic. Everything tasted so fresh. I had the platter with lamb and rice. I even got to try babaganush for the first time. My gf who had it tons of times elsewhere said this was one of the better ones she's had. She said it definitely tasted authentic. Very friendly staff.

As for seating, it's very limited as it's more of a take out spot. However, my gfs and I were able to grab the seats and enjoy our food right on the spot. We did come off peak hours though, so please keep that in mind.

I will be back when I make another trip to NY.

Ordered a mix gyro plate with a scoop of  hummus and falafel and some cheese rolls for pickup. They forgot my cheese rolls, but the main problem was that the food was bland. The rice was soggy and flavorless, which like ruins the entire meal.  All the meat had no flavor. The falafel and the salad was good, and the side sauces were actually amazing, but come in really tiny cups, so not enough for the plate. The hummus had no flavor. I also ordered some bread.  That was great. They included a pita bread into my order, but real disappointed that I missed out on those cheese rolls. I did have some leftovers the next day, and when I reheated it, the flavors came out of the meat or I was hungry. I think it might be a heating issue, but that hummus and rice left me disappointed. Maybe you're better off getting just the sandwich.

Speedy service with fresh ingredients made to order. Was not aware of the meal deal (fries + soda for 3.99$), I ordered each separately. The cashier did not let me know the discount option...

Also, the fries were not crispy at all. It was almost like the fries were not fully done when sold. Further, the meat has no seasoning. I had to dump hot sauce and salt on it.

Overall I think halal guy is better!

I always tell people if it has a 4-star Yelp rating you can't go wrong. Well, I have to admit after eating here, that statement no longer holds true. I ordered the small lamb doner which is slices of gyro meat over salad and rice with pita. Pretty standard.

While the rice and salad were surprisingly well seasoned, the gyro meat was tasteless. And to top it all off, the white sauce was watery and tasteless. You're much better off getting some street meat from a nearby vendor.

We walked by here and grabbed a quick bite. The meat was so so. We ordered a wrap but were given a sandwich. The bread was too doughy and just overwhelming. Not the best food. I prefer the pizza slices next door!

Ordered a couple mix wraps and chicken wraps, a soup, and a baklava for dessert. The soup was meh, the baklava was amazing. I didn't try the wrap but my friends said they were good.

Service is pretty good, the workers here are really friendly. They make the food fast and they give a LOT. Prices here are pretty reasonable.
We just had good delivered. The food was very poor quality. The lentil soup tasted like a drink. And they missed an order of lamb gyros and a greek salad.

If you were in DE at any point, you know how amazing and plentiful döners are. Me and bestie had to check it out. It reminded us of after club days in the Cobblestone streets of Heidelberg. When they showed me their wraps are traditional Turkish (yufka), I decided then to take one wrap to go as I left today. I'm here on this train waiting to get home to devour it.

For those unfamiliar with the the spike it's on, they do shave it and cook it to the appropriate temp, so you are never eating undercooked meat. The veggie I got with yesterday's wrap was so fresh, but today. Nothing but meat and sauce. It's gonna be magical!
Please don't hesitate, come try it. You won't regret it.
Selected the lamb donner Kebab on Turkish bread which is accompanied by veggies and some sauces and this sandwich led me to be quite full and wanting more!

We ate here 3x during our trip because it was so good! Tried the lamb gyro and mix gyro wrap and both were generous portions, flavorful, fresh, and decently priced. The staff was so nice. They offered us extra plates and napkins when they saw we were sharing a plate.

Highly recommend.

I stopped by for dinner on the go. Place has decent seating.
I ordered the Chicken Douner that came with a side of bread. I ordered the large and it was enough to save 1/2 for two meals for me.
For desert I ordered this yummy little pastry that was super delicious and comes in two pairs.
Food was fresh and delicious highly recommend.
Price was worth it.

Food was bland. Also they charged me a fee for using credit card in the store even though I ordered over $20 worth of food, and they didn't even tell me beforehand. Moreover, they also charged me a higher price ordering directly in person than what i would have been charged ordering through Yelp, which does not make sense. So definitely check your receipts if you are ordering directly through them at the store. I feel like all that was pretty shady. Would not come back
Chicken gyro was incredible, the best I've ever had. Worker is super kind. I saw his generosity to a man by giving him a free meal. It's not everyday you see that kindness. I could not give this p

Great stuff! Good and fast service.

If you're in the mood for some Turkish food, you can't go wrong with this place.

You get a pretty generous portion for what you pay.

We ordered the gyro and also falafel platter.  Both were excellent.  The rice is on point and the salad is fresh.

My only wish was if you get fries, they just pile the meat on top of them, and this leads to some soggy fries.  I think they should just have them on the side if possible.

I'll be back.

I did not expect this to be as life changing as it was. From the outside this unassuming joint can be easily mistaken as just another halal place. Who ever would think this was THE ultimate halal food hub. Omg I was in euphoria. I've never had such a delectable, flavorful and savory lamb gyro/yufkas before  ("lamb wrap" on the menu).  I've had countless lamb dishes and never had one come even close to what I had just experienced. The owner was very warm and hospitable and you can see the flow of regular customers coming in and out.
I would usually post some food pix but that lamb was devoured so fast I had completely forgotten to take photos.

Istanbul Bay is a casual Turkish & Mediterranean spot at the corner of 42nd and 9th. It is a new and welcomed addition to the neighborhood and an delicious and affordable meal.

The restaurant is very small - standing room only with a couple of bar stools. The menu offers an array of salads, apps, salad, rice plates and sandwiches and wraps. The guys behind the counter are friendly and passionate about their food. I ordered the doner (lamb gyro plate), mix doner (lamb+chicken gyro plate), and a side of falafel (not on the menu). The plates come with bread, rice, and salad. They kindly threw in a container of what I think is keskul (milk pudding with almonds + pistachio) for me to try.

The plates were generously portioned. I think we got more meat than we did rice! Definitely had to split it into 2 meals. The thin slices of meat were moist, tasty and flavorful. Salt level was balanced.
Salad was refreshing, though a bit heavy on the parsley for my taste. I could do without the bread.  Istanbul Bay's falafel is solid - crispy on the outside, soft and flavor-packed on the inside. They are on the larger size too. A side order of these guys isn't on the menu, but you can just ask.

The keskul was the perfect dessert. Great smooth texture, delicate milk flavor and lightly sweetened.   It's not listed on their menu but you can grab it from the drink case.

I'm excited that Istanbul Bay has opened up, especially when many businesses here have closed during the pandemic. I look forward to many future meals from here.

Istanbul Bay, a Mediterrean-Turkish restaurant recently opened on the corner of 9th Avenue and 42nd St. i stopped there recently for dinner. It is a small space  with limited seating inside and some tables outside since the weather is getting warmer. They have an extensive menu-gyros, salads, drinks, desserts etc. I ordered a lamb gyro which arrived promptly. it was extremely large and I had difficulty finishing it [as a matter of fact i had the remainder for lunch the following day] My recommendation is to go there hungry if you want to finish the entire meal. I would recommend and return.

Pretty solid Turkish place.  Only tried them once so far, but it was good.

Portion sizes are pretty big.  The meat was tasty - I tried a mixed doner sandwich and both meats were juicy and good.  The bread wasn't all that great, it was just ok.  The accompanying salad was better than I expected.  Overall, this is not a bad choice at all for some Turkish on the run.

Not a great option if you're anywhere near a street cart (ie all of NYC). Their large plate is grossly overpriced at 17 dollars. The size is maybe 10% bigger than a platter from any street vendor. I wouldn't mind paying the price, but the actual quality and taste is not great.

Their plate comes with a small amount of meat. Meat quality was very good, I had the lamb. However the rice, which is more than 80% of the dish, was just plain white rice. No flavors, no spices, nothing. It ass dry and bland and does an extreme disservice to the good meat. Honestly dokt understand how they justify the price becusse the rice is dirt cheap and has nothing at all done to it. To top it off they only give a small contianer of their yogurt. Extra is 50 cents!

You are way better off getting a wrap, or better yet just going to a street cart. Better flavor, better sauce,and way more food for the price. Thankfully there is one right down the street.

Workers are rude, not polite and unfriendly. I don't know if it's because of the way I was dressed and they're conservative or something but they treated me like i was an idiot saying "excuse me miss hello" just because I didn't see that my order was ready. Also they were speaking in Turkish and laughing in my face while looking at me so I know for a fact they were talking about me. They could've just told me my order was ready didn't have to be so rude about it. The falafel wrap was extremely bland, and they offered me an extremely bland and watery tahin sauce. If you want a flavorful meal and respectful staff do not go here.

Omg this place is delicious.  The employees were so nice and the service was speedy.  The food is VERY good and fresh.  I got a small chicken doner with salad and rice and wow wow wow it is so good.  I think it was $12 which is a GREAT deal for the amount of delicious hot fresh food you get.  HIGHLY recommend.  Will definitely be back.
Amazing taste. I have the lamb doner /shawarma/ gyro and it was fantastic. Rich portions, efficient service, good price. A must if you are in the neighborhood.
Well worth your time and money to check out. Donar and Chicken kabab were amazing.  Generous portions and great flavor.  Glad we took the chance and tried them.  Highly recommend.

I went here with my family, and every single one of us loved it. The prices were ridiculously cheap, being right next to times square, and it was delicious. If you are hungry and want outstanding turkish food, you should definitely visit.
Ordered for delivery but restaurant never delivered food. Really bad service and can't recommend.

Ordered for delivery and I'm impressed!
I'm usually really hesitant ordering from new places from past disappointments but I'm so glad I did.
The Chicken Gyro Sandwich was amazing. Full of flavor and HUGE. I can literally eat it for 2 meals and still have leftovers.
Mix Gyro Dish with rice was just as good. Meats were so tender with explosive flavors. HUGE portions that can well over feed 2 grown men.
I also ordered Hummus and their Homemade Bread. They were super fresh and just PERFECT as a side dish.
Give them a chance - let's keep this joint alive!

Wanted to try halal on my vacation to NY and heard great things about this place. The food and kind service did not disappoint. Large portions of flavorful meat and even got a complimentary dessert for my birthday. Best gyro I've had so far. Definitely must try on your visit to NY

This place is awesome! We love the food so much, they give yummy hummus for the main dishes and the prices is definitely (relatively) more affordable than the same cuisine in the area! Honestly we love the food ( mixed donner sandwich and their falafel is our favorite to go!!! Omg the falafel is so crunchy  and so flavorful!! And there are always way more meats that I've expected in my sandwich!! My partner is vegetarian and he always eats the falafel dish there now haha ).  The owner is always soooo friendlly for a chat and a quick catch up in life, that's what touches my heart after this past year with pandemic, truly this is what neighborhood business should be! We truly enjoy their food and business ( they are always our default cozy dinner option!) and we are super  grateful to find them open around the corner for us!
Very rude, I was explaining what I wanted and he kept throwing the menu at me. While I was speaking to him he was ignoring me and taking other customers. VERY RUDE

I ordered the Lamb gyro with homemade bread and white sauce this was at the Istanbul bay express on 9th ave,I have not been in here since they opened.Why did I do this to myself? I guess the magic word was lamb...I love lamb although I've seen gyros for 20 years i never had one,where do i begin the homemade bread is hot and delicious the sandwich itself is just nasty somehow it tasted fishy but there's no fish on the menu,it was salty and had almost no white sauce on it.Anyone who's reading this please save your money as this stuff is really,really nasty...i feel sorry for the people  who purchased a lamb gyro diner at 13.95 or 19.95
If i come again i would order a falafel,although at 8.00 plus tax it's pretty pricey,they also serve French fries at 4.50 and rice at 4.50.The drink options include Turkish soda,aryan,snapple and water..
Save your money unless you truly dont like good food.Servers are very nice and polite

The food here is reliably good and they give you very large portions. Ordered from them many times, and I've had a couple of small issues, but every time they fixed it right away and apologized. It is a little bit expensive for a small take-out place but there are not many low budget options in this neighborhood anymore.

Very impressed. As a long time fan of Turco around the corner and somewhat of a city halal snob, I'm not impressed often but damn these guys have a great product here. Esp the lamb. The lamb is very juicy and it has a great flavor profile.  Plus portions are always huge.

For all first timers I'd recommend get a combo sandwich with the garlic sauce and the house tomato sauce. Once you try their sandwich all other nearby Mediterranean spots wont compare.
Very delicious and filling, perfect for late night snack. I got the combo Hero. Friendly staff and great service on a not busy Tuesday night.

Always try to have halal when I come to the city. This was 2 blocks from our hotel so I gave it a shot. I had the mixed plate- chicken and lamb with rice and salad. Came with three sauces and bread. Soooo yummy. I definitely recommend.
The meat was SO flavorful and the employees were really kind.  They even gave us extra fries.  But, really, the meat was so good

Istanbul Bay is a welcome newcomer to Hell's Kitchen! The food is very good and fresh and the service is friendly as well. I tried the falafel sandwich on homemade bread. The bread is not very thin and not super thick and is very yummy! Very good falafel. I only wish the red cabbage was pickled, but it is raw. They do have pickles though, so I had those added in. The baklava is super delicious and fresh tasting too!
I called for delivery at 9.44 and they said they are about the close one and half hour earlier than closing time.
New restaurant that opened during COVID. Glad to see a doner shop in the neighborhood. Good food and good service. Will come back again definitely.
I had the chicken doner on a wrap. I loved it. It was fresh, the meat was tasty, and the salad and dressing were fresh.
good food, great Turkish service and a great location, what more could you want? we had the mixed platter with ayran and baklava.. we will be back!

The food and the hospitality was amazing! The lamb was so moist and flavorful, the hummus perfect, and the desserts were divine!  It is on the corner of 42nd and 9th, right near the Doubletree we were staying at. Highly recommend :)
Huge portions and delicious. Hope this place sticks around! Great addition to the area, friendly and good prices as well.

Literally disgusting. I tried to reach a manager or someone in charge before posting this, but no one seems to be running this location. I just was served a rancid sandwich. Although the man behind the counter wore gloves, he was also on and touching his phone the whole time. And his face. The sandwich absolutely reeks of spoiled yogurt sauce, and the additional container of sauce was also spoiled. I also watched him attempt to hide my debit card, then insist he returned it to me. So I moved the stack of receipts he "hid" it under and took it back. They are violating so many health code regulations and the staff is rude and maybe worse.
Really tasty food and really nice employees! There are really no other fast/casual places in the area to get good falafel and shwarma so I plan on coming back many more times!

These are literally the best wings in the city - I'm so happy that they have a second location now in Times Square. Everything here is amazing  from all the signature sauces that come with the wings to their burgers, epic fries  and so on. DO NOT MISS  this place. It's as much a destination as Times Square itself.

Happened to try their food the NY Fashion Week and was so impressed by the quality and especially the variety of their sauces. I made it a point to order from their new location in Times Square. I placed the order online and received their wings in less than 45 mins. The wings were crispy and had a ton of flavor m.  I ordered the Tandoori Masala Wings and the Lemon Cajun and they were both fantastic. I also ordered a side of their fries and trust me they were the best fries ever. Don't forget to order some extra dipping sauces because they are so good. I also ordered a bottle of their Original Buffalo sauce so I can have with my eggs in the morning. I also see they have a great breakfast menu and can't wait to try that. I hear they have a huge dining in space. Can't wait to go visit them and dine in.

Incompetence at its finest. Ran out of wings continues to collect orders. Made us wait an hour for 12 wings, 12. Not 1200 but an hour for 12 wings. Also, not very sanitary. No masks, no hair nets, and no shields
Looks ok from the outside, but the Food is ABSOLUTELY incredible, MUST TRY the lemon Cajun!!!!!

This place is an instituion by now and doesnt need another raving review.
The ramen ofcourse is amazing and expectedly good.
But the karaage and the eggplant appetizer were really good.
The bun is like any other bun at any other place and probably can skip.

I had been wanting to try Ippudo because of the hype over the years. For a Saturday lunch, the restaurant was almost full and was very loud. The service was nothing special. Unfortunately, my experience did not live up to the hype or price.

I got the Karaka Spicy ramen which was good, but not worth the $20+ before adding on an egg. The marinated egg was also not that flavorful. I also tried the Akamaru Shinaji which was the most disappointing. I don't know if this was missing any salty components but it just completely lacked depth and flavor.

Maybe this was an off day but it seems like there are other places in NYC with better ramen experiences.

Walked in on a Thursday around 7:15 PM without a reservation, was quoted 5-10 min wait. Hung out at the bar to wait and the bartender welcomed us, asked that we let him know if there's anything he could get us, and poured us two glasses of water without us even getting the chance to ask.

Was sat at the U-shaped counter bar and immediately knew we were in great hands. Personable service that took the time to explain the ramen bowl variants when asked while seamlessly working with the rest of the FOH.

Ordered the karaage which was easily top-three karaages of my life - incredibly well-marinated thigh meat with a Popeyes-esque breading.

We ordered the Potaru miso ramen (added Bakudan) and the Akamaru Shinaji bowls. Great flavors, noodles had the ideal bite-texture, and overall well-composed bowls that didn't leave us with the feeling like we had just consumed an excessively rich bowl of ramen (though these have their place!).

We got a chance to talk with the GM, Robin, who was awesome to talk to and shared some of his favorite local spots highlighting different styles of ramen while we got to talk about the differences between East Coast & West Coast ramen trends.

Great crew working at this spot, you'll be in good hands here.

I walked in with no reservation after our Broadway show, a table of 2 and we were seated almost immediately. We sat at the center bar style tables. Loved the seating area.
The food and the service was just amazing!!  The server was super attentive and refilled our water cups every time it reached half level. Cocktail was amazing .. The portion sizes of the appetizers are good enough to share between 2 people. Depending on how many you get, you may not have space for your ramen. We ordered a bunch of appetizers:
Loved the Vegetarian Bun (Loved this and ordered a second one), potatoes, avocado tempura ! The Karaka spicy ramen is incredibly flavorful. Hands down the best veggie ramen I have ever tried !
Little hard to locate if you are new to the area.  Definitely recommend ifyou are around !

Amazing ramen. An incredible assortment of vegetarian options on this menu made it hard to pick. We got the Nirvana classic in the end and it was sooo good. The broth was creamy and flavorful and the mushrooms had a really neat texture and flavor.

Nice ambiance and good service. They were busy but we were politely and efficiently helped. Between this and the food it's a really good option for ramen.

My word, the ramen here is top notch. It's hard to get a table but we got lucky more than once finding a table quickly at this mid town spot. Best vegetarian ramen of my life and they had so many starters to choose from even as a vegetarian. All of them were so flavorful too.

We got the truffle French fries, Goma Q, Veggie buns and the veggie ramens - shiromaru and nirvana karaka. The spice level on the karaka was not all that spicy so you could definitely turn the heat up more if you wanted to. We were lapping up our broth to the very end. It'll now be a mandatory stop on future trips to NYC!

We were visiting New York and Ipuddo was our first food stop. It started our trip on such a good note because our meal was DELICIOUS. I got the Karaka Spicy Ramen. I like spicy and eat spicy everyday, so to me, the level was perfect. The broth was creamy and rich and noodles felt perfectly cooked. I also got the takoyaki and it is probably the best that I've ever eaten too. It has squid inside, but I promise, for all the folks who are picky with seafood, the squid taste is not strong! I still look back at these photos and reminisce! Take me back!

A  delicious ramen place that's 10 minute walk from Times Square/Broadway and opens late. We were looking for dinner after a Broadway show that ended at 10:30pm. I'm glad we got seated right away and were served our food within minutes after ordering, given that I was hungry and tores. Not only are they efficient, the food was delicious. We got:

Akamaru Shinaji - super thick, creamy and sweet tonkatsu broth. A dependable, traditional tonkatsu ramen 5/5.

Karaka Spicy - a more fusion-style ramen with a ground meat-miso bolognese and slightly tart-spicy sauce added to their tonkatsu broth. Very flavorful. 5/5

$3 to add an onsen tamago
$3 for kaedama

This place is pretty good.  
The broth is really really good - perfect blend of tanginess, a tiny bit spicy, bone broth/pork flavour.  Everything else is good too - great noodle consistency, good pork.  But the broth is really something else.
Also tried the fish and chicken broth ramen.  The ramen itself is just OK but broth is really interesting.
Oh and the truffle potato fingerlings are the BOMB.  So so so good.  Welll come back for those.
A gem.

My husband would rate this place 5 stars but I have enjoyed other ramen places more, so I gave it a 4. The price was a bit steep for the ramen and we also got the pork buns. Everything was good, I just don't think the ramen was anything crazier than places I have tried before.

Stopped for lunch before going to the theater after reading the posted menu. Beautiful interior that resembled a courtyard in an Italian town. Good selection of food from flatbread pizzas, pre fixe 3 course menu, entrees, sides, and reasonable drinks.
Waiter was very professional and attentive. When a side we had ordered came too close to curtain time, he graciously took it off our bill.
This was our first time at Il Forno, but we will definitely be back.

Yummy food convenient to the theater district! We were  looking for a spot to grab a quick bite after a matinee of Parade and after being unable to score reservations at a couple spots, we were pleased to find this place. I had one of their pizzas, the Black Label and was definitely pleased! My companions got the flavorful and impressive Penne Alla Vodka. Service was quick and friendly and our waiter was super attentive. It added to the eclectic ambiance of this spot that right in the dining area, you could watch the pizza being prepared in front of you!
My menu was a little ratty but I will definitely return next time I am visiting Broadway!
Great service by Sam! Food was good and priced right! The salad was delicious and the pasta and pizza were savory

I was staying in Times Square for a work event and randomly went to this restaurant, it is a cute restaurant in theatre district and the food was good. I got the Penne Vodka and it was good, and a good portion not oversized crazy portions. Overall it was a good experience and the staff was friendly.

Stopped on after a show. Weeknight. Quick seating. Warm and very engaging staff. Fantastic service. Very clean. Quick food prep. One of the best salads I've ever had, a roasted cauliflower with roast pork. Companion had Chicken Parmigiana which was delicious. But the highlight of the meal was a side dish of Brussels sprout, sliced thin, roasted with bacon. Absolutely delicious. And a fun thing, connected through a back hallway to the Iron Bar next door which was a fabulous place to watch sports. This is a great affordable place (approx $25-27 per person) with a broad menu to please all types. I'll be back!

Hostess super rude! Sat us by the door and we asked to be moved due to it being cold. She acted like she couldn't understand us and went ahead and seated another party in the back.  The food and services was okay.

We had just gotten out of watching Phantom on Broadway and stepped into this restaurant by chance because it was close by and looked nice...and I'm so happy we did! Let me start off by saying the ambiance is so nice and relaxing, the decor on the walls was beautiful and the atmosphere feels soothing. The staff were all incredibly kind and helpful and gave some great recommendations (their house moscato is a must!). Finally, the food! From the salad to our main courses, everything was fresh and flavorful. I loved their classic spaghetti and meatballs. They were nice enough to bring my husband a complimentary dessert for his birthday and sang him happy birthday. We couldn't have asked better from a restaurant we quite literally stumble into, we'd love to come back!

SOS...Do not go to this restaurant! I rarely write a poor restaurant review. God knows we have lost a lot of them to Covid and a bad economy, but this is a must.

We had a reservation for 8 people, 4 of them children. When we arrived for our res they said they were sorry, but they were just too busy to accommodate us. The manager refused to appear.

We were forced to walk the streets of time square on a cold December night with a pending theater engagement.

I am a seasoned New Yorker, but never in my life have I experienced this kind of treatment from a restaurant, where I had made a reservation weeks in advance.

I can't imagine how bad the kitchen was. I guess I will never know. I only hope to spare others from this embarrassment and disappointment.

I give I'l Forno a big thumbs down and a big fu.

We had a decent dinner here. It was super convenient for our show around the corner, Moulin Rouge. I wouldn't go out of the way to go here or declare it the taste of Italy or anything but it was decent. I note a lot of comments about the bread - they weren't serving bread at all when we went.

The place was super busy. Our server was very nice. He was Friendly and made some playful jokes with my 14 year old niece.

The portions were reasonable. I wouldn't call them large or small. We ate all our food. It was a little heavy on the sauce but tasty.  It was served at a reasonable speed and we were out the door in a little over an hour.

We were walking through the city and saw this small place, we popped in without a reservation for dinner and waited about 15 minutes before getting seated. The space was crowded but intimate. We started with a bottle of moscato and it was so amazing! Then I had the mushroom soup of the day- delicious. My biggest complaint was the main dish. The risotto was so over cooked and mushy. We didn't even eat half of it. We got tiramisu for dessert and it was very good. Our service was friendly and we were served fast.

This is a great place and is definitely worth a return visit! I ordered the fusilli bucati and liked the food. The portion size was just right. It was totally satisfying, and I was able to clear my plate without feeling like it left something to be desired.

The server was knowledgeable about the menu and choice of wines. He made solid recommendations and offered us several tastes, but he didn't make us feel pressured to commit if we weren't feeling a particular bottle.

The only knock would be for ambience. The place has sliding glass doors that open out onto the street making it an uncomfortably warm dining experience on a hot summer's day. Also, the acoustics make this place a little loud and difficult to maintain a conversation. It felt a little more like being in a bar than it did a mid-priced restaurant. You definitely need to raise your voice to converse with others at your table.

This place was so good! The pasta was made perfectly and the cream sauce wasn't too heavy. The chicken parmisean was cooked perfectly and the spaghetti was really well done with the sauce. Really amazing atmosphere and you can see the city outside.

What a great place!! This was one of few places open past 10pm due to Covid. The place had a good number of tables already seated, but they were very accommodating of our group of 9. It's a very nice and beautifully decorated restaurant. I'm not sure if we were being served by the manager or the owner, but he was adorable! Extremely personable, Italian, and fun! Tall & good looking too. He knew to take the credit card from the only man in our group. ;) Lol! He answered our questions, made wine and food recommendations but didn't hover over us.

The restaurant is really pretty. The atmosphere is casual and low key. Not really quiet but it could still be romantic. There is a club next door. So during dinner, a couple of us could feel the bass from the club reverberating to our chairs. Our bums were vibrating pretty good in our seats. Not the most comfortable, but then again, it was late Saturday night in NYC.

The food was so good!!! We ordered a number of pizzas to share. They were all so tasty! I ordered the herb chicken witn fontina orzo. Soo delicious! The chicken was moist and perfectly seasoned to my liking. One friend ordered the salmon, which she said was delicious. The pastas were tasty too! For dessert we had the chocolate molten lava cake, which was rich, warm & delicious. It's small enough for one person. Since two of us had birthdays this weekend, our sever (owner/manager) led the table in singing Happy Birthday, which then included everyone else in the restaurant.  Il Forno is HIGHLY recommended!! I will definitely be back.
Nice atmosphere, the bolognese was the best I've tasted in a while. Definitely recommend and will be back ! Our server was Jesse who was also delightful and honestly made our night !
The restaurant was clean. The people were friendly the food was fabulous. What more can you ask for this is a great restaurant for before or after theater.

Il Forno - my wife and I stopped out to this restaurant after the Giants vs Eagles game on Dec 11, 2022. It was pouring rain and this restaurant was less than a block from our hotel. Although very small and quite packed, the only real down point was when the door opened to cold and wind hit everyone. We were actually seated fairly far from the door and still got the gust. This was in addition to the problem when someone walked in the door there was no where to go, so the door remained open. Other than that the ambiance was cute. Apparently it's connected to some sort of night club next door, as I used their bathroom having missed the single restroom in the restaurant. The food was basic but tasty. A limited menu, but we both had a salad and pasta with a side of broccoli. Everything was good. The service started out sketchy. The waitress took forever to come over and then wanted to take our whole order at once. After we ordered a mixed drink, she came back 3 times before our drink arrived to take our order. Finally, I think she got it. Then things went smoother. The Chianti we ordered (pictured) that the waitress recommended was delicious and paired well with our pastas. All in all, very satisfied!

I made a reservation that apparently never made it to the system. Along with probably 10 other parties. I would have just left when I saw how packed it was with the staff having no idea how to handle the crowd, but it was Saturday night, and trying to get a decent meal without a reservation wasn't an option. We had a 5:30 "reservation" and were seated at around 6-6:15. After ordering our meals, the staff promptly forgot about us. Our food didn't arrive until 7:30. The food was perfectly fine, nothing amazing. I can't blame the staff as they were clearly understaffed and everyone was pleasant and trying their best, but I won't be retuning.

We ordered the fusilli, chicken parm, bolognese, and oricchiette. All decent portion sizes. I tasted the fusilli and bolognese which were pretty good.
The atmosphere is Beautiful,  I feel like I'm back in Italy.   The food is delicious and presented well.  The servers are great and make recommendations if asked.  I will definitely be back
Love this place. Delightful atmosphere and the pasta is to die for. I usually come here with a dear friend and they always treat us like family. Looking forward to my next visit.

I had no issues with this restaurant. I was attracted to this restaurant, first, because of its location to the theater but then, after measuring it up with the others nearby, i chose it because of it being Italian but also how it was decorated and the open window looking out to the street and foot traffic. I was there by myself having a pre-show dinner. The place was extremely busy at the end of May, 2023, and I showed up and was seated immediately at a small table by the door which was fine for me; I enjoyed the spot, watching the people walk by and come in and go. I was a spectator of the action and I loved the buzz of conversations around me. Anyway, I ordered fettuccine Alfredo primavera with chicken and it was delicious, perfect temp, perfect amount of sauce, chicken and veggies cooked perfectly. I was focused to finish within a certain amount of time and get to the show. The staff were friendly and accommodating when I waved them down to answer a question or had a request. I hope to return again one day. Sorry no pictures; I didn't think of it.:)
Quaint little place with great service. Spaghetti meatball was great, as was the chicken Marsalis. Definitely worth checking out. Oh and cheesecake and tarimisu amazing

Food is amazing! The prices for the area are comparable to all other fine dining establishments and we had reservations for 5 pm; however, the play let out at 4 and we asked if they could seat us early. Turns out they could and honestly, I'm glad they did- by 5 pm, they were getting packed. They are on top of a theatre apparently and today, there was some very loud bass coming from below that reverberated so strongly, our drink menu fell over and the glasses were clinking against the plate they sat upon. It only lasted about 30 minutes, so if that bothers you, maybe inquire if there is a show playing during your seating time. The service was fast, the person who took our order seemed to be the owner, and if he wasn't, he sure had a lot of pride in this place. I would definitely come back.

We were disappointed that our favorite pizzeria was shut down due to the pandemic. We decided to take a short walk to ll Forno in Hell's Kitchen to give it a try and we are glad we did! The environment in the restaurant is very urban and the main part of the restaurant is open so you can still experience the city while you eat. We ordered a few pizzas, Brussels sprouts (could have been a little more crispy), and the seafood linguine. The pizza's are thin crust and cooked in a brick oven pizza so they only take a few minutes to prepare. The pizza's were cooked perfectly and each of them were packed with flavor and the crispy thin crust was the icing on the cake.  The service here was the best we've received at any restaurant in NYC or any other establishment.  From the moment we walked in, to the time we got up to leave, it was a personalized white glove experience! Well done!

Just a terrific spot. Beautiful restaurant, the decor takes you to Italy. Awesome bar attached.
We had the bruschetta, herb chicken and marsala. All perfectly prepared.
Wait staff was fast and courteous.
As Grande Mo's first customers, we would like to wish him a ling and successful career. Viva Mo!
This place is amazing.. Hard to not want to go back the whole trip! Mushroom risotto was so amazing as well as the chicken Parmesan.

Outstanding. Service is incredible and the food is delicious... from salads to dessert. Drinks are strong and the atmosphere is fun. After forgetting my credit card on the table, the server saved it and I retrieved the next day. Great integrity and nice to know there's still good, honest people these days. Enjoy!

This is probably the best Italian food I've had. I
came here while on a work trip in NY. I ordered the penne a la vodka with chicken and a glass of Prosecco. The meal started out with fresh warm bread and oil/balsamic. It was hard to not get full just on that. I was able to hold myself back in anticipation for the full meal and I'm glad I did. This was the best penne a la vodka I've ever had. The chicken was perfectly cooked. The sauce was phenomenal. I finished the entire meal.

My coworkers ordered : the chicken parm, wedding soup, risotto, and penne a la vodka (non protein) and every single one of them were happy with their meal.
All of us finished our plate, except the person who ordered chicken parm. It's a big slice of chicken.

Was not able to get any pics, but I would go out of my way to come back.
Food was not good. Pizza was a flatbread & pasta tasted like something I'd make at home. Restaurant was shaking from loud club music playing next door. Would not go back

We were seated immediately upon our arrival (we arrived 3 minutes before reservation time). Restaurant was clean and cutely decorated. Staff was extremely attentive and kind. Food came out quickly. Drinks were tasty. Had the caprese salad, which was very good. Cheese was freshly made. Gave it a 3 because other dishes- 2 pizzas and brussel sprouts were just ok. Pizza a little undercooked and not very flavorful. Other dishes we saw coming out looked good. I'd try it again but would not get the pizza.

With an 8 p.m. curtain call and my friend arriving at 7 p.m. (thanks MTA), our choices for dinner was going to be either Junior's or Il Forno. Having eaten here a few years ago (pasta), I suggested Il Forno.
The ambiance was adorable (resembling a quaint Italian street) and I expected a good dining experience. Wrong

While the waitress was attentive at first in terms of service, it dwindled as we were halfway into our meal. We emphasized that we had tickets to a play and needed to be quick.

We ordered a Pinot Noir to start things off. It was smooth and delicious but they do not offer happy hour. For main, we decided to order two pizzette varieties so that we could share. When I visited a few years back, I ordered pasta and remembered enjoying it. I never tried their "pizza".The pizzette was oval and cut into 8 pieces.

We selected the  artichoke with 4 cheese and the garden vegetable with ricotta. At first, when it was served, it looked amazing. Keep in mind, it is more like a flatbread or a cracker like crust with toppings. Not even remotely close to being a pizza.

The artichoke with 4 cheese included a sprinkle of diced canned artichoke while the cheese topping was oily and thick. The cheese tasted like it was the  processed variety. Also, quite salty.
The garden vegetable was equally disappointing--sprinkle of some greens, grape tomatoes, cheese and a dollop of ricotta cheese. The 4 cheese pizzette style's cheese began to get stiff as it got colder. Overall, a mess.

If you must dine here, stay away from the pizzette. I was disappointed in general and will stay away for good long while. The only positive was that we were out by 7:55 p.m. and made the curtain call.

Should have gone with Junior's.

Not the best NYC has to offer.

PROS:   Very cool interior, with hanging lights and an Italian city street motif.  The tables are nice and just far enough part to not be on top of each other, but tight, like most places in NYC.

The bread they brought to the table was very good.  Hot and fresh.  I recommend just filling up on this as the meals were disappointing.

Hostess was nice.  Waiter was very polite.

CONS:   The water they brought to the table was luke warm, and no ice was supplied, without having to ask for it.   There's a huge difference between NYC water that's warm and ice cold.  

The menu was limited.   The pasta did not taste fresh, and the sauce was just a mess of cheese and cream with no real flavor.  The pasta dish options are limited... but it's an Italian place.  

The pizza came out loaded with a half inch of oily cheese on some kind of cracker-like crust.  I like thin crust, but this was beyond that.  It wasn't pizza dough, or they used some odd method to cook it.  UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU ORDER THE PIZZA.

OVERALL:   Nothing here tastes fresh.  They could use Gordon Ramsey to come in and do a make-over on the menu.  It's one of those places you're surprised is still in business in the area.   There are so many other choices for Italian around here.

Had a reservation before a show and when we showed up they said, sorry we aren't doing reservations anymore tonight. It is Christmas week so I was stuck with three kids with no meal before an expensive show.

Awesome (and I rarely ever say anything is awesome, haha!!!! Went to Il Forno in Hell's Kitchen with hubby since we were looking for a restaurant during our NY vacation that was close to Broadway since we were going to a Broadway show. Absolutely loved it. So much so that we went again before we went back to Chicago.  The ambience was romantic and beautiful inside. The menu has plenty of variety, with fair pricing, especially for Hell's Kitchen and being by the Broadway district. Service was fast and efficient. I picked the fusili bucati and as the other poster Ashley below my review mentioned it was great! The portion was absolutely just right, and as she mentioned very satisfying - I felt full, but not so full that I was uncomfortable.
