The pasta was cooked just right, the sauce along with the cream was absolutely delicious and the meat that came with the pasta was tender, warm and seasoned just right. I can't find another word for this plate other than delicious. So much so that got the same thing on my second visit! Price was about $25 which is more than fair. Husband got the marsala chicken dish that came with a salad, and dessert, as well as risotto.The risotto was tasty, the tiramisu was also very very very tasty.
The ambience was very romantic, with dim lighting, rustic type environment.  We case in with no reservations the first time and had almost no wait.  The staff was very pleasant and seated us right away. The place was quite full but the food still came out rather quickly.
Absolutely loved this place.  Essentially a perfect evening out with my husband -romantic dinner at Il Forno, and great time at Broadway.  As Chicagoans, we had a great time in NY, and left NY having had a much better experience than expected. Thanks NY for a great vacation!
Amazing food and service! They made our twin daughter's feel so special for their 10 year birthday! The hostess was also extremely welcoming and kind! Highly recommend! Also love the atmosphere!

One word... AMAZING!

From the food, to the service. The exclusivity is everything. Omar is the sweetest guy EVER. The food is just a plus. Our pasta was perfect! The flavors were delicious. Customer service 10/10 food 10/10. Definitely need to try this place if you're ever in NYC!
Wonderful holiday atmosphere and music. Food was excellent. Service was incredibly fast and our waiters were polite and welcoming. Would definitely recommend! Thank you for a wonderful evening!
Great food friendly service. What else could you want. Oh cozy atmosphere too. Thank you guys for our to go pepperoni pizza late Friday night. It was phenomenal.

This restaurant was very good. It was very close to Moulin Rouge, so my friend and I went after the show. We had no idea how good it was gonna be! It was just conveniently on the way to the train. We split the burrata salad. It was very good! I don't know what dressing was on it but it was delicious. They also give you complimentary WARMED UP bread, which makes the biggest difference. I got the Pasta Bolognese. It was delicious! The picture was taken after I started eating. Sorry I was hungry. But the presentation of the food was very nice as well. Our waiter was such a sweet man too. They took us right away and the food was out very quickly. We were there for maybe 20 minutes. The restaurant itself is very cute. Looks like an authentic little Italian restaurant. I'd definitely recommend and will be returning.

There was a minor issue with the reservation we had, but the man at the front was understanding and sat us. Other than the minor hiccup, Il Forno's was fantastic. The salad was great and the entrees were absolutely delicious. The Penne Vodka with chicken is something I want for dinner everyday since I visited. We had 3 separate wines which were all great. We only ordered 3 desserts but the waiter treated our 4th guest with a free dessert.

Our waiter was also incredible, not because he talked us up (in fact he didn't talk much at all) but we was very attentive, quick, and good.

When I come back to visit Broadway, I will definitely be stopping in at Il Forno's again.

As a New Yorker, I try to avoid this part of the city like the plague. But if you're wandering around here after a Broadway show, Il Forno is an okay place to stop if you've got a big group and don't want to be wandering around.
We just had dessert and wine, but it was A-Ok.
The service was fine. The place was clean. The gelato and sorbet were delicious.
For this touristy area, the prices were what I would expect.
It's a little weird that Il Forno is actually connected to the place next door, a serious party joint that's thumping with bass. So you share the bathroom with party chicks doing their makeup.

Had dinner last night with my kids. The manager or owner was funny as heck and the food great. I had a fettuccine and the gentleman serving us was like......you want it, we got it. We'll make anything you like. Great place.

Pleasantly surprised by this times square restaurant. The service was amazing the food was exactly what you would expect for the price range. We were not rushed even though it was full. We got the prefix menu and we're very happy everything ran smooth. The drinks were excellent I had a very good time with you saying a lot.
This is a fun place to go eat for people in the area. With a good staff its family friendly and I would recommend it. The playlist is bopping. With its unique interior its slightly difficult to miss.

So we went to Alforno because we needed to eat dinner before a show. The restaurant is very cute and quaint.   The menu offered prix fix meal as well as a la carte items.   We went with a house salad and items off the regular items.  Chicken cutlet parmigiana and seafood linguini.  
Everything was fine. But during our meal our server vVictor never checked on us once! .  I asked for bread, grated cheese for the pasta. That was very disappointing.   When we were done with our meal he did ask us if we wanted dessert, and then brought our check.  He was busy. But not that busy.  He definitely had time to check on us.  
Though the food was good our service experience was not!!

My friend and I were quite hungry when we happened upon this restaurant on our way to Central Park. It was about 4:30 on a Sunday and we walked right in and we're seated immediately. We both had the Prix Fixe menu. I got a Caesar salad, capellini pomodoro and cannoli for $27 along with a glass of the house white for $6. She got the house salad, mushroom risotto and cannoli. We both felt it was a good amount of tasty food for the price.

Our server was personable and knowledgeable about the food. Only odd thing was no bread service. Still a good deal for decent Italian.

Cozy restaurant with quaint décor and delicious food options. The interior is decorated as if you're in between the streets of Italy- very cute.

All the food options we tried were delicious! The vegetable soup, salmon, and penne vodka were all delicious. The portions sizes are also perfect-not too small and not too large where you feel the need to force yourself to finish all the food. The penne vodka was not as saucy as I'm used to, but it was still tasty and I would recommend getting it. For dessert, we split the tartufo.

If you're in Hell's Kitchen or Times Square I would definitely check this place out. It's located next to many broadway plays so it's a great option for a more intimate dinner!

This quaint little place is tucked away on the edge of the theatre area. Inside the staff is friendly, knowledgeable and warm. The food is simply amazing! The decor is quaint, reminiscent of a small italian outdoor cafe.  On day 1 we sampled the Caesar  salad, pizzette and herb roasted chicken with orzo. Perfectly prepared and scrumptious! We returned two days later to sample fusilli bucati (beef ragu -tender and perfectly seasoned) and spaghetti with meatball. Another home run!  Don't forget dessert (cheese cake, lava cake, cannoli or key lime pie) All to die for!  Highly recommend!

This place is truly a gem in the out skirts of/near Times Square! Service was efficient, personable, truly immaculate. Our server, Omar was nothing shy of perfection including the food. A simple stumble turned into a memorable experience over Italian food. I hope to see this business flourish in the upcoming years & beyond.

Anyone that says they like this place is lying. First off, the website says it's in Hell's Kitchen (which is why we went). No--it's on 8th in the middle of all tourist areas (shame on us for not paying attention to the address). Our waiter ignored us all night. Forgot the wine. And the food tasted like it came in bulk from Costco. Never going back. And would encourage anyone considering a reservation to recognize that A box of Kraft Mac&cheese is waaaaaaay better.
Incredible Italian food. Tastes what I would consider "authentic." The penne alla vodka was insane. Absolutely delicious. The margherita pizza was also really good. Another place to not sleep on.
Best food we have had in nyc. So flavorful and colorful. Wonderful!  Drinks we tasty.

By the way. After conversing with my coworkers after the meal two experienced food poisoning. One had the soup and the other a thin steak with white rice. Luckily I was okay but then again I didn't eat most of my meal due to the pork chop being inedible. However be warned. Food was not fresh.

Back in January, I had my belated birthday celebration dinner at this cute Peruvian restaurant. There was a little Christmas tree still up in the front, as well as orange walls, and cool symbols. The place gave a warm, inviting ambiance. And I appreciated that it was super easy to make the reservation.

For my starters, I had to get the Fried Calamari and of course, the Tostones. The Calamari was decent, but not as crispy as I would have liked and a little too chewy. The Tostones were delightfully crunchy, and was amazing with the mouthwatering garlic sauce (which everyone used for their own meals!)

It was tough to decide what to order for my entree. At first, I chose the Peruvian style Spaghetti Pesto, served with Pork Chop, but it never came and I was having second thoughts, so the waitress allowed me to change it up. This time I went with the Peruvian style Fried Rice with beef, eggs, scallions, and soy sauce. I enjoyed this dish, as the rice was perfectly cooked with tons of tender, well seasoned beef pieces, along with yummy egg.

For dessert, I wanted the Alfajores, but my friends ended up getting me the Tres Leches Cake and Lucuma Ice Cream. Both came with a little dance in it. The cake was melt in your mouth moist, rich, delightfully milky and creamy. The ice cream was bright and refreshing, velvety smooth, not too sweet. It tasted quite unique, like a mixture of sweet potato, caramel, with slight apricot flavor.

Service was decent, but there was only 1 waitress for the whole place, so it was a bit slow. It was difficult to get her attention on multiple occasions. Prices are pretty reasonable especially for the area. I would be open to returning and would like to try one of the Seafood or Steak offerings.

Quick dinner before a concert

I came to the restaurant because it was a few blocks from Terminal 5, and I wanted a quick bite before a concert. I was in a group of 4, and we were seated immediately. We let the staff know that we were on a tight schedule, and they were friendly and understanding.

My partner and I shared a lomo saltado with tostones. We asked to change the French fries for tostones. My first had a quinoa salad and chicken caesar salad. Everyone was satisfied with the service and quality of the meal. I especially liked the meat (lomo). It was tender and tasty.

The ambiance of the restaurant is casual and comfortable. There were many tables empty, and everyone was chillin'. If I am in the area, I will go back to try a different item on the menu

Had a team dinner here this past weekend after working a show at the Javits center. Everyone on the team loved their meal. I ordered the Lomo
saltado - beef and we ordered tostones, and maduros for the table. Everything was flavorful and tasty. Make sure you request the green sauce , as well as the garlic.  The fries were ok. But this is definitely worth a visit.

Chicken Empanadas
Lomo Saltado
Maduros
Rotisserie Chicken
Tostones
Tres Leches Cake

Not sure why this place was recommended on so many sites and rated highly. Service 1/5, it took them about 25 minutes to get my drink and they gave my sister and I the wrong meal the first time around and we had to send it back. Food 3/5, my sister and I got tilapia which was cooked well but my mother's salmon was over cooked and plain and my brother in law got streak which wasn't seasoned and fries that were soggy. Ambience 2/5, boring and nothing special with a Star Wars film playing in the background. I would not come here again.

This was my first time coming here and I was not disappointed! As pictured, I got the Lomo Saltado and it was really good, flavorful, and not too salty. The meat was also really tender,
Service was great, our waiter was friendly and welcoming. Overall I recommend!

Delicious Peruvian food! The ceviche was to-die-for. The crispy corn was amazing with the fish, the large corn was fresh, but the carrots were just a bit over cooked. The citrus taste with the fish was absolutely delicious and I would come back for just the ceviche. My soup was large but I would've wanted more shrimp (it came with three or four). The eggs and rice were delicious but I wish the soup overall had a bit more flavor. The restaurant was a little bare and the ambiance left a little to be desired. I would come back with a large casual group again but I would find a more intimate and fancier Peruvian restaurant for a date.

It's was good but I wouldn't say great. I got just the Lomo Saltado which is one of my favorite Peruvian dishes so I often order that to compare restaurants. It was a bit overly salty.  I actually kind of like that but others might not. The portion was fair but not overly abundant for the $26 price point. The green sauce (aji verde)  looked kinda old and was crusted around the spout of the maple syrup bottle they put it in so it wouldn't pour and so I don't even try it. And the roasted corn kernels they serve before your dinner comes was seriously lacking salt.

They have no lunch menu so I probably won't be getting lunch from here even though I work close by. I'll definitely come back and try the chicken which is a much better deal at $22 for a whole chicken. I can at least split it into two meals that way. You can also get half or a quarter chicken. And I have to try the papa relleno which is another favorite.

This is a local gem!
The food was fantastic!  The shrimp avocado  appetizer salad was just OK.
Empanada were good! Fried rice was good.

Small but quaint  restaurant with a full bar and no frills. Only a few servers were working, So I feel like this is caused by the pandemic. So I would not hold that against the restaurant.
But the food was great!!

I would recommend this place! I will certainly return.
You must try to green sauce!

INTI Peruvian is an unassuming, relatively spacious restaurant that doesn't shy away from large portions.

The camarones inti was very, very good, in large part thanks to the sauce (despite it being a little salty). The bistec a lo pobre features steak, rice and eggs that aren't particularly out of the ordinary. The fried plantains, however, were tasty. Overall, it's absolutely worth giving a try, especially for hungry diners!

With the few Peruvian options in NYC, this was a nice change and reminded me of cuisine from my time in Cusco and Lima, Peru.

We opted for a Pulsd dinner deal and got two entrees, two drinks and dessert. Overall, the deal was good but felt a little light for what we paid.

We added the Ceviche Mixto as well - this was excellent and fish was very fresh. Would've liked a bigger portion but it was fine.

For entrees- sea bass and the chicken. Sea bass was well cooked and juicy, just lacked some flavor for my tastes. Chicken was tasty and a good portion size. We did both family style. Table had a  green salsa which was delicious.

Dessert we did the donuts, which were fresh and in a tasty syrup.

Ambiance was nothing to write home about... it's a nice casual spot where families come and enjoy the eats.

All in all, 4/5 but on the lower side. I'm sure it'll get better as it seems they just reopened and some stuff just needs to shake out a bit.

Complete disappointment.  I ordered yuccas with huancaina sauce, fried calamari, and anticuchos and I was not able to finish any of them. The anticuchos and yuccas came with the same sauce, which it was runny and did not taste like anything. When asked, I was told that the flavors are not the same due to the ingredients/products are not found easily. The cook did not want to speak with me and sent another sauce, which was blend with bread to thicken the sauce. The drinks were served well. This review is not so much to deter people from going, but for the owner to make some changes, and for the cook to have some pride for what he makes. FYI, the bill was paid in full, and the waiter was tipped accordingly.

I took a friend for lunch.  She lives in a neighborhood with a lot of Peruvian restaurants,. which she likes, but when we were done, she agreed that our lunch was outstanding.   I had another very generous fried calamari and fish appetizer and we had the most delicious lucuma ice cream for dessert.  The service was attentive and friendly as before, and I think this is the fourth time in a month, I have eaten here...for me, quite extraordinary, but excellent food just beckons.

Amazing food in a great environment! Inti provides very tasty and fresh. The seafood was particularly good. We had the fried calamari, fish, yuca and shrimp plate. I cannot praise it enough. For desert, their ice cream and doughnuts were also amazing. The service was prompt and attentive. I cannot recommend Inti enough and intend to return as often as I can.

Had a nice alfresco meal here - weekend had live acoustic music too.

Enjoyed our frozen pisco sours too.

We've ordered delivery / takeaway a bunch and it was nice to see the service was as solid as the food.
Food is wonderful: fresh, varied, beautifully presented, tasty, healthy and DELICIOUS!  The service is efficient, helpful and pleasant  the ambiance is tranquil and welcoming

After a long day at Rockefelller Ctr, city lights and shopping we wanted to have a quiet and relaxing dinner.

Made a reservation via Open Table for 9pm.
Ended up arriving at Inti at 8:30 pm on a Friday evening and we were seated right away.

It was perfectly full but not overcrowded.

The service was great. Female busses and servers were excellent. They were attentive, pleasing and knowledgeable. Our server even noticed that our table was a bit wobbly. ( we hadn't noticed at all until she brought it up) well she went under the table and made sure to fix it immediately! Thank you for being so attentive and prompt!

We ordered the lomo saltado, jalea and ceviche. We also ordered a chicha morada and two pisco sours.

The food was absolutely delicious. Nice presentations and good portions. The sauces were perfect.
The jalea included fish, shrimp, calmar, onions and yucca. It was absolutely perfectly cooked and seasoned! The calamar was tender, tasty and plentiful. The shrimp was also perfect and same for the fish. We only ordered an appetizer portion and I'm so glad we did! Had we ordered a larger portion we would have devoured the plate!!

The lomo saltado was very tasty!
Same
For the ceviche! The fish was perfectly raw yet cooked in its yummy sauce!

The chicha morada was full of ice and it was just Ok. I feel that too much ice takes the flavor away but it was OK.

The pisco sour is all about the foam. The foam was lacking but the taste was delicious. They may have prepared it with a Hand shaker which is fine. It perhaps needed more shaking? Not quite sure bc I'm not a bartender by any means but I have made this drink at home and I personally use a blender and the foam is perfect when using a blender. Nonetheless, all was delicious. The dishes came out rather quickly and so did our drinks. We were attended to in a timely manner and I noticed the same for the other tables.

If you are in the area this is a must try!

Review for delivery

I ordered from here on Sunday to take care of my ceviche craving. I ordered two orders of ceviche and plantains.

First, I must say the delivery was quick! I was pretty hungry so I appreciated that.

The ceviche was great! It was the fish ceviche and it was super fresh. I wish they would put more sweet potatoes but the fish was on point.

The plantains were such a miss - probably the worst plantains I ever had! They weren't sweet like they're supposed to be and just had no flavor. The green sauce was bomb though.

I will order from here again!
The food was excellent. Service was great. It was a wonderful ambience. The location is not too busy parking was available.

Hands down the best Peruvian ceviche I've ever had. They're not cheap with the portion and the base is so good i could drink it.  Whenever I've gone, the taste has been consistent.  I can't wait to try other menu items but going for just ceviche is well worth it!
Very authentic Peruvian taste! Reminds me of piopio but quiet atmosphere and great dine in food, would recommend!

I've been coming here for a year, and everything I've tried has been amazing. I especially love the Beef Saltado, Arrauz Chaufa, and Ceviche. They have good deals for lunch and good portion sizes Definitely recommend!

I would rate this restaurant less than one star.  I was referred to this restaurant for the great rotisserie chicken ... on a Friday, we get there at 11:30 am the restaurant is closed... it says it opens at 12:00.. we waited for them to open... we go in at 12:00 to order the chicken and it's not ready, according to the lady, for another 1 1/2 hr.  Why would you open the restaurant and don't have the chicken ready... ?

Oh what a gem . My date knew I loved Peruvian food so he decided to bring me here and I loved it ! The place was small and intimate , service was excellent and the food was delicious . The ceviche was so fresh and so flavorful we ordered our appetizers twice ! My seafood fish with mussel and shrimp was great ! (Came with rice)

I'll be revisiting Inti very soon

I was concerned about bringing my husband's parents to a restaurant that I had not been to but was SO RELIEVED that INTI exceeded our expectations.  It is a quiet place without fancy decor but it was very good.

One of the most underrated places I have ever been in NYC. The decors are perhaps a bit old fashion but the food you will taste is absolutely succulent! Service is perfect: kind and care for the customer. Plates are generous. Just stop by to check, here this is our new to-go place!
Cute little cozy spot with great delicious yummy food. Very clean.  staff is very friendly and helpful.

I stopped at Inti for a quick business lunch while in the area and was impressed by the attentive service and delicious food! I love Peruvian cuisine and this place represents! Since it just so happen to be Happy Hour I ordered a Pisco which absolutely hit the spot! As an appetizer I had Causa with Crab meat, huhmm tasty! I follow this deliciousness with an amazing seafood soup. What a great place this turned out to be! I'm surely be back any time I find myself in Hell's Kitchen!

I ordered through the Too Good To Go app and had a generous portion of Peruvian rotisserie chicken, rice and beans with spicy Aji verde sauce. For $3.99 I got a steaming hot plate of fall-off-the-bone chicken, flavorful beans, and filling rice. We live nearby and are eager to visit for a full dinner soon now that we've had a taste!

I came here with a friend and the food here was very tasty. Our entrees were a rotisserie chicken (pollo a la brasa) combo and the corvina a lo macho. The chicken was very juicy and as good as what I have had at other Peruvian places. The corvina was also very good. It is a saucy mixed seafood platter that has corvina fish, octopus, scallops, clams, and more.

Our main criticism is that the portion sizes here are small (especially in relation to the price). The seafood platter only had a tiny bit of each of the aforementioned items. And for the chicken, we actually got the whole chicken combo ($32). The "whole" chicken was not a normal sized chicken. It was a very small Danny Devito sized chicken that was equal to a regular half chicken portion. They were stingy with the sides as well (plantains, rice, beans, salad).

Food was good quality, but there is better value to be had at other Peruvian places like Pio Pio.

The menu drew us in and we left satisfied. They're friendly and greeted us when we came and were helpful when we asked for suggestions. I had the sangria and he had one of the signature drinks. We skipped appetizers though I'll come back for those. He had a simple fried rice dish with beef and egg. I had a seafood soup that was brimming with perfectly cooked mussels fish shrimp scallops and a couple of clams. Listed as spicy but I added so much of the green sauce condiment since I love heat. No leftovers and we left so happy.
Very good and fresh food, service was excellent as well. Very authentic experience. Definitely a high recommendation.

What a marvelous surprise when we walked into this restaurant for dinner for the first time. We were greeted with a warm welcome and warm ambience with sun colors (Inti is the ancient Inca sun god) and Inca wall symbols. For starter drinks the chicha morada (purple corn drink) and pisco sour were delicious. Then we shared a plentiful ceviche mixto that was excellent with a leche de tigre with a bite. For entrees we had a wonderful lomo saltado and chupe de camarones with a side of papa rellena.

The service was excellent throughout the meal.

Overall we had a terrific experience and shall return!

If you go order the Pisco spur.  It was refreshing and beautifully presented.  

The quarter chicken was tasty but just thrown on a plate.  Yuca fries were just okay.
The service was impeccable and the atmosphere was lovely.

4.5 stars, because I only tried the grilled chicken and beans from 'TGTG(too good to go)'. The grilled chicken was just so PERFECT, even when it was served as a TGTG dish! The grilled chicken is one of the top best I've tried within this price range. Tender/moist and not oily at all.My friend loved it a lot. A great high-protein, delicious keto-food. I liked the beans :)
Had a few good take out here. The rice is done right the dishes are not greasy. Fresh authentic Civiche. Open till 11am but only for take out during the covid19 restrictions..
Really authentic Peruvian food:  the conchitas a la chalaca a made me think I was back in Lima, with my friends, at the beach..the ceviche was amazing. Will be back!

Super delicious and good bang for the buck. Also, I accidentally ordered takeout instead of delivery (although I live two blocks away). Realized after 15min, called and asked if they can deliver instead, the guy was really nice about it and delivered. It was super fast (i know, two blocks, but still). Would order again for sure.

I got ceviche, whole chicken, and avo/toma/lettuce salad
This place definitely serves really good Peruvian food. Loved it & highly recommend it. Their prices are truly reasonable too.

Gregorio was a gentile and eloquent waitstaff.  Very polite and knowledgable.,
The food was fresh and tasty and though the ambiance is über casual it is clean and comfortable.
Typical Peruvian fare is offered and lives up to the reputation of great food.
Delivery is available.
Great and unique spot open in this area where there is really little on offer.

Drinks took 2 hours (no exaggeration) to arrive. My martini was a cup of vermouth - apparently they didn't have vodka. Like just say you don't have vodka so I don't pay $18 for a cup of vermouth that I'm not going to drink.

The texture and heat of my fish were that of a microwaved turd. Mashed potatoes sucked.

Not sure how this place is in business.

We ordered delivery and the food was not good. The tallarines verdes looked like it was just pesto sauce and not as creamy and thick like the sauce supposed to be.
We ordered two ceviches and they were missing the uniqueness of the Peruvian ceviche with it's kick of the spice. The maduros were not ripped. In general it was disappointing. Peruvian cuisine is my favorite and this place just made the worst out of it for such an expensive price.

This is a good place for large groups (we had 8 people). Came here for dinner after a long afternoon of volleyball down the street. They had a drink special, sour pisos for $1! My table ordered a round and the owner or manager was so appreciative he came by to thank us. The atmosphere of the restaurant was very pleasant and I enjoyed my food. I split a seafood paella with my friend, which was enough for the two of us. The plate was huge! Maybe because I was so hungry, the food tasted particularly amazing. I definitely would come back for more!
The food was great, authentic cuisine. We enjoyed the ceviche, empanadas and chaufa. The cocktails were marvelous. The owner was very friendly and helpful.

Tried this place with a Groupon, and had a nice dinner on a weekday evening, but nothing extraordinary.

The waiters were very attentive, and the restaurant is clean. I was a bit confused that they have white tablecloths and nice wine, but paper napkins.

The avocado, shrimp and onion appetizer was the biggest hit - super flavorful, delicate, crunchy.

For entrees, I tried the Jalea- which is basically just deep fried seafood. The calamari and shrimp were nice, but they picked a horrendous tiny fish that was tasteless and scaly.

My friend ordered fish in some kind of yellow sauce, which was again unimpressive.

The meal does come with a really nice spicy green sauce, and corn kernels, which are tasty (and authentic of Peru).

The desserts were nice: flan and tres leches cakes.

Atmosphere:4
Service: 4
Food: Meh, 3.
Price: Meh, 3 (would've been $90 without the Groupon??)

So, overall a basic experience.

Came here for lunch on a Monday. Service was friendly and the food was good. For 1 appetizer, 2 entrees and 2 drip coffees, the bill was $90- so not exactly a great price for a small 10th Ave lunch location. The server did not mention any lunch specials, but that would help.

It was also SO cold every time people came in and out and we were sitting in the back of the restaurant. They could really use a vestibule!

Really love this place!! Me and my boyfriend went there and had such a great time because the food is just extremely good!! I'm salivating now just thinking about it.

We asked for ceviche mixto as an appetizer and it was delicious, basically the ceviche has raw fish chunk marinated with lime juice and a bit of salt and pepper, it has shrimp and calamari as well.

For the main entree we ordered corvina a Lo macho, it's a pan fried corvina, sauteed scallops, octopus, shrimp, squid, mussels, clams and it's served with white rice. It sounds like a lot of food but I recommend it just for one person, good for one!! That's why me and my boyfriend asked the same for each one.

If you love seafood I think you should go to this place the fish and the rest of the seafood is very fresh.

For dessert we got flan and it was good, some classic Spanish dessert.

We used the groupon, and it's very very   worthy!! I like this place the restaurant is nice, oh for winter time don't seat close to the door you will freeze anytime the door opens. Service is good too.

A good place to try Latin American food!!

Interesting minimal menue of Peruvian food. a little pricey for my tast but very tasty.  The service was ok but could have been better especially knowing we were one of the larger parties in the place. Go with the half chicken option and sides cheaper option.

Definitely making my way back! As the first meal of the day, I had the Salmon A La Pimienta - Black pepper salmon served with mash potato and broccoli.

Happy Hour Mon - Fri 3-8pm

Ordered the Mojito, had one and it had me feeling myself .

It's a great place for a date or out with a group of friends.

Ohmygod- what a sleeper hit! I had never come to Il Barettp before but was fortunate enough to get their food during a catering event. We ordered several of the pizzas and foccacia sandwiches.

The pizza was pretty good- lots of toppings with a soft, thick dough. It reminds me of grandma style pizza, which I've always been a fan of.

The foccacia sandwich- however- blew me away. We ordered the parma and the caprese. The parma had SUPER tender and fresh proscuitto, the stretchy mozzarella I've missed from NJ delis, freshly sliced tomatoes. However, the star was that foccacia. It was buttery, crispy on the outside, tender on the inside, with the fragrance of olive oil permeating through the shell. I was so impressed by the foccacia I could have had just a meal with that and been happy.

Would def returb
Hidden little gem. Delicious pizza , other food looked good but I just had to try the pizza coming fresh. Very authentic Italian. Also have to go pastries in the fridge. Definitely a must.
Pizza is so good, soo crispy and square. Delicious. I got the Bianca slice  it had mozzarella ricotta and zuchini

Authentic Italian pizza a totally different New York taste also the Gelato and dishes
Almost entirely take out they do have like a few high sit chairs

Ordered from here on seamless. At first I thought they forgot our pizza and just brought us a salad because just a salad and bread were delivered. so I submitted a refund claim on seamless. Immediately after doing so, the pizza showed up in a separate delivery still nice and hot! Food was great, and I'm now trying to get seamless to reverse the credit they gave me so I'm not accidentally stealing from this restaurant

Ordered a pizza, a Caesar, a sandwich, and a dessert. Four stars for the pizza, which was great. The other items were ok: the dessert (a tiramisu) was freezer-burned; the salad was boring. The sandwich was fine -- pretty small. But we really enjoyed the pizza, and will probably try this place again in the future (but stick to the pizza).

Stopped by here after the Daily Show and loved it! Tastes authentic and the owner is great. He is amiable and a pleasure to talk to. Once slice is about $5.5 and is filling. There are 4 high seats inside facing the store front so you can people watch and a few outdoor tables.

I've never been so hungry after ordering $20 worth of food from a restaurant. I ordered the eggplant parm, which was a new item on their menu. What I got was a few slices of eggplant, a tiny bit of cheese that was barely visible, and a bunch of sauce. I've never received a smaller portion of eggplant parm than I did today. If it was actually good, then perhaps the extremely small portion could be forgiven, but it just wasn't that good. Also, it doesn't come with any pasta. It's unfortunate because other items at this restaurant are good, this just isn't. And I get eggplant parm all the time all over this city. This comes in at the bottom for value and taste.

Great place for all-around Italian take out and creative focaccia pizzas. Favorites are the zucchini pizza, Parma focaccia panino and the carbonara pasta.

Also, really friendly owner who's there everyday!

I paid $43.00 for 7 slices of pizza. What kills me is that I could off gone somewhere els for a pie that coast less then what I paid. I ask the owner why 43 for 7 slices of pizza he did not know what his employee charge me till I told him this will be the last time I go to that pizza shop. And to top it off the pizza was not cook all the way it was still cold. But I put it in my air fryer to get it nice and hot. But to be honest I will never go there because of the price gouging and they act like it's normal to charge so much for a slice. I DO NOT RECOMEND because you will be wasting your money.

P.S. I gave 1 star but I don't give any stars because they don't deserve it.
The best Caprese Foccaccia I've ever had. The bread with tomatoes, mozzarella and pesto was so delicious. We sat at the counter and really enjoyed our quick lunch.

Excellent !!! Fresh ingredients freshly made ! Pleasant help!!
Highly recommend this little hidden gem on the west side
They got it right! Best tasting pizza. Truly Italian crafted. Great spot, and kind staff. Good location too as it's right by the pier.

We have been going to this place for years and recently the overall experience has not been that nice. Orders placed on their websites or through third party platforms are skipped, we have to call every time we order and they are always 10-20min and this is when they viewed your order. It happened twice that we walked in for a pick up and the order had not been even started. No apologies were offered or commercial gesture. Bedsides from a taste perspective ingredients are forgotten such as Parmesan on a whole pizza pie. When you find out about it and you have been waiting for your pizza for so long, you have no time to go back especially when prior complains were not considered.
I would suggest to avoid this place until improvements have been made to reach their usual standards.

A hidden gem! Literally ran into this place while looking for shelter from the cold and wind after walking away from the Hudson River. There's not much for food and drink in this area, so my friend I were happy to find anything at this point.

Well, gosh darn it good thing the cold forced us to seek shelter. This is a seriously charming and yummy place to visit. At first glance you see pizzas waiting to be chosen by the next patron. Then you realize there's a chalkboard menu with a list of fresh pasta items...and the combinations offered made me salivate.

We shared the following:

1. Paccheri with Lobster and Shrimp - delish!!! Lots of good sized bits of lobster and fresh shrimp. The pasta had the most perfect chew.

2. Pappardelle alla Bolognese - Well executed classic.

3. Burrata pizza - Could-like dough. So good. I thought it would be a thick and heavy dough, and really loved the airy texture and topping combo.

Speedy and friendly service. Fantastic value. Just try it!
Love this place! Can't get enough. My go to daily spot! 2 pies on a snowy night, perfect! The food is delicious and the people that work there all amazing and friendly

Very delicious food. Authentic ITALIAN Italian. Prices are very good. I chose this venue over the overpriced Greek venue a block away. I'm glad I came here. Outdoor dining available. My new neighborhood favorite!

Their Margherita Pie was everything I hoped for!  I enjoy the simplicity about a good margherita pizza, and this was it.  The crust was the perfect thickness with a good flavor.  The tomato sauce was perfect with lots of flavor, and in general the pie was seasoned to perfection!  I really enjoyed this pie and glad that I chose it, with the help from the previous yelp reviews!   Delivery time was fast, and the pie was still hot!  Nicely done!  Big thumbs up!

This place is bit out of the way, being on the far west side of town but if you're in the area, do stop by and try the pizza.  The slices are surprisingly delicious and not like your typical square slice.  The crust was like some fluffy clouds with a nice crusty, crunchy bottom and the toppings fresh and tasty.

The 2 slices I got was the Salsiccia and Burrata.  The burrata slice had this mild, super fluffy melty cheese topped with arugula and cherry tomato and with every bite the silky cheese just wanted to slide off but it was so good that you just wanted to not lose any piece and catch every bite of it.

So if you are ever far west of 55 and 11th, good pizza awaits.

Delicious! I've ordered from here a few times and my orders are always correct and quickly delivered. Salads are fresh. Dressing are delicious. The rosemary bread is INCREDIBLE. I could eat pounds of it! I love it. im addicted to it haha. I wish I could order more of it. I'll definitely be ordering from here again. The pesto is yummy! I usually order the arugula and artichoke salad and caprese salad. The rosemary bread comes with them. Amazing!

We are in the middle of a coronavirus assault and I give Il Baretto's my goddamn business for them to send me a portion size fit for half a Weight Watcher's diet meal. I just ate all the pappardelle, all the bread, and I'm STARVING.

How could you starve me like this? I'm in my bubble at home because if I get sick, I will die. Now, I have no food because Il Baretto's wants me to wither like a flower in October. Most Italian restaurants will give you a circular tin filled with pasta but this one gives you a small plastic rectangle of hatred and hunger.

Don't eat here, don't order here. They'll starve you to the grave.
Excellent pesto tagliatelle with potatoes and string beans as well as pancetta penne pomodoro.  Great Italian on 11th Avenue.

Without a doubt....the BEST pizza in nyc! This small pick up store is Italian authentic, serving by far the best pizza in town. The dough is perfection and ingredients are quality!! All of that, for regular price pizza or even cheaper than usual. I recommend that place if you love pizza.
Delicious pizza... fresh and even better than regular New York style pizza (which I already like!) Can't wait to try the pasta sometime.

Ordered delivery last night fir the first time from this restaurant. As I am gluten free, it can be hard to find a great Italian restaurant making gluten free pasta. We ordered the lobster Mac and WOW it was delicious! I was so impressed! My gluten eating husband said he never would have guessed that it was gluten free pasta. Large chunks of lobster and huge serving size. My son loved the focaccia (he's having it for breakfast too as there was SO much food!) he also enjoyed the steak w/mushrooms, spinach and mashed potato. I'll be making this a part of my ordering in rotation!

Very nice and tasty Italian Pizza with artichokes and ham!
Definitely will order again.
Delivery was quick.

This place has some authentic Italian pizza. I was working in the area and decided to stop in for a slice then went back in for another 2 slices after being so impressed. This is the best pizza you will get in the hells kitchen area. The staff is all super friendly
I was quite impressed with the caprese panini, which was a decent size and fairly priced and tasted good. The only problem I had with this place was how warm it was inside.
I can honestly say that this was the best pizza I've ever had! I had their pizza a couple times and it amazing.

Really love this place! Delicious delicious food. I've tried their pizzas pastas salads espresso .. All of it is fresh, fast and truly Italian perfect for a pre Terminal 5 dinner ! Sad they are closed Sundays, I am craving their Amitriciana pasta!
Thank you Il Baretto!

Quick delicious food! I'm so happy to get a fresh made hot meal on 11th ave. The salads, pasta
and pizza awesome always!! My new favorite go to for Italian eats. Thanks Albeiro for a great conversation and delicious food.

The restaurant is just a block away from my apartment and I was really hoping that it would become a favorite of mine. It will not. I was as disappointed with their food as I've ever been.
The Margherita pizza was flavorless, basically sauce and mozzarella cheese strewn on a rectangular crust. There wasn't even the traditional fresh Basil one is accustomed to enjoying on a Margherita pie.
I also ordered the Burrata Salad which too, was devoid of flavor. Two small pieces of Burrata on top of arugula and sliced hot house tomatoes. Again, no basil and no balsamic reduction, as described on the menu.
Finally, I ordered the Truffle Mac. It was hot but watery and the truffle flavor was overpowering. Chocolate Gelato was good and I certainly had an appetite for it after  pushing the other three items away from me. I was given a 10% discount at the register for take out, as opposed to delivery but I wish I'd spent my $60 somewhere else. Sorry I'll Barreto.
BEST PIZZA I EVER HAD IN MY LIFE - If That's What Pizza Is Supposed To Taste Like I've Been Cheated My Whole Life - Staff Was Also  Very Friendly

Unacceptable for margarita pizza, it was just a cheese pizza, mostly thick dough, sauce tasted like tomato sauce and no basil, when I tried to call to see if they got the order right they never answered the phone. I would not recommend or order from here again.

The cannoli!!!!! Literally had one of those eye closing mmmmmmm moments when I bit into it! I also got a slice of the margarita pizza which was also very tasty- just the right amount of basil! Great place to grab and go find a little spot to eat outside.

My new little gem. The owner is so sweet and so are the employees. I frequent this place for their pizza, truffle mac (so yummy), and my favorite - their tiramisu! Tiramisu is one of my favorite desserts and I love that they make it traditionally. The food here is properly seasoned, clean, & much more authentic than other Italian restaurants in the area. The main Il Baretto restaurant is located a block away and is just as wonderful.

We have been to Il Baretto once and ordered takeout a couple of times. Everything is delicious! My last time ordering takeout we ordered a veggie pizza, which was huge, delicious, and SO reasonably priced. It was just about $20 for the massive pizza, tax, tip, and delivery included! All in all, a very authentic and delicious restaurant for eat-in or delivery.

This is a nice little shop for artisan sandwiches and pizza. The store is nice and clean. Staff is very friendly. Overall, the food is pretty good, particularly the chicken baguette and the margherita slice.
Nailed it. Had the pizza with ham olive and artichoke. Amazing crust. Might have to be a weekly lunch joint...

Their lemon gelato is to die for! I'm pregnant and all I've been eaten is their gelato every chance I get. It's so creamy and has the perfect hint of lemon. And let's not forget the mango. Yummmm!!! If you need a light, quick treat... this is the place to go for gelato. My mouth is currently in heaven.
The salads are large and fresh. Their paninis are just amazingly full of flavor. Personal favorite of the truffle Mac and cheese

Best thing is their delicious Gelato. Pizza is thick crust with a very subtle thin spread on top. Taste good but it's mostly dough if you like that type of pizza. Caesar salad was pretty bland, not fresh made dressing. 2nd to worst was the lobster slider. It was basically a mayo sandwich on big thick buns. The amount and freshness of the lobster was ridiculous. The absolute worst was the steak. It was actually bad. Smelled putrid and the roasted potatoes were cold, hard and one bite tasted like they'd been in the fridge for a week. Disgusting.
I gave it two because I'd like to give the Gelato 5.
Authentic italian pizza. It is consistently delicious and ever disappoints. For take out or delivery.
This place is my go to for take out. Their food is excellent, reasonably priced, usually includes a side of pasta and focaccia. Love it.
This is a great spot for pizza, salads, Italian pasts and homemade gelato! The staff is friendly and the food is awesome
Real authentic Italian pizza, can't believe I've passed this place and never went in. They found a new customer.

This is a good find, great slice, working in the area and found it on Yelp, will be back for more. Would have given it 5 stars but I don't give out 5 stars on one visit, but I'm pretty sure my next try will get all 5. Clean and friendly place with fair prices.

Top notch food at an unassuming "take away". I have regularly been eating Il Baretto and now Il Baretto To Go cuisine for at least 7 years and always loving it. Ingredients are fresh (emphasize fresh) and of a high quality. The kitchen consistently prepares dishes as good as a Michelin starred restaurant (if not better). Love the lamb sliders, salads with Baretto lemon dressing, salmon, pastas, béchamel lasagna, chicken parmigiana and on and on. If you need a sweet there's gelato or other Italian goodies. Staff always responsive and on time service.

I love this place, for dining in or carrying out for convenience. When I lived at the Mercedes House it was my 'go to' place and I love sitting streetside in the Spring and Summer. They have the best Chocolate Mousse if you're dining in, it's a must!
I am in town for a trade show. Wish I had found this gem earlier. The people are great and the cherry tomato pizza with burrata is so so so good!

07.08.2019

Little O got a roasted duck sandwich from here. She started to eat it but the flat bread was too much for her. She took it upon herself and ended up opening the wrap and eating the duck and veggies. The small amount I was able to eat was pretty good. I enjoyed the flatbread which was definitely grilled before being stuffed with yummy duck, veggies and sauce.

The small amount of duck I did taste was tender and had good flavor. I enjoyed the sauce in the wrap. All the flavors and ingredients went well together. I wouldn't mind coming back to have one myself.
Love this restaurant so much! Amazing food and ambience. Will be returning in the near future.

Despite all the restaurants located in the heart of Times Square, it's not that easy to decide what to eat if you only have 45 mins. Pizza? Hmmm... Burgers and fries? Maybe next time. Thai or Italian? Well just had it the last few days. At the end, we decided to return to the City Kitchen.

The Box seemed interesting. Got the Lebanese salad and pita chips. Pretty simple meal was what I wanted. Salad was fresh and pita chips were great.

We sat by the window to get a view of 8th Ave from the second floor seating. Place was half empty and no lines for any of the eatery.

I'm loving the location of this bougie food court.  Lots of space (if you consider the hotel lobby too) and ample air conditioning (also look to the lobby).  Perfect for a not-that-expensive and not-that-insane pre-theater meal.

8-Hr Lamb Wrap: So delicious!  I didn't see a large spit roasting this shawarma, but it still managed to be nice and crispy without that griddle-to-reheat taste.  The wrap was soft and chewy yet had some bits of crunch from the quick grilling.  Tons of tasty sauces and veggies instead.

Roasted Duck Wrap: Wasn't a big fan.  Was hoping it would either have the rich duck confit vibe or be crispy like peking duck.  It was neither, but tasted more like those roast ducks hanging in windows in Chinatown.  Had the unappealing cold fatty taste.

Phoenician Fries: Loved the garlic based dipping sauce.  The fries by themselves weren't that exciting and a bit soggy at times, but totally doesn't matter thanks to the sauce.

Labne: Was hoping the texture would be whipped and/or creamy, but it was more like someone took a tub of Philadelphia Cream Cheese out of the fridge.  Also, no interesting spices to flavor it up.

Lemonade: Standard.

Kimchee wrap: hardly any kimchee, meat was mushy, contents were over salted, tasteless. Thankfully I had split this with a coworker so I was spared from eating the other half.

The only reason we ended up at Ilili was because we were in a pinch to see a musical across the street and needed a quick option. Lo and behold, the only station without a line in this food hall was Ilili Box.. probably for good reason. Sad I didn't see the writing on the wall.

Stick to the store front restaurant on 28st . Don't waste your time or money on bad service, expensive food where the fries have no taste.

Fries seem to be the opposite of the actual restaurant these were precut frozen fries.
Asked for salt after we all sat at our table to eat and unanimously stated theres no flavor. Did we order the wrong thing? which they were hesitant to do so they asked me to pay for salad oil, salt or seasoning to add to the fries. We were a group of five who ordered the fries at my recommendation which sadly we all threw away. Garlic whip sauce was only flavor to the fries. The fries had no parsley as described.

The lamb wrap was ok, lamb and sauce of wrap were tasty.

Green tea was surprisingly refreshing at first the taste is of lime.

Update:
See image attached as I was direct messaged by an "employee" who stated I was a liar. My intention was to advised yelpers of my experience and their response clearly shows the level of professionalism and customer service.

Also My initial order was taken by a middle aged man, I was attended by a female employee when I was asking if there were any other variation of fries as I thought perhaps I made the mistake. Who rolled her eyes at every question without assistance. The other employee was a smaller young male working the grill whom I did not speak with. The older employee who took my order was not there when we went back to ask for help.

3/5 because
The food isn't really good
Seems like they're understaffed and have an extensive menu to keep up with

Considering the space I wasn't expecting a full restaurant menu but they have plenty of options to choose from

The food arrived pretty quickly though it almost shows in the food how quick it was

The place is clean
Good sized seating area that is shared with neighboring markets, has space for plenty of people

The service is friendly  
The quality that you get is below average even when factoring the smaller kitchen and staff

Wouldn't come back here

The falafel crumbled up like dry cornbread, not sure how that happened but the only way to eat it was with a spoon or fork

The wrap fell apart and got soggy from the sauce even though somehow the inside stayed dry

There isn't enough greens and pickles to offset the flavors dry falafel for a fresher taste

Cool idea, cool menu, not great product

Stopped in to City Kitchen during the break between HP&TCC parts 1 and 2 and ordered a BLT Pita Wrap. It took a shockingly long time for it to be ready but smelled amazing when it was done. I went over to the seats we had found to eat it and it basically disintegrated as I unwrapped it. The pita was not warm (which is weird since it was just in the heated press?) and was old and cracked. I had to eat it over a napkin so I could pick up the pieces as they fell.

It tasted good, but it was a mess to eat. IDK if I would choose this again. The fries looked banging and I wish I had ordered them.

After checking in to our hotel, I pulled out my trusty Yelp app, and it lead me to City Kitchen: NYC Food Hall. After checking out all the options, I noticed that ilili Box clearly had the longest line, so it must be good!

I loved my duck wrap! Not sure what the yogurty/white sauce was, but it was sure tasty! The duck was tender, plentiful and a little oily. Grab a lot of napkins, because it got really messy! My date and I sipped on mint lemonade, which was a delightfully refreshing.

Great place to go for a quick meal on the go!

I am so glad I stumbled on to this place. Thank you for the introduction MealPal! Every menu item is absolutely delicious! I especially loved the duck rice bowl. It's essentially a duck gyro with delicious tasing rice and sauce. The flavors are amazing. I've been to ilili for restaurant week and was blown away by the portion and taste and ilili bowl definitely met my expectations. I was glad to be able to try almost everything on their menu through MealPal. Im definitely going to order the Brussels sprout side dish next because the ingredients sound like they would taste awesome together.

This location in City Kitchen is just amazing. The hotel has a wonderful green tea smell and there is a lot of seating space.
Ordered the greek salad and was very good but the toppings were a little stale. Good customer service.

My fiancée and I grabbed a falafel wrap to go right before checking out a play nearby. The service was quick. The wrap was flavorful and filling. It's located in a food court with several other options nearby. Seating was limited and shared with the other vendors in the food court.

I was staying at The Row hotel, accompanying this "upscale" food court with many options, and for breakfast the ilili Box menu caught my eye. For a fair (for NYC) price, I got a hearty and delicious breakfast. Huge mound of fluffy, delicious scrambled eggs (I added chives), zaatar potatoes (my new favorite!!), sausage links (meh and greasy), pita bread and a drink (coffee, juice or bottled water). Guests of the hotel get 10% off.

The food was so good, quick, and plentiful that I came back the next morning. Quick, clean and yummy - exactly what I needed to fuel a big day of work.
I LOVED the pork buns!!! They are my new favorite food! The bun was so fluffy and pork had a great hint of sweetness. I am obsessed!

Here's what I think of my visit to ilili Box, where I had a Spicy Chicken wrap (aka chicken shawarma).
- The shawarma was good, but wasn't the best I've had.
- The cold one wasn't a very good one.
- Holy moly, that was some pricey meal. Almost $19 for a wrap and a drink in a NYC's food court.
- Easy access from where I was staying at Row Hotel. Take out, lay back and bon appétit.

Three and half Yelps.

The City Kitchen eatery is cute.  Many choices, including The Box.  We had the chicken BLT and the Silk Road Falafel. The falafel was fabulous.  Crispy, full of flavor, including a cashew and sauce. The sauce on the chicken was also very good.  Great place to sit by the window and people watch at 44th street.

Loved the dinner I got here! It was Saturday night but a little on the late side so eatery wasn't too busy.

I had the Korean wrap and green lemonade. The wrap was so delicious, lots of flavor, filling, not too greasy. They had several veggie options on the menu.

The green lemonade was refreshing and not too sweet.

Price was decent.

Anytime I am passing by times square, I can't resist not to pass by this store and grab a box of Brussel sprouts and Phoenician fries and a lemonade juice.
As good as the main Ilili restaurant on 5th avenue.

In a crowded space of med rice bowl places that includes places like Roti this one does not stand out.  Portion was decent and food tasted okay.  Spicy chicken did not have much spice.  Also not much variety as only get a little bit of lebanese salad.  They could use to add one free option from among feta, olives and onions for same  price as for what get is a bit much.  Also add some sauces like a garlic tahini or hot sauce.  The homemade hot sauce cost 1 extra.  Located within one of the food courts with a few other choices so really nothing to say about space other than when tried to log in to city kitchen WiFi was asked to provide row hotel room number.  Most places like this provide free WiFi

I liked the sauce in the duck rice bowl, but wish it had veggies too. I did get the Brussels sprouts as well, but they contained walnuts, which I am allergic to! And there was no mention of it on their menu board!!  they should specify that for people with allergies!

----------------------

I just checked their website and do see walnuts under the Brussels sprouts there, but it was not on the menu board at this location

Okay, I don't know what the bad reviews are about. I got the chicken BLT with a side of fries and holy cow this was absolutely delicious !!!! The service was super fast and the food is great. The only issue I had was the the lady who took our order was sitting on her phone and we had to ask for her attention to order but I understand it may get boring to be stuck there for hours upon hours so I won't let that decrease the review because the food was totally awesome !

When I was using MealPal for dinner, this place became my go-to takeout dinner spot. I've never been to ilili (definitely on my list!), but this place serves quality food that I've enjoyed pretty thoroughly throughout many times I've picked up from here.

I can't really speak to anything except their rice bowls, but all 3 are good. My personal preference is probably duck, chicken, then lamb. They give you a ton of meat, and the garlic whip is so good on everything. The meat itself is pretty delicious too--I can't remember it ever feeling dry. Definitely don't go too far with these bowls because it's best warm. The combination of flavors honestly make me feel like I could eat some of these bowls forever, especially the chicken. Speaking from personal taste, I'm not sure if the vegetable ingredients work as well as I want for their 8-Hour Lamb Shoulder, but the lamb itself is great.

Some of their other stuff also looks pretty good, so maybe I'll try those and update my review sometime down the line, but for now, I see little reason to veer away from the rice bowls. My only complaint is that it's too far from where I work!

This place was part of the kind of food court connected to our hotel. They were pretty nice at this location. They offer wraps that have some different meats inside. We got a couple of things off of their menu. The 8 hour lamb for the wife and the duck for me. They were wrapped in a crispy something. The something was kind of hard and hard to chew. It just broke up as I chewed it. It was easier just to eat the meat out of it. The dusk was tasty with a good spicy package. Name them all I can't but it was a good combination. The same for the lamb it was over done in my eyes. I'm mean it wasn't bad food but it really didn't wow us.

A small group of friends and I stopped by this restaurant for a quick bite to eat before heading to a  broadway show.  We ordered the falafel wrap, the sliced chicken bowl, and the lamb bowl. Unfortunately something was wrong with the food and two of the people in my group started to immediately feel sick right after lunch. The food was pretty greasy and just okay. Not worth the potential food poisoning.

Location: Aimed for City Kitchen, I got surprised that it is where ilili box located. WOW, okay, let's have some Mediterranean food for lunch. The line is long, why, pretty much because the cashier is trying to be nice to every female customers. Alright, while I was waiting, I looked through all those items on the menu.
There's a lot of people hanging around here. Some who dressed well seems to be people who work in the neighborhood, others look like visitors who want to eat every single piece before leaving NYC.
PS. No seat as always.

Food: Okay, wraps seem to be a good choice for lunch. But the fries seem to be also delicious. What should I eat? Okay, falafel korean wrap. Why? Cuz my new resolution for 2016 is to be a vegetarian. Now, falafel seems to be the ideal choice.
And it was delicious. I personally, love their korean sauce. Well balanced but not too spicy.

Although the wrap is small, which is the ideal size for my appetite, I still cannot believe it is only 7 dollars. Okay, I guess no more cynical reviews. Then let's end with Bon Appetite!

3.5 for food.

Really solid wraps.  The lamb was super tender, and the falafel was really flavorful.  Only non positive is despite being good, falafel wasn't very hot, so probably not fresh fried.  Wouldn't mind a little more sauce too, but that's really nit picking.

My order was perfect. I love the restaurant on 5th and I rarely order in but was wanting good Mediterranean food and couldn't go out so I ordered Brussel sprouts, rice and kebab, hummus and fries. Everything was great! Highly recommend.

Been to their restaurant in Flatiron and I'm glad to have had a chance to stop here. The phonecian fries with garlic whip is absolutely heavenly! I went with the dick wrap which was good but a tad bit too sweet, will try the Korean falafel next time!

I used to eat lunch here at least 3x a week at the location in Madison sq park. They had this best deal in town. The chicken or the chicken blt in a "box" it was the perfect portion. Nice and large. And it was light on the carbs. In fact they used to have all these options available in the "box" format.

Recently I discovered that they have other locations. So I went here and to my disappointment this option is now gone. Not sure why they would remove it, probably the worst decision.

I'll prob stop by once a year for those fries, but you definitely lost a customer by removing the best lunch option in midtown

I ordered the "falafel korean" pita wrap which ended up being a great choice. I wasn't sure how the mediterranean-korean fusion would taste but I was pleasantly surprised (I even added hot sauce from the taco place next door which also oddly worked). It was filling, just a little spicy, and the kimchi added a really cool texture. My friend ordered the lamb wrap and also thought it was good.

Sorely disappointed. I heard AMAZING things about the restaurant ilili so naturally when nothing else was appealing at city kitchen, the best option was ilili Box. I love Mediterranean and ilili has been forever bookmarked on yelp for me to try. I was excited to get a little taste! I asked the man behind the cashier what he likes and he said to try the duck rice box. I decided to trust him and got it! It was COLD!! The duck was cold, the rice was all clumpy and not even warm in the slightest. I love scallion but boy oh boy, I don't need 2 whole stalks of it!! There was some sort of spicy mayo on it and it was way too rich. I should've just stuck to the ramen 2 doors down... never again! But I'll still try ilili.

Was very pleasantly surprised by this place, the Beiruti falafel wrap ($9.50) was delicious. It's not the hockey puck dense falafel, but one that crisps away in your mouth. The wraps are made to order, you get a buzzer but the food is ready very fast. There's lots of freshly chopped mint and thin sliced pickled turnips, very refreshing and delicious. Was barely able to finish the wrap, it's huge and very filling. Table seating is very limited, if you are lucky to get one of the 3 tables, expect to get asked if you are using a seat many times. Plenty of high chair stools but they are not comfortable. It was not crowded at 5:30pm but around 7pm it got packed with people hovering around.

The spicy chicken wrap is to die for. I love the sumac garlic whip they use. Been meaning to try the other wraps but because they dont come with the sumac garlic sauce I always keep getting the chicken wrap. I ordered the Phoenician fries once because let's be real, it sounds like it'll be a flavor explosion. Sadly it's not!it taste just like regular salted fries, I was really disappointed. I also couldn't tell if the specks on the fries was seasoning(it didn't taste like any particular seasoning) or it was just from the dirty oil. Anyway, I'll be going back for the wraps.

As I've learned from Brooklyn Nine-Nine, which is obviously a 100% accurate depiction of the city, New Yorkers care a lot about "mouth feel" when eating. And the actual grilled wrap component of my lamb shoulder wrap felt damn good in my mouth. The experience of chewing it was a sheer joy. I'm less enthusiastic about the lamb insides where the dominant flavor was salty, and other flavors were hard to discern. Other wraps, such as my date's duck wrap. might not suffer from this problem.

The biggest problem plaguing all the wraps, however, is the lack of a plate. The wraps are a drippy mess, and, by the transitive property of drippy messes, my pants got a little messy as well. Prodigious amounts of napkins were required. You can't take me anywhere.

Summary: Wrap that rascal.

Love Ilili but Ilili box is the bland-er version of a beloved restaurant. I had a wrap that was a bit dry and served cold (vs. the bread being warmed up). Most disappointing, I ordered a side of hummous and labne and both were very flavorless - I was expecting some olive oil, spices, better seasoning on it, but it was a very basic (and pricey) meal. Too bad!

I have been to the physical Ilili once with a group of my friends and I would say the Ilili box essentially carried over the most amazing dishes at Ilili. We ordered the roasted duck pita wrap for share - the bread was so crispy that it almost cracked in my mouth! The duck meat was tender and mixed itself perfectly well with the special white sauce! I would love to try their other wraps as well as over rice series.

Awesome place. Delicious food! LOTS of fries  the food was absolutely delicious I got a chicken BLT same as my bf. I devoured it very quickly. The service was a little rough because the lady was ignoring us in her phone but she was nice once we got her attention
ITS DELICIOUS! This is one of my favorite places to order lunch from to work. They've never messed up my order and the food arrives intact.
There is dry,  there is drier and than there is Ilili Box's falafel wrap.  Please try harder,  I'd like to come back and refer friends.
A great spot for lunch or dinner in midtown. Especially if you're going to the theatre. The duck and chicken shawarma with sumac toum is my go to. The brussel sprouts are excellent as well.

After hearing rave-reviews from a knowledgable cousin for the main restaurant I was pleasantly surprised to see this mini-Ilili @ this hotel on 8th ave. steps from my theatre on 45th street.  Ordered the hummus & Beruiti falafel wrap.  The humus was smooth but a bit flat.  I liked the lifit (picketed turnip) on the wrap but the falafel had an crumbly texture--not as crisply fried as most.  Novel concept--kind of like a mini/food court in Hotel in lieu of a traditional restaurant (& I mean that in the
Classiest sense of the words food court).

Came back here because I was craving the duck rice box. Got the combo again. The gal working the front could not be bothered. Though she was so cold she kept her arms in her shirt though she had a sweater tied around her neck.

Looks like they've halved their portions and the duck was missing whatever greens were on it last time. The guy cooking the food was friendly but I think overlooked the Brussels sprouts because the gal left and he had to also work the register.

Probably won't be back. No more cravings.

Service: Cashier doesn't look at you, customers in line looking at each other - wondering if they had ordered already because the cashier isn't acknowledging anyone, he continues to talk to other workers before asking you "Yeah?"

Food:
Spicy chicken over rice - Overall: very bland. Rice was mushy and over cooked. Chicken bland, not sure where they got the "Spicy" in Spicy chicken. When I asked for some hot sauce they charged $1 extra.

Roast duck over rice - Overall: too creamy. In addition to the mushy over-cooked rice, they added too much sauce/base which made it a little too savory.

Green lemonade - Made of Lemonade + Cucumber + couple other things. It tastes like pickle juice. I like pickles, I like pickle back shots, but I wasn't in the mood to drink pickle juice with my meal.

The food is always fresh, healthy and affordable. The staff at the location on 8th Ave (Times Square) are always super friendly and quick in processing the orders. I'm there at least three to four days a week. I can't get enough of 'ilili Box', and once you try their food, you'll feel the same.

I ordered the chicken rice bowl. The food was good but a bit dry. However the portion was generous. We also got the fries which were really good and unique. I also enjoyed the green lemonade but wouldn't go out of my way to stop just to get it there.

I would never have thought that when I came to this place, aside from the other stalls such as Ippudu ramen, Lukes Lobster and sushi, that I had my eye on this place. Don't get me wrong, Ippudu ramen and Lukes Lobster is a class of its own specialty. So I thought of trying out this place, ordered the duck on rice combo which comes with the main duck on rice sided with fries and green lemonade. The duck on rice was everything that I have expected, the umami from the duck fat just adds extra flavour to the rice when eaten together, and I also like how they do not cheat on the green onions as they fill it up till its being flatten by the packaging. The fries was good for the first half of it, since the flavour is so strong it went the other direction when chowing the rest of it. The salty flavour becomes too much and its becomes tough to eat the rest, on top of that it dehydrates you quite abit which you turn to a lemonade drink ( you know how that will go). I was hoping that it would be sugar cane drink, but if it was it would have been perfect.

Would give this another go and recommend others!
Pretty good wraps in one of my favorite food markets in the city. Can't go wrong with these wraps, even though they are a little bit on the expensive side. At least they're tasty, right?

I was really looking forward to trying this place but when I stopped by, the girl who worked there didn't bother looking up from her phone to acknowledge me.  I walked around the food hall and came back ready to order.  I stood there for a few minutes and she still did not look up.  After she finally did without saying a word, I shook my head and walked away.  Terrible service.
I got the duck wrap, not tasty at all, meat dry and not good ! Not recommending at all.

I ate here twice during my stay at The Row hotel. I got the egg blt wrap every time, it was amazing! They put a mayonnaise sauce on it that just made it over the top! I want to come back here for one!

I've been here three times thus far. the first since it was the closest japanese place to my work.

The lunch specials are can't be beat except by teriyaki boy up the street but the food here is better.

it's small but great for take out

Izumi Haru Sushi you are absolutely outstanding, I had a spectacular experience here yesterday. Nice, welcoming and reasonably priced. Every single thing that I have tried has been rather tasty. Wonderful afternoon and the staff is wonderful! Overall, I really like this place. Highly recommend Izumi Haru Sushi.
The food here is amazing !  And my server , Pam , was just the best !!!  Pam has a wonderful knowledge of the menu and great personality
Pamela was greattt ! Checked in regularly to see if anything was needed! Great service! First time coming here and can't wait to come back.

Half the table were vegetarians and we enjoyed the crispy brussel sprouts and spinach with sesame side dishes and our orders of vegie rolls. The other half of the table said their sushi and sashimi was excellent. Reasonable price and good service. We enjoyed the evening.

Rainy evening, long waits at other restaurants = Izumi Haru

Cheap is the key word here.
"Regular" rolls were about $4ish-$5?
Special rolls (with no. of pieces indicated) : $12ish
Soft shell crab: 2 for $8? Came out cold though...:(
Tempura: 3 shrimps and couple vegs
Unagi dinner meal was about $8?

Food wasn't all that fantastic, but for that price in that area...why not?

Tip-bits:

Pick-ups seem quick
Delivery available
Small place, only several tables
Lunch specials available

Basic and bad.  Fish seemed old, rice was bad.

I've had sushi served on a conveyor belt that was better than this.

I've only gotten the delivery.  

The food reminds me of what you can get at the ready-to-go section at a Japanese supermarket.  If you're expecting some sort of high-end Japanese cuisine, you are bound to be disappointed.  

This is junky (in a good way) Japanese comfort food that comes with the added benefit of delivery.  

A great, inexpensive option if you know what to expect.

I thought this place was bad the first time around but I was kind enough to give them a second chance by eating here with my boyfriend. Uh well that was a mistake!! Big mistake!!

The food itself is just OK. Nothing to get all excited about but definitely not bad. What made my skin crawl like never before was the drunk, high or just plain dumb customer they allowed to sit inside their restaurant.

She was screaming that she wanted items from their "unlimited sushi" menu. Every time she finished something she screamed that she wanted more! "Can I get more SAKE"!! "Can you bring us out more spider rolls with extra spider"!!!!!! I couldn't wait until she started to eat because I thought she would finally shut up! WRONG! She just kept talking and yelling so loud and acting like a obnoxious 10 year old! She was eating her sushi with her hands and dipping it into sauce like chicken nuggets. Normally I would just mind my own business when it comes to a persons table manors or lack their of but I couldn't help but notice because she was chewing with her mouth open and smacking her lips like a cow. What topped it all off was when she started belching.....loudly! Finally I had enough! "Really"? "Really"? I asked her. She apologized and followed with the classic low class fraze "Well in some countries its a compliment to the chef it you burp". I would really like to know what country that is because my boyfriend is from France and he was equally disgusted.

WHY DIDN'T THEY KICK HER OUT OF THE RESTAURANT?!

Now I would never usually add a customers behavior in my own personal judgment of a restaurant but this person was seriously ruining our dinner. Cheap sushi or not the fact that they were bringing her out more and more sake was just ridiculous. I could tell that the man she was with was somewhat embarrassed as well because he did not once turn around when I told her she was disgusting.

I WILL NEVER EVER EAT HERE OR ORDER FROM HERE AGAIN!

I've tried five different items from their menu, and although it's hard to hate them when they're so reasonably priced and generous with portion sizes, none of the ingredients are of very good quality. It's not bad, nothing is horrible, but nothing is exemplary or excellent. To be honest, nothing is even very good, but if you want extra mediocre ginger and extra mediocre wasabi, they'll gladly accomidate. Also, their delivery people are lighting fast and extremely friendly, though that's not reason enough for me to ever order from them again. There's better elsewhere, although this area is definitely lacking superior alternatives.

The prices here are reasonable/cheap and the food was alright.  The miso soup was average if not salty, and the fish wasn't bad.

I got the Sushi A combo which came with a CA roll and 8 pieces of nigiri. The nigiri was good.  The rice was decent and the fish was relatively fresh.  The CA roll was disappointing.  I guess it's the standard imitation crab in the CA roll, but it's far better when the CA roll has that crab chopped up and mixed with some good ol' mayo.  

Overall, a very typical sushi place.  If you don't expect much, you won't be disappointed.
I ordered three sushi rolls.... they were UGH! They tasted OLD and spoilt....I will never order sushi from this place!
Excellent choice before I caught a show. I managed to catch a seat at the bar before it began to get busy.

I owe, what has now become one of my favorite Italian restaurants, an updated review.
A matinee Broadway musical, Sweeney Todd (which was phenomenal) deserved a stellar dinner and Il Punto immediately came to mind.

I tried this restaurant several months ago and meant to return sooner but time just flew. This visit was the perfect opportunity to ensure an excellent dinner.

Upon entering, the manager, Antonio and I hugged as though we were longtime friends. This guy is just amazing--he not only treats everyone like family, but has excellent taste and makes really good recommendations.

For starters, I felt like having a Lambrusco and was offered a taste. Since it was a bit on the sweeter  side, Antonio suggested mixing it with Prosecco. Viola! A very delicious cocktail. Their Aperol Spritz was also well made and comes recommended if you're a fan.

For appetizers, I had to order again their Gelato Insalata. This salad is a must try. Gelato is used as the dressing for the salad which included grilled Shrimp (yum), shaved Parm (double yum), blackberries , tomatoes and a couple other salad ingredients. By far, unlike anything you've tasted.
The special salad of the day , Spinach with Mango (and more) was offered to us gratuitously. This was excellent and so refreshing.

We also ordered the Caponata as an additional appetizer. Opinion? I thought my parents or grandmother made this in their kitchen. It had all the authentic Sicilian flavors that makes Caponata so good.
