We both selected  the same entree--Black Linguine with Seafood. I have had this pasta dish elsewhere at so many restaurants but none compares to Il Punto. A generous portion that included--Scallops, Shrimps, Calamari, Mussels and Clams--theirs was executed very well. My mouth waters just writing this review. At that point, I was getting very full and packed the rest of the pasta to go especially with dessert coming up.

We ordered a traditional Sicilian dessert which was a stuffed almond  cookie with a dollop of gelato. Out of this world delicious.
The dessert didn't end there. We were surprised with the MUST try Pistachio Tiramisu.  A tiramisu unlike anything you've tried. Made with Sicilian  pistachios. Excellent.

When we wrapped up our fantastic dining experience, we agreed on the following:
I'll Punto is a top Italian restaurant that offers a superb dining experience.
Antonio and staff are very accommodating and you're able to modify a dish on the menu. Example--Chicken Marsala instead of Veal listed on the menu.
The interior is charming and you'll be thinking about the meal you had for days to follow.

I know I did.

Love this place! Staff is friendly, service is fast, food is so so delicious!

I came with a friend for dinner and ordered a Pinot Noir, the arancino and the orecchiette with sausage and broccoli rabe. The dishes were well made and flavorful. I was deciding between two dishes when I ordered and the server guided me to the orecchiette since the pasta was homemade! It was an excellent choice.

Compared to how quickly they took our order and  served our food, it seemed like it took awhile to get the check (though the restaurant did seem to get a bit packed toward the end of dinner so totally understandable).

The restaurant doesn't look like much from the outside but inside the crowd is buzzing with energy and the place is packed with diners.

The pasta was so so good, I will definitely be back!! I want to try a bunch of other stuff from the menu (including some of the mouthwatering looking desserts). 5 stars all around.

Fantabulous dinner at this restaurant. The food wine and desserts were just incredible. And the ambience and service was superb.
Highly recommend the arugula pear salad, mushroom risotto and the almond cake dessert. Can't wait to be back here!

A cozy Italian restaurant with some great food! We ordered appetizers to share for the table and our own entrees. The appetizers didn't stand out much to me, and I thought the carpaccio was not worth (super thin slices of meat, mostly arugula). However I got the special of the day which was lamb chops, and they were cooked to PERFECTION! A beautiful pink medium rare and the balsamic glaze and potatoes were delicious. The free warm bread and EVOO + balsamic is a classic.

While visiting in NY, we had a long day and really wanted some good quality Italian food. My husband read reviews on this spot and luckily, they were able to accommodate our party of 4 for dinner. The location was not very large, and was very busy (as we were traveling in mid-December), so we called ahead earlier in the day. When we arrived about 10 minutes prior to our reservation time, we only had to wait a few minutes before being seated. The welcome was very genuine, and we were greeted with a smile. As far as first impressions go for an Italian restaurant in New York? This was outstanding.

The ambience here is so cozy and comfortable. You really feel like you're dining in someone's house, which is something we love about smaller Italian restaurants. The severs were also very friendly, knowledgeable, and happy to provide recommendations based on our preferences. I opted for the chicken parmesan and the tomato sauce was SO DELICIOUS. I can certainly see why it was a recommendation. My husband ordered a special ravioli that they had, and it was devoured very quickly; I think he liked it. The plates are elegantly dressed, and the prices are reasonable seeing the quality and experience you receive while dining here. There are so many dining options in NY, so it's nice to visit a place with reasonable pricing and amazing food and drinks. We will definitely be back to try other menu items - bravo!

Wow! Wow! Wow! Food was outstanding! Service...brilliant! Sat at the bar and it was a real treat! Miquel at the bar was all over all of it!  Hustling! Engaging! This place is my new spot and if your are anywhere around Time Square, love Italian food, and skip this place...you've missed out!

Made a reservation and yet were seated outdoors and had to wait for them to arrange a table for us, so clearly the reservation was irrelevant. The service was very very slow, took far too long to get our food, and the food itself was nothing exciting. Don't particularly see a reason to come back.

So good!  Nice cozy little restaurant with great service and delicious food. They had a lot of nice pasta options on the menu including zucchini noodles.  Would definitely return. My husband has the chicken Milanese salad and a lentil soup. Both were delicious. I had the zucchini noodles with sausage and broccoli rabe. So good!!

I found this place when we were looking for a restaurant to celebrate our anniversary. I was curious about the gelato salad that has been mentioned in Yelp and Google reviews. Il punto definitely exceeded my expectations. The flavor of the food is definitely on point just like its name. Service was great. All staff members are  truly committed to deliver the best service. Antonio, the manager , was super friendly and welcoming. I felt like I had known him for a long time. He truly made our anniversary dinner very special.

Compliment bread was fresh and soft and the bread sticks is addicting.

Appetizer: I highly recommended the fried calamari. Very crunchy batter and the calamari was not rubbery. . It's served with marinara and spicy dipping.

Salad with gelato: it's a must. You will not regret it because you cannot find it anywhere else. The shrimps were fresh, the blackberries were also fresh lighten up the salad. The shaved Parmesan gave enough saltiness to the salad. The server mixed the gelato dressing at the table. It was an excellent salad. I overheard the guy next to me said that he had never had anything like this.

Entrée : I picked branzino special of the night served with fresh crab meat and spinach. Fish was cooked perfectly with crispy skin. Crab meat was fresh and sweet. Beautiful presentation. Flavor is on point.

We had been waiting for the entree quite a while and I had to ask about it. However, Antonio nicely compensated that with amazing desserts for our anniversary celebration.

Pistachio tiramisu: he even put a candle on top. Very sweet. I  enjoy the lady fingers and I can taste the pistachio. Very light dessert. So delicious.

Almond cookies with jam fillings: the cookies were served with ice cream and it had very authentic flavor. The cookies really took me to Italy m. Very special, you cannot find it anywhere.

I really thank Antonio and his staff for a wonderful dinner experience.

Grazie mille. Siamo davvero felici e soddisfatti.

Il punto is definitely a gem.
Great food and great service! I had Burrata and Branzino both were specials and they were definitely special! The cannoli dessert was great too.

This place has to be one of my favorite restaurants in the city, and certainly in the neighborhood. It's a no frills Italian restaurant with amazing, homemade pastas and excellent service.

Highly recommend the orecchiette and the squid ink pasta, as well as the fettuccine when they have it (they have daily fresh pasta specials in addition to the fresh pastas on the regular menu). I also love the seafood salad and also enjoyed the gelato salad, which is quite interesting (literally gelato in salad - don't knock it before you try it).

So in love with this place and could not recommend it more. We have been regulars here the last two years and will continue coming back for years to come!

Landed here after a business meeting in HUdson Yards, and it was a solid choice! Great service in a comfy atmosphere.

The mozzarella was fresh and delicious, even if the tomatoes weren't quite in season. The calamari appetizer was outstanding, with spicy aioli. Everyone enjoyed their dinners, which included lamb chops, a timbali, various pastas. Thumbs up to everything!

Dessert was a variety of sweets, which were also a big hit!

We discovered this place at the last minute, as it was within walking distance to our Yotel hotel. We were exhausted after a day of NY exploring and cancelled at a restaurant further away. This restaurant said it was "kid friendly" but looked very fancy on the Yelp reviews. That said, it WAS! :) They put us in the back room that was more spacious and the food and service were INCREDIBLE (and I'm an Italian food snob). Highly recommend, popular hole in the wall, and would definitely give 2 thumbs up to!

TL;DR: Great place no-frills in Hells Kitchen, especially if you are looking for dinner after a Broadway show or Javits center convention.

The design of the restaurant is a little confusing, with colors that seem to have more of a Mexican feel, but the Italian sounding name got us in for some pre-race.

Free bread + breadsticks was a great touch and you could tell the waiter really cared about the business; he was very attentive and non pushy.

The Timbalo (béchamel beef pasta) was decent--not too many  robust flavors, just a hearty dish overall. The lobster ravioli, on the other hand, was amazing! Creamy, nicely salted sauce with the right amount of ravioli filling.

This place is excellent for good service and food without the strain of dressing up or putting up with crowds!

I have been to Here twice and both time it has not disappointed ! Firstly, the service is impeccable and makes the dining experience even more special . We ordered Calamari and a Caesar to start - both were excellent ! After , I had the salmon while my colleague had eggplant - also quite good ! If you want some solid Italian food with great service - you should certainly try Punto!!
Very good! 10/10! Go try in New York! It's an Italian restaurant. Very yummy! Try now'

We chanced upon this place as we were staying at a hotel nearby and glad we did! The staff was so pleasant and friendly.. smiling. The food was great! The branzino fish special was amazing and so was the mushroom risotto! The ambiance inside was very nice, though the exterior "add-on room" made us think twice before we went in.. so dont be deterred by the exterior and take the plunge - you will not regret it.
Fantastic food, great service! Had a special, a branzino dish that was amazing! Highly recommend!

Shocked....that I have never been here before and i've lived in the area for 5yrs. Shame on me. The chicken parm was awesome, chicken was seasoned and not overdone with the sauce & cheese. The pasta is still on my mind. Service was attentive. It was packed on a Tuesday which tells a lot! Will be back again.

Great food, excellent dessert!

The Cioppino was amazing everything was cooked to perfection.   Can't eat at a place like this and not have the tiramisu it was also delicious!
Penne Al pesto with salmon...really great.  Delicious food, good ambiance, attentive servers, nice old fashioned.  All in all quality food authentic Italian.  Try the pistachio tiramisu!

We wanted a place off the beat and path and my son found this place. The food was amazing! Every fresh, well salted, great quality, and the portion was just right. We had 2 lobster ravioli plates, a lasagna, and a chicken fettuccine Alfredo. Highly recommend that you eat here.

Amazing service great food with an amazing location my group was bud a time constraints and the staff was more then accommodating the food came out quickly and tasted amazing my friend Hamez's stomach was a bit up set afterwards but that was because he was chugging milk earlier not because of the food. Needless to say we left more then satisfied except for Hamez his stomach was very unsatisfied. Good food tho

We love the food and the service!  We had the seafood black ink pasta, ravioli w lobster meat, drinks, gelato salad, pistachio tiramisu and a macchiato.  Everything was outstanding, especially the gelato salad! And the macchiato was authentic- just like how it was when I was in Italy.  Antonio and the staff were super attentive and friendly.  This was wonderful experience!  Highly recommend!
Food was amazing  service impeccable- very friendly staff - manager  we will definitely return  thanks for a great evening-

Just wow! We were in New York City and a friend of a friend had recommended Il Punto. We were able to make reservations on Valentines Day. We were wowed from the minute we walked in...we were  greeted and seated. Water and bread appeared almost immediately. I was unsure about which wine I wanted so I was offered a taste of two wines. I had the Mushroom Risotto and my husband had the Bolognese. Both were delicious! I always have to look at the dessert menu, but didn't order anything. A few minutes later we were served shots of Limoncello "since we didn't order dessert". Such a nice gesture- and the Limoncello was house made and delicious! Everything was perfect- the ambiance, the service and the food. Will definitely return on our next visit to NYC.
Delicious food and excellent service.  The burrata appetizer was amazing!  Drinks were very tasty.  Highly recommend!
Cozy spot for Italian dishes. The Frutti so Mari was outstanding and are every bite. Good drinks and house wine. Not a big place, but very good food and service!

Best meal I've had in a long time! My daughters and I shared the caprese and the gelato salad. We were suspicious of the gelato salad - but dang, it was really good. The grilled shrimp in it was especially tasty. For dinner, we shared the lamp chops special and the Il Timballo (like a lasagna) - both extremely good. For dessert, we got the cannoli, the chocolate cake, and the coffee tiramisu. The service was great as well. Highly recommend!
Gelato salad and lamb chops were amazing! I definitely recommend. Inside the restaurant is much nicer than the outside. The service was top notch also.

Stopped by for dinner on a Friday night before a concert at the Garden.  Seated immediately, seemed we got there about ten minutes before the entire place suddenly filled up to capacity.

Dinner was excellent.  We started with the calamari and the "gelato salad", both were absolutely outstanding.  The gelato salad was especially memorable, I couldn't recommend it more!

Entrees included the Il Timballo, a sort of deconstructed lasagna.  Very tasty, but next time I'd go for something more unusual.  My wife had a pasta special that was prepared with a delicious mushroom and prosciutto ragú.  We opted for a glass of red from the outstanding wine list, along with a "Fiesta Brava", one of their excellent signature cocktails.  

Service was attentive but not overbearing, the atmosphere was terrific.  Whether dining as a couple or a group, can't recommend enough!

I've lived around the corner from this place for a little while and always pass by it. We decided to stop in for an impromptu dinner date and were so happy we did. The pasta was delicious! I got the lobster ravioli and the sauce was so good I was using the bread to finish it off at the end. We also tried their walnut pesto pasta - also good, just not for me. I tried the Prosecco cocktail and thought it was alright - the ice in it threw me off. The service was a bit slow as well which is why I knocked a star but we'll definitely be back for some more pasta!

This spot was such a great find! The staff is super friendly, the menu is extensive and well done, and they're very covid conscious with plexiglass still up between tables.

I've been here a few times already and have never been disappointed. They have daily specials too so you can always switch it up. Cocktails are really yummy. A super random perk that I love is the oil and balsamic bottles on your table so you can choose your ratio for dipping the bread.

My niece and I enjoyed a fabulous meal at IL Punto before going to the theater.  The service was exceptional as was the food.  We savored over the menu and ended up taking the advise of Antonio the (?)owner/manager.  We enjoyed the Carpaccio di Manzo and the Burrata app, the Orecchietti salsiccia e cime di rapa main course and of course exploded on desserts! Such a fun and enjoyable place with excellent authentic food! Definitely get the Pistachio Tiramisu! Mangia!
Fantastic Italian food and atmosphere. Wanted to enjoy a fun night and was not disappointed. Loved the ambiance as well. Amazing pasta!

We've been looking forward to our dinner at Il Punto all week. We hoped it would be as good as our first experience in 2021. We were not disappointed, in fact, everything was as good or better 18 months later. Antonio was just as friendly and welcoming as we remembered. The service was excellent and our meal was delicious! We started with something new, Insalata Gelato. It was a great way to start our dinner. The taste of the red onion gelato, grilled shrimp, blackberries, caramelized onions and mixed greens went well together when tossed with the balsamic dressing. The pasta dish, Tagliolini neri ai Frutti di Mare, continues to be our favorite. The amount of seafood is abundant and the tomato sauce lightly coats the pasta. It is the best seafood pasta dish we've had anywhere. Our main course, the grilled salmon was better than before. It was so moist and perfectly cooked! The grilled asparagus and creamy mashed potatoes were tasty too. We were too full to have dessert that night but we enjoyed the Sicilian cookies Antonio gave us the next day. We will return on our next visit to NYC! Thank you, Antonio!

For nearly 20 years I have walked by this restaurant just assuming it was a rather high end Italian spot catering to a very specific clientele - family, old friends, conventioneers. Also, that it would have food that I couldn't eat (allergies) or food I couldn't afford. On a whim, me and a friend stopped in last week around 8pm and we both were pleasantly surprised. First off, we had a spirited debate as to whether the restaurant was Mexican or Italian. The outside shed artwork seemed to lend itself more to a Mexican vibe than Italian. Once inside, I asked the maitre'd the background of the colors and he said that they represented southern Sicily but conceded that they do cause a little bit of confusion with patrons.

The place had a fair amount of diners and everyone looked to be enjoying their meals. My friend and I sat at the bar where Eladio was very friendly and attentive. We ordered a bottle of wine as well as carpaccio with arugula and a burrata and tomato salad. Both were excellent and memorable. I would recommend Il Punto for a local date night, dinner after a day at the Javits Center, or just hanging out with friends looking for a good meal. I will definitely be back!

This place goes above and beyond to provide a great experience, from the courtesy and attentiveness of the staff, to the quality of the food.
I highly recommend Il Punto.

Promptly seated. Promptly provided specials and the wine menu. Order taken and within a very reasonable amount of time, the most amazing dish was brought to me. Creamy, large chunks of lobster and salmon. Pasta cooked perfectly, sauce was smooth and amazing.
A beautiful little niche type restaurant. So so good! Delicious!
Excellent service and food. Exquisite attention to detail on each dish to insure a beautiful melody of texture and taste in every bite.

Very nice meal.  The atmosphere was really cool, comfortable and casual but definitely something "quality" about it.  Took quite a while before anyone came to our table to even give us menus BUT our server (I think Luis??) was absolutely amazing and pretty much made the whole meal.
Wine list and cocktails looked ok, but I just had a couple Captain Lawrence Hop Commander IPA's ... date on bottled showed one was 4 months old and the other was 7 months old, though! Should really be served fresh.
bread was ok with sliced italian bread and breadsticks, with olive oil and vinegar on the side.
Apps were delicious: Huge deep fried risotto and cheese balls, and calamari with salsa plus and nice spicy mayo.
The star was the recommended Gelato salad. yes, gelato salad! there was a scoop of "red onion gelato" on top of a salad that they then mixed in at the table to become the dressing. sounds weird as hell but it was delicious and everyone loved it. My main course was a nice orichietta shell pasta with a ton of sausage and some brocolli rabe.  very good!

I visited Il Punto for the first time this week when I was seeing a friend in a show at The Tank on 36th. What a delight! The charming host and attentive waitstaff were outstanding, and the food was amazing. I considered the bruschetta appetizer special (it sounded amazing) but followed the server's suggestion of the insalata gelato with shrimp, a salad served with a scoop of red onion ice cream (!) that becomes the dressing when it's tossed tableside. I also really enjoyed the butternut squash cavatelli special. And if you're into limoncello, check out their housemade version. Service was great, food was great. 10/10 experience all around.

We visited the Garment District of NYC (9th and 38th) in May for a week. We ate at Il Punto 3 times. Their food is exceptional. Their staff is kind and accommodating. Try their gelato salad. It's mixed at your table. The gelato makes a creamy dressing.
Home made chocolate pudding and sauce served warm- delicious!
They were very welcoming and friendly in a crazy busy night the evening before the marathon.  Gnocchi was fabulous.  Inside looked cozy but got a table in the outdoor enclosure which we preferred.

Hells Kitchen hidden Italian/Sicilian gem. Don't let this place slip off your radar while in NYC.

Having travelled to NYC for dinner and often working in Hell's Kitchen area I had not had the luck until now of discovering this gem.
Antonio and the entire staff made us feel like family visiting their home.  This is huge, as we feel EXPERIENCE is most of what people go out to enjoy.  Check that box.

Now moving to the PRODUCT/FOOD.  My group had several items and the most amazing bottle of super tuscan which reminded my wife of our trips to Italy. The entrees from homemade pasta and the detail of presentation and preparation was far beyond our expectations for this casual comfortable dining experience.

The atmosphere reminded us of small Italian cafes in Italy and other parts of Europe.  Cozy comfortable yet elegant.  

Must order...Gelato salad is amazing and like nothing we have had anywhere in the world.
Entrees are too hard to even narrow any recommendations.  But I will say this. Venture beyond your norm. If you normally order pasta maybe order fish.  If you order fish maybe order veal.

My gut tells me if you drift a little out of your normal lane and find this place then drift outside your normal lane when ordering and you will be rewarded on both accounts.  

Can't wait to see you guys soon.

arrivederci
Came one night with my local best friend and it was the best service and food I've ever had. Service was fast, accurate, food was fresh and tasty.

Tonight, me and two friends were introduced to not only the best Italian food in New York, but also to the BEST desserts. The pistachio tiramisu is a must try for everyone who comes here. The service was pristine, the food is authentic, and the atmosphere is jovial and familial. I will be back! I have NEVER finished my plate before, but I devoured everything tonight.
The homemade pasta and meatballs were excellent! We ordered in, and really enjoyed our meal.

Overall, delicious food. It wasn't the best service (mediocre). I found it to be kitsch in atmosphere/ambiance.  Prices were leaning high for what you get in terms of food and experience, but not offensively so. Wouldn't select it again, but wouldn't be disappointed per se if someone brought me back.

This is a great and super convenient location. It is sparkling clean and though small, was not slow or overcrowded. I got in and out with an expertly prepared flat white in minutes. I barely had time to panic check my phone for work emails while I waited.

The friendly barista (and master coffee beanbender) Min also deserves a shout out. I'll definitely be back when I need my next midday caffeine fix.

Went there for a quick bite on a Sunday and let's quite disappointed. We ordered two coffees (cortado and latte) and they were pretty good, however, we also ordered two egg bacon cheese sandwiches and while they looked good, they were fridge-cold to the first bite. We requested them to be reheated and were told not because they were already bitten (what's understandable due to COVID). We were offered only one replacement sandwich (because supposedly they had just one left) but we declined the offer because we didn't want to risk it again. You would imagine we would get at least a partial refund but nothing. Oh, and we were charged $10 for green juice, not sure if that's the regular price for that product but it looks quite steep.
The chai tea latte was a little bit bland for me. But the customer service was exquisite and just because she was so kind I will return to try something else.

It's been a while since my last visit most recently stopped by & figured might as well time to update.
Happy to see that this place survived the pandemic since one of the best things here is the now 29 flavors of margaritas!
The Margaritas are great & after 1-2 u have quite the buzz. So many flavors still the best one is Mango, Watermelon, Banana & Guava to name a few.
Nachos with chicken good to share but seems like the portion got smaller, very good Quesadilla with chicken a lighter option is the Garden salad.
U finish your dinner & drinks & usually head upstairs or below to dance it off.
Drinks upstairs Tito's & seltzer , Jack & coke not bad.
Good variety of music but usually a nice mix of Spanish music.
Decent service overall, nice ambiance as the restaurant is nicely decorated. I noticed they now offer HH specials which if I recalled wasn't the case before.
Price wise ahh they are a bit on the high side but very doable.
I decided to up the starts simply because after all these years the Margaritas are always on point & never disappoint it is still a decent spot to grab drinks & dance it all off.

So I dont know what happened to this place but I really would not recommend. I came here twice over the course of this year and both times my experience was bad. The restaurant and the dance floor above.

The first time I was on a double date, and the food quality is not the same. It is no longer as flavorful as it once was. We ordered drinks, appetizers and sides (I dont love Mexican and I could find an entree I wanted), and one full entree. We spent approximately $300 and they wouldn't let us on the too floor without 3/4 of us paying for entry since we did not all get entrees. I pointed out that the amount of apps and sides came out more to one entree each and they did not care. So after wasting $10 to get in, we had the pleasure of a sticky empty dance floor. This is where you come when you want to practice in the dark with people who are doing the same.

My second time was just one week ago for my friend's birthday. The HORROR. After waiting over 20 minutes for their frozen drinks, the waiter came out to inform us that their frozen machine was broken and unapologetically was like do you want to drink or no then when we finally ordered the food Al Pastor tacos I wanted they didn't have and because I don't really eat Mexican food, I was disappointed because that's what I really wanted. I ordered the brisket tacos and they were DRY with no flavor and the pineapple salsa on the side needs work. Didn't even bother checking the dance floor. It was dead in the restaurant so we can only imagine upstairs. The best part is the fact that they were empty did not stop them from having the slowest service ever. And expensive. DO NOT come here.

A great place to drink and appetize, but for serious dinner go elsewhere. I had been here several times in December and just came back to try again. The bar was empty at 7:30 pm: probably foreshadowing!
I ordered crispy-skin boneless half chx which came w/mashed potatoes and green beans. The chx was completely dried out to the point of inedible. The green beans were so underdone they were difficult to cut with a table knife and fork. The potatoes were ok but I didn't finish them either. This was my only meal on long day of travel- so disappointing.
I told my server: chx overdone, beans underdone. He said "I will tell the kitchen" them served up my $34 tab. I wasn't looking for a freebie but when the food is all left on the plate it seems like SOMETHING should be offered to make amends. Chips and guac would have made me happy. A dessert. 10% off. Speak to the manager. Many options to help offset the bitter taste that results in me taking the time and effort out of another busy day to write this review so others know before they go.
Have a sangria-margarita and something easy off the appetizer menu and you'll be fine.

Nice inside for Happy Hour!. To me, The Iguana Restaurant has a nice old family feel to it.  It's a pretty large establishment.  We went for Happy Hour and the drinks were good, my beef nachos were soggy - didn't like them, Brown had wings, they were good he said, Robinson had a chicken sandwich with calamari- grilled chicken over cooked and dry, calamari was rubbery cooked to long.  The Mango Margarita was made very good to your tasting. The service was ok. We sat at the bar because we were going to see MJ. So, fingerfood it was. How do you serve happy hour drinks but not food- Beats me!!!!! We didn't even get a theater discount.

I was visiting my aunty who lives nearby. My aunty took me to Iguana for a light dinner. The music inside is wonderful. Staff is highly efficient. We ordered beef taco, chicken salad and orange juice. Food came in fairly quick. I like their beef taco. Chicken salad is kinda boring.  Nothing special to me. It's a great place to hang out with friends or families here. On average it's about $25~ $30 per person depends how hungry you are.

I really don't get these places in Midtown that have outrageous overhead and occupy privlileged real estate locations. The service is non existent, it feels more like they expect ou to be grateful for their existence.
The food is dismal at best, feels more like they opened a package of frozen vegetables and a can of beans. Nothing special about it except for the unreasonable price.
No service and bad food, nothing to see here... keep moving.

The food was horrible and the sodas where water down . The tuna I ordered was cold and they didn't know how to cook it . I asked them to reheat it and they didn't understand me the service was low par and the ambiance' was not existence there was a lot of workers just standing around and didn't care about anything
The best guacamole I've ever had! Staff was the warmest out of anywhere the experience during our entire trip. Super friendly and everything was really tasty.

Came here for food, drinks, and dancing over Memorial Day weekend. There was a cover charge of $20 to get into the dance area. Restaurant is separate.

Just because you eat at their restaurant doesn't secure your entrance to the dance floor.

We had margaritas which were delicious and a few appetizers.

Ended up going to another place to dance because there weren't too many people here. A

Can't really say much about the food. As we never got to try it. My SO and I arrived about 10 before our reservation. There was no one at the door. We flagged down the bartender & told him we had a reservation. He gave us a blank stare and said they closed early because they were slow.  This is not what one expects to hear when you wanted to have a nice birthday dinner.

The ambiance in the dance floor upstairs was fun. Stayed for a but had to leave early since we were hungry. Might try having dinner earlier next time, hopefully they don't close early again.

Came here starving after seeing a show next door and not wanting to be bothered with a wait or walking around to find something better. I had a feeling it wouldn't be great when it was almost completely empty, but decided to give it a try. My friend said his salad was pretty bad, and I the taquitos I had weren't better than the Trader Joe's frozen taquitos (granted they are pretty good for being frozen taquitos, but considering the price mark up and this is a sit down restaurant, not exactly a good comparison).The margarita was okay. Probably steer clear unless desperate like us.

Managed to squeeze in some adult time while on our trip and this place was perfect. The dark wood and low lighting was great after a day of taking in the city. The taquitos were great as well as our Margaritas. Not sure who our bartender was, but he was an older Spanish man who was very hospitable, chatting with us on a slow day. For any travelers, specifically staying at the Ameritania, this place is convenient and fairly welcoming. Enjoy.. expect a fat tab, you're a baseball pitch from Broadway my friend!

This is my second time at this restaurant. The first time I came the food was absolutely amazing and I couldn't wait to return. My friends and I enjoyed the steak quesadillas along with the chorizo taquitos. Everything was delicious. Unfortunately this time around I can not say the same thing. The food was bland and just all around terrible. The steak quesadilla had maybe 2 pieces of steak IF THAT. And the rice was crunchy and bland. The chorizo taquitos were under seasoned and fatty. 2 sodas and 2 appetizers came and a side of rice came out to be $62.

While the service was great and the ambiance is fun, this is the blandest Mexican food I have ever had. The food had absolutely no flavor. I really couldn't recommend this place. They dance floor in the basement might be fun to go to some night for drinks, but I would eat elsewhere before.

My coworkers and I (a team of six people) came here for lunch on July 13 and we all got the worst food poisoning that left us still feeling the effects weeks after. Do not recommend, horrible experience! Saw another person post on Google reviews that their party also got food poisoning the same day we visited so we can definitely confirm that it was this place that made us all sick.

I'll keep this as short as I can, so you won't have to read too much. Let me preface this by saying it is currently Cinco de Mayo. My friend and I had an 8:30 we made and confirmed via OpenTable.

If you're in a TLDR mood, allow me to summarize: we ended up at a nearby IRISH PUB and had a lovely meal and great service. So you can guess how the experience at Iguana went for us to leave on CINCO DE MAYO.

That being said, if you want the full story, continue on dearest Yelper:

When we arrived, the hostess was nowhere to be found, and a line was so long, it trailed far beyond the front door.  The bouncer claimed "it's Cinco de Mayo, and she'll be back". I myself and every other person in the line had a reservation as well.

None were accommodated, some waiting for hours on end.

The majority left out of disgust.

Those that stuck around opted for bar service, which would've been fine, but no one came to check on us, let alone anyone else.  Quickly realized others at the bar had been waiting to even be seen by a hostess for HOURS.

My friend and I were seated an hour and a half later and only because we raised the issue to one of the managers. We had ordered food at the bar and they brought it to our table.

The table we were seated at had dirty glasses and cutlery.

I'll spare the rest, but needless to say, we left as quickly as possible and went to a nearby Irish pub where the service was impeccable and the food, much better.  

Who would've thought an Irish pub would save the day on Cinco de Mayo.  

Ps- never met the hostess who was MIA even when we left. I hope she gets some good R&R and comes back refreshed-- and I genuinely mean that. Clearly she was so overwhelmed, there should've been at least another hostess to fill in.

Wouldn't have been surprised if this was 2021 and we were only a year post-pandemic.

But no excuse to run an establishment this way, in 2023 in midtown on Cinco de Mayo.

Do better next time for those that come back. I won't be one of them.  

Ps- still tipped 20% because those that did care enough to serve us were kind.  They deserve it.

PPS: there were EMPTY TABLES that were reserved and none of them filled with lines waiting still out the door. No excuse.  I have photographic proof that I'll drop if necessary.

After having a delicious dinner and drinks($196.00) total, management charges $20.00 just to enter their second floor where practically nobody attended. Good music but $11.00 for a Corona, a bit dark. My suggestion is if you spend money on their food and drinks then you should be able to show your receipt and enter the dance floor.
Otherwise both dance floors will remain 90% empty at all times.
Margaritas delicious and table side guacamole.  Who could ask for anything more?   Service quick and friendly.  Outdoor seating on a breezy summer day.  Iguana is trendy and fun.

Food
Was amazing very flavorful
We had the taquitosdelicious filled with cheese . It's not worth ordering the entree
It's best to order from the appetizer they are really filling .
Service
Was ok nothing to brag about. They were prompt And courteous .. not very friendly but it can always be worst.

Ambiance
There were many couples. It was clean and they played music. Nothing over powering where you couldn't speak with each other.
They have a little lounge area upstairs.

I would go back !

This restaurant is not it. Expensive for what. Mediocre food, it was 4 of us. 4 different plates with two appetizers. Over $200 dollars, not only will i complain about the food but the quality was not there. What i definitely recommend is don't step foot inside. Its empty for a reason.

First time here, we had appetizers and drinks. Food was good ( pricey) the place is very nice. The staff was cheerful and attentive.  The manager came over several times to check on us and talk about music, he was cool. We decided to try the desserts we got the fried ice cream not like tempura style fried ice cream but was pretty good. The music selection was good too! We enjoyed our lunch here.

Went here tonight. Horrible experience overall. Was not crowded, looked nice and had nice ambiance. Unfortunately, our waiter never checked on us throughout, he only came by to take order and deliver order. The waiters serving water were polite and attentive. Those servers were really wonderful.

We waited a very long time for our food, despite it not being crowded. One of our kid's entrees we ordered (carne asada tacos/ ordered medium rare) came out almost raw. Not exaggerating, it was not even edible (side note: she ate one and is now sick).

Another of our kid's beef tacos (ordered off of the kid's menu) was comparable to chili stuffed into a hard shell, which was inedible for a child... nor should they serve or advertise this as a kids "beef taco".

After 10+ min of waiting for someone to check on us... we flagged down our waiter and expressed that one meal was raw meat/carne asada tacos and the kids menu tacos were not edible.

The initial waiter agreed the meat in the asada tacos was not cooked properly. We told him we would not need a replacement since it was so late. When advised of the kids beef taco he looked irritated and walked away. Good to note - both meals were untouched other than a few bites.

Without apologizing, another waiter brought the bill a few minutes later. Did not ask us if we wanted more drinks, nothing. And we had been charged $22 EACH for the remaining other two children's meals ( they did rightfully deduct the undercooked carne asada tacos and the 2 kids menu tacos. But they up-charged us for the two remaining kids meals).

When we asked them why the remaining two kids meals were priced at $22 each (on top of our two adult entrees and drinks) the new waiter shrugged and said "it's New York" and walked away. Some of their adult entrees were priced at $15-$20. How are kids meals more expensive than adult meals on the menu? We visit New York regularly- and have never experienced these prices for kids meals. (The $22 per kids meals in question was a small cheeseburger and the second kids meal priced at $22 was 3 small chicken tenders).

Upon leaving the new waiter told the initial waiter we did not leave a pleasant tip based on the service and what we were charged... the initial waiter came outside as we were leaving to attempt to intimidate us.

This place is genuinely awful. Terrible food... arguably the worst Mexican food we have ever had. Terrible service. Rude waiters. Dishonest prices. Do not go here.

Nachos amazing and the frozen margarita...perfection. Came when they were slow so I had a very attentive waiter and the wait time on my food was nonexistent. The upstairs is for private parties... the downstairs you can hear a lively club with Latin music and a lot of people. I will definitely be back with friends. Especially since they don't close until 2am.

We went for the bachata class advertised to start at 7 PM online but were told it would start at 8 PM (which isn't the restaurant's fault). We came back to the restaurant/bar at 8 PM and the class hadn't started (again, not their fault - the instructor was late), but their bouncer was extremely rude, abrasive and wanted us to pay or leave while there was yet no class and we were waiting for a class to actually happen. Kind of silly that all of this happened over a meager $10 and after us waiting for an hour. They should really hire better staff that understands their patrons instead of being insulting. I think the service here has low standards, as also reflected in other reviews.

The people are friendly and so nice.  Really try and please the customer.   Interior is beautiful and full of lights and lanterns.  

The food had traditional and fusion dishes.  While it was decent food it was not worth the price.  The enchiladas red chili sauces was really good.  Chicken taquitos were decent with moist chicken.  The blue card avocado salad lack crab and flavor.

I would stick to drinks and appetizers.
We popped in to check out the dance scene.  Did not disappoint.  Had the best time ever. Great DJ!

They charge a crazy cover even at the end of the night. Ladies don't go.
Ksnsjsjdjek

Looking for a space near Times Square for 20 people can be hard to find- but lucky for us, Iguana had just what we needed! The menu had plenty of options to meet the needs of all of the members of our party- even those with allergies. The food was just what we needed after a long day of work. It was a dark space and somewhat hard to hear the people around you since it was pretty noisy.

Worst experience ever! First, there was no welcome at all. The waiter was a jerk he was rushing us not a single smile on his face. The food comparing to the price is not worth it at all. The kids menu doesn't have the prices I ordered chicken tacos for my daughter 3 years she almost thrown up it was very dry and not tasty( $20). The music very loud we can't even hear each other and the best is when they gave me the bill he included automatically 22% as tip and said that when it's over $100 the system calculates 22% automatically (bullshit).

The place is not worth to spend a dollar on it

I really like coming to this restaurant pre-Covid i ate here for lunch & dinner. I enjoyed the likes of the afterwork parties on the lower level. This place had it all. Dance lessons upstairs you couldn't beat it. This past weekend i had dinner and i had the best waiter.  He was very attentive and joined in for a little conversation. Food and drinks are great and tasteful,

I really wanted to like this restaurant, but the entire experience was a complete let down. To start with our waiter, was extremely pushy and was rushing us constantly to order and decide and then disappeared and didn't check on us at all until it was time for the check and even then we waited for over 20 mins (they were not very busy at all). The drinks were decent, lots of choices, but the food was extremely overpriced for subpar mexican food that essentially felt like a nicer, sit down version of taco bell. Theres far better options in the city and certainly in Hell's Kitchen as well.

Came here to have a nice night out with friends and listen to some Hispanic music instead I was extremely disappointed and disgusted by the extremely racist service. An employee followed me and my girls all night to the bathroom and to the bar I'm not sure why an Hispanic women is discriminating against her own people but I guess that's the kind of people they hire. She was so ignorant that she didn't even realize I'm clearly Hispanic not white and my people are also Afro-Latina not white when I approached her she tried to talk to her co worker about it in Spanish LOL.
They charge $20 to dance in an empty space and be profiled  the people who walked out after also complained about the ignorance so I know I'm not bugging. If you're a clueless tourist this is the place for you!
They closed and had last call before 1:27am... a place if nor busy... you are SOL!  Be ware.

Nice atmosphere but food is subpar. Not very good in my opinion, generic and not authentic feeling. Really mad the queso on my cold nachos was watered down, small portion. Not worth the high price. Don't eat near Times Square unless you want Disney world type food.

Nice restaurant in the upper midtown area. The service was great food good and they have a nice dancefloor at the bottom. For starters we got the fresh guac and the super lump quesadilla. Both were delicious. I got the snapper for main that was delicious too. Overall good outing

First the good...  Amazing food.  Now the bad; we got there to a broken table and we asked for one that was not.  We were given another table and the manager quickly fixed other.  Then. Waitress nowhere to be found, saw her arguing with manager and pointing at us...  Very awkward.  We had 3 intermittent people waiting on table and fighting with each other in Spanish.  Service was slow and we all felt weird by how childish they acted.  Also we were sick the next day although not sure it had to do with the food.  Our last waiter was very nice.  Don't know who got he tip, but only he earned it.
Great place dance Latin music  the security guard Rocky was awesome 2 great cocktails.

I came here in August of 2022. And I am back around the area and decided to do a review. It's a very nice space. Beautiful ambiance. Definitely 4 stars on that. However, the food. They need to revamp the menu. And the ingredients. I ordered my son a cheeseburger and it was a burger you can get at a local diner. The patty wasn't made in house. Literally your run of the mill burger with a sesame seed bun, which you have to be careful for because some people don't care for that sesame on the bun. I got the fajita dish. Steak was good. Drinks were strong. I give those a four. Service was not the best. As nice as I was to the waiter he just seemed to have the biggest could care less attitude. Made me feel not welcomed and also, the price tag for the subpar food and service was ridiculous.

I love this place so much I have been 3 times in the past 2 weeks. The food and drinks are amazing! So many great options to choose from. I highly recommend the Steak Sandwich, the meat was tender, juicy and cooked perfectly. I'm salivating as I write this, YES ITS THAT GOOD!! Everyone that works here is super friendly and provide really stellar service. Great drinks, great food, great service, great portions and prices.... What more could you ask for?

Amazing music
Customer service as well, I have the best flautas here and it was enough to share
Great service and great Mexican meal, mojito was very good.will definitely come back again

One of the best places to go after work to get a margarita.

Management and the service is one of a kind.

The food is on point, no place like it.

I have been going to Iguana for probably close to 20 years now and it PAINS me to write this horrible review, but it was a train wreck.  We went for Cinco de Mayo, and we were a crowd of 10.  The space was fine and the service was good.  So there, now you have the good things.  

HOWEVER, the food was marginal and for the last many years it has only been that.  What made it so bad were the margaritas.  You need good margs for cinco, and they were not even drinkable.  My friends and I sent back our drinks, not once, not twice but THREE TIMES.  They were not drinkable.  I don't know if the mixer had gone bad, they were using bad tequila, or just filling the drinks with triple sec, but it was just bad.  The restaurant manager NEVER came over, and didn't even offer to taste it, etc.  

I don't go to NYC that often, and when I do, the next time I will pass up this space that I used to love, but just not anymore.

I actually wish there was a way to give zero stars. first off, they promote on their socials that it is $10 for guys to get into their clubs, SO as a female I expect to pay $10 or less. But no, it is $20 for everyone to get in. So we had to go to the ATM and basically paid $60 with fees to get in. THERE WAS NO ONE THERE. The music was decent, but the we were the only two there. We got there at 11, stayed until 12:30 hoping it gets a little packed. NOTHING. Not a single soul.  $60 for a shitty night, DO NOT GO TO CLUB.

Great atmosphere with music downstairs and a chill Mexican restaurant vibe on the main floor. Happy hour prices are great and the service is quick and friendly. Loved the guacamole made right in front of you!

Possibly the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Me and my mom came here because how fantastic the outside/inside of the place is. Absolutely gorgeous place. I was expecting some incredible food. What came out was actually comical, we had the time of our lives laughing at how bad each dish was!!!! I don't know who the chef is here but if it isn't fixed this place is going under QUICK. First we got fried avocado . Which came out looking like it was tossed on a plate with one swirt of sauce and completely unseasoned. Even the breading was unseasoned. We had to salt it to eat it. Then bean soup. It actually tasted like you opened a can of black beans from the store & blended it and served it. It had no pork, no veg and certainly no salt no heat no anything. It was laughable. Zero salt, zero seasonings. We also got the shrimp salad. The dressing was so bland I would hardly even know there was any on it. Literally no salt, no anything. I was shocked at this point. We asked the waiter for some kind of salsa for the avocado so he brought us BBQ sauce! Then the crab quesadilla. It came out with the same bean soup in a dipping cup....? Are we dipping quesadillas into bean soup? And the amount of crab was about a half tbs for the entire thing, a joke. Finally we ordered the chocolate raspberry mousse. It came out with strawberries instead of raspberrys so we asked the waiter "I thought this was raspberry's?" And he pointed at it and said "raspberry" and we realized he didn't know what a raspberry is... absolute joke of a restaurant. Whatever that was it isn't Mexican food

The food was just ok but our server was a jerk. Really ignored us, didn't offer chips and salsa while offering them to other tables. Just didn't make us feel welcome at all, and we still walked away spending $150 for three people. Wish i could get my money back and choose another place.

Terrible experience for a Saturday night. Spent $150 on mediocre food and drinks. Decided to go to the other 2 floors for dancing and music. Floors were empty at 12am, they wanted to charge $20 even though we just spent $150 there. The manager Carlos is RUDE and DISRESPECTFUL. He said $150 is nothing and we need to pay a $20 cover to enter the not lively "club." He would not allow us in. I would NOT recommended this place. Food, drinks, management and vibe is WACK and TERRIBLE.

We couldn't even get someone on the phone to let us know if there was parking or valet to this restaurant.  Was trying to celebrate a birthday.  Will spend my money elsewhere.  Called to ask a question and was hung up on before I could get an answer.  Rude to say the least.

My review is not about the food at Iguana but about the horrible experience I had at this place when it turns into a night club. First of all, the female bouncer is extremely aggressive and violent. She was very physical since the beginning. She pulled my arm with force to take me back to the coat check and (by the way coat check is mandatory) she'll rip your arm off if you, god forbid, stay with your coat on. Second of all, this woman try to get into altercation with me later on into the night when I was assisting my friend who was drunk in the bathroom said we had to leave right away and pulled us both with force again when we weren't even doing anything to her. She started insulting me with foul language and got very physical again. She was trying to kick us out of the place. We wanted to leave voluntarily but she just kept pushing me and telling us to leave and talking over us.  Finally, I had it and spilled a drink on her. I had to defend myself somehow. That's when she hit me on my face and started yanking my hair out in front of everyone. They had to get people from their own staff (her coworkers) to separate me from her. Otherwise she wouldve killed me. I mean really, you work there and that's how you treat your custumers. Not only that but there is a 20 dollar admission fee to get in. And for what? To get assaulted by their rude neardenthal female bouncer? This stablisment should train their staff on custumer service better and how to behave professionally before any one else gets hurt by this woman. Less to say I am never coming back to this place again. If I could give it 0 stars I would.

I've traveled the world, had some amazing Sushi and found some bad ones. (Stay away from Spokane Washington lol). This one is one of the best I've found stateside.

We were greeted at the host station, the host spoke very clear and was pleasant. The atmosphere was excellent and the place was spotless clean.

I started with an app, the yellowtail jalapeño... I must say it was incredible! I sampled my daughter's Shrimp Tempura, it was cooked nicely and not greasy. I had the Spontaneous roll, was similar to the appetizer I had but with more going on. Loved that as well... then had the Sushi & Roll combo. The different tunas and salmon were vibrant and melted in my mouth. The Spicy Crunchy Tuna Roll was also delicious.

And now, time for the bill. For my table of three, with more food than we should have ate. The ticket was very reasonable. Definitely a win!!!

I will hope to return here on my next trip to the city!

Went here with a group of friends on a Friday night to celebrate a birthday and came out happy.  The restaurant is in Midtown, just past Times Square and located close to the orange line.  It finds itself in good company, being right across an elaborately themed karaoke bar. I was sat down promptly and was given a menu to peruse while I waited for my group to appear.  The restaurant was spacious; there was plenty of room to move around, and the bathrooms were roomy and in good working order.  Service was attentive yet unassuming throughout the night.  The host and waitstaff frequently checked on us and glasses of water consistently being refilled throughout our meal.

The restaurant offers a sizable menu that includes the classic izakaya fare, sushi staples and various fusion offerings, no glaring omissions in the menu.  The only issue was the lack of alcohol. I later learned that the restaurant is awaiting a liquor license, which was a shame, as while I enjoyed my food, I would have enjoyed it even more with a frosty beer, and would have happily ordered a bunch were it available.

As starters, I shared in an order of edamame, calamari, takoyaki and brussels sprouts.  The brussel sprouts stood apart from the bunch; they were roasted well, had a snappy chew, and were tossed with sliced lap cheong (one of my favorite meats) and pomegranate seeds that lent a slight sweetness and tartness enhancing the dish.  The calamari was crispy and heavily seasoned (would have paired really well with a cold one), with an aroma resembling five spice. The edamame and takoyaki was just what one would expect; nothing to write home about, but reliable in which one would get and taste what they would expect.  I enjoyed the appetizers, which was great because...

The kitchen was slow.  For the sort of dishes that were prepared, the wait was longer than what I would have liked and kept me from ordering more.  For what it's worth, the food came out looking pretty and neatly plated, but given that the restaurant bills itself as an izakaya, the speed should be pub-like (you know, like, you're out with the boys, you got some beers in you and you want to eat as soon as possible) and I would have easily forgone the presentation if it had meant the food would come out faster.  I chalked up the lack of speed to the restaurant being new and as it gels together and streamlines its operations, I don't think this will be an issue going forward.

We ordered a few mains to share amongst the group, including two orders of the premium sushi & sashimi combos that cost $95 (9/9: corrected to reflect the proper price per receipt) per order.  Each combo included sashimi staples (e.g. salmon, tuna, snapper, etc.), with two pieces of each fish and two additional rolls, that came out carefully plated on a visually impressive staircase-shaped platform.  The fish was fresh and tasted good.  The salmon, for example, was rich and buttery.  Notably, the mackerel did not have the fishy, almost pungent taste I expected from this fish, nor did it strongly taste of marinade, which I was very impressed with.  Especially because of its visual flair, the premium sushi & sashimi combo is definitely a *splash* order someone looking to impress their date. With that being said, while one combo is a sufficient amount of food for two persons, one would want to supplement an order of this with a small plate or two.

Our orders also included a beef kimchi fried rice and a salmon & ikura don, which I tried.  The beef kimchi fried rice was Japanese-style, so the texture was a good deal softer.  The rice was cooked nicely, but could have included a little more kimchi and beef to feel more substantial.  The beef could have also been sliced into smaller pieces so there would be an even distribution of beef in each spoonful.  The salmon & ikura don was good (no surprise as I had enjoyed the salmon that came out in the combo just a moment ago), though I would have wanted more ikura because the amount present made the ikura look more like a garnish than an actual part of the dish.

We were also given a sample platter of desserts on the house to enjoy at the end of our meal consisting of mochi ice cream and brownies, all of which was delicious.  The desserts obviously are not a signature element of the  establishment, but it was a very thoughtful gesture by the restaurant that I very much appreciate.

When divided between the group, the dinner cost ~$57 per person, including tax and tip. While not a bargain, the price is more acceptable when taking into consideration that the restaurant is located in a pricey and touristy part of Midtown and the level of service that we were given throughout our meal.

All in all, I had a great time eating here and look forward to seeing how the restaurant is later on in the future.

Came here for my friends birthday and the restaurant itself isn't busy for a Friday night. Initial thought was, they don't have their liquor license and they're new, so not many are aware of here. Later on when the food came...a number of us begin to realize there may be a different reason behind the lack of customers.
Before I get to the food, wait service is fine, however kitchen is extremely slow, considering there are many empty tables around. It takes around 20 to 30 minutes just for food to come out. Had the restaurant been busy, I can understand why it takes so long.
We ordered the brussel sprouts which was pretty good, the sushi and sashimi for two, which I am highly disappointed at. For nearly $100, it is not worth it. Honestly, I've had better sushi at an ayce place. We also ordered three maki rolls: eel avocado + cucumber, tuna roll and spicy crab salad. This is pretty much standard everywhere, however the size of the pieces were inconsistant. Each piece of sushi was unevenly cut, whereas the pieces kept getting smaller down the roll. We had also placed a few orders of calamari, neither were consistant. The second time it came out, there was too much salt. We also had their kimchi fried rice with beef..lets just say there's room for improvement. Presentation of the sushi was nice tho.
What appeared to be the owner/manager kept managing the waitstaff, which is fine, but it didn't look too well in front of the customers.
Granted this place is still new, there is much to improve on.
They had also given a dessert sampler on the house for us to try. It included their mochi ice cream and brownie. The mochi ice creams were really good, which makes me believe it's made in-house or of the sort. The mango mochi ice cream actually tasted like real fruit and not artificial. The black sesame mochi is also good if you like the taste of black sesame. The greentea was alright. The outer layer of the mochi was easy to cut through and soft. So you can definitely try them out.
At some point, there was a lot of water shoe prints around the kitchen and bathroom area in the back. They need to work on keeping the floors dry in the halls and the bathroom.
If they work out all the kinks, perhaps it's worth trying out again. But in the meantime, I'll stick with ayce, especially after paying $65 a person and still coming out hungry.

My friend and I were killing time for lunch before a show, and lucked out to find this tasty spot. Amazing lunch specials under $20 (even on the weekends!), ranging from sashimi/rolls/NY strip that come with a maki roll (6 pcs), eggroll, mashed potatoes, choice of white or mixed rice, and half a soy marinated egg.

My friend opted for the NY strip ($19), while I got the sashimi ($18). We also ordered a roll to split (hamachi with tuna).

Very friendly and attentive service. Sushi is prepared at the sushi bar, and food orders are prepared in the half-open concept kitchen. Very clean space, although the bathrooms could have used a bit more attention. Owner said they had just opened about a month ago. Overall, great value for the amount and quality of food.

Stumbled upon this restaurant while walking to another one and decided to give it a try. This is a new restaurant, having only been open for 3 weeks. They currently do not sell alcohol, probably because the liquor license takes a while.

This place has a modern izakaya feel--woody and bright. The service staff were very friendly and made great recommendations.

We had the pork belly buns, Takoyaki, karaage, tuna pizza, Angel Roll, Spontaneous Roll, Amazing Sandwich, and Phoenix Roll.

Our favorites were the Takoyaki for the appetizers and the Angel Roll.

Overall, it was a great experience, and we left with happy bellies.

Stumbled upon this place after Sugarfish had 1 + hour wait. Sushi was good. Service was very good. Small place. I had edamame, Tuna and Yellowtail sushi along with a spicy tuna cut roll and unagi for dessert!

Sushi here was delicious and the ginger salad so fresh! Cute spot for a quick date night dinner. We came here before going to a Broadway show. They brought out the food so quickly which was awesome! The waiter was friendly and service was good. Definitely recommend for a quick bite to eat! They're still waiting on their liquor license so no alcohol at this establishment for now. Only down side was this.

Order spicy edamame, fried rice with shrimp and the sushi sampler with tempura shrimp and California roll. This place is new as in opened under a month ago. The restaurant is very clean, as well as their restrooms. The servers and staff are friendly and prompt to take your order.

New Japanese joint just opened in midtown west. We've been needing a solid sushi place in the neighborhood. Fish is extremely fresh and
great value. Great lunch deals too. Service is great, super friendly staff. Very casual and relaxed. Introduced this place to fellow neighbors and we've been back several times on separate occasions!
Special Maki Combo - any 3 rolls. Also, try the spicy garlic edamame. Great atmosphere, casual, and great sushi and service!
Best sushi I have EVER had! I ordered the Post Roll. It was incredible!! Friendly service and quiet comfortable atmosphere.

All I can say is... WOW!!!!! What a find! We happened to find this place while walking around and decided to try it... it did not disappoint.  The service is spot on, the sushi is fresh and delicious, and the owner is lovely.  You have to give this place a try!!!!
Amazing food and great ambiance. Super clean restaurant, fast and attentive service. I definitely recommend checking Imasa out if you're in the area.

So happy that I got to try Ichiran Ramen again! My first experience with this establishment was when we traveled to Tokyo in 2018 and I'm so glad they expanded to NYC. Ichiran Ramen offers an unparalleled dining experience and the reputation speaks for itself since people were already lining up early prior to their opening time to experience this popular ramen joint.

The main attraction obviously is ramen and it didn't disappoint! They allow some type of customization with noodle soup by having the customer select the toppings, broth richness and spice level. For people unsure with the customization, they also have a "recommended" level to remove the guesswork. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen with the recommended toppings set and It definitely made my day since it was a bit chilly when we visited.

Ichiran is popular for their solo dining booths creating somewhat a cozy, focused atmosphere, enhancing the enjoyment of the delectable tonkotsu broth and perfectly textured noodles.

Overall, Ichiran is the ramen joint I mentioned in my other review as the better alternative to Tsuta Ramen. The staff was very attentive and made sure they accommodated our seating need since we has a toddler at the time. Lastly, the minimalist décor contributed to an authentic and immersive Japanese ramen adventure. We will definitely be back!

So, anyone interested in Japanese culture aka a filthy weaboo like me knows this place. Does it live up to the hype?

Honest review: Yes and No.

Noodles: 8/10. They're good. They won't be the best noodles you've had.

Broth: 9/10. Customizable but I got rich and max garlic, so it was well creamy, flavorful, and the red spicy condiment was great. I had a small orgasm with the first sip, indeed a 9/10 broth.

Chashu: 9.5/10. MMMPH. Those slices of Chasu SLAPS. Thin, tender, fatty, and melts in your mouth. For a chain, one dish pumping restaurant, that was some good ass chashu.

Egg: 7/10. Go to Japan for better egg.

Overall, a very solid 8.7/10. What really makes this place "worth it" is the customizing experience. It makes you more engaged and thoughtful about the meal and encourages you to come back and test out other options. Not the best ramen place I've had but it is really good and might be worth going back for all the reasons above, especially with a friend who's never had this customizing experience before (I love witnessing people lose their first times ).

Rounding it closer to 4/5 if we just consider food and price point. Again, better cheaper ramen exists.

ICHIRAN is such a fun experience. How it works is you get in line, order your food on a kiosk, receive a ticket, and a waiter will seat you at any open spot. The dividers are what make this a unique individual experience, but if you come with friends the dividers can also be collapsed so you can spend time chatting with friends.

You can customize all things about your ramen from the sodium level, spice level, even your noodle texture. The broth is so rich and flavorful, and I think I would be satisfied just drinking the broth.

Last time I went here it wasn't a peak hour so we didn't have to wait at all, but be wary of long lines at dinner time!

A review long overdue but better late than never. Ichiran is hands down the best ramen I've ever had.

The way it works is simple: get in line, fill out a menu, and get a ticket. A worker will direct you to your seat. If you're eating by yourself, you have dividers between you and the people sitting next to you for privacy. You can also move the divider if you just want a normal dining experience with your friends. You won't even see the person serving you since Ichiran's concept is to minimize as much of the social interaction as possible (great for socially awkward introverts or people who wanna get in and out).

The best part of the ramen experience is that you get to customize each part of your ramen to your liking (saltiness, noodle texture, amount of oil, spiciness, etc.). It is also one of the only places where I can get a relatively spicy ramen that doesn't just taste like spice. The broth really stands up to the spicy paste they use and is so rich and flavorful that it keeps me coming back for more.

There is really nothing to complain about when it comes to Ichiran, 10/10.

I heard great things about ichiran so I had to stop by to see what all the hype was about. I waited in line for about 30 minutes before I could order. You order on an ipad when you get in, and then wait to be seated. It's a nice place to alone because you can sit in a booth by yourself!

I just tried the tonkatsu ramen with the regular recommended level for everything except extra garlic. When the ramen came out, the soup was piping hot and stayed like that for quite some time. I tried the soup without mixing in the spicy, and it was very flavorful. I think I actually preferred it without the spice mixed in. The noodles also had a great chewy texture. Overall, it's a solid bowl of ramen, but a bit pricier than other places.

This is by far my favorite ramen place ever. It can be quite a long wait so I I would recommend going to lunch and getting there ~15-20 min before they open! It's individual booths that you can open up the wall if you are coming with people, but this place is a great place to start solo dining if you're someone who's intimidated at the thought of eating alone that I am!

I love the simplicity of the menu- it's really just one type of ramen that you can customize with different amounts of spiciness/garlic/scallions/toppings. Definitely on the pricier side but totally worth it in my opinion (also no tip!)

I love the richness of the broth and the chewiness of the noodles. The flavor is so good and tastes very ~authentic. It's just the right amount of saltiness, fatty but not too much for my flavor palate. The hot sauce is also quite delicious and is very assuming at first but hits the back of throat and adds a great depth of flavoring to the broth.

I got the recommended toppings set my first time there and to be honest, I don't think it's worth it! I've gotten just the ramen my subsequent visits and was plenty satisfied.

They used to have a paper menu where you check things off and then give the paper to someone and you pay after you eat, but the most recent time I went, they've changed to an electronic ordering system and you prepay. Was definitely more disorganized with the new system as it seems like they're also trying to figure out the best way to do things.

We came at an off hour and there wasn't any line, we ordered and got in right away. Seating is fun and different, for smaller groups or singles, the seating is bar style. Once you order someone takes your ticket and seats you, you then wait for your food in a cube like seat and they deliver your food from behind the bar. There is a button if you want to order more food and they do serve beer.
Love their noodles though the service process keeps changing!! Staff is new and takes longer to provide assistance to customers! Other than that, I enjoyed the privacy dining area!

Absolutely the best ramen place in the area. The line is always long but it moves relatively fast. Worth the way. Inside is super fun with the individual windows. The ramen is delightful and super consistent!

I love that there's an Ichiran in Times Square! Sometimes you just want a warm bowl of ramen but  like all New Yorkers, you're on the clock.

I ordered the Classic Tonkatsu Ramen with all the default selections with the exception of the oil amount. I did light oil and didn't find it to make that much of a difference as the broth was still rich.

My ramen was piping hot when served and the portion was pretty big. I was glad that I didn't order anything else because I wouldn't have been able to finish. If you're dining by yourself, this is the ideal place. No one bothers you. You get your own water. When you're finished, you take your card with your seating number on it and pay on your way out. If you're dining with someone else, you do have the option to slide the divider next to you.

The long awaited review of one of Japan's most iconic Tonkotsu Ramen chains. The solo seat cells are designed so that you don't have to interact with anyone (this satisfies my introverted soul to the max). As you enter the restaurant, you can immediately hear the noodle slurp harmonies. The menu is pretty straight-forward as you are given the choice to select your noodle firmness, broth saltiness, spiciness, etc. Ya gal is a huge sucker for spice so I had to go for the 10x. After 10-15 min or so, the mysterious server behind the wall is here to deliver your personalized perfect bowl of ramen.

The first sip of the rich and creamy broth is actually life-changing and I'm not exaggerating. Everyone says Ichiran is like McDonald's of Japan then so be it. I love it. And they do not kid around with the red pepper paste! Don't forget to finish your meal off with their yummy matcha pudding! Ugh the most satisfying meal ever.

Definitely a touristy spot, but I think everyone should try Ichiran in NY at least once. I love their concept of individual booths so you can enjoy everything on your own time. They only have one type of ramen on the menu, their Tonkatsu Ramen, that's full customizable.

Their ramen is definitely good, but the broth and noodles are a bit salty so it's easy to get tired of them. I always get their marinated pork and soft boiled egg too which really enhances the umami. The prices are very fair too, so I'd definitely come back if I was craving some late night ramen.

A unique dining model where you sit in your own stall and are served through a curtain!! Great for going with friends or solo.

There's really only a few menu items but they make everything customizable, from the flavor, richness, garlic amount, spice level, and noodle texture. There's also add-ons and I highly recommend the egg!

This is a really solid ramen place. They're very consistent (I've been here a few times) and always deliver what you order. My only complaint is that I find that even when I get less richness and dashi (saltiness), the broth is a bit too salty for my liking. It's very enjoyable at first but as I eat, I get tired of the flavor. Despite that though, I think the ramen is good overall- I particularly love their noodles!

Good spot for lunch. A bit pricy so it would be a treat. They serve one kind of Ramen but you can customize it and add egg, or bamboo, etc. service is quick and efficient and they have personal booths so if you go on your own you have your own booth.

Alright alright I see the hype!!! I always warned my friends who raved about this place that I'm not the biggest Japanese ramen fan, but this ramen was fantastic and I'd come back again.

Usually, I don't like how ramen broth is very heavy and easy to get tired of after the first few sips. Ichiran's broth is very "clean" despite how rich in flavor it is - it's hard to simply describe in words. Ichiran doesn't just try to make the broth super salty to make it "flavorful". I also loved the chili powder on top to give the broth a bit of a kick. The noodles are also perfect - thin and not too soft.

Worth the hype if you don't mind waiting in line for a bit! I came with 6 friends on a Friday for lunch and we surprisingly still got to sit next to each other!

Ichiran originates from Japan and has found a home in two locations in NYC. This is my first time dining here and experiencing what seems like an authentic noodle dish.

They serve only one type of ramen, the Tonkotsu, but you have the option to customize your bowl with a variety of toppings and sides. The ramen is cooked perfectly and the bowl comes together nicely with a mix of salt and slightly spicy flavors.

You order at your booth and the food is served relatively quick. You have the option of sharing a meal by bringing down one of the booth sides. You don't tip but the bowl is already kinda pricey for ramen which I think is the downside of this experience. There was a line to be seated when I arrived so show up earlier than you'd like to eat- worth the wait.

[Ichiran] Japanese ramen restaurant that focuses specifically on one dish only: Tonkotsu ramen. Supposedly originated from Fukuoka City in Japan. There are several locations but this was the Times Square location.

I waited in a short line before entering the restaurant. Upon entering, you are given a sheet of paper to customize your Tonkotsu. I had everything regular except extra garlic, extra sides, and the matcha pudding.

The food was really good but nothing life-changing. The ramen had a flavorful pork broth and everything tasted somewhat as expected. The ambiance is very clean, simplistic, and somewhat aesthetic. After ordering, you are seated in these private booths however if you're with guests you can unlatch the side panel. The service was very quick by placing a metal Kae-Dama plate on the sensor. Overall, this restaurant provides a private atmosphere which I love because I hate eating alone. Luckily, I wasn't. You can even purchase to-go or purchase their ramen kits over the counter to take home. Overall, 8.5/10.

ichiranusa.com

152 W 49th St
New York, NY 10019

First stop in my NY trip and so far one of the best! I love "real" ramen. They only have one option which is the tonkatsu ramen and it's done well. You can select your ingredients, intensity of broth, heat, oil, texture of noodles, etc... The house made noodles & deep flavored tonkatsu broth are both a winning combination. Only flaw is I feel like the pork cutlet was slightly overcooked, but still good. I ordered an extra serving of noodles to eat with the rest of the broth.

You sit in these individual stalls, but can close the dividers if you're eating with others. No shared tables like you'd see in a typical restaurant, so this place isn't good for large groups.

Service was pretty fast and friendly. I'll probably be back later this week.
