This is the best ramen place! I first tried it in Japan and LOVED it! This spot in New York is an almost exact replica, the food is an EXACT duplicate of what we had in Japan, there are just small differences with the ordering process. LOVE IT!

There are slight differences in the ordering process, for example, in Japan you use a machine to get tickets that coordinate with what you are ordering, you then hand those tickets to the person behind the "curtain." You then use a sheet of paper to specify other things, like broth richness, spice level, garlic level, etc., this part is the same. At Ichiran-New York you use a sheet of paper to note your entire order and then give it to the person behind the "curtain." Otherwise, everything is the same, the individual booths, the person behind the curtain and the food. Wait! I forgot, in Japan there is a water spout at your booth, in New York, you have to go get your water from the side.

Otherwise, the ramen is off the hook. The flavor of the broth is rich, buttery and porky, it's great. The egg is perfectly cooked, it's a soft boiled egg and extra yummy. Everything about the ramen is PERFECT, can't wait to go back!!

ICHIRAN changed my life.
Okay maybe that was exaggerated, but it definitely changed my view on Hakata style ramen & what a wonderful experience it was!

ICHIRAN only serves Classic Tonkotsu Ramen but they do a dang good job of it.
You're allowed to customize everything from toppings, to richness/oil amount, Dashi/saltiness, spiciness, & for anything additional you'd may like.
For first timers, I'd recommend getting the "Recommending Toppings Set" for the full experience. (Extra Chashu, Soft Boiled Egg, Scallion, Dried Seaweed, & Kikurage Mushroom)

The taste was absolutely phenomenal, the thin noodle texture was perfect, & the closed test-taking window experience allows you enjoy food without interruptions.

My only regret is not getting the Ramen Kits to bring back home. They're about double the price at regular Japanese Supermarkets!
Will definitely come back again!
The best ramen I've ever had in my life. I'm sad that I've had the tastiest ramen in the world because now everything else fails in comparison!!!

We have been to both the Midtown & time square locations so far, the Time Square location is much busier and has a lot more people.

Ramen quality is the same with efficiency services.
Matcha beer is in right now, goes great with some extra spicy ramen!

Whenever we visit Japan we always make sure to eat at Ichiran at least a few times before we leave.  We were pleasantly surprised to find an Ichiran while visiting New York.  

The service was great and very efficient.  We got there around 5PM and surprisingly we did not have to wait at all to be seated.  The food is slightly more expensive compared to Japan but everything is expensive in New York.  Also, this is a no-tipping establishment.  

The broth is so rich and flavorful.  My favorite is strong dash, rich oil, 1 clove garlic, with scallion and chashu, medium spice (not spicy at all but just enough to give it some flavor), and medium noodle texture.  I also like to add a soft boiled egg and kikurage mushroom.  This location boiled the egg a little too much but it was still good.  My son and I always have extra broth after eating our bowl of ramen so we order a noodle refill and split it (cheaper than ordering two half orders).

Everyone eats in their own individual booth and you serve your own water.  If you need help, there's a button in the booth you can press.  You can always add to your order.  When you're done, you pay at the register.

ENJOY!!

I had been looking forward to trying Ichiran for some time. I was on vacation with my family and we were set on going here. There was a line of course, but after a half hour or so we were seated in our private tables. We could have moved the partitions but decided to try the experience of focusing on our ramen.
We order using the form and after a short wait our ramen arrived. It was a hot day and hot ramen still hit the spot. The broth was very savory and very tasty. The noodles were firm just as I'd requested and quite satisfying.
We all enjoyed our rame very much and this was one of our best meals in NYC.
If you are in Manhattan and like ramen this is can't miss spot. Oishi desu ka!

You know a place is good when they have only one thing on the menu because it's all they need when it's been perfected so well. Ichiran is super popular in Japan, but luckily you can still try it in the states only in New York. They do have 3 locations in NYC, but the place is still popular so I'd suggest coming at non-peak hours.

As a solo eater, this place is perfect because everyone is seated in individual booths. If you come here with more than two people, you will not be able to have much of a conversation --FYI. They specialize in Tonkotsu ramen, so that's basically what you're getting for $22. You are able to customize everything from the amount of salt, oil, toppings, and noodle texture. For my spice, I got level 10 (which is the highest without the extra charge) and this was pretty spicy for me. Next time, I'd probably just got for 8. Nonetheless, it was delicious though and I finish every last drop. You can also add more special toppings, but I didn't find it necessary.

Everything about this place took me right back to when I had it in Japan. The only thing is that it's much pricier than Japan, but for being in the heart of NY, it's comparable to all the other ramen spots. Plus, they do not accept gratuity, so it's just $22+tax. They also have private and clean bathrooms, which can be hard to find near Times Square as well. If you can't make it to Japan, this is the next best thing and glad they opened in NY.

~ Classic Tonkotsu Ramen ~
Ichiran was a late night comfort food for me back in Hong Kong. One day I suddenly crave for ramen so I came to this place knowing it will not disappoint me. The ramen look & tasted just the same! The broth is rich and have a strong tonkotsu flavour while not being oily. The noodle is perfectly al dente. The scallion and spicy sauce completed the broth really well.

Will I be back? Of course!!!
Probably no one does a tonkotsu ramen as good as ichiran in the city, so yes I will be back whenever I want to eat ramen. Plus it's perfect for dining alone as I often do, especially after a movie or concert which I often fly solo.
Interesting expierence, good for a one person dinner, very efficient straight forward menu, delicious ramen in an authentic ambiance

Vibe is normal. If you hate talking to anyone, then its here. But at the same time, its just like anywhere. People are still noisy. Sure, theres divided but you can still hear people talking.

But those doesn't matter.
What matter is the FOOD! They actually made it unique. I can tell the difference between their tonkatsu and other restaurants tonkatsu.

Egg is not pilled for you btw.

Finally got to try out the famous Ichiran, and I definitely think it was an experience to RAMEN-ber!

Yes, there is quite a wait (we waited around thirty minutes for dinner at 6 PM), but service is definitely fast and efficient, and we received our orders soon after being seated. You first fill out a paper form with your ramen preferences and any add-ons, and the staff will confirm with you before quickly bringing out your orders within five minutes. I personally loved how simple their menu was, and I was definitely blown away with everything I tried.

Ramen: the broth was so creamy and rich without being overly oily, and the chashu wasn't high in fat (which I prefer). The noodles were perfectly Al dente and the egg was perfectly cooked with a gooey interior. Loved how you could also add spice to the ramen at no extra cost as well!

Matcha pudding: this was surprisingly SO good, although a bit of a splurge. Would still recommend tho!

Ramen was a chef kiss. I selected all the recommended but choose it to be just one up spicer.  It's not overly creamy or less rich. It's perfect for all ramen lovers, Id perder a little more but it'll be another trip for me to test it out again! I'd definitely go again, 10/10 recommend getting all the suggested items for first timers.

instagram: @xcyanneats

Water is self serve, tables were clean and service was pleasant. I didn't understand the wait of having to wait for over 15+ people having to finish eating before at least 5-8 of my party of 2 and the others behind me, but it may just be easier for them

Line was not long as we went on a Wednesday

I was really excited to try this place out based on the good review and their reputation but was disappointed. Thankfully my party did not have to wait long. The experience was different and very cool. Would only come back with friends who never been to Ichiran for the experience.

The most flavorful ramen I've ever tasted, and there was zero wait time!

ICHIRAN draws from the traditional dining style of ramen in Japan. The ramen is eaten in an individual booth with curtains that hide the chef until you are served. The idea is to remove all distractions to allow you to enjoy your meal at its full extent.

I came here with a friend, and we had the option to open the side blockers such that we could eat together. When we arrived, we were given a paper where we could customize our ramens based on saltiness, richness, the amount garlic, scallion/meat presence, spiciness and noodle texture.

If you like your noodles a little more Al dente, I recommend "firm" or "very firm". I ordered the "firm" and it was delicious but could use a little more texture! There weren't many topics on the baseline set, so the additional 7$ topping set is highly recommended.

The medium spicy level was average. I could definitely increase the spicy level a notch!

The matcha green tea -- nothing extraordinary! I would pass on this unless watery matcha green tea aligns with your tastebuds. My preference is more Starbucks style of green teas. Americanized, perhaps, but a lot more flavorful.

I would definitely come back!

Get transported to Japan with Ichiran Ramen!!
Everything from the decor to the service is quick and friendly but don't let that fool you!

The ramen is top notch with nice springy noodles. The meats are cooked so perfectly tender, be sure to order extra with an egg to help elevate your ramen even more! Highly recommend to those who can't make it out to Japan!

This is a very cool spot for one person or two. When we visited this spot we got in immediately it was meant to be. I really really loved how they have this set up. Past that curtain, and you feel like you were pulled away to a different world. It was super cool. You can sit at a booth by yourself or open the divider for two people. They give you a menu and you check off your selections. The Ramen is delicious. I got an extra serving of noodles because it was just so good, I ordered the vegetarian broth and the soft boiled egg. I was chugging it down it was so delicious. Can't wait to go again!

Waited about 20 minutes to be seated for lunch. Perfect for coming here as a lone traveler, you'll feel equally welcome and taken care of here because of the super easy ordering system
I enjoyed the ramen and found it a bit too salty for me, so recommend pairing a drink or get plenty of water from the water machine. It's nice they are a no tip establishment although the price is a bit steep already with the recommended toppings. I still enjoyed my lunch a lot
Ambiance is pretty chill, just people enjoying their food and talking with friends

If you like the idea if eating without being bother by staff and waiters..this is a good spot. Food menu is small and they have veggie options

You have to get your own water by the fountain ( didn't like that part)

Ichiran is one of my favorite places to visit in New York! The ramen is always served fresh with a delicious depth of flavor. They only serve tonkatsu ramen here, but you can customize your noodle firmness and add additional toppings, such as egg or extra chashu. The price per bowl is $22 pre-tax. While that might seem high, this is a no tipping establishment, and the ramen is also some of the best I've ever had, so it is definitely worth it!

On this visit, I also got the seasonal Matcha Pudding dessert. It was very good! The matcha flavor comes through strongly, which is exactly what I wanted.

As for ambiance and service, this restaurant can't be beat! Each customer gets a little booth with flaps on the side that can be lowered if you come with a group. The server is behind a bamboo screen and lifts the screen only to take your order (which you fill out on a sheet of paper) or give you food. Eating here is an amazing and enjoyable experience every time!

Overall, I plan to return on all my future trips to New York!

Best ramen ever. I usually don't get tonkotsu but the broth was so rich and flavorful. I recommend getting the $7 topping set though because the topping portion that is included is not enough. I also got the spicy level which wasn't too hot, I loved the flavor it added to the broth (10/10).
For dessert I got the matcha pudding and omg you need to get this(10/10)!!! It was so creamy and not too sweet which is perfect for me
I really liked how it's mainly solo dining so you can focus on the flavors but you can also put the walls down if you want to eat with your friends. The servers were also really nice and explained everything to us for our first time visiting.
Everything was so good I miss it I need to come back!!!

My 13 year old son has been talking about eating at Ichiran for 5 years now. The first thing he wanted to do when we got to NY was to eat here. I dreaded going to this location because it's times Square. Wasn't trying to stand in a long line. The line moved pretty quick though.

You get your own cubby hole. Fill out the ramen quiz and you await for your bowl. I'd say it's a pretty decent bowl of ramen. The broth was light and not heavy. Been there, done that. Would love to try the one in Japan one day!

100% worth the wait. Very simple menu but full of flavor. You can customize the ramen to your flavor profile although you seriously can't miss. The line seems a little overwhelming yet the reward is great!

If you're hoping to come with a large group and hang out, this is probably not the place for you. The sitting is individual pods in a line that can be "opened" if you want to talk to the person next to you. I think you'll too busy eating the delicious food to even want to talk. The service is quick and so kind.

If you're a beer person, try the matcha beer, it's super interesting and a nice addition to the meal.

Gratuity is included in the price, which was nice.

Honestly, I'm a little surprised that ICHIRAN is as good as it is anywhere, especially considering it's become a chain and has multiple locations. But no, they keep their standards high, and their ramen is equally good across locations. I came to the Times Square location just because I was in the area, and even though the wait was a bit longer than I'd've liked, it wasn't a huge deal to me since I wasn't in a rush. Seats seem to turn over fairly quickly--after all, it is an eat-and-go place, not a place where you really dawdle. I do like that they try to seat your entire party quite near each other, though it would be most efficient/convenient for you and the restaurant if you came either alone or with only one other person. We happened to have four people, and we ended up sitting in couples, but not too far from the each other.

As for the food--what else could you ask for? Extremely solid ramen. Tasty broth, noodles well done, and the egg just is the cherry on top. They really do a good job with their ramen here, and this (or any of the other ICHIRAN locations) are definitely a must-visit if you're a ramen lover.

My fave ramen spot. I go here first every time I come to the city and it's always always alllways consistent. What more could you want. If you go during off hours you can walk straight in! Everything is customizable from the texture of the noodles to richness of the broth. I tried adding vinegar at the end of my bowl and throwing in some rice. It was good. I'd still just prefer throwing noodles in there but the acidity of the vinegar does cut Into the richness of the broth if you want a little palate cleanser.

For the tourist:
This place is a must try! The ramen is authentic and served in the same manner as in Japan. The broth is rich and savory, the pork is thick and meaty, and the noodles can be customized to your firmness preference. From a quality standpoint, this place receives high marks as well as a perfect score for ambiance and authenticity.

For the regular:
Once you've come here more than once, the novelty probably wears off by round two. The prices are high, the private booth seating is not amenable to large groups, and there is usually a line out the door. If you love ramen and are working nearby, go for it and take your lunch here. If you need to travel cross town for a bite to eat, it's probably not worth it.

The service was excellent and everyone was very polite and helpful. there was a line when we showed up, but it moved quickly. The broth and noodles were so delicious. I've never tried anything like this before in the states, also there's a no tipping policy, individual booths great for solo and couples. Pretty cool experience.

We saw that Ichiran had solo booths and had to try it ourselves. We came in on a rainy day during dinner time and there was no wait. We were immediately seated.

They had self serve water & a server kindly explained the menu & how things worked.

Most of the selections I made were the recommended ones but I did add a boiled egg.

I love the solo booth, but you are able to fold the barrier so you can eat and talk to the person next to you.

The service was really fast & the ramen was delicious. I love being able to customize things to my liking. I wish we had this in the Bay Area.
Great spicy broth, quick service, interesting private dining layout. Slightly overpriced but would recommend a try.

Just like the Ichiran in Japan. You marked your order before you sit down, the food came out quick, and any additions came out quickly too. They request that you do not tip to make it authentic to Ichiran in Japan. Can't wait to go again!
Authentic ramen spot that looked just like it's counterpart in Japan. Great for when you're hangry and just want food with little social interaction!

FOOD 4/5
Was doubting the hype around this place but wanted to give it a try, and it didn't disappoint! The broth was so rich and flavorful, and we appreciated that it was pretty customizable, from saltiness to spice to noodle texture. The only downside is that the portions are kind of small for the price but maybe that's just nyc pricing ‍

SERVICE 5/5
Of course since there is a cover between you and the servers, you hardly talk to anyone, but when they do come by, they are super respectful and announce it prior to pulling the covers up. We filled out the order form prior to being seated so our food came by pretty soon!

AMBIANCE 5/5
The seating arrangement provides a super unique experience that makes you feel like you're really in Japan! What's nice is that while you can enjoy the solo-ness of the barriers, you can also unlock and push them aside if you want to be able to talk to your neighbor more openly!

My friend and I went on a short trip to NY and I had put Ichiran in our itinerary. I was bummed thinking we wouldn't have time to try Ichiran but thankfully the line went by pretty quick! I love the individual stalls and how fast everything is. From being seated, ordering, getting our food & checking out.
If you have read my reviews on Japanese ramen, you would know I'm not a huge fan. It's usually too oily and heavy for my liking. However, Ichiran Ramen was delicious, not too heavy and the perfect serving size.
Will definitely come back when I visit NY again.

In a city where the diner is pretty much extinct, this place remains a star. It's charming, retro and vintage. Good food (the Il Caffe Latte egg wrap is the bomb, also the spinach chicken curry soup is one of my faves), excellent coffee and hot ginger tea (giant chunks of fresh ginger with honey!).

The owner is Korean and has run this wonderfully for nearly 20 years I think (she used to have a 2nd place uptown that sadly she had to close post-covid). She's so nice and caring - her manner can be gruff (if you're familiar with Korean ahjummas, she's classic!), but behind that gruffness is a very warm heart. she loves dogs and always has fresh water and dog biscuits and gives our dog great lovvies!

The staff are lovely - so sweet and fun.

Really a wonderful neighborhood place for breakfast, lunch and dinner - not fancy food, just a nice casual local place.

Really awesome spot my son suggested.
Seems like a perfect place to meet up with a friend for breakfast/lunch, or to set up at a table and get some work done.

The space is cozy but very comfortable with lots of seating inside and out (in warmer weather).

They have lots of delicious looking baked goods, an expanded coffee and tea menu and a long list of brunch options

I only stopped in for coffee but saw big, fluffy omelettes, platters of french toast and bagels coming out of the kitchen and everything looked great!

The staff did seem a bit overwhelmed, but there was a young woman training behind the register who was lovely.

Sitting right on Malcolm X Blvd, this cozy spot has so much character. The warm lighting, homegrown artwork, exposed brick and wooden tables & chairs are nostalgic. I come here for breakfast and various lattes on the go. It's less than 5 minutes away from my folks. The chai tea latte with the fresh cinnamon stick is my fav. They include the sticks in the to go cups as well.

I'm moving my way through the breakfast offerings and will eventually try the other stuff. I've had the lox platter, omelets, French toast, fresh baked croissants, and breakfast sandwiches. Note: they charge $2 per sandwich for cheese now. Service can be a little slow because they're busy with call in orders as well. Pack your patience. If you're lucky enough to get a seat outside, enjoy the musics & people watching.

I was so grateful to find a cute café on Malcolm X Blvd. on a sunny Sunday afternoon. I ordered a café latte with waters to go, which was just what I needed. The ambience is very warm and quaint. Look forward to coming back for a meal.

The best place to visit for great breakfast food and coffee. They have a dine in and take out option. The atmosphere is very comforting and sorta vintage. The establishment played jazz and it definitely set a nice mood.

I ordered an ice latte with oat milk. This was by far the best iced latte I've had in a very long time. I ordered a omelet with hash browns as well. The omelet was great with a huge helping of spinach. The hash browns were just right ! I highly recommend this place !

We ordered breakfast to go. The service was friendly, the food was well packed, and it was soooo delicious!  The egg sandwiches on the croissant were to die for. I would have loved to eat-in as the cafe was cute and cozy.

We visited NY for a few days, this place happened to be close to where we were staying. My husband googled it and all I did was look at the food pictures, it was an immediate Yes for me. We loved it so much we ate there for two consecutive days! I seldom do that, unless the food and service is great.
My husband is a coffee lover and he loved their coffee! Food was so tasty and the staff so friendly!

Cafe Latte has been one of my favorite spots in Harlem since it first opened! I would take my dog to Marcus Garvey's dog park and afterwards come and get a mocha latter and the owner always had water and dog biscuits!!!
Now it is my go to spot for breakfast meetings and food for all meals! I just got a new dog and plan to walk her uptown to visit and go to the dog park too!
This is a nice little bistro. The music highlights the jazz era and they seem to love Nina Simone. Wait Staff are all very nice and the food is good. This is my and my daughter's go to place.

The owner is despicable! To say the least, she's unaccommodating and very nitpicky. She is not into "you" having a valued service experience at her establishment. Which is unfortunate because her waiters are amazing. When asking for a refill of coffee after I pay the bill she stated that they don't give refills anymore after bringing me a to go cup. I have an asked Joe can I please have a another cup of coffee she snatched it to go cup and spilled it all over my friend.  She returns with a smaller version of the coffee she spilled literally filled the cup up with less coffee.  You would think from the experience she would have at least filled the cup up.  If not given a complimentary I just wanted a full cup to walk with and enjoy this beautiful day.  She yells at me "customer" why didn't I tell her the cup was full.  I had my reshi and Chaga mushroom with my own stevia in the cup.  So a half cup was not at all a suitable replacement. Disgusted

The food is good. So is the coffee. The staff is, contrary to other comments, polite -- at least toward me and everyone else here at the moment.

But it lacks the features Yelp says it has. There is no Wi-Fi no less free Wi-Fi. It is not good for working. When I opened up my laptop I was told, politely, to close it. Basically you're allowed to eat hear, enjoy some light conversation over a second cup, but then you are expected to promptly leave.

I'll not overstay my welcome.

I have frequented Cafe Latte for years. Today, I witnessed the owner berate an employee in the restaurant and couldn't let it pass. I don't know what the accusation was, but there's no justification for treating people the way she did. I want the owner to know her customers are observing her behavior and what I saw today was unacceptable. I will no longer patronize this neighborhood restaurant as a result of today's incident. Do better.

Pretty decent local spot in Harlem.

I've ordered from Il Caffe Latte a couple of times. Overall, the food is fine, and the price is well in line (or a little lower) than other places in the area. I will admit that sometimes the service can be hit or miss. This might be one of those places where you should request your check while ordering your food if you are a bit in a hurry. The older, Asian woman, who I think is the owner, is very nice. Also, she'll personally check in on you to make sure you are enjoying your food.
I think it's the best cafe I've been into in Harlem . It's clean , friendly , the brunches are awesome . And I love the atmosphere

The best mocha I've ever had (and I've had ALOT)

I love coffee so I was really happy to run into this shop. The outside decor really got me. There's nothing fancy inside BUT the customer service is spot on. The gentleman who made my coffee was well nice. It was unfortunate that I didn't get a chance to stay. Maybe next time.

Nice place but the boss is really bitchy and unpleasant.
We are always eager to help the locals businesses but when people are acting like her you only want to leave !

Food/tea is just OK...but not worth it for putting up with an unfriendly experience time after time. I've come several times and each time barked at instead of greeted in a normal way. I give up on this place and will gladly go somewhere else. Never again!

This is a wonderful cafe with tasty breakfast and coffee. We reserved for eight people and they set up a table outside on the street. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We enjoyed it a lot.

I came here to kill some time while I waited for an appointment close by and grabbed a latte and figured I would do some work on my laptop. I was shocked when I walked in to find the owner belittling the employee behind the counter taking my order so it immediately made me want to sit outside. I sat outside for a few minute, open my laptop and within 10 min the same owner came outside, cut me off from the conversation I was having an someone else to tell me "you can't use your laptop, no laptop, no wifi" very rudely. When I said " oh I don't need your wifi I have my own" she proceeded to get even more rude and say "I said no laptop or leave". I then told her "well that's weird" and she got even snappier then decided to stand behind my table and watch me my entire visit and stand outside. She's probably watching me type this out because she was very adamant about NO WIFI - which is so sad because this place has potential to be a great working cafe.

So needless to say, I will NOT be returning here and anyone who treats their employees like that does not deserve to own a business. If you do visit this place, it's best to take your food/coffee to go.
My favorite brunch spot to bring family and friends. It's a nice homey feeling and most importantly all the food options they have for brunch! My go to meal is the Huevos Rancheros

Not too sure why this place has such low ratings. I had two takeout orders, both times I got the lamb burger with sweet potato fries. I also tried their iced mocha. I had no complaints.

The lamb burger was phenomenal. I personally hate sweet potato fries, but idk what they did to theirs. Their sweet potato fries are like crack. I enjoyed their coffee as well.

What struck me the most was how friendly the lady was. I believe she owns the cafe or she's just always there when I visit. But she was so sweet! I had a casual conversation with her and she ended up giving me a free soda. It was very sweet of her.

This cafe has a very cute charm to it if you sit outdoors. I definitely can't wait for when it gets a bit warmer so I can drink a cup of coffee while reading a book in their outdoor seating.

Dry and dusty pastry. Terrible! Make sure to check the menu for pricing! The elder lady over charges customers and then gets upset at you for pointing out the correct price on the menu!!! So rude and  tacky! She was so disrespectful and didn't find the need to apologize for her intentional price gauging!

I stumbled upon this quaint (has it all) cafe in Harlem earlier today.
As the weather felt very summerlike, I only stayed long enough to enjoy a tropical iced tea.
Honestly, that was it, BUT it was all about the vibe that attracted me to this place.
I felt welcomed and not pressured to order anything more from the menu even though I sat at a table. But, I had already eaten and it was quiet ( no lines or anything).
The energy was positive and serene and to me, that spoke volumes.
Let me add that everything looked and smelled delicious as I enjoyed my tea.
It was suggested that their brunches are really good---and I'm going to find out for myself soon.
I just thought this little, sweet cafe was just what I needed today--so thank you for allowing me to enjoy my pitstop.

I walked in just to purchase a coffee and while doing so an African American gentleman walked in looking to sit and use his laptop the Asian woman who was at the register advised Ii Caffe has no wifi policy, the gentleman then left. After he walked out the door she made a comment about him being Black and all covered up.. Its fall and the weather is chilly there was nothing wrong with him having on a hoodie. The irony of it all is 90% of the patrons in the Cafe were African American or Black. These establishments open up in our neighborhoods and have no respect for us and our money. This behavior is totally unacceptable. This is the 189 Malcolm X Blvd location.

This place has been great for everything I've tried it for -- cheeseburger, sweet potato fries, Korean BBQ lettuce wraps (3 huge ones!), and iced tea. Maybe it's not great for some other things? Every time I've come in, it's been a super quick turnaround on food, all delicious, and I appreciate that they have the various sweeteners out so I can adjust to taste rather than trying to describe to someone behind the counter how sweet I want my iced tea to be.

Seconding what somebody below said about their sweet potato fries -- I usually hate sweet potato fries but theirs really hit the spot somehow. They're even better if you have any chipotle mayo around.

This is my new favorite neighborhood spot and central harlems best kept secret. So don't be telling people because there's only like 10 tables and I'm not trying to wait  came in one random day middle of the week, and now this is my boyfriends and I spot for some good easy and affordable food. We usually come on our off days which are in the middle of the week, and sometimes it's packed and other times pretty slow so grabbing a table isn't too much of an issue. The staff is super nice and chill, Matthew is funny as hell. Show them some love .

Service is terrible. There is a 45minute limit for dine-in which is unreasonable for a cafe. Also saw one of the waiter basically scolded one of the customers by accussing her of having the intention to sit there for a long time using her laptop when the customer was just simply asking whether her table had an outlet.

I waited for a long time for my food to be served or even to be offered water or anything.

Might not come back, especially if I plan to dine in. Horrible service.

The girl that serve me was pretty nice, She had to save me from the Racist elderly lady that was the cook. The thing that sucks about businesses like this one is that they come in to your neighborhood and when you're willing to give support they treat you like an outcast or an outsider when you don't look like the other white people moving in. The food wasn't even edible due to the amount of grease that was perfectly placed on my plate.  That's the thing ... You don't expect for people like me to even have a Yelp account to vocalize miss treatment.

Avoid this place as much as you can! This joint is an unpleasant experience. From start, it is noticable that the owner has a particular prejudice against people of color and ironically this individual seems to be an Asian descent. She is rude as can be, fake as can be, and she can't even hide how awful and disgusting she is.  Shameless, unrespectful and irate are some of the ways she greets  blacks customers who patronize her business and she treats her employees as if they were nothing. How dare she comes to Harlem with such atittude? Those are the people who are feeding her, putting money into her mouth and she has no consideration to the community that's is keeping her alive. The other day I stopped by for breakfast with a friend and I witnessed how enraged she is when a person of color comes to her joint - I was embarrassed by her disdain toward blacks and her staff. The way she acts and behaves is very conniving. I always try not to be judgmental but clearly the owner seems to be a racist big time. Her bigotry must be stopped! This joint's location is ok and the food is pricey and mediocre to say the least, and the portions are small and tasteless. Skip all the dead pastries and cakes and soggy breads. As an alternative look for others better eateries close by. I am sure you will be happier.
Great sandwiches and salads.  Fast and friendly service. Glad they are our neighborhood joint!

I really tried to like this place. I've been here a handful of times but it's always a miss. After a couple of years, I came back the other day for an oat latte. I paid $6.78 - naturally (eye roll) but was disappointed. They use oat planet, a not so very good and not so expensive oat milk so right off the bat I know my coffee won't be good. If you're going to charge that much money at least use the better brand. Oatly I would suggest. I go to other coffee shops and they charge the same amount. Better coffee, better milk, better over all. #justsaying.

Service: Great
Quantity: Great
Cleanliness: Good
Food: Korean BBQ taco & Sweet Potato Fries

What a neighborhood gem in Harlem. Great menu selections, fair price, and friendly service.

I ordered the Korean BBQ taco. It was huge and enough for two people. Very generous with beef on the top, layer with lettuce on soft taco shells.
Nice Korean BBQ flavor, however it was a bit sweet for me. But I think most people will enjoy due to the intense flavor. Very tender beef that I can't complain even it's a little sweet for my taste.
Sweet potato fries were cooked perfectly.
A great experience after all and I look forward to trying other dishes when I return.
Charming inside and out.  Clean bathroom.  Nice server made us smooth creamy lattes.  A second visit with wine outdoors.  Naughty good dark choc brownies.
This was the worst latte (flat hot water) most expensive latte for no damn reason. Horrible
Squash soup was tasty. Food was fresh and delivered quickly. I'd definitely order again.

This is such a good quality cafe. I've been coming here for a few years now and finally tried their breakfast menu for the first time. I had an omelette which comes with a big portion side salad. I love the dressing they use for it! The staff is always so pleasant too. Great neighborhood staple.

We love this place!  Not sure why there are so many negative reviews on here.  My wife and I have been coming here for years and we are relieved that the place is still doing well in these COVID-19 times.

I ordered the salmon burger for lunch with a side salad, and my wife had the veggie panini with fries.  They were both delicious!  We've also come for breakfast many times -- the huevos rancheros are great.  A pleasant, cozy place for a nice meal.

Love both locations of Il Caffe Latte in Harlem.
Their menu has great variety and offer wonderful/delicious options.
Green tea latte is a go-to beverage for me (it can be enjoyed hot or iced).
I also like their spinach, shrimp risotto - so creamy and tasty.
I often come to this location for the upbeat atmosphere. The staff members are charming and engaging. The vibe is attitude-free and very laid-back.

I recommend this restaurant

The perfect little neighborhood coffee shop with healthy food options and friendly neighbors who frequent the establishment.

If you're a salad fan like me, you'll love the Cafe Latte Grilled Chicken salad loaded with ingredients that will not leave you wanting more. Not many places in the area to get a quality salad so this is my go to for that option.

Love the simple decor as well!

Fantastic charming local cafe!
It is LOCAL! The prices are fantastic, and the food and drinks are top notch. Continue to support this business, and tip extra during pandemic. Love this store.
Delicious to put it simply. Good service, clean and friendly. Would def eat here again without any seconds guesses.

Not a bad place for bunch. The salmon burger is nice and juicy. The chicken pesto panini was really good as well.

This is a relaxing place to grab a coffee and a bite to eat.

Overall: might return, there are a lot of good options in the area.

Get. The. Waffles. They are amazing. The dairy free homemade whipped cream and fresh fruit make the dish, and the waffles themselves are cooked to perfection. Dang. I was still talking about them the next day.

Not a lot of room to wait, but luckily the turn around is pretty quick, so we only had to hover by the door for about 15 minutes.

Coffee lovers--coffee comes in a BOWL. No refills needed. Haha. Such a great experience.
Cozy and great place to get coffee in harlem. You can get branch to here. All coffees are good

Last Summer I visited with a good friend. In the past, I have enjoyed one of their salads. Well, on this particular busy day, I waited patiently to be seated outside. I asked if feta cheese and peppers could be added to the salad - I was then chastised by this angry-looking Asian woman working there. This is clearly someone who hates Black people, hates working in the food industry and she probably hates herself. She told me the salad comes as it comes and basically how dare I ask for any modifications or add ons. Seriously? If she had charged an extra $5 for the cheese and peppers, I would have paid it! I've learned that when it comes to racist people, it doesn't matter how nice, how educated or even how much you're spending - they don't want you there! Businesses like this would rather go broke than being respectful and accommodating to all paying customers. My friend and I got up and left. But based on how rude and disrespectful this person was, I wanted to throw my water in her evil face! It's a new day in Harlem when Black folks are the ones being discriminated against!

If you haven't been here, please check it out! This is a small coffee shop with a full lunch and dinner menu, as well as a wide selection of pastries and coffees. There is also a wine and beer selection if that is what you are in the mood for. I came here after work around 6pm and was seated right away for a party of 2. The setting is intimate so it is great for catching up with a friend or date night.

I ordered a soy cappuccino and pumpkin pie- first of all, having pumpkin pie on the menu in March is already impressive, as my craving for this extends beyond what is seasonably appropriate. The pie was delicious. The total check for two drinks and two pastries came to roughly $20. Service was attentive throughout our time and even though we did not order dinner, we were not rushed at all. The customer service was great. I plan to come back and try more items.

Loving the Mixed Greens Salad with Chicken!
The waiter was nice and personable!

I am glad I stopped in to charge my phone and grab lunch! Sometimes it is nice to treat yourself and I am glad I cane here to do it!

The chicken is seasoned nicely and it's juicy! I was expecting a smaller salad and was pleasantly suprised!

I'll be taking this home for dinner too!

This place is so cute, homey and pretty spacious for a NY coffee shop. I sat right by the window and got to enjoy the Sun and breeze while people watching. The cafe latte I ordered was big and delicious. The lox platter was good and the salmon and capers were fresh. The service was quick but not too attentive, took a little while to get my bill even though it wasn't busy.

Closer to 3.5 stars but the service is really "ehhhhh".

This is a cute, artsy spot that serves tasty, reasonably-priced food in a comfortable setting. I want to love it, I really do. But the service does need some work. I ordered a cappuccino and the "make your own omelet" with bacon, cheddar, and mushroom, which came with a very fresh and generously proportioned salad.

All of the above I quite enjoyed, but my waiter never came back to check on me or ask how it was. I would have appreciated the chance to ask for some hot sauce and really don't like having to flag servers down for something they should be checking back for anyway.

After my meal was done, I still had some time to kill before seeing a movie and decided to order a glass of wine. It took the waiter about five minutes to bring me a wine list and another 10 to take my drink order.

This would have been completely understandable if they had been particularly busy, but this was not the case. He was standing around chatting with a barista with his back to me the entire time as I sat there looking and just...waiting. Another server had to prompt him two times to come take my order. Not a good look, dude.

The Montepulciano red I ordered (very reasonable at $7.00/glass) was poured into a tiny wine goblet. I'm not a wine snob by any stretch of the imagination and I understand that this is not a wine bar. However, a "big" wine like that really needs a big glass to be enjoyed and as a result, it tasted kind of off. Not necessarily the servers' fault, but management should make proper glasses available for the wines they offer.

I almost always tip 20% but on this occasion, I couldn't merit more that 16-ish %.

TLDR: Good food. Good prices, but very negligent service. I wouldn't necessarily not return, but I hope they will make improvements in that area.

Came here on a late afternoon, enjoyed the contemparary cafe ambience..a few tables, a partially open kitchen, artwork for sale on the walls, and the sight of the owner with dreds/locks..very hipster vibe.

The food though wasn't as interesting and appealing. The menu looked promiing: black bean burger, shrimp and crab on croissant, and the salmon burger.

Chose the salmon burger, unfortunately it was dry, overcooked, and bland, not saved by the spicy mayo sauce or the cilantro sauce I asked for on the side. Needless to say, I didn't finish it, which is surprising for me..I eat every and anything. The fries were good though.

So in an attempt to redeem myself, I ordered the chocolate cheesecake..another fail..chocolate was so thick and rich every bite brought me closer to a diabetic comas.

My friend on the other hand, a  Harlem resident, enjoyed the black bean burger and a smoothie drink. So I'll be fair and say 3 stars. Service was also pretty good. If you're in the area, worth a trip, but don't travel out of your way considering the million of restaurants in the area.

P.s. someone tell me how the shrimp and crab croissant is please??

Cute cafe with outdoor seating in a lovely part of Lenox Avenue, food could be better, the pastries are the best part of the menu... this place has so much potential, but the customer service really needs work, the owner who is often behind the counter can be rude
Love it. very good food and kind staff. new favorite place in my neighborhood. sat both outside and inside and both areas are nice.
Was A Good Burger "! Thought about Them Being # 1 Before Or After The COVID Break"! In The City"!Tough"! A Few Times Went "! "Was Good!"

We had a wonderful dinner, sitting outside and being allowed to have our 3 lap dogs with us. Shamima, the waiter, provided a very attentive and charming service. We started with vegetarian Samosa, a vegetable platter both of which were complemented by delicious sauce/dip. As mains we had the mango salmon (my fav this evening: absolutely splendid, smooth, creamy, sweet/salty - a dream), paneer makhani (a tomato based paneer dish), as well as a chicken korma. Really without exception, the dishes were on point and just a pure pleasure to combine with garlic naan and rice. We could not escape the desserts - and again, the mango cream with vanilla ice cream was my fav! But the Gulab Jamun and the Kheer (the latter on the house) were also very delicious.
Lovely Indian restaurant in Harlem. Very cute restaurant with delicious naan and very satisfying dishes all around. The tandoori is especially good!

Service is among the worst I have experienced in 53 years of life.
It took three calls, being put on hold for 5 minutes without being told I was on hold, to even get a straight answer from these people. The young girl answering the phone was unable to answer simple questions like "can I have tamarind with my order?" Eventually, again, after three calls, I spoke to the manager who told me two things. One, they will only include tamarind if you buy an appetizer (which actually  costs less that my order) and didn't seem to care that every other Indian restaurant I order from provides tamarind without even asking for it. The second thing he told me is that they are too busy to answer questions from customers. Luckily there are dozens of other Indian restaurants in the area. I suggest you try one of them.

the food is terrible. I ordered a mixed grill, very disappointed by the portion and it was all so dry. nothing tasted good. the salmon the shrimp the chicken the lamb like all of it was dry and tough to eat. i would not come back here

The Best place ever for Indian food. Service was amazing well recommended ok. I'm so amazed that the my ladies took care of me.
I will always make this restaurant my place

Food was very good! Ordered pick up and our order was completed very fast. The saag paneer could have used a bit more salt but otherwise very delicious and filling. The chicken biryani and tandoori chicken were both great. The naan and potato stuffed bread were the best!

Let me first start off by saying this is the best best best Indian food I have had in the country. Everything is authentic, NOT greasy and just outright delicious.  

I dined with my best friend and my little boy (1 and a half years old), the staff were extremely accommodating and attentive in every single way from the moment we walked in to the moment we walked out.  

We ordered the Lamb biryani, butter chicken, garlic naan and samosas. Everything was 10/10.

The lamb biryani was fluffy and bursting with flavors left right and center and the lamb was cooked to the t, the way it's supposed to be - warm, soft and falling apart.

The butter chicken was creamy and subtle with delicious aroma.

The garlic naan was soft and extremely fresh...

Last but not least, the samosas were unbeatable.

The portions are more than generous and after we were done we had plenty left over which we packed and took home with us.

The wait staff are courteous and obviously very well trained, not only that but they were great with entertaining my toddler.

My best friend lives in Harlem and it's safe to say we will be dining at Indian summer on every visit.

Food -10/10
Service -10/10
Ambience - perfect date night spot

PS we were too busy enjoying the food to take photos!

But I will be sure to update this review the next time.

I got some lamb biriyani for takeout and it was ready promptly. It was a huge portion and there were many meat pieces in it. It was flavorful and definitely did not lack on any spices. Would definitely try more items from their menu
As good as I've had Indian cuisine anywhere on the planet earth. Highly recommend. Every aspect of dining is first rate!
Still my favorite Indian restaurant here in Harlem! Service is great and food is just as good. Make sure to get the bhel puri, lasuni gobi, bhindhi masala, and malai kofta!

Service was good; restaurant interior is clean and very nice; good music in the background.  But when it came to the quality of the food, I was very disappointed.  I had a duck/mushroom/eggplant in an onion/tomato sauce with rice.  Seasoning was so-so; duck was overcooked, dry and tasteless.  I thought about sending the dish back but I did not as it was eatable and I was super hungry.  Naan bread was $5.00 extra; no small salad or any other extra; main dish portion  was not worth $19.00.  They also added a 20% gratuity.  So, for a very mediocre LUNCH, my damage was $31.00.  BUT, I would not go back again.  BTW, the same owner also owns Harlemite, a restaurant a few doors down with far to many different food options.  My friend and I tried the Latin dish Mafongo.  Horrible. This restaurant is always empty although ambiance is really nice.  Again, it boils down to the food.

Indian cuisine is one of my favorite types, so I knew I wanted to try this spot out. This place is super cozy and adorable with lovely decor, along with pretty lighting.

For my drink, I had the Mango Lassi and it was sweet, creamy, and refreshing but a little bit on the small side.

My friend and I also shared the garlic naan. This was sooo tasty! The naan was still warm, slightly crispy, irresistibly buttery, and actual bits of garlic, giving it that satisfying strong garlic taste.

I ordered one of the duck dishes for my main course, because I found that to be a unique protein offered at an Indian restaurant. I went with the Battakh Khumb Wala, which consisted of crispy duck breast and mushroom in a sauce of almond-saffron sauce. The duck was nice and crunchy, as well as tender and full of flavorful seasoning, such as garlic and ginger. The almond-saffron sauce was the perfect accompaniment and well balanced.

The meal came with rice, which was served to us with a red heart in a green border. This was such a sweet touch.

I also got to try the vegetable samosa and tandoori chicken. The outside skin was wonderfully light and crispy. There was an ample amount of potatoes and peas inside with bold flavors of different spices. The tandoori chicken came on a sizzling platter with onions, green pepper, as well as lettuce. There was also a side of yummy savory sauce. The chicken had a bright red exterior with a slight char and was so easy to cut into.

Service was excellent and we were well taken care of by our friendly waiter. I would like to return at sons point to try the Baby Lamb Chops and a seafood special.

I am saddened to update with one star as I gave it another try and it became my go-to take-out every other Friday night after swim practice.  At the end of February, I noticed that my usual dishes had fewer pieces of moist whit meat chicken and the rice containers were now 3/4 pint size. My visit 10 days ago of the usual items: Chicken Tikka and Chicken Tikka Masala was inedible because the dishes, while filled with more chicken pieces, are no longer white meat. Upon calling the restaurant instead of walking back on the cold night, a woman explained that the kitchen now mixes white and dark meat for the dishes. And the only way to get all white meat is to request all white meat in advance. I asked for a refund given that the taste and consistency of the chicken was 1. Not what we ordered 2. Unappealing and a bit "mealy" given the white and dark meat blend. The woman ignored the request and repeated the changes in the kitchen. This place offers other delightful dishes, yet I'm wary that other changes will occur without warning, thus costing me $49.00 (3 chicken dishes) with no meal to enjoy.

I wanted to try somewhere new in the area & I saw that this restaurant had great reviews.

I quickly saw why.

The food was absolutely delicious. We started off with a vegetable samosa (my favorite samosa to date). I also ordered the mint ginger lemonade and it was extremely refreshing. The food came out hot and was truly flavorful.  We ordered lamb vindaloo which was as spicy as the waiter advised. The meat was tender and the flavor was unique. The restaurant was clean and the servers were helpful and friendly.overall, the ambiance was really nice. Suitable to families, couples friends etc.

We will definitely return in the future.
I loved the food here and the prices are pretty decent as well. I've been twice and will consider it my regular neighborhood Indian spot.

A hidden gem in Harlem that I'm so glad I discovered. Indian food is sometimes a hit or miss but baby this is a HIT! The prices are pretty affordable and cute and intimate space. They also have some outside seating. Service is also amazing.

Here's what we got and ratings:

1. Chatpata Poori - 10/10 perfect starter since it's refreshing and just the right size. The taste is amazing! Didn't expect it to be cold but it works!
2. Lamb Madras - 8/10 The lamb was tender and thought it had coconut milk I'm glad it wasn't overwhelming.
3. Indian Summer Mix Grill - 10/10 Hot plate goodness! Love the sauce and really great portions. Comes with lamb, salmon, grinded lamb (kinda spicy), and chicken.
4. Garlic naan - 6/10 I've had better elsewhere but not too bad
5. Rice - 9/10 the decoration is cool and not dry!

He Ram!

Okay, so maybe that is over the top. But I will not deny this hidden Harlem gem some acclaim for getting this cuisine right on the money.

The portions are (almost) perfect, but the prices and taste of the food work well to balance out the first criticism. Hey, two out of three ain't bad.

As for the damage...

The Mango Lassi is not real sweet and has great flavor. If you order something spicy or rich in flavor, wait until the food arrives before you enjoy this. The Mulligatawny soup is pretty blah. I expected more and got less. Less is not more when it comes to soup.

For my entree, I got the Mango Chicken per a coworkers suggestion. It comes with some rice. When I say some, it is a fair amount. They also bring out your entree with some fairly decent sized portions of garlic naan. All of which tastes great. The mango sauce comes through beautifully with the chicken. The garlic naan is a great sidekick, and the rice is like that wrestler that enters the match late to really determine the winner, which the chicken clearly is here.

Now read this carefully. You get one free portion of garlic naan with your meal. There is a charge after the first basket if you want more. They do NOT tell you this.

However...

There have been imposters and wannabe restaurants that try to con you in for something special - and for a time they can seem invincible. But in the end they always fall. Think of it - always.

This one does not.

The food is pretty good but the service is impeccable. The waitress was amazing. She is attentive, aware, and polite. The restaurant, is warm and homely. It is spacious, yet intimate. I can't sing the praises of this establishment any more. I highly recommend this establishment.

delicious food, great service, and beautiful cozy decor! i unfortunately tend to be pretty unadventurous at indian resturants, and their butter chicken did not challenge me in that regard because it was truly phenomenal! the only (slight) downside was the portions were a bit on the smaller side, no leftovers.

So I came here last week after my sister raved about the food. For the app round, we ordered vegetable samosas, which were actually cold (not good at all). The chicken biryani and garlic naan were my favorite-- both pretty good and tasty! Lastly, the butter chicken was just alright; the base of the sauce tasted like a heavy tomato sauce/paste and was also a bit on the sweet side.

I really wanted to love this place, and had high expectations, but it was just alright in my opinion.

We love Indian Summer. Everything is always delicious, service is pleasant and attentive, prices are reasonable.

We've had Lamb Biryani, Lamb Vindaloo, Tandoori Chicken, Butter Chicken, Samosas, and can't recall what else. Biryani is always my favorite; but that must be true for a lot of folks because they're often out of it! That can be a bit frustrating when I'm hankering for it.

We can always count on Indian Summer for a delicious meal in the neighborhood.

It was a perfect Valentine's Day dinner.
I'm glad I picked this cute and casual spot with great food and service. From samosa, pakora to chicken tikka masala, chicken madras, everything was delicious. And don't let me forget their garlic naan and mango lassi too. We will be back!!

All their curries taste the same. I believe they use the same base. From chicken tikka masala to lamb vindaloo

Saag paneer is excellent

Aloo ghobi is okay nothing special

Indian restaurant is filled with all mostly white customers. I have been there twice, never saw any Indian customers, not a good sign on my opinion. Not a bad place if you are craving Indian food

This place was awesome! The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious! We had the Bhel Poori to start, it had soo much flavor! Perfect appetizer! Then we had the mango chicken with chicken tikka masala. Both were very good. Glad i found this place, will be coming back to try more things! Also the ginger mint lemonade was very good and refreshing!
Ordered in take out food was spicy but right up my alley. Host was accommodating and gave a free desert. Highly recommended

My friend and I checked out this spot on the last day of indoor dining in NYC. We thought it would be packed but we were the only patrons for the majority of our dining. The staff were very attentive, friendly and professional and followed COVID safety protocol.  Our server helped with questions we had about menu items.

I love Indian food so I was excited to try the food based on all the great YELP reviews.  The reviews were right on this time because we both enjoyed our meals.  I ordered one of the lamb specials and my friend ordered this meat combination of lamb and chicken that came out sizzling on a plate. We shared some rice and ordered some garlic naan to complete our meal. Everything was simply very flavorful and delicious. I was happier that I had leftovers that I slaughtered for lunch the following day.

This is definitely a spot I would check out again.

Thanks for watching Arabic Body and Soul. We always aim to provide a great experience, and we can't get down when we can't meet expectations. It would be nice if you mention the reason why you are not happy.

If there were more stars, then I'd give them all of them...
Food was spectacular, flavors were on point, presentation was stunning. The service was superior. I will definitely come back again.

This was one of the worst looking chicken saag I've ever seen . It didn't impress with taste either although it wasn't bad by any stretch .  I've definitely had better saggs elsewhere though . Their garlic naan was good and I'll give them props on that but my main dish was not memorable . Perhaps they are better with other Indian dishes so I'll give them another go at some point .
The food was delicious, the ambiance was very calm & relaxing, and our waitress was soooo sweet.
Amazing customer service and delicious food! I wish I could come to eat here every day.

We ordered the food through the delivery and it came in good time and the food was still hot. They gave nice good portions of the food. There were big chunks of meat. The food was spicy and delicious. The only thing that would have made it better was if I had some naan bread. I didn't order it, and that was my fault. But next time I definitely would. The food tasted fresh, fragrant, lots of different spices. I loved the fruity, floral cardamom taste in the curry. I forgot to mention that we ordered chicken tikka masala, lamb madras curry, and some kind of chicken curry with coconut milk. I forgot what it was called. The only thing for my taste the food could have used a tiny bit more salt, but overall very delicious! By the way they use whole spices in the curry so I you know it's legit.

I placed my first and last order from Indian summer today. I ordered two Vegetarian dishes and while the order was correct and hot, the food was BLAND. They literally used no seasoning! What the? Chana Masala is usually flavorful, however not from this restaurant. Really disappointing however you can learn from my mistakes and save your coins. This Indian restaurant is NOT it.

This is the worst indian food I have had in my life. The Aloo Gobi taste like boil patatoes with no flavor, the shrimp taste like crush tomatoes with shrimp no spices at all, the poori bread was flat doe. If you know anything about indian food never go to this resturant. I could go home and cook better indian food than this This is the worst indian food in the world.
The food and service was beyond great.  This place is really a gem in Harlem. You won't be disappointed witn the food or service.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! The food here is amazing, and they present it really really nicely. Everyone loved their food. The vibe is so perfect as well; there are nice plants decorating the outdoor dining area, and it is in a quiet, secluded, well lit space (we dined outside). There is a little roof that still lets the sunlight through which is perfect, and it started to rain at the end of our meal, but it we were protected by the roof. The waitress and other staff is incredibly kind and patient. I highly recommend this restaurant. We went for Mother's Day, and it was the perfect place for that occasion. My mom was very happy. The staff even surprised us by putting a red heart on the rice, which we all loved.

I have been twice. I wasn't thrilled the first time I was there, but I couldn't remember why. So I went again. It is ok. The food isn't bad. But it won't be the first place I think of for Indian good next time I want some.

Glowing reviews from all of my dinner company, self included! Food is flavorful, spicy and deliciously fresh! It's a refreshing high note of cuisine in the dull lull of the Harlem Indian food scene.

If you're afraid of flavor and spice be sure to let them know that. Although I was thoroughly happy with the level of spiciness, some folks may find it extreme.  We have sampled their butter chicken, chicken biryani, lamb vindaloo, vegetables jalfrezi, and their samosas and I've got nothing but glowing compliments.  

I do really hope that the level of quality and freshness maintains after the newness of this place wears off.  I have been disappointed by other Indian restaurants in the area, but I'm hoping that Indian Summer will not be a passing fad.

A very welcome addition to the neighborhood!

Ordered chicken vindaloo a chicken and potato dish received a horrible 3 tiny pieces of chicken breast and 2 cubes of potato in a giant bowel of tomato sauce for $17. Do not go here there are better Indian food restaurant's I am sure of it.

Edit: nice attempt at saving face and lying albeit horribly I actually ordered the meal to be spicy but went outside and checked my to go order saw that
I'm being ripped off because you have hardly any chicken or potatoes but just a huge bowl of unspicy tomato sauce. You can try to lie and cheat but will always be exposed sir. Thanks for trying to rip me off now I go to yelp also.

COME TO INDIAN SUMMER!!!! My boyfriend and I had passed this cute spot a couple times after recently moving to the area and finally decided to give it a go tonight. Our server, Shelly, was incredibly attentive and ON IT!! I got the butter chicken and my boyfriend got the chef's special (recommendation by our server) along with the garlic naan and let me tell you, it did not disappoint. Our rice came out with an adorable heart on it. They even gave us dessert on the house because it was our first time!!! All the food was superb!!! We sat outside and the ambiance was wonderful as well. The chef even came out and spoke to us afterwards. It was a great experience and we highly recommend to try this place!!! They will not disappoint!!!

Also, bathroom was super clean, waiters wore gloves and masks, and seating was 6 feet apart!! :)

Nice to see a good Indian restaurant in Harlem. Ordered the summer grill which came with a quarter tandoori chicken, chicken kebab, salmon, and a piece of sausage. Tender, moist, and a very generous portion size. The chicken vindaloo has a very nice amount of heat. Needed some yogurt afterwards to cool off but you were still able to taste the chicken and spices.

It's great to have another Indian option in the area. The service at Indian Summer was pretty on point. I swear that our cups of water were never empty (or went below 3/4ths full) during our meal. When the food arrived our waitress constantly checked in to make sure everything was ok.

The meat served in the apetizer sampler was so juicy. My fish and mango dish was prepared very nicely. It was so delicious that I wanted to order another dish to take home for dinner, part 2. For the price, you will get a decent amount of food.

Hopefully in the near future, the restaurant will have wine and beer options.

This place was spectacular! It's a super cute spot and the staff was very attentive!. The food was delicious & the waitresses recommendations were spot on! I definitely recommend the Bhel Puri if you're looking for a good appetizer & for the main course, the Chicken Hara Masala (has a creamy, minty, and cilantro flavored sauce ~ soooo good).  If you're in the area, would make sure to stop by or order take-out.
Favorite restaurant in the area. Sometimes I order from them twice a week. Highly recommend.
Delicious food and wonderful staff! We ordered the crispy duck vindaloo, spicy lamb and samosas. Everything came out amazing!

Okay this is probably the best Indian food I've tasted in my life. The area was not the best and there were barely any people inside, so we were beyond pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. The price isn't even too hefty; the taste definitely justifies whatever it is. If you like Indian food and you're in NYC, you need to give this place a try.

Second time ordering take out from Indian Summer Harlem and it has yet to disappoint. From start to finish, everything was on point. The delivery was impressively quick and the food was still hot upon arrival.

My girlfriend and I ordered chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken. The chicken tikka masala was creamy, tender, and rich in flavor. The tandoori was also flavorful and juicy. And the garlic nan! The garlic nan was a pleasant surprise! It was so airy and light, tying the meal together perfectly. Definitely a place to consider when looking for a healthy alternative.

Really all I could ask for when we craved Indian food for weeknight dinner delivery -- dishes (vegetable samosas, saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, lamb biryani, plain naan) were delicious and portion sizes were good. Came faster than expected, arrived hot. Would order again in a heartbeat!

I did the Chana masala, goat curry with rice and ordered a paratha on the side. Food was excellent and priced well. Service was great however it's the summer and it was hot af in there. This place could benefit greatly from some outdoor seating.
Gross food! The palak smells like rotten watermelon or piss. Is this a joke? The chicken is full of small bones and kept getting stuck in teeth. The lamb is I think goat and it lamb

I called back after being disappointed in the palak paneer. It smelled spoiled and tasted sour. The guy said I could get other food to replace it. I said no thank you, because; the rice was flavorless and burnt. Also i only got 1 type of sauce and it was bad too.
I asked if i I would be able to return the food so they could see for themselves and pick up the refund $17 total. Not including the delivery tip ofc. He started yelling at me and telling me I cant do that because they were closing. (They still had about 50 min before closing) But come on. this guys reaction is yelling at me over the phone, not even letting me talk. And so i wrote this review.

Got their palak paneer, I took a few bites and couldn't finish it. It was oddly bland and mushy with some bits of undercooked or uncooked raw ingredients that were pungent and unpleasantly gritty/crunchy. Also so greasy, for some unknown reason. I've never had a palak paneer I didn't like. Only reason I'm not giving this place 1 star is because it's the only thing I tried here, and because prices are cheap. But between the grimy interiors and poor experience I will not be coming back.

This is the worst food I've ever had. The meat was full of bones, oily, and rancid. It was inedible.

The sides were microwaved and probably safe, but the sight of the rancid orange tikka made me lose my appetite.

I don't understand how this place could possibly have good reviews. Please, please do not order.
Food was flavorful enough but rather oily. Service was okay--the store feels chaotic and the menu is difficult for first time customers. Not sure I'd go back. Garlic naan was amazing, however.

Friendly staff, delicious food, big portions, good price at this counter service establishment.

I have been here many times for pick up. I get a veggie combo (with roti) and a mango lassi. It is always great.

During normal times I like to join and eat inside.

During covid also has a few tables outside.

An extra-star for customer satisfaction that isn't always present in NYC establishments. The owner-man from Pakistan was kind. I had the Seek Chicken with rice. I asked for some of the lamb gravy and he was kind and generous, adding several dollops of rich goodness over my vegetable biryani. And on top went sliced pieces of 2 large chicken kebobs, spiced mildly. I also added a veg samosa on the side which was not especially memorable but the yogurt sauce that came with it certainly was! I also had two of the small, green chili peppers with my meal. I ate at the tables set right outside, due to covid regulations. Left sweating bullets from the spice and heat, just how I like! Will be back again!

The food is suuuuuper yummy. Ordered takeout. We got the aloo paratha, lamb bhuna with naan, and seekh kabab with chapati. Everything we ordered was made fresh. I think the key to eating at a place like this is - order something that needs to be made fresh, not what's in the case up front  Also really great, courteous people, great service.

Cheap and fast halal/"Indian" food in East Harlem.  It's greasy and not authentic by any stretch but it is filling and the portions are good for the prices.  You can get a chicken or lamb over rice for $5.99 (mix of two for $6.99), and add a naan for another $2-3.  As long as you manage expectations, it's not bad.  There is next to no seating but they deliver if you order at least $15.

Absolutely horrible experience... please do not waste your money and time on this one. I don't think words will describe how bad it was, I wish I could send it back and watch cook to eat it please do yourself a favor DO NOT order anything from this restaurant

worst chicken tikka masala ever. stay home and make your own food. there is better indian food out there.

why did it taste spicy, rancid and like garbage?

the owner called me and had the rudest manners. he said that people order this everyday but the real question is - do they ever return back to your restaurant? no.

i told him i would be more than happy to dig through my trash to give him back the uneaten food.

make yourself a pb and j. the food is not worth it. don't order.
The food was just ok (three stars), but they messed up my order. I was supposed to get naan and bread with my order. Either the naan was awful, or they forgot it and charged me for it.

Ok so .. first off the service is terrible.. the staff is rude and they have no care for customers opinions. Now on to the food... if you want to call it that. I ordered 5 items off the menus and everything just tasted disgusting. This is not Pakistani or  Indian food, it's a really poor attempt at best.

Do you self a favor and spend $10.00 more and other from someplace else.

Never again ... never

I live directly across the street from these guys. The owner's son Shemoon and worker Owais are super nice and the food taste great. Cant get enough of the chicpeas and vegetable fritters. They know me by name and i feel really welcomed and safe here. EAT HERE AND TIP WELL.
Very good, nice and spicy! Nice clean small spot in Harlem!! Our chicken tiki was sooo good. For sure a new spot we will be coming to often

Standard Indian style fare.  Very popular with can drivers cause it's cheap an be fast.  They use to be located on 1av n 91st but moved uptown a few years ago.  It's a satisfying meal and worth the $7-8 dollars.  I'll get the goat Curry an be the samosa are pretty well done.
To be honest, they just don't know how to cook goat or lamb meat. It's terrible and smells a lot. These people also charge extra for using a credit card.

I tried several dishes with a friend. This place can be summed up in one sentence: Large portions of good food at inexpensive prices.

Samosa - It was an order of two of these for $2.00. They were definitely microwaved, but still tasted fine. A good choice for an appetizer.

Garlic Naan - Not bad. The naan actually had little chunks of garlic in it, was very fluffy, and tasted good.

Chicken Tikka Masala - This was the first entree we tried. The portion, along was the side of rice, was huge! Their chicken tikka masala is very creamy and was excellent. Taste-wise, it was very strong on the yogurt taste, but weak on the tomato taste.

Lamb Biryani - This dish was even better than the tikka masala, and was the best part of the meal. It was very fragrant and full of flavors. I highly recommend this entree if you try this place.

I don't understand why people are slamming this place. For the most part they make my food nice and fresh everytime. It may take an hour or more but everything is good. I have been ordering takeout from here for years and it is pretty much the same all of the time. These guys are awesome!  Keep it up guys.

My friend placed a very large order from here and I picked up the food for his ordination ceremony. The food was excellent, all of the guests liked the food.

I gave up with NYC Pakistani restaurant until I came across Indo Pak Halal Restaurant.

Had simple daal and peas & carrot subzi.

Glad I tried to give it one more shot today and discovered the hidden gem.

The restaurant is complete mom pop style yet outstanding delicious food.

Will return 200%!

My husband has already posted about our experience with Indo-Pak, but I wanted to elaborate just a little more. Literally the most disgusting delivery service imaginable (attitude-wise). I was hosting a party in my building, and I confirmed with Indo Pak that my order (40 naan and 40 samosas) was going to be a certain amount. I hate dealing in cash so I called the restaurant twice to make sure the price would be X amount. I never carry cash on myself, and if I do, it's usually singles or a $5 bill or something. I asked if I could pay over the phone with a card to just keep things simple. I even spoke in clear Hindi so he would understand. They said that they only deal with cash.

When the guy came to deliver, ridiculously late, my husband handed him X amount. The guy yells about the delivery fee and tip... but the order was to be delivered by 7 and it was already almost 8. I was aware of the delivery fee, which my husband and I already had accounted for, but a tip for a yelling man who was super late and didn't even follow our directions? Nope. He began yelling at my husband and threatening to call the police, lol. I told my husband and our other friend to stay quiet for a second while I dealt with him.

I (very calmly and collectedly) told him that I wasn't here to cheat him out of his money, and that I didn't care about an extra $20 or whatever he wanted. But I did tell him that from my thorough understanding my bill was supposed to be X dollars, and that it wasn't cool that he was racking on dollars just because of his own inability to follow the GPS (he kept complaining that it took him forever to get to our place because he couldn't figure out the directions). He literally waved his hand in my face and acted psychotic almost, saying that I was a terrible woman and "you people are bullsh**!" There were kids around and he kept cursing. Our doorman and concierge began trying to calm him down and our friend handed him a $20 bill to shut him up which finally made him leave, as he cursed the whole way out.

I have a problem with unorganized businesses that are inefficient, but feel so entitled to a tip. I also hate that this man was just so utterly disrespectful and lacked class. He embarrassed us so much.

This was good Indian food despite the bad reviews. It seems like everyone was very harsh on the rudeness, delivery troubles, and ambiance but it is what it is when it comes to cheap Indian.

I had the Chicken Tikka Masala w/ Rice and it was delicious. Not too much chicken but the sauce was creamy and full of flavor.

The garlic naan was also up to par covered generously with garlic.

I had the samosas too which were very generic and the vegetable pakora which I would stay away from. Both came with more of a mexican style salsa verde rather than the mint chutneys that I'm accustomed to but still good.

I would come back again for the Chicken Tikka Masala and garlic naan

. Rude delivery guy. Messed up order. Couldn't find the address, kept on arguing about not being able to find the place..... all this while he was standing right outside my building.

Worst Indian food ever, floating in oil. Had to throw away most of food

Horrible experience, the place is ugly and dirty, they're extremely unfriendly and the food is gross.
