Don't bother there is a real Indian restaurant on third ave. at 119 right in front of Hunter College which has delicious food an friendly staff. I need Alka Seltzer right now. Got to go, I have to throw up. Sorry but is the truth..,

My tongue fits with Pakistani side taste of curry. This is the great place to have Indo-Pak curry. Chicken Tikka Masala is good, Nan is great. Pre-made curry at the store are great enough, too.
Rice has to improve somehow, tho...

Genuinely one of the worst places I've ever had delivered from within an cuisine. This isn't so much horrible food, which it was, but also tastes NOTHING like Indian food. The naans are about the only thing that made sense. I ordered from here just because they were open earlier than other Indian places and was hungry. They are cheaper than most places I will give them that but you pay for what you get in this world and if you order from this place the chicken tikka masala might as well be chicken in ketchup and water. GROSS AND STAY AWAY if you want authentic Indian flavor

Very cheap Indian food with a ton of options- they usually deliver on time but be this it is a cabby restaurant so not great quality. Big portions but the food is very oily.

I'm giving 3 stars because they serve the purpose when am looking for some quick Indian food that is not doing damage to my taste buds.
Great food and can't beat the reasonable price. Chicken tikka and kebabs are great along with the naan.

I have been coming here for years. The staff is friendly, the food is delicious and they are moderately priced. I only have one complaint, they don't take credit cards.... you can order through seamless but for some reason everything they offer is not on there.

I had the same initial reaction to this storefront as some other reviewers, but I can also say that we used to live upstairs from the vegetarian-friendly Indo Pak and have enjoyed countless filling takeout meals.   2 years later we are in the neighborhood and they still recognize us with a big hello. Usually four meat and four veggie choices at the counter but there is also a menu.  They make their roti fresh on demand in a clay oven the owner brought from overseas.  Look for the taxis parked outside, sadly, this kind of place doesn't exist in the Heights.

Indo Pak Halal is an excellent option take out lunch. I usually get the one meat, one veg and rice option for $7 bucks. The food is fresh, it taste great and is wholesome. Most of the folks who dine in are cabbies. I would give this a try for sure.

My wife and I catered naans and samosas (40 of each) from here tonight for a party. She placed the order a few weeks ago and confirmed it this morning. Our total was to be $100 (cash only) on delivery, and the food was to arrive at 7 pm. In theory, everything sounded great, even though the restaurant employee barely spoke English.

Our guests began arriving around 6:30 pm, and around 7:30 pm the delivery driver finally called us that he's outside. Actually, he had mixed up drive and boulevard. Around 8 pm, after wasting time that I should have been spending with my guests on the phone with him deciphering his broken English, he was finally outside. He was an hour late, and he didn't know how to use a GPS.

I went outside to collect the food and handed him the $100 bill. "What about delivery and tip?!" he screamed. I calmly reminded him that my wife confirmed that $100 included everything, both a few weeks ago and again this morning. He exploded! He came into my building and began yelling that I was cheating him out of $20 in front of my neighbors and doormen. He was cursing in front of children! I had a lone $5 bill left in my wallet, so I offered it to him to meet him partway; I wanted to get back to my party, but he wanted to cause a scene and call the police.

My wife came to check on the hold up, and he began insulting and threatening her too. I can handle an asshat, but nobody can talk to my wife like that! He started demanding the food back and trying to return our money. My guests heard the commotion too, and out of embarrassment one handed him a $20 bill and told him to GTFO.

The food was mediocre. The attitude ruined the experience. If he was the owner, he should know better. If he was an employee, he needs to be fired.

Went in cuz friend of mine wanted to eat Halal Pakistani food..This is a small place, they have some tables and chairs which is good.

Food was....nah. I mean it's affordable, but I guess u get wht u pay for! It had flavor, but it wasn't anything out of this world or anything!

Terrible experience with this establishment. I recently attended a party that catered 40 naans and 40 samosas from Indo Pak and witnessed the following scene unfold. Upon arriving more than 1 hour later than the agreed delivery time, the delivery "man" demanded extra tip money due to us living in a "nicer building" and "being able to afford a higher price." Completely unprofessional. He created a scene in the lobby (cursing and yelling in front of children, threatening a woman, etc) and had to be removed from the premises. I DO NOT RECOMMEND doing business with these deceitful individuals ever. However, if bottom-of-the-barrel service, deceitful and downright scummy business tactics, and late delivery is your thing, this is your kind of place!

On top of all that, the food was terrible. The naan was dry. Samosas were nothing to write home about.

CHEAP CHEAP WOOAA CHEAP!!

I just ordered from here and though that because it was so inexpensive the dishes might be too small and for under $20!! Honestly there is enough food in my apartment right now to feed 3-4 people!

$3  Samosas WITH Chick Peas - UNBELIEVABLE!
    (they came in one dish together and it was
     the BEST thing I have ever ordered I swear!)

$6  Chicken Tikka Masala - small pieces of meat loads of sauce
     (not a small portion doesn't come with rice)

$4  Tarka (Royal) Daal  - EXCELLENT!
      (Lentils, Kidney Beans Prepared with a Touch of Herbs   )

$3  Keema Naan  - DIFFERENT BUT GOOD. I could taste Lamb?
      (Unleavened Bread Baked with filling of Minced Meat)

$1  Regular Naan
      (1 Order is one medium/large folded piece of unleavened bread)

$2  For (1) Gulab Jamun  & (1) Rasmala
      (The guy was nice enough to let me have one of each
        instead of two of one)

They even packed in some raw onions along with cucumbers for those of you who like adding more spice.  Each dish already has a lot of flavor and in my opinion does not need to be spicier or saltier or changed at all!  I'm going to chop up the onions in the morning when I make eggs for breakfast.  Now I don't need to run to the store!  Thanks Halal!

Needless to say I will be ordering delivery from here again. I don't think it's a sit down restaurant but either way take out or delivery is okay with me!

Date Rating: N/A
Pick up Scale: N/A

Strong Suggestions: If you like rice specify that you want some with your meal. Ask if it is included.  If it's not then just order some I'm sure it's cheap!

NOTE: This place is a GREAT deal. I wouldn't bring a date all the way across or uptown just to go here. But if you're ordering delivery and live on the UPPER EAST SIDE then this wouldn't be a bad choice at all!! It's SUPER CHEAP AND SUPER TASTY!!

Used to go here a lot! But I feel like the curries they have here are pretty oily and I'm not a big fan of the rice or naan, It's nice that they let you put together your own salad for your order, and the kabobs and the chai here are pretty good. The food here isn't expensive and the service is fast because the orders are prepared from the dishes in the steam table. They also have a couple of desserts in the fridge.

I really like "hole in the wall" places. They are cheap, and the food and service are good!
I have been going to this place for ages, even back when it was in the old location. I try to make it here at least once a month.
I really enjoy the chicken tikka masala. Plenty of sauce to enjoy over rice, and to dip naan into.
The mango lassi is pretty good as well! Nice and cheap, and quick service to boot.
Self serve seating, and they have water in pitchers if you prefer water with your meal like I do.
I wish they delivered to my area (UES). If they did deliver to my area, I would be ordering here at least 3x per week.
The rice served here is very tasty. Portions are generous and can be shared for two. One hungry husband and one very pregnant lady (me)  :))

Hubby and I usually order
-one order of chicken tikka masala
-garlic naan
-rice

enough for a 6'5 hungry german oaf
AND
a very preggies me!

definitely check this place out.

Hit or miss! Authentic Pakistani food, freshly cooked and delicious when done right but I made the mistake of ordering Chicken Tikka Masala one night and it is the most vile thing I have ever had. Dishes of preference are the lamb biriyani and the minced meat offerings. Ordered the beef once and it had terrifying tiny bones and hardly any meat. They also often don't have all the items and call you after an order has been placed to check if you can take something else instead. I will still take the chance sometime but it comes with its risk.

I was hopeful that this place would be good since New York is a melting pot of all cultures, and it came recommended from a local. First, they were 30 minutes late delivering. Then, the delivery driver smelled HORRIBLE and spoke no English. He was also driven to the location by another employee. I'm not sure why the driver wasn't also the delivery person, but this seemed odd. The food was mediocre. I ordered papadum, chef special biryani, garlic naan, palak paneer, poori, and grape ginger ale. Instead of what I ordered, the poori was replaced with wheat naan,  and the grape ginger ale was actually plain ginger ale. Once I dug in, the chef special biryani just ok. I wasn't expecting bone-in chicken and bone-in lamb, but the flavor was good. The garlic naan and papadum were also good, but those are pretty hard to screw up. The kicker for this 2 star review was the palak paneer. I asked for saag paneer but decided to try this anyhow. I have never run to a trash can to spit out food so quickly in my life. IT WAS DISGUSTING! Had it not been for that, I might have given this spot 3 stars. It was just overall underwhelming.

I ordered from here and honestly i doubt I will order from this place again. The chicken vindaloo was NOT spicy at all and i had more bones then chicken.  The Aloo Gohbi was okay a little mushy.  

My Naan how ever was cold. :/

And to make matters worse I didnt get any rice with either entree... I doubt I will order from here again.

This place gets two stars only because my g/f feels bad for the owner/slash guy working the cash register; otherwise, this place would get a solid 1 star.

I ordered the lamb vindaloo and some naan. The naan was good and tasted like human food, but I can't say the same for the lamb vindaloo mush.

The lamb was gummy and the vindaloo sauce was oily and underspiced.

I would not recommend this place to anyone with  taste buds.

The food was okay, not great, but okay. However, we picked up the food, paid, and went home to find out they left out half our order. We called, they said they would send it right away. An hour later, it still has not arrived. We call again, they said they would send it right away. 30 minutes later it arrives. That is absurd, awful service.

It doesn't look like much from the outside , or the inside for that matter but the food is awesome. We only ordered the chicken tikka masala and shared it and it was more than enough for my husband and I. It has so much flavour and not too sweet. The flavours were just right. It was a little on the spicy side. One star taken off because they only accept cash, will order again.

This place is okay.  Their pricing is reasonable- I had the chicken and vegetable special, which comes with a small salad and bread for $8.  They leave the bones in their chicken, which I really don't like at all.  I didn't finish it.  It was a lot of food.  However, you do get more than what you pay for, which is a good thing when you're really, really hungry.  I'll order from them again as they are affordable, but next time, I think I'll just go for veggies and rice with no meat or sides.  The rice dish alone was more than enough food for me.

Cash only.  However, they will accept a credit card if you order from seamless or grubhub.

Worst customer service imaginable. Ordered through Seamless, then called to make sure they noted my request for less salt and spice than normally. Got immediately yelled at with a "Who do you think you are to call us and make demands about your food?!" - and then, was told I lived "too far" to deliver to anyway. Nevermind that they've registered my neighborhood as one to which they deliver via Seamless, and that I'd already paid for my order. Not that I missed out on much - the adjectives used to describe their product range from "oily" to "subpar" and downright "disgusting," but it is incomprehensible why they'd wish to add "unprofessional, flippant and boorish" to that list.

The chicken tiki masala is to die for here. Quality Naan, fast delivery service. The location is a little suspect in terms of cleanliness/friendliness, but ordering pick-up or delivery is awesome.

Heard the alo-gobi is good as well (vegetables)
This is my favourite place to order indian food great quivk delivery and the best prices the food is amazing alot comes a la carte which is great cuz i don't eat rice!! So i get to try everything

The food here is absolutely incredible. Everything is prepared with homemade care and attention--fresh ingredients, wonderfully spiced, and so delicious!!! I have lunch here at least twice a week and am always impressed by the broad range of vegetarian options. This is a gem!!!

the first impression was formed when a few friends ordered food. it was good food, generous servings and very very economical.

a few days later when i was craving meat and looking for halal stuff in east harlem, this is the only place i could find. the restaurant is a typical taxi stand kind of place.....which is a good thing, cuz food is always being consumed and fresh stuff being prepared.

I highly recommend this place for delivery. if dining-in, just dont expect silver ware and silk napkins.

Environment:
with Geo News channel playing in the back ground and the restaurant owner displaying his political affiliations expressively and a few middle aged men discussing the problems of the world, the environment couldnt be more authentic desi!

We stopped in while in the area with our picky 13 year old. It was AMAZING! We had goat roti, jerk chicken, and Mac and cheese. We all loved it! Honestly, best food I've tried in a long time and we are foodies. So savory and delicious! The owner Jason is lovely and friendly. Try it!

This business was taken over by a new owner and this once great restaurant has really gone down the drain.  It's not even worth much time, so all I'll say is the that the food is below par and the service is even worse.  I wish it was not like this because we don't have a good Island place is the area.   I've tried it serval time in hopes of an improvement so I walk in the this past Sunday, I was the only customer and two guys came out from the back, look at me without saying a word and just ignoring me as if I was not there at all.  
What even more disturbing about this place is that it set up with these glass barriers and nowhere to order from.   It's uncomfortable and I simply can't understand how they could remain in business.

The best food on the upper East side. Stop by and enjoy the different dishes.
You will not be disappointed. They are open Monday -Saturday, for lunch and dinner.
I really enjoy everything.  Please read my first review, it hasn't changed.
There are days, I don't  cook! The owner would says, Hello, with a smile. How are you? And I say " HUNGRY ." LOL
Thank you,
ISLAND BITES
Brown Stew, curry chicken, collards, cabbage, patties. Everything here is great. My favorite Caribbean spot around.

I wish I could know I was wasting my money on something before hand but that would probably defeat the purpose of delivery . I ordered the oxtail meal and idk what type of meat this was . It was unflavored and hard felt life I trying to chew through leather . I am very disappointed, not every one should put oxtail on a menu that do not know how to prepare it . Zero stars !

I ordered the large oxtail meal with cabbage rice and peas and plantains, the plantains were really good but for $26 (I got it delivered but still) it was definitely not worth what they gave me. And the oxtails had a taste to them that I couldn't get over

Omg ... my stomach!!! Not even an hour after I ate your curry chicken... the food is like deli chicken and Spanish rice and gradules... seriously not sure what kind of food this is but when I looked up Jamaican food I really thought I was getting Jamaican food ... and this just can't be!!!! and now my stomach is literally in an uproar... nope nope and nope

This restaurant has respectful employees and super awesome food. The soup-specifically the carrot and corn and the cow foot are both excellent choices. In addition, I would also recommend the shrimp and rice with a side, which is extremely tasty. Finally, I would advertise a patty -of your choice-with a Tropical Rhythms drink.

Good flavor but VERY small portions.
Got the jerk chicken w/ steamed cabbage for $7.62 after tax.

I did not enjoy anything from this restaurant. I was excited to try a different eatery and was highly disappointed. The oxtails tasted spoiled and whatever seasoning or spice used to possibly enhance flavor only backfired. I can barely describe the flavor. Unlike any oxtails i've had before. The patty was stale and flavorless. The meat inside was not appetizing in the least.

I almost never write yelp reviews however considering they charge $2 per patty, I figured I would at least receive a product of decent quality. Unfortunately, after waiting nearly an hour for my food, all patties received were burnt.

I tried to call multiple times to have the issue addressed and unfortunately received no answer.

Would love to support a Black business, especially as Harlem is rapidly gentrifying however this isn't how you treat customers. Will be spending money elsewhere in the future. Over $20 spent down the drain.
I love the food but when you ask them for extra meat they dont give it to you..they so stingy with the meat.. lol they will give you 4 pie of meat for a large.. not looking good

Best rice, beans and plantains I've ever had. Get the read beans with white rice, you don't need the seasoned rice because it's going to be sopping up all the delicious juices they cook the beans in anyway. Get the sweet fried plantains. Get a little plantain, rice and beans in every bite and you're on your way to heaven. Oh yeah, and it's only $5 and I could barely finish it... barely.
First and last time ordering. I Ordered Large fish meal , Mac n cheese, collard greens, and lentil peas, coconut cake around 1 PM. I had diarrhea and sick the next day.

The food is extremely salty and of bad quality. I ordered curry goat, several vegetable dishes and Haitian legumes, and everything tasted the same. Two of those dishes aren't even from the same country. I won't be ordering from this restaurant again.

Great tasting food .
Decent price .
The staff was friendly
** small resturant
** no sitting no tables

Unfortunately, I never got to taste their food. I arrived to an empty restaurant, said hello to the gentleman behind the counter who was serving plates and let's just say maybe I didn't hear him. After about about 5 minutes of standing there he tells me he'll be with me in a minute. After another 5 minutes of watching him make plates, I walked out and I'm never coming back. #customerserviceiseverything

I ordered the large oxtail meal from grubhub. The oxtails were so dry & a lot of fat.  I asked for extra sauce,  there was no sauce on the oxtails.  I make better candy yams & the mac & cheese wasn't great.  I'm said my usual restaurant was closed.  I will never order from them again. I don't even think the restaurant deserves 1 star.

Was just walking by, and saw the big "grand opening" sign, so I stuck my head in to check it out. It was small and clean and smelled frickin' amazing. The ladies behind the counter were so warm and friendly too.

I wasn't really hungry but it smelled so good I knew I had to taste SOMETHING. I had the Haitian chicken patty and it was delicious, with a crunchy phylo like dough and lightly spiced chicken inside. Cannot wait to really explore the menu. There's jerk and oxtail and curry goat in my future.

I ordered the black rice, curry chicken, mac n cheese and collards... and I must say it was damn good! The collards weren't over cooked the mac great and the Mac was the best I've had in a long while! I'm definitely ordering again.

Food is usually pretty good, although there are times when the chicken patty has been off (the chicken tastes like it went bad before cooking) or the oxtail is very fatty and not good quality. Also recently increased prices and their sizes aren't best

I went to this restaurant on a whim and couldn't believe the small amount given for such a hefty price. Shame on them I ordered a veggie meal the man gave me cabbage and yams very small no rice no bread nothing and charged me nearly $8. Never again and I suggest you keep away also.
Everyone needs to check out this place. The food is irresistible and the the prices are great. The staff is super friendly. Check them out if you're in the area. You won't be disappointed.

I heard good things about this place so I had to check it out for myself! Needless to say it is AMAZING!! This is truly a special place brining food from the islands, Haiti, Trinidad, Jamaica to east Harlem. Stoked that this spot is here and I will definitely be coming at least once a week.

Service is great-they welcome you and give the attention you need when placing your order.

I love the oxtail, it comes with sides. Definitely try the Mac and cheese and plantain and cabbage. Also, their menu will be expanding!

This is a nice welcoming place w great food. Definitely check it out. I was going to post a pic of my meal but I ate it before I had the chance to take a pic! Next time
How did this place got 5-Star? We ordered oxtail and the oxtail was dry and the meat did not fall off the bones. It's like basics for Jamaican oxtail to be soft and juicy. Major fail
I order the oxtail and mac and cheese from here at least once a week. So good. The only thing I wish is that they were open every day.

I love the food here. I have nearly tried everything off the menu & nothing disappointed me. Great taste, decent price and nice portions. The oxtail is amazing, meat always come off the bone and the gravy.. omg!
Food was good it was a little pricey was not happy about not allowing to get a smaller meals. It's a meal with two sides. It's good if you like to eat a lot with a bunch of people.

Nasty attitude. Mediocre food. I ordered curry shrimp she said they don't have it. I asked, what kind of shrimp was in front of me? she said shrimp. I inquired about the flavor she pours juice in a cup and hands it to me. Lost a customer.

I've had the pleasure of ordering out a couple of times and honestly the food keeps getting better and better. The food is consistently flavorful. The plates are hefty and you deff fell like you get what you paid for. To be completely honest what i like the most is their friendly and warm approach to customers. I have the pleasure to chat with one of the co owners and the love she has and puts into the food is amazing. It makes me feel better about eating it lol. I highly recommend. The jerk chicken is spicy. The oxtails and make and cheese are to die for. Spinach rice is delish. The corn bread is

I like this local pizza on 125th and at nicholas ave
Their pepperoni is beef and that's a big plus for me.
Due to inflation, their pizza size has gotten smaller compared to what it was a year ago.

The ipozza in 126th amsterdam is terrible, don't go there

By definition, this is a New York Pizza slice not gonna lie. It is the best NYC pizza slice? No, but it does the job, of a typical new york slice you eat on the go when you are rushing and you need the quick bite to eat. The garlic knots are pretty good too! The place is  well needed on 125th because to be honest 125th street is lacking pizza places. So thank you for being there.

I don't write bad reviews. This time, however, I can't see a way around it. Do not bother ordering from IPizzaNY on Amsterdam Ave because it is truly awful--the sauce is soupy and pale, the cheese slimy yet undercooked, the crust cardboard-esque. It's just very, very bad.

This is a local pizza shop on 125th that serves allow meats! This is a plus for anyone who does not eat pork for religious or dietary reasons. I haven't been able to get a good slice with beef pepperoni outside of Brooklyn in a really long time.... it is much appreciated. The staff here is very friendly and they greet everyone like a neighborhood place should. You can get in-and-out within about 5 minutes and the pizza's usually fresh (They sell a lot of slices). The space itself is pretty small but you can get what you need and go.

I didn't know it was even possible to have a bad pizza in NYC. In fact, this is by far the worst one I've ever had in my life. (And I'm somebody with pretty low standards when it comes to pizza, so that's saying something.) I ordered it (2 slices of margherita pizza and a drink) on Doordash about 40 minutes before closing, so it's not like I placed a big order at the last second. (I've worked foodservice before, and I never place an order at a restaurant if it's less than 30 minutes to closing.) When I tried a slice, the cheese was hard and had absolutely zero sauce at all underneath. The only sauce on it was a few very thin scattered dollops on top of the cheese. It was completely flavorless, all I could taste was the crust.
NYC has thousands of other pizza places to choose from instead, so I'll choose any of them next time.

After getting done with exams, my classmates and I decided to get some pizza. One of them pitched the idea of coming to this particular place, so we all went with it.
The place is small, and unfortunately not air conditioned. So we decided to take our pizzas to-go.
My classmates all got cheese pizza, and I went with the barbecue chicken slice. The pizza was delicious, and the slices came in a good size.
The staff was ok in customer service, not rude, but not overly friendly either.
While I would seek healthier options regularly, I would check this place out if I was craving pizza again.

Nice drop in pizza  joint. Great location great and quick service. Only thing is it's not much space to stand since there is no seating during these times. The margarita pizza added with pineapples and sausage is my go to, and oh so delightful. Don't take my word for it try it out yourself. If your looking for quick and easy from your pizza pie! This is the space abs the place as you pass by! Great people as well, share the word with someone and please do tell!

Not bad!  The family got hungry while sightseeing in Harlem and we just wanted something fast and easy.  Perfect spot to come to.  Pizza was ready in a jiffy and it was really good!

My daughter and I both got a slice of pepperoni  and those suckers were HUGE and tasty.  It hit the spot and gave us enough energy to conquer our next tourist attraction on this list - Central Park!  I loved the dough, it was stretchy yet firm and the cheese on the pizza was good and fresh.

The service was fast and super friendly and the food was very inexpensive!  Dont forget to try their garlic bread rolls also!

This is a solid quick-fix non-franchise pizza spot in Harlem. I have stopped by a few times when I'm craving a quick meal. The slices are pretty large and two slices are more than enough for me. Prices are bit higher than I would expect for the neighborhood.

I've had pepperoni and sausage slices. Their sausage slices have quite a bit more oil than the pepperoni. I prefer my crust thinner than what they serve here, but overall the texture isn't bad. Overall this place is a no frills pizza joint that is thankfully not a Dominos or Pizza Hut. There is minimal seating and I've always taken my pizza to go.

The staff was fine in terms of customer service - not overly friendly, but they get the job done.
Not bad. A local place if you want to just grab something really quick to eat. It was packed when we went. The staff was friendly. The pizza was okay.
Great find at a local joint! I was craving NY pizza and this hit the spot! The people were friendly and there were enough spots to sit down. Will be coming back!
IPizzaNY in Harlem is delicious. Consistent flavor   Our go to pizza spot for the family when we want a tasty pie.
The slice of pepperoni that I got was better than I expected for $3.50. If it was $4 I would have been ok with it. 5 stars because I got a slice that was better than its cost. I like pizza.

Oh my God, IPizzaNY was definitely cool. Excellent service, nice atmosphere. Absolutely tasty and also wholesome. Workers are extremely welcoming. They're attentive, polite and always on their game. Keep it up IPizzaNY! Can't wait to go back soon.

This place is amazing.  I went with my hungry family and their food was so good.  The thin crust pizza was great and their pasta too.  We also had tenders which were white meat, tasty, juicy and delicious.  Staff was friendly and clean place.

While the pizza is good, the attitude of the staff sucks. The guy making the pizza has a horrible attitude.  I asked about the specials and he asked if I could read. BITCH, can you read??? Perhaps you should learn about customer service before opening a business. I won't be going there again!
5 star! Best food truck I ever had , everything is fresh , clean , mac and cheese hit different!

Was in the city during lunch looking for somewhere to eat and came across this truck. I tried the lobster mac. It was delicious. The lobster was a fried lobster tail on a bed of macaroni pie. I enjoyed it. Pro tip add a bit of jerk sauce on it. Thank me later

Listen i love to support, but after following the truck for years. I can finally say. THIS AINT IT.
The food was okay the service was aight.
But for the price I paid I could've went to any Jamaican
Spot and gotten the same thing if not better.
I love support my fellow Jamaicans but sheesh
I paid over 80$ for two plates.
They ran out of Mac & cheese and I was like okay no problem. So I order the lobster Mac
Regular was idk what price but they charged me 27 & change for Mac and cheese with lobster thrown on top.
I was really looking forward to this food but now I'm just disappointed and hurt. Save your bread because
Imma tell y'all even with all that love in the meal
You can get it elsewhere for a better price.
Also I waited about 40 minutes when they said it was gonna be a 20 minute wait.
I wanna give a second chance but honestly I can't.

I'm sold on Island Spice Grill!! I've eaten from this truck twice this week.

Firstly on a Tuesday from the 168th & Broadway location. I had the Surf & Turf *Lobster & Oxtail with Mac & Cheese* sooooo good!!! The oxtails were so tender and perfectly cooked, lobster full of flavor.

Secondly on a Saturday when they pulled up to Fordham Rd. Oxtails again, this time with rice & peas and cabbage. I am NOT a cabbage fan BUT I tried theirs and I actually liked it.

On Tuesday they arrived on time, Saturday they were 20mins late. I can see how that becomes a problem for ppl on their lunch breaks. But for me it was a lazy Saturday so I patiently waited.... Believe me their food is worth the wait!! Order from their app, go to the window to pick up your food and you're on your way.

Saw they were going to be on Long Island for a food truck festival so I went, they were in Huntington. I had a plan and it was to go straight to this truck. I ordered lobster and shrimp over mac and cheese.

The food was DELICIOUS!!! The lobster was tender and melted in your mouth, the shrimp was perfectly crispy, with a sweet and spicy sauce. It was tons of flavor exploding on my taste buds.

They were very generous with the portions. It was somewhat pricy but that was to be expected quite frankly. This was definitely a cheat meal for sure.

I've been waiting To eat at this truck for a while I always miss them. The worst 31.00 I've spent! The rice was hard tasted like leftover The mac was ok. The oxtail was good I also got the sorrel drink it was pretty good.
I will not be eating from them again!!!! Don't waste your Time or Money!

I figured eh how good could it be from a food truck. I was getting something for someone else and said to myself  I'll give it a shot .  

Holy ...!!! WAS I SURPRISED ...THIS IS AWESOME !!!

I got the lobster Mac n cheese and to my surprise ...there's almost a whole lobster in it  !

The lobster is sweet and cooked perfectly. The Mac n cheese is done exactly the way it's supposed to be. Not too much not too little....just right.

I'm torn.
I used to really love this place.
And, I really like the Chef, his wife and family.
I'm giving 4 stars for the family and I'd give 3.5 stars for the food.  For me, 3.5 is good...decent.

However, I must say that I've been disappointed lately. And unfortunately, I have to stop going. Although I'm moving to another state soon, I still wanted to show support until I left. But, lately the arrival time of the truck is ridiculous. Most of us are professionals and can only be out of the office an hour (give or take). This last time, I arrived at 11:45am and didn't get back into my office until 1:15pm. The food is good but not worth my job.

My favorite is the jerk chicken, roasted corn, festivals and plantains. Unfortunately, the last two times they didn't have roasted corn or festivals...no dumplings either. Well, I was told that it wasn't ready. So, I just got the jerk chicken and plantains. I couldn't wait any longer.

I do hear and see many complaining about the prices. Yes, they are pricey. PERIOD. I agree. But, it is what it is.

Again let me reiterate that I truly like this family and want to support them. I'm almost feeling sorry that I'm writing this review. But, if they tighten up with the time and food offerings it will be great!!

Suggestion: have a point person at each location ahead of time to help with parking the truck, "crowd control" and giving updates. It could even be a regular customer! I'd help if I were staying in NY.

Anyway, blessings to Island Spice Grill! I pray that a restaurant is coming soon...I think that would help the truck with preparing food and having all advertised selections available.

The people who run this truck were very pleasant people. Friendly smiles, great customer service, just really nice people.
Now about the food.
I like that they have many options to choose from, and if I'm in the area and they are there, then I would definitely try other options. On this visit I went with the oxtails and white rice, and although tasty, I really didn't care to much for the way the oxtails were prepared. I'm really picky about the way I like my mines. I like more meat and way less fat, and although some people like theirs that way, I don't. So this is why I say the meal was tasty, very well seasoned, but not something I would order again.
The prices are a bit more than some Moms and Pops, more like a sit down fancy restaurant price. I think as a food truck maybe the prices should come down a bit. I mean I don't want to pay prices like that, with no were to really go but back to work or home. I feel like it should be a good street fair price, just my opinion.

They do take cards and cash. Don't know if they are at this location often, but if I see them there again I would buy something not more then $10.00. This visit I believe I spent about $15. to $17.

I'm picky, but I know good food!
Island Spice is next level, the oxtails are the best.
the Mac n cheese ooooooooouuuuu!

First I'll start by saying I'm a big supporter of small businesses because I understand the struggle small businesses encounter with that being said I also feel business can learned from mistakes and take constructive criticism. So I Pre ordered at 9:57 am  place pick up order for 1:35 got there 1:41 they had sold out of Mac and Cheese. I was a bit surprise because I ordered at 9:57 am didn't think it's something that should be sold out.  Food was salty and overpriced for the quality of food being served. Items I order
Stew Chicken with rice and peas
Jerk chicken with rice and peas
Jerk chicken with Rasta Pasta

Lobster Rasta Pasta!!! Let me say that again LOBSTER RASTA PASTA! Sooooo yum. Nice shareable portion and let me tell you that I was pleasantly surprised at the chunks of lobster meat throughout the dish. They definitely do not skim on the lobster and for that alone they deserve a gold Star. Nice claw meat chunks. I was totally surprised when my friend mentioned that this was a food truck. Like how wow! It is recommended that you order early given the risk of running out of lobster meat haha. Get you some lobster Rasta pasta and prepare yourself for the glorious post carbs nap!

This is the best island food I have had in a while...especially a food truck.
Me and my friend stopped here and got the oxtails, lobster, mac and cheese, peas and rice. It was a $35 plate but well worth every penny.
I understand they go to other boros but no matter where they go, I will get a meal from here anytime!
the jerked chicken lunch combo is very good. I don't have it often because I can't get it where I live, but this is VERY good. Very friendly people as well, great story!

Would you like some oxtail with your salt?? Did the salt bottle drop in the pot and you were like " well screw it "
My wife is Jamaican and we eat Jamaican food ( not from here ) 3 times a week soo we know our food! This was disgraceful! I wish we ate it at the food truck so we could of gotten our money back.
Jerk chicken didn't taste like how jerk chicken is supposed to but it was still pretty good. It was giving me spicy bbq vibes. The Mac n cheese was BUSSIN but the rice was mad dry.

Island Spice Grill is a company that serves grilled food via a food truck. The Island Spice Grill food truck travels to various boroughs (Brooklyn, Manhattan, Bronx, etc) and services people with a variety of grilled food such as Jerk Chicken, Jerk Pork,  and Brisket.

I had the pleasure of eating and thoroughly enjoying Brisket with Salad and they also give you a slice of bread. I have been anticipating trying the food and was eager once I got my food order.....As soon as I opened my styrofoam container, I saw the Brisket swimming in lemon pepper seasoning and I took my first bite. The Brisket was absolutely DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!! The Brisket was moist, juicy and succulent!!!! The salad was great and the bread was soft, chewy and tasty!!!!

I cannot say enough great things about the food and I am looking forward to trying new selections on their menu the next time such as their grilled corn, their fish and their lobster (they only serve the fish and lobster at catered events).

So I just ordered this so called patty and coco bread that is supposed to look like the picture this was a disappointment it was nothing like it #not even close I'm so maddddd  that is false advertisement

Not even put together
Have to do better

Thank you for coming to the upper east side!

Delicious food, enticing smells and forgivable long lines.

This is one of the yummiest jerk chicken I've had in long time!

The food is, and remains, exceptional!!  However, I wouldn't set my clock by the arrival of their truck. My last experience started with a late arrival of 30 minutes. But they quickly made up for the delay with quick preparation and excellent food.

If I could give 0 stars I would. The worse Jamaican food I have had in my entire life and I'm not exaggerating. I just ordered this from the food truck near NYP columbia and the lady taking  my order was so rude and to top it off this is what jerk chicken and rice is. The chicken was extremely dry I could barely chew it and it had no jerk chicken sauce to it at all no seasoning no flavor or anything. It was old and dry and the rice had no peas and it was very dry and I kept biting Into hard pieces because it's so old. The salad came with no dressing that's dry too and the plaintajns were oily and greasy and soggy. Absolutely horrible!! I rarely write reviews unless it's really that bad. It was horrible what a waste of $15.

We tried the food today for the first time. I've always followed Island Spice on IG and I read the rants and raves about the food and decided to give it a try today. We were/are truly disappointed and dissatisfied with the taste of the food. The food looks good but does not taste as good as it looked. My husband and I ordered pepper shrimp, jerk pork, jerk chicken, festival, cake, jerk sauce and a drink. We spent a good portion of money so this is no BS review.

The jerk chicken and pork lacked flavor. It was so bland I had to salt my food when I got home. I ended used some of the jerk sauce and That didn't help much and we ended up throwing the food away.

The jerk sauce/marinade is very watery and lacked flavor also for something that's supposed to be homemade. We were better off buying some grace or Jamaican choice jerk sauce.

The festival is great!! The sorrel is great!!! The pepper shrimps were bomb. I just wish our main dishes could have compared.....
Very pricey for a food cart. Rice was hard and no taste. The jerk chicken was overcooked and tasted more like barbecue chicken

Whoever runs this truck is got an amazing marketing team. The hype on FB and Instagram got me excited for months until I finally dragged my ass out to TSQ (my least favorite place). The line were well organized and the truck has a certain ambience that attacks those who are adventurous for "exotic" foods.

Well, I've had some fair amount of Jamaican food to know what good jerk dishes taste like - from whole-in-the-wall spot in Brownsville, to corner stores in Jamaica, Queens, plus road-side jerk stands on a road trip from Kingston to Negril. To me, the food here is truly not that impressive. The jerk sauce they serve is nothing more than a spicy BBQ sauce. All the meats are dry and lack the true jerk profile.

If you are simply looking for a different type of BBQ, this may be your spot. (pick chicken because it's the relatively okay one out of the three). If you are looking for real Jamaican jerk, I'm afraid you will have to cross the bridge. Unfortunately, paying $14 for a small portion of mediocre BBQ and a side salad just isn't my thing.

So after all the hype on Facebook I finally got to try Island Spice Grill. Today's location was on Court Street and Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn.

Let's start with the positive:

Prompt and Courteous service. The lines were distinct: one for those who prepaid and one for those walking up. I prepaid for my meal and was given a stub with my corresponding PayPal invoice number.

Let's talk prices. Bare in mind I hail from a West Indian household. Jamaican heritage . So I know when I'm getting jerked. For $13 I received two quarter legs cut up, romaine lettuce as garnish because it fell significantly short of being a side. The other "side" was a meager slice of hard dough bread which was half of the end of the bread. My friend who hadn't prepaid purchased a combo, jerk pork and jerk chicken with two roast corns. What she received was one quarter leg cut up, a slab of pork cut up and two halves of one whole ear of corn that was barely roasted. All for $21. Oh and for one combo, you guessed it ONE slice of the "front-back" hard dough bread.  

As for the taste, it wasn't super phenomenal. No mouth watering goodness, but it wasn't bad. It tasted fresh and was satisfying for what it was. However we will not be patronizing them again.

Walked in the snow to get some great food around 1pm
No lobster Mac No oxtails
I received a small portion of inedible Mac and cheese for $7Small portion of jerk pork with no bread as advertised
$12Waste of money waste of time

I actually direct messaged on Instagram to see if lobster Mac was still on the menu and got no response unfortunately with the weather I wasn't able to leave work to even see about getting it rectified

I work at NYP in Brooklyn and this food truck came today to serve food. We ordered over $100 on food through the website. Preorder. They arrived late and we had to stand on line for the food after we did the preorder hrs before. Plus to top it off they charge you a tip and taxes on food. Never again would I eat from this truck. You come to the hospital to serve us frontline workers food and we have to deal with the unprofessionalism of this food truck. Bad business

This food vendor is around the city Monday -Friday I believe and I've been dying to try them but unfortunately , i haven't had a chance to meet them anywhere .. until yesterday after leaving curlfest activities for the weekend .. long story short I was SO HAPPY that I saw them outside the rollerset .. with the heat and a few drinks in my system I needed some good food .

So I ordered jerk chicken alone with festival - the chicken was really delicious .. moist and well seasoned but the star of the show for me was the festival .. this is not ur typical fried piece of dough.. it tastes like is has a blend of spices cinnamon nutmeg even vanilla ..

I follow the vendor on Instagram and I got to meet the chef and run some jokes with everyone on the truck .. he let me try a few other things like the oxtail and breadfruit and everything overall was very yummy and fresh especially it is original Jamaican food ..

Anyway I'm definetly gonna follow the truck for some jerk pork and some seafood .. I really advise you to eat from here for some authentic delicious Jamaican food and follow on Instagram for truck location -hours and  menu .. Also get a visual of the deliciousness .. trust me u don't want to miss

Wish I could give zero stars. Very unorganized. If your going to have the option of Pre ordering food or Door Dash there is no reason for long lines when food is being picked up. And why was it that people who pre ordered getting food after those who was placing orders at the truck. If you do not for-fill orders that we're paid for already, you shouldn't be accepting new orders.

People had plans for Mother's Day but ended up spending hours on a line waiting for food. And I am very dissatisfied with the service given. You run out of food and the substitute was not substantial to what was paid. I paid extra for Rasta Pasta and only received cabbage with my jerk chicken which happened to be cold btw. For the prices you are charging for food that isn't the best, it should be better. No oxtail. No mac n cheese. No rasta pasta. And no rice and peas. I DID NOT GET WHAT I PAID FOR. I WANT MY DAMN MONEY BACK!!! $20 for jerk chicken and cabbage is a disgrace.

PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND DO NOT ORDER FROM THESE PEOPLE. ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND VERY DISORGANIZED.

Island Spice Grill will never see another penny from me. I preordered food this afternoon at (at 1:39pm to be exact) for a $40 meal. The pick up spot was supposed to be 168th st and Broadway in front of Presbyterian Hospital in the Heights. I walked over and arrived close to 2pm. When I got there, there was NO TRUCK! I waited there, walking in circles looking for this truck for 45 minutes and there's was no truck in site. I know the area very well as I was born at that very hospital so it wasn't like I didn't know where I was. I emailed, DM'd and commented while I waited...no response. When they finally replied to a comment, they LIED and said they waited. I know they lied because I recorded video of the area and there was no truck. I never got a reply to my numerous DMs and when I asked them in the comments about a refund no one answered. I will be disputing this charge with my bank to get my money back.

The worst part about it was, I had my lil brother with me. They had us come near a hospital during a global pandemic just to never show up. Ridiculous.
The jerk chicken mac & cheese was amazing, it was great having the truck right outside our job location, I will definitely be following them on days I'm off and near there location.....

Tried Island Spice Grill at 60th and Lex this past Wednesday. Yumm! It's got a burly food truck grill. A grill truck, via trailer hookups. The grill was not for sale.

However, the meat platters were. 1, 2, or a little bit of everythang. I tried Jerk Pork and Brisket. Good and MOIST, unlike the bread. But the bread, the whitest bread I have eaten all year, was a nice useful little sponge/napkin. Grilled corn available as a side, as sweet as high summer.

Orders and payments are collected in line, which moves quickly. No drinks available.
Excellent food as always. Caught up with them here at the Famous Food Festival in Jersey City.

I've been following your food truck, FOR YEARS!!! Since I can't even remember... I've never had the time or ability to catch you because of where you would be located for the day. I moved to MD, and still follow you because I enjoy looking at your delicious food daily, only to dream of one day being able to catch you. FINALLY!!! It happened! I came to the city for a day, and was able to catch your truck @ Mt Sinai yesterday. I tried a Large Lobster MAC, your oxtail dinner, and lobster Rasta pasta... and your rum punch! If it wasn't my son bday weekend I think II wouldve tried everything on the menu, but I had to save SOME funds . Your food did not disappoint it was EVERYTHING I dreamed of... and more! I didn't even get a chance to eat it hot off the truck, I had to wait until I got back home and heat up again, and it still was amazing!! I just had to take the time out to say how much I enjoyed your food! It was well worth the wait AND the $$$. The young lady at the truck was a beautiful soul! She was very friendly and excellent customer service. I was just a little disappointed there wasn't a separate line for pick up, but everything else was amazing. I plan on trying to catch you guys again next time I'm in the city. Now I know what to expect!

I've been seeing this food truck on Instagram and everything looked so good.  SoI finally decided to try it a couple weeks ago and I was highly disappointed. I ordered the belly buss and it was sooo salty you couldn't even enjoy the food. I could not taste any flavor only thing I tasted was salt I ended up throwing my food out. That was $40 down the drain. There are plenty of local Jamaican restaurants with way better tasting food at a reasonable price.

This is one of the best food trucks I've ever had. When I say 'truck', I mean a black Escalade pulling around a huge oil drum grill.  You can usually find it on on Broad St between Beaver and Pearl. Just follow the smell and look for the long line of people.

The food: I've had the Brisket and Jerk Chicken.  Both were perfect. Smoky, spicy, juicy, and tender. The ample portion of meat is served on a bed of mixed salad greens and corn.

The service: They are very polite and friendly. There are a couple people working the line, helping it move quickly, someone on the grill, and a guy standing behind a big wood block with a meat cleaver, chopping away. They've been playing Bob Marley every time I've been so you get to jam out to that while waiting on what will likely be a long line.

I'll def be going here regularly. And after bringing our food back to the office and having the smell take over our floor, my curious and hungry coworkers will be doing so as well.

Other Info:  Jerk Chicken ($10), Jerk Pork ($12), Brisket ($12), Combo ($14) - Ca$h. And they cater.  Highly recommended.

Too much fat for me personally, the bread was from the end slice & stale. The line moves quickly & everyone seemed nice.

I just need some more meat with mines. Couldnt eat it, was gonna toss it but decided to use it to make a stock instead. If theres a next time I'll have the chicken breast or see if I can choose my slices of brisket.

You can't go wrong with chicken. Was standing in line with face mask on because I had the flu, it is a bit of a wait and it was cold outside too. I'm a fan of soup so I was planning to get the soup of the day, and then they passed out samples of the soup which was delicious and help warmed me up on the line. Just the soup I was sold! Their jerk chicken was well spiced up and moist.  Everything would'e been perfect except I got the sweet plantains and it wasn't ripe. I prefer that they don't put it on their menu if they don't got ripe ones that day.

On 3/4/21 I ordered food online for pick up at the One Love Truck in Harlem on 135 th street. My order# 1530467975 and my order total was $139.08. When I arrived to pick up my food I notice that the 2 Rum Punches was not in the bag. I brought it to the young man attention and he said that they did not have any Rum Punch and that he credited my account. Today is the 4/02/21 and I have not received my money back yet.

Their professionalism needs to be better. I always try to support..but it seems like they're never on time. So I don't even bother anymore. If I happen to be in the area maybe I'll give it another try. But it's just been a waste of time. They'll post that they'll be somewhere at a certain time, tell YOU to be early, but won't show up till an hour and a half later !! Just not worth t

So to update: a few months ago i happened to be right in the same area as the truck so I hopped on line. Line was long, waited at least an hour but I was anticipating that already. I got the lobster Mac and the oxtail with Mac. They definitely know how to sell well on their IG cause the food and portions looked nothing alike lol. I ended up barely eating the lobster Mac. Pretty dry. Oxtail and Mac fared a bit better but the portion was EXTREMELY small. Especially considering the cost. You're paying the price of a full meal.. while only getting the portion size of a side order. When I factor in the wait time, cost, and portion size, the value isn't there for *me*. Wish them the best tho

Horrible Horrible Horrible , I had the oxtails w rice and peas n cabbage. I got a box of bones , dry rice and soggy cabbage . For a 1st time customer , I would have thought to receive better. When I posted on the page of Instagram to voice my disappointment , they blocked me .

I have walked by this grill for months and always avoided it because of the long line, but now that its getting a bit chilly figured my opportunity to grab a bite outside is soon coming to an end.  WOW - I have been missing out.  The grilled aromas of brisket and jerk chicken were right on with the delicious tender flavorful meat.  Not to mention the traditional island music that they play making you feel like you've been transported to the Caribbean.

I was indecisive about whether to get the jerk chicken leg/thigh or breast so I had the guy grilling the food make my decision.  He then went into the grill pulling out a chicken breast and replied that I never tasted a chicken breast as good as his and if I had, he would give me my money back and proceeded to cut me a sample.  He was absolutely correct!  It was a succulent piece of chicken infused with incredible smokey flavor.  He then cut up the breast and placed it on a bed of lettuce w/ hot sauce (that is a little sweet as well) and a slice of bread on the side.  This has to be the best street food I have had, cooked to perfection.

After all the hype, they were in Rockefeller Center just a few steps away from my office, so I decided to give it a try.  I had the jerk pork and, first and foremost, a spring salad is not a good side.  The pork was tough and chewy and the plate was full of fat.  What a waste of $12 as I had to throw most of it away.  In addition, I hated the sauce, which was more like a BBQ sauce, as it tasted of too much tomato so lost its authenticity.  Will definitely not go back.

The best thing about this outfit is their marketing.  It will draw you right in but honestly, don't waste your time.  Back to the Jerk Pan I go.

I was veryyyyyy disappointed with the food I received today.  The Mac and cheese was cold and I was given a very small portion. Nothing like what is advertised on IG. The jerk chicken was ok but it was mostly bone and had that blood taste in the center of the thigh.  As long as I have waited to have your food I was throughly disappointed.  The first time I was able to get to Jamaica the oxtails were good but I always was dying for the jerk chicken Mac and it was less than subpar . I was given a small plastic container of Mac and a leg n thigh jerk for $12.

I've passed this truck a few times in Manhattan. The lines were always long. I was intrigued. Today they happened to be in Jamaica queens. Being that my coworkers were going I figured I'd give it a try. There was no line..not surprising being that it's in Jamaica queens charging 12,17,20 dollar plates. This came with two sides, which ended up not being sides. A bed of spring mix greens and one slice of hard dough bread was the sides. Shameful.
Now to the food
Not impressed to say it plainly. Not horrible but def not worth the sticker. My pork was burnt. Nothing like eating bbq with the outsides burnt. Pieces were toughish as well.
Just wasn't good overall. Kudos to doing something different with the whole festive truck thing. Lots of people will enjoy. But to hardcore jerk fans, not so much

I've witnessed the lines smelled the BBQ and was intrigued.  I did the prepay so I didn't have to wait I didn't know what to get everything sounded great so I tried the sampler platter so I could try the pork, chicken and the brisket.  The jerk chicken was good, the brisket was tough as shoe leather I was so disappointed in it. I wanted to badly to try the lemon pepper brisket that was supposed to be so tender it melted in my mouth.  (Not today). The pork was just meh, I had a hard time telling the pork from chicken everything was pretty charred.   So back to the chicken which was good, I will go again and get just chicken.  It was more BBQ chicken and not so much jerk chicken though.  Be prepared to go back to work or wherever you are going smoked out from the BBQ Pitt.

first time I tried them, the jerk chicken was dry and just didn't have flavor. I decided to try them again, maybe they were just off the first time, but jerk chicken was very dry again and burnt with no flavor- taste like regular store-bought chicken. disappointing and overpriced, was charged $16.

I've always wanted to try this food truck but lines were always long. I was in the Midtown area and thought that at 1pm, maybe the lines wouldn't be too long. I waited on line for over a half hour to get food. I asked if they do half pasta and half meat (I've seen photos of people's food on their fb/instagram) and they said yes, so I ordered half rasta pasta and half oxtail. The portion was so small, I was still hungry after finishing. It looked like 2 small scoops of pasta and 7 pieces of small oxtail (2 were just bone). For $20, I thought I would've gotten more food. The pasta was good, albeit a little oily. The oxtail was tough but tasty. I want to try more of their menu but I'm not sure the long line and small portions will be worth it.

My experience yesterday was absolutely horrible. The truck posted up at noon as advertised. I got on line at one. This line was wrapped around a busy corner in Washington Heights on 168th St. and Broadway under some dirty scaffolding. People were skipping the line. I ended up waiting in line for an hour and a half. The line got volatile to the point that folks were cursing each other out. It was madness. I stayed on line remembering the last time I had been there which was a pleasant experience. When I finally got to the front, they were out of everything but jerk chicken and rice. I am going to say rice because, although I paid an extra $3 for rice and peas, when I checked my food when I got to my desk, there were no peas in the rice at all. There is no meal price. You are paying a la carte for each item. Any other West Indian restaurant for that price ($12) is going to give you rice and peas and cabbage included. So, for $15, I got an hour and a half of my life I can never get back and some basic jerk with no gravy on the rice with no peas in it. What an absolute waste.

Today I had the opportunity to wait in line and try two of your famous dishes the Lobster Rasta  Pasta and the Jerk Chicken with Seasonal Salad and let me say that this was my first time trying food from a food trunk and I can say that you set a high standard for the other food trucks.the lobster Rasta Pasta was delicious and melted in my mouth and the Jerk Chicken had the perfect amount of Island Spice. I can't wait until tomorrow so I can eat the little bit a have left-over. I schedule my daughters follow up appointment to a Tuesday so I can now have an excuse to wait in line again.

We're new to the neighborhood and wanted some adult time after putting the kiddo to bed so we stopped by at INine Bistro for their Taco Tuesdays on August 15th.

Ambiance:
The restaurant is very instagram worthy with a multicolored flowers, a light up photo opp in the front and really hip decor.The also have a HUGE outdoor backyard with couches and chairs and a projector. They were also having a Open Mic show outdoors. We were more hungry than anything so opted out of the open mic show and choose to sit inside. (Though we will be back on another Tuesday to check it out) The inside is dim, perfect a date night with upbeat R&B music that was the perfect volume.
The only thing that was a little off putting was being searched and patted down at the door. That kind of put me on alert but we were happy they are taking extra precaution to keep everyone safe and the security guard was super nice.

Service
Our server was a nice young man who was patient and understood the menu. We were super impressed that he remembered our orders and got it correct  without writing anything down (I guess I'm just old school like that lol). The young man eventually left and a nice lady took over and continuously checked on us. Everything came out quick and hot.I have no complaints on service

Food:
I had the salmon burger with sweet potato fries. And it was perfect!! Salmon was fresh, and seasoned well. The purple slaw on it was delicious. With some extra tartar sauce on my burger is was seriously awesome. 5/5 in my book.
My boyfriend took full advantage of the $5 taco Tuesday deal. And got about 8 tacos  he tried the jerk shrimp, steak, fried fish, buttermilk chicken, paprika chicken and oxtail taco. And me being the annoying girlfriend, I went ahead and took a bite of each one. They were delicious!!! The jerk shrimp was too spicy for me but if you're a spice lover like my boyfriend you will love them.  
I had a glass of merlot which was simple but good.

All in all, we really enjoyed iNine. Was a great restaurant for a quick dinner date. We will definitely be back. Would love to see what their brunch vibes are like! Would definitely recommend 5/5

International Nine has been on my list of places to try for some time now.

Back in May, plans were made to grab dinner and catch up, @ another location. When I arrived and they were closed, I was in search for a backup and I remembered my list.

Late afternoon/early evening I was lucky enough to find a non-metered spot across the street. We entered and was seated immediately, as the place was pretty empty at first.

I ordered the Nephew Punch (the first of 2) to start along with a couple of apps- Vegetable Patties & Firecracker Gulf Shrimp Tempura. The punch was tasty and the patties and shrimp tempura were nice starters. In addition I ordered the Grilled Jerk Shrimp Taco & Grilled Paprika Chicken Taco to try prior to my entrée of the Kingston Caesar Salad w/ Jerk Salmon. My dinning companion ordered the Kingston Caesar Salad w/ Jerk Shrimp. Of course by the time my salad came out I was full. Both tacos were delicious and flavorful but the most memorable star was the jerk salmon, I had to try it before I packed it to-go. Light, flaky, juicy with a well balance of both sweet and spicy flavor components. The croutons also had a slight sweet coconut flavor which was a nice added touch.

The dining area itself is not that big, but they made great decor decisions with international clocks and hand painted murals. Even though the dinning space is small they do have a seated bar as well as outdoor space in the back. As the night proceeded foot track increased, for the event that was held in the back space.

The food was great and the staff was pleasant, however at times the services was very spotty even though it was not busy. We were the only ones dining initially. Also I was little put off because we were seated by a table occupied by someone with authority and a definite managerial position (based on his interaction with staff and the laptop) who had his shoes off and did not deem it appropriate to put them on after we were seated or when our service started. It was a bad impression to say the least.

Overall I enjoyed my food and I am happy I was able to give them a try. I will return but I will make sure it's around the same time (early). With a small dinning space and slow service I can only imagine when they are busy.

Just A Note:

The Jerk Salmon was amazing!

We ordered an extra piece to take home with our salads that we couldn't even attempt to eat because we were already too full.

Inne Bistro truly impressed with its lamb and oxtails. The lamb was perfectly seasoned, tender, and flavorful, while the oxtails were rich and melt-in-your-mouth. The presentation was meticulous, and the attentive staff added to the overall positive experience. Definitely a gem in the BX.

I came to ININE Bistro for poetry open mic a couple of weeks ago and was absolutely stunned by how incredible of a restaurant and venu it was.. and is. I arrived a few hours early to ensure I received a performance slot as this particular event, Voices in Power, is quite popular. Since I was so early, I decided to order lunch and was pleasantly surprised by their very affordable and delicious sounding happy hour menu. I ordered the mozzarella sticks as well as the beef empanadas. Both were fried golden brown to perfection and came out piping hot.. so good!

Spark notes:
- Incredible and friendly service
- Gorgeous art
- Fabulous rear outdoor space with heat lamps and cool murals
- Chill, laidback and upscale vibes
- Strong drinks

Been wanting to come here for a minute, and finally had the opportunity to come. I came for brunch and it was a cute vibe. We sat outside in the garden and it was cute but just a tad bit hot with only the fans to cool the area. The drinks were really good, but the strawberry lemon drop was my favorite. For my meal, I had the Korean BBQ steak and eggs which was very tasty. No complaints here. My only critique regarding the food was that the brunch menu was a little limited. A few more items on the menu would be perfect. Despite a semi-private birthday going on and a nearly packed area, the service was a 10/10. The hookah was perfect, and not too harsh. We got Love 66, which is my go to. The DJ was great and played a mix of r&b, dancehall, and afrobeats. I would definitely return. I have to try the jollof rice for sure.

This review is simply based on my fire ass drink that I had. A lemon drop. It was sooooooo good. Service was a little slow at first. Overall it's a cute Lowkey spot. Music was on point. I'll be back to check out the food.

This place is a capital V vibe!!!! I went with my boyfriend for just a lunch but we ended up partaking in their brunch menu. And when you walk in, you don't expect this place to have a huge, beautifully green and floral decorated outdoor area, making for perfect instagram worthy shots. Inine Bistro is a Caribbean party!! They only rocking with Afro beats and Caribbean songs! I got the korean bbq steak and eggs and my man got the piña colada shrimp with waffles and both were delicious. We also got their hennesy bbq wings as an appetizer and we were slobbering over these, about to bite our fingers off, they were that good! The waiters were nice and attentive, and they made sure to keep refilling our mimosas. I do think that their menu prices are a bit on the expensive side, but the atmosphere, the music, the flavors, and the vibes make up for it. Its not giving Bronx prices, but it is giving a Bronx vibe, and for that I give it a 10/10.

I loved the vibe of this place when I came. I stopped by on my lunch break, I was looking at the menu outside when the waitress saw me and kind of coaxed me to come in (lol). The place is small but long and inviting. During the afternoon the place is slow; I was the only patron there.

I ordered their salad with jerk salmon for protein and finalllyyyy, I found a restaurant that gives you portions that will FEED YOU. It was generous, and matched the price. It was beautifully plated for a salad and came with fried sweet plantains, fresh toasty crunchy croutons (sweet bread?), the lettuce was crispy and possibly romaine lettuce. The jerk salmon was a good size, possible 6-8oz. and meaty! Not too spicy maybe a little on the sweet heat side.

Overall it was a pleasant experience and would love to visit them again during the later hours.

I hate to give this restaurant such low stars because i have been here twice before and the food was a lot better! I went there for brunch on a Sunday.

The food this time around i would give it a 3/10. We ordered the chicken and waffles, chicken wings, the classic burger, fries, plantain and bacon. The chicken for the chicken and waffles wasn't seasoned and the waffles were hard and dry. The person i was with didn't like their burger and said it didn't taste fresh. The only thing we like was the plantain.

The ambiance was great like always and i loved that they had the World Cup playing on the screens. The staff was attentive and accommodating. I'm not sure if i would go again.

This Drink Nephew Punch was something else..., Oxtails good but portion size not a fan but the chef made it all right, our cashier Waha was fantastic, the atmosphere was a cool vibe- not to crowded, just enough people. Happy Hour was good.

This is probably the worst place to go to with a big party for brunch. If you decide to do so, be prepared to be seated in very tight spacing as well as being hunched over to eat on low tables for their outdoor seating.  Their outdoor seating party couples or a party of 4 be prepared to be placed in uncomfortable seating which are plastic chairs or plastic bar stools with no back support. Number one the front of the restaurant has bags of garbage to the side of it from another business, along with an abandoned outdoor seating probably left over from the pandemic. Inside, The indoor seating smells like either mold or very bad plumbing along with very limited seating so there is also the option of sitting out back where the ambiance seems like a backyard party. Literally! I came here with a group of six and they gave us the option of sitting at an area with one square table for six people or another area with three tables. But the space was very tight. Logically, we opted to sit in the area with three tables but there was no space for legroom and I had no idea how they expected us to eat. I guess hunched over or eating on our laps.  Seems like there are a bunch of young individuals, starting out, working here. The customer service is not the best, although the wait staff is friendly. Drinks took forever to come. The water tastes like tap water. Friends did order bottomless mimosas which they are happy with what they ordered and I ordered a Mai Tai which was delicious and actually tasted like alcohol more than syrup. I ordered sweet chili Thai wings along with a hamburger and fries. The wings were decent. Flavor was great but my fries tasted like They weren't homemade and very mushy like they weren't cooked long enough. My burger, whatever sauce they used on it was heavily doused on both buns to the point of it making the bottom bun soggy and causing my burger to fall apart. I really couldn't enjoy it but nonetheless the burger was good. Also, they automatically add a 20% gratuity charge to a party of more than four which I don't think they deserve. It is what it is, but this is not a place I would come back to and a place I do not recommend. Also be prepared, just a side note, to sweat as they only had one working fan and no ventilation as you are enclosed in some type of plastic roofing entrapment. They did have a DJ on this Sunday but he was not the best that I've ever been entertained by. They also had a television playing and at the restaurant's choice they decided to play.

I heard good stuff about this place.... So I recommended it to a friend. When we got to the place around 4 something it was only one other patron there. The waiter was attentive. She seated us immediately and brought us water. But it was so hot. They didn't turn on the AC. There was no frozen drinks that day and the selection of drinks were only wine and champagne based. My friend and I decided to leave and go with a nearby option that was better suitable for us.
The back patio is a laid back vibe. They play a mix of Afro-Caribbean music. It is a small location, so expect crowds but they service is top tier!
Brunch was great, nice music and vibe.  Chicken and Waffles only available during weekends

I dined here a few months ago on a holiday. Labor Day maybe. The ambiance was beyond what I expected. I'm not from the city, but I definitely traveled there a lot this little gem in the "Hipster District" of the Bronx's was definitely everything I needed on a holiday. My company and I enjoyed the  Bahamas Trip Crab Cake for an appetizer along with a bottle of champagne for Mimosas to start off.

For the appetizer she enjoyed the Georgia's peach Chicken and Waffles which I tasted a bit of and it was splendid. I really enjoyed the peach honey syrup. It added a nice touch to the Vanilla waffles and the crunchiness of the chicken. I enjoyed The Black Samurai Hanger steak Suya spice and eggs. Although my meal was deliciously prepared, I was expecting a more eloquent preparation of the eggs. The slab of slice cheese on top gave it more of a fast food feel as opposed to what we received prior to. Overall the meal was extremely tasty.

We ended our visit with hookah which is something I enjoy after and nice brunch. I thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would definitely return.

Celebrated a friend's birthday here. It's cute and quaint. We originally requested a table in the patio section, but it was smeltering out there. I believe they are doing renovations. After a bit of a wait, the staff sat us inside instead. The temperature is a little toasty for the summer. I would suggest cranking up the AC just a bit. Otherwise,  our waitress was great & the staff was friendly. I would return but I would sit indoors and hopefully the AC is a little higher.

Happy I finally tried this place. Food, drinks, service, vibes and music were great. I would definitely say work on the hookah part. It took a very long time and wasn't good. The guy had to make it over but I got a discount. I would absolutely recommend.

Food: 9/10 really good, I personally had the Korean Bbq Steak and Eggs it was absolutely delicious. Only critique is I feel like they could have a few more options on the brunch menu.
Service: 10/10 We came on a saturday and no one else was there so the service was great and very one on one. She came to check on us and even asked what music we would like to hear.

Our total price was: $122 including gratuity already added which was a bit annoying because it says gratuity was added for groups of 4 or more but we were only 3 people.

Let me first say the food was amazing. I had the shrimp & GRITS with fried okra. So good! Hubby had their chicken & waffles which he thought was great. My problem is the unlimited boozy brunch. If you're going to charge me $28 for 90 minutes & I only had 4 small glasses of mimosas I have a problem. I will go anywhere for a boozy brunch but I had to chase down the  waitress for me drink after every time my glass was empty. I didn't leave happy after paying almost $100 for brunch & I ain't drunk. When ww tried to speak to the Mgr & the waitress I don't think theu cared or comprehended what we were trying to tell them. But I know for next time IF I return.  I'll bring my own beverage bc they don't have a liquor license.  Theu serve beer & wine only. So maybe I won't go back. ‍

Food and drinks definitely top notch.  While you have brunch spots that do drinks well and not food and sometimes vice versa... i can honestly say that ININE does BOTH well.  

I had the best Chicken & Waffles I've ever had in my life.  The waffle batter was delicious as well as the butter.   The chicken was well seasoned! I could have easily had seconds.

Drinks? They introduced me to a Lychee Mimosa.  I'm sold and can only do Lychee Mimosas from here on out. It changed my life! Lol.  

COVID protocols were on point. Service was great and friendly.  When it gets warmer I'll go to backyard oasis... I took a peek and it's gorgeous.

We had a great afternoon at ININE bistro. The music was on point! They had Afrobeats and current hip-hop softly playing in the back. The back garden had a great ambience which would be great for hosting events.

I ordered the coconut shrimp and waffles with the Pinot Grigio mango drink. I loved the shrimp, the waffles could've been sweeter and I wasn't really feeling the coconut sauce. They had maple syrup as well. I would recommend longer and wider straws for the slushy drinks.
The staff was friendly but it would have been nice if a waiter was in the back readily available for us to ask for a check or an addition to our meal. Look forward to coming back again

My husband said theirs is the best vegan burger he's had in all of New York City.

The hand cut fries are exceptional and you get a good portion! The interior is very comfortable with a lovely vibe (great music, not too loud). The staff is friendly and attentive.

Their outdoor garden is also stunning and romantic. Perfect for their weekend brunch or a date night

I honestly had high hopes for this place (it'd been on my list for a while), but was utterly underwhelmed. I came here with a girlfriend of mine for Sunday brunch and she shared the same disappointment . We both ordered the Korean BBQ steak and eggs. The steak was tough and the eggs weren't seasoned (severely lacked salt). I also got a to go order of lemon pepper wings for my mom and those were very underwhelming and dry. We had mimosas which were ok and then I ordered a "rum punch", which wasn't good. The music was fine, but the DJ didn't let the songs play long enough. This was more like a 2.5 star experience, but I rounded up because of the service. The waitress was so sweet and attentive and so was the bartender. I probably will not return
Had a decent experience. The food was great but the restaurant was hot. Turn on the AC people

Came here for brunch on a Sunday and it was not packed at all. I was able to find a parking spot right on the same block.
