What I originally ordered (chicken and waffles) they did not have so I had to get a burger which was fine I guess. The drinks were pretty strong as well. The DJ played really good music so the vibe there was really nice. I would visit again !

Their chicken sauces are to die for. Many varieties. Amazing chicken wings cooked without breading or sauce, so if you're GF or DF there's nothing to worry about.
And their burgers YUMMalicous! Moist, large, and no, I'm not sharing, delicious.  They even have sweet potato fries, which I guess they should since this is an African Diasporan restaurant with French specialties thrown in. I hear the shrimps, grits and pancakes are delicious, too.
So yes, they're a little southern America Soul Food, a lot African Diaspora with a pinch of French thrown in. It has a party atmosphere, no matter the day of the week, 'cause the music is always popping. Both the open air in front and out back are nice depending on your mood and vibe you'd prefer. And inside is nice too.
Food is great even though it was a bit pricy. I recommend the chicken sliders (it has so much flavor). The staff was amazing!! The vibes were great honestly. I 100% recommend.

A few of us came here after seeing them on the news. Our server handled our large group very well, especially given many of us had issues with our order. She kept it professional. This place has a ton of potential. One suggestion would be make the patio furniture comfortable for eating. The outdoor furniture was more so for lounging.. so most of us were hunched over eating our foods on our laps without proper tables. Extremely uncomfortable and not a good look if you're trying to have some etiquette. Like most places, the food has room for improvement. The DJ was on point though, so I say give it a try with some friends for the vibe.

Everything I had was amazing! The chef made my friend and I shrimp and grits even though it wasn't brunch time and it surely didn't disappoint! I asked for extra cheese in my grits and you could taste that they're using quality cheese. The wings were amazing. They tasted air fried or something. Crispy but still juicy. The crab cake was great. The music was on point. It was empty but the tunes were still playing. I love Afro beats so I was in my zone while demolishing the great food. Service was great. Everyone was so nice. Our server was a sweetheart.

Amazing new addition to the hipster district of The Bronx (Port Morris)!  Great customer service and attention to detail.  The backyard is def the place to be.  Food was amazing  atmosphere and bathrooms were clean!  Seats were socially distanced to perfection in the backyard.  I had the pina colada shrimp and waffles and my partner had the Korean bbq steak and eggs special, we were both very delighted.  Oh and did I mention they have hookah wow who knew?  This gem will soon be hard to get into, so make sure you visit now!  The Bellini and mimosa carafe prices were the only thing I would change, they were a bit pricey for what you get.  For brunch $40 dollars should get you unlimited or at least a bigger carafe, mine wasn't even filled to the top but I digress this place is special.  Best of luck

I came to brunch here with friends. We were able to get a reservation last minute on a Sunday.  I wasn't able to see the backyard space but it looks dope from pictures. Anyway our party of five was seated in the inside.  We ordered the unlimited mimosa and sangria. We tried the BlackBerry mimosas, the BlackBerry mimosas was divine.  I didn't try the sangria and my party enjoyed the BlackBerry mimosas.

I had the salmon burger and it was perfect I mb would definitely get that again. My friends got the chicken and coconut waffles or the shrimp and waffles.  The food took a tad bit long to come out and at least two of the orders of waffles were cold. They replaced those rather quickly.

They also have a lychee mimosa but unfortunately didn't have anything that day.

I would definitely come back but would try and do outside seating.

I had a great experience for brunch yesterday.  The staff is friendly, respectful and hospitable. The food was AMAZING so much so that my boyfriend tipped the chef separated. The ambience was cozy & comfortable.  Great place. I will definitely be back.
The food was good. Service a little slow. Great vibe. Didn't like sitting on the "couch" because you have to each hunched over.

Decided to come here on a rainy Tuesday evening. We were the only customers in the place so it felt good for social distancing. The place is beautifully decorated with an outdoor space in the front and the back of the restaurant. We ordered a white sangria pitcher, which was sweet and tangy combined. I ordered the Louisiana chicken sandwich, which was delicious and tasty. The salmon and steak sandwich's were also amazing.

I visited INine on a long distance cycling trip with some friends. There were A LOT of us. Service was friendly but some in our group had to wait an hour for their food.

It's really unlikely anywhere could have done a perfect job on serving hot and fresh wings burgers and salmon to 50 people so Im going to give them 4 stars anyway. Cuz the food was banging! I got my food within 20 mins and the burger was a perfect medium super flavorful and juicy. Fries were good and I threw on some hot sauce on the burger (its hot for real, dont play with it) and I was on cloud inine lol.

Im not in the BX a lot but I wont hesitate to stop by if im in the area.

This is a low key chill spot offering bottomless brunch for an incredibly affordable price of $30. The $30 includes your meal plus 90mins of unlimited mimosas.
For my meal I went with the Georgia Peach (chicken & waffles). The waffles were good, chicken a tad over cooked. What I really enjoyed is the mimosas. They offer five different choices with the caramel apple being my fav. It was a perfect balance of champagne & juice. My waitress was very attentive making sure our glasses stayed full.
My complaint is the piece of hair my friend found within her food. As soon as we alerted the waitress she swapped it out. Besides that the meal was great.

I went here for brunch on a sunday with 14 other people to celebrate my sister's birthday & it was an enjoyable time untill the miscommunications started. I just wish that the service was better. The servers were all over the place & seemed to be confused & overwhelmed alot of the time due to miscommunications, which i had with them as well as other parties. I am grateful the manager came over to speak with me after i continued having issues with the service that was being provided (considering it was my sister's bday & the goal was to make her feel celebrated), which at the end of our time ended up happening. I appreciate the kind gesture of a bottle on them for all the inconveniences. The food was the best part of the whole experience & i would deff go back but most likely with a much smaller group, if a group at all. The DJ was great & played plenty of good music the whole 3 & a half hours we were there. I love to support black owned business', & hope i can return in the near future and have a better experience.

Spotty glasses and no ice. I'm just scratching the surface. 2pm reservation but seated at 3pm. Ordered at 3:15pm received food at 5pm. Brunch has officially turned into dinner. The wait was only bearable due to the "unlimited mimosas/unlimited sangria".

What seemed to be the owners sitting in the corner enjoying themselves came to be true. It was only until my table and another party adjacent, started a conversation with the owners that worked in our favor to get our food moving out of the kitchen faster; prior to we spoke to out server and the manager several times about the service and they didn't seem to have answers.

We came to find out that there was only one chef cooking for 50+ individuals. Not the equation for success. After talking to the owners, they granted us a voucher for free entree and drinks on future visit.

Finishing this review as I enter again to redeem the voucher. Part 2 coming soon...
I love ININE! The atmosphere is just as amazing as the food! They've also expanded the outdoor area so it makes for an even better vibe.

In an attempt to support local business I came to the restaurant to support. After a 2 hour wait, finally got my Korean steak and eggs which are amazing but at this point there is a level of frustration that won't let you enjoy the food.
I ordered wings to start which came in a decent time frame but the entre which was meant for brunch came as a dinner.
There is so much room for improvement and I hope they get there.
Terrible waiting service. Tasteless food. Disorganized .to expensive for low quality food

Visited this place with a friend for brunch and the food was amazing. I got the Korean bbq steak and scrambled eggs. Good amount and delicious shout out to the chef
The place is small but I like that makes it much more intimate however the should get an AC in there the fans aren't enough to keep you cool. The only part I wasn't a fan of is the waitress coming up to us WHILE still eating to tell us we have 15 minutes left. I understand there 90 minutes once you sit but that's bad for business when we are paying costumers and there wasn't a line or people waiting for a table. That will require improvement there a way to say things and that wasn't okay

Amazing amazing amazing experience! I absolutely loved eating outside. Loved the chicken scampi. Loved the service. Loved the attention I received. I would definitely recommend this place. I heard that they are building the backyard. I cannot wait until I go ! I am sure it will be amazing. Would love to do brunch here. Definitely recommended !!

Came here for lunch, on a whim, because the lemon pepper wing sign outside caught my attention; although I'm not sure why I don't usually like lemon pepper wings. Nice, small, intimate spot. I arrived a bit early but they were very accommodating. The menu looked yummy although a bit pricey for just lunch. I went with the $15 wings (6 ppc) and sweet plantain with pepper relish $10.  While the food was being prepared, I was invited to check out the outdoor patio seating in the back. On the way back you get a quick peek in the kitchen...clean. Phew!  The heated outside seating was better than I thought it would be (see pic). They are expanding the back area, too. It took a title while for the food to come but it was pretty good. I really enjoyed the pepper relish most of all. I'll take a bucket of that to go! And even though I'm not a fan of lemon pepper seasoning, I would order theirs again. I will come back to try other items on the menu.

** went there to celebrate my birthday and have a nice brunch with about five other people
Pros
The DJ was playing a good selection of music
The atmosphere was casual and, for the most part, good vibes
The host was very attentive and kind. We were late for our RSVP( due to traffic), and she made the accommodations right away

CONS
The waitress service was horrible. Our server Safia was not attentive and often ignored us. We had to repeat our orders a few times, and when we received our food, things were missing. Then she would try to tell us we ordered something when we didn't. I was not too fond of that.

The food took a while to come out, so be prepared to wait for about 20mins or more.

My lemon pepper wings were semi burnt, but the pieces that weren't burnt were flavorful. Someone in my group thought the Georgia's Peach Chicken and Waffles were overcooked( she didn't complain because the food took long and she was already hungry)

Overall I enjoyed the company I had with me, but I'm not sure I'd return.

It's not a bad place for brunch; I hope you get a good server.

I love eating and vibing at this establishment, not only is it kid friendly but it's a great brunch spot for a girls day and a date night. The waitress Tiyana was super helpful and attentive. I will definitely be going back !!!

Lord....attended brunch, let me tell you everything was a mess. You had to ask for the utensils and the water. It was only one waiter attending to 4 different groups, making it nearly impossible for her to attend us properly. The manager was obsessed with the attendees getting there, instead of helping the waiter. The mimosas were trash, and the food even worse. They didn't have any steak even though it was on the brunch menu!!!! Live DJ? It was a CD playing.....

Maybe the reason why everything was bad, is because each and everyone was outside the bistro smoking weed. The chef, the waiter, and the busboy. Manager is on vacation that's why they was doing whatever they want. SMH $400+ down the drain!! Stay away.

And then as we were leaving, the waiters and the chef were having a physical altercation.

Way to go black owned business!!! Smf

Birthday brunch celebration was amazing. Our waitress (Kelly) was pleasant, informative being that I'm a vegan on guiding on my meal. Not to mention the service was excellent. The food was well seasoned and my vegan burger was made from scratch! By (Chef Bintu) YES!! Lastly, the drinks prepared by (Mixologist Val) simply was 100% on point! Thanks so much to the wonderful staff and blackowned business! We will be back soon.
InineBistro is the place to be! Five Stars

Nice staff, good food, nice drinks and cool ambiance. I went today with my cousin and I was greeted by the most nicest people ever. The Korean Bbq Steak on the brunch menu was nice and the drink Yushi made was great wish I could have remembered the name of it.

I really wanted to LOVE this place but I can't back it up. The food is amazing. Shouts out to the lead brunch cook Khalil. He was the one employee that really, truly cared about our experience. He came out a few times to make sure we had our food and even spoke to us for a little bit.
The other servers would come by, ask us if we needed anything. If we did, they said they'd be right back but took a long time with whatever we needed. We even had to ask for cutlery.
Long story short, I'll only come back because Khalil was holding the place down.

I ordered from here via UberEats accidentally when I confused it with a different Giovannis. The pizza is horrible and the fried calamari is probably the worst I've ever had. No wonder there are no reviews on Yelp.
When you talk out loud and someone says yes that Jamaica restaurant is  that's always a + great food

If there was an an option for no star I would put it. THEY ARE LIARS. I ordered Uber eats and it said buy one get on free STRAIGHT LIE! on top of that it took VERY LONG FOR THEM TO FINISH FOOD. If this store closes down I would clearly understand why. HORRIBLE.

This place is the greatest for any type of food you're in the mood for.  I have been at all their locations as I look for them depending on where I'm at, and they have not disappointed me yet.  They have the best thin crust pizza.  The penne a la vodka with chicken is the best I've had.  Their chicken tenders and biscuit are to die for.  They're friendly and very clean...totally recommend them.
This is my go to spot in the neighborhood. My kids and I absolutely love the pizza and chicken! The Margarita pizza is absolutely delicious. The staff is polite and friendly!

Not surprised to find out that this business is unclaimed! I wish that I could give iPizza at least two stars. But this pizza was not even edible, so I cannot justify that. It is a MIRACLE that this place is even still in business; their pizza is disgusting! A wet, greasy mess. Cheap ingredients. Hard, stale crust. And it is not sold at a discount! Why do people go back? I don't get it ... anyone who has had a decent slice of pizza would recognize the poor quality instantly. And right now they have a 'B' sanitary rating posted. I would love to know who is buying this pizza and why!

This is one of the best atmospheres for a casual date spot in the East Village if you're looking for more than just a bar. It's a very classic setting but still trendy with the neighborhood and the size  makes it perfect for a small group, or larger groups seated outside.

For apps we tried the meatballs which were definitely fresh. At the server Nate's recommendation we tried the Esposito pizza and he didn't steer us wrong- it had very unique flavors and a really high quality pizza for the price! We also shared the carbonara which was a nice addition since the pizzas are slightly small for sharing just one. Plus at the really affordable prices, you'll want to try several items on the menu!

I'll definitely be going back for brunch- that menu looks very unique. Overall if you're looking for a slightly classier but casual date night in this area, this is a great pick.
Great dinner of chicken Marsala, though I'd have loved more sauce on the pasta. We really loved the garlic bread. Wonderful. We had a nice seat outside, watching people pass on a warm spring evening.

Wonderfully rich pasta dishes and great staff! The outdoor seating is on a quiet block. They were so kind to our party including our pups. Highly highly recommend the spicy vodka sauce, peach sangria, and a salad with the yummy lemon tahini dressing.

This place was hard to find online, but walked by it and the menu looked great so we came here last Friday.  The place was fairly crowded, but we only had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table for four.  The seating is for both David's cafe and Isabella's, which can be a little confusing, but it's nice because you get to pick from either menu.  My sister and I both ordered from the Isabella's menu, which is notably cheaper than the David's menu.

We both got sangrias (they only have red, which was fine with us). They were only $6 and fairly huge glasses, so I would recommend getting one or five.  Their menu has a range of things from sandwiches to chicken parmigiana, and then a few different pastas and sauces to choose from so it's nice to be able to mix and match.  To eat we shared the baked penne ($12) and the rigatoni with vodka sauce ($12).  The baked penne seemed to be with vodka sauce as well, but that worked for us because we're huge fans.  Both dishes were great, and I'd recommend either one.  I'm excited to come back and try their gnocchi with pesto.  For being on such a fun street, having cute outdoor seating, and good food, the prices are very reasonable.  I'm glad this place opened, and I'm recommend it to anyone!

The food here literally had no taste. My friends had the pesto pasta which tasted like nothing. I had the penne Esposito which also tasted like nothing. Even the sausage was bland. We emptied the entire Parmesan and red pepper shakers just to feel something.
Paid $18 for a pizza for takeout. It was insanely mediocre with hardly any sauce and it's only a 12" pie. Will never order again. I make better pizza at home.

Great food, amazing service. Definitely will come back next time in NYC.
I recommend the Penne Vodka pasta. Very delicious.

Happened to walk by while looking for some pizza and pasta. Such a a treat! The pizza and pasta were fresh and amazing. Garlic bread was overkill for this party of two, but worth it. Not pictured was the ceasar salad ....we ate it before we could take a photo, 100% recommend!

Enjoyed a post-bday get together with friends at this place. Not sure what to expect since they are new-ish but glad we tried it out. Good-sized servings especially the pizza. I really liked the carbonara (bucatini) as well. Will be coming back!

This place might be my new favorite place in the east village! That staff is incredibly nice and the food was DELICIOUS! I could go back weekly! My boyfriend and I split the rigatoni with pesto and the chicken sandwich with a side salad! The salad and pasta were our favorites! The pesto was flavorful and creamy and the pasta was perfectly al dente! 10/10 recommend!
Walked in here after not seeing many reviews on yelp and wanting to try something new. Surely did not disappoint, the food was great and customer service was amazing.
Great service and food! The environment surrounding the restaurant makes for a perfect dinner.

My friend and I only came to Isabella because the reservation we had at another restaurant in the neighborhood fell through. While the ambience and decor are nice, I am sad to say that the food we had was either disappointing or straight up inedible. For appetizers, we got the meatballs and the garlic bread which were both fine but tasted like Trader Joe's frozen food. My friend got the Penne with chicken parmesan for his entree - the chicken was fine but the red sauce was exactly the one they used for the meatballs (which probably came from a jar). For my entree, I got the penne alla vodka which was simply inedible - it tasted like they literally threw at least two or three SHOTS OF VODKA on my plate - it was so bad that I had a few bites and left everything else. Our drinks came from a different menu / the restaurant next door, which was a little sketchy. Posting reviews like these make me sad but this is definitely a place you should avoid. No wonder it was completely empty on a Saturday night.

Came here on a Saturday night with my family and we had a wonderful experience. Our waitress, Lauren, was very kind and attentive. Our food came out fast and it was DELICIOUS - we ordered the chicken parmesan with bucatini, the chicken piccata with rigatoni, and the chicken marsala with gnocchi (our collective favorite - though all three were very good). We love trying out new places in the neighborhood and this did not disappoint - we will be back!
I love Isabella, and I know you will love it too. Very cool scene. Unbelievable flavor. The staff are always so helpful. Isabella - Made me feel special.

Went to Isabella a couple months ago and will definitely be back again. The pasta was great as well as the drinks/service. Very affordable vs paying an arm and a leg in comparison to other spots in NYC.
Came in and had the pasta carbonara with gluten-free pasta bucatini it was awesome. then I came back and had the pizza it was delicious  would highly recommend this place. Thanks

"All warfare is based on deception." - Sun Tzu

Deception, in the form of ridiculously strong and cheap sochu cocktails is the name of the game at Oni.  Get em' drunk, and they won't notice the sub-par food, is what someone was thinking when they opened this place.

I checked this place on the merit of the nearby ramen Setagaya, for whom I would give up my first born for a bowl of shoyu ramen.  On a whim, we ventured to the back room which specialized in Izakaya, or Japanese street food.

I won't call it an outright mistake, because I did discover a few things to like.  The fried chicken was completely fatty and laden with connective tissue, but for some reason, my dining partner and I finished the entire plate.  It was delicious, in a gourmand sort of way.

Near inebriated on a couple of glasses of the white peach sochu (at $4.50 a glass, it was a helluva bargain), we ordered up the grilled mackerel and a daikon radish salad.  The salad was a mound of freshly chopped daikon, dressed in a vinaigrette, covered in bonito flakes and other... "stuff".   By itself, the daikon wouldn't have been bad, but the chef completely fucked the dish by adding... "stuff". I don't even know what... "stuff" was, but it didn't taste that great.  

The grilled mackerel was well cooked, but I definitely tasted notes of freezer burn.  No matter, for $7, it was literally a whole side of giant mackerel, one of the better deals you would find in Manhattan.  We shoveled the fish down, muttering something about "Omega 3's".  Not one of my finer moments, but hey; we were drunk.

By the time we tucked into the food, we were pretty well sloshed.  At that point, a soft taco and side of beans at Taco Bell would have tasted like a $30 combo plate at Dos Caminos.  The waitress played her part well.

This place is worth checking out, if anything for the chill atmosphere and cheap booze.  Though it's sort of a cursed spot (pasta waifu didn't fare so hot here), I hope their kitchen and PR department can get their act together and make this place a popular eating and drinking joint.

Hate to be the kill joy here.  Despite the awesome 50% all drinks grand opening promo, this is by far THE WORST IZAKAYA IN NYC.  not trying to be a hater and all, but come on?!?! put some effort it was your opening weekend

Wanting to take a break from Yakitori Taisho for once, my bf and I decided to give Oni a try.  Since we LOOOOVED pasta wafu/sushi wafu that was closed abruptly and now became this "Oni" place we thought we would just give this place a try.

since the drinks were half off, we both had the shochu cocktail ( the white peach was good, the grape was too sweet)  but they really make strong drinks here, more than half the glass was shochu, i think they are trying to get you drunk so you cant tell that their food totally blows.  but for $4.50 this is a good deal while it lasts

we ordered 3 cold appetizers:
picked eggplant (this is a pretty regular dish, you might be frightened by the bright blue color, but it taste okay)
kani daikon salad (crab and japanese radish salad)  Appalled that they actually used IMITATION CRAB MEAT!  what kind of crappy restaurant charges like 10 bucks for a salad with imitation crab meat?  even though i love that imitation crab stuff, this salad lacked taste completely.
then we had the kimchi natto (fermented soybean with kimchi)  they cannot possibly screw this up, such an easy dish, it was good

then we had the Kushi-yaki (3 different types of chicken parts on skewers: gizzard, liver , and chicken chunks with scallion)  chicken chunks was edible, the meat was too tought and totally unfresh.  the gizzard was okay, the liver was disgusting, it was totally unfresh and mushy

then under the "oni special" section of the menu, they had a bunch of stuff that was not available.  so we had to settle with the grilled potato with cheese, which was the best dish we ate there (they better not screw that up, its just potatoes and cheese)
then we had the Takoyaki (octopus dumpling style balls)  which was not bad either

since the portions were small and we basically didnt eat half of the food because it was so gross, we decided to order the Ochazuke with salmon ( salmon with rice in green tea), given that it was only $2 (the cheapest thing on the menu) and we always make this dish at home its super safe, we waited for over 20 minutes and we were too upset and frustrated we decided to just get the check and leave.

total bill with decent tip put it came out to $60. for this much money i could have had a delicious feast at Taisho or Typhoon sushi

still not sure why they closed down Pasta Wafu/Sushi Wafu to open up this joint.  this place is nothing special at all, i would skip it and just go have a bowl of ramen up front at Setagaya

Set it the back of Ramen Setagaya, this is a nice little Japanese place with bar food, foods on sticks, and little salads.

The food is good but not great.  Well arranged, in OK portions.
The BBQ sauce is not overwhelming and the food is cooked well,
giving everything a great flamed flavor.  Best of all, the chicken,
fish and veggies were "clean" flavored, not harsh like other cheap
Japanese eateries.

Get the Mackerel fish dish ($7) for a well flamed mackerel
  layed out.  Very nice.
Otherwise, the Chicken, Onion, and Eggplant is delicious.
The large Radish and Crab salad was nothing special.
Also try the grilled veggie "deluxe" dish.  The veggies are
  flamed to perfection, and the onions melt in your mouth.

The space is pleasantly open, with paper lanterns hanging over
tables.  The service is efficient and attentive  (Not to mention cute).

All in all a pleasant find.  If you're lucky to arrive between 5-7pm,
everything is 50% off.  BARGAIN!

The person who said this is the worst izakaya in NYC was not exaggerating. I had a horrible meal at Oni tonight.  We went in with an open mind, having read no reviews prior, and just ordered whatever sounded good off the menu. The sashimi was of questionable quality to the point where we were afraid to eat some of it. The grilled vegetables were charred and dry, the takoyaki tasted good but didn't seem freshly made (perhaps reheated), and the salmon rice bowl was edible but bland. The best part of the meal was the beer, which came in a chilled glass and was very cold. Also nice was that they offered each customer one free drink per meal.

The place was nearly empty at 8pm on a Saturday, with only five other people eating there and many open seats. No customers entered the restaurant throughout our entire meal - and keep in mind there was a sign on the sidewalk advertising the free alcohol. It's unfortunate that the food is so bad; it's like they don't care and maybe assume people will just walk in when Setagaya is too crowded. At $40 for two people, which only included one beer since the other two were free, we felt like we'd paid too much.

The 50% off part was pretty sweet. I had salmon sashimi, grilled mackerel, and short ribs. The mackerel was a much larger portion than I was expecting. It seemed over cooked though. The salmon sashimi was pretty good. The short ribs were tender.
Great take out pizza. Always arrives hot and fresh. This has become our new go to place for real NY style pizza.

What a wonderful treat I have been coming here on 2nd Ave. right around the corner from Venero's it is really something nice thin crust pizza nice and crunchy friendly service about 10 tables you can't go wrong for $3.50 a slice they also have grandma pizza and grandpa pizza so come do your thing here and you will be tickled pink

If my daughter didn't like the pizza here, I would have stopped ordering from them a long time ago.

Delivery is slow and food always arrives cold which is a shame because they're just a few blocks from me.

Over the last few months, I've noticed they've started skimping on the fried calamari. They used to fill the foil container, now they use a smaller container and only fill it 1/3 of the way so I stopped ordering it after they did this about 4x

The riceballs are very bland and usually arrive crushed with a mess all over the foil container.

This evening I ordered a small pizza and 20 piece buffalo wings. I called them because I receive a small pizza and 9 buffalo wings. When they spoke to me, I was on hold for several minutes as I heard them going back and forth in the background. The guy picks up the phone and asked me if I received my fries or if the delivery guy took them.
Typical NYC pizza shop. Not great seating for dine in. Convenient if you are local and doing takeout. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat it.

Sadly, this business has fallen well below its old customer friendly service.  Over the next 2 HOURS i called 5 times asking about the order.  I was told 1. Its on the way 2. The delivery guy said he delivered it and then confirmed a wrong address.   Im out $35 and my family ate eggs for dinner.  Think twice as these new people do not care about the customer!

"PIZZA" caught my eye on a 6pm Saturday. After walking around all day I was really hoping for a slice of cheesy, gooey, hot and fresh pizza.

I ordered the classic cheese slice.

Cold, card board like, and super oily.

While the staff is very friendly, the quality of pizza is far too disappointing.

Delicious pizza...long time customer...
Highly recommend Iggy's pizza..
Try it you'll love it! So scrumptious!
A perfect slice. Cant walk into a pizza place anywhere other than NYC and get this quality perfect pizza.

Had the square cheese slice - I think it's called the Grandma slice . $3.75  Tasted homemade, pretty good. This place is also very neat and clean when I was there . They have tables outside on First Avenue too . Pretty tasty .

My favorite place to go and chill with my daughter whilst she was growing up in the EV.
We could sit for hours watching the street from the giant windows and see local folks come in and out.
The pizza is great and the wine is the right price. Great memories of this little place over many years.

I ordered the white clam & linguine. Absolutely
Horrific! Call to complain and was brushed off.
The clam was beyond disgusting.
Iggy's offers fast, cheap, yummy pizza slices. I usually get a slice or two of whatever looks fresh and am always satisfied.
Little Italy is a great spot for Pizza and Iggy's makes a great cheese slice in NYC style.

I always order Iggy's on Seamless because I don't want to know what the shop looks like. Based on the reviews below, seems like that's a smart move.
The pizza is pretty damn good (some pies are more oily than others, it happens), pasta is A+, and delivers pretty quickly.
My biggest complaint is their "buffalo" wings don't actually have any buffalo sauce on them although they are deep-fried deliciousness.

Really good slice in the East Village, went in with low expectations but great no nonsense NY slice and friendly staff. Prices are reasonable love the regular slice and the vodka slice. May be the best for a no nonsense slice . East Village Pizza I don't get the hype so Iggys it is!

This place has the best grandma slice in the neighborhood, and I had to bring my friend (a bit of a pizza snob) to confirm (he agreed). The selection of soft drinks perfectly complements the slice, and the staff are great, always happy to see you come in. If you're looking for pizza in the East Village, it's worth a little walk up from St. Marks to try Iggy's.

Two words: food poisoning. The worst I had in my life, after eating the cheese and spinach ravioli last week.  I almost went to the hospital, it got so bad.

My husband had the chicken parm and that seemed to be fine. I won't be going back to find out, though!

Pizza is so-so staff pleasant but I can't stand when workers take your order, touch all over your pizza, take payment with cash then go back to making a pie from scratch with bare hands. Dude at the front did this and Not one time washed his hands!!!!!! Gross! All he did was wipe his hands for 5 milliseconds on his apron. I would give them one star if the staff wasn't pleasant.

Gross! Unsanitary! Please management have your staff meeting their hands clean.

My go to place for a slice of pizza! I always order the "Margarita" and a Snapples. There's nothing like a thin crust classic New York Pizza, one of the best for me.

Pedro - one of the Staff is really nice too. Great job and Thank you!
Ordered an 18" pie for with onions and mushrooms. Thin crust. Stayed crispy through delivery. Tangy sauce. Moderate cheese. I am impressed with this place. Would give a 4.5 if available.

Tried the Iggy's which came with sausage, pepperoni, and mushrooms. It's your standard low quality NYC pizza at a pretty steep price. The staff was friendly and the restaurant was clean, but with so many other pizza joints in the East Village I don't see a reason to come back.

This review is purely for takeout experience. I work in the neighborhood and Iggy's always hits the spot for a simple pizza without all the bells and whistles (who needs those anyway). Might not be the best pizza in the city but it keeps my belly happy within walking distance.

The eggplant pizza is my go to. Very reasonably priced and sized.

Service is pretty much non-existent but that's not what you go for in a place like this anyway. Just get your za and get out!

My go-to pasta delivery place. My life has changed ever since I discovered their Penne alla Vodka with pancetta. SO good!

This place is out of the delivery range for my apartment, but thankfully my boyfriend lived within range. Unfortunately, he recently moved away. Goodbye, Iggys. You have treated me well.

I've only tried two things on their menu: the penne vodka and carbonara. Don't get the carbonara. Get the penne alla vodka!

Sucks that they have a delivery fee on seamless, but the pasta is worth it.
Horrible. Ordered a large plain pizza pie. Got orange cardboard. Pie was old & hard. Not to mention semi cold.

While performing in a play at Theater for the New City, I was scoping out pizzeria's between the theater and the subway. There are three 99 cent pizza joints in close proximity. One is fair, one is really good,  the other is Papa John's. I had been to East Village Pizza and Kebab's and, I'm sorry, but those two words just don't belong together. Then, just past Schnitz, I saw Iggy's. I looked inside and really liked the atmosphere, so I went in.

The little Spanish guy (is anyone Italian anymore?) took my order with a minimum of customer service, and I had to wait for the house pie to finish. "Two minutes" was really eight, but damn it if it wasn't worth the wait! Easily the best city slices I've ever had!

The crust was thin and doughy at the same time. Crispy and hot, The cheese was flawless, from tip to crust. The sauce melded completely. Nothing beats a fresh house pie and Iggy's became my regular stop. I even got cast members of the play to go in and suddenly they had a new favorite place as well.

Solid. The play ended and I miss Iggy's.
Quick slice on the way  home from running an errand,  Pizza was fine, staff was friendly enough.  I have had better slices,  but in the area this was the best of the slices

The hours listed on Yelp were I correct. Yelp specified that the restaurant was closed on Saturday. Totally not true.

The Yelp is going to source info from the public, they need to put some quality controls in place. This is the forty time I have used the app and I think we are 4 for 4 I regraded to incorrect info.

The food was ok, I guess we might order from here again.
WORST DELIVERY EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE! AVOID!!! I ordered with Brian J. tonight. See his review for the full story. It is not okay to lie to your customers!

This place turned out to be not bad after all.  Its situated smack dab in the middle that was once an Italian neighborhood; hold-outs like Veneiro's and Russo's around the corner remain to remind us of this.  The inside has a nice chandelier but otherwise its strictly a slice joint.  Nice amount of seating for a small place, good view of the street.  What looked like the owners behind the counter were Italian, but they couldn't be bothered to lift a hand and give me a slice while their Latino worker was busy in the kitchen.  Apparently shooting the shit is more important than doing actual work for them.

After a moment the worker came out and quickly got me a slice.  There's a discrepancy between a price posted on the wall and what they charged me, but it was still only $2.50.  Thankfully the slice was good!  Crust had that ideal crisp-but-soft consistency down pat.  It was alright flavor-wise, but the texture was there.  Cheese was high quality and there was plenty of it.  Tomato sauce was ok but overshadowed by the cheese.  Overall it was a solid slice; no more, no less, but more than I was expecting from this place.  Service notwithstanding, I should be back.

I was looking for something cheap to eat for lunch and I came across the $7.50 eggplant parmesan special at this place. I didn't want to walk any further so I decided to give it a try. There was only one other person in the place, which seemed strange.

After what seemed like an eternity (actually 15 minutes), my food was finally ready. The eggplant had a very good taste, the sauce was okay, but there was plenty of cheese, which made me happy. Also, the portion was huge, I think they served me an entire eggplant!

Nothing special, but it definitely hit the spot. There is plenty of seating, which is a plus when walking around the area.

Iggy's is definitely one of the best pizza places in the East Village. It goes pretty unnoticed and the name is a little hard to say whenever I'm trying to recommend it to people, but it's a true gem with some mighty fine pizza.

The thin crust grandma's sicilian is seriously amazing. I brought it to a Tompkin's Sqare Park movie the other night and every single person was dying to know where I got it. It has the perfect crust that's crispy but gives a little in the center when you bite into it. I really can't do it justice by describing it, you just have to try it for yourself. My absolute favorite is that pie, with sausage, pepperoni and onions (see photos). Obviously not the healthiest of choices but when you want to have an all out pizza and movie night and make poor diet decisions, get this. Surprisingly, it's not greasy and doesn't make you feel as guilty as you should.

A key factor in why the pizzas are so delicious is that they use really amazing toppings. The mushrooms are always well cooked and fresh (and lots of them), the onions are caramelized, the sausage is cooked until the edges are crispy and juicy....ahhhh!

Their pasta dishes are surprisingly really good too -- I've had the stuffed shells, the ziti, the lasagna, chicken parm and chicken marsala and all were really solid. Can't beat the prices and the portions are huge -- always lasts me a couple meals.

Miguel behind the counter is also really nice and you can tell he puts a lot of effort into making your order great.

Long live Iggy's!

Solid pizza all around. Not great pizza but SOLID. I prefer the Grandma over the regular pie (a bit more flavor). The pizza would get another star if he sauce was more flavorful. It's a little bland with a sweetness that doesn't do it any favors. But the dough to sauce to cheese ratio is on point.

I would rate Iggy's 4 stars for the pizza but I had to knock it down for the pasta. Oh boy... the pasta is absolutely INEDIBLE. Really, seriously it's just so gross. It's way worse than hospital cafeteria pasta. Airplane food pasta is like a dream compared to this. The noodles are way, way over-cooked. Basically soft like baby food. The sauce is so, so bland. It's like you would have to work hard at making sauce that flavorless. Like someone made it their specialty to cook flavorless crap.

Just stop guys. Stick to pizza, please.
Good pizza, prices are really great. Staff was real friendly. Small sized shop but enough seating for a bunch of friends to grab a few slices for lunch.

Great Italian on a budget. The location itself is moderately sized with six four person tables and a clean environment.  You can order by the slice or one of their classic Italian creations to go... or have a seat and enjoy a traditional Italian entree.

No one will be overly impressed by Iggy's, but it is a staple Italian place with a cafe feel.
Seriously amazing pizza. I grew up in NYC and I know pizza. This is what it is supposed to taste like. The crust is crisped to perfection with just the right blend of cheese and sauce.

I wish I tried their pizza... I came here with all the intention of getting pizza slices, and then as soon as I saw the calzone on the shelf decided "calzone with the typical NY pizza crust must be fantastic!".  You see, some years ago I had the most sumptuous calzone in the Wilmington, DE area, really more a suburb of Philly, and have been longing for that calzone ever since.  Surely I would get it in New York, right?  Well, not quite here...

Now, by no means is this calzone not good.  It is good.  The dough is quite good actually, to a point where I think if it was on the pizza, I would really like it.  But I'm forever going to compare any calzone to the one from Philly, and their crust is a bit different - more buttery flavor and not quite as chewy.  Second, they only had the calzones with the ricotta cheese - good in its own right - and none with the tomato sauce, which was what I was really looking for.

So yes, the calzone is perfectly good, but I'm looking for something more.  It's really more a 3.5 stars, but a sort-of-attentive, sort-of-not service, quite a wait for the food (20 minutes or so), and not quite a satisfying food experience means rounding down to 3.

Table-for-1 Factor:  The restaurant is a nicer version of your typical NYC pizza joint, so eating alone is almost expected.

Wow a neighborhood pizza place that has 2 slices and a soda for 5.00.  Pies look good and sandwiches look really good. Check this place out.   Pizza surprised me way better than most places with combos.

I must be Italian-American on the inside. I've been having major cravings for hearty Italian lately. I found this place thanks to Yelp. I ordered through delivery.com (they had a 20% off discount for first timers) and seamless. Delivery is slow. Prices are very reasonable and portions are huge (read: leftovers). A garlicy wedge of bread comes with the pasta.

Items I love:
- Grandma's pizza knocks my socks off. You can also get toppings on seamless (but not delivery.com). I prefer the original and freezing the leftovers. I got mushrooms once and they made the pizza a little too soggy.
- Chicken marsala over linguini.
- Eggplant parmigiana with ziti.
- The lasagna was ok...

Solid East Village slices. I got a regular slice + a spinach/ricotta/garlic ($6.25 total). Both were tasty.

Dude working behind the counter was kind enough to let me know that a fresh pie was coming out of the oven soon if I wanted to wait a few minutes!
My boyfriend and I come here all the time. Always quick and their pizza is the best. We always order the margarita slice, it's soooooooo good!!!

I read the negative reviews and it's shocking, whenever I order or go in to this pizza place it is always welcoming and great! Their pizza may not be the best I've ever had but it's not bad at all just nothing special. But something that is truly amazing is the lasagna, please go try it you must!!!!!!!! It's amazing taste homemade and it out the box at all. It is truly so good and amazing. I order it at least once a week with garlic break and it is just the perfect combination! Do yourself the favor and try it!
Pizza is crap much like the rest of the pizza on first avenue.  Generic pizza in NYC what a shame, especially considering the home made wonderful Pizza place it replaced.
Mediocre, overpriced pizza. The size of the pie is generous, but the quality of the crust and the toppings leaves much to be desired. I wouldn't recommend it.
My favorite slice in nyc. I've tried at least 4 different vegetarian slices here and have loved them all. Perfect cheesy-salty-tomatoey-doughey-crunch combo

Dropped by Iggy's the other day. Had never been before. Service was friendly and quick, and the pizza was fantastic (I've spent my whole life in the NJ/NY area so I'd like to think I know my pizza). HIGHLY recommend the thick grandma slice. Plain Sicilian slice was also good.
My favorite slice of pepperoni in the east village. Good calzones and chicken sandwiches as well. Very fairly priced. Quick delivery, but Iggy is in there a bunch and friendly for a pizza shop owner.

Real Italian food like my Italian grandfather makes.  It's not just a pizza joint, scroll down the menu and you'll find Tortellini Soup !! Pasta e Fagioli !!  Shrimp Scampi !!  also fast deliveries on Grubhub,
It was a really forgettable pizza. If it was anywhere else I would've given it a better rating but with so many good places on 1st I wouldn't recommend it.
Pizza is soft and tasteless.. Limp pizza. Just bought 4 pieces and threw them in the trash. Dollar pizza tastes better.
Good slice of pizza.  Definitely recommend, but don't miss out on the pasta dishes - like the lasagna.
I ordered pan fried wonton, drunk-soaked chicken, sticky rice balls with sweet rice wine, dandan noodles, peach resin stew with white fungus and pan fried dumplings. All delicious!

Amazing flavors and generous serving size - don't sleep on IttEast!

Got a pad Thai with tofu to go for the lunch special. Order online if you're in a time crunch as it's a one man kitchen.

To be honest I didn't have high expectations for Pad Thai since the taste never varies much at diff Thai establishments but there's something about how this was cooked that hits different. There's depth, some smoke in this (nothing was burnt), right amount of sweetness, not overly sticky noodles and it was HOT - I couldn't help sitting at a bench nearby to dig in and there's no better timing than when it was just freshly cooked

I did ask for mild, wanting a bit of kick but that was too much for me so no spice for me. It was teetering on the tolerable line as I kept going so low spice eaters, be cautious.

Also the tofu bites was surprisingly soft, I was expecting the firm tofu bites but this is not a negative.

I could not finish it all in one sitting and was super stuffed

IttEast is a great place if you're in the area and want to grab a quick lunch. It's rare to see something priced below $15 these days in New York. There's very little room in the restaurant, so would recommend to-go.

I got the drunken noodle, which is made to order and satisfying. Unfortunately mine didn't have very much veggies and was mostly just noodle.

I ordered the Drunken Noodle lunch special with mild spiciness and sweet sauce and it was delicious! The rice noodles they use are extremely high-quality and have the perfect chew. It's a thicker noodle than what I typically see and I love it! The spot seems to carter towards a more casual, grab-and-go situation but there are a few tables to eat it. Overall, would definitely recommend trying their noodles.
Heard it's a must try from a representative in a bank. Order the chicken over rice. Love it with the sauce. I usually want more flavor then just white rice. So this is the spot!

A very cute place to have lunch, the staff is very friendly and patient when I had questions about the menu.
Food was delicious and affordable, I got the drunken noodle with fish sauce and it was great ( if you are not a fan of sweetness).

The food here is so good you gotta try it,
It seriously is where I go when I am in the neighborhood and want to treat myself to something yummy,
I usually get the drunken noodles, the veggies are so fresh and have a great smoky flavor from the wok, while still retaining some crunch
I have also had the Khao Mun Gai chicken over rice and it is delicious
it comes with a hot cup of chicken broth on the side, a perfect meal full of protein,
the tofu is also great for all you veggie heads out there

This is a great local business in the east village! The owner was so friendly when I went to pick up my meal and it tasted great as well! I got the crab rangoons and the chicken pad thai, both had great portion for the price.

Highly recommend checking this place out for the prices, quality, and kind owner/great chef. Will be my new goto for takeout

I first ate here some 20 odd years ago when it was called "East Village Thai", and it sustained for me as the best, no frills, legit Thai restaurants since.  I was planning to be in the area tonight  and sought out "EVT" only to sadly have google/yelp tell me it had closed.  I decided to walk by for nostalgic reasons, and noticed there was a "new" spot in its place.   I soon learned Itthi has since taken over the place earlier this year, and has continued on the tradition.  The food is delicious, the portions generous, the prices reasonable even in todays inflation fattened reality. And on top-  Itthi is super sweet, passionate, and friendly. Eat here- you won't regret it.
Fantastic food, amazing service. A great local business to support and absolutely delicious, homemade food. Highly recommend.

This place is a hidden gem! The prices are low compared to the typical East Village meal, and (more importantly) the food is AMAZING. I've ordered the chicken basil and drunken noodles. Both were so flavorful and delicious--honestly some of the best Thai food I've ever had. The owner is incredibly friendly, and the environment has great vibes with lots of color and funny signs :) I almost never write reviews but this place is really so good that I had to share!

I've come here almost religiously since the end of January, and the food never fails to delight. The flavors are full and fresh and always satisfy my cravings. As good as it is, the food isn't even the best part. The store is a one-man show run by the most authentic and wonderful person you'll ever meet, Itt. Itt is always happy to see customers and does whatever he can to make them feel at home. He makes an obvious effort to remember his customers and treats his returning customers extremely well. The food being good is almost a given, but Itt is a true diamond in the rough. Please come through and enjoy some fantastic Thai food!
A true hidden gem in the East Village. Inexpensive and so fresh. Must get the thai fried rice!

Had the drunken noodles (new recipe). Really solid. Only good thai spot in the area besides Soothr (which is more of a sit-down spot), but this place is a lot more convenient/quicker.

Believe it or not, this place is just run by one guy, who's really friendly and always brings a smile to my face. As they're understaffed, I'd recommend ordering online ahead of time if you can via their website. This place is a welcome and much needed addition to the neighborhood. Looking forward to going again.

Some changes compared to the old joint that I think were a big improvement
- lunch specials
- new pricing
- new recipes (I'm not even sure if the old recipes are worth keeping, personally I think the new drunken noodle recipe is a lot better than the old one)

Also, who is doing the doodles on their website? They're really cute lol.

Itt East is the BEST. I'm not sure which I love more, the people or the food! Both are so incredible. my go-to is the chicken basil with the papaya salad. If you haven't been here, run!! Sprint!! I predict that this place will be one of the most popular Thai places in the next few months. It's a perfect grab and go or sit-down restaurant and it makes me feel like I'm right at home. WE LOVE ITTEAST

Excellent Thai food!. I was searching for Thai food in the area and IttEast came up. I am so glad I went .The Owner/ Chef Is an nice and authentic person. The passion he has  for what he does is evident in every dish that comes out of the kitchen . 10/10. This is a must try.
Literally the most flavorful pad Thai and drunken noodles WOW. and sweetest owners. Authentic is an understatement!
This is a hidden gem in the east village. you must try it! And the staff members are so wonderful. 11/10!!!!!!

I just picked up an incredibly delicious lunch at this new Thai place. I had the drunken noodles. The taste and quality of the ingredients were absolutely phenomenal. Lots of fresh basil with perfectly seasoned noodles and a generous amount of tender chicken breast. The very friendly owner Itt (pronounced "E.T.", like the alien) cooked my meal. If you are craving excellent, high quality Thai food in the East Village go to see E.T.!
great place! itthi is so nice and welcoming! i have rarely been in a place with such friendly service. the $6 meal WILL fill you up and taste great! love this spot so much!

So I decided today to stop by I Green Market and get a kiddie cone of Cappuccino flavored Gelato for myself. Very disappointed. The scoop lady didn't want to give me a cone at first and when she did it was broken in numerous places and being held together with a napkin wrapped around it. There was barely enough ice cream to cover the cone. When I questioned the size of the scoop. The scoop lady states "you get three spoons" and my reply was "That's three spoons". To which she replied "YES". Oh I got it now. You must have meant I get THREE INFANT TEASPOONS-FULL SCOOPS and to think I actually thought she meant a real Ice cream scoop. And to top it off the Gelato was so-so. It tasted more like regular Ice Cream then Gelato. Very Disappointed!!

I came here for brunch and was surprised to find out they offer the lunch special over the weekend. It was a cozy and inviting casual environment. The servers and chefs were nice & the chefs even said bye to us as we left. I came because I really wanted to try their freshly made tofu & it did not disappoint. I love the silky texture of the tofu, which is similar to a thick soy milk rather than solid block of tofu. The tofu was paired with Bonito flakes, a savory sauce, and scallions. This tofu is a must try.
My boyfriend and I each ordered a lunch combo which comes with hot/cold soba and sashimi. I picked the sushi option and he had the katsu option. We both had the cold soba; soba was firm and light. Sashimi & sushi was high quality and melts in your mouth. Their Wasabi was definitely not the usual tubed fake Wasabi most restaurants give, it didn't have that strong "sting". The katsu was crispy, with a light batter, and didn't feel oily at all.
Overall, this restaurant is worth the money since the quality and attention to details did not miss. I love all the food we had & it felt very healthy. I will come back to try more items.

all in all, really enjoyed the food! i'm vegetarian (but not super super super strict about dashi in soup bases), so i ordered the zaru soba. it was reasonably priced for nyc i think, and honestly the quality was pretty good too! they brought out hot water at the end to create a sipping broth with the dipping sauce. fully enjoyed the main course.

we also ordered tempura, agedashi tofu, and the tamago for appetizers. i think i would get the agedashi tofu again for sure -- the other two weren't bad but unsure if it was worth it for the price.

we also ordered the pickled cucumber, which i really really think was *not* worth it for the price...as you can see in the picture it came out with like 8 cucumber slices, and it was $8....$1/small cucumber slice is kinda wild imo. would not order again, even though the taste was alright. very very mild pickled taste, as the menu description states just a FYI

ambience was cute! cozy little shop with not a bunch of seating, but we were able to get a seat pretty easily at 5:45pm on a wednesday night.

unsure if i'll come back because there are other soba places near me that i also enjoy, but was fun to explore while in the area!

Exterior is pretty unassuming, but solid soba spot in EV!
Can see it being an easy choice during the week for locals.
Recommend for a cozy meal now that fall is just around the corner. Sets are available before 7 pm on weekdays!
Inside is quiet and some sectioned off tables for more privacy. Great catch-up spot for small groups.

My friends and I came here for dinner and loved it! The seating is in some sort of private room setting. We got the Sushi Assortment which came with about 18 sushi and shared the TanTan Soba and Curry Soba Noodles. The soba noodles were sooo good. I personally liked the spice of the tantan more but both broths were great. The sushi also tasted super fresh!

For dessert, we got the Matcha Cake which had a great layer of cake and some sort of mouse. It was topped with a delicious strawberry cream. Definitely recommend!

we were in New York City and ate here twice. Their soba noodle is top-notch. I prefer the cold version the warm version. The cold soba was a bit more bouncy and resilient to the chew. The staff was very attentive. The decor was Japanese modern.

both times, I had the beer on tap, which was perfect for a hot summer day.

For lunch, we ordered the agedashi tofu and a lunch special. The one special that I picked came with an eel, sashimi, side salad, and cold soba. for dessert I ordered some ice cream and mochi with red beans.

For dinner, we ordered a agadashi tofu, a side of Chilean Seabass, a sashimi and sushi plate, and a hot bowl of soba. We finished with a piece of Matcha cake.

Everything was fresh, seasoned well in perfect balance, and cooked perfectly.

Both times, we made reservations, which I highly recommend.

This is a nice restaurant, with very cramped space inside. They still managed to put a nice bar inside. Most of the other tables are are in backside of the restaurant.

Foodwise they have lots of nice appetizers, udon. Sashimi is really good. But the sushis are disappointing to me. The rice was not fresh, felt stale and cold to me. I enjoyed the skewers, tempura, and beef tongue though.

Nice Japanese restaurant. Very nice and modern inside. Only a few tables so reservation is highly recommended.

I don't eat sashimi so hard for me to judge but according to my friends, they are good and fresh.

Love the tempura (appetizer), black cod (appetizer) and black sesame ice cream.

Friendly staff and very clean.

Ise Sushi is a hidden gem for sushi lovers! The seaweed salad was a delightful start, bursting with flavor and freshness. The sushi was a work of art, each piece meticulously prepared. The otoro nigiri was an absolute standout - a melt-in-your-mouth experience! Can't wait to return for more culinary delights!

Before I move over to CA, this used to be my favorite sushi spot in Manhattan! The quality of fish was amazing fresh and the portion sizes were huge! I can't wait to come back and try it again after a year of being away!

More of a 3.5 star for me (4 for soba, 3 for the sushi)

~ Sushi Combination (Lunch special) ~
The sushi are ok, not the most fresh I have had in the city, but it's not bad. The sashimi (especially the tuna) are better, having some nice shine on them. The soy sauce is a bit too salty, and doesn't taste like soy sauce for sushi/sashimi.
The cold soba is indeed very good, quite chewy and springy!! Tasted great with the umami dashi.
Overall, it's a pretty good deal for $35, very stuffed after this.

Will I be back? Yes
Next time I'll probably go for the taksu and sashimi set with soba, or just a big bowl of soba (since it's what tastes best) with sides. Also, lovely environment.

se Restaurant took my cold soba noodle virginity and I am very happy about it. I came here and got the Tororo Zaru cold soba dish which was so good. I have no baseline to compare good vs bad soba but honestly it was seriously great. I really enjoyed the salty flavorful broth that you dip your noodles in (highly recommend dumping in lots of wasabi, and scallions). I also really loved the grated yam; it had a sticky/stringy texture that was so much fun. The flavor was very subtle but definitely noticeable. To be honest, my only complaint is that my soba noodles often clumped together because it was drying/out in the air which made it a bit hard to eat.
The vibes in here also are really great; lots of Japanese people dining in here (a good sign if you're eating out at a Japanese restaurant right?).

Solid find!

Stepping into this restaurant felt like we were transported to Japan. The food was amazing and so flavorful, with a variety of unique dishes. We especially liked the tuna with mountain yam dish since it was so unique. We also liked cooking the duck ourselves on a hot plate since it was very interactive.

I had a wonderful meal here but I waited a little too long to write this review so it will be shorter than I would like (just means I'll have to come back!).

They have combo lunch specials that let you get a bit of everything so there are no tough decisions. I ordered the soba noodles in a flavorful broth, eel over rice, and three types of sashimi. Everything was so fresh and flavorful, every dish could have stood on it's own but together it was phenomenal.

This spot was good for casual lunch/dinner and had tasty soba. We tried duck so a and mushroom soba and both were delicious. We also got a nigiri set and cold soba from the lunch special menu. The food was reasonably priced and could be a good lunch option.

Ebi Hotate Shumai: Steamed Home Made Shrimp, Scallop, and Jalapeno Dumpling ($10)
Chawanmushi: Homemade Egg custard ($12)
Stamina Soba: Cold Soba topped with Okura, Mushroom, Tempura Flakes, Grated Yam, Grated Radish, Quail's Yolk Egg ($25)

Food: Everything was amazing! Rarely do I get to say all the dishes were great, but ISE nailed it. Perhaps I was just really lucky with all my choices. Ebi hotate shumai was full of minced shrimps and scallops that I could actually taste the flavor without overdoing. It was a little bit short of jalapeño but still good nonetheless. I liked that it was not heavily seasoned so I can decide how much soy sauce I want to dip it into. Granted that I was craving Japanese style egg custard for a while, but ISE's Chawanmushi exceeded my expectation. The steamed egg custard is soft, jelly-like and tender. Its toppings like edamame, scallops and mushrooms bring more texture to the whole dish. Also, it's presentation was so cute placed in a clay pot. Stamina soba, as they advertise, felt hearty and healthy. Popping and mixing in the yolk is always fun. Grated radish is a must in soba, but I didn't realize grated yam and okura could go well with soba as well. It was a bit sticky at first but with sauce poured in, the noodles get coated with all the ingredients, which balances the whole dish. Another lovely dish for sure!  

Price: I believe the price is reasonable but slightly expensive. It's justified with the quality of food, its presentation, and the location of the restaurant but also even comparing with other restaurants in the neighborhood, it is on the pricier side.

Ambience: The store is bigger than how it looks like from the outside. It has a few private rooms, some bar seatings and dining tables. The interior is wooden, giving calm vibes.

I liked all the dishes we've got, and would love to come back to try more! Highly recommend!

My boyfriend and I came on a Thursday night to enjoy their Early Bird Dinner Special (Tuesday-Thursday, 5-7pm, walk don't run people!!) This was my 4th visit to Ise Restaurant, so I figured it was time for a review. We made a 6:30pm reservation on Yelp, and the restaurant was about half full when we were seated. They still have good Covid measures in place, with plastic dividers between the tables. The service is quick, and the waiters are incredibly attentive, frequently refilling your water and ensuring you are cared for.

I had the hijiki salad (black seaweed salad), sashimi (4 types), soba noodles, sushi (5 pieces and half a spicy tuna roll), and green tea ice cream/barley tea for dessert. They were generous and fresh cuts of sashimi, especially the fatty tuna, salmon, and snapper. My boyfriend opted for the unagi and said the eel had a well-balanced and rich flavor, crispy skin on the outside and tender on the inside.

Overall, I am always impressed with the flavor profile and quality of all their dishes, and service is top-notch. At $38 for 5 courses, I consider it one of the best Japanese dinner deals in town!

Came here for dinner and got seated quite quickly. We were in the mood for soba and never tried it so picked this spot.

Food is relatively inexpensive and service is quick. A great place to get some no frills comforting soba!

I was craving for a yummy lunch bento box and decided to go here after my dental appointment for lunch. Their lunch special is a bit steep for my wallet but considering the freshness and quality of the ingredients, it's understandable.

I ordered their eel over rice with soba and sashimi lunch special. Everything was fresh and I only wish the gave me more. Lol...wishful thinking. The eel was plump and delicious. It went perfectly with the rice. As for my soba, it was slurping fun. I love the taste of bonito and the broth was packed with it. as for my sashimi, it was fresh. It's regular tuna, not fatty tuna so heads on that.

As for décor, it's a simple design but very clean and comfortable.  Service wise, I was please as my waiter was very friendly and the tea he served was super hot. He even warned me so I won't burn myself.

Overall, I can see myself coming back here if I'm nearby. I love authentic japanese luncheon and this place hit the spot.

Affordable lunch specials and attentive service. Would come back to try dinner!

My lunch came with: sushi & sashimi set, soba, so worth! Ordered a chawanmushi on the side and it was bigger than I expected.

This place can be kinda hard to find but well worth the search. The food, the vibe, and the service were all immaculate. The lunch specials are a must! The fish was so fresh and the katsu was crispy on the outside and moist/juicy on the inside. The pork itself was nice and tender and didn't reek of pork. The soba noodles had a nice bite to it and the broth wasn't too salty but savory instead. For the price point, this meal is super worth a visit.

Wow!!! Hands down, Ise is one of the best kept secrets in town. The meals were well priced, and we enjoyed how authentic everything was And if you like soba, this is the spot to visit. We got the squid ink soba and the combo special (soba, sushi, and some hot items) - both dishes were delicious. The restaurant had an interesting layout with 2 sections of counter seating, some mini booth, and tables. Either way, plenty of seating for a small storefront. Service was friendly, but the server couldn't really recommend any dishes to us. Complimentary hot tea at the end of the meal was a nice touch. We left with our bellies satisfied!

A taste of Japan in the heart of the East Village. Ise serves extremely fresh food and absolutely recommend if you want an authentic, no-frills experience!

For starters, the sashimi is EXCELLENT and they don't skimp out on the cut! It's so fresh and melt-in-your-mouth. Wish i could eat this every day. The soba is also perfection - served cold with a dipping sauce, and some broth to pour over the sauce once you're done if you want to sip on it.

The food speaks for itself - make sure to check it out.

Good foods + Good services
Every thing was fresh and delicious.
Price is rea
Music was nice and soft, not too loud that you can't hear each other.
Try to get the booth if your party is btw 3-4 people.

I cry.

This place is amazing for every single dish they have on their menu. I've been here a few times already and they do not disappoint!!

We got a sushi/sashimi combo to share for the table and each got our own soba noodles. Both cold and hot were yummy. If you get the cold soba- they give you some warm broth at the end when you're finished.

Please try this place!!! It's so worth. A little bit of Japan in the heart of NYC

Came here for dinner and it is definitely one of my favorite Japanese restaurants in NYC (up there with Soba-ya and Nippon). But, I do appreciate when a restaurant doesn't just serve food and provide excellent service, both of which this place has, but also when restaurants like this one immerse you in a completely different world and thus memorable experience.  I ordered the bluefin tuna sushi and the shrimp tempura cold soba noodles.  Everything tasted like heaven, the staff was overtly nice, and I will definitely be returning to this wonderful establishment.  We even got complimentary green tea! Awesome 10/10

Amazing experience at this low-key Japanese restaurant during my trip to New York. We ordered an assortment of items, all of which were delicious.

The soba set with shrimp tempura was refreshing and the texture of the noodles was perfect. The duck breast cooked on the hot plate was nice and having the vegetables cook in the duck grease was a nice touch. The chicken katsu was crispy and dipping in the ton katsu sauce gave a nice flavor. The home made tofu was very warm and fluffy and felt authentic. We ended our meal with a red bean mochi dessert, which wasn't too sweet, but very satisfying.

The service was friendly, our waiter explained items on the menu and answered all of our questions and the pricing felt reasonable for the quality and freshness of ingredients.

Overall, I would highly recommend as a casual Japanese dining experience.

One of my favorite Japanese restaurants in NYC. I leave here continuing to dream about the next time I can have their pork katsu or their squid ink soba with uni and salmon roe. The prices are reasonable for a nice meal out (around $30 a dish) but you'll know once you've had the food here that this is a place to save down and try to be a regular at. The waiters are also very nice and attentive and the food comes out relatively quickly so you're not hungry for too long!

Caveat I've only been here for Sunday lunch so hopefully these items are also available during the week but the squid ink soba and the pork katsu are my favorite dishes!

Unfortunately, this restaurant did not live up to expectations. For starters, I made a reservation for 845 pm, which was offered on their website. I was called at 830 pm and told that I would only have 15 minutes to eat and that I should consider coming another day. This was pretty upsetting. I decided to go anyway. I ordered tons of food before the kitchen closed and felt rushed to eat: yellowtail, eel, salmon avocado, and spicy tuna rolls along with udon, gyoza, edamame, and agedashi tofu. The food was just decent. Overpriced in my opinion.

This place is remarkable! We were visits NYC for the Thanksgiving weekend I wish I would have been able to have two meals here! The service was excellent. I wish they had some cocktails though. The fish was fresh. My husband got the squid ink Ikura Uni soba. What a great dish. I got the Kake (hot) soba with mini Ikura Uni Don. We shared an ankimo, chauamushi, and ika geso. All so good! Will definitely come back here again. Would like to try the cow tongue appetizer next time!

I came here on a tuesday night with no reservation and I was able to get seated at the bar immediately. it got busy pretty fast so i would definitely recommend making a reservation.
we ordered the hot soba noodles, the sushi and sashimi platter, and the spicy scallop roll. The soba noodles were very flavorful and really hit the spot on a cold day. All the fish tasted so fresh and I could tell it was great quality.
Service was also really good. Although it was really busy, and it seemed like there were only 2 waiters, our server did a good job of checking in on us.
They are still taking COVID precautions and have screens set up to separate the tables.

I think this was just everything I needed after a long day of walking around NYC. Reservation was very easy to make and they are so quick to answer vs other busy NYC restaurants. You do need to make a reservation though as it does get quite busy. I can't stress enough about the beautiful presentation!! I ordered the hexagon? Or is it the dodecagon since it's twelve sided?? I don't remember. But it included sushi, some small Japanese side dishes, and soba. The soba was one of the best I have had. Dipping sauce for it was not too sweet or salty, just the perfect balance. It is a must try if you come here. Sushi was decent, pretty good nigiri but the star of the show is probably Mr soba. Ambiance is absolutely perfect for a date night! It looks so romantic inside with the low lighting at the booth area.

Ise is a great place for some good sashimi and soba without breaking your wallet. I came here for dinner - the ambience was good, the restaurant is a bit small but they have dividers between tables. I really enjoyed the squid ink uni soba, but it's pretty fishy/tastes strongly of seafood (which I like but I know some people don't).
The sashimi platter was delightful and I also got two rolls on the side. These dishes were shared between me and one other person and it was a very good amount of food.

To me, this is a noodle place first, then a sushi place. The sushi was tasty, but the soba noodles and broth were an absolute delight. Enough bite and chew, a rich and complex broth with plenty of flavor and oiliness. Atmosphere and general vibe are nice. Prices are a little high, but they have some good deals depending on what time you go. Great service too.

Food (3/5) - The soba got soggy / started breaking pretty quickly after being served. Though, the broth was very flavorful and the chicken was melt in your mouth (the right texture! generally hard to find that around here). Would definitely recommend adding a poached egg or something similar. You can add 2 dollars for the soba to be served on the side and the broth to be served in a stone, heated pot. If you're very picky with your noodle texture then I would definitely recommend taking that option since that basically solves the issue of noodle integrity.

We also shared a starter of the beef tongue - I thought the tongue could've had more char and it was a little on the tough side, but it is tongue and that was to be expected. Mustard was a nice touch. It was only 4 pieces for $12 (I think?) so not quite sure if worth the price.

Price (3/5) The average bowl of noodles was around 20, which is average for nyc but definitely a little high for the location (around St Mark's Pl).

Ambiance (4/5) - it is St Mark's so keep your expectations low, all the places around here tend to be pretty cramped and / or loud. It wasn't loud here though definitely on the more cramped side, tables are separated with little plastic partitions.

The decor and spot was decently cute though; and clean.

Service (5/5) - we were seated very quickly, food came decently quickly and they were not overly intrusive! Good spot for a quick dinner.

Was also easy to get a table on Sunday night!

I loved Ise!!! This might be the best sushi that I've had in New York. We only had sushi rolls but all of them were amazing. I will say that the portions were pretty small so two rolls didn't fill me up completely. Next time I would probably go for three or grab a chirashi bowl. I will also add that the staff were incredibly accommodating as we were super late for our reservation and they still seated us!

TL;DR - 4 to 4.5 star. A bit pricey but overall good food. More of a cozy spot where there is limited seating.

Restaurant consist of a bar space near the front where the omakase is served. Looks very fancy in the front area, but don't get intimated as they have a back seating area that can house about 20-25 people. If you have a large party, definitely call for a reservation as it is a small space.

Overall Ratings - Factoring in taste, portion, and cost

Nabeyaki Udon - 8.5/10 - Broth is a veggie broth and doesn't have much flavor. It does grow on your and is more clear/clean flavor that kind of makes you feel a bit warm inside. Udon noodles are great and cooked to the right level of firmness. They add a multitude of different veggies such as cabbage, mushrooms, leaks, and scallions. Also has fish cake, shrimp tempura, and chicken. Overall the portion was filling and the taste was clean but flavorful.

Sushi and Soba Lunch Set - 8/10 - Sushi was great and seemed really fresh. The soba was a bit underwhelming. It was not firm and was soggy. The taste of the soba dip was up to expectations, but the noodles not being cooked well ruined it. Would still go back for the sushi as it was pretty good.

Overall Food: 7/10
Service: 9/10
Great service with food coming out at a perfect pace, never felt like I was waiting for more or getting impatient. Additionally, the plating and decor was absolutely stunning.
Ambience: 9/10
Great setting with traditional Japanese touches including Shoji japanese paper walls touch
Food:
Fluke Sashimi w Ponzu Dressing 9/10
Fresh Fluke sliced thinly and dressed with a light ponzu dressing that had a nice bite. Really enjoyed the taste with the perilla leaf combination bringing the neutral fish flavor with a more minty leaf
Tori Nanban: 7/10
Very juicy chicken thighs with a selection of fresh spring vegetables and a nice, light tartar sauce dressing
Chawanmushi: 5/10
Can skip this egg dish, traditionally this is one of my favorite dish but I thought the one we received lacked dashi flavor but had a very silky egg texture which was nice
Tempura Soba/Duck Soba: 8/10
