Amazing broth and tempura shrimp. The broth had a rich sweet and salty taste with hints of bonito, soy sauce, mushrooms. The tempura shrimp was perfect and had a nice bit to it. The duck, kamo, was very tender but lacking in portion. If i came back i'd get the tempura again over the duck.
The soba and sushi lunch set was a good amount of food and pretty good quality. You won't need a reservation for weekend lunches, and there is a $20 fee if you cancel.

I wanted to give a higher rating because the server was really nice, but the food left a lot to be desired.
The soba (their specialty) is solid, but other items involving raw fish (such as chirashi, sashimi) are not good. The lunch sets, which are $32-34 each, are really small in portion.

Got a 7:30 reservation and was so happy with the food. My friend got the udon which was perfect. It was hot and had chewy bouncy noodles and the tempura batter for the shrimp was so flavorful. The tan tan noodles were also delicious. I think I would come again and try a soba in a both with less of a ramen vibe, but it was so good so no complaints. The tuna with ponzu tasted very fresh but the ponzu sauce wasn't very light or citrusylike I'm used to. We also got couple of beers and service was very nice! 10/10 would recommend!

Came here a while back on a Friday night and just WOW. Was craving some excellent quality sushi and got exactly that. I ordered the chirashi bowl and it was HEAVENLY. The sashimi selection as well as its quality made me feel like I was taking a dive into the ocean! The rice with the ikura and uni was flavorful and balanced well together with everything else. We also ordered a bottle of sake, a hot soba and the sushi and sashimi, everything was to die for. They also complimentary serve hot green tea at the end of the meal.

The restaurant's ambience definitely seems to be on the fancier end. I felt very zen the moment I walked in through the door and even more so when I left after such a great meal. Be prepared to wait a while if you don't make a reservation, as well as to splurge a bit, but the quality and experience is so well worth it!

It is a super cozy environment and loved the aesthetic of it all! I really enjoyed the food there! Oh there's free green house which was super good and rich!

I had the assorted sashimi - 10/10 very fresh and big cuts! So tender and a good variety !

I had the hot soba with tempura - 9/10
The soba and soho was really good and a hot temperature (I like my soho hot) and the tempura was pretty crispy but was a bit soggy from being in the soup

Special dessert- black sesame with matcha and strawberry cream - 9/10
The matcha was very rich and sooo yummy. The black sesame cake was a bit dense (stale?) like it was in the fridge for too long but that was the only thing !

I am definitely coming back! Especially during the fall when the weather gets a bit chilly again!

This is our go to spot when we are craving cold soba and that just happens to be quite often. Lunch time is our favorite hour to go - we love the lunch special boxes of cold soba that include sashimi, salads and my husbands favorite is the meal set with the donkatsu. You also have the option of udon noodles or warm soba. But we are huge dans of their amazing cold soba. Ingredients here are fresh and happily satiating.

Green tea is complimentary and a warm treat in the winter. The portions are perfect, I never leave feeling hungry or overly stuffed. Service is always quite timely and friendly.

At the end of your cold soba dish, they will give you a soba broth to pour into the soba dipping broth. Its a pretty interesting taste at first but now Ive grown to look forward to it at the end of the meal. More times than not we leave here without dessert (in an effort to make healthier choices) but we have had dessert here and it is delicious - simple, balanced and tasty.

Sharing our favorite spot with you and hope you feel the same.
Delicious food, gracious service, and a calm elegant atmosphere. Looking forward to our next visit.

Such a cute little spot, esp if you can get one of the rooms in the front. The food here is so good, there is so much attention to detail with every little thing on your plate and those little details add up to make for such a great meal. We had both hot and cold soba combinations, honestly everything was outstanding. I cannot say which one I liked best, they were both great, maybe just depends on the weather outside.  Our server was very attentive my water cup never got empty. Overall this is such a great place, I would definitely come here again. The bar area looked really fun but it wasn't open during the time I was here (lunch time).

It gotta be shrinkflation. We ordered smoked oyster, and gome as appetizer and two soba noodle bowls as main. The smoked oyster only has two pieces chopped into six. It's tiny for $12. Noodle soup is tasty but has less than four pieces of meat (curry soba and duck soba). Love the taste but probably won't come back.

Serene little place for soba, sushi, and other Japanese foods. Great for a hot bowl to warm you up in the winter, or a refreshingly cold bowl for the summertime.

For appetizers we got the homemade tofu, which surprised me with how delicious it was! Definitely recommend trying this as a warm-up to your meal. I got the Stamina Soba (from the Special Menu, which I didn't even notice until I was ordering and made me change my mind mid-order). There's a lot going on here with the grated yam, radish, tempura flakes, mushrooms, and quail yolk- avoid if you don't like  slimy textures lol but luckily I do and very much enjoyed this!

Would love to come back and try some of their sushi/sashimi options or some other appetizers. Til next time!
An amazing experience at Ise!  The sushi was so fresh and delicious.  I recommend sitting at the sushi bar to watch the chefs cut the fish.  They are truly Assorted Sushi masters at their craft

Love the lunch special! For $35 I got high quality sashimi, sushi and soba noodles. The sashimi was extremely fresh. The soba noodle broth was clear but rich at the same time. Highly recommend coming for lunch to avoid the crowd and enjoy the meal quietly.

The food here was divine. Epitome of Delicious, clean Japanese food.

Cold soba with dashi and seaweed. I got the early bird dinner special. Sashimi and light sushi. Many options of junmai daiginjo.

I want every single dishware I saw!

I want to come back.

Walked into this ihop; cold, and starved. The waiter served our party immediately. Our order was taken quickly.

The food arrived fresh, hot, and made to order. Everything was perfect with our order.

The service was great, good experience.

When I got here I waited with a few customers at the entrance to be seated. After a few minutes someone finally came. We were promptly seated and given menus. I was able to get my order in fairly quick. The place itself is deceptively big. I found it annoying that I needed a code to use the bathroom. I didn't see the need for it given that the bathroom is in the back of the restaurant. I can't imagine people slipping in from outside and using it.

My food came at a decent time. About what you would expect. The food itself was ok. Normally I wouldn't get a burger from IHOP but it was on the happy hour menu and I wasn't in the mood for breakfast items. It was a decent burger at best. I could never recommend it though. Tasted like something you can get anywhere or make yourself. I really came here for the pancakes. Well, unfortunately I've had better pancakes at other locations. The pancakes were good but definitely tastes like something I could get elsewhere. Syrup caddy makes it worth it though.

Finally when I was done I was lucky enough to catch the waiter. I wanted to pay but he was taking a while to come back. So I just scanned the QR code on the receipt to pay on the app. All in all, the location and restaurant itself is t bad. Service and the food could've been better. I probably would've been better off at a local diner or even ordering from a ghost restaurant.

I haven't visited this location in years. Maybe 7 or so. In my opinion, its gotten so much better.

I walked in at 9am and was seated right away. The hostest was such a cutie pie and greeted us coming in and also leaving.

Our waitress was cool and down to earth. I loved her vibe and how quick she moved. She took care of us immediately and consistently stopped by to ask if we were okay and needed anything. What really impressed me WAS a group of teens walked in. They were seated with my waitress. She dealt with them and didnt treat them like they were kids. When it was time to get the bill, she separated out everyones check for them. One of her colleagues complained about the fact that those teens didnt leave my waitress a tip.. her exact words were "i dont care about the tip. Im grateful they paid the bill. There kids so im okay with it". I loved that. I left her a tip, she deserved it.

The food came out fast!! And hot. We ordered the Sirlon tips platter. It comes with hash browns, the steak with onions and mushrooms, two eggs and pancakes. Everything was delicious. I always ask for my steak to be cooked medium because they always cook it well done anyways. We also ordered the pancake combo which came with eggs, bacon and hash browns. Everything was delicious.

I would certainly return here. Ask for Leomary L, she's awesome.

Food was terrible! I had a terrible experience with the services as well. I was ignored by the waiter additionally the sanitary was trash. The silverware's still have stains from the previous person that used them! I don't know how the paper turned brown when I wiped my knife with it. After eating the food, I felt really sick and threw up, this place is absolutely disgusting. I hope a inspector review this place and close it, it's not fit to be a proper restaurant.

Recently visited and happy to see an expanded menu that offers among other things protein pancake options. They also opened an additional small room, and no longer rely on plastic utensils anymore (although if you drop one, they'll bring you a plastic replacement for some reason).

Our waitress was excellent and the food really filling: I think I would've been okay with one mixed-berry protein pancake with my protein sides as I couldn't finish them and my partner didn't need lunch with her Spicy Poblano Omelette.

One thing that was annoying was one of the workers was arguing with another on the other side of the cut-out wall, one seat over from us, and we could hear their whole conversation throughout the meal: I can't imagine how the couple sitting directly within earshot felt.
Awesome all around food is great and the service is always on time.  I recommend IHOP to all who love breakfast
It's an ihop in prime New York and it still serves up iconic pancakes with fast service. We don't go often but when we do, it satisfies our craving for syrupy stacks and decent omelettes!

Food (3/5): Food was decent and OK. Got the steak omelette with hash brown and strawberry banana pancakes. The omelette was pretty good however the pancakes came soggy and was not fresh.

Venue (2/5): The place was reasonably large but had this messy, old, and unkept atmosphere to it. It's as if the restaurant didn't get maintained well.

Service (1/5): This was probably the worst part of the experience. I came here with a large group of people. They needed to split us into four tables, so we asked if we could basically just have separate checks and orders. They said no. This resulted in a massive mess where they forgot orders, misdelivered food to the wrong people, and never once came to check up on us. Literally we had to go up every time to ask to order, refill water, and ask for places to be taken away. Besides our group, the restaurant was empty so there was no benefit of the doubt here. The service was exceptionally terrible.

Very disgusting , food not well cooked. Server smelled like a ton of weed.
Not recommended!!!
The food was terribke the eggs were not good, the wait time was 25 minutes for our food too

IHOP on Fourteenth Street is not the fanciest place to brunch, but if you crave their endless coffee and buttermilk pancakes, look no further. It's a huge place with big booths where you can be left alone if you want. Definitely pricey for an IHOP but portions are big. Miss the suburbs? Drop by. Woodgrain  tables beckon. The service is attentive for a chain restaurant; slow so get coffee first (it looks like a long walk to the kitchen so I get it). Make sure you bring a big tote bag for leftovers! Plus, sign up for the free frequent diners' program online; they have nice perks. Enjoy!!

My first time having IHOP.  Split Decision Breakfast with 2 eggs, 2 bacon strips , 2 pork sausage , french toast, and 2 buttermilk pancakes. Sirloin Steak Tips with 2 eggs, golden hash brown, and 2 buttermilk pancakes. Big portion & fulfilling . Yummy egg benedicts. I love their hash brown!  Amazing service and atmosphere. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner .

COLD FOOD SHIT COFFEE AND THE WORST SERVICE. The manager was upset that I was complaining. I paid $32 for two coffees and a cold waffle.. if this is a service that's being provided for your New York IHOP you shouldn't have an IHOP in New York city.

If I could I would give this place negative 5 stars. The service was horrible, the place was dirty, and they got our order wrong 2 times. After waiting 20 mins to order  then 30 mins for the food. All our orders had pork on them and no one at the table eats pork. They came back with new orders and my French toast were  Black and burnt. They put extra whipped cream on them to cover them up, but I was to over it by then. I only stayed because the children were hungry.  NEVER AGAIN !!

This iHop was a disappointment. We had to wait to be seated for 20 minutes despite the restaurant being empty. Upon being seated, we had no waitress for another 15 minutes. We never got water and she took long to also make our drinks. Despite ordering the same drinks, they look and tasted completely different! They also said free refills, but when our cups were empty we had to beg her for a refill. The pancakes came out burnt-- every single one of them. They also didn't bring our food out at the same time, and our chicken and pancake platter came with 3 small tenders??? For 17$, that is simply unacceptable. The table next to us, despite having a different waiter, also received the same horrible service and burnt pancakes.

The burnt pancakes, lack of food, and horrible service are enough for us to never return to this location again.
Great new location on Springfield. The food was delicious and fresh. They have happy hours with amazing price points for a full meal.
Came here for breakfast on a Monday and had a great experience!! Our server was exceptionally friendly and our food great, overall a good time. the double chocolate chip pancakes are the best!

What a terrible disappointment this IHOP on East 14th Street in Manhattan is. Having lived all over the eastern and midwestern United States, I have eaten in many IHOPs and always enjoyed their breakfasts, especially the yummy hash browns. The restaurants have always been spotlessly clean with welcoming staff and waitresses. On 14th Street in NYC, it is Opposite World. I entered the 24-hour eatery before 8 am, and there were 6 people eating at 2 out of the 25 tables, and yet the first thing the waitress/seater said to me was that I couldn't sit down until the friend I was meeting there arrived.

I am disabled and all I wanted was a cup of coffee and to read the newspaper as I waited (I wasn't sure when he would get there as he's not the most punctual friend) but she wouldn't allow that. Despite the empty restaurant, I was told that I must wait on the grimy little plastic settee by the front door until my friend arrived, When I complained, she snapped, "Are you going to order something?" (such hospitality!), and I replied, "Yes, that's the idea."

So she took me to the one table in front of the restaurant that was squeezed between the two that were actually in use. Again, I objected and asked to be seated at one of the empty booths farther away. I mentioned that she wasn't making me feel very welcome, and she immediately said, "I haven't done anything wrong. I'm just telling you the rules!" Since when does a visit to IHOP for breakfast require a reading of rules before one can sit down?

I asked the waitress if I could speak to the manager, please, and she said, "Sure, I'll get her." After 10 minutes with no one coming by to speak with me, I had had enough. This is not the kind of IHOP I have known all my life, not the least bit welcoming, not to mention the place was dark and dusty and needed a good cleaning. I would recommend you choose one of NYC's many great diners for breakfast rather than this hellhole.

Don't waste your money here.  Have been here many times in the past both pre and post pandemic.  They were always short on staff.  But I will not return after this visit on 9/15/23.
Waited 10 minutes for someone to come to the front to seat the people waiting. You saw the servers walking back and forth and looking at the front of the restaurant so they saw the line of people.
Waited another 8 minutes for the server to take our order.
The food was just okay and was warm.  It was not hot.
Asked for more coffee from another server.  He looked at me like I asked him for $10.
After 10 minutes and no coffee, finally saw our server to order more coffee.
Coffee was so bitter that no amount of sugar or cream could make it drinkable.
And of course, had to wait 10 minutes to get the check.
Whoever owns this iHop must want to go out of business
Not ever going back there.  I would've been happier at McDonalds for breakfast.
You've been warned.

The food is mediocre at best ? IHOP used to be a great place to get something to eat, day or night but the quality of the food has slipped big time & the prices have skyrocketed in the past couple of years since Covid ? I understand that the price of grocery items have gone up but they haven't gone up anywhere near as much as IHOP is now charging ?

I love my iHop. I've always loved my iHop rewards. I have free Pancakes for my birthday and again for my yearly anniversary as a member of the rewards program.
Today was my birthday pancakes. My daughter had the day off so she came for breakfast. She always has the poached eggs and potatoes with toast. Last time she came with me she had sausage, this time she had bacon with her breakfast. She also had coffee. She said the pot keeps the coffee nice and hot.
I had my usual Cinnamon Pancakes and I enjoyed every delicious bite. I was also happy with our seat in the back corner where it was private. The tables are clean and they use disposable utensils. We were given plenty of napkins too. I needed them when my whipped cream slid off my pancakes onto the table!  I salvaged most of it.
Leomary was waiting on our table and she's the best. I've had her service a lot over the years. She's so professional. My daughter remarked about how happy she was with Leo. I look forward to seeing her when I visit iHop.
Naturally I used the restroom before I left. It was clean and spacious. It's unisex and they have two. From the time we entered we were treated with high safety standards. First we showed proof of vaccination and our photo identification card. Then we had our temperature taken. I asked for a booth and my wishes were granted.
It was a perfect birthday brunch today. Thank you iHop. My daughter paid for her breakfast even though I said I would treat her. She said it's my birthday brunch I shouldn't pay. We both left a tip. I saw the man cleaning tables and the receptionist was very nice. She said goodbye when we left and asked how we enjoyed our food. We said we sure did. I was surprised when my daughter loudly said "We'll be back!"

I wanted some breakfast while I waited for my daughter  to get her hair done at a nearby salon. The food was just ok, the kids enjoyed it. There were some issues with the servers and other customers who argued about their checks. The couple next to our booth were also arguing to the point where a fight almost broke out. Honestly don't know if I'd go back, it's was just meh.
Ordering and taking out literally takes forever, FOREVER. Living nearby causing me to eat in this place more than 3 times and it happens Every Single Time.

Would leave negative stars if I could. The pancakes had several spots of mold on them. I sent them back and said I just wanted the check. They then charged for the pancakes until I pointed it out. Very concerning. Eat at your own risk

Placed an order online was supposed to be done at a certain time but had to wait 28 minutes more And they still didn't complete my food order and waited til they cooked the missing item then they gave me milk instead of a milkshake which It was packed separate and I didn't open it until I was home I realized it was just milk....service is slow and poor will never ever go back to this location

I don't know what got into me; it could have been nostalgia, or perhaps it was lack of sleep, but whatever the case, it culminated in a take out breakfast order from IHOP on East 14th.

Unrelated to this restaurant, I was working on a theory the other day, and my experience here reinforces it: fast food chains in the city are like their rest stop outposts - an overpriced shadow of the reliable mediocrity they represent elsewhere. And yes, in my opinion, IHOP is fast food; there's not one iota of craftsmanship or pride to be found behind the counter, and cookie cutter meals are pumped out with the same concern people flip a 2 ounce patty onto a stale bun. Unlike, say, the golden arches, there's no system in place at IHOP to ensure even the minimum conformity to established standards.

That must be the case, or there would have been gravy on my cold country fried steak.

In their defense, when I discovered this, I called the restaurant and they offered to deliver some gravy. By the time that could have happened, my already seized sunny side up eggs would be even more inedible. Instead, I told the manager I would return the food, and they could either re-fire it or credit my card for the meal. I walked back to the restaurant and informed the two staff members at the counter what had transpired, neither of whom had any new food for me or knowledge thereof, and so asked them to alert the manager that I had fulfilled my commitment and expected my money back. A month and a half later, I'm starting to get the impression he won't be refunding my card.

Whatever. Sometimes it's worth the money just to be genuinely outraged, but not in this case. I should have known better, and I got what I paid for, which was nothing.

My girlfriend, meanwhile, had the steak tips and eggs. I told her in advance that she wouldn't like them, and she didn't. That's her fault for not listening to my advice, and has only to do with the fact that they're gross and terrible across the entire chain. This one, they nailed perfectly, which I suppose justifies the single star I'm forced to award.

This IHOP was truly outstanding, from the moment my party and I arrived we were treated like one of their own.

We were sat immediately at a clean and well-located booth equidistant from the front door, bathroom, and kitchen -- the place to see and be seen at any eatery.

Our waitress, Shaunte, took care of us from the start with a smile on her face and took extra steps to ensure we were comfortable and enjoyed our time there. We began our breakfast at midnight by splitting a cookies and cream milkshake 3 ways (a perfect portion) and it was spectacular. The cookies were fresh and perfectly crunchy while the ice cream tasted like it came straight from the udder and provided a wonderful creamy base. We could not have asked for a better sweet treat!

Shaunte helped us order an appropriate amount of food for three moderately-hungry young women looking for fried food and carbs. We ordered the appetizer and breakfast samplers with an additional pancake so our group could have one pancake each (thanks for the tip, Shaunte!).

One would think that the International House of Pancakes might be lacking expertise in the appetizer department. One would be wrong. The onion rings were perfectly crisp, the mozzarella sticks stringy, and the chicken tenders were just as tender as one could hope. The platter came with an array of dipping sauces and we had such a great time mixing and matching the food and condiments!

When the breakfast sampler came out we were truly overjoyed, it brought all of the usual suspects to the table: eggs, bacon, and hash browns cooked fresh and just to our liking. I've never had scrambled eggs as hot and fluffy as those that Shaunte served us (looking at you, Gordon Ramsay). But when it comes to pancakes in New York, there's really only one place you can go, and it's the IHOP on 14th Street between 2nd and 3rd. I'm not a religious woman, but I saw the Lord in the pancakes served to us at this IHOP. They came out crispy on the edges, soft in the middle, a little sweet, slightly salty, and dripping in butter.

The only thing that makes them better? The syrup they leave for you on the table! I should have taken some home with me (yeah, it's that good), but I didn't want to sin after the experience I had just had.

From the bottom of my heart, thank you to Shaunte and the entire 14th Street IHOP team -- we've never felt so at home.

6/2/2023 I was stopped by to get some food before going to work with my GF. From the moment I walked in the environment was off.

I ordered a sprite and asked for a water. Never got the water. The waiter asked if my gf wanted 2 strips of bacon or 4 and she requested 4 (still received 2) I had to request for the other two. My gf ordered hash browns with her meal and also took longer to come to the table. After requesting for the other two strips I asked again for the water that I never received and waiter just took his sweet time getting it (resteraunt is not even busy) I ordered a egg Benedict with hash browns and the eggs Benedict just didn't taste good to me so I requested if to be removed after two bites.

This was extremely frustrating to me as I work in food service business and I am all about ensuring great experience/service to all guest. The resteraunt was not even busy. The waiter was extremely off!!! After asking the  for adjustment on my check waiter gets the manager makes adjustment brings back the check and no apologies or anything. The waiter also over charged me $4.99 for hash browns that was suppose to already come included with my meal so he had to adjustment my check again. At this point I am furious, the waiter makes adjustments bring back the check to the table. I requested to speak to the manager and the waiter said she's too busy right now. WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! After the experience I stormed out the resteraunt. I can't believe I still even paid close to $30.00 for me to not only like my food and most importantly the service. It starts with the managers leadership so no wonder why the staff is the way they are.

Even the guy next to me wait 10 mins until his waiter attended to him. The only reason the waiter came to him is because the host asked if anyone helped him yet so host went to the back to get the waiter.

Horrible Service Here I will not be coming back

This location is always late when ordered through UberEats, which I have done a few times over the course of a year. Every single time the order arrives late due to the restaurant taking excessive time for the order and it is cold by arrival time. For the price, this is very disappointing.
it was fun until it gave me food poisoning. me and all my friends spent a lot of time on the toilet lets just leave it there

This shit was terrible as fuck. I got my food two hours late, and didn't receive everything I ordered. I got no updates on when my food was arriving throughout the whole delivery process. This made zero fucking sense to me since this location is 10 minutes away from me. Never ordering from here ever again.
The new waiter, Trevor, was very attentive and very polite.

I want to salute IHOP  because every veterans day for a number of years they've  offered vets a free stack of red,white,and blue pancakes.I believe they also do something special on your birthday.Since I'm  a breakfast person I'm  looking forward to their latest breakfast special for $6.00.manga,manga.As long as I have my tablet and wifi I'm a happy camper.plzlog on to birthday freebies

This is one of our many visits here and always enjoy the food and the service. they are following covid-19 guidelines which is a plus. the place looks a little bit empty right now I guess is because people doesn't want to eat outside as much as before the pandemic happens.

This was my first time at this location and my last. I ordered a slice of toast with avocado, topped with tomatoes with a side of fruit.

Fruit was good because, well, they didn't make it and coffee was decent. My avocado toast on the other hand was HORRIBLE. I was hungry as this was my first meal of the day but I just couldn't finish it. The bread wasn't really toasted for starters and they put so much butter that my bread was starting to get moist. I got the feeling that they didn't have much avocado left because they thinly spread it out instead of adding avocado slices. The pieces of tomatoes almost nonexistent. This whole meal was just terrible.
food was ass. took a while. burn down this place and get new food. kys

once again another major shout out to manager venice and her amazing staff, extra shout out to brandon.. and the others who are always friendly and helpful and get people in and out in a timely manner.
they keep the restaurant spotless and its always neat and well staffed. the food is always hot and fresh and plentiful.  so happy they are in our area and that this one is our neighborhood staple to go to.  this should be the model for all ihop's as they really do care about their customers and always make them feel like vip's when you come there.  highly recommend  you check them out.  also great place to take children.

The service was as good as boneless pizza. Chicken sandwich: ASS. 0/10. Nothing good about it. No flavor, wild patty. NO. NEVER. The eggs as always were undercooked. Salmonella. Don't do it. Worse than the guy who eats plastic bags. The burger I got was good and beefy tho. I like cow a lot so I'm picky you know. Nice buns. Didn't have bacon tho and I like pig too so eh. Mozzarella sticks were as fresh as the shit I took after. Ripe and crispy. 10/10. Onion rings nice. Pancakes fluffy like a carnival stuffed animal. Bacon nice and textured like my pubic hair. Not as wild though. Went a few weeks ago. Free refills.
First time there - don't go!  I had an order to go - pancakes and side of bacon.  When I got home, three tiny pancakes and burnt bacon.  No extra syrup or butter as requested.  Expensive, too!
Waited 2 hours for food that was mid.... Servers ignored our table. And I actually left more hungry, ended up getting a sandwich after.

I have a bad leg from all the years of soccer, which is why IHOP.

If you come to Manhattan and you eat at IHOP, I don't know what to say. You shouldn't be on Yelp and you shouldn't be reading my reviews. I mean seriously - you can't get anything out of my food reviews and stuff if you're a fan of Denny's and IHOP, especially when you're in a city with so much incredible food like New York City. Dennys and IHOP are not incredible... they're inedible. But go ahead and prove me wrong. I know you will.

So if you love them, I'm sad. Like my friend did that dragged me here, late night, a few months ago on my BobaTour of NYC. My heart weeps for you.

So sure, check it out if you want to. Your call. (Cough crap taste in food cough)

Wanna save money? Buy frozen crap at the store and throw it in the microwave. Just as disgusting, just as bad for you, but one fifth of the price.

It's a pretty standard location - only perhaps even worse. IHOP is the bottom of the Barrel, while New York City food is at the top of the barrel, so go do the math and stay away from this place.

Despite the overall low review on yelp, I found this place to be better than expected! Food and service were decent. Overall, great place to take huge parties since they have plenty of seating.

Service - Excellent, our server was attentive, quick and friendly

Food -
We ordered the
- Saussage & bacon supreme - The hash brown was perfectly cooked,
-Chicken and waffle - The chicken was moist! Perfectly cooked, major props to the chef for consistency(my boyfriend had it the previous day and it tasted the same) and execution.  
- Wednesday webcakes - it was like eating a giant donut
- Hot chocolate - sweet and not too watery

The food here is extremely salty; I felt like I developed hypertension after eating here. However, if you are in search of pancakes they are very fluffy. Service was pretty slow as well. There are definitely better places to eat at if you are in East Village.

This place needs to be shut down! And all the employees needs to be fired or retraining, the place is so dirty the employees have attitude. Not greeting at all! The air conditioning was to high! And because there is waiters they want to keep all the customers in a small nasty room and everyone was talking really loud and the table was so close to each other, and of course I didn't stayed there I just leave!!
I mean it's IHOP grab yah pancakes and go, service was very good compared to other locations and the food was actually pretty good

When I'm in the mood for IHOP this is my go to location. There is usually never a wait, and most times you'll be seated right away. For the most part, it's never usually crowded. This location is 24 hours on the weekends, so it's perfect for a late night treat!

I have been a customer since the menu was a plastic orange circular flat map of the world.

I have experienced the best you have to offer.

I have also experienced the worst in Fort Lauderdale Florida.

If you are looking to add value, loyalty and traffic but can't deliver the basics your are wasting your time, your money and your future.

I suggest that you send in an undercover customer to evaluate the problems.

Please be assured of my continued hope for your potential success.

Atrocious

Never knew a place could have such terrible food and service. Like how do you manage to do both? I simply came here with some coworkers of mine. I ordered a burrito and so did my friends. For some reason, the food took longer than expected. I thought to myself "damn if it's taking this long for them to prepare the food, it's gonna be good" I was excited. 40 minutes later, the food arrived at the table. The burrito looked a bit dry but I didn't think much of it. As soon as I took my first bite, I no longer wanted to continue eating but I had to eat because I was HUNGRY ASF. I was really gonna leave that IHOP. In conclusion, you'll never catch me at an IHOP again, especially this one

Service was very, very good. Nice, kind server.  Attentive, too. Much appreciated!  

Food was delicious. We had buttermilk pancakes. My friend also had 2 eggs w/his pancakes. On the table were 4 syrups .  Pancakes came w/butter.

Have not been to an IHOP in many years.  I can tell you the coffee is still good, but the carafe of hot coffee on the table is smaller, but that's ok, because it is bottomless. So we needed a refill.  The coffee cups are gone, and a small, cute IHOP coffee mug is in its place.  Keyword is small, LOL.  Coffee was $3.39 per person.  Remember, it is bottomless coffee.  So, all is fine.  

My friend had a stack of 5 pancakes; I had a stack of 3.  He had 2 eggs. We both had coffee.   Our check came to $27 + change.  The large booth we sat in was great .  We got to chat and catch up. A fun time.  I'd definitely go back.

If IHOP ever thinks of redecorating, I'd say go with lighter colors , rather than the dark woods. It'd make it more airy, and spacious.  

Overall, a thumbs up. See photos of our food.

Honestly food here is meh. If I were to ever come back it would be simply for the pancakes, but even then the pancakes aren't THAT great.

The food here is REALLY mediocre. It just tastes like fast food, but slightly elevated fast food. The hash brown weren't that great, it breaks apart super easily, and honestly I think McDonald's hash brown tastes better.

Eggs: can't really go wrong with that, so it's okay.

Pancakes: this is the only dish I would only come back to IHOPs for, it's nice and fluffy, and tastes best with syrup. Of course it's not the best pancakes I have ever tried, but it's pretty decent.

Service: it was pretty good, my waitress was very nice.

Would I come here again? Eh, I'd just go to a fast food restaurant instead or unless it's national pancakes day.

WOW! Total hidden gem find!! My parents were in town briefly for a concert and wanted to catch up afterwards over a quick bite. The timing was a bit rough between it being Halloweekend and nearly midnight! My dad stumbled upon this place as we were walking and talking and we were immediately drawn to the ambience. It's super classy inside--dimly lit (but not too much, so we could still see one another and chat!) and beautifully decorated.

Our server Tomo was out of this world fantastic!! Not only super knowledgeable about the place and menu, but also incredibly kind, genuine, and positive. We need more people in the world like Tomo haha!! We also interacted with another server (though I didn't catch his name!) and he was also wonderful, helpful, and kind.

I ordered the teriyaki chicken entree to share with my family and it was delish and a hearty portion with salad, rice, and miso soup all included for $15-highly recommend! We also got some grilled veggies and loved that japanese onion sauce!! All around delish.

My only pieces of feedback are as follows...
- the music was amazing, but a tad too loud a times. It was a bit hard to have a full on convo at times, but it wasn't like club or bar loud.
- the chicken was a taaaad too fatty for my liking, but the flavor was so good, I'll excuse it!

We will be back 100%! Check it out! They're open till 2am!

An outstanding under the radar NYC treasure!

What a find!  The food here was truly amazing.  Great appetizers, an amazing steak that was made to a medium-rare perfection.

Every dish here had some unique, Japanese delicious flavor.  Even the chicken, the plain fried chicken.  That chicken was elevated here to some outstanding Japanese delicacy.

Great drinks, amazing service, super vibe.  Definitely a great find.

I was very hungry in the middle of the night and I know, there not many options in the area for a nice food.. I didn't want any fast food or pizza.
I yelped and saw this place was still open!
I gave it a chance - and I didn't regret, it was just perfect!

Nice spacious restaurant, very friendly service, delicious and super fresh and flavorful food (tuna was so good! soft and fresh!) and refreshing yuzu drink (and large portions!) made me very happy.
I couldn't believe that the place like this exists in the city.
I'm definitely coming back to try other options in the menu, also bring my friends with me for sure.

Cool ambience - dark lit room and people were dressed nice. They had two gender neutral bathrooms.

As an appetizer we had the Gesso calamari, it was decent. As for the drinks, I had the Yuzu Soda, it was bubbly and delicious. My friend liked her Yuzu sake as well. It was a good portion of food, we both had a piece of chicken left over on our plates. My chicken katsu was good and I really liked the salad dressing.

When discussing with my friend on where to eat, we were thinking Japanese food would be our priority that day. However, we were both thinking "sushi", which was very different that what Ichibantei was offering. Nevertheless, we were not disappointed by their offerings.

Ichibantei's specialties are in its chicken nanban and Japanese steak. The chicken nanaban had just right amount of crispiness and tenderness for fried chicken and certainly was a highlight. The Japanese steak was super tender and full of flavor. I'm not sure how they were able to take rather generic dishes and turn them into a flavorful dishes. I forgot that I even wanted sushi after having my lunch here.

If the pictures and menu seems a bit generic to you, don't be discouraged. You really need to try what they have here.

I love chicken nanban and not most Japanese restaurants serve this underrated dish. I was happy to see this on the menu. I got seated right away. Loved the music they were playing. The place is very dim lit. The bar was very empty and dark, not sure if it's supposed to be like that or they were redoing the area. The mirrors at the bar just made the place look so empty. I couldn't see the posters on the wall well. There was one server and she was great. I got my food quickly. The chicken nanban had a sweet ginger glaze with an egg salad on top. The egg salad didn't taste like anything much. The chicken had some crisp to it but it was juicy inside. The salad had my favorite sesame dressing on top. Overall, not the best chicken nanban I've had. Would come back to try their steak since it looked good!

This was one of the most amazing meals I've had. The quality of the service, food and the entire restaurant was splendid. The tofu was outstanding, the broth was so savory. My husband raved about the udon and the broth had so much flavor. One of my favorite things was wasabi salt that came with the steak!!! Wow!! The ambiance was modern with nice music as well. We enjoyed every bite. Definitely check this place out!!

This is a long overdue review when this was still in LES. Their food was pricey, but their portions were huge!! My favorite is their steak, which was approximately $35~ and filled me up. They also became the sole reason why I fell in love with their takowasabi. They made it with lots of scallions and wasabi, and their octopus was so fresh and not super slimy. Now they have moved closer to Union Square and I have yet to try their new location.

Large, luxe feeling izakaya right by St. Marks

Service: 5/5
Our service was prompt, with a host at the door as soon as we entered. The waitstaff also was very attentive when we ordered, and food was brought out quickly. No complaints here!

Environment: 3/5 in the day, 4/5 at night?
We came at 12:00 ish on a Saturday and had the whole restaurant to ourselves. When you enter, there's a relatively long walkway/entryway before you get to the host/check in point. It doesn't make very much sense during the day, but I can see how at night it would be perfect to wait around when the place gets crowded. Inside the restaurant, there's two floors of seating as well as a bar. The entire interior is black, making it extremely dark. There is a large mirror at the very back with some lights that is reminiscent of a club. When you sit down, the chairs and tables are not as "luxe" as its environment (metal chairs). They also give a fork and knife wrapped up in a nice cloth napkin, which was surprising. At an izakaya place (more bar like food), chopsticks is the preferred method (+ paper napkins). The bathroom also had an all black interior with gold fixtures. Overall, the environment of the place screams luxe speakeasy, an interesting vibe for an izakaya with late night bar snacks.  

Food
We ordered three drinks, three appetizers and two entrees to share amongst 3 people, which was a good amount of food, if not too much.

For the drinks we got the cocktails in the peach, grapefruit and lychee flavors. Peach definitely tasted like watered down peach soju, the grapefruit was tart while providing enough of a kick, and the lychee was pretty sweet/sugary. It depends on what you like!

For appetizers we ordered the calamari, karaage and agedashi tofu; the appetizers were decently sized.

Karaage: 3/5
Calamari: 4/5
Agedashi tofu: 4.5/5

The calamari was pretty nicely flavored, with a spicy mayo(?) based dipping sauce on the side. It was definitely on the oilier side, but a great snack. The mayo sauce was okay, and could've used the other flavors, as all I could mainly taste was mayo/cream. The karaage also came in big pieces as well as a dipping sauce. However, we weren't too impressed as the dipping sauce was just a teriyaki/sweet dark sauce; we found the dipping sauce to be too sweet, it could've used a mayo/aioli sauce instead (I ended up dipping it in the agedashi sauce or mayo sauce)Additionally, the karaage itself came in rather bigger pieces, leaving it to be on the drier side. The breading wasn't as crispy as we would've liked, and wasn't as flavorful. The agedashi tofu was great; the sauce had ginger and scallions, and the tofu had a great "skin layer." Perfect for sopping up the delicious, light sauce.

As for entrees, we got the pork katsudon and the deluxe/combo udon soup.  
Pork katsudon: 3.5/5
Deluxe/udon: 3.5/5

The entrees were pretty standard, nothing stood out to us that much. I will say that for the pork katsudon they bring the pork/egg and rice in separate plates. The udon deluxe is essentially the classic udon with the both classic toppings (beef and tofu skin).

Overall the price wasn't bad for 3, around 115 with tip, and would recommend for a late night snack with friends.

I ordered today from door dash expecting it to be really juicy and tender and the portion I got was mostly the fatty pieces. I asked for medium rare and I got it more on the medium well side. I could've definitely gotten a better steak somewhere else for $38 and the wait to receive the food took a really long time too. Waste of my money.

This was the perfect meal for the grey rainy day. Savory delish comfort food that isn't too heavy but hits all the spots. I was wanting a place with a cozy feel which the space has potential for but was pretty sparse when we were there. Would definitely go back and enjoy the Chicken Nanban over and over. My wife had one of the udons and loved it.

I don't know if it was just that day, but it was difficult to get seating as well as to place orders. And the food was mid, I think it was supposed to be on the crispier side but it was served kinda cold where the chicken katsu was soggy. Salad and rice were fine.

Great food, good service and a cozy little outdoor cabin to enjoy our meal. If your looking for a meal under $20 this is your place ! We ordered the Chicken Nanban, and the Garlic Chicken which came with rice , salad and a side of miso soup. Each entree was $15.99 and it was plenty of food ! The chicken was flavorful, moist and well prepared. Our server was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Only downside is the have limited seating outdoor only but are opening up indoor dining in the next 2 weeks. If your in the area this is a great spot to grab food with friends, family or even a date night.

For night owls, this place deserves your attention. The kitchen stays open late all nights ! So where else  can you get a meal after 12a that's not a chain take out , pizza or street halal?

Food is ok. I had the garlic chicken. While it's not mind blowing it's cheap and filling.  15 bucks gets you a plate of chicken, a salad and rice with a side of miso soup.  The chicken is nice and juicy. It's thigh meat. It can be crispier but the juiciness made up for it.  There is NO dressing on the salad though !! It's just bagged mesclun lettuce.  You'd have to pay 2 dollars for sesame dressing. If you wan to be cheap maybe stash your own dressing in your bag or pocket and sneak some on haha.  

It really does have a side street late night Tokyo bar with food feel to it. Gritty but satisfying after midnight.

The only mixed drinks are soju or sake based and are served in plastic cups. But they do have a cupped sake list. This place isn't for ambience

Still only outdoor seating but they the outdoor shack is partitioned so you have your own little area. Or you'll be seated at one of the picnic benches. It's not a first date spot unless you'e like me and prefers after hour places ;)

Beware of this restaurant and the wait staff. As noted in other Yelp reviews for this restaurant, the wait staff adds items to your bill that you did not order and refuses to rectify it.  My son attended a dinner party here this past weekend and this happened.  They are very suspect. You've been warned.

i got the deluxe udon. it was amazing. idk what else to say. i ain't no gordon ramsay tho so i cant tell if my standards are low. tht tofu soaked up all the rich soup n it was delish. the beef was so soft and i liked that. it was a little sad when the soft beef broke and got disintegrated so i could only drink it instead of chew it. the udon was very bouncy! yummm. the place was quiet and dark during lunchtime on sunday. i enjoyed my experience. i forgot to take pictures because i was so hungry and i was gobbling my noodles. HAHA

Came here unexpectedly when we couldn't decide on what to eat for a late lunch.

We ordered the karaage and oyaku don to share. It was a delicious, homey, and filling meal. My fiancee and I usually can never share an entree because we would still be starving afterwards, but we were both full at the end of our meal.

There was a cockroach x2 incident as we sat outside, but I truly appreciated how quick our server was to "dispatch" the uninvited guest.

I was referred by someone who was Japanese to come eat here as it was authentic& her favorite restaurant to eat after work. We tried: 1) Imo tempura (japanese sweet potato tempura), 2) Cold Ramen Noodles, 3) Chicken Nanban, 4) Draft Sapporo.

The Imo Tempura was delicious, soft and crunchy, well seasoned. Japanese sweet potatoes are not as sweet as american sweet potatoes so I preferred that very much.

The Cold Ramen Noodle was very delicious! Super refreshing and the noodles was al dente. The broth was savory and vinegarish.

The Chicken Nanban was very delicious too! The chicken was tender and well seasoned. The potato salad was delicious and the salad was good.

Draft Sapporo is always bomb! Nothing beats draft beers! Super refreshing w/ the meals here.

The foods here were very homely and authentic. It tasted like the ones I ate in the mom and pop shops in Tokyo.

We sat in the outdoor booth and it was very comfortable and spacious. The staffs were super attentive and friendly - always checking up on us to make sure everything was good.

Highly recommended if you want Japanese foods that are homely and authentic!
The inside is spacious and comfortable. The staff is polite and helpful. Food is delicious. I would definitely return again.
I never write reviews but this is the worst katsu I have ever had. It is small greasy and expensive. Do not trust the yelp reviews it's terrible worst restaurant in New York City so gross
Their regular cold noodle is sooooo good, must-try for summer time. I didn't order the ShabuShabu cold noodle so I don't know if that one is also good or not, will try it next time!
Places open til 2AM are an automatic 5 star (their food was excellent too, no complaints). Got standard izakaya/bar fare, it was all good.

The food here' is of abnormally high quality considering it's price and how late they're open.

I got a miso soup and oyaku don. They were perfect, I couldn't imagine how they could be better. You can see how legit it is from the photo.

It's rare to find food this good, available this late in lower Manhattan lately. Even Veselka was closed for the night but Ichibantei powered on, playing Jamaican music and making perfect food.

I will definitely eat here again. This is the kind of please you are eager to explore the menu of.
I crave their katsudon so often it's crazy. I also had their calamari and it was so good, big portion too! I had leftovers :)

Okay, I wasn't sure what to expect from Ichibantei. It was late on a Sunday and I wanted something delicious and didn't want pizza/fast food/halal cart/big chains. I came across Ichibantei on UberEats. The Yelp had me a bit worried since some people gave it high reviews while others rated it bad. Here's my experience.

What I tried-

Hamburg Steak:
This came with a beef/pork patty covered in Demi-glacé, side salad and side of sticky rice. I've had this before, it's a typical western Japanese dish. Literally a hamburger patty with a sweet and tangy sauce on top. The demi-glacé was great! People who've never had it before describe it as a ketchup/bbq mashup. That is exactly how it should be. It's supposed to be sweet, salty and tangy. Authentic. My only ding is I think they accidentally cooked my Hamburg a little too long so it wasn't juicy. It had a bit of too charred flavor to it and to cover it up I think they put extra sauce on it which was what I wanted anyway lol. Salad was good, basically mixed greens with kewpie sesame dressing (I think). Sticky rice was good to eat with the patty and sauce.

Karaage:
I'm not gonna lie, after opening this I was not expecting much. It was extremely soggy looking since the steam had condensed in the packaging. I squeezed some lemon on it and dug in. It was still BOMB. Such flavorful and juicy chicken. Yes bits of the skin was soggy but it wasn't as soggy as it looked. The flavor was still there. I ordered a side of garlic sauce and it was a perfect accompaniment. It's basically a roasted garlic type sauce. Amazing garlic flavor and I couldn't figure out what else was in it. Get it, you won't regret it.

I was not expecting much from Ichibantei but I'm glad I gave them a chance! I was definitely surprised and impressed. I would def order again and hope to go in person soon! Can't wait to try their other Japanese fare.
We wanted something simple and nearby for lunch, and my friend recommended this place. She likes their ramen but given the summer heat, we opted out of noodle soup. Very dimly lit, well ac'ed.

I had one of the weirdest experiences while eating here last weekend.  My friend and I came in around 1 AM since it was one of the few places open and the reviews had me fooled thinking I was in for a good time. The first thing to note is that the lighting is terrible, and the music is extremely loud. The bar is super empty and they have a really sad drink menu.  Anyway. One of the waiters was wearing a 1920's flapper dress and a feather on his head. He also kept laughing so loud and randomly that I saw people flinch a couple of times. I did place my order with him and he forgot to put half of our order in.  The second and probably the most disturbing thing was another waiter that came up to our table reeking of alcohol. He mumbled something at us and when I asked him to repeat himself, he just stared at us like a deer in headlights for a good 30 seconds before saying "ok whatever"  and stumbling away. I have never felt so uncomfortable in a restaurant. I almost started yelling for a manager to get him away from our table. Seriously, who allows someone in that state to be on the floor working? There was a total of 4 waiters there that night. When I tried to ask for my food to one of the other waiters he just filled up my water and walked away (he was Asian and I don't think he speaks English so I try to overlook that) The 4th waiter was the only one there that seemed to know what he was doing. He checked on my table, retook our order and apologized sincerely when I told him our food was missing. He went down to the kitchen and asked them to expedite the process. I wish I would've gotten his name. I get that there aren't a lot of places to sit down and eat late at night but it's definitely not worth it. There's a Taco Bell in the corner that was open, I wish I would've just gone there instead.

Some friends and I after heading out from bars around midnight were looking for a place to eat. After feeling weary from our long night out, we were on the grind to find a sit-down restaurant because after all it is the city that never sleeps..there must be some place that'll fulfill us. After searching thoroughly through Yelp we came across this restaurant serving quality Japanese food located in East Village and open until 3AM for dine-in, it was meant to be

This place was pretty small and can be harder to spot. The outdoor dining looked a bit make-shift, but actually ended up being a complete vibe. It resembled one big shed and each section by was completely closed off so it felt like an intimate, quieter space to enjoy your meal.

We order some sake to start. I asked for the most popular sakes and Kitaya was one of them. It had a hint of fruitiness and was super smooth.

For food we got pork yakiniku, which is a BBQ pork belly with grilled onions. I'm a pork belly fan and this was just delicious, the BBQ intensity was just right and paired with onions brought out a delicious mix of flavor. The other dish was chicken nanban, which I also was a big fan of. What made this dish so good was the tartar on top which had such a rich, creamy flavor. The chicken also was cooked with sweet and sour sauce which combined with the tartar was an ultimate end to my night.

The service was also terrific given all these dishes were so freshly prepped and served at such a late hour. I did have to go in a couple times for a few requests as it was taking longer than expected, but other than that no issues. Would definitely stop by here again if I'm in East Village.

Me and my friends were really hungry and we found this place on Maps so we tried and it was great! It's open until late, food has a lot flavor and the sizes are pretty big. Service was amazing! Tomo and Meho I don't know if I'm writing your names correctly but we appreciated your service! I was full and I took the rest to home! Also prices are reasonable. Definitely I would come back.
This place is awesome, fast service, the food was amazing, mijo and tomo take care in my table and they were really kind and patience with us, definitely I will back here

Super cute authentic Japanese restaurant that cooks Japanese comfort food. They have outdoor seatings, but in the warmer weather if you are magnet for bugs maybe avoid. Love the decor inside with the vinyl disc and the music and vibe of the place. The staff are friendly and great with recommendations. They have draft Sapporo beer!!! Enjoy the meals and app and felt like I went to a Japanese household and had a home cooked meal.

I eat at Ichibantei so much, the least I can do is leave them with a 5-star review. I've tried a couple things on the menu such as the Katsu and Okayo Don, the Kaarage, and tuna steak (all super delicious!!!) but nothing compares to their niku udon bowl. The broth is perfect, they don't shy away from piling up the beef and everything meshes together so well. I've had the niku udon more times than I can count and I will continue to do so because Ichibantei is consistent with their delivery of home cooked goodness.

Great takeout, will definitely need to come for a late night snack. The Udon portion was big and the tempura rice was a nice crunchy addition. We also ordered gyoza, which were standard--hard to mess up. The pork tonkotsu was also delicious, although portion was smaller than some other places I've ordered from.

Take-out review: Awesome food, super authentic Japanese flavors & style. I got the dumplings, chicken karaage, the udon, the Hamburg meal & a side of potato salad. All were so delicious & simple yet packed with flavor.  
The udon was packed separately from the soup which made it travel well & I was able to add it fresh right before I ate it. Overall, 10/10 takeout. I would definitely order again

Came here for a late night dinner since a friend was craving katsu.
He ordered a Chicken Katsu entrée and I got only fish option Maguro Tuna Steak. The portions are very generous. They came with a big ball of rice and salad with dressing.
My friend was hoping for a saucy katsu but in the entree the sauce comes on the side and you have to dip. I think he would've enjoyed the katsudon more. But he liked the food overall.
I didn't really like the tuna steak. The slices were a bit dry and flavorless. You have to dip them in garlic sauce that comes on the side. But I think the sauce was super msg so I had that strange sensation in my throat when there's too much of it. Or maybe it was from salad dressing, I'm not sure. But the sensation was definitely there. Thankfully they were amazing at refilling our water and I got rid of it quickly.
I'd say the review is a 4 because of their service. They're super nice and attentive. If it's only for the food, it's be lower.

This "Japanese soul food" restaurant will do in a pinch, particularly late at night when this is one of the few restaurants whose kitchens close past midnight. We plopped down on one of their outdoor benches recently and were served right away. Their succinct menu of donburi bowls and noodle dishes was easy for me to choose from as there were only a couple of veggie friendly items, and I gladly gulped down my cold ramen, which was full of flavor and cucumbers, seasoned soft boiled egg, and seaweed in a light broth.

Nice enough for an on the go meal, not one where you'd expect to have a breadth of options and luxuriate for too long.

I ordered 4 things from this place for my family lunch.
I wanted to give a more favourable review considering the times we're in, but the agedashi tofu shocked me. It's 7 bucks I believe, and there were 2 small pieces in the takeout box. The portion size is ridiculous...
The entrees ($18 each) are normal sizes.
Btw, the prices on their website are not up to date.

If you're in the mood for some delicious Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend trying Ichibantei. Although I've never actually dined in at the restaurant, their takeout is consistently good, and their dishes never disappoint. From my frequent orders, I can say that their Karaage, Agedashi, and Ichibantei steak are must-tries. The steak, in particular, is always cooked well and pairs well with a dry sake. Despite the occasional mishap in delivery, the food is always of high quality and is reasonably priced. I appreciate their consistent food quality, making it my go-to spot for a late-night Uber Eats order. If you're looking for comfort food that hits the spot, give Ichibantei a try.

Went here to eat with a couple of friends and after we were seated, the same waiter who seated us was nowhere to be found. After 20mins of waiting, we just decided to go somewhere else to eat and that's when the waiter decided to show up to ask us "oh you're leaving?" with a slight smirk on his face. It was obvious that they just didn't want to serve us, which was a shame because we were excited to try this place. Don't give them business.

We were craving good fried chicken last night around 1AM, but wanted to sit down and dine in in a more quiet environment that also had beer.. it seemed like we were asking for too much because what can you really get at that time? Well, after extensively yelping around, and going to numerous places that were either closed or too busy, we took a chance on Ichibantei.

Despite it being on the corner of 13th and 1st Ave, they were pretty lowkey that we almost missed it. The outdoor dining area was kinda tight but somehow the way they built it, it made it feel really intimate and quiet even though reggae covers of popular songs played on the speakers! Which was such a vibe~

We ordered the potato salad, chicken nanban and garlic chicken. This was already way too much food for us considering how filling everything was! Each entree came with a salad, rice and a miso soup as well. And you get quiet a generous portion, for a reasonable price.

Potato Salad - The flavor was really good and I surprisingly enjoyed the little strips of onion pieces in it.

Chicken Nanban - This is their signature dish apparently. It is a sweet and sour chicken with a tartar sauce on top. The sweet and sour flavor was not overwhelming and I loved that it wasn't so sweet at all. This was a clear winner for me!

Garlic Chicken - This is a fried chicken with a type of gravy sauce poured over top? I wasn't sure what that was but I didn't taste much of the garlic flavor either. I didn't enjoy this one as much as the chicken nanban. Nonetheless, it is still pretty good. I wish the chicken was a bit more crispy though!

The staff was incredibly welcoming and friendly!

TLDR: If you're craving good fried chicken (Japanese fried chicken!) late night in an intimate setting away from rowdy drunk people, go to Ichibantei!
Good prices and ambiance. Really chill place to hang and have some drinks. Casual but has great a Japanese dishes.

We ordered steaks(beef and maguro).
I had a stomache.
Overall these steaks made our stomach  at stake
Good quick eat, sat outdoors, waiter was very nice, food was delicious, try their ramen , they are open late also

This restaurant is probably happier that they have a dining out option at the moment since the place inside  is so small. Although 25% dining inside is now allowed in NYC, they still opt to seat customers outside and their outdoor seating is comfortable even on a slightly chilly weather night

Ichibantei serves favorite Japanese soul foods and steaks. We started with crispy karaage or fried chicken, taco wasabi and gesso calamari we found the calamari interesting as they served it with tentacles only, it is chewy but delicious never the less.

The high light of the dinner was the main entree's of course, we ordered pork ginger and hamburger steak; they were ok and both served with miso soup, rice and salad. If anything the pork ginger is something I might reconsider ordering again, but the one that really stood out is the Ichibantei steak 7 oz. It was cooked to perfection and complemented well with our dry sake.

Some dishes stood out and a couple didn't, but with great customer service and reasonable price point it gave us enough reasons to come and try other dishes on their menu.

Super delicious food, very fast walking distance or I can ride my bike in lock it on a pole or something. It's just leaving full in a little drunk with my bike  after the food service and ambiance is very upscale. Room filled with Japanese people of varies multi culture backgrounds. I always loved diversity when it comes to cooking.
Nice spot for a later night bite! Small menu but super fresh and yummy food! And plenty of sake options!

The food is probably more like a 3.5 but in terms of service it's almost like they're trying to make it as hard as possible on you to order. If you order in person they'll make you wait outside in the freezing cold, if you try to order by phone they won't take the order, if you order online they don't estimate the preparation time accurately. So overall with other options in the neighborhood it's hard to justify coming here.

Fantastic Japanese comfort food with the best chicken nanban! Pre covid I came here before and enjoyed sitting in this long bench restaurant with bob marley theme chill vibes. Recently I got takeout and got the chicken nanban and karaage. The chicken nanban is comfort food because it's affordable, not too greasy of a chicken, but bites full of meat and juicy too! Goes so well with the rice and the egg like sauce that I just devour. Karaage was big and meaty. The tako wasa here was good too!

ICHIBANTEIK-OUT

Ordered for delivery. Love that it's open until super late. Chicken still crispy and food still hot. Delicious as always with the tangy tartar at sauce. Squid tails equally as tasty. Also very very salty. But the tartar sauce cuts through the greasy saltiness.

Interior is dark and jazzy with albums and records plastered across the walls. Cash only. Super hot during the summertime.

Found them on Yelp because they open until 3am. We spent $30 to Uber there after hitting a few bars, arrived at 2:20am. The waiter "respectfully" told us they no longer take dine-in customers, take out only. Couldn't stand the attitude, walked a few blocks to The Halal Guys.

Friendly staff and nice environment. Usually busy so it may be hard to snag a table. They also close at 4, not 5 like it says online.

The matcha latte was nice. Not outstanding but good enough.

Good environment, a shame latte was  more lukewarm than hot (at least mine), $6 burrito or wraps for $12 (10minutes to reheat).
Beats Starbucks though

It was bright and early, well 11am on a Monday early anyways. I went into this cafe as I was about to browse a book store for an hour.

As soon as I walked in, I was greeted so the Star definitely has to stay for that care. I proceeded to order a mocha latte, most cafes even if they're experimental make this well. What I received was not that. The power they use, tasted like it was mixed with a cup of water. It was bad. I had almond milk, which is normal as ever of course. What did it was, the way the mocha tasted. Ruins the taste completely. At that point, you don't focus on the espresso taste, all you taste during & after is watered mocha powder.

Overview- cute interior, nice for reading and friendly staff. As far as the mocha latte, stay away.

Stumbled upon this Irving that supposedly opened up about a week ago! I got an iced matcha tea latte with regular milk but you can sub it for oat or almond milk for an extra charge. Definitely add some sugar if you want it sweetened but I think it's perfectly fine on its own. Not extremely bitter :)
Absolutely delicious food! One of the best ramen I ever had. Ordered the shrimp and chicken bao bun. Both were amazing and a must have. Definitely going back!

Ippudo doesn't disappoint. Came here for my mom's bday.

Food: We started off with the takoyaki and karaage which got were so fresh and tasty. It's no secret that this place does ramen. We got one of each on the menu! The broth, noodles, and toppings were on point.

Service: Staff here is very professional. We booked a reservation on the day of, and were able to get seated early. Our server was able answer all of our questions about the menu and was very professional when we noticed one of our add-ons was missing.

Ambiance: This is a family friendly spot and had some community table seating as well as booth seating. Good for a family lunch, lunch date, or even a casual date night!

What a disappointment! Haven't come in maybe 4 or 5 years, and this is the first time after the pandemic. The bowl looked smaller and the price went up a lot. I ordered a Yuzu Shoyu Chicken ramen. No yuzu flavor at all but just a tiny bit yuzu peels. The soup was way too salty (how much soy sauce did you pour in it???) and the chicken meat was also purely saltiness and somewhat gamy (like the taste you got from undercooked/raw chicken tender). If you don't taste yuzu, don't put it in the name just because you threw a few peels in the soup,  expecting the flavor would come out so that you can charge people $20+. I was really pissed after paying $28-ish for such a low-quality bowl of noodles. My server was nice though.

Bye, Yippudo. I don't think ill be back again.

I came here with a friend for dinner on a Wednesday night. We came at 6:30pm, and were able to get a seat without a reservation.

I had the akamaru shinaji ramen. It was pretty good. Not outstanding, but I was definitely satisfied with the quality of the dish. It was a bit expensive, but I suppose that's NY prices.

Our waiter was really nice and the ambiance of the restaurant is cool.

The music is a bit loud, but the atmosphere is decent for dinner and dimly lit. The Ramen is getting expensive but so is everything else in life recently. I think +$20 for a bowl of Ramen before kaedama is a bit much, but it's tasty and better than many other spots like ichiran. The dessert was a bit of a surprise. I would consider getting it again and it wasn't overly sweet, but had a lot of yuzu. That sauce in the dessert was addictive. I'd be curious about their other desserts, but I wanted to get the chicken wing appetizer they used to have of the menu. I might go another time or by myself to avoid the lines and wait times.

Every time I come to nyc I have to eat Ippudo :) they have the best vegan ramen broth I have ever had, my mouth is watering just thinking about it. I get it with a soft egg and it is chef's kiss. Also, the service here is great, they were kind and answered all our questions! The restaurant is also fun, with some bar seats and tables spread out across the restaurant. It's a vibey, open space, great for a casual dinner with friends and family.

Recently visited ippudo with some friends for dinner. We had to wait a bit to get seated - the hostess was a bit short with us maybe because she was busy.

The atmosphere in here was pretty lovely as it was quite busy with a lot of people enjoying a meal. It's not a huge space. As for the food, we ordered a bunch of appetizers to share including the takoyaki, truffle potatoes, karaage and a cold duck dish. The takoyaki was pretty standard, nothing special. The potatoes were actually quite good and worked well with the truffle flavor. The karaage was also pretty good, it was juicy and had a good sauce. The duck was VERY rare - way more rare than duck is typically. I had it anyway but I should have skipped it because I had a really bad stomach ache the next day and the people I ate with did too.

I also got the cold noodle which was pretty refreshing but the bell pepper and cilantro felt very out of place.

Still excellent after all these years. The gyoza to start were great, and the karaka spicy was excellent -- not our favorite in the city, but really enjoyable. I added the spicy paste, and that is a must on future visits.

This is a good place for a night out with friends. Its near fun bars to go out to after. The food is decent, the ambience is cool and gives an elevated feel. Although you may want to try and ask if you can be seated in the main area, we were seated around the corner in the back and would have preferred to not be so separated.

It was also really difficult to get our orders taken. You have to flag someone down every time you wanted something. The waiter never introduced themselves.

You are able to split the check 4 ways if you plan to do that.

Ambiace: casual/fancy
Would i eat here again: not dying to go back, but yes

Friend: hey let's go to Ippudo during our NYC trip.
Me: okie!.....*checks Yelp* wait, why does this ramen spot have over 10k reviews!?! Lol.

Excuse my tourist naïveté, but I later learned that this particular Ippudo location was the first overseas one (with Ippudo being an established ramen restaurant chain in Japan) and claims to be "the birthplace of New York's ramen craze." What a reputation. In that case, does the ramen here really hold up well IMO? Eh, sorta kinda.

---------------
- Karaka spicy: broth was very tasty albeit a bit overly oily. Pork belly chashu was fairly tender but could've had more flavor for bonus points. Overall a pretty good bowl of ramen. FYI, spiciness is medium-ish level; you probably won't have to chug cups of water while eating it unless you rarely eat spicy food.

- Shiromaru motoaji: pretty underwhelming. Broth mainly tasted one-note salty with a heavy lack of umami flavor.

- Oishii karaage: yup, I had an appetizer to try as well! Amazingly crunchy batter coating for karaage but the meat was borderline dry.
---------------

To me it's ultimately an above-average ramen spot but I can see it being a no-fuss go-to one for NYC folks.

Used to be my favorite ramen ever but, after their menu change, it's incredibly disappointing.

Their vegetarian ramen used to be amazing but they've completely changed all of their vegetarian ramen for the worse. Now, the broth has soy milk, making it taste very milk-y, and overall doesn't have the flavor or depth it used to have. The Nirvana Classic was actively not good and I probably won't come here again. My boyfriend usually orders the Karaka Spicy, which is luckily still on the menu, but also found that it wasn't as flavorful as before.

J had never been, so I had to introduce him to this amazing spot. I tend to nibble on my meals, but this was one place I finish my entire bowl. Karbala spicy ramen totally hits the spot! The level of service is impeccable and the food is fantastic. Loved the lychee soda, I feel like you can skip the gyoza through.

After a trip to get groceries we stumbled upon this ramen place (or it popped up when we searched for food in the area), and I had been craving ramen so we decided to go, not knowing about it's popularity.

The restaurant itself is very nice, dark ambient lighting and large wood tables. The server sat us (me and my friend) across from another two people at a large round table, which I felt was slightly awkward. The server was very nice and gave me a box for me to put my bag in, so I didn't have to put it on the ground.

We both ordered the first item on the menu's ramen section, the Shiromaru Classic. When I go to ramen places (and most specialized restaurants in general) I like to get the "classic" to try the dish they are known for/best at. When I ordered it, the server said that the second option, Akamaru modern, is much more flavorful. I stayed with my initial choice, thinking if its the classic it still must taste pretty good right?

The broth was very light and tasted natural, definitely not overly salty like many of the other ramen bowls I've had. However, the ramen was otherwise not impressive. The amount of broth and noodles was very small. The only toppings on the ramen were chashu (pork), bamboo shoots, a fish cake, and scallions. It didn't include the wood ear mushrooms that seem to appear in most pictures of their ramen I've seen on the internet. The chashu was paper thin and not flavorful. Adding an egg would be an extra $3. This was very disappointing for a $25 (after tax/tip) bowl of ramen.
We ordered Ippudo Pork Bun, Karaka Spicy, Akamaru Shinaji. These taste absolutely amazing with rich broth flavor and good texture noodle.

Really like how ippudo keeps legit ramen experience with efficiency. Once seated your order is captured and sent straight to the kitchen . We got karaage chicken to start. It's very well marinated and crispy while keeping the meat juicy. Great with a beer. Gig the spicy ramen which had just the right amount of spice to keep me slurping down every last bit of the broth and noodles . Been to the other locations in midtown and they similarly match great decor with authentic ramen

Food - 4/5
- The pork bun is a must. I enjoyed it so much I ordered 2.
- Akamaru ramen is a solid 4/5. I enjoyed the chashu and I also liked the thin noodles. The broth was also good, but I prefer broth that is slightly richer than this one. Either way, it was still pretty good.
- However, the prices for these items are quite expensive. I think if I was craving ramen, I'd probably go somewhere else. So I would treat this place as a nice sit-down restaurant to stop by once in awhile. It's definitely still worth a try though.

Service - 5/5
- Service was impeccable. They did a really good job being attentive and getting my food to me super quickly.
- Everyone was very kind and helpful. I can see how some people might feel that they were being rushed, but I think this place is just usually very busy. I went during off-hours and they were still really fast.

Ambiance - 5/5
- Solid casual restaurant. Great place to catch up with friends.
- they provide bar seating for individuals and table seating for larger groups
