I am not very picky when it comes to plating but the pesce crudo was uneven slices of white fish on a white plate with olive oil on it; very ugly to look at. The lack of effort was so minimal that it made me feel more like a burden than a customer.

Value - 3/5. The food is good and you get to try some unique items but the portions are very small. Even though it is sold at $26 as a prix fixe, you'll most likely end up leaving hungry. The prices might be fitting for the area, but you won't shake the feeling of having spent a lot for little.

Parking - Street (Metered)

Branzino alla griglia (grilled branzino stuffed with fennel fronds and orange) - Fish was fresh, succulent, and fluffy. It was filled with bones. Probably the most stressful meal I've had in years trying to 'fish' out all of the tiny jagged edges.

Contorni (corn) - Good.

Service - Absolutely took away from the experience. The person who seated us was unhelpful and strange. We had to approach him and had to interrogate him to find out if the restaurant was open seating or not because he was so reluctant to reveal any information about the restaurant? Why should we be seeking him when we're the customers? Was he hiding something from us? Why is he dodging all of our questions? Was he actually trying to hide the restaurant from us? I will never know. And then our waiter obviously showed he was not interested in our dining experience. Every question was replied with something sarcastic.

Me: How bony is the branzino? Is it already in the spine of the fish or is it all in loose pieces throughout the meat?

Waiter: Uhh it has bones. What more do you want me to describe?

Wow. Fine then. Don't describe it to me.

The Pesce crisp (Italian-style sashimi finished with Ligurian extra virgin olive oil) - Three paper thin slices of smoked fish. It was ok.

Pesce azzurro (local bluefish with eggplant caponata) - Very underwhelming. Where's the eggplant?

Price - Absolutely not worth it. Eat somewhere else in Eataly for better service that doesn't stare at you like you're stupid.

What a pleasant surprise this Eataly was tonight.
For drinks I had Proseco and for dinner the "Pulpo". It's really nice sitting by the bar, you see how the dishes are made kind of makes you feel excited for ideas to cook at home sometime in the near future. At least that's what it makes me feel...
Anywayz, having a variety of selections inside Eataly is awesome! Taste the wonders of italy culture in this market full of a few different restaurants and a fresh market shop. This place tends to be a lil pricier than most places around Flatiron, after all everything about it makes it all be worth the cash being spent here. I had two glasses of Proseco, my Octupus , my friend had two beers, and pasta. Total was about $100 no tip included.

My friends and I were walking around Eataly and decided to try Il Pesce for lunch.  The food was good but I was very disappointed on cost, service and non-availability of certain items.

They offer a variety of Italian soft drinks but none of them have caffeine in them which is a bit weird to me.  Also, I ordered a ginger ale and they brought me a cola instead. I will say the fresh bread and olive oil they served on the table were delicious.  I could not get enough.

For my entrée, I had the Capesante con Senape Indiana e Fagioli: Scallops with braised mustard greens, Romano and wax beans and a lemon vinaigrette.  This was very tasty but was a very small portion and cost something like $29.  I had to eat a ton of bread just to get full.  The scallops were cooked perfectly and I loved the sauce but $29 for three scallops, that is just ridiculous, especially at lunch. My friend's son loved his kid's pasta but my friend was disappointed with her panzenella salad.  

Also, our server was gone for long periods of time and did not come by as often as he should.  He took forever to actually take our food order.  He was good about asking if we had any allergies and helped my friend pick an entrée due to her shrimp allergy. But overall he was not a good server.

So the food was good here but the service and pricing were not.  If I am at Eataly again, I will eat elsewhere.

Good food but overpriced.

First come first serve seating at the bar, but the menu is limited to the pasta dishes only- no seafood options at the bar. The tagliatelle was good but nothing special. The food came out hot and fast. Service was fine. You're certainly paying for the atmosphere within Eataly. Personally I think it's something you can skip.

This is our favorite restaurant in Eataly!

Whenever my mother comes to visit from out of town, she always asks to come eat the whole fish here. They never disappoint! Today we were choosing between whole monkfish, red fish, or branzino - all delicious options and the branzino we chose was so fresh and perfectly cooked.

It does get very busy, even on a Tuesday night at 8pm we waited about 30 minutes for a table. But there is so much to explore within Eataly so time flew.

Unfortunately, this was a huge disappointment.  My wife and I came here for dinner on a Thursday night.

Good:
- Eataly itself looks great.  The shop has wonderful items and reminded us of our visits to Italy.
- We made a reservation and were seated early

Bad:
- Some tables get bread.  Others don't.  We didn't.
- We got the Fregola with clam broth.  There was no clam broth.  It was actually a dark and dry tomato sauce.  The Fregola itself, since the dish was dry, was basically dough.  We've had Fregola from Sardinia and it didn't even resemble the same dish.
- It listed multiple seafood within the dish.  We got 1 shrimp.
- We were never asked how the dish was, how our dinner was, if we wanted cheese, or even if we wanted another drink.  Service was flat out rude.

I cannot recommend this place.  Find something local.

My friend had never been to Eataly so we decided to come check it out.

We were starving so we checked out each of the restaurants to see what was available. There were two seats at the bar at Il Pesce so we gave it a try.

I ordered a glass of wine and after pouring me a taste, I didn't like the wine. Unfortunately as I was saying I didn't like it, the server poured me a full glass. I didn't want to be a pain so I let it go.

We ordered the fritto misto, sea bass, and roasted fingerling potatoes to share.

The fritto misto was okay, but it felt like it was missing something. The lemon juice was needed but not enough to give it the depth I was looking for. The sea bass was very tasty, and the potatoes were cooked nicely and it was a decent portion as a side.

After our meal the server disappeared. We were waiting for our check for over 15 minutes and he came back to us without it and acted like he didn't know we wanted it.

I wouldn't be back, unfortunately, but will probably try other spots in Eataly.

Don't waste your time or money here. Slow, uninterested service staff, insultingly overpriced menu given how small the portions are, and just overall a culinary experience devoid of any authenticity or passion.  And the "warm" dishes were served at room temperature. Only if room temperature were a Manhattan apartment without heaters in the middle of winter. Eataly, you can do better.

Can't decide where we wanted to have lunch (hello this is NYC) so we head to our frequent favorite Eataly across from the Flat Iron Building.

With their many restaurants cafes bars and markets we were sure to find just the right place to park our appetites.

On the ground floor (by the restrooms important) we are seated at Il Pesce cafe.

Our very friendly server smiling Johnny soon appears carrying an open bottle of wine very convenient to dole out samples to prime the pump.

We taste three different samples and order three glasses of wine...Pavlov would be proud.

We also order a delicious squash appetizer accompanied by fresh just baked Italian bread and olive oil.

It's Saturday and as usual the whole building is pulsing full of happy customers eating and shopping savory smells conversations and high energy.

Here's the thing although Eataly was crazy busy with most of the seats and tables occupied Johnny treated and served us as if we were the only patrons there...cudos. Now that's dedication and focus folks.

We will return soon as it was a few hours later apre shopping for happy hour at the "soft" opening of Il Pastaio their new pasta bar (see review) about twenty feet away.

I highly recommend a trip to Eataly (or Italy) for the varied eateries and their many shops with wonderful meats pastas wines seafood produce cheeses gelato groceries and gifts.

Eataly is the largest Italian market in the world (they say) so you should be able to find some delisioso goodies.

Ciao Bella,
Ricardo y Julia

Delicious and fresh! I ordered the Fregola con Sugo di Mare. Light. Bright and fresh! We were able to get a seat at the bar area on a Saturday during lunch rush. So cool to watch the food be prepared. Authentic and delightful!

Tucked inside the crowded and sometimes chaotic Eataly market is a gem of a place for seafood.
Everything we ate was fresh and well flavored. We had large group that they managed to accommodate despite the relatively limited space. Some folks might find the atmosphere a bit too much for them but the food, service and drinks will surely make up for it.

Went here with a friend to grab dinner on a weeknight. It was not very crowded so we were able to be seated right away.

After perusing the menu, we decided to split the burrata, monkfish, and the tagliatelle.

The burrata was very good--classic and probably my favorite dish of the night.

The monkfish was cooked well, but did not have a lot of extra flavor imparted on it and the tagliatelle was pretty standard.

Overall, the meal was a little underwhelming as this place is located inside Eataly. Also, the menu is pretty limited, so just know that as well.

This area for seafood only is nestled in Eataly. The seafood fare was fresh. Tried the special swordfish meatballs, the skate wing and the seafood cannelloni. All three dishes were very good. The skate wing came with 1 side dish, on a weekend night when all the other food areas in Eataly required a wait, this was a great choice especially if you like seafood.

First time dining inside Eataly and had to try Il Pesce. We sat at the bar as we like to watch chefs cook. First come first serve seats so you don't have to wait in the long line for table seating.

We ordered their special: razor clams and Branzino fish from the main menu. 10 fatty razor clams for $19 very fresh and juicy. Had a squid like texture. It was grilled and drizzled with a combination of butter, olive oil, and salt they freshly made. It was definitely the most oily dish we've had. Wish they added garlic or wine so it was more flavorful.

Can't go wrong with a whole Branzino fish lightly salted and grilled. With a side of kale and onions it was quite tasty but very generic I guess. The meat was tender and not overcooked.

Decent food but incredibly bad service and slow kitchen times. Friend had the steak, which came out undercooked for her liking. It also came out about 50 minutes after ordering, and the people around us were all getting their food before us. When we were finally able to get our servers attention to bring the steak back, he seemed to know it was not her order but was not apologetic. I had the Bronzino which was good! Great flavor but I'm not the biggest fan of deboning my own fish, which might've been my fault. The artichokes were my favorite part of the meal by far. Also had good wine! Overall, would not eat again due to how overpriced it was and how inattentive the staff was. However the host was lovely! They also did not give us more water the entire time.

Two of us came for dinner. My fish cruda was a joke, three uneven poorly cut tiny pieces of flavorless meat. But my blowfish & squash entree was great. Service was a bit all over the place, but I'd totally come back again.

Inside the eataly market! Delicious homemade pastas, you can taste the freshness. The Brussels sprouts were a great side item, they were very well seasoned. Service was friendly and relaxing, we never felt rushed. An added perk is you can walk around the market when you're done!

I love Eataly. My favorite thing to do is to buy some cheese, meat and bread and have my own feast. I should have done just that. But I chose to dine at Eataly by myself one afternoon and oh I was so disappointed. I asked the chef if they had any good catch for the day, he recommended to go with the lunch special. So I went with the Endive salad (which was the only good thing) and a super dry piece of trout with the worst looking and tasting roasted carrots. I don't think I'll be repeating this experience ever again.

Came here for the second time and sat at the bar by the kitchen. It was an amazing experience to see how the food was orchestrated into beautiful and delicious meals. I had razor clams and it was cooked to perfection. The burrata cheese, grilled sardines, and grilled octopus were divine. I can't wait to eat there again.

Great food with no ambience, awful staff, and close quarters. A lot needs to be done to the improvement of the flow and dining dynamic... One of the only times I would not return to a place because of the customer service and waiters
Seafood the way it was meant to be. Cooked in a simple way to showcase delicate flavors. My favorite was the RAZOR NECK CLAMS special.

One of the worst restaurants that I've been in New York, the attention is rude, the drinks are bad (we tried both the Bellini and the Mimosa) it was a water down version of what I've known all my life, I've had 5$ mimosas and bellinis better than this 12$ version that tasted like soda. The food was also appalling we asked for the Cesare salad and it came down with bad lettuce and none of the ingredients listed on the menu. When we asked the waitress she brushed of our complaints only to come with a plate with all the missing ingredients. Not even a word
Or sorry we paid and left immediately. Extremely rude. Don't even bother coming here.

Make sure you check the daily special on the wall!

For first timers to Eataly: Go to the host stand located near each restaurant to get a table. The wait varies but most of the time, it's fast paced so the wait isn't too terrible.

The service isn't too great but can't complain too much because the food is just spot on. All the seafood is fresh and they have great flavors.

I would recommend the razor clams (on daily menu), pulpo, fried seafood and any whole fish they have on the daily menu.
The razor clams are around $18 and it's a great appetizer to share.
The pulpo (octopus) is super tender and comes with vegetables. I would definitely recommend this if you like octopus.
Their fish is always spot on and what can go wrong with fried seafood?
If you like seafood and if you're at Eataly, make sure you check this restaurant out.
Their food reminded me more of food I had in Barcelona rather than Italy but still good.

Would definitely give a 4.5 if I could but service was hectic and erratic.

With all my trips to the city, I can't believe I had never been here before!  So much on the menu that I want to try!

We booked last minute reservations on a Saturday night and I feel fortunate that we were able to get them since it was very busy.  We waited at the bar for about 15 minutes until our table was ready and the bartender was very kind and attentive. The service at the table was honestly quite poor - our waiter was never around but....those awesome meatballs and spaghetti made up for it!

If you are a meatball lover, these are for you! Please don't tell my Italian mother-in-law but these are hands down THE best meatballs I have ever eaten!

Ive gotten takeout from here a few times. Satisfied both times. The bolognese and the pomodoro pasta were great. The entree sizes seem reasonable but not great for sharing if someone has a big appetite. The cauliflower appetizer was good.

For the service, the order estimates are accurate and the takeout packaging is nice and study. Can't ask for much else. The restaurant itself looks pretty nice for a sit down date or outing.

Isabelle's is an airy and open restaurant which was perfect for a warm fall day since it has big doors that open up on to the street.

We started with the burrata with figs which was a pretty big portion for two people. For my entree, I ordered the salmon and corn risotto; the corn risotto was light and stuffed inside small bell peppers. The salmon was cooked perfectly and was a perfectly light lunch.

The staff were all really nice and attentive.

Had a great experience here last night! Wonderful service and we all loved our meals and cocktails. The pork ragu pasta with ricotta was AMAZING. Also loved the burrata and figs. The service was really great. We got there at 6:30 and by the time we left on a Sat night, it got VERY busy. Would definitely return!

Isabelle's Osteria was the final restaurant where we had lunch mid-August for Summer Restaurant Week. This is a pretty restaurant on Park Avenue South with both indoor and outdoor seating. A warm cauliflower salad with Meyer lemon, Calabrian chili and shisito peppers was Jennifer's selection to begin her lunch. It was unusual for her and flavorsome. She enjoyed it immensely. Arancini with spicy pomodoro sauce and mozzarella was my choice. Both of us picked the Spaghetti & Meatball as our main course. In fact this was the main reason we chose this restaurant. An ample mound of spaghetti annointed generously with tomato sauce topped one plump meatball. We ate in studied silence. The pasta was cooked al dente and was delicious. The meatball was toothsome and filling. Our plates were polished clean. Neither of us had any room for dessert. In fact we wondered if wheelbarrows were also on the menu?

Service here was good and our server attentive. One of the staff members saw us put our bags on the floor as the chairs wouldn't accommodate them. He gave each of us a handbag hook. That was kind of him.
Great service and brunch! The ambiance during brunch is awesome, and we loved the food. Can't wait to come back!

Great casual Italian spot in Flatiron. Luckily, reservations weren't hard to secure (you never know in NYC these days) as we had made one day of for a Friday night

Between the two of us, we shared the arancini (daily special), caesar salad, fried pork chop and mushroom lasagna. Everything was delicious and the pork chop was huge!

I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a casual dinner spot that doesn't require reservations weeks in advance.
One of my neighborhood faves!  The service is always perfect and the food/atmosphere/ambience to match!  I highly recommend the Lumache - my fave that always wins over any guest I bring.

An absolute adorable place for a holiday gathering. Their decorations are festive and fun. Came here for a team holiday lunch and it provided the right ambience for the occasion. Service was quick and friendly. Placed our orders and food came out in a decent timeframe. Tables are a bit close to each other in some areas.

Got the salmon entree which their description says it comes with broccoli rabe, castelvetrano olives and almonds. What I received was a salmon salad (lol). Not a bad thing because I do need to eat more vegetables but I thought it was quite funny to see my entire plate filled with broccoli rabe stalks. Everything was cooked fine. My salmon was a bit fishy for my tastes so that tells me it was probably last night's leftovers. Got the chocolate budino for dessert. Didn't know what to expect. It's like a chocolate mousse with peanut topping and whipped cream. It's very rich and be a little overwhelming. Either way, appreciative of a decent meal with nice vibes.

I visited Isabella's on a Thursday evening with a group. We made a reservation before hand and we were seated right away. I loved the ambiance and the decor of the space. The food was pretty good, but a little pricey for the small portions.

We came here with a large group on a Saturday night and had a reservation, and it appeared to be busy, so this was a good idea. We all started off with some cocktails, including the Isabellini, Pink me up, park avenue passion, bianco spritz, everyone thought theirs was delicious! We shared some bottles of wine after that which were good as well. Our server here was kind and attentive with our large group. For entrees everyone got pastas, with the popular options being cacio e pepe and spaghetti pomodoro. It was tasty! Since we were there for a birthday, they came around and gave us free limoncello shots with cute little "isabelle's" edible paper on top.It was a lot of fun! Prices were pretty reasonable here for NYC, so I would return.

Visited July 2022.

I know you're probably thinking there are so many Italian restaurants in this city, this is just one of them. But Isabelle's Ostaria surprisingly so good! The service and ambience was an icing on the cake. We were initially seated at a table that we didn't like, and were immediately seated at a better table on request. Don't know where to start from their wine list, alll were so good! But the Etna Rosso was amazing! Our top recommendations:
1. Rick's Potatoes: Was really crispy and served with mayonnaise (really good)
2. Burrata: AMAZING
3. Mushroom Lasagna: One of the very few Italian places that serves such amazing vegetarian lasagnas, my hubby was really happy!
4. Bucatini (Cacio e Pepe): cannot go wrong with this dish and they definitely didn't!

Isabelle's is one of those neighborhood spots that has great service and an manager that cares about his customers. My friends live in the building next door and he went out of his way to get to know them and offers them an extra special welcome every time they come in. While there are a million Italian restaurants in the city, I love Isabelle's as an option when you need somewhere consistent, good, friendly, and easy (you don't need to try to get a reservation at midnight 30 days before - you can pretty much expect to get a table here any time you want). The burger is delicious (and the fried potatoes that come with it even better). Come for the service and you'll be pleased by the food!

Do not go to Isabella's Osteria.  Yes, the room is large and airy.  The staff is extra pleasant and accommodating.  The decor lovely and unfussed-over.  You may have read that the food is delicious with so many items on the menu, you will have to come back repeatedly and force yourself not to stick with your favorites so far.  But skip it.  Right now, I can still get same-day reservations but if all of you come here, then what?  

They are going to bar me from coming anyway.  I drink up way more of the bottomless mimosas than the price can cover.  I'm going there so often and drink so much with their unforgettable chicken and waffles that they will either give me the heave or go bankrupt!

One of the worst dining experiences I've had in my decade of living in NYC. Service was atrocious. We waited more than an hour from the time we were seated for our order to be taken. We had originally asked if we could order appetizers and our waiter told us we needed to order everything at the same time. He then left and seemed to forget about us for the next 40 minutes, despite us getting so desperate we raised our hands and tried to flag him down.

Once we were finally ordering, he was the least helpful. I asked if they had mocktails and he said yes, but didn't provide any options. I ordered the passionfruit mocktail on his recommendation and what I received was pure passionfruit juice. Ick. He also couldn't help others at our table with any wine suggestions.

The biggest disappointment was the food. How dare they charge so much money for some of the worst food I've ever consumed? The appetizers were decent, though all the bread that came with them was stale/burnt so badly it was inedible. The pumpkin paparadelle--which half our party ordered--was unseasoned, unsauced, and served with rotisserie chicken that had so many gnarly bits I had to spit it into my napkin and left the bulk of my food uneaten.

One star for the ambiance, it's a cute place. But please, save yourself and go literally anywhere else to eat.

We came here with a group of 6 for a birthday.  It took about 20 minutes to be seated, despite having a reservation.  Once we sat down, we waited another hour for our order to be taken. We had to ask the hostess to please have someone come take our order.

One of our friends has a severe allergy to gluten, which I called ahead about and was assured could be accommodated - there are gluten free modifications that can be made to any pasta dish.  When we reminded the waiter of the allergy, he said he wouldn't recommend getting any of the pastas, it couldn't be accommodated.

The original waiter returned about 2 hours after our arrival, to ask if we were ready for dessert. We hadn't even received our entrees yet.

A final waitstaff member asked the birthday girl if she needed anything else, eluding to the dessert that was supposed to come out as a surprise.

Overall, the drinks were delicious, and the food was okay (nothing special for the price, but not offensive; pasta was far too aldente), but the service was abysmal. Definitely will steer clear in the future.

My coworkers and I enjoyed a wonderful lunch on the outdoor patio at Isabelle's Osteria. The pink, funky decor of the restaurant set a vibrant ambience and created quite an office escape.

Our attentive waiter served us swiftly and recommended appetizers for us to share. The cauliflower was a table favorite-- crispy and well-seasoned enough to make your forget it's a vegetable.

The refreshing fluke crudo opened our palettes, although its bed of "crazy water" was not as shocking as anticipated. Roasted beets receive 10/10 for beautiful presentation and tasteful pairing with goat cheese, strawberries, and pistachios.

I ordered the grain salad with chicken, and it was a perfect balance of protein, fiber, and fun. Farro, radish and pumpkin seeds were an exceptional combination. No complaints about the rather large serving-- I took the rest to go.

Go to Isabelle's Osteria for a fun lunch, brunch or dinner. I can't speak for the cocktails and oysters, so you'll have to try those yourself.

Pros
Classy restaurant
Excellent service
Nice outside seating area
Close to subway
Aesthetically pleasing
Decent portions
Somewhat accommodating
Delicious olive oil cake

Cons
Mediocre food
Pricey$$$

I really like this place! The spaghetti was oily and bland; The next time I come back, I'll try something else to give it a better review! This place is absolutely fabulous and elegant,

Isabelle's is one of those places where an excellent meal and impeccable service is the standard. A beautiful space with plenty of great tables for all occasions or a very romantic dinner. Even our very picky little eater was very happy with her meal and gave the restaurant a 100 stars rating.
We'll be back.

I came here for a Thursday night dinner with some friends and loved it! We started with some cocktails which were all great. For an appetizer we shared the calamari, and it was delicious. I ordered the pasta special of the night which was a shrimp scampi. It was so lemony and had a kick too which was so yummy! My friends ordered spaghetti with meatballs and the lumache pasta dish which were both hits! The vibe is so cute in the restaurant, and the service was great. I will definitely be back to try their famous mushroom lasagna!

I came here with two friends and we ordered a bunch of food to share. Everything was consistently delicious and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. My personal favorites were the kale salad, meatballs, and prawns. It was super easy to get a reservation the day before we wanted to go because there seemed to be a lot of seating available; one thing I loved is the space didn't feel cramped even though there was a good amount of people there. The ambiance was perfect for catching up with friends. The only thing that I didn't love which made me deduct a star was the drinks seemed very watered down - I got the classic margarita and the spicy margarita and would recommend going straight for the spicy one for the kick.

Perfect perfect PERFECT - from the service, hospitality, the fois, and down to the BEST espresso martini in NYC!  Their General Manager Miles is a true one of a kind gentleman and concierge, and he makes everyone feel right at home. The staff is well-trained and VERY hospitable. Our favorite brunch place in NYC hands-down.

Two stars for the food--quite decent, but 0 stars for professionalism and experience. My friend was hosting her birthday dinner here at 9:30 for a large party. We had been waiting for almost 30 minutes and it was around 10pm now and the two tables we were supposed to have were still not vacated by prior parties. The hostesses / waitresses said they told these prior parties but did not do anything about their overstaying. Worst part is that they called us before 9:30 making sure our group shows up at 9:30! Very unprofessional and stressful. Not good for big groups at all, even though they claim to be.

WHEN: Tuesday @ 6pm

I wanted to try Isabelle's since cyeats regularly dines at the restaurant, n her bf James Tracey owns it. The food was awesome, but the service was meh. We were sat by the kitchen n the bar where it's the loudest. We can hardly carry a conversation due to the noise, ambiance and the loud music playing in the background. I was really disappointed by the service quality. Our waiter didn't even check in on us during our meal, nor provide today's special when taking our order. We felt so rushed and uncomfortable dining there.

WHAT I ORDERED
Shirley temple (they didn't have any cherries and it came in a really small cup, literally drank it in 5 sips)
Tagliatelle Bolognese
Really rich in flavor, it has pork, beef and veal.
Salmon
Mushroom lasagna

The food was delicious, we only waited about 10min for the food, which was fairly quickly considering it's rush hour dinner time. We were stuff after dinner.

This place was delicious! We started with the burrata, which was such a good appetizer to begin with- paired with the Italian bread it was perfection. Each of the my friends and I ordered a different pasta dish and we all enjoyed the food. I had the Cacio e Pepe and it was fantastic. Just the right amount of pepper, which can sometimes be hard to do. Ambiance and service was also great- not too loud and staff was attentive but not overbearing. They even had a gluten-free pasta option for my friend with celiac!

OK this place is a hidden gem. I have been here several times & each time I'm extremely impressed with the food.

You can typically get a reservation, which is great for last minute plans and you can count on the service being very good as they are always attentive.

The menu is thoughtfully put together with options for everyone.

I would definitely recommend ordering the Lumache, which is a MUST. I'd say this place is a pasta lovers dream.

I'm not a really big desert fan, but they're desert selection is good as well!

Will definitely be back.

This place is charming and so beautiful! The ambiance is perfect. So glad we chose this!

The service is outstanding. Kindness and joy - every recommendation they gave was on point. From the starters to dessert. OH MY!

Food:

Bruschetta- delicious

Branzino - five stars! Had avocado, watercress salad. Perfect.

Polenta - so good

Linguini Di Mare - oh wow, they do not skimp on seafood. Every bite was flavorful.

Bucatini - ok so I've never had this before and let me tell you ... it was rich in flavor.

Dessert - BEST TIRAMISU we've had EVER!

Take a chance and have some delicious Italian food in NYC.

We were able to walk in at 5pm on a Saturday. We ordered fried calamari and meatballs as appetizers. Both dishes were good. Pappardelle and mushroom lasagna were decent. I did the find the mushroom lasagna a bit cheesy. Balance it with a red sauce pasta and you should be fine. Next time I want to try the bucatini. Great service! They refill your water and check in on you every few mins. They have a cute, cozy seasonal decorations inside and the restrooms are in the basement.

Second times a charm. When I walked in for restaurant week, it quickly dawned on me that I had been here pre-pandemic. Was warmly greeted at the door and found myself at a cosy table nestled between two wall partitions.

Service was very attentive and friendly. Our waitress came by four times before we finally placed our order, though she was very pleasant about it. Food was delicious.

Beef Carpaccio: full plate with soft, thin slices, covered in cheese and arugula. Very fresh.

Pumpkin Pappardelle: with braised chicken and pumpkin seed pesto. Marvelous, huge portion. I barely had room for desert.

Chocolate Budino: with dulche de leche and salted crushed peanuts, and whipped cream. I took one bite and nearly had a heart attack - or maybe I died momentarily, I honestly do not know which. Finished the whole thing over the course of an hour with no regrets.

Highly recommend.

Really cute ambiance and some of the best pasta I've had!! I got the lumache (pork ragu, lemon, whipped ricotta, chillis) and it was the perfect, most unique combination of flavors. My sister got the mushroom lasagna and it was delicious as well.

The service was also phenomenal - we had made an outdoor reservation on OpenTable to bring our dog but found out it was closed when we got there. They opened up the section for us anyway and turned on the heat. Really great experience all around!

Was not expecting it but this restaurant is actually really really good! All the food here taste so delicious! I want to go back for more!

Location: It is located in Park Ave. The restaurant has nice interior, looks classy but you can come in casual. Nice atmosphere at the bar too. I went here for a birthday party, they have room at the back if you want to rent.

Service: omg best servers and employees. You are well taken care of.

Food: Everything was delicious! MUSHROOM LASAGNA: i was not expecting that it will be good, cause it is just mushroom on it. The lasagna is so creamy and rich. Best lasagna I had. LANCASTER COUNTY ROAST CHICKEN: another favorite! The chicken is soft and the skin is so crispy! You can taste the lemon and garlic flavors in the chicken. SALMON: another favorite! The salmon is cooked perfectly and melts like butter. Broccoli rabe taste good too with bits of garlic. PORK CHOP MILANESE: its like tonkatsu! The meat is soft and the outside is breaded and crispy! CAESAR SALAD: it is so good too! Best salad i had! It has crispy anchovy on it which adds crispiness to the salad. MEATBALLS: so juicy inside and cooked perfectly. I love the bread that comes with it. CALAMARI: kinda salty, but otherwise good! Its crispy as well and the dipping sauce is good. OLIVE OIL CAKE: the cake is moist and soft. The strawberries makes it fresh. CHOCOLATE BUDINO: omg this is my favorite also! The cream is silky and the peanuts with it is soo good! As if you are eating ice cream that is not cold!

Price rating: 8/10, worth every penny!

I will definitely come back here when I'm craving for good food! Get the chicken!

I can't remember his name (Brian maybe?) but the Asian male waiter with facial hair- PHENOMENAL!!! We had a larger group and explained that we were in a bit of a time crunch, and he was super accommodating. Already knew without us saying to bring food out as soon as ready instead of coursing it out. Was also very efficient with our drinks, dessert (one of which we won!!) and check. The food came out quickly, and I'm sure it's bc he told the kitchen. We made it out with plenty of time. The food was all delicious, especially liked the cauliflower and calamari and the chocolate budino. Overall a wonderful experience and again, super grateful to our waiter for being so on point!!

LOVED this spot! My personal NYC tour guide booked a reservation here, and she nailed it. The ambiance was so chic and inviting, and the server we had was so great. We got the cauliflower and the burrata to start and they were both DELICIOUS! I got the cacio e pepe bucatini for my meal and it was one of the best pastas I've ever had. I ordered Prosecco and it was the perfect accent throughout my meal. I will definitely be recommending it to anyone visiting NYC!

It was our first time eating in this place. There are a lot of Italian restaurants nearby and we just decided to try this out. We ordered calamari, lasagna and carbonara. We found all the food to be salty, way too salty. I love salty food but the way they prepared the food was too much, I couldn't even finish the carbonara. The service and ambiance are as expected.

Been here a couple of times now for dinner and once for brunch. Solid place. Good atmosphere, service, and food. Consistent every time. The wait staff is  knowledgeable and helpful with dietary restrictions. I was pleasantly surprised to find out the cauliflower is gluten free - and it's so good!

The grain salad, while a simple dish is flavorful. I added salmon, which I am picky about and it was cooked perfectly.

My favorites for dinner are the risotto, branzino, and cauliflower.

I plan to be back.

Their outdoor setup is super cute and always catches my eye when I walk by. Honestly, I thought that it was one of those Instagrammable places with mediocre yet overpriced food, but the incredibly delicious entrees proved me wrong.

We shared the Roasted Cauliflower, Fig and Burrata, and Fried Calamari. They were were all decent, but I wasn't blown away... until the entrees came. I had the Crispy Branzino which I was expecting to be bland like that of most places', but it was seasoned perfectly. Moreover, the skin was very crispy while the meat remained soft and tender. Probably the best I've had at a restaurant. My friends' entrees were also really good: Both the Lancaster Chicken and Pork Chop Milanese came in humongous portions and bursted of flavors, the Mushroom Lasagna was a smaller portion and looked different than a traditional lasagna (cut into several strips) but tasted absolutely divine - I'd go back for this! And the Prime NY Strip 12oz Steak was extremely juicy.

As for cocktails, the Park Avenue Passion - sweet and tart - and the Dancing Green - basically an alcoholic green juice - were hands-down our favorites of the night.

We were a large group, but they took good care of us. There were a few large groups that night (one gigantic group celebrating a birthday and one mid-size group out for what seemed to be a girl's night), so the noise level was high, but the service wasn't slowed down or lacking because of that. I'd recommend this place for a large-group gathering!

When have I ever left before dessert‍ took a little trip off the beaten path in search of refuge post a very traumatic experience in Union Sq  (different review different site)!  Things started off great. Lovely hostess, she took great care seeing my frenzied appearance post-event and helped me settle quickly. Things took a turn with my waiter ... like where is he. I think he quit mid shift. Good things cause once the kitchen closes on me. HANGrY Keisha set in and the staff took note and changed to mood  way to go. Customer service is still alive.. and I guess I can have dessert later ‍

Such a cute spot to stop in for lunch or brunch.

We sat at the bar and drank several glasses of their frosé, which was the perfect level of sweetness. For lunch my friend and I shared the burrata, pesto pasta, and grain salad. All were delicious and could have been an entree on their own.  Can't wait to come back for brunch!
We came here yesterday and the food was amazing! The pasta was delicious and the braised beef was so tender. I really enjoyed the valentines day decorations and service was great!

Arrived 10 minutes before our reservation time and seated yet our OpenTable reservation appeared afterwards cancelled by the restaurant - strange.

Staff was friendly and accommodating. Drinks and wine bottle choice was surprisingly good. And then the food arrived. Mediocre at best and not a cuisine emblematic of what should be expected of an Italian and Park Avenue establishment. Portions way too large and some which arrived late and mid-course only too be rejected as cold and insipid. Thankfully  our group made up for a lackluster meal with good company. Not a terrible or memorable evening but just OK.

Food, service and ambience are as great! it was my bday and the server treated me like a princess. his suggestions were on point regarding our order. We ordered cauliflower, roasted peppers, Cacio peppe, mushroom lasagne and salad. tiramisu was to die for

They have an aesthetic indoor area that's super packed and very much not socially distanced. However, the outdoor dining area is also cute and in this wooden shed thing. I think the table they gave us would comfortably seat 4, but they kind of forced 5 into it so it was a little tight. Service was pretty quick and they refilled our waters pretty frequently since it was so hot outside. Bill comes electronically.

Pappardelle ($25) - this was cooked perfectly al dente and had very clearly hand made noodles. The pesto flavor was pretty light and not too overwhelming. Had a good amount of meat as well.

Lumage ($24) - also recommend this, had whipped ricotta cheese on top and the flavor was good.

A little expensive, but pretty good portion sizes.

More like a 3.8

Fried Calamari - is fried calamari
Burrata - is burrata
Meatball - is meatball
Fried Cauliflower - is fried cauliflower

UHM the above 4 apps is quite standard as what you expect to have in anywhere american/Italian restaurant but a Park Avenue price.

Skirt Steak - is skirt steak... LOL but better than usual.
Lobster Bucatini - pretty good. The lobster is not the freshest but the Bucatini texture is quite satisfying.
Branzino - tender in delicious sauce (well also like anywhere else...)
Crispy Potato - somehow it look crispy but not really crispy.

UHM the above 3 entrees also quite expected but slightly better the expection.

Oops sorry about my non-descriptive review but you get the point.

We came in on a weekend for dinner, and this was a nice Italian spot! It was a quiet, romantic spot, it was pretty dark in there too. Service was good overall. Lots of options to choose from. I got the tagliatelle bolognese, it was a simple dish but so flavorful, noodles tasted fresh, perfect amount of sauce. Next time we have to try to dessert, it all looked super yummy!
The place is very new looking inside. We had an amazing zucchini salad as appetizer. And the roasted chicken was super tender and nice.

Isabelle's interior design and the service was really nice! We had a party of 11 people and it is advisable to call in advance if you wanna reserve a huge party. Overall the service was great 5/5 and the waitress was always available when we needed stuff. However the pasta I had were mediocre imo! I honestly thought the Pumpkin Tagliatelle was very bland, didn't have any unique flavor to it and made the noodles kinda not worth eating in my opinion. the Lumache however was very good and had a proper balance of sauce and pasta! The appetizers of the octopus (very generous portion) and the fried calamari was solid!
Overall, the environment was good, but I would give the pasta another try or try something different!

The pasta at Isabelle's shouldn't be missed!! I will be thinking about the lumache and the mushroom lasagna for a long time. Excellent service and while pricey, definitely a great spot for an occasion!

We had a dinner at Isabelle's Osteria on Saturday. We went without a reservation and were seated immediately.
The food was simple but delicious, and its priced reasonably. We ordered salmon with broccoli rabe and prime NY strip 14oz.
We skipped desserts (didn't find anything special on the menu).  

The space was cozy. I liked cartoon character paintings on the walls.
Pretty place  in union Square . Bar scene small but chill.  Very nice place for glass a wine and check out the nyc vibe.  Several times to drink and munch at bar

Outstanding. Beautiful place. Food was brilliant. I had the salmon dish and it was amazing. The broccoli rabe dish was phenomenal. Drank a beautiful Pinot Noir reccomened by them. My guests were gluten and dairy free and were easily accommodated. We will be back!

Lunch special delivered to your door for $10!  AWESOME!

Soup, Salad, Katsu Don.  Mmm Mmm licious.  The Katsu was really good (albeit could have used a little less salt).  Am very very happy with the katsu otherwise.  So good!!!

Interesting place.  The sushi was not memorable.

With so many places to choose from in NYC, I can't say I would go here again.

Stellar Bento Options for under $10 a Pop!

Great value for lunch.  $7.95 gets you your choice of chicken teriyaki, beef teriyaki, shrimp tempura, katsu or yakitori  over rice plus a dumpling, salad AND soup.   It also gets you some Lunch Don choices and Noodle Soup choices.  The best and tastiest value might be your choice of 2 rolls for $7.95, comes with your choice of a soup or salad.(wide variety of good choices, I opted for the spicy shrimp tempura roll and the spicy cali roll, both really delicious).  Was told the hot dishes weren't as great as the rolls althought the katsu looked mighty tasty.

A real lunch delight.

ehhh...one of the places i order lunch from. their sushi is ok, decent most of the times, but nothing to die for.

they are one of the cheaper sushi specials around me and on seamlessweb. if you want good sushi, this is not the place for you, if you just dont care, and have low expectations this will fill the need.

sushi lunch B FTW!

WORST delivery service EVER. They left menus at my building in Queens. I called and placed a delivery. I waited for an hour and a half before calling and they said that the delivery guy was just leaving. When I responded that was unacceptable, they responded with "Minimum delivery time is one hour, EVERYBODY knows that." I waited another half and hour. When I called back they said the order was cancelled. AVOID AVOID AVOID.

In my opinion, this is the best lunch spot in Nomad, and you can get a terrific lunch for under $15. I started weightlifting again recently, and it's a relief to be able to get healthy protein reliably. And, the ingredients are impressive for the cost, e.g. check out the oils they use. The cauli-quinoa/greens 50/50 is a great base.

If you are expecting an authentic Indian restaurant, this is not it. It is a fast casual spot for a quick bite, but there is cute seating and a little more elevated than, for instance, a chipotle.

The food came out outrageously fast and looked gorgeous, super colorful. Very tasty, healthful, fresh options.

Even though you order at a kiosk, the server was super nice and even brought us a free brownie after he noticed we were sitting chatting for a while!

Inday is one of my favorite places to order for lunch. It reminds me of Dig, but with more Indian flavors. They have a variety of different bowls which they have come up with, but also allow you to build a DIY. I usually order a DIY off DoorDash and come pick up. They're always super quick to prepare my order. I will be ordering from here again.

I used to love Inday. Now? Delivery orders don't even show up, and no one at this location will help. They charged us too, for a lunch that never showed. Pretty sure their delivery guy is enjoying our tandoori salmon!
Sorry Inday but you should have made this right - you've lost our whole office's business.

I have been to Inday when I have worked in the area but, I recently decide to stop by here for lunch as it's been a few years.

I did an online order for a chicken tikka bowl. The restaurant was spacious and well lit. They have machines available to order your food to your liking and then a pick up window available. Since I did an online order I went straight to the pick up window.

My food was there and waiting for me. I am not sure how long it was sitting but the sauce already thickened but the plate was hot.  Personally I wished they coated the chicken with the sauce instead of just dropping it on top of the chicken. I felt that there wasn't much sauce and not enough to coat the rice. The chicken was a bit dry and so was the rice. They only included a bit of pickled onions. The sauce had flavorful but it was mild in terms of spice and heat. I feel like this is geared towards people who might be more spice averse. It's not bad for a fast casual Indian restaurant but it's not for those craving more spicy and flavorful Indian curries and food.
Healthy & clean options with decent portions and fast service. A great alternative to the traditional work day lunch options!

I'm definitely adding this place to my lunch options when I go into the city for work. Delicious chicken tikka masala and super filling for a decent price. You order on the touchpad inside or online. The food comes out pretty fast --give or take 10 minutes and they provide brown bags for you to pack your food. The interior of the place is really pretty and the aesthetic brings out the stores classy and positive vibes.
Never fails to hit the spot. Always fast service. No hassle and most of all delicious.

Came with a friend and got the spicy lamb curry, garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chaat.

Really enjoyed the chaat -- well balanced and very flavorful. Definitely recommend! The lamb curry and chicken tikka masala were delicious - so flavorful and meats were extremely tender. The garlic naan was nice, even came with a side of yogurt, which was appreciated.
Truly scrumptious and delivered early.  I look forward to trying more dishes from their extensive menu

INDAY came onto the scene in an area full of fast casual options, and I met the option to have a healthy meal with Indian influences with open arms. This is not a place to get curried stews and rice-- instead, ingredients like tamarind-lime beets, turmeric potatoes, and coconut ranch over a bed of greens with a protein covered in Indian spices.

Over the years the quality of the flavors and the dishes has changed a lot, and the latest iteration is its best yet. Instead of a salad building station, the place is treated more as a takeout window, with all the dishes being prepared behind the scenes in the kitchen. Their tamarind glazed salmon bowl with spring vegetables, avocado, and mint is my favorite bowl-- the salmon is sizeable and cooked to tender perfection. The portion size is about average, as are the prices.

They have a few tables set up outside out front and I find myself getting a quick and healthy lunch here often.

Smooth process. No cashier. Self serve tablet with menu or on your app. Workers are just in the kitchen preparing the meals. The food is fresh and filling. I have the turmeric salmon (perfect temp, not over or under cooked).  All look so got a side of the chicken breast. Yummy health protein powered lunch is great fuel for the rest of the day.

Another establishment that I will return to in the near future.
My favorite lunch break!  Always consistently good!  Healthy and so delicious.  Quick as well!  So happy I discovered this gem in Flatiron

They make the food super fast and pickup is super easy. I love the Chickpea Coconut Curry.

Cute restaurant ambiance but I only do pickup so it's pretty sparce but a decent lunch spot

Ordered takeout. The service was great and the food tasted amazing! I got the Golden Chicken Curry Bowl and it was a little spicy and flavorful. This is a great Indian food option without having to spend too much money for one meal.
Love this place. Easy lunch for a good price. I always get the coconut chickpea curry :)

Inday was a decent fast casual spot if you are looking for a quick meal and a modern take on Indian cuisine. The ambiance of the restaurant was pleasant and clean.

When we ordered, there was no one at the cashier and we simply placed our orders on a tablet, which was efficient. Found it a bit strange that this location does not have naan, but when we asked, it sounded like that was only specific to this location.

The Chicken Tikka was alright. Instead of rice, I substituted with a quinoa / cauliflower blend but it was quite cold when it came out of the kitchen, and we dined in. The chicken was a bit dry, but the sauce had decent flavor.

We ended up staying until 8:58, when the restaurant closed at 9pm and were abruptly signaled to leave by the lights being turned off from the staff. We found this a bit jarring as we were cleaning up and planning to leave regardless.

Overall, I would stop in and grab something if I was in a rush / very hungry, but don't see myself returning frequently.

Got the charred chicken bowl over rice which was very good (4.5 stars). The chicken is nicely spiced and the yogurt sauce is delicious. The bowl basically tastes like halal cart chicken but healthier, and does not make you feel bad afterwards. The only criticism is that it needed heat. A spicy sauce or hot sauce would make this 5 stars. The portion and price are good and I would recommend trying it if you are in the area.

Such a flavorful and filling option for lunch or dinner. The only thing that's changed since pre pandemic is that everything is done in the kitchen (behind the scene) including the "make your own bowl". I don't mind this at all however I really wish there were photos somewhere of the options, specifically the sides you can pick.

I absolutely loved what I got. I chose basmati rice, braised kale + turmeric cauliflower as sides and the salmon as protein. I recommend the golden curry sauce which is just amazing.

Nice decor and seating including outside.

Super f*cking dumb that you can only order only or through third party apps and not over the phone??? Many of the third party apps are missing dishes from the menu and their official website glitches! Absolutely terrible experience.

Pricey, but healthy Indian. Eating it, I could tell that the dishes were modified for that type of person who wants Indian, but is looking out for oils, fats, carbs, etc. I got the I got the golden chicken curry ($11.75) which came with spice rubbed chicken thigh, green hot sauce, and basmati rice. I also ordered a Mango Lassi + MCT oil ($7). Unfortunately, there was no way to prove that I had gotten MCT oil in my Mango Lassi as it was sealed. There should be a better system to show that as I honestly did not know. Service was very transactional.
Amazing fresh food. Prepared so fast. Good rewards on the app. Great ambiance of the restaurant.

Gotta say this place packs a punch in flavors for a salad! Used to work in an office space above here so it was an obvious choice for a lunch.

There are a lot of options, so glad there are many flavor profiles and diverse ingredients instead of some average cobb or caesar salad. The only miss for me in my experience was that it was overdressed so put on the side for you light-dressing- salad eaters like myself out there. One major plus for me that gave it the 4th star on this review was that they actually had a decent spicy sauce!! I was so pleasantly surprised that they had one and that it actually hit a good level for me! Typically a spot like this would just have some random bottle brand as the only option but this spot had one!! Major points there and I would come back just becayse they do have one and it's actually decent. That in itself made my experience unique to other options in this busy busy area, just go easier on the dressing please (: Until next time!
The tamarind  salmon dish and the coconut chickpeas are -salad is also very flavorful.

Wow !.All of the food has so much flavor. Delicious. This chill little casual Indian spot is actually on 26th Street just off Broadway. Natural wood and soft light inside. There's no person to order from - it's contactless - you just order from their touch screen. Maybe more places will start doing this . Food came quick. We got the Gunpowder Potatoes side dish , comes with vegan ranch dipping sauce (I actually liked this even though I avoid ranch flavor anything. ) We got the Tandoori Pineapple side dish, it was hot spice ! For main I got the Complete Macro Bowl and I added salmon, which turned out to be a big portion! This is listed under salad section when you order. It contained many different ingredients from lime beets to the really tasty coconut chickpea curry . My friend got the Golden Chicken Curry with like a green chutney delicious sauce and basmati rice. He finished everything. Also got a side of Red Coconut Curry Sauce, a spicy red sauce that I enjoyed with the potatoes and also on my Salmon. I tried their Lemonaid ginger and turmeric beverage , it's very tart and next time I'd try the cold chai in the drink case . They don't have alcohol or naan though. Highly recommend, I wish it was closer to my house.
Food so good. Service incredible. Great place for a quick bite to eat would definitely come back.

I decided to taste the Inday again and from my initial impression it's a great flavorful way to eat healthy. I had been upset by some sandy food last time I tried this place about a year ago.

Today I'm all in on the holy macro bowl. Healthy but still delicious due to spice heaven in each ingredient. I especially enjoy the sweet potato and turmeric cauliflower. I happened to eat vegan this time but their chicken is good too.

The address is 1133 Broadway but the entrance is on 26th St, not Broadway. I walked into a residential building, turned around and started to walk out but the nice door man helped me find it around the corner. I went in between lunch and supper so it wasn't busy but the food still tasted fresh. Service was fast. The portion was generous. As you can see from the picture, the whole bowl was filled with food. Prices are very reasonable for the area and for the quality and portion. This place is great, give it a try! I will be back to try some of their other items.

I still REALLY enjoy the food here (see previous review), but I've had issues with pickup orders lately that have turned me off.

If you place an order that includes a beverage, and you head to the pickup window and ask for your order, they present you with a sealed brown paper bag that usually does not include said beverage. I guess they expect customers to ask for pre-ordered beverages at the register or just grab them from the fridge? I'm not sure what the system is supposed to be, but it's confusing. Have had this happen twice now, of course not realizing the beverage was missing until I was blocks away or already home.

TLDR: just make sure your delicious beverage is included with your order before leaving

On my most recent order, the sauce was packed separately in a small container inside bowl- which is cool, great idea. Sadly though, they either put super hot sauce in a plastic cup, or a plastic cup on top of very hot food, and when I opened at home to eat, the sauce cup was badly melted and the food had traces of melted plastic on it, so it was inedible (by my standards anyway).

Again, still love the food but will probably stick to dine-in from now on.

Great spot for lunch takeout. $13 for a well portioned bowl. I always get the DIY bowl with either golden curry or tikka sauce. The mango lassi and golden milk are nice as well.
I'd suggest you order from their app since you get loyalty points. Also if you order DIY bowl via seamless you only get a 1 veggie add on but on their app you get 2. They are only open on weekdays.

This place is seriously a hidden gem!! It's something you won't find anywhere else. It's Indian with a healthy twist that can be done fast! I seriously could not decide what to get for about 5 minutes because I wanted to try a little bit of it all but I am so happy with what I got!

Whether you are feeling curry, kebabs, fish, or a salad. The only down side is deciding on what to get!! **you can BYO too**

My order:
COMPLETE MACROS BOWL Cauli-quinoa, turmeric-roasted cauliflower, kachumber, avocado, black lentils, coconut crisp, beet cashew dressing & I chose spinach chickpea falafel for my protein.

Oh & a side of golden curry because that on top was

P.S. Would you believe me if I told you this photo isn't edited at all?? Talk about vibrant colors !!!

Thank you also to the lady who was so kind when I entered and gave me some good recommendations! I really enjoyed the vibe and set up of the whole place as well. Thank you!!
Inday absolutely is the best takeout in the area. They have the best vegan options. The falafel is off the charts and the curry is so good. I love the lentil bowl.
One of my favorite things to get at work is the coconut curry chickpea bowl from Inday. If I'm feeling crazy I'll add their tamarind salmon lol, so tasty!!

I can't tell you how many times I grabbed INDAY for lunch and was blown away by the flavors packed into these bowls. My all time favorite is the salmon with citrus salad and the salad side as well because it's so fresh, healthy and filling. Many of the other options are just as good though so get whatever is calling out to you at the time! I'm willing to bet you won't be disappointed.

Whatever you do, do not order the chicken tikka masala. It's disappointing x10! Half bowl of rice and 3 small chunks of chicken. THREE. I also ordered a mango lassie because it looked delicious, well they use an artificial flavor that I haven't been able to digest, a cruel reminder of my lousy lunch. If I'm giving it 3 stars it is because my colleague's meal, the salmon, looked good. And because I remember the good'ol days when I would eat 3x week here a very substantial meal full of flavor. Maybe it is a new owner, maybe it's the post-pandemic or the inflation, I don't know. I just feel like I'm getting more happiness from the halal guy in the corner.

I'm not sure why they have made EVERYTHING on the menu so burning hot you can not even eat it anymore.  Even a side of potatoes were SO SPICY I had to toss them.  I have been going for years and the last 3 times I could not eat the food.   The dishes I order do not mention SPICE at all.  
It's easy to add spice but when you overspice food it's inedible.
Ordered food on the app it was ready when I arrived. The staff was great and the food was delicious. My new fave spot!!

This place is sooo yummy and the portion sizes are perfect. There are so many options to choose from, and each one looks as good at the next. One of my personal favorites is the califlower rice. I don't know how they make it but the flavors are perfect.
Their falafel is interesting, it is nothing like a traditional falafel. It's more of a veggie ball, but it's really good! The spices they use to give it a really interesting flavor. The carrot hummus is also super good and has a really interesting flavor. I just love all the unique flavors that this place is able to create with its dishes. Especially for a place that has the make your own bowl style of food, most of the time it's harder to find places with unique flavors but this one really does the trick!
Hidden gem! Cheap and if you order pickup you get $7 off from rewards! Place is also very relaxing and aesthetically cool. My chicken tikka masala ended up being $6-wild!

I heard about Inday on TV, and wanted to try it.  I stumbled across the Broadway location a couple of months ago and fell in love with the Macro bowl with added Salmon.    It is my Go-To, feel good, eat good meal!     The inside is a cute place to take a break and enjoy your meal. And the staff is super friendly.      I had a sore throat and asked for more hot water for my tea, fully expecting to pay for it.   I offered to pay or give a tip, and the gentleman said "for what?    I just heated some water".  He wouldn't take it.    That's great customer service!    Keeps me coming back.
Very stingy this place. Unless you like lots of rice and few veggies on your plate...don't eat here.

Giving three stars because the food was amazing but one staff person (or the owner? Not sure) was really rude. I personally am just going to order out next time.
I ordered via the iPad which was glitching - and didn't realize it had deleted the extra sauce I had ordered. When I asked about it, the staff person became defensive even when I pulled up my receipt and apologized that it got removed (even though I added it). I guess this made her not like me much, so when I asked for a to- go lid and a bag she just grabbed a dirty lid off the prep table (covered in grease, food and fingerprints) and threw that and the bag on the table at me. I told her the lid was dirty and just took the bag (didn't even ask for a new lid at this point) and she started arguing that it wasn't and slamming things around as I walked away. Sucks because the place is super cute and the food is so good

If this is the Inday on Broadway - it is the best. It always tastes amazing and the service is great everyone is too friendly and lovely. Yessenia is always helpful beyond measure. I have to say Inday is amazing - healthy excellent food at a fair price with stellar service.

The curry chicken bowl is absolutely delicious! So much flavor in a healthy bowl (I subbed rice for quinoa-cauliflower salad). I added additional spice rubbed chicken thigh to the bowl that already had breast so I could try both and you can't go wrong with either. The chicken breast is juicy and flavorful (not dry at all) and the thighs were super tasty as well.
Great and healthy food options. Great ambience and customer service. Good for lunch meeting.
Love their food. Just the right amount of seasoning. It's so unique and I'm always going back for more. We'll balance!

It's absolute Insanity how good it is. We went in looking for some takeout for dinner.  then we took out the dish just because we wanted to try it first and then have some later. There was no stopping us from eating so much, it is that good.

I had the roasted chicken thigh masala mama with the basmati rice.  What surprised us is how little oil is left in the dish.  Don't know how they do that but it is amazing. It's definitely got a little bit of a kick to it which was a very nice surprise and the chicken was very tender.  My friend had the same dish but with chickpeas. We were both very pleasantly surprised on it.

Definitely wanting to be having this every once in awhile for a great Indian bite.

Excellent place for a quick, healthy lunch! It's not your typical Indian food, so before bashing this place and commenting that this is not what "Indian food" is like, think again! It's got a very nice fusion twist to it, and the Curry flower with chicken ($11) is absolutely delicious. Who would've thought raisins would taste so good with curry!!

I wish they are supported in LevelUp.

I would come here every week if we lived around here! Light, filling, and delicious - plus the price point is great! I got the charred chicken bowl with 1/2 rice 1/2 salad, side of gunpowder potatoes, and the hubby got the kebab with cauliflower quinoa rice. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

This small restaurant in NoMad seems to do a lot of takeout business, but they do have a few small tables inside. The food was fresh and tasty. The dishes are more indian-inspired than traditional, but the spices were on point! I had a chickpea bowl with a base that was a mix of cauliflower rice and a quinoa salad. It was delicious! My mom had a curried bowl with the same base and the chicken was juicy and well seasoned. My only complaint was that I wasn't able to customize my bowl at the order kiosk to remove cilantro. (The dish I ordered didn't mention cilantro, but there was a big pile of it on top of my food.) I have that issue with cilantro tasting like soap, so I always ordered things without it. There were really no customization options for the bowls, other than the base. If you have allergies, definitely talk to someone if you can find someone as ingredients on the menu may not be complete... I would definitely go back here, but I'd try to find someone to ask about not getting cilantro on my bowl...

The food at this place was really good. It is a tiny space with small portions but after bar hopping, It was one of those places that was open late and the prices were cheap. The food had just enough spice so my eyes weren't running and it was well seasoned. I would definitely go back.  I had a wrap with lamb, can't remember the name after all the drinking but  Yummmm!!! :-)

This is the first business that I've had the chance to add to Yelp... I wish, however, that I'd be adding a 5 star venue to the site.  Unfortunately I'd have to rate this cart 2-3 stars max.  The food wasn't bad by any means, but the quantity was just too small.  For $5 I was handed a box with white rice, shredded old lettuce and some relatively delicious chicken on top... not the best i've had in new york, but definitely not the worst.  

I can't say I'd eat here again, perhaps maybe to try one of their Kati Rolls, or even their indian breakfast special... but for now, I'd say STEER CLEAR... luckily you're only a couple blocks from the Halal Cart on 28th street and Madison....

I thought my first visit to this place last year was a fluke because I loved it so much!

I ordered the lamb chops and tabouleh salad and highly recommend them.  Back in NY for another trip and I had to come back here and see if it's still as good as I remembered.

Ordered different menu items including shawarma, hummus and kanafe and was blown away again by the quality of the food.

Hands down - this is the absolute best Lebanese /middle eastern restaurant in America.

If I had to find something wrong - I wasn't too excited about the cappuccino. Tasted more like standard coffee. But we are deep in the 5- stars range here. Highly recommend!

I plan to go again while I'm in town. Can't wait to go!

TLDR: Ilili is a great choice for Lebanese cuisine, if you're into Middle Eastern or mediterranean cuisine - you'll love this. The mouhamara is great and definitely give that burger a try.

Ilili was one of those places I wanted to try for a long time. The menu is quite extensive but our server helped us make some excellent choices. The mouhamara was something different from the usual hummus. A mixture of red pepper, nuts, a bit sweet - very tasty.

The waffle and fried chicken was brunchy but slightly different. My favorite though was the burger. Juicy, fatty but a nice blend of Lebanese flavors.

Food can get pricy here but if you're looking for a fine dining establishment beyond steak/sushi - this is a great choice.

My friends and I came here for our reservation and we were pretty quickly seated.
We got the mixed platter, rice, labne, and duck shawarma. We all agreed that the duck shawarma was the best dish but everything else was average at best for the price. The labne just tasted like yogurt with no deep flavor and were disappointed. The pita, however, was very delicious and airy.
The mixed platter did not come with nearly as much food as an $80 platter should come with and the taste of the meats was dry and flavorless. The flavored butters that came with were good but not enough to make the platter worth the high pricepoint.
The ambiance  was good and the service average. I don't think I would come back as nothing really stood out to me, leaving me wanting to revisit and introduce a friend to this place.

Our son lives in NYC and invited us to one of his favorite restaurants, Ilili. This meal was one of the highlights of our trip, and I wouldn't know what to recommend because every dish was fantastic.
Our server was on top of it without being overwhelming. Ilili is definitely on our list next time we're in town.

I came here with my family to celebrate a birthday. Our waiter was very helpful and patient with us as we decided what to order. We tried the following dishes:

- Labne
- Fattoush
- Arnabeet Mekle (cauliflower with tahini labne)
- Warak Enab Bil Zeit (stuffed grape leaves)
- Kebab Kerez (lamb and beef meatballs with a cherry sauce)
- Duck shawarma
- Mixed grill (chicken shish taouk, beef kebab, kafta, lamb chops, garlic whip trio, seasonal vegetables)

The kebab kerez, the fattoush, and the mixed grill were my top three favorite dishes. Everything was very flavorful, and it seemed like the team who designed the menu put a lot of thought into how different ingredients paired with each other. The only dish that I didn't care for was the duck shawarma, despite the hype.

For dessert, we shared the knafe and the baklava. Both were amazing. The knafe was warm and fresh, and the baklava wasn't overly sweet.

I feel like Ilili is worth the price for a special occasion. The interior of the restaurant is beautiful, the staff are professional, and the food is delicious.

Ilili has been one of my preferred options for fine dining in Midtown over the past few years. At first one might presume it to be yet another generic Mediterranean restaurant, which seem to have replaced steakhouses and stuffy New American joints as the default for a formal splurge dinner these days.

But the menu here goes beyond that, with highlights including things as simple as the arak service - as a frequent consumer of rakı, I love all its derivatives - and the Lebanese "white coffee," which is a perfect conclusion to a heavy meal that I had never heard of until coming here.

The cold mezzes were some of my favorite here taste wise. I always love the textured muhammara paired with their pillowy pita. The balsamic brussel sprouts may also be on the less authentic end of the spectrum, but are always a crowd pleaser.

Came here for lunch.
Everything was on point.
Octopus and the baba ghannouj were the highlight apps. As for the mains- your best bet is to share the mixed platter with the rice.
Gorgeous spot with amazing service.

I hardly go to Mediterranean restaurants because it's never my first choice of cuisine or craving, but I gave my husband the choice of cuisine and I'm glad he chose a place I never would have! All the dips we tried were delicious, the pita was perfect, and the mixed grill was a perfect share for two people. I really love Mediterranean food on the rare occasions I have it, and this was one of the best Mediterranean meals I've had. I'd have to say the only drawback is that this restaurant is so massive and loud, it's not a good intimate date-night spot, but maybe better for a group of friends for a night out on the town. It's lively and energetic, but just too loud for a romantic date night. The massiveness of the restaurant also gave me a little bit of a cold feeling, I like restaurants that have cozier, warmer feels. Servers were fine and friendly.

Get the mixed grill - such flavorful meat that is also juicy and perfectly medium rare is a gem to stumble upon.

The herbs at the bottom of the meats paired well, enhancing the already generously spice-rubbed meat. Absolutely delicious and had the right amount of salt.

-1 star for how rushed the service felt - I definitely had the sense they wanted us to get out of the restaurant as soon as possible. Also this small platter of meat being $82 pre-tax and tip was a bit alarming (and I'm somewhat used to NYC prices).

I've heard so many great things about ilili so I went today after work. The reservation wasn't too hard to get and I booked it the day before.

The food was just yummy as expected, I've never seen such cute pita breads(the picture shows everything). We loved it so much that we asked for some extra to go, and the server kindly packed on for us.

The baba ganoush was great, smoky and flavorful. However the mouhamara was the one we loved the most. It was smoky and sweet and crunchy, not heavy at all either. We also got the duck shawarma and lamb shank. Both were absolutely amazing. The fig garlic sauce complemented the duck shawarma so well.

The lamb shank was huge, it came with carrots, onions and squash. Everything was so flavorful and the meat was of course chewy and soft. The gravy on the rice, perfection.

I saw many good reviews on the candy bar. I personally could take sweet really well so it was a great yet definitely sweet dessert for me. The chocolate ice cream tasted almost like melted chocolate. The caramel was also thick and creamy. However this dessert might be too sweet for a lot of people, it does taste like a real candy bar.

I also want to comment on the service and ambience. The place was so pretty inside with different styles of tables and they switched the lighting later so it felt more intimate. The service was so great, honestly probably one of the best I've had in nyc. Our server was so friendly and sweet. I highly recommend this place

What a great restaurant!

This is a lovely, intimate but upscale restaurant in midtown that offers a great menu. I've never had Lebanese food before but boy was it delicious.

The food was fresh, tasty and the portions were great for two people. The service was also phenomenal and they constantly checked up on us and offered great recommendations for drinks and what to order.

This place is worthy of a 5-star review and I can't wait to go back!
All around fantastic! Beautiful restaurant. Super kind and friendly staff. All delicious food and drinks. What is not to love?! And the steak tartare is hands down the best I've had globally!

I remember coming for my mom's bday over 10 years ago, and the food is just as good as I remember. And this time I got to try the fantastic cocktails (a rainbow themed one for pride during June 2023).
Get the muhammara, shrimp, octopus and plenty of bread to start. The meat sampler plate is perfect to share between 4 people. Personally I loved the tender beef the best. Baklava for dessert is okay, I'd go for the knafe next time!

Came here as a group of 9 - made a reservation for a Saturday but there were plenty of tables available. I had thoughts this would be ideal to have sharing plates, but there weren't as many things to order that we could share as I remembered. The portion sizes tend to be on the smaller side but the food is good.

Of the things we ordered, I'd get the Baba ganoosh (very smoky), Brussel sprouts, and mixed grill for 2 again (shared this along 3 people). The mixed grill came with an assortment of meats that were all NOT overcooked, and comes with 3 different butters to accompany with. Delicious.

The pita pillows were as good as I remembered and they offered complimentary refills if you'd like.

I couldn't really tried the Octopus, and the Lebanese toast looked good but couldn't try.

There's restaurants you go to genuinely appreciate food & start to feel that one of our sole purposes of life is to pursue & enjoy delicious cuisines. Lebanese food achieves that harmony of veggies, meats, herbs & spices. Ilili simply brings some of the best version of it to New Yorkers.

An elegant & spacious spot with high ceilings, relaxed vibe and warm service, ilili has just enough options for everyone. I decided to go all veggie- and spread out a hearty mezze lunch with recommended classics like hummus, labne, fresh pitas, falafels, tabouleh, roasted Brussel sprouts and finish off with one very special sweet kunafeh.

The hummus & labne absolutely stood out for me in mains. Super smooth and flavorful bites with fluffy fresh pitas as I got creative with this fascinating spread of healthy ambrosia. Falafels are good, but am sure you'll have better ones elsewhere. Tabbouleh & Brussel sprouts are refreshing, yet quite heavy with their portions even to share.
