I highly recommend the semolina kunafeh. It's a delicate yet decadent, sweet but light dessert even with its cheese filling and sesame bread served on the side. You can taste the freshness, the love in each bite.

Need I say, I am definitely coming back for the meats!

This was on my list for a while now and I'm so glad I got to try this on my last trip to nyc. I went for lunch on a Thursday but it was decently busy. Reserving ahead of time is a good idea.

Ordered the mahumara dip which was a delicate balance of sweet and savory- found it very interesting. It came with fluffy light as air pita bread which really impressed me. Also ordered a fattoush salad which was delicious.

I tried white coffee for the first time and that was great too. Overall a great experience. Staff is polite, quick and attentive. Definitely recommend this place to anyone looking to try a good Mediterranean meal.

Restaurant is both upscale and casual in all the right ways. High ceilings, nice ambiance, upscale wait staff. Menu is perfect for sharing and has options for everyone - vegan, gluten free, etc. food came quickly and was very good. Highly recommend the falafel!

This place is fantastic! The ambiance it's very nice and large. There is seating upstairs on the second floor too. The service is very polite and attentive.

The waiter was kind to provide dates to break fast. I forgot the entree we ordered but we started off with lamb links and baba ganaouj! both were very delicious and we had some complimentary flat bread to go with the appetizers.

The entree was shredded lamb with rice. The waiter shredded it table side for us and it was wonderfully seasoned with vegetables too. There was some jous on the side which was very tasty.

I will come here again! The only thing i wouldn't recommend is the dessert, it wasn't my cup of tea.

everything is A+ 9/10 rating!

Had a super fun time at Ilili while visiting NYC with my family. I like how they're open late so we were able to have late dinner after landing. It's also delicious! The service was surprisingly quick and on point (the restaurant is huge so this was impressive). Drinks were also on fire! Try it out

Great Mediterranean restaurant that I would recommend for any nicer occasion; I came here with my boss from work who is from out of town. All of the food tasted really good, very authentic Mediterranean and smooth dips. I enjoyed the ambiance the most; it's one of those places that opens up when you walk in (huge and beautiful space) and you can definitely have a conversation over dinner (not too loud). They have a nice assortment of drinks as well. Would recommend for any nice occasion and for solid Mediterranean

Food (5/5): Came here with a relatively large group and experienced absolutely amazing Lebanese food! All the dishes we got were top notch and all the meat was super tender. Not a single dry piece. We ordered the Mouharama, Rkaykat bil Jibneh, Mekanek, Duck Shawarma, Phoenician Fries, Brussels Sprouts, Mixed Grill, Knafe Bil Jibneh, Harissa, and Garlic Whip Trio. My favorites were the Mixed Grill with it's top notch meat, Duck Shawarma, Phoenician fries, and the Mekanek. Although everything was super good. The garlic whip sauces and fries were also super flavor and great.

Service (5/5): The waiter we got was very excited and talkative. He gave us a nice intro speech about the menu and walked us through the options. Really enjoyed the attention to our group. Additionally, the food came out at a good pace and everyone was super helpful and friendly.

Ambiance (5/5): Impressive restaurant with tons of space and seating. I liked the high ceilings and upscale decor. The restrooms were also modern looking and super well maintained. Overall very nice looking place.

Very nice Lebanese restaurant!!  Coming from someone who is close to Lebanon, it was definitely authentic and tasty! Also fast service and great ambiance. I enjoy it a lot. Lamb shank was very tasty. And baba ganoush was delicious. I would come back!

We came here for a late dinner.

Ambiance: The restaurant is beautiful and very big. It looks like it would be a great place to host a large party of people.

Service: I thought the service was fine. Nothing extraordinary, but still good.

Food: The food was good. The item that did stand out was the pita bread. It came out warm and was beautifully soft and tasted fresh. Also, the Mouhmara dip was well seasoned and unique.  The falafel was good but tasted like most falafels I've had. We got the fattoush salad as it's one of our favorite mediterranean dishes and it was good but again nothing that stood out. The chankleesh and tabbouleh were fine but under-seasoned.

Price: High. For the type of vegetarian food being served I did find the prices to be high. There was nothing unique or even nostalgic tasting in the dishes to warrant the prices.

Overall, I felt like the whole evening was okay, nothing too memorable really. Not sure if I'd come back. There are other Mediterranean places I've been to that were much better.

Woooooooow! This place is something. Large, upscale, delicious. The flavors are familiar but elevated. I'm no Lebanese food expert, but wow this place to me to a whole new world. We got the chicken, duck shwarma, tuna tartare, and hummus. It is an elevated price, but pretty reasonable for what you're getting.
Good service. Will be back. Once I'm rich I'll be here for each meal.

Soo good! I absolutely love the ambiance in this restaurant, ilili is perfect for any occasion. 10/10

We really enjoyed the drinks and the beef shawarma was so so good. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive.

Can't wait to try other items on the menu!

I've lived in NYC for five years, and this has to be one of the best restaurants I've ever eaten at. Our server, Alex, was so knowledgeable of the menu and made great recommendations. Although everything sounded incredible, we went with the labne, duck shawarma, black rock shrimp, and tabbouleh salad. Alex recommended eating the pita bread with labne, a shrimp, and some tabbouleh for the perfect bite -- and it truly was. The duck shawarma is one of the best dishes I've ever had. It's served with a fig toum dip on the side that is addicting. The service was impeccable, whenever we needed a refill of water or bread it was being served to us before we could even ask. Alex even taught us about the toum dip and had us try the original flavor versus the fig to see the difference. Both were the perfect accompaniment to the other mezze dishes we tried.

The entire restaurant felt very hip and trendy, and every table we passed on our way out was full. This is the perfect spot for anyone looking for a unique restaurant experience in the city. Can't wait to come back!

Have been here probably 5+ times in the last year. It's a great place to bring family friends / acquaintances here to visit.

Food (5/5) - Everything here tastes great. Would highly recommend the toum if you can get it (comes with the duck shwarma, I believe), the muhammara, tabouleh. All the meats are great, take your pick! The free flowing pita is a nice touch.

Price (4/5) - a little on the pricier side for the portions, $20+ entrees but you likely won't have leftovers. The sampler platters are a good deal if you come hungry, we got the 2 person platter and had 5 people to share it alongside other apps, which was a solid choice.

Ambiance (3/5) - the only real knock on this place is how loud it can get. The lounge / bar area is almost preferable if you want to have a long chat. The two main seating areas can get really noisy during prime meal times. Had to shout a little across the table.

Wonderful presentation of Lebanese food in an airy space. The value for the cost of the protein courses makes this difficult to work into a rotation, especially a lunch rotation, but I don't think there's anybody out there saying that this food is disappointing. The shared meat plate allows you to sample everything that you could possibly want. Do note that the 3 scallops pictured cost a lot of money and I wouldn't recommend getting them.

WOW, where do I begin? If you're looking for Lebanese food in the city- look no further.

We ordered:
kibbeh: so tasty- I wish I ordered more of these
fattoush salad: the fresh mint was a game changer
hummus: you could taste the fresh garlic inside of it

For drinks:
Beirut to Manhattan and sumac spicy margarita which were both very strong which we liked.

Service was top notch. The manager was very accommodating when we complained that it was very cold inside. We requested to be outdoors and the manager took us outside right away with no hesitation. Also, our server gave us the best recommendations. He was extremely attentive.

Both indoor and outdoor was lovely. I would recommend outdoor if you want a more intimate conversation. Indoor is a bit loud for my taste.

Overall, I would return but I only knocked off a star because I felt the portion sizes were a bit small for my liking, and that there wasn't a full range of authentic Lebanese choices on the menu.

Pretty nice place to have a birthday dinner here with friends! My friends and I made a reservation a few weeks out before our date and when we arrived they led us to the lounge area until everyone in the party arrived before seating us at the table. Their cocktails were good and many of the dishes were sharing size so we went with that. I also got to shout out the 2 sauces that came with the fries - they were a scene stealer and we all pretty much dipped everything in them. We also had a cake prepared and they helped us bring it out and cut it (fyi it's a $5/person cutting fee). Service was pretty fast for how packed it was and I would come back!

The food, the drinks, its vibe, and its service is all wonderful! When you first walk in, you immediately feel like you're at an incredibly high end restaurant. The couches near the bar all feel very cozy and welcoming, and seeing everyone just sitting there and chatting gave me such a heartwarming vibe. At the welcome area, there are almost always 2 or more staff waiting to greet and lead people to their seats. The staff were all incredibly friendly and attuned; filling our waters and replacing plates within a very short amount of time without asking.

In regards to the food, I have to say that I am not too familiar with Mediterranean/Lebanese food so I honestly did not have any expectations walking in whatsoever. Our group of 10 decided to order food family style and boy was that the best idea ever; not only do we get to taste a little of everything, everything was extremely delicious! The sauces paired perfectly with the entrees and meats, and we all had fun sharing all the foods together. Definitely get the mixed meat platter for 2, for it came with so many high quality cuts of meats!

Please give this restaurant a try and it'll be a perfect place to bring your date/family!

Thank you for reading and good luck! (:

I decided to come here after much hype around the food. You will probably need a reservation especially if it's the weekend. When we first arrived, our table was not quite ready, so we waited in a lounge area where you can order drinks and sit comfortably. The ambiance of the restaurant was very nice and upscale.

I usually never have complaints about the service at restaurants, but the wait staff here were a bit aloof and did not feel welcoming:/

I ordered the Brussel sprouts for an appetizer. The best part of the dish was the yogurt infused with mint, but other than that there was nothing too special about the combination. The grapes also did not seem to add much to the flavor profile.

I also ordered the Black Cod Siyadieh which was a bit underwhelming. The fish itself had a nice soft texture, but the tahini sauce and onion rice were lacking in flavor.

Overall, I wasn't too impressed with the experience, but maybe we just ordered the wrong items.

Such a cool dining experience! The ambiance of Ilili is somehow both cozy and luxurious at the same time. I came here with a friend at 3pm on a Wednesday to try their restaurant week menu. We had a great time and were happy with the top notch service.
We tried their hummus, baba gannouj, falafel, mekanek, salmon la plancha, and roasted chicken breast. Everything was good, though the falafel was a little dry and the mekanek was a bit too sour for my taste (but thats just my opinion - I'm naturally not the biggest fan of sour foods). We loved the hummus and baba gannouj, and they came with a little basket of pita bread which was nice. I think the baba gannouj is the best I've had in the city so far!
Although we thought the food was a bit overpriced after seeing the regular menu, overall I still recommend giving this place a try. I'm glad we chose to come here for restaurant week.

Food: BEST, MUST GET DISH is the DUCK SHAWARMA
their most unique specialty dish. When do you ever see duck shawarma from a Mediterranean place? The best decision I've ever made, cuz it was SO GOOD. This is the only reason why I'm giving this place a four star and not a 3 star, since the other two items we got were more mediocre.
black iron shrimp: DO NOT GET THIS. One of the worst shrimp dishes I've had. Extremely bland, even my mom's garlic shrimp tasted better than this
Baba Ghannouj: not bad, but also nothing special. Their house pita bread deserves a special shout out tho, since they are made in house and look like fluffs of cloud.

Service: we sat at the bar area, and the service was descent

Ambiance: cute ambiance! However, not sure how comfortable it would be to sit at the lounge area since you would have to slouch over to eat. The main dining area looks kind of like those cafeterias... so ambiance may be lacking in those areas.

I know this place has existed since a long time but I never got to try it until now. The ambiance and decor are on point - you really do feel like you're in a restaurant to celebrate an occasion. The food, however did not live up to the hype / my expectations. The cauliflower came with a hummus that was overpoweringly sour. The octopus was cooked well but lacked flavor / seasoning and was a bit too salty, and while the vegetables that came with it surely added to the visual appeal, it was mostly tomatoes that I felt didn't really complement the octopus. The lamb sausage was probably my favorite dish of the evening, cooked to perfection and packed with flavor. The grilled chicken dish had slightly overcooked chicken breast and wasn't anything special overall. The cod was pretty good though, cooked beautifully to a medium rare and went really well with the rice. To sum it up, I think if you end up liking only 2 out of 5 dishes you ordered and paid a bill that was on the higher end, it's not a place I would highly recommend. But I would be curious to try some of their other dishes like the lamb shank, if I do come again.

First of all, this restaurant is absolutely gorgeous inside. It's so pristine and the decor/ambiance is 10/10.
Moving on to food, the prices are on the higher end but I did think the food was worth it. Especially for vegetarians, so many options. You MUST get the hummus it was the best thing I ate there and it comes with freshly baked warm pita bread!! Falafels are good, maybe a little above average. The cauliflower in tahini labne I would get again. Lastly, I got the feta cheese that's fried in dough? Did not like that at all.
But overall I would literally just go back here for the hummus and pita bread.

Lovely ambience, fantastic service, and delicious food!

The food:
*Crispy Brussel sprouts - 4.5/5 really delicious with toppings such as grapes, nuts, and dressing
*Duck Shawarma  - 3.5/5 tender meat wrapped in a soft shell, flavorful, good portions

Experience:
When you first walk in, you are greeted by a host and I was seated in the lounge area to wait which was super lovely. The warm and low lighting set a romantic but chill vibe.

I was seated upstairs and it was smaller than the lower dining floor but felt very intimate.

Service:
Incredible. Our waters were topped up constantly, staff was very attentive, food came out quick. 5/5

Overall:
Fantastic food, service, and beautiful restaurant that immediately envelopes you with its classy yet romantic vibes. A great place for a hangout with friends or for a romantic date. I'm adding this spot onto my go-to list  :) I'll definitely be back!

History of Present Indulgence:
My wife was having a small reunion dinner with about 6 of her law school friends and brought me along. Total group was about 10 people if I remember correctly.

Physical Exam:
Taste - Everything here was delicious. From the mezze, to the main plates, and even to the baklava we shared for dessert, all the food was wonderful to eat and beautiful to see. With a big group like ours, it was easy to try a variety of foods, of which there were a lot of options to choose from. While the items stood out, and we sure tried a few dishes we've never had before, I don't think flavor particularly"stands out" from other Mediterranean/Lebanese restaurants. Every dish tasted like something I've had elsewhere and for a restaurant that appears as it does, I wish there was just that little bit extra of a uniqueness in flavor.

Service - Our server was friendly and always offering to help. There is a lot of staff here so you never feel neglected.

Environment - A large format, high-ceiling, warmly, and dimly, lit space made to provide a calm, intimate atmosphere while you dine. Tones, a mix of light and dark woods, adds on to the calming effect. The ambiance, and clientele, gave a shared sense luxury that would make me put it in the fine dining box.

Assessment/Plan:
Ilili is an excellent restaurant for large groups that don't mind spending an extra dime or two for the environment and service to justify the markup in prices. It's a fantastic restaurant that elevates an immigrant cuisine and showcases items that are hard to come by. It's good for loud, rowdy groups and for intimate dates. The staff is very welcoming and are there to help you enjoy your meal. I probably won't be going again anytime soon, but I recommend that you do!

Amazing dinner here!! They had really good drinks and the food was fantastic. They have plenty of vegan options, though the pita is apparently not vegan because it has yogurt in it, so they brought some crudite for the dips. (Please make a vegan pita!) The hummus, mouhamara, falafel, brussel sprouts, riz, and fattoush were all amazing.

There is a bunch of outdoor seating and the inside area is really nice, particularly the lounge and they also have very nice clean restrooms. The service was excellent - our food came so fast and our server was extremely nice and accommodating. I would absolutely return.

A very dependable Lebanese restaurant near midtown. They typical eating style here is sharing many mezze dishes with your table. We had about 10 mezze and one big mixed grill with different types of meats for 6 people. All of the mezze were perfectly cooked and flavorful. My favorites were the lamb shawarma, the beef kibbe, and the fried cheese. The mixed grill was also a winner and a great way to try many different types of proteins in one sitting. Baklava dessert was amazing and avoided all of the typical downfalls of a mediocre baklava (too dry, or too sticky, or too dense).

The one and only issue with this place is the price point. It's pretty damn expensive for what it is. Perfect spot to go for a work lunch or dinner when using a company card :)

One last thing - outdoor seating options here are really nicely decorated and insulated.

Some of the best food, service, and ambiance I've experienced in nyc.

Food and drinks - so so so good. The Brussel sprouts and shrimp were my favorites. I also liked the baba ghannouj and the duck shawarma. I got the egg nada which was a unique variation on an eggnog drink. It was strong, but still pretty good.

Ambiance - we had a reservation upstairs since we got it last minute. However, the ambiance is much better downstairs. Definitely book in advance for this experience.

Service - amazing to say the least. The waitress was so attentive and came whenever we needed her. After we paid, my friend and I were chatting for a bit. The waitress kept refilling my water after we paid, which restaurants rarely do.

It's a great place for dinner or even a fancy dinner. We were seated on the second floor and due to the AC or cold air that was blowing, our food was cold quickly after being served.

Wouldn't recommend the hummus as it's nothing out of the ordinary. However, the pita bread that is served with the hummus was really fresh and hot!

The mixed grill was great to share, but nothing to rave about!

An easy, dependable, high-quality restaurant that's conveniently located on fifth Avenue where an abundance of options already exist. Inside feels like a royal palace by the outside feels like separated makeshift rooms with their own standalone fans and air conditioning. The food is actually quite good and tastes fresh Including hummus that appears extremely smooth.

I ordered the cauliflower steak that included a side of spiced chickpeas. To share, my wife and I order the pine nut infused hummus that was the perfect portion size prior to our big sized lunch. My reason for three stars is the prices are quite expensive and most add-ons (eg pine nuts on the hummus) will cost $5. Staff are accommodating and general clientele is mostly corporate-based.

Loved everything about this place: the food, the service, the atmosphere, the decor.
Loved every single dish from appetizers to warm pita to main course to desserts.
Loved ilili's twist and presentation of Lebanese cuisine.
Best to come with a group of friends so you can share and taste everything.
Our servers friendly recommended his personal favorite dishes and desserts and made suggestions along the way and checked in on us frequently.

Best of the night and must try:
Mouhamara: re-ordered twice!
Brussels sprouts
Warm pita
Lamb shank
Warm pistachio up side down cheesecake

Still very good:
Lamb shawarma
Duck shawarma
Baba Ganoush
Tuna tartare
Ilili candy bar

My friend and I had reservations for this place on a Friday evening. We got seated right away when we arrived. Great ambience and decor. Also really enjoyed the food. My friend and I were in a time crunch as we had reservations to fotografiska so we let our sever know in advance and she was super accommodating. I recommend ordering a bunch of their appetizers if you're not super hungry. Even if you are the appetizers can be quite filling. We ordered the lamb hummus ( highly recommend!) which came with fresh hot pita bread. We also ordered the cheese rolls, meatballs, and fries. Everything paired so well and was delicious! We also ordered Aperol Spritz for our drinks which were also really good.

I can't wait to come back and try more things off their menu.

I was so so thoroughly impressed by this place that I can't wait until my next visit back to Ilili. I reserved a 10-person birthday dinner here for my boyfriend due to a friend's high recommendations, and every single person at the dinner had an amazing time.

If you want a good intro to Lebanese food and the Lebanese culture of eating family-style around the table with your hands (according to our AMAZING waiter, Alex), this is the place to do it. I asked Alex to create a dinner menu for us when we arrived and left it in his hands. Our appetizers started off with some delicious shrimp, hummus, lamb sausage, and lots of other sides combined inside the cheese rolls. Everyone was rolling their eyes in pure joy when we took our first bite - an unforgettable experience. We were sadly a little full going into the main course, but the mixed grill was also delicious and very filling.

Words cannot convey how much I enjoyed dining here. Service was amazing and vibes were immaculate. Pricing isn't even that bad either considering the amount of food we ate. If you have a large party, I'd highly recommend dining here.

This is the perfect spot for a group dinner with friends. The ambiance is dim and the tables are round, perfect for sharing a ton of small plates with your best mates!

We started with all the classics like the labneh, hummus, toubouili, extra pita, tuna tartare, salad.

For the mains ordered Lamb and beef meatballs , chicken , Beef Shawarma, and iron shrimp. Brussels sprouts were a great side.

The drinks were great, the service was fantastic, and the food was delicious and fed an army! I would definitely come back with a hungry group and order one of everything again.

Went here with a couple friends to support queer-owned restaurants during Pride, and I definitely plan on coming back! Every dish was incredible, particularly the duck shawarma, mouhamara, and brussel sprouts. Got dessert on a whim, and the ilili Candy Bar was delicious! Only thing we weren't feeling was the ilili punch.

Overall, an absolute must, especially if you're into Lebanese/Mediterranean food.

Ilili has been my go to special occasion restaurant for over a decade now. The atmosphere (beautiful wooden panels), service (top notch), and food are exceptional.

When dining, my MUST ORDERS include the duck shawarma, baba ghannouj, labne, fattoush, and brussel sprouts. The duck shawarma comes with four small wraps filled with tender shredded duck, fig jam, and garlic whip that all come together to make magical in your mouth. Their baba ghannouj is my favorite in the city (which is saying a lot from this Lebanese gal). The brussels are divine - charred and covered with yogurt, fig jam, walnuts, and grapes. The fattoush is fresh and delicious, and labne is oh-so- tasty. Plus - if you're looking for something truly special - end your meal with the knafe bil jibneh. It's a Lebanese dessert classic with a small twist (the orange blossom syrup).  

I also very much enjoy their beef and lamb shawarma (which is full of flavor and a classic), kabab kerez (delicious lamb meatballs covered in a cherry sauce - yes!), hummus (you cannot go wrong), and arnabeet mekle (cauliflower with tahini). I also appreciate and love their selection of Lebanese wine as well as their sumac margarita!

Looking forward to celebrating future special occasions for many years to come!

Went to ilili after a few years and the food is always amazing!

Our reservation was at 8:30pm we got seated at 8:40pm not bad. But the wait for the appetizer and food was a little too long we got our food at almost 9:45pm and That is my only complaint.

I have a few dietary restrictions and our server Isaac was really informative about the menu and how the food is prepared and guided me in exactly what to get. I would definitely come here again and hope the service time is just a little better.
I'd give them 5 stars, but their not dog friendly. Excellent coffee, food, and staff.

Cute spot, not really for studying and is more a socializing spot. Even then, conversations so loud and all overlapping each other.

I ordered a chai latte and a veggie burrito which the cashier kindly recommended to me when I asked what she liked. You can't go wrong with a chai latte, so no complaints there. The veggie burrito was yummy, but it was small! It came with a little green sauce which I did not use.

I would come back for the drinks and pastries/food but probably not a great place to chat cause it really gets loud!
Cute little spot on Irving with excellent coffee and a great seating area. Excellent alternative to the more well known named brands nearby. Great location, friendly staff and just right.

Needed a break during a very long walk, popped in here for iced coffee and maybe share a pastry if anything looked good.

I asked if they made decaf americano, and the person behind the counter asked hot or iced.  How lovely to have the choice, and the day was hot & humid, so black and iced please!  An almond croissant called my name, so I asked for a knife so we could share; again the person gave us a choice - would we like her to cut it in half for us?  Sure, why not.  The coffee was strong and good, and the croissant was excellent; I was pleasantly surprised that it tasted fresh because it was late in the afternoon.
We now have a perfect place to stop when we're down in the Union Square area!

A friend and i were craving iced cold coffee and AC on a hot NYC day. Thankfully, Irving Farm was around the corner from the spot we were at. This place is so cute inside and has the creamiest ice oat milk latte I've ever tasted. So delicious. I didn't realize they have a full breakfast menu too.  I'm definitely coming back for a coffee and croissant date.
Came for coffee & to meet a friend! Loved the atmosphere. The coffee itself was good too, and the employees were very sweet. I would definitely come again to hang out :)

Great ambiance with plenty of seating, quite a crowd during the morning rush. Breakfast sandwich such as the egg and cheese was bland. Limited breakfast option. The coffee is great though, it's strong and they offer varieties of milk.

Was In the area so decided to quickly stop in.To start if you're in a rush lines can get pretty long. We did not tried any food but we grabbed a regular black ice coffee and a iced chai latte. The latte was just okay for me not my favorite. The expresso in the latte and coffee wasn't as strong as I thought it be. Also a bit pricey for coffee and tea. The taste was very watery coffee and to much milk in the latte.

$10 breakfast burrito... smaller than my hand not worth it super rip off

coffee is good though!

Love the coffee. Been ordering from here by mail for years. Found myself in the neighborhood and was excited to visit the store. Cashier was nice but the barista seemed annoyed I wanted ice for my iced espresso. Was even more annoyed when I wanted milk for it. Didn't realize my tastes were so exotic. Barista gave me a lecture about how he can't give me much milk with my iced latte and cookie ($9 purchase). I interrupted because I just don't care. Seriously.

Nice little coffee shop. Quite a few tables and a small counter to sit at. A variety of baked goods, but seemed a bit short of non-dietary-specific options. Gluten free and vegan options on some items. Blueberry scone was very good. Only offered a few selections of tea. This always surprises me because tea is so easy to store and display. Comfortable atmosphere to eat, work or read.

Writing a review more so to let people know about the horrific customer service rather than the coffee. I'd give the latte an A. Customer service gets an F.

Let me start by saying I worked at a coffee shop for a year and a half, so I understand how stressful it can be working in food service. And this was not one of those moments where I can give a pass for poor service.

I walked in and no one was in line, and no one was behind the counter. I stood there for probably close to a minute, looking around, wondering where the employees were. I was in something of a rush, and was pleased I would most likely be able to get in and out quickly given there was no one in line and no one waiting on drinks.

Finally, just as I was about to leave, two employees came out of the back. One of them didn't seem to be doing much. The other approached the register and stared at me. No apology for making me wait, not asking what I would like to order. He just stood there and stared at me until I ordered my drink.

At this point, a small rush had come in and there were four or five people in line behind me. After taking my order, I assumed maybe the other employee would help run the register while her coworker made the drinks. She left him on his own, and he decided to take the orders of everyone in line behind me before making anything, thus delaying me further. I didn't think it was ridiculous to ask to be in and out in five minutes, given there were no outstanding tickets and no one waiting to order before me. But apparently that was too much to ask. It took nearly 10 minutes for me to get out of there.

The barista then pulled my shot and dumped it into the cup and decided to prep the drink of the person behind me before completing mine, despite me being first in line. He then haphazardly dumped the steamed milk into the cup, without any attempt at latte art. While I might expect that at Starbucks or Dunkin, I have higher expectations of a specialty coffee shop. The art doesn't have to be perfect, or even all that good, but I appreciate an attempt. And no attempt was made.

The entire experience was ridiculous from start to finish. This is the second time in the past week I've been here and had a subpar experience. The coffee itself was great (not the case last time I was here), but the customer service was truly atrocious. I've had my day entirely turned around by a friendly barista who provides exemplary customer service. This time, my day was made worse by someone who clearly didn't care about the customer's experience. I will be avoiding this place in the future.

The staff needs training, they're exceptionally slow AND rude. Not a great combination. Perhaps they are understaffed, but this behavior has been consistent. In a customer service industry it's almost jarring to see how little the staff seems to care. The food and coffee are noticeable worse than they used to be. Most of the food appears to be frozen. Especially disheartening to see the coffee get worse as they invest in expansion, as it's now also extremely expensive (prepare to pay anywhere from $7-$10 for a coffee) but used to be quite good. Sad to see Irving go down hill.
They don't take names. I got someone else drink. I think the machine makes better cappuccino. Their staff are very rude and don't care. Never again!
Awful sandwiches. Caprese sandwich for $8,50 was two dry pieces of bread with literally two slices of thin tomato and cheese. The whole thing was dry and gross.

My sister just moved around the corner from here and we were excited about the proximity to her new place but unfortunately I don't think this will be our go to coffee place when I'm in town.  I don't like the coffee at all.  It's the super bitter tasting kind that tastes like it's been sitting around for a few hours.  I know a lot of people like this taste but I hate it.  Bummer. Oh, and it's super expensive- but it's on Irving in Gramercy so I get it.
Decent spot to do work, seating both indoors and outdoors. I ordered the house chai latte and definitely would recommend!
I am pleased with the environment, perfect music volume, welcoming baristas, and good coffee.

Been a long time since being here when wife had salon upstairs. The menu is expanded beyond quiches. Same interior, a little dark, loud music, long lines. Staff is nicer than I remember.  

Got the crispy croissant with avocado, white cheddar, some chipotle heat. Very nice. Washed down with a cold brew for about $13.

Irving Place is beautiful and I do miss my old neighborhood here.

Highly recommend coffee shop over the chains for food and coffee quality.
My last time when I'll pay 8 dollars for this horrendous sandwich. Blend, unsalted eggs, and gross piece of half slice of bacon. Ridiculou

I met up with a friend and wanted to be able to sit down and chat. This place is perfect- not just a grab and go coffee shop. There are plenty of tables (and the AC is going strong!) I had the breakfast burrito, which was a perfect small breakfast, and the Hibiscus Palmer, which I would highly recommend!  I would definitely come back for a casual coffee date in the future.

Coffee is good. Will go back for that. But this bacon egg and cheese? $8.00 for bacon egg and cheese on a toasted English muffin that took 5 min to heat up? What a joke. Deli bacon egg and cheese sandwiches are better than this.

Coffee is good tho. Def recommend just for that
Other than the line, this was a pretty decent coffee shop experience. No issues with the drip, and the iced latte was pretty good overall, just not my favorite

I'm wavering on 3 or 4 stars for this Irving Farm in particular.  The hubs and I have been coming to this location for about 2 years or so.  It seems that in these 2 years the service and cleanliness has really gone downhill!! So far downhill that they currently have a "B" rating.  I didn't research this rating as I fear what I'd find out.  Mind you the sign was there in the window one day then a day later it was conveniently laying face down (02/25/2018). Like someone was hiding something??

The drinks are usually pretty good, but don't ask for any substitutions!   They won't make a drink with half caffeine, something I'll never understand.  I don't like to be jittery so most places do one shot of caffeine and one shot of decaf.  They won't do that here.  WTFE.  I like the flavor of coffee so no, I don't want just one shot.  They have a decent selection of food items but the place is DIRTY.  I'd like to see some consistency on the bakery items. It can be hit and miss but that could just be me.  By the way, I like to order a large iced latte most days.  They only offer one size here.  They have larger cups for iced coffee but not the iced latte's. Stop being ch

The staff looks as though they just rolled out of bed, eye boogers and all.  Just watching them make the hot food or smashed avocado made me cringe. It's just a cluster f^*% where the food prep area is.  Oh, careful if you have to use the bathroom. The mess in there is as bad as the mess on the counters where you sugar your beverage.  

If anyone like an employee for example is reading this, can you please make sure the simple syrup/liquid sugar bottles are full.  The one by the door is almost always empty forcing us to battle back through the line of people to the back of the coffee shop in hopes that bottle is full.  Can you please add a bottle to the area where a latte's are passed out? I get why it's not there as you wanna move people along but it's just not user friendly at the trash area on the way out.  Just a kind suggestion as I do plan on coming back as I LOVE Irving Place. The Gramercy Park area is gorgeous and I for one would expect more from you all.

You guys used to be great and I think you can be great again! Clean up the shop. Have your staff wash their hair before work and put on a smile.  Maybe uniform shirts would help out.  No more of the "chip on your shoulder" attitudes.  I start my day with you guys so I'd like you to set the positive vibe. Not that "I'm so annoyed that you came in for a drink today vibe".  

I promise to update my review as soon as I see things start to turn around as this place used to be AWESOME.

Like 3 weeks later and they still have a "B" rating!! Do the owners care? Fix it or forget it! Gross!!

Back to an A! We are back....

I am aware that this establishment is a roastery-- known for their coffee; however, I cannot speak/write about it.
Per a friend's suggestion--because she loves Irving Place (as in the street/neighborhood)--we decided to meet here today to catch up.

The neighborhood is very charming and upon entrance, Irving Farm appeared to be getting crowded. It was nearly 1 PM. Once inside, the place was spacious with lots of tables/chairs and counter seats.
As I waited for my friend, I looked over the menu. They had a decent selection of items from baked goods & salads to breakfast items and sandwiches.

Since it was my first visit, I decided to skip the coffee having had a cup earlier and ordered an iced hibiscus tea. Along with that, the avocado toast hit my eye. My friend ordered an iced coffee and a muffin.
All orders took place at the counter as there was no table service. In addition, I don't know if there was a kitchen--it seemed food orders were being prepared behind the counter.

The avocado toast was pretty good. I was expecting for the mashed avo version--my preference-but this particular version sliced the avocado on top of a toasted grain bread (couldn't tell if it was one large slice or two smaller ones) of which whole grain mustard was drizzled as the finish. The hibiscus tea was refreshing for a non coffee beverage.

One tip---the space was extremely loud. It was often difficult for my friend and I to speak over the blasting hip hop music and the conversations from other tables. I found this to be a bit annoying; not sure if it's quiet at other times. And as it got later, it also became more crowded and louder.
The restroom, although clean, was a bit unkempt.

Overall, it was decent/average. Feeling neutral.
Irving Farm is quite cute and very popular. I ordered my latte just seconds before a rush of people came in. The lattes are pretty good but nothing special.

Honestly hate this location, I just get a vanilla latte and they always forget the vanilla or something. I'm not one to say  anything because I work in food service and I understand mistakes happen. But I come here because I live close by and always tip, yet the staff has the worst attitudes. As a waitress, you don't get a tip because you are doing your job. You get it because you are kind and helpful.
I absolutely adore this coffee though the food offerings leave a bit to be desired. I tried a turkey and cheese sandwich (needed more mustard but the bread was GOOD) and a vegan grain bowl.
The coffee sucks. It has a sour after taste. Please do yourself a favor and checkout Devoción or Blue Bottle (both are nearby) instead!

During the summer they had a "cold brew cola" that blew my mind!

Winter time I stick to my non-dairy lattes - and their latte did not disappoint!! They use oat milk which is so creamy and not bitter like almond milk can get when it's steamed incorrectly. Great drip coffee too - I'm usually a dark roast person, but their house drip is outstanding. Notes of grapefruit and chocolate!

Loved the avocado toast here, and their vegetarian bahn mi! Significantly better food than what I expected (totally thought it would be a microwaved egg like at Starbucks and was pleasantly surprised by what I received)!

Great place to have a coffee and a meal - it does get crowded/loud, so I kinda like that there's no WiFi: it keeps the laptop zombies from taking over!

I had to work on some things and was in the Union Square area. I went here and saw 7-8 people on their laptops. I ordered a muffin and latte, which came out quick. The muffin was good (and gluten free and vegan) but the espresso in the latte wasn't as strong or rich as I would've expected, potentially too much milk. However, when I sat down and opened my laptop I realized they don't have WiFi! Upon investigation I only saw a tiny framed sign by the trash can informing people of this. I guess they're trying to limit people taking up all the spaces, but people seem to be working in their anyways. So I had to scarf down my latte and muffin so I can go to another coffee shop which actually provides WiFi.
These guys have the best coffee. Go to any of these you can find. Their service is nice and fast and we come back to their coffee every single trip

The two stars is only for the yummy pastry I had the other day, the cinnamon cardamom bun. Unfortunately, the coffee is terrible. I've had it four times. Once at Friend of a Farmer and three other times. Each time, I swear I won't have it again but I keep suffering because I live across the street and hope  it got better. (It never does). Last week though was my last time. I had a few of their pastries and a bagel before. All were pretty below average tasting and very above average in cost. For example, my medium iced coffee and cinnamon bun last week was almost $10. If it was all very good, I wouldn't mind as much but when a coffee place can't make great (or even decent) coffee, I just can't (and won't) go back anymore.

Came here this morning (Sunday 8/22) and had the unfriendliest cashier I ever had at a coffee shop. He was so short with us and kept rolling his eyes when we asked him questions about the menu. This dude really should not be working in customer service.

There are lots of good coffee shops in the area that make coffee that is just as good. They should get their customer service operations together.

There's a few Irving Farms around Manhattan, but I guess this Irving Pl. location is the OG! It's a cute little coffee shop in Gramercy with good vibes. If you accept this place as a strictly grab and go coffee spot, it's great. There's no WiFi, and it gets packed and loud, so it's definitely the ideal place to get work done in the afternoon.

I really enjoyed the pour over coffee they had.

Pros: atmosphere, location, outdoor seating, really good vegan choc chip cookie
Cons: superr acidic coffee, limited flavor options, cramped, loud, no WiFi

I can't believe I have been to this location but didn't review it. I saw Ellen's recent review and remembered going there with her and Cesar the first time I met them. I even took photos of the two places I parked my butt. I used the bathroom and hated it. It was cramped and very dark in there. The long narrow establishment was full of people and the line for service very long. Once people line up there's no room to navigate through the space. Seating limited. I made my way outside while Ellen and Cesar purchased their coffee. I grabbed a table in front of the business. At least I didn't feel claustrophobic!
I've been to at least two other Irving Farms locations and enjoyed both of those. I'm especially partial to the location on the Upper East Side. As for this location, I'm not a fan. I do have the pleasant memory of my first meeting with my favorite Yelp friends!  I love them like they are my children!
If you live close to this location I advise going early. It may be a nice neighborhood coffee spot before the crowds arrive. As for me I'll avoid it if I can!

Definitely overpriced - the coffee is not as good as the high cost of it. Always too packed and busy, so don't expect a friendly and "all about customers" service.
Oh, and NO WIFI... Yep.
I came here again for coffee and I'm still hooked. So hooked it got me craving oat milk latte on a daily basis...not sure if this is a good or bad thing, but nonetheless come here for come coffee!

The staff here is remarkably friendly.  The wait time is inordinately long. 20 minutes for a sandwich the last 4 times i went in- the last time i went in, they skipped my order.

problem is: they make every order one at a time. no one has trained them to batch orders. they'll make one pressed croissant at a time.  then make a salad. then make another pressed croissant. then toast a bagel. it's really inefficient.

Not a good place to study or do work as it's very loud here at most times of the day.  It sounds like a bar most of the time. customers are loud, music is blaring.

The men that go here are also notably attractive most times I've been in which is a nice plus, but sadly- i can't justify 13 dollars for a sandwich after waiting 15-20 minutes for it.
The best peanut butter cookies in the city! I frequent the locations on Irving Place and 79th Street. Both have nice, efficient staffs.

I really, really like this place. Music is groovy (and louder than I've seen in most coffee shops), not your average coffee shop with people glued to their laptops. Yes there were some, but for the most part people were engaged, laughing, talking. It was nice- felt like I was at a local bar or something. They serve food but the kitchen was closed when I got there (around 5pm) so I opted for a croissant instead. They do have yummy looking donuts. Will try one next time. The cappuccino was GREAT.
No WiFi here which I commend. If you want to study, go to a library. Go to the coffee shop to sip on a drink and spill the tea, honey!!!!

That lavender latte is worth every penny. My friend made the observation that it's hard to succeed with lavender, because you could go slightly overboard and ruin the whole thing. Well, they make it perfectly here. Slightly sweet, super smooth, ideally foamy.

Croissant is your standard croissant, and the cashier gave my friend a full glass of wine. I think he was either super generous or really liked her!

Ambiance is super cute and cozy too, with outdoor and indoor seating and dim lighting. Great for dates, reading, or hanging with friends.

Irving Farm is truly my favorite coffee. It is the best coffee I've ever had. It is bold without being bitter. It's so good I could drink it black, and I never drink coffee without a ton of whole milk.

I am about to sound like such a snob but the coffee has such excellent notes of nuts and chocolate. It's seriously great coffee people. Trust.

It is super expensive and this location is usually pretty busy. The hidden location is just close enough to Union Square to be convenient whole reserved for those who know of its existence.
Im confused by the low rati  no. This place is awesome and delish. Also loved the staff!
They don't let customers use their restroom. A coffee shop, with no restroom. Screw off. Tried to come here for the first time and will never come again.

Love love love.

Irving Farm coffee is the coffee served at The Beekman Hotel, which I think says a lot.

They are also inside Grand Central Station.  That's also saying a lot.

I visited several cafes during my 9 days in NYC, & this cafe was my favorite.

It's easy to name all the pluses; great local pastries, great coffee, great space.  But how it felt to be here, that really surprised me.  It was so random & serendipitous.  It reminded me of my old neighborhood cafe in SF's north beach, where I made best friends that I've had for decades.  

Walking in here just felt like home.

There's even a fireplace.  I don't know if it's operational or not, since it wasn't lit.  But props for the aesthetic.

And a stairway to nowhere.  Classic.

Great cafe.

5 stars.

COVID-19 review: started coming here during the pandemic, and now it's my daily spot. Best cold brew in the game! The lines here definitely get long during the weekday morning hours (everyone seems to be getting 3.5 lattes and then ruminating on a pastry) but always worth it. They also are running what I've deemed to be a silent customer appreciation program here: the baristas are not big on small talk, but a few of them always upgrade my small cold brew to a large and give me extra punches on my punch card. I love them.

I used to work a couple of blocks away so I came here all the time for years. I recently came back to try it again and while they have changed the layout of the place a bit and updated the menu, the service remains something to be desired. I think it depends on who you get because I've dealt with a few of them who are super sweet (I even got a free coffee one time) but the majority of the employees here are very rude and seem to really dislike their jobs.

The coffee and baked goods are good but still way overpriced. I haven't really tried the food except for the bagels, which are decent but don't warrant the high price tag. Lines are also really long and move very slowly, so it's not the place if you're looking for quick service. I will come back because I live in the neighborhood and I like the coffee but there are a lot of other coffee shops I would rather frequent.

Welcome to New York a fun active spot to grab a decent cup of joe -
Wasn't sure what all the buzz about New York Cafe's was and we're big fans of comedians in cars getting coffee- but this place really brought it home- it was like New York and Hollywood and having a chance to sit down in the middle of it all to take it in with an outstanding cup of joe.  Efficient staff, never a dull moment- can't wait 'till Sienfield stops by to film his next segment here.

My girlfriend and I went there on Christmas Eve..
expecting something but not much..
Our experience was fantastic!
The food was incredibly delicious. So good!
We started out with drinks; a lychee martini and bombay 'n tonic.
Both drinks were made to perfection. The alcohol content was just what your palette could hope for( ..not too much, not too little..)
Then we had their hot and sour soup...which also was made to perfection..the soup had just the right amount of spiciness. You could tell the ingredients were fresh. We also had the chicken shumai with a delicious ponsu sauce. Oh my ..., those things really tickle your tastebuds, don't go and not try them! Then we moved on to the duck and Kung Po chicken. I had the chicken. I have had this dish in many restaurants. In Chinese restaurants you are either given a really poor cut of meat or too lean of a cut where the chicken becomes more dry. The taste of the spices and the chicken were perfect. We had a wonderful waiter (possible owner) who had a very cunning sense of humor and constantly made us laugh. We left feeling relaxed, satiated, and just happy!

Incredi Asian Cuisine, Sushi & Bar offers an amazing culinary experience for the price. Numerous lunch specials from pad thai to sushi, all in the $6-$8 dollar range, with good sized portions. I suggest the Incredi Summer Salad with apple, orange, mango, endives, honey walnuts, red wine & vinaigrette. Next time I'm trying the Rock Shrimp Tempura...will let u know...

UPDATE: I'm adding an additional star to my review given that management liked my suggestion and added the Summer Salad to the lunch menu...

Its my neighborhood restaurant so i go to this place a lot for their lunch special ($5.60 and up). The interior is good--whether u are having lunch with your friends or having a casual date. the waitresses there are usually very friendly.
but i dont really recommend their pho, though

A very nice and friendly restaurant. Not as busy or popular as the other restaurants along the block though, but that's good you want a quiet evening out. Food is decent and the kitchen will cook the food to your liking. The dinner noodle portion can be small, so maybe I'll try the sushi entrees next time. I love the hot ginger tea. Very spicy and totally warmed me up. Desserts are a bit pricy though.

Okay... I'm gonna be a tiny buzz kill once again. But I have two words for you about this place... ORDER IN. I went there last night (because Kuv told me to go). Decor... very similar to Ahn, the Vietnamese restaurant before it. Service... here is where it got tricky. It was sort of like the time I had a patient that only communicated with French sign language. (Yeah, I didn't know sign language is different in every language.) I needed two translaters (French to American sign language then American sign language to English) to communicate with the patient. That is sort of like the service. Not a single language issue but a double decker disconnect.
But once that was solved, the food was delicious, fresh and fast and really quite good. The cocktail list was a little too fancy for me (how many brightly colored liqueurs can you mix with pineapple juice?) So order in. Try it. It's good. If you don't go there.

FYI, this establishment is no longer called Incredi; it now goes by the super lame name of Yan Yan Restaurant.  We had a hell of a time trying to find "Incredi" when we were staring at Yan Yan from across the street.

Their lunch offerings were fairly limited compared to Incredi, and the quality of the food was decent.  I was unimpressed by the hot and sour soup, which had no sour and little spiciness.  My boyfriend refused to finish his eggroll, which was far from authentic and straight from the frozen food section at the supermarket.  My boyfriend and I decided to gamble on our food and chose to go with the Pineapple Fried Rice and the Chicken and Mushroom lunch specials, respectively.

The chicken and mushroom lunch was decent.  It was served in a clear white sauce, which is typically used in seafood dishes (such as shrimp).  It was actually reminiscent of Lobster Sauce served by Americanized Chinese restaurants.  Pretty good, but not really what I was expecting.  I feel that this dish would have tasted much better in a brown sauce or something like a garlic saute.  My boyfriend's pineapple fried rice was REALLY REALLY good.  My general rule of thumb when it comes to eating is not to eat sweet things with salty foods mixed together, i.e., pineapple and ham pizza and pb&j sandwiches, but surprisingly, this dish was the redeeming quality of the entire dining experience.  I half-expected the rice to be weird and sweet, but it had a curry-like flavor and appearance (yellowish tint on the rice) and tasted fantastic.  My boyfriend hardly shared with me, but completely understandable.  

It got relatively busy once we finished lunch, so maybe our appetizers were mere flukes.  I would like to give this place another try and test out some other dishes when I'm back in town.  Remember, it is no longer Incredi -- it is YAN YAN Restaurant!  (Try telling your friends that without them thinking it's the Asian snack!)
Note:  this place has changed names since my last review and is now called "Yan Yan".  Food and service remain just as good however!

Incredi NOT. Where do I start? I had not eaten all day and was looking forward to my meal at Incredi based on all the good reviews. I was terribly disappointed in everything, right from the complete lack of taste in the food to the fact my dishes did not contain any of the ingredients mentioned in the menu. The chicken was double deep fried and had hardly any flesh (only skin and junk). Oh, also they forgot to add broccoli and later on brought me a side of STEAMED unseasoned broccoli to throw in. As for the noodles, I had to ask for soy sauce and chilli sauce on the side cause the chef forgot to add absolutely anything to the noodles after they were boiled. The tofu in the noodles was just thrown on top, literally straight from the grocery store package. While the waitress apologized (since the food was untouched 30 minutes later), she made no gesture towards wanting to replace our dishes or improve them in any way. I am never going back.  I respect other Yelpers' good reviews, so I'm hoping I just caught them on a bad day!
I can't believe how reasonably priced this place is.  I also like the mix of Thai and sushi.  You can get things not so spicy too.  Wimp of all wimps here.

Friday, September 27, 2023 @1:00 pm

"The higher the clouds, the finer the weather" and indeed it was.  My daughter Brandy and I were looking for a place to have lunch in the Inwood section of Manhattan and she chose this restaurant.  

Iiana, was the only waitress at this time and she had several other tables to wait on, yet she didn't fail to check and see how everything was and if we needed anything else.  Brandy's dish was the chicken scampi with linguine.  The menu says shrimp scampi, but she requested chicken instead.  I had chicken francaise with linguine, seasoned with garlic and oil.  Both dishes were good.  

Il Sole has a relaxing atmosphere and good customer service plus live jazz every Thursday from 4:30 - 7:30 pm.  

#ilsole #ilsolerestaurant #nyc #dinner #lunch #seafood #pasta #pizza #soup #salad #livejazz #greatcustomerservice #forkfeed #good #foodblog #foodiesofinstagram  #foodstagram #foods #instablogger #instagramblog #instafood #instagramblogger #instragram

The food here was so amazing, honestly finding Italian food is so hard sometimes. But the penne alla vodka with grilled chicken was soooo good. The berria pizza was so delicious and don't forget to ask for the Burria soup

Went for a quick lunch and was seated right away. There was only 2 tables occupied and this is the Sunday before Memorial Day. The server was friendly, food came quickly, and the price was affordable. The bathrooms were clean too.

Honestly I just came here last night to have a couple of beers. First impression was excellent, the place smelled really good, clean. Drinks menu is different and they have many many options of liquors. The service was excellent, they really made me feel like they wanted me to have a good time. Next time I'll try out the food.

Food is soo yummy
The pull apart bread is a must for an app
The clams are tasty
Drinks are good
frugal spot
Nice vibe outdoor seating

Great Live Jazz Happy Hour every Thursday.
Along with Awesome food and cocktails.
Friendly staff.

Il Sole brings a combination of Italian comfort food with the vibe of Uptown. The staff is attentive and helpful and the food was delicious!

Congrats to Sandra and the team!
Excellent food.  Best Eggplant Parmigiana I have ever had.  No joke.  Tiramisu soooo good.  Highly recommend

It's 90 degrees today and I wanted to try a restaurant that I've never tried before. I wanted something light but filling and fresh. I saw some of the dishes that people were enjoying and while dining at il Sole and thought why not?! The outdoor seating on Dyckman was PACKED but I saw a table opening up and swooped right in the menu had two "QR" codes one for Il Sole (which is Italian, I thought it was seafood) and the other is Sa Tacos, so again, why not?? Let's do a lil' of both!! I ordered Tinga tacos as a starter and the grilled salmon for an entrée with a side of sautéed spinach and mashed potatoes.
Everything was amazing!!! Exceeded expectations. Just go check it out, have something healthy (I like to eat clean) and oh yeah if you drink, have a Gatsby, I added a splash of sparkling for that spritzer effect   Now all I need is a cigar and I don't even smoke.

I frequent my visits in the Dyckman strips for years now, but for whatever reason never stepped foot into Il Sole. Went on a Friday night after work to catch the happy hour which consisted of $6 Sangria, Margaritas, and I believe some beers.
Me and my friend had the sangria to kick off then later on the passion fruit margarita. We sat at the bar and was serviced by the AMAZING bartender Gabby! We were soo impressed with her service as it's rate to find within the surrounding establishments. She was very attentive to us and made us feel comfortable throughout our whole stay. We did order some appetizers which hit the spot too.
Overall, great customer service, good ambiance although small, but cute. Good for small groups and music not too loud that allows for conversation. I would definitely go back and recommend to others. I look forward trying some of the entrees.

Super good food !! The service was awesome and we were treated nicely.
I will be back, thanks.

This place has gone down hill.  Before pandemic we ordered often. It was delicious at some point,  not sure if they've changed chef or have new owners, because its definitely not authentic Italian at least it's not anymore.  It's salty and seems canned or bottled tomato sauce.  Mozzarella cheese on garlic bread is sprinkled on and never have we ever had it served like this.  We received our penne allá vodka over creamed didn't even taste nothing like it but my husband was hungry and ate what he could.  I know good food and this is not the first time ordering from here we've tried ordering several times in the past year and still are disappointed.  We have even tried dining there and yet service and food have never reached our expectations.  Even though I have recently been just reviewing we're personally big critics on food good or bad.  We've wined and dined so we do know what is to be expected.  If you're going to charge these amounts of prices on your food, presentation and fresh ingredients are highly important in Italian cuisine. Food it's not being checked before serving or going out or they just don't care.

Ordered the grilled chicken cutlet sandwich with fresh mozzarella and roasted red peppers.  Samdwich cam with only lettuce and tomato
No fresh mozzarella! No roasted peppers
C'mon II Solei! I could have gotten that sandwich from the corner bodega! If you want my money-  DO BETTER

I really like the ambiance of Il Sole, i really liked this place to be honest, so I will explain why I didn't give 5 stars belowwwww...

Me, my partner, my twin and her partner joined my cousin and his girl here last Saturday night (daylight savings night unfortunately). First thing I have to say, this is probably one of the safest restaurants around Dyckman.

The owner walks around through the night to make sure everything is perfect for everyone one, which is awesome!
While we were on line to go into Il Sole, another guy ahead of us on the line seemed to be a little too drunk and started an argument with the bouncer. Of course, the bouncer didn't let him in and explained to all of us that he's responsible for letting people in and couldn't let in a person who seems to be intoxicated prior to the entry plus a problem maker. I felt really good by his actions.

We didn't order food due to we had gotten there around 1 am and we had come out of a restaurant. Because the time was to advance an hour ahead when it marked 2, the waitress advised for us to order two pitchers of Margaritas instead of one because once 3 hits, they usually don't sell more drinks. We did as she said.

We had a lot of fun. Drinks were LOADED!!! Really strong but really really good!!!
Now, the reason I gave it 4 stars although I had a great experience here is while our waitress was being polite enough to serve all our drinks.
She was also grabbing our straws by the top, that part that you put in your mouth to be exact. I tried to grab mine because my sister and me were disgusted by the fact that she was doing that and she kind of confronted me and told me she was the waitress and she was the one giving the straws to all of us. I couldn't tell her she was doing wrong cause she had this "I know it all" attitude but didn't enjoy watching her do that to us and can't imagine how others feel if she does that to others as well.

Other than that, i had a GREAT time and definitely want to go back when we don't loose a whole hour because of daylight savings.

This was once one of my favorite places to eat, but they seriously have been lacking lately...last night I ordered a shrimp and chicken mofongo.... this absolutely the worst mofongo I've ever tried in my life.  Zero flavor..no taste of garlic... nothing... the shrimps was uncleaned ... they didnt bother to cut the top of the shrimps to take the shit out of it, the chicken tasted like they just boiled it...pure white.... I told my waiter and she changed it... I then got the churrasco with mashed potatoes.... the mashed potatoes was fine but the churrasco tasted like the steak was spoiled.... at this point I just gave up

I walked in and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and incredible aroma of baking pizza. This is an amazing Italian restaurant and it's a must go to. I recommend their pasta, starting with the scampi, their bar tender/mixologist can make any drink you want.
love the place. Amazing food and drinks and a good lounge atmosphere when they have special events!!  deff a most try.  pizza's are wonderful!

Hmmm this one is complicated for me since I really really really enjoyed the food and mojitos lol.

Everything else just drags the star potential down.

1- People are right. The service leaves much to be desired. We had a hard time asking for things we needed. It wasn't even busy that night. The employees seem mostly focused on socializing with the others. I saw some smoking hookah with the customers, huddling in little corners to talk chisme. I had to ask someone else for the check because I swear our girl had gone home without telling us or something.

2-This place is overpriced for what it is. To me, this was a tastier version of Olive Garden. $5 to add chicken to fettuccine. $9 to add shrimp to penne alla vodka or whatever it's called (friend ordered that, so I don't recall).

3-The music was kind of weird for me. Madonna on a Friday night is cool, but as soon as you're playing more than one of her songs I'm just wondering if it's a theme night or something.

Nice restaurant with great Italian food. They have a seafood and Italian menu . They also have a pizza menu. The food is pretty good. I had Mac and cheese lobster and my friends got ravioli lobster and penne alla vodka everything came out delicious. The one thing I would say is that some of our foods were brought out first then the others. And the service was not as fast but they only had one girl working multiple tables.  They have hookah here and happy hour until 7. They also have wine for 9$ and cocktails 12-17$ . This is is a nice chill spot with pretty good food.

You can: Eat, drink, hookah smoke and party here indoor &  al fresco!
Came here for my cousin's birthday brunch on a Sunday ( 6/3/2018)
We were a large party of 10.
Our party was SUPER accommodated!
We actually ended up ordering from their dinner menu bc of the time.
So many apps, entrees and signature cocktails were ordered. We ended up ordering bottles to our table and ordering hookahs afterwards and stayed past our meal to party!

Here is my experience & review:

I do everything on a rating of 1 to 5 star, with 1 being tragic and 5 Terrific!  

Food- 3.5 stars overall
1.Churrasco(cooked medium)con tostones- 3.0
2. Penne al vodka- 3.0 stars
3. Calamari 2.8 stars
4. Chicken cacciatore- 5 stars
5. Mofongo con camarones en salsa blanca- 5

Drinks- 5 stars overall
1. Firecracker- Hendrix gin base with watermelon. Strong yet super refreshing-5 star
2. Moscow Mule -standard,but done well- 5 star
3. Mimosas- 4 star

Customer service- 5 star ! The managers worked alongside our wait staff to make sure our experience was excellent!  Julio was EXCELLENT!

Ambiance- 5 star! Perfect place to watch and be watched on a nice summer late afternoon.  The people watching is great.  There was a live dj spinning a great vibe of deep house and afro deep house, Debow,  and some salsa & merengue.  

Decor- Posh with clean modernity and pop art work and paintings.

I came here for happy hour because I've heard from multiple friends that this is the best place to be.

It was a nice Tuesday evening( 7pm)  and my girlfriend and I came to have a dinner date.

The happy hour menu immediately caught my eye. Sangria for $5? Pizza for $10? Like how could I not order anything else !

I opted for a white sangria which was very refreshing, and I ordered the ricotta pizza. The pizza was cooked to perfection and the cheese was really good. My friend ordered sliders and fries which was also really good.
Both orders arrived in a timely manner.

The overall ambiance is very uptown, if you've never been to dyckman expect loud music playing in the background. If you're not for music then I wouldn't recommend this neighborhood. I happen to love dyckman especially in the summer time !

Lastly I want to add that if you're a hookah smoker I suggest coming here. The hookah is only $20! Our hookah stayed lit for a little over an hour and was prepared very well, the hookah didn't have that horrible after taste and was very smooth.

I would most definitely come back again with friends. The pricing is great and the service was just as good. I had a good time here and have 0 complaints.

Very good food but the service should improve, only one has good service.

The employees must have more sensitivity and be more friendly because it is not asking, we pay to consume, and they work for their tips.

5 star for the kitchen, 1 star for the service especially the bar.

I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this place!
We had our son's first birthday party here last week-- everything was amazing! The food, the space, and the staff.

The food was outrageous!! Our guests raved about it. Everything from the house salad, to the penne alla vodka, to the chicken scarpariello was so well flavored and seasoned. Sandra was so incredibly accommodating with the menu; I am gluten free and have several food allergies, but she was able to have everything prepared to meet my needs (the whole spread was made GF!). In fact, we had come there for dinner one night a couple weeks before the party to try the food, and she literally had one of the staff go to the store to buy the GF pasta and flour for me. I was so touched. Also, some of our guests were vegan, and they were able to prepare a special dish for them that was not included on our menu, which was totally above and beyond.  

We had the whole restaurant to ourselves, which was really nice and perfect for our party size (we had 50 guests including children).  They put away any equipment/wires that were not necessary for the party to make it more children-friendly, which was really nice.
The location is also excellent-- being so close to the HH parkway and Harlem River Drive made it super convenient for our guests coming from NJ and LI. Sandra also helped us out with finding parking for our large group, which was awesome.

And last but not least, the staff was so kind and courteous; all of our guests commented on how nice everyone was, and how well everyone worked together as a team.

Our whole family was so impressed overall with the quality of service. Our parents both commented on the fact that when they come into the city to visit us, they want to go out to dinner here!

I love their food, I haven't visited for a while now due to COVID. I know this place takes about 45 to 1 hour to serve their food to clients but it's because they prepare it fresh, and honestly speaking, I prefer that anytime rather than having frozen food served in my plate. This place deserves a better rating.

You will definitely really like Il Sole. This place is great at what it does. Wonderful food, Surf and Turf was excellent without a doubt. This Surf and Turf was done just perfectly. Workers are really pleasant and service is really swift. Great location and we will be back.

This restaurant has so much potential. Service during the day is great...but in the evening/night...not so much. Decor is beautiful. All white. Bathrooms are always clean. Every time I've gone there was a dj playing reggaeton & hip hop/reggae. They offer hookah in the evenings ($30 cash only). On Tuesdays they have an all night happy hour starting at noon I believe...it gets incredibly packed. Ok now on to the food.

Eggplant rollatini is what I usually get here, adding shrimp sometimes. Very good.
Cheese ravioli - so good!
Salmon- pretty basic grilled salmon & slighty overcooked.
Penne ala vodka with shrimp- Ok
Cod with mash & asparagus- fish was definitely overcooked...so dry, mashed potatoes needed salt, asparagus were...asparagus.

The drinks are pretty (flavored mojitos, margaritas, and sangrias) but it depends on who's the bartender whether its strong or not.

I've never had dessert here.

I give this place 5 stars because of the workers.  Staff should be retrained and taught how to greet patrons, bring water when asked and check in on their tables from time to time.

I came in on a Saturday early afternoon, the waitress who attended our table was just busy speaking to the other employees by the bar.  I had to "disturb" her chat at the bar, and ask her after 20-25 mins waiting for my entrée, if she can go check on the status.  Guess what?  She came right out with my plate, meaning my plate must have been sitting back there but the staff was too busy chatting to notice.

I had order from the brunch menu and never got asked what I wanted to drink.  I had to ask her to bring me a drink and remind her I ordered the brunch menu so I have an hour or so of bottomless drinks.  I chose a soda, but come on, I should NOT need to remind an employee what is included in a brunch menu.

Now, the food, I wish I can give that four stars.  The food had great flavor and it was a great portion.

Came to Il sole with a friend and our waitress had to take care of a birthday and had advised us that she was going to be unavailable for 15 mins and asked if we needed anything before she went away. She was super sweet and showed us a waiter that can take care of us in the event that we needed anything. I had the lobster Mac and cheese, the dish was very creamy and cheesy and there was a lot of lobster junks. Super good! My friend had the Italian pizza; two ppl can def share since it's a lot. she said she really enjoyed it and the pizza was crispy. The garlic bread with cheese was okay, could've been better. If the bread was toasted a bit more it would tasted better. For a drink I had the guava frosè. It was good, after two I felt good. Would recommend.

Im so sad, this used to be my go to place for lasagna but last night I ordered it go and was so disappointed at the way they're making it now. they must of changed their Chef because who uses cheddar cheese on a lasagna? It was so bad I couldn't even eat it. Please bring the old chef back this one doesn't know what he's doing

HORRIFYING EXPERIENCE (Lice Found)
I decided to try this place out today after passing it a few times and right from the start, I could tell it wasn't going to be good. My server (I believe her name was Sandra) looked like she hadn't bathed in quite some time, but I don't judge. After she brought me my food, I noticed a small ant like insect so I called her over like any other paying customer would and she immediately apologized to me and said "I thought I got rid of it all" and then offered to pay for the meal herself. What the hell is this establishment doing letting these kinds of unhygienic people handle food?! I would not recommend anyone ever eating here I'm sorry.

My cousin suggested for us to come here for Sunday brunch because their food and drinks were good. Our brunch included an appetizer, entree and I believe the drinks were unlimited for 1.5 hours. First off their brunch is all off, hardly any egg options. It's mostly pasta and burgers; I got the burger which was dry and not tasty at all. The drinks were all watered down and I decided to stop drinking them since I was getting full of water with them.  They're probably popular for dinner because I will never return here for brunch. It should've been a sign when there was only 2 other tables with people in there.

What they have going for them is the décor, very classy and modern at the same time with mostly all white color theme which makes them stand out in the Dyckman Street area, small but cute and welcoming.
Horrible experience manager/owner was very rude . Owner was prejudice and it was so sad because the food was good

I've been here during the day, early evening and during late nights. The best time to get good service is during the day and early evening.

When we arrived to get seated, I noticed a sign that says: "2 Hour Limit". I never seen a sign like that at a restaurant. It gave me an uninviting vibe. The sign will give bad business, because Dyckman is mostly latino family oriented. If I bring my 6 cousins and 6 aunts to come eat at this place, we will need more than 2 hours to eat, chat, and enjoy our time.

The service DURING THE DAY, is good. Our server was very attentive to us. The food and pina colada are delicious-- we had a chicken parm pizza and a pina colada with rum.

Unfortunately this restaurant has suffered greatly during covid and now their food doesn't taste the same. They must have switched kitchen staff and hired a worse chef, or they are now forced to use bad ingredients. In any case, The penne ala vodka with extra chicken was very bland, chicken lacked flavor and it was just really bad quality. The sauce seems like it was from a can with no type of seasoning at all. even the pasta lacked seasoning too. Everything was just really bland and watered down. The eggplant rollatini tasted spoiled and the mozzarella was low quality. the garlic bread was cheap bread and not even toasted properly, it was cold in some spots. Which is crazy since the restaurant is 5 minutes away. All in all this place has gone downhill and it's a shame since they charge so much I'd expect better ingredients. oh well.
