I normally don't right review but this was necessary. After leaving the hair salon really wanted a good dirty martini. I decided to go to Il Sol. Always a good experience but not tonight. One of the worst dirty martini's I've ever had. When I asked the bartender how she made it she became very defensive. These are the olives I always use. They brought the olives from the kitchen so I'm guessing they use it to cook. That's why I was tasting oil in my Martini. The bartender proceeded to ask the other patrons very loudly at the bar if these olives tasted weird. No need. Check please! Do better or find another job!

Went here with my two friends on a Sunday night. We just wanted good conversation and drinks, so we only ordered appetizers as opposed to a main course. We ordered fried  calamari n some type of scrimp scampi on top of platanos. Both meal choices were tasty. We ordered the white Sangria and it was good, but my friend and I both had headaches at the end of the night...that was strange.
The waitress was super cool. Very attentive and pleasant. The one thing that I didn't like about this place was that there was 20% gratuity added to the bill. Now don't get me wrong, she definitely earned her tip, but I just like having the option. Also, there is a live dj. He played a good mixture of music, but it was extremely too loud for a restaurant. I felt like I was in a club. All in all, the experience was pleasant and I would return

Came here with family for a Sunday dinner. This is NOT a family place. The music was so loud that we had to yell at each other. Hookah everywhere, although we specified we wanted a hookah free zone.
The service was great and so was the food. But if you're coming here with family this is not your place.

Okay, everybody knows that food on Dyckman isn't the best but Il Sole never lets me down. You want the try Dyckman/Uptown experience without being overwhelmed by the people and prices? Go to Il Sole!!! They service hookah outside and inside but the smell and smoke is not overpowering! They are my go to spot in uptown when I want to turn up and be humble about it!

They do a have good food but for me it's too loud to call as a restaurant, I prefer go there for drinks and hookah
Summer there it's pretty cool they have outside sitting

Maybe I will be back

Like the other yelper mentioned. This restaurant has a lot of potential. But then again, this area is dedicated to a certain type of crowd who will suffice with whatever they get and pay the money. I live around the block. I prefer to come here during the day when is less crowded I get better service.

About 3 weeks ago I came here on a Sunday. The outside tables were all taken and there were about 2 tables taken inside. (If you have been here you know they have a decent spaced place compared to the other restaurants) I was waiting for my other friend to join me and the first thing the waitress tells me after I get seated is "you can only stay for 2 hours" ON AN EMPTY RESTAURANT at 4PM. Come on. I would understand if it was crowded, I get that. But this is just bad service. Some of the staff could use more customer service training.
And, of course, I stood longer than 2 hours. After pointing out to her there were barely any people inside!

Does not seem like an Italian restaurant the servers could barely speak English but ok.

Pros: The fried calamari and brushetta were delicious and fresh. The penne ala vodka with chicken was tasty and the portions were large. Overall I enjoyed the vibe;  a live jazz band was playing.

Cons: If you dont mind the smell of Hookah or the smoke being blown to your face while eating (which seems to be the usual for any restaurant past 96st) then this is a nice restaurant.
One of my favorite restaurants in the Dyckman area since it's first day opened.  Great food, phenomenal service and incredible ownership.  Authentic Italian food in a beautiful Dominican community.

Another great spot on dyckman but it can get very loud in the evening. They have an indoor restaurant which is very nicely decorated and elegant, we sat on the outside patio, party of 2 so seating was available quickly, The servers were very attentive. We had a caprese salad and the arugula prosciutto pizza and sauvignon blanc wine. Will def be back to try more dishes.

The food is the best, we went ther on sunday a take the brunch menu, the mimosa is very good too. I really have a great time here. I went to celebrate my wedding anniversary, our waiter was Luis he really make a good job with us. The have good music and a guy was playing the batery. I don't why rhe have low stars cuz for me tha nigth was just perfect. Oh and I really love the have area for not smoking hooka!

Hubby and I was looking for a place to have brunch on Sunday and we stumbled across this place. The vibe was great they had a drummer playing to latest hits which was awesome! The food omg it was not just delicious the price topped it off. We will definitely be back!

Came here for brunch with my mom and my sister yesterday afternoon. We sat outside as it was nice and hot yesterday. The place itself is beautiful and spacious. They have a dj for brunch that plays cool 80s throwbacks that had me jamming while sipping on my mimosas. The server took a while to take our order. Which is probably my only complaint about this place. The service could've been faster. They took pretty long to refill drinks and it wasn't really crazy busy. But the server was really nice and friendly. I got the bruschetta salad as an app which was delicious. The mozzarella cheese was fresh. Dressing was spot on. As an entree I got the shrimp Alfredo ($9 extra for shrimp). The Alfredo was amazingly tasty and was a huge portion which I ended taking to go. I would love to come back and try their popsicle cocktail. Unfortunately I was too full to get one afterwards lol. Out of all the restaurants on the dyckman strip, il sole is number 1 on how delicious the food is and their presentation is.

The food is amazing
The Staff are educated and actually care about customer service
Tuesday Nights are really fun!
The drinks are very good.

On a Monday afternoon, my hubby and I were looking for a quick place to celebrate both our birthdays. The whole weekend had been a bust so we weren't expecting much. We ended up coming here and I must say it was definitely worth it. Our waiter Mikey was absolutely amazing throughout our whole time here. He went above and beyond his job and was super attentive. He totally redeemed our weekend let down and made us feel welcomed and celebrated. I would totally recommend this pace. Btw, the food and drinks were fabulous too!
The service and food are both impeccable. They have an amazing Sunday brunch and they continuously refill your drinks even after brunch ends. They also have a live DJ.

This is the third time I came to this restaurant. In the first time, was in the end of May. The restaurant was only serving take out due to COVID. The penne and Hennessy Frose was delicious. The last two times I came for their outdoor seating. The staff members wear masks at all times, the food was good, but the service isn't great. We asked for several things such as; ketchup, napkins, forks, and never got them. The food is so good,but the service isn't great.

Such a delicious place! I got three pizzas for $11. Pepperoni, a ground beef with lots of vegetables on top, and a thick cheese. My favorite was the ground beef because it was such a pleasant surprise. Never had something like that before. felt like taco meat on a pizza with delicious sauce!

The thick cheese, my first bite I thought, that crunched like cardboard. Not the best first impression, but that's a harsh critique. It was a good slice but my least fav.

The pepperoni was so solid. So good. Definitely recommend.

Nice Latino music that I Shazammed whiled inside. Not very busy. The place is really clean and looks brand new.
Lunch special and quite inexpensive, ordered the salmon meatballs, best deal in town. It had a relaxed atmosphere and everyone was charming.
Good place for lunch and drinks, it's pretty busy for 12pm in the heights.  Service and ambiance were great.  Only thing is my friend had the chicken and said it was pretty dry.  Rest is a ok!

This was our second time here.  The first time was had a great time but when we came back to the Bar and Grill and had a very uncomfortable experience.  It was a party of 6 and it seems that your wait staff kept coming over to our table, picking up every glass and dish while reaching over our food.  We being watch every second. Which was not done to the other tables. In return we still made it like we had the best time.  Our bill was over $300 and got treated like we was stealing.  I WILL NOT BE RETURNING this place to spend my money in again.  I will say watch how spanish people get treated then watch how black people get treated.  Never again!!!!!! P.S. I take pictures wherever I go and have a good time regardless.

As of late I'm realizing that I have been late to the party more often then not. I'm gonna say 3yrs of the "panoramic" has put me off my game. However, as I penned this review I'm giving more then a few of my Yelp friends some serious side-eye because they knew about this place for years and didn't put me on... shameful!

Nonetheless, I made it to IB&G for lunch the other day and I was pleasantly surprised by a few things. First by how big and spacious it is and secondly how nice and gracious everyone was. Lastly and most importantly how good the food was and how much they give for their very discounted lunch menu.

They have lunch special where most dishes are only $5 until 4pm and also Happy Hour all day up until 8pm. Not only is the price surprising but so is the decent serving size.

In my party of three the orders were:

-Chicken Fillet in Pepper Sauce Lunch w/ Arroz Amarillo (my dish)
-Roasted Chicken Lunch w/ Arroz Blanco
-Fried Pork Chops Lunch w/ Arroz Blanco ($7)

All the dishes were accompanied by a side Habichuelas (beans). The food was extremely tasted. I particularly enjoyed the chicken in pepper sauce, it was totally different from how it was described by our lovely waitress Yury. That's not a complaint she was great and she tried to describe it the best she could (English is her 2nd language).

Overall a great lunch experience with some good options. I would have preferred that the temp on my dish was much hotter but that's just me. As well as the white sangria was better then the red, again my preference.

Just A Note:

Not every lunch dish is $5 some are a couple of bucks more. Please note the lunch specials are for Dine-In, the price differs for To-Go orders.

I've been to Inwood Bar and Grill a few times and was very impressed on my last visit with how fast and efficient the service was. We came in around 1pm before it became packed with the brunch crowd. I ordered yuca fries and fried cheese, and my friend got El Dominicano brunch special that came with mangu, eggs, and fried cheese. It also included a small soup and flan for dessert. The food arrived right away! I really liked the yuca fries because they were not extremely dry which tends to be the case with fried yuca. The fried cheese was really good. I tried the mangu, and it was good, but needed a bit more butter/salt. I had the coconut margarita and it was delicious. This is a great spot if you're into watching sports. They have lots of televisions and a giant projector that takes up a whole wall.

Went here for brunch but the line was so long that by the time we got inside, brunch was over. It was super crowded so service was pretty slow. We ended up only being able to get some appetizers and drinks. I've been here a few times though and it's always this crowded. Vibe is always like a club so don't come here if you want to be able to have a meal and talk with your group. You'll have to scream to be able to hear each other. It's always a good time though. The food and drinks have never let me down.

This place is always a vibe.. ive been here on a friday night for drinks at the bar. On sunday brunch on a saturday night with the girls. It never dissapoint. Its very loud so dont come here if you plan to chill and talk!  Happy hour prices are amazing. Food ehhh is a hit or miss sometimes. Big portion tho! Servers are friendly and nice bathroom for your selfies.
Overpriced garbage with bad service. Worst Caesar salad of my life and even worse calamari.

I came here for brunch. The food was okay. I had a quesadilla and it was mostly cheese with big pieces of chicken. The guac was okay, it tasted like lime. The flan was really good. The drinks were good as well. Ill give the drinks a 7/10.

The service however, was great. EQ was a great server and was ordering our unlimited drinks before we finished.

The ambiance was lively. Good music and good vibes.

Traveled from Los Angeles, tried this place.. Best drink ever. Helen hands down the best bartender. Drinks where stiff but delicious.
Food was great. Dj was playing great music

Inwood bar and grill is such a vibe! AQ took such good care of us! The calamari, wings, & sliders were delicious. I cannot believe they had premium margaritas on happy hour. As a Margarita lover that made my entire night. We were also celebrating my friends birthday and the staff made that extremely special! Thank you so much I really appreciate the service!

Beautiful place and amazing music.

Poor customer service.

Made reservations for upstairs a week prior and the day of they put us in the basement and told us it's our problem. It was up to us if we want it or not.

Flooding happened under our table and moved us about 1 foot away from the puddle. Asked for some sort of discount or accommodation since we all got wet but it was our problem. Rude white waiter.

Place has a lot of potential. Workers are just rude
Bad experience. Waited almost an hour for someone to take our order. It's very loud which I don't mind. Unfortunately I never got to taste the food.

I'm giving Inwood 2 stars because they exist. Inwood Bar is a multi-level restaurant on Broadway in 207th St that maximizes their indoor spacious Bar area, outside glass-enclosed patio and a downstairs under these colorful upside-down umbrellas.....for non-vaccinated humans.

I feel brunch should be the greatest meal around. Here? It's actually the worst. Every now and then, my friend, her boyfriend, hubs and I get together to catch up- especially, since we no longer work together. It just so happened, we were chatting it up over Sunday Brunch here in their patio.

The four of us picked the $14.95 Brunch pre-fixe menu with a choice of Caesar or soup+an Entree (several to pick from)+Dessert(only Flan) and single Mimosas not included. Hubs picked the 'Chicken & Waffles'- so did my friend, her guy picked the Steak & Eggs and I went for the Nutella French Toast. The first, had rock-hard waffles and inedible "fried" chicken, the second meal was ok (accordingly to my friend's boyfr.) and my Nutella "French Toast" was nothing but store-bought, frozen crap.

While we didn't get ill after eating here, I did feel sick about how much the guys spent on a second-rate meal. I know. It's hard to hear. No one likes to hear their Brunch menu is being slandered- but does this place get more than that? Nahhh.

7 Young black men- we all received atrocious service the night of the Tank Fight. We arrived early in the night with our entire party and was told that there were no tables available- "all tables were reserved" yet upon entering, we saw that they were an abundance of open tables with no "reserved" place holders to be seen. At one point in time we were standing at the bar and watched individual ( 1 by 1) walk in and be seated at tables by themselves.
Servers were not even trying to provide service to us. Being that we were standing at the bar, we asked one server who adamantly watching us, how do we go about ordering food and she told us we needed to speak with the head hostess standing at the door (YES a hostess wearing a white shirt told us we needed to speak to the head hostess in order to order food). The final straw came when we were in the back left corner by the bar, standing next to a few tables and was told that we needed to step away from the tables because they were reserved.

From the moment we encountered the head hostess at the door, the service was very suspect. We should not have had to ask to use the bathroom in order to be let in, just to eventually make our way over to the bar. In our short time there we received several dirty looks from the staff (wearing white shirts) and also noticed that our presence was an issue for them by the looks on their faces.

Overall it seems the people who run the establishment cater to their own and make it difficult and uncomfortable if you don't look like them. Needless to say I can't recommend this place- but i would hope the establishment see this and makes some changes. If not- just don't go here if you don't look like the ppl work there.

This was my first time here, I came with my sisters in law. We came early for lunch before getting the kids and the environment was so peaceful.
Everything we ordered was $5 except the drinks and Quesadilla.

I ordered the BBQ Chicken Wings with Fries and the Shrimp Quesadilla, along with the PassionFruit Fish Bowl. When I say this food was delicious I mean so delicious. The shrimp was cooked prefect in the quesadilla, I don't know what kind of cheese was in it but it was melty wonderfulness. The chicken even though coated on sauce was still crispy. My sister got the pork chops with rice and wings with no sauce along with a Pina colada.
They sure know how to make a phenomenal drink. These drinks put me to sleep lol.
I wanna thank our waitress Cherly for an amazing experience. This was our first time here and we will diffently be back for happy hour and hopefully have Cherly again.

I have been here twice and that's enough for me. If you are not Spanish YOU WILL BE TREATED DIFFERENTLY. Parking is horrible so don't drive there unless you want to partake in their valet. Overall service is trash, music is mainly latin/latin hip hop and a uncomfortable vibe if you are not Spanish. Also as others have said make a reservation or else they will give you a hard time. But I suggest going elsewhere like Lagos for a better vibe honestly it's not worth it. You will walk out just like I did.

I'm reviewing this for the weekend brunch. I came here for brunch after my half marathon it's a great spot. The service was very attentive Jessica was so sweet And provided excellent service. The food for bunch was super affordable and tasted delicious. I had the skirt steak with yuka fries. You get an appetizer , entree and desert that included a soft drink. I also got one mimosa if you WNAT unlimited you can add it for 15$ more. Definitely go visit if you're in the area great for large groups and birthdays they have an outdoor section as well.

I came in here the other day after not being here since Covid. Mind you I tried to place my order over the phone and was told "WE DON'T TAKE PHONE ORDERS". I'm just going to say I was completely displeased with staff and owners might want to check the honesty of some.

When I walked in the front desk host was just chatting with another employee and I had to wait until she was done to be addressed (and it was NOT work related). She takes my order and tells me $8. I know it has been a while since I've been there so I asked if the $5 lunch special wasn't still there. She told me it has gone up. I said okay and has her a $10 bill. She puts it in HER POCKET and resumes a convo. As I'm still standing there she tells me it'll be a few minutes. I tell her I want my change. She giggles and says oh yea and hands me my $2. I go outside to wait.

When I come back for my food there's a line so I notice the scan menu on the table. Low and behold the menu still says $5. I asked for a receipt with my item and she didn't want to provide it. I was short on time and didn't have time to get a manager but there went the tip I normally would have given.

The food tasted fine. Got chuletas with tostones. Fried perfectly, not greasy. Just needed more flavor. Missed the garlic sauce I used to get with the tostones.

Love the vibe in this place!
Brought my friends from Puerto Rico here on a Saturday night and had a great time! The DJ played a great mix, but most of it was Spanish music. We loved it, but there were a lot of people who were annoyed with the music selection. Hookah was good, but pretty pricey ($40).
Our waitress was super attentive and the prices for drinks/food were reasonable.
Definitely try to make reservations, as the line outside does get pretty long!

Came for a post-race brunch with a large group of ladies. Our server, Jessica was really sweet and was on point. I opted for the regular brunch option without the bottomless option. For 14.95, you get an app, entree and dessert. I got the chicken and waffles as my entree, and the portion was generous. I didn't take a picture bc I wolfed down my food :D lol.

I recommend this for a large group as prices are really reasonable. They okay a variety of music and the ambiance is really good.
Yenny was awesome! She was very attentive and gave great service! The $5 lunch special was delicious and decent portions!

Always yummy food with delicious lunch specials. My favorite waitress Lisa always makes the best drinks and she is a staple in the community for creating great dining experiences in INWOOD. I love coming here for lunch and Happy Hour. She always greets me a smile and knows my favorite drink.
The $5 menu is unbeatable during lunch hours and the Monday dinner specials are really good too.
If your in the neighborhood definitely make a trip to Inwood
La comida is ok. Pero el servicio no muy bueno y lo que no me gusta es que siempre te incluyen la propina aún que seas una persona lo cual no está especificado en el menú.

Ordered from here on seamless and have spent time in the restaurant. Happy with both experiences. They have a great choice of food and $5 lunch specials, which is unheard of. We have gone and ordered 4 for variety and they are also a smaller portion. I have enjoyed everything! The drinks are good too and they have happy hour and outside patio. Love the baby back ribs and the chow fun rice.

I had a great time here. I love the set up that they have during this pandemic; it is really cute!! The service was also great!!

The food was amazing and the drinks were STRONG. My bulldog margarita was so big, that I was actually kind of embarrassed when it came out LMAO.

This place gets five stars all around.

OMG I'm so glad that I found this place!

I applaud them for using their outdoor backyard space and transforming it into something festive, colorful and lively.

My girlfriends and I had brunch on Sunday.  We had an early reservation and the place was empty when we arrived but that soon changed.

As soon as we were seated water was brought over and our waitress came to take our drink and appetizer orders.  For $34.95 you get a two hour unlimited drink brunch with three courses - what a great deal!  What was even more surprising was the fact that they had quite a few alcoholic beverages that you could get with brunch.  Most places have only mimosas or sangria and sometimes bellinis.  They did have those, but you could also choose a screwdriver, bloody mary or vodka and cranberry.  We had the bellinis which were good and just kept coming so we were happy campers.

For appetizer you have a choice of chicken noodle soup or cesar salad.  The main course selections are pretty similar to most other restaurants, pancakes, eggs, burger, etc.  I ordered the steak and shrimp with french fries as my side.  I ordered my steak medium, but received it medium rare.  It was a little too rare for my liking but since I never send my food back I just dealt with it.  My girlfriends ordered the salmon, french toast and the quesadilla.  I tasted the quesadilla and it was really good.  In fact, we all agreed the food was good.  There's only one dessert option which is flan.  I'm not a fan of flan (say that three times fast lol) but my girlfriends said it was really good.

We were all very impressed with Inwood Bar and Grill and we will definitely go back again.
Went with friends for happy hour. The waiter provided good service. The food was good EXCEPT for the breaded wings, which had very little wing and was tasteless. But everything else was fine.

Came to enjoy a light dinner with my family members as we always do but today we was rushed I didn't understand why. I didn't even get to finish my wings n she took my plate too fast did my even wanna replace my wings

I came here for my birthday on 2/5 made a reservation and we were quickly let in but the server was terrible she was an older lady she was  rushing our entire meal she took off our appetizer without asking if we were done then when I left to use the bathroom my food was gone even tho I still had a lot leftover and my table also ordered hookah and when I came back my pipe was missing because she had taken it off with my plate additionally prior to going to the bathroom she never mentioned anything in regards to our time limit being up but as soon as we came back she told us to leave because other people were waiting outside ??! Yet the table next to us was there before us and stayed till after
Great experience and waiter was very friendly. The food is bar type food so if that's not your preference wouldn't recommend !

A 3.7 for food and I'm rounding up. We sat in the outdoor dinning area upstairs on a Friday night. The pros: above average comfort bar food with a twist and bouncers plus servers alike are friendly. The cons: this place tries to do too much both in the food and music department. They "try" hard with Dominican fusion on the menu and American while also having a DJ to turn the bar and grill into a club. I will have ambiance be the first category and food second instead for that reason.

Ambiance: N/A
This really depends on what you are looking for. If you were thinking loud bar plus hookah on top of liquor and border lining dance club with food, then this is your place. The music is loud and there are speakers outdoor too  (at least upstairs outdoor) so you can hear announcements from the radio and hear the music the DJ is playing in the main dinning area

Food: 3.7 out of 5
Wings in Thai flavor
Perfect amount of sweetness with a hint of spicy. The wings are over fried, but you cannot tell because there's enough Thai sauce to cover it
French fries
The fries weren't crunchy but flavorful and slightly soggy. The food came out really fast, so it makes me think these fries were already fried and left sitting
Grilled Octopus Salad
Again, our food got to us very quickly, so I feel like they had boiled or steam the octopus ahead of time, but did not grill it enough when I actually ordered. The "dipping sauce" is melted butter. There wasn't much flavor to tasted. The first .15 was los there
Lava cake
Although your typical bar dessert, the bundt cake is not too sweet even with the chocolate syrup on top so it definitely is above average. The con: they give you so little ice cream. I mean little, little that you end up eating 30% of your bundt cake w/out ice cream. Use the 4 slices of strawberry to pair at that point
Flan
This is a thick and heavy flan. If you expect a jello-like consistency, this is not it. It's dense but not creamy, which is slightly confusing. Tasty, but too sweet. The second .15 was lost here

Service: 4 out of 5
Our server was beyond friendly in an otherwise mad environment. Imagine 3 dinning areas: main, main outdoor, downstairs outdoor with really drunk people and loud music. The dessert did take almost 20 minutes to get to us, so I am not sure if our sever forgot our order or the kitchen took extra long warming up a bundt cake?

Price: 4 out of 5
$63 total before tip. After tip, it's $75. That's 2 appetizers: wings and octopus salad, 1 side: fries, and 2 desserts: lava cake and flan

Cleanliness: 4 out of 5
The outdoor tables weren't unclean, but they didn't look spot clean. Credit should be given for the bathroom downstairs. It's a club ambiance so there's a female handing out paper towels in a flower-decorated bathroom

Came here for a friends birthday dinner this weekend. Pros: good music, good food, decent drinks outdoor seating area is nice And Instagram ready! Cons: the staff. Our waitress, Yanna & the security guard with the long braids were both great! Everyone else especially management were VERY
rude! Because of this, I won't return and wouldn't recommend. Plenty other places in Inwood to get better food for better price with good music and staff who know how to make their patrons feel welcomed.

Inwood Bar & Grill is one my favorite restaurants and sports bar in Dykman. I've been here a few times and it's always a good vibe. It's easy to get to by subway and there's valet parking nearby.

I've eaten at the bar and dined in at a table. My favorite meal is the bbq ribs and I get with mashed potatoes. The ribs are cooked tenderly and the the flavor is deliciously sweet and bold.
This entree is a must try! Ice also try the calamari appetizer, these were average at best unfortunately. The cocktails are very good here! I love the passion fruit mojito.

As a sport bar there's plenty of TVs and space this is a great destination to view your favorite sports event. The restaurant area has plenty of room as well. The service can be slow so I would suggest some appetizers and drink for sure while you wait on your entree. There's also a dance club downstairs that can also be used for events like birthday celebrations. As it get late you can go downstairs and get your party on!

I've only been here twice so far, but it had a different owner/name the other time so I had to check it out again. I remember having steak before back then as well!

Went for my mom's bday, and this place is popppinnnnn' on the weekends (lines outside the restaurant) so keep this in mind! Maybe you can call ahead and make a reservation.

They followed Covid Guidelines pretty well, checking your temperature out front, contact tracing, providing a digital menu when you scan their QR code, socially distanced, and all staff wearing masks. There is also a $10 Covid Fee for all dining there in addition to your meal, tax, and tip.

Since we were just 2 people, our wait time was considerably shorter than those in groups (about 15 min) and the bouncer out front was kind to us. There were a LOT of birthdays that day, and so there was a live DJ there playing party jams for everyone there!

If you are looking for some place quiet where you can have a deep conversation, this place ain't it  But the patio out back is usually quieter from what I remember.

Since I haven't been there in a long time, I was *hoping* and praying the food was at least decent--but it exceeded my expectations for sure!

Before ordering our server Jose informed us we only had 2 hours to eat (due to quick turnover) but since this was a short walk away we finished within an hour anyway.

We decided to order a virgin pina colada for my mom--and it was delicious, perfectly thick. All drinks come in plastic cups by the way. For our appetizer we love grilled seafood so decided to order grilled octopus.

You will receive only TWO pieces of gigantic grilled octopus tentacles there with a lot of salad on the side, so beware about that. BUT--it was fresh, and grilled to perfection. Didn't need a sauce or anything, and no fishy-smell. The dressing on the salad was good too, so it was filling, and you didn't feel unhealthy when you ate it.

My mom ordered the 14 oz skirt steak with chimichurri and a side. I ordered a 12 oz NY Strip Steak, great amount of char and gristle. Both steaks were cooked to PERFECTION at medium rare--we were both super shocked and pleasantly surprised. And we even had leftovers for the next day, and they were STILL soft and moist! Great cuts of beef, all fresh.

Overall, a great time, especially when you go during lunch/dinner, when there is fast turnaround so you'll get fresh food. I can't say anything about the drinks because we didn't order any alcohol.

We will definitely be going back for more, and will probably try out take-out from here, hopefully it will have the same quality. I'll let ya know with an edit if anything changes ;)

My waitress was rude. I give her my Id which is an Antigua I'd and she didn't want to take it and say it's a state law for me to walk with my passport. She need to come again. And try to reading my id properly.

This ain't your Applebee's Bar & Grill. Getting in with security, the interior and the music I found it to be more of a club. I think with security it's pretty organized so I'm alright with that and they take many precautions in line with  the pandemic. The food and service were fine as well but this is where things start to unravel this cool neighborhood spot.

First the parking. Yeah silly me for thinking it will be easy. There is a valet guy, very unofficial, he was nice  but very unassuming, sporting a Canada goose  jacket standing there. I wouldn't have even known what he was doing I had to wait a few minutes for him to walk over and talk to some other guy trying to park. $10 bucks isn't bad but unless you're on foot, this is probably gonna be your solution.

Next up is the "all at once ordering". As mentioned in another review you order everything as once. I like to loosen up with a drink or two myself but you put in pretty much the whole order which I didn't care much for. The entrees came shortly after apps which kinda throws off the balance.

Lastly the music. My nemesis when it comes to dining out is ear splittingly loud music. Like I said I felt it was more like club atmosphere than a casual eat and drink spot. When the music is that loud I'm not sure it helps slow the spread if when you're talking you have to raise your voice so loud to be heard.

That all said I can tell this is a fun spot. Drinks were good, food is about what you'd expect, nothing gourmet but I've had worse.

If your looking for an uptown vibe, this is the place. TV monitors everywhere, constant music and sometimes a live DJ. The food is delicious and plentiful.  They're Happy Hour food menu brings in a crowd. Grab a table or sit at the bar. Lisandra will take care of you even as she's prepping lime wedges for your cold Corona. The staff is friendly and efficient. If the weathers nice they also have a balcony and huge patio. To summarize you'll get a mouthful, an earful, and an eyeful.

This place  attracted me with their attractive promotions for drinks and food. However once we ordered and ate the food was just not impressive. The drinks were good and pretty strong but the food was disappointing.

Disappointed to say that this establishment is not a safe space for queer folks. Although we arrived in a group (a group of professionals, mind you), one individual was singled out at the door. Truthfully, that should've been the end of patronizing the place but remember this is a work-related outing. The same individual was then singled out AGAIN and approached when they headed toward the bathrooms. This is blatant homophobia and discrimination. Imagine trying to have a nice time out with colleagues, only to find yourself the target of someone's hate because of their own biased assumptions. This is 2022 in Manhattan no less. Please don't patronize this business and feel free to pressure management concerning the discriminatory practices.

Came here with my bf & his moms friends and her for her birthday. This place was such a vibe - wish I stayed longer. The music was aaa1! But the aesthetics here!!!!! It was my first time in Inwood and this place made an amazing impression. The backyard patio space is two floors, highly spacious. Would definitely recommend for any occasion. So many drink options with reasonable prices & the food was yummy! Would definitely come back for the overall ambience.
Love the place after the phone issue was cleared up. Great food, tasty drinks and nice atmosphere
Queer people are subject to horrible treatment at this establishment and management doesn't care to do anything about it. Don't spend your money here.

What can I say about In wood Bar and Grill...
They have an amazing crowd that shows up regularly to enjoy indoor and outdoor seating, great food and drink, and the staff which is top notch.... Please take advantage of their Brunch menu if you come to visit.... God Bless!!

For a pandemic happening right now, this place really did a good job for what they have to deal with, such as not using their indoor space. The outdoor space is amazing. Its a huge backyard with a top and bottom level. They are really fortunate to have such a great space. Yes they enforce masked wearing you can not enter the premises without wearing one. The security is real here. They have hand sanitizers throughout the main indoor space so as you walk to go to the outdoor space you can stop and get your hands clean. They also have tables set out front of the restaurant, but I really didn't see anyone eating there, they were kind of just waiting as if they wanted to sit out back, I'm not really sure but you ask before arriving. Yes you should definitely make reservations, because this place seems to be the spot for locals. The line was extremely long, like how the line looked after everything shut down and you now had to wait  forever on a Target or Cosco line. You also need to make sure your whole party is there other wise you will be waiting, because they won't allow you in without everyone being there. The good thing is do have tables for a large party but the more you have you still may need to wait. I say go small. Just my opinion.

Now to the food. You have to scan a QR code to see or download their menu. Then you can order some happy hour drinks. If its happy hour. Prices are good and I'm glad the drinks were in plastic, it just seems safer and you can take to go. What I ordered was delicious. My chicken nachos. The queso was ok, but the guacamole it came with was really good. My friend enjoyed her keto burger and so did I with the piece I was given. The lobster mac was something I wouldn't recommend. I've had better but kudos for them serving it in a cast iron skillet. Calamari was really tasty. Chips and guacamole was good. Overall we all had a satisfying meal.

Service was good, food was good, space was good and clean. I would visit again but only thru a reservation. I know this was a long review but I needed to give you a well written review.

Great spot for brunch! You get unlimited drinks and the best strong sangria I have ever had. I ordered chicken penne which was ok could've been better but the drinks make you for it. We were seated in the patio which has a beautiful decor! Flowers everywhere great for that perfect picture.

Alicia was AMAZING! Great hookah flavors. Music was perfect! The service was so attentive and the drinks were strong. I loved the DJ's music, and the whole atmosphere was as a vibe. I'll be back next week!

As a parent, when I get to escape sans my child, I have higher expectations than most . Given the times we are living in , I have to be a bit more open minded . Below are my highlights :

Pros: very warm welcome , amazing staff, gorgeous patio, decor , outdoor fans, and I felt safe . Had grilled shrimp, baguette pizza, maduros, and the calamari . Definitely get the passion fruit punch and a pitcher of mango sangria !!

Cons: I usually like to have drinks first, and ease into apps, entrees . Here, you just order everything at once , before you are given a drink . Not a fan at all . Also I like to give a custom tip, but here gratuity is already included in the bill.

Came here with family. They have an outdoor beautiful patio. It's more social distanced as well. The indoor seating tends to get really packed especially on weekend days. There is a live dj playing a little bit of everything. We had the wings sampler of 15 wings 22$ (you can get 2 flavors. We also had the Inwood burger 16.95 that comes with regular or sweet potato fries. For drinks we had mango frozen margaritas $15 and Hennessy shots $13. There's plenty of cute photo op opportunities on the patio or even near the unisex bathrooms. Would definitely return for patio seating.

The environment was nice but there was a cockroach In our chicken soup. We didn't get a sorry or any apology for that matter we didn't get anything at all they just took the soup away and brought another one, charged full price not even a apology discount like most places do if they mess up. To make things worse they are still charging a 20% COVID charge even though NY as lifted almost all restrictions and they're operating at full capacity. Most restaurants we've been to have removed the Covid charge but it seems they're still milking the system. I would not be returning and I will make sure I steer everyone away from going here.

Came here for Mother's Day and it was an experience to say the least. First, there was no one to greet us at the front so we were just standing there for a few minutes while an employee was standing nearby just chatting on his phone.

When seated, it took a while for the waiter to come to our table. I was impressed by the way she was able to memorize our orders though! By the time our drinks came out, they had ran out of cups, so they gave us the drinks in to-go cups. They placed the cream and sugars inside of a to-go coffee cup and told us to use the same cup for our coffee. Seems a little unsanitary for me?

There was one gentleman that was clearing tables and it was shocking to watch the manager fire him on-site. I saw this whole thing unfold while we were seated by the kitchen.

Worst fkkin ihop ever. PERIOD!!!
Service
Food
Complete and utter TRAAASSHHHHH!!!! Never come here I promise you
I saw a lot of bad reviews, but I didn't have any major issues personally. The burrito was really good, it felt like a typical IHOP visit. Probably spent a total of an hour from beginning to end.

Left hungry AND nauseous!
What happened to this place?!?
Waited for 45 minutes for food that was partially frozen.
And someone took a half my veggie sausage before it was brought out.
My husband is sick from what he ate.
I left hungry and nauseous.
Server tried to make it right but you can't fix a discussing experience.
I know IHOP. It's not fine dining. But no one should be charged to get sick. Someone please fix this. It used to serve a nice meal.

You like to stand there while people stare at you, this is the place for you!!!!! Rudeness is their touchstone word. Customer service is a foreign concept. Food as well...waiting for nothing, apparently! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!

The service was atrocious, no one is at the front greeting guests or inquiring about orders everyone is just chilling in the back doing Jack shit like bozo's. The ambiance is trash. the food is trash just don't eat here.

If I could give them negative star reviews I would,besides the staff being inattentive,we waited to sit,they were having conversations instead of getting our tables,after an hour 15 minutes,we just 3 things out of 5 that we ordered,undercooked and 2 drinks,me and my partner were forced to leave without eating anything because they took super long,they tried to convince us the food was being done,I highly suggest you do not go there unless you don't mind waiting for an hour or more.

Slow.   Unfriendly.  Terrible service.  

COVID restrictions has eased a bit.  Prepackaged plastic utensils and napkins are not appropriate if you're adhering to proper sanitation and food handling.  

The place is dull, dreary and expensive for what you receive.  

I would NOT recommend going here.

For a long time I've been wanting to do a positive review but after countless incidents at this IHOP today was my last straw. I went there today for breakfast with my friend and my small puppy (toy poodle) and after sitting and settling down (even after ordering our drinks) we were told by one of the workers that my puppy couldn't be on the premises. My puppy is tiny (was in his bag the entire time) and was not visible to anyone else. He also never barks and is a service animal.

When I was first encountered, the worker says to me that people might complain about seeing him and his barking. NEITHER were plausible because my dog was not visible or making a sound. Then he proceeded to tell me to put him on the floor if I wanted to stay.

 This experience taught me one thing ... the owners of this location have to be the DUMBEST business people ever. Not only do you start problems with people willing to pay money to eat here even though the service is already terrible but Everytime I've come here A STAFF MEMBER ALWAYS BEGINS AN ISSUE ALWAYS. NEVER FAILS.  

Last time I came our waitress was simply in a bad mood and couldn't be bothered to get us sink water lol. I stood up and left this time and will make sure to never come back because our community should have a GOOD place with DECENT PEOPLE that enjoy where they work instead of making me paranoid that someone will spit in my food because I looked at them wrong.

I went there this morning and had breakfast and I was so disappointed because my breakfast was cold the toast was cold as well had to beg for butter it was the worst experience I've ever had in a IHOP I will never go back there again
There is a high chairs that sit on the seat and it has no strap so i literally have to hold my child!!!!

We came here at about 4AM after being at Locksmith bar for the night.

Due to the time there wasnt anyone at the front desk so we did have to wait a bit for someone to finally come out of the kitchen and seat us. There had been a lot of cleaning being done with mops and supplies everywhere so we were pretty limited as to where we can sit. It did take a bit but our orders were taken and we were able to get beverages relatively fast. Our food didn't take too long to come out and I was shocked that everything was just as we ordered it (I feel like most IHOPS always do something wrong). We had no complaints on the quality of the food and our waiter was friendly and super attentive which was great.

Let's start by saying, we went in and got seated pretty fast (2 total). Great. We then proceed to wait 10 minutes for our waiter to arrive. We put our orders in which he was not understanding when honestly it was simple as we were saying and pointing to the one we wanted. Didn't think much of it, although now I was afraid of our food coming out wrong. This is when the fun truly started. We arrived around 10:40am, order was taken around 10:50ish. We proceeded to wait for our food for an entire hour, 11:50am. Mind you, those who were coming later than us, families/groups of 3 and above (they were white to be frank). They got their food before us & various colored families that have been waiting around the same time as us (we are Hispanic). Unsure if color was prioritized but it is surely what it seemed. The waiter never returned nor did he come over to at least let us know what's happening/apologize for the wait. End of the story, we left without the food because it is unacceptable to have someone wait for that long without an update or apology, meanwhile we are seeing others of bigger groups that arrived After us, being fed before us. Never stepping in there again. 0/10 recommend.

So me and my girl friend went to Walmart in jersey last night and to drop my car off in pep boys we was tired and being us in the car Suffice it to say we get on each other's nerves but we are a team so when she was driving us back home lord in her car and trust me I'm a big man she has a small car so we was hungry and I need my fat ass out that car lol she loves ihop I really don't but hay who can go wrong with breakfast it's ihop they invented this shittttttttttttt this ihop is an epic fail the food was Disgusting the eggs taste like eggs no type of texture they gave me sausages that was half cooked french fries that was so hard I don't get me wrong me and my girl ate the breakfast because we were hungry but she order pan cakes and some special meal with chicken And mozzarella sticks and onion rings o you can see the onion rings those shit was burnt My girl was outrageous we called the manager to make a long story short she came to a table nonchalantly And said o we cleaned the grill and the food still came out like this all day so they gave me a bill for $59 we end up paying 40 cause she took some of it off when you go out and eat and spend your hard earn money it's a shame that we had to suffer like this to me the whole staff should be fired especially the cook fire his asssss twice the manager doesn't care now look at these pictures where's the board of health when you need them don't ever eat at this I hop on 174th in bway in Washington Heights

Top-notch service and classic consistency of IHOP!
In the middle of Washington Heights with the hustle and bustle of the busy community of Shoppers and workers and you can still get this type of service and quality!

This location deserves no stars at all . walked in and the receptionist has an air pod on and on her phone, didn't even greet us. She sat us down as soon as we walked in to a dirty table. we tried to ask her if she had anybody that can whipe it down and she completely ignored us. We sat there for literally 12 minutes and not one person came over to greet us or ask us if we wanted anything to drink. The bathroom didn't have any hand soap. we finally decided to walk out and what seemed like the manager dressed in all black was talking at the front desk and nobody even acknowledge us leaving either. HORRIBLE SEEVICE !

I've been to this location twice and I do like Ihop in general, but my most recent visit was not a good experience.

When my boyfriend and I came in on a Saturday morning, we saw a line at the entrance, thought the restaurant was busy and that we'd have to wait for a table. Turns out the restaurant was pretty much empty and the host was just not paying attention to anyone walking in. THAT itself should have been the red flag convincing us to go somewhere else.

When we were finally seated, we waited a good 10 minutes to even know who our server was and at that point we just ordered our food and drinks at the same time. I ordered the Garden Omelette with Avocado. It was my least favorite omelette I have ever tried from anywhere. The eggs were not fully cooked (totally not safe) and the cheese and broccoli were overcooked, leaving the tomatoes, mushrooms and avocado to make up for the meal. My boyfriend got the Breakfast Sampler. The bacon didn't even look like bacon, the ham was burnt and the eggs, sausage and pancakes were just okay. We didn't finish our food even if we wanted to.

Our server only checked on us once ONLY to give us the check that another server already gave us but when we needed someone, we just asked a server who had just happened to pass by for things like ketchup and mustard because it was ridiculous. My boyfriend and I ended up getting sick from eating here. It's kept us up for the past couple nights. It's been 5 days and our stomachs are FINALLY settling down. So.... we're definitely NOT coming back.

PLEASE DO NOT EAT HERE! If I could give this NASTY, DIRTY, GREASY, UNPROFESSIONAL restaurant zero stars I would!

Not only was my husband surrounded by the manager plus an additional male staff member at our table (with our 4yr old daughter present) because he questioned the cleanliness of the restaurant we were followed outside after our extremely quick meal by a 3rd employee who came out to antagonize my husband into a physical altercation.

Never in my life have I ever been disrespected like that in front of my child BUT to be told by the staff member that he didn't give an "f" that my child was in the car & that he'd kick her father's a$$ in front of her???? Absolutely disgusting! Mind you all of this was happening while the other employees on duty watched from inside while they had customers present.

I'd sooner eat glass in hell before I give Ihop another dime of my money because if this is any representation of how they do business and their customer service training they can keep it!

Always cool to have an iHOP around the way for some good breakfast food even if not to eat specifically for breakfast. Came to this specific iHOP recently for the first time for National Pancake Day...was not pleased with the wait which was upwards to 40 minutes but I held my patience being that there were several parties there waiting to also take part in their yearly National Pancake Day promotion. Once finally being seated though the waiters are very attentive and did not have to wait long for my food which is always pleasing...especially if it's good which it was.

Once seating is allowed in restaurants again, will return here for some waffles and a full breakfast.

If I could give this place a 0/10 I would. Horrible service nobody is ever at the front I waited over 10 minutes to be seated and nobody came to ask me when the workers saw me standing there So i ended up leaving. I live around the area and I've experienced this multiple times and I keep giving it a chance but it disappoints every time. Not only that but the quality of the food is not good either they've served me raw waffles and I ended up sending it back and not eating it because it didn't look appealing. Either they need to close this place down or hire better staff.
The pancakes are fluffy and the service is always fast.  I never have a long wait.

This IHOP location is completely terrible. It got one star because the waiter was very nice. Other that that the food was completely terrible. I ordered the Breakfast Sampler thinking it was a safe meal. The bacon looked as if they took it off the grill and stepped on it a few times and put it on my plate, the ham has a weird flavor too. My boyfriend had the same meal and bit into a piece of plastic while eating his eggs. The coffee was ok, watery but not terrible. Orange Juice was watery too but I know that happens with the machine, not terrible. Totally disappointed with IHOP.

This ihop is terrible. The food is not the problem, the service is. I came in just to sit and have a meal, but I'm leaving with neither. I came in and waited but no one greeted me, or gave me any attention. Funny thing is I see the staff moving around but instead of talking to me, a customer, they're just talking to each other. I try to give this place the benefit of the doubt but at this point it's becoming too much. Don't come here, I hope they close this place down or hire new staff.

This place is ridiculous. The "lobby" is huddled full of people not being socially distant, there's a woman with no mask on that placed an order at the register and the host didn't even ask her to put a mask on. Servers are wearing airpods, barely acknowledging guests.

I placed an online order that was supposed to be ready at 12:04, it's now 12:30 and I'm still in here waiting. Someone needs to come get this place in order.

Bring your own utensils. No I'm not kidding. They give you disposible plastic wrapped fork/knife/napkin packets like for take out or delivery. Food was OK. Service was decent given it was at the crack of dawn. Hash browns were ... you know how Puerto Ricans have a fancy term for the burnt rice at the bottom of the pan? Yeah, that, but the whole thing. I had to use my fingers coz the thin plastic knife kept bending sideways instead of cutting it.

Servers not wearing their mask properly. Some with nose out and some bringing mask all the way to the chin. Glass cups have food debris around it and silverware needed extra wipe down.

Not too safe for covid guidelines when employees aren't wearing mask properly.

Food was mid as per usual in iHop, just an itch to scratch.

Listen, I love IHOP and the food. Yet, this IHOP does not know how to staff accordingly.  So, if your the management let me bring some thing to your attention.

1) I am a single person and when I walk into a restaurant, see at least 8-10 tables vacant and people are waiting. Problem. This is taking money out of your waiters pockets.

2) Currently, it's noon on a Saturday - usually a rush - and you have only 4 waiters.....problem.

3) Um, you have three, um I'll say it again, three hosts when I walk in - so almost as many hosts as waiters - and they seem to be useless - in fact a "wet floor" sign fell down - they looked at it and walked over it. THESE PEOPLE are the first face of your restaurant. MAJOR ISSUE.

4) HOSTS, in fact no staff members should be chillin, texting and calling people on the phone (See Below Picture).

5) Lastly, the wait for your food is ridiculous. So far over 20, well now 30 min for eggs and pancakes.

So, the reason that come back here is the wait staff. They bust there ass to make it happen. They have to not only do there job serving, but deal with upset costumers. Managers need to be more visible, be hands on and do a better job. Hosts need to step in when needed to clear a table, bring c

I'm no expert, but my family owns some of the most successful food establishments in NY. Half of these people would be retrained or let go.

****UPDATE****

So, today 12/28/19 I came to IHOP for breakfast and my favorite waiter, Aisha, quit.....no more IHOP for me. Managers & Owners hire her as a manager - she is awesome.

This spot is absolutely disgusting with the worst service ever. My boyfriend and I went to get a quick snack and was absolutely appalled by this horrible service first of all the resteraunt was basically empty and they made us wait almost an hour to be seated and another hour for our food then when we got our food it was cold and we did not receive the right order. At this point me and my boyfriend were ready to go I then go to the bathroom and am horrified by the disgusting stuff in that bathroom paper all over the floor and poop all over the toilet. I definitely would not recommend there we're even other people complaining.
They need to close this IHOP down. There's a reason why it's always empty. Place is garbage.

Was in the neighborhood for an early appointment, and I walked by this location and thought to myself I dont need it but what the hay, tomorrow is my 50th birthday!

It was interesting to find out that its 24hours and pretty spacious. Since it was morning, it was pretty empty but after I order it started to fill up.
I decided to indulge in my childhood favorite Chocolate chocolate chip pancakes but order the 2 cakes instead of four and 2 smoked sausage although I'm eliminating meat.

The order came out hot and quickly.I also had the green tea which was served in a large tea cup, I loved it. My server although  her name slips  my mind was friendly    and attentive. I'm not sure if and when I will return to this location  but if in the neighborhood again, I may stop by

This is a warning to anyone who comes here:

You will be waiting. And waiting. And waiting.

We have been sitting here nearly an hour, and there is no food in our mouths.

It is not very busy.

Everyone around us is likewise suffering. We actually thought they were already eating when we came in, but slowly the servers went around taking their orders.

One person got up and just left because their lunch break was probably ending.

IHOP will always have business, but if you value your time or even have any sense of self-worth, eat somewhere else.

The worse service ever, I usually come with my 7 year old son since he likes to eat here in my day off it use to be semi ok but not is totally bad; we were waiting for like 30 minutes just to get our coffee served; though about leaving but I just didn't want to be rude but I definitely nit coming back here again; maybe is the new management or something but this place just took a turn for the worse.

Honestly with all the options in the world (maybe not at the crack of dawn and after the club) I'd rather chew my fist than come to this spot.
I had ordered chicken and waffles. That's it! Not so hard right? Ha. Next thing I know I had 3 microwaved strips of questionable chicken, and cold waffles. After seeing this, I automatically realized my expectations of this establishment were too high. IHOP, I once loved you - but now I know better.
I guess you can still come here with children, or if all you want is some pancakes but if I were you I'd just go to the bodega or invest in a waffle maker.

Didn't expect this to be a good experience. But it was.  Was promptly seated.   My order was taken, waitress was very nice.  The restaurant appears very clean.  Was not disappointed at the restaurant.   Food was hot and good.   I will return

Worst ihop location ever.
Very slow and very rude workers.
Whether you try to order online for pickup or dine in they will make you wait at least couple hours.
I suggest you go other location.

I would not give it a one because simply the food was okay but breakfast is the easiest dish to make to they should have it down packed , out waitress genesis scammed us when we came inside first of waiting 5 min at 1am no no body is there basically she's sitting in a chair not paying attention we had to waive at her to get seated and BEFORE we order I asked is it Monday already because is we came in at 1 am on a Sunday she said yea it's Monday so we all ordered the deal that they have goin in that's why we went in because we saw that deal so when the bill comes I asked hey it's Monday the deal and you stated yes earlier , she replied back saying that's before 10 pm mon - fri I just feel I got lied to and played all of us did we would not go to ihop for a while now and will suggest if you love ihop JUST DONT GO TO THIS ONE
Worst IHOP in New York !! DO NOT EAT HERE !! The food is old and disgusting. I could not even finish my food. They also forgot a side of buttermilk pancakes and they stole a mozzarella stick from me.

This place is a joke lmao. Dont waste your time or money coming here. Seems they get paid to stand around and chill. People in outside wear in the back and kitchen, as someone who works in hospitality, YUCK! They got 2 people working while the other 10 are just loud and inattentive. Waited 45 minutes just to get water and my order taken. All we got was "Im trying to figure something out, sorry!" Like we live in the area and coulve gotten food delivered faster than what theyre doing in there. After ordering, 5 minutes later the waiter comes over to verify the order was what we said..sooo basically out order wasnt put in?  An hour in and all I had was water. Didnt want to be rude and leave while the food is being prepared but thankfully I wont have to say "next time I will" cause Ill never be back. I ordered a juice and it never came. Yum. Water with my breakfast.

Cups could use another wash & wipe down. Waited til after the food arrived to give the utensils and condiments. The napkins we received were in the utensils pack. Yeah, the plastic ones w the small thin napkin. Was anyone around to ask for more? No. And what a shocker!!! The food was cold.  No one came to ask if your ok or if you need anything else or a refill.

If your looking for terrible service and food PLEASE come here. If not, dont step foot in that door.

THIS IS WHY DENNYS IS TOP TIER.

Ugh I really like IHOP but this specific location has the worst costumers service. It always looks like they are short in staff and they take too long to do everything, you see dirty tables all over and no one cleaning them for a long time. So sad because I live around there and I really like IHOP but I think about it twice to go there.
Absolutely worse customer service I've ever seen I'm the city. most of the staff needs to be replaced ASAP.

I was seated quickly, my order was taken in a decent amount of time and the food was good. So you're probably wondering why I've given this review only "1" star?

My issue is that the server decided later to change the amount of tip I had left, probably believing that I would never check.

One thing I CANNOT and WILL NOT abide is a thief. This is exactly why I normally leave a cash tip and will NEVER be going back to this IHOP location. I'm also going to make sure that I lodge a complaint with the corporate office, because that kind of behavior is unacceptable.

Going to this IHOP in Washington Heights was the biggest mistake we have ever made.  We went for breakfast and we're looking for a pleasant experience it was a total nightmare for starters it took about 45 minutes for our order to arrive at our table we called over the waitresses and they didn't seem like they wanted to work and they told us you already have a waitress you'll just have to wait we were even witness to a family who downright told the hostess there we are leaving the food isn't cooked they left do not go to this IHOP it's sad that people who have a job don't want to work.

Bad customer services The guy who took orders 10/30/2020 at 2:00Am he have bad attitude to the point he start saying bad words to me I asked him to call a manager but he refused
His name is jarrel he works over night

I was so hype when they opened this IHOP. I have to admit I've visited more times than I'm proud to say. My experiences have all been pretty positive for the most part. Staff is friendly and quick. I've never noticed any problems with cleanliness, however, they do get a large volume of visits so I can see how things could get messy sometimes. My only complaint would be with regards to the wait time. On Sundays specifically, it can def. take more than 30 minutes to get a table so I would call in ahead before coming. Other than that, it's a solid spot to grab a quick breakfast. All they need is to start serving mimosas for brunch, or am I asking for too much?

I had a very bad experience in this Ihop.  The staff was very unprofessional.  Leading to the manager.  Will people were dinning most of the staff from the kitchen was on the dinning area having a jolly old time, making fun of the guess. They was that loud that everything could be heard. When I got my order, the food was all broken in pieces.  I called for manager and he said that's the way the food comes. Now I am a regular customer at ihops restaurants especially the one in Queens, Northern Boulevard. That has great service by the way.  If I was to compare the two , Washington heights ihop should be ashamed. They should close that location.

I really wanted to like this IHOP, I really did. Despite the long waits I usually experienced upon dining in; however, I had a pretty bad experience that's a dealbreaker. I've been coming to this location about once a week for the past year since I enjoy breakfast food a lot, but as I was waiting for my order today in my booth, I noticed a roach running around at the back of the booth near my purse. I shot up and kindly asked to sit at another booth, but when I notified a passing server about the roach (which was still visibly there), she nonchalantly told me that an adjacent booth was available.

The food, as always, was good, and my server was apologetic when I told her, but I unfortunately can't return to a restaurant with roaches. I'm pretty bummed that I now can't experience a diner-like setting in Washington Heights.

WOW i'm surprised a 24hr IHOP opened up in the heights! I mean the area is always crowded, finding parking can be a nightmare, and forget about traffic but, nonetheless I was happy that something new came to the area and Just a short drive from the Bronx.

We went out there EARLY (9am) and luckily found metered (1hr) parking right in front of the establishment.. yay.. Upon entering we noticed that the decor is completely different than all the other IHOPS we have been too.. Very chic and modern.. We liked it! Everyone greeted us and seemed friendly.. I did notice that for it being in a primarily Hispanic community, I did not see any of us Latinos working there... hmm.. anyway we got seated promptly and waited for our waiter (Almond was his name)

Our waiter was indeed very friendly BUT very forgetful. It almost seemed as if it was his first day on the job. We gave him the benefit of the doubt though.

Usually Ihop coffee is not terrible but this coffee seemed watered down. I had to ask if it was decaf.. UGH not good at all.. strike 1. We placed our order, waiter messed up some drinks and forgot to put in half of my nieces order... My food came out lukewarm but my sisters food came out cold.. strike 2...

After our underwhelming breakfast we paid the bill and decided to use the bathroom. I had a newborn with me so needed a changing table etc. Well to our surprise the bathroom was not even in working order!! We were told to go down stairs (mind you i'm carrying a car seat which was a bit heavy) to use the bathroom for us ladies BUT there was no changing area/table for babies!! WTH!! Strike 3!

We were very disappointed with this visit and we weren't the only ones. There was a table nearby that complained about their food and even left without paying the bill!!! LOL WOW!!

Manager invited me to return for a meal "on-the-house", with a friend.
She greeted us and was friendly & accommodating. I think that we got a new or nervous waiter, as he forgot to give us silverware when our meals arrived, then we had to flag him down to get them. Also,he forgot to offer drink refills when he was checking on our meal and the glasses were all completely empty.
I still left a generous tip, as the meals were free.
This location still has hiccups, but is striving to improve.
PS definitely DO NOT order the iced coffee. This is an IHOP problem. If you want ice coffee, just get regular and ask for a few glasses of ice. Trust me.

I hardly ever write reviews but this ihop location was exponentially bad. To start, our server had terrible attitude and made us feel like we should be apologizing for even sitting down. It was clear she just wanted to leave and I get having bad days but her service was terrible. We also heard her talking badly about some other guests. Thankfully, the other staff was very nice. The hostess, the busser and another very nice man were the highlight. We left a tip JUST because of them. Our food also took forever and we had to ask to replace the bacon after it came out looking disgusting. (thank you again to the man who helped us when our waitress was god knows where). The bacon then came out still undercooked and they charged us for it. Finally, the kitchen staff didn't seem to be wearing their masks and once they would leave the kitchen, the masks would be put back on. Unprofessional especially during covid times. Will NOT be coming back and will be warning other people about this location.

First impression, no hostess. Tuesday morning around 11am, restaurant was probably 20% occupied and the service was extremely slow. It took us 1 hour and 45 minutes from beginning to end. Ordered 2 breakfast samplers and two children cheeseburgers. Rating 2 stars for it's surprisingly good children's burger.

Servers were pleasant. Unfortunately the service is extremely slow. Was the kitchen short staffed? Or are the servers just slow? Not sure.

Last but not least the back end of the restaurant and the staircase leading to the restrooms are filthy. Had I noticed it prior to eating, I would have left. Needless to say, I won't be coming back.

I love their vegan tuna. Just make sure they give you enough for what you paid for. I had an egg on an whole wheat bagel, something simple yet good. If you're vegetarian/vegan diet, they do cook the eggs on the same grill with the meat. The service here is good!
WAY overpriced. $15 for a sandwich made on a bagel? No. Just, no. Here is a tip: never order without seeing a price on the menu.

The bagels have gone downhill in my opinion since I moved in to the neighborhood years ago. Disappointed on an increase in prices for a decrease in quality. Wish everyone working there could be as professional as the older gentlemen who owns it.

I like a number of things from Inwood Bagels but their opening time is so unreliable. Popped over there this morning only to discover they hadn't opened yet, and this is the third time it's happened to me. :(

The staff at Inwood Bagels are super friendly.

I purchased a dozen bagels for $17. This is a bakers dozen so you'll receive 13 bagels. I did a mix of onion, garlic, egg, blueberry and wheat. I always avoid sesame bagels or any type of bagel including sesame as my mom is allergic. I was super disappointed when I got him and realized there are sesame seeds on the onion bagel. Now I'm not sure if this was a fluke for the 3 that I purchased or if it's common practice. Either way money was wasted as my mom could not eat the bagels.

Solid BLT bagel here.

Lots of fillings, and they season with salt and pepper (which not all places do!).

St Patrick's Day Special Bagel. Magically Delicious!
Great customer service such positive inspiring girl working the counter on Mar 17 morning.

UBER EATS only has pick up option, so I loved that the main site allowed me for to order for delivery for $6.99 to my area (15mins away). Unfortunately I never received my order, got to speak with store rep (a male) twice to get updates why my order which was no longer trackable via the DoorDash link I received via text, he stated he accidentally marked the order as complete, but assured me twice my order was on the way since he spoke with driver himself and the driver confirmed they lost gps of my address when the store marked the order complete before delivery. 1.5 hours later no order, and when I tried contacting the store again, no response. No one answered the phones for the remainder of the day I tried calling from another number and they answered and hung up when I mentioned my order. I was left with no choice but to contact DoorDash the delivery provider for store site, and they even tried to contact the store to attempt to get a re-deliver (I was still willing to still keep the order) unfortunately DoorDash had no success reaching anyone at the store. My order had to be escalated in order to get a refund which is still pending. Door Dash informed my order would be refunded once Inwood Bagels "support team" responds back to them. Very unprofessional, and an unfortunate experience. I paid $29 for an order (sandwich and coffee) I never got to enjoy. The store has very poor customer service, I would not recommend ordering on their site.

Great bagel place!  Small, clean, serving the kind of bagels I love, not BIG FLUFFY BALLS OF DOUGH!  Normal and chewy sized.  I had toasted sesame with vegetable cream cheese, my husband had the "works" on a toasted everything bagel.  Service was great, people were friendly and I highly recommend supporting this restaurant!

Delivery is quick and mine have always been perfect. This morning's order - pancakes, eggs and bacon - was exceptionally well made! Everything was fresh and delicious.
Good food, nice selection of beverages, great employees.
This place is good but literally never open. Why don't you follow your listed hours? What's a gurl gotta do to get an everything bagel with lox and jalapeño cream cheese on the reg?

Could I give higher than 5 stars? I had Seamless delivery on Sunday at 1:30pm, near closing time. I was worried that they wouldn't have some of the items that I ordered (pumpernickel bagel) as even places that list it, often are out, but success! They followed all of my order notes, delivered contact-free as requested, it arrived 10 minutes early from the stated time and all the food was perfect temperature. Remember this is Sunday at closing, but the staff was professional, efficient and exacting.
THANK YOU.

This place is overly priced paid $25 for 3 bagels
And one was plain with cream cheese
Good quality bagel shop. Great service and fast. For the price, I wish they don't skimp on the smoked salmon but that's really my only feedback.
Great breakfast and super friendly staff. Went two days in a row when we stayed in the neighborhood.

This place is adorable and the staff are friendly. I also appreciated that the staff were all wearing their masks correctly. However, if you're serious about authentic New York bagels that are chewy, dense, moist, and have that finely bubbled crust, these just aren't "it."

I saw this spot with great varieties of bagels, and it seems like a popular spot. So, we decided to check them out one weekend.

The inside was smaller than I expected, long and narrow.  You can order fillings on a roll, bagel, or as make it a hero sandwich. They had so many cream cheese spreads, and also, vegan spread, Lox, egg, bacon, etc...

They had a cute display on the wall with all sorts of bagels in rows of racks. Although, we didn't see too many bagels there. The male staff greeted us as soon as we got there, and told us that they don't keep too many bagels there on the racks, in order to keep them fresh. That makes total sense... So, if you don't see a particular kind of bagel you want, just ask them to see if they have more in the back.

One thing about this place is that there is not spot to eat... Since it was a chilly day, we decided to just head home and have the bagels.

The first bagel creation was chosen by my hubby. He went with Fresh Lox & Flavored Cream Cheese on Salt Bagel. And what kind of cream cheese did he get? Blueberry. Hmmm... Blueberry cream cheese with lox... It was actually not bad, the blueberry cream cheese was not so "fruity," but cream cheesy. The bagel was good, but a bit tough.  

I went with more breakfast type, Sausage, Egg, & Cheese on Everything Bagel. It was quite tasty, and the bagel but much softer. Maybe because it was toasted? I really enjoyed this bagel!

The staffs here, especially the male staff who made our bagel creations, was really nice. We felt welcomed and our business appreciated. We shall return for more in a near future!

don't know why there are so many mixed reviews or lower ratings... 10/10 customer service, super friendly staff and they gave me an order receipt to double check my order, quick service and a smiling face with my final total receipt. Not expensive bagels but super yummy. definitely enough salmon when i ordered lox. someone said $25 for 3 bagels and one was plain.... 4 bagels (two of which were sandwiches) $27. Y'all are being dramatic. Good price, good customer service, all around good place for a bagel

This was my second visit.  i did not get prepared food.  But my order of bagels and pastries was ready when I arrived.  The bagels are large and tne pastries are huge.  My husband and I share 1 pastry and are both satisfied.  The staff is very nice and efficient.  New York City prices are sticker shock to those of us who have been transplanted.  But these bagels are the real deal.
Not worth the price for a sandwich with 2 pieces of pastrami $11.50 sun dried tomatoes aren't even cut up properly

Great bagels, breakfast sandwiches and juice selection. Highly recommend! I recently took a friend from out-of-town to visit here and he fell in love with the fabled NYC bagel. The proximity of this bagel shop to the parks make it a must-visit on a weekend with favorable weather.

I came here wanting to know the answer to the question: "What's the difference between a standard $5 lox and cream cheese bagel versus a $12 one?" Transcendent cream cheese? Ultra-fresh and plump lox? Bagels that seem like they just came out of the oven?

Nope. The answer? $7.
