This place takes brazen to a new level. The bagels aren't any better than those at delis that dot the Inwood landscape. They just have more variety, and they hope consumers confuse that with quality.  There is actually way less lox than you get at some of the delis, and I could barely taste it against all the cream cheese.

Here's the worst part, though. They have an expensive chicken noodle soup that's $7 (yes, I fell for the more expensive, must be transcendant fallacy). I ordered it. And I discovered that it's... REPURPOSED Campbell's "classic" chicken noodle's can soup! All they do is take the Campbell's and add more water to dilute it and make it less salty. I couldn't believe it, so I grabbed a can from my cupboard, opened, it up, and the contents are entirely identical. Unreal and anti-consumer.
Great food, great service...perfect after a morning walk through the park! Love their Sausage Egg & Cheese on an Everything Bagel!!!

Good bagels - we ordered the everything with veggie and onion with plain. We also got an iced coffee. Pretty great that they offer oat milk for no extra cost! Win! Staff is also super nice, sweet, and helpful! :)

Breakfast in Inwood, Northern Manhattan calls for one warm bagel with cream cheese and salmon $8 plus one bottle water $1.25.  In hopes for either garlic or onion bagel, unfortunately neither were available thus I opt for everything bagel which was not really my first choice.  At 8 am on a Tuesday morning garlic and onion bagels are sold out?  I do not believe they re-stock their inventory throughout the day.  The female server was somewhat attentive and efficient as I checkout and repeatedly requested three (3) times for a receipt as she abandoned her cashier post by walking away from my request.  Yes, I agree with a previous Yelper customer service is either hit or sourly miss to a deep abyss.  The bagel contain substance as well as the fresh salmon and fresh cream cheese but it was not sufficiently toasted thoroughly.  It sustain to eat my fill as a interim meal until hunger pangs strike for lunch.

This bagel shop is cute.  Aside from bagels there are chips and a few crackers available.  I like their hanging metal racks which contain their bagels behind the counter.  The selection is very limited as they do not have Asiago, sesame, blueberry, raisin, pumpkin, pumpernickel, rye or bialy.  Decent cream cheese selection inside their enclosed glass case.

This restaurant is five stars all around the management is excellent all of the food tastes amazing and the ingredients are fresh I highly recommend for anybody looking to get something to eat in Manhattan this is the perfect place they will satisfy your every need the prices are amazing and the staff is very friendly and helpful

I think saying Inwood Bagels is welcomed in this neighborhood is an understatement. When I went in on 11:30 a.m. on its opening morning, the bagels were ALL SOLD OUT! Most of their pastries were gone. All that was left was coffee, basically. Ha! Needless to say, we've all had our eyes on that mysterious black "Inwood Bagels" awning for quite a few weeks now, and we were clearly all ready to pounce.

A bagel shop is hard to come by uptown - save for the wonderful Mike's down on 168th and Broadway - so the arrival of this place is exciting! They have a multitude of bagels to choose from, many kinds of cream cheese (even chocolate chip!), a large array of pastries including Dough Doughtnuts (OH MY GOSH, YES!), and La Columbe coffee. In addition, they also have a fridge with a small array of bottled beverages and meals - to - go, as well as a nice array of grocery products to buy. I saw cookies, energy bars, and, yes, even some boxes of Annie's Mac & Cheese!

As for the bagels and cream cheese themselves, I can only speak for the plain bagels and garlic herb cream cheese - I'll experiment more over the next few weeks, haha - but the bagel had a nice crisp exterior and a doughy center. The cream cheese did not skimp on the garlic, either. I was a happy camper!

Oh, I'll be a regular at Inwood Bagels soon enough. ;-)
Wide selection of bagels and pastries. It's a busy spot on weekends, but it's worth the wait.

OMG, Inwood Bagels was definitely cool. The menu is impressive, I was overwhelmed with the choices. These guys have a great menu too. The staff are friendly and so very helpful. Anyway, get here and enjoy Inwood Bagels!

I ordered a lox and cream cheese bagel and it was sent to me burned. Then when I asked for a new bagel the delivery guy yelled at me and was completely unprofessional. I will never order from
here again.
Amazing bagels and sandwiches. Unique options, consistent delivery. Vegan choices, great chicken salad and whitefish salad too. Can't recommend them enough!

I called in an order for pick up, it was not a complex order...bagel with lox, lettuce and tomato.  When I picked up, the bag clearly labeled what was ordered, and I was charged extra for the lettuce and tomato ($13.37 total).  When I got home, there was NO lettuce or tomato.  I called to complain, no answer.  I could have walked the mile roundtrip (AGAIN) to complain, but it wasn't worth the effort.  I will never order from them again.

My bacon & egg on a bagel was good. The bagel could have been a little better toasted, but other than that, it was delicious. However, my wife's bagel with lox and cream cheese was VERY disappointing. There was a sad, single layer of a thin slice of lox. Completely unacceptable for $12. It felt like a ripoff.
lovely spot in Inwood. Great varieties of delicious bagels, cream cheeses and more. I recommend it.

Second time here and just had to try that apple cinnamon cream cheese on a bagel again. Never had something so delicious as with this cream cheese and enjoying every bite of the bagel with it. The coffee, 100 times better than Starbucks. Nuff said!

I really wanted this place to be my go to bagel spot but it's pretty subpar. The past three times I've been the bagels have been stale and hard as a rock. I don't think they use fresh bagels everyday. Not worth the money.

I used to live on Academy St & Dyckman St back in the day. I went to the old neighborhood on 5/1/19 before I left the city to drive back down to N.C. I had been looking for a good bagel shop & I saw Inwood Bagels. My mom went inside to grab a dozen assorted, we left, & 9 hours later we got into N.C. Today, I took them out of the bag so that I could put them into ziplock bags for the freezer. [I want my bagels to last because they don't make them the same here] When I got to the bottom, the bagels had mold on them. They had sold my mom molded bagels!!!! WTF?!?! I couldn't believe it! I was looking forward to having a good NYC bagel. THIS is NOT the place to get one!!! Bad business, bad product!

I guess this place is empty for a reason. Got a toasted bialy with veggie cream cheese. I'm this is probably the lightest amount of cream cheese I've had from any place I've ever been to. It's unfortunate, I love bagels and bialys and of this is how they make it they'll continue to stay empty. Good luck!

Whitefish salad on a toasted garlic bagel! Yum! Everyone who works here is very polite, nice, and efficient.  

They also have fantastic pastries, donuts, cookies, soups and salads.

I don't know how they fit so much into this cute small space.

It's definitely a take out place.

My favorite bagel shop, Inwood Bagels. I love this place and thought I should write a review on it. First off they employees are nice and knowledgeable. They also have a lot of healthy type bagels and gourmet coffee which are a lil pricey but when you taste it you know where that extra couple or dollars went to. All there bagels are Fresh and I am assuming they bake them fresh every morning. Inwood Bagels is nice and clean, all the food is fresh looking and tasting. They also sell donuts that would make Dunkin donuts seem like crap... it's not a big place but it's peaceful and so worth the trip. If your in the Inwood area plz give Inwood Bagels a try you won't be disappointed.

Get a great bagel with Tofu! Cream cheese.

Yes, Tofu, you'll love it.

My personal favorite is the the Whole Wheat everything bagel, with tofu baggy.

Skip the coffee though

Been coming here since thier grand opening day, staff and owners are very polite. I haven't experienced anything close to that kind of warmth from a bagel shop. The faro salad is our go to item then it's a toss up between everything bagel with vegan veggie tofu or the artisan confectionery. Bakers Dozen for $10 is hard to beat and they have a decent variety to choose from.

Read a couple of complaints about service being slow or messing up the orders, and I have to say that had happened to us as well, in the start of the shop opening, I think it was probably due to early jitters because of recent haven't experienced those type of issues.

Often they have samples of items out or willing to allow you to sample items really has cemented my decision to return here. Something I wouldn't have got is the vegan tofu veggie cream cheese. But after sampling it although it doesn't have cream cheese in it gives you a similar texture and has great flavor so when you want a bagel without all the calories they have great options too.

Hard time picking a star rating for this place.  For Inwood, this place is pretty good.  Compared to all other bagel store options in the city, ha, not even close.  Honestly, if you want a decent bagel for not an insane NYC price, this is where you go.
I had an egg bagel and a black and white cookie, both of which were stale. The scallion cream cheese was fine. The iced coffee was good. I would not order from here again.

While I agree with the other reviews that this shop is still working out kinks, I want the business to succeed because it's a great addition to Inwood - fresh bagels, a nice selection of foods, and a super cute space/renovation.

I have only bought 2 bagels on 1 occasion - went the first day they were open & they had already run out of bagels.  The bagels can stand up to any decent NYC bagel, so no complaints.

What do you need to know in advance?
Bring cash, and small bills
The space is tiny so if you're with a few people, try to delegate someone to order for the group to make room for trying to dance around the other patrons.
Build in an extra 5 minutes.  Their systems/rhythm is not synched, and not having a lot of space behind the counter is probably part of the problem.  They need to figure out the coffee set-up, as they may be able to automate that better so that people can get that part of the order more quickly.

Finally a real bagel shop in the neighborhood. The bagels are always fresh as are their pastries. They also make sandwiches and have a variety of beverages, including coffee. Exactly what Inwood needed. Service is always fast and friendly.

I've been craving an authentic bagel with chive cream cheese and bacon for months now. I settle for a Dunkin bagel every now and then but my craving is only satisfied when I head to the upper west side. I'm happy that Inwood has a shop selling real NY bagels. I got a pumpernickel bagel with scallion cream cheese (they don't have chive) with some bacon. It was so good!

They are super new and it seems they are still working out the kinks in taking orders and preparation but it was a good bagel. Just go with patience because I could tell they were overwhelmed. I do hope they get a credit/debit machine soon because they had already run out of some coins by 9:30 am.

Your everything bagel is MY everything. Gives me life!!! And you had to go and put BACON in the cream cheese. Ugh! Buy me some bigger sweatpants cause I'm gonna need them.

Seriously I love seeing this new small business pop up and I'm going to support them. This is not just about my addiction. The people here are so nice.

The staff are always working really hard and smile and they give me tasty bagels with BACON CREAM CHEESE!!!!

Big fan of this place. Even though the bagels are not made on location they seem just as fresh. I had the tuna salad today and it was spot on. Not too much mayo and can tell it was fresh as well.

The one knock are the people working there. They are really nice but they just seem disorganized. I have seen the owner a few times step in to course correct so it's not like it is going unnoticed. Still worth 5 stars.

A tiny new place added to Inwood, we are just missing more parking and a good gym.

Inwood Bagels.. The bagels are super fresh. The creams cheese choices are really good, not too many, but among the best. The staff is friendly. Their coffee is good, really good. The snacks selection as well, and their iced coffee pre-made makes it really convenient in the morning, so you only have to grab it add some milk and you're good to go.

Mmmm I actually want one now brb..

Dope.
Period.
Excellent food, great beers, and wines. Fab location. EXCELLENT service. Aunt Carole Approved- IYKYK

This is only a 6 min walk from my apartment and I must have walked past literally hundreds of times without even nothing this place exists.

They have a great selection of beers on tap, and a pretty decent menu. I was alone and sat at the bar, but there are some small tables for two, and in the patio/garden area out back there are larger tables for bigger groups.

It's a really nice modern bar, bar keeper was friendly and they had chill music that wasn't too loud so easy to have a conversation. Also had frozen margaritas and frozen cosmos which would be great during summer.

I like this place. It's not just a solid bar... the food here is good, too. The space on the back is great, with a relaxed vibe and a nice outdoor patio as well. Their selection of drafts is impressive, but before my last visit I'd never tried their food. I'm glad I did this time.

Fried calamari: just like you want them... crunchy outside and tender inside.

Pulled pork sliders: the BOMB. Truly fantastic. Get them.

Grilled chicken sandwich: the chicken is a little dry, but it's a huge portion.

Another positive note was the service. We couldn't have been in better hands than with Victoria, who was professional, attentive and patient. I can't wait to return and have more items from their menu.

Recommended.

Sigh. Another uptown establishment overrun by the gentrifying crowd who let their small toddlers run around as they sip their beer.

Really great beer selection and their food is also good (typical bar food). I love that they still blast hip hop like it's nobody's business and the quiet patio in the back is probably my favorite part of Inwood Local. They also deliver, though I don't know how much justice you'd be doing their sliders by ordering through seamless.

Went there for the first time with my friend to grab some drinks.
Love the atmosphere. Not too loud, not too quiet. Servers r so friendly, we enjoyed the chat with them! And good to know that they open till late!!

I wish I lived in Inwood so this could be my local!

Not really, I like where I live but this is a great place.  I've been twice, most recently when my beer club met here.  This is a great space with tasty food and a terrific beer list.  Plus, the service is wonderful.

The bartender we had was really efficient and kept all 40+ of us in our beers and Brian who was taking food orders and running food and drinks did an outstanding job of keeping up with us.  

They have an enclosed back room that is good for groups and their garden is nice.  Can't wait for warmer weather to hang out there.

It's a quick trip uptown on the A to this place, so if you haven't been, get yo-self up to Inwood, stat!

See picture for lie.

Happy hour boasts $5 craft beers but charges $6-$7 on most without telling consumers. Bad business practices that are very new, there's a reason we haven't been regularly visiting anymore ‍

Hump Day was rough especially a sweltering hot day that need a cooling as I was succumb to heat exhaustion.  I desired indoor seating away from the blazing sun in the comfort of air conditioning environment.  Inwood Local was outside my time as a intervention to my travel reaching home and certainly outside of space - very distance from home but I always give the opportunity for a try.  In the passage of time and space of Inwood this bar appealed to me for Happy Hour for one peach Sangria $5.00.  It strongly tasted like lemon- NOT peach.  It surely did not contain any elements of Sangria- no fresh fruit.  This drink written on the menu should be change to "Lemon Sangria!"  Furthermore, I was not greeted with a warm welcome upon entering as apparently the heat has injected a negative energy to the male bar tender and female waitress whom appeared busy cleaning or arranging the bar rather than serving me.  No smiles.  Rude scowl looks tossed at me as this is customer service!  It was not busy as it was very early at 5 pm and the business was not packed with customers.  Obviously, they prefer to do anything else to evade my presence.  With utter dismay for such a business as the food was rated good reviews from previous Yelpers which was another reason the attraction for my visit.

Ergo, no gratuity granted.  No return visits - only fast exits.

Came here for brunch today what a great time I had.

This is one of the places I had to check in the upper West side of Manhattan [INWOOD]  after hearing friends and great reviews of this place I had to experience It myself.

I did not get the servers name but she was nice, the music was nice and low to the point u can talk and communicate.

What i order was delicious I'll post some pictures up.

Will be coming here again thanks guys.

I'd really love to love this place, too, but:

The service is GLACIAL.  Last time I went, it took 45 min (!!!) JUST to get menus.

Once we finally got our food, the ENTIRE plate was cold.  (Both plates we ordered!)  I had ordered a cheese omelet.  We know what cold cheese in an omelet is like.  The sides included in the dish were also cold (cheesy potato square; biscuit?)  After I'd sent it back for a fresh one, they'd tried to re-microwave it, but the potato thing was still cold inside.  I think it's all pre-made, in the fridge, microwaved.  WHY BOTHER going to a restaurant when you can just do it yourself after going to the prepared-food counter at the supermarket?

This is a regular experience upon dining here.  So, if you have hours to kill and aren't really that bothered by cold food, this is the place for you.

It's also VERY VERY VERY loud.  Think club volumes at all hours.  If you want to actually have a conversation, look elsewhere.  Bring earplugs too.  If you're not really speaking to your dining companions, great!

Note:  they are friendly.  At least they are friendly.  But really, the SLOWNESS and cold food issues are huge for me, and I just can't afford to return, psychologically.

Inwood Local is definitely a gem of this neighborhood. I love the vibe. Every single thing was great and flavorful. The crew was very friendly and service is exceptional. Keep it up Inwood Local! Can't wait to go back soon.

It took me a while to check out this place but once I did I knew its the kind of place I've always wanted to have in my neighborhood. The owners have a couple of other establishments in the neighborhood but this place is the only one I really liked. I've been back multiple times since and on different occasions. It's a great brunch spot as well as a wonderful casual drinking spot with friends. The menu is solid and for brunch I really enjoy washing it down with their beer mimosa. The beer menu is stellar and the draft selection is excellent. And when I don't feel like beer then their wine selection is also decent.

The front area gets louder just because of the space configuration so I prefer hanging out at the back on one of the communal tables. It's never been too crowded though so my friends and I have always had the entire table to ourselves. The staff is nice but if you are sitting at the back area then service might tend to be a little slow. But then, why are you in such a rush anyway? Relax and enjoy!

I really wanted to like this place more but the food just isn't up to par. I ordered the pastrami sliders. The presentation was great, but the pastrami was very tough to the point where I couldn't take a bite. I had the chew the small slab as one piece. The flavor was decent, and kraut was good, but no excuse for tough pastrami in NYC.

I tried the apple crisp next. Again excellent presentation. The first few bites were warm and tasty but as I worked my way to the center it was beyond cold. It was actually frozen! I don't mind that it wasn't freshly made but it needed to be heated properly.

I enjoyed the wide beer selection, but they were out of Kelso so I settled for a substitute. There is no beer offered below $6 which would be a nice option for locals on a budget.

The outdoor seating appeared not to be set up as chairs were stacked high in the garden area. I sat in the back room and watched the U.S. Open which was a nice option from the noisier front room. I was enjoying the vibe until a couple brought in their two children, one whom shrieked through most of the meal. No fault of the restaurant, but why do parents bring young kids out after 9pm?

The bathroom needed attention. The sink had some green slime in the corners and the trash can appears have taken a beating. Easy fixes with a little attention. There is one shared restroom.

I will say I did enjoy the service. They have a great team of servers and staff works together. They all smile and are happy doing their jobs.

I am going to give this place another chance  because it's close to where I live. I like the atmosphere, service, and food presentation, but they need to up their preparation game before I put Inwood Local on my weekly list.

I was meeting some friends for Brunch on a Sunday morning. It was actually
St. Patrick's day. My cousin and I got there early and (of course) got us some Bellini's and white peach sangria to start our day. The place is cute and they even decorated a little for the occasion, my cousin and I got plastic clover necklaces from the bar.. Our bar tender was good, served us quickly and effortlessly.

Once our group of about 15 arrived we were seated towards the back in something like a picnic table. I thought it was kind of cool to be seated on a picnic table in the middle of Washington heights! lol. The food was delicious. I ordered the Kobe Burger and the apple pancakes.

My issue with this place is in the service we received. The server who tended to my group must have been new. I was surprised at the fact that he really just did not get that with a large group, you have write things down and just pay attention. Now, before I continue let me say there were probably 5 tables in the entire back room and two servers taking care of them, so it was not that he was too busy.

It took him 25 minutes to bring me a Bellini, another 10 for me to even order my food. I had to ask the other  server for water because our server was M.I.A for a while. It took about 35-40 for me to get my food, once I got the pancakes and burger my friend volunteered to get me the syrup and ketchup so it would not take another 25 minutes!! He actually went to the front to get it.

After this ordeal, when the bill comes it says: suggested tip on the receipt of $18, so I am thinking this guys sucks, I'm leaving him $14! He is once again M.I.A so I go to the front to pay and they actually manually add the tip w/o my permission. I asked them why does it say suggested tip if you are just going to put it in without my consent?! I left it at that, whatever. As I am walking out my first bar tender asks me how everything was and when I tell her our server sucked, tips are added without consent  in this establishment,  but at least the food was good... she just looked at me dumbfounded and confused. I told her: "if you didn't really want to know you should not have asked!

I am giving them three stars because the place is cool and the food is good. If I ever go there again I will just eat by the bar. No matter what anyone says, this place is NOT GOOD FOR BIG GROUPS!

My favorite local bar. Very nice inside, good music, bartenders are awesome. Beer selection always has something new. The black bean burger is probably my favorite thing to order in the neighborhood. Fries are great too. The chicken fingers are delicious and so crisp. The nachos with pulled pork is awesome--huge portion so either order to share or only order if you're hungry!! Happy hour specials are good too, I think they run 4-7pm. Most things I've ordered off the menu are really good.

Intimate seating in front, open picnic-like table seating in back is great for groups, and there is also a yard area (no service outside, but you can order in and sit in the yard). A lot of room for you and your group. But also, a chill place to go solo.

16 beers on tap, 14 of those are local.  You can fill your growler here also you can buy one for filling.  Prices are very good as their happy hour.  They offer beer flights and let you taste beer and wine prior ordering if you aren't sure.  

I love the people and the atmosphere in this place, however you need not order food here,  I have sampled pretty much the entire menu and it leaves much to be desired.   Stick to the basics and you wont be disappointed here.   Anything other then the sliders and the french fries is terrible here.  They do try but it would be best if they just offered beer burgers and fries.

Happy hours is daily from 5-7 pm, and they do have special nights for wine and also poetry here.

Come thirsty not hungry to this place!  Cheers!

A generous 3. Fried chicken tenders with magical chipotle mayo is my favorite. Most of the food I've had is well done and priced appropriately.

The service leaves something a little bit to be desired. My favorite Inwood Local bad service moment is when we were seated in the tiny two top table right across from the cash register, 2 feet from the bartender. Here's how most of the evening went.

"Hi we've been waiting 25 minutes for menus..."
"Excuse me but I could I just..." (as waitress walks by and ignores me)
*Desperately trying to make eye contact with waitress at cash register*
"Hey when you're finished with that table do you mind..."
*Sad wistful look toward bartender, bartender pretends not to see*
*Awkward, hungry waving*
"DEAR GOD PLEASE PAY ATTENTION TO ME" in a starving Chris Farley voice (not an exaggeration. OK, maybe a little)
"If we reach the 20 minute mark waiting for our check, does that mean our food is free?"
*Taps pretend microphone* "...Is this thing on?"

I would return more often if I could be assured that our menu, drinks, and food would be served in a timely manner and if we would see the waitress more than two times during our stay. Please Inwood Local. I want to love you. You don't make it easy.

I used to really love this place but I went last night and was pretty disappointed. We ordered sangria and it was definitely not as good as I remember. It wasn't mixed well and just tasted like a light juice. I ordered the lamb burger. It was a little dry but overall, pretty good. On the bright side, the service was great and we didn't have to wait for a table!

I was reluctant to leave a review of this establishment, however this isn't my first rodeo with this bar. I find that the majority of staff lacks knowledge of beer and wines. I will say that the waiters are more that accommodating to all needs of patrons.

I am a big wine drinker and enjoy all types. I made a few attempts to drink the waitresses suggestions; however they were all terrible. The storage of opened bottles are horrendous! I asked waitress what else she suggested and her recommendation was for me to get up and refer to the Bartneder. The Bartneder that just got back from smoking three cigarettes, I thought to myself.

I reverted to some seltzer water and no ice to avoid issues. I love the fact that this is an uptown lowspot; however I challenge the owners to do better.

Step the wine list and knowledge of your staff. Lost drinks is equivalent to lost money...
Step it

It's not my 1st experience here .. The wine selection is by far the *BEST* I have only tried their wine selections and never been disappointed . But Really the Shiraz with Malbec  what a Good surprise..
      The piazzete appetizer .. yummy n light to get my tummy for a Fried chicken salad .. Oh how Tasty the Chicken with blue cheese .. This could be a salad to share for 2 . Mi hija loved the chorizo appetizer n the pastrami sliders are tasty and filling( enough to eat 2 and share the other 2 sliders)
Overall Inwood local is a 4 star neighborhood restaurant /bar that has interesting atmosphere a great wine and food selection and did I mention an outside garden with some tables .. In back ..

Only down size is service .. But it's not easy to hire waiters esp enough in this up n down economy .
Thank you ! to the owners who took a chance I will be back again n again with amigos n family

Inwood Local is a great spot. Every time I go, I have a nice time and I meet nice folks. The food is good, standard bar food. The drinks are mighty fine. But what really makes Inwood Local a great spot is the people, both the patrons and the staff.

Great restaurant in the neighborhood. Can have a hipster vibe at times. They have a lot of beers on tap and the selection changes frequently. They seem to like to focus on local and US craft beers, which I'm not a huge fan of, but they do always have a German or Belgium beer on tap as well.
I am crazy about their version of caprese salad because they oven roast the plum tomatoes to perfection. Chicken wings and burgers are great too.
The portions at brunch are huge. French toast is sweet and crunchy because it's crusted with cornflakes. The BLT sandwich is served with avocado on a big piece of crusty French bread.

I've read through most of the reviews here and they ring true.
TOO LOUD, in fact I can't sit up front, I always go to the rear enclosed patio.
Which may be nice in the summer, but it's very austere, plain, cold in the winter.
Food is pretty good and service is friendly, but not overly professional.
I think this place won't be around for long if they can't improve.

Really nice waiter, not much of a wait for our food even on a Sunday afternoon.  The table was clean and even had a hook for bag/umbrella which is a nice touch.
My friend had peach sangria and a bacon/leek frittata of which was a surprisingly large portion.  I had a pineapple cider (tasty!) and a burger which was delicious, with cucumber salad on top.  Overall, would definitely go back.

I go to this place a lot and they have been pretty consistent. But for some reason this time was not as satisfactory.

They had more people working than they usually do but the service was slower than when they are short.

I usually order boardeux by the glass for  me and my wife because 4 glasses cost the same as 1 bottle and thats usually what u get out of a bottle. However our first round of glasses wasn't even close to a serving. We complained to the waitress Isabel who is great by the way and she relayed the message to the bar tender Harry who refused to add some more. It's not that I wanted extra because I am a regular but a little loyalty for customer retention goes a long way. None less, next time we will just order a bottle if there is a next time. Which I think there will but just not as often.

We ordered our normal Nachos, Wings, Fries, and added a pizzette.
Nachos weren't bad but weren't their usual. Wings were still great. Fries were not cooked evenly. Pizzette was over cooked.

My second visit to Inwood Local, four years later...one less star.

Dinner time. Wasn't even that busy, but the service was annoyingly slow. The food was a major disappointment, too. Calamari were rubbery and chewy, while their burger was overcooked and flavorless.

Above-average beer selection; servers and staff are friendly; I would steer away from the typical bar food and just drink here.

A meh beer list at times while at other times, can have some better options. Typically the service and ambiance makes you forget that the beer list leaves something to be desired. However beware of the range in service that you may receive. Unfortunately their latest new hire who was wearing a large flower in her hair should be avoided at all costs. She went out of her way to be rude by stating she would go to jail if a member of our party used their passport as a form of identity, as she only accepts NY state IDs. The irony wasn't lost that she made such a strong statement when other members of our party she did not even check their ID. If she is working, I would avoid at all costs. Huge shout out to the other servers I have had that are very pleasant and helpful. Hopefully the sour server learns how to politely provide customer service.

Great Beer Garden!!!!  The staff is quick and friendly. The food is good.

I usually skip the bar and head straight to the backside of the restaurant where the outdoor garden is located.  

Inwood Local Rocks!!!!!!
Great live music, awesome vibe and really yummy food selections. Love it there on. Sunday night.

I'm so glad Inwood has this place!
Ambience, good food and great wine/ beer.

Service is so amazing!!! Thanks to the waiter who ran to give me back the purse I forgot! That meant so much for me.

Love you Inwood local!
This is a super cute place to get your beer and wine on. Great happy hour specials. Love the guacamole. Small menu but everything we had was yummy.

My husband and I have come here frequently.  The food is good and they have a great beer selection!  However,  I'm currently 9 months pregnant and just had a terrible experience.  

My husband was parking the car and so I went into to sit.  Most of the restaurant was empty.  I took a seat in the back.  A waiter came up to me and told me he was reserving the table.  I said, "oh so sorry!  Where should I sit?"  I pointed out the corner of another table and he said "Great". He brought me menus but I sat for probably 10 minutes completely ignored.  Then another waiter came up and asked me to move again.  He was apparently reserving this space as well!  Being hungry and a little hormonal I almost started to cry.  (I feel silly about it now). The waiter told me I could sit at the bar and waved me off.  I ended up just leaving.  

I'm leaving a review because this just isn't what I'm used to at Inwood local and I thought it was sad. I gave three stars because I love love love this place and I want it to stay awesome.

Great place for folks who don't want to leave their nabe for a fancy wine bar. The food is delicious: zuc fries, calamari, applewood smoked bacon wrapped scallops. So delicious. The bar tender kept my Sauvignon Blanc replenished just when I thought I'd be out= thoughtful, in my book!

Cute place for a date night. Great place for a small group in the back room (imagine twinkle lights & picnic table set up but no grass). Walk outside through the back of the bar & find a quaint outdoor courtyard. Love this place! Will be back!!!!

I love that this place is one of the few, if not probably the ONLY beer garden uptown. While I do love the uniqueness and the beer selection, I was left a little disappointed.

The prices don't match up to the food, drinks or service. I went on a Saturday night and the ambiance was pretty dead and boring. Not much going on so we left after 2 drinks. This place might be different on weeknights, but I'd stay away on Fridays and Saturdays.

The staff is very friendly and the customers seem decent and kinda hipster. I liked the experience, but was left unimpressed.

Don't order any food from this place. I placed my order via seamless.com at 9:37pm and I still don't have my food and it is now 11:05pm. I LIVE 4 BLOCKS AWAY. Due to a sleeping baby, I can't wake her up to pick up my food myself. The only reason why Inwood Local gets 2 stars is because their beer selection is wonderful and the option of outdoor space is nice.

Update: my food arrived at 11:07pm and it was cold. After an hour and a half, 4 blocks away, for a sandwich & sausage, I cannot believe the food was cold. Make an effort Inwood Local, geez. Or just don't say you offer delivery.

A beer fan will love this place, tons of beers from all over the world and wines.
the food is good, but it takes a little while to come out, but don't let that or the other reviews stop you from coming here.

Ambiance: very chill place to relax, read a book, watch a game or enjoy some live music. Inwood Local offers you all that plus a back room and a patio.

Most of the time the service is very good, I have no complaints about them.
I think the only con with this place is not having a liquor license, but remember: beers and wines get people drunk too ;)

I really like this place.

The bartenders are super friendly!!!

Great beer and wine selection.
They usually have about 16 beers on tap and many bottle selections.
Keep in mind they don't have any hard liquor. They only carry wine and beer.

The chicken fingers are yummy and very filling.

Great ambiance.
Dimly lit and the music is not overpowering.
They have outdoor seating in the back which I have yet to utilize because I really like sitting in the bar area.

Overall, a great place to have a glass of wine or beer, catch up with friends and enjoy a good meal!!

A group of 4 of Us decided to meet up on a Sunday afternoon for some beers & food. I had about two years without visiting this place & I must say it was an OK experience. The place seemed to be understaffed on a busy Sunday afternoon & we def suffered because of it. I lasted a while to even get the staffs attention to order my food; we waited a very long time for the food to arrive & I was very disappointed with my meal :/ I ordered the chicken sandwich & the bread was so HARD that I had to remove it in order to be able to eat the chicken/ avocados.  In general, I know this is a cozy spot in InWood however, they should have more staff working to avoid ppl waiting awhile to order drinks/ food & even get napkins lol

This was my first visit to Inwood Local. It is a beer-garden. They have wide variety selection of beer. However, the place doesn't have a full bar. On the menu, you will also find some selection of wine. The listed cocktails are of limited variety. In fact, only 4 types of cocktails are available.

I have given 3 stars to Inwood Local because of the service. The waitress was kind. However, she forgot my order of Fried Calamari and had to be reminded. In addition, for one of the guests, she put a pint of beer close to the edge of the table and didn't tell the patron about where she placed it. The result was that his wife and I were showered in Dark Stout as he dropped the glass on the table. Furthermore, the waitress did place glasses of water or wine very close to the edge of the table on numerous occasions.

The food was good. No one at the party complained. My Fried Calamari, which did come 45 minutes later after my initial order, came and were well done and delicious.

The location of this Local is far especially for those who don't live near Inwood neighborhood of upper Manhattan. However, if you are in the area while visiting friends or been to Cloisters, then it could venture here for a refreshing pint and some food to nimble on. Would I come back here? I'm not sure. Maybe, if I am in the area but not on purpose.

I've really come to dig this place.

Food is excellent. Good selection of beers. Service is excellent. Bartender is awesome.

Bar scene seems very chill - backroom is large, comfy and relaxed. I wish they'd ditch the TVs but that's ok as long as I'm not there during a game.

Overall vibe is really nice and crowd is diverse. I feared hipsters but it's safe.... ;-)
Great service all the time, brunch is my favorite. Cozy ambiance nice eating space in the back. Staff is really nice bartenders and servers. Family friendly, good to watch sports and converse.
A friend and I came here for Paint Nite so of course we had some apps and lots of wine. The staff was great, esp Mike. He made sure our glasses were filled quickly.

This is my brunch review for today.Food was good. I had the French toast but they try to hard with all the extra wheat cereal dipped and stuffed with a cream cheese filling. Just give me a good French toast and it wasn't hot off the grill. Just a good warmth to the food. Turkey sausage a bit overcooked. Cheddar biscuits were ok nothing to brag about. It's a good neighborhood spot all in all. I'm just not crazy about the brunch.

I've been debating on going here for a while but I've finally got a chance to check it out with a friend.

The place is pretty chill, we had calamari which was alright, the sangria was on point. I really like the atmosphere, I just wish all the seats weren't high. My butt was hurting after a while lol.

This is a little gem in the middle of nowhere! I've found a few nice places in the Inwood/Washington Heights area but haven't found anything this great. The decor is really nice and romantic with exposed brick, wooden rustic-looking high-tops and candles on all the tables. The bathroom is really clean and cute too! In theme with the rest of the place. I love the beer garden in the back, although the heating lamps aren't really warm enough but in the summer it's the perfect place.

IL also has the most consistently friendly bar staff I've ever encounter in NY. I've been there several times and always very relaxed, friendly service. The bartender makes excellent recommendations and will let u try many samples as well. You can tell they really enjoy caring for their customers.

I had brunch here and had the best BLT ever! Ive also tried their hot pretzels and zucchini fries. At brunch they have $20 pitchers of mimosas and sangria which is amazing.

I can't wait to try other food here as well. It is moderately priced and very fair for good it is.

I keep on forgetting to review this place but it's definitely one of my weekly hangouts. Usually a Friday or Saturday night I'll meet up with my friend and we will grab a beer and Pinot.

Food is great! The menu is a little obscure and random but once you've seen it a few times you know how to maneuver around it. My go to is the cheese board (feeds like 2-3), wings, and nachos.

Can't go wrong with anything there for food and craft beers.

Ok so this is why they don't get 5 stars...they run out of food ALL THE TIME. If I'm craving something it's out. That's annoying. Second there's one waitress there who acts like a ditz but she's just passive aggressive...sorry if I'm inconveniencing you with my order. Lastly...the live bands are GREAT, however do not allow sloppy garage band kids to play in there. I do not appreciate a fucking trombone or whatever in my ear while I'm having dinner and girl talk at the bar.

Anywho minor tweaks would give this place a 5 star rating but overall a great go to local bar.

Oh, Inwood Local. How the mighty have fallen. I've been coming here for over 6 years and it feels very mediocre now. The food is just meh. Prices are average. Service is... well, it is. The staff is always bordering between wildly helpful and wildly annoyed. They have a great selection of wine and craft beer, which is really the only reason to come back continually. I like the idea of Inwood Local but service and menu have to change to push this local bar over the top again. It just feels like the entire place is resting on their laurels.

Great beer selection blah blah blah.
Nice outdoor yadda yadda yadda

Most under rated thing about this place is their brunch. Hmmmmmm.
Cereal crusted french toast, hmmmmm Carbs!
Cheddar biscuits. (not as good as RL though)
Potato squares.
Everything here was pretty good.
Fried Chicken Salad was eh though.

Go here if you like your carbs in beer and brunch form.

Good food, caring, creative, and attentive staff. Parking in front.
Get anything on the menu and be happy.

The Inwood Local is a great addition to the neighborhood, with a very diverse menu. Service is always excellent and they have a fantastic cheese board to go with your wine. They only serve wine/beer and sangria.

More people need to know about this place.

From the outside it looks like one of the janky bodegas that are sprinkled all over the city, but inside is the best same breakfast sandwich and iced coffee you hungover self could ever ask for. Seriously, best iced coffee I've ever had. They also have a huge selection of sandwiches and a build your own salad option!

If I could give them zero stars I would. I ordered food at 7:50 with an estimated delivery at 8:35. I called at 8:45 because it hasn't arrived. He then told me the delivery man had already left. At 9:20 the food finally gets there. So if the delivery man left at 8:45, that's 35 minutes. At that point, everything was ice cold.

I called the restaurant, and they hung up on me, explaining it wasn't cold and maybe I could warm it up. I've never been spoken to as rudely. I hope they are taken off of seamless

I like these guys - I enjoy their food. But their delivery service is RIDICULOUS. I always expect to wait about an hour before my order arrives - btw, I like half a block away. Literally down the street.

This time I am pissed though because it's now been over an hour and a half and my order just never got here. It's not like it's even busy time because it's noon.

Anyways - ended up ordering from someone else ands or order got here before them.

So disappointing. They need to either get new or more delivery people because this is just so upsetting.

It's midnight, and you're hungry. Who is open? Ideal Mini Mart! I love their hours. They open extremely early and close at 1am.

This is a bodega, highly stocked, with a great deli. Their food is pretty good for it's price. They pretty much make it all...burgers, subs, paninis, salads and deserts... they also serve breakfast which I often like to order. If you want an affordable chicken gyro with fries, you can get that for a little over 6 bucks. A lot of their lunch combos are about 6 bucks and they do not skimp on the portions either.

Across the street is a laundromat. Throw your clothes in the wash and walk over. Have some coffee and a muffin, if anything.

Okay so i am a big fan of their food, but their delivery service isn't exactly... Ideal.

Their delivery guys generally take a vacation right before they go out. It's the only possible explanation for how it takes them an hour and a half to go 2 blocks

This is the 3rd time I've been overcharged. It seems like they are always trying to make an additional $3-4 dollars. I'll start going back when they place prices on their items and they start being honest at the register. Too bad the food is pretty good for a deli.

This place is very hit or miss, food-wise. Sometimes the food is great, other times the order is wrong (today i ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and got a panini pressed plain bagel?). The only consistent part is that it always takes at least an hour to arrive. Order at your own risk.

I live around the corner of this place, enjoyed their food, but recently I tried one of their popular dish, Fish and Chips, and it was even One Star.
Dry dry dry fish with too many bones!
This place is suspended from our list at least 2 months from now.

This place tries to look healthy but in reality is not. The vegetarian supreme sandwich sounds healthy, right? cucumber, sprouts, tomato, avocado, cheddar on multigrain bread with herb mayo? Alas, after eating it, I calculated that the thing had at least 700 calories in it.

My other gripe - the owners are just too cheap. They gave me about a pound of quesadilla with about a tablespoon of sour cream and salsa to top it. And my "cheese" quesadilla tastes like it was made exclusively of Kraft American "cheese food". Not what the description said.

Another time, I tried to order soup and found out they only had 1 out of the 4 soups advertised. And just now, I ordered a green juice that was completely undrinkable. Let's see if I can get my money back...

Yeah, the hours are good. Yeah, the prices are good. But will your food be what you expect? I guess I'm the odd one out because the others all gave four stars. Maybe I just haven't found the right stuff to order?

Every order I've ever placed and every food item I have ever ordered has been excellent. The delivery service quick and courteous, the food fresh and delicious. Their menu is enormous. I am grateful that such an amazing treasure is in my neighborhood. In this neck of the woods, 75% of the food service and markets suck. This is the one that stands tall above the crowd!
Not very fancy but the sushi bar is delicious and very fresh. Lots of parking. The staff is friendly and helpful.

We haven't gone back to this spot since we had a bad experience, BEFORE they became Inwood Farm. I am not sure why they didn't create a new Yelp page when they changed over their name, management, everything... But hey, here it goes.

This spot has changed its name once or twice, and now it is called Inwood Farm. The inside space is the same, with a nice large dining space with lots of natural light. They have a fully stocked bar as well. They have the "café" section in the front as well, with all sorts of baked goods, and ice cream too.

We were there for a brunch, so we ordered cappuccino, Crab Cake Benedict, Stuffed Brioche French Toast, and side of Bacon.

Stuffed Brioche French Toast was a nice size. It is made with Raspberry Filling and Mint, although I don't know where the mint was on ours, I didn't taste any minty flavor.

Crab Cake Benedict is pricier for obvious reason, but I really wanted crab cake... It is made with Jumbo Lump Crab, moist and flavorful. The biscuit/English muffin (?) on the bottom was a bit too hard.

We had a pleasant brunch here at the Inwood Farm, I say the new people are doing a good job! The food was tasty, the service was friendly. A nice relaxing brunch. I would like to go back again to try some other dishes in a near future.

I've been coming to Inwood Farm for almost two years now for lunch, dinner, coffee, ice cream. Although I'm dropping my score to a 3/5, it's still going to be a place on heavy rotation.

Here's the good stuff:
1. Location is amazing, looking out over the park, and some great sunset views.
2. Staff are fantastic.
3. Menu is straightforward neighborhood restaurant stuff (burger, roast chicken, steak etc).
4. Some nights they have live music (blues/jazz etc) which is always fun.
5. Good coffee (if you like a dark roast).

Here's the reality check:
1. It's a bit grimy. It kind of needs a deep clean. I've had a plate come out that had residue from previous meal. Ice cream cabinet has broken glass in it. HVAC vents have grease/dust build ups.
2. Kitchen can be a bit inconsistent- I like meat cooked medium, but asking for medium can get you anything from medium rare to well done.
3. Price/quality is a bit off. I had a chef friend order the burger (which I think is fine) and they mentioned it was poorly seasoned and kind of disappointing for the price ($18).

I still love this place, and could easily be a 4-star place with a little more attention to detail, but to be realistic I have this a solid 3 (still worth a visit, but with appropriate expectations).

What an amazing neighborhood spot in Inwood! Came here with a friend early Saturday morning when only the coffee and pastry bar was open and everyone was so friendly and the pastries were delicious. Got a spinach and feta pastry which was so flaky and I am still thinking about it.

I definitely want to come back here for brunch/dinner - the atmosphere looks great and seems like such a fun spot.

Decent brunch, but service was painfully slow (and can't say the place was particularly crowded). It was an inopportune time too--we stopped to refuel in the middle of The Great Saunter--a 32 mile walk around the Manhattan shoreline, and didn't have the near 2 hours it took us to finish a simple booze-less brunch.

I Will say that the Crab Cake Benedict and the Crispy Brussels Sprouts sides were on point. On the other hand, I ordered the Steak and Eggs which were a bit disappointing--steak was overcooked (ordered medium rare, came out brown and tough) and eggs were as well  (over medium vs requested over light).  Our server, Joyce, seemed pleasant but was a bit hard to find at times and didn't seem to expedite anything--including bringing the check--even after we indicated we were in a bit of a rush.

Dont be deceived by the looks. This was GROSS!
Hard bacon fried sooo hard it is not edible. I mean it just broke off.

The french toast was DISGUSTING!!! The raspberry jam too sweet inside. It just didnt taste nice.
The chicken was reheated purdue chicken! So disappointing

The owner was so nice. And our waitress even nicer. Dope customer service!
But very poor food.

Ps the decor of the place is beautiful!!!!! Absolutely beautiful for pics

This is a small, cozy restaurant at the very top of Manhattan, next to the tidal marsh Inwood Hill park. It is more or less on the Bronx River.

I was there for lunch with my wife.

There is a small bar, a pastry counter with coffee, and a sit  down restaurant. It has a smart and appealing menu. I had the fish tacos which was on the light side. My wife had the Cubano Sandwich, which had very good quality pork, and vibrant flavors that complemented each other.

Very cute neighborhood restaurant. Perfect for a date or nice drink and ambience.
Music just right, the ambience so cozy and loving. Outside seating very attractive, specially on a nice weather.

Pretty diverse restaurant with a coffee shop, restaurant and bar all in once.

After waiting for the Right timing to make it to this restaurant, so long between reading reviews and exploring its website to learn more about it, since I enthusiastically looking for nice local spots, I thought tonight was going to be the day.

Unfortunately they seem to be short of staff, service was extremely slow. Me and my friend stop for a glass of wine and maybe a snack to enjoy it on the little outside patio set up, which seems lovely. We waited to be seated when there wasn't a line nor the restaurant were busy. Once I get the hosts/ server attention, we walked out to the table we picked.
Around 10 mins passed for the waiter ( another lady) come around with glass of water and left immediately, trying to catch up with the order of another couple we were dining in, and they complained about being waiting so long for their order to arrived, and incomplete.

We kept waiting for over a few minutes more, at this point ( 15 -20 ) mins, no one has come up to take the order of the drinks at least. We choose to leave.
We just wanted a glass of wine and we couldn't get past a glass of water.
I'll give it my benefit of the doubt, and come back once more, hoping for the best.

Was not expecting much when a friend and I came here for lunch but this place turned out to be a real hidden gem! All of the food was very fresh and you could tell they use quality ingredients. The coffee was good and strong as well. If you sit out on the patio there are some nice views of the park and waterfront to enjoy will you dine. Would come back for drinks and their lunch specials.

Been to this spot several times when i need to have a bite or coffee while walking around Inwood hill park. Their food always taste good & looks good.

Their coffee is lukewarm everytime& i like my coffee hot. Maybe i'll stick to cold coffee next time

The view is always good, just a few steps from the river. muscota marsh/ columbia boat launch is just across the street and perfect spot to enjoy peace & quiet.

We came here for brunch.  The breakfast options were a bit limiting.  We had lunch items instead which included delicious Brussels sprouts as an app.  I had a flavored iced tea.  My entree was the shrimp wrap which was fresh and tasty.  I enjoyed the greens and chipotle mayo with it.  The rest of my family had burgers, fries and chicken fingers which was made with a great blend of beef.  I would definitely recommend this spot for a wholesome fresh ingredient lunch.  My nephew wished their ice cream was available.  Ambience is cute inside, great location by the college stadium.

I e eaten here two or three times already and have loved it each time. The menu is varied and offers something for everyone. The service is accommodating and welcoming. The atmosphere can be a bit noisy at times depending upon the time of day and whether it is a weekday or weekend.

Ordered a group lunch from Inwood Farm for a work event.

We were told to order via GrubHub, so we ordered a full day before the event and scheduled lunch for 12:30. The lunch did not arrive until around 1:40 pm, and people were ravenous by then.

I understand that the restaurant technically opens at noon, but we did give them a day's notice and ordered ahead of time. If they couldn't fulfill the time, they had plenty of opportunity to let us know, and we would have been happy to work with them. I'm wondering why they didn't plan accordingly for a large group order when they had notice.

We got a variety of food including wraps, salads, and sandwiches. The food was good and everyone seemed to enjoy. However, they also didn't include any utensils/napkins etc, which also caused disruptions and further delays for us (after having waited for a while already...) in order to procure these supplies.

Good food, but not the most reliable for group orders.

I have been coming here since the pandemic.  The coffee is always tasty and the pastries are great (especially the cookies).  The owner, Tom, is a very nice guy who always takes a second to say hello when he sees me.  I highly recommend Inwood Farm.

Beware!
I've eaten here in the past - food and service is palatable, adequate. However, I was walking past one evening and caught movement out of the corner of my eye and stopped to look in - RATS. Plural. Running across countertops, the floor, snacking on crumbs - just making themselves at home! After staring transfixed by this scenario for a couple of minutes, I managed to take a pic but a rat outside the place ran me off before I could properly document the multitude!
In a Pixar movie maybe this could be cute but in real life, disgusting and filthy. Yea, this is NYC and rats are everywhere but still. This restaurant inside and out is just teeming with the critters. Inwood RAT Farm is more like it - time to clean up your act!

Beautiful outdoor dining area, on a pretty quiet street of NYC. We had dinner on the patio & the weather was perfect. We shared a watermelon salad with feta cheese & red onions for our appetizer, it was refreshing & delicious too!
We also shared the Cobb salad  and the fancy macaroni & cheese. We really enjoyed everything! Our servers were great, fast & friendly ; ) of course we had to get a dessert, Chocolate & Banana Gelato was a really good choice

Food is a bit above average however their prices are more then a downtown restaurant, to be on this level they need to improve the Taste of the food, and bigger plate, the place needs a much needed renovation to be charging these prices,

As for the Icream one scope of Icream 5+ dollars,

Been to this place more then ten times,

Staff very friendly and understanding  for staff I would give it a 5 star.

Good food and acceptable service. However, on a recent Saturday night the bar was awful. I asked for a Negroni and was told the bar couldn't make it because it didn't have Campari. Terrible. For years, the Negroni has been a popular cocktail. Any decent bar should have the required ingredients. So, I asked for a Manhattan and was told the bar couldn't make it because it didn't have vermouth. Doubly terrible. Many popular cocktails require vermouth. What competently managed bar runs out of it? This bespeaks poor management in general. What will go wrong next time? Guess what? I won't find out; there will be no next time.

I found this place by mistake when I first moved to Inwood almost 3 years ago. It's so cozy and warm. The staff at the always so accommodating. The food is always delicious. I've been there for brunch, lunch, dinner and I have never been disappointed. On ny last visit (Saturday afternoon) I did notice that the waiters were hiding a bit; behind the bar or in the corners talking.  Guests were raising their hands and calling for them and they were oblivious. The hostesses were doing more than the waitresses were.  That was the first time I experienced that. It wasn't that busy because it was the day before Easter. Waiters and hostesses seemed to not like each other as the tension between them was palpable.  I hope they figure this out and can work together.
Food is quite good but don't be in any type of hurry, they are usually under staffed. But it's a nice place to hangout in the Inwood neighborhood.

Elevated coffee shop/cafe/restaurant all in one with solid food and drinks. We shared the farm burger, mac and cheese, and fried artichoke hearts. I had the margarita which was well made. Didn't expect to order such a heavy meal but we were starving and everything ended up being really delicious. The menu had a variety of good options.
The outdoor seating was really cute and spacious. Such a surprisingly relaxing, quiet, and cozy vibe - slightly away from the rush. Although we didn't actually have to go inside, it looked equally cute from just popping our head in. The service was kind and attentive. Would recommend and come back next time I found myself in the area.

I don't know if it's a race thing bc we were brown, but the service is horrible. we arrived, they sat us at a table and left us empty handed for a good 30-35 minutes. we were just at the table waiting to be noticed and  waiting to be attended too. finally the bartender came to our table to take our order and she was not friendly at all. the food was okay. drinks were good. and the waitress had an attitude. I wouldn't come here again . not worth the horrible customer service.

This cafe is also known as Indian Road cafe and is a cute little corner restaurant in the area close to the Allen Hospital. We came on a rainy day and a bunch of us ordered the soup and sandwich (melted cheese and grilled onions) which certainly hit the spot! Some of us also ordered the sangria and the house fries. I recommend the fries because they come with some pretty unique and tasty side sauces.

The staff are all super friendly and hospitable! We also met the new chef who is in the works of revamping the menu so stay tuned (:
This is our neighborhood go to. Warm and cozy in winter and breezy and open in summer. The food is satisfying and good. Has a hipster feel, but don't be put off, because families are regular too.
Great food. Go to spot during the pandemic getting. The burger and chicken sandwich are my go to's. Brunch is always a treat. Parking is tough but not on them.

I went there with two good friends for dinner and it was not crowded at all. There were only 3 other tables and it still took almost 10 minutes for a waiter to come over and deliver menus. He never said anything about the menu nor gave any possible recommendations. The food was good, but the waiter never, never came back over to refill our water glasses. Never once did he come over to ask if everything was okay and if were we enjoying our dishes. After they cleared our plates away the waiter never came over to ask if we would like any dessert or coffee or another drink. The service is terrible here and I do not recommend this restaurant to anyone. It's a shame because it's a nice looking little restaurant with a good ambiance. Again, the service is terrible. I repeat - THE SERVICE IS TERRIBLE

I went there for brunch.  Unfortunately what I wanted to order, they did not have any more as they had a large early morning party.  

What I finally decided to get was good and the service was excellent.

I would definitely go again

I've been coming to this place for two years, and it literally never fails.

Coffee? Strong, and generous pour. One of the baristas literally tiptoed over to my table to ensure he didn't spill a drop from a nearly overflowed mug. (And it was a huge/large sized mug, even though I paid for a medium).

Food? Slightly pricey but notice I didn't take off any stars! You get what you pay for, and the food here is wonderful. I ordered a SIDE of truffle fries (was $12) but the plate it came out on was more like an entree.

Oh, and bottomless mimosas during brunch are always fabulous- a heavy pour as me and my bf were pleasantly tipsy after only a couple mimosas. Usually places water it down, but not this place!

I want to add one more thing! Christine- oh my she is a godsend. If you have the pleasure of being served by her, you're in for a treat. I had such a weird experience with my bank, they had to cancel my card and send me a new one. I was still able to use Zelle and Venmo, but I did not have a physical debit card. I wanted to buy drinks, but I didn't have cash! I explained this to Christine, and she was kind enough to put it on HER OWN CARD, as long as I sent it back on Zelle. I couldn't believe it, that was so nice of her!

Friendly, attentive staff, great ambiance with a rustic decor, oh and a live jazz band on Saturdays!
Been here a few times close to the park. Very nice location. Food is good. People are friendly, very yuppie, so give it a try. I doubt you'll be unsatisfied.

I used to love this spot but since the change it has really gone down hill. Legit found a roach in my food and instead of the manager or owner coming to apologize (who was hanging at the bar) he made the waitress tell us that they were voiding the meal but never really apologized. I left with the quickness.

Amazingly good food. Indian Road Cafe is another hidden gem. This is about as close to getting out of Manhattan as you can while still being in it. Casual atmosphere. There's lots of good choices for vegans and vegetarians.

Because of the relatively remote location, for me it's not convenient. It's certainly somewhere I would go to more often. This at least is located close off a subway. Contrary to the name, this does not serve Indian cuisine. It's just named that because of the road it's on. As for that road, it's best you take a subway because there's not much parking around here. The food is top notch for casual stuff. At breakfast I like to have the Vegan Breakfast Burrito. It's about $11 for a tortilla stuffed with tofu scramble, with a side of pico de gallo. The price may be kind of high but of course it is with the cool rich people around here.

I would come here more often if it was convenient. It's also too pricey to go to often. The quality is excellent and it seems most people around here like it so it's not going anywhere it seems.

Food was great. The service, was none existent. You have to place your order you have to get your drinks. No utensils on the table. I guess they are going for a whole customer interactive thing, idk. Luckily they bring your food out and don't make you go to the kitchen and grab it. I will get my order to go from here on out. The view was great.

When I initially heard about this place, I thought that it was a restaurant serving Indian cuisine until my friends let me know otherwise.

My friends and I came here after visiting nearby Wave Hill Public Gardens. There was a decent amount of outdoor dining, as well as adherence to social distancing regulations. On the table, there were QR codes to view the menu and signage indicating that tables are self-service and to order inside. In addition, we were treated to live jazz music on the Saturday evening that we went, which added to the festive and light-hearted atmosphere.

I decided to order an iced mocha coffee drink and the brisket sandwich, which came with french fries. The food comes in plastic container within a brown bag.

I enjoyed the iced mocha, which was delightfully creamy with strong mocha taste and just the right amount of sweetness.

The sandwich was pretty good. It came with a nice portion of brisket, accompanied by sweet BBQ glaze, which was quite tasty. In addition, the sandwich came with cucumber and chipotle aioli. The brisket was tender, juicy, and full of flavor. There were a ton of fries, which were extremely crispy and delicious with tons of potato mouthwatering goodness.

Later, I had the chocolate chip cookie, which they were almost out of... I think I got the last whole piece. This cookie was wonderfully warm, gooey, crumbly, incredibly moist, and rich with plenty of chocolate.

The servers inside were lovely, as well as kind. Also, the other patrons were extremely friendly, funny, and there was a true sense of community... The kind that is difficult to find nowadays. All in all, an evening full of tasty food, compelling conversation, and much laughter with old friends and new friends alike.
Great happy hour! As far as what to eat, can't go wrong with the southern fried chicken sandwich and fries. Yum!
Wonderful place with warm atmosphere great views and excellent food- welcoming to dogs and families with kids too!
Love the food and the staff is very friendly. The place is cozy and the art work are beautiful

Delicious food, lovely location next to the park and river, and even some outdoor seating if you're lucky.  I wish they took reservations, or that those sitting outside had any sense of how long they are spending at the tables once they have finished their meals.  We showed up on a Friday night and were told it would be maybe 10-15 minutes for a table, but an hour later the same table that had no food an hour ago was still sitting there chatting.  But I do not hold that against the restaurant, which had live music the last two times we came.  They have been short-staffed lately, but who hasn't?  Highly recommend and we will have to come back for brunch sometime soon!

I've had my eye on this place ever since I accidentally clicked on it on my Apple Maps.

Anyone whose been out today knows how beautiful it is. It would have been such a waste to stay home. So I convinced my lady to venture out with me to northern Inwood to try out Indian Road Cafe.

Unsurprisingly, this place was bustling when we arrived. There was one table available next to a leashed adorable pupper and it was ours for the taking.

We took a seat, and I ordered us a farmhouse burger and a chicken sandwich. To drink, we went with two watermelon margaritas. If you haven't already seen my adorable picture of the marg, please indulge now. It is so refreshing, so tasty, and so Instagrammable.

The burger and sandwich were delicious. The fries come with three amazing sauces, and you need to try all of them because they are awesome!

The owner came out to take the mysterious dog's temperature which came out to 97 (kinda low for a dog). We had an interesting banter on that. He was also sure to ask us how our meal was.

All in all, this experience was a complete success. However I am curious to know: how does everyone know the owner is a Trump supporter? I looked everywhere for a MAGA sign or hat and found nothing. I separate food from politics and expect others to do the same. But yeah, enlighten me!

Will 100% return as soon as I can!

I've been coming to this place for seven years and I like it more every single day. The place is cozy and perfect for the sunset. The food is fresh and varied. If you want something very healthy just pick a salad or if you want to feel filled just go for the burger or the chicken or the stews. Whichever is your preference you won't be disappointed! The menu is of choice, well prepared, and the ingredients are fresh and delicious.

At times you hear a band or just someone coming to play the piano it s just feels very much like home, sweet home.

I would recommend to walk in the garden facing the restaurant or the park just next to it ...

Totally different vibes that busy and over expensive restaurants with loud music that you will too often find in the neighborhood or Manhattan!

A very nice place for real talks with friends wherever they come from. And the staff is also super nice just so you know.

Enjoy!

The hostess Giovanna was extremely rude to me and my family today simply cause I asked for tobacco Sauce. She had audacity to say "I am only a hostess" (basically don't bother me, that's not my job" and rolled her eyes

sadly she still represents the restaurant cause she works there. I then apologized for asking her for assistance and she then says "I'm here to help" extremely sarcastically like wow! If she was Truly there to help, I don't think she would have said that rude comment to me and my family

Very sad for such a nice place to have had such bad energy and POOR customer service :/ I really hope the manager and staff can read this review

This place is trying too hard to be upscale, even have some upscale prices. Upon arriving, we were promptly seated. No one came to take our drink orders for 20 mins. We decided to order food while we got drinks since we didn't know how long it would be before they came back. I had the risotto and fish. The fish was crunchy, and flaky, all the things you want from fish. The risotto was bland if eaten without a bite of fish. Definitely missing something. My friend had the burger with fries, which was a fine, basic burger made to look fancy. We then had the lava cake which was terrible. It was as if they threw it in the microwave to heat it up. The outside was too crunchy the inside soft but not melty. The "gelato" that comes with the lava cake was merely something like buyers vanilla bean ice cream. We also had the croissant bread pudding, which was good. It had a caramel glaze on top which reminds me of ice cream sundae caramel. Not too sweet. Finally, we shared two bottles of Pinot Grigio (house) which was the best thing we had all night. Overall it was about $80 pp, not including tip for two glasses of wine, $28 risotto, and $10 bread pudding and the worst house tequila I've ever had. Once the food arrived no one came to check on us. After we tracked someone down to order our second bottle of wine we didn't see anyone again until we flagged them down again for the check. As we were leaving no one wished up goodbye. We walked out and left as the staff was loud taking shots at the bar with what I assume are regulars.

The ambience is pretty nice, and the restaurant did accommodate our service dog, but food is important in the dining experience and the food here was just a few sprinkles of spices short of being good.

Came in for the first time and immediately felt at home, local artists framed on all of the walls, relaxed setting and music . The staff was absolutely lovely, wide range of dishes on the menu, Im a big fan of options. The crab cake was out of control, must try. The crossover between the cafe and restaurant was perfectly executed, this place does it all. I'll be back :)

The food is, for the most part, very good. Is it as good as the price tag? No. I understand rent on that corner must be extravagant, so I guess there's not much choice in the matter. But, twice I've gone there and someone's meal in a party of 4 and a baby came out late or not at all with nothing but a quick sorry after several inquiries. Additionally, there's no reasonsble sides/create your own dish. So, instead of ordering, say, a slice of toast and an egg for a two year old, we had to order an insanely expensive avocado toast. I didn't expect to pay nothing- 13 dollars, albeit ridiculous, would have better than the 20+ cost to feed my toddler.

Very good friends brought us here for lunch. They have wonderful options on the menu, they all seemed delicious. We loved what we chose, I had the chicken wrap and my wife the Salmon. The service was great and the staff was very friendly. We even met the owner, who was very nice and took time to talk to us. The pastries are baked in house. The walnut chocolate cookie is a must try!!! The location is perfect, very relaxing and quaint.

I absolutely love everything about Inwood Farm! The location is perfect, the ambiance is chill, and the food is on point. Our waitress' name was Tish and she was pleasant, professional, and attentive. We did not wait long for our food, which was awesome because we were hungry  

We ordered the following: fried chicken sandwich, chicken tenders and fries, Nonna's Ragu, and the bistro steak with Brussel sprouts. Every item was delicious. As an appetizer we had the seared scallops and boy were they yummy. The fries were so good, freshly cut and just right. The pasta dish was so tasty. The steak was tender and full of flavor. I strongly recommend you check out Inwood Farm. Oh, they also have yummy pastries and amazing coffee.

Nice, quiet place in Inwood.   Best hidden secret, the restaurant and location.   I had the burger and my wife had the Egg sandwich.  Both came with fries and let me tell you, it was absolutely delicious.  Service was fantastic.  We had a very sweet and friendly hostess and waitress.   They were all so pleasant including the guy that bought the food.

I saw the Cuban sandwich on the menu and I'm always skeptical because I'm from Miami but other menu items have been fantastic here.. so I tried it and it's truly melt in your mouth next level. Totally raised the bar on what I thought was possible for a Cuban sandwich! Nothing innovative or shockingly different about it, just the highest quality ingredients and most savory pork meat preparation. Bravo Inwood Farm!!

Came here around 3pm on a Saturday and the outdoor seating was full. There were still a couple tables open indoors so we opt for the inside.
It told about 5 minutes for us to receive our drinks and 30 minutes to receive the food. We ordered the French blue lavender iced tea, mellow mango cold drink, seared jumbo scallops, cauliflower rice bowl and country fried mushroom.
If I had to describe everything in one word, it will be: Bland.
French blue lavender iced tea: tasted like lavender infused water. Did not taste any iced tea.
Mellow mango: tasted like turmeric mixed with some milk based solvent. No mango flavor at all.
Both of these drinks were over priced  ranging from $4.75 to $5.25 and highly disappointing.

Seared jumbo scallops: on the bland side and didn't taste any truffle oil at all. The only flavor was coming from the yellow sauce.
Cauliflower fried rice: bland. I don't think any salt or seasoning was added to this dish.
Country fried mushroom: the only good thing was the waffle. It was partly crispy and soft. Would be better if there was butter but since it's a vegan dish then it's fine. The mushrooms were perfectly fried in a golden brown color. However, it was also very bland.

The quality of the food  does not match up with the price. My friends and I chose to come here due to the highly rated reviews but left feeling disappointed with the overpriced food. We definitely regret not choosing Dominican/Puerto Rican food around this area.

I love to come here for biscuits or croissants and coffee, which you can enjoy outdoors - they have plenty of sidewalk seating with a view of the river and the park.
If I were to rate their brunch, as a vegetarian I would have to give 3 stars. We had brunch here in autumn, and there simply weren't a lot of vegetarian options, including among the vegetable sides dishes because they were seasoned with prosciutto or bacon.
