The juices and empanadas are SO GOOD!! My go to is the Tasty Caribbean with added ginger. If I'm in the mood for a snack I'll grab a chicken or beef empanada with the pink sauce. The women who work there are great and the service is fast.
The green juice I ordered was delicious, the ingredients tasted fresh and the guy who helped me out was friendly and polite.

I ordered on UberEats and they called me back to tell that  they didn't have what I wanted. I replaced it with something different that was only .50¢ extra. They decided that because it was extra money they weren't going to send me the fries and soda that came with my order without consulting me, but it was ok for me to pay $8.50 for a sandwich a la carte?  Bad customer service, she wanted me to order again and pay ubereats fee and delivery service and tips just to send me fries. She was rude about it too, as if I were the one who made the decision to not get my fries.

Imagination Juice Bar is terrific. Such a wonderful addition to the area. Every thing here has wonderful flavor and taste. Staff are super courteous. They're accommodating, well-mannered and always on their game. Imagination Juice Bar - You guys are really good!

I ordered a party platter for a BBQ and everything was gone within minutes! The croquettes, pastelitos, quipes and veggie rolls were all so delicious! Service was timely and friendly. Will definitely be ordering from here again!
I ordered a Beyond Burger sandwich and I believe I was given a beef patty instead. I was a guest in NY and was very disappointed.

First of all, it's now called Imagination. Secondly, the place is absolutely amazing!! They serve smoothies and salads with fresh fruits and vegetables, and the staff is extremely friendly. I met Ivan, the owner, shortly after it opened. I had just had back surgery, and standing was a bit painful. After I ordered, Ivan immediately pulled a chair from the back, and had me sit, while I waited on my order!! I'm HUGE on customer service, and that one gesture alone, made me a customer for life!!

I go to a lot of juice/smoothie shops and this is the very first smoothie shop that makes their smoothies using fresh fruit instead of frozen fruit. I make smoothies at home all the time with fresh fruit and it's always so much more delicious than smoothies with frozen fruit that I buy for absurd prices. Finally, I have found a smoothie place that makes smoothies as deliciously as I do at home!
My order all spilled, delivery guy Ibrahima yelled at me and make me walk outside to pick up the food, I want my money back
Not for sitting down, but perfect for smoothies/juices on-the-go. My recommendation: ginger shot with lime and cayenne, whether very sick or very healthy!

I stopped in on a freezing Friday night (walked out of my way in my neighborhood) into this bright and welcoming shop with friendly and attentive staff. I ordered the Green Hulk smoothie with pineapple juice and added spirulina. It was delicious and refreshing. I had read here that Yellow Banana had been considered the best in the area and I would heartily agree. They've only been open about six months it seems but they have the assurance and leadership of being there much longer. Iván, I believe the manager, was very personable and warm. I look forward to calling them for delivery and for future smoothies!

I just moved to Washington Heights and wanted to find a nice smoothie bar to go to. I found this place and the smoothies were good. The only thing was I ordered a large and there was extra smoothie left so I ask the gentlemen if I can have the rest in a cup since I'm paying for he flat out said no and I asked him so you're just going to throw it in the garbage and he said yea. I didn't like that because one I'm huge on not throwing food away and two he didn't even give a valid explanation as to why I couldn't have the rest in a cup. Didn't make sense to me but this will probably be the last time going to this smoothie bar.

I like this place. Smoothies taste great and fairly priced and they have great add ins/shots. For what's nearby, this is pretty much the best. But it's not as healthy as maybe a health food store, which would have more green options.
I ordered a catering platter it was beyond amazing it was the most delicious platter I've ever had thank you so much my daughter and friends enjoyed it the veggie rolls were phenomenal
One of the best juice bars. The owner and staff  are very friendly. The catering platters are amazing for any event. Love this place!!
This is the BEST smoothie/juice bar . I love coming here there juices taste AMAZING ! And the food is just so delicious and addicting.
This is the best juice/ snack bar. They have it all. The food, drinks, and service is incredible. Best spot in Harlem!

I ordered from this place two to three times now, both the food and delivery service was on point most of the time. The naan bread I ordered was burnt on one side (to the point where you give up trying to eat it) but other than that, has been exceptional all other times. The delivery is one of the fastest from places I've ordered in the area. Last time I ordered, I had to call the restaurant and communication was difficult as the gentleman could not understand any English. Usually, I don't mind as long as it's enough to answer basic questions/ share super basic information, but this actually got in the way of me knowing anything about the order ( like where it was). If I had suggestion, it would only be to make sure whoever is answering the phone is able to somewhat communicate with customers about their orders. A samosa that came with my meal was drenched in grease, good thing it was free. Other than that, the flavors and textures have been great. Also, packaging is efficient to keep the naan warm in route.

Pros: Fastest delivery ever, food is decent and satisfies the Indian food cravings, includes utensils and naan well packed.

Cons: Communication issues, greasy samosa and burnt naan (chance it may occur).

The fact that these guys deliver to me north of 181st street is amazing. Five stars for that alone. Their food is flavorful and delicious. Far better than the Indian I have literally around the corner.  Whenever I call they know exactly who I am and always get treated well.  

For Indian takeout in Washington Heights, this is the ONLY place to order from.

This review is for take-out only

I recently saw that Indian Express delivers to Washington Heights without delivery fee as long as you have minimum of 15 which is awesome.

So far I have ordered twice and it is so much food! First time I ordered the Chicken Tikki Masala Special and Mango Chutney. Oddly I can't believe I'm going to say this but these items were kind too sweet for me. Did not enjoy the chutney but will be ordering tiki masala again

Second time Lamb vindaloo special and rice pudding. I decided I wanted more spice and kick since the first item was really sweet and left me craving the opposite. This dish was pretty spicy but yummy!

The Specials come with nan, side of you choice, rice, and the main item. It is a lot of food so you'll probably be full.

This place may not be the best curry you ever had but for take out this place is awesome and satisfies your craving!

The food was excellent until we got to the end of our Marsala chicken and found a roach IMG_8927.jpg

I was literally sick . I'm eating bread for a few days now or forever
I love ordering delivery here.  Fast, friendly, and reasonably priced. I guess it's called express for a reason!

Food is tasty. However,  a little disappointed in the presentation of the chicken Tikka Masala there was way too much sauce and not enough chicken. Also the menu stated there are vegetables and there were no veggie with the meal . Overall, I enjoyed the meal after removing most of the sauce . Next time I will double check order prior to delivery and my suggestion to you is to do the same .

I just ordered delivery from here yesterday and I got the Paleek Paneer, mulligatawny soup, garlic naan and a mango lassi. First of all, the special is the BEST deal around (about 14$ for the paleek paneer, naan and appetizer)!!!

Although I've had better paneer, it's a huge portion and I'm not complaining at all. The naan and mulligatawny were also really good.

But the BEST in the order is the mango lassi. It is the creamiest, sweetest thing around!!! I'm so happy I got it, it is by far one of the best lassi's I've ever had!!!!!

2.5 stars. Let's call it ... the better side of "meh". Ordered chicken vindaloo and a chicken samosa. Vindaloo somehow both spicy and not very flavorful; reminded me a little of the sweet and sour sauce you get at the Chinese place (only a little though). Chicken not too dry but not great, and more of it would have been nice. Samosa filling was dry but also very flavorful, the (shell?) of the samosa was excellent. The order was prepared quickly, handed to me by a friendly man, possibly the owner/manager. Good prices. Might try again, if only to get some samosas, in which case I'll update my review.

The word is "inauthentic". I ordered Paneer Makhani which was salt-less & tasteless. If I had to put Paneer in a ready to eat gravy available in the market for much cheaper, why would I order online from a restaurant? Not happy!!
The food was ok. Had good flavor. Not spicy enough. The naan was a bit on the tuff side

If you live or work in the neighborhood you quickly realize how little variety there is available. There are good options, but I can only eat diner, Dominican or Mexican so many times before I gag.

I stumbled upon this place. The Seamless reviews had me concerned because of the complaints of very long delivery times. But I had to try, because I couldn't get myself to order Mexican or a burger again.

I was not disappointed. The food arrived quickly, hot and the portions of the main were decent. The appetizer was a bit on the small side for the price and the garlic naan was a bit burned but OK.

I ordered their shredded chicken. It was good, but the chicken was in small cubes and not shredded. Also, the sauce was a bit too sweet, but overall I was satisfied.

My only complaint is that they did not include utensils. A must for delivery. Also, most Indian places include a small side salad and some vegetable side, but here you will get exactly what you order.

Delivery review

Vegetable Samosa, Mulligatawny Soup, Gulab Jamun, Raita, Mango Chutney, Roti

Samosa : perfection
Soup : very good lacks salt though
Mango chutney : it's very sweet and marmalade like. Not sure if it was dessert or a side / dip
Raita: different than what I expected. This was like watered fruit yogurt but it was for some reason good
Roti: was fresh and warm when it arrived
Gulab jamun: very sweet dessert in syrup the highlighter of it all

Stuffed my face
*Update: Aloo Gobi Mutter is less spicy than Aloo Gobi Jeera
The beat Indian Ive had in awhile. Wow. The delivery was super quick and the food so flavorful. True Indian!

We ordered delivery from here and were very disappointed. My boyfriend and I both got the briyani, his was lamb and mine was vegetable. The vegetable briyani was terrible - borderline inedible. There was no flavor, and the side sauces they gave didn't add much either. It lacked all of the vegetables you want in a briyani, like onions and raisins and potatoes, but instead was just yellow rice tossed with mixed vegetables. This is not what was listed on the menu, and I'm not interested in peas and corn in my briyani. The lamb briyani tasted more like beef and also lacked the flavor you hope for in an Indian restaurant. Never ordering from here again, suggest that you don't either.

I love this place! They have the FASTEST delivery time I've ever experienced- and very reasonable prices! I always get the Lamb Vindaloo Indian Express Special- delicious! And it comes with Naan and Samosa, plus i order a delicious mango Lassi- great addition to the neighborhood. btw, this is my first and only yelp review- enjoy!
TJ

I don't have a lot of experience eating Indian food but so far the most flavorful Vindaloo I have ever had!!!!  Not too salty, Spicy yummy goodness.  I enjoyed every bite.  The only knock that i have is that they give you very little meat.  You'd think that they would serve a little more for the price but thats it.  The Garlic Naan was also good but probably could have used 1 more minute in the oven.  I'll be ordering from here again very soon.!!!

Great delivery Indian for the neighborhood. I'm only concerned about the actual establishment as I've passed it and it doesn't look like the most sanitary place. Their grade has been pending for months.... interesting.... food is decent price and I will order again!

I LOVE this restaurant and have been ordering from them for years!! They have the best Chicken Tikka Masala I have ever had! I'm not sure if Grubhub has a way of showing what I've ordered from them previously, but I always order the same thing: Tikka Masala, Veggie Samosa, and Cheese Naan. This evening I made a mistake and quickly pressed "Chicken Tikka" as opposed to my usual order of "Chicken Tikka Masala". I wasn't even aware of my error, and was excitedly waiting for my order to arrive when I received a phone call from Indian Express. They were calling to confirm that I meant to order the regular Tikka and not the Masala, or if I had made an error while ordering on Grubhub! I am so appreciative for them contacting me, because I would have been so bummed if my order was missing the delicious yogurt sauce due to my mistake (the BEST part!!!) Thank you, Indian Express, for exceptional customer service, speedy delivery, and the very best Indian food in NYC!!

WARNING -- YOU MAY FALL IN LOVE

This restaurant is spectacular! I have had their veggie samosas, their nan, their garlic nan, their chicken vindaloo, a few different eggplant dishes, a few spinach dishes, a couple chickpea dishes, a potato dish, and their okra dish. Some okra dishes from other restaurants are big and clunky. This is well-seasoned, juicy, and cooked-down so it's the right balance between being okra and being part of the dish. You know? The potato dishes are excellent. Eggplant dishes are my favorite and they do a few kinds which have different sauces, each totally on point.

I have shared this food among friends and I/we have NEVER had a problem with any dish and everyone agrees the food is excellent, every time!

Basically I swear by this place and I will recommend to everyone I know. Get the Indian Express special -- 12.95 for a main dish, naan, and rice.

They do take-out and delivery, though there's a table inside if you want to eat.

Enjoy!

I ordered through Seamless. I usually order from Hungry Bird and wanted to try some place new. The food was about 10mins late (it was raining outside) and the guy delivered to my apt door. The order was correct. Ordered the chicken tikka masala special w/garlic nana & chicken samosa and aloo tikka chole. The chicken tikka was very tasty and the chicken was tender. The garlic naan was not very garlicky. The samosa was very juicy inside. And aloo tikka chole was good. Overall I would order again.

I ordered the chicken Tikka Masala, the sauce is so so good, but if you can't handle spicy make sure you get mild. I wanted to try medium out, but medium taste super spicy at least to my taste buds. But other then that I will definitely order again. PS make sure you mention utensils and napkins I didn't get any but I saw other reviews you have to ask. Oh and the Garlic Naan is Amazing and huge!
Just ordered for delivery. It took awhile to get here but it was quite tasty. Nice portions. Would order again.

I ordered from here because they have free delivery to Washington Heights. My expectations were low for a take out place in this part of town, but this place is great! I got the chicken tikka with a side of vegetable samosa, and an extra order of garlic naan. The food arrived promptly and was still hot, and I even got a call from the restaurant notifying me when my food was 5 minutes away.

The chicken tikka was the best I've ever had; creamy, slightly sweet, and not too spicy, which was perfectly suited to my tastes. There was way more sauce than meat, so maybe this wouldn't be enough for a carnivore. The samosa was big and still crispy after being wrapped. The naan was very fluffy and not burnt. Overall, a lot of delicious food for an affordable price. Would definitely order from here again!

Love this place!
The Indian Express Specials are AWESOME! An entree, rice, bread AND an app for 12.95 or so? Hard to beat it!
I usually order Chicken Tikka Masala and Palak Paneer which are delicious and my boyfriend has ordered the Lamb Vindaloo (forewarning, quite spicy for him which I didn't think was possible) and Saag Gosht which he loves.
Delivery is prompt and I have never had any issues with missing/wrong items.
.............
Unfortunately I moved from Harlem to Inwood recently and delivery stops at 180th street :( :( :(
Would be AMAZING if delivery opened up through Dyckman!! Pretty please! :)
A lot of food for the price and it was the best Saag I've had in Manhattan! Definitely ordering again.

I've ordered from Indian Express a half-dozen times since they've opened and have never been disappointed. My wife and I love Indian food and this has become our go-to spot in Harlem (there are at least four others). The food is seasoned well and tasty. Their service and willingness to please the customer is excellent as well. If you're looking for good Indian cuisine "uptown", this is the spot.

I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT. Don't bother calling in your order because nobody will understand you, just use Seamless. The food is A++++ ! Great price, great portion sizes, and fast delivery. The food is always hot when it arrives, which is amazing. I am so glad I found this place, I order from here at least once or twice a week. The Chicken Tikka Masala, Palak Paneer, Mulligatawny soup, the Samosas, Naan, are ALWAYS perfect! I love you Indian Express! Keep paying your rent and cleaning the kitchen, never go out of business please!
Delicious food, and speedy delivery! A feast for two for two days! Cauliflower is bomb and the spice they added when we requested "extra spicy" was so flavorful and not just burning hot.

Massive eye roll to the user review left before me. Everything I've ordered has been correct and extremely delicious. The delivery has always been prompt and the people who work here have been NOTHING but nice to me. They go above and beyond. I would never sit in the restaurant and eat because it's entirely too small. But yes, I would come here again and again and again. Their lunch special is 13.95 + tax and comes with many things. So, excuse me while I order for the fourth time since I've discovered this diamond in the ruff.
Awful awful awful!!! Ordered delivery, EVERYTHING was wrong, and super gross!! So frustrating.
I ordered Baghare Jinga. It was disgusting. It was like ketchup and chunks of terrible shrimp. They refused to give me a refund. Do NOT order from here.

I've lived in the Hamilton Heights/Sugar Hill section of Harlem for close to a year, and this is the first Indian restaurant i've encountered in my new neighborhood which has managed to deliver food that both tastes good and is made from quality ingredients.  Other Indian restaurants in the area have tended to serve meat that is obviously fatty, and to add too much sugar to their entrees, ruining the flavor.  As a result, we'd been returning to our old neighborhood for decent Indian food -- until now!  Finally, we've found a good Indian restaurant which delivers!  I was particularly pleased to find numerous and varied vegetarian dishes on the menu. The black bean/red kidney bean dish I ordered was delicious, and my daughter enjoyed the chicken curry, which consisted of lean slices of chicken in a flavorful sauce.  It's also worth mentioning that both the man who answered the phone and the man who delivered the food were notably courteous and polite.   After this experience, the Indian Express menu is one that I will definitely hold onto and order from again.
Tasted really good!! Wait time was a bit high but it was well worth it. The Ambiance was nice and felt kind of rustic.

Haven't tried the pizza, but I did pop open the box of chicken tenders and eat one while walking home. These were a huge hit. Very crisp, nicely seasoned, a hint of spice. Also the tenders were big, so $9 for a box of five was not outrageous.

Will definitely be in here again soon.

Make no mistake about it, the pizza is good... But the price hike is outrageous. And unless these prices come back down, as inflation eases, I don't see them staying open much longer in this neighborhood. A slice jumping by a dollar fifty, in one shot? You can't be serious. Especially when the special they were offering was 2 slices and a can of soda for five dollars. Now a slice is four dollars. LOL I think they forgot that they're a corner pizza shop. A slice of pizza is supposed to be quick and cheap eats. I'll check back after the pandemic.
The pizza tastes great. Has a strong sauce. The wait time for a large will take forever though.

I've been dining here daily for the past 2 months and it's alright.
At least we get to eat surrounded by a beautiful decor and it's steps away from our dorms. There is always a salad bar, which is decent, with the usual condiments. Then there are usually 2 hot food stations, one usually serves chicken and vegetarian options, and the other one rotates different specialty foods such as crepes, stir fry, tacos, etc. It takes a while to know the tasty items from the bland tasteless ones (stay away from the pasta in the right hand hot station). I tend to stay away from the meats, but the chicken and the crepes tend to be very well prepared. The portions are enormous! I can never finish my plate. The desserts I usually pass on, they are not good, except for the warm apple cobbler which is made to perfection. Overall, it's worth the cheap price and I don't mind eating here regularly. Besides, the service here is always nice and friendly :-)

This is not a buffet. It's pay for what you get. Summer menu is limited and full menu will be back on September 3rd. Drinks are no refills. Pastries are like basic low tier grocery store quality but for nearly triple the price. It's best to just take the bus/subway to a grocery store and stock up on breakfast items. For some reason, I paid $6 for a small apple danish and small fountain drink.

You can select ingredients (pineapple, watermelon, grapes, yogurt, milk, soy milk, almond milk, orange juice, etc) for a guy to blend you a smoothie. I added a lot of honey and still  noticed how bland and sour the fruits were. Friend said the fruit sucks. $3.60 (?) For 12oz. $5.50 (?) For 16 oz.

I'm from a poor family and I appreciate food, so if I think the food is mediocre, then rich international residents would think this is fecal matter.

ihouse recently changed the food provider from FLIK to AVI. Everyone hopes food will be better.

After a while, I have noticed several times that they were changing the menu (compared to what they posted online) and selling leftover meat from the day before.

I give an example here. Day 1, they had Korean bulgogi with beef chunk (same as online menu). Day 2, they supposed to serve linguine pasta with shrimp but changed to beef chunk all of a sudden!!! (online menu was linguine pasta with shrimp on next photo). I personally never ate pasta with 'beef chunk' before.

After seen these several times, I questioned the chef why you guys kept changing the menus, the guy was nice, but his response was a bit silly, he said they are new company, the menu was from last company's...

Convenient for the students/families who don't have time to cook or work too much. Staff is nice and friendly. Breakfast is not bad, salad bar too. Pizza is horrible. They do have OK grilled chicken served almost everyday. And they occasionally have some good meals like risottos, burritos, etc. served at the first station from where you enter. Overall food quality is not the best, but it's nice to have a dinning hall to go to while I'm still at home and it's freezing outside.

The proper name of this place should be 'Comfort and Compromise': comfort because the residents have a dining option within the house elevator, and compromise because they truly compromise many standards by dining there... I eat at Barnard/Columbia locations more often since the only consistently reliable option is a breakfast. Other meals tend to support a high-carb and low-taste diet which I am not a particular fan of. So it's +1 from 1 star for convenience but not a dime more.

Great place that usually stops around lunch time. They accept card now! It used to be cash only when they first started and when they were a cart

The food is cheap, filling and affordable. Reminds me of Indians take on halal cart.

The food is not very saucy. They keep everything to a minimum. They'll put spicy sauce or white sauce on your food depending on what you request.

How does this business not have any reviews? My fabulous coworkers introduced me to this truck and I am so glad (my waistline may not be).

There was a bit of a line but it moved rather quickly and I was glad because it was cold outside (below 30). The food was so good I was dreaming of it while eating it.

Try anything on the menu and I guarantee deliciousness in every bite.

This place is GREAT! There is a specific region in Italy called Puglia that is known for panzerotti. You can also get them in Milan at a famous spot called Luini. It's rare to find panzerotti anywhere else in Italy, let alone in America.

I've travelled all over Puglia, from Bari to Ostuni. This spot serves amazing panzerotti that taste as good as any in Italy, which makes sense given that, as I understand, the owners are literally from Puglia.

If you've ever had panzerotti, you already know whether you like them or not. If you do, this place is bomb. If you don't, then you don't! If you've never had one, then ignore the naysayers and try one here because they're as good as they come. Honestly, I was completely shocked that they managed to make them as good as those in Puglia, but I was pleasantly surprised.

My advice is try to classico first. If you like that one, then begin expanding your horizons to the other flavors!

It's really exciting that one doesn't have to fly all the way to Southern Italy for an authentic panzerotto!

I think a more accurate rating for this spot is 3.5 stars.

The service is amazing. The woman at the counter was so lovely and was hands down a 5/5.

As for the food, really fairly priced for the size but man it was oilyyyyyy. I love some deep fried food but wow I don't know what sort of oil they use to fry everything but it really felt like the dough had soaked up a lot of it.

There's plenty of options for non-meat eaters which I really appreciated. I find a lot of the time the veggie items are like tomato and basil and some other basic red sauce related dish but in this case there were indeed some options to pick from.

The spot is really quaint and good for a quick bite.

This was my first time trying panzerotti - I passed by the store while I was in the area running some chores and thought why not?

The store is cutely decorated and the menu had good variety. I was a little disappointed with my experience as the cashier got my order wrong 2 times when I was trying to pay (I had to pay twice because of this) even though I was the only customer at the time... It was also disappointing that there was no packaging for to go orders - my panzerotti was put on a paper plate, stuffed into a brown paper bag..

The taste itself was ok - similar to a calzone but a little more doughy. The flavor was also not bad.

I would recommend eating it there as their lack of packaging meant it didn't travel well.

I guess I got there just in time last month. Very happy I ran into this great spot. I haven't had Panzerotti since I lived in South Philly years ago. They don't make it anywhere I know of here in the South. It was just as I remembered it. Perfectly deep fried golden, crispy goodness. Hot and gooey cheese inside along with a wonderfully tasty sauce. It was the same taste I remembered as a kid and I savored every bit of the two I ordered. If you have never had inside out pizza, please try this great spot when they reopen.

Looking for a quick filling bite then this is your spot. Somewhere between a calzone and an empanada one of these is a full meal   The one I got had ham, cheese and mushrooms. They make them fresh to order and it's not too much dough. It is fried vs baked so be warned. You can get them half sized which is the size for the dessert ones. They also have some nice Italian like sodas to go with and fresh potato chips on the menu.
No tables but counters to eat in so take it to go and head to a park

Very weird. I've been to a Panzerotti place in Brooklyn a few times -- it's very good -- and I saw this place and figured given that it's the exact same branding, the exact same menu, literally the exact same everything that it was a new location of that store.

Nope. No connection.

So basically it appears like this place just straight ripped off everything about a small business in Brooklyn and took it to Manhattan.

If the food is similar, fine, there are lots of steakhouses and sushi places. But these guys straight ripped off everything down to the typeface in the logo.

That's some wack shit. No thanks.

Good idea for original Italian food. Soft with amazing filling.
Thank you for having me

We ordered lunch for the office after I came and had some the day before to try it out and suffice to say I was not disappointed again! And neither was the office. Hopefully I've created some repeat business as they really deserve it for the fantastic quality!
Only slight criticism is that I would recommend that if you get the calzones from here eat them ASAP as they do tend to get soggy after a bit of time so it really is a race against the clock to eat it before that happens not much the guys can do about that. It's science lol
Panzaburger is like no other burger I've had before. Totally on point! A must try if you love burgers.

We were walking by one afternoon and the building is so cute, so we decided to check it out. I had the ham and cheese and my friend had the eggplant parm. Both were crispy and delicious. They start you out with paprika chips while you wait for the food and those were flavorful and fresh. Ate those right up.

This was my first big panzerotti and i loved it. It was hot, cheesy and very tasty. Would def come back and recommend.

At the time I went, they were offering half sized panzerottis. Just a warning that these take longer to make than regular size:
- The pepperoni was pretty good. It's a nice spin on a regular pizza slice.
- The parma ham was really good. The ingredients here paired well with the bounce of the panzerotti.
- The pistachio was surprisingly also good too. I never thought the pistachio cream and mascarpone cheese would taste good together, but it worked.
- The nutella was my least favorite mostly because I am not a huge fan of nutella. I definitely prefer the pistachio over this if you're looking for something that's mildly sweet.

BUONISSIMO E AUTENTICO!! My boyfriend and I were walking past and he casually remarked "oh someone's making panzerotti." He's from Rome and was a bit surprised to see a panzerotti place in the West Village, so we decided to go in on a whim. Best decision we've made in a while... ridiculously fresh and authentic dishes which, as my boyfriend said, "tasted like Italy." We honestly couldn't wait to get home to eat our Margherita panzerotto and complementary dessert. Both were *sublime* - highly recommend dropping whatever you're doing and heading over there now! We'll definitely be back soon... a presto!Classic PanzerottiClassic Panzerotti
Unique and a  only way I can describe as pizza/calzone.  Very consistent every time I go. I'd would definitely go back a third time.

You know what made this worse? Getting a nasty reply from the owner. I've been eating Panzarotti my entire life. I don't need a wiki on something I've experienced for more than the owner has been alive. Again, for anyone that wants an actual Panzarotti, that won't drip all over your table, look elsewhere.

I absolutely love this place and couldn't recommend it more highly. I've been to their location in East Village as well and both branches make consistently great panzerotti and pizza. The staff in all locations is super nice and accommodating and the food is always fresh, made with quality ingredients, and tastes great! The prices are more than fair considering all the high quality ingredients used and given that everything is made freshly right in front of your eyes. There is so much love for detail in this store and I really loved the step-by-step guide projected on the wall on how to make your own panzerotti, what a great idea! I'll definitely be back for more!

Well I had a hankering for a Panzerotti, and this place hit the spot this afternoon. Crispy fried exterior, soft doh on the inside, and a juicy and beautiful filling.

If I were the owner I would cringe every time I the C word in a review, I'm going to be nice and not even say it. This is Panzerotti, Panzerotti, Panzerotti. Even if they offer to bake it for you, it's not one of those Ricotta filled blasphemy's.

Super awesome girl taking orders and bringing out the food. Was like they read my mind, didn't serve me the two I ordered together. Brought me one and when I was close to finishing, the other came out. Perhaps this was just a necessity in making and filling the orders, but it worked for me. I had to order a 3rd for the road. When I asked about how spicy the Jalapeño honey one was she was very careful about calling it being conscientious of the different sensitivities people has to spice. She did provide enough detail that allowed me to make the call and I am happy I did so. Sweet with a relatively mild spice and very tasty.

If your like to indulge your taste buds, don't get a slice somewhere, pick up a Panzerotti. If I had known this place existed, I would have been there 9 months ago. It just so happened I was reminiscing about my early days at my mom's office in downtown Toronto and how I used to love the Panzerotti place and thought I should be able to find one in New York. Yelped it and viola only 7 blocks from my office.

The only thing that could be problematic was the price. One is just not quite big enough and they are $8 each. So either they need to make them a little bigger, stuff them more or give you 2 for no more than $12. Having 2 with a drink for $18 is not an ideal lunch cost.

I'm two bites into my Parma Ham Panzerotto (prosciutto, fresh mozzarella, arugula, and truffle oil), and here I am typing this review with one hand...panzerotto in the other obviously. I've walked past this new spot numerous times, unimpressed with what just looked like an overpriced calzone joint. Let me tell you how wrong I was...

What they're serving looks simple, but when simplicity is done right with fresh and superior ingredients, that's all you need to say they have the wow factor. Whilst I continue to inhale the remainder of my lunch in the office, I can't believe this unsuspecting calzone/empanada/sandwich just gave me flashbacks of dining al fresco in Italy :)
Made fresh!  Super light dough. I got my classic Panzerotti baked In fear it would be heavy but the dough is so light you could easily fry and still be good. Super clean shop. A real hidden gem

I just ate a deep fried ham sandwich, and I feel really good about it!

Seriously though, I've been here a couple of times for lunch with MealPal and they are my new favorite treat on the block. The guys are also really friendly and looking to build a clientele so they're generous with samples, etc. Really yummy spot!

I was prepared to savage this place, after being the first customer to arrive and the last to be served. To make matters worse, I was served the panzerotti that the woman beside me ordered-and vice-versa. So it basically took them nearly an half-hour to serve me the item on the menu I had actually ordered.

That said, they did eventually give me the Panzerotti Classico, along with a complimentary batch of fried dough and chocolate. Anyone who knows me knows that sweets are the way to my heart, so all is forgiven. Hopefully, my next trip to ILP won't be as eventful.
I love this place! Authentic and Delicious Panzerotti! Great prices too! The owner is very friendly. Highly recommend!

New place just opened and is definitely worth trying! Stopped by on my way home from work and got the classic. I've had more calzones than I can count but this was my first time having Panzerotti and it's definitely different. The dough tasted a lot more like zeppola than a pizza dough since these are fried vs a calzone being baked. All ingredients were really fresh and I liked this more than a regular calzone. I'll have to go back to try some of the other items!

I love Panzerotti too now. I didn't know what Panzerotti was until today. It's like a calzone as we know it, but fried instead of baked. And the dough is rolled out thinner. It was yummy. They offer savory and sweet panzerotti. I would give the food five stars because it was very fresh and the bread part was delicious. I got smoked salmon, fresh mozzarella, arugula and it was served on/in an empty calzone/panzerotti "shell". It really really scrumptious. Unfortunately I had to send my first Panzerotti back because it had truffle oil on it. I detest truffle oil. So they really need to indicate that on the menu. Fortunately another person behind me also ordered the salmon too and overheard me me mention the truffle oil. She also did not want truffle oil. Fortunately, they made another Panzerotti for me. Sadly, I waited 15 minutes for my Panzerotti to be remade. It does not take 15 minutes to put smoked salmon, mozzarella and arugula on a calzone. I got there about 11:50 AM. So it wasn't that crowded. I'll attribute it to the staff getting ramped up. I have to say that the homemade spicy potato chips were a highlight. They had just the right amount of heat. and they weren't barbecue flavored, which I liked. I would've liked to have eaten the with my sandwich but because I was waiting so long, I ate all my chips before I got my panzerotti. Oh well. The food was excellent and I think my instance was probably a one off. I also sampled their "Classic" which was already made. I preferred my panzerotti with the smoked salmon. I would come back and order the one I got sans truffle oil (and avocado) and I recommend you confirm what is on your made to order panzerotti.

Surprising tasty and light dough. For us plain white Americans, the signature food item is kind of a traditional Italian pizza/calzone combo -- and for those who haven't had one, traditional Italian Pizza is a very thin dough with minimal toppings. So it's this thin pizza like dough with fillings inside. I had mine fried (recommended by the staff). They are made to order, so expect a little wait.

Great! Love this Panzerotti place :) I'm from Italy and this brings me back home!!

Definitely try the classic and the Parma Ham - Italian approved!

This place was super cute inside and outside. Staff was extremely friendly! The panzerotto was a bit on the pricey side, but overall the taste was heavenly. I was able to get full off of one pepperoni panzerotto and small serving of their homemade chips (which was also delish btw)! I also tried the Clementine Carbonated Beverage (the orange one), and the taste was was divine. Definitely will be returning.  Thank you for bringing a Little Taste of Italy to this area.

First off, I would like to say how friendly the staff is and you can definitely tell that they serve authentic and fresh fried calzones. I have heard about Panzerotti before but, and usually I am not a fan of fried foods, but these calzones are BOMB. I had the parmigiana calzone they recommended having it fried since it's my first time trying a calzone. They also serve it baked.  You can really tell the ingredients are fresh from the taste and you can even see them hand make the calzones right in front of you. The environment of this spot is also just really chill and the energy is great. Also, they have an ad posted saying for every Panzerotti you buy feeds a child in need which is amazing. I will definitely be coming back.
Update: I tried a few of the dessert panzerotti and I really liked them! The warm Nutella was amazing! I want to try the heart shaped ones next time!

Hi peeps.

Checked out this super awesome Italian chic place the other day.

Didn't really offer any low carb options but ya know. Their pizza was gluten free, dairy-free, vegan but like ya know vegetarian or like ya know that thing.

Anyway. Follow me on Instagram @influencersinthewild and I'll promote your content.

Came here bc of the good yelp reviews. $9 for the ham panzerotti....got an overfried empanada thing with a thin slice of ham. When i brought it to my work desk, there was grease dripping all over the table. Gross. Waste of money.
I had a great experience here. Friendly staff, fresh ingredients and very delicious. I ordered panzerotti and my friend ordered pizza. Both were backed to perfection.

This was pending for a long long time. We visited New York in July;had never heard of panzerotti & were curious about it. The person from the store must have figured that out. He came outside, explained what it was & encouraged us to give it a try. We ordered just one for tasting, he was kind & offered us all potato chips while we were waiting for our order. I didn't quite enjoy the panzerotti but my son became a huge fan. He had one almost everyday!! His smile told me that the food is super yummy!! It is a small place with awesome food, that fills up the heart :-)

I wus heere at 2AM (it's 10:36 now) and it waz closes. Wtf man. I'm trying to get some tacos bruh.

Then I came back the next day and saw it was Italian. My bad fam :(

Fried dough stuffed with cheese or other delicious options of your choosing, made fresh in front of you - what can be better?! This is a type of southern Italian food and it did not disappoint! I love simple delicious ingredients personally, so I had mozzarella with tomatoes and basil (classic). Really great! If it is busy, just remember that all good things come to those who wait...at least at this place this is true:)

YUM!!!  Really great, fresh panzerotti.  I never had this before and I'm sooo glad I tried it!  The pepperoni was absolutely delicious.  Like a pepperoni calzone, but the dough was so light and airy.  Will definitely be back for more soon!
I love panzerotti!  Fried dough light and crispy stuffed with savory or sweet, great quick bite or dessert.

I went here recently and the food was really good! The first one I tried I got fried because that was recommended but fair warning it's greasy. The homemade chips were nice and light. I wouldn't come around lunch time because it gets very busy and the place is small.

Really good, fresh ingredients. Fast service so so tasty. Never heard of this before but it was worth the try. A bit pricey i think. They should sell the meal with the chips for 9 dollars. Not one panzerotti for 8 and the chips for 4. overall good spot.

I ordered the baked pesto calzone with vegan cheese. What I got was an canola/olive oil blend sponge with some flavoring. The bread pouch literally shot hot oil onto me when I cut into it. The food continued to drip as I ate it. Absolutely disgusting and unacceptable for 8.00. The workers were also completely uneducated on allergies . Told them I was allergic to eggs and got a litany of things that had cheese in them.

I grew up in Milan eating the amazing panzerotti at Luini. Couldn't be happier and more excited to see that panzerotti are now available in the Big Apple. Some of the best street food you can have. A true Italian tradition from Puglia.

Nice new addition to the New York food scene, very small but cozy shop, and friendly workers. This place specializes in Panzerotti, which is fried unlike a Calzone that is baked. They have a variety of ingredients here. The one I liked the most was the Mushroom, Ham, and Cheese. They also have organic sodas from Italy which is a nice change from regular commercial soda drinks.

the panzerotti here is delicious.
i'm new to this style of food
as i'm mostly a pizza lover,
but wow!!

Today marks my discovery of what a "Panzerotti" is. And what a delight it was. I've had this restaurant bookmarked to jumpstart my lunch break on an otherwise unexciting routine work day. I'll admit this place was worth the trek in the sweltering summer heat. I get inside and order the #2 with Pepperoni and Mozzarella cheese. I figured if they can master a classic, then everything else on the menu should be just as amazing. I sit and wait a few minutes while browsing the "social media's" and munching on complimentary potato chips (they make these in-house, very good if you wanted to know) wondering when I'll be able to eat as the lunch hour was ticking down. (There was a wait because they are freshly made.) I was then handed a paper bag within which contained a hefty pocket of warm goodness. I contemplated walking back to the office with this treasure but ultimately decided to chow down post haste. Be warned, the contents were very hot but definitely tastes better warm. Upon initial inspection, it looked like a calzone but fried and I've never had a calzone before. I've only witnessed Ben Wyatt enter the "Calzone Zone" on NBC's Park's and Rec.  It was love at first bite. The dough was like nothing I've tasted before, crunchy outside and soft pillowy inside. I was pleasantly surprised at how it wasn't greasy at all. I didn't have to employ any napkins and started to doubt if it was even deep fried in the first place. As I ate on, I was then greeted with delicious gooey cheese and savory pepperoni slices that perfectly complimented the crunchy dough. I was so astounded by the flavor and mouth texture that I had to speak with the owner. The owner was actually sitting next to me and we had a wonderfully warm conversation with me raving about his restaurant. He even stated that a portion of each order is donated to "Mary's Meals" charity to end child hunger globally and today was the restaurants 3 month anniversary. Im glad to hear my gluttony benefits somebody other than just me and I'll definitely be back to try the rest of the menu, 5 out of 5 stars. PSA: don't let Shake Shack across the street tempt you away from supporting local businesses because this one is a keeper.

One word says it all outstanding. The free samples got my attention. If you order strictly to the menu it's great if you eliminate some stuff out of it I found it to be doughy. Def will be back to try others

Finally an authentic panzerotti spot in NYC. Great ingredients and well cooked. I had the Classico which really reminded me of home. The guys serving us were friendly. Fair prices. Only hope they start selling some beers as well, to make the panzerotto experience complete. Good job guys!

I found this place by accident, while walking by one day.  My family is from Puglia in Italy, the home of Panzerotti. For decades I use to comment on how I was surprised that Panzerotti had not come to the United States, especially New York where you can find every type of food from around the world, and given that in Italy people line up for Panzerotti, including in Milan.  So I was thrilled to find I Love Panzerotti!  The owners are from Puglia.  They know what they are doing.  So far I have tried 3 kinds, all delicious.  I highly recommend the ones with truffle, and the classico is always lovely.  My husband and my friend from Poland LOVED them. Drink them down with a chinotto.  They deliver with UberEats and Ritual.  So happy that Panzerotti are finally here!   Bravi ragazzi!

What a fantastic place! I went with a friend and we opted for the Zola sausage and also the four cheeses  variety. Both of them were delicious. The owners are all from Italy and they fly in fresh ingredients from Italy each week. That dedication to quality comes through. I can't wait to return and try out the dessert options. The s'mores sound likely to be amazing.

whew. not sure what all the hateful/bad reviews are about but let me tell you this.
it was amazing.
we got there about a half hour early for our reservation at 8:30 PM with only 2/3 of our party and was told we'd have to wait to be seated until the 3rd comes (if they still were, obviously) which, as a hostess at a busy italian restaurant, i love and 100% support this way of seating!
makes life much easier!!
hostess was super sweet and gave us the option to sit outside at the time we checked in (with the 3rd person), or wait for inside. it was quite warm out this past friday (the 28th) so we vouched to sit inside, didn't wait long at all and we sat!
we got bread upon arrival and i ordered a bottle of lambrusco, and like always, so amazing. best wine ever.
we order appetizers and they came out FAST. server was attentive but not overbearing and was quick, which i love!
we ordered a watermelon feta prosciutto appetizer and it was great! my sister really liked the prosciutto wrapped melon, and i was more into the watermelon feta. so so good.
my other sister got a caesar salad, she seemed to like it, finished the entire thing.
for entrees (also came out fast!), we got the formaggi pizza, fruitti de mare pasta, and a tortellini dish. my pizza was probably the best pizza i've had in a while. i really enjoyed it.
and for dessert. ugh. the choc. mousse cake has my heart. so good and super light. i was told that the tiramisu was great, granted, i did not get it, my sister did
TLDR--overall; amazing meal, price was great too. $189 without tip ($231 with tip) for 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, a bottle, and 3 desserts! service was phenomenal! as someone who works in this industry, and has for some time now, you can tell that this place has great food and fantastic service. we will definitely be back!!!

Nice Italian restaurant in Soho. Pasta was decently priced and there was a good variety of dishes on the menu. I ordered the penne napoletane, which I enjoyed. The mozzarella was delicious and the garlic and oil sauce was light but flavorful.

The service was a bit rushed. The waiters were friendly and gave good recommendations but it seemed a bit like they were trying to get customers in and out.

I made a reservation for 2 people. But when I arrived I was told that I can have a table only when a second person arrives.

This is ridiculous and absolutely discrimination.

I was going to order a lot of food and o was told to just stand by for whatever. I wasn't even sure when my friend was coming.  But I was ready to order a lot of food. And even then I was told to wait outside on hot weather and sweat. Thank you. I am not coming here anymore. Bye bye

I used to be your regular!!! But your new rules are going against your business !!!

Bye bye !!!

I came here on my bday, and while the service was decent and ambiance was cozy, I didn't enjoy my entrees as much as I had hoped. The pastas from the 3 pasta dishes we had were overcooked and mushy. The osso bucco was tender but otherwise forgettable. The seafood pasta was possible the best pasta dish out of the 3 we orderes; other 2 were carbonara, and white wine clam sauce. The crab dip was packed with crab, but I wish we had more bread to dip into it. The caramel custard/ flan was my favorite dish from the whole night. It was sweet, velvety, and exactly what you expect a flan to be (maybe not as thick as I would have hoped but still solid dessert choice).
Overall, I would rather try other restaurants than to come back. Nothing wowed me here or impressed me enough to order again.

We ordered the Pizza Rustica, Tortellini Parmigiano, and Fusilli Boscaiola from their lunch specials!

The Pizza Rustica was a burst of flavors - the fresh mozzarella and tomato sauce complemented perfectly by the zucchini, eggplant, and mushrooms. The option to choose between a soup or a small green salad was a thoughtful touch that added to the overall dining experience.

The Tortellini Parmigiano was heavenly. The tender tortellini filled with flavorful cheese, combined with a delectable Parmigiano sauce, left us craving for more. It was a true Italian comfort dish, and we savored every bite.

Fusilli Boscaiola. The spiral pasta cooked to perfection, accompanied by the delightful combination of mushrooms and peas in a creamy tomato sauce, created an explosion of taste in every mouthful.

The service was impeccable, and the staff made us feel warmly welcomed throughout our meal. The ambiance was cozy and perfect for a relaxing dining experience.

Great Italian restaurant in SoHo that I definitely recommend getting a reservation. This is NYC so parking be limited; get here via rideshare or walking/subway.

First off, the restaurant is quaint and small but also has outdoor seating since they have this makeshift patio on the curb of the street. Being that it is small, it is more intimate. We didn't have any issues with nearby tables and it's nice that the restaurant even puts of plexiglass-sort-of walls to assist with privacy.

All the servers were very welcoming and nice. They offered recommendations and were quick to clean and take dirty plates/utensils.

For the food, all of us enjoyed what we got from the pizza to the pasta and even their complimentary bread. We were very very hungry after our flight, so did we eat everything...yes, yes we did and it was also because everything was flavorful. Two of the pastas had seafood and one of the pastas was made with squid ink. So so good! The pizza also had seafood, and we even ate it with a tad bit of vinegar/oil which made it even more delectable. Lastly, their gosh darn Tiramisu is a must. We ate it, scraped the plate, and it was such a good way to end the dinner.

The pasta here is just average for NY. Nothing really stood out to me about the food, it was fairly uninspired. There are much better pasta options in the vicinity.

The service was great though and the $9 house wine is a good deal. They have ample indoor and outdoor seating.

Complimentary bread to start and I appreciated their olive oil.

We got the Black Taglierini Frutti di Mare ($30) and Pizza d'Oro (seafood cream pizza - $25). The squid ink pasta was excellent and the pancetta added a richness which was a nice touch but I wish it was Sliced a little smaller since it could get quite rich whenever you ate it. The shrimp was also overcooked. The tomato sauce was flavorful and paired nicely though, and I dunk the pizza crust with this sauce because it was so good.

The pizza was a little less too, very generous with the seafood. It was somewhat soggy in the middle though and the cream sauce was not strong at all in terms of richness - I was afraid it would be too creamy but I would have appreciated more.
Still delicious after all these years. The black taglierini is perfect, and the burrata with prosciutto and pesto is also excellent. We'll keep coming back here forever.

II Corallo continues to never disappoint. We continue to frequent this restaurant and I continue to try new dishes (when I'm not craving my usuals).  The hostess remembers us and always greets us with a smile. We're also happy to see Martin is still there and continues to provide wine recommendations (especially telling us when our usual is out of season/stock).

I do want to keep this update quick so please go get the newest mozzarella and asparagus ravioli dish! It is to freaking die for! What's interesting is that it has smoked mozzarella but you don't really taste the smokiness you expect from the name - in a good way. It was so rich and the sauce was so creamy, it had me craving for more even though I was full.
We're especially happy to taste that the Fettuccine Salmon and tiramisu has not changed.

We'll be seeing you later this week, Il Corallo Trattoria!

I was pleasantly surprised at this Italian restaurant! I got the meat pizza and it was tasty, filling, and great. My friends has different pasta dishes. I was a fan of the vodka pasta (not pictured unfortunately) and will definitely try that dish in the future.

Service was nice. They gave us complimentary bread and would refill it when we asked. I like the bread added with pepper, balsamic, olive oil. We were a large group so I think they did a great job handling our table. Prices are reasonable and the decor is very comfy Italian.

This was some of the best pasta we've had! We had a reservation and we're seated when we arrived. We chose to sit outside but the tent in the street wasn't super nice so I'd probably chose to sit inside next time. The servers were very nice and attentive. The pasta was so delish. We got the squid ink pasta with shrimp which had great tomato flavor. We also got the pasta with mushroom and sausage in a oil based sauce (don't remember what that one was called) but it was soooooo so good but also very rich which made it hard to finish. It was a ton of food and very good.

We went back here for dinner with two of our good friends. I had gotten a reservation. The person who served us was one of the sweetest servers I have probably ever had. She was so patient and so kind. The food tasted really good. We got the house red and it was not the best. The pasta tasted good. We even got the tiramisu which was good as well.

Solid Italian restaurant with a nice homey atmosphere.

I ordered the Pizza Urbino ($18), which had mozzarella, mushrooms, and prosciutto (among others) -  the prosciutto came in large strips and was very tasty. The other ingredients on the pizza were standard but pretty good.

I also got the Taglierini Sorrento ($26, squid ink pasta), which was very tasty as well. The pasta noodles themselves tasted fresh and were the perfect amount of chewiness. The pasta also came with a bunch of seafood, which was very good - the small scallops and clams were good and the peeled shrimp was a plus too. There was not much crab meat in there though. These dishes were generally decent value.

For dessert, I ordered the Tartufo Classico ($12), which had some nice gelato inside and the caramelized hazelnuts along the outside added a nice crunch and texture to go along with the cocoa powder on the outside.

The staff (especially the guy I assumed was the owner who was the main person servicing us) were very friendly and attentive. The service speed was very fast. The restaurant has some nice homey decor with a cozy atmosphere and moderate noise level. There is a decent amount of seating inside with some outdoor tables as well. The indoor tables filled up, even on a Tuesday night.

Overall, Il Corallo is a solid option for classic Italian pizzas and pastas. I would recommend it if you are looking for good Italian food in the Soho area.

I'm a lover for Italian food, and glad I came here for my birthday dinner for their fresh and homemade pastas! The restaurant is very cozy and reminds me of the local shops in Italy, seating is slightly tighter than normal. I enjoyed the house special Black Taglierini Frutti Di Mare which is fresh squid ink pasta with prawns, squid, mussels in tomato sauce -- pasta was very well made and Al dente, seafood and sauce both tasted very fresh. We also got a side of burrata salad to share. Be mindful that a lot of the dishes here can be shared between two as the portions are fairly generous. At the end of the dinner, our waiter brought out their popular tiramisu with a lit candle and sang the happy birthday song which was so kind. Their tiramisu isn't overwhelmed with espresso flavor, which I like because it's lightly sweetened and just right. Overall, I had a great dinner here and highly recommend it for a nice date or family meal.

I recently had a very disappointing experience at Il Corallo Trattoria.

When 3 of 4 of my reservation party arrived I asked the host if we could be seated because I'm 8 months pregnant. I let the host know the last person would be arriving within 5 minutes. I also mentioned that we would order drinks and appetizers when we sat down.

I was quite surprised when the host seemed extremely frustrated with this request, stating, "that's not how we do things here." I understand there are policies, but there were at least 6-8 open tables... and I am very pregnant.

After some back and forth, the host begrudgingly agreed to seat us, but at the point the experience had already been tainted. I would recommend some better judgement in applying policies - especially when one of the customers is pregnant and the restaurant is not particularly full on a random Tuesday evening.

I also emailed them to share this experience and never received a response.

The food itself was fairly mediocre / bland as well.
Great service. Great ingredients . Food was good not exceptional. Drinks were not the best choices. No cocktails only wine and spritzers no mocktails

Honestly I didn't really enjoy the pasta. I ordered the Taglierini Sorrento and my friend ordered the version with Frutti di Mare. While the black noodles are a bit chewy, there was certainly something to be desired. The Frutti version sauce definitely has a stronger seafood taste, as expected. The free bread was served cold and the Crostini Pomodoro was not good. We also ordered the Chicken Parmigiana and it was forgettable, like Olive Garden style. Tiramisu is generously portioned and not a bad option for dessert, but honestly I would save your buck for the other plentiful things around the neighborhood like Dominique Ansel down the block. The service was okay. We sat outside where there were fans to keep us cool.
My favorite pasta place hands down. Everything I've ever gotten here has been so good every time!

I visited II Corallo on a Wednesday evening and was greeted with an inviting host who worked quickly to seat my party. The wait staff was punctual to take and deliver my order with less than ten minutes passing between my first seating interaction and the foods arrival. I ordered the tortellini pesto pasta which came in a generous portion. The environment and dining experience of II Corallo is one that I am especially fond of, with plans to return in the near future.

We made a reservation for 3 on a Wednesday night. We were seated right away (as soon as everyone in our party arrived).

What we ordered: my bf and I split the capellini limone and the pizza pesto. The pasta was so refreshing and didn't leave us with a heavy feeling at all. I wish the pizza had a little more cheese, but it was still great.

The waiter was sure to keep our bread basket filled which was appreciated.

Overall a great dining experience!

If you want unique pasta then this is the place for you! We ordered the Squid ink ravioli with lobster and crab meat. The squid ink pasta is jet black in color and has a slightly briny and oceanic taste that is perfectly balanced by the rich and succulent flavors of lobster and crab meat. You also taste the buttery chucks of seafood in each and every ravioli pocket. Overall, Squid ink ravioli with lobster and crab meat is a luxurious and indulgent dish that is sure to impress any seafood lover.

Service and drinks were great. Pasta wasnt too impressive.

MY friends and I all ordered pasta so I can only speak to that. We had three different pasta dishes none were too impressive. The appetizers that we did have were good though.

Came here without reservations and we were still seated of 4 people. Great atmosphere around the area and perfect place to sit outside!

They have qr codes to scan the menu with and the food also comes relevantly quick. The prices are very affordable for the area as well. We had pizza and pasta and all together it was only around 28 dollars which is crazy cheap nowadays. The pizza was very fresh, the sauce was on point. However the pasta was very sour, I didn't really like the taste of it. It also tasted overcooked. I haven't had the desert but will definitely need to when I come here next time!

Food was fantastic! Got there late on Friday and was able to get in after a 25 minute wait. Unfortunately they didn't have Cioppino but I substituted it with black squid ink pasta with seafood. Food seems to be reasonably priced. Only complaint was that we had to specifically ask for bread as it was clear it was not going to be brought out. I was hoping I would enjoy eating it with my leftover sauce but the bread was not great.
Ambience inside isn't anything special so I would definitely eat outside for a date night.

Came here for a birthday celebration with a party of 6 and had a really nice time! Despite the restaurant being very busy during prime time, we were greeted by the hostess who seated us promptly in their outdoor section, which was worked out well since the restaurant itself was rather tight, like most establishments in that area.

Honestly, we were pleasantly surprised by how good the food was! The complimentary bread was fresh, Pizza Bianca was a great appetizer to start with, and my braised lamb shank was fall-off-the-bone tender and not at all gamey (thank god). I also tried some of my friends' Capellini Limone and Fettuccine Pescatore, both were fresh and flavorful; Their seafood pasta is on point! Not to mention everything was very reasonably priced. How did I not know about this place till now?!

They didn't have license for hard liquor, but we were more than content with the wine and spritz we got.

Service was also friendly and attentive. Thank you, Il Corallo, for more than offsetting my recent disappointing experience at Da Andrea.
Great food. Quite casual atmosphere. Wouldn't bring a date here unless you were going for casual.

The food is very authentic, but the table is very small and uneven. We had to squeeze everything onto it. I kept hearing forks dropping from different tables so I guess everyone was having a similar problem. Next time I will probably come back by myself instead of with a friend because the table size is just right for only one dish together with your small plate, bread basket, a bottle of water and drinks.
Nice little Italian restaurant on Prince Street in SoHo that we discovered while walking through the neighborhood. Highly recommend going back because the food was delicious.

Visited with a large party on a Friday night, and was glad that they were able to accommodate all 9 of us! It was outdoors so it was just slightly cold since the overheat heater mainly covered just one side of our table.

With all the amazing reviews from here, I'd love to go back and try another pasta dish. I ordered the risotto and special to share, which was a squid ink seafood tagliatelle. I thought the pasta could have been better cooked because the flavour was not totally fused together and some parts were a little more bland. I actually liked the risotto a lot more because the meat was so tender that it was falling off the bone, and was a great combination for each bite with its sauce.

I stumbled upon Il Mulino during a hot summer day and it turned out to be the BEST decision ever. The bright interior made it feel welcoming and the staff's warmth made the experience even better! The food was a burst of rich flavors, and I loved the surprise breadsticks and charcuterie they served. As a pescatarian, I couldn't try their steak, but their dishes were top-notch (which I forgot the names to them but definitely get the Grilled Octopus!)

If you're looking for an Italian food experience, Il Mulino is the place to go!
This was a phenomenal meal with amazing wine list. I wish the prices weren't quite as staggering especially for those of us on our own without a dining partner.

SO great! I went here for NYC restaurant week and absolutely loved it. Was able to get an app, entree and dessert for $60. Would highly recommend splitting the cacio e Pepe and strip as both were delicious. We also did the $30 wine pairing which was a nice added bonus. The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about everything.

This is a small and cozy place with a lot of ambience.  We sat at the bar and had a drink before we moved to a table for dinner. Our lobster salad was fantastic, the truffle patatine was excellent and we loved the NY Strip (shared).

Yes, we will be back!

We came to Il Mulino Prime to celebrate Christmas Eve and they went above and beyond to accommodate our requests- created additional seating at our table and even allowed our little pug dine in with us. The food and the service were excellent and the ambiance was Christmassy and festive. We were a party of eight and every dish we tried was delicious and amazing. My truffle ravioli dish was absolutely sublime. Loved everything about this place!
We dined at the Miami location several times before so we were really excited to try the Soho store. We were not disappointed!

Friday night dinner around 7pm, not too busy. Sat outside and was the only table.  Service was great at the beginning and then started to wane.  Ordered wine and steak, didn't expect to have a mini meat & cheese board show up, and didn't eat too much as I needed to save room for the steak.  

Steak arrived and was delicious as anticipated with truffle butter and I love truffle butter.  Brussel sprouts seemed more boiled vs roasted without a real good char on the outside and minimal crunch.  After the food arrived is when the service disappeared.  Even after the meal was done and glass of wine empty, I had to call someone over to provide the check.  

I'd maybe try at a busier time where other tables are outside as I think the table was 'forgotten'.

Very average nothing crazy food. Can't say I was wowed by anything. Place is very very tiny. Service was great though. Drinks are good too. If you're in the area it's nice to pop in for some food. It's not one of those places you travel to if you're outside of the city.

We came here for restaurant week and the foods did not disappoint! We were seated by the windows which gave us great lighting and enjoyed our lunch while watching the street.

Everything we ordered came out great!

Next time we will definitely need to try the steak because the table next to us have it and it looks so mouth watering.

On the down it seems like there was only one waiter when we arrived and we had trouble waving him down for water since it got pretty busy.

Excellent service, food and location. We thought we were in Italy. The food here is that amazing made from scratch. Great size portions, great wine list and great service. It is a very small restaurant, but they try and accommodate indoors and outdoors. Weather permitting. If you're in the Soho area a must check out.

My friends recommended this place and I was excited to try it out. When we got there around 6 on a weekday after work, and it was pretty empty, but nearing the end of our dinner ~8, it was packed! When we sat down, we ordered a bottle of Chardonnay to share; they also brought us a small charcuterie platter and fried zucchini chips (which was kind of soggy) while we decided what to order. I got the Mixed Beets and Watermelon Salad to start and it was sweet and refreshing; my friends who ordered the meatballs highly recommend them. For the entre, I got the Salmone Alla Griglia which came out to be a lot bigger than I expected! I also got to try my friend's New York Strip which was ok (I wasn't a huge fan of the potatoes). Overall it was an good experience, however the one star deduction is for a wrong order - one of my friends ordered the Tagliatelle Bollognese but they brought her the Linguine Cacio e Pepe, which is quite different.
The food was aaammaazing, the service was a plus and the atmosphere was perfect. It was a great way to celebrate our special occasion l.

Odd interaction with the host at Il Mulino regarding the water. They added a surprising $9.50 for water on our bill.  It's a lot, but that's not my issue.  

I'm open to paying for water.  When being seated, my table was given the choice of "still" or "sparkling".  We decided to play along, and not ask for "tap" water.  We said "still", to which he replied (enthusiastically) "one bottle, coming up!".  The water was fine: clear and flavorless.

After seeing the $9.50 charge on the bill, I was curious what kind of water this was, since they didn't place any bottle on the table. I asked to "take the remainder of the bottle" with me, but the host refused. The bottles I saw waiters use were large, generic glass bottles with a wide opening. When I asked to know what brand it was, "so I could buy more on my own", he said it was from a propriety source. He chuckled and said "that's a million dollar question!".  I finally asked, "your water costs a million dollars?" he basically just walked away.  

The couple seated next to us overheard this and said that even though they ordered tap water, they also got stuck with the $9.50. Anyway, food here is very good, but you might want to order something else other than water to drink.

Visited Ll Mulino during January for outdoor dining. The restaurant has a tent for dining with heaters for each table and small cabin houses for more intimacy. The food was very good! My friend and I wanted to try a little of everything and our server Elvis was very knowledgeable of the menu and also made some suggestions. We were not rushed to enjoy our meal which was nice. Must try the rib eye or tomahawk steak it's cooked to perfection. I enjoyed dining here and will recommend to friends.

Definitely not for your everyday dining.
It is on the very expensive side...
I had never ever paid $5 for a single glass of tap water which they didn't ever tried to refill and at $5a pop... they did me a favor.
The food is exceptional and truth be told when they are already charging $67 for a10oz. Steak,i think there's no need to try and do the extra un necessary charges.
The scorch out is generous enough to justify the price, the salad, Branzino and the meat are so good and of such good quality that makes it all worth it..
Even the self imposed 23%to on a 3 person table.
Ve prepared to shell out $100 plus for a one and half plate dinner.

Sunday late lunch is a perfect place to sit down and enjoy a meal, without any stress or urgency.  Wghen you're doing so on a sunny Soho day, people watching is another leasurable activity to engage with.  My friend and I ordered some Aperol Spritz, starter and pasta and then some more wine.  Forgot about the details except that the food and the company and the scenery were superb.  To be repeated!

What a sad review this will be.  

The starters: I was told one was veal something and another burrata and tomatoes. Tasteless.  Worse.  The veal? I believe I had deli sliced roast beef. Honestly, pathetic at 26 bucks...

The mains were the worst. Porterhouse of (at 136) crap and Brussel spouts of tastelessness.

I mentioned this to the manager...he tried to give us a free desert. No matter.  We left. As did everyone ... no one comes here.

This place carries the big Il Mulino name but is a complete joke. Joke  joke.

Delicious dinner here during covid. Server was awesome and had a great attitude
I never thought id be eating outside in December in NYC but wasnt terrible
Tent was not heated but i didnt freeze at all

Did the bone in filet and i highly recommend it

Well let tell you if your walking past this place and your hungry make sure you stop it's well worth the wait and the money will not be disappointed!!!
10 out of 10 will return again !!

great italian good, some of the best in NYC. We came for resturant week and tried mostly everything on the menu, no complaints with any of the meals.Also added the wine pairing for only $30 which was so worth it

I'll start by saying we loveeee to eat but some of us have food intolerances. My dear friend and I came here yesterday for dinner and it was a total disaster! First it took a good 15 minutes plus before anyone came to take our drink order. Fine! It's a busy Saturday night.

Once we were ready to order we had a couple of questions about the menu items to ensure we'd stay away from stuff we are food intolerant to. Our server was downright rude and acted like we were inconveniencing him with our questions. He said they do not offer ingredient substitutes for any dish then forget to mention other ingredients in the meal we chose! Suffice to say, I started to get sick half way through our meal. We couldn't finish our meal which is fine. But when he came to the table we told him we were done and shortly after requested the check.

Upon getting the check, we noticed something was off and asked for an itemized bill. He brought us the itemized bill and we discovered that the server had not only overcharged us but also doubled our "suggested" gratuity. He did not apologize one but he was finally nicer and told us that next time we could request substitutes or ask for a special dish to be made to accommodate our food intolerances!!!  I was shocked!  This was the same man that had told us they do not do substitutes early in the night as we ordered!

This was a disappointing experience all around mostly because I got sick  because of the server's negligence and carelessness. This situation was completely avoidable!

To sum it up, if you have any food allergies or intolerances be VERY careful here or skip this place all together! Always ask for an itemized bill if something seems off! Ughhh!!!!

Food is tasty but Buyer Beware. Though the prices for a pasta dish on the menu were about what you'd expect in a decent NYC cafe -- they were for half portions -- but they don't tell you that. And the specials can be exorbitant-- but they don't tell you that either. When we questioned the bill - which was outrageous for what we had ordered and received, the waiter informed us "this is kind of a pricey place. Customers know that and don't question the bills." When I asked to see a menu with the full prices -- he continued lecturing me. In the end, they reduced the bill -- but it all seemed so brazen and inhospitable -- especially when you're hosting a table of mothers on Mother's Day.

I have eaten all around NYC, the US -- the world -- at all kinds of restaurants -- and have NEVER had an experience like this.
The calamari and sliced zucchini are excellent starters. Bistecca con Uovo is a good choice for brunch. Lastly, the full bar has an excellent variety of spirits and beer.

I had a good meal at this restaurant. The antipasti were amazing and they are included in your meal. I had a nice glass of pinot grigio. The pasta selection is too limited and they need to explain their full and half plates on  the menu. Over all , a good meal.

My number one spot for all business meetings and dates. Make reservations.
Across from the iconic SoHo Grand Hotel between Canal and Grand St. on West Broadway. All major brands and luxury buildings are within strolling distance. Vibrant spot. A must.

Elvis, the bartender, is simply a star and the best.

The zuchinni slices and the bread were good starters. I got the salmon which was also really good.

Service was average. We also visited during restaurant week a month or so ago. However, once we got there were were notified that they don't do restaurant week menus on Saturdays.
