This was not mentioned anywhere on their website, menu, or even on the restaurant week website and they didn't honor the deal. So, we didn't end up getting to try what we really came there for. All of us were super disappointed about the exorbitant prices especially because we came excited for a fun reasonably priced restaurant week tasting menu.

In general, I'd say the food is good but overall overrated. You could find the same dishes and better service for less elsewhere.

10/10, top notch experience at Il Mulino Prime. I'm not one to rave about Caprese salad but this one was one of the best & freshest I've had.. the buffalo mozzarella was as creamy as burata and primo tomatoes! Calamari and ricotta meatballs were also fantastic starters. There were several standout pastas on the special menu, including the mushroom ravioli and pappardelle. Ordered a Tomahawk steak to share for the table, which was again cooked to perfection. Truly fantastic Italian and steak dinner. Excellent service and cocktails. Enjoyed a long, intimate dinner with friends without feeling rushed out the door. Would highly recommend, especially for a celebratory meal.

My first impression of this place was that, is very cute, small and very welcoming.

We had reservations for a group of 7 at 9pm. We didn't get seat until 10pm. Yes, I was already VERY Hangry at this point, I was ready to go eat somewhere else. But luckily my friend bought a few rounds of drinks and made the wait a lot less irritating.

The menu looked amazing, But the daily Specials sounded even better, so decided to try a few thing for myself. Needless to say it did not disappoint. The service was okay, for a small place and very busy, our server was good.

Let's just say.... the wait was Well worth it. I'll be stopping by again soon.

This place in SoHo is an Italian classic.
I was able to be seated without making any reservation although I had to wait about half an hour. Place is small with modern, simple decor and has Ernest Hemingway's quotes on the wall. Only con, waiters could've been more attentive.

Had the following:
-Complimentary bread and cheese sticks
-Dozen oysters which were very small but sauce was delicious
-Sautéed spinach
-tomahawk steak (it was okay; had a bit too much fat for my taste but lemon squeezed on top made it taste better)
Tiramisu-so delicious that I took one to go :)

Overall a nice place but not worth a second visit.

Let's start with the good staff.
Service: from the door of this cute, modern restaurant design is very welcoming and warm. The Bar tender smiled from behind the bar, the host, who greeted us was a jolly kind of guy. We had reservation but we happened to be there about  1/2 hr earlier. He gladly accommodated.
He than brought in the drinks menu. NICE! Very interesting cocktails. Can't remember the name of the cocktail I had, but it was with grapefruit liquor and Prosecco.. it was lightly sweet,  citrusy and of course bubbly due to the Prosecco. Delicious.
We then ordered the appetizer as a main dish (the offered to make it larger) - Risotto Langostino and the Tomahawk. The risotto was presented in a very large plate which made it look unattractive, almost like a porridge over a flat dish, with few pieces of langostino on it and the rest of it on the side. It missed the creamy, rich flavor I know and love and no one offered to shave some Parmigiana over it. The Tomahawk - we asked it to be medium-rare it was made medium, but otherwise was tasty and tender! We ordered two glasses of Barolo to accompany the meal. The wine was great, really good and again, the host was wonderful in assisting us choosing the wine. For dessert we ordered tiramisu which was delicious, creamy, but not heavy or too sweet. An absolute winner. The host treated us for a dessert wine which was unexpected but wonderfully appreciated. Overall, we enjoyed the ambiance, the service, but we felt it was a bit overpriced ($250 before tip) for the food we had. Culinary wise, it wasn't the experience I wished for.
So... if we come back, it is bc of the service! Maybe I'll give the chef another chance, maybe he had an "off day", we all do, sometimes.

Service was amazing. Very friendly staff!

We ordered octopus, grilled calamari, and crab to split. It was very nice of the restaurant to already split it up for us rather than have 3 different plates at a small table on top of our own plates. The octopus was so juicy. The crab was purely great. The grilled calamari was yummy too! They did the same with the oxtail parpadell pasta which by the way was delicious!!!! I also must say, the branzino was absolutely amazing.

I was here about a year ago for restaurant week as well. I had the octopus, pasta, meatballs and steak. It was delicious then too and it was amazing last night!

Unlike Il Mulino Uptown, I will be coming back again to Il Mulino Prime again :)
The service is great and it's in a great spot. The meatballs were excellent. The steak was good however covered in basil. So if basil isn't your thing, don't get the steak.

Ladies and gentlemen: sit back, relax and get ready for the single best dining experience of your lives. Five. Stars. Strong. For this amazing nouveau steakhouse in SoHo. The il Mulino brand is one that evokes visions of grandeur and class. Prime is no exception.

I arrived on a Monday, in the pouring rain during Restaurant Week. Total monsoon - you know the kind. I immediately expected to be turned away or pushed off the stairs with a broom. In the words of the Scissor Sisters, I looked like a "drowned, harassed, rat."  Imagine my awe when I was welcomed in, offered a cloth napkin to dry myself and something to drink.  Ummm, mom? No, it was not my mom! She was home in Queens! It was was actually the gracious professional staff including the manager, Antonio, and bartender, Elvis.

I sat at the bar, super early for my dinner reservation.  The Prosecco was perfectly chilled and refreshing.  They have these DELICIOUS complimentary rosemary truffle potato chips of which I could eat no less than 300,000.  I ate so many the bartender refilled my bucket.  Embarrassing.

On to the real food which was as beautifully plated as it was delicious (don't take my word for it - look at the photos).  I highly recommend the octopus, the wild salmon and the swordfish.  All of these were outstanding.  For dessert, we had a ricotta pie and American coffee.  We enjoyed a dessert moscato - which I usually would turn down but this was NOT a saccharine moscato - it was sweet but crisp.  And it was pink! And bubbly! Adorbs!

Even with the delicious food, lovely decor, impressive wine list and hot location, it was the professional, welcoming, wonderful service I would count as the highlight on this trip.  I will definitely return and you should, too.

Why is one not like the rest? For decades there was Il Mulino, one Il Mulino on West 3rd Street. Then there seemed to be Il Mulinos everywhere, well at least a few. But one Il Mulino is different from the rest and that one is Il Mulino Prime. While Il Mulino Prime has the great pasta dishes and other Italian/Italian-American favorites, it is really a steakhouse. Their signature dishes are "prime" cuts of beef that have been dry aged for 30 days. Great steaks, great pastas, super service and in the heart of Soho.

Ate there today with my brother-in-law, sister, niece and my father. Beautiful corner location on a lovely day in Manhattan.

It is Restaurant Week and there was a condensed menu for the table with various options of steak, spaghetti and salmon as a main entree, appetizers and dessert for just $42 per person.

The waiter was first class all the way and made us feel welcomed for first-timer's

We all opted for this menu and two of us had the steak, two had the salmon and one the spaghetti. All were satisfied with their meals, service and overall decor and environment.

There are only like 10 tables inside the place and we had a beautiful corner table that was comfortable and inviting.

If you seek a great venue as well as food and wine, Il Mulino fits the bill handsomely.

Highly recommend.

This is a small place but has good vibes. Is light and airy, open, lots of windows. Well air conditioned.  Wait staff was friendly. The food is tasty!  Appetizers was nothing special but they also shared focaccia, cheese, eggplant and salami s a freebie.  That was unique and appreciated.  The Steak was well cooked!  Nice charred edges and medium !  Dessert was delicious!  I had the chocolate cake and hubby had the tiramisu.  We had a delightful time!  Worth visiting and would come back!

I came here for lunch for restaurant week. There were 6 people in the place. I was in a party of 4.

We ordered the appetizer and entree with wine pairings. The food was good. I would never pay the full prices here because the food isn't that good.

The waiter was really nice and the service was great.
Their pasta is soooo good! Just try them all. You won't regret! They also have this delicious Aperol Spritz, made by Elvis, the best bartender in the world!

This was tough because looking at the menu beforehand I noticed it is supremely overpriced. I wasn't sure if it was going to be worth it but I took a shot. I ordered the oysters ($4 a pop) which was a little more than I wanted to spend but ok. They gave us a some cheese/charcuterie/focaccia as an on the house starter which I thought was nice considering again - how pricey the menu is. THe wine was great but noticeably expensive for a glass. Finally I settled in on the filet mignon. I thought it was my chance to just go for it. Glad I did because it was divine. The peppercorn sauce was delicious and it was cooked to perfection. Fabian, the bartender was just wonderful. He was quite helpful and patient the entire time which is what I needed. I'd go back for a glass of wine and the filet mignon and to say hi to Fabian.

Woof. I don't often give bad reviews but they had a number of things going against them that night. We came for the restaurant week prix fixe menu and I know, I know, the caliber of food is never quite as good when it's restaurant week. Honestly, when you're churning out the same 3 dishes over and over again, you'd expect them to perfect them at some point. But boy, were they not even close.

I was a extra agitated that day in general so I'll let you take this with a grain of salt. Our full party of 6 arrived on time and the restaurant was still pretty empty. When we checked, the host directed us to a table right at the entrance and we asked if we could instead take another open table closer to the back. Without giving it a thought, he said it was taken and that the tables were "exactly the same". Sure sure. Two of my friends spent the rest of the night getting the door slammed into their backs and herds of people running into them back and forth from the entrance and bathroom. Thanks.

Ok now onto the real problem, the food. It was restaurant week so...you know...$38 for an app, entree and dessert. In our group, we each got either the tuna tartare or meatballs for our appetizer and the steak or salmon for our entree.

- Tuna Tartare: It was fine.
- Meatballs: Honestly, and unfortunately, the star of the meal. 3 meatballs came in an order and they were tender and flavorful; no complaints here.
- Steak: Objectively "just OK" and "way too much fat." Both of my friend's steaks were undercooked but it too long for it to arrive, that they didn't bother sending it back.
- Salmon: So overcooked and flavorless. The skin, was crispy, but not the good kind of crispy: it was the burned kind of crispy. I can yell they attempted to salvage any flavor from the salmon by oversaltin the skin specifically but it couldn't mask the dry, flavorless hunk of meat that sat below it. The broccoli rabe that came with it? Yea, over cooked and stringy.

And I honestly couldn't even tell you what we got for dessert because it was so forgettable.

Excellent cocktails, Amazing rack of lamb, the mashed potatoes are fantastic as are the home made chips/fries. The buratta was tasty, great caprese, and friends love the 10oz filter. Aspargus was ok, loved the brussel sprouts with bacon.  

Food 8/10
Service 9/10
Drinks 9/10 (excellent old fashions and wine list, we had four bottle la thou on silver oak)
Parking 4/10
Bar 6/10
Lighting 8/10
Bathrooms 7/10

One of my favorite restaurants of all time! I recommend this place to all family and friends. Overly friendly staff who treats you like family, outstanding customer service, great menu items, fantastic drink selection, and amazing ambiance.

Recommendations:
- bone in chicken Parmesan
- pasta with ragu sauce
- porterhouse! Wow!
- all of the desserts they bring you
- the complimentary charcuterie
- 10/10 the truffle ravioli- it is unreal! Very generous amounts of truffle

Still killing it in Soho with all of the best Italian staples accompanied with steaks that are aged to perfection. A board of meat, cheeses and bread greet  you when you're seated. Plenty of good pasta dishes to choose from but save space for more because the steaks available hold there own with the dedicated steakhouses in the city.
Love the service and the food. The chicken parmigiana was to die for. Totally a divine experience.

Overall: overpriced for what you get...this place is super expensive!

Prices for everything including steak is higher than the average steakhouse (Peter Lugers, wolfgang's, keens, etc)...sides $15!

The food was average, nothing special, decent quality and ok flavor...for the prices that they charge you would expect more!

On the house....cheese, prosciutto and salami....nice gesture and good quality

Appetizers
Pappardelle Ravi: the pasta was a little overcooked, would have been better a little more al dente...sauce and flavor of the filet mignon was good...but not worth $24 for an appetizer

Steak tar tar: decent flavor, average, not the worst but not the best either

Entrees
Veal parmigiana: good flavor on the sauce, and cheese was good quality. Huge portion as you can see from the picture but definitely not worth $46!!!

Filet mignon on the bone, 12 ounce...$56 the steak didn't have a whole lot of flavor....the quality of the meat was good...but not enough to justify paying more for the filet than you would at another high regarded steakhouse

Yelp is pretty accurate. I wish I'd yelped this place instead of going with the glowing reviews from other sites endorsed by the restaurants themselves. 5 star reviews: it's quite obvious you did not actually eat here or have a pretty low bar for flavor. Additionally, maybe you are friends or made friends with the staff who were having a particularly good day and took to you if you'd received good service because the 2-3 star yelps review all have a common thread- poor service and I am in complete agreement.

The food wasn't awful- it was passable, but for the price, it was a disappointment. We were paying purely for the location and decor, not the quality nor execution of the cuisine... because there was little to none. The 4 and a half (3 yr old) of us had the prix fixe dinner for $42pp. We opted for some upgrades sans wine: ricotta meatballs, octopus (+$10), arugula salad, strip steaks (+$10), and wild salmon. Octopus was nicely charred but cooked about 20 seconds too long on each side that made it a bit dry and tough. Ricotta meatballs were textually lacking in any firmness, herbaceousness and salt. The sauce that would've saved the meatballs was lacking in quantity. Topped with 2 slices of stale crostini- it goes to show you can never judge a book by its pretty cover.

After extended wait time, our entrees arrived and my discerning cousin immediately noticed the odd appearance of the New York strip steaks that 3 of us upgraded to. They were not on-bone, thick, tender nor seasoned- at all! I thought they were soft albeit bland but my companion quite vehemently insisted the steaks were sinewy, lacking in every flavor/texture profile that normal $54 cuts of meat should have. We were an hour in, tired, hungry and were not going to argue. It wasn't awful (to me) but definitely not good. The "wild" salmon on the other hand, very surprisingly was great. It was golden, crusty, red-brown throughout whereby judging from the appearance we thought they must've overcooked it. They didn't. It was exactly medium-delicious-tender-rare. The sides were completely negligible. In fact, what sides? You mean the home fries and a grape tomato and half of a grilled lemon on each of our plates? At least they were more memorable than the paltry, almost soggy "truffle" thin cut fries we ordered to share.

I don't have the time nor heart to go onto dessert shaming- lemoncello tiramisu, ricotta cheesecake and chocolate cake. Yummy sounding, no? If you haven't already noticed the trend here, Il Mulino Prime is all foam, no beer. The best dish we had was the complimentary mini charcuterie starter. That is sad.

I've spent too much energy on the food alone- which was just mediocre at best. For a brand touted as high end luring ppl to an approx $80pp dinner for restaurant week, Il Mulino Prime really needs to hire an entire new kitchen and wait staff. I've ragged enough about the cooks and haven't left enough time to gripe about the service!

They were abhorrent. With an exception of a charming, gracious bartender. Our slicked back, not exactly appeasing waiter asked "will you be opting for restaurant week menu" not to assist us but as if to gauge our spending potential. It was not subtle. None of the inattention, pretentiousness, and rubbish was. As a service professional, the importance of putting a patron's comfort and desire before your own is paramount to the individual and company success. If I had an hour I would freely drill this into the entire service team at il Mulino Prime, because they so desperately need a good example.

Btw... You cannot use "aged" hanger steak if it is not actually aged. It is clearly flaunted on the menu but when asked how the hanger was aged, the waiter acknowledged it isn't aged, whereby I promptly pointed to the print. He went into the kitchen and promptly return to apologize in-genuinely about the "misprint"... it is Not aged.

Even in the face of glaring hypocrisy and outright dishonesty, it is unlikely il Mulino would pull those menus. How many people unknowingly have ordered this misprint and went on their merry way? Every single one of them. How many times has il Mulino just shrug off this "Oops" Lie amongst other inaccurate descriptions? A good restaurant serves good food and pays full attention to every detail. A reputable restauranteur and a good manager stands behind their product and care about more than just turning the table. Clearly, I've already wasted 15 minutes of my time, the precarious staff's and yours!

I have been wanting to go to any of the Il Mulino restaurants for a while now, so was excited to go here recently. We went one night for Restaurant Week and had the best time. My friend arrived first and sat at the bar for a drink, I met her there and by the time I had gotten there, one of the owners sat down and talked to her and we chatted w him for a while. He was so nice, it was really great to meet him. We had reservations, but he suggested we just stay at the bar because we would be in great hands w the bartender, so that is what we did, and he was right!

As we were ordering they brought over a complimentary cheese plate w various cheeses that were all delicious. We both ordered from the RW menu. I had the ricotta meatballs for an appetizer and they were delicious. Then for my entree I had then chicken parm which is pounded very thin and was so so good, it was a huge portion so I had left overs. For dessert I had the tiramisu and also excellent. Can't go wrong coming here!

Inside is smaller than I expected, but decorated very modern and fits well in Soho with the white brick. Can't wait to try more of their restaurants.

I was very excited to try the restaurant as it began its debut for Restaurant Week! It's a small location with large windows which make it fun to people watch in Soho. We sat at a table by the windows and were immediately offered a  small cheese board with meats, cheese and bread along with fried zucchini chips! I would say that everything was good but not GREAT including service and ambience. The food was mediocre and I was glad we went during restaurant week instead of a normal day. The wine selection was wonderful and recommendations were on point. I would try the other locations and would not come back to this one, although I do appreciate the large vegetarian offerings.

Went for restaurant week, 4 of us. 3 did the appetizer + entree and 1 did entree + dessert. All the appetizers were very good (meatballs, caprese and onion / tomato salad). Entrees came, salmon was very good, one hanger steak was cooked perfectly, the other was ordered medium and came close to well done, and it didn't seem like one cut, there were three end pieces. Last ordered spaghetti and it was crunchy.... Desert was the chocolate cake and was more crumble than anything. We did not finish it.

Yes going for restaurant week we know to expect smaller portion and less quality but this was pretty sub-par even for that, and expected a little bit more consistency.

Won't be back, and you can skip it for a many better places.

Service was fine, though our waiter looked very bored and kept opening some bottle of liquor at the bar and sniffing it... it was very peculiar.

I can only comment on the bar as I came in for the wine alone. The Brunello did not disappoint! Simply beautiful!

Friendly service.

The poor service here was enough to make me never want to come back, and also give a very low review. A group of us came here to celebrate my friend's birthday. We had the prix fixe lunch menu.

Food: Some of the dishes tasted quite good and were well presented, but the portions were very varied and sometimes WAY too small.

Caprese - The Caprese literally consisted of one slice of tomato and one slice of mozzarella. A little ridiculous.

Ricotta Meatballs - Consisted of one meatball, which I had to admit, was delicious. The meat was super tender and almost melted in your mouth. The tomato sauce and ricotta accompanying it was delicious. Too bad there was only one.

Orechiette - Wasn't anything particularly impressive. The sauce was broccoli based, which was a little unusual. The portion was large, but the taste was bland.

Italian cheesecake - This was pretty good. The cheesecake was very rich and not too sweet.

Atmosphere: The restaurant was well decorated, with a lot of white and clean lines. That being said, it felt a little stiff.

Service: The service was extremely lacking. We had come in with a larger party, and while we waited for a couple of members of our party to arrive, we weren't given water for the longest time. We didn't even receive menus to look at until we asked for them, and the waiter didn't even ask whether we wanted to wait for the other two or just start ordering. Beyond that, there was only one waiter for the entire restaurant. When we finally got his attention to order, he came to the table, then walked away to help seat other guests who had just arrived. He also had a ton of confusion about what everyone had ordered when it came to dessert, and had to ask each person what they wanted 2-3 times. The waiter was standoffish during the whole meal and was slow to respond to anything we needed, whether it was water or to order additional drinks.

We had also brought a cake to celebrate one of our friend's birthdays. The cake was pretty large and could serve 10-15 people. I was expecting for them to cut small slices for everyone, since our prix fixe menu also included a dessert component. When they cut it, they cut up the entire thing amongst 8 people...the slices were ridiculously large, and some of the cake went wasted. Afterwards, we had to ask them about the dessert to our prix fixe menu and they were surprised that we even wanted it after having the cake cake. Wasn't the dessert included in the prix fixe?...As if I would leave without something I would have to pay for. They reluctantly brought it to us.

This is a pretty cool store, "cool" meaning they have magazines and books staked in the entrance with two book shelves on either side- ceiling to floor, walk more in and it's a deli and convenient store. This place is pretty hip. I like the lay back vibe and affordable food choices. I had a Mexican wrap- the wrap was made from spinach($6).

My brother introduced me to this place cause he eats here pretty often for lunch. Will come back here again soon, but it sucks that its a long walk from my work.

This place is near the job and its a block away, but because it's a long block, count it as two Blocks if you will.

I wondered around and saw them nearby yesterday so I took a menu and today I placed my order and got off the phone at 12:16pm....And by 12:54pm..38minutes later...No delivery...I called back...He told me it's late because the delivery guy didn't have his ID and couldn't get in and they are busy....Give the guy 2minutes and will be right there. It's now 1:06pm...Nothing. . We clearly have a different understanding of this thing called "time"....

I don't know how long they think a typical lunch period is....Generally 30minutes by law in NY

How they expect a customer to eat with the delivery taking about an hour, and they're across the street !?!?!?
I placed this order for delivery, to save time from walking back and forth; ..Not to kill my entire lunch period and then some !!

By 1:11pm I finally got my order....The delivery guy was given a incomplete phone number (pic included), which the guy didn't bother  verifying with me when I called to order or called back the second time....Ridiculous...
I even asked to be called with that number upon arrival ...Wtf?! No credit card receipt too...
The poor guy was like, can you write tip please...Feel bad for the delivery guy
You guys suck for making something so simple into all this nonsense. Never call you for delivery again...Sheesshh...smh

On top of all this....There was a hair in the sandwich....Just eeww

Food wise:
The torta sandwich was great until I found hair in it while eating it,
Other wise, its a big sandwich...Delicious., until it got gross....

The other pros: minimum for delivery and credit card usage is $5...

They cook the breakfast menu all day

I gave this place a second chance, but was equally disappointed as the first. While delivery was fast, the bagel was not given much love (see pic). My whole wheat everything bagel came as whole wheat (if they didn't have ww everything, they should have called!). Very limited cream cheese. I would recommend finding a different place in TriBeCa.

Service was good, decent selection. Wasn't going to bother with them when I realized it was a magazine stand. My coworker enjoyed their offerings so I popped my big ole head in. Nothing spectacular or different from what's already in the area. Had the Italiano panini which was good. It was $6.50, no tax. Add $1 extra and you get a can soda plus chips. I RARELY drink soda so I passed. They accept cards without a minimum... for now. Also they have a card system for each meal. So after a certain amount of stamps on your card you get something for free. One for drinks, one for breakfast, one for lunch.

I love this place! Their coffee is really good, bagels are super fresh and their lunch menu is very attractive! And  best thing: it's not a rip off like the other deli's on the surrounding area..highly recommended!
Standard deli fare. Food is of decent quality and prices are reasonable for the TriBeCa area. Recommended for a quick snack
Tons of printed magazines! Like in the olden days. And delicious bagels, sandwiches, and coffee.
Not often you will find a magazine store anymore. They also have great Caribbean bagels, coffee, and lunch items.

I come here at times to enjoy a big meal with family. The selections are decent, and most of the time, i order chicken tenders and pancakes, and if I'm feeling more,milkshakes. To get a table usually doesn't take long and the staff and the service are very friendly too. I do wish that they offer more than a certain number of items. Like more than 3 tenders, for example. It's overall, a decent ihop location
Quick service and food was really good. The waiters were very kind and attentive. We had the breakfast sampler, and all was good

This is very disgusting. I went in with my family. We ordered Two hot chocolate, an orange juice and a apple juice. For our surprise my wife's hot chocolate has a little friend. It was a baby cockroach's. Honestly, the location needs to be a little more clean. It's very dirty.
The person who took care of us was ok but the manager came and act like nothing had happened.

I was extremely disappointed with the service I received at this location.  I've eaten here before  and was pretty much satisfied with the food, at least. Today was and still going to be a fun filled Mother's Day with my children treating me to lunch and going to have an amazing  day in the city.  While we were seated right away at a table of our choice. We waited and watched others (non-black) be served  before our order was even taken. I had to go ask for someone to take our order. That someone was Pamela who had walked by several times while not acknowledging that we were even seated. When she finally came to the table, she was dry and didn't introduce herself.  The food took long, we were about to leave. My daughter's and my silverware were filthy, and I didn't  enjoy my food. While I'm sure they would like to serve their people. Me and mine will not patronize this place again.

Shout out to server Fatima and manager Jessica at IHOP #4650 in the Bronx at Broadway and W 232nd St. for excellent customer service!! My meal was not cooked to my satisfaction and the issue was was resolved immediately with kindness and professionalism. They were eager to make it right and made me  feel like a valued customer.
Kudos for Fatima and Jessica. They are true ambassadors fir IHOP!!

Ordered UberEats from this location multiple times. The last time they sent me undercooked eggs. It was gross. I ended up tossing them out and cooking my own. The pancakes are always delicious. Thankfully that's something that's always consistent.

There hours of operation are a little off on ubereats but overall it isnt a terrible experience. I've ordered during this pandemic about 5xs.

This location has been around way before my existence. They recently remodeled and change management.

Highlight of the visit was when my best asked for grits and the waiter Pablo said "hold on let me check" when he came back he said "we have grits but they don't look good".....LMAOOOOOO! I love that

I've been coming here for years with my wife. There use to be a manager there that use to stay that the host stand and direct traffic from there. The servers were all very nice and well trained. Yesterday, was officially the last day I will come back and will not recommend to anyone. A server approached our table 10+ minutes after we sat. At that point I was ready to leave but my wife whom just gave birth was hungry. Server approached us physically bothered and was short with us. Once the food came out we ordered a total of 5 over medium eggs with our meal. We noticed the whites were not fully cooked. It was more over easy. It took about 10 more minutes for the server to pass us and my wife called to him and explained. He literally told us it was cooked properly. We explained that it was not and this needs to be cooked again. Finally he said ok. I have to take it back to show the cooks. He said the only way is to take the plates from us. I told him we were still eating from the plate. Instead of offering another plate to put the eggs in he simply walked away. I explained the situation to a very young Latina woman whom claim to be the manager. She was clearly annoyed I brought this to her. She offered a discount. I said cool. She discounted and gave me a receipt. I noticed the bill was still a bit high. So I asked for an itemized copy. She discounted $1. I could see in her face she was a bit shocked when I asked for the itemized copy. I didn't even bother to say anything but at the end of the day they won't get another penny from me. I hope it was worth it. I'm sure I'm not the only one in the neighborhood that noticed the changes with the new management. Good luck and good riddance.

Service is horrible had to wait over an hour for my order that I was told would be ready  by 8:30am never received until 9:30, even more horrible experience that my order was incorrect. a horrible way to start Mother's Day.

The food came out cold and  they gave me old bananas on my fruit toast and the orange juice had stuff floating around in it it was so nasty nothing was able to eat not even the eggs I would not recommend this place to anyone

Space inside is way too small and crowded. Had to wait about 20 minutes for a table. When I finally sat down I got a waiter who barley understood me because she didn't speak good english. Because of this she got my order wrong and had the audacity to give me attitude when  I told her my order was incorrect. My milkshake had no whipped cream and tasted like water. Then when my waiter came back with my order it was STILL incorrect but I did not feel like arguing so I just let it slide. The presentation of my pancakes were also horrible. I had ordered the cupcake pancakes wigh we're supposed to look nice and cute based on the menu pictures but I got a dry looking pancake with about 4 sprinkles on top with no whipped cream or the sauce it's supposed to come with. Overall I had a horrible experience at this Ihop

The food is good. It can have its hit or miss  moments.The customer service, is always good. If you do decide to stay and dine, be patient. They do take a long time to sit you at a table, depending on what time or what day it is, but for the most part, its always a long wait. I mean evening after you order something. It seems to be a long wait. I do enjoy eatting here, but I think they do need improvement. I think they should also get a hugh make over. I mean IHOP has been around for a long time, if Mcdonald's can do a remodel, they can too, and they need to. It will make dining there more pleasurable.

I will not be coming back here the staff is being mad loud cursing and talking about other employees. Also I heard one say she went to the Hospital because of ruff sex and I quote her (that shit hurt) there's a time a place for those conversations and on the floor at IHOP is not one of them .The sampler I got looked like it was fried twice like they saved it and then re-Fried it . The coffee pot and cup where still dirty and your worried about my temperature and where I live. make sure u clean your dishes. SMH ‍

Once again they messed up my order. This time they forgot my milkshake. Doordash order from this location always messes up something with my order.. I called IHOP and they told me take it up with the driver.  Honestly that's not how to do business with customers looking forward to their food.

Today this IHop lost a customer! Gravy from chicken fry steak un edible. I wouldn't give to my worse enemy! Andre the manager argue his product is perfect and that I was the one with the problem. Unfortunately for him, this is not my first time buying this product. He also argue that the product was one hour post picking it up and that It wouldn't be perfect now, no apology. This was like eating motor oil. Not only did I wait 1 hr outside the store for my food but now I am hungry and mad.  I gotta say David the receptions did a good job managing the situation. I guess someone has to be promoted. He argue that I just wanted a refund. Trust me! I am not fighting for 20 dollars. Bad experience, I guess I just have to wait to go back to California to have a good service!  zero stars!

Poblano Omelette with avocado on top it's my choice!
The servers are friendly!
The background music is smooth (oldies)!  I recommend IHOP for everyone. The restaurant is family oriented, excellent for breakfast & dinner.  Pumpkin pancakes were great as well as the minty who-hot chocolate!!!

The outside is nice but the loud speaker and calling people on the loud speaker is really inconvenient for the people eating at the restaurant. They should try calling the people who are picking up and waiting to be seated on their phones and not on an incredibly loud speaker over the heads of people that are eating.

the hot cakes breakfast meal lingered w/ dog stinch... the filling requested to create my very own pancakes was removed in store.. i was emptied handed with no fountain drink, that was included w/purchase.. the hash brown tasted like fresh farm, well farm-based an extremely burnt..

The serve which her name is Linette was or is great. She was so polite with everything. There was a mistake with my food but she care it and I was so grateful. Omg. We need my sever like her. She came around and check on us many of time made sure our glass of water was alway full you know I like a serve who care about us. She was perfect go linette. Time was at 12:16 pm July 5 2019.

Being that this Ihop is in the Bronx, i love that it has it's own parking lot. Super convenient. The employees are pleasant and are very welcoming. The waiter that served us was great. I loved the all you can eat pancakes. Who doesn't love unlimited pancakes. I also had an ultimate waffle stack. Which was amazing. Everything I expected and more.

Our server was Niquan, one of the most professional, good-natured individuals I have ever encountered. He had me smiling and I consider myself a tough cookie. He took our order, brought it to us quickly and checked on us frequently. The food was hot and delicious. I have been visiting this particular iHOP since I was small kid (over 40 years) and this was definitely one of the best experiences I've had in ANY iHop.

This location is smaller and much tighter than others but that doesnt affect the service at all. Food comes super fast, and wait staff is very attentive and friendly. I ordered the Homestyle Cornbeef Hash and it was a winner. Shout out to Steven he was a great Server!!!!

Although some of the food tasted fresh and good, the bacon was old...makes a difference! My issue with this restaurant (and let me preface this with the fact that it's my father's 102nd birthday and this is where he wanted to go for breakfast), back to my issue...our waiter - Stephen, he needs to be retrained, if he was trained at all. Telling me to read the menu because it states either/or, getting our orders wrong, no water for the table, having to request additional things multiple times, waiting for over 20 minutes for the check- ridiculous! In addition, I have to complain for what I saw at the table across from us, the same waiter, Stephen gave a patron at the table someone else's food at the end of the table for them to pass it down, they subsequently knocked over their beverage and he didn't even give them anything to clean up the mess or clean it himself. I understand the restaurants are reopening but make the experience negate the value of being able to serve.

The servings are hefty the staff is great. Food comes out quick!!!
But...
The crowd is too ghetto and it's hella crowded on the weekends.

The service was less than acceptable. There was no organization. My husband asked that music with lyrics containing the "N word " and vulgarity be turned off. We are frequent patrons of this IHOP location. It is clearly under new ownership!  We will not be returning to this establishment!

Worse service ever, its my so s birthday turning 4 brought him to eat breakfeast to start the day off, but of course we waitied 40 mins for sum oancakes and only half the food came out and my other kids sta there looking at them eat so i went and asked for my check but  the cashier had a problem me knocking on the window to get my servers attention and had the nerves to yell at me! Wen i already on edge with the food problem so i sed u know what give me my check! Wow to my surprise she replys with i dont gotta do shit, you can go sit back down n wait for your server! So now im just off the wall mad so i said you dont wanna give me my check? Ok so the foods free thx! With customers there waiting for there togo orders, but i felt like man ihop should still get paid cause it was the cashiers fault so i went back to pay and the cashier want to go n say im lieing, that she never said any of those things! Omg im in the twilight zone but shes so dumb she doesnt notice customers that was there waiting for food witnessed all of this and just shook there heads like shes crazy, the manager came and handled it, i lived in this neighborhood my whole life and this Ihop always gave problems to other people and todag i finally witnessed it myself! I cant beiliev this how they run there establishment, go to Dales diner or Tibbet diner for breakfeast wayyyg better then this place for sure and service is excellent! Never again will i go, thx for ruining my sons birthday breakfeat!!!! Went and got him mcdonalds i stead

Always a pleasure coming to this restaurant. I normally come in for breakfast or lunch. The Food is always cooked to perfection and the customer service is awesome. Very family oriented place. Mostly crowded and can get loud. Also, I drive so parking my car is always an issue because parking is very limited. There are about 15 spots in the entire lot and probably twice the amount of tables inside. So you see the problem there. Sometimes I would wait for 20-30 mins just for a parking spot.

Aside from that I would recommend this IHOP because the food is great, service is awesome, portions are generous and price is reasonable.
This has got to be the worst IHOP ever. Staff is friendly , however my pancakes were hard . The prices on the menu didn't match my check . They mad changes but have a old menu .

This spot used to be so good but unfortunately the food quality has declined.  The waffles and the bacon were cold.  My chicken strips were hard either from over frying or from being old.  The server was also too quick. And I felt rushed out.  Needless to say going back there is not an option.
I haven't heard of any Restaurant that doesn't take any  on the phone order for pick ups.The night shift sucks!!!!

I love this place
And it's franchy's fault
I really hope I got her name right

Let me explain
Living in the area I'm definitely not a stranger to this IHOP.
There have been days when it is far too crowded
And waiting for a seat just seems to take way too long.

And there's a reason for that
It's not only the food it's also the SERVICE

People like GOOD SERVICE.  

And this doesn't  seem to be exclusive to just visiting the restaurant.

As we are right in the middle of the COVID-19 pandemic I am ordering more often now from UberEats.

With every order I'll follow up with a call to the restaurant to make sure they don't forget small things like forks etc

More times then not it seems that Frenchy is the one answering the phone and she has been wonderful.

She has personally made sure that every cup of coffee has a side of whip and cinnamon

There's always enough syrup for the pancakes

And the bags are securely packaged.

Bravo  to them at the Broadway , Riverdale
IHOP
Thank you for the  care , great service and the smiles that it's produced during such a difficult time.

Amazing Food and Outstanding Service the Server Shane was extremely professional Everything was perfect... Another Member of Staff Lynette amazing personality great customer service Whenever I go to IHOP I always feel welcome.

The manager and employees went above and beyond to go through the trash to find something I had left on the table that was thrown away. Even after I told them they didn't have to keep searching, he insisted and eventually found it!

There was about a 15 minute wait on a sunday morning, but the food and service were good. Although I think we were overcharged on our bill by about $10. We didn't catch it until after we had left.

After a long and cold day I had a craving for some pancakes. It was so bad I dreamt about them the day before  for brunch the boo and I went to this IHOP. As she went in the to reserve us seats I looked for parking. Normally we have a hard time finding parking in the lot but today was great. Within 2 minutes of me arriving someone left.

By the time I parked she was seated already  (clutch). Place was busy and packed like any other IHOP on a Sunday. People brunching and coming back from church. As I sat at my seat my girlfriend complained that it was quite chilly. It didn't bother me much because I love the cold. I explained to her that the AC is on to circuit the air. No one likes stagnant air full of bacteriA. After a few minutes of complaining to me   we mentioned it to the managed and he happily turned it off.

Overall ambiance was good. Family to one side and another couple to our right. Food arrived hot and oh so good. I ordered the strawberry banana pancakes (heavenly) topped with whipped cream with a side of coffee scrambled eggs and potato hash. That whole meal left my gf and i stuffed to compacity. I definitely recommend getting the blue berry pancakes which she ordered. I give this visit 4 stars
After having a very bad experience at ihop in Newark, I decided to try this one OMG these people are so good, everyone was so friendly, they made my day. The food was as good as the hospitality.

This place is The worst ! There were multiple roaches wandering around the table and seats ! The service isn't all that and the good is room temperature not even hot !  Don't bother coming here wasting your coins

At first I thought it was going to be crowded location. However we arrived after mass around 2:30ish and were seated right away. However it was a windy cold winter day and they had the AC on. I asked twice before they were generous enough to turn it off as I was extremely cold with two vents above our seating area. I was detailed on my order and Shane I believe was our water was very attentive. The orders were right and brought out in timely manner and my pancakes eggs etc were all warm vs other IHOP locations I have gone where food is served almost cold. I was very pleased with the service and food. Definitely recommend coming here on a Sunday late afternoon.

They are now under new management. I decided to have a seat and eat some lunch by my lonesome. It's not like they had a large party mind you there was not a lot of people at the restaurant. They were all waiting around doing nothing. This new management sucks compared to the old one. I was waiting for 20 minutes and had to say something to them because no one said or asked me if I wanted anything to drink or if I was ready to order. So I got up and walked out. Step it up guys

We just got back home from vacation and I had a taste for iHOP so we came here for some good food.  Was very impressed with the enthusiasm and kindness of the waiter by the name of "O". - Thank you for your kind and prompt service at IHOP after our jet lag and sleepiness!

The service here is so ghetto. I heard the staff hollering "yur ". My waitress served me with a complete, horrendous attitude. She was on her phone while serving me. They need to conduct a thorough training program.
If you want a good shake on a sunny day go to this ihop in the morning and ask for Frankie he makes the best shakes out of all the other servers he loves making shakes

To put it nicely this place sucks. It can be damn near empty and you can bet on getting the slowest most inconsistent service of your life. I was seated and no one even came to the table until about 25 minutes later, I received my appetizer before my beverage?? People who came in after us were seated served and done before us. You walk in and they side eye you as if it's an issue to even be seated. Not worth it way too many other cafe/diners in the neighborhood.

Great customer service and awesome food. This is one of my favorite spots near my house. Customer service is great and the food is delicious. Our waiter called Steven made our experience just wonderful. He was professional, charismatic, and friendly in every way. I hope I end up in one of his tables everytime I visit this place.

Let's start with how bad the service is in this establishment. We were seated in such a uncomfortable place. The middle of it all, after a lady came in with her shopping cart they did not want to accommodate her which was very awkward and annoying to hear cause they didn't have a reason to just sit here somewhere where her cart can't fit. Also our waiter Shane customer service was horrible, took 15 minutes to bring out beverages and never checked up on us. The food was good though!

The worst service & attitude that I have ever recieved from anywhere. It was this pass Mother's Day & so I did my order on line. I placed the order around 10:25am & the pick up time was for 10:37am. It was almost 11am & my name wasn't called so went inside to find out when it would be ready. The bitch at the window there's no other name I can describe her for now. I asked about my order   & she told me,  it'll be ready soon because they're running behind. I paid the bill & asked how much longer? She then tells me people have been waiting for almost 2 hours for their order. I asked why did I get a pick up time of 10:37am? Oh, that's just how the system works & we don't go by it. I said, I'm not waiting 2 hrs for my order. She said, I didn't say 2 hrs which she clearly did & now she had an attitude.  So I said just cancel my order & can I get a refund. She said I'm too busy to do that right now so I'll do it later. She slammed the window as the asshole walked away. My hands were on the counter right before she slammed it. If my hands were still there they  would have been crushed. I called the restaurant & left a message of the incident. It's Friday & still waiting for a phone call. The refund hasn't been processed because she didn't bother to get it done. I'm calling the bank tomorrow to get charges reversed. I understand that it was Mother's Day but if you can't handle the business then you shouldn't  take on line orders since it useless according to your employee. The people waiting outside were pissed because of the long wait as I left.
What a way to spoil Mother's Day morning for many customers.
This is the worst customer service ever. Avoid this place if you want a good experience  & most of all good service.

walked in- the greeter was amazing, then I came to the table, dealt with the server VERY VERY poor customer service skills! I usually get my regular chicken fajita omelette- with toast, I told the server the toast was burnt and he returned it with an attitude, but sadly it was still burnt- I asked for water- waited 20 mins for my water, maybe it was a bad server exp... but sadly my rating score had resulted to this!

Service is too slow. 25 min wait to be called ok, can understand that if its busy but on top of that a 40 min wait for the food to arrive and then its not hot? Not Good.  I had to find the waiter twice!
Great food. Steak on point. Sunnyside up eggs perfect. All you can eat buttermilk pancakes were fluffy

Order # 275008485

Well, my girlfriend and I live near the area and, before going there, we looked at the menu online. It said "order online", for every item. We ordered online, thinking that it was supposed to be ordering ahead so that when we arrive RD at the restaurant the food would be ready to be served AT the restaurant; not realizing that it only meant to order online for pickup. When we arrived there, the cashier offered us a seat, and as I proceeded to tell her that I had ordered online she then yells at her coworkers that I ordered online but decided to eat it here, instead. That, apparently was a huge problem for everyone, having to unpack the food from the containers and put it in plates to be served. Well, they do it and this is when the servers start looking at us and treating us like dogs looking for free food or something. Throwing the plates on the table and then leaving, not acknowledging anything or asking us whether we needed anything (for which I had to be ordering and asking the cashier for service and this upset her). We were very unsatisfied with all of this and proceeded to pay and leave. While I was paying (to the cashier again, mind you), I asked what was the big deal about us making the mistake of ordering online and eating it here? She said this had never happened (really?). Then I asked why was the server treating us this way. She said that because she (the server) wasn't aware that we ordered online (as if this explains her more than nasty, impolite, extremely rude behavior). Then I said that if I'm seating there she should expect a tip regardless of whether we ordered online or not. Then the cashier said that it was not about the money, then I asked: then what is it about? To which I she don't reply and just processed my payment (to which I added an undeserving gratuity). So then we left: no apology, nothing at all but a bitter moment and a very regretful memory of having gone to iHop. This was my first ever visit to an ihop restaurant. And it will probably be the last.

It's not the cleanest IHOP. My family and I have been going here for as long as it's been open. The servers have always been very friendly. There's usually left over food & crumbs on the seats and floor. Last time I went was to get breakfast. We were seated in the booth closest to the KITCHEN entrance/bathrooms. There was a cockroach crawling on the wall of of the kitchen entrance side. My boyfriend killed it with the check clipboard. I'm most concerned with the fact that it was right near the kitchen and when we brought it to the waiters attention he didn't seem phased or shocked.
Soooo bright! I was almost blinded and couldnt even see the pizza details. It is a good thing for ample lighting but this is glaring!

Decent pizza appropriately priced.
Fresh lemonade and salads for grab and go.
No bathroom.

Nothing to complain about, but also not something to write home about. Service is quick and efficient. The price is not exactly cheap either or what you'd expect from a joint called iPizza. Not a slice I find myself particularly craving, but a convenient slice. I never find myself ever planning ahead to get iPizza with conviction, but sometimes find myself thinking "I'm hungry, this is the fastest option and it's right here." The prime corner/intersection location, late hours, and bright lights with lots of seating makes what's otherwise very average pizza "not a bad option" when hungry and just the wrong side of the street or when the waits for the other pizza joints in the area have long lines. And yes, there ARE meals when I have cravings for the other pizza options available in the area...

Their PLANT BASED slice is pretty bad and worse if you get the cauliflower crust.  Not all plant based cheese are good.   I avoid the old type made out of soy. It just doesn't taste good.  
Two Boots Pizza has great plant based cheese pizza. They have one in the East Village, one in the West and one 2nd Ave.  65/66
As for their real cheese pizza. It's passable and has enough cheese on it but nothing special.

This is their latest location, and it ain't that good!!
I came here last month -twice, in fact, By midtown standards, their pizza at best is Meh. I orderedd a Chicago and square. Neither was worth it. Will I be back, no!

This is a new great addition to the neighborhoods of Murray Hill and kips Bay on the south west corner of 34th St., and 2nd Ave. used to be clovers deli 1934 closed now ipizzaNY  at lunchtime. I got two slices of pizza and a can of soda for 699+ tax a very nice bargain for the neighborhood pizza nice and chewy asked for sauce extra sauce on the side no problem will return many times more in the future very clean, friendly staff very roomy let's go for pizza and other items from their extensive menu from California right? Where is it? Oh, there is OK.

a new decent pizza joint in the kips bay section of manhattan that serves good pizza , pasta dishes. etc. good amount of spaced seating and display of different types of pizza is in plain view .a few salad slices and a large soda should work out for me till dinner time. overall pizza is good and they dont shy away from putting lite toppings as one slice was really enough to fill my belly. this pizza joint has a real shot at staying around for a long time and with good pizza , they will.

Pizza was great, that marinara sauce was top notch as well, They offer an awesome range of fresh pizzas. I liked dining here. Staff members are always friendly, prices are reasonable and the spot is always kept clean.

Arrived at this fancy, classy restaurant with a beautiful hostess and the waiters welcoming us with a smile, the service was amazing they were all being attentive and helpful the whole evening. Surprisingly the head chef came to our table and we chatted a little about Italia his hometown and we were all remembering our best Italian food experiences. including the one I was having at that moment, at the Il Divo. Food looking as piece of art and the real, authentic taste of Italy. Definitely memorable dinner. can't wait to be back!

No idea how this place is so high rated. The service was ok and the food was horrible. The person I was with had the prosciutto, lasagne, and fresh fruit. They said theirs was good but I dont know considering mine was horrible and their fresh fruit was covered with powdered sugar - doesn't anyone know that's not how you macerate fruit?

I had the mussel tomato soup which wasn't soup at all, it wasn't bisque either, it tasted like they took a jar of ragu and threw frozen mussels into it. For my entree, I had the pan seared salmon which wasn't even pan seared, it was steamed and the asparagus was also steamed, my salmon didn't even have the skin on it. For dessert, I had the gelato which wasn't gelato, it was ice cream

After our meal, they had a cappuccino which wasn't a cappuccino, it was a macchiato and I ordered an iced latte which wasn't an iced latte, it was an iced coffee

The restaurant itself is cute but I wouldn't come back here

Il Divo was wonderful. Lovely ambiance as soon as we walked in to when we left. We had birthday dinner reservation on a weekend, staff was quick to seat us and gave us time to peruse the menu but also offered recommendations when we were unsure of what to order. Our server Ahmed was amazing he explained the dishes to us, and we were glad we followed his recommendations. We ordered Truffle fries & Baby octopus Alla Luciana style which was amazing to start off with. For mains we ordered their Gnocchi and Linguine which was phenomenal. The whole meal was so delicious, literally can't wait to try other items from the menu. For dessert we got the Creme Brûlée, probably the best crème brûlée I ever had. They also packed up our leftovers.  Overall from their food to service & ambiance 10/10.
Definitely became a fan of Chef Antonio after having his meals.

This place had the cutest interior decorations, perfect for a date night or celebration outing! The staff is super friendly and accommodating as well.

We started out with the Negroni Spagliato and the special apple cider margarita. The Negroni tasted as one would expect. The apple cider margarita did not have enough of a sufficiently robust taste of apple cider to qualify as an "apple cider" margarita.

For appetizers we ordered the crudo hamachi which was the star dish for the night for us. It was packed with truffle and caviar flavor! One of the best crudos I've had in NYC. We also ordered the sea urchin risotto. The uni in this dish was unfortunately masked by the presence of other overpowering flavors.

For entrées, we ordered the duck which was strangely paired with Parmesan crisps. The individual components of the dish did not mesh well for me. The duck was perfectly cooked and presented beautifully but was also under-seasoned. We also ordered the gnocchi, which was nothing special, and could probably be found at other cheaper restaurants. There was too much ham which was very salty and overpowered the sauce accompanying the gnocchi.

We ended with a chocolate sponge cake affogato, something about it just tasted it off to me. The cake tasted a bit gritty- perhaps too much flour was used. There was an insufficient amount of chocolate used as well. I probably should've gotten a different dessert- they had a lovely selection.

Overall, for the price I am paying, I wish that the dishes were executed better.
Excellent cocktails and great ambiance if you don't mind seeing a cockroach or two crawl across the bar.

Came here for a weekday lunch. It's a fancy place with nice decor and lots of light, but overall it was too expensive for the quality of the food. The arugula salad with honey olive oil dressing had too much dressing and was too sweet. I did really like the ziti though, which was nicely cooked Al dente and with a bolognese sauce. Not really worth $40 though.

In the area and consulted Yelp.
This place had a strong rating.
Toughest review yet but I'll net at 3 stars.

ENTRANCE - right on the corner with outside seating on second Ave and 72street.

In fairness it was 1:30 in the afternoon so we waited for someone to come from the back to seat us.

DECOR - very elegant looking with table cloth wrapped tables. Had a real European feel albeit to me more of a French look.

MUSIC - I have to mention that the music in the background was a bit out of place. More like 80's to post 2000 than perhaps Sinatra.

SERVICE - they were very polite but with our table and 1 or 2 outside I have to say not very attentive as we needed to flag them down on occasion.

MENU - fairly limited by my perspective but will note the options were northern Italian so if you are looking for red sauce stuff this is not the place.

APPETIZERS - I had the beef carpaccio which was tremendously good.

ENTREES - I had the linguine with manilla clams. I prefer the long island little neck but have had b4. Pasta was slightly under cooked. Seemed to me not homemade. The broth was quite good but limited. The portion size was not so great given the $35 price.

My daughter had the shrimp and scallop pasta in a brandy sauce. Her pasta was a bit under cooked. The scallops were excellent in her opinion. The sauce lacked seasoning.

DESERT - wife had the  panna cotta that was decent but not great. Daughter had the sponge cake with the coffee pour on top. The coffee flavor overpowered everything and the cake was dry and not flavorful.

PRICE - this place is not for the faint of wallet LOL. Appetizers are $20+, most entrees are high $20 to $30+.

Three people with 3 drinks racked up $217 for lunch without tip.

Given portion sizes this place is expensive. Don't get me wrong I'll spend a lot for great meal but not this place.

Loved our time here. Food was delicious we licked our plates clean. The service was phenomenal, everyone is so kind and make sure we are comfortable. The ambiance makes you feel like you're in Italy . Highly recommend.

Super cute dinner date restaurant! Il Divo was such a wonderful restaurant , definitely recommend coming here with your loved one for a special/romantic date with delicious food and amazing service.

I have to say I was extremely satisfied while dinning here, the service , the ambiance, the food
It all came together to create such a wonderful experience for me and my date

The drinks were wonderful , the espresso martini hit the spot

The food was outstandingly delicious, we ordered the daily specials
Which was the seafood soup and the truffle pasta

I loved the soup it was one of the best broths I tasted , it reminded me of growing up by the beach

The octopus and lobster appetizers were fresh and tasty

My date had the Veal accompanied with polenta , amazing
Definitely worth trying it

We were super full from this delicious experience so we didn't order dessert , definitely on my next visit I will

The restaurant had such a nice ambience and vibe , our server was super friendly and service was phenomenal

Definitely on my next visit to the city I will come back to this lovely restaurant
Can't wait to see what daily special they might have

This was definitely a 5 start restaurant that really deserves more than a 5 start review!

Had a great lunch here the other day. All the servers were really great and made our meal enjoyable.
They were accommodating to us and our 10 mo old which was really nice.
We ordered the fried shrimp, risotto cavio and pepe, and carbonara. All three dishes were done perfectly. Noodles and rice were cooked perfectly. No dishes were too salty but tasted like what they should. Our only regret was that the portion sizes were a bit on the smaller size but it made us want to have more and come back to try the other dishes.

The starter truffle caviar hamachi is outstanding. I highly encourage you to try this. Loved the flavors incredibly. I followed up with the truffle risotto which was made very nice. Service was warm and traditional Italian decor. I'd recommend this to a friend.

So glad we found Il Divo! Excellent location and food . A dinner that was supposed to be an hour turned out to be a whole evening because of the setting this place provides. Christian was such an amazing host and his team as well, everyone seemed to be alert in case we needed anything.
Food was delicious  and looking forward to coming back
I never leave reviews. And this is 1 of the best restaurants I've ever been to. Service, quality, and Venue.   Top Notch.

I was really looking forward to dining here.  But it was very expensive with a McDonalds atmosphere.  

Lovely decor, but I wouldn't recommend coming here to celebrate anything special like an anniversary or romantic birthday.

Food was good but not good enough to warrant ever returning.

Staff was super nice and cute, but clueless.  They have no idea how to run a restaurant.

"Walked in for dinner on Thursday night with a friend. The GM, Christian, couldn't have been more excellent and professional. He recommended a good bottle of Gavi di Gavi of high quality, at a rational price. Linguine clams and eggplant parmigiana were out of this world, my friend got the steak, and it looked delicious. This is my absolute favorite restaurant in NYC.

Came here with some friends on a Sunday night this summer, and had a really good meal.

We started with the prosciutto and eggplant Parmesan appetizer. The eggplant was absolutely perfect, up there with the best I've ever had. Melts in your mouth, and with the perfect proportion of sauce and cheese. The prosciutto was quite good too- my only complaint is that it was slightly more thickly sliced than I prefer. Obviously just a preference thing.

For the entree I had a pasta with veal and mushroom sauce. It was rich, and very meaty with perfectly cooked pasta. The portion was also pretty large compared to what I had expected. Overall I really liked it. Others at the table had linguini with clams, and a lobster risotto- all got rave reviews.

Very charming place as well. While it is a bit expensive, I certainly would come back!

Il Divo is the true Italian dining experience, from the hospitality to the culinary execution, it brought me back to Milan and my child hood of well prepared dishes. The chef truly brings flavor to the fullest.
Thanks to the team for an amazing night, we will be back.

Great attentive service. Excellent food.
Atmosphere is elegant but relaxed.
Quiet, but lively area.

Just wanted to write a note to say thank you to the entire team (extra shoutout to Christian!) at Il Divo for providing impeccable service and amazing food! I live just around the corner and it's my absolute favorite restaurant, especially if you're into Italian cuisine. The restaurant is so beautiful and the attention to detail is on point.
I'd highly recommend their lobster ravioli with truffle or any other pasta dish for that matter.
5 star rating by me every time! See you guys soon again!

Highly recommend the Risotto with Lobster and Summer Black Truffle- perfectly cooked and flavorful. They did not skimp out on the truffle or lobster meat, which some places do. The lamb gnocchi was good but did not stand out quite as much as the lobster risotto. The asparagus Au gratin was disappointing; the asparagus didn't pair well with the cheese and there was a bit too much pepper.
We will return to try their other dishes, since everything sounded so delicious, but of course you can only order so much in one meal.
Their outdoor seating is lovely.
Pricing is $$$$. It's a special occasion kind of place.

Ambiance is fire, very romantic setting but also great for a business dinner or lunch. Just a very nice modern Italian feel. Waiters and service is excellent. The focus of the menu is certainly the meat dishes, but their vegetarian pastas were also INCREDIBLE. Their butternut squash pasta dish was so yummy, and not overly sweet. The other veggie option was the burrata-stuffed pasta. For people that like red-sauce pasta, this is a great option. The zucchini app is packed with flavor.

But the desserts though.... ALSO AMAZING. The affogato was the best I've had. I'm not much of a dessert person but this was a must have.
Classy uptown Italian with authentic food cooked by Actual Italians!! This place is great, near perfect food and the staff is sweet and knowledgeable.
Great food, great service, beautiful inside.  They even serve my favorite tequila, YaVe!

My friend and I had an amazing meal here last night. The ambiance is gorgeous, the service impeccable, and the food absolutely delicious. They have very reasonably priced bottles of wine in addition to the pricier options. The Manager, Christian, went above and beyond to make our time enjoyable. He had a packed dining room, but the attention we received felt like we were the only ones there. We will definitely be returning for another girls night out!
Absolutely beautiful interior and outside dining area. The service is impeccable. The menu is creative and the brunch menu is so good! Their burger is amazing. Great spot on ues!
really like the place and the food and service was so good, definitely gonna go again, special thanks to Christian:)

Had a wonderful dinner here. It was pouring outside but the ambiance inside the restaurant was warm, upscale, and almost made you feel like you traveled to Milan for a few hours. Everything we ordered arrived hot and delicious (especially the eggplant parm appetizer!). The wine pours were generous and they even brought out complementary champagne at the end since we said we were celebrating. Prices are definitely on the higher end, but the service and food make it worth it!

Amazing restaurant in NYC, really clean and nice atmosphere, stuff outstanding and super professional, food sooo delicious, can't explain it with the words you just need to go there and try it, the Chef Antonio is from Naples so the dishes are made in Heaven! The GM Cristian really friendly and caring person working at really professional level. Had a great time here. Highly recommend this restaurant!
Charming, classy, and romantic. Impeccable service.  Cozy in the most sophisticated way.  Every element of the experience here was top notch.

Really wanted to love this place as it is beautiful and the staff was so friendly. Unfortunately, the food really underwhelmed. Every dish was average or worse. The clams linguine may have been the worst I ever had - just no flavor at all (only a concerning fishy aftertaste). Given the other reviews, maybe an off night, but just no excuse. Can't believe we spent over $200 for that dinner for 2. To end on a positive note, the cocktail I had was excellent. Everything lovely except the food (kind of important though!)

Food and ambiance was amazing. I would recommend for date night. Very romantic and cozy. The staff was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. The lamb was so tender and succulent. I highly recommend.

I had a bad day at work and stop in this restaurant to have a glass of wine and don't regret it at all!
The friendly waiter Raul definitely was helpful me to forget my terrible day at work also I met the Chef of this establishment Antonio Savino . He was also very charming .   I tasted two of his dishes , burrata salad and pasta with slow cooked veal and mushrooms both  were absolutely great.  I am highly recommending!
My experience overall was great and definitely made my day much better! I would love to come back there soon .

Il Divo has been on my list for quite some time and it didn't disappoint. The service was professional and old-world, and the food was classic but also creative and thoughtful.

I started with the warm lobster salad with lychee dressing. A bright, fun and unusual dish. While the balance wasn't perfect, the inventiveness made up for this.

Next I had stuffed squash blossoms that were done to perfection.  This can be such a hit or miss dish but everything about them was perfection. Perfectly crisp, just the right amount of grease, good cheese to blossom ratio, and sitting on a small pool of squash bisque that enhanced the flavor of the squash blossom.

Next a burrata stuffed agnolotti with a poached cherry tomatoes and prawns. The agnolotti were bigger than I'm used to which I didn't mind, but they were closer to ravioli as a result. The rich tomato sauce clearly used a stock made from prawn shells and it was a beautiful touch to this dish. The prawns were large and very nice quality.

For dessert I had a lemon mouse that was nice but nothing to write home about.

I ended up finishing my meal with two glasses of port because it was the sort of place that makes you want to linger.

I've definitely found a new neighborhood spot.

Good place in UES.  This may sound odd, but they have the absolute best Cesar salad.  I lived and worked all over the world.  I usually don't eat salad, their Cesar salad was amazing, the dressing and the fresh.  Again, I am not a salad eating man, I eat meat.  I live in Manhasset area on Long Island.  I would actually drive into the city just the Cesar salad - that's nuts - long drive but would be worth it

The food and service at Il Divo is phenomenal. Christian and Stella provided me with great service and were very attentive. To start I had a Lychee Martini and it was great for dinner I had the Agnolotti. I'm a sucker for Agnolotti - anytime I see it, I have to order it. The Il Divo Golden Martini is by far my favorite. I've never had anything like it and loved it. They also gave me a brownie with ice cream and white gold as dessert and it was to die for. I'll definitely be back for the great food and even better service. Thank you again!!

We came here for a celebratory dinner, and the upscale atmosphere, attentive service, and presentation of the food did not disappoint. The restaurant has white tables cloths, and walls covered in artwork and memorabilia. The restaurant feels upscale and the kind and attentive waiters make all the diners feel well-cared for. We ordered the lasagna and the grilled octopus with sopressata. The lasagna had a tomato sauce that tasted fresh and light. The grilled octopus was grilled to crispy perfection without being dried out a complimented by the tasty sopressata. We also ordered wine by the glass to compliment the meal. Overall, Il Divo provides a lovely, upscale meal with tasty and high quality food. Prices are high, but the elevated and relaxing environment makes them feel warranted.

This restaurant is great. We didn't have a reservation, but they were still able to seat us even though they were very busy. The service was great and the food was also great. My husband started with the poached lobster appetizer and loved it. He said the sauce that came with it was amazing. I got the Burrata and prosciutto appetizer and it was also amazing. The portion was a good size and the flavors were great. My husband then got the Dover sole for his entree and it was very good. However, it was pretty small for the price. I got the 30 egg yolk spaghetti with tomato sauce. I like this dish but I wish the sauce was a bit creamier. I think I would try something different the next time (the eggplant parm appetizer looked great). The espresso martinis were also amazing. I would definitely come back.
Amazing experience: authentic Italian cuisine with a very cool ambient. Christian and his staff are on a good level, keeping an eye on details. Will comeback for sure.

I heard about Il Divo opening from where I live in California. I went last week and was very happy with the decor, vibe, and dishes. Christian (the manager) maintains a high level of professionalism among the staff. As a result, everyone was friendly and accommodating, which was awesome. I lived in northern Italy years back and the dishes reminded me of then. Thick, delicious proper balsamic is served with bread, which is a major plus. Can't wait to go back very soon - it's worth a trip to the UES.

First review during opening week: 5 stars

Ok, I'm a believer. Just opened last week and the food is spot on. The first impression bread was fresh and savory. The burrata, bolognese, and filet mignon / frois growere all cooked to perfection. Christian, the manager, walked around to meet everyone and was kind, eager, and considerate.
The tiramisu was solid and had a hazelnut edge to it.
Feels like your in an elegant living room with only 60+ guests. Good Italian place to check out!

Second review a couple months later: 1 star

Ordered the eggplant parmigian: over cheesy and lacking eggplant. Couldn't taste the eggplant with all the cheese. It was recommended by the waiter. Tony's or another basic Italian restaurant is better and more eggplant

Cruto: Hidden in frisée salad and looked like little ripped off scallops. Didn't dare tasting it as the wifey wasn't happy.

Branzino: There were overly oiled potato chips in the dish that made the rest of the dish oily. Maybe put lemon potatoes or fancy fries. But, oily chips? Really? I told the onsite manager about this and he said he would tell the chef and instead of comping for the half eaten plate, he said he would give us free coffee and dessert.

Not one to take advantage, we ordered 1 dessert, the chocolate mousse which tasted like someone poured sugar on it.

Would have expected an extra dessert sent out or something for not being to eat our entree.

Linguini with clams: the one solid entree and recommended.

The waiter: looked like we were bothering him. What's good to eat? What do you recommend? Everything. Gee that's helpful.

Last time, we ate at the bar and ordered different stuff that was spot on. And the bartender was pleasant. This time, the dishes and service was off. Bad dishes? Or maybe management is now skimping on the chef and service. Don't know. But, definitely a let down.

Total score to be fair: 3 - average of 5 and 1 star reviews.

Absolutely one of my favorite Italian Restaurants! I loved the Linguine with Clams and Bottarga. As a real Italian, I can assure you this is authentic! My husband ordered the Risotto with Lobster and Truffle, so delicious. Very good service and staff. We'll go back very soon ;)

Food was absolutely delicious! For apps, eggplant rolls with prosciutto were amazing. The veal appetizer was a little heavy for me.
