For entree, I had the spaghetti that was really delicious and shrimp in it was well cooked. Everyone's pasta looked and tasted amazing. Service was alright (had to ask for water etc multiple times) and the prices are quite steep but we truly enjoyed our time. Outdoor dining option is good too

Nice neighborhood Italian restaurant. Four of us had dinner. The restaurant was quiet an comfortable. Staff was very pleasant. Food was excellent. We are actually returning next week with friends who live in the neighborhood.
Delightful cozy UES Italian for a date night. Attentive service, lovely cocktails and the food is wonderful. Get dessert- it does not disappoint.

This is my favorite restaurant in my neighborhood, but also possibly in all of NYC. Everything about it is just 'me', 'perfect' and all that I've ever wanted in a restaurant.

Firstly, the decor. I mean, its just too good. Its a cozy library feel with little lamps on your table, but also extremely well decorated with photos covering every wall. Its how I would love my living room to feel. It has large glass windows, and is overall very small but still comfortable. The service is top notch, it has a Michelin feel to the restaurant. The bread is 10/5, one of the best I've had in NYC. Its so good in fact, that I contemplate asking for to go bread everytime I walk by. Surprisingly when I went, I didn't get the pasta, which is not like myself. However, I tried Greg's Bolognese which incredible. However, my chicken dish was the best chicken I have ever had. My mouth still craves the flavors. This is a true win, and is a moment of NYC life that I will hold with me for years to come, as its everything I've ever wanted in one place.
This place is definitely on a pricier side BUT It has a beautiful decor, excellent food, and friendly service team. Will be back!

Decent food. I requested grilled chicken on a salad and was told that the chef would not accommodate my request.
I understand that chefs can be particular but this seemed a bit unreasonable. It is not that  I was asking for something insane, I just wanted grilled chicken on a salad!
Needless to say, I won't be back!

Just visited Il Divo for the first time and it was amazing. Food was delicious and service impeccable. We didn't have a reservation so we dined at the bar. Antonio was attentive and personable. Food was delish and drinks on point. Christian the manager was a gentleman.  We will be back for sure.

Il Divo is just simply amazing. The entire place certainly had a very cool vibe. Pretty much every thing that we purchased was super fresh and tasty. The staff was very welcoming and service is wonderful. Il Divo - I was blown away.

Went last night after waiting patiently for Il Divo to open. Didn't disappoint. Superb attentive service and superb food. The truffle pizza was sublime. The branzino was perfectly cooked with a crispy skin and a delicious sauce that complemented it well. Didn't miss that they didn't have their liquor license yet. I came for the food had a great meal. I've been to restaurants when they first open. Most have kinks that have to be worked out.  None here. Can't wait to go again.

A hidden gem.  I came bay late just before closing on a Monday night.  Ordered Onion Pakora (which it turns out want usual pakora but just onion rings) which were absolutely delicious for a starter.  For my entire I had the Lamb Keema Marat which is a moderately spiced minced lamb curry with peas.  Paired with basmati rice and garlic naan this was a delicious dish that I would absolutely order again.  To top it off they bring a rice dessert at the end that tasted like rice pudding and was just the right size and a touch of sweet to finish off the savory meal.

I can't wait to dig in to the egg curry and chapati that I ordered to go to have for breakfast in the morning!

Would absolutely recommend!
SO yummy and made super fast. Gave me a great recommendation on what to order. So happy with this meal!! Def coming back

We stumbled in for a late lunch when the placed we originally intended to go to was closed. Our expectations were not just met but exceeded! The samosas were incredible! They tasted fresh, well seasoned, and were a generous size. The buttered chicken was juicy and flavorful. The lamb vindaloo was spicy in all of the right ways. We enjoyed many glasses of the red sangria prepared in house. While the meal was delicious enough to make me want to return any day, it was the service that was truly spectacular. We felt well attended to and like the staff was more than happy to answer all of our questions. We sat outside because I had my dog with me (they were very accommodating) but the inside looked lovely and comfortable for a casual date!

Coming back for a vegetable thali review!!! If you are vegetarian, definitely try this place! The malai kofta was a recommendation from the owner/head chef and it is also now my #1 recommendation. Has so many different vegetables inside and the flavor is so rich and filling!

PLEASE PLEASE GO TO THIS RESTAURANT IF YOU ARE EVEN REMOTELY INTO INDIAN FOOD! The owner is so so wonderful and proud of the food they serve. They will accommodate you as much as possible and give wonderful recommendations based on what you like. Not to mention the best garlic naan!

I wish I took a photo of the outside. The restaurant is so pretty and decorated! It has lights and flowers all over the place. I think they might recently renovated.

I really enjoyed the food and service! The lamb vindaloo was spicy, flavorful, and a perfect match with the yellow rice. The mixed grill came in sizzling and absolutely fantastic! Putting some pick yogurt sauce on the grilled meat and eating it with the yellow rice was an unforgettable experience!

IPA beer with lemon was lovely to pair with the meal. You have to try the mango ice cream!!! It tasted so fresh and creamy. Idk if it's made in the house, but it tastes like so. You need to check out this place, such a hidden gem!

Unfortunately the dish( chicken tikka masala) I ordered was not what I was expecting. The dish had little to no flavor. I also asked for the chicken tikka masala to be spicy and it wasn't.
I'm very disappointed with food.

This was by far one of the worst Indian restaurants I've ever been to anywhere in the States.

The food:
We started off with chapati which was fine. It went downhill from there...
We decided to add an order of pakora. They a pulled bag of onion rings out of the freezer which was literally behind us (why was the industrial freezer in the dining room? It was filled with bags of onion rings and fries... wouldn't they want to hide that? ).
The pakora came out... and it was definitely onion rings, sprinkled with coriander and served with ketchup.
We decided we were going to reserve our judgment til our main dishes came out.
I ordered chicken tikka masala it was edible but not flavorful. I felt like I was eating a melted butter. My bf ordered thali with chicken saag, Chicken Tikka Masala, and chicken curry which had 1/4 inch thick layer of oil on the top. Saag was Cream of spinach with chunks of chicken. If onion rings and cream of spinach are Indian food, I can make it at home.

The service was terrible.
Our server was chewing on something while serving us. He also would place the food (a whole plate of thali) on the opposite end of the table from where we were sitting. So we had to fetch it ourselves.

The ambiance is also something to be said.
The music was blaring... except some of it wasn't music...it was pure yelling. It felt like a typical day riding the NYC subway but I was in a restaurant. But to be fair, they did turn it down when the yelling got out of hand.

Overall, I think it could've been worse (at least one  of us thought the food was half edible)... but I'm being generous by giving them 2 stars.

I normally don't try restaurants that have less than 4 stars on Yelp or Google. So admittedly, I was a bit reluctant to give this place a try - at the suggestion of my Indian in-laws - but am I glad we did. We ordered two Thali sets (one vegetarian and one non-vegetarian) and everything was very good. The butter chicken and chicken korma were definite winners in my book. The daal was also very tasty. The naan was soft and fluffy. The rice didn't seem to be drenched in ghee (which IMO is definitely a good thing). Is this an amazing Indian restaurant that I'd go out of my way for? No. But if you're in the neighborhood, it's definitely the best of the 3 I've tried so far (the others being Moti Mahal Deluxe and Imli).

Secret gem that opend up one year ago. The best chicken dishes ever. Ordering lunch special gives you  an option  (if you choose any meet) to taste 3 options.
Service is fabulous,  but naan and every single dish that I've tried is out of this world. Must visit.

I'm really not sure how this place has a high rating on Google and Yelp. The food was not good at all, but the service was decent hence the two stars.

We got the Samosas to start which were pretty bland, but still the better dish of the meal. For mains, we got some mixed vegetable curry and butter chicken. The mixed vegetable felt like it was made from frozen veggies, it did not feel fresh at all. It was also very bland. The butter chicken was extremely watery, nowhere close to what it's supposed to be. The chicken was also very tough.

Took my lady here for her first Indian food experience. She unfortunately cannot eat spicy food. So I ordered the basics...chicken tikka masala, lamb vindaloo and naan bread. All the food was actually very tasty and she really liked the chicken. The missing stars is because I specifically asked if the vindaloo could be served mild. Our waiter was strange. Seemed like he had aspergers as his demeanor was really off and when we asked for things his responses were often odd. So the vindaloo is labeled spicy. However, I specifically asked if it can be mild. He said no problem. The vindaloo came out very spicy. When I called him over and said we ordered this mild and she cannot eat it, he said, "oh, sorry, I told the chef to make it mild". He then walked away! was very confused as he didn't offer to take it back or or tell me what was going to be done.  10 minutes later, I asked if the chef is making a new one, he said no, and oddly walked away! I actually really liked the vindaloo, so I but I was aggravated that my girlfriend didn't get to try it and was stuck with only one dish. The chef came out and asked me how the meal was and I explained that we ordered the vindaloo mild and my gf couldn't eat any of it. he said that it's normally served spicy. So I explained that we ordered it mild and I asked if it is even possible to make it mild. He said yes, it can! He then gave us the bill and it wasn't taken off. So, even after telling him that we ordered it mild, and him, explaining that it could be made mild, and that they made a mistake, he didn't replace the dish or take it off the bill! He also kept saying to come back and try other dishes! Not once in my entire life, has a restaurant made a mistake with our order or complained that the dish wasn't good for whatever reason did we ever not have it replaced or taken off the bill!

they have the best chicken tikka masala in midtown. no questions asked. chicken is tender and juicy. naan was soft - not chewy.surprised this place has not blown up already. owner / operator really knows his food.

fresh roses on the tables and they play solid 90s Bollywood music. does it get better?

We ordered the Dhal, Chicken Tikka, Raita, and Garlic Naan. These were pretty large proportions compared to most NYC restaurants! When we went to go pick up the food, the staff was very kind, so I look forward to dining there in person. Overall, the food was good, I am looking to try more of their dishes in the future.

Our dining experience at India Palace was fantastic.  It's a small restaurant with great ambience.  The owner and his wife were so friendly and the food was excellent.  We have Indian friends and have been spoiled by their home cooked meals.  Eating at India Palace recreated those delicious meals.  This place is authentic!  If you love good Indian food, you've got to try this place.

Excellent Indian food and very attentive service.  The Tandori chicken was the best that I have had in a long time.  The complimentary rice pudding for dessert was amazing.  This is a new place and they are trying very hard to please and are succeeding.

Delicious Indian addition to the neighborhood! So interesting to see the split in reviews. In my opinion the chicken tikka masala is the best in the neighborhood for sure. Fantastic delicious chicken meat, buttery creamy sauce! And the naan is delicious as well. In person has an edge on delivery so go in person if you can. Bring a nice bottle of wine as their license isn't ready just yet but it's coming soon! Having had good food but some unpleasant experiences at nearby competitors, we're definitely coming here as our local favorite!

Just finished dinner at India Palace. What a great experience! The Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Tandoor were so good that we completely cleaned our plates! Finished with the rose ice cream -- such a nice treat. The owner was so friendly and made us feel like we were a guest in her home. Can't wait to go back!

Great place!
Good food and lots of food.
I think this is my first time I am writing a review on a restaurant,  and doing it only because it was good!
Very recommended.

Delicious food,  warm & welcoming hospitality.  A lovely intimate atmosphere.  Having been to India for 3 months at a time ~ This is the next best thing !   Your food will be prepared with love and skill by the owner.  5 stars are not enough, but will have to do.  Can't say enough how much I enjoy the food and the ambiance.

Wonderful Indian restaurant in the Upper East Side on a quiet side street.  The appetizers, the beverages (we loved  their salted lassi), and the main entrees were all delicious, and served quickly.  Chicken tandoori, vegetable biryani, and lamb vindaloo that we tried were all phenomenal!  Their garlic naan was also very good.  The service was excellent as well.  A pleasant touch was a visit to our table by the chef/owner at the end of the meal.  He is obviously very proud of his craft, as he should be.  He answered our questions and accepted our compliments very graciously.  We would highly recommend this undiscovered gem to fans of Indian cuisine,

New to our neighborhood and really wanted to like them. We got Thali of lamb and chicken dishes (to try several versions) and cauliflower gobi appetizer. The coating of the cauliflower is nothing like we have every had - way too thick. Could barely taste cauliflower. Part of the chicken was so overcooked and dry that we could not cut it with a knife. One of the sauces with butter was separated and greasy. The naan tasted like bad pizza crust. The only decent parts - the chicken saag and the lamb vindaloo.

By far the worst Indian restaurant.  First ordered Rogan Gosh and it came in a cream sauce like Kurma and it was so tough.  Sent back and asked for Chicken  Tiki Masala and I think they just replaced Lamb with Chicken in the very same cream sauce like Korma

I have eaten alot of indian food and both dishes dont resemble any  Rogan Gosh or Chicken Tiki Masala I ever had before

Tali with veggies was ok
New Indian place and it's by far our favorite in the neighborhood! Will deff be back next week for more. Everything from the starter to the dessert was amazing. Best samosas and garlic naan ever!

I don't understand where these negative reviews could possibly be coming from.  This is a small place recently opened up in Midtown (relocated from Brooklyn): As they don't yet have a liquor license, and are located on a somewhat scruffy street off 1st, they have yet to develop a following. But the food is absolutely superb. This is a family operation run by people who obviously care about what they are doing; my chicken jalfrezi was fresh and freshly made, tender, with perfect seasoning, and the naan was the best I have ever eaten in my life. Prices could and should be higher for the quality, and the service was friendly and (understandably as I was the only diner at the time) eager to please.  In a neighborhood filled with indifferent Indian places that are just phoning it in, this stands out and deserves more attention.

Such a good little spot...was in walking distance from the Bentley hotel where I was staying here on a work trip. Got the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan and it was delicious! Great service and so many food options too!

Just went here last night for the first time and had a great experience! The food was amazing- garlic naan, pappadum, matar paneer, chicken buhna, rice pudding. The women who served us was very welcoming and kind! Will definitely be going back here.
Flavor excellent with good value for UES. Got veggie thali and mixed thali. Host/owner very friendly. Only downside is a bit heavy on the ghee/oil. Will be coming back.

Indian Palace was in Bay Ridge for 45 years...new location is amazing. We live nearby and decided to give it a try...friendliest service, awesome good (the garlic naan...omg), and just a great neighborhood spot. I hope people in the area try it because they will almost certainly go back. I've been back twice this week. Good stuff.

So disappointing. Was really excited to try this place out but it was underwhelming. Bland tiki masala and overall below mediocre Indian. It is not cheap either. Unfortunately will not be returning because we really wanted to like this place.
Best Indian in NYC!!! Everything is fresh and made with love . Highly recommend A++++
Worst indian food ever, worst service, food had no flavor and owners have no intention in making this right
My son and I order from this restaurant frequently and we are never disappointed.  Our food is always delicious and it is delivered promptly.

Finally I have any Thai restaurant in my neighborhood where I can enjoy lunch and dinner and send my friends and business associates for either casual lunch which always turns out to be incredible and an unbelievable dinner with service that goes beyond expeectation.

Keep it going.  5 star

Chicken milanese was fresh, breaded to perfection and my waiter very attentive. I will be coming back here to try more dishes....

What a hidden gem....

$31 for a mediocre Negroni?!?! Never again.
Went after work for a drink asked the bartender for a Negroni and said well gin was fine. He poured the drink and it was nothing special. When they gave me the bill I did a double take. I should have questioned, but it clearly said Negroni $31. My mistake. Il Gradino is very close to my apartment and would have been nice to have a new local spot to regular. Nope.

We are vacationing in NYC and staying in a unit directly above this restaurant. We wanted something quick and easy that we could eat from home. Presently surprised by how delicious all of the food was. All 3 dishes were flavorful and fresh. Their chunks of parmesan were fresh from Italy quality.
Cannot comment on how the in dining service was as we ordered take out. Menu is slightly pricey for what seems like an unknown small dining establishment, thankfully the food lived up to the price.

Absolutely fantastic. Brilliant Italian comfort food at its best, and the best thing to happen to the UES dining scene in 2023. Dishes are unfussy, portions are ample, ingredients are seasonal and fresh. Attentive and professional waiters, cozy, uncluttered  ambiance, and always an extensive and interesting list of specials in addition to an appealing regular menu which in several places includes the words "a piacere" - as you would like it. If you in the mood for a light, gorgeous branzino; a rich,hearty veal dish; or a tricolore salad and a perfect pasta, this is your spot!

Bustling Italian restaurant on the UES. Everything here was as it should be:

1. Servers were knowledgeable about both the food and culture.
2. The ambience was dim, romantic, but also catered to a wider audience of friends, coworkers, families, etc.
3. The food, of course, divine. We got the mushroom ravioli and sea bass. They were both well-prepared, decadent, yet light.
4. The tiramisu is a must.
5. Wine list was extensive & eclectic.

Definitely 10/10 must try. Also they are pretty new so you'll be in the know if you go here

But for the lack of red zebra wallpaper (as well as some basic red-sauce dishes like spaghetti and meatballs), Il Gradino could become the new Gino's (which, by the way, was located only a block away). I have believed this since they first opened...

Diego, former maitre d' at Scalinatella, has assembled a friendly and hard-working waitstaff (Eduardo, Renato, and Armando, the bartender, to name a few) who truly want your experience to be top-notch. I actually think they overdo trying to please their diners...They want you to order whatever you want--on or off the menu; they think this will make you happy, BUT this desire to please everyone will work against them; they cannot be all things to all people. In trying to do so, dishes will turn out to be watered down and mediocre.

As a diner, I don't want unlimited choice. I prefer a narrower selection of dishes that the chef does best. He cannot possibly have mastered, or even have the proper ingredients for, every Italian dish in the universe; he can't possibly focus on so many preparations each night. And, honestly, the more choices I have, the more indecisive and uncomfortable I become. (On top of that, do I really want to be surprised by the price of my customized dish when the check arrives? No. I generally prefer to order from the printed menu, and know what I'm in for and what the chef does best.) Heck, Le Bernardin doesn't let you decide what the chef makes; the menu is based on the freshest ingredients and what the chef feels he can do best.

I am confident that when Gradino focuses and narrows its intent, it will be even better--not that it needs to become more popular! I believe that come Fall, when things are back in full swing in NY, Diego will have everything fine-tuned. I have no doubt I will find myself pampered and enchanted in Il Gradino's cozy bar with linguine alle vongole, a great bottle of wine, and visions of zebras dancing in my head...

Food and service was outstanding.  
I would strongly suggest putting on your radar for fine Italian restaurant
Incredible. The food and the service were some of the best we have ever had and have eaten all over Italy. Every single thing we ordered was perfect and the wine recommended was too.
Mediocre food in an extremely noisy restaurant with rude and inattentive service. Will not return.

Specials were outrageously expensive. Charged me $106 for filet of sole for one person!!! And it was not even that tasty.
Desserts were verbally described & no price given. Charged $58 for berries with zabagione! Real ripoff.

Owner called me to apologize, but only credited me $61.

We had a wonderful dinner at Il Gradino tonight. The service is really top notch.All the staff is very attentive and friendly. The ambiance is relaxing and inviting. The food is impeccable. Every dish we had was prepared perfectly. Stuffed Zucchini flowers, burrata, truffle pasta, veal chop, frutti di mare, pasta Siciliano, zabaglione, everything was delicious. Very nice wine menu too. I can't wait to return.

Loved everything about this restaurant. The food was all delicious and made with fresh ingredients and the service was excellent. This is our new go to restaurant for special occasions and when we are just in the mood to treat ourselves well.

We always enjoy great Italian cuisine while visiting NYC. Some of our favorites are the original Il Mulino, Lusardi's and Elio's.
After seeing an article, my wife and I decided to try the new Il Gradino on the upper East side.
Wow!  The artichoke and Burrata appetizers as well as our main courses of Dover Sole and Soft Shell Crabs, were as wonderful as any other restaurant we have been in the city.
I highly recommend giving this new restaurant a try.

Dined here with the girlfriend last night. We first met Diego at his previous job and he welcomed us with hugs and kindness. The entire staff made us feel like family. The "a piacere" feature is wonderful! We described our ideal risotto and it was prepared perfectly! Our mains were gorgeously presented and delicious! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! Diego, congrats on your restaurant! See you again soon!

You are certainly paying a premium for extremely tasty food. I think its worth every penny though. The vast menu certainly gives you a 1000 choices. Just in case you did not see or hear a dish you want just ask. They will certainly make it. I went with the massive veal chop with cherry peppers and garlic. My son had the Bolognese. My wife went with the steak with some sort of sautéed tomato's on top. My buddy dug into a pasta dish as well. Not much left on the plate even though generous size portions. As far as apps all salads are olive oil, fresh lemon, salt and pepper. My boy and buddy went with the tuna tartare. They wrapped it in smoked salmon and covered in a decent amount of guacamole. I felt the salmon was over kill and distracted from the tuna. We went with a shared pasta dish. I left it up waiter i said just no cream. He brought out the fresh pasta with assortment of mushrooms in a light tomato sauce. So good! The desert the ricotta cheese cake is so light and yummy. The fresh berries and cream just worked. The glasses of limoncello or sambuca on the house was a nice touch to end a massive meal like you ate at grandmas.
Probably the noisiest restaurant I have ever been to. I would never go back. Food is average.  Nothing redeeming here.

I have never had such horrendous service in my life  by a restaurant's captain. He was rude, condescending, and unapologetic for his a abominable behavior to all three in my party. Although a fan of their food, I would never recommend this restaurant the since waiter ruined the occasion we were there to celebrate. It would be best for them to rethink his employment.

Service was great. Ambiance was ok. Way overpriced. 1/2 of the menu says M/P. They make up their prices . They told me a veal chop was $72 which was outrageous for a local restaurant, and charged me $84. INSANE. Food was average . Nothing special. Would not recommend  and not return. I wish them well, but for that pricing i would rather be in a fine restaurant on Madison Avenue.
We had an amazing dinner, from this delightful, understated upper east side gem.  The staff was courteous,  the food and service were fantastic. An overall great dining experience.

This was the best food I've ever had. The service was amazing and every item I ordered was perfectly cooked. I ordered clams and mussels for an appetizer and mushroom linguini. I am so glad a friend recommended this gem.
Our new favorite place on the Upper East Side. Great food, great service, very accommodating. Everything was perfect and everyone made us feel at home. Will definitely be returning.

First time tonight at IL Gradino which is very similiar to Scalinatella. No wonder, as the owner, Diego, was the head waiter at Scalinatella before opening here about two months ago. Don't bother with the menu. Have Diego recite what he recommends. You can also have him make almost anything. I told him to give patrons a blank menu which is useless here anyway.

The food is outstanding and the waiter service excellent. The owner however is disingenuous! We asked him to suggest a bottle of wine and when he came over to the table one of the members of our party said "I hope you are not charging us $400 for this wine (as he frequents the Resturaunt) the owner said no I am charging you $199. So we said ok. This was our third bottle of wine all different. When we get the check the bottle was $900 and we were floored, when we asked the owner he said he meant $1.99 as a joke!!! First he never told us the price, second he misrepresented what he meant. Although he tried to make a minor concession in the price it really was not at all professional. So again the food is great, the ambiance is great and the waiters were very accommodating. The owner needs to learn to be forthright and not pull a fast one, it ruined the entire evening and the four of us will not go there again, so beware.

Incredibly good service. We had4 changes of plates and silverware; one each course. Real napkins and tablecloth's. I had Frutta de Mare linguine and Tiramisu, the lady next to had Dover Sole with very good brute blanc sauce. Our glasses were filled 8 times anytime one of us took a sip.

I went to this restaurant on Sunday for dinner with my uncles however, this was not our first time here. I absolutely love the food, their presentation, and the portion. Everytime they allow us to modify the non veg dish and make it to vegetarian dish on our request and we love that.
Service is on point. We were served by Monica this time and last time as well. She is very friendly, witty, patient and makes great suggestions specially with drinks. She made sure we were having a good time there.
I definitely recommend this place and their Patio like a sunroom is the fab spot ever seen in NYC.

I'm not sure what to make of this restaurant.
Service very friendly!
Ordered HH drink. It was considerably less full than my friend's identical drink.
My food was also considerably less flavorful than my friend's.
It took over 25m to figure out my payment, and still they were not able to figure it out.

Imli has such delicious Indian food in the UES! It's such a cute and chic Indian restaurant tucked away in my neighborhood. Imli has such great food, a great selection of cocktails and has a beautiful backyard patio for when the sun is shining!

Oooo I ate so much, I recommend starting with the lamb seek kebabs and the Kerala beef curry - the beef was so tender! For main dishes, you should definitely try one of the sizzler platters! I got a mixed meat platter which was perfect for sharing with everyone and getting to sample the tandoori chicken, shrimp, and salmon! I also absolutely loved the lamb biryani - this was one of my faves! They have great naans, I got a cheese one and the chili mushroom naan (had never seen a chili mushroom one on a menu before - take note of the chili and order based on your taste buds)!

There's a great selection of cocktails - I had too many  The 'East Side' has hibiscus infused gin and is made with an egg white and topped with a cinnamon stick - super cute! The 'Chili Lychee Martini' was delicious with the fresh lychees inside it! You can't go wrong with the classics either, get the 'Thumbs Up' for a cocktail made with Old Monk rum and a classic Indian soda, Thumbs Up (Indian Coca Cola)! My fave was the 'Imli Old Fashioned' served smoking and had delicious cardamom flavors!

I'll be back super soon, it was all so so so good!

Seriously some of the best Indian food I have ever had. I always love Indian cuisine because the flavors are out of this world and really incredible but it was totally amped up a few levels here.

Let's start with the garlic. Non-... You can never go wrong with non-but this one had such a perfect amount of garlic, I couldn't stop eating it.

The appetizers we had were absolutely incredible, I had to stop myself from licking the plates clean because of how good they were.
For my entrée, I got the butter chicken, which is served on the bone, but you can ask for it to be boneless which I did. This dish was so flavorful and super saucy. The perfect amount of sauce for mine on to wipe up.

The overall vibe is super laid-back, cozy, and sexy. Dim lights and a very nice bar.

The service was seriously out of this world. Our waiter suggested many dishes, gave us some insight on Indian beer and liquor, and even let us look at the kitchen at our dishes being made for some behind the scenes action.

The spot should be on everyone's list of MUST TRYS! I can't wait to come back soon.

We just moved in upstairs. We were the only people there at 6pm on a Saturday night. The food was outstanding. We are not Indian, so we order chicken tikki masala and beef vindaloo with a side of Ocra everywhere we go. This meat was perfection. It tasted slow-cooked and was super tender. The sauce wasn't the same as it tastes in other places but perhaps it is more authentic. Still very good. We will be back! Would have appreciated more water refills, especially since we were the only people in the restaurant.

Food is very spot on. All the dishes have flavors you'd expect out of them when you read the menu and then taste what they serve. The service is sometimes too aggressive or lacking, they haven't mastered the in between so your experience may be a hit or miss in that category.

Their varied naan options are a definite plus. Chili mushroom naan is a diamond in the rough not really found in 99% of Indian restaurants but it deliciously works well with their menu as a stand alone app or intended purpose of naan.

The daal makhani is also very enjoyable. It has the right balance of flavor/ spice as well as creaminess.

I've eaten here a few times as well as used the back patio/sunroom area to host a private event. They're very accommodating and food has always met my expectations.

If I could give this restaurant 10 stars, I would. I am genuinely in love with everything about this place. The vibe, the food and the staff are as amazing as you could ever hope to have. The tables and atmosphere is beautiful and calming. The staff is so nice and accommodating. I already have a feeling Chef Piyush is going to be a Michelin Chef. The plates are the perfect size and portion and the flavors are unlike anything I have ever experienced. Every lamb dish I had exceeded all my expectations. The drinks are also unique and out of this world. This restaurant is perfect and I recommend Imli as one of my most favorite restaurants. I am already counting the moments until I can come back. Thank you so much Chef Piyush, Antoni, Vincent, Jessie and the entire staff for the perfect experience .

Was able to go in for a late brunch with my friend after work. We were fortunate enough to get in a hour before closing and it was perfect. What caught my eye was how clean and cool the bar looked from the outside. I definitely want to sit at it one day. Our server was very kind, attentive, and knowledgeable about the dishes when we had questions. The food was amazing. I haven't had a great bite to eat in a while I will dream of it until I go again. The drinks came and tasted perfect each time.

We generally stay on the west side for our culinary track.  With that said form time to time we venture over to the East side.  Glad we did this time.  Food is pretty good and worth an out of your way stop.  Service a bit slow, but friendly.

Came here for brunch with some friends and was thankful they let us order off the dinner menu! I got some butter chicken with garlic naan to share with a friend and I'm glad I did!! It was so filling and delicious, and can easily feed two people. The butter chicken was creamy and flavorful and the naan was soft and freshly baked! Overall a great spot if you're craving Indian food- they also had some cool brunch options!
I've had a lot of Indian food, nothing compares. It's clean and a cute place. Service was great, and everyone was friendly.

Went for lunch and waiter was friendly. Samosa and daal were good but main entree chicken tikka masala was disappointing. The sauce was sort of sour and chicken was over cooked and very hard. Won't recommend

The worst thing that can probably be said about an Indian restaurant is that its food is bland. Unfortunately, that was kind of our experience with Imli. We tried:

-chicken biryani (mild)
-garlic naan
-sag paneer (mild)

Everything was pretty bland and flavorless to be totally honest. The biryani had pretty much no spice, no taste (I order mild biryani because a lot of Indian places will tend to overseason their food; but I have had mildly spiced biryani that had a perfect level of flavor without being overpowering). The garlic naan did not taste of garlic. The sag paneer was decent, but by no means amazing.

I went here for happy hour and wow! It's $8 for Tom collins, daiquiris, old fashions, manhattans from 5-7pm everyday- that's an amazing deal and the cocktails are actually made properly. Weekend HH are so rare and they're even more rarely an actual good deal. They also had a special HH Pear vodka drink that was shockingly good. The bar tender was very nice and friendly, he mentioned he was updating the menu to have more Indian inspired cocktails using Indian spirits- how exciting!

The inside seems small but they have a big back section that's an extension of the restaurant.

I'm eager to try the food! Will definitely be going back.

I have only ordered online the lunch special which is about $18 and it couldn't be any better. I have tried a lot of Indian places throughout New York and this is in the top 5. For the price you can not get a better deal: one appetizer, one entree, naan, rice, lentil soup and a piece of dessert. It tasted amazing and I've been ordering ever since.

I had a very good first experience dining in here. The beef curry was delicious, I highly recommend it. I ordered mine 'medium' heat and probably could have went a little hotter. Super tasty, regardless. Service was prompt and sufficient. Space is bright and clean. Give it a try.

Really really wanted to like this place and am still hoping my experience was just a fluke incident. We went around 9 pm on a Sunday night and were seated in the bar room. I ordered a glass of the toscana rosso and the waitress said they don't do it by the glass. I showed her in the menu where they have it by the glass. My boyfriend ordered a glass of rose. She comes back with two glasses of rose and I told her I ordered red which I had clearly physically pointed out to her in the menu. She said it's rose and showed me a similar name of a wine in the rose section, which obviously wasn't the one I had asked for. She went back and got me the wine I requested. The glass of rose was about 3 oz less than the pour of the red, which was also smaller than expected. We didn't bother to say anything about this. We had come here hoping for the lobster tikka masala which sounded amazing. So when it came time to order, we ordered a samosa appetizer, garlic naan, mushroom naan, paneer makhani and lobster tikka masala. After a couple min the waitress came back saying they didn't have lobster that night, which was very disappointing. I would expect to be informed of any items that are missing off a menu prior to ordering. We ordered chicken tikka masala. For the quality of food- samosa filling was undercooked, chicken in the tikka masala was dry, and the paneer tasted rotten. Both of us also felt the taste of the gravy in our entrees was a bit bland. The naans were just ok. I actually had to send back the paneer makhani because the cheese tasted so bad. The waitress offered a replacement meal, which was nice, but I was very put off by the experience and just wanted to get out of there. She ended up comping the paneer makhani and the garlic naan. The owner and the waitress seemed so nice and sweet and I really hope this was a weird one time experience. This place has great potential.

My girlfriend and I stumbled upon this UES gem randomly on a Saturday and were seated immediately without a reservation. The service was really quick and attentive, they use this cool buzzer pager system to get the waiter to come to you when you are ready. For food we got the cauliflower appetizer, saag paneer and chicken tikka masala. Cauliflower was delicious, loved the sauce and the cauliflower was nicely fried, great texture. The saag was good but they left these large chiles in and almost murdered my girlfriend. She survived to tell the tale, but was definitely an unenjoyable experience to eat. My chicken was also great, but I found the sauce a little too sweet - got tiring by the end. Overall, the vibe is very modern and welcoming, Would definitely come back and maybe try some other dishes.

You can't ask for better Indian food than Imli. It's authemtic and delicious. I had the salmon tandoori, tried my fiend's vegetable pulao and the samosa appetizer. All were excellent.

It can be hard to get good salmon tikka and tandoori at Indian restaurants, but they did a fine job, and unlike some places the pulao had real fresh vegetables, not frozen stuff tossed in. Service was prompt and excellent.

Garlic naan is always good!

But unfortunately, the entrees were just average to me. It wasn't great, it wasn't bad. It is good enough where if the restaurant is on my way home and I'm craving Indian, I wouldn't mind ordering.

The cocktails on the other hand was underwhelming and I would not order again. The wine was served in these tiny little glasses.

Service was overall acceptable.
Updated to add that delivery has resumed and so has my love for Imli!!! Have already ordered a few times! Thank you!

For South Indian, whose family is from Kerala, it's been a joy to find even a few true true foods from there. There are many North Indian foods, so wherever your friends are from, if they want Indian food, they should find a great dish.

Intimate ambiance for a date night because the music isn't loud. We were immediately seated and the servers were attentive through the whole experience. The tandoori chicken was juicy and tender. I've ordered the chicken masala twice and it's good but a hit or miss with the flavor. The first time I ordered it as a to go order and the masala sauce was amazinggg! So good I sat in the car during a hurricane advisory/ flood warning tearing it up with the garlic naan before I pulled off. It was those same flavors that got me to go a second time but this time the sauce was less seasoned and more tomato tasting. I still have hope to try it a third time before giving up on it.

Great food.. ordered samosa chaat, green chutney used in it was fresh.. chole, kadai paneer, chillli naan  and mango martini is what else we tried.. kadai paneer was very flavorful went really well with chili naan,. We didn't ask for spicy food but it was in the spicier side, well done.. will go back again to try their eggplant.. deducting a star because their chef and staff in kitchen were very loudly talking
Food and service was great. Staff was very attentive and polite. There were 3 of us at dinner and we all enjoyed our meal. Will definitely return soon.
Everything is delicious! Portions are reasonable, service is quick. The bar is modern, dining area is bright clean and aesthetically pleasing. Highly recommend.

WOW! Great service. Great food. Great outdoor patio space for parties. Highly recommend this place. Loved the non alcoholic watermelon mojitos. The appetizers were beyond AMAZING! The lamb meatball, the Brussels sprouts, both chicken appetizers, the cauliflower Manchurian, and samosa chaat were all DELICIOUS! My favorite and a must have was the mushroom and cheese naan just so YUMMY! Can't wait to come back and eat it all again!

Just moved to the upper East side from the upper West and this was the first restaurant I tried. We were very happy! We started with the shrimp with pineapple appetizer. A little small but tasty. For the mains my girlfriend got the Gobi dum aloo. She liked it but said it wasn't spicy enough. I ordered the lamb madras. The meat was tender and I asked for it spicy but it also wasn't spicy enough. We asked for a spicy sauce on the side and that fixed the lack of spiciness. My gf also ordered a mango lassis. She liked it. I thought it needed to be colder but I guess that's how it's served. Anyway, Service was good and decor was nice. Overall, a nice dinner!

Always gotta start out by saying the service was top notch! They have a decide at the table, which they explain. Pressing a certain button will call the server to order, ask for water or to even pay your bell. However, we never had to use it! We were the only guests outside, the inside was packed, yet our waiter never forgot about us!
I'd been hankering a nice Indian meal for a while and am now very glad that I held out for this one. The inside looks very nice but their out door space, which seats 4-5 tables is also nice and comfortable. We were also given complimentary papadum chips with mint chutney. Papadum's aren't as common over here as they are in other parts of the world and to see them in an almost tortilla chip form was not something I'd seen! Despite my hesitation they were delicious and that mint chutney had an excellent spicy kick to it! We ordered garlic naan, lamb jalfrezi (comes with enough raita for two) and the Konkani fish curry. That curry blew me away, delicious fish and just loved the type of heat coming from the curry.

Amazing food. Amazing drinks. Amazing Ambience. Amazing presentation too and our server Karan was so so so lovely. This was me and my girlfriend's first time trying authentic India food in nyc and we were NOT disappointed. I was honestly pleasantly surprised why this place doesn't have more hype. The owner even came up to check up on us and served us one of our drinks. All of the four drinks dWe had the bottomless brunch for $45 which was definitely worth it. You need to try this place at least once. I'll be coming back again for sure!!

The food was decent.

Cheese mushroom naan - very good. Simple. Great for kids.

Malai kofta - nicely done koftas. Good and hearty gravy.

Dal tadka - usual. Hard to go wrong there.

Cauliflower Manchurian - could've been better. Don't think they cooked the cauliflower before frying and hence the stalk area was a bit bite-y. But again, the crisp texture was good.

Samosa chat - good, tasty. The crisp samosas held even in the Chaat.

They were short staffed and didn't offer cocktails that night. But the server was nice, communicative and kept us informed.

We got a bottle of red.

We got their private room / area at the back as they had a cancellation. Worked out great with kids in tow.

Pretty average place. We went at 630 on a Friday and we were literally the only people there. The cauliflower manchurian was pretty good. The butter chicken and chicken tikka masala tasted exactly the same and were pretty bland and flavorless. We even asked for spicy but it had absolutely no spice.

Back to Imli for I believe the 4th time in the past month. The food just keeps getting better!

This time around we ordered the aloo gobi, chole and tandoori chicken. All were excellent and cooked to order at the perfect spice level. The gravies were served with white rice and we ordered a paratha to sop up as much of the delicious sauce as possible.

Portions were generous and today I am looking forward to the leftovers for lunch :)

The staff again is incredibly hard working and personable. Rex and Anil are excellent at making you feel at home and catered too. Excellent again!

My family and I were just walking around looking for a restaurant to grab dinner at on a Friday night around 7 PM and we randomly decided to stop into this restaurant. But I'm so glad we did because it turned out to be a great decision.

When we arrived, I saw that there are two parts of the restaurant. As soon as you walk through the door you arrive in the bar and are then taken past that and brought to the dining area on the other side.

As soon as I walked in, I was impressed by the decor. It was clean, modern but also true to its culture. The setting of each table was also lovely.

Service was very professional. Everything was very efficient and well thought out. My only complaint is that the servers all did not have any sort of smiles of their faces which was a bit weird to see in a restaurant. They were polite just not very friendly.

After we sat down they brought over some water and complimentary starters and chutney. Flavors were great and really opened my appetite for the rest of the meal.

Afterwards for an appetizer we ordered the ratlami proha kabab  which was a croquette and was really delicious, a bit dry and heavy in terms of flavor but was a great order.

As for the main course, we got the goa shrimp curry (nice flavor with large, jumbo shrimp) and chicken tikka masala (good flavor). Both dishes were surprisingly filling and really good portions. The complimentary side of rice was also very delicious and just worked so well with the curries. We also ordered the regular naan to go along with our meal which was very fragrant and so yummy.

Finally for dessert we got the gulab jamun creme brûlée. Surprisingly this was the most disappointing dish from our meal. The creme brûlée's flavor was great; however the dough ball soaked in syrup was not very good and just felt like it pulled down the flavor of the rest of the dessert. Also the chocolate drizzle had a strange aftertaste as well and was just not needed.

All in all, even though there was a couple of hiccups during the dinner it was truly a great experience with generally great dishes. I will definitely try to make my way over the next time I am craving Indian food!

This place has great food with generous portions and a very convenient location to both the tram and 2 major subway stations. They give you a call button that you can use to page the waitstaff at any time, and the waitstaff were very attentive. They were also generous with extra orders of rice and informing us about dishes on the menu. The atmosphere was great as we went early and were the only people being served. They also were willing to turn down the music when it was too loud. Would definitely recommend.

While I was very disappointed to hear that they didn't use any "imli" - all the dishes were super tasty. The service was excellent. Cauliflower Manchurian, samosa, chicken appetizer, cauliflower sabzi, dal makhani are the dishes we ordered.
Reliably delicious Indian fare at a reasonable price. One of the neighborhood's muted culinary gems. If you're bold, get the vindaloo.

The short: really, really delicious, clean food in a contemporary setting with great staff.

The longer: we made a reservation on OpenTable and came here on a Monday evening. The space was super quiet, and our waitress was very nice.

We shared a large beer. The menu is a mix of tapas and regular size plates. We started with the tandoori shrimp in a tapas size. Amazing. 3 jumbo shrimps in the order.

Then, we shared the okra masala, chicken tikka, dal & some naan. Rice is complimentary -- which I appreciate -- and they give you refills if you need them. The food was all super fresh, wasn't overly oily or creamy, and was generally just very good. It's nice to have such a high-quality, trendy Indian tapas spot in the neighborhood.

I highly recommend!

This place is SO YUMMY. I loved the saag paneer, the naan is super soft and fluffy, and the samosa chaat was amazing. W also ordered a beef curry (and beef isn't usually used in Indian cuisine) and it was a little tough. I would have expected it to be more tender. The curry flavor was really good but the beef needed work.

Good Indian food. a bit Americanized so you may have to ask them for extra spicy. Close to Memorial Sloan Kettering and major hospitals so very convenient. They offer great discounts for pickup orders which I adore.

We came in on a Wednesday night and had the restaurant to ourselves. Nice ambiance and decorations, perfect for a date night. The food was decent, but not great with flavors that were a bit muted. The service was a bit fumbling and maybe overly attentive, but I suspect our server was new so likely hes still getting the hang of things. Overall the place was fine, but given the abundance of amazing Indian food thats available in this area, I, sadly, wouldn't go back. If you prefer americanized Indian food, then you'd like Imli. If you want authentic, go to curry hill.

If you are over by the hospitals it should be your duty to try Imli. Their lunch special is unbeatable. So much food for such a good price ($13). Its a real bargain. Honestly its the best lunch bargain in NYC.

All of the food was super flavorful. The chicken chaat was quite nice. Ive had the chana chaat before at other restaurants this chicken is just as good. The fried okra and cauliflower tikki are both devine. I have yet to have an appetizer veggie or meat that I didnt love. Head and shoulders above appetizers at most other Indian restaurants.

The plating is very nice as well. The staff is very nice and the restaurant has a nice array of art. I hope Imli is around for a long time. Its a gem. They do traditional flavors is a way most Indian restaurants don't and I appreciate it.

Great Indian in the UES! I got take out from here and everything was delicious as well as large portions! The chicken tikka masala is always my go to. You can't beat this classic dish served with rice and naan. Also got spicy Brussels sprouts which I recommend. I'll definitely be getting Indian from here again and maybe even dining in.

Came in for brunch on Saturday around 12 and it was absolutely empty. A few couples gradually came in but safe to say you will not be waiting a while for a table like other brunch spots.

Menu is intriguing, with some familiar dishes and some with a fusion flair. I tried the egg paratha with Chana and it was pretty good. Other dishes we liked: chicken chaat, scotch egg burger and the pav bhaji. On the other hand, the tandoori pizza did take a while and the fries were thick cut and kind of stale.

Finished off with creme brûlée and cassata, both good. Not an overly heavy brunch,  good service and reasonably priced.

Great little Indian restaurant that served some very delicious entrees. They have a few outdoor dining tables. Very attentive staff.

My wife and I tried their eggplant dish in a peanut sauce- never had anything like this before, and I'm glad I tried it ! Will definitely be reordering this in the near future!

Definitely Support this establishment during these tough times

Great Indian food at Imli!! The chicken tikka masala is to die for and very reasonable portions. Perfect for a date night, group dinners, family dinners, or take-out! I am so happy Lenox Hill has this restaurant!!

We arrived when the restaurant was about to close. It looked clean and we were craving Indian food. The restaurant had just closed but the owner let us in to order takeout. They were kind, and hospitable. They explained every dish and answered any questions we had. We sat down to eat at home and the food was delicious, fresh, and hot. HOWEVER, I found several chunks of Cloves inside the leaves inside the curry. Imli: we love you! But please know that people are dipping their nan in the food and DO NOT want chunks of cloves in their delicious curry!

Ambiance-3
Service-4
Value-3
Food-4
Overall-3.5

Enjoyed our brunch here, the service and food was good. The layout of the restaurant takes away from the atmosphere as you are in a long corridor like setting- the open kitchen is the saving grace.
The food choices are interesting and innovative, eg, chicken chaat and scotch egg burger. But the number of dishes with beef is unusual for an Indian restaurant- and it does not offer substitutions.
The best dishes were pav bhaji, egg paratha and Gulab jamun creme brûlée.
The Tandoori chicken pizza had to be sent back to add extra minutes in oven to crisp up- it was really good after!

I went to dinner with my family tonight and had a fantastic first experience.  The appetizers were amazing! Everyone loved their entree and I loved their lamb biryani.

The service was excellent. As a bonus the portions were so generous that no one could finish their meal! We will definitely be back!

Bold flavors, succulent kebabs, warm buttery naans, Imli is our home away from home when we are craving classic deep flavors of Indian cuisine.

Thoughtful service, intimate ambiance and did I mention they deliver and cater too?

Food is great,, limited but thoughtful, prepared immediately.
Outstanding friendly service!
Continental cafe interior clean and tidy!
Wish this place was near my house.

+3.5 stars
Local spot with a cute interior
Signs that say no laptops from 9-2pms and I didn't see any out.

Would order again
-Bacon, Egg and Cheese ($8): Fine, but nothing special

Would not order again
-Avocado toast ($12.5): Small portion size and this was one you could have made at home.

I can't speak for the coffee although my friend had an iced latte, which she liked.

Great breakfast sandwich vibes! Looking at pics before coming here, I was worried the bread vibe would be too much. But, it turned out to have a perfectly crispy exterior coupled with a very soft and fluffy interior, so the vibe wasn't overwhelming at all. If I had to summarize the ambiance of this spot in one word: vibes.

What kept me from a 5 star review was that I thought the sandwich could do with a ~little~ more egg and the bacon could've been distributed better (easy to fix on your own!). Overall, the food and chill vibes are there on top of the early open hours, so I'd definitely come back

I picked up the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich on ciabatta from here and it was amazing. It was still hot when I got home and the bread was perfect. It would have been nice to have some more eggs and bacon on the sandwich but overall the sandwich was great and I would get it again.

Ines seems to have all your beverage needs (coffee, wine, beer) + brunch/baked goods. While I've only had their coffee, I definitely plan on going back to try their brunch menu cause it smelled so good!
Their latte was very solid! Coffee was strong and had a nice balance of espresso and milk. The barista was super nice. There is a good amount of seating inside. Loved the plants outside as well as the black/white theme with navy blue accents. I feel like I can see myself catching up with friends over brunch or trying to get some work done. Of note, I think they had a sign saying they only allow laptops after 2pm? Didn't confirm but a little sad/worried that I cant work/study in the morning while I sip on their coffee. Either way excited to have discovered this place and looking forward to coming back!

This cafe is so cute, and the food is delightful! The cafe is quite small, so you may need to scope out a seat. I hear they have a no lap top policy to allow more customers to come and go.
My capuchino with oat milk was so good! And I had to get a chocolate almost croissant. The croissant was incredible. I also had the avocado toast with smoked salmon on top. The portion was big! I was very pleased with the freshness and the flavor. Everything we tried here was great! My friend loved her matcha latte. I even had to grab a cold brew to-go after our meal because I was loving this place so much.

This cute coffee shop has very nice staff that work here. It is a cozy vibe inside. There is an outdoor seating area in like a hut.

I usually get the Bacon, Egg and Cheese on a ciabatta. This is very good.

BOMB low key brunch

Woke up hungry and found myself here. Small cafe with cute decor. Got the egg sandwich which was amazing....tons of fluffy egg bacon on a huge soft fresh yet crusty ciabatta. Also got the BLAT which is like BLT with avocado which obviously makes it better. Tons of fresh avocado and juicy bacon. Came with a side of greens. The real star again was the bread - sourdough was legit amazing. So fresh. So soft. The food here is low key amazing in such a humble store. Will def be coming back.

Inès is a charming coffee shop/cafe nestled on a quiet street on the upper east side. I was in the area looking for a spot for breakfast and Inès did not disappoint! The person behind the counter was very friendly and helpful. She recommended the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich and I'm so glad she did! It had scrambled eggs, Gruyère and bacon on ciabatta and it was so good! I also ordered a hot chocolate which was good as well. I tried the avocado toast which was nice, but I preferred the bacon, egg and cheese, personally. I look forward to coming back to try the BLAT sandwich (BLT + avocado).

I've only come here once in the morning, but I can't wait to come back. The salmon tartine had me drooling, and I cannot wait to order another one.

I will point out that the menu says the salmon tartine comes with pesto, and I feel that this is inaccurate. The vibrant green sauce on the tartine seemed to be basil oil, not true pesto. It did not appear to contain pine nuts, garlic, nor any kind of cheese like Parmesan or pecorino like one would expect in pesto. Don't let this deter you though. It's still delicious, and I think the fresh flavor of a simple basil oil was actually better than a true pesto would have been.

My sister got the Brie tartine. To be totally honest, I thought her tartine looked disappointing compared to mine. It was much smaller, and of course simpler, but the size of it alone was what really made me not want it. That's one of those items where I would have wondered why I didn't just make it on my own at home as soon as I received it. It looked like they were liberal with the honey, which was heartening, but I personally would still not want to order that in the future.

My one qualm with this place is that regardless of whether or not you stay, you're going to get a plastic to-go container. I suspect this is because they have very limited space to make food and drinks, so using real plates is just not an option. I wish they would at least opt for a compostable container option if using real plates is not possible.

I also tried one of their hazelnut chocolate filled donuts. I personally preferred to pop this in the microwave for ten seconds before eating it once I got home. It was already delicious and fluffy, but it was ten times better once it was a bit warm and melty on the inside.

Their oat milk latte was solid. I want to say they use Oatly, but don't quote me on that. Im not 100% certain.

Most bang for your buck as far as lunch salads in the area go.
Fresh ingredients and hearty servings. Healthcare discount, which is much appreciated.
Several coffee options, pastries, and nice greenhouse seating.
Wait can be long at times, recommend ordering ahead.

I came here with 7 other friends early on a Saturday. I got a cappuccino and a bacon egg and cheese, it was phenomenal! Eggs on the sandwich were very creamy and nice. The service was also excellent, and was very kind and speedy. The music of the restaurant varied very well. I would come back here again for breakfast in the upper east side!
My favorite coffee shop in the Upper East Side. Coffee is delicious and the inside is adorable.

Top notch coffee shop. There are plenty of shops with great coffee these days, so that's not what makes this place 5 stars. This place gets 5 stars for 2 reasons beyond their coffee. One, their food is quite good. Good breakfast sandwiches and bowls as well as nice lunch options. But most importantly, it's their people. They have the loveliest staff. Shout out to LILY who is a gem of a human and forms real relationships with customers. JOSH is also the bomb! Amazing people and this goes a long way these days!

This cafe fits right in with the neighborhood. It has very cozy, friendly vibes. Staff was friendly and social- asked about my day, how long I've been living in the area and how I was liking living in the UES. Ordered a almond milk latte- very good, no bitterness, almond milk made it sweet and creamy. Ate a chocolate almond croissant on the side- fresh, buttery, flaky, and moist with plenty of chocolate. Will be back.

Sometimes you just need a place where you can sit down enjoy a book, a conversation without being tied down to s laptop or phone and Inés is that place. I usually go for a Vanilla latte and enjoy taking endless pics of the latte art that their baristas are amazing at. I'll definitely be back for an actual meal but so far I've enjoyed starting my mornings here.

I always enjoy coming here for lunch, or an iced coffee or iced tea, when I can get a break from work. I particularly enjoy the Mediterranean bowl, and dining outside in the attractive seating area they have decorated with pretty plants. I do wish they would put the cauliflower rice bowl back on the menu..... I always loved that item!
Service is always excellent , too!

I was in the area and was searching for a breakfast place. I came across this place with great reviews so decided to give it a chance. When considering what to order which was a simple sandwich and small salad I never thought it would be so delicious! I ordered the BLAT ( bacon, lettuce, avocado, tomato) on sourdough bread. Wow! I wish this place was in my neighborhood. The ice coffee is as good too but the food tasted so fresh and good. If your in the area, I would highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch! Also staff is friendly and welcoming. I ordered my food to go.

Amazing cafe!  Great matcha.  We got the breakfast sandwich eggs cheese and bacon, salmon tartine, healthy start, and almond croissant, absolutely delicious!  The eggs are so fresh, fluffy, and tasty.  Best eggs I have had!

Fantastic! Came on a cold winter morning with one of my coworkers.

Cute little cafe with small tables inside and a more extensive table selection outside

Ordered the avocado tartine - one of the best I've had in NYC, the sesame seeds and chili oil really made the flavor!

The brie and honey was...oddly perfect. Not a combination I'm personally very used to, but we couldn't stop eating it!

The matcha was a little bland, but overall not terrible.
Really enjoyed this place and would come back for more!
Lovely staff, great outdoor seating area, and - most importantly - STRONG cold brew. Free WiFi is relatively fast, and the bathroom is clean. Love stopping here on a quick work break!!

Delicious and cute cafe!

Dirty chai was perfectly strong with nice chai flavor, not too milky.  Bacon, egg and cheese was filling and fresh. I love a breakfast cart BEC, but this one was a nice treat too.  Bread was crispy with fluffy eggs, and bacon was thick and flavorful. Great portion!

Service was friendly and fast. Decent amount of outdoor seating.

smoked salmon tartine was really good.
one thing to note, no laptop inside from 7a-5pm.

Great neighborhood coffee shop and cafe! Solid selection of pastries and salad, sandwich, and tartine options. We tried a chocolate almond croissant (yum) and a matcha latte, a perfect balance of matcha and milk and not too sweet.

Love that they have a range of other goods for sale like oatly, Devocion coffee, and bottles of wine and beer!

Came here on a weekday morning for breakfast. They had an outdoor patio set up with heaters (which unfortunately weren't on at that time because its controlled by the restaurant next door). The patio is cute with some green and flowers planted on the side. Got the avocado toast which was delicious and far from your "I could've made this at home." The aioli really added a nice kick! The toast was crunchy. It was so good that we ended up ordering another one. Also got the Brie with honey as suggested by a lot of the reviews. I am still... so... CONFUSED by this concoction. It was such an unexpected but pleasant mix of flavors that I've never experienced before! I would definitely try this again. Hot chocolate was decent but could've been warmer. Matcha was good.

You go inside to order your food and then they bring it out to the patio for you.

I had heard that Ines had one of the best BEC Sandwiches in the UES, and they were not mistaken! I wouldn't think to get a BEC not on a bagel, but I have to say-this was even better!! The delicious combo of ingredients paired with this nice crunchy bread, were a perfect duo! The employees were so nice too! I placed an order to pickup; and when I got there-it wasn't ready yet. So they gave me a free coffee of my choice. This was super generous and accommodating, especially since I didn't care that I had to wait a few minutes. Would definitely recommend and would definitely come back!

I love this place. Best egg sandwich in the neighborhood.

Service is great, they could get a little overwhelmed at times but they work so hard to give you a good service that waiting a few extra minutes is not a big deal.

Swung by quickly this AM to grab a matcha latte and was impressed to see how wonderfully everyone was social distancing outside for outdoor dining. The server also immediately wiped down the table with sanitizing spray after a group of diners left. I think if everyone took the precautions they take here at Inès, we'd be in much better shape.

My matcha latte with oat milk (to go) was good, and service was fast and friendly. I was offered hand sanitizer right after paying for an extra level of safety.

I'd come back here to try some of the brekkie/lunch options which all look reasonably priced as well.

I come here when I feel like splurging on brunch instead of making my own at home haha and the prices aren't even that bad for the ues. The americano ($4) and cappuccino ($4.50) are on point and the bacon egg and cheese sandwich ($7) is fancy-- swiss cheese, fluffy eggs, baguette or sourdough.  This is a great spot to drop in for a quick break that is reminiscent of brunch because you order inside at the cashier like the old days and there are lots of tables outside (during covid) so you can sit down and chill while enjoying your meal. When I went on Saturday a little after noon, there were a few people on their computers, but mostly people just chatting in small groups.

Have been here a handful of times. I think it's best for takeout. Food quality is solid, much better than most other coffee places, and the types of food sold (salads and sandwiches) are perfect for takeout. Also, the space is small, so it's less inviting for a sit down thing. If the space were bigger, I'd come all the time - it would be the perfect study spot given the good coffee and food.
The shop is fairly small. Hard to find a seat inside. The coffee was good, not great. I would come back again, however.

My husband and I, took our son to this place today on our visit. I picked it out from the great reviews on Yelp. We ordered the beet salad with grilled chicken, the healthy start bowl and a tuna sandwich. My husband and my son also had the coffee. We sat outside, in their lovely setup. The young man who took our order, also served us and cleaned up. Wonderful disposition. So nice to have service with a smile. So I saved the best for last, the food. We all loved it. It was fresh and plentiful. The coffee, though sounding interesting, missed the mark. No biggie. My son can't wait to return with his girlfriend. We'll be back the next time we are visiting the area.

I really loved this place the first time I went (got a delicious brie and honey tartine), but the second time was a huge disappointment. I arrived around 7:20 AM after working a night shift, hoping for a delicious breakfast. First of all, the cashier told me that I couldn't order a tartine because the chef hadn't arrived yet - they were hoping he would show up in about 15 minutes. I didn't want to wait, so I opted to get some of their baked goods instead, mistakenly thinking that they would be freshly baked. The chocolate/almond croissant had a nice flavor but was so dry, it had probably been sitting behind the counter for days. The cheddar-thyme scone was even worse - so hard, it was almost inedible. Maybe I'd come back sometime if I could figure out what day of the week they have their baked goods delivered.

We stayed at an Airbnb nearby and she recommended this as a great place for breakfast/lunch spot. We decided to try it based on her recommendation and Yelp reviews - we were NOT disappointed!!
Customer service was really exceptional - kindness for your customers goes a long way and the two guys behind the counter were wonderful.
The food? Simple but done perfectly- I had the honey Brie toast the first day which was decadent and based on my experience I returned the next day for the chicken sandwich - really happy with this UES local gem.

This cafe is fantastic, we came to enjoy some coffee and watch it snow. It has delivered well on both things. Big windows, great view and a good amount of seating. Everyone working here is incredibly friendly and we keep coming up with more to order because we don't want to leave.

This led us to the Kouign-amann. Oh holy hades- do yourself a favor and get this pastry which I will very unprofessionally describe as a croissant, shaped like a muffin with a dollop of chocolate and candied orange peel on top. The bottom is just slightly crispy and gooey and the inside is light as air.

Fantastic place. Big fan.
Great coffees. Great food (croque madam is amazing). And they forbid people to work / use laptops etc. PRAISE!

We went for brunch around 10-11 am on Saturday. Place was pretty full. I thought menu was pretty good with lots of healthy options. I ordered Nordic Bowl which had only tiny piece of salmon, lettuce, onion and tomatoes.. $15. Regular packet tea was $4. The bowl tasted so plain and I was starving after eating it. Not sure why is it so expensive when it had nothing inside. I definitely would not order that bowl again. I honestly though bowl means they put something inside, like rice or barley. But it was the saddest brunch I ate in a while. The bathroom was the only place I enjoyed, it was very clean and smelled good.

Lovely coffee shop offering a good selection of pastries, bowls, and a strong coffee. We usually come for breakfast on Sundays, and not every time we can find a spot to stay. This hidden gem has vegetarian options and the delicious standard selection of tartine, such as avocado toast.

Cute little cafe Ines sprouted out of nowhere, but I am glad it did. This neighborhood could use more (better) coffee spots with good food, and Ines is an answer for both. If you happen to spot Ines along the way, definitely drop by for a cup of joe and one of their sandwiches. It just might be a tad pricier than other spots.

The coffee is pretty good here. The flavors are nice, and thankfully, I haven't encountered a bitter flavor. The temperature is on the warm side, which could be an annoyance to some. I don't mind it though because I'm not waiting for my coffee to cool down. The chai is also good if you want an alternate, but they have other options. I am going to assume their beverages are all served on the more warm side though for a reason. I was pleasantly surprised by the sandwiches here. For breakfast, I have so far tried the Bacon, Egg, and Cheese sandwich, the Salmon Club, and the Croque Madame (their Monsieur with an egg on top). The BEC comes with scrambled eggs, bacon, and swiss on a hero. They actually modified my sandwich a bit by using American cheese and adding some arugula. I was perfectly okay with this though. This sandwich was great. I really liked the scrambled eggs on this. There was a bit of an herbal flavor, maybe rosemary, coming through. The bread was perfectly toasted and easy to bite into. The Croque Madame is slightly more heavy with black forest ham, bechamel, mustard, and swiss cheese. I was less into this sandwich, but I liked the kick of mustard in this. I highly recommend asking for the Monsieur with an egg on top (for an extra fee). The Salmon Club is very tasty and light. It comes with smoked salmon, capers, crème fraiche, arugula and cucumbers.

I've really enjoyed the sandwiches here so far. My only issue is that it's a bit expensive, as expected of the upper east, so I can't say I will go too often. Though I can highly recommend this place to anyone in this neighborhood who wants a good coffee, sandwich, or pastry. Another note, their doughnuts are from Dough. I'm not particularly fond of Dough's doughnuts, but if they are your favorite, they do carry them.

Love this place! The coffee is always amazing and the bacon egg sandwich is DELICIOUS. It's always served piping hot with warm soft bread.

I have also stopped by the restaurant during covid19 times and the service was quick and friendly. You can call your order ahead or just swing by.

I travel to Manhattan on Sundays for my daughter's volleyball practice (for which I have a 3 hour wait). I stopped into this cafe for a cup of coffee and some breakfast while answering a few emails.  It was empty with 2 people having breakfast in a corner, I thought this is perfect.  I ordered my coffee and some food and sat down (in an empty seating area on the other corner of the cafe).  As I started drinking my coffee n eating the food, I took my laptop out to begin answering my emails.  The owner comes over to me and says, "there's a no laptop policy".  I laughed and asked are you joking, he said "no".  He proceeded to explain that "the seating is for dine in customers only".  To which I said, I'm a dine in customer, I just need to answer my emails, I won't be using your WiFi I have my own.  His response was, there's no laptop allowed in here, other customers need the seating.  I proceeded to look around because there was still no other customer sitting in other than the two ladies that was there when I walked in and myself. The entire cafe was still empty with plenty of seating.   I said ok because I realized in that moment he was being an asshole, but he proceeded to stand over me until I closed my laptop and put it back in my bag. I didn't even finish my coffee, I left.

If your looking for a cafe that's welcoming, cozy with good customer service, DO NOT go to this place.  This is the absolute worst service I have ever had in NYC.  To be honest if I could give it zero (0) star, I would.

I spent my Saturday morning at Inès today. I was really hungry and wanted something substantial so I ordered the Croque Madame. It was perfectly cooked and full of melty cheesy goodness. My friend got the healthy start bowl which was pretty good too. The portions are great and the prices are reasonable considering the high quality of ingredients.

The coffee, though, is the real superstar at Inès. The owner explained to me that the coffee beans are picked fresh in Colombia, roasted in Brooklyn, and brewed at Inès, all in a matter of two weeks. The coffee is rich and flavorful, none of that bitter over-roasted nonsense you get at Starbucks.

Highly recommend. Great place to read or catch up with friends.

This place is such a cozy cool spot - it's very European, which takes me back home and makes me feel nice and warm inside.

It's pretty small but I love the interior and the high tables by the windows.

The day I went was a rainy gloomy day and I felt a bit as if I were back in Paris, sipping a cappuccino and eating my chocolate croissant.

My husband got a cappuccino and a BEC on a mini baguette (or European style hero) and it wasn't bad either - a bit on the dry side, but not bad all in all.

The chocolate croissant was really good, flaky, chocolate, and fresh. Cappuccinos were good too. For all this the total was around 20$ - which is not bad but a bit on the expensive side for a breakfast.

I definitely will be back to try their croque madame (or was it just the croque monsieur?) and maybe some of their other dishes. Oh, they also have Dough Donuts, which is never a bad thing.

One suggestion - be careful with the temperature inside because last time I went it was steaming hot and I wish I was wearing a short sleeve shirt!
