I'm sure it was just bad luck for me that day but it was way too warm inside (other customers were taking their calls outside to get fresh air), which was a bummer cause I would have definitely stayed longer !

I'll still recommend you to go cause the place is really nice and has good options, and if you wanna feel like you're in Europe for a few bucks can it's definitely the place to go!

This place was chosen by good Yelp reviews for my breakfast at NYC. I have asked whether they make eggs, and the told me yes. Finally I've got a cold salad full of vegetables with a single almost raw egg on top. And I paid over $20! Stepping out with upset stomach.
If you are into salads its probably okay, otherwise look for something else.

After leaving a 18% tip I was asked to clean my table at leaving. Seriously!??
Great coffee and loved the smoked salmon avocado toast! Will absolutely be coming back, great spot.
Danielle great help and server she should be the manger if she is not already . Breakfast bowl delicious . I highly recommended this place .

Came here for coffee after brunch with a friend. She'd been here to study before and loved their cold brew. We ordered cold brews and got donuts to share as well (Dough donuts!! So good.). The cold brew is good, strong, and with a splash of cream it was just delicious. The donuts were good as per Dough's usual, and I really appreciated that the restaurant look, the ambiance, and the friendly staff behind the counter. People seemed to come here to pick up their take out orders for food too, which was interesting of a coffee shop to offer. Not sure I'd study here, but Cafe Ines is for sure a place to get a coffee with friends on a leisurely weekend afternoon.

This place absolutely stole my heart. The vibe, the music, the food, and most of all that coffee! The service is so hospitable, I could sit there all day just like it was home. We were only visiting for a week, but we had to go back twice! Other coffee shops could not compare for just a simple cup.

Another bonus is the bread on their sandwiches. I don't know where it's from, but it is positively ethereal. The perfect amount of soft and crunch. Every other dish from other customers looked positively divine as well.

If you want a place to soothe your soul with delicious food and coffee, don't go anywhere else.

Good place for coffee and pastry / donuts from Dough downtown.
I had the healthy breakfast bowl, which seemed like a salad with scrambled egg on it, but worked surprisingly well and I'd have it again.
My youngest ordered a bowl which had fruit and chocolate with oats and chocolate milk, he didn't really like it because of the coconut, so I ended up eating most of it for him, apples, blueberries, strawberries etc over some past soaked in semi chocolate milk- slightly strange but worked ok.
Nice spot if you are nearby, although they don't have a ton of tables, but do have quite a few high seats if you are just sitting for coffee and snacks.

This place is great. The BL(A)T is amazing with extra crispy bacon. Placed a pickup order and it was ready upon arrival. They took extra care to pour my coffee when I arrived so it was nice and hot to go!

I have to say being Italian, there's no other place like isle of Capri. We had an amazing server. He was very kind and the food was immaculate. There's nothing bad I can say about this place. Juan
And the whole staff were just amazing and accommodate us with some limoncello shots that were home made. It really feels like I'm back in my Nonna's basement eating her home-cooked meals. Everything was amazing and perfect. Thank you for a great night

First off, the service and staff here are A1. I don't even say that lightly. We had a party that had people coming from all over the city and half were late and they were so accommodating. The breadbasket was fresh with crazy variety. There was even this bread with tomatoes (like a pico) sorry I don't eat Italian often so this all is new to me. After meal they even threw us shots of limoncello. I'd invite the staff to my wedding that's how dope they were.

The setting and ambiance is cozy and not too loud. Temperature was perfecto. Great for big parties and dates.

Food? Okay, we ordered a bunch of stuff and ate family style. Not one dish underperformed or anyone brought up any comments. Oh did I mention a man comes around with grated parm... and they give you heaping spoons of it. I wanted to cry right then and there. Happy tears.

I had the linguine frutti di mare. I inhaled it.

We stuffed ourselves there and had the best time there turned out we were there 3 hrs. What a dinner it was ‍

Plenty of parking in the area. Please go eat there and let me know if I'm right. Cuz I'm always right.

Always passed by this restaurant and always saw people inside so I decided, why not?

First off, they put me and my friend at the smallest table alive. There were other parties of two and they were placed at the bigger tables. We were the only ones at the table that was made for children. Mind you, I'm not overweight in any sense. It felt almost discriminative, as if they saw we were young and wanted to save the bigger window tables for the older couples who "appeared" wealthier.

Secondly,
It took over 10 minutes to receive our waters.
We were being asked for our order prior to receiving out waters? My friend didn't even have a napkin placed at her side of the table upon being seated.

Next, food took extremely long to come out. I would be okay with this is the food was great, but it definitely wasn't.
We ordered:
-calamari: 3/5, red sauce was good but the calamari a bit under seasoned
-caprese:2/5, mozzarella didn't taste fresh; I've had better
- spaghetti with meatballs:2/5, meatballs tasted good  and good consistency but the spaghetti was HARD. It had an almost chewy consistency

We didn't order dessert or another entree because our experience was already terrible. The manager came by after our meal and provided us with complimentary shots and biscotti. While it was a nice gesture, it was a little too late by that point to recover from the horrible experience we had during the meal and upon entry.

I will definitely NOT be returning. If you're looking for good Italian food don't come here... much better places in the UES.

A wonderful surprise! My s/o and I strolled in for an early dinner and wow I was so pleasantly surprised! When you first walk in it's very old world environment and you feel like you have stepped out of NYC. The service is fantastic as the staff are very attentive.

The food was also absolutely delicious. I got a chicken Francese and my s/o got the chicken Marsala. Both dishes were so tasty. I love how the chicken was just the right thickness as well. Overall - great gem of a place and definitely coming back
The food is incredible. The service is perfect. The ambience is the best. I want to give this place a 100/10. It's delicious and a neighborhood favorite for a reason.

I'm dined here twice and I absolutely love it. From the decor to the service to the food, I simply have such a good time here.

I came in today without a reservation and was seated immediately. The service was really impeccable as the waiter saw me take photos and offered to take photos for us. They gave us complementary bruschetta and complementary dessert. I had the pasta and it was just so warm and delicious and flavorful. I love how the herbs Hit you.

I also enjoyed people watching from the window seat. I would come back again for a nice and fancy Italian dinner. Recommended.

Juan Pablo was our server once again as we come to this establishment for lunch while being on the upper East side.

We usually start with a plate of cheese, olives and bread  to start. You have to order the eggplant parmigiana for an appetizer too. It just melts in your mouth! We also ordered linguine with seafood. It was also very good.

I'll be back to this quant Italian spot real soon!

It's the kind of place that becomes our place with someone special. A bottle of white, a bottle of red.
We'll get a table by the street in our old familiar place.

Met a colleague for a midweek dinner. Crowded at 6 pm. Walked in. Greeted by a tuxedo clad host and sat at a table near window.  Listed to the specials and reviewed the large menu selection. My colleague has all her meetings at this restaurant and orders the caesar salad and spaghetti bolognese every time. I shared the caesar salad and couldn't decide between some veal specials they had offered, eggplant parm or chicken parm. However, I went with the waiter's suggestion... fusilli porcini. OMG GREAT CHOICE.

I highly recommend this restaurant. Location is upper east side, old school, great options and clearly consistent with a good following (acc to my colleague who recommended it).

We had dinner at Isle of Capri for the first time moving from the neighborhood to the burbs.   We are happy to report that it's as good as ever !! Great old school Italian food and professional service.

Great little Italian place recommended to me by a local I met on my flight to NYC. Great service and delicious food. It does smell a little old and musty inside, but it just shows how long it's been around for... the real deal in NYC!

Isle of Capri is a Homie gem on the border of mid town on the upper East side. My group of three stumbled in for an early dinner around 6 PM on a weekday and there was no wait for a table. The ambience is slightly fancy with the waiters wearing suits, but you can also get away with casualwear.

The staff was incredibly friendly, and brought us water and bread and breadsticks to start along with complimentary bruschetta. The menu is quite large and has everything from starters to homemade pasta to meat and fish plates. I opted for the homemade pasta, and was happy with the soft texture and portion of the plate.

All around a good meal was excellent service!

Have not been here frequently.  Met a friend for lunch about a month ago. The food is ok, nothing outstanding, but it's an affordable restaurant in a very expensive neighborhood, so It's worth a try if you're in the vicinity.  

Wait staff is amiable and service is professional.

This isn't one of our favoriteItalian restaurants, because IT IS OUR only one FAVORITE. . Every single dish is simply delicious, the portions are generous too. Today I had a pasta e Fagioli soup, my husband had the veal Parmesan, nothing left to go. We also had some experience today, our guests from Ecuador were late two hours , they had to move us from a nice table for 5, to another nice table for 5 in the back of the restaurant. Our waiter Andres was wonderful, the hostess Donna was so kind and caring, for the five plus hours we were there, that I want to adopt her. The ambiance of the restaurant is a mix between romantic and "Belle Epoque", I know! Its supposed to be Italian, well when you eat here, you know someone in the kitchen had the Bible of the Italian Nonna's recipes.

Loved this experience. Everything we had was exceptional and downright delicious. Our server was incredible and picked my entree for me. Pictured here! Exactly what I wanted and reminiscent of being in Italy. If I'd change anything it would be the very average bread. This caliber restaurant needs a dynamic bread to match everything else. Just amazing. Grateful to have gone there on our short NYC stay!

The ambiance is very pretty and fancy! We had dinner in the basement because I was in a big group so it was a fixed menu. The appetizers were caprese, Mellon and prosciutto, and shrimp cocktail which were all really good! We got bread and breadsticks with our meal too. The waiters were fast and consistently refilled our water but they could have been friendlier. I got the rigatoni vodka which was a little too Al dente and the sauce was not thick enough but the flavors were all really good!

DO NOT EVER DINE HERE AT ALL COST!!!!!!!
My husband who is a cancer doctor and understands healthy eating habits and myself and my son have been coming here for many Fridays this year. . We enjoyed seeing Armando who is a kind waiter that often seems scared of his owner.  The owner is a witch who makes you feel AWFUL when dining at this neighborhood establishment.
We have tried to over look her atrocious attitude .

This time we waited over an HOUR for a table and food. I am health conscious and wanted my food prepared with out TONS of GARLIC and GREASE. The waiter was unfriendly and didn't write anything down . He gave me my shrimp dish which was FILLED with OILS AND GARLIC.
He was unapologetic and said I had to wait for a new shrimp and veggie dish. I told him to cancel the dish as I cannot wait for hours.  They are GROSS and INHOSPITABLE... please go to Primola or  Campagnola or il mulino.  DO NOT COME HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO GET SICK!!!!!

This restaurant easily perfects everything you need. It has a amazing scenery inside with its roses and various plants, creating a beautiful atmosphere to really set the mood. It also has amazing and friendly service, who constantly make sure to accommodate you and let you know to ask for anything. Their Lasagna La Fordo is truly a amazing dish... the first bites were amazing and so was the rest of the dish. The meatball appetizers were also extremely delicious. Love this place a whole lot, hopefully will get a chance to come here again soon.
Delicious! Great food. Great service. Great ambiance. They treat you so nicely there. I need to get there again!

Very intrigued by the Italian decorations and the variety in the menu so we went inside. Greeted by amazing service. Everyone was very nice and kind, made me feel very welcomed, like part of the family.

All three of us ordered the Gnocchi Bolognese and it was amazing! The handmade gnocchi had a perfect texture with very robust flavor that was complimented very well by the tasty meat sauce. The actual meat of the sauce was more than sufficient and gave the dish a tomato tanginess that elevated the flavor from potato to sauce to meat.

Finally, the tiramisu was the very best tiramisu I have ever tried. The different creams tasted extremely fresh as they were homemade in house. The coffee was high quality and finished off the rest of the cake and lady fingers exquisitely.

All in all, there is nothing I would have changed about the experience and I highly recommend this restaurant if you are looking for good high quality Italian food in NYC.

FYI the prices were very good for size of the plates and fairly economical in comparison with the other restaurants in the area.

Best Italian in NYC hands down. Classic feel, family owned, never a bad meal here. Owner's are amazing, nice, and super accommodating! 10/10 recommend to anyone looking for a true Italian meal in Manhattan.

Horrible rude service for our large party and they kept telling us oh sorry we have a large party in the other room! They shouldn't have taken our reservation for a large party if they couldn't handle all the groups. Couldn't even get one waiter to serve us drinks and then one came and tried to keep pushing bottles of wine. Too bad, we were expecting at least a nice family experience.

Visiting NYC from WV. My wife and I wanted to meet a friend for lunch. Her pick, our treat, was Isle of Capri.  She had never eaten there before. She and I had salads and minestrone soup, delicious. My wife got a seafood special with shrimp, calamari, squid, and clams in red sauce over pasta (which she shared). Also delicious. A bottle of Chardonnay topped off with some biscotti and lemon cello for dessert. It was fantastic. Great atmosphere, wonderful service, reasonable price. Good old school Italian. I highly recommend it!
One of the absolute best! Never disappointed, only always delighted! Ambiance is charming and the staff wonderful! Can't wait for our next visit!

Such a cute restaurant. Great people, delicious food.

We dropped our sick animal off at the vet and definitely needed some comfort. This place delivered x1000. We sat in a little room deemed the "Dick Ebersol" room. It was private and the windows were able to open and close. The servers were all extremely attentive and helpful. They allowed us ample time to take photos and mull over the menu.

They gave us a bread basket and then we ordered the linguine alla carbonara, the spaghetti con polpette (spaghetti with mama Maria's famous meatballs), and linguine alle vongole (linguene with red clam sauce).

The carbonara was so creamy and extremely flavorful. Usually I have a tough time with ordering carbonara because it's usually too greasy and doesn't taste like much. This was not the case here. Again, so flavorful and yummy. Will definitely order again.

The spaghetti with mamas famous meatballs life true to their name. The meatballs were perfectly meaty and dense. The spaghetti was a delicious al dente with sauce that also screamed homemade with love.

The pasta with clam sauce was very saucy and packed with clams. The linguine was perfectly al dente too.

All portions were huge- enough for dinner the next night and everything was so worth it. At the end we were given Italian cookies. Sooo yummy.

Can't wait to come back for the incredible service and even better food.

Saying that it's the most  wonderful, delicious, best, would be an understatement. From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere, the staff, the owner, we felt like we were part of the family .the food is beyond excellent . Feels like Italy. Highly recommend as one of the best Italian restaurants on the east side .

This has always been a very good restaurant for me with one of the best waiters (he is from Venezuela). Very good Italian food. Nice but not extensive wine list. Reasonable prices (for Manhattan).
Always friendly from the owner to staff.

This review is for takeout.

We tried Isle of Capri for the first time tonight. They were friendly and efficient when taking our order for pickup over the phone. Customer service was very good, including when I arrived--they were very organized.

They also included bread, butter, and a little bag of cookies and biscotti at no charge. This was a nice touch.

My penne vodka was delicious and very fair for the price. It was a good value for dinner on the UES/Midtown East, especially during COVID when many restaurants are having to raise prices just to hang on.

My husband's linguine alla vongole was made with canned clams instead of fresh, though, which was disappointing. We will try them again in the future, but just not order the clams.

We decided to stop into this spot a few blocks from Roosevelt Island Tramway. The menu was limited but we decided to still stay. We ordered a Salmon with salad and Calamari for a appetizer. Both were tasty.

Would have rated this location higher but was surprised to see that they changed a additional 10% COVID fee. Especially with such a little menu.
Unbelievable meal and great service. Very old school ambiance. Will be returning soon.

This is a regular stop for us every time we are in the area.  We made reservations ahead of time as always, which I highly recommend,

Unfortunately when we arrived, they were going to seat us at table located in one of the busiest parts of the restaurant, after some consideration they eventually sat us at the same table we always sit at which is much more intimate and quiet.

We were fortunate enough to have Armando as our server, he is absolutely wonderful and literally takes care of everything.  Of course we started with a bottle of 2004 Vigna dogarina, the fresh bruschetta, accompanied by a plate of fresh olives and parmesan cheese.  The freshly baked bread is typically brought to the table as well, I prefer it eaten with dinner.  

I have had the lasagna before, it is absolutely phenomenal and I just had to have it again, so that is what I ordered.  The entrees were brought out as if they were right out of the oven, hot and fresh, so I prefer to let it sit while I attend to the wine bottle.  The lasagna definitely did not disappoint, all fresh ingredients with a wonderful sauce, I was exceptionally pleased as always.  

Unfortunately we did not have much time for dessert so we enjoyed a limoncello and a nice selection of Italian cookies prior to leaving for the show.  
Armando was a wonderful host, Isle of Capri does not disappoint!
Cheers!

Have been wanting to dine here for years and finally took the plunge last night. I know all about its vaunted history: opened in 1955, was a favorite of Montgomery Clift's (who dined there with Marilyn Monroe), and was frequented by the writer Tom Wolfe.

We were greeted very warmly by the staff and we sat next to the window nook where Wolfe's favorite table was, and had a prime view of the beautiful raspberry-sherbert-colored dining room that is a riot of Italian haute kitsch. Our gregarious waiter was delightfully informal as he told us the specials and, to punctuate his recommendation of that evening's salad, ferried a basket of ginormous ripe tomatoes over to our table.

We ordered the divine polpette appetizer--meatballs in red sauce that were out of this world--and the clams oreganata. Soft shell crabs sauteéd in white wine, butter and lemon was one of the specials and I ordered that. Delicious! My friend sliced off a big piece of her pollo Milanese for me and it was thin, crispy and perfect. (Served traditionally with salad on top.) We also had the excellent asparagus smothered in melted parmesan.

We arrived a little before 6:30 and by 7:30 the restaurant was a buzzing beehive of conviviality and birthday celebrations. As guests drifted in, they were welcomed by Donna D'Agostino, whose grandparents own the Isle of Capri. The evening took on the air of lively party in a private Italian villa.

As I am scoping out a locale for my birthday dinner in January, we asked our charming waiter about the downstairs, a chamber known as "The Grotto." It was closed but he kindly unlocked the gate so we could survey the space that seems suitable for larger parties. It's furnished with a small bar and statues of David seemed to peek out from every nook and cranny. Perfect.

(After dinner, my dining companion and I strolled down 61st Street and visited the townhouse where Montgomery Clift lived.)
Food, drink, service and atmosphere were fantastic! Great for date night or an event. Staff was attentive! Everything you want in a dining experience ! I will be back!

Their place has wonderful Italian food, it's our local neighborhood spot as we live up the block, the food is always on point. The always have specials but it's the same every week which is funny. But when they do have the chilean sea bass order it!

The service is always great, usually about 2-3 waiters at your table always checking on you. It's family owned for years so you get to see the history in the food and the building itself, lots of signed menus from Kennedys and Roosevelts.

They are closed on Sundays so don't stop by then i sometimes forget and usually smack myself in the head. But it's a great local Italian restaurant that's been open for years and i mens like when subways where above ground in the area years. A Definite try!
The best Italian food ever!!!! Amazing & delightful atmosphere with the kindest staff.

Decided to stop in for lunch with a few co-workers staff was pretty friendly and nice the food was terribly over priced and horrible. I orders for appetizers meatballs and I asked waiter if I could have a little Ricotta cheese with it , I was charged $18 for 5 super tiny frozen meatballs in nasty sauce and charged another $6 for the off name brand ricotta cheese.. my co-workers had supposedly lunch special and they said the food was very very bland and horrible with a price that exceeded $170 just for lunch ... never never never again will I go back

updated review: this is one of those places that just gets better and better. I continuously become more conscientious about where I spend my money and I never ever regret spending money here. The service and food is unrivaled. Some of the best Italian food I've had in the country. Delicious.

Food is nothing special, though the pasta is perfectly cooked. But the atmosphere is wonderfully romantic and the staff is very friendly. Every table is charming in its own way - especially the nook right by the window, definitely try to snag that one
Delicious food and great service.  I've been going there for years and I have never had a bad meal.Their homemade pasta is always great as is their eggplant parm. Yumm

This is one of those really special must visit restaurants in New York City. Located at 61st and 3rd Ave and  a few blocks from the big Bloomingdales, the location is great as well.

We made reservations for 8:00pm on Saturday night for two people. We arrived a little early and were accommodated in a busy restaurant. Apparently on the weekends, they offer seating in their "grotto" (basement level). The grotto is an awesome place to sit with a really nice ambiance. We were seated at a secluded table in the corner.

Our waiter was very nice and the service was really great.  Once we picked our meals, Vitello Piccata and Chicken Piccata, our waiter gave us a special
wine recommendation after we requested a white wine. The Sauvignon Blanc Domaine Fouassier Sancerre was served cold and left on the table for us. The price was also with minimal markup!  We loved it.

For an appetizer we ordered the Clams Oreganata ($11.50).  There were only six small clams but we thought the flavor was really good and not overbearing.

Our main courses were Chicken Piccata ($23.50) and Veal Piccata ($25.00). They were both served with a separate plate of sides consisting of green beans and potatoes. Everything was really really great, cooked perfectly with amazing flavor.

After dinner we had to order dessert. We settled on tiramisu which was unbelievable and cappuccinos.

They also served us complimentary cookies and glasses of limoncello--all on the house.

While I will say that I loved the whole meal and can't wait to return, I wish the bread at the beginning was served hot and the butter wasn't served cold.

I will certainly be back to try some of their other offerings!

Lovely family owned place! Cozy and delicious! The service is attentive, fast and friendly. The food is delicious, we order a cheese and olives as an appetizer and as simple it can the cheese was phenomenal! As entrees we had the lasagna, fresh and tasty and penne a la vodka, which it was delicious as well. For dessert, we order the tiramisu and OMG ... first is huge and second is soft and delicious!

This is my new favorite place in my neighborhood and I honestly think supporting local business is the best way to go this days! Go and check out the lovely Isle of Capri

All is right in the world! So happy to be back dining at old timey Italian spot Isle of Capri. This place is the definition of neighborhood with excellent service and decent food. Certain dishes weren't up to their usual standards - the $45 Branzino was a big disappointment. Looking forward to going back to being a regular!

Excellent family owned restaurant. I've. eaten there many times and never been disappointed. My favorite starters are caprese salad and minestrone. soup.  The soup is entirely vegetables not pasta ( that another one of their soups); the stragetelli ala romano. soup just as good. The striped bass and red snapper were delicious, well prepared and large portions. They have great veal and chicken dishes. The tiramasu. is unusually better than most. At times they serve limoncello after dinner on the house.
The prices are  reasonable.

Old school
Family Italian restaurant. We think best one on our area. Lots of fun and good food and drinks

We had a great dinner outdoors at the Isle of Capri.  The staff were charming.  One of the owners paid us a visit.  The tables were well spaced and felt safe.  Lots of comps- cheese and olives, bread, cookies and limoncello at the end of the meal.  We brought our own wine and the corkage fee was reasonable.  The salad was excellent. My buddy and I split an order of a pasta special- linguine in red sauce with shrimp and lobster that was cooked perfectly.   The entrees ranged from OK to very good.  The branzino was pretty good.  The chicken Milanese was OK.  The veal Parmesan was very good.  The prices were very reasonable.  It was a nice evening.  I would go back and try some different entrees.

Food was delicious,
Recommend the shrimp scampi & the branzino
atmosphere very intimate tight space but comfortable. Service is great very attentive,  checking constantly.
I have visited several times over the past year or so.  Consistently great service.  The food is delicious and many choices.  We have enjoyed everything we have tried.  Highly recommend.

In February - weeks before the restaurants and bars began to close in New York City due to the pandemic - an Asian friend and her parents were denied service at Isle of Capri. My friend is a mild-mannered, polite woman in her 30's, who is modest/neat in appearance. She works in finance in the city, makes a good living, and lives close to the restaurant, on the Upper East Side. She is Chinese-American. She and her parents went to the restaurant when it was more or less empty, and asked for a table. The maitre'd asked them if they had a reservation, to which they said no. The maitre'd then looked up and down at her and her family, then went to the hostess and whispered something. The hostess nodded but wouldn't look at or address my friend or her family. The maitre'd also refused to address them further.

My friend's father said to my friend that they should just leave, but my friend said no, because she could not fully process what was happening. So my friend and her mother and father stood there, waiting. None of them were sick, coughing, or acting inappropriately whatsoever. They continued to not be addressed. A Caucasian couple then came into the restaurant after them and asked for a table - this white couple also did not have a reservation - and they were seated immediately by the maitre'd. At this point, my friend realized what was happening. She and her family were being denied service at Isle of Capri.

To deny anyone service at a restaurant in this day and age is despicable. But to do it to any person of color is unforgivable. In a time like this, we cannot tolerate racism or discrimination in any way shape or form, and we must stand up to those who exhibit such unfathomable behavior.

I wanted to write this review for my  Chinese American friend  whom was denied service by this restaurant. It happened during the pandemic outbreak. They weren't sick or coughing, and the restaurant was empty. The restaurant seated a white couple that came in after them, and ignored my friend and her family . They wouldn't attend my friend.  That is so absurd ! Racism is so disgusting and there is no place for it in New York City. Shame on you ! Diseases can happen anywhere in this world and one ethnicity shouldn't be stigmatized for that . We don't purposely cause it to happen. I don't blame anyone for other diseases that happened in this world .

I told all my friends not to come here and we all have agreed not to give your restaurant any of our business.

I would have given you less than one star if there is an option here. Your restaurant doesn't deserve any merit at all  !

Restaurants like this are the reason why my Italian Stallion husband doesn't like to go out for Italian food!

We have been wanting to try Isle of Capri for a while. On many trips to Bloomingdales, we have walked past this restaurant and admired its kitschy Italian decor. When we checked the Yelp reviews, they were very positivie. We tried to walk-in one night before a show but was told there was a 90 minute wait. That definitely piqued our interest.

Yesterday afternoon we made a same day reservation for dinner. The heavy Italian accented maitre de was friendly but when he kept mispronouncing my very Italian last name (named after a region of Italy) that should have been a hint.

We arrived on time for our reservation and was shown to our table pretty quickly. In the entry way, they had a half wheel of parmigiano cheese that the waiters would frequently dig fresh pieces out for appetizers - pretty good start!

After we were seated, we were given our menus and the bread basket which was disappointing. It consisted of semi-toasted Italian bread and a packet of thin breadsticks.

We also couldn't help but noticed that most of the people there were regulars and members of the UES blue haired set. That being said, there are several other establishments on the UES that have the same clientele and are terrific!

We ordered the following:

- 2 glasses of Prosecco - good and filled to the tippy top of the flute

- Shrimp Cocktail - very good and fresh

- Beef Carpaccio - terrible! It looked like roast beef and tasted like roast beef. We aren't even talking about superior roast beef, more like supermarket lunch meat.

The hubby (who attended culinary school) said the beef should be sliced and pounded just prior to serving. This almost had a refrigerator taste and was very dry. The beef should have a little peppery arugula, thin slices of parmigiano cheese and aged balsamic vinegar on top of it. This was served like you would get a steak salad (steak on top). There were several slices of beef on top of a pile of (not peppery) arugula and several huge pieces of cheese. It was served with cruets of oil and (not aged) balsamic vinegar.

- Linguini with white claim sauce - no flavor at all

- Linguini with carbonara sauce - needed a lot of pepper and tasted more like alfredo with small pieces of Boars Head ham (instead of seared pancetta). In the pictures, you can see how the sauce isn't fresh and had an almost congealed look to it. It was way too heavy.

To add insult to injury, our Saturday night dinner was over in 30 minutes. Seriously, 30 minutes from seating to check.

Next time I go to Bloomingdales, no more peeks into this kitschy Italian restaurant. I will just keep walking.

I love this place.  The food is so consistently delicious and the menu is varied with interesting options. Save room for dessert and set a spell - The service and hospitality are old world class - top notch! I highly recommend adding this neighborhood spot to your list!

This is an absolutely  gorgeous spot on the Upper East side...back room has no windows or outdoor light so could be day or night, but very pretty room...
Service is bordering on "Old World", but does require vigilance...prices are high and the food is inconsistent..the soup was delicious ($16 for small bowl)
but the calamari looked like cold rubber bands tossed in a red cabbage leaf...
the bread was OK, kind of stingy with the olive oil & no butter was offered.

The main course was OK, if you liked under-cooked, tasteless vegetables with
your entree, but it was a relaxing respite on a busy  day...

Loved the ambiance. Had higher expectations for the food especially at the prices they were charging.
My parpadelle looked and tasted like my mother in laws homemade thick and misshapen noodles. Not good!! The rest of the food was meh, although my husband's linguine dish was on point.
Service was excellent except for the poor Swiss junior waiter who most likely has been fired since we dined there. I feel like there are much better Italian places in NYC. Probably why they ask for a credit card number when you make a reservation.

We went here last night for dinner with some friends that are like family. They're all Italians, except Lorenzo and I and they told us it's the best Italian food in NYC. I would disagree I think it's the best Italian food in America!

Some of the best ravioli I've ever had, their truffle sauce is what dreams are made of! To top it off the service was even better. The waiter is friendly and knowledgeable, the chef comes by to make sure we liked our food. It was just a fantastic experience all the way around. It was one of those meals that made you realize just how good a dining experience can be and should be.

Oh and the dessert! Wow! It's so incredible! We ordered the dessert sampler and it fed 7 people and  we had some we had left because we couldn't finish it. The cheesecake melts in your mouth.

Also the wine selection is wonderful and the waiters make sure your glass is never empty. This place is magical, the decor is spectacular and the way you're treated is like you're royalty. If you're in NYC this place is a MUST!
The service was excellent and the food was fabulous. The chef stopped by my table after dinner and chat for a couple minutes. Amazing!

Had the pleasure of being invited to dine with a frequent at Ilpostino. We were treated like royalty. The restaurant is small but well laid out. The chef/owner came to the table.  Greater is with open arms. Great wine list.  We shared a 1999 bottle of Soldera.  
Would strongly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys a intimate Italian night out.

My hats off to Ilpostino and it's staff.

Stopped in yesterday afternoon for a drink at the bar since we were in the neighborhood, and had the nicest time.
Beautifully elegant restaurant, friendliest waitstaff, and our lovely bartender Erica and host Renato could not of been more welcoming.

Amazing ravioli- I am not a ravioli person but for my birthday my friends recommended me try. I never had this good creamy tasty delicate mouth-melting ravioli ever. A+.

Pretty tasty tiramisu. A!

The reason I put 4 stars is that
1.  A server dropped a dish on our chair and the ravioli and its sauce got in and on my daughter's moncler jacket (while they immediately clean)
2. I am a vongole bianco spaghetti person and I cook myself and eat everywhere.  It was not good as the best vongole spaghetti with flavor. It was not bad but not the best for the price .  Beautifully served, though.

Overall, it will not go wrong at this restaurant.  It is a fancy restaurant.

we have been here nearly for nearly every year from the early Covid year in 2020 after our third grandson was born and further pandemic dined Al fresco .. for the past two years have been repeat customers in late august . the service atmosphere and food are not just fabulous but happily anticipated.  highly recommend both locations Bach and dinner

Absolutely delicious and feel so lucky to have randomly found while walking and hungry. This spot doesn't show up on Yelp when searching for restaurants so we walked by it at first and went back because we were curious about the menu. The interior is really chic and we were warmly greeted despite not having a reservation. The place was full and lively and we were seated on the top floor by the bar. Service was impeccable and the food was delicious. We had a fresh pasta dish and the branzino fish that was cooked is salt and very fresh. What a treat!
I went here with my sister. it was so great.Neighborhood place very pretty. The service was suburb . Food was yummy I do recommend it here.

100%!!!! The Lotte New York Palace recommended IL Pastino for real homemade delicious Italian food. The staff was beyond great and friendly. They were very accommodating and stayed open late too!!! The bartender was so sweet and the manager was so kind!! We felt like family by time we left!! I totally recommend this beautiful restaurant!! Its gets a 10 for the delicious food!!!
The atmosphere, service and food were excellent. The back dining room was beautiful and the menu had many choices. A really wonderful evening!

Just had my second meal here in 4 months. It is superb. A lovely atmosphere, impeccable service, great food. A very extensive menu, multiple evening specials, but they will make you ANYTHING you ask for, within reason. A Large loud family group
was seated next to us. The hostess repeatedly offered to move us, but we were fine. Very thoughtful.
Eat here!
Owner is SO RUDE. Never come back. So unhinged. Wish I could give 0 stars. I had high expectations but the way he treated us was absolutely insane.
Great traditional Italian food, family style service and atmosphere. Was my first time I will be back!

This is one of the most traditional old-school Italian restaurants if you don't like what's on the menu they will make you whatever you want. The food is always fresh and the wines are amazing. The salted Bronzino fantastic the ravioli with truffles spectacular even their grappa is amazing. .

Wonderful classy Italian restaurant great for dinner with friends, family or a date.

Service.  Bartender, hostess and servers were extremely friendly and attentive from the time we arrived to the time we left.

Ambiance. White linen tablecloths, black chair covers and small fresh flowers on the tables contributed to a comfortably formal and classy atmosphere.  The table where we were seated couldn't have been more perfect, set apart from the rest, private feeling, and overlooking the tables on the first level of the dining room.

Food.  We had dinner here restaurant week, and everything was great.  
- bread with oil
- mussels in a light broth - fantastic
- burrata- very good
- veal- tender, excellent
- seafood with green and white pasta- the pasta was cooked perfectly, and the sauce was delicious.
- tiramisu-
- chocolate cake- delicious

Definitely recommend for a great italian dining experience with outstanding service.

This restaurant is special. If you're reading this and are deciding whether to go here - take this as your sign to give it a go. The staff is top notch. Ambiance excellent. Deep wine pours. Food phenomenal.

I think what set's Il Postino apart from other similar establishments is the service. There was no question that not only had our waiter worked there for years and knew the menu like the back of his hand, but he was overly accommodating in substitutions and off menu items.

Our dinner started with some lovely prosciutto and burrata, and my dinner was followed by some epic seafood stew.

This spot is a little off the beaten path and totally worth it for the experience. Ask to get a table in the back if you want to talk as it can get a bit crowded by the bar.

Amazing food and the service is wonderful!
Carpaccio is delicious and the pasta w truffle is really good!

I remember from 49th street, there was always a problem with the bill and instead of adjusting it, they said "we will take care of you next time"! I figured to try again on 61st. Firstly, we ordered a bottle of wine, they neglected to tell us the year we picked, wasn't the one we received! Secondly, the pasta and veal dish were not on par with a typical bistro! sauces were heavy and thick and pasta was small and mediocre to be nice. They we asked for the bill took more than 25minutes to arrive! Told the waiter I was a regular at 49 th st for a while and would like to speak to the owner. Luigi was too busy! he will always be second rate, perfect for the client that lacks sophistication! Nothing has changed, shame on me for going back, however I was a guest!

Posting is a classic Italian dishes, cook as perfection, and the chef is almost every day there, that's make it very important, it's family business, his wife get you to the tables.it's a really nice atmosphere, and elegant place, more casual at the bar, food is excellent. Wine list also is very good. Pastas, and crudos are really good and fish, like Dover sole. As a complementary they put you a white beans and squid it's delicious, and zucchini fried. Bathroom in the same level. Dining room it's beautiful.
Love this place.

For food and atmosphere, my rating is 5 stars, we were a party of 4 and we all enjoyed our food. Service was 3 stars, the host and managers were friendly but the waiters could use some additional training. We had 2 waiters, 1 of whom constantly tried to sell us things we didn't want. There's an art to selling in this manner to not annoy the customer. Our other waiter had the menu memorized which was impressive but lacked people friendly skills. I would go back but not for a few months with the hope of having different servers.
Good news! Il Postino is not closed. It has a brand new location on 61st street. Luigi is still there and same delicious authentic Italian food! Wait til you see the new decor! It's fantastic.

We live in the neighborhood and come here often. What really sets this place apart is the customer service and the fact that they will make virtually any Italian dish you ask for, even if it is not on the menu. Do you feel like a particular pasta and sauce, such as linguine with clam sauce or ravioli and pesto? If you ask your waiter, there is a very good chance that they can make it!

This is not a trendy restaurant that everyone knows about, so it tends to be mostly locals. Come join in and be pleasantly surprised!

I'm a regular at scalinatella. So i was excited to try il Postino in their new location. I couldn't have been more disappointed. We ordered a few drinks. A few salads, mushroom special, a crudo and a white truffle pasta and a dessert. When the salads came.  I tilt the bowl and use my knife and scoop it into my plate. I cut a piece of cheese. And i realize It's a  paper towel not cheese!!!!
So i call the waiter over. And i say. Listen. I never ever ever complain  But look. He's like oh my. I say. Am i wrong for saying something?
He's like no. Oh my.
So he comes back. And he's like. Oh. We made you a new one (like he did me a favor) and he's like what happened was, There was a napkin between the plate and the bowl. And you lifted it and it fell in your plate. I said. Ummmm NOOOO. That's not what happened. There was a paper towel in my salad and all you had to say was I'm sorry. Not blame it on me. So i get the "the customer is always right" response. Which i take as "go F yourself."
So the mediocre meal continues. And when the check comes. They come back and say. Oh. What did you drink again? We forgot to add it to the check. So they had an opportunity to comp me one  drink each . But no.
The check comes again and every single cent is accounted for on it. Not one thing comped. Not an apology. Basically it was my fault it happened and i should be grateful they remade the salad that i didn't even want to touch.  I am absolutely mortified. I will never go back

Wonderful  Place
Great service
Fun owner
Multicultural
Great food
Wonderful atmosphere
My family and I plan
On becoming regulars
Thank you so much for a great night;
REGINA AND PILAR

I was craving Italian food and quickly found this place on google. I tried to eat here around 7:30 on a Saturday evening but I had to leave before I could order as the waiters were instantly pushy and that really irritated me. I was asked 3 TIMES by 3 different employees If I wanted wine in which I answered no 3 times. This restaurant was pretty empty so the persistence seemed intentional. At that point I couldn't help but feel like these people were trying to extort me. In just the first 10 mins there I had been approached 5 times by 3 different waiters asking me if I was ready. I could not get a moment to myself to actually get through this menu. I felt so uncomfortable that I had to get up and leave. This place was empty on a Saturday evening, I should have took that as a sign. I will not bother coming here again. NYC has way too many options.

Il Postino hostess was REALLY rude/insulting.  We sat at our table at 6.15, (next to a deafening table of +/-20 people all literally yelling over each other).

At 7.27pm, the hostess came up to us and said "you need to move along, I need your table."  After spending over $200 for dinner for three, in a deafening restaurant, we are told in approximately one hour, time to leave.  

And BTW, the menu was rather odd; the waiter said "we don't put much down on the menu, just tell us what you want, and we can make it."  We each asked for things (that actually were on the menu) and none of the three were available.  Over a five min period when we were just sitting down, he came up to us 4 times asking to take our order.

Wonderful lunch!  I cannot say enough good things about Il Postino from the warm welcome, to the gracious service, excellent food and outstanding wine list. Although the wines by the glass prices  seemed a bit high the excellent quality and generous pours made up for it. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and our time spend in this lovely and comfortable establishment.
One of the best traditional Italian spots in the city. Staff is incredible, food is on point.

The entire frontside of the restaurant opens out to the street in the summer and it makes you feel like you are in Europe. It wasn't too crowded for lunch and quite a few older Italian-American regulars were dining there. 3 stars only because I thought the food could be better but I went for restaurant week...so should try it again another time!
Grilled calamari was great, pesto tagliolini was slightly overcooked, tiramisu was ok.

Eight of us decided to go to II Postino for Restaurant Week for lunch and treat my Intern who was on her last day. We picked from their Prix Fixe menu, and I had;

Salmone Marinato, with orange sauce
Veal Scaloppine, eggplant, zucchini, and onions in a light tomato sauce
Semifreddo

It's a medium size restaurant with separated sections at different elevations from each other which with the decor did bring some classy elegance to the place. The sound travels here, so it's was hard to hear your own conversation because the ones at the next table interfere and I recommend not to speak of anything personal because they will know two tables down.

The service was slow and not attentive, we didn't get checked on or get our water refilled for a long period of time but were charge for sparkling water when they gave us tap on refills.

The Salmone Marinato  was above average with the nice touch of the lemons that had little netted covers so the seeds don't come out.  The Veal Scaloppine was average. And the Semifreddo was average in taste but below average on presentation because it was just a piece cut from a slab with some drizzle on top. The food did arrive in full groups so the kitchen must have a good staff.

The Tiramisu Il Postino that the others had did get a lot of mmms, and yums from the table.  Also the others had the Fettuccini, veal ragu pizzaiola which had too many olives but was above average still in taste when you removed them.

They auto added a 21% gratuity to the bill at the end.

Most likely I will not be back since I have already I been to one where the food was better 2 blocks away and I still have a half dozen other Italian restaurants within walking distances I need to try out.

We came for restaurant week:
Appetizers:
- Veal : my friend who texted it jut kept saying,"this is really good" over and over.
- Eggplant parm: also well portioned with eggplant to cheese ratio! Solidly flavorful
- Lentil soup: we found plastic in the soup. The waiter was very nice and replaced it quickly but still... you lose a star on yelp for that

Mains
- Pappardelle: this was good, and I'm not usually a big fan of mushroom but it was in good portions and not overwhelming. The pasta itself was perfect!!!! Seriously!!

All the main courses were fantastic!

Desserts:
- everything is great... EXCEPT the ice cream, which was weirdly grainy and disappointing.

Went here for restaurant week but was not too impressed with the food. As soon as we walked in it felt like they were annoyed we were ordering from the restaurant week menu (as opposed to the full menu). It got worse when we decided to order a glass of wine as opposed to a bottle of wine. Nonetheless, the food was good. The fish was very tender and not over cooked. Red snapper was not very flavorful however the salmon was very delicious. The best dish was the calamari and salmon ravioli- very flavorful. The calamari was fresh and sauce was not too acidic or salty - just right. The ravioli was cooked perfectly and the pink sauce was delicious. What was out of this world were the desserts- all three were very delicious and fresh. I was disappointed they ran out of tiramisu however the other desserts were amazing. Don't think I'll return but good dishes available.

We visited II Postino during restaurant week and I was a little underwhelmed. The dinner portions were extremely small (granted it was restaurant week, but this was more of taste testing sized portion). I had the mozzarella carrozza for my appetizer and the salmon ravioli for my entree. The flavor of both were pretty good, but again, the portions were ridiculously small. The appetizer was one triangle (think grilled cheese sandwich cut into 4 triangles, this had ONE triangle) and the ravioli came with four in the plate and no they were not large. they were barely medium sized. So by the time I started to enjoy the flavors of each course, they were finished and the meal ended up feeling incomplete.

The servers were quite annoying as they were rushing every course. The restaurant was empty so there was no need for the haste. We actually had to ask them to wait for us to request dessert as they were asking to bring it out as soon as they picked up the 'dinner' plates.

The only thing that saved this dining experience was the atmosphere/decor which is beyond adorable and welcoming. It is like a cute little secret hideaway tucked away in the NYC. I would love to give this place another chance because as I mentioned, the flavor of the food was pretty decent. But I am not in a rush to return in the near future.
Old world service - excellent food.  Totally accommodating to any taste. Have Been following these guys from 49th St to new much more elaborate new location on 61st St.

Simply the BEST Italian restaurant in NYC. It's authentic, the staff couldn't be nicer and the food is better than what you'll find in Italy. I've been coming here for years and will continue to for many more. I love the new location as well. This is a MUST for anyone looking for an authentic best-in-class Italian restaurant.

I've visited Il Postino on two occasions, both for dinner on a weeknight. On the first visit, I was on a date. We were seated in the main dining area and were one of the only tables that night. The service was ok, but the staff seemed a little put out. I always try to order something on the lower end of the price range when my date is paying, but that was just about impossible here. Pasta entrees were around $40 and so was the steak, so I figured I might as well get the steak. It was ok, but nothing to write home about. For the price, we could've gotten much better elsewhere. The ambience is ok, very old school. I just couldn't get over the value ratio, the quality of the food and service just didn't merit the hefty price tag.

Recently, I returned during Restaurant Week to meet my parents and a family friend. We had a 6pm reservation so we weren't exactly taking up a prime time dinner spot. We ordered a nice bottle of wine for the table. When the waiter came to give us menus, he rattled off a list of specials and walked away. They hadn't given us the Restaurant Week menu. We had to wait for him to return and ask. He begrudgingly got us the menus and from that point on we were treated like second class citizens. Never mind that our bill still came to around $400. I had the mozzarella app (meh), the lasagna (actually pretty good), and the panna cotta (again, fine.)

If you don't want to participate in Restaurant Week, you don't have to! It's not an excuse to be rude to your guests and it's just bad advertising. I often find places through Restaurant Week that I return to again and again, paying regular prices. It's worth treating guests with respect. Suffice it to say, I will not be returning to Il Postino. There are too many superior options.

Il Postino has become our new favorite restaurant. We have been there twice in the past month and both times we had very memorable dining experiences. The food is outstanding and the service impeccable. While it is a bit on the pricey side, it is worth it.

What an exceptional experience!!! I was going into the city for a Billy Joel concert and decided what better way to kick off the night than with a great dinner for my fiancée. Il Postino blew it out of the water. From the moment we walked in we were welcomed and taken to our perspective table. We sat down and a beautiful spread was placed before us as we sipped some wine and ordered our entrees. I ordered a chicken parm with a side of angel hair and vodka sauce and I can easily say it was probably the best chicken parm I've had. My Fiancée ordered the Chilean sea bass with shrimp and lobster and she was extremely satisfied. We will DEFINITELY be coming back!!

I had white truffles on the brain and read that Il Postion could take me there.. So I called and they said it's not on our menu but we can make it for you. We can make anything you like for you!

After hanging up and no sooner than you could say white truffles, my phone rang. It was Il Postino calling me back saying white truffles are not in season. But they could make me something with black truffles if that was okay. Kind of dissapointed but said okay. It was cool that they called back and what the heck, better to get my truffle training wheels than to eat rotisserie chicken again.

I get there and this place is fancy. I passed on the restaurant week specials that look so good and cheap. The waiter said the chef will make you 8 cheese filled raviolis with a cream sauce, and with shaved black truffles done table side.

When the pasta came, he took this round hunk of black truffle from an old wooden box, like a small treasure chest, and began to shave it with a small mandolin over my pasta. I was like damn, this is Foodie Heaven with a capital F H baby! I musta looked as excited and with a dumb trance like my dog waiting for his T-bone scrap.

It was delish (and fricken exspensive) but another great NYC experience.

Excellent lunch today! We had a couple of hours to kill for lunch while waiting for Consulate paperwork from the Consulate of Macedonia. We stumbled upon Il Postino! Excellent little place ... Very clean and very welcoming. The staff was VERY attentive from The moment walking in the door when they took off our coats. Perfect Lunch menu with 3 courses. Never felt rushed and the service was excellent! Food tasted wonderful... Especially the little tastings on the table before your appetizers.
I will definitely be back.
The place is absolutely gorgeous and the food is outstanding. I can't wait to go back!!!

I'll skip right to the dessert.  We had delicious wild strawberries with a cheesecake.   The small wild strawberries from Spain were amazing.  They melt in your mouth and taste incredible.  A little expensive but worth it.

The pastas were great too.  We had the ravioli with porcini mushrooms and a pasta with shrimp.  Both were good but the ravioli was better.  

Service was good and attentive.  Restaurant decor was a little too dark for me but some may like that.

This place was the real deal. Everything was extremely fresh. The mozzarella and prosciutto app was one of the best i had. The free bread and olive oil was even great because of the quality evo they used. The grilled octopus was cooked perfectly. Definitely worth checking out.

I had the Osso buco and it was excellent as was the desserts.  The hostess was very polite and accommodating.  As this is a high-class restaurant the prices are - as well - high, well very high even for this area.   I was enjoying the eating experience here; however, I will now relate the incident that marred my experience and that of my friend's permanently.  Our "pressed-for-politeness" waiter went into what I can only described as a "highly controlled hissy-fit" when he received the (2) customer credit card signed slips instead of the merchant's copy from our table; my friend and I having spilt the bill on two (2) credit cards.  The was barely any light at out table (which was fine for ambience) but did not allow us the proper mount to see the 9 Point-sized text at the bottom.  He was rude and snotty and demanded to receive the Merchant-labeled as he glowered at us stating "It messes up my accounting."  I doubt that he DID the accounting, he spent of of his off time chatting up a rather petite brunette at the bar.  I can go one, but I have better manners than that gentlemen.  It was not even a crowded evening and the mood of the restaurant or at least the patrons was of good spirit.  I was going to say something to him, but I did not want to dignify his childish and un-professional behavior.  We took our coats I slipped the hostess a $5 bill and left.  The Osso bucco is to "die for"; however, I won't return to this [my] neighborhood establishment again.  

I wish to leave a message to the owners: "Get rid of this guy, he is the tall thin dark haired (hardly a gentle & somewhat a man)... He is the one that could not help reminding you - every time I made complimented the food - that he is native Italian [as if his accent would not give that away.]  Alternatively, just relocate your establishment to the Theatre District as his behavior might actually amuse the Bridge-and-Tunnel folk.  It did not go down well here in midtown-east.

My husband loves this place -has come here several times for business. Brought me and our daughter here for dinner a couple weeks ago. It's no wonder why he enjoys it - the food is homemade, delicious and very fresh. The service is what makes the dining experience so wonderful - the servers really seem to care about what they do and want to make sure you have what you need. They don't rush you, when the restaurant was super crowded and we came in without reservations, we had drinks at the bar while we waited. The hostess was apologetic because the wait was longer than what she'd estimated. but as soon as the table opened up, they carried our drinks over to the table and got us settled in. Our appetizer (burrata - sooo creamy and delicious!!!), and salad came soon, but the entrees were taking a while, but came quickly after we mentioned it to our waiter. I think they were just trying not to rush us. I can't remember our entrees, I think it was pappardelle, braised shanks (osso buco?) but it was delicious!! The desserts were also amazing. It is a cute neighborhood restaurant serving excellent food, with amazing service.  Prices are on the high side, but it's definitely worth it especially if you have time to sit and enjoy your meal with someone special. Can't wait for our next visit!

Il Postino never disappoints. The branzino is fabulous as is everything else they serve. Light  and flaky cooked in wine makes this the perfect main course. The octopus for an appetizer is a "must" and the salads will meet your expectations. If you like veal, you will love this dish. Cooked to perfection. The portions are more than ample. If you have an appetizer, you can share a main course. The litmus test for this restaurant is that you always find locals dining here because it has not lost its neighborhood atmosphere.

I always order meals from Italian Village and am never disappointed. This time I ordered a beef burger and it was delicious.  Char boiled to my liking.  The fries were hot and crisp.  Try it and you won't be disappointed.  Enjoy.
Great pizza with decent prices. Garlic knots and wings are always delicious. Near front seating area and back dining area. Sit down dining menu has great food as well.

This place is kind of trash
I dnno I expected about as much so maybe I shouldn't be disappointed and just conclude it's very middle of the road..

This being said, you'll get a nice amount of knots for the price but they won't tast like anything.

I maybe should have said pasta in the same sauce but the pasta itself wasn't very good, the red sauce on top was your standard "meh" red sauce.

The chicken dish I got had a decent tasting sauce, but they left the chicken in big chunks, same with the sausage... you can't experience all the flavors in one bite.

I'm not a fan.

Been going here for nearly 20 years, great tasting New York pizza and easy place to pop in and out for a good slice, or order a few pies for a party.  It's my favorite pizza in the area and the guys working there have been there forever!

Was torn about this rating. Would probably give it a 3.5 if I could - this is for delivery only. We called the restaurant directly and placed an order. When the food arrived we received eggplant instead of chicken parm. We called back and the man on the phone said it was our fault. They ended up sending a chicken parm which I appreciated but made us give back the open/touched eggplant (gross!). The chicken parm was one of the worst I've had in a while but On the other hand, the garlic knots and penne vodka were delicious! Soooo very 50/50 experience.

Food, very friendly service & ambiance.
They are wheel chair friendly and know not to give big glasses of water to little ones.  They bring the little ones paper cups with lids & straws!

I will admit that I only came here because it was the only sit-down restaurant that was open in the area around 10 pm. For my dining experience, I went with the stuffed mushrooms and chicken piccata. The stuffed mushrooms were pretty much on point, but I found the chicken piccata a bit too lemony for my tastes. The service was pretty good because the waiter constantly checked in on me. While I would not go out of my way to dine at Italian Village Pizzeria, the food was ok, especially for late-night dining.

For this review, I'd probably give the food a 3.5 and the service a 4.

The pizza options at this place aren't my favorite on the Upper East Side, but I gave the buffalo chicken pizza a try, and it was pretty good! Both the toppings and the crust were tasty. They also give generous portions of garlic knots. The flavor was pretty good, but they were slightly on the hard side. They did not provide any sauce with the garlic knots. They accept cards here.
My favorite white slice in UES. Great margarita slice also! Great bang for your buck pizzeria

What was a convenient place near my job to grab a quick bite turned into a place I'll never return to.

I was charged incorrectly (then blamed for it) and was refunded for the entire order which I assumed was a nice gesture for her mistake. Wrong.  

The worker was mumbling and was hard to understand what she was saying, but I then understood they'd charge the difference after refunding. No mention of me having to run my card again.

I rush off back to work after cleaning up after myself and she FOLLOWS ME outside for over a block to say "why did you leave? don't you remember me saying we need to charge you again?"

I run back, pay, and was late returning to work. All due to this workers error and incompetence. Nothing was offered other than a mumbled apology. Won't be returning.
Great neighborhood pizza spot and nice dining area to eat in the back - recommend the white slice!

Italian Village Pizzeria, was always my go to place on the Upper East Side, but after discovering a new place near where I work downtown,and as the years go passing by,Italian Village Pizzeria has lost a lot in taste/delivery departments.Maybe there has been a managerial take over, I really can't say.They are still better than any "Fast Food Pizzerias" all over NYC; becuase they are closer to the real thing,but something has been lost along the way since 1979.I might start shopping for a new Pizzeria Place, to A) Save money on a whole Pizza B) Save money on a delivery charge C) Refresh my tatse buds!
Great slice and place to relax on a Sunday. Loved the overall vibe and originality. Calzone and plain slice were excellent.

Tony, one of the original founders still works here making pizza and greeting customers, we met while he caught me staring at the old pictures in the walls and told me he was "making pizza before I was born" well this must be the reason why their pizza is so good, because is made with love. People working here are super friendly and prices are great. Also try their chicken wings. Winner. Unfortunately I ate the wings too fast and didn't have time for pictures so I guess you will have to try them for yourselves! Support locals and give them the love they deserve. And yes they do have Hawaiian pizza and I loved it.
Ok so I came back today for the lasagna...delicious !!! Served baked in its own cast iron pan with just the right amount of crunchy charred edges.
Some of the Best Pizza I've had in NYCity and I'm very picky about my pizza,this place is a hidden gem

This restaurant took our meals to wrap them up and then sent us home with the WRONG togo bag of half eaten food. We didn't notice till later in the evening.  When I called to tell them the situation and that another customer must have gotten my meal while I had his.... they passed me back and force between waiter and manager and who knows who. After explaining the situation a third time they hung up the phone on me. First time customer, last time. Terrible customer service.
This place has fresh, delicious calzones! Had a chicken one. Can't wait to try the rest of the food!

Giving one star for delivery (they do their own) as the pie took over an hour (estimated time was 30 min delivery) to be delivered and arrived cold.
Guy on the phone was pretty rude about it.

We were leaving the City and we were looking for a pizzaria for a quick slice to hold us out for the ride home.

This pizzaria was fairly large with plenty of tables and was fairly new. The white cheese pizza with a splash of red sauce was good enough to fulfill my hunger.

Since it was a quick visit, we really did not have the opportunity to learn more about the restaurant, but we were quite happy for the short experience we encountered.

My family had a little 90th bday celebration for my father here this week and everything was fabulous!  Though of course this is a "pizza place" the service and food in the restaurant area was 5 star!  The care that was given to us and my father (who is a regular customer)  was amazing! There were 9 of us and the food all came out at the same time and was hot and correct! The bread was hot and fresh! We brought a cake and they served it so beautifully! Thank you so much Italian Village for a beautiful and memorable evening!

After a long day and an even less desire to cook, does anything beat a NY perfect slice? No way. The slices here are huge. The mushroom was divine. I asked them to crisp it up and it was perfect. Just the right amount of sauce, loaded with cheese and mushrooms. I also got a Sicilian. Not my favorite. But it was my first time trying this style of slice. A little doughy for me. But the taste was on point. Looks like they are back open for indoor dining with an extensive menu of pastas, apps, and sandwiches too, plus beer and wine. And a huge outdoor dining section. The staff is kind and knowledgeable. And everyone was Covid safe. Couldn't ask for more!

Beyond their delicious pizza they also have delicious dinner selections! Tonight I tried the potato crusted flounder with a mustard sauce. 5 out 5 stars ! I also had a lovely glass of Sicilian wine called Nero D'Avola. Yes, it's red and I was having fish, bust it is my comfort wine of choice. I highly recommend this for dinner! Friendly service, clean, and decent prices!
Very good pizza! It's hot, greasy and cheesy- exactly what I want in a pizza. Always satisfying.

Lovely little spot for a nice Italian meal or lunch.
Drinks and wines are nice staff was very nice.
Spacious seats and bright atmosphere. I had a fresh calzone and it was good. My aunt ordered chicken parm and it's a great size.
Will def go back for a relaxed chill spot for a great meal.

Pizza is incredible.  Ownership has it together!  Meet Chris and as a young entrepreneur he is as sharp as they come!  Looking forward to dining again!  Indoor and outdoor (when warmer)!  Need a beer or a glass of wine?  They have that too!!!

I had both the regular slices and their Sicilian slices. Both were very good. Their pizza is thick, very cheesy and also very saucy. They are also of a good size. Overall, it is very nice old school New York style pizza exactly the way I like it. My only criticism - though just a minor one - is that the crust is little too big. This makes the slices a little too bready.

Usually just go for some quick pizza But today went for Sunday Brunch and As always good food, good quality and value. And everyone IS SO NICE - Chris, Rosie, etc. Always a welcoming, pleasurable experience. I had a spinach and cheese omelette with salad- presented nicely, tasted delicious. And the bread, oil and grated Parmesan cheese are SO GOOD!!

I must have walked past this place 100 times and never noticed it. A friend of mine told me they have really good food and I should check it out. Today I did.

The hubby was out and about and asked me to order in lunch. I asked my kids what they wanted and of course they said PIZZA!! I wasn't in the mood for any of our normal pizza delivery places (Gotham, Pizza Boss etc.) so I figured I would give Italian Village a chance to knock my socks off - and they did!!

We ordered:

- Fresh Mozzarella Pizza, half meatball - it was totally delicious! Very thin, crispy crush. Not burnt, just delicious.

- Antipasto Salad - Loaded with cheese, salami, peppers and olives, it was great! My youngest daughter filled up on the salad and ended up eating her pizza for dinner!

We will definitely order again! I can't wait to try their entrees.

My fiancée and I were about two months into living into New York and the pizza cravings have intensified.

But what is a poor couple to do when it's hitting 9PM and it's mad windy outside? Trek 10 blocks over to Italian Village Pizzeria because the pictures on Yelp showed some thin and mad cheesy slices.

Long story short, we came, we saw, we ordered... a large pie! Cause we did not just battle gusts of wind to eat one slice each. We split it up and went half pepperoni for her, and half meatball for me. We saved half and took the rest home.* Overall, it's good and so far it's the best we've had on the Upper East Side!

*For the curious, we transferred the leftovers into a small box. Ain't no way I'm carrying a large pizza box in the wind. Mad props to all you deliverymen and women.

Yay! ALWAYS PAYS to order direct from the restaurant for delivery!! Love this place their delivery is super prompt AND they bring a CC square so you're not online or on the phone dealing with CC bs  
Their pizza is v good and service is great there's a reason they've been around so long!
Best White Pizza I have ever had in NYC.  Tried many places in the vicinity and nothing touches this pizza.  Not sure the magic but it is delicious.

AVOID DELIVERY!!  We used to regularly come here pre- COVID -- but now bad, Actually Awful, experience with deliveries. Wrong items and even when order technically correct-  tasteless and often cold . My husband is loyal and said to give them another chance. Big Mistake!! Today's pizza was particularly BAD-- my guess is that   they  used an old pizza that  had sat around, put our ordered toppings on it  and then did not even  heat it sufficiently-- otherwise  I can not figure out how so very bad. They did Not even bother to include any of the usual extras: red pepper, grated cheese or anything else - missing even those  specifically requested. Totally Unacceptable- especially at the high price charged.

I have to admit, I adore Italian Village Pizzeria. I'm so thrilled to be here and the atmosphere is so pretty. I am very glad that we had Eggplant Parm, this was one of their very best dishes, very flavorful and delicious. Workers are super courteous. They're attentive, polite and always on their game. Do you need another reason to stop in Italian Village Pizzeria?

At 7pm the place was very busy but most of the pies on display looked dried out-- especially the square slices and Sicilian.  So went with the regular --- big slice but lacked the flavor of a really good NY regular slice.  The worst part was the crust -- rock hard and inedible.  And this from a pie they had just taken out of the oven!

It had been years since I'd ordered from here, despite it being a former go-to. A change in my schedule - and their distinctive change in ingredients - weaned me off of the place entirely. But tonight I was in the mood specifically for their meatball parm hero.  When I offered a card # was told to give it to the delivery person, since they now carry machines with them.  

Only the delivery showed up at the door and he didn't have the machine with him. He said nobody had told him. I believed him. Then encouraged me to go to the store to pay. Obviously I didn't given that defeated the purpose of delivery. Which means no food either.  

Decided against calling to complain - what was to be gained? But surprised they haven't called me to apologize, explain or you know, show interest in having and keeping a customer.  I guess they won't miss me.

This place is unprofessional! I paid for three slices of pizza then sat down with my family and my baby to eat them outside, when done I returned my tray inside and left. As we were walking away one of the employees chased us down the street reprimanding that I needed to pay my meal and I couldn't leave without paying. I told him that I did but he insisted that I return to the restaurant to pay. I turned my stroller around and returned. The man who had rung me up just 15 minutes prior told me directly in my face that I didn't pay and he didn't remember me. Just for clarity, the restaurant was empty when we ordered. I was the only one there so it baffles me that he didn't remember me and flat out call me a liar.  After embarrassing me in the street and in front of other patrons inside of the restaurant, making me take out my credit card and compare it to the receipts they had, they finally admitted that I did in fact pay. The way they handled the situation was horrendous. I do not recommend this place unless you want to be thoroughly embarrassed and called a thief.

Interesting home style pizzeria that has a semi hidden back dining room. Yummy softer bigger slice of ny pizza with melty cheese and sauce that just makes everything better- like butter. Or sugar.

Surprisingly, their Caesar salad was heaping with shaved Parmesan and coated perfectly with a dressing that had just the right amount of fishiness to cheese to olive oil ratio. It was so simple yet decadent and I finished every bite. Their tropical salad as I stole a bite from someone else, was, is, phenomenal. Arugula with softened palm hearts, Granny Smith apples and possibly pine nuts, parm cheese and a lemony sweet dressing. Who knew? A pizza joint in the front w dining area in the way back would serve up some world class salads?

We shared a chicken parm. Tho hearty and huge, heaping with melty mozz... I felt the sauce fell flat, as it was just tomato pasty. And the chicken was neither so moist nor crunchy nor standout- your basic soggy, not - too- dry-not-too salty- boring breaded breast.

I would come back for their salads in a heartbeat and a cheese slice for good measure.

My favorite pizza restaurant is Italian Village Pizzeria.
The best pizza that I have ever eaten is their sausage and onion               pizza. It is made with fresh ingredients and caramelized onions. The restaurant delivers hot food, and it arrives fast. When you buy from this restaurant, you know that your money is going to a good use because some it goes to feeding hospital workers.  (FW, grade 4)
Best pizza in the hood! I often get the Mushroom slice. A good size for the price!
