I ordered the French fries, spicy ramen with some fish cakes, and the Korean fried chicken wings in soy garlic and I think kbbq sauce. We were a group of 3 and we definitely needed some water and didn't need anymore alcohol. This meal saved us for the next day. Service is pretty quick, there's usually a security guard but looks like a place people come and go. It definitely has a Korean feel for it, dimly lit, small tables, etc. They have tons of options for food to choose room too for late night snacks. Would highly recommend coming here if you're in the area!

I really want to give this place 4 stars because the food and atmosphere were good, but it STANK in here. Smelled like a mixture of vomit, redbull, and cleaning solution. Granted I came at 2am which is prime time for inebriated ktowners to get their barf on. Also, the fish tank on display could use a deep cleaning. An animal activist would definitely throw a fit.

Other than the stench, the food was fine - typical Korean bar food. We ordered the cheesy boneless chicken, bulgogi fries, and the veggie dumplings. Interior is nicely decorated. Great for pictures.

Food: Itaewon Pocha offers a pretty ample variety of Korean comfort food that pairs well with soju! Enjoyed our visit here with a group of friends. We ate the creamy rice cake and spicy chicken with cheese. They were somewhat heavy so it's better to just buy food to share/snack on if you plan on drinking. Overall food was reasonably priced as well.

Ambiance/Service: Super vibrant interior design with lots of colored lights and kpop videos playing! Really plays into a beach-y club-y vibe. I can imagine it would be a fun place to celebrate someone's birthday or something. Service was great - we waited over an hour for our food due to a technical issue but our server gave us a free soju cocktail to make up for the long wait.

This place is pretty cute. I went here a 3 days before Halloween. The service is good. People are very nice. The food is decent. If you plan to go here do not forget your ID. They will ask you for it.

I like coming here! Sometimes it can be hard to get a spot though - long waits later in the evening on weekends.

Came early evening on a Saturday and only had to wait a few minutes. We ordered the seafood pancake, the tempura spicy rice cakes, and a soju cocktail to share amongst 3. It was filling and tasty!

Party vibes fill the place, with K-pop on the speakers. Staff is a bit hard to track down but it's busy and loud in there. Good for groups.

I came here for drinks on a weekend night, and the place was quite busy. We were able to squeeze 6 into a table meant for 4, but definitely come prepared to find another place if it's too busy and you're with a large group. The inside is super loud so it can be quite hard to have a conversation, and it's also pretty cramped. We ordered a lychee soju cocktail which was quite good, not too strong but also a nice flavor. The bottle is definitely meant for sharing and they have one of those color changing lights at the bottom. Overall decent spot!

Came in on a Friday night for a late dinner, restaurant was pretty packed and the lights are fun (but a bit blinding at times so be ware if you're sensitive to strobe/disco lights). We ordered the lychee soju cocktail, bulgogi fries, kimchi cheese fried rice, and seafood tteobokki. Everything was good, however there was SOO much mozerella  cheese over the rice and tteobokki where it was a little too much cheese and not though rice or tteobokki (I love cheese but it wasn't porportionate).

This place is good for a group of people hanging out at night for dinner or drinks. The price of food was not that high in overall. We went there as a big group of friends for NYE dinner before countdown, but they didn't offer the "beer tower (mixing beer & soju)" where other places did, they said we have to mix by ourselves, which was a bit annoying, so we just ordered the Korean rice wine instead. Their calm soup was really good, clear broth and refreshing. The "Rose tteokbokki (creamy spicy rice cake)" was not too spicy and rice cake was perfectly cooked (soft & tender), so my non-spicy eater friends were enjoying it for first time! But I didn't like the seafood pancake because it was not crispy (size was huge and good to share). I will recommend if you try to find a place for vibe, late night dining, and big group dining.

I've come here a couple of times and had a good experience each time! This is a great spot to get together late at night with some friends and drink or eat some late night Korean snacks. The music is very loud kpop which is fun and the ambiance is so vibey, I love the decoration. I usually just get soju or their soju cocktail but I got their ddeokbokki with tempura, soy garlic chicken, and bulgogi kimchi fries and all of them were SO good. The ddeokbokki was so yummy, perfect spice level -- definitely get this.
Staff is nice and I never have to wait too long, they brought my party free shots once.

Service was so bleh that as soon as we entered that we decided  leave and go to Pocha32, which we instantly knew was the right choice because it was much fuller and more lively compared to the almost-empty itaewon pocha. When we sat down, the waiter spilled an entire bottle of water on our table, and soaked my Louis Vuitton bag . Honestly I didn't care that much since it's old and canvas (lol) but his attitude was so terrible... didn't even apologize and was extremely slow in helping us clean up, I wasn't even handed a napkin until I asked for one later. Then we were handed menus and told that only highlighted items were allowed to be ordered, without an explanation why. When we entered we were curious as to why it was so empty but clearly it isn't even worth it to stay.

Food was amazing!!

I actually went here before with a huge group of people and it was amazing and so fun.

I went again with a friend of mine, and we loved it. The vibes are amazing. Our waitress was so sweet and attentive. the food was just amazing.

The drinks are perfect.
The wings are to die for!  Such a great time. I had so much fun. highly highly recommend.

It does get very busy so I recommend a reservation. we made one online beforehand.

Such a fun and friendly atmosphere here! My first night in nyc and k-town and my friends and I came and we loved it so much we came back two more times throughout our stay here. We ordered green grape soju and kloud beer for sake bombs and that was an amazing combo! Definitely recommend for anyone who wants a fun night in k-town.

Fun place, nicely decorated, great service, and good food. I came here with a few friends for dinner and drinks yesterday. There was no wait (party of four) but the place was relatively busy (2am Sat).

We ordered the kimchi dumplings and a seafood ramen - both were solid! Our server was kind enough to promptly get our questions answered although they didn't let us know when the kitchen closed so we weren't able to order more. Our table also got a bottle of watermelon soju to share which was decent. Tasted a bit thick and artificially sweet like cough medicine.

Overall, it's a cool place and good time overall. While the main dishes were a bit pricey, I'd recommend stopping by.

the vibes here are TOO good!!! not only is the placed decked out in lights and colors making it look so lively, but everyone always seems to be having a great time!! during my nyc stay, we came to itaewon pocha twice!!! both times we only had some soju bombs and didn't try the food but that just explains how much we enjoyed ourselves here! the service is good, sometimes it a bit difficult to get the servers attention but be patient! they were quite busy both times we went! the music is AMAZING! n you can even request songs at the bar. great vibes will be back next time.

Overall 5/5: Nice little wind down spot to be with your friends and enjoy some soju.

Drinks 5/5: They offered a great variety of flavors for soju. We went with the apple, peach, yogurt, and plum. All solid choices. Everything was decently priced and we got our moneys worth two times other places we had in NY.

Food 5/5: We got the cheese chicken, which wasn't what i was expecting when i ordered it. But it was still delicious! We definitely enjoyed it after our soju intake. Would definitely be down to try other food if i'm back in town.

Service 5/5: Everything was really fast and prompt. Our water container was never empty. Service here was great, both servers were stopping by to make sure everything was okay.

Vibe 5/5: Great energy, cool decorations. Super fun and enjoyable place to hang out with friends. We loved the music and the lights!

Thank you, Itaewon Pocha!

Fun atmostphere! We ordered the bulgogi kimchi fries it was pretty decent, I've had better.  They soju cocktail  the offer comes in so many different flavor, we got the korean pear flavor, it was kind of too sweet, barely tastes the soju.

Was excited to find this place after watching Itaewon Class Kdrama. Just wanted similar experiencing of Korean pub where you can enjoy affordable common food.
Located in Ktown NYC, you will see the sign but the entrance is hidden as there is no sign.
Once you find the entrance and get to the second floor, you can find many small tables and good ambience. As we were there close to the opening hour at 5pm, sat next to the window so see and enjoy people walking in the street. There are plenty of good Korean items to choose from along with drinks. Ordered three items; Spicy kimchi tofu, spicy chicken cheese and seafood fried rice.
They came out fast however here are things missing.
Food portion was good but lacked main ingredients and flavor as there were very little. Seafood fried rice had very little to none veggies, pieces of squid and 3-4 shrimps. Spicy kimchi tofu had very little tofu and pork. Spicy chicken cheese had very little chicken. But the biggest disappoint was neither were spicy and did not have that Korean food flavor as if they were cooked by none Korean. Like American Chinese food in a way. If you are looking for the experience, it is okay to visit. But would not recommend if you want the authentic Korean food tasting.

Fun pocha vibe! Got the lychee soju. It was strong and very sweet. Service was pretty fast and they were nice. Definitely a fun place to hang out with friends. The food looked pretty good and will definitely be back to try it because it would be fun to have pub food with the soju!

The wings were perfectly cooked and crispy with enough sauce , the fries were the best thing we had! With the beef being tender on the fries and the sauces just complementing it so well! If there is anything you get let it be the fries !! The final  plate was Arabiata toppokki  it was good there was a lot of seafood -and a little spice to it !

Walked and they said 10 minutes wait. Then was told that there was a waiting list. After I signed up for the waiting list, Im assuming the "bouncer"? asked why we were standing inside the bar. No one told us there was a staircase outside to wait. Came in after all that ordeal. Was about to turn around. I wish that I had turned around. Worst cheese buldak I had. Chicken had an after taste and seasoning was salty and not spicy at all. I would not recommend this place at all!!!!!!

We came here as a bit of a spontaneous get together at prime dinner time, and while I was expecting a packed restaurant, I instead found a small, intimate lounge-type restaurant. Incredibly attentive staff and a neon-light type ambiance that was a fun addition to our meal.

For a Korean restaurant, the menu focused less on the traditional options and more on new-age American fusion dishes like the Kimchi fries (pictured) and different types of house made flavored soju's. Bulgogi was still available, however, as in the name of the restaurant, this is the kind of place where you order a bunch of appetizers for the table to split.

Their appetizer menu is expansive and creative, where we found ourselves more drawn to than the actual dinners. I also mentioned the soju before- be prepared to fight your friends over which of the many, many flavors to order.

Excellent meal, good staff, we left happy.

This is a lovely small coffee shop in the lobby of an office tower, this is not a hang out for a few hours place, it's a great stop and go option in this area.
You can sit in the lobby, lots of light and one long table, but again not a work space.
Coffe is great, and service has been lovely, BUT the reason I give it 5 stars is THE LOBBY SMELL. It's incredible, if you know what it is  PLEASE TELL ME.

If I were to rate the coffee on quality, they'd get a 5. But then you get absent minded baristas, that don't even look at you and just turn around the screen and ask for a tip (that's kinda of the new normal nowadays everywhere to be fair) so there they get a 1. And then for the lack luster pastries (granted these are def not baked there) they get a 2.... Round up and then you get a 3 star average!
Don't get me started on the price... a latte and a mediocre pastry - $14!!! How is that even possible!

If only there was a way to rate Food, service and Ambiance individually on this app it would be perfect. But for those reading my review for the first time, here is how I arrive at my overall grading scale.
Each area of service can get a max of 1.66 points for a total of 5 points or 5 stars.

When it comes to Irving Farm New York, located at the beautiful Nomad Tower, the first thing you will notice is the ambiance, or the lack of a ambiance. This might be a tad unfair to say since this small coffee kiosk is located in the lobby of a prestigious building. The architecture of the Nomad tower is reminiscent of Bauhaus styled architecture, with interesting column cement forms , naked textures, and railings that surround the stairs leading to the forbidden lower level.

While this architecture is interesting it is cold stark and lacking comfort. The simplicity in design leaves one not feeling welcomed, but forewarned not to touch anything that looks expensive. For this reason the ambience gets 1 point.

The food is limited, as a kiosk location would be, but the selection is vast enough to satiate the hurried passerby or executives that emanate from the floors above. When it comes to coffee places I prefer a larger selection of drip coffee and espresso beans that would really get the caffeine aficionado's heart pumping. Alas they only had a mild roast coffee and limited amenities to offer. The breads, snacks, and assorted desserts where cold but well preserved. For this I offer 1 point.

The service was fast, while a kiosk usually boasts a total of only one employee this kiosk had two to handle the burst of busy patrons looking to get moving with their coffee bean elixirs for their morning motivational meetings.

Walk into Irving Farms New York at Nomad Tower for a quick coffee or stay for some work at their long shared table. Whatever your choice is, you won't be dissatisfied with your selection.

quality coffee representative of most other Irving Farm locations. on the ground floor of a corporate office building, this location seems to serve the building's companies as it closes early like ~ 3:30 pm. pretty typical coffee drink menu as well as some baked eats and small bites. stopped by here during the warmer months of the Fall and had iced Americanos. the coffee is flavorful and brewed with care. service is kinda standard / okay.

Mediocre on a good day.
Pedestrian commercial almond croissant with an odd taste.
Nothing special cortado.
Expensive.  If you're desperate, maybe.
But with so many other better choices in the hood.

New outpost of the typically solid Irving Farm coffee shop in an absolutely lovely setting. This new spot is in the lobby of a sleek, modern office building.  There is one large, central communal table, along with more private stools at the ample, floor-to-ceiling windows, with a nice view of Broadway/31st if enjoying the weather--or people watching--is your coffee-drinking pleasure.

They just opened Monday, and are having a half-price off all coffee drinks promotion, which seems quite generous. My cortado was excellent, full-price quality at the bargain rate $2.12. And the salted peanut butter cookie was nice as well. Smallish selection of food/pastries, but a beautiful setting for great coffee, with friendly baristas who seem to know what they are doing.
I was at the Irving Place location today. Great coffee.  Great Muffins.  Very rude blonde woman behind the counter.  Not sure what her problem was

All I care about is coffee. Is the coffee good? Yes, they are great not just good. This area needed Irving coffee. For a year I have been struggling where to get good coffee. I'm glad they opened up. Go here every morning.

So this Irving Farm is in the lobby of my company's NYC office HQ so of course I had to try a latte while I was visiting. Both baristas were extremely funny and helpful, and I went with an oat milk latte at their suggestion. The one was super funny and wanted her fingers in the shot for Yelp, and I was happy to oblige. Def recommend getting a latte from here, they're delish, not a bad price, and the baristas are awesome. Def helped start my morning off with some laughter.

Their cold brew is really good, I tried this vegan chocolate cake and it was good and moist but non memorable. They only offer oat and soy milk as a substitute, the cold brew is definitely something to impress your coffee lover friends.

I like to think of this place as a gourmet Indian chipotle. I just moved to Murray hill and this has been my go to spot. There's tons of delicious options that are pretty healthy and less expensive than sweetgreen and other healthy alternatives.

My personal favorite is the golden curry chicken bowl. I've ordered it at least 8 times in the past month lol. They prepare their food pretty quickly, and if you order on Doordash, they deliver very quickly as well. I don't have anything negative to say about Inday!

Overall food is pretty bad, surprised there was such a long line. Perhaps the non vegetarian food is great.

There's too much rice, not enough curry, very very dry falafel. I'm really surprised they don't have a paneer option as well.

Wouldn't recommend.

My go-to lunch spot in the neighborhood. I love the flavorful, vegetarian options. It can get a bit chaotic during lunch rush, given how small the space is, but I'm usually in and out pretty quick and there is always a table if you want one. The staff does a great job of keeping track of orders too, so they notice if you've been waiting
So delicious and flavorful my chicken tikka masala roti! This was my first time ordering from this place and it was so, so good! 4 stars!!!

I had the pleasure of trying this place and it was just as good as others say. Very filling with delicious vegetables!

I ordered the grilled Inday kebab and all the flavors blended so beautifully. I love the use of pickled onions! We also tried a DIY with chicken thigh and masala sauce, and that blended amazing with the basmati rice.

Please try this place if you're ever in the area!
I got the coconut chicken curry over the rice takeout. It was extraordinarily mediocre, with weak flavors. It did fill you up, however, so there's that

Just arrived to NY for the Chris Rock/Kevin Hart show at the Barclay Center on Monday, and my cousin randomly picked this restaurant. Small establishment for dining in as there are only tables for 2 but we made it wrk for the 3 of us.  Also a bit warm inside for 90 degree day outside.  We ordered the a Tamarind Glazed Salmon, the Charred Chicken(no red sauce) and the Golden chicken Curry all served with Basmati Rice. When I tell you the food was delicious!!  We couldn't stop talking about the different flavors, tenderness of the chicken and the perfectly cooked salmon, we loved it. All meals were ordered at the register and served to your table in a bowl. For my first meal in NYC during this weekend trip it was delicious and highly recommended the restaurant.

The food was served fast and service was good. We had lentil falafel chat and roasted gunpowder potatoes. We found the falafel chat dry than was hoping for but it was good to eat. Loved the interior design and overall feel of the place.

Always amazing food, chill environment, great people.
Never had better coconut curries!

2nd time ordering from here via Uber Eats. Got the chicken tikka masala over basmati rice and salad. Both times were very good, I'd definitely order this again for lunch. I tried the turmeric cauliflower this time and that was meh. Didn't really taste the turmeric and the brown sauce it came with wasn't good. Get the chili oil and green sauce with your order. Chili oil was better with the cauliflower.

Back in the pre-COVID world, this used to be my go to place for Indian meals during lunch. I realized how much I missed this place after grabbing a quick meal after more than 2 yrs. Staff was very friendly, I was dining in for the first time and they got me food to the table, which was a surprise as I always thought of this place as sef service.

I had the golden chicken curry with quinoa and greens. Curry was very light with coconut flavor and the chicken breast was very well cooked.

I highly recommend this place for anyone looking to try healthy fusion Indian food.

I wish I still worked in this area, because I would come here for lunch more often, especially when I want quick Indian Food without feeling the heaviness from it.

I like how the menu is simple with basically a protein dish on top of a bed of rice, salad, quinoa, or mix and match. I got the Chicken Tikka Masala over basmati and salad.

I would definitely come here again if I'm ever in the area.

Ever since @inday_nyc is back open, I am addicted to their bowls! Especially the miso salmon bowl. We got the veg indian buffet bowl (with basmati rice, summer greens, spiced chickpeas, roasted cauliflower, cucumbers and cilantro chutney) and Miso salmon bowl (loved it! Miso salmon, napa cabbage, ginger miso dressing, coconut summer beans, INDAY slaw and superseed crisp). I got this twice in a week and wasn't disappointed
Ps: Also get their sparking brewed tea! It goes perfectly with their bowls

Cold food in the winter day is not what I should have been served while dining indoors.
I ordered Complete Macro Bowl and, all are pre-maid components, simply added into a bowl, including cold quinoa, and items that must be hot - the Cauli-quinoa salad and  coconut chickpea curry are barely over room temperature.
Ruined experience.
FYI, I know Indian cuisine pretty well, and this is no-go stile.
I really like the tamarind glazed salmon and the macro bowl. The food is fresh and the service is good.

Great lunch place in NY for a fast and fresh lunch yet has some space to sit and relax. Enjoyed a late lunch on our first day in NY. Appreciated the bright flavors and quality ingredients. Service was friendly.

Incredible food! I can't say enough about how delicious our meal was. We each got a different item- and we loved all our entrees. Friendly staff, fast service and very clean. Don't forget to get a brownie too- amazing.

Inday is the perfect lunch bowl in the neighborhood for someone who loves and appreciates Indian flavors. The chicken bowls are very well flavored without being too heavy and you can pretty much add in any toppings you want. The restaurant itself is super cute and a nice, quiet place to hang out at lunch hour. Highly recommend!
I've been getting the tamarind salmon and it's just very consistently delicious everytime, fast and easy takeout experience with their app! Definitely recommend
Consistently excellent fast casual indian and indian fusion fare. Great service. Fast delivery. Carefully selected ingredients.

Update: While I never heard back from the owner after shooting him over an email he kept on his promise of bringing back the charred chicken. So happy. Their signature menu seriously deliver in the flavor department, but it would be awesome if they offered customizable options. Which I believe they have at their Nomad location.

Although it's a bit of a splurge at $13+ for a weekday lunch their bowls are so so worth it.
Delicious! Fresh and so wonderfully flavorful. What a surprise and treat!  The plant based lamb dish with fresh mint and yogurt was amazing. Chicken Tikka Masala also fabulous

Was in the area, while walking by noticed inday liked the ambience and walked in because your girl was getting hangry! They checked my vaccine card and proceeded to take my order. Everything seemed very healthy with a twist of Indian cuisine. I got the holy maco with chicken. The service was very fast which I appreciated. Was so delicious and flavorful! Will definitely come back.

4.5 stars - found a new lunch spot steps from Grand Central.  Just opened about two months ago and the lines are out the door!  I can taste why -- lots of flavor combinations here.  Indeed a kick to your taste buds.  Love at first bite!!

I am so digging my Golden Curry chicken lunch bowl - eating as I type this.  This is a pre-set meal not something I customized but customization is available.  You can select the base and then start adding things.  Not as economical as ordering a pre-set - just saying.  My first bite was the garlic chips, on purpose (love them and can't get enough - so crispy and delish).  Then I tasted the curry with some long grain basmati rice - an explosion of delicious flavors in my mouth.  I purposely picked each bite to taste the curry on its own *(can't get over that it's dairy free?!), the turmeric spice, and the pickled carrots and cucumbers.  Yummy altogether.

Next bite, I mixed some of the green salad and grilled chicken - sweet and smoky at the same time.  Almost like a teriyaki chicken but without the visible appearance of sauce.  That marinade is really good.  Anyway, all mixed together, it packs some heat from the spice but not a five alarm heat - just to tickle your tongue.  :-)  Am pleased with my choice.  

Management - Can you sell the garlic chips as an extra topping or somehow package it on the side for a little extra cost?  Loved them.  Completed the dish in both appearance and taste.  Will return to try the slow braised spring lamb ... drool!

i'm visiting new york and decided to try inday, not knowing it was a fusion restaurant.

i got the golden chicken curry. it was creamy and very flavorful. the cilantro added another kick of flavor, but was not over powering. i also liked the rice because it didn't stick together, unlike rice i am used to.

also, since i did take out the food was tepid.

Meh. Fast casual Indian food sounded tasty. Wasn't so great, though. Unlike most Chipotle-style places, you're not customizing your order. Pick a meal, and that comes with a designated meat and toppings. If you want to remove some things, okay, but it really seemed like they just wanted you to order one of the premade things off the menu.

Meat? Awful. Practically inedible chicken, hard and dry. The rest of the bowl was alright, but if you can't get the protein cooked right, why bother?
It's one of my faves! So fresh, tasty, and satisfying! It's reminiscent of an Indian inspired healthy bowls! Chicken Curry and Tikka Masala are my go to!

I got the chicken tikka masala over basmati rice and salad. I'd say it was good for take out lunch but not as full of flavor as I've had at other restaurants. I would come back here if I was in the area.

I came here on a whim after the sweetgreen nearby was closed and ordered the Chana with basmati. It was super delicious!

I wish the ratio of Chana curry to rice was a bit higher but even the rice was packed with tons of flavor - so I'm not complaining!

Though I got my order to go, I did order inside and the staff were super nice. Moreover, the dine in area was super nice and clean. It looked like they took the time to keep it spotless

All the items look good here tbh... will be back to order more delicious cuisine!

One of my favorite new lunch spots. Nothing like having a filling delicious lunch and not wanting to fall asleep at 2pm.

I actually ordered 2 times in one week here. Both times the chicken curry bowl, once with cauliflower rice and the second time with quinoa (and the banana bread because it looked yummy when I saw it.

The curry bowl was super flavorful but not overwhelming or over seasoned. The juicy tomatoes and fresh cucumber gave the bowl a lot of flavor contrast that I love. The portion I also found very satisfying. The vegan banana bread was also super moist.

The place looked very big and airy. But It does seem a little disorganized for ordering there-I can see it getting pretty hectic when it's packed.

All in all the food is delicious I can't wait to try something else I was very impressed by the quality and flavor. I can definitely see this becoming one of my favorite lunch spots!

Inday is a great midtown lunch option if you're on the go and looking for flavor!! Most of the options are great and they do have several great vegetarian options. It's quick and healthy. Sadly they are closed right now for the pandemic but I can't wait to order lunch for them and walk over to the park to eat outside in the spring!

Inday has taken over a spot that I have seen occupied by at least three other restaurants over the past decade or so.  Inday's philosophy appears to revolve around dishes with clean ingredients.  There is not a heavy reliance on heavily processed foods.  Instead, they make bowls to order that focus on vegetables with proteins of your choice added in.  The space is mostly designed for the lunch crowd with plenty of room for people to run in and out on their breaks.  The interior has an almost retro-futuristic vibe to it, with a lot of white but lighting that feels like it could have come out of a scifi movie made in the 60's.

The staff is very efficient and reminds you that they are a card only shop as you wait on line.  I heavily recommend knowing what you want ahead of time so you don't wind up being the "blockage" on the line.  I wound up ordering the charred chicken bowl (both gluten and dairy free) which their site describes as "Our healthy twist on the halal-cart classic | antibiotic-free chicken thigh oven roasted to perfection. comes with romaine hearts, pickled cabbage, pickled onions, cucumbers, coconut tahini, chili sauce, crispy shallots, cilantro. served over your choice of base".  For my base I chose cauliflower "rice".

Much to my surprise, except for the meat, the entire base (even the cauliflower) appeared to be raw.  It is *possible* the cauliflower was poached slightly, but everything was crunchier than I expected.  That said, the dish was very tasty and their hot sauce (which you can load up on while you wait) is actually much spicier than I had expected!

Inday was a nice change of pace from my usual lunch and I would recommend it for anyone looking for something lighter and brighter than your normal lunch time fare.

My favorite lunch option when I'm in the office. As a person with celiac disease, I'm so grateful to have this as a gluten free fast casual spot so close by! I've tried so many options and all have been great. The staff are friendly and reliable. Love this spot.
Great food with healthy choices.  Love their salmon and all the sauces.  Made fresh each order and the whole place appeared very clean food managed.

Good sit down lunch spot with coworkers.  

Filling bowl portions.  It reminds me of a Dig Inn/Chipotle with Indian inspired flavors.
Delicious! Fresh and so wonderfully flavorful. What a surprise and treat!  The plant based lamb dish with fresh mint and yogurt was amazing. Chicken Tikka Masala also fabulous!

I haven't tried their bowls yet, but L was thirsty so we ordered some drinks. It says it helps detox your body, but the LemonAid and the Arnold Karma were just so strong. It has a lot of spices and cayenne in it, so it's not something I'd want to drink on a hot day to refresh my body. It's literally drinking a spicy sour drink. I did not feel good after drinking this. I was so bloated and maybe it gave me heartburn. L had a sip and couldn't have more since the drink wasn't that cold at the time. It definitely tasted better over a ton of ice and watered down. I would not recommend it.
2.5 stars for the drinks. Since I haven't tried the bowls yet, I'm rounding it up to 3 stars.

It's my go to comfort food place inside Urban space... Their green felafal with chia seed roti is something I can eat every day of the week. I think they add lots of ghee (clarified butter) to their chia seed dough and that really does the trick (I could be wrong though)
The green felafals are soft, well made and are simply delicious.
I wish they could share their secret recipe.

Inday is good food. Not just good food for a fast casual place, but overall good food. It is a creative take on Indian food, making it relatively healthy yet still tasty.

My favorite is the golden curry chicken and it really never disappoints. Consistency is very solid and the place was a huge hit when I worked in midtown.

The portion sizes are a good size and surprisingly, I don't want to take a nap in the middle of the office after eating this (unlike other delicious Indian food). Overall, a very very solid addition to the weekday lunch rotation.

Walked by this place a few times close by my work and finally decided to come and check it out. I saw that it advertised itself as being healthy, gluten free, and had an overall mental well being vibe.

It looks like a lot of people are regulars there. It's card only and the cashier lady seemed to know a lot of people. She was also very happy and the whole staff had good customer service. Despite the fact that the line was long, it moved very fast so make sure you know what you want before you order.

This is a fast casual Indian-American place with different bowls and salads that you can order or customized your own. It's definitely not authentic Indian food. I think the spices and the hot sauce are mild compared to authentic Indian food.  

I got the curry chicken rice bowl. It came with pickled cabbage and onion crisps. The chicken was coated in a curry flavored sauce and the yellow sauce was their tumeric dressing which tasted kinda creamy? This place is healthy and a solid spot for lunch, I was just disappointed because this was the first time I've had Indian food without their traditional bold flavors.

TL;DR: Fast casual Indian spot. Not authentic but is healthy and will fill you. Card only and friendly customer service.

Came here during weekday lunch. The line to order and pay was quick and easy. I had the Golden Curry Chicken over salad greens without raisins and crispy shallots. It cost a little over $11.

My bowl was delicious and full of flavor! There was plenty of warm tender dark meat chicken soaked in this wonderful orange sauce that I can't describe. I didn't enjoy the yellow curry mayo that goes around the bowl but I devoured the rest. The spice level was medium. The green hot sauce that they provide on the side really gave an extra kick so be careful.

I also loved how it was gluten and dairy free. Def worth a try!

I have mixed feelings about Inday. I love the concept, and when they have great dishes, they really knock things out of the park! But the service is mixed and I wasn't a fan of the chickpea curry. The golden chicken and grilled chicken bowls are fantastic, and I love that they have cauliflower rice! So if you're not vegetarian, get the chicken bowls!

The chickpea curry is bland, and they messed up my order (I had to walk back to swap out the food). They also messed up my friend's order. The employees don't seem to know what has cilantro and what doesn't. I specifically ask each time whether a dish has cilantro, and I get different answers. Today they told me the chickpea curry had none (FYI fellow cilantro haters, this does, and it has a lot of it). My friend didn't like the curry bowl either, for different reasons.

The desserts leave much to be desired. I'm a fan of healthy desserts, but they taste like cardboard...

This is my GO TO lunch spot whenever I'm craving a good meal.

For the amount of food and flavor you get, this is so worth it. I usually get delivery from this, which has been a hit and miss with the way they plate things. However, the quality of the food does not suffer!

I've gone to their storefront just once and it's pretty crowded, so I'll probably just get delivery going forward.

Inday? More like "in-haaaaay!"

Delicious and completely gluten-free. I just wish there were more locations. Will definitely be back. Love the healthy and delicious options. Great for celiacs.

Inside is very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Also love the bright decor.

I was walking by and saw this place and OMG why didn't I see it before. Their food is amazing, their curries are the best pick me up lunch. Service is fast and their team members are so polite. Order in the app because they can get busy ! Hope you enjoy it as much as I do.

I really love the indian inspired chipotle like food here.

But I do have to say that ordering from the menu is so so so much better than the mealpal options. It's not that the mealpal options are different food options from the regular orders but it's because they prepare all the mealpal orders much earlier than the pickup that by the time you pick it, it's not nearly as good anymore.

If you're expecting "authenic" indian food tho, you should go somewhere else. This by all means was not meant to be authenic.
Food taste fresh and clean...flavors of India with a fusion ... really supports my diet
You might miss it when walking past. Great and healthy salads and bowls. Friendly staff and fast service!

Five stars for lunch, let's goooooo! My fellow midtowners know a great lunch can be a make or break in a mediocre-to-bad work day. Inday has mastered the lunch niche of healthy but not bland, flavorful but not doused or busy, filling but not coma-inducing, and affordable but not sketchy-quality.

Seriously. All. Bases. Covered.

The chicken bowl with quinoa is now a staple in my lunch rotation!

Ordered inday on seamless for lunch. Really enjoyed this! Felt reasonably healthy and didn't taste like a bunch of junk was added in. Went with a grilled chicken bowl with basmati rice, cabbage, some other veggies and charred curries cauliflower. Would definitely try more if their bowls soon!

Il Tinello is the most authentic Italian restaurant I have been to in Midtown. From the Cacio e Pepe being cooked table side to the veal chop cooked to perfection, the whole experience was worth every penny. Benny the owner is a class act who takes care of everyone who walks through the door, and Ray, the waiter, takes care of everything you need. I highly recommend visiting this restaurant. You won't regret it.

IL TINELLO EAST is a classic midtown Manhattan Ristorante with a retro vibe.   Frank Sinatra and his Rat Pack would love this hidden treasure.

Upon arriving, we immediately received a warm welcome from the owner, Benny, and hostess, Denetria.  While listening to soft standards music in the background; we enjoyed a well-crafted martini and a lovely Prosecco poured by Miss Mixologist, Arta.

We recommend guests stop by the cozy bar for a leisurely cocktail before dinner and or a dessert after dining.
 
Flaming Bananas Foster with strawberries tuck in if it's your choice, is served tableside.  Benny really delivered this show-stopping dessert.

The lasagna (when available) and shrimp scampi was full of favor ... noodles were the perfect texture.  A pleasant culinary experience.

They offered a complimentary cordial, Grappa, after our dining experience.  That makes the Ristorante extra special besides the congenial and efficient wait-staff.

Don't miss the authentic Italiano cuisine professionally provided by IL Tinello East.  Buon Appetito!

We'll joyfully return to our new Italiano Famiglia in September 2024.

"Mama Bear" and Reggie.
Three Visits in October 2023

A lot of fancy restaurants make a big show of good manners and formality, but it's just to impress you.  So I was a bit skeptical.   But at Il Tinello it became clear that their elegant hospitality is genuine and motivated by their desire to serve you.  

We just wanted a small late-night bite, as we'd had a late lunch, and Tinello was close by.  We asked as we walked in if that was OK.  They were very gracious --although it's clearly not a casual dining place-- brought delicious roasted vegetables and bruschetta to munch on as we ordered.  My husband had a superb glass of rose with our very light apps and a side.  To finish they surprised us with a complimentary glass of grappa!  We will def be back.

Il Tinello is one of the finest Italian restaurants in NYC. The service is impressive and impeccable.  The ambiance is warm and welcoming especially when you are greeted by the professional staff.  I had the Branzino and it was the best I ever had.

Discovered what is going to be a great neighborhood gem serving classic Italian cuisine with on point service and great cocktails in
A cozy environment.

I really enjoyed the food and the focus
Of the service on getting the simple things right - as I entered the restaurant a couple walking out stopped to tell myself and my fellow diner how good the food was - as well as the martini's mixed by AJ.  Well the food did not disappoint - the spaghetti carbonara recommended by the departing guests was quite excellent, as were the other dishes.  Great work!

Food was excellent. Service was amazing. Benny is THE MAN! We were given complimentary umbrellas because it was raining. We got the table side Caesar salad. It was so good. My wife got the rigatoni with eggplant and fresh mozzarella, I got the Branzino special. It was quite possibly the best fish dish I've ever had, and they remove the filet from the whole fish removing the bones. I now know why this place routinely gets 5 star reviews. It earns them. We'll definitely be back

For me to come on here and write a review takes a lot. Let's start with the service: we were seated right away. The entire staff was inviting and really made you feel at home while maintaining professionalism.  They never rushed you out of your seat or to hurry you to place your order.

The ambiance: was great. My mom and I went at 7:30pm so it was nice to go into a restaurant that has dim lighting. Not only that it felt very high scale.

The food: out of this world. That's all I have to say. New York has the best food in the world. They served real Italian dishes. Not only that, most dishes weren't that badly priced. The quality of the food was great and had left overs.

By far one of the best Italian restaurants in NYC in my opinion. Not a tourist trap. This place is a must-try and will deff be back for our next trip.

Hey they gave me some amuse bouches that certainly amused my mouth.  A spicy pickled pepper, grilled zucchini and some type of tomato sauce along with a bruschetta and a bread basket; all that before I ordered my meal. I had penne with portobello mushroom and fresh tomato in a garlic butter sauce.  Decadent! The service was attentive without being intrusive.  After the main plate I was given an almond cookie and a biscotti which were both excellent. So much so I asked if they sold them separately.  The waiter said yes, brought me several in a to go box and didn't add them to my bill.
The ambience is all dark wood, leather and muted lighting. Typical without being typical. Classic, not stuffy.  I would definitely go back.

Excellent food, service and ambiance. We came on a very rainy night with flooding, after the the rain and we were lucky to get in but did due to cancellations. We had the sweet and sour Calamari which was very good. We had the mushroom risotto (best we've ever had) and sea bass special (very good but perhaps overpriced). After three glasses of wine, two anisettes and chocolate cake plus espresso the bill was over $300 with tip. This is fine dining without the stuffy attitudes.

The best way to seafood is the fish sauce. I like to cook the fish in fishing boats.
Thank you, Dr. Jacqueline Sacco MD PhD

We had a lovely dinner tonight! Intimate restaurant. Burrata, osso bucco, ravioli & tiramisu were all fabulous!  The owner, waiters and staff and gracious and took good care of us. We even had some grappa at the end which was a nice touch! Highly recommend.

Walking inside this East Side establishment instantly made me think of almost any old Italian gangster movie you can think of. It also immediately conjured up thoughts of Frank Sinatra. So right there is the vibe you're gonna work with.

But let's get to the food and service. First off, the entire staff is dressed impeccably. White jackets, pressed pants. This is top notch, top tier, fine dining. And every single team member paid us wonderful attention. Kudos to all of them for making it feel like a really wonderful restaurant experience.

Now, the food. I'll preface it by saying I went out with a large group and there was a lot of food. The pics posted here are all the plates I was able to take pictures of. There were a lot more I, unfortunately, missed.

First off, their carpaccio salad was incredible. Fresh, delicious & the beef was tender and packed with a nice subtle flavor. Great way to start the meal.

Their veal parmigiano was incredible. Not only was the size amazing for the price they charge, but it was unbelievably delicious. The tomato sauce was unreal.

Their octopus salad is a can't miss. I wish I had more of it, but I had to share it with several people. Pro-tip: order it for yourself and yourself only.

The vongole was superb. The little neck clams were on point and the garlic & oil was to die for. So. Damn. Good.

And oh man, their ossobuco was absolutely glorious. Tender, fall off the bone meat. Just so fantastically delicious.

Last but not least is their filetto pork tenderloin smothered in a balsamic reduction sauce that was absolutely incredible. This was the juiciest piece of pork I've had in a very long time.

All in all, this was an incredible dining experience and one I give a wholehearted recommendation to.

This was just a great Dinner , from beginning to end I completely enjoy it , the atmosphere and decor was delightful so clean and neat from the staff to service.
The food was just fresh and delicious I had the whole branzino over roasted with fresh herbs deboned table side with final touch of olive oil, was amazing the Ossobuco with risotto also was a great choice.
Tradicional homemade tiramisu so fresh , in all we had an beautiful Dinner .ll Tinello will be in top of my list  , manager Benny was very attentive and in top of the service see you soon!!!
Food is always amazing and the service is unmatched. No matter if you go weekly or it's your first time, they really treat you!

I'm rarely near 3rd avenue, but i know have a reason to be when I'm in the mode for great Italian food and service.
I started my meal with the calamari, very generous portions, more than enough to share and it was very good, I tend to order calamari at every place that serves it and Il Tinello East's was some of the best I've had.
My main was the crab capenilli, again they didn't scrimp on the portions of either the pasta or crab.
If your looking for a nice place, with an intimate feel, fast and attentive service near the Eastside, I heartly recommend.

I'm over 50. I was born and raised in NY. I'm 1/2 Sicilian and half Napolitano. I love food. I love wine. This is a review you can absolutely know comes from a qualified and trustworthy source.
Last night my wife and I moved out two daughters into their new apartment. For weeks before move-in date I knew that Il Tinello was on their street as I had been scoping the area. I had been on their site days before just to look over the menu and was impressed enough to think that this would be a nice place for my wife and to take our girls out for their first night in their new place. However, what I didn't realize is that we would be hot, sweaty and likely under-dressed for us to walk into this beautiful ristorante. Nonetheless I walked in and was greeted by the owner, Benny, who was dressed to the nines in a handsome suit . I explained that we had just completed a move and would've loved to join him for dinner but we were probably under-dressed for the lovely dining room. Benny would have none of it. He said that he would love to have us for dinner and would give us a nice quiet table for four. Done! I got my wife and daughters and Benny introduced himself to everyone and escorted us to our table.
The wine list was absolutely amazing. Great varietals and vintages. We ordered two appetizers and four entrees and EVERY SINGLE ONE of them were absolutely delicious. The service was outstanding...attentive but not intrusive.
I hugged Benny when we left, thanked him for his warm hospitality and extraordinary food. There is absolutely no way you can keep me from going to Il Tinello the next time I in the area visiting my daughters. Only next time, I'll dress a little better ;)

I've eaten at many five-star restaurants, and a half-dozen or so Michelin star ones.  I wholeheartedly recommend Il Tinello, it's superb.  While the menu is adventurous and interesting , it is also pleasingly simple.  There are nine sections, each with only a few items:  Antipasti, Zuppe, Insalate, Pasta, Risotto, Pollo, Carni, Pesce and Legumi.  You will not be shocked by most of the offerings, you will have seen these before (though some of them you will have not).  I recommend looking at their menu via the link here on Yelp.

The important point, though, is that they are all done superbly.  The rigatoni with roasted eggplant, fresh tomato, basil, diced buffalo mozzarella is a dish we all know.  However, it's also the best version of that dish I've ever had.  And so on, for other menu items.

Paired with the superb food (and delicious wine list - a whole other topic) are the old-world good manners and sincere commitment to hospitality and generosity of Il Tinello's owner Benny and his captain Ray.  Both are deeply experienced, career restaurant professionals and this is clearly a labor of love for them.  It is clear to me from my several visits that they have a deeply devoted, local customer base, but I have spoken there with tourists as well (treated with complete, welcoming respect) who are delighted to find such a worldly and *human* place in Midtown Manhattan.

I cannot think of an Italian restaurant in NYC that I would recommend going to before you go to this one.

Wow, wow, and wow again. Not to sound like a food snob but I've eaten in many Michelin starred ristorantes in Italy. You name them I've  eaten there. Life has been good to me. And I'm always appreciative. Well tonite we tried 3 month old Il Tinello. By far the BEST food we've had in NYC bar none. Ray was amazing and he treated us like family. The food is second to none. I am amazed that this place still has tables available. I cried when I ate. My wife said do not cry because you might miss your mouth. Do not miss the opportunity to explore the menu at this most innovative Italian eatery. Benny G. Bello should be proud of his achievements with this eatery. We will be back.
Ciao,
Remy

We had such a great experience at this restaurant. I can't recommend it enough! All the staff were friendly and welcoming, particularly the maître d, Benny, (I think) and our bartender, AJ, who, by the way, made excellent cocktails! The coffee martini was a standout as well as the lychee martini!
Just the right ambience for dinner and the food was delivered promptly and was delicious ( I had the veal parmigiana, yum!).
I've already recommended this place to my friends who are visiting as well as my family who are NY residents. Do yourself a favor and dine here. It's not too often that I write a rave review but Il Tinello East checked all the boxes.

Walked by this new neighborhood spot but could never get a seat until tonight. AJ greeted me at the bar with a nice martini on a rainy night :).

Love the old school music and vibes and looking forward to bringing more  family and friends. Benny G Bello and his team are doing a great job!

I have not written a review in a bit but I had to break my silence for Il Tinello.  This is a first class establishment.  Intimate setting, warm and inviting staff and a perfect menu.  The eggplant rollatini melted in my mouth. The sauce it was in tasted like it was made by someone's nonna.  The orecchiette was fresh and cooked perfectly.  The owner was so happy to have us there. I am rambling but you get it. I can't wait to go back.

OMG...What a great real Italian restaurant!  My wife and I went there because it was near our hotel and it had great reviews on yelp.  Little did we know it was going to be a piece of old  Italy on the East side of Midtown in Manhattan. They started us with free appetizers that were scrumptious and  presented us with wonderful cocktails.  The waiters were elegantly dressed and took care of us at every turn.  My wife ordered veal parmigiana and I ordered seafood and pasta.  Both were outstanding.  I then ordered my customary B and B and coffee. The waiter also brought me me his own concoction  o Grappa which changed my after dinner forever.  Benny the owner stoped by several times and inquired if we were enjoying our meal.  Needless to say it was the best true Italian meal I ever ate.

The service is amazing. The hospitality is great. It's so busy but they accommodate you to the fullest. Tonight for a Wednesday it was busy but they made sure we were comfortable and could tell the other people were having a good time. The bartender Arta is 100/10 she takes her time with drinks and makes you feel like you are the only one there. Thank you so much.
I was delighted with my dinner at Il Tinello East, the crispy Calamari were excellent as were the pasta carbonara and the chocolate cake. Everything was perfect.

I don't want to write this review as I would like to keep it a secret but in good conscience I can't. It was a highlight of our visit. An intimate restaurant with a welcoming staff that made you feel like family. Family that knows how to take care of you and promptly.
Food was five star worthy as was the presentation. From the Caesar salad prepared at the table,pasta Vongole and pasta with eggplant , perfect portions and delicious. Topped it off with cappuccino and profiteroles.
A neighborhood gem but shhh.... Don't tell anyone.

This restaurant  is fabulous. Tiny and intimate, you are greeted with bruschetta, eggplant, peppers, sauce, and bread as you are seated. Service was beyond excellent, and food amazing. The staff made you feel as though you were family. We ordered the special veal meatball appetizer, lobster ravioli, pasta with sausage and broccoli rabe. All were delicious. For dessert, we had the table side banana flambé and house made tiramisu. I've been to Italy and this tiramisu was better!!! We we come back when in NYC again.

We felt like we were part of the family and thoroughly enjoyed Ray, Julio, Benny, and the extended clan. The food and drink was SUPERB!  We're only in town for 5 days and will definitely go back again. Cheers!

This is my go to restaurant in the neighborhood for its consistency and fine welcoming service.  The highlight for me is the sublime cacio e pepe, often prepared at the table with flourish by the owner himself, Benny, a spirited and warm raconteur. With its coating of parmesan and grated pepper, mixed in a hollow wheel of pecorino romano, the dish is creamy, salty, spicy, and so so satisfying all at the same time. One of those dishes that your friends ask for a taste.  A glass of the house chianti rounds it out every time.
Amazing food and service!! The ambiance is great. The staff is very welcoming. 100% recommended. So much food to try but what's why I keep coming over. There is so much to try!!

I went to the West location over ten years ago, so I figured I'd try their newly opened location IL Tinello East. All I have to say is AMAZING!!! Extremely friendly and professional staff to go with one of the best Ciao de pepes I've ever had, made table side. The baked clams, Caesar salad for two and Bucatini Amatriciana are a must. Homemade Tiramisu was out of this world. I will definitely be returning soon.
Fantastic neighborhood spot.. Came in on a Wednesday night and it was lively. Loved their tableside caesar & cacio pepe.
Delicious dinner and fantastic service.  Very friendly atmosphere.  Loved the pear salad and veal. Thanks for a great evening. I will be back

Best service, food and drinks. Just an amazing time!!!!!
Everyone is so friendly and you will not regret coming here

Tried this a few weeks ago with my wife. Its a great addition to the neighborhood -- very good food, nice drinks, and impeccable service. The owner Benny is very welcoming and professional. There's another sister restaurant located over by 5th Avenue which is also very good. We look forward to being regulars at this place.
THE BEST. If you're looking for traditional delicious Italian in midtown this is the spot! Table side Caesar salad was my FAV! 10/10 would rec!

One of best service restaurants that we've ever been to.  It was five star.
Also, Very nice ambiance.
The food was well prepared and good, but not special. Had the baked clams as
Appetizer, then pear salad (pears too hard and tasteless).  Main courses were
Linguine vongole and eggplant with rigatoni.  Both good, but not unique.
They had on the table a wonderful tapenade with bread, as well as marinated
Eggplant with spicy peppers.  The peppers were way too spicy.  They should have
substituted olives. The Cabernet by the glass was surprisingly good, but pricy, $18
a glass.  
We are going back, maybe monthly, but for the service rather than the food.

This is the place to go for forgotten old world charm waitstaff and excellent Italian food.  A great deal of attention is given to every plate that is put before you. The chef has a wonderful talent of coaxing sublime flavors out of even the most simple preparations. An example was the roasted hot pepper and zucchini  small plate and exquisite caponata delivered with the bread while we pondered our menu. The calamari appetizer is perfection, and very generous.  They have a wide selection of carefully prepared fish, as well as wonderful pastas, meats, and chicken. You will find yourself delighted with your meal, and longing to come back to savor all the other items on the menu you wanted to choose. Don't pass this place up if you appreciate wonderful Italian cuisine.

Great food and even better service !
Ray really took care of us on my daughters birthday

Had an amazing experience here with my sister the other night. We came for dinner and we were not disappointed. Hats off to the kindest staffs and for recommending some great dishes. While we were there, we saw people having business dinners, family outing and romantic dinner dates. The place is great for any occasions. Lastly, they made our desserts right in front of us and it was quite the show. Definitely recommend this place!
Outstanding and delicious menu that is elegantly and perfectly presented in a classy ambiance. .

Love this place.    Just opened a few weeks ago and have come back many times and tried different dishes each time.  The staff is amazing and the food is even better then the staff.  Large portions, great flavor, good prices. Highly recommend.

Nothing but amazing things to say about this restaurant. Benny is a true host who makes you feel right at home. Great hospitality, great atmosphere and great food. I will be returning here for multiple future meals. Make sure to save room for all the incredible food.

Every time I am in New York I get dinner here. Benny the owner is a consistently gracious host who amplifies the restaurant experience. They have excellent daily specials and I have never had a meal less than amazing.
Food was excellent (had a delicious pasta). Staff was friendly and helpful with menu. Restaurant space was lovely and nice and clean. Busy even on a weekday. A bit pricey though.
Such great service and food! Ray is fantastic and treats you like family! Marco was excellent as well! We can't wait to go back time and time again!
Not really authentic italian food. My plate was salty and the seafood not very high quality
Food is absolutely wonderful. Atmosphere is even better. Sit at the bar and AJ is a great bartender! We will definitely become regulars!
I have yet to been to a restaurant that has such impeccable service. From start to finish. 5-star Italian food!

Wow! Walked in to a beautiful little slice of Italy in busy NYC. We needed a warm and welcoming meal after spending much time in the cold. Came across great reviews for real Italian cuisine and this one hit the top of our list. We stopped in and were immediately greeted and sat upon arrival. Service was warm & welcoming. The amount of just complimentary starters were surprising. My crew ordered the special Barrata. It was rich and creamy. We also ordered a pasta dish and the chicken sorrentino. Both were outstanding. Pasta was authentic and cooked al dente. Our friend had dietary needs that were met with ease and was extremely Happy with his meal. The young gentleman Benny was a pleasure. He ensured consistently through our meal that our experience was top notch. He also surprised us with tastings that were incredible. We are local and will be back to see this hidden gem again! Being in the industry myself, this was a 5 star review hands down. I can't thank this team enough for making our nights end, the best possible venture !

Run don't walk. The food was incredible from the minute we sat down. They present an amuse bouche upon arrival and that first bite said it all.  It was a little toast with bruschetta on top and a plate of roasted peppers and zucchini. They also brought caponata and a bread basked out too!  Very simple ingredients prepared to perfection.  Seasoned perfectly and an excellent start to the evening.  The wine menu is great, but the knowledge of our server Ray made it even better. They had tons of specials, all of them sounded outstanding.  We opted for a table side Caesar salad, Capellini with lump crab and eggplant parmesan.  The salad station arrived at our table where we were asked if we had a preference on garlic, anchovy's etc.  Next thing you know this fresh, perfectly seasoned, deliciously dressed salad arrived in front of us.  Not one leaf of lettuce was left.  We ate it all.  Then our main courses came out.  Food was hot, and prepared to perfection.  While the food speaks for itself.  The real treasure here is the team work.  This restaurant is like watching an orchestra perform.  Everyone works together in perfect harmony to provide an experience like no other.  They take care of you from the minute you walk in until the minute you leave. You want for nothing. Benny and his team are genuine and sincere in their dedication to your experience.  I cannot stop thinking about the food & experience, and look forward to visiting again so I can try more of their perfectly prepared dishes. Thank you to Ray, Benny and the rest of the team for the care of not only us but also the ingredients you prepare.

I have to admit, Iron Sushi was actually epic. Location and service was great. These guys certainly have a great menu too. I became good friends with the staff, who are all awesome and super courteous. Liked it and I would recommend it to any of my friends.
Don't come to this place, uneducated and rude workers (I think she might be the owner), bad smell fish, not even worth for half star

I recently ordered from Iron Sushi for pick up. I was highly disappointed with their food. I ordered the chicken teriyaki dinner bento box. The chicken was very dry and not that flavorful. It came with very little vegetables. I've had bento boxes before and they weren't as boring as this one unfortunately.
Sure to satisfy at any event. kind and professional.  The food and service was unmatched.

The food was delicious and freshly made. Hummus, baba ganoush were top quality, and manti just delicious. The place is very clean and modern and the restroom very tidy and nice and looked like it had been renovated yesterday, which is quite exceptional in NYC. Staff was nice too.

This place just wow . Had someone take us here for a large group graduation dinner.

The ambience is beautiful . The music is light and romantic and the seating is cozy quiet and very elegant .

I can't remember the name of the red wine we got but it was absolutely delicious .

We got quite a few of the starters . I got the Il Monello salad which had arugula goat cheese
shaved pears, grapes, toasted almond flakes, with a delicious lemon truffle dressing. I absolutely recommend getting this . My friend tried the wedge salad which was also quite good. The mozzarella and tomato was on point . They got the calamari and the carpaccio de manzo which I didn't try.

We got a dozen of the east coast oysters on the half shell and they were absolutely perfect.  

For the mains I got their dover sole which came with a beautiful lemon white wine sauce and capers . But the star of the show was probably the filet mignon which came with this absolutely amazingly delicious peppercorn sauce which I still have dreams about . I'd go back just to try that amazing sauce . I wish I knew what was in it. It's so good.

Their dessert although with a lot of choices was quite basic. I tried their tiramisu which was good and quite boozy. But their lava cake was better . I wish I had ordered their crème brûlée instead . I also tried a sip of their homemade lemoncello which was one of the best I've tasted .

All in all I would most defn get the Il Monello salad , the oysters, the steak with the sauce and the lemoncello . You have to try these items .

Nothing remotely special to see here. Average food with way overpriced prices. I would recommend Da Raffaele or La Pecora if you're looking for better Italian food and better people to give your money to in this area.

The waiters are incredibly disrespectful and rude to the neighboring buildings. They smoke, spit, and take their breaks in a disruptive manner in front of the local apartment buildings. This restaurant doesn't own the block. Very disappointing to witness.

Ok just finished at the dental surgeon down the block. I go to get my car and spot this place across the street. I've been a brave boy, so I'm going to reward myself!! So in I go!
The Maitr'd tells me to sit anywhere I'd like
I find a nice table and my waiter comes right over I recommends a half bottle of Brunello
Ah this wine is just so perfect.
Ok don't laugh...I go with the familiar pollo parmigiana.
It comes and it looks just delicious. Which it is!
And a healthy portion.
Really perfectly done.  
This is a delightful experience. The only thing some people wouldn't like being on the street, with passersby gawking at their food.  Not me I just smile and wave    Especially greeting all the dogs walking by.  One especially friendly Enzo a beautiful rust cavapoo
So I'm just loving this experience.  Vincenzo my waiter is the best!!

What a great experience for our party of six enjoying the delicious classic Italian cuisine on the blistering cold Saturday night. Excellent service greeted by the gracious host & friendly   coat check staff. Intimate ambiance, humming sound of 60s music , & our friendly & delightful server. His wine recommendations were excellent, attention to details were just perfect  enhancing our dining experience to the fullest. We giggled & laughed whenever he cracked jokes in his delightfully accented Italian-English. The timing of the service was a piece of art , so effective & seemingly effortless.  A true gem to enjoy the classic Italian cuisine . Highly recommend.

We were searching for something new to eat in the neighborhood, and found a Post article about this restaurant's history, and how a young man emigrated to the U.S., became a  busboy at this restaurant (at its former location on 76th), and eventually took over when the previous owner returned.  The restaurant closed back in 2008 because of rent hikes, but just resurrected at this new location!

What an inspiring story!

They're still ironing out some kinks in the new space, but everyone is suuuper friendly and helpful.  We had a chance to meet with and chat with both owners.  Down to earth, grateful and gracious, and salt-of-the-earth people.  Even the hosttess made a point to introduce us to the owner of the article fame before we left (we had chatted with the other partner when we arrived).

The food was delicious.  Flat out, without exaggeration, the best orrechiete we've ever had.  My ravioli were delicious as well, and all the pasta were perfectly cooked.

My one point of pause (and only thing keeping me from giving a full 5-star review) was the wine list.  It wasn't published online, so we had no idea what their offerings were, so we brought a bottle just in case.  When we saw the printed list, it was fair, but nothing to write home (or to yelp) about.  We were told that they'll spruce up the list and add to the collection and cellar as they're able.  In the meantime, we figured we might as well open the bottle we brought, since it was going to be more enjoyable than most of the offerings on the list.  What do y'all think is reasonable corkage?  $25? $30?  I typically balk and frown when it gets up to $35 and $40.  But never have ao seen a place that charges $50 for corkage.  Oof.  The thought behind that?  "We want to discourage people from bringing their own wine and to drink the wine on our list."   OK, well, maybe you lean in that direction once you have a more palatable list.

We'll definitely be back, and hopefully, the wine list will have grown (and/or) the corkage becomes more reasonable.  Once one of those happens, I'll happily revise my review and add that last star.

New restaurant with some good reviews so we popped in.  We won't be back. First off host tried to seat us at a table by the wait station. We asked for a more romantic table and then he tried to sit us at a table by the kitchen entrance. Finally on the 3rd try he moved us to a more reasonable table.  As to the food, it was meh. The eggplant parmigiana was flavorless. The bianca salad bland.  The cacio e pepe pasta was nice, but plain. We ordered lava cake with ice cream for desert - but there was no lava.  Just chocolate cake with syrup on top. No lava flowed out of the middle.  Bottle of still water is $9 here. In a city filled with great Italian, I see no reason to return here.
A true neighborhood gem. Great food and good vibes! The calamari was so meaty and delicious. I recommend trying the beet salad as well.

This restaurant is amazing and the service is great. You will be seated right away with time to enjoy the beautiful music and ambiance. The food is delicious. It reminds me of when I was in Italy. This is a must come to restaurant. I highly recommend this restaurant. A 10/10.

We went there last Saturday night and we thought the service and food was average for the prices. The atmosphere was very noisy and could hardly hear my dinner partner.Also we paid by credit card and they charged 3% service fee which I think is ridiculous especially it not a cheap restaurant . We don't think we would go back there ,there are other good restaurants in our neighborhood
First time at Il Monello and I will be back.  Everything was on point.  My Martini, the service, the look of the restaurant and of course the food!

Wow!  All I can say is Wow and how amazing it is to have this new restaurant.  The food is outstanding. The service was on point!  Great bar.  Beautifully decorated.  The place is gorgeous!   Go!  All food is made to perfection!

I found myself in the Turtle Bay area last evening and I met the gf for dinner. I went based on the review's of others and my recollection that Il Monello was a popular restaurant once upon a time. The dining room is very handsome, and the tables are widely spaced. We both ordered a Wedge Salad to begin. It was very tasty, and the Bacon bits were cooked just right. I ordered Linguine con Frutti di Mare, and the gf ordered Branzino. Both were delicious. We skipped dessert, but we plan to revisit and sample everything on the menu.

I waited three hours for my food.
Overcharged and it was corrected.
Rude staff and sarcastic .
Food was cold and ok.
Anyway, will not be back there.

C. D.
AMAZING restaurant!! The food was incredible, service was amazing, and amazing vibes and ambiance. So solid and delicious

Everything was just amazing at Il Monello.  It was a great experience. The ambiance is very welcoming and charming. Amazing wines, food and service. Staff are extremely knowledgeable and made great recommendations. They were very welcoming, especially the hostess, Nora.  There is not enough praise for how delicious the food was.  They must have a great chef.  Will definitely become a regular here.  Highly recommend!

First time at Il Monello and all I can say is WOW!!! The ambiance is very welcoming. The food, wines & service was amazing! Everything we tasted melted in our mouths. Very knowledgeable & friendly staff. They know exactly how to make the customers happy and give great recommendations. Do your self a favor and visit this perfect restaurant, you will not be disappointed!!
Will be back soon.

Honestly felt taken advantage of at this restaurant. Me and my friends live in the area and have been saving up to eat here. We are young and don't get to enjoy dinners like this often. My friend ordered a wedge salad and the waiter asked if he wanted to add protein but when we got the check he charged my friend $20 extra dollars. Actually in fact he charged him for a specialty pasta. Not even the salad. We didn't want to make a scene but my friend got a salad to avoid the pasta prices then got charged for the most expensive pasta. Seemed like the waiters where trying to fix the mistake by telling us it was the added chicken, but come on, $20 for added chicken in a salad! The main issue is that we weren't informed of it. Very disappointing because if it wasn't for this we would being giving a 5 star review. Crème brûlée slapped but don't add chicken i guess

Amazing! From the ambiance, decor, service, and food! Very welcoming and flavorful dishes. The seafood is fresh and the steak was excellent. Also great wine list. Fantastic place Overall. Already planning my next dinner.

I just had dinner here. Close by in the neighborhood. Seems like a nice atmosphere, good food. One of the waiters was rude to me, and I don't   think I was imagining this. I then told the head waiter or manager, not sure what his position is. They both didn't seem to care. I left sad and felt  disrespected. The place was empty, but it was early. The prices, well typical, were a little more than they should be, but it was more the attitude. I did not know they had reopened at another location. I would give them the benefit of the doubt, but it seemed like verbal attitudes dont help my impression, this time.

I made a dinner reservation 3 weeks in advance for a very special "twins" 77th birthday dinner.  We were called 5 days before our reservation saying  that our reservation is cancelled due to the fact a huge party has taken over the restaurant for that evening.  They offered up their sister steak restaurant which was totally unacceptable to all.  I had gone to Il Monello when they were on the upper east side on so many occasions.  Very disappointed that we were treated so off-handedly.

I had my birthday lunch with a group of 10 guests recently at Il Monello and it was excellent. The food was beyond expectations - it was the best eggplant parmigiana I have ever had and the calamari was "fried to perfection" according to one of my guests. The staff were very friendly, accommodating, and attentive to detail. The atmosphere is beautiful - modern yet warm and elegant. I could not have asked for a better experience. Thank you to Eddie and Jimmy for making my birthday a memorable one! I look forward to coming back.

I have now been to Il Monello twice, at its new location on East 49th street. I believe it is a great food addition to the neighborhood. Using Danny Meyer's definition of a good restaurant, we walked out feeling very satisfied. The greeting by Eddie was very welcoming. Service was excellent and friendly, and the food portions were large and tasted great. It is a small restaurant, and I'm almost reluctant to recommend it, for fear that I won't be able to get a reservation in the future!!
Absolutely delicious food served each and every time my wife and I have . Excellent service  and drinks are are amazing.

I thought everything about this place was perfect.  The lighting, the tables, the glassware, the service, the menu, and especially how delicious the food was.  Casual but classy.  Friendly. Intimate.  I can't wait to go back.  Perfect.
Absolutely an amazing time at Steve and Eddie's newest venture!!! The food was outstanding along with the service. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a fabulous dining experience!!!!

Came here for a work lunch, was able to get a reservation 45 mins before on a Thursday! They have a delicious crispy chicken sandwich. Would highly recommended! Probably one of the best crispy chicken sandwiches Ive had. The chicken was juicy and came with a side of fries. Saw cauliflower on the menu online but they don't have it for the summer.

Stepped in for drinks the other week. Venue is great - love the outdoor or enclosed space. It's a good vibe even if it gets rather loud given its popularity.

The downside is the drink menu is nothing special and the food menu is weirdly limited for a place designed for happy hours; no handheld appetizers, nothing easily split. The food was fine when it came out.

Nothing unique or great but nothing bad either.
Loved the food... just amazing... small portions for snacks and pricey but definitely worth it.  Service was slow but the quality of food makes you forget about it!!

Outdoor dining at the church which was a plus, we had drinks and fries (too salty) while we waited under the tent for a seat, and then we're seated after about 45min wait. Interestly the church bells tolled at irregular intervals, we wondered why at :55 and :09 they went off. Timer issue? Bartender was great, super friendly service there.

Small wine and beer list which was simple, good for an easy decision. The burrata was excellent as a starter but could have used some toast points or similar. The hangar steak was tough and lacked much flavor; the sauce was just so-so for me. The single scallion could've been better as a single asparagus or similar. The bean burger was a hit with my fellow diners though. Meatballs as an appetizer at the next door table looked and smelled awesome though. Will try another time.

One downside was dirty drinking glasses; two had lipstick stains on them (as three guys, not us). Quick to replace but might want to get on that washing, and for some reason the guy clearing tables tried to clear our dishes early twice during the meal. Check was quick and efficient. Overall a nice epic view of the church and nice spot to grab a beer and small bite. Next time more appetizers.

This location is fantastic. Eating right outside St Bart's with a very open feel is quite pleasant, but it does feel like eating inside a tent.
