I had a nice salad with chicken. It wasn't anything special, but I didn't really order anything special. They didn't offer the healthiest menu - added sugar in everything for those who are looking out for that.

Very friendly service.

It was nice once, but for the crazy prices, I wouldn't go again.

Remember to tip well.

I can't tell you how many times I've walked past this place when making my way from 57th street down to grand central. I took a mental note to drop by one day and today it finally happened.  

It's a great spot for after work drinks & an app. I'm not entirely sure what the indoor dining space looks like since we sat outdoors, but I couldn't imagine anyone passing up sitting on the terrace when the weather is nice.

I like the Social Hour/Happy Hour options. Unfortunately the meatballs & artichokes were sold out when I arrived for my 3:45 reservation. Thought that was very odd since there's only 4 food options for social hour...

In any case we shared the grilled octopus, which was phenomenal. My friend ordered it again for an entree. Unfortunately, I went for the Oricchette. It disappointingly bland. The sauce had no flavor. Tried adding fresh pepper -- didn't do much. If my Riesling wasn't so good i would have given this 3 stars. But I'm willing to come back to try other things before coming to that.
If you're in Midtown, this is a good outdoor happy hr spot. Drinks are cheap and solid. Best in the summer time when the tent comes down. Good place to start and venture out post HH. Would recommend.

Decent place for lunch. I really enjoyed the appetizers- Burrata and meatballs. The chicken sandwich was OK... it was mostly breading and not much chicken so a bit disappointing. Our waitress, Leanne was phenomenal. Just super nice and knowledgeable about the menu items. Our party also got a bottle of wine which was really good. The inside was cooled on this hot summer day and not too crowded which was even better!

Inside Park has a coveted Park Ave location, with outdoor dining above street level, and boasts a namesake with storied St. Bart.

Tried if for lunch recently and was really underwhelmed by the food. The Burrata salad was just barely ok; their house chicken salad was below average and the roast chicken was drenched in oily juices.

Perhaps other items were better, these are basic dishes that restaurants should perfect. How hard is it to procure decent cheese and put it on a plate? That's basically the art of making a burrata salad. How can you get lettuce and chicken wrong?

Anyway - they need to step their game up!

Our orders: Park burger, south side (cocktail), passionfruit sorbet

Pro
+ Service: amazing! Everyone was so thorough. Kevin, our server, checked on us often!
+ Food: delicious. I loved the crisp of the fries. The passion fruit sorbet was a bit on the sour side, I might not get that again.

Cons
- Parking was fun to find..be sure to take the metro if you can help it!

It's a beautiful oasis  in the concrete jungle located in the courtyard of the St. Bart church with better than average comfort food & drinks. The lunch time can be quite crowded with business professionals in Midtown but if you show up at 12:00 Noon sharp, you can be seated right away. Reservations recommended, regardless. I will visit here again just because of the cool ambiance.
Very nice outdoor experience, and the hostess was very gracious.  Note: you don't need a reservation if you are coming just for drinks (you will be sent to the bar).

I am seriously surprised this place has such low rating on Yelp - definitely way underrated!

We came in on a Tuesday night at 6 p.m. and the place was packed, mostly with business professionals, so better make a reservation.

The restaurant shares space with an active church (St. Bart's), how cool is that?:) the vibe is amazing.

We had Tuna Tacos for appetizer, I had Crab cakes (one of the best ones I've ever had) and my fiancé got pasta with shrimp and lobster - that was a favorite of the night.
The pasta was so good I kept stealing from his plate ha ha :)

We ended the night with Guava cheesecake, definitely a must try! And I don't even like cheesecake!
Overall - great place for a night out or a business lunch.
For more fabulous places check out my Insta page @daria.newyork

Came here for a work team dinner and the outdoor seating are was pretty nice. The items on the menu were all pretty pricey but luckily this was on our corporate card. The food was good for the most part, but not high enough quality that I would ever pay that price for it myself.

One of my favorite restaurants in the city! The Tuna Tartar tacos are a MUST try and the soups are always incredible! Highly underrated. Not too hard to get a reservation. Typically just an after work finance crowd. Amazing food at both lunch and dinner. Must visit place in the city! Sit outside if the weather is warm

Order:
- Froze (4/5)
- Pretzel Bites (5/5)

Pros:
- Great outdoor dining set up
- Kind service
- The pretzel bites were SO good
- Good happy hour menu

Cons:
- I wasn't all that impressed with their cocktail menu
- I wish there were more appetizer options

Overall: I good happy hour spot to go to with your coworkers after work

I've visited this place many times prior to this review (long overdue). Most recent visit was for a work lunch which did not disappoint. Our party of 7 was promptly seated and greeted by our server; very polite.

Food and drinks were spot on. I went for the lobster with shrimp roll - amazing. Every item arrived timely to our table and we left room for dessert; which was delicious - must try the guava cheesecake.

Worth the trip if you're visiting or looking for a casual lunch place - I do recommend.

I came here for a team lunch--we were welcoming a new employee. We came towards the end of summer so it was nice to sit outside. That said, the food was okay (I had the Mexican lobster roll) but not worth the price. Plus, they were kind of slow. it wasn't horrible but I wouldn't really go back in a hurry.

Great food and outdoors dining on the terrace. The hanger steak was perfection.
The roadwork/building next door made it particularly noisy though and I will only come back once it's completed.

I came by for lunch with some coworkers rsvp doesn't seem to be needed but am sure it helps specially during the busy lunch hours & on a nice day when everyone seems to be outside.  
We were seated outside under a nice umbrella drinks we all stuck to water.
Food I had the Buttermilk chicken sandwich with a salad, nicely breaded piece of chicken this was good great taste to the chicken. Salad was good as well nice tasting dressing.
Other dishes the Kale salad was good, seems a bit small but my coworker enjoyed it.
Another good salad was the Cob salad nicer looking salad with enough avocado, bacon & blue cheese not bad.
Nice looking area outside perfect on a nice day to have lunch outside as long as the wait it not crazy long.
Service was good, prices are decent normal to the area we had a good lunch.

Three of us went for lunch and everyone was very disappointed in both the quality and price of the food.  Two had the chicken sandwich which was large, but very dry and is not recommended.  My burger was small and not nearly worth the exorbitant price.  

The location is convenient and the wait staff accommodating, but be prepared to be taken advantage of when it comes to food.

A better choice would be any neighborhood bar or Uncle Gussie's food truck on the corner.  There is a reason the food truck has such a long line!

A beautiful environment and good food, but the service is pretty spotty. When we went there, there was a fairly loud, irritating event of people standing next to the tables; we're not sure if it was a corporate event (in which case it may have just been our bad luck) or part of the restaurant's regular operations.

I was hosting an important dinner for eight people, so I called nearly two months in advance and made a reservation. Just one week before we were due to dine there, I received a voicemail message saying they had a "buyout" and would not honor my reservation. They left me with no options for my dinner during a very busy season. What a really crappy, unprofessional way to treat customers. I will NEVER set foot in this restaurant again.

Had a great lunch outside on a beautiful day today. Such a relaxing atmosphere and very fast and good service. Had fish taco was good tasting but little cold. Buddy had pests chicken sandwich he said it was very tasty and fresh. Quick service in and out for a nice relaxing lunch hour. Only block from my office is nice too.

Went there after 7, was seated in a timely matter towards the back by the terrace and bushes. First thought it's dark. Had to pull out my phone flashlight to read the menu, no biggie. I had the crab cakes my friend the pork chop. We were happy with the meal and our waitress was very attentive. About an hour in, the itching began... mosquitos!!! Wish I could rate this place higher but as the bus boy kept throwing water over the edge, I figured that's why there are mosquitos in this area... In either event if I do come back, I would take seating to the bar or as far as way from the bushes as possible
Nice spot for drinks, if you want somewhere with decent vibe and want to be outside. The food I've had here has always been pretty good but nothing to write home about. Really all about the ambiance
I wish it were better. Nice outdoor space, fine for the bar. But don't order food. It's the worst food I've had in the city - and it's priced like a higher end restaurant.

In the city for a business appointment and chose this restaurant as it was convenient and offered nice off the street outside dining. We were extremely pleased with our choice. Excellent food and service to match!
Great Place to come for quick bite and some drinks. Service good and the Atmosphere as well.

I came here for drinks after work with a friend and we both really enjoyed this outdoor bar. They had lots of seating so you could choose whether you wanted to sit at a table for food service or sit/stand near the bar. We got really tasty frose's for $10 and ordered some fries as a snack as well. We loved the atmosphere of young professionals and enjoyed the dj's music which started later in the evening. I recommend this place for after work with coworkers or even for a casual night out with friends.

Ok, this time our alumni event was better than last year. I got to try a few hors d'oeuvre and they were perfectly made (for me!). There were chicken, mini burgers, pear and cheese, salmon, etc. The evening was cooler than last year. The evening was great, more space to walk around. Very pleasant. Good job!

Inside Park at St Bart's is a remarkable, and I highly recommend it. Love the vibe here. My friend got Long Island Lobster Roll, that I tried and also liked. It was really flavorful. The customer service is superb. Bottom line: Inside Park at St Bart's = awesome.

This is an amazing place that I can't believe I hadn't been to before!
Awesome bar outside next to a church that is so unique! There is lots of outdoor seating, the service was great, the drinks were great and the ambiance was so cool!
We had a few of the summer cocktails and they were all delicious! Not crowded on the weekend but apparently this place is packed during the week/happy hour which makes sense since it's in midtown! Will be back!
Was nice. But was not blown away. They were having a party outside so the staff was quit busy and my table was neglected. But food and drinks plus ambiance was nice. Inside is beautiful.

The hubby and I were looking for a place to grab a quick lunch. I have eaten at Inside Park at St. Bart's about 20 years ago - seriously - 20 years ago, so we decided to give it another try.

We had:

- Spinach Salad with Chicken - Tasty

- Caesar Salad with Chicken - Tasty

The service was good and the space was nice. It is a convenient place to lunch if you are in the neighborhood.

Great salads - average options for vegetarians (salads + a pizza and a panini) but the ambience makes up for it. Coffee machine wasn't working that day.
Beautiful place to lunch. Can't wait to see it in winter.

I could see how this place does well in the summer months, when professionals need a drink after a long day at the office and it's nice enough to sit outside and enjoy the outdoor bar area. I get it. I do. But for lunch? Eh, it was just okay.

We opted to sit inside since it looked like it was about to pour. The service was a bit slow but they kept our glasses filled with water. I went with the turkey burger that comes on an English muffin, opting for a side salad rather than fries. Our food finally came out and the top of my English muffin was missing. I ended up being fine with this since I cut it anyway but how do you leave that out? Also both mine and my colleague's salads were without dressing. We had to ask for it on the side and the waitress seemed shocked that none was already there.

The inside is very pretty with the vaulted ceilings. I might stop by again during the summer to check out the outdoor party but I would probably pass on the food.

Inside Park at St Bart's is simply excellent. Friendly service, welcoming atmosphere. Fried Calamari was the dish that my friend got, he absolutely loved it. I really liked it as well. It was amazing.. The service is fabulous. Inside Park at St Bart's - It is a unique and wonderful experience.

Very cute spot for drinks! It's a nice open terrance next to St.Barts; a pretty location to admire the architecture and feel secluded from the busy streets. It was a hot summer day but there was plenty of shady spots and a few fans to keep it breezy. Service was good as well!

I went here last night with three of my colleagues and we left really disappointed. The atmosphere is weird - stuffy and quiet but they have the patio which is very fratty.

The waiters were very off putting as well; it felt as if they were trying to fight over our table and get our tips but when we put in our order we were asked to put down a card and open a tab? We ordered drinks at a seated booth so maybe it was because we were just drinking but I got the impression that they were not too keen on four 20-something year olds ordering fancy wine without some insurance. When we were ordering drinks, they did not give us a beer menu and when asked what beer my colleague wanted to order the waitress said "sorry we don't have that" and then didn't tell him which beers they did have? Very unprofessional for an upscale location like this.

The happy hour is decent - $5 beer $7 well and some wine. We got 2 glasses of $15 wine and four beers and the total came out to $60 which is not bad. I will say, however, that my $15 glass of wine came in a DIRTY WINE GLASS and I had to request a clean one. I was not pleased.

All in all, I would not return to this place for drinks. I would consider giving the patio a shot during happy hour but not the inside dining area (the patio was not an option when I went as it was closed).
Really great after-work atmosphere but honestly way over-priced. Might come back for another drink at some point but would rather go to one of the many other decently priced happy hour spots in NYC.

A very nice restaurant with great, friendly service and very nice atmosphere whether you want a raucous drink with friends (or new friends) outside or some quiet contemplation with friends or a date inside the church clubhouse.

The rolls to start out the meal were soft, tasty and slightly warm.

For the main courses, we had the good short ribs (which could have used some more sauce), some good crab cakes, and a fairly good, but not extraordinary burger.  The burger did not come out correctly twice. When it finally did, it was very tasty, but still not perfect.  I would still consider ordering it again. Note, they also have an Impossible Burger.  On the other hand the french fries were fabulous.  They were very moist and with skins. Anyway, the staff was very nice and did not charge us for the burger.  Not only that but they brought us all a lovely dessert wine with our dessert.  That is superb service.  

For dessert I wanted the cheesecake, but they were out of it.  I had to "settle" for the Italian cookie plate, which was actually very good.  

All in all, a great evening and I look forward to going back.
The best Cobb salad I've ever had. It was huge, with lotsa yummy goodies and the dressing was sublime.
Food is very very mediocre and overpriced for no reason. Nothing is fresh. Bad combinations. Just no taste. The atmosphere is ok , nice view, very uncomfortable chairs. Would never come again
Here regularly for a glass of rose after work.  Happening outdoor spot with lots of professionals.

Went there for lunch the other day I had a hamburger
my friends had salads and the Panini the service-the service was impeccable - this place is very NYC
Worth the trip

Happened to go on a business social night.  Very noisey, had the weather been nice to sit outside we may have enjoyed the experience more.  View outside would have made the food better.  Food is good nothing special though but good.

I've been coming here for a corporate events for the last 3 years. Great setting if it is not too hot (not much wind like you do get in a rooftop).

Passed hors d'oeuvre and station with hummus, cheeses and cured meats were great quality. Staff was nice, both at the bar and waiters.

I love the location and that it overlooks Park Ave and the Met Building. The church behind is also very cute. I'm sure I'll be back for Happy Hour.

Follow for more cool spot alerts: instagram.com/danapgreco

Some friends and I came here for a drink after having dinner and we enjoyed ourselves.

Décor: It's an outside patio right in front of a beautiful church. There are tons of tables and plenty of room to just stand and hang out. It is wildly popular, as you might imagine, with the after work crowd on nice (summer) days/evenings. There are also, at least what appeared to be, several bars to choose from so there wasn't a bottleneck for getting a fresh beer.
Bathroom: I don't think there is one

Staff: Our bartender was kind of a jag when we inquired about the cost of three shots we ordered, but other than that things were fine.

Drinks: It's a (almost) full bar so you can be sure they'll have what you're looking for. Additionally, they have a small selection of different beers.

Value: It's a cool spot, so prices are a bit higher. But nothing that will break your wallet.

We had a good time and would stop over again if we're in the area.

This is where Jesus goes to party after a long week of smiting unbelievers and sitting in really long prayer meetings.

There's nothing I like more in a church than the ability to have some tasty drinks and a cheese plate while I contemplate the state of my soul. (That contemplation usually leads to more drinks) Inside Park @ St Bart's lets me do exactly that - there is a restaurant in the old church community building but what you really want is the terrace on a warm sunny afternoon. You can certainly have a meal but the Mister and I were here for a snack and a refreshment.

The space itself is really inviting - there are some small couch/lounge areas as well as a full bar plus tables for dining. There's music (sometimes live) and once you're here you really don't feel like you're smack in the center of Midtown anymore. The wine list is pretty "meh" but the cocktails ($14) are great. I had a Josephine which was blackberries, St Germaine and champagne - strong, pretty and delicious - just like me. We also had a cheese tray which was fairly small but good quality.

The crowd seems to be a lot of UES finance-bros and their Ann Taylor Loft clad companions so don't show up in shorts, a tweety bird tshirt and a fanny pack. Service was efficient but not particularly friendly. I understand as the typical order went a lot like this:

"She'll have a Pomegranitini and I'll have a Bullit Rye with 2 ice cubes" (because the horrors of watering down a middling-quality whiskey are real, my friends).

St Bart's does a lot of community outreach, including a food bank located on the other side of the church. I hope the overpriced drinks I consumed help them keep on with their mission of serving needy NY'ers and getting chatches lit up during happy hour.

My favorite daily lunch spot at work... the Owner is great and his staff keeps it going.  He must treat them right because the place is clean and the food is always fresh and hot food is always hot.   They have something for everyone. From hot food buffets to salads and creative ones, pizza and then some, soups... snacks ... oh and coffee bar and dessert. If you weren't hungry going in you will be when you're done... easy Apple Pay option and self service condiments... wish I had pictures but I start eating and forget .  Maybe next time...

Perfectly adequate cafeteria for the the midtown worker on the go. The food is fine, comes out fast and you are out the door. Better than what used to be here. Down in the basement, but escalators get you there fast.

I'm not sure about the negative reviews either as someone else mentioned. The place is pristine. They really do focus on maintaining cleanliness which is of great importance in a food establishment. Staff are very attentive and warm. The quality of the food is great, and prices are on par. I'm glad I work in the area and can always pop in. It's my new favorite spot.

Itavolo is located in a basement food court among other restaurant offerings. They have sandwiches, pasta, salad bar, and more.

I ordered a chicken sandwich with tomato and lettuce, it had a name but I unfortunately can not recall at this moment. I asked to add pesto to add flavor as the sandwich did look a bit flavorless. I also grabbed some crushed red pepper before leaving to spice it up.

The sandwich wasn't awful but I haven't had any inkling to return and order it again. The bread was a bit too tough and the chicken flavorless without the pesto sauce and crushed red pepper flakes.

It was edible but wouldnt recommend Itavolo for a sandwich.

Itavolo has now re-opened. Yay!
The selection of foods is a little less than pre-Covid days, but it's still a very good spot for breakfast or lunch when in the neighborhood of 53rd St and 3rd Ave.

Itavolo is located in the food court of my office building.  I get food here all the time.  In fact, I just called and ordered a personal size pizza for lunch! There is a great assortment of hot foods, salads, pizza and sandwiches.  The food is consistently delicious and the staff helpful and friendly.  Pro tip:  after 3:00 pm. the price per pound goes down $3....I often pick up dinner instead of ordering food when I get home.

I'm shocked by the negative reviews here. This place is the best food bar for miles. I'm impressed by the food, attention to details etc. the options are always something different and I've never had a bad meal. Some of my favorites: pernil, all their salmon options, pasta dishes, lasagnas, etc. Everything is flavorful and don't all taste the same! Unlike other food bars where the food all has the same taste and is greasy. So many cold options, hot options, and all very neat and cleanly presented.

Went to this location at 2:30 pm today (March 25th). Was impressed by the food options, as the few times I've been in the past I was disappointed, which made me avoid this place for a while. I thought I would give it a try again since I work in the next building upstairs. Food was not so bad, but WOW the customer service was AWFUL! The cashier (a woman) snatched the money from my hand, didn't speak, didn't make eye contact, didn't acknowledge me at all. After closing the transaction, she turned to talk to her colleague, who seemed more attentive to his customer. I took my time placing my change in my purse to observe for a few seconds and thought about if it was worth saying something. I honestly would've been more impressed by a self-checkout machine.

I'm eating the food as I'm typing this. It's really good, but ugh your Client Service is NOT! Maybe, it was just that one cashier... who knows.

No good. I asked the guy  at the register  for a pastry  item. He completely  ignored me and proceeded  to set up the coffee  machine.  Now i see why this place is not on the list of the popular  places  in this area.  Very  rude and the food doesn't  look very good.  I will not be back. Good  thing  its New  York and there are a million  great places in this area

This place is in a food court, which is convenient for me considering I work nearby.  They have a wide variety of food, but it's been very overcooked most of the time.  I like variety, but if I continue getting poor quality meals from them I won't be back.

I got two desserts here - a banana pudding and a biscotti. Both were great. The banana pudding had a little bit of that sugar alcohol taste but if you've been doing keto for a while, you're used to this.
The place is tiny, just a little bakery cafe down a set of stairs (it took me a minute to find the entrance) so don't expect a place to sit. To me, I'd describe it more as a "bakery" than a "cafe."
The service was helpful. I'd love to come back and try more!

Ok! Got some desserts here for family visiting from out of town who has health restrictions and it was really good choice for desserts. I really wanted something of quality for them to try and this delivered! A bit expensive yes and the portions are on the smaller end but for what I was looking for this was a perfect choice! We got the brownie and cheesecake and my family members really enjoyed.

One of my favorite keto bakeries in the city!! I did not know many keto bakeries exist, and it is slightly expensive, but I came in to pick up some cupcakes for a birthday and they were absolutely delightful!

I called about ordering an emergency sheet cake, which they put together in a day! Absolutely amazing service. This place is hard to find, but its located in the basement of the building. It is a very cute little shop (no seating area), but they have so many options for people who are keto and gluten free. I loved every bite of what cupcakes I had. It is on the upper end of bakery cost, but highly recommend this place for anyone who is keto.

I dont know how they do it, but the bakers are definetly making magic behind the scenes. This was the only keto bakery I have ever been too but I felt it was just as good as normal bakeries.

Got the cheesecake to die for! I got it for my birthday (pre-ordered online). We got there late and the lady was just leaving the store but she came back when she saw us and the service was great and she gave us our order. The ambiance is okay, small and cute store for pick up, but I'll definitely stop back in to order more... they don't just have sweet but savory too, can't wait to try savory!

Great treats for fellow Keto-ers! Both sweet and savory foods.
But more pricey than I expected :/

Uhhh yeah this is why NYC is awesome. Tried it first time today. Chicken pot pie was delicious so was the philly empanada! A real keto meal option ? Yes!!!! So happy I found this place. Give it a try. I'm stuffed.
This place offers great meals and desserts with low carb counts! Many gluten free options as well. Any and all low carbers needing a treat must learn about this place!
This place is such a gem! Keto baking is so tricky and inKETOble cafe has definitely figured it out. I had a chicken pot pie and an ube cupcake for desert. It was such a delicious lunch!!

Dropped in while walking by.  As a frequent Keto baker glad I did!  While prices seemed a bit high its clear they're using keto ingredients - namely, almond flour, which is expensive.  The chocolate chip blondie was great and the lemon pound cake was delicious.  Great place to pick up bakery to enjoy with your morning coffee and not have to feel guilty about enjoying it!

If a little more affordable, especially the treats, would indulge more.  But have to say my chicken pot pie was very filling , delicious and KETO.  Looking forward to trying each item they have.  A lot of places say they are keto but use things like sucrose which is NOT keto.  They use monk fruit which is a natural sweetener that doesn't raise blood sugar.  So this is very acceptable for diabetics also.  Best to order ahead if you don't want to wait.

Didn't expect it but, Inside Cafe was definitely cool. Very cool and unique. Every single item that we have purchased was incredibly fresh and flavorful. Staff ensured that every thing was alright. I would definitely come back to Inside Cafe.

We had a wonderful meal this evening at IL Nido the menu was fresh and interesting. Loved the service. Amanda was our waitress. She explained all the nuances of the menu and we enjoyed the food and the service. The atmosphere was warm and cozy. They change their menu seasonally.  We will be back and we will ask for Amanda!!
Amazingly nice staff and the food is just amazing,my go to place when i wanna grab something to eat

This is a good, solid pizza choice with really cool entrance doors. Their penne pasta pizza is great and they've got a good variety of fresh slices. Somehow, there are several pizza spots on this part of 36th Ave and not too much else, but it's always a great time for pizza on this side of Astoria.

The workers are always happy to see customers so it's always nice to stop by when I'm craving a slice. In the evening I often notice the place full of people just hanging out so the place seems to be doing well. Will be back often!

Great pizza in Astoria. The prices are moderate and you get good value.

I really liked the mushroom chicken slice and eggplant slice. The chicken wasn't dry and was very moist. The eggplant had nice seasoning and had some Italian basil.

Will be back again!

The pizza was warm and fresh. They have some good flavors and the crust is thin and crunchy.

The place is super clean and cozy. If you want a good slice in LIC, this is the place to go!!

The staff Nick is super nice and friendly. He ensure to make you feel like home

My go to pizza ordering place. I've also have the pasta and chicken, always great. I have only ever ordered from, never dined in, but the staff is always very kind and patient when I call for complicated orders
Amazing pizza... perfect texture, quality of ingredients and chew! Queens reigns supreme
The best pizza spot in the area. Great variety and ingredients at better prices than spots closer to me. Always recognize the staff too. It is a neighborhood pizza spot
The absolute best pizza in Long Island City! So many different flavors and styles. Excellent service with a friendly staff. Everything was hot and fresh and I'm so happy I decided to eat here.

Ordered sides of spinach / broccoli which were cooked great with the olive oil and garlic. However, the spinach could've used more sauce.

The spinach pinwheel was great too but came cold by the time it was delivered. Had to reheat it for dinner.

Hands down the best kept secret in Queens. Their vodka sauce is the best I've ever had. The carbonara pasta is out of this world. Even the french fries are some of the best tasting. Staff is beyond friendly and accommodating.
Great simple New York slice at a good price. We got two take-away pies-plain and margherita and they were terrific. Big pies and the service was great.
This place has a wonderful thin crust pizza and the sauce and cheese are just right.  We also had a very nice salad delivered.
Definitely one of the better pizza joints around here. The grandma vodka pie is to die for!

When I first laid my eyes on this slice on Instagram, I instantly knew I had to have it along with all the other unique pizza slice selections over here! They have so many to choose from which made my decision more tough but & this was the first one I picked to try! Every bite I took was better than the last! Who would have thought ravioli on pizza would be so damn good? It was made to perfection & I'm so glad I got to try it
.
I also met the owners who are so nice, friendly & down to earth! I learned more about them & the business & couldn't be happy with my decision on checking this out this pizza place. It's such a great feeling to be able to connect with people especially at a time like this. Thank you guys for having me  Can't wait to be back

Yummmmmmmmm!  My boyfriend has been following their IG page for quite some time and would show me their posts almost daily.  So we finally made it our "treat yo self" meal of the week.  We went the ravioli pizza and the panda fries.  I've never heard of panda fries so for those who also don't know, it's fries covered in vodka sauce with melted cheddar.  Sounds a little bizarre but they were delicious.  And their fries are KOALA-TEE.

The pizza was also super tasty.  Unfortunately in transit, the cheese moved around a bit but that didn't take away from the taste.  It reheated really well the next day too!  I posted a slice on my IG and tagged them (as a little brag), like "look what I got!"  But also to tell others to check them out!  They wrote back and asked how it was and thanked me for supporting them.  I've never really seen a business page interact like that, in a private, unprompted type of way.  You can tell they're service forward which goes a long way.  We will definitely become regulars after a great first experience.

Wow. Wow. Wow. If you are looking for a solid meal you HAVE to try il Miglio! The fried calamari was crisp to perfection. The chicken parm melted in my mouth. The penne was the perfect al dente. The pizza? The pizza has the perfect balance of cheese, sauce and crunchy-ness. There are sooo many different kinds to try. My bestie really enjoyed one with bbq on it. The staff are really friendly and the restaurant is small and well kept. Look forward to many more meals at il Miglio!

Was satisfying. Went for lunch with a pal, got a couple slices regular/ cheese. A bit more n the oily side, tasted like regular corner shop NYC pizza. Crust was foldable, thin, all in all, was good. Hit the spot.

Fettuccine Alfredo  . Found this place on Instagram . I ordered and the sauce is to buttery and salty. The chicken is burnt to the point I taste burnt flavor. Also the breast they gave was dry bad hard chicken.Couldn't even eat it. Drove all the way back home to the Bronx and  To sum it up I will not be eating in here ever again.
It is not brick oven pizza and I ordered delivery . This is what I got. It's the Cajun pizza. Did not taste that good either.
The vodka sauce barbecue pizza I ordered via the slive app was average at best. Considering this is NYC and you have so many better options for pizza, this one ranks very low. I won't go here again..

always fresh clean ingredients in their pizza and pasta!! they even pay attention to minor order tweeks  food always comes nice and hot too and the pasta today came perfectly al dente still! and the meatballs omygaw so good ... so amazing ! and they deliver to LIC!!!i dont understand the other reviews but i hands down highly recommend!

------

still delicious, super fresh, super amazing service!!

I absolutely love this place ! It's hard to find a reliable pizzeria in LIC but this is definitely it for me. I love the chicken picatta and it comes with a side of pasta , rice, or mash potatoes. I've had all 3 sides and there all really good. This is probably by 20th time ordering from here and today I just wanted to say thanks for being awesome ! The sauce on the spaghetti is really good and fresh. I also love the tortellini with vodka sauce.  Next time I'll take a picture because it's too good and I usually just eat it all right away !

Love this little place. Great menu, great people, great ambience and great times. Pepperoni Pizza was something that I think I just fell in love with. Team are super friendly and service is really quick. il Miglio Brick Oven Pizzeria & Italian Restaurant is awesome.
Terrible. Used to be good but last several times food was awful and instructions were not followed. I'll never order again.

Decent pizza, but not more than that
I asked them to cook it crisp, but they did not get it!

This place is awesome! It was really close to my hotel. I was walking around the neighborhood checking things out and saw this place. They have great specials for eat in or take out. The prices are AMAZING and the guy behind the counter was friendly, talkative, and was a pleasure to converse with while waiting for my food.

Their Fettuccine Alfredo sauce was to die for. I also ordered a meatball sandwich which was equally amazing!

I not only went here once, I went back everyday for a bite to eat my entire week long vacation. I will for sure go here again. Not to mention their ATM machine only charges a $1.50 for a surcharge and that was unheard of. I guess it's the little things that make the experience perfect and this place is full of amazing little things!

You definitely need to check this place out if you are in the area.

Pizza came on time looked fresh was very happy when I saw that their was a crispy option for the pizza when I receive my pizza I was expecting to have a nice crispy bite instead I received a doughy center and had to reheat the pizza back up to get the crispy that I thought I was getting with the crispy option

As a true New Yawka, you might have been to many pizza spots BUT there are some major points they have to hit to be the BEST. You gotta have: bangin sauce, customer service and true Italian flavors. il Miglio checks off all the points on the list! My favorite is the pepperoni pizza and of course the classic cheese. I can't wait to come back and try the hot food and anything that's parmigiana cuz CMON WHO DOESNT LOVE A CHICKEN PARM!! Keep up the great work guys, you are making New York proud

Received our large cheese pizza today April 17, 2020. I spoke with Joe and requested a very very lightly cooked pizza with sauce but not overwhelming. The person who answered the phone assured me the large pie would be delivered within a half hour just like I requested. Excellent, excellent Joe and the delivery was on point! This is the go to Pizzeria in Long Island City! Will absolutely be ordering from this pizzeria that has great customer service, great food and great delivery service.
Be Safe& Stay Well

Judy
This place exceeded my expectations. Must try the low carb vodka pizza! Super flavorful. Love this place and will deff be coming back soon.
Place sucks. Ordered on seamless at 8:30 (on a Friday). Order never came and when I tried to call the restaurant nobody answered.
One of the best random pizza joints in the area. veggie slice is fantastic, sandwiches and pasta are super tasty as well!

I've ordered twice from here and it was really great. This third time though wasn't that good. The chicken roll I order was reheated and tasted a day old, the bread off the end of it was rock hard. I also ordered mozzarella sticks and it was ok but it wasn't the mozzarella sticks they usually make, they were most Likely pre made ones

Living on Roosevelt Island the take out spots are limited so when we got a menu in the mail from this new restaurant we decided to try them. We were very pleased. The food was very flavorful and the portions were perfect and they threw in some awesome focaccia bread. We will be ordering often. Putting phone number on speed dial.

JetBlue and Estee Lauder's favorite Italian go to place for a reason!!!!! They offer  extensive Authentic Italian menu choices . The thing I love most, Queens not, Manhattan pricing. And the food is worth traveling for but guess what ? They deliver !!!! And who doesn't love brick over Pizza ? They cater for all Occasions too .
Great pizza, they serve it hot and fresh every time I stop by. Nice ambiance to take for date night or hang out with friends.

Bad service.One day me and my mom and dad we're here and my dad wanted Tea and they gave my dad spoil milk inside the tea. He claimed it was cream.
"My point is he should of ask the customer would you like milk inside of the tea or cream or no milk or no cream." "Would not suggest to come here."

Spent some time in NYC and this place was my go too for pizza delivery during the whole Pandemic. Would definitely recommend this place. It's very hard to find New York style pizza in other areas of the US so take advantage of this place when you can.
Wonderful cozy little place with artisan vibe and chicken parm on hero worth the trip. Hidden gem in a little weary neighborhood
Love this place! Amazing pizza, food, and people!!! Everything from the pizza to lasagna was fresh and so delish! Come by and check it out.

Wow- great local find! The service and the food were  both amazing! We had the chicken slice- and garlic knots- great! fairly priced and served with a smile- we would not only recommended,  but definitely will be returning!
Awesome team, great service, and the pizza was amazing! Best little discovery of our trip :) thanks!

I've ordered twice from this place, and on Saturdays, there's a rude guy with a thick accent who takes the orders. Today was the last straw, I'll never order from this place again. The food is good, and with the limited options we have on Roosevelt island, i liked ordering from them. This is it.
Ordered a regular pizza and eggplant parmigiana hero at 8pm on a Saturday night.  Food was good,  pizza a little thick, hero hit the spot, but food took 28 minutes.

Wish i could give them 0 stars but thats not an option. Ordered online and after an hour of waiting i called and the guy who picks up the phone says in a very rude manner "ill be there in one minute".. 10 minutes later i call to enquire on my order since they are literally 2 blocks from my house and the guy got so rude and arrogant telling me " i dont know why you people order online, why dont you just call us directly" i said why do you post your business online if you don't want people to order from your business online? He then went on to say "I take care of my people who call me directly first" which is obsurd especially since they haven't even been in business that long I've been living here in this neighborhood long enough to know. I told him I should have my order cancelled based on how he was speaking to me and he said "okay that is fine". long story short I had to call and have my order cancelled and my money reimbursed to me because I couldn't stand to be spoken to so rudely and then pay them for this sort of treatment as much as I wanted my food.

Their regular slice pizza is good!! I am super picky with pizza like I will literally compare to my favorite pizzeria in Brooklyn but this place did a great job!  the sauce and cheese and dough were on point, their zeppolis are yummy. Only downside is the food arrived cold so I had to reheat.  Their garlic knots are really good too, very fluffy and fresh.  I'll reorder next time I just want it hot hot!!

As a business professional, I often have to eat in my hotel room.  The food I ordered from here always arrived hot and was very fresh.  The pasta dishes I had were the stuffed shells, manicotti, baked ziti, ravioli, and I had a couple of the fish dinners.  Food was excellent, and you get a ton of food and bread to eat.  Be hungry when you order from here.  Otherwise, you might need to share your meal with someone, as the portions are big.  I found the food and the prices the best in Long Island City for Italian take out.  The soups are delicious, and also big.  So if you are one person, the small soup is enough, the large soup can be served to three or four people, and I'm not kidding. The only soup I was disappointed in was their New England Clam Chowder.  It is their most expensive, but they serve it with the clam shells in the soup.  Who does that with clam chowder?  To me it looks like it's done to take up more space in the container so that you get less soup.  The clam chowder was good, just not worth the price.  The staff is friendly and funny.  I highly recommend this restaurant.  You're going to love it!
Food was really good and the Delivery guy was a sweet heart. I really enjoyed the food

Food was good. I enjoyed the meal that I had especially the patty which I forgot to take a picture of before I ate it all.

J ordered the curry chicken, rice and peas with cabbage. Also a side order of Mac and cheese. The curry chicken meal was good. Chicken consisted of thigh and breast meat. The Mac and cheese was just ok. Probably wouldn't order that again.

I ordered for delivery and it took longer than predicted. I called the restaurant and asked the hold up. They said they were making fresh patties because they were all out. I was ok with that because usually restaurants would just call and say "we don't have that item". Thanks again for that.

Rice and peas with oxtail gravy, steamed cabbage and plantains from #IslandFoodie. I just wanted light dinner and Lacy at Island Foodie hooked be up. Their food gets 5 stars      in my book
Open daily to serve the community.

Food not cooked. Had the jerk Wings and got sick.
So have many others I know. Reported to owner and they didn't care because their biggest consumers is DELIVERIES.
Really good stew chicken and the portions are huge! I ordered two days in a row, so good!

TLDR - I am not sure what Island this restaurant claims to represent, but the food here is NOT great at all.
Based on their social media, they seem to identify themselves as Jamaican, but I would beg to differ. I have ordered here once and that will be it because the food was bland...seriously flavorless and unlike any West Indian cuisine I have ever tasted. This coupled w the ridiculous fees ordering through delivery makes it an easy pass. I should have paid closer attention to the google reviews.

I ordered the oxtail, peas and rice and cabbage. While I appreciated the inclusion of butter beans, i could not find much in the way of gravy. The oxtails didn't seem like they were browned properly and seemed boiled/pressure cooked in tap water. Just not cooked with any real seasoning. (where is the scotch bonnet, cream of coconut in the rice, etc. any ingredients from the Islands!?)Some of the oxtail pieces were tender enough, but I didn't finish it because it wasn't tasty. Rice and cabbage were also lackluster. In fact, I threw it out. I was looking for a new spot for West Indian food and was glad this place sounded like they made things homemade, but to be honest, although a chain, Golden Krust is better. I can't attest to any other main protein dishes, because honestly if you don't do the oxtail right, i don't care about the chicken, whether it's jerk or stew. My advice, don't offer things on your menu that you don't make well.
The mac and cheese seems to have a velveeta type of base, because I did not taste any real grated cheese.
I think that the patties are also made in house? The beef has a flaky pastry crust, but the chicken didn't. The beef was better.
3 stars is because i didn't find anything foreign in my food and it came well packaged. Would not recommend until they do a revamp on seasonings for their dishes.

Just ordered the oxtails with rice and peas, chicken pasta rasta, and pineapple lemonade. Everything is flavorful and delicious! The oxtail meat falls right off the bone. I will definitely order again.
I got the veggie patty with coco bread and my boyfriend got their beef patty and we both really enjoyed them. Their sorrel drink is so good
I don't know what's worse-the food or their attitude!  Will not be back even if they were giving it away! $@&@@$&@"";:;&(@@&$!!!!!!!
Not sure why so much bad experiences but I ordered a selection dishes and alllll was good !!!

Nice surprise. Food was well prepared and arrived a lot sooner than estimated. Ordered the Rasta pasta and oxtail meal. I'm not a super spicy fan but the oxtail could've been a little spicier, lol but grateful that I could adjust to my taste. Will order again!

I didn't want to give 1 star , I have been coming here since may. I'm always polite yet the staff is not.  The same rude chick that refused to give her name is a nasty coward.  Please try n go anonymously and see how rude she is.  This has happened several times like she's always upset, face screwed up.  And I let it pass but not anymore.  The prices are too high for that. I came to purchase Rasta pasta (which is great). As the menu above states;  I wanted a large plain order and then I'm looking at the menu to see what else I may want.  She walks over grabs a medium container cus she always "assumes " she knows what ppl are getting. (RUDE)  I order n she says with an attitude " chicken or Shrimp" 3times in a row like I'm the one bothering her. I told her not to speak to me that way. She played unaware when she knows she was disrespectful but no one calls her on it.  Then still speaking rude back n forth instead of apologizing and taking my order she storms to the back and never comes back. I told her how  how nasty she always is and she acts like we are wasting her time, mind you I was the only customer there. So she could have waited for me to finish if (this was the case )perusing the menu or came back when I was ready but she's not intelligent or professional enough to do a.  This energy is why the place is empty most times.  I asked to speak to the owner who's wasn't there well you need to shift the energy of your establishment if you want it to become successful.  It's a horrible atmosphere and I know I'm not the 1st one with complaints.  We can't keep letting people get away with being rude because they hide behind their culture to do so.  No you will be held accountable

Love Instant Noodle Factory more and more each time I go. I literally want to try every type of noodle they feature on the noodle wall. Not sure how spicy I will ever go but only time will tell.

Given that you are pretty much in charge of cooking your noodles via the directions given to you (I mess up every single time and whatever staff is around is always super sweet in helping me) and that might throw some people off, but this spot is quintessential Queens. Fun, slightly kitschy but most of all very delicious!

Another thing to note is the beef birria stacks up to others. I'll throw beef birria on anything any day especially noodles!

This was quite the experience! I'm not a huge instant noodle person. I like them, but they're never my first choice. But this spot was recommended to me and I figured why not?!

The shop itself is decorated perfectly and very Instagram friendly. The ordering process was very simple. You order your noodles and toppings/ingredients on a kiosk and then they bring everything out on a tray for you. You then cook your noodles with their machines that add hot water as you stir everything up.

The beef birria noodles I had were very good! It had really good flavor for instant noodles and some extra toppings like the jalapeños. It was very hot for a long time so I added in some rice to soak up the water and also help cool it down a bit.

They give you a spoon and chopsticks so better practice up your chopstick noodle skills before heading over here!

This was a cool experience and I would go back. It's fun!

Interesting concept.

If you try or get your favorite ramen or any type of noodles, you might want to try this place with various toppings.  

There is a combo that comes with a drink or build your own, toppings are extra.  The cost of the meal can quickly add up with a topping here, protein there and next thing you know it's more than if you cook the items at home.  Though truthfully, I don't have a marinated soy egg or fried garlic at home and to buy it for one setting is too much.

It takes a little while to receive your tray and your items.  An employee will ask if you have ever dined at the restaurant.  If you haven't, the employee will explain to you how to cook the noodles.  The number on the tray is the time it takes to boil the water and cook the noodles.

For my udon noodles, there was a 2 on the tray so I put the bowl on the machine and pressed the 2 button.  Watched the water fill up the bowl and begin heating up.  Didn't see my water bowl boiling like the one we saw earlier but it was hot.  I pressed the button for extra cooking time since there is a suggestion to add the toppings at the end though the egg takes a bit of time to heat up.  I would suggest putting the egg in earlier if you want a hot egg or a bit later if you want a warmish egg.  The other items I ordered included roasted pork belly, fried garlic, and kimchi which didn't take too long to heat up.

Warning: Be careful removing the bowl from the machine since it's hot!  It is a bit hot when you eat the noodles or items.

The marinated egg was on the salty side though my bowl wasn't too salty until the bottom of the bowl so it was complimentary.  If you order a noodle that is more on the salty side like mama, you might want to get some extra water to dilute the flavoring.

We ordered a side dish of kaarage which was a bit hard and oily.  More breading than meat though it gave us more protein to the bowl

It's interesting to try different noodles and toppings.

PS: There is no public bathroom at this location.

Very fun concept! You order your meal from a kiosk, then an attendant comes out to help.

I tried the laksa, which was just OK (I know, that's what I get for ordering the outlier at a mostly ramen-focused place) but the chirashu in it was amazing. Don't know if I'll be back because it's kind of out of the way from the Court Square area, but glad I tried it once.

Ramen wall is cool and there is plenty of seating.

Super cute concept that is very simple and well organized. Ordering from the kiosk and navigating the different ramen and topping options was very easy. Getting the order took longer than expected and there was a few toppings that were sold out, such as egg and scallions. The meal itself tasted good and I got to try a ramen packet I've never had before! I chose all free toppings and added birria beef for my protein. I also got a peach tea that was refreshing and not too sweet. The meal came out to around $15 which isn't a lot for dinner but a bit steep for instant ramen. Overall I liked the experience and would recommend trying out with friends.

I came here after seeing how cute this place looks. For instant noodle fans, this is your place. I got the budae jjigae and the ramdon. The budae jjigae was essentially a ramen with spam and hot dog. The Ramdon was two ramens with beef and scallion. I also added jja jjang sauce to the Ramdon. Overall the total came to about $20. You basically choose which set you want and the staff brings the bowl out with the ingredients. They tell you how to use the machine to add water and let it sit, something I could just do at home. It was an interesting experience but not particularly worth the price...

I recently swung by the Instant Noodle Factory, and here's what I thought. It's a fun spot where you get to choose your own instant noodles and cook them in a cool water heater machine. They've got an impressive array of noodle options and toppings like pork, chashu, corn, chili oil, eggs, seaweed, and more - a true noodle lover's playground.

However, while the experience is undeniably fun, it does come with a price tag that might not quite justify the novelty. It doesn't exactly fit the fast-food vibe it's aiming for, and the whole process could easily be enjoyed in a proper ramen restaurant where you might get more value for your money. The time it took for ordering, cooking, and eating was almost the same amount it would have taken at a legit ramen shop.

So, it all boils ()down to, the Instant Noodle Factory is worth a visit for the unique concept, but if you're seeking an authentic, budget-friendly ramen experience, you might want to opt for one of the city's dedicated ramen joints.

This is the ultimate ramen lover's paradise. What a great idea!! 115 different ramen noodles available to choose from and 1000+ different meal combo choices.

You can DIY your own ramen bowl from noodles to toppings or choose from a list of pre-selected combos that mostly cost under $10.

To order, place your order choices on the IPad. Then, the service staff will hand you a tray with the noodle cup and dry toppings so you can head over to the cooking station with the heating machines.

To cook the noodles, place the noodle cup under the machine, press the number that corresponds to the amount of water that's appropriate (a number 1-4, written at the corner of your food tray). It should take ~3 minutes for most of the noodles to be cooked and the noodles to be ready.

Then, assemble your dry toppings, mix and enjoy! This was such a fun and interactive experience for a casual lunch. I love how novel this concept was. There's plenty of choices and sufficient seating to dine in.

You can find more nyc food and travel on my Instagram: alice.likes.food

Such a cool college hang out kind of spot! A wall full of ramen and noodle options from all over the world basically. You can do their pre-determined options or make your own ramen bowl from scratch. The amount of options and the display of options on the wall is so fun to see, and the servers are very accommodating and helpful.

Instant Noodle Lovers - Rejoice!  

NYC's first self-service Instant Noodle Restaurant!  
@instantnoodlefactory

@instantnoodlefactory is located in Long Island City. You can choose from about 90 different types of noddles and over 30 toppings.

You can order ramen  exact how you want it
1. Order noodles in the kiosk, choose from meat, seafood, miso flavors and more
2. Then select your toppings (classic, protein and premium)
3. The staff will hand you the ingredients and you can toil away "cooking" the noodles at the self-service stations
4. add your sauce and toppings

Each combo is about $8-11.

We also ordered Japanese soda with glass marble and ice-cream mochi. Super Yummy!
Have you tried it yet?

Tag and share with foodies!

Tips:
1. Ramen discount: 20% off 5-pack, 40% off 10 packs for take-home.
2. Only credit card payments accepted

Instant Noodle Factory is a great place to get a quick and tasty bowl of noodles. They have a wide variety of noodles to choose from, and you can customize your bowl with all sorts of toppings. I've been there a few times, and I've always been impressed with the quality of the food and the service.

One of the things I love about Instant Noodle Factory is that they have a really creative menu. They have all sorts of different noodle dishes that you won't find anywhere else, like the "Dan Dan Noodles" and the "Kung Pao Noodles." I've also tried their "Ramen," which is really good.

Another thing I like about Instant Noodle Factory is that they're really affordable. You can get a big bowl of noodles for under $10. And if you're feeling really hungry, you can always order a side of dumplings or spring rolls.

Overall, I think Instant Noodle Factory is a great place to get a quick and tasty meal. The food is good, the service is friendly, and the prices are affordable. I would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a good place to eat in LIC, NYC.

Here is a tip: If you're going on a weekend, be prepared to wait for a table. Instant Noodle Factory is a popular spot, and it can get pretty crowded. But it's definitely worth the wait!

This is a cute little store located in LIC. There are the menus located all over the place, from combos to desserts. You choose what you want to eat and they have 1 kiosk to put in your order with your toppings and extras. Then they bring it out and tell you how to prepare it. I thought it was a cute experience and I'm glad I tried it.

I had the duck duck combo and my bf had the beef birria. I recommend ordering a drink or bringing water because it can get very salty as with all instant noodles!

My friend and I had the opportunity to visit this spot for lunch on a weekday. We both live in the neighborhood and wanted to see if the spot was worth the hype! We arrived around 1 PM and walked in. No need to make a reservation since this spot is very casual. When you walk in the walls show the types of bowls you can order, the bowls you can make, and how to order as well. When it came time to order I decided to go with the beef biria combo. After ordering you sit down and the server comes out with your bowl and instructs you how to use the water heating disc to make your dish. Overall a fun experience but given the prices for the common ingredients it seems more like a novelty rather than something I'd visit multiple times.

Just to get it out of the way: this is instant Ramen, so be sure to walk in knowing what kind of standards to expect. With that being said, it's very fun to choose exactly what you'd like to eat and the pricing is very affordable. They have set combos if you're indecisive like me. It's worth going for the novelty but maybe not regularly unless you really love instant Ramen! The staff were very friendly and helpful and walk you through the cooking steps.

I love this concept, inspired by instant noodle convenience stores you can find across Asia.

Upon walking in, you're greeted with a large wall gallery of instant noodles, which also conveniently serves as your menu.

For those who don't want the hassle of having to interact with another human being when ordering food, you're in luck. At the end of the shop, there's a place to place your order and pay on an iPad.

Soon after, a tray is delivered with your instant noodles in a lined paper bowl alongside any toppings you've chosen. You can then cook and prepare the noodles yourself, with the setting you're supposed to use listed on a piece of paper.

It's a great place to enjoy a quick and convenient meal. No frills eatery and admittedly pretty fun to watch your noodles cook in anticipation of devouring them!

My wife and I decided to try out this place tonight since the weather was rainy and it seemed like a good time to have ramen. I'm glad we decided to get food from here. I placed the order online for take out and by the time I got to the store, the food was ready for me. When you get the food for take out, they give you the noodles uncooked and you have to heat up the noodles depending on what number (1 thru 4) is on the tray. Once the noodles are cooked, you then put the rest of the ingredients on your tray into the ramen. My wife got the  Classic Tonkotsu, chicken karaage, and an iced yakult lychee. I did a build your own and got the mama chand with pulled duck leg, silken tofu, scallions, Narutomaki, and furikake. When I got home, I realized I never got the chicken karaage. I texted the place that I never received the chicken karaage and they were able to refund me right away. I would definitely recommend this place because of the the fast service, the pricing and the quality of food. Usually I'm not a fan of ramen because it's usually too salty for me but this place didn't have too much salt which I was a huge fan of. The staff was very friendly and helpful!!
A new concept in the US.  In Japan, and Korea, these systems are common on every 7-11.  It's fun and innovative. Come down for a quick cheap meal and enjoy the variety.

New must try spot in LIC! This is our second time here after randomly stumbling upon it in the neighborhood last weekend.

It's a fun twist on instant noodles: you pick your noodle pack base and add any toppings you like to add protein and fiber to your noodles. The cooking process takes about 3 minutes, you do it yourself by pressing a button and its fast and efficient. Load up your ramen with the different toppings and enjoy you yummy meal! It really gave us a new appreciation for instant noodles.

Overall a chill spot that my wife and I enjoy coming on the weekends regularly!

Find the time to pop in here and try one of their amazing combos or customize your own ramen bowl! We've now been twice in the past week and plan to make it a regular stop off on weekends. The customer service from the owners is sweet and genuine-- you can tell they truly care about the experience they offer you here from the minute you walk in.

The decor is also fresh and clean-- they have their own pets as the mascots and it's all over their bowls and signs, SUPER CUTE  

So far my personal favorites here are the duck leg, the marinated egg, and their tofu for toppings. Both of the teas they offer (peach tea and citrus ginkgo tea) are made in house and are so refreshing-- perfect pairing with any of the noodles.

Honestly I can't rave enough about this place, this is definitely a hidden gem that should be found ASAP by you and everyone you know.

Cute concept, great options! I recommend the Mala Madness-- I've tried 3 combos and that's my favourite. It is expensive for what it is but it's also one of those things where it's for the experience.

This place has no business being this good! It's like those days in college when you used to remix your instant ramen. The restaurant has about 80 varieties of packaged noodles, and you literally choose your noodles and build a bowl. They have a wide variety of toppings, including fried onions, garlic, corn, marinated soy eggs, duck, beef birria, chorizo, and of course chashu pork for those ramen aficionados. They also have pre-selected combos. I ordered the Duck Duck Noods, a pre-selected combo, which contained scallions, soft boiled eggs, pulled duck leg, and MAMA duck flavored instant noodles. I swapped the soft boiled eggs for marinated eggs for about $0.50 extra. As for the ordering process, you place the order on a kiosk in the back of the restaurant. Since this was my first time at the restaurant, I was confused at the ordering process and the types of noodles and combinations. There was one person in the front of house, but when they go to the back to retrieve the noodles, there is no one to explain the ordering process. There is only one kiosk and the line builds quickly while people are confusingly trying to place orders. After ordering, they bring your bowl, which is mostly dry ingredients. You take the bowl to a machine on the side of the restaurant that adds water and boils the noodles within the bowl. Overall, the experience was pleasant, and the noodles were quite tasty. I'd definitely come back to try different noodle combinations.

This was a really fun experience! My husband and I are very good at making instant ramen at home with various toppings, so we had low expectations when a friend recommended this to us, but wow, there are so many various types of ramen and broths to try. Some of the ramen offered can't even be found in any Asian grocery store nearby. I wanted something more familiar for my first time so I chose the Kimcheese and added on egg and kimchi. I was pleasantly surprised as it had a bit of a twist to the classic Korean flavors with the jalapeno sausages. There's also an option to add rice to soak up the broth at the end, which I highly recommend. Because there's no server and it's automated for the most part, there's no need to tip. Instructions are easy to follow, so no worries if you don't know which buttons to press to boil your water and for how long. I hope this place is able to stay open for longer at night in the future, as it'd be a great place for people to eat after drinking. Can't wait to come back and try something new!

I've been twice now and can confidently say this is our newest neighborhood favorite! When I first heard about this place, I thought it would be a fun, gimmicky spot that I would never return to - but I was quickly proven wrong. There are tons of choices for instant ramen (and if their Instagram is to be believed, they'll soon have 100 different choices) and toppings, ranging from the free (green onion, naruto, garlic chips) to premium (duck, chashu, marinated soft boiled egg). You place your order through an iPad-style kiosk and then wait for your name to be called. An employee will pop out with a tray with your ingredients and explain how to cook the noodles using the automated machines (the tray will indicate which number on the machine to press, which corresponds to pre-set boiling times). Then, cook up your ramen, add your toppings, and enjoy!

The selection of ramen is pretty impressive, even including some Buldak versions not commonly found at your local H-Mart (cream carbo!) and Hong Kong-exclusive Cup Noodles. The toppings are reasonably priced (if you go all out, it'll be around $15-17, but you can easily make a cheaper bowl that's still tasty) and much tastier than I expected. The chashu is up to par with any fresh ramen restaurant in the neighborhood. If you're overwhelmed by the choices, there are also pre-set combos.

Overall, a great experience at a fair price. My boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised at how the toppings transformed the ramen from a sad struggle meal to a "real" dinner. I know we'll be back many times to test out all our wildest combinations!

Happened to stumble across this newly opened spot around the area - im so happy this concept is finally here. Definitely recommend coming here as the selection of instant noodles is unmatched-with stock you cant find at grocery stores that are native/popular in Asian countries. Something about the induction cooking just makes the noodles that much richer/tastier. The toppings are so suiting and price is amazing for the quality. So happy this concept finally was done right in NYC
Such a cool place to visit!! Food was delicious, and love the concept, highly recommend.
Love this new place in LIC! Beef Birria was amazing and I can't wait to come back to make my own combination next time.

Quirky cheap and cheerful. Affordable prices. Meal is ordered on a computer add delivered to a machine where you' cook it yourself. Very easy. At 73, I was the oldest patron when I visited but I enjoyed the experience. Very convenient to the LiC Plaza Hotel where I was staying
Quick to make with easy to follow instructions. Food was delicious with good value for reasonable price
Eh, not bad. Quick meal but I wouldn't go that far for instant ramen lol. The service was amazing tho
Cute store with easy to follow instructions for making your own noodles. Food was delicious and the employees were so helpful and friendly! I'll definitely be coming back here to try more!

I cannot explain how kind and helpful the staff are! Great service and very tasty noodles, and not to mention the variety of toppings you can put on your ramen! Definitely coming back here. The place is a comforting, and aesthetic ambiance. If you're in Long Island City, this is a must!
Great ramen, great price, super cool system! Will be back to try all the other flavors!

Now this is a disclaimer
This review reflects on my experience in my purchases ordering food from this location so take everything with you about to read with a grain of salt. The first time I visit this location I ordered chicken and broccoli with white rice and it turned out pretty good for the most part what I didn't like was the chili oil that I received. It wasn't spicy and the chili was flakes that were in the oil was burn. (Not A Fan) So I thought maybe this was a bad batch so I went back two days later and ordered a A general Tao chicken and that was pretty good too. But again, The chili oil not very good at all. Burn chili flakes and Yes, I'd love spicy ingredients

So I decided to go to another location just for chili oil, and now my third visit was a little bit more on the opposite side because he was not expecting me to order a chow lo mein dish and that was pretty good too but the chili oil again, isn't the best..... So my experience results are that the food is good but anything else other than that like chili or you may want to skip on the chili oil. You can always ask for hot sauce packets and that's an option but if I were you just buy a bottle of Sriracha.

Now when it comes down to hospitality wise the owner is super friendly but he did not realize I'm
not from New York. Now he's a one-man army it seems like so if you do make a visit to this location keep in mind that you will probably wait just a little bit more longer for your food because it seems that he wants to do everything himself and I can VOTE as I right these review that the food quality is excellent American Chinese standard food. And he does have a A rating too.... So Don't judge a book by its cover (wink)

My boyfriend and I tried takeout here for dinner. It was prepared pretty quickly. When I came to pick it up, there was only one older man working at the small kitchen of i-Fortune! I have a lot of respect for him taking care of all the orders.

There was a ton of food for the price. The leftovers lasted us a while!
We liked the general tao's chicken the best. The chicken and broccoli dish had big portions, but was the least flavorful. The lo mein had a ton of different proteins, but the noodles were soggy. It did have good flavor though.

The sesame wontons is another dish I wouldn't recommend- a strong nutty flavor, and basically just wonton (no meat).

Overall, a good takeout option if you need a dinner quickly, and are expecting it wont be top tier chinese food.

I ordered my standard for any Chinese takeout place: chicken with broccoli with pork fried rice. The fried rice was the best part; it had plenty of fresh ingredients and was smokey from the burnt soy sauce. The chicken and broccoli on the hand was slightly cold and a bit old.

I think I would come back for the fried rice because there is value there. I wish the place was bit cleaner because I've worked at a Chinese restaurant before. The place looks like a one man show; it's run and cooked by the same guy.

Cheers

Decent value for quick Chinese takeout. The food is okay and the portions are fairly big. The Wonton with Sesame Sauce barely had any meat in them, but the flavor wasn't bad. Classics like Lo Mein, General Tso's chicken, and Chicken with Broccoli are what you'd expect from a fast takeout joint.

I decided to come back and try the food again today. Overall the food got better. It's the same owner and he's very nice. You can do pickup or delivery. The lunch specials are pretty good. The last few times I tried to order ribs none were left. But overall this place is a staple in the neighborhood. This isn't a place to come dine in as it is very tiny. It's a grab and go place. Usually when you pick up you get the food quicker. Delivery can take no longer than an hour.

Definitely wouldn't go back.. the older gentleman seemed a lil upset with me idk maybe having a bad day besides that the food lacked the traditional American Chinese flavors I'm used to in nyc seemed to be a twist of ingredients of some sort but the taste was off.

Great spot to fulfill a fast chinese food craving! Was really surprised that the chef (owner?) makes everything from scratch upon order, not just heating up pre-made things. The chili oil is also adequately spicy so i recommend if you're looking for an extra kick. Portions are plentiful too!

Tried i-Fortune for the first time and really happy I did! I got the general tso's chicken & garlic eggplant lunch combinations and crab rangoons.

General tso's chicken: this is my go to for Chinese takeout and they made it really well, extra crispy without too much batter and flavorful. If you're looking a saucy general tso's dish then this is not that but that's the tradeoff you make for extra crispy chicken. I ordered it with their white rice which is on the stickier side, which I prefer.

Garlic eggplant: got this on a whim and it really hit the spot - nice flavor with some sweetness and the eggplant was really tender. I got this with roast pork fried rice which was yummy.

Crab rangoons: they call this "cheese wontons" on the menu, they were made fresh when I ordered takeout so by the time I ate them it was still piping hot. Love the juxtaposition of crunchy to melty filling.

All in all, really enjoyed my meal! The owner is also really nice & personable, clearly takes care of his customers and wants to make sure you enjoy your meal.

Just ordered the general Tso' chicken combo with crab Rangoon. Pork Fried rice was fresh. This came out to $16 and some change so affordable. Food was made in a timely order. Crab Rangoon was crispy and I enjoyed it. Overall, a decent Chinese takeout spot on this side of town, which doesn't have too many Chinese spots. Owner is a cool dude and a one man cooking operation; props to him!
Consistently the best Chinese food in all of Queens. This is old NYC style Cantonese cooking at its best.
The owner is the kindest man. Best spring rolls! Affordable! I will keep coming back!

We ordered for delivery during the pandemic and they were quick to arrive. We got the shrimp with garlic sauce and it only came in the large size so it was ~$15. More pricy than we expected because we had originally wanted the special which was around $7-8. Nevertheless still really tasty and we got a lot of shrimp! We also got a large hot and sour sweet which is vegetarian and really good.

Will come here for my Chinese takeout cravings!

I came out of yelp retirement to write this... nice spot in the neighborhood, one of the few fast chinese take out. No complaints, except there were no fortune cookies! Prices are reasonable and the chef/owner was very nice. Spicy oil is a great topping. Will be back next time there's this craving. Note, don't bother coming here if it's not what you're looking for.

Their GeneralTso with Pork fried rice is soo much better than other pricy restaurants! And the old man is very kind and friendly!
Definitely give it a try!!

In a search for local eateries I found the Fortune Cookie here in Long Island City. With most of the local places closing due to the virus they have a big sign saying they are open for business. And busy they were. I ordered a buffet of items with my sesame beef as the winning course. Holy smokes it was good!!! Everything about it was awesome. The hot and sour soup was still nuclear hot by the time I walked back to my place but when it finally cooled a bit it too was very very good! Fried wontons and a few other sampling's I was stuffed. I will absolutely return for more. The guy who helped us was very friendly and helpful. If your nearby you definitely need to stop in!

DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT ORDER. This was the most disgusting, putrid, Chinese food (or food in general) that I have ever tasted. When I opened my chicken and broccoli I knew I was doomed. The scent was overwhelmingly sour. I gave one piece of broccoli and one piece of chicken a chance. I don't even think the chicken was chicken. It was mushy. Everything was just as expected - SOUR!! I thought I could resort to just eating my wonton soup (even though my hopes weren't high since it was dark brown).  As soon as I opened it, SOUR!! I didn't even taste it because it smelled like it had been sitting in a dirty pot for the past 25 years. Even the white rice didn't taste right. I threw the entire order in the garbage. This establishment should be shut down.

My comment is not about the food which I haven't had but the service. I was just SCREAMED at to not order food here because they are too busy. I can't imagine how they're still in business with such atrocious behavior to a paying customer. I will not give them any of my money and would advise other yelpers to do the same.

There are not many cheap takeout restaurants in LIC, so I greatly appreciated finding this typical take out Chinese restaurant in Court Square section of LIC.
