Food is nothing special, but for me it hits my craving for Chinese takeout food. Sesame chicken is decent, shrimp and broccoli had too much sauce but it was fine. I've had other dishes as well, but I think the sesame chicken and similar items are their best options. It could be better, but with so few options I think this place deserves your business. Owner is also super friendly, which is a great bonus! Support your local businesses!

Hands down the worst Chinese food I've ever had.  This location is take out only, and has no seating.  Had the hunan chicken combo dinner.  The rice was severely overcooked that you could literally take a fork and easily smoosh it into mushy mess.  The chicken was really chewy and was just so bland.  I asked for the dish to be hot, so the cook added what seemed to be nothing more than burned, greasy pepper flakes (see photos).  Best part of the dinner was the egg roll, which was decent.  I'm giving two stars because the food was horrendous, but adding a star because the chef/owner was actually super nice.

It wasn't good, wasn't good at all. I moved here from Sunnyside about 2 weeks ago. This place is beside key foods. The owner is really kind. But the food isn't good. I had the vegetable fried rice & egg roll.. very disappointing .

even for americanized chinese food, which sometimes i yearn for to hit the spot, this place is mediocre.  the dish i ordered had an unnecessary sweetness, and the soup was not quite right, even for american chinese food standards.
This Chinese takeout place pretty authentic. They make really good hot and sour soup and their fried chicken wings are really good. I'll be ordering from here more and try the other things
Run by nicest man--always puts a smile on my face when picking up delivery. Great tasting food, fair prices, ready for pick up quickly.

Henry is an awesome guy, I went to his old Chinese restaurant in court Square by the seven trains for years, now he is by my business on 21street and I always buy steamed dumplings, chicken, and broccoli. He is very friendly likes to talk to his customers and leaves you satisfied. The guy is a hero as an essential worker who feeds the neighborhood, and struggles working hard to keep his customers happy,  great food, and excellent service!

Consistent, classic New York Chinese food. We come here 1-2 times a month.
Beef & eggplant in garlic sauce is my fave. They can make your orders extra crispy. The servings are generous in my opinion. The owner is very nice.

i-Fortune Cookie is a new Chinese takeout place in a swath of LIC that is up and coming.  I spoke with the owner, and this is in fact a replacement of his original location that used to be next to Court Square Diner.  I've ordered takeout from here twice now, and while I can't speak for delivery as both times I've picked up - they are super fast, and super friendly at the counter.  It's a small space, and when you enter you are basically coming right into their kitchen.  The space appears very clean and you can technically watch them cook your food if you'd like.

It is basic Chinese takeout, and as long as your stomach can handle it, it's great.  I definitely recommend the
- Orange Chicken,
- General Tso's Chicken,
- Beef Fried Rice,
- Hot and Sour Soup,
- Cold Sesame Noodles, and the
- Ribs appetizer.  

However, I'm not a huge fan of
- the "brown sauce" nor the
- Chicken Fried Rice or the
- Chicken with Chinese Vegetables.  

They always include the usual and typical fortune cookies, and many packets of soy sauce, duck sauce, and mustard.  I don't really understand the mustard...
Overall, I've heard good things about the original location, and look forward to trying many more entrees down the road.

I'm a fan. Look, I know what I'm getting...cheap chinese food. But for Long Island City, there aren't many inexpensive places to eat - and whatever I order from this place, I then have food for two days.  I recommend the standards - general tsos, kung po, moo sho, and love the szechuan dumplings.

The owner, or guy who runs the place, is super friendly. He knows his customers and he's been in the neighborhood for a while. Stand up guy and establishment. Oh, and delivery is always faster than estimated.

Ordered here for delivery bunch of times and the experience was all very pleasant. Lunch special is cheap and comes with soup and rice. Delivery man was/is always on time and super friendly he makes me want to tip him more because he always walks in with a smile on his face. One time they forgot a dish- which happens and offered right away to go get it and came back so fast and apologized profusely. Will have my business because of their professionalism. Food is also pretty delicious. I can be a picky eater and be full of criticisms but don't have anything bad to say about them.

Four of us got takeout. Only one of us liked their meal which was the beef teriyaki sticks. THE CHICKEN FINGERS WERE TRASH. These are not chicken fingers, my man dead just dipped it in some batter and fried it on the wok. Waste of $13. Anyway, if you trynna have diarrhea this place is great.

It's your standard no-frills takeout Chinese spot. The chef and staff are friendly and the $7.50 lunch special has an enormous amount of options with an equally enormous portion size! Look, the location isn't the cleanest, the food isn't the healthiest, and you might feel a bit queasy if you eat everything in one sitting, but in my opinion it's the best cheap Chinese takeout in the area, and a nice inexpensive option in LIC, which is hard to come by.

The spare ribs and sesame chicken are great, would definitely recommend either of those as an option for the lunch special. As a general advice, I'd avoid seafood at lower-end spots like these, save your stomach and toilet!

I've been here twice in the past three weeks and haven't been disappointed; got my orders correct both times and tasted delicious!
I've seen plenty of reviews giving the owner 3 stars, but this little shop is honestly a go-to for my family when it comes to good chinese near us.
Definitely recommended!

Ordered Beef ribs and the rude owner gives me teriyaki beef that's burnt and then says sorry we have no beef ribs, next time.  What a joke!  
Never again, save your money.  Much better places to eat.

Sweet mother of pearl. I haven't felt this sick since I was unplugged.

Do any of ya'll wash your stank hands after loosing fecal matter from the shallow depths of your puny bowels?

Good thing the big bear has a Japanese bidet that is worth more than all of your lives put together and is also attached to a Bloomberg machine - haha you thought Barry Snakeman would miss out on the paper bc of a stomach virus?  lmao ur gonna have to try harder than that Mr. Smith and Co. (I have since ascertained that this restaurant is a wholly owned subsidiary of said Co.) Ya'll some bitches.

It's a good thing I got "keep around hoes" (supermodels that basically lay around in my loft space, constantly high) for times like these when Barry jr. needs to be fed organic and locally sourced combinations of beef, veal and goose livers.

I shout commands at Barry jr. from le bain (that's the bathroom, dumbasses) and he still listens. But I let him get his fair share of order number #69 "pungent supermodel." To be clear, I'm saying that my dog has sex with human supermodels while ya'll have not, do not and never will.

The food tasted great though on the way in I have to give it to you on that account.

Service was fast and the owner was very friendly.  The place is small and lacks space if you want to eat there.

I ordered the beef w. Broccoli. The meal wasn't covered with sauce which is nice.  The beef and fried rice was so so. The broccoli wasnt overcooked which I l liked. Previously, I tried the general tso chicken which i thought was better. I would rate the food at 3.5 but the speed of service bumps it up to a 4. Overall, good place for take out.

4-6 years ago, this place was not good and very rude. However, after re-opening they are awesome.

The food is on point and quick.
General Tso's chicken had so much chicken and Broccoli; my husband always asks for sauce on the side and they did that too.
So far, all the food we've gotten has not disappointed:
General Tso's Chicken, Beef and Broccoli, Mooshu Beef, Orange Chicken, Moo Goo Gai Pan, Lo Mein, Egg Roll, Shrimp Roll.
This is our new Go-to Chinese food place in LIC!

For $7 lunch special I love the general Tsos with egg drop soup. I drop by often since j work down the street. Super fresh fried chicken on the spot. The owner is super nice. He even does deliveries himself. My friends loved all the food we got delivered!

OMG, The worst Chinese food ever. The chicken wings tasted like
seasoned plaster of Paris and the shrimp fried rice was by far
the worst ever.

MUST READ!! This is by far the worst Chinese food I ever had. They must use old shrimp and beef which just get crushed in your mouth without chewing. Not only that it must been cook by someone who never had experience of cooking. I will never go near this place or order. I was embarrassed to give this to my guests and they didn't even touch it after once. I really wanted refund but I rather write this instead to save your money!

Fortune cookie was ok. Thats it!

The owner basically does everything and is really quite nice. This place does the trick for your typical chinese fix...or in my case, the 'mitzvah' of eating chinese food on Christmas. I ordered the shrimp and chicken hunan style, asking if I add beef in as well - which he did for a $1 extra. It's supposed to be spicy, but seemed like more of the typical 'brown sauce'...but I had some hot sauce, so I made do. They have brown rice too, which was nice ($1 extra to swap). All in all, not Michelin worthy, but with a name like "i-Fortune Cookie"...it serves it's intended purpose.

Don't waste your money on this crappy food!
The meat was tastes old and not fresh.
Never order from here again

Um pass.. thought I'd try a new spot. Thought it was a good idea. It'll be fine I thought. So, so wrong.

Boneless spare ribs were weak. Hard and old tasting. It was like what I imagine warming up teriyaki beef jerky in the microwave and serving it over minute rice rice would be like. As I was eating I knew I was in for a rough morning.. thought right on this one.

Cheese wontons were good but cold because the delivery took an hour. You'd think we live in middle America where the nearest Chinese restaurant is  20 miles away. Fast and convenient score, 0.

(Disclaimer: "Fast and convenient" score is a metric I made up. It holds heavy weight in my reviews)

I'm sorry but this was very bad Chinese food. Worst I ever had and way too expensive for what Chinese take out is supposed to be. Even for this neighborhood. Ordered take out last night and everything tasted bad. The dumplings were too doughy with no flavor at all. Fried rice didn't even taste like a fried rice. Chicken and broccoli was below average and the chicken tasted odd. Maybe it's one of these hit and miss places or we ordered on a bad night (which isn't excusable), but we threw half of our food away and I was sick most of the night. Extremely disappointing.

For 1 chicken fried rice, chicken and broccoli, 1 order of dumplings and a side order of rice with a ginger ale it was $35. Like what? Outrageous! And the quality of food is below poor. Infuriating. The one star is for pretty quick delivery and I think I'm being rather generous given the overall experience.
The worst food ever!!! The owner is a nice guy. The food is cheap, but it really really sucks. Dog vomit. The guy just can't cook. Bummer.

The worst Chinese take out I have ever been to.  They use the worst parts of meat for their dishes.  You can tell by how hard and chewy the emat is when you bite into it.  Seafood produce is small and of the cheap kind (not even jumbo shrimp available).  The taste is very bland as well as they don't do anything to especially season their food.

Had a neighborhood menu so wanted to try it First off the menu has no beverages and few sides listed so should have realized something was off. They delivered a lunch special and charged me 6.00 for 2 bags of crispy noodles instead of .60. He apologized and sent the guy back with my change saying he hit the wrong key.
Then when i opened what should have been sweet n sour sauce really looked like hot sauce the egg roll tasted like sour cabbage and the spring rolls were soggy. The vegetables and bean curd was too soft with barely any sauce. It was like light beige water. Absolutely the worst chinese food I have ever had! too expensive too
Their prices are getting close to Manhattan prices. But the food is almost worth it. I usually go for the lunch specials

Been ordering here for years. Great place. Really nice owner. The food always seems fresh and tastes good.  I paid them a visit during the coronavirus lockdown and the owner is in there alone keeping it going. Support local businesses!

Fortune Cookie was my favorite Chinese restaurant in LIC, and used to be located on 23rd Street across from the Court Square Diner. One day they didn't answer their phone, and just like that, they had vanished. Stupid LIC leases.

But alas, they are back! Located in the old local pharmacy near Key Food, they are open for business again. I was so excited to see this today that I stopped in for lunch.

The owner remembered me and was super friendly. I got a few different dishes (the basic standards) and I am writing this quite full, as happy as ever.

While I can't speak to their delivery yet, at the old place it was one of the fastest to arrive in all of LIC. The food isn't super fancy but it's by far the best Chinese takeout in the neighborhood.

Best Chinese take out in LIC, hands down.

First of all, the owner guy is SUPER friendly!  Always get a big greeting when I walk in here.

The prices are very reasonable.  The best is the lunch special for about $6.50 which comes with meal/rice, and a soup or drink.  A huge bonus is you can also get this deal for dinner.

The chicken is always soft, tender, and real, unlike say Mr. Wonton and some of the other Chinese joints in this hood.

Some of my favorite meals:

General Tso Chicken - yummy sweet sauce, nice big chicken chunks
Orange chicken - sweet orange sauce
Sweet & sour chicken
Chicken with broccoli - wow very surprised both the chicken and broccoli were super soft and tender.  the light sauce was also tasty.

Great egg drop soup too, salty and eggy like I like it.  Comes with the combo.

Delivered on time, delivery person was very friendly and appreciative. Food was definitely a letdown, bland, a bit cold (despite delivery not taking very long), but really it just didn't taste very good. My first time ordering Chinese since I moved to LIC in late 2014. I'll hunt for other places.

FTR I had Hunan Chicken (it was not spicy at all, sad to say), and chicken fried rice.

Food 4.0/5.0
Service 2.5/5.0
Value 3.0/5.0
Decor 3.0/5.0
Overall 4.0/5.0

Service would have been good but it was very slow and the waiter was way too pushy on the wine and dessert menus -- had to remind myself I wasn't at a flea market.

Decent spot in a townhouse on 54th but the lights went out briefly more than once.

Pasta was excellent, fish was good.

Would still go back... but lets try to show some class next time...

Best Italian Restaurant in NYC. First rate. Quality organic ingredients. Olive oil from Amalfi coast. Pasta is not commercial type and presentation, service and ambiance is dedicated to fine dining experience. Head Chef Vito is a passionate culinary genius.
Visit MOMA and enjoy one of the best restaurants in the city.
Try the paccheri alla genovese and the fish dishes are all exceptional. Veal alla Milanese is a huge portion of pure joy.
Wine list is amping the best but there will not be a sommelier. Ask for advice to the chef for pairing. The trebbiano is a steal for the price quality ratio.
Desserts are outstanding.
Just first rate fine dining experience that deserves to be savored and experienced more than once.
Buon Appetito!

For whatever reason, when I eat out, Italian is not anywhere near the top of my preferences. Thankfully, someone else picked this place, and probably has changed my mind. If more Italian places are like Il Gattopardo, then my preferences will probably change.  

This restaurant was, in one word, fabulous.

Overall: 5 stars
Food: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Ambiance/Layout: 4 stars
Value: 3 stars

Food
We had a large group (7), and ordered a wide variety of foods.  Forgive my lack of vocabulary, I'm just going to describe rather than name.

For appetizer, most ordered the tomato/mozzarella salad, including myself. It was fantastic. Best I've ever had. Main course was more varied.  I had the branzino, my wife, daughter split a steak, others ordered lasagna.  My fish was excellent, and of course, I "sampled" the steak, which was also excellent. My friend who ordered the lasagna was raving about it.

Dessert
High-end Italian served in an intimate space on the lower floor of a beautiful townhouse. Rave reviews all around.

Lovely meal and service-can only give 4 stars because of the truly terrible fruit fly infestation in the outdoor dining shed-the waiter had to provide covers for the wine glasses in advance since he knew there was a problem. $96 dollars for a bottle of wine and 10-12 dead fruit flies in the bottom of the glasses-management please fix this problem!

ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC! Found this place because it had some relation to Michelin stars but I don't remember how. I made a reservation but honestly didn't need one as there were still plenty of seats. We sat outside and it was quite nice!

Started off with some bread appetizers with olive oil. We were also treated with a complimentary appetizer which I believe were some sort of rice balls. Meal was off to a great start.

I ordered the pan-seared venison loin and it was PHENOMENIAL! The meat was so tender and the juices were amazing. The sauce had such distinct and complimentary flavours that I was honestly baffled at how good it was. The timballo was also so tasty - but definitely could taste more potato than anything which I liked.

I was also able to try some of the pasta and it was so delicious! The pasta itself, the sauces, and the meats and veggies that came with the dishes were all cooked and seasoned so well.

I ordered some of the Silene red wine to go with my food and it was very tasty alongside the meal, so wine is definitely a plus with the experience.

Overall, I had a great time and the food was amazing. The head of the restaurant sometimes comes by to talk to us so got to learn a bit more about Italian culture which I liked. It's a very nice environment but definitely dress nicely. Bathroom is nice too. Food is expensive but I think you should expect that when coming here. Honestly, some of the best Italian food I've had in my life and I'm thankful that I came here. Have to come again to try some of their other stuff.

After three or four fun dates if you're sure they're the one, this is the place to seal the deal. Ideal high end site on one of nyc's elite blocks. You're arriving at the Rockefeller townhouses, as if you're invited. Private side entrance down the short steps to a gate that happens to be open for you. Perfect greeting and service start to finish. Friendly and personable, as if you belong. The food is good enough, strong creative cocktails, great wine list. Some night when you return, take a seat (or two, if the deal persists) at the small almost hidden bar at the side. Five stars for the setting!

Il Gattopardo is one of my favorite Italian places in NY.  It is as authentic as it can be.  It specializes in southern Italian cocine.  Their menu is seasonal so there will be slight variations periodically.  The service is excellent, their tables impecable.  Quality ingredients, passion and a great chef along with a great wine menu and a fun, classy and impecable ambiance make for a great experience.  To finish the night, I highly recommend a Zabaione for dessert.  They will prepare it in front of you.  Enjoy!

In two words:  totally underwhelmed.

This place is has a great (if noisy) setting, a high-end ambiance, and the guts to charge $68 for a veal chop milanese.  The question is do they deliver?  The answer is no.  Bland, unremarkble food.  Tasteless mussells.  A lobster salad that was huge chunks of lobster haphazardly thrown onto a mixed green salad heavily dressed in vinaigrette.  A dry tasteless milanese.  Lukewarm branzino.  And an inedible pork chop, which we were asked to cut with a butter knife.

An AWOL waiter who never appeared, never checked in, never asked if we wanted more drinks and who, on the few occaisions we saw him, always seemed to serving other tables and deliberately never making eye contact with us to at least acknowledge our entreaties.

They did the right thing and pulled th pork chop off the bill, but the meal was already ruined.  I won't be back.

One of the best experiences ever !
The restaurant is located inside an historical building the indoor is minimal and chic the outdoor was very nice and romantic .
The food is from south Italy and is very authentic . we got the zucchine alla parmigiana , and the Buffalo mozzarella .special both of them were amazing! The genovese pasta was one of the best I ever had
The service was outstanding.
Sebastian our server was very attentive and took care of us !

Food- below mediocre overpriced
Basement! $50 wine priced at $550. Uncoordinated service   Really puzzling why would anyone come back to this place.

Loved this place for the service!! Went here for a date-night and I was overwhelmed by the special treatment. To start off with the wine selection and the chefs special which was complimentary.

Antipasti - Parmigiana of Zucchini. The zucchini was not fried but still mild-crispy. Loved the eclectic spices in the dish.

The waiter took time to help us out with the menu on the Primi. We got the lobster ravioli and the Agnolotti Filled with Honey Squash and Bufala Ricotta. I wouldn't recommend the agnolotti if you don't like dish with a hint of sweetness. The ravioli was out of the world.

They recommended the Zambianone for dessert and it was made live, next to our table.

Overall fun experience.

Sustainability at its peak. The utensils were reusable and clean.

Very delicious.  Beautiful interior and excellent service.

Came here for a large work dinner in the downstairs area. We had passed hors d'oeuvres and several dishes. My favs were the tre ditte, bass and chocolate mousse but every dish here was perfect.

Service is classic as well - one of those old school places that feels like they anticipate your every move

Went to Il Gattopardo for a business lunch. It was extremely crowded and the restaurant seemed to be understaffed. The food was very good and I would certainly try it again for dinner or on a weekend when it might not be as crowded. Across the street from MoMA and otherwise well located in Midtown.

This midtown,  east side Italian "Ristorante" never disappoints!!!  Waitstaff is unseen but attentive, and very knowledgeable.
The house made ravioli or tortellini is perhaps the best in NYC. While there is a limited selection of Pasta Fresca, it is always outstanding paired with a delicious sauce.
My "secondi" consisted of Dover Sole, deboned table side, with lemon and capers. It is simply perfection.
For dessert Delizia a La limone, lemon delight, transported me back to the Amalfi Coast.
What a meal!!!!!!!!

Perfect and authentic Italian restaurant, highly recommended
Nice ambiance, very chic environment

Food: I started with the burrata. It was good, but literally every burrata is good. This one was simple. Burrata, prosciutto, some tomatoes, lightly seasoned. Delicate. I enjoyed it, but not really one to remember. The Public House in Mountainside, NJ has the best one I've had in a while. Dinner was the baked cod. Very nice. Sauce. Capers. Tomatoes. Olives. Really enjoyable dish. Not very heavy. I'd get it again, BUT the enjoy of the table was the veal osso buco served over mashed potatoes. I'm sure it was wasn't the healthiest option, but it looked awesome... and my buddy said it was as good as it looked!

Service: what you'd expect at a place like this. Polite. Professional. Attentive, but not pushy.

Atmosphere: Packed. Literally every seat was filled. White table cloth. Clean. Elegant, but tight. They have tables close to each other and they even have a table right by the front door which looked terrible. I'd be upset if they say us there.

Miscellaneous: Good meal. Good service. I don't go back for dinner based on value.

First, I would like to start by saying I think they were trying to be prejudice at first. The staff tried to seat us in the far back from everyone else when there were empty seats until I called them out on it.

After I called them out the service got a lot better (big surprise) lol !

The food - 4/5 my friends thought it was the best pasta they ever had. I personally did not think so. The menu is very authentic to Italian culture. No meat and cheese and tomato based. They don't have white sauce pasta.

Ambiance: intimate and high end

Service: 3/5 minus them treating us differently I thought it was great service besides that

Overall: I'm not sure if I'd go back to be honest. If you're white I'm sure you'll get the best service available. I noticed the chef went specific groups but did not come to our group.

My date made reservations for us to enjoy dinner on the steps. The food was fantastic. Summer is the best time to enjoy the outdoor experience, esp as people walk by.
I'd love to enjoy this restaurant indoors during the cooler months.  I went to the restroom and was pleased w the interior. I'll be back.

This restaurant has really taken outdoor dining during COVID to another level. They have a creative setup with some of the tables located on charming terraced landings of the old-time building above the main restaurant. We sat at one of these tables tonight and had a bird's eye view from our higher vantage point. The remainder of the outdoor tables are nicely spaced out and in a well-designed covered area. If you want outdoor dining to feel special and not cobbled together due to necessity, this is your place!

Our food was excellent. The only thing we couldn't try was the complimentary rice balls they offered, as our party did not include meat eaters. The pasta was homemade and delicious.

The service was very good as well. The jacketed waiters were friendly and gracious. The mood of the staff seemed welcoming and positive. We will be back!

Impecable and outstanding service, from the moment we walked in to the moment we left.  We came during probably their busiest time of the year - a week before Christmas -  and an hour before our reservations (had an errand nearby and got done earlier) so I was apprehensive that they might turn us away.  No, they did not. No only that, they didn't even mention it!  We were immediately seated on the main level. Whew lol

Breads and gourmet olive oil were served right away, and were delicious. We were brought a complimentary appetizer (rice balls?), and ordered  a zucchini parm appetizer to split. At this point were already full (lol).

For the mains, we ordered veal and branzino (special), which was skillfully deboned tableside. I want to say it that with the sides our meat and fish came with, the dishes were simple but yet perfect just like they were.

We also asked for wine reco, and received something that complimented our meals beautifully.

Overall, we had a delicious and filling meal, and exceptional service.  Thank you.

A NYC Italian Staple

We originally picked this restaurant years ago as it was well reviewed and the location was central to a group of us that were meeting for dinner. The managers and servers are experienced at being gracious and very attentive. We've continued to go here as the food is always fresh and delicious with daily dinner specials. The wine list is outstanding. It is usually full and lively at dinner time but we don't mind the loudness as the food and ambience is always enjoyable.

Ate here after visiting the MoMA and it's excellent.  Both the branzino (deboned table side) and the lobster ravioli were very well prepared and tasty and the desserts were fantastic.  Would definitely come back next time we are in NYC

The service was eh, food was good but salty. The meal started with fresh bread that was good. Then we shared their special burrata salad that was good as well. I shouldn't have put cheese on my pasta as it was already too salty. All in all, I would go again but not a must
Beautiful interior and nice staff. There was a baby roach on our table and the waiter didn't know what to do so I killed it. I think this would be the only time I would visit.

I visit Il Gattopardo every time I'm in town from Omaha. It's is out of this world. Very authentic and full of flavor. You won't be disappointed. The staff was on the ball and very eager to help. My only complaint would be that I didn't have my vaccination card so I had to sit on the sidewalk. Not a bother, just remember that when you go and visit.
Excellent food and service at a perfect location. Call for reservations! The ambience is casual and welcoming !

Great place while in NYC when looking for a relaxed environment away from the hustle. The food has the right amount of flavor not overwhelming. We were a group of 12 sitting in a reserved area where we could hold a conversation. The menu had a variety to choose from. The wait was short and food was fresh.

Are you looking for a great Southern Italian food in a beautiful romantic setting. Look no farther than Il Gattopardo. It is located in The Rockefeller Townhouses. Built in 1897, the buildings were designed in the Beaux Arts Renaissance style. They were once owned by  John D. Rockefeller who called them home for nearly forty years. The feel here is understated elegance. I think this is the perfect date restaurant. It is very romantic with tables set up individually on the steps of the various townhouses lit by candlelight. It was not stuffy or over done. We had martinis to start. They were good but served in Champagne glasses rather than martini glasses. I don't care but our friend pointed it out. We moved on to appetizers of veal meatballs and octopus. The meatballs were very well prepared, moist, tasty, not too large and disappeared quickly, enjoyed by all. I ordered the special risotto with vegetables and made with a rich pork broth. It was perhaps the best risotto I ever had, creamy and vibrant, and was a healthy portion. My sister had lobster ravioli which she enjoyed. She said it was creamy and she could actually taste the lobster pieces in the ravioli. It was also a healthy portion. Even though we were mostly stuffed, we ordered deserts- a limoncello sponge cake and a dark chocolate sponge cake with raspberry, which were satisfying and special and just the right size The waiter brought little almond cookies to end as an added little nosh as well.
The service was friendly and attentive. The waiters kept the drinks flowing at the beginning but then let us relax and enjoy the beautiful NYC evening in a romantic, calm and sophisticated atmosphere. No rushing to get the next reservation in, just very relaxed, smooth, non intrusive service, very much like a night at a restaurant in Italy.

We went here with high expectations since we lived in Italy for a long time and are passionate about authentic Italian food. Well, we were very disappointed for various reasons. The food was mediocre at best. They claim to be a southern Italian restaurant and the food was authentic but definitely missing flavor. The cucumber-tomato salad was ok but nothing special, the ravioli with porcini mushrooms was very bland and definitely missing a different touch to the sauce, the fish was ok but again very basic. The cantucci we were offered with check was also just ok in fact we commented that the ones I made home for Christmas a few days before were better. (I'm an accountant not a chef). The wine list was ok. Service was too forced. I could tell from the accents that some of the staff was really Italian but some weren't and it was obvious that they were told to use basic Italian words as 'grazie' or 'prego'. On top of it, the day after I noticed that my card was charged twice and when I called them they were just rude. The first time I called, after a wait, I was told to call back in an hour since the manager was not there. Not a 'can I take your number and call you back', not an apology, nothing. When I did call back , (not sure if this was the manager or some other person that felt confident enough to respond to my inquiry), I was told that it should be a problem regarding my bank and that their records show I was only charged once in a very rude tone. Guess what? I know exactly how cards or pre authorizations work and as of today the second charge is still standing. Would I go back? No, with all the choices in the area, absolutely not!

I was here for a work event and we were seated in the private atrium downstairs. It was essentially a large room with very high ceiling because it was in an small alley between two buildings covered with a transparent roof. It was very cosy and classy at the same time. Food was impeccable and there's also a private bar at the side of the large room. Highly recommended if you are looking to host a large group of people in a fancy setting.

Solid Italian food in a beautiful townhouse setting, expect very professional staff and very delicious food. Stick to their fresh catch of the day and pasta dishes. The homemade butter and cheese ravioli with walnuts was the standout. There are both indoor and outdoor seating and staff do not rush you. On a warm and pleasant day, sit outside.

This is the perfect date night Italian place. The service is amazing as they even go as far as splitting the appetizers on your plates for you. The grilled octopus is the best I've ever eaten and the veal meatballs are to die for. Very enjoyable.
Great spot for brunch.  Had the wagyu burger, shakshouka and ricotta pancakes.  Nice cocktails and wine list. Relaxing atmosphere and attentive service.

Our kids in Chappaqua had Il Gattopardo cater a diner for 30 at their home.

There was 8 in staff between kitchen and serving staff. Very personable and efficient.

Started with an outstanding array of Hors D'oeurves including Fried shrimp, fried baby artichoke hearts, meatballs, and fabulous squash blossoms.

Next was an Endive salad with pressed anchovy dressing.

Artisanal cavatelli  with shellfish ragout and Rigatoni with spicy nduja sausage and red onions, both awesome.

For mains, we got a choice of Codfish "in casseruola" with Gaeta olives, pantelleria, capers, cherry tomatoes and organic potatoes or thinly sliced aged New York steak with rosemary, Himalayan salt, served with roasted fingerling potatoes. Both fabulous

for dessert, we had Mousse di cioccolato with Aglianico wine heart or Frangipane tart with fresh summer berries and caramel gelato. Superb ending.

WOW what a dinner.

Quite expensive and quite disappointing. A table of six diners next to us got up and left after being served their food and complaining. The service was ok, but it took 15 minutes for our wine to be served and it wasn't busy. The clincher was my wife's order of the Sardinian risotto-style fregola. It was an unappealing brownish green mush of minced (minced?!) scallops and some micro pasta that resembled lentils. It looked like dog food. Our son is a chef and runs an upscale restaurant so we know how dishes should be presented. A chocolate cake desert was average. The next night we had a slice of pizza from Rays and saved $220, and were a lot happier.

I was looking for Italian food before a show in the city and came across this restaurant.  We booked a 6:00 reservation and we were seated immediately and the service was spot on.  I dined with a friend and our 2 daughters.  They don't have a "kids" menu, but offered a standard spaghetti with marinara for the girls.  Our server basically picked our wine, our appetizer, and entrees, which were all incredible.  They provided bread service before our meal and we started with the octopus.  It was outstanding!!  I had the codfish which he warned would be a bit salty, but I love olives and capers so it was right up my alley.  We didn't have time for desert which was disappointing but will be back again!!!
Menu has nice selections and the food was very good. Was there on a business dinner and the waitstaff was responsive and unobtrusive.

Sad that this restaurant has deteriorated so much. It was an old standby. Expensive yes but it was excellent food. This time it was at best mediocre and super expensive. We ordered some of the special risotto and pasta. It was just ok but overly salted. I ordered a spaghetti con vongole - again ok and super salted. Wine was ok.  Service was good but they seemed stressed out. We could have bought an excellent to go meal at Eataly with a better wine too.

Truly a lovely evening, from start to finish. From the warm greeting upon entering to the mini biscotti upon exiting.
  The food is fantastic, as is the wine list. However the service and hospitality are what makes this a wonderful dining experience.

This is my most favorite Italian restaurant and our favorite place to celebrate a holiday, anniversary or birthday. The food is amazing and the staff is very attentive to your needs. I love this place.

So...this place is insanely nice and insanely expensive. I wasn't paying so whatever...free fancy meal for Jax!

I came with a party of eight people for a Sunday evening dinner at 7:30. the restaurant is PACKED PACKED PACKED. I left at 11pm and it was still busy. The service was perfect, which is expected at a place like this. What was nice was when we ordered a bunch of appetizers for the table, the kitchen made everyone a little tasting plate of everything so that we didn't have to go around passing around the dishes. For my entree I had one of their specials that night, a veggie risotto, and it was excellent and a hefty portion. I was so full from the appetizers alone I only ate about half of my entree. The best appetizers were the burrata (arguably better than what I ate in Italy) and the zucchini parmesan was FANTASTIC.

For dessert we had the cheesecake, the chocolate mousse, a special fruity dish the kitchen made for one of the gluten free folks, and a plate of biscotti. The mousse was awesome, but truthfully, everything was good.

An $1,800 bill and a few bottles of wine later, we were all stuffed and tipsy.

First of all -- Make a reservation!! You will need it! Fantastic dining experience! Very pricey but definitely worth it. This is probably the finest Italian (and AUTHENTIC Italian) restaurant in NYC. It is as high as it gets. You can get REAL truffles here! Yes! And yes, they cost a bunch, but hey... it is REAL TRUFFLES! The wine list is EXTENSIVE! I wonder where they store all those wines in such a cozy place! The food is absolutely fantastic. I have ordered the pasta carbonara -- it is a brunch menu item -- but they did for me at dinner (twice). They are really accommodating. The deserts are really good as well. Get the gelato! It is pretty close to the real gelato you would get in Italy.

Love this restaurant. One of the best kept secrets, tucked away in the lower level of a beautiful building just down the street from the University Club.
My husband and I stop in for a drink and an appetizer or entrees whenever we are in the neighborhood. Great wine selection and the pasta is delicious. I don't eat seafood but my husband loves their specials every time. The service is always very good. The restaurant and small bar area are kept neat and clean. We will return again and again!

Last minute reservation and food, service and ambiance was all stellar! We walked into this charming restaurant and were warmly greeted and seated at a lovely table. The ambiance was both inviting and welcoming. Our waiter, Sean was fantastic and the food was absolutely delicious. It was a lovely experience!

Here goes the cliche....I almost don't want to review this place, because I love it so much.

The Leopard (yeah yeah, it really means The Serval) is housed in a beautiful townhouse across the street from the back of MOMA. They've set up a nice Covid greenhouse and some awesome tables around the townhouse steps, so I have barely been inside. The food is STELLAR Italian and the whole vibe is that lazy, bottle of wine with lunch, Upper East Side classy vibe.

EXCEPT. It's not actually on the UES and it lacks only one thing...that UES snottiness.

Those UES places tend to look at most people like we are dirt on their shoe (I'm looking at you, The Mark and Sant Ambroeus and especially Nello, where women are not allowed at the bar alone because apparently we might be hookers, what !!!). I mean, hubs and I clean up well but at the above spots, unless we hit the host/ess hard in the face with a Birkin, we will be, as clear downtowners, at best second class.

Il Gattopardo serves up not just killer food but warm and endearing, truly Italian service, even if you roll up in your jeans and sneakers and somehow forgot your diamonds and facelift. At this point, the place is like home to me.

Sold? OK! Here's what to eat!!!

- one of the best branzinos in the city
- a house made cavatelli that will knock your socks off
- the crispy salad - on a hot day OMG
- the arancino amuse bouche - I don't eat veal but I confess I taste this when it comes. It's insane
- almost all pastas and antipasti
- OK actually, I've never had a bad dish here

This is your spot for a day of trying to understand what MOMA is showing, or for escaping the midtown masses. Please though.... Leave me a table. Love ya!!

Fantastic delicious fresh food and impeccable service in romantic ambiance. True Italian style. They are so gracious and everything is on point. I ate outside in a lovely private table and it was the best dining experience I've had in the City. Grazie! PS the arancini are to DIE for! Plus all staff wear masks, I think too mostly N95. Very clean place.

Exceptional staff from beginning to end, and personable. We enjoyed our dining without any rush from the wait staff just high quality attentive service.
Entrees was as the service exceptional exceptional. Great Restaurant
Wonderful atmosphere, friendly and exceptionally accommodating staff, good food in a great area. Grazie mille Luigi and Giuseppe.

such a great experience! the ambience, service, and food were all 5 stars! could not be happier!
the setting feels very fancy and the dress code is smart casual. it's a large restaurant and was pretty filled when we came in! they even had outdoor tables which were also set up v nicely and looked so elegant
the waiters were all so attentive & friendly. our main waiter was very knowledgeable on the menu and was able to tell us the specials of the night in great detail!
the grilled octopus was not what we were expecting but it was delicious! it seemed more like a salad (see pic) but all the flavors were very gentle and didnt overpower the super tender octopus
the pastas were great- my bf LOVED the paccheri pasta and practically inhaled it! we told them the special pasta was a little too undercooked for my liking and they gladly and quickly took it back and even offered us to change it. we enjoyed the flavor so we kept it and just asked for the pasta to be cooked more. they were so kind about it and it wasn't a huge deal
we left extremely satisfied that night and are still talking about how much we loved it days after!

Pricey but to be expected
Great Wine selection
cool bar scene
Great waiters and service
just an overall great experience
I forgot to take pics....

Eat it!

Service was six stars out of five. They were extremely senior experienced wait staff with many of them in the tight space but always close when needed. They were efficient and friendly. The food was all high quality and freshly made and presented well. I only gave it four stars because it is not as unique as I would expect with five star. Great staple for a romantic evening or small business lunch.

The service is impressive, but... When asked about a menu, the waiter just rattled off a list of specials and seemed to not want to provide a menu. The same with the wines by the glass options: just a rattled off list of varietals (e.g., pinot noir, Amarone, Chardonnay). I like to see what producer makes the wine, what year it is, and how much a glass will cost.

My alarm bells go off when a restaurant makes it difficult to know what you're going to have to pay. I realize that perhaps the old saw that is "If you need to ask, you can't afford it" may apply. I can afford it, but I also am wary of paying much more than I should. For example, their online menu lists a full order of Linguine all'Amatriciana as $24.50. My waiter convinced me to have half an order of all'Amatriciana and half an order of a special ravioli. On the bill the 1/2 Amatriciana was $18.95 and the 1/2 special $21.95, so high, but not outrageous. The problem is that it might have been $50 or $75 because there was no menu nor prices. I heard a waiter pitch adding white truffle shaved on the pasta of a table for 3. I didn't hear the waiter mention a price, but I know that other restaurants in the area charge a supplement of around $100/plate for white truffles. I wonder if the clients at that table knew what they were getting into?

I would likely have ordered more food and wine than I did, if they'd provided a menu so I could see the details of what I was ordering.

The food was mixed. The Amatriciana was pretty good, the special ravioli wasn't very good. The Tiramisu was okay (and again, the list was verbally recited, not provided as a menu with description and price).

WOW! What a hidden gem!! I'm honestly shocked this place doesn't get the hype that Don Angie or L'artusi gets in the city because the food I had here was incredible from start to finish. Service was also excellent.

The interior looks a bit unassuming, but it's definitely a great place for a romantic dinner or taking out your clients. Everyone was dressed nicely, and all the waiters and servers wear suits. It gave me old school vibes in a good way.

Definitely take their advice on the specials for the day. We started with the pumpkin soup that they recommended, and it might possibly be the best soup I've had at a restaurant. So creamy and subtle with the pumpkin flavors and perfect with their black pepper on top (Idk how their black pepper tastes so good but I want to buy it).

We also ordered a lobster/seafood pasta that I didn't get the name of and an unforgettable pasta dish with sausage and tomato sauce. The sausage pasta was absolutely delicious and I would come back just to eat this again. It seemed like a staff favorite as well. I wasn't too excited about the halibut that we ordered; it was a bit overcooked and dry. Next time I will be sure to order the caesar salad here, which the staff mixes in a bowl with housemade dressing in front of you.

I think the service here deserves another shoutout. It was truly exceptional that the staff didn't even need to be asked to make sure all the dishes were split and plated for my boyfriend and I so that we could try all the dishes. They checked up on us very often as well. Absolutely loved this restaurant!

Old School! If you want to know what it was like to eat at the upscale, white cloth Italian restaurants in New York in the heyday of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin and Frankie Valli, you don't need to look in old newspapers or magazines, just head over to Il Tinello on West 56th Street. The waiters still wear white jackets and the recipes are still the same as the day they opened their doors. Their wine list is great, stocked with the classics. Don't think of it as a dining experience, it is more like time travel. If you want an amazing meal and to have a great evening, head over to Bad Roman but if you want to see what dining was like in the old days then give Il Tinello a try.

When my parents lived in NJ , we would go to a restaurant called IL Goccino. One time when we were there, I said that I lived in NYC and they went crazy. They said their cousin runs this place in NYC that is amazing and that we have to try ... So naturally we needed to go!

We came here on a Wednesday night (parents as well) and were not disappointed. It is a small, upscale Italian restaurant with knowledgeable and helpful staff and even on a random Wednesday, it was packed .

We started off with a caesar salad which they make the dressing (and salad) right in front of you. Quite the show to watch - we were salivating over a salad (who does that?!) . The salad was delicious and fresh and very garlic-y... in a good way. I'd recommend everyone starting with this.

For dinner we got a variety of items.
Lamb chop: these were good but were different than the Lamb chops I am used to. Had less meat on the bone but were good.
Scaloppine Monte bianco: this was 3 pieces of veal plated very nicely with spinach and mozzarella over it. This was probably the 2nd time I've ever had veal and I was happy it was here - the entire dish was great and surprisingly filling.
Bologonaise pasta: this might have been among the best bolognaise pasta I've ever had.

The staff speaks with you like you're family and really knows their stuff. Had fun and really enjoyed the food. Would come here again to try other menu items.
Very beautiful restaurant.  Ambience is fantastic.  Great food and impeccable service.

We had a business dinner there with a group of 8 people. Given the plethora of pricey Italian restaurants in NYC, I was underwhelmed.  The service, of course, given the price point, was very good.  We were served complimentary cheese and olives and spicy marinated peppers. The cheese did not have the depth of the complimentary cheese served at Il Mulino. We had the cold and hot antipasto appetizer for the whole table.  That was a nice assortment and the eggplant stood out.  I had the Radicchio and Shrimp pasta.  The Spaghetti, which I believe is home made, was well done, and cooked properly to the al dente consistency.  There were 2 overcooked shrimps in the entree.  The Tiramasu desert was a small serving that did not resemble tiramasu, and cold have been less sweet.  The Tartufo seemed good and served with whip cream.

There are so many things that Il Tinello on West 56th St does "right" it is hard to get them all into a single review - but I will try.  When you walk in the first thing you notice is the ambiance.  If you are looking for loud and hip, go elsewhere.  Il Tinello is a classic.  Wood, mirrors and white table cloths. The tables are in a pattern which allows each party to enjoy their meal and conversation without sharing either with those close by - and while not hushed, it is comfortably quiet.  After you are seated you are immediately provided with a complementary (and delicious) offering of bruschetta along with a plate of spectacular (and hot!) peppers.  As to the rest of the food, the menu is too extensive for me to have claimed to have tasted it all but I can tell you the Dover sole is outstanding, my wife thought the Bronzino was the best she ever had, my mother-in-law is still talking about the seafood fra diavolo and any Italian Grandmother would be proud if her manicotti tasted as good.  To make the Il Tinello experience complete is the waitstaff.  Not only do they have years (if not decades) of experience but you get the feeling this is not just a job for them but a profession. They like what they do and treat their guests accordingly.  Go and enjoy!

I had a client dinner cancel and I was looking for a spot close to my hotel. This unassuming, Italian restaurant did not disappoint!
I sat at the bar because I was flying solo. The bartender was just lovely and his service was excellent. I started off with arugula salad with the thinnest slices of Parmesan I've ever had and a few grape tomatoes. It was lightly dressed with oil and vinegar.
The Spaghetti Carbonara caught my eye and I usually reserve that for my birthday once a year. I asked the bartender about it and he said, "It's to die for!" Well, sold! It was INCREDIBLE and falls into my Top 3 all time Carbonaras, and the other 2 are in Italy. And as much as I didn't want dessert, I felt like I was getting a redo on celebrating my birthday in style and the tiramisu was delectable. It paired nicely with my Limoncello night cap.
My unassuming night turned magical. This restaurant delivered and I will return.
Delicious food, fancy dining and professional service. I highly recommend as a nice date night!

Let me tell you from start to finish just the most amazing service. This was not just a dinner, this was an experience. There were 7 of us for a birthday and it was effortless. You would be missing out if you don't give them a whirl.

Fine dining at its best!
Service is impeccable, and the prices are certainly reasonable considering the location and top quality ingredients.  The cuisine is consistent with representing authentic Italian recipes.  A must visit when in NYC.

Came in 15 minutes before they're about to close. I told him I would have to pass. I didn't want to rush eating here. They said we never said you couldn't take your time to eat. We just said the kitchen closes in 15 minutes, so they sadist down and treat us with one of the best treatments in New York for a restaurant I've been in I must go food is great.

Highly Recommend! One of the best Italians I've ever had in NYC - quality food & workers. Everyone was extremely kind and I truly felt well taken care of. Food was delicious! Slightly expensive bill but absolutely worth it. Burrata was great!!! Everything was so fresh and yummy :)

Amazing espresso martini!
Even had Gluten free pasta! ( no bread or pizza )

Back again and it was fitting.

Il Tinello was the last restaurant I dined at in NY before the pandemic so the dinner in NYC post pandemic indoors was the first!! And it is so good to be back!

The service and attentiveness is the same as is the enthusiastic staff and welcoming atmosphere. The food...oh yeah still terrific!

We started with some of the salads and the table appetisers, including the hot peppers which were delicious.  Cheeses equally so...

The appetiser special was the prosciutto and it was deliciously served with some balsamic and figs.  Great combo!

The entree was the veal and it was spectacular. Perfectly cooked and on a bed of spinach.  The grill and salt were a delicious combo and enhanced the flavor.  

I highly recommend this place!!!

This restaurant was excellent; the STRACCIATELLA FIORENTINA soup was very good as was the veal parm and a side of linguini. The ricotta cheesecake was outstanding.  The service was very attentive.  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Came here after work with some coworkers for dinner and the food was amazing! I got the Spaghetti Bolognese, which was amazing. Great sauce, balanced flavor, and fresh ingredients. The service was above and beyond as well. We received a rundown of the daily specials and tried their starters. Flavor was 10/10. The resturuant was a bit small and the lighting made it difficult to read the menus, but we were able to fit our party of 7 (which was a little cramped but not really much you can do there). Overall a great experience and would highly recommend if you are in NYC. 5/5 for service, 5/5 for food, and 4/5 for environment.

What an amazing night!  The service was impeccable.  We felt like celebrities while dining at this beautiful and quaint restaurant.  The maître d' was so friendly and nice the bartender, and out of his way to make us a special cocktail. Our food was so delicious and yummy. We wanted to come back the next night. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to an amazing experience.

Eh, just another Italian restaurant covering up over priced sub par food with old world charm.

Positives... all the staff were super friendly and accommodating when asked. Plus the decor, linens, and settings were refined amongst the old world setting. All a great basis for a potentially lovely evening.

Critiques... $60 medium rare veal chop was served well done and no one checked in. Bruschetta was quite soggy (but the tomatoes had a great steaky umami, so compliments for that) . Asked for wine but wasn't served for 20 mins. sazerac was (confidently) made with only gin and lime juice. Upon explaining it was made with rye, absinthe, and peychaud's bitters, I was served rye and angostura bitters.

I wouldn't go back. So many better options, but I wish them the best.

We were greeted nicely and the service was attentive. However, most of the food had no taste. To pay almost $30 for overcooked and tasteless chicken is not worth the trip. That said, the pesto was okay. Will not return.

After walking around looking for a dinner spot on a busy Friday night, we ended up here. They got us in right away and it was spectacular. The service was some of the best we've had. They brought out bruschetta and peppers with bread. Unexpected and the peppers were spicy but great on bread with butter and garlic. We split the Burratta which was great with prosciutto and tomato. For the main course we had the lamb osso bucco special. The lamb fell off the bone perfectly and had a nice complimenting sauce. For dessert we got a slice of chocolate cake which we couldn't finish but perfectly ended our meal. Great restaurant and even better service

The worst dining experience in my life.
The service and head maitre' D was horrible. They insulted my husband after he refused to give out personal info with his credit card. The manager shoved my husband, and he fell to the ground. We called 911 but typical NY, no one responded.  They are not who they say they are. It's an Italian restaurant in name only.
Be very careful there.
Wonderful ambiance, and service. All of the staff were excellent. The food was okay, but not what I was expecting at this price point.

We had a family dinner here. The food was absolutely divine!!! I mean I cut my food so small, to the point where I wanted to not have the meal end. My family and I were very pleased. My best to the chef.

Wow! The best orecchiette with Broccoli Rabe I've ever had. From the greeting in Italian by the hostess, to the wine list, to the limoncello at the end. Everything was top notch. A little gem hidden in NYC! The staff was excellent, the food delightful and whole experience a pleasure. Will be coming back next time I'm in New York.
Amazing traditional nyc Italian restaurant. Great food, great service with warm and welcoming staff.

Well, I can say this was a first:  the appetizer - SEAFOOD WITH MUSHROOMS ALLA MARGHERITA $24.25 that I planned to share consisted of 1 shrimp and 2 scallops. The servers were wonderful, and lots of theatrics including traveling show and tell trays and table side salads are part of the smoke and mirrors. Truly inflated prices on specials or wine by the glass where there's no menu to share at the time of ordering.. My entree of linguini pescatore was good (I asked for fra diavolo but it was not spicy) but feeling uneasy by the "experience" when leaving a restaurant is not the sign of satisfaction..
Wow!!! Amazing food!!! The place is an elegant example of fine dining!!! The owner,  Benny, is a warm host!! Excellent vodka gimlets!!! I enjoyed the veal parmigiana.

5 stars to restaurants that deliver food on time even on down times (like New Years Eve) and listens to your special requests which are often lost in the 'Notes' section for most of our takeout orders. Il Tinelllo thank you for listening and delivering everything perfectly! You made our New Year's Eve dinner special! I requested for extra white wine sauce for my salmon that I evidently got, and my hubby requested for onions to be added to his pasta which was also generously bestowed on his dish ;). I got the Salmon Copa Santa with white wine sauce, asparagus and Dijon mustard which was really good! Saucy and perfect. They gave us two huge salmon fillets and the baked potatoes were delicious. My hubby got the Integrali Ala Funghi with integrale pasta, mushrooms, mozzarella, garlic and truffle oil (and the onions on special request)

Fabulous old school (in a good way) Italian restaurant.
Ordered online and pickup was easy. Chatted with the owner(?) while waiting. They've been there for 40 years and have seen it all.
Delicious pastas and we went with the classics: (Spaghetti Bolognese, Spaghetti Carbonara, Caesar Salad, and Clams Casino).  Plenty of unique pastas and other meats and seafoods on the menu too.

Went for dinner at the new E 46th street location and both the food and service (special thanks to Ray) was amazing! The pear and arugula salad was fresh, the veal ravioli was a crowd favorite, and the tiramisu was phenomenal. The restaurant has a cozy yet classic vibe with a great bar area. Will absolutely be going back!!

This is a tourist trap with mediocre food, racist waiters and a bunch of fake reviews that they probably paid for. We were a family of four looking for a decent Italian dinner in midtown and instead got one of the worst dining experiences in NYC.
Have not eaten here for a while and its still as good as I remember. Service is excellent. Salads are great. Lamb chops super. Wine choices excellent. Recommended.

This restaurant is by far- our new favorite! the staff is professional and attentive. the quality of the fish is superior and the  host treated us like family! the food was fresh and tasty- without being overly seasoned! just perfect! we will be back soon:)

Love this restaurant.  What an absolute wonderful experience. So professional and the food to match!
We even waited a little longer than the 10 minutes that they told us and they were so apologetic. The management was truly caring. Everything the waiters did was perfection.

We had the Caesar salad which was done exactly how it should be done. Yes fresh egg Yolk with capers, anchovies prepared perfectly at your table. The Veal with spinach and mozzarella was fantastic as was the fettuccini with white clam sauce.

We also had the tiramisu and several other desserts which were delicious.

I cants ay enough about the quality of the food and the exceptional service. One of the best experience in NYC. Don't miss this one.  You will regret it!

Came here with my sister for a sibling night out and we had a great time. Some of the kindest staffs and everything we had was amazing. We saw lot of diners with suits on and couples enjoying a romantic night out while at the restaurant. Perfect for any occasion!
Old-school Italian with excellent service and a comprehensive menu. Look out for the tableside options.

We had reservations to eat dinner at a different Italian restaurant, but we missed our seating because my husband had to work an hour late. His job gets one star, but that's a different review for a different time. Oh, and it was also my birthday.

In an attempt to save his life, hubs opened up Yelp and immediately began searching for a comparable Italian restaurant in the area. And that is how we ended up at Ill Tinello. All I can say is that I'm immensely happy that reservation number one didn't work out. This was more than just a fabulous meal - it was an experience.

From the moment you walk in the waitstaff goes out of their way to make you feel at home. There is someone to push in your chair, someone to take out your napkin, someone to hang your coat over your chair. Someone else is filling water while someone else is asking you how your night is going. I've never had so many people tending to me at one time, and I've got to say it's pretty flippin' fabulous.

Immeaditely upon being seated you are served a piece of bruschetta and a basket of crunchy bread with butter. Menus aren't brought out until you've had a tour of the fresh appetizer cart - there are various antipasta selections like fresh roasted veggies, cheeses and meats. We started off with burrata, prosciutto and tomatoes. They cut it into two perfectly sized individual portions which I loved. The burrata was oh so creamy and the tomato was ripe and sweet.

Choosing entrees was difficult. The menu is huge and has a ton of different pasta, meat and seafood selections. There was also a long list of daily specials. We finally decided to split the tortellini of the day - meat stuffed and topped with vodka sauce and ricotta salata along with veal scaloppine in a spinach and white wine sauce.

Again, if they know you are sharing each dish will come out already split on it's own plate. You can also opt to have your pasta first and your meat second. The second our plates touched the table there was someone on hand with fresh pepper and someone else on hand with fresh parmesan cheese.

Both dishes were so delicious that I'm still dreaming about this meal. Each plate came with two pieces of veal and a large portion of pasta. So while the prices here are a bit high you are definitely getting your money worth.

The maitre'd came over multiple times to ask how we were doing. He knew we had limited time to eat because of a show, and had us in and out in about an hour. He also overheard that it was my birthday and brought me out a complimentary slice of tiramisu with a candle.

If you like incredible Italian food and being treated like royalty then do yourself a favor and make a reservation at Ill Tinello. You won't regret it.

Been here forever, but we never tried it, until just recently.  The best veal parmigiana I've ever had, lovely sautéed broccoli and serviceable eggplant parmigiana.  It's a peaceful restaurant with excellent service, and we shall return.

Very Italian!
In Manhattan, it's impossible not to find a good Italian restaurant. The first time when we found this place, we walked after the dinner looking for a decent dessert. We stepped in because we liked the name of the restaurant. The atmosphere was welcoming and we ordered a tasty dessert and promised that we would comeback for a dinner.
In December, we got the chance to comeback. It was close to Christmas, so the place looked festive and cozy. The atmosphere reminded me a home atmosphere: warmth, calmness and good vibes. The personal was mostly men and Italian-that made restaurant more traditional.
We had plenty of food starting from starters and ending desserts. My favorite were: pasta fagioli soup, risotto with truffles and all desserts. On top of fantastic food, the service was excellent.
We definitely will be back!

This place is highly underrated IMHO. It was a great meal and hands down one of the best Italian meals I've had.  The service, decor, and everything was just as you would expect from a classic Italian restaurant. I don't know the exact name of what my friend and I had ordered but it's basically a trio of pastas (refer to picture for reference).  Every single one was absolutely amazing. Yes, it's just pasta, but it's cooked perfectly. My personal favorite was the gnocchi- true comfort food. At the same time, I'm glad I got to try three different types of pasta as well and highly recommend this entree. For dessert I got half of the chocolate cake and half of the tiramisu. Both were great and decadent albeit not too sweet at the same time. All in all, I highly recommend Il Tinello to anyone looking for great Italian comfort food or just great food in general.
I would not recommend this restaurant.  They did not honor our reservation and made us wait.  That's not acceptable.
They're great. They are so accommodating and will do anything they can to please you. Very highly recommend it.

First time there yesterday for my 11 wedding anniversary .
The the good was fantastic. The food tasted fresh. I would recommend the Cesar salad because you could learn how to make it. The service makes you feel very special.
I love this place

I've been dining my entire life at the most wonderful places and I love restaurants more than anything.
Last night I've had without any doubts THE WORST EXPERIENCE in a customer service IN MY LIFE.
My friend and I have arrived at our 9pm reservation. We booked the table through the OpenTable for 3, but saying that our friend will join us a little bit later on.
We have waited for more than 40 MINUTES for the table without any nice word, smile, drink on the house or basically any normal thing in hospitality that goes with their overbooking problem, because we were not the only one waited.
At the very end when we couldn't wait any longer, after 40minutes I went to the manager and asked him when are we going to get a table. Just like that he said when your third party comes. I asked him since when is that rule? He replied to me "SINCE TONIGHT".
You can't imagine how I felt at that moment.
I couldn't believe my own ears. He was the most rude, arrogant manager and such a shame for this place. I promised him that I am going to spread a "good word" about this place. After a crazy argument with him, we immediately left the place and of course none of my friends and I are coming back. Another important thing to say, the same manager gave the table for 4 for 2 people.
DO NOT GO TO THIS PLACE!!!
I am really sorry to say this, maybe the food is nice and other stuff, but if a manager of the place- the main representative of the place doesn't know how to behave and after all that "Customer is always right", then what can I say about this place?!
Zero hospitality that have ruined our night.

Three of us just came from an excellent dinner at Il Tinello. The service was impeccable and the food delicious. I will single out a few items. My wife had the gazpacho for an appetizer and loved it. I had the cannelloni and will say it was perfect. The pasta was more crepe like than noodle like, which is as it should be. My brother had the veal chop special which he raved about. We had two deserts. My brother had a chocolate lava cake with coffee gelato. My wife and I shared gelato wrapped in a hard chocolate shell. Both delicious. Expensive? Yes. It's midtown NY. But I thought it well worth the expense.

I wanted a celebratory dinner after my successful cancer surgery.  Classic, white tablecloth, Italian restaurants are disappearing from the restaurant fabric of cities across the country.  However, they still exist in New York, and I craved veal parmigiana, white jacketed waiters, and a suave maitre d' offering recommendations and elegance.  Il Tinello checked all these boxes.

The food was absolutely delicious, veal parmigiana, trenette al pesto, fegatto di vitello, were all perfect! Desserts were amazing, and the maitre d' was discreetly charming.  I felt blessed, New York City, zero cancer, and an incredible Italian dinner.  Che bello!

I definitely recommend Il Tinello, delicious food, great service, good environment. Last time I came here was on Christmas eve with family and we loved the food, specially the lobster linguine special. Don't forget the desserts!!

A Delight for the Pallet!  After careful research I selected Il Tinello for my reunion with a dear old friend and boy I picked the right restaurant!  The pasta was delectable, the salad was fabulous, the meat was superb!  The service was excellent and Nick was just lovely.   I can't wait to return to Il Tinello!  Thank you for a memorable evening out!

By far the best Italian food I've had since traveling to NY. I have been multiple times and now that I know of this place I'll make sure to come every time I visit.
Our server Pablo was very knowledgeable of the specials/offers they had for the day, and as well on the regular menu. Thank you Pablo!

Our food came out in order right on time. We started off with the croquettes, and the filling was so flavorful while the outside had a nice crunch. 10/10!

We both went with pastas (we were craving something starchy after a long day at the zoo) and I couldn't say enough how much I fell in love with these dishes. So delicious!!! My dish had lemon zest and most people would say it's a bit overpowering but i love the taste of lemon.

Our waters were never empty! I mean the man would come and fill up our drinks even if we took only one sip. Service on point!

It is a smaller restaurant so don't be alarmed when you walk in and the Hoststand is right in front. Not much space to wait inside but make sure to do a reservation so you don't have to wait! We didn't have a reservation but I think we got lucky.

Loved the location and service with a really nice wine selection. Our server was awesome.
The main courses were ok and I would suggest they get a bit more consistent with their "al dente" as my partner's dish was perfectly prepared whereas mine was very undercooked and the pasta was hard and starchy.
Desert, wine and service made up for the so-so main course.

Within what I ordered, I'd give the truffle salad, the pistachio cream paccheri and the fig stuffed ravioli 5 stars, but I'd give the rest 2 stars.
The fig stuffed ravioli was the special of that day it was so creative!!! I was so surprised about the multiple layer of different flavors. I loved it so much! And the pistachio cream paccheri was the reason I visited this restaurant and it didn't let me down! The sweet sausage inside was also so delicious.
And the truffle salad was also nice. The truffle honey was a very nice addition. However, I didn't like the raw mushroom.
The other dishes were not so good. Like the cacio e pepe. The pasta itself was ok, but the crispy parmesan not so disappointing - firstly, it was supposed to be crispy, but it was not at all - it was stale and pimp. Secondly, it was way too salty and too thick. Thirdly, they were supposed to make it a bowl but what I got was just a huge and thick chip.
And the branzino filet was not good either. It didn't go bad. It was still edible, but it just didn't have the freshness taste that a fish is supposed to have.

Last but not least - the services. One thing I loved about was that they were able to make the pasta half portion, so that I could order more dishes to taste. This is so considerate! The waiter was okay, but we've been waiting for him for like 15 minutes after we finished our main course. He didn't check with us if we wanted the dessert menu or check etc. Finally he showed up and asked if we wanted dessert. Anyway, it was not bad but not so satisfying.

Overall, it was still a nice experience. I would come back for the pistachio cream paccheri, but I'd pass other dishes, especially the main courses.

We were seated immediately in this lovely restaurant with white tablecloths. I was undecided about a wine choice so the waiter offered two samples! We ended up with a bottle of Sassania Alfa Rose. Rosé is not typically my choice but it was quite good. I had the Papardelle el Telefono which WAS DELICIOUS. I'm not a big pasta fan and am always looking for some really good pasta so I can experience what people rave about. This was it. Hubby had tortelloni with cheese and spinach and really enjoyed his meal too. Because everything else was so good, we ordered the chocolatissimo dessert. It was enough for two people and a perfect ending to a lovely meal.

Really delicious Italian food! I came with a party of 4 and we all really enjoyed the food here. We got the Grilled Octopus and eggplant parmigiana to start. Both were seasoned so well and so delicious! For the mains, we got the Fettuccine Con Funghi E Prosciutto, spaghetti, fettuccine bolognese, and seafood pasta. All were excellent! They even gave us free sorbet for dessert. Service was great but a little slow. The inside was very cute and there was an outdoor patio as well.

We had an amazing experience with Il Corso this past weekend.  What initially was planned to be a dinner for about half our group turned into nearly taking over the entire restaurant.  I loved how accommodating Il Corso was from the get-go.

Once seated, we enjoyed a selection of appetizers and wine while determining our pasta dishes.  While they were all "winners", I loved the Burrata.  Portions were more than fair.

Like the appetizers, the pasta dishes were all excellent as well.  Cacio e Pepe was probably the table favorite, as it comes complete in a cheesebowl!  I went with the Fettuccine alla Bolognese and did have food envy.  That being said, the fettucine was cooked perfectly and like the apps, the pasta was portions appropriately.

We finished with desserts.  Them bringing out the dessert tray made picking easier (or harder since they all looked amazing).  I went with the flan and did not share.

Overall an excellent experience and one I'd be happy to repeat on a future trip to NYC. Check them out!

I picked up an order of Pasta Bolognese togo tonight to have as a late night snack. It was very delicious, aromatic, moist and good quality. The meat gravy was very tasty n savory. The little carrot chunks went well with it. The noodles were very fresh and soft. One of the best bolognese I have had yet. Great service as well. I will re-visit this place when returning to NYC in the future.

This midtown Manhattan Italian Restaurant was wonderful!!! I chose this restaurant because it was  around the corner from my friends hotel The Bismarck. The food was exceptionally good! I had a soup that was the soup of the day. My partner had a clam and pasta dish it was pronounced to be excellent!! My 2 other friends had a lasagna dish and a seafood soup dish with all kinds of seafood! The service was exceptional. They had a pairing of wines with your dish. They brought samplings of wines! The service was exceptionally good! We were not hurried out and our reunion went way past their end of lunch. The ambience was nothing to write home about but the service and quality of food more than made up for it.
im a tough pasta critic (and also not the biggest fan) but il corso pasta was bravo! i had pistachio creme pappardelle and it was so so good. spacious inside too - we enjoyed our food and convo.

I have not been to this place since 2012? One cool evening last week my friend & I stopped in the place for a late night dinner. The same ambience, service & equally delicious meals & great wines remained the same. Then my friend realized this was the same restaurant where Carrie in the show , " Just Like That," was mistakenly to meet Aiden who was waiting for her next door.  We had some fun with recreation the moments while enjoying the meals .
Fantastic Italian restaurant. Beautiful ambiance, great service. We had waiter order for table.

Great place to have a no frills Italian dinner with awesome service. Place was packed and it's not surprising.

Best thing I ate was the pistachio sauce pasta (forgot what it was called)- super unique and haven't had anything like that elsewhere. For non pasta the beef tenderloin medallions were great and a heavier option. The seafood vongolle was good. Overall great service and experience and would recommend.

High yield Italian

Was gonna watch a Broadway show so stopped by here for din beforehand. Got the spaghetti  di mare which was jam packed with fresh seafood. Also got the fungi which had an absolutely delicious sauce, creamy but not overpowering with a burst of truffle flavor. For dessert, they bring out a giant platter with sample desserts prepared so you can actually see what they look like. We went for the classic tiramisu and was not disappointed.
