Perfect end to the meal. Restaurant is fancy and cozy with a  warm ambiance. Great place for a romantic get together.

PSA: the sides are super high yield. Got a side order of brocolli rabe and asparagus and they were huge. Fresh and perfectly cooked/seasoned. Perfectly complimented our meal.

The food here was absolutely amazing, and the ambiance is decent enough. The issue we had was service. We made reservations for an early 5:30pm dinner, to give us time to get to our later engagement in the evening. When we arrived, the front half of the restaurant was about 50% full, and they took us to the back room, which was 2/3 empty. They attempted to seat us right next to the restrooms... which I found ridiculous, and refused, and asked to have us seated elsewhere. The backroom was fine, as it was nice a quiet, but the hostess tried to give us some BS excuse that other tables had pending guests/reservations coming, to which I simply said the table next to the restroom was not acceptable and if they couldnt seat us anywhere else, immediately, we'd just leave. Thankfully she backed down, and we didnt see her again. Rest of the meal was delicious, and our waiter was fantastic and attentive.

The best restaurant in the world!!!
Ok, maybe an exaggeration, but it's incredibly good. The service is excellent, wine menu expansive, and the specials are uniquely their own. Plus, if you have a craving for a specific Italian dish, and it's not on the menu, they'll try their best to make it. They made chicken fettuccini Alfredo for my daughter, which may not seem like a bug deal, but try going to a jive place in NYC and ordering off menu. For me, they took a seafood pasta dish, hav eve linguini instead of spaghetti and subbed a creamy fra diablo sauce - it was incredible. The wife had lasagna, to die for. And my eldest daughter had the clams - again, incredible.
We love this place - you will too.
Ask for Luis.

We stumbled upon this place because we were in the mood for Italian while near Rockefeller Center and this was one of the closest places haha. Well, it was a good impromptu choice!

Food/Drinks: 4/5
I ordered the Fettuccine con Funghi e Prosciutto and the Araciantini cocktail. You gotta love mushrooms for this dish (which I do)! It was so scrumptious. The flavor is a lot (in a good way) but the portion is just enough. I will say some of the other dishes (Cacio e Pepe) looked to have a super small serving. The speciality cocktail menu doesn't have a ton of options. I didn't love my drink but my friend ordered the Fragola Limone and loved it!

The pasta was absolutely delicious! The prices are for sure $$$, pasta dishes start at $20 but I'd say it was worth it!

Service: 4/5
We didn't have a reservation but the staff was still very accommodating to seat us on a Wednesday night, it was pretty busy!

We had a few different servers and they were all great. Our waters never got empty, they we're constantly refilled! There was a solid amount of time where our waiters disappeared and no one came to check in on us until we had to flag someone down to get the check. We got a great presentation of the specials and recommended some dishes on the menu!

Vibe: 5/5
There is both indoor and outdoor seating. The weather was nice when we went so we got a table outside. The exterior has a portion with outdoor string lights closed and then tables on the sidewalk. The table was lit with a cute little light and it felt like a scene out of a movie in NYC! It gives both a classy but cozy atmosphere.

Had to post a review ASAP! frequent New York City because of my husband's job and am fortunate enough to try many restaurants.... Took a walk yesterday and noticed this little gem.... It was too late to make a reservation so we decided for the next day...I don't know how many more wonderful things I can say about this place. Service, food ambiance.... You're lucky if you get all three with a dining experience but here it comes plentiful. My husband has a Beef Carpaccio and the Cacio e Pepe, tender eye round, topped with beautiful arugula and shaved Parmesan...the Cacio e Pepe nestled in a basket of delicious cheese. Spectacular! I couldn't choose between the Gambarella salad, or the split pea soup which was on special. I left it up to our server Pablo he presented me with the most unbelievable split pea. I've ever had! A rich, beautiful smooth  broth with peas, vegetables and potato....I went onto the lasagna as my entree, which I never order, but thought I'd give it a try... wow presented in a baking dish, a perfect portion, and in a delicious béchamel sauce.... perfection in every way, and we just couldn't do dessert as we were so satisfied. at that point...we could easily become regulars if we lived closer, but this is a place that id come just come in from Long Island just to dine at... thanks to Pablo our server, and Gennaro, the maître d',/owner,/manager,  that looked over every table and making sure his guests were all  satisfied and the lovely hostess who made our reservation possible on short notice....we will try to get back as soon as possible!!! so if you're close by or whether you have to come from far, it's a culinary must!

Loved every part of this experience!  Delicious artichoke salad and the veal medallions were also perfectly cooked and the sauce was special.  I'm not a huge mashed potato fan, but I actually ate them as the really complimented the sauce.  

The service was very attentive and the environment was peaceful.  The bathrooms were so clean and large.  

Thank you!
Want to feel like you're in Italy? @ilcorsonyc will take care of that for you 10/10!! The ingredients and quality are out of this world! Chefs kiss **

Small restaurant, but they make the space work to their advantage! If it's a nice evening, I think it would be great to sit at one of the tables out front. I sat in the back, had a great glass of wine, and struggled choosing between the specialties of the day/main menu items. I tried a few bites of the gnocchi, risotto, and ravioli and they were good! I ordered the salmon with white wine and asparagus... it was incredible. I walked in barely hungry, but I finished the entire (generous) serving! I would definitely come here again. Our waiter Luis was awesome :)

We loved our dinner at Il Corso! We had the Avocado E Carciofini for our salad and the bread was excellent! My husband, who has a garlic allergy had the Caceo e Pepe and I had the lasagna. We both had home made pasta in our dishes. Will definitely visit again when in NYC. Recommend!
Very good pasta 12/10!!! You must give this a try and the service was 20/10. I have nothing bad to say and yoh must give it a try

I came here for a business dinner and the food was delicious. The waiters were attentive and provided good service. We sat in the back since we had a large party and the ambiance was great!

We ordered tons of appetizers and bottles of wine to share. My main dish was the linguine with clams. I typically like them with more sauce and the chef accommodated to my specific request. The restaurant is kind of small but they do have a bigger area in the back. I would recommend making a reservation and coming here with friends or a date night.

I've been a loyal patron for the last 7+ years and I come here every time I'm in the city. I've gotten the lasagna, Cacio E Pepe, and the fettuccine alla bolognese. All of those pastas are amazing. The desserts are always good as well. You gotta come here if your in the city!

We came here on a weekday for dinner for 2. For start we get bread for the table and oil with capers. We didn't get any apps but got the beet salad with goat cheese which was very fresh! For dinner we got the cacio e pepe and one of the specials which was with spinach and ricotta cheese.

I enjoyed the cacio e pepe! The spinach and ricotta cheese dish lacked a little flavor for me. For desserts they bring out a little platter so you get a visual of what you can order which I loved! We got the chocolate cake with ice cream which was yummy.

Nice place with good food, solid prices and excellent atmosphere and service.

While in New York, we wanted a really good meal and the reviews on the Corso were good. We stopped by with no reservations and they welcomed us right in. Our server, can't remember his name, was awesome and friendly as could be. He graciously answered any question and made some excellent recommendations. Our appetizer was good the Bufala was not as creamy as we like, but good. The La Tartufetta salad was great and the entrees, veal vutlet and Fettuccine were delicious.  There's a potential trip back to New York in the future and we'll definitely be going back.

If you want absolute delicious Italian food for a reasonable price close to time square you have to come here! We came right when they opened since we did not have reservations and we were lucky enough to get a beautiful table outside. I am Italian and am very picky with Italian restaurants and this place did not disappoint! The calamari was fresh and so tasty and the pastas were beautiful. We will definitely be back!

I came to Il Corso with 2 other friends. Overall, the food and experience was pretty decent but I expected a lot more given the price paid.

Food = 3/5 : We ordered a few pastas and a few appetizers. All the pastas were good and we thought the best pasta was the Cacio e Pepe (the presentation was great). However that said, the cost of each pasta was $25 and at that price point I expect more than good. It was roughly similar in quality to the decent places in Little Italy, which generally cost somewhere in the teens.

Ambience / service  = Somehow Il Corso pulls off both a business lunch / dinner vibe (perhaps just the clientele in that day) and cozy vibe simultaneously. Service was good (my water glass was never empty too long)

Went with two others and it was a romantic, cozy setting. Service was just perfect. Attentive but not too attentive. Options on the menu were great - I love me some squid ink pasta and clams. I was between the squid ink dish and the clam garlic white wine dish but had a taste of both and preferred the squid ink one. Portion was just perfect. Also had the flan as dessert and that was amazing. Originally didn't want the flan and would be more interested in the chocolate cake but the flan was nicely done. Overall great time here, highly recommend!

I was ready to give Il Corso a 5-star glowing review -- but I took a picture of my receipt at the end of the night, and the restaurant overcharged me on my credit card bill. I really enjoyed my dining experience and overall food / service / ambiance of the restaurant, but I am unfortunately very very disappointed that this restaurant would incorrectly charge me. I purchased a lot on the menu that evening and it's a shame that I was incorrectly charged.

Good food. I had the lamb shank. Others in our party had the fettuccine bolognese. Lamb was delicious - flavorful. The bolognese - a little less so.  I have had better bolognese...just a little...unflavored

Wine list is great - very happy with the choices.

I would recommend you try it

Simple Italian Pasta

Cacio e Pepe is such a simple sounding dish, translated literally as cheese and pepper

I knew NYC would be a great opportunity to sample various versions and Il Corso was our first stop for authentic Italian pasta

The preparation here is presented in a lovely parmigiano cheese bowl and the al dente spaghetti is mixed generously with cheese, pepper, and olive oil

It's a divine combination and the fettuccine with mushrooms was just as good

Cacio e Pepe $25 ~ Fresh spaghetti, black pepper, pecorino cheese, olive oil, crispy parmigiano cheesebowl / Fettucini con Funghi e Prosciutto $26 ~ Flat noodle, wild mushrooms, Parma prosciutto, truffle cream sauce / Mozzarella di Bufula e Prosciutto $25 ~ Buffalo mozzarella, Parma prosciutto, fresh tomatoes / Parmagiano Fries $10 / Tiramisu

Il Corso (West 55th Street, NY)

I stumbled onto this place on a work trip about a year ago. Dined alone and loved it. Staff were attentive and food was amazing. I revisited last night with a friend and we had an incredible dinner. I appreciate how it is small atmosphere but not loud. Diverse menu but not an overwhelming amount of options. Appreciate how they offer gluten free pasta, although I chose to go all in on the lamb ragu and pistachio pasta.

Such an amazing little restaurant. Great atmosphere and staff super friendly and professional. Chef prepared meals are amazing. Can just pick a random item and you're good. I had the special of the night: ravioli. So good.

Wondered around the corner from the plaza and decided to give this place a try! We were definitely under dressed but the staff was pleasant and made us feel welcome. Food was excellent and they make an amazing old fashion!

We had the beet salad,
Mushroom ravioli and the

Zuppa di Mare allo Zafferano

Delicious!!

Cocktails were also very good.
Great service

We are looking forward to our next visit.

I came here with a relatively large group for dinner, and I thoroughly enjoyed the wild boar pasta that I got. The place had a really nice ambience, and it felt like a nice date place vibe.

The service was also great, the servers were very nice and accommodating, with one caveat. My friend specifically asked for the gluten free option several times, and even asked when the pasta arrived if it was gluten free, and the server still mistakenly gave him gluten pasta. Thankfully, my friend wasn't too allergic, but he felt lethargic the next day. When he noticed, he talked with our server again, and we had it sent back. They sent another pasta (gluten free this time), and they gave us a bottle of Proseco on the house.

Some mishaps, but I feel like they made up for it, and I still enjoyed my experience there.

I tried the Fettuccine con Funghi e Prosciutto and the special for the day-a wild boar pasta. I loved both of them. The Fettuccine was just the right amount of creamy and savory, while the wild boar had a really nice gamey taste. Will definitely come back for more.

We never visit NYC without dining at Il Corso!
The food, service and old school ambience is second to none. There are not enough superlatives for this neighborhood Italian gem. Everything is absolutely delicious - but do not leave without experiencing their tiramisu.

Let's start with the food. Wow! For whatever reason, I just was not expecting it to be soooo good. EVERYTHING! It's a small place with no bar but it's intimate and lively at the same time. Service was top notch. The owner was engaging and beyond hospitable. Leave room for dessert. I cannot wait to go back!

I really wanted to like Il Corso because of the reviews that I had seen on Yelp but my experience was quite contrary to what I had read. I will say that the vibes and atmosphere inside and outside are great! It looks very classy and cozy all at once. The service and professionalism of the staff was great but when it comes to the food, I had to remove 3 stars!

The gnocchi was poorly made to say the least. There was no bounce in the chew of the potato pillows and the lamb was was not flavorful. The lasagna also lacked flavor and the layers were very compressed.

With such a high rating, I expected a higher quality of food especially for an Italian place in Manhattan.
Food was good, quality was fine but I would say it was expensive at $160 including the tip for two people at lunchtime.

My wife and I dined a couple days ago for a pre-theater dinner around 6pm.  Upon entry, we were greeted by a lovely host who made us feel welcome and insisted she take our coats.  Our server, although he never formally introduced himself, was swift and efficient.  The cocktail menu is not as well rounded as most in NYC and reminded me more of a local town list.  We asked our waiter (who we found out doubled as the bartender) to make a lemon drop martini but it tasted like watered down vodka with no lemon flavor.  I opted for a glass of prosecco and was questioning how long the bottle had been opened due to the lack of fizz.  The bar was lacking but it didn't take away from the experience too much since the food was very good.  For appetizer, we started with the fritto misto that had fried calamari, shrimp, zucchini, and dates.  Each item was delicious and truly an art to how lightly battered everything was.  It was a generous portion that would feed 4 and justified the $29 price point.  For our entrees my wife enjoyed the cacio e pepe (black pepper, pecorino, and olive oil) that was served in a parmesan crisp bowl that ended up melting down throughout the meal to make the sauce very creamy.  I ordered the traditional pappardelle with lamb ragu and it was good with a modest amount of meat.  We declined to have dessert but were very tempted when they brought out the tray and every item made my mouth water.  Il Corso was a reasonably priced restaurant that won't break the bank with a wide selection of homemade pastas priced between $20 and $30.  It's possible to get in and out for a quick pre-theater dinner which is always a bonus since the restaurant is fairly small they are able to turn tables fast.  If the cocktails were on par with NYC dining this place would be a 5/5!

We are outdoors and we were actually the only ones besides the other 2 outside.  We were well attended by our Server.

Food was excellent.  I had the special which was home made noodles of my choice (egg noodle spaghetti) with seafood l.  The sauce was special for the day - Saffron sauce.  It was exquisite!  Something different and light.  My friends all wishes they had ordered what I had.

The mixto was also very good.  Thin slices of zucchini and calamari / all very lightly battered and fried.  I like to eat fried foods if done right because I do it want to fuss about oil in my kitchen.   So this was worth it.

My dessert was the pannacota.  Very good too.

I like the outdoor area.

Il Corso Shop, your ultimate destination for the finest Italian food products. Indulge in the authentic flavors of Italy with our carefully curated selection. From premium olive oils to delectable pasta, our shop offers a wide range of culinary delights. Experience the essence of Italy at Il Corso Shop. Buon appetito!  #IlCorsoShop #ItalianFood #AuthenticFlavors
Found this place because it was near our hotel and took reservations.  It's a beautiful dining experience that feels very personal.  Absolutely delicious!

Excellent! Food and staff was amazing. Appetizers were the baked eggplant and the fried zucchini - which was incredible. For the meal we had the ravioli of the day, pasta with bolognese sauce (we could tell the pasta was made fresh!). Dessert was tiramisu and panna cotta (DO NOT SKIP THE PANNA COTTA!!!!).

After enjoying quite a few meals at Il Corso it remains a favourite. The food is superb and the people even more so !
   Every dish we have ordered has been delicious. This past week it was a risotto with eggplant and smoked mozzarella, truly fantastic. The best Italian in NYC by far....
Great food, great service, perfect little neighborhood spot. We've been coming here for years.
Great service, amazing food and great location! Would definitely go back. I got the risotto and loved it

Good service and nice people.  The Zuppa di mare was very nice.  We split a tiramisu and enjoyed it.  Avoid the eggplant Parmesan appetizer, it was not made fresh - came out too fast and was part cold, part warm, so clearly was heated up quickly.
Overall, enjoyed the meal

if every walk across the Brooklyn Bridge ended with chips and guacamole then the world would probably be a friendlier place. Ivy Stark Mexology is one of the many food stands in the Time Out Market food hall in DUMBO. there's just something about simple high-quality guac that can make even the most calorie-starved person go from "hangry" to sated in the mere moments it takes to inhale some chips dipped into some flavorful chunky green gold. the folks i was with also had a variety of tacos which they devoured quickly. my calories were the simple delight of the crispy fried corn chips covered in avocados smashed in lime with layers of pomegranate and pepitas plus a trio of salsa. whether you make your mileage by foot through a sweltering day to find air-conditioned respite in DUMBO or just UBER it to a casual place to sit down and eat...then the guac and chips is a necessary starter to a meal at the Time Out Market. let the chips fall where they may...into your mouth.

there's a good amount of seating in the food hall, itself. pretty clean considering how many people roll through here. ordering was easy. you get a wireless buzzer that goes off when your food is ready and you just go pick it up. service was friendly.
Decent but not outstanding tacos Al pastor, like I've had elsewhere.   Based on the other review I wish I'd tried the guacamole.   A bit pricey for what you get.

GREAT pizza.  9.2
We got the pepperoni.
This is worth waking over the Brooklyn Bridge to get.

We are so lucky to get here early during lunch. It is very, VERY popular and for good reason. Good service + great pizza. Everything about Ignazio is customer oriented and geared towards a good time and you will leave satisfied.

If I'm ever back in the neighborhood, I am definitely thinking about coming back here because I know Ignazio's will not disappoint.

My husband and I had an afternoon to spend in the city before a wedding and Ignazio's was recommended for lunch before walking the Brooklyn Bridge.

We were able to get an outside covered seat which was comfortable with bridge views.

The service was quick and friendly and we found all our food to have good flavor. We orders a large 1/2 The Pizza and 1/2 Shrimp and a salad.

Zero complaints. Check them out next time you are in the area.

No, just no. This is a cash only place so be prepared or you can use the ATM machine which will charge you $3. I had a salad and meatballs the salad was mediocre at best and the meatballs were bland. No taste. It's right by the bridge so it's nice to look out but I would not go here again. We should have gone to Grimaldi's down the street. The servers were nice but they didn't understand english well.

Went here because the line at Julianas was too long. This line was quick and we got our take out food shortly after ordering.

There's a Sicilian and normal style pizza. I got a slide of pepperoni. The crust was way too flimsy and thin, I could barely hold up the pizza to eat it. The flavors were good though I did like the red sauce.

Note that it's cash only.

I went for dinner to celebrate a friend's birthday on a recent Saturday night. We were able to get seated right away, which was one of the few positives about the experience.

We had multiple servers in a row come over to tell us the same thing. This would have been just comical but one of the waiter/hosts said he would go get dessert for us from a neighbouring place but never did. That would have been a better use of one of the waitress's time than needlessly coming over.

My friends enjoyed the food (stuffed mushrooms and a salad to start), but I thought it was all mediocre. Worst of all was the bland veggie pizza: the toppings slid immediately off when I picked up a slice. Total disappointment.
Great pizza great atmosphere definitely a must hit spot. Food was fresh meatballs wer So so so good and delicious. Pizza was delicious as well and it all had a lot of flavor.

First time exploring Brooklyn and chose this pizza place for lunch. Really good pizza and salads, enjoyed the Brooklyn lager. Tried The Pizza - fresh mozzarella cheese, Italian plum tomatoes, pecorino romano cheese, basil, oregano & olive oil. Really good flavor and perfect crust. Really liked the house salad as well. Good dressing and a variety of veggies. Good size portion, it could feed two. You have to get whole pies if dining in, but they do have a to go window and can get just slices. Also, they are cash only, so be prepared! But they do have an ATM. I loved the location right under the Brooklyn Bridge. The only thing that was frustrating was the waitress was really short with us, and we didn't even finish ordering. Wanted avocado with the salad but wasn't given a chance to ask. It was really weird as it wasn't busy. Besides that, I really enjoyed eating lunch here.
Pizza is good here, nice that you can split flavors in one pie. Large restaurant so lots of seating and great location.

If you're visiting DUMBO and in "pizza junction", don't let Juliana's and Grimaldi's be your only two options! Ignazio is an oft forgotten gem right around the corner, but has even better pizza. Their "The Pizza" offering is a crispy pie that sticks to a few simple ingredients, but does things a little different than usual. The pie has more of a breadstick type crust, so it does not have the strongest depth of flavor, but makes up for it with an outstanding crunch. The sauce is really great and possibly the best quality of their pie. It is more on the tart side, but is well complimented with the oregano and other herbs on top. It works really well and tastes complex even for a basic pie.

I've tried Grimaldi's and Julianna's about thrice each, and have done the same for Ignazio's. I can definitely say Ignazio's is the strongest of the three. However, my only criticism is that they could try and be a bit more consistent, as I did bring a friend once and we were disappointed to get kind of soft, soggy pizza instead of the usual crispy pie. Or perhaps this place does slices better than pies? I'll happily get another pie soon to know! Maybe it was just a one time mistake.

The inside is quite chill, they have a cute little bar as well so it's a nice place to go with friends. Service is usually pretty smooth, and the dude (was it the owner?) hanging outside and talking to folks who ordered a slice was pretty chill.

Overall a very underrated place! With the new L&B opening nearby I hope folks do not overlook it even more. I try to direct tourists here from time to time when I walk past the long lines for Julianna's and Grimaldi's.

Worst experience of a server! If you look at the very popular server in the reviews, her name is Dana and apparently, she said she is the daughter of the owner. That does not mean that you can be rude to your customers. She even put a finger on us when we walked out because I complained about the automatic 20% gratuity which she doesn't deserve. The food was not all that, it was just because of the view and thats it!

I dropped by late on a Sunday afternoon and sat by the bar. I had the medium tex mex pizza. I enjoyed the tangy sauce and the flavorful and slightly spicy toppings. The crust was a bit sweet, which isn't really what I prefer. Overall the food was good, but, at $33 it was definitely overpriced. The business is cash only, so make sure to be well stocked before visiting.

The service was good, ordered a large to go and did have to wait for around 15 minutes after ordering but pretty typical. One worker made sure to keep us updated and was very friendly.
The pizza itself was just okay. Nothing special but not bad by any means. The sauce was good, wish there was more cheese but that's more of a personal preference. Large Pie was $29

Great place to visit. Pizza is really tasty with a nice crispy crust. Meatball appetizer was tasty too. Place is nice and service very good. We took the Bayridge ferry to dumbo so this was just a short walk from there.

Popped in here for what we thought would be a quick slice and decided to get a table! Lucky for us we sat in the window seat looking at the Brooklyn Bridge. Enjoyed our appetizer and the pizza was bomb! Definitely worth checking out if you're in the DUMBO/BK area in NYC. Love the fact they offer two pie sizes and can do different types as well!

If you're into it, they also are featured on the One Bite App!

We stopped into Ignazio's after stumbling upon it while in the DUMBO area. It's located right underneath the famous Brooklyn Bridge.

We came here for takeout and the service was fairly quick. You can dine-in or takeout. The ambience was chill. There's a good amount of seating. Staff was friendly and accommodating. The place was clean. There's no doubt about it that we chose the best pizza I've had in a long time. The slices are a decent size and the taste makes you want a whole pie to yourself. Slices are about $4 each. They offer a selection of sodas and juices.

They offer specialty pizzas in addition to, regular pizzas, salads, calzones, appetizers, hero's, wraps, pasta dishes. For extra toppings it's about $3-$3.50 per topping. I'd highly recommend for the food, service, and taste! I'd definitely come back again when it town.

Good pizza, good price, good views!! We were seated immediately, server and staff were very friendly and attentive. The wait was not long and we were soon scarfing down our pizza!! Would definitely come back again

Ignazio's was solid! Came here instead of Juliana's for the wait, plus I had seen a few iffy reviews for Juliana's that made it seem like a tourist trap. Ignazio's isn't a tourist trap by any means, their prices are fair, and the food is great!

I split a medium pizza with 2 others, and that was quite filling.

This place has a good energy, some nice music combined with good furniture goes a long way.

If there's one thing that stood out to me, it seems that management is very involved in with every table, one of them was going around and checking in with people, but also showing people to their table and bringing out food from the kitchen. To me, an involved management team is a sign of a well run business, which this clearly is.

If you're in the area, look into getting food from Ignazio's, you won't be disappointed!
Delicious pizza! Highly worth going to instead of waiting on long lines for the two pizzerias around the corner. Really great quality and the restaurant is very cute, great view of the BK bridge.

Beautiful pizza restaurant located right under the Brooklyn Bridge. You couldn't find a better location to enjoy a bite. We ordered a custom veggie pizza and had some of the award winning meatballs. I HIGHLY recommend the meatballs.

I truly enjoyed our experience and recommend stopping here. Top notch New York pizza.

Bacon avocado and tomato pizza. That's the only pizza I order each time when I come to this pizzeria. I first stumbled on this place years ago when making the journeys to try the infamous Grimaldi's around the corner and didn't want to deal with the long 3 hour wait. This time would make it a solid 10th time and the pizza choice is still as good as I remember it. With the pandemic, there's an added option of outdoor dining now and they take credit cards too instead of just cash. Service is a bit slow when getting our server's attention since they may not be used to servicing customers dining outside.

This didn't overall take away from the main experience and as an added bonus, who can honestly say they could have Brooklyn pizza with a closeup view of the Brooklyn Bridge in DUMBO. Yup if you need pizza options after touring DUMBO and need a place to sit, come here.
Very friend, welcoming staff. Anastasia was very accommodating, courteous, & fast to sit us as well as to bring our order to us. The pizza was beyond yummy. Will absolutely come back....

Stumbled into Ignazio's while spending the day in Dumbo. Lines were long at almost ever restaurant around the block but Ignazio's seated us in under 20 minutes. Win! Super helpful host and staff. Caesar salad and pizza hit the spot. A bit of a wait for the pie but once it arrived it was piping hot. Exactly what we needed for the trek back home. Delicious. Good crust, sauce, cheese, and quality toppings. Give it a try for sure!

Came here at 12:30pm on a Sunday. Grabbed the last table for two. Sat by the window. What pretty views of the bridge and Manhattan skyline. Until a line to enter the restaurant filled up that view. The entire two hours of our meal, we were on display, like in a zoo. Hungry onlookers were ogling us and our food, as we ate. Extremely uncomfortable. Zero enjoyment from being watched from the other side of glass. Huge detracting factor. Instead of the views, you're watching hangry faces of strangers ogling every inch of you and your food.

Get here right upon opening, at noon, or prepare to wait outside in the freezing cold. The space is not big, and this being a touristy location, you'll wait a long time during peak dinning times.

Service was harried. Probably understaffed.

Got a large pizza--half clam special and half shrimp special. Clam special was completely bland and tasteless. Skip. As if the kitchen forgot to put anything besides the clams on this half of the pizza. The shrimp special was delicious--truly a highlight. Can't really imagine seafood on a pizza, but this combo worked well. Really delicate shrimp perfectly done oreganata style.

Also got a medium white pizza with mushrooms and spinach. Tasty, delicate.

Crust - good crunch, not much flavor in the dough
Sauce - very grainy due to all of the spices that they use, was not a fan. Pepperoni was very thin and did not have any flavor unfortunately
Cheese - very thin, wish there was more

Square slice was better than their regular

Had lunch at Ignazio's on Saturday afternoon. A great location cannot make up for extremely poor service, inadequate cooling, and subpar pizza. Also, cash only for their higher prices is absurd.

Quality: We ordered a Medium The Pizza and a Calzone With Prosciutto. We ended up with The Pizza With Prosciutto and no Calzone. After failing to flag someone down to fix the order we just ate what we were given. The pizza was okay, but not in the same league as its neighbors Juliana's and Grimaldi's. Not nearly enough cheese, too salty, which certainly wasn't helped by the prosciutto, and a texture that was too crunchy without any softness.  
Quantity: A Medium Pizza was still quite big and enough for two to share.
Value: $24-$30 for a Medium Pizza. $3.50-$4.50 for each Topping. Cash only.
Ambiance: Ignazio's has prime real estate as the pizza spot under the Brooklyn Bridge. The restaurant looks out to the nearby park and sees tons of traffic. They have two sections of outdoor seating and then a fairly large indoor space. The indoor area does not have central A/C, so you will be relying on fans and portable units. There was also no music inside or out, which felt eerily silent.
Crowd: Busy on Saturday afternoon, but seemed to be a lot of folks who were unwilling to wait for the neighboring pizza shops.
Service: They got our order incorrect and were impossible to flag down and fix.
Parking: One of the busiest areas in Brooklyn, street parking is a challenge.
Very good pizza!  One of the best I've had in NYC. Terrific sauce, good crunchy crust. Pizza slices are cash only. Definitely recommend if you are in Brooklyn

Very lucky to be seated here within minutes during the Labor Day holiday weekend! Great service and atmosphere. The owner seated us by the window which allowed for great view of the Brooklyn Bridge. Garlic bread and pizza were tasty and flavorful.

When it's good, it's REALLY good, but when it's bad, good god! The 1-star is only because I feel bad for them. They are a neighborhood pizzeria that I want to support, but my guess is their rent is so high by now, that they have to just crank out the pies, factory-style.

I've ordered from them on and off for the past few years. Most recently, I ordered 3x in a 2-month period or so. Twice the pie arrived a soggy, raw-doughy mess with tomato sauce all over the place despite requesting "extra crispy."

The box in which it came already felt heavy in a weird way. Thats because the extreme sogginess of the pie went right through the cardboard smearing all over my kitchen counter. Since then, I've begun firing up my oven when I order from them in anticipation of a poor quality pie -- I've come to expect poor quality everything in NYC given the rents being charged, small businesses don't really stand a chance here anymore.

They did give me a credit, but when it's so hit or miss on a $45 pie each time I order, I can't justify continuing to order from them as much as I want to support local.

It's really too bad that this neighborhood has become what it has. A place that must primarily cater to tourists, i.e., who cares if they're served up inferior products; tourists are not repeat customers. And who cares if locals are annoyed, it's not like the other local pizzerias serve any better product (they don't).

I would like to point out that Ignazio is like the step sister to Juliana's.  I have pizza the first time form this place because I didn't want to wait for the pick up (yup not dine in but take out) so I decided to give Ignazio a try.  Now I don't know why they don't have better reviews because honestly they are good decent pizza!  We ordered white clam and "the pizza" pies.  First let me say I have had white clam pizza elsewhere and usually it is a hit or miss, it can be challenging to get a white clam and have it too soggy.  This one is not! The flavor and the amount of white clam on the pizza should make it soggy but it isn't.  The Pizza is not your average pizza, fresh, crusty and of course I did check off "well done" on my order preference so if that's what you like make sure you do the same.  The garlic bread is so awesome that it never made it home, as my 11 yo wolfed it down on the ride home.  I would try them again and when I picked up the pizza I checked the interior space and it is more spacious than Juliana's and have better view too.  I would not over this hidden gem if you are in the area.  This review is done by a local Brooklynite and not a tourist so take it how you will!

Our first night in NYC so we walked across Brooklyn bridge and I looked up best pizza in dumbo. A few came up but we ended up here and glad we did. We all just got single slices and they were very reasonable, especially by NY standards. $4 for a cheese and 4.50 for pepperoni. The sauce is what did it for me. Fantastic tang and a good crunch on the crust. You can get it to go like we did and go sit by the pier and people watch and look out on the water. Perfect

Probably the best pizza place in dumbo Brooklyn , The pizza comes out super hot n fresh always. The staff are super nice & friendly the really cater to there customers . Place is nice n clean the also have outside sitting which is always a plus especially in the summer .

Food was mediocre and not worth the NYC prices.
Plenty of better places to eat a few blocks away on Main St

My bf and I ordered a slice of cheese and pepperoni pizza and thought it was just okay. We were on a Brooklyn pizza tour and tried 9 places. The pizza was not awful, but could not compete against the other 8 places we tried.

The crust was over cooked, pepperoni was paper thing and wasn't cooked with the pizza. They just topped it at the end so it would all fall off and wasn't cooked with the cheese.

Very big and clean inside located in a beautiful and perfect location! I would come back to try other food but would skip out on pizza. Again, pizza wasn't awful but after doing a Brooklyn pizza tour it just could not come Pete against the other 8 places!

My partner loves pizza, and we're always trying to find new spots to try/visit the places which have been highly rated by barstool. This place had a 8.7 score, and we were very excited to try it.

The atmosphere was very laid back and the employees were nice. It was packed, but we were able to get a table fairly quick. We decided to keep it simple and just get a plain pie.

The pizza looked great, smelled great and the sauce was fantastic. However the crust was too thick for my liking, if it were a thinner crust it would have been great! 3 stars for the great service, awesome decor and the okay pizza.

Went here on a whim after sightseeing over at  Brooklyn Bridge Park. Immediately got sat at the bar, had a really good and hardworking waiter Emily who took care of my friend and I on a busy Sunday afternoon. We got the Red sangria, Buffalo wings & meatballs as appetizers, and for the grand finale a medium 'The Pizza' w/ Pepperoni and we were blown away!! From the bake of the pie (not too charred), the perfect melt of the cheese, the pepperoni not too soft w/ slightly crisped edges, and the crust was PERFECTION! I highly recommend and I WILL be back!

Ignazio's was the first pizza we tried in New York. I was super picky about wanting to eat a good cheese pizza and this spot did not disappoint. We started off with:

*Caesar Salad: This was a refreshing touch as we hadn't had greens during our trip. Although it was slightly over-dressed, It was really good.

*Garlic Bread: The bread was warm and garlic-y, as it should be. The paprika on top made it have more of a spicy kick.

*The Pizza: Your basic cheese pizza but elevated with fresh mozzarella versus the shredded kind. I liked how the mozzarella slices were scattered around and not all over the slice. The tomato sauce had the perfect tang to it. I smothered this with oregano and it was delicious.

As someone who doesn't live in NY, I initially thought the service was slightly off. It's more of a "what do you want?!" than a "what can I get ya?" Our friends explained the atmosphere is pretty much like that all the time so we let it sink in. With that said, we had a great time and enjoyed the food. Cheers!

4 stars, one for each dollar a slice! seriously, seems to be a pizza pocket right here, a hot pocket.

i saw the one bite when we got back to base and it was very surprising to see that pornoy rated them the #2 in brooklyn, i mean, i watch them always on the lookout and what not!

comes out HOT! seriously, you've been warned! its crispy so quick math tells me this all adds up!

HEY! IM EATIN HEER!

This place was there for me when Juliana's failed me. I ordered a handful of pizzas from Juliana, which is around the corner up the street, and to simply put it, they refused to make my order because they wanted to prioritize in-restaurant diners (You can read my negative review on their page to get more details).

I had to order these pizzas for my daughter's 2 year old birthday party and when we got to Juliana's to pick them up and find out they refused to make it, I had to scramble. This is when Ignazio's saved the day. They were very understanding and prioritized my order to help me out and had the pizzas show up basically right in time to when I needed them. The vibe is just great here and they are the type of place where I sense that they still care about good customer service, which always makes things taste sweeter. I hope this place continues to stay humble and hungry because this is the kind of experience that brings people coming back, especially locals. Thank you for your help!

"The one that serves slices."

Or so they say. But they do - only for takeout.

After my first attempt went awry, I went back to give it another go. This time, I had more l success.

I got two slices, and I took them over to nearby Brooklyn Bridge Park to try them out. I also heard that the crust is so crispy that it will echo across the river if you listen close enough.

Hehe, it really does!

The crust is perfectly cooked here. Like better than Juliana's and Grimaldi's, okay, maybe I am stepping out of line on the latter. It is amazing.

The rest of the slice is solid but nothing too crazy. It is very heavily seasoned with oregano, and the sauce has some sweetness to it (lots of sugar I can tell), but the cheese has some nice pull and tastes homemade and that is something that can not be taken away.

These are also big slices, so I will not complain about the $8 (cash only - warning) total for two slices. See for yourself.

I would come back here for the sake of that amazing crust, which I can still hear echoing off the bridge and skyline.

Nothing too special to be honest. It was a good option I guess in the area near the bridge and dumbo. We were sitting right near the bathroom and the line to enter the bathroom was right near us... we could see the toilet as the door opened and closed.

At one point during our meal, a women waiting in line for the bathroom had her butt very close to my partner's face. Imagine trying to eat and seeing that in front of you......

Pizza and salad very good, not great. What was great was immediate seating on a busy night in the area, high chair for kids, reasonable wine and beer, clean with nice view of action outside. Pizza was tasty, very good and plenty of sauce and cheese. Not enough basil. Not too noisy for a big space.
Perfect spot for Dumbo bridges and parks. Best of all, no big line to get in.  Friendly place.
Great pizza! Low rating for cash only policy with in-house ATM charging $3.00 fee. Complete and total BS. I will boycott for 2 months

Consistently bad. I imagine the rent to be very high--though prices have gone up 25%-30%+ in the last 2 years, presumably to accommodate this along with inflation. Most recently, the size of the pizza has been cut by a 3rd in ADDITION to the skyrocketing price. But by far the worst thing is that they don't COOK the pizza. Occasionally it can be good. But most of the time, it's burnt both top and bottom, and there's visible raw dough in places where the pizza is not burned. Things work out poorly even after trying to cook the pizza at home post-arrival. They must be forced to move these pizzas as quickly as possible, and they can't keep them in the oven long enough at the temps necessary to actually cook them. I have to say avoid.
Best regular slice you may find in NY. Straight delicious, crispy, and just amazing. Would put up against any of the others .

I made the decision to place my purchase after reading these wonderful Yelp reviews. For takeout, I choose the stuffed mushroom and clam pizza. Although the food was delicious, I gave it a low rating due to the rudeness of the counter employees. She began treating me in an obnoxious manner as she became enraged with me. That gives me a very uneasy feeling. She persisted in being a jerk and obstinate over things I didn't understand despite my best efforts to remain cool. If I hadn't been served in such a rude manner, I would have greatly enjoyed my meal. I'm hoping that the service I receive the next time I order won't be similar to what I received today.

The location is in a lovely spot, but I felt like we were racially profiled. Upon walking in we ordered a pie and asked to be seated we were told there isn't  any available seat available, although there were vacant seats. Two white ladies came in immediately after us and we're seated right away after bringing it To their attention, we were seated. However, the service we received was horrible. They ignored us while checking in on everyone else which made us feel like we shouldn't be there. I won't be visiting this establishment is anymore very displeased  .

LooKing for a good pizza while visiting Brooklyn, NY and I think we hit the jackpot with this one. Spent 2 days in New York City, went to our usual place for pizza at 57th street (not going to name the place) and wasn't as good as I used to remember it. Tried another pizza place and it was good. Driving back stopped at Brooklyn to see the sunset and  night views of New York City skyline and found Ignazio's Pizza. Had the BEST, let me repeat, the Best white pizza I have ever had. It was out of this world. It's a very simple place, nothing fancy but a must try if you are a Pizza lover.
Steven did an amazing job serving us! Love the pizza and the service! Stop by! It won't be a mistake - you'll thank me later!
We enjoyed it and the view. Pizza was good. The server was nice. This is our third time coming here.

Amazing matcha latte. Loved the roasted mushrooms in the prepared case and their focaccia.

Looking forward to sampling some of their healthy packaged snacks in the future. Asha Popped water lily seeds look intriguing- have not seen them in any other healthy snack places.

Friend and I were looking for a lunch spot that had some decent salad options. Found Isle of Us and hopped into an Uber. 10 minutes later, we were ordering the arugula and salmon salad ($19) to split. It was enough for both of us to be satiated, but not stuffed. Couldn't tell from the menu, but be warned the salad was very strong with the olives taste.

Light seating in the front, with some additional tables in the back. Definitely not a spot for big groups. It was just the two of us and the round tables in the back were so tightly squeezed together that we had trouble getting out, even with a table or two next to us being empty.

Really great lunch spot.
Went with a friend
Great service.  Vegan options - more if you just omit 1-2 items.
Great healthy food.
Lots of drink choices
Will be back
Very nice clean space.  Nice bathrooms

I really loved this place - cute small cafe and really nice vibes. The staff is also friendly and all seating is in a laptop free zone; which works well since the tables don't stay occupied for too long.
I got the eggs and hash burrito and that was really good! Potatoes were roasted nicely, lots of cheese and jalapeños- perfect meal after a long workout. The latte was also really good!

I visited Isle of Us on a rainy day. It was delightful sitting and looking out the window while drinking a delicious coffee and eating breakfast. I got a super delicious egg and hash burrito! I highly recommend it!
Delicious and healthy food. Beautiful decor. Cozy ambiance. Fast service. Fairly priced for the quality. What more could one ask for? Definitely coming back!

Isle of Us
This cafe was an accidental find after I left Cafe Serafina. Yelpers complained about Serafina's prices. The prices are even higher here! The space is huge with indoor and outdoor seating. I was put off by the unsmiling employees behind the counter and the lack of a friendly greeting when I entered. I doubt I would sit down for a pricey meal or coffee.

I did find the $5 Chocolate Tahini Babka really the perfect size for my breakfast. It beats buying a whole Babka elsewhere. There's groceries for sale in the front space. Nothing that interested me.

Bottom line is the place didn't have the vibe I enjoy. You may feel differently. Check it out if you're in the neighborhood. It's attached to a Health Spa and Nail Salon also. You can spend the day and lots of money!

I loved my meal at Isle of Us and can't wait to go back! My friends and I came for a weekday dinner and sat in the small seating section in the back. We had no problem getting a table, but I would guess that it does get very busy on a weekend for brunch.

I ordered the winter harvest bowl and was amazed at how flavorful each component was both individually and together. I took off a star because my bowl was originally missing one of the components (the pumpkin & sesame seed granola), which I only noticed since my friend had ordered the same bowl. I asked if I could get it on the side and am very glad I did as the pumpkin & sesame seed granola was delicious. I believe they actually sell it by the jar along with other prepared food! Overall, everyone really enjoyed their meals, so I can't imagine you could go wrong!

KIMCHI GRILLED CHEESE ($10)
- crunchy, perfectly grilled, but won't hurt your teeth crunchy, with satisfying soft crunches of kimchi giving you that punchy, mildly spicy smoothed out by the ooey gooey cheese. What a delight !

EGG AND HASH BURRITO ($17)
Great burrito - and vegetarian to boot. The chiles really add another level of flavor and the potato chunks are so tender and satisfying to bite through. Star of the show? The green sauce served with it. It'll make you forget that there's no meat in this.

Small-ish space, seating inside and outside.
Water station available.
Breakfast items are served even into the afternoon.
The service was pretty good also.

I think if this place fits your budget it's def worth checking out on a weekend morning/afternoon.

This is a great addition to the Upper East side. It is very clean and well organized.

The Latte I got was tasty but did not stay too hot for too long. Not sure if it was because of how it was made or that it was pretty cold on that day.

Staff was friendly.

Crustless quiche, you came to the tastyAF party! Wow! So damn good! Absolutely loved it! The coffee selection is quite good here, just a wee pricey compared to some places nearby. Nonetheless, a great addition to the UES scene!

After placing our order at the counter we took a number and found a seat at the community table in the back. The atmosphere was bright, clean and pleasant. I got the avocado toast which came on a thick, grainy, crispy bread slice with a hearty helping of smashed avocado sprinkled with seasoning and topped with fresh dill. I also ordered a matcha latte with almond milk which was creamy and delicious. They have a water station where you help yourself and a clean up station where you put your empty plates and separate out the trash. The food was great and the counter service was friendly. The only thing is the prices were rather high for a serve-yourself place without a wait staff. The total bill for the 3 of us was over $80.

I was pleasantly surprised by this cute marketplace/cafe! First, the space is very stylish and nicely decorated. They have a well-curated selection of items for sale as well as prepared foods made in-house. The food menu is small with lunch starting at 11am. We got there pretty early so we tried a couple of the breakfast items and we were pretty impressed. The Eggs and Hash Burrito came in a flaky wrap and the charred tomatillo salsa complemented the meal really well. The Greens, Eggs & Jam Sandwich with added Impossible sausage patty was also a winner - super flavorful and well done! I would definitely recommend checking it out if you're in the area.

I've had lunch here and done take out for lunch a good bit of times. The food is always fresh and delicious. The staff is super nice and helpful and it has a fun and bright vibe inside. The portions are also great.

excellent neighborhood joint boasting a variety of options for day-to-day needs. Creative food that did not feel heavy and a cute little marketplace selling original products featuring diverse flavors and new ideas.

Isle of Us is a great fusion of a small marketplace, coffee shop, and lunch spot. The food comes out quickly, but there is a nice quiet seating area in the back for those with extra time. Their lunch offerings range various proteins, vegan, vegetarian, fish, chicken, etc. and cross cultural boundaries ranging from japanese to middle-eastern. Everything is executed well and makes use of no low-quality ingredients that would otherwise make the food feel heavy. The food was light, bright, and filling.

The drinks are delicious. We tried the coffee and orange kombucha that was far better than what you get in a can from Whole Foods.

The marketplace is also super fun! It's a pleasure to walk around, get ideas from all the little spice rubs, or even buy one if you are feeling so inclined. The furikake finishing spice is unlike anything you can buy at an H-Mart and boasts an interesting anise flavor. Each of the grab-and-go foods and pre-made pantry items featured one or two twists that speaks to the chef's creativity and allows Isle of Us to stamp out its unique style. I wanted to buy everything!

I will definitely be back next time I'm in need of a bite in the UES.
We LOVED our first order here... turkey meatball bowl (really amazing flavors) , kimchee cheddar sandwich and tried the awesome hummus, too. Dangerously addictive, we want to try it all!!!

Very cute atmosphere and amazing brands and products to discover! I was blown away by the aesthetic and design.

The space is pretty small and too many tables it's almost impossible to move around without bumping into customers or staff... and don't even think about squeezing behind a table to get to a booth. It's almost impossible.

I ordered the everything bowl and americano. It came with 2 poached eggs and wilted spinach which made the dish bit little watery.

I was super excited about this place (especially walking by a few times the past week) but I cannot get over the terrible experience.

A manager came over to me upset that I had plugged in my laptop into one of the many outlets nearby to charge while I was using it. He told me I needed to immediately leave, and no laptops were allowed. There was at least one other person sitting right next to me working on a laptop, but the manager proceeded to only target me. He stood over me until I cleared out my laptop and left.

Not sure if it's worth the embarrassment to come back for a second shot.
Very cute cafe--i think a store is connected. Coffee was great! Raspberry matcha mochi was okay (too sweet for me) and the quiche was too salty :( but definitely coming back for coffee :) :)

Came here for a quick breakfast bite and thought it was really good! We tried the Eggs and Hash Burrito and the grilled cheese.

Both were really tasty. The portion size is not huge so I recommend getting a few things to share with someone for a meal!

There is interior lounge seating in the back or a few tables outside.

Service was normal. They don't serve orange juice which I found odd.

Such a cute market/café! Dreamy millennial packaging for specialty items -- picked up a local chrysanthemum kombucha. Can't wait to go back and try their prepared foods from grab & go + café menu. Overheard they have pistachio milk for coffee! Small seating area in the back too. A bit pricey overall but this is the UES after all...

Went there to  get coffee, food to study for a bit.  I ordered coffee (light and sweet) and the turkey sandwich with avocado for about $25 (quite pricey). I grabbed a table to do a quick study and they delivered the food to me. The sandwich was good but a bit messy. The coffee DID not taste like coffee at all. It was watered down.
Laptop use: When I came in, I saw someone using their laptop in the back seating area and there was no sign that said "no laptops allowed". I ate my lunch and studied for about an hour when I was informed that laptops were not allowed in the back seating. I was pretty annoyed since I was not informed prior and I was completing a timed exam. Overall, the food was good, coffee could be better and annoyed about being told no laptop.

Had the breakfast burrito with vegan chorizo, breakfast sandwich, matcha cake, and chocolate chip cookie. we loved the burrito and breakfast sandwich, and the baked goods were also good. Everything was filling but not too heavy or greasy. Service was great as well!
My new favorite neighborhood cafe! Great seating area in the back.
It's ok. The breakfast burrito was fine, not great, and coffee was good. Expensive, but not out of line for the UES
Great food great space. Really don't want it to be discovered! Service has been wonderful

My favorite place in the city. Space is beautiful. I love meeting friends here. Food is delicious. Team is so kind. Try the kelp salad. The very thing bowl is EVERYTHING. Shop the store: such good packaged goods: the hot sauce and tuna are perfection.

Love it here. Need one downtown too! Go  go go!
Lovely spot. Cute interior, friendly staff, and my chicken salad sandwich and chocolate chip cookie were both very good. I'll come back for sure!

Great healthy options, fair prices, good portions, friendly staff, & nice outdoor seating. I got the harvest bowl and kombucha. The bowl was 11/10 soooo amazing and kombucha great too. I came hungry and wasn't even able to finish my bowl. I highly recommend for a quick bite or an on the go snack, drink, or meal!!!!

I had the best breakfast burrito for lunch here today (gluten free wrap was super crispy!). Staff was helpful and friendly, and the place had a great vibe. Also, in addition to the delicious prepared food, there's an amazing selection of pantry and gift items.

I have lived on the upper east side for 6 years and have been constantly let down by the lack of good, healthy food choices. It looks something like this: Healthy with absolutely no atmosphere to speak of, or delicious, but $234,463 with the atmosphere of a Delta Sky Lounge. Isle of Us is like something I dreamed up: a crustless quiche, a salmon sushi-like bowl --- and something that I can grab and go and eat. Really good food that's in a really good-looking place.

Scrumptious food and great, quick service. My friend and I split a few things - the marinated kale and chicken salad and the winter harvest bowl. Walked out with a delicious latte! Will pop by whenever I'm in the area.
Good quality coffee & quick eatery spot. The food was a bit pricy for the portion size, but tasted good. Will definitely come here more often.
Food was very mediocre, I ordered the turkey sandwich which had only one flavor- salty, extremely salty. Tabbouleh salad was ok.

Was perusing Uber eats and came across this place located in Yorkville. I love wings and decided to order this for lunch. Order arrived on time and still hot!

7 piece extra crispy wings: hot, crisp, juicy but cooked perfectly.
I decided to get sauces on the side:
Vietnamese mango- holy moly this has real mango in it and a touch of heat, addictively good! Must try
Mild buffalo- vinegary and a hint of butter
Jalapeño ranch- insanely good and pairs well with the hot sauces

For sides I chose  
Mozzarella sticks- thick, gooey cheese interior, just a bit too salty for my taste . Marinara sauce included and is good to cut the richness.
Creamy red cabbage slaw- crunchy, has a nice bite to it

All in all a dope spot that I will definitely have to check out in person next time I'm on the UES. Lots of unique flavors to try and a variegated menu is a plus.

Ah, let me regale you with a tale of my recent culinary escapade at the International Wings Factory. You see, dear reader, it all began on a day when my soul was in need of nourishment, and my taste buds were craving an adventure.

After a spiritually enlightening visit to the Church of the Holy Trinity, I found myself on a quest for sustenance, and fate led me to this delightful establishment. As I walked in, the aroma of deliciousness wafted through the air, promising a gastronomic journey like no other.

Now, let's talk about the stars of the show - the wings! These aren't just any wings; they are the epitome of flavor, the apex of taste bud ecstasy. The garlic parmesan wings were a revelation, a perfect marriage of garlic's pungent allure and parmesan's creamy embrace. And the fried chicken sandwiches? Oh, they were like a crispy, juicy hug for my senses. But wait, there's more - the cheese fries were a symphony of gooey, cheesy goodness that deserves a standing ovation.

But it wasn't just the savory delights that stole the spotlight; the sweet treats were equally enchanting. The brownies were fudgy squares of chocolate nirvana. Asida, a dessert I had never tried before, turned out to be a delightful surprise with its unique flavor and texture. And the crumble, oh my, it crumbled my resistance to dessert.

One of the things that truly impressed me was the option for takeaway. In a world where time is of the essence, being able to savor these delectable dishes on the go is a godsend. The friendly staff, always ready with a smile, made the experience even more delightful. They say that service with a smile enhances the flavor of a meal, and here, they've perfected the art.

Now, let's address the elephant in the room - prices. Affordable is an understatement. You get gourmet-level dishes without needing to auction off your prized possessions. It's like a culinary steal, a secret treasure trove of taste that won't break the bank.

The decor and atmosphere? Impeccable. The fine decor and lovely ambiance make you feel like you're dining in the lap of luxury, even though you're indulging in comfort food. It's the perfect place to relax, enjoy a meal, and let the flavors transport you to a state of bliss.

In conclusion, the International Wings Factory isn't just a restaurant; it's a flavor sanctuary. It's where your taste buds embark on a magical journey, where savory and sweet delights dance on your palate, and where affordability meets gourmet. Don't miss this culinary gem; it's a taste adventure waiting to happen!

International Wings Factory are some of the best wings I have had for two reasons: flavor and crispiness. The culinary training and background of Deepak shine through in the product. I ordered them extra crispy, which would be the sweet spot for how you would likely want your wings. I also ordered them naked with the sauces on the side, which is how I would order them to go , because they were crispy when I got home and...listen to this...They were crispy the next day simply warming them in the oven, not microwave, without a convection oven or air fryer assist. They are not audibly as crisp as Korean wings, but all other comparisons for the wing connoisseur, these wings are crispy and you can order them one step crispier if you like yours fried hard.

I go into all this, because a true wing connoisseur gets into these details. The wings here have flavor to the bone, the only way I would order them, but to each his or her own. Deepak 's preparation of the wings involves some type of brining or marinating. There is also some care in sourcing the wings too if I am not mistaken. So a lot of details are given attention here, as well as their own sauces they prepare at International Wings Factory. Nothing is coming out of packets or poured out of jugs, save for the ketchup. The details matter here.

I can confidently state the wings here will please nearly anyone's palate with sauces that range from mild to very hot. I had the Vietnamese chili mango and the Confession buffalo type sauce. Neither of these was particularly challenging in my opinion and those who like it spicy will likely want to step it up to the third and fourth levels of heat here for the sauces. The Vietnamese chili mango was actually less spicy than the Confession. The Confession was very tangy, but neither was salty. I like places where  they produce flavor without all the sodium or overly salty taste.

Their fries are not an afterthought. I had the regular fries and sweet potato fries. Both were excellent and those who are connoisseurs of fries will be quite pleased with the results. There are better fries out there, but no one will be looking for them here. One recommendation would be to develop an in-house sauce of cinnamon, maple syrup and mustard or smoked paprika for the sweet potato fries. All of a sudden, the sweet potato fries would be a hit unto themselves...

The one downside to all the attention paid to the details would be the price is a bit steep for what one receives. 25 wings will run you $45, plus whatever else you order. I'm certain inflation has influenced the pricing here, but it is something to consider when one has tons of options in NYC. If you're looking for something on the side or to watch the game, these are your wings. If you are looking for sustenance and substance, you have other options. There are a handful of small tables where you can sit and enjoy them fresh and the small place is comfortable.  Deepak and the folks here are personable and welcoming. It's not at all a factory. Three and a half highly recommended stars!

$25 for 12 wings???? Are these wings made of 18k gold? What a joke. I can't imagine a restaurant that cares about their customers less than this place. They said it's hard for them to survive. Well with no customers willing to pay $25 for 12 wings I can imagine it would be hard to survive. Do everyone a favor and close up shop now so we don't have to look at your insulting prices for your average to below average wings.

Best Chicken wings and Mac & Cheese of Upper East Side.
The spot is small but well designed. The food is amazing, they have a huge variety of sauces and sides.

Everything was on point. Convenient tables to dine-in, warm and thoughtful decor, good music playlist, good food temperature and preparation time, super clean, utensils were handy, heat lights to keep delivery orders warm until they get picked up. You can tell by all the attention to all the details that this place is managed by a very experienced food industry person, at the end the result could not be other than an excellent experience.

We ordered the 18 wings option and choose parm garlic and buffalo for sauces (half and half) also a side of Mac and cheese, and celery/carrots. The wings came with 2 additional dipping sauces of our choice, we had creamy cilantro and blue cheese. Everything was absolutely delicious.

Everyone in the store was extremely friendly and attentive.

Theres a 15% discount if you eat in the restaurant, great deal, they also offer lunch/afternoon special combos during weekdays from $9 to $12 average.

Would definitely recommend and I will definitely come back.

Long-standing wingstop with a very cozy interior and bright lights. Not many people inside on a Saturday night with a few tables still free.

Prices have definitely gone up in recent years for wings, and this spot is no exception. Decided on four Wings with the Chili Mango Sauce ($7ish) and the Lemon Butter Fried Chicken Sandwich ($12). Wings are as good as advertised, meaty and cooked perfectly with a sweet and spicy sauce drenched on top (as well as to the side). Sandwich was a letdown - too tangy and an unbalanced flavor, though the chicken tenders were juicy. The dish did come with fries though, which was a repreove from the sandwich sauce.

Service is quick and they have napkins and water to the side. Would stick with the wings and enjoy

I ordered the 7 piece wings with the Original Confession (buffalo) sauce and a side of the regular fries with the southwestern seasoning. Both were very good! The wings were juicy and had a ton of flavor. It was easy to order online and have it ready for pickup. I'll for sure be coming back to this place soon!

The wings here are the best in the area and the staff are amazing - friendly and helpful. The prices are a little higher but you definitely get what you pay for. Highly recommend the garlic Parmesan and the lemon Cajun. Really glad we finally tried this local gem out especially since they are so close to home.

Best wings I've found on the UES, bar none.

Have tried multiple options of dry rub and sauced wings, yet to be disappointed. When you order extra crispy, they are done perfectly.

Both the tikka masala dry and Nashville dry rubs deliver on flavor.  Buffalo, American Gold and Original Confession sauces have all been tasty.

Yes it costs a bit more than many of the area bars, but the product is higher quality.

Wasn't as good as expected. Ordered chicken Burria quesadilla, Mac and mozzarella, and battered mozzarella sticks. Everything was just ok and not very flavorful. I'm not sure why this place gets such good reviews.
The Birria didn't taste like anything with some low seasoned quesadillas. Ended up throwing away the mozzarella sticks because they weren't worth it after eating one bland stick. And the Mac also didn't taste like anything.

This place! I love you, but i do not like you!! For all of the right reasons! Great wings!!! Great mother loving wings!! Not breaded, fried to perfection, or longer for my peoples who like well done wings, seeping flavor out of every single one.  Better than what wing stop should be today, but nostalgic of the wing stop wings of down south from years ago. Unique and more familiar flavors and that jalapeno ranch??? A must try! The dipping sauces all do what they are supposed to do. I haven't had this in person, so I haven't tried their fries, but i have had their mozzarella sticks, to be fair, they are probably better in restaurant, i do not feel they travel well, they are underwhelming, but i would definitely try them in store to give them a fair review, i can say they ARE cheesy, the texture of it cold was slightly off putting. My mister and i are looking forward to the experience in person, seeing as we have only the delivery perspective. But again, GREAT WINGS!!!

My friend, D,  and I didn't know what we were in for coming in here. We just knew we wanted wings.

I knew D liked the wings cause he was having a good old time licking the sauce off and eating every little bit of flesh and leaving the bones clean. I was shocked too. The wings were fried just right, and not covered in batter but didn't have to be. The seasonings shined through and spoke for themselves. The flavors carried some serious umami and my nose was definitely on fire. No regrets though, some of the best I've had in a long time!! Def wish to come back someday.

These wings are phenomenal. I really wish they would open a few more locations in the city but with that sometimes the quality suffers. So keep doing your thing. I'd definitely recommend if in you're up in the UES. You can request extra crispy if you prefer. Really great flavors!!

I was in New York City and I was hungry. I was looking around for a quick place to eat and I was checking out Yelp and was reading some reviews and I decided to give this place a try and I'm glad I did.  Upon walking in. I was instantly greeted by the owner, and a very friendly worker. I was explained the menu and I decided to go with the bone in wings and garlic Parmesan sauce, along with some mac & cheese, and some mild blue cheese dressing and Gorgonzola crumbles.   The food is made to order and it was piping hot when it was served to me and very delicious, the place is super clean and I really enjoyed my experience there. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.

i had high expectations and was thoroughly disappointed. Not sure if they were having an off day but my experience was different from the patrons who rated this place highly. The dry wings were decently seasoned but bone dry, and the sauces on the sauced wings were mostly sweet in flavor profile, but lacked in overall flavor. The buffalo wings were okay but nothing special, could get similar wings at any local bar joint. If you want outstanding wings, go to the west side and order from blondies sports, thank me later.

Dropped by today and got a mixed lunch to try them out, after reading the good reviews.

Regular chicken wings with different flavors (BBQ, spicy), boneless chicken wings (garlic), sweet potato fries, Mac n cheese.

All in all it wasn't bad, and not too expensive (around $35 for a sizable lunch for 2).  But nothing exceptional, or that I wouldn't find at a decent pub or sportsbar.

The boneless wings were pretty dry and chewy, kinda disappointed; the bbw and spicy wings were decent though.

Everything else was alright but...I was hoping for a bit more.
I ordered from ubereats the Traditional Wings with Black Pepper Teriyaki Sauce. It's was good the only con is that I didn't order more lol I also ordered the Panko Crusted Brownie.

Had family that was in the mood for wings. Saw the reviews, seemed decent.

There are various flavors to choose from. What can go wrong with BBQ wings.

These wings had no flavor, the BBQ sauce had no flavor. They looked very appetizing but the sauce lacked flavor. Maybe it was an off day. Want to give the benefit of the doubt.

Not to mention, I do not like flies being anywhere around food. Too many flies getting on the food which to me personally is not sanitary.

Would I return, most likely not. But what may not taste good to me and my family. May taste good to someone else. It's best to try for yourself. The ladies at the counter are nice, you will find the service to be great.
A friend and I tried this place out for dinner. The wings were solid. We had the mango chili and parmesan wings. The mango chili wings were slightly on the soggier side. Overall a good spot.

I was in the area and decided to grab a small portion of wings while I waited for the ferry. Saw this on yelp and dropped in to get some wings and fries. They were mediocre and the sauce was just okay too. I don't see myself coming back here unfortunately.

Ordered wings via delivery on an NFL Sunday. Overall was very satisfied with the wings and efficient delivery, would definitely recommend this place if looking for wings delivery. Prices were very fair too.

Got their Buffalo and teriyaki sauces and both were delicious as well as their fries. Wings were hot upon delivery and good size.
The chicken wings are the best money can buy in America!!! Highly recommend you try the soul purifier flavor! The staff is very kind and quick- the owner is the nicest guy around!

Was craving wings and heard about this place so gave it a try. I got the lemon pepper wings, mild wings and a fish cesar salad. I enjoyed my fish salad. The wings weren't to my liking and lacked flavor. The service was ok. Overall just a ok outing

I loved my dinner from here! I started off with a small order of wings in the american gold sauce, which was a delicious honey mustard with a little bit of spice. The BBQ chicken sandwich was delicious as well, and a really large portion with red cabbage coleslaw and tomato. The side of fries with the sandwich was delicious and fried perfectly. The presentation of the meal was carefully put together, and the staff were very friendly and thoughtful in preparing my order accurately.

*3.5 down to 3*

Ordered delivery wings - 12 wings for $22. We did the mild buffalo sauce and the delivery was quicker than the expected ETA. Overall, good not exceptionally great but the wings were a good size. They were also a bit softer than I thought - I thought it was be a bit more crispier even without choosing the extra crispy option.

Not giving the full 4 stars as it looked like one of my wings had looked like there was an undercooked portion of meat in one of my bites near the bone.
Excellent wings! The sauces are on point! The box was of full of fries which was unexpected.

My girlfriend and I are on the hunt for the best classic wings shop in NYC, and I'm proud to say that International wings factory now ranks near the top of that list.

A poultry eating veteran of 30+ years, I consider myself an expert when it comes to the art of the chicken wing. As you can see from my pictures, I don't eat wings like no b*tch, I eat it down to the BONE bro, cartilage and all.

As part of our taste test, we ordered the classic buffalo (because how can you make a good wing if you can't make a good classic?) and the vietnamese mango chili as our wildcard pick. Doing our hw in advance, the tandoori chicken and lemon pepper also seem to come highly recommended by other top yelpers.

Too many people overhype the sauce when it comes to choosing the best wing. However, true wing connoisseurs understand, that when it comes to the best wings, what matters is how you COOK the wings, and thats where IWF gets the job done.

Right from the first bite, it's the perfect mouthful of crispy skin, tender juicy meat, cooked to perfection, not too dry, not too raw.

Complimented by the tangy sweet goodness of a perfect blend of sauces and spice, IWF masters the art of the wing, combining a quality wing, cooked to the tits, with top notch sauces. Every bite was a creamy poultry orgasm in my mouth.

Order IWF for your next night with the boys. I promise you boo boo, you will NOT be dissapointed.

Great wings with great flavors! I like that you can customize how crispy you want the wings. I never had tandoori flavored wings and they were great.
