The fries were just ok with the Siracha cheese sauce. I would skip these next time but definitely would go back for the wings.

The fried brownie was amazing!

A well chosen reroute on this nights dinner.
We got 25 wings. Lemon Cajun and mild buffalo.
The lemon pepper wings were so good. Fried perfectly. They weren't cajuny at all but the lemon zesty flavor was so good.
The buffalo on the other hand. Eh. We could've done without them. It was drowned in buffalo which I do not like.
The sriracha fries- bring on the heat! I loved them. Spicy spicy spicy. With the added jalapeño was a bit much but we devoured them! Good fries too ( aside from all the toppings )

During this pandemic, we eat a lot of our take out foods in our car so we can get this full fresh hot food experience.
It was much better when it first opened. The wings had more meat on them now they are very fatty and usually served cold and gotten very expensive. Not my first choice to get wings.
Really likes their mac and cheese. Wings are great. When im visiting the area from the bronx, i usually come here

Very average Buffalo and Nashville run boneless wings...so small for the extremely high price- was a bit shocked how small the boneless wings were. More bite size. The fries and coleslaw were average as well. Likely won't try again.

The wings here are very good, but pretty expensive since the minimum you can order is 12. We got the boneless wings with mild buffalo sauce which was really good but pretty standard. We also got the traditional wings with mild buffalo sauce and they were very good. Lastly, we got the naked wings with sauce on the side, which were still crispy when they were delivered. I would order from here again.

Was in the neighborhood several days ago and found this spot. It is a small store with only few seats. The staffs were incredibly nice, I could absolutely feel the energy of the team. Being in NYC I've surrounded by countless Korean fried wings but this place definitely offers terrific wings. They do make wings perfectly. Since they offer so many options, it is probably best to ask the staffs for suggestions.
Straight trash do not go here. Fries hard wings had no flavor what so ever just terrible. I will never go here again

I had heard so much about these wings from a local friend - I just had to try them. I ordered online (I am in Chicago) and got them in 2 days - perfectly packed and I just loved them! Amazing wings - I got the Vietnamese Chile Mango sauce - it was the perfect amount of heat and tanginess and rest assured - my taste were happy! If you are looking for wings - give them a try :-)

These are the best wings I've had!! I love my chicken crispy and they achieve that level of crunch perfectly. I got the dry rub of the garlic lemon in extra crispy and the mild Buffalo in extra crispy as well.

I would recommend if you're into extra crispy to get extra extra crispy for sauce or get the sauce on the side because it will get a little soggy by the time you get home.

Staff was friendly and service was quick. Expect to be there 30-40 minutes if you plan to order and wait. Best bet is to order ahead of time if you just want to grab and go.

They mentioned that they went up in price on their website, but the price is still reasonable and the food worth the price.

If you want to dine in, there's booth seating for probably a small group of 5, but the store is small so I personally would recommend to just pick up.

Don't waste your time going to this place. The food is average. Also, the place is very small so dinning in is only for two small groups of 4. I tried takeout and that was a 45 minute wait at the place to get my food. Two thumbs down. Again, don't waste your time.

If you're a wing fan you definitely should make the trip yo here. I go every couple of weeks and tried a lot of the menu. The traditional Buffalo wings are great. I've also enjoyed the Thai wings, all the chicken/fish sandwiches and burgers were good. The onion rings and fries (w Indian seasoning) were the bomb, man so addictive. Fried panko brownies with mixed berries compote, yes please, my metabolic health be damned. Only disappointments, the blue cheese dressing is mixed w ranch and tandoori wings would be better if they weren't a dry rub. Real juicy tandoori wings would be the bomb. Other than that, my mouth is salivating writing this up.

Finally international wings factory Was able to spread their wings all the way to Nashville Tennessee. Delivery made possible by goldbelly.  Excellent service, perfect packaging, recyclable materials used and finger licking sauces.   The sauces are being made to good use even after the wings were devoured.

This place used to be awesome - always got great wings.  Lately though they've had to increase their prices, as is the case with everyone these days, but at $2/wing, I'm disappointed in the size of their offerings.  I'd rather pay $2 wing to Delizia & get meat on the bone.

Got the spicy tandoori wings with creamy cilantro sauce, absolute banger. Mac 'n' mozz was a nice side. Order was made quickly, too. My friend tried some of my food when he was "good" on food and ended up ditching his cooking plans to order the same thing I did.

Some of the best wings I've had in the city. During my first visit here, I think I ordered poorly and got the boneless chicken with the dry rub and extra crispy, so I was a bit disappointed with how dry it was but the next time I got the Mexi and Thai wings / drumsticks and they were so delicious. The wings are huge (split a 18 pc with my bf and we were not able to finish it all in one sitting). They're generous with the sauce and it's not overly salty or sweet. I also added on fries which were surprisingly reallt delicious too and kept well (we ordered delivery, but the fries were still crispy). I'm very happy that this restaurant is still offering take out and delivery during this pandemic, and I am excited to continue supporting them both during and after this is over.

I wanted to check this place out for a while now and glad I finally did.

Ordered 7 piece wings extra crispy with the pure heat sauce and an order of regular fries. The wings were cooked crispy as I ordered them, the only thing I recommend is when you do want them crispy to eat them at location itself as they tend to get soggy if you do take out or get the sauce on the side.

Fries were alright, a thicker cut fry. Only thing I can say here is that for some reason they came out 5 min after I got my wings. Not sure why this happened but would be nicer to get my whole meal at once instead of a little here and there.

Seating is limited so if you do want to dine in when it's busy you might be out of luck.

Will come back to try a different sauce and try the extra extra cooked wings but be aware that they take a little longer to cook.

Amazing array of flavors at this establishment! You have to try their tandoori chicken. If you're in the mood for a certain flavor, just consult their staff and they will direct to you to your palatable needs. They even have seasoning for fries. A whole variety. Can you believe that they have over 20 flavors of wings? And you can pick your level of crispiness! So amazing and great to be able to customize your order.

This place must be busy for super bowl. You have to just come here any day you can. It's worth the trip. At least go to the museum and come here for the yummy wings! Great service and hospitality.

So many wings, so many flavors! What can be better than this?

I've given this place now at least 3 tries and today will officially be my last. It's my own fault because every time I order from here I think ok not getting from here again but alas, there aren't a lot of wing options for delivery nearby and I think ok, let's try this place again.

Today I thought maybe the boneless wings would be different. We ordered Bbq and the buffalo. The sauce isn't anything special but it's also not the problem. The boneless wings are just big overlooked pieces of chicken. They were so hard, tough and dry. So hard a knife was hard to get through! They truly were just not enjoyable!

The fries were sadly the best part of the delivery.

I've also had the regular wings from here and they serve the funky looking pieces of wings that should be thrown away and not given to customers.

Definitely done ordering from here once and for all.

Through the doors of this unassuming storefront, past the posters with hand-written puns, where a giant whisk looms ominously above your head... are some of the best wings I ever had.

This spot may be small with limited seating, but it's packed with personality. The owner & chef, Deepak Ballaney, has a zany sense of humor that trickles into the decor, making a fun and quirky atmosphere. From appetizers, to sandwiches and burgers, to wings and dessert, you can pretty much have a full meal for an incredibly reasonable price.

To start, a handful of us shared the Sriracha Loaded Cheesy Fries, and Mac N' Mozz. Both were super cheesy and wonderful, and I don't know if you care about this sort of thing but... these dishes also happened to be very "cheese-pull" friendly.

I should also note - I'm very picky with cheesy things, and both exceeded my approval! That probably doesn't matter to anyone else but me...  but the cheese texture and viscosity was perfect; stretchy, gooey, and not too creamy or loose. Plus, delicious.

Then came the wings...the main attraction! With a variety of their in-house made dipping sauces. Here's everything we tried with some brief descriptions;

*American Gold (a mild and sweet spiced honey mustard flavor)
*Garlic Parmesan (no spice, buttery and garlicky flavor)
*Lemon Cajun dry rub (little kick, acidic, peppery)
*Vietnamese Chili Mango (sweet with a mild kick)
*Nashville Style Hot dry rub (super spicy, lingering heat)
*Tandoori Masala dry rub (moderate heat but it's more of a fast tingle, not a lingering burn - with an earthy spiced flavor)

It's difficult to pick favorites because every single flavor was amazing - but based on my own personal preference toward sweet and savory with mild acidity (I know it's weirdly specific but it's a thing ), the Vietnamese Chili Mango was the flavor that stole my heart. Moderately sweet, with a little bit of fruityness from the mango, a mild kick from the Chili, with a subtle vinegar based acidity, it was delightful.

Even though we were beyond stuffed, we finished the night off with some DEEP FRIED... PANKO CRUSTED.... BROWNIES. The outside had a very crisp and delicate shell that didn't feel at all oily to the touch or on the tongue, was gently dusted with cinnamon, and the inside batter had a lovely cake-like quality, while not being too thick. The brownie in the center had a good balance between cakey and fudgey, with a rich chocolate flavor that was wonderful.

Yet still, I wanted more..

Let me start off by saying I'm super picky about my wings. This place caters to all. They know some of us like our wings SUPER crispy (sometimes even naked with the sauce on the side) and when they say they're going to cook it a certain way, they mean it. The place itself isn't big, but I always order to my job in east harlem.

The sauces are UNREAL, the chicken is delicious & even the sandwiches are good. Can't wait to try everything else on their menu.

International Wings Factory... now when you're looking up places to eat and this pops up you're expecting something quite elaborate. Lol. Some big place with maybe steel on the walls, exposed ventilation, TVs everywhere and a girl with a cowboy hat riding a mechanical bull in the back. Not the case, but I was not disappointed either. So it's May 18th, 2019. My fiancée has her hair AND makeup done because we just took our engagement pictures in Central Park! We're on a high from that so now we just need some food. What better way to celebrate than to smash on some wings while wearing bright colored clothing and white pants?

Atmosphere/Appearance: So we held our pee in until we got here thinking there would be a bathroom. Nope. The place is too small to have a public bathroom so what we actually did was went around the corner to another restaurant that was super busy then pretended to "wait" for a seat while using the bathroom. We rolled out after our bladders were empty then returned here. Lol. So there's maybe room for 16-20 people to eat inside, MAX. It's a hole-in-the-wall, but like a decorative hole. It looks nice inside. There's painted brick, plenty of cute decorations, quirky quotes and light colored wood. The ordering counter is straight ahead and they just bring the stuff to your seat, if you can manage to snag a seat.

Service: There isn't much table service here aside from when they bring your food or if you catch one of the staff members cleaning up. But I mean, what could you want besides more food? The refrigerator is right there if you need to grab something and pay for it. The water container is right behind that and there's always someone at the counter. We were going to get our food to go then hop in an Uber to the hotel, but the nice owner (or so I think he was) convinced us to stay. He made room for the 2 of us and my backpack to eat and we genuinely appreciated that hospitality. Shout out to you if you're reading this.

Food: THEY AAAIIIGGGHHHTTTT. They're fried and about the size of an "average" wing. We tried 4 sauces and first up was "Mexy Q". It's a 2 out of 5 on their heat scale. It was cool. It was hard to describe, but it was what the name suggests, Mexican barbecue. Quite tasty. Next up was the "Original Confession". It's their traditional buffalo sauce and I wanted to try it seeing as it was 3 out of 5 on their heat scale. It was quite flavorful and not too spicy. Next up was the "Soul Purifier". Sounds spicy right? Even their description reads, "Buffalo based with house blend spices and chilies. Very spicy, but not crazy hot." I like a challenge so the 5 out of 5 heat scale is what drew me to these. They tasted like their traditional buffalo sauce just cranked up a notch. I could definitely handle the heat, but I was kinda looking for something I couldn't. Know what I mean? I wanted to push the envelope. Last, but not least, was Vietnamese Chile Mango. These were my favorite of the 4 sauces. They were a 3 out of 5 on the heat scale and had a fruity, sweet taste that blended well with a bit of spice.

Value: We ordered 2 sets of 18 wings so that we could split the sauces in half for each order (yielding 4 different sauces). An order of 18 is $19.50 and that comes with 2 choices of dipping sauce (bleu cheese, ranch, chipotle mayo, creamy cilantro, jalapeño ranch and bleu cheese crumbles which they just recommend adding to their bleu cheese sauce). We also added a box of baby carrots and celery (gotta be healthy somehow) for $2.00. It's a pretty good deal in my opinion for New York City. So we smashed and had major leftovers after spending about $44.00. Not bad AT ALL.

In conclusion this whole day was just... US. From getting glammed up to take engagement pictures to smashing wings with sauce all over our faces immediately after is just what her and I do. Thank you IWF for your delicious food and generous hospitality. I may find myself here again someday.

Ordered from Uber eats (ended up taking 2 hours to get to me, so it wasn't as hot as I would've liked) I accidentally ordered boneless, but thought they turned out great, I ordered mild Buffalo with pure heat on the side and was glad I got the pure heat because the mild just wasn't spicy enough for me!  Was happy with the taste of the blue cheese, didn't seem like a low budget one, but sad I didn't get any celery. Also got the spicy garlic fries, which is nice again weren't that as spicy in my opinion.  My friend got a cup of the Mac & Cheese that we found just okay. Lastly, I ordered some of the Panko brownies which were interesting and delicious.  Overall I would go here again for the chicken but not much else!

Great service and food is excellent! They have beef, lamb and goat, vegetarian, and seafood including crab dishes. Their menu is very diverse.

Get the Chai to start off the meal with the free pappadum.

I can't find anything I wouldn't order on this menu. Been a few times and really love the staff.

My friend and I dined here for dinner the same day I had a wisdom tooth extraction. Thankfully, most of the food was soft and easy to eat. The interior was lovely and the atmosphere was cozy, as well as peaceful.

I had to get the Mango Lassi, which was wonderfully thick, creamy, sweet, and refreshing.

For my meal, I ordered the Thali-E Samunder combination platter, which is took about 25 minutes to prepare. This consisted of Crab meat, shrimp saag, fish masala, raitha, naan, rice and dhal makhni. I requested this with Garlic Naan, which was delicious! This was thin and satisfyingly crispy. There was plenty of garlic, spices, along with butter on top, making for strong garlic taste (which is sometimes hard to find). All the different components of the platter was served in round silver bowls, on a circular silver plate, which was reminiscent of how some entrees are plated in India.

My favorite dishes were the Fish Masala and Shrimp Saag. The Fish Masala was delightfully tender, flaky, and full of yummy seasoning with bold flavors of onion, tomatoes, chilies, and fresh herbs. The Shrimp was juicy and succulent. There was also a veggie dish with lentils, onion, and more, which had great depth of flavor. The rice was cooked perfectly, and was yummy with the different sauces. I couldn't really taste the Crab though.

Service was solid. Our waiter was kind and attentive. Prices are decent, especially for the area. I would return to try the Tandoori Mixed Grill, Shrimp Biryani, Lamb Korma, and Kulfi (Indian ice cream).

My boyfriend and I just ordered from here for the first time and I cannot say enough about how delicious the food was and how nice it was to speak with the staff there. It's often challenging ordering food when you have an allergy. The staff was very helpful when I called multiple times to ask about different items on the menu and they even recognized my voice when I called to place our order. The food arrived very quickly, and was still piping hot! We ordered the lamb vindaloo (spicy and it was definitely spicy), roti, naan, chicken kurma, and meat samosa. Everything was so tasty! Definitely going to order from here again!

I came here on a Monday night for take out the service was great, very quick. They provided me with utensils and even a paper plate. They also gave me a dessert  on the house. I had never tried the dessert but definitely enjoyed it, it resembled "arroz con leche" it was simple but yummy. Worth checking out !

From the moment we stepped into this restaurant, we were impressed by the beautiful decor and welcoming atmosphere. The staff was incredibly polite and attentive. We started our meal with Naan bread, which was simply divine. While the Lamb Korma wasn't our personal favorite due to its slightly sweet taste, we still appreciated the high-quality ingredients. But that won't stop us to give it another try or at least ordering another dish.

Based on the reviews, I had high hopes for this restaurant, but they were sorely dashed.  This is a mediocre Indian restaurant with food that really isn't that great.

I arrived yesterday at 5:00 PM, and there was no one there.  This is tiny restaurant with pretty good atmosphere that seats about 22 people.  I was seated at a table just inside the door.  The servers were friendly.  During my stay there, only 4 other people entered the restaurant.  Two were seated, one was takeout, and one seemed to be a delivery person - not very busy.

When I go to a new Indian restaurant, I usually order the same thing - lamb korma, basmati rice, raita, and poori.  The lamb korma isn't supposed to be spicy, but it is usually flavorful.  This lamb korma was bland with too much meat and not enough sauce.  Although the lamb was tender, I like lots of sauce to finish up the dish with the rice.  The rice was typical white rice, nothing special.  I've had much better raita.  This was yogurt with some mini pieces of cucumber.  The poori was okay, but not as flaky and good as I have become used to.  I had a glass of Malbec, which wasn't very good; so my second glass of wine was Chardonnay, which was a little better than the Malbec, but not that great.  Having dined at the wonderful former Hevele and UWS Mughlai, my standards for Indian food are high.  This restaurant didn't come close to my expectations.   It is doubtful I will return.  I'm still searching for an Indian restaurant to match what I have known in the past.
Perfect place for good Indian food. Excellent service. Good place for a date and family dinner.

I've been looking for a new Indian spot to take my daughter and wife for dinner. We stopped here and let me tell you, you won't be disappointed. Not only was the food incredible and flavoursome, the service was friendly and welcoming. I didn't get a chance to take pictures of the food because we just dug straight in.

Looking for a new spot? Check these guys out!
A late lunch near my hotel proved to be an excellent choice. White table clothes, stemware for wine and the best flavors! It was an excellent choice. Do not let the weathered awning fool you.

I've lived in this neighborhood for over 30 years and have walked past Indian Tanpura many times.  Well, tonight I was craving Indian cuisine and boy was I lucky to get off the subway at 86th Street.

This place is the real deal.

Do not expect a fancy place for tourists so much as a very small (mostly take-out) place for locals.

The server could not be more gracious and welcoming.  The only other patrons inside the restaurant were a local big mouth and two flight attendants, in the know, from Air France.

I was craving Chicken Vindeloo.  The server asked me if I wanted it prepared Indian style or mild.  Well, this dish is not for the timid.  It's as hot (spicy) as the sun on the Ganges in summer.  I loved it with the basmati rice and a little bit of bread (poori). It is deep fried but light and fluffy.  Authentic.

I was able to make two meals out of the dinner and I left  the restaurant like a fire-breathing dragon.  Do not be discouraged by this.  There are mild and flavorful dishes on the menu.

When you are visiting the UWS and having a hunger pang for Indian cuisine, this is a good choice.  

I'll certainly return.

I have ordered from here several times ! Always delicious ! ITS BEEN A MOMENT SINCE I ORDERED. Today guys this food is so tasty ..even the condiments taste splendidly. It taste better . I got the chicken vindaloo (I love spice) it was so fresh and simply taste better ..it's always on point ..but there is a delightful change ..it's in my neighborhood ; it's affordable n I do recommend

We loved this entire experience! Everyone was so friendly and lovely to chat to. The food was amazing- we ordered veggie pakora, meat samosas, and chicken tikka masala and everything was amazing! We will definitely be going back again and again!!
Gross, overpriced food (especially for the quality) as well as the tackiest, most dated decor in this restaurant.  The sign in the front with the woman playing a sitar is particularly hideous.
The food is really good, but I asked for my meal to be extra spicy twice and it wasn't spicy.

Just when we we were about to give up on finding a good place to eat, we stumbled upon this one!

Amazing food and wonderful service. The guy who works there was very lovely, we were fasting for Ramadan and he was as well. He took good care of us and brought us dates.

We ordered chicken vindaloo, samosa, chicken cha.ag (maybe wrong spelling), and butter naan, it was all yummy!

I ordered for delivery. The food was fresh and delicious. I had the Chicken Tikka Masala with a side of Mango Chutney. The man who took my order was very friendly, which was a definite plus. I will definitely order from them again.

Disgusting.
Ordered delivery.
Chicken Tikka, Alloo mottar gobi, veg samosa. All inedible.
Chicken was so over cooked and dry with no flavor.
ALG tasted rancid. Stopped eating out of concern for food safety.  Samosa greasy and flavorless.
Tossed in the garbage.
Love this little restaurant so much! The crunchiest samosas, yummy chicken vindaloo, puffy poori bread - never disappoints!

Best Indian food on the UWS hands down.
Wonderful food, wonderful service, I highly recommend.

Been going to this place and ordering takeout for years. It's the perfect neighborhood Indian spot. They have been 100% reliable every single time. The food is delicious and the staff is super friendly.
Great neighborhood restaurant with excellent food and timely takeout, on a consistent basis - we have tried several dishes on the menu and enjoyed each one

Hands down, the best Indian food on the east coast. This is a huge claim, I know, but Indian Tanpura is absolutely brilliant when it comes to food selection, value, and atmosphere. The owner is an incredibly kind man who says hello every time we walk past the place. Their coconut curry, chicken curry, and chicken tikka masala is easily the best I've ever had. Their naan is also unparalleled. You should absolutely check this place out if you're on the UWS.
best lamb ever! if you've tried any other lamb dishes in any other cuisines, such as paomo or mutton hot pot, this is way above them.

I came here with a group of 20 college interns. Usually restaurants are irritated by our appearance, but not this restaurant. Goshi was happy to serve us and converse with our group the entire time we ate. The food was delicious, and the service was the best I've ever had. We are going to try to make an effort to stop by whenever we are in the area.
Thank you for a great experience!

I've been ordering from Indian Tanpura ever since I moved to the Upper West Side 27 years ago. It is by far our neighborhood's most reliably dependable Indian, with an owner who is always polite and friendly and usually adds a free rice pudding to our order. Crispy pappadam, creamy chicken kurma, vindaloos as hot as you want and terrific biriyanis. Bottom line: we have never had a bad experience, only great, which is why Indian Tanpura has been around so long and hopefully will be here forever.

I was with 6 other friends at 8:30pm on a Saturday night.  All other nearby restaurants had 30min or longer waits.  Only two people were eating at Indian Tanpura.  The place is small but very nice and well kept.  They said they could take as and quickly re-arranged some tables.  The Mulligatawny soup was spectacular!  The Chana Poori was amazing!!!  The curry and all other main courses we had were all solid.  The service was pleasant and considerate.  This is a gem....go to Indian Tanpura and enjoy!!

I love Indian Tanpura! This is my go to Indian spot on the Upper West Side. Dining in is always a really nice experience, the atmosphere is really calming and the staff are so pleasant and want to make your experience great.

I highly recommend their vegetable samosas, naan and poori bread, and lamb or chicken curry meals.

Leaving four stars because my most recent take-out chicken curry meal was really oily/greasy. After having eaten here countless times over the years, this has been the only time I've ever been slightly dissatisfied with the food. This place will continue to be my go-to for Indian food. :)

Love love love this place. We order take out from here all the time, and every time the food is fresh, flavorful and delicious. We especially love the biryani, chicken vindaloo (spicy!), samosas and dal. Tastes like home cooking in the best way -- deep flavors that soothe the soul. Highly recommend!
Favorite restaurant in the world. Everything is delicious and the service is always awesome. 11/10 would recommend.
Best Indian on the upper west side! Was super pleased with everything we ordered. Especially butter chicken. So tasty.
Just ordered in from Indian Tanpura!!! OMG so delicious. Got everything we wanted how we wanted it. Delivered fast also. It's hard to find a better restaurant in this category!!!! Love this place.

A gem of the UWS, and one of my favorite Indian restaurants in the entire city. The storefront doesn't stand out at all, and the inside of the restaurant is small and rather quaint. There are no fancy decors, and everything is just incredibly simple, including the food. However, the taste of the food just speaks for itself.

I've been here about a dozen times, and more than half the time I order the shrimp vindaloo (including this time), and it has never disappointed. This is the only place where I can order vindaloo, don't specify spiciness level, and it comes out perfect (and spicier than most places when I order extra spicy). They insist on using baby shrimp, which might be disappointing to some, but it keeps prices low (especially for this part of town), and really it tastes amazing. I might even argue that it tastes better than larger shrimps since it mixes much more easily with rice.

For those of you getting takeout: please give dining in a shot. The staff is truly exceptional and really do their best to make your experience pleasant, in a casual and home-like atmosphere.

Love this place, and I'll be a regular for as long as I am in the city.

This place is terrific.
The takeout is reliably warm and wonderful.
It's inexpensive and delicious.
The staff is gracious and always ready to help.
Really like this joint.
Delicious Indian food and the owners are so kind!!!! A neighborhood gem and a great takeout spot

Happy to have this place in a neighborhood - we've just finished our dinner which was delicious! Lamb and seafood, wine and overall service - everything is great!

The place is super small but very cozy and clean. The owner is very nice, and welcoming. Highly recommend!
I love this spot, the staff are so warm and friendly and the food is always spot on. A fabulous neighborhood spot, and great for take out too.

Excellent food. We got delivery, and as another reviewer said, it was fast and still piping hot when it got here. We had the chicken vindaloo which was great and SPICY and the lamb rogan josh which had amazing flavor. Both the chicken and lamb were very tender. This will be my new go to spot for Indian food on the UWS!

Great Indian food in the Upper West Side. I always order pickup, and the staff is so great and friendly. The food is delicious and a very generous servings. You can't go wrong on the menu! Indian Tanpura is my go to Indian spot!

This food is great but the people are better. I've eaten here 20-30 times and the food is consistently excellent. The people that run the restaurant are kind and attentive. They always greet you and serve you with a smile.

I'm a particularly big fan of the chicken vindaloo, beef vindaloo, goat curry, and shaag panir. Everything though is really excellent.
I highly recommend the Roger Josh, mulligatawny soup (add lime juice) and the okra with tomatoes. Frequently heard when eating here: "Mmmmm Oh, this is so good."

Love this place.    Deceiving from the street, but what a treat.  Delish food.  Always delivered hot.
Best chicken korma. Boom.

So far amazing food. Have ordered takeout from this place twice and they ever have a very nice storefront location. If I didn't live so close I would have dined in more often so sorry to say I do not have pictures of the take out. The garlic naan was awesome both times and you can never go wrong with their chicken tikka masala. I highly recommend. That being said they just didn't do anything 5 star worthy. It is just really good and I will continue to eat there!

Indian Tanpura serves Desi food for gringos. It's not awful within these parameters, but the food tastes very mass-produced, sourced from some Sysco of Indian-American food service.

Notes from several recent delivery orders:

- Some nasty corn-syrup-based maroon stuff (which I think was supposed to be an interpretation of tamarind chutney) really drowned / ruined the chana chaat. (The dish could also benefit a great deal from some sort of crispy element.)

- Breads were premade and reheated, often overly toasted, crisp and hard where they are supposed to be soft and pillowy.

- Samosas were next-of-kin to the kind you get in 7-11 convenience stores all over London, with the overly doughy / thick crust, rubbery from microwave reheating.

- Lamb bhuna was our most enjoyable main course dish (of the large variety we've tried over a number of orders, including aloo gobi, baighan bhartha, various dals, chicken makhani, chicken kurma, chicken biryani, etc...). The tomato adds a depth of flavor that most other dishes lack.  

In a small town somewhere remote, I'd be thrilled to come across a restaurant like this. In NYC, I know we can do so, so much better for north Indian / Pakistani, even within the parameters of the UWS neighborhood.

I'm open to suggestions, Yelp friends. Tell me where to find the best bhelpuri on the UWS and you'll have my undying gratitude!

Overall, great quality food.  Chicken curry was very tender, well cooked. Very flavourful but could have done with something more. Chicken tikka masala was creamy, not too tomato-y. Garlic and onion naans were both stuffed with topping and very tasty. Mango chutney was also amazing, perfectly sweet with nice chunks of fruit. Service was wonderful and I was even given a free dessert! The dessert was something of a mango spiced rice pudding and was very yummy. Would definitely go back and recommend to friends :)

This place is fantastic and the ambience is very pleasant. The service was great and the food was delicious. I stopped by for a quick lunch and ordered the Aloo Saag which came with vegetable pakora, side salad, rice, and coriander chutney. They have great lunch special selections for a very reasonable price. Goshi was very kind! Definitely recommend this restaurant for both sit-in and take out!

First time here
Live nearby
Outstanding place
Quite small but cozy and not uncomfortable
Very full on Sunday nite and I see why
Mulligatawny soup was best I've had in nyc
Had the vegetable platter for appetizer- very sweet waiter cautioned too much food but I told hi I'd take it home and he was truly happy!
Delicious mushroom saag and Taj Mahal beer and I was delighted!!
My new local place
Everything you look for in Indian food - tasty and full of flavors. Bang for the bucks as well

Mr. Goshi has an establishment that provides excellent food -- prepared with care -- at reasonable prices AND a hearty sense of humor that makes the entire dining experience great!  My wife and guests enjoy ourselves thoroughly.  I highly recommend coming by  -- enjoying a great meal, great laughs  and jovial socialization with friends and / or family who join you for the experience!

You'll be grateful!

I have eaten here 5 or 6 times in the last few years.  The food is always great and so is the service.  They have many vegetarian choices which is the way we usually go.   The naan and poori breads are amazing.  The place is relatively small and cozy.  Maybe 25 seats total.

5 stars always!!  I have eaten here more times than I can count - both in the restaurant and delivery. It's excellent. I grew up eating really good homemade Indian food so my expectations are high.

The food is fresh, flavorful, and consistently good. If you haven't eaten here, you are missing out!

My favorites:

chicken saag (with freshly cooked spinach; not overly creamy)
Goat danshak (lentils and spinach sauce and perfectly cooked goat)
Saag paneer (creamy, delicious)
Paratha (bread with layers, just as it should be)

We had a fantastic pre-theater dinner at Iris. Our server Alicia (sp?) was lovely. The mocktails were delicious. That grilled octopus is out of this world. The moussaka was excellent. Great dining experience!

We had a fantastic pre-theater dinner at Iris. Our server Alicia (sp?) was lovely. The mocktails were delicious. That grilled octopus is out of this world. The moussaka was excellent. Great dining experience!

I love octopus, especially in New York. It just seems fresher and better prepared then anywhere else. The grill version at Iris arrives with a blast of smoky flavor. Once you dig in, the chili and tangy mix with the sweet kumquat citrus to delivered a unique method of preparation.

I also loved the Long Island Duck. The rosemary and sage crust made the breast full of flavor and the confit leg was so tender, the meat slipped off the bone. When your palate needs a refresh, the rhubarb provided a nice alternative. This was excellent.

The Pistachio Baklava was a sweet (sweet) end that made this a place that will beckon me to return. Soon, I hope.
Really excellent dinner. Quail and octopus were particularly amazing. Don't skip the sourdough pita.

Service and ambiance fine.
Suggest you get dips and dessert but skip entree.
Dips definitely the best.

This is our second time at Iris. We go here to have a great Greek dinner as it is very close to Rockefeller center. The baklava for the holiday menu surprisingly had a hint of alcohol in it and it was just too strong for my taste. The flavor was not blending well with the sweetness.

For appetizer, we got the Mezze mix! The roasted eggplant was the best.

For dinner, I ordered the swordfish kabab and that was so so good!
Excellent experience.  Great service and great food. Octopus was amazing. Thoroughly enjoyed!

Creative interpretation of Greek/Turkish food. Made reservation because Iris is on NY Times top 100 restaurant list. Did not disappoint. Lovely room and gave us a nice large table not a crowded two-top. Service was gracious. Best items ordered were squid appetizer in a broth with different beans and the roasted and confit duck main course. They gave us a delicious dessert of baklava with a spiced ice cream for our anniversary. A little pricey but a real treat!

Hosted a last minute corporate dinner at IRIS on a weekday. Arranging details with the manager was extremely easy & the prices for a large group prix fixe were on par with similar restaurants in the city. IRIS is a good choice for corporate / more upscale group events -- they were very flexible with dietary needs and fluctuating numbers, and the restaurant's indoor atmosphere is dim, quiet, and very classy.

I was a bit surprised at how good the food was. The dips were outstanding and the Greek salad was delicious. We loved the moussaka, which was an addition to the standard prix fixe option and came with table-side fire presentation. The grilled sea bass was also outstanding and very pretty. I personally thought the lamb flatbread was a little too salty and the hanger steak was a bit under-seasoned though.

Service was a bit mixed. Our group had a strange interaction with the sommelier which was a little off-putting. While discussing which bottles to order for the table, one member of the group mentioned not liking Greek wines, and the sommelier's reaction made her feel unwelcome in the restaurant. Other than that, we had great experiences with the service. Leftover boxes were packaged with care and the hosts watched over a few phones that needed to be charged.

All things considered, IRIS is a great restaurant with a lovely ambiance and I'd definitely come back for classier group events or drinks with friends.

Awesome experience/dinner on the most perfect NYC evening! We decided to sit outside since it was such a pleasant summer evening. The outside tables were adorable - I loved the comfortable director's chairs, and the small 'hotel looking' dim lights on every table.

We started with a bottle of fantastic white Greek wine (from Santorini) and the quail kebabs. The wine was incredible - perfect for summer and seafood. The quail kebobs were spiced and cooked perfectly - lots of flavor, nice salt and pepper taste to them. For dinner we split the Sea Bass from Spain and the grilled broccolini. The sea bass came with a nice flaky skin, some sauce on top and a few veggies on the side (yellow zucchini). They also gave us a side of a slightly spicy aioli sauce on the side. The broccolini was great too, very fresh, with a little sauce on top.

We loved the wine so much, we ended up with a second bottle. I also insisted on ordering their baklava because it's such an amazing dessert. They used lots of pistachios in their baklava, and it came with a side of ice cream. It had a very unique flavor - pretty positive it was made in-house by their pastry chef.

The waiter was really sweet, nice European man in the food industry. The interior of the restaurant was so gorgeous, - it was hard not to sit inside instead, but there's nothing like a beautiful summer evening in NYC!

Went here after seeing Phantom of the Opera. Great place! The restaurant is very trendy, super clean. Love that the bathrooms are all singles. We decided to do the restaurant week menu for dinner. The lamb meatballs & grilled octopus were exceptional appetizers. I had the branzino fillet which was delicious. Fig sorbet for dessert hit the spot. Would definitely come back!

Iris had been on my radar ever since they opened, and Restaurant Week offered the perfect opportunity to finally get in on the action. I am so glad I did! Last night was one of the loveliest dinner experiences I've had in quite some time.

I requested a booth in my reservation and they accommodated my party with a gorgeous curved booth in the back. I felt very special in that comfy nook. My date and I looked over the various menus, then placed our order with the attentive and thoughtful server.

We started with the hummus, which comes with a fresh baked sourdough pita. Solid appetizer. Next, the grilled octopus, a juicy tentacle with astounding texture and oh so perfect vinaigrette. Wow wow wow. First course set a high bar.

Next, the branzino filet. This was actually my first time eating this particular fish. Served with the crispy skin facing up, I was impressed with the taste, texture, and preparation. This was my favorite main on the Restaurant Week menu and it did not disappoint.

My partner ordered the steak, and I got a few bites as well. Tasty! And a big, honest portion size, too. For dessert, the sorbet and the baklava. So tasty, so sweet, so honest, so pure. Felt like being in grandma's warm kitchen.

Great food, delicious drinks, impeccable service. Iris absolutely blew me away.

I tried the happy hour here with a colleague which is from 4:30 to 6:30.  They had a couple cocktails and glasses of wine for $12.  The appetizers weren't really a happy hour deal but we got a mezze of dips for $18.  The dips included whipped feta, hummus, baba ganoush, and tzatziki.  It only came with one flatbread which wasn't enough.  We asked for one more and they charged a whopping $6 for one flatbread which was annoying.  Everything tasted delicious though.  I especially loved the eggplant dip which had a nice tangy lemon taste.  The lamb flatbread was also amazing.

The chef is a James Beard winner. Spacious for NYC, modern decor. I only ordered appetizers - a puff of pastry with spicy hummus. Lamb on bread. Carrot tartar (vegetarian dish that resembled the raw equivalent). Sat at the bar.

The service, food and atmosphere her was excellent.  The dips were good, but the other appetizers and mains really stood out.  The flatbread was deliciously fresh.  The moussaka was a fun take on a moussaka with fennel and other non traditional vegetables.  It was well balanced in terms of sauce and mix of veggies.   The flaming presentation was an unexpected nice touch.  The eggplant was well seasoned.

The service was also excellent here.  The space is modern in terms of decor and the tables are well spaced out.   I was really surprised  by how much I enjoyed this place.  It felt like a little bit of downtown uptown.

Let me begin, it was very surprising that I was able to get a last minute reservation! Such warm welcome immediately and our waitress, ahhhh! Bless her! What a cheery and spirited woman!

1/ Lamb flatbread - Too spicy for me!
2/ Swordfish kebab - MUST ORDER

When in midtown, DEFINITELY try this place out!

IRIS Restaurant is not my favorite flower, nor the apple of my eye sadly.

My husband and I have had drinks at IRIS many times; I have also brought multiple friends here for a nightcap. I finally decided to dine here and I have to say... it was not the best.

I give IRIS a 10 in the ambiance area as I always love the decor, and the lighting.

The service is always a bit strange here as there is a sense of arrogance overall and this did not change during my dining experience last night.

The service was so slow, and the food is overpriced for what it actually is.

Side note: You will pay $70 dollar for a $20 dollar bottle of wine.

Down to the meat and potatoes of it all (the food):
- Whipped feta (good, but was not told until midway through the dish that we were supposed to mix the chili oil in)
- Spring tzatziki (I like the fact that it is not super cucumber forward, overall this was probably my favorite dish)
- Fried eggplant (Not great at all and super saturated in oil; we also heard our waiter tell the couple next to us that "the roasted eggplant is much better" but failed to mention that to us)
- Moussaka (I did love the mushrooms, but it felt like it was missing something, they should try making an impossible meat version as I think it would be better)
- Hanger steak (my husband said it was cooked good, but needed sauce of some sort)
- French fries (fantastic and would recommend ordering even if you are just grabbing a drink at the bar).

It took way too long to get our food out and the server would disappear and not check in throughout our courses; for the price you are paying here (our bill was over $200) the service should be on point (we had to pour our own wine that we ordered).

I will not be returning to IRIS anytime soon for food.

Very disappointed overall:(

Very good food though on the pricey side with waistline friendly portions.  Quite a few interesting and tasty dishes.  I would call this "trendy contemporary Mediterranean", very enjoyable.

Everything we ordered was tasty.  My favorite was the fried fermented milk crouton things (trahana croutons) that are moist inside and dusted with an umami cumin powder.  They were dangerously delicious.  Felt like I discovered a new world - where were these things all my life?!  This dish alone bumped the resto to A+ category for me.

My doggo appreciated the outdoor seating.

Came for weekday biz lunch and had a great meal. They offer a $40 prix fixe menu, and you get two dishes. I ordered the lamb flatbread (good) for my first course, and also tried the oysters (great). For my main, I had the lamb burger, which was particularly awesome. Would definitely return for another work lunch, especially because there aren't many good options in the area.
What more could you ask for?  Great service, great food, central location that's easy to get to.  It's also a very nice space!

Iris is in a great location and pretty inside but I expected more. I didn't love the fact that you looked out onto a busy street. The food was delicious especially the gnocchi! We had a nice table & our waiter was lovely. The restaurant got packed as we were leaving & we saw some dishes being prepared table side as well as some flaming desserts that looked interesting! The only downfall is it's very very pricey & they have a full bar which makes it double the price when you get your bill. Xoxo

From the moment I walked into Iris to the moment I left, I felt extremely uncomfortable and judged. The service was not great and I did not feel welcomed at all which really killed the vibe.

For a Mediterranean restaurant, there wasn't many Mediterranean options on the menu. Dishes were on the higher end and portions were in the smaller side.

I ordered the branzino fillet and there was still a good amount of bones in my fillet which took away from the experience. The fillet was nice and crispy on top though. The sauce didn't go well with the branzino and the radish felt out of place. The carrot looking like veggie tasted like a potato and honestly the best part of the dish.

The hanger steak was a little dry so was just ok. The gyros were basically just meat inside a pita bread. It lacked toppings and sauce (there were sauce in the sauce). I didn't try the lamb burger but it looked good.

Side note: We had wanted tap water but got served with still water and then were switched to tap water again. Confused but we paid for the Acqua Panna anyways.

Also, the staff touched my friend's purse and moved it farther away from her to the edge of the table without asking. She found that odd and preferred her purse to be closer to her.

Overall, this was my worst dining experience in NYC.

A very pretty place. I have nothing but compliments for the vibe and interior. The outside looks great with its glass doors; the inside is just the right about of dimly lit for a quiet and classy vibe; the interior color scheme is muted with grays and whites, pale blue abstract artwork, aesthetically pleasing seating, and clear glassware that matches the clean and simple menu design.

The only reason I was able to come here is that they have all day happy hour on Mondays lol. We basically got 1 drink and 1 happy hour food menu per person and it was still over $30..........for small girls like us yes that's actually enough but 70% of the population would probably disagree. Regular prices are much, much higher. I also had to ask for the happy hour menu twice? It wasn't there until I asked for it; bless my roomie who knows all the secret deals that exist in nyc lol

As for the taste of the food alone, it's great. The squash flatbread was flavorful and sweet; the variety of hummus was tasty and the ingredients really came through; the pita bread was fluffy and chewy. Drinks were good too.

4 stars for prices/size.....don't know if the price is worth the food tbh. Worth going for happy hour for the vibes. You'll just probably be having some more dinner after you get home lol

A gorgeous sumptuous space with lovely Aegean flavors leaning Greek.
Ate: restaurant week lunch plus Greek red:
Fluke
Branzino
Chocolate ganache( extra)
The fluke was incredible, fresh and with red onion and radicchio. The branzino had a lovely Muhammara sauce. Dessert was delicious though I did miss a little pita bread bit served.

Mmmm! Went here before the MJ musical and I rarely go to a restaurant w/o checking Yelp first but I was asked not to and trust the recommendation. I'm glad I did Bc the food was so yummy in my tummy. The Rosè was flowing, the conversation was epic and I was surrounded by good people. If you have any further questions, holla at ya girl!!

An upscale restaurant but the pricing is actually pretty reasonable given the portion sizes and ambiance. If you want to take someone somewhere nice that isn't impossible to get a reservation and won't completely break the bank, this would be a great option. Maybe living in NYC has just desensitized me, but we ordered kind of an exorbitant amount of food and each had a glass of wine and were out of there for $130 after tip (with leftovers), so I'll let you be the judge of what is reasonable.

For two:
MEZZE MIX -  all of the mezze, olives, pita & endive
GREEK SALAD -hot house tomatoes, cucumbers, feta, citrus-marinated olives
LONG ISLAND DUCK - pomegranate, confit leg, rhubarb
GRILLED BROCCOLINI

The mezze mix is impressive and a lot of food - definitely could be shared by 4-6 people as we barely made a dent. But hey, we wanted to try all the mezze. By the time the duck came out we were kind of full already, but the duck was absolutely delicious. It was cooked perfectly - very tender, not fatty at all, perfectly paired with just the right about of sauce and garnish. Great spot if you find yourself in this part of the city.

Sat at the bar and the service was great!! My sisters and I ordered some items off the happy hour - white wine was good, red wine was ok, the oysters were really good and fresh, the pikilia was also really good and flavorful (favorites were the tzatziki and hummus), the autumn squash flatbread was good and the tots were just ok. From the regular menu, we loved the grilled octopus, but the lamb meatballs were a little salty. From the cocktail menu, we liked the hound of hades, the dawn of Adonis and the iris Manhattan. For dessert, the donuts with chocolate sauce were really good!! Would definitely return and recommend coming here! Nice ambiance and the bartender was great!

Just dined here for their Restaurant Week dinner.  It was fantastic.  Husband & I shared grilled octopus & lamb meatballs.  Dressing on octopus tasted like had candied citrus mixed in- so we'll balanced- prob best dressing I ever tasted.  Both delicious.  Entrees were roast chicken & branzino.  Loved them also- pistachio topping on chicken was just so good.

Really enjoyed the rice pudding & backlava for dessert ( although a tad too much honey for me)- thanks for the ice cream with it !

Besides the food, ambience was very nice & staff just attentive enough. We definitely plan on going back.

It began poorly and just got worse. First, try opening the overly heavy door - difficult to say the very least.
Then the greeting was a bit sour - no smile or welcome just - "do you have a reservation."
The noise level was over the top, and the prices were ridiculous. The worst, however, was the service - or I should say the lack of service.
We enjoyed the tzakiki and carrots but the cauliflower was mushy and the meatballs were mediocre.  
Looking for a good Greek or Turkish meal - try Elea, Bodrum, or Nerai.

As a Turkish, I really like Turkish Mediterranean and Greek food. I really want it to try this new place so bad. I was trying to find a reservation but they were so busy all the time. So, long story short we picked that place for special occasion. Since I entered the place I got so excited.

We start from the drinks and I got Melon of Troy it was extremely delicious. I loved it. As a hot appetizers, we got spiced Lamb flatbread and fried eggplant. I really was so disappointed from Lamb flatbread. It's so expensive and super small also the dough was kinda taste like raw flour. Fried eggplant was so delicious I really enjoyed.

As an entree, I had a hanger steak. It was pretty good jucy and so tender (4pcs of small shish kebab) $40 My husband ordered dived scallops (only two pieces of scallops and 2 shrimps) it's not really worth for $38

I really don't want to have a dessert because that place is extremely expensive and all the portion are super small.

All in all, that's not a place you could go in a regular basis.

When we saw a new Turkish-Greek place was opening by our apartment, we wanted to try it.   We could never get a table just walking up so we made a reservation a week in advance with a friend.  Unfortunately, he forgot his wallet that night (insert emojis for pursed lips) so we couldn't get in because he didn't have ID to match is Excelsior Pass.   The restaurant called us the night before to remind us of the requirement so no issues there; it was our fault.    Anyway, we made another reservation for a few days later and finally got to have our long awaited meal.  And the result was....fine.

We checked in, got the vaccine verification business taken care of quickly and got seated at a table outside.  Service was very nice from start to finish.  Very polished, especially for a relatively new place.

The cocktails we started with were very tasty. My husband really liked his "Melon of Troy" and my Iris Manhattan had a great flavor.   We started with lamb flatbread (like lamachun) and some fried eggplant.  The flatbread was fine but at $16 more than twice what we'd usually pay, although I get that this place has to pay midtown rents.   I really liked the fried eggplant but it was like 1/4 of an eggplant and it was $14.    I would have liked it better at $10.

For entrees, we got the hangar steak kebab and the diver scallops and shrimp.  Both were fine.  I will say that getting two scallops and three shrimp for $38 seemed a little pricey.   If it had been better than fine, I might not have minded so much.   Again, I understand this is an upscale restaurant in an expensive neighborhood so prices will be very high relative to what you might see elsewhere.  One note, we ordered fries ($12) and they were the best thing we had.  Very, very good!  If I was on an expense account or if the food was mind-blowingly delicious, it would be great but it's not some place I could eat every night.   We didn't order dessert and our bill was $166, so just about $200 with tip.    

As a place for a special occasion or if your rich uncle is taking you out for dinner, this is a terrific selection.    It's not really a neighborhood place you could go to regularly based on the price point and although the food is nice and the service is really good, I couldn't afford to put this in my regular rotation.     One positive note, if you're still hungry after eating here, the dollar pizza place across Broadway beside the diner is excellent and won't leave a hole in your wallet!

We arrived for a 5pm reservation in the freezing winter cold.  It's 5:01 and they still have not opened the doors.

Now inside, no apology for making everyone wait even after the issue was raised.  I've had warmer hospitality at McDonalds.

Food was five star (duck breast).  Hospitality one star.  So three Yelp stars and zero Michelin stars I guess.

My friend and I went to Iris for restaurant week and it was excellent. The vibes were on point. The food was great, especially the squash flatbread with crispy sage and feta! A little pricey but the restaurant week deal was a steal.

Portions are average not spectacular but food was pretty good. The Mediterranean Greek restaurant has a wonderful lounge vibe with a vibrant atmosphere and very welcoming staff. We ordered Restaurant week menu and all was fantastic except for the Yogurt Parfait dessert which was extremely tart. The lamb Flatbread was delicious along with the very soft steak and well seasoned branzino

The fantastic meal we enjoyed last week should have another star!
Upon our arrival we were greeted in such a lovely manner, which set the tone for the rest of the evening.
  Each and every dish was delicious and presented beautifully. The Greek salad was exceptional, as was the eggplant spread (maybe the best we have ever eaten) the pita was incredible.  The baklava was so delicious I am craving it currently. We will be returning soon to try some other dishes.....

The food here is terrific. It's the service that needs a little work.

The food is Greek and Turkish with seafood and veggie emphases, elegant, on the expensive side but not outrageous, and nice but non-stuffy atmosphere. This place has been open for two years, yet it's still easy to get a reservation at peak time (we came in on a Saturday pre-theater, same day reservation). This all makes it a "sleeper" in the Theater District/West Midtown area where so many other places are tourist traps or nosebleed-expensive corporate dining rooms.

The veggie dishes are highlights. They are prepared with care. We had the steamed carrots with tahini and the roasted cauliflower -- both delicious. We also had the whole grilled branzino, cooked perfectly (presented as a whole fish, then taken away to be fileted, French-style) and the lemon & oregano fries, crispy and yummy. Good selection of regional wines by the glass.

Now let's talk about the service. The near-obsequiousness of the wait staff masks glitches and problems that they need to fix. Most seriously, the food took forever to come out, and when we asked about it, we were told that the kitchen was "a little backed up." This was at 6:30 pm, with the restaurant maybe half full. Requests for salt went unheeded. Various other little things like that. Finally we asked them to just bring everything to the table as it got to the pass, and we were able to eat and get out of there on time.

We'll be back when we're looking for a nice place in that area.
Came here with my girlfriend; pretty venue, egregious prices. $34 salad with overripe tomatoes. Not impressed.

On our weekend visit to NYC we were looking for something a little different than our usual dining and we found it! I ordered from the Restaurant Week menu and got Lamb Meatballs, Branzino Fillet (sea bass) and Pistachio Baklava. The husband got Roasted Eggplant and Divers Scallops and Shrimp. It was all delightful. My sea bass was light yet delicious. The roasted eggplant spread was so good I wanted to roll around in it. The baklava was a little stiff but still yummy. We also had a couple of Greek beers, reasonably priced and very good. The acoustics are a little annoying- kind of loud - but also the place was packed. The wait staff was super attentive. We loved it!

My husband and I came here for our 2nd anniversary celebration and the staff, food, atmosphere-- the whole experience was just amazing. The restaurant itself is extremely clean, and the decor is quite swanky.
We got the flatbread as an appetizer; it was very flavorful and the crust was thin but nice and crisp. The different dips with the pita bread were also amazing!
The scallop entree was fresh and surprisingly very filling. We also got a whole fish to share with a side of fries. Let me say, these are no ordinary fries. They were perfectly crisp but the inside melts in your mouth. They are also so perfectly seasoned.

All this to say, highly recommend this place and will definitely be coming back!

I went with some colleagues during restaurant week a while back but ended up ordering off of their regular menu anyway. They have a pretty nondescript storefront. I got a squash flatbread that was delicious, crisp outside and fluff inside. I also got a dry aged steak, which though smaller than I would have liked was cooked and seasoned perfectly and significantly better than those at dedicated steakhouses in the area. I got both the baklava and beignets, because I couldn't decide between the two. The beignets were great, but the baklava had some spice that left an off aftertaste... They had mulled wine on the drink menu, though there was some confusion as it was apparently supposed to be a seasonal item and off the menu by then; they still were able to make some for me. I would definitely go back and try other things on the menu.

Very good food, service, and ambiance. The general vibe inside is very clean and soothing, the aesthetic and interior color palette reminds me of what a spa would look like if it were a restaurant. I had the pea and mint falafel and we shared the autumn squash flatbread as a table. I was there for a business lunch and it eventually got a little too loud (like in a cafeteria way) for our conversation but overall was a great experience.

IRIS is a great new addition to the NYC dining scene. While most of the new "Mediterranean" restaurants focus on Israeli/Palestinian/Lebanese/Moroccan cuisine, IRIS is really a Greek/Turkish restaurant. The flavors are outstanding and the presentation is well done. Add amazing service and a wonderful ambiance and you have an excellent dining experience.

Very sadly the portions have got smaller and smaller while the prices have got larger and larger. I was a regular here for a few months, but there was a growing feeling of taking-advantage. For example, the wine list. Many things are available at Trader Joes and Whole Foods for 1/5th the price. It's absolutely insane. They obviously think very poorly of their customers.
Classy Turkish food with well-made (but costly) flatbreads, hummus, and meats. Definitely more of a "celebrate occasion" spot. $20-50 a dish. 3.75/5 stars as a dinner spot.

Had dinner here post theatre. Arrived early & had a glass of the Greek white at the bar from the HH list - delicious. They transferred our tab to our table which was cozy & comfortable. We were greeted warmly & experienced excellent & friendly service throughout the evening. Ordered from the RW dinner menu & enjoyed it tremendously: Greek salad was large with amazing tomatoes ( where did they get flavorful tomatoes in January?) & chunks of yummy feta. The flatbread was also delicious. We both had the branzino which was a little white on white in terms of presentation but moist & flavorful. The accompanying walnut/red pepper spread was excellent. On to dessert! Baklava, very good but the fig sorbet was disappointing in presentation & flavor. Only 2 "misses" were the Athens Spritz cocktail & fig sorbet. Overall, a wonderful experience!

I went here with a friend and the staff was great- very attentive and friendly. We ordered the feta and pita, lamb flatbread, oysters, Greek salad, and octopus to share. Everything tasted good. The octopus was more citrus which was a newer take for me. The lamb flatbread had a very small amount of heat that I think anyone could handle, but added great flavor. The salad was refreshing. Pita is always amazing. We were very happy. The aesthetics were also pleasing.

Came on valentine's day and took more than 30 minutes to be seated when we had a reservation (and there were other times avail on Resy). Service was very very slow but our waitress was very sweet and knowledgeable. Food was average at best. Ordered the octopus, moussaka (doesn't have any meat in it fyi), shrimp entree from spain (was ok), the gnocchi was tasty. Wouldn't really recommend or go back. Ambience was the best part even though it shares a space with an office lobby.

Iris is pretty good in most respects.  The food is solid, and in some cases more than that.  The appetizers and dessert outshone the entrees at our recent visit, but everything was pretty good.  The squid appetizer in particular was excellent.  

To the extent that I have any complaints it has to do with price and structure.  On price: the cocktails and wines by the glass are 25% more at Iris than other restaurants and in some cases even more than that.  Wine is never a good deal at a restaurant, but it's a particularly bad deal here.  In terms of structure, many of the entrees don't come with sides.  If you order the duck, for example, you get the duck and nothing more.  The menu lists a variety of side dishes available to share, but functionally it just means adding another expense to an already hefty bill.  And honestly, if I go to a restaurant it's often because I want the chef to come up with a composed plate.  If I wanted to compose it myself, I would probably have stayed home and cooked.  

Still, all in all it's a good meal even if it ends up costing more than it should.

Peace earthlings-  as my belly growls - it sent a message to my brain to find food -lol determined and in good spirits to start a pre birthday treat with a few friends - and off we go.

**Covid check in flawlessly-

Staff- 5/5 very hospitable and friendly- shot out to Mademoiselle #Valerie  and team with their addictive smiles.

Yum yum approves !!!

A wonderful meal with excellent service. Our server Alysha was wonderful and attentive. I had an excellent eggplant moussaka and flatbread appetizer. We were able to have a relaxing meal and leave it time for the theatre.

This place did not disappoint--thank you NYT for the reco! The ambiance was very calming and chill. The patio is right on Broadway, so nice opportunities for people watching. Their Happy Hour is definitely something to take advantage of, the $18 mezze selection is really great and tasty (the eggplant was the star of the offering along with the pita!). Note that Happy Hour is only available at the bar and patio, but you can get full dinner service as well.
We came here for our anniversary and decided to sit at the bar for Happy Hour + full dinner. At the end of our meal, the bartender surprised us with a complimentary dessert wine that he paired to the dessert we had ordered (mastic ice cream sundae). Very sweet! We ordered: Happy Hour mezze, oysters, and squash flower flatbread (fun & summery!), then sweetbreads (buttery & delicious), and hangar steak kabob (slightly small portion for the price, but supple and cooked to perfection) and a side of the spinach orzo (creamy like a risotto almost). All the waitstaff were very nice and accommodating. We are looking forward to coming back! Easy for small or larger groups, and the happy hour is a great place to meet up if you work in the area.

Travelled from the UK a party of four. Looking at the Istanbul cafe, thought this should be good, lets look for some real tasty spicy food.
Started with anchovies, WRONG they served white bate. Asked for the wine List, WRONG do not serve any alcohol. Thought give them a chance so we ordered the main meal.
The meal came. looked and tasted bland.
Very disapointing food, asked for the manager, not available so explained to the waiter what we were complaining about but to no avail.
So we left paying the bill (160 dollars and thought we sure have been ripped off)

Never again.      Kenny

Awesome service, they are sooo welcoming!
The food is great.
The beef bibimbap is simply awesome. Their wings and dumplings are also great!
Location is not great, but you will be surprised how good the food is.

For takeout, you should call first as all their food is fresh and takes time to be ready, but it's worth the wait. Definitely recommend takeout!
I recommend they upgrade their eat-in experience as the decor is very plain and basic. They should spruce it up a bit.

This place just recently opened up and I am extremely happy it did. Since Covid hit, the one good Korean restaurant in Washington Heights closed down. I learned about this place through a co-worker. I ordered shrimp dumplings and spicy Korean fried chicken. When I bit into that crunchy, juicy, spicy chicken, I was in HEAVEN. I really think that the owners of Go Go Gi re-opened in this new location. My friend loved her bulgogi beef with rice and veggies. The dumplings were good but the sauce was meh. I'll be back very soon.

I have been missing my favorite Korean restaurant since the closing of Go Go Gi during the pandemic. This place just opened up and I have a sneaky suspicion that these are the Go Go GI owners. I found out that this new place opened up due to a co-worker. I ordered the spicy Korean fried wings and the moment I bit into the crunchy, spicy, juicy chicken, I was in heaven. My shrimp dumplings were good but the sauce was, meh. My co-worker was very happy with her bulgogi beef with rice and veggies. I can't wait to eat from here again. This place was needed in Washington Heights.
